Nothing is clever.Adult viewers like myself will be left wanting unless you enjoy this type of childishness with lack of substance.I was mesmerized every time Christian Bale showed up, but sadly, he's barely in the movie.

title: Good, not great.
text: Bale was awesome, Hemsworth was his likeable self, Portman was ok, always felt like all the characters were disposable tho and the post credits offered nothing of note, a solid 7 but could have been so much better.

title: Disney is destroying Marvel
text: Since Disney bought MCU all the movies are childish and boring. This was a BORING movie! After Avengers Endgame all went to hell. I want MCU back pls. Thank goodness for Russel Crow and Cristian Bale. No story no cgi no nothing.

title: Disappointment
text: Just the concept of Gorr the literal 'GOD-BUTCHER' makes villains like Thanos look small and could have been portrayed in a much awe-inspiring way yet Marvel chose to make a movie for it's teenage and kids fanbase instead.The film totally lacks character depth and seriousness and fails to depict the back stories of Gorr and Jane Foster in true sense.Could have been much much better.

title: Ad if they wrote it within 5 mins on the toilet
text: If you want to see how a movie with good actors and a good background story could be messed up, check this movie definitely out! It was an absolute waste of time. Written like a comedy, no seriousness throughout the entirety... Super happy ending as expected. Disgusting.

title: Love And Thunder
text: I had a fun time watching the movie definitely one of the best movies of phase 4 Christian bale as gorr is aaaaa!! "Love" other actors also did a great job with what they were given my only problems with the movie is the run time and the character development surely the movie is a fun ride but feels short at times n the jokes umm they work 4 the most of the time bt sometimes they also feel flat still an entertaining journey which will make you cry,smile n laugh... A Solid 8/10.

title: Subtlety is not a thing anymore
text: The first watch of Taika Watiti's movies are always great. But when you revisit his projects later, you're gonna start noticing it's age.Thor: Love and Thunder is what I felt like an experimental project that wants to explore different ethnic races & certain LGBTQ communities in a very subtle way. You might not notice it when it's fun, but you will when it's not. The first part is Taika's some of the best comedies you'll ever see. The mid part is where it starts to get cheezy, except the visual grading. The final battle and the climax might or might not convince everyone.Then there comes the director's vision of 'comedy first' & 'plot secondary' aspect that some like & others might not. Overall, his movies are enjoyable with whole family. You could give credit at least to that part.Apart from it's downsides, Love & Thunder is it's another own standalone Thor movie that progresses MCU "just a little bit", meanwhile also ending some past characters & arks of the celebrities involved in the past MCU projects.

title: Utterly disappointing and embarrassing
text: The only two things this movie had going for it were Gor and Jane. They took everything that worked in Ragnarok and cranked it up to 100%. To a point to where all character development previously set up with Thor in previous movies is thrown out the window for a movie that feels more like a thor parade slap stick comedy, then an actual cannon MCU film. I found myself rolling my eyes and sighing embarrassingly more than laughing. Honestly embarrassed this movie exists.

title: Fun, adventurous and quit deep!
text: I love everything about the movie, the reunion, Jane and Thor, the meaning of being God, being powerful and the meaning of love.Great messages to kids!The only negative thing is I wan the movie longer!Hopefully next one will get to see Loki with Thor again. It's the first Thor without Loki and already miss him!

title: Not quite good tbh
text: The plot was simple and everything was straightforward.But I liked the performance of Christian Bale and the jokes and humors in it.He just fundamentally nailed his role. The entire performance was thrilling and enchanting. I just thirsted for his appearance.Some romantic scenes were tediously long and boring. I just couldn't help myself watch those scenes and not feel sleepy.

title: Good cast limited runtime
text: After ragnarok, I was pleased to hear that taika would direct love and thunder the man redefined and redeemed Thor's character. Christian bale's gorr is one of the most sympathetic and yet chilling villains in the MCU but I was disappointed by the screen time he had in the movie. If there was one thing I would improve about the movie is that they would take more time with the script. Overall the movie feels more like a redux from ragnarok but the performance of the cast make the movie worth while as well as enjoyable considering phase four has with led with many controversies.

title: Pushing the Limits of Silliness
text: The Latest instalment of the MCU, Thor: Love and Thunder is a delightful and fun movie which pushes the limits the silliness and at times feels like the movie is making parody of itself. The Comedy at the very beginning is really good and slowly as we enter the end of first act, it becomes goofy and there follows the silliness. That being said I laughed at 60% of the jokes and they were really good and at the other 40% the whole theatre was silent and gasping and it felt really Awkward. All the weird sounds made by Thor in the trailers have been cut as they might have realised it was too silly. Also at times I really didn't like the editing of the movie.The Mighty Thor, Dr. Jane Foster had most of the silly jokes which was weird and made the arc of the character by the end little unsatisfied and underwhelming for me because if the writing had been right, it would have impacted audience emotionally and would have been beloved by the whole fans.Gorr was really under-utilised in the movie. I really can't judge the character and performance as there was so little onscreen time, 10-15 minutes more would have made a lot of difference and made him beloved Villian like Thanos. Maybe the Gorr stuff was too graphic & dark for the tone of this movie, so they had to cut him out ,I don't know.With all that been said ,this was still a really good movie. Chris Hemsworth really owns the Thor role. The Action was really good and fun. The Cinematography was really good , the monochromatic scenes were greatly executed and when hit correctly, the comedy Scenes were really funny. If not for the silliness pushed too far it would have been a 9/10 movie because it really had that potential , great story and story arcs , redeemable minor characters , great action & soundtrack and cinematography as mentioned before.I really hope Taika Watiti to pull down some of the over the top comedy for Thor 5 it happens and keep the balance and he is really capable of that as he showed it in Jo Jo Rabbit .My Score : 7.3/10.

title: Go with open mind
text:
The things now days is that we go to Marvel movie with expectations of end game or infinity war, so we feel its a let down.But i felt the was average good not better the Ragnarok. It was a good combo of comedy and action Fight scene were exciting.Some parts were below average God's were shown dumb dnt know why...
Still and enjoyable and entertaining movie.

title: I wish I had just watched Ragnarok again instead of this.
text: Thor: Love and Thunder was like watching a table read of a first draft of a parody of some other movie. The only member of the cast and crew who didn't mail it in was Christian Bale. Maybe there was a key rigging gaffer or 2nd unit digital imaging technician who also didn't mail it in, but it was hard to tell with everybody else sucking so much.

title: Need to get back on course
text: It's was a very enjoyable movie experience but these last few movies of phase 4 have been leaning too much to push an agenda that is going to end up damaging the franchise here and abroad. Those scenes with Korg and Valkyrie didn't need to be there and if they were gone it would have been such a better movie and had no impact in the story telling.

title: I came to warn you all
text: Please do not watch the movie. You will not only waste your time but also your money.The film is childish, with no story and poor action sequence. I was totally bored throughout the movie.

title: Good HEART-WARMING movie
text: I love it very much. I liked the first three movies but I always thought it wasn't perfect. The first two are too serious and the 3rd is too funny. When it comes to this movie, everything is perfect. The character of Thor and Other people, the story and the tone of the movie are very driven together. It's a very complete movie. There are fight scenes that are very fun. There are a new adventures that open up new worlds. There is a lot of humor and a very sweet and bitter romance. Smile and cry along with the story. It's a movie with a great heart.

title: Not as funny or as good as Ragnorak
text: This film is ok but nothing special. It doesn't feel as funny or as well made as Ragnorak and has that rushed sequel feel to it. There are some decent scenes but nothing that will stay in the mind once you've watched. It. Christian Bales performance is good and he makes the rest of the cast seem like weak actors. Worth watching but don't expect to be blown away.

title: It's awful
text: I left after an hour.....and only cause I fell asleep......absolute pile of trash. Do not waste your time.....watching the washing machine is more funny.

title: A good watch
text: As usual for the MCU, 'Thor: Love and Thunder' is a good watch. I did want more from it, though.Chris Hemsworth remains the star of the show, I'm adding nothing new by saying he is just perfect for the role. Tessa Thompson, Taika Waititi and Natalie Portman all make for good support. Christian Bale is also someone I enjoyed, I like the look of his character but kinda felt that I wanted to see more of him - it's like we see a beginning and an end, but part of me feels like we coulda had something in-between.The special effects are solid, as is the music; even if the track choices aren't the most creative. I probably would've shortened the run time a little, though that isn't anything all that noteworthy to be honest. There are some funny moments in there, which is always something I expect from a Taika Waititi flick.As for me and my own personal Thor ranking, this - like the 2011 original (also 7/10) - isn't one of my favourites (fwiw, I enjoy 'Thor: The Dark World' and 'Thor: Ragnarok' (both 9/10) way more) but it's still a fun enough time that I'd recommend it.I simply cannot (cannot, I tell you!) believe they didn't just call this 'Thor Four' btw... ðŸ’”

title: Hate is way over the top
text: I went into this fearful following the reviews about how silly it was although Ragnarok was as well and I loved that movie so I had a small amount of hope.Turns out, mostly, there was nothing to fear. The scenes with Gorr were rightly not played for laughs and Bale was brilliant. Ok there was maybe a few too lame jokes that didn't hit the mark and Zeus and the meeting of the gods was a horrible cringeworthy moment. But these were the exceptions in a movie that I enjoyed.It is not a great addition to the MCU but equally it is not Dark World. Some perspective needs to be gained by the fanboys who are just determined to shut everything down now cos "Disney ruined it".

title: Too much Taika, not enough Gorr
text: I like Taika Waititi as a director, but I think the movie suffers from too much Taiki humor and feels more like a light hearted romantic comedy than a superhero film.Christian Bale shines in what screen time he has, but I left feeling disappointed that there was not more development of Gorr's character arc and that he was not given more scenes.Overall, it's a movie I think kids will enjoy but don't go in expecting another Thor Ragnorak.

title: Thor has been reduced...
text: First off, I love the MCU. They have reduced Thor to a big dumb idiot and I don't like that. This movie is funny, but they have taken funny Thor too far over the top. Thor has jumped the shark. ðŸ¤·â€â™‚ï¸

title: It's a creative presentation of possibilities.
text: I love this one. It's a creative presentation of possibilities.The movie portrays the characters as they are supposed to and chooses to use comedy to subtly remove some of the gloominess.

title: Marvel turned into a comedy show
text: So many jokes, made-to-be-funny moments and laughable nonsense that it renders the entire movie to be a cheap comedy show."Choose love" is a nice message, and if you want to give deep meaning for a 12 year old, it might fly, together with the very simple story. As for adult audience, I would expect something more complex.Examples show that Marvel can obviously produce better than this.

title: Overall bad
text: Bale, Hemsworth and Portman put up good performances but the rest of the movie was terrible. This is worst MCU movie to date, hands down. To much silliness and not enough actual effort in the script and directing.

title: All over the place
text: Not a bad movie for children and people who want to see a movie for a day out. If you are at all into the marvel story line or care about comics not a fun watch.

title: Too much of a good thing?
text: I really wanted to like this movie. Thor Ragnarock is a great film, this isn't. I love the comedy of Guardians and Ragnarock, but this movie tries too hard, and too often to be funny but it doesn't land often enough and gets in the way of the story. It feels like a bit of a missed opportunity with some great characters and performances wasted. Having said that, I'm still looking forward to the sequel, I just hope that balance is restored and many of the weak jokes get left on the cutting room floor next time.

title: Pathetic.Money-Milking Movie.
text: What the hell was this? Overhyped movie with no real content. I don't even remember the BGM. This was just made for cash-grab. Wasted an actor like Bale, this is just ridiculous. I wish this flops.

title: Just like Thor Ragnarok
text: The Movie is Good..... I am giving 7 Out of 10 Because there are a lot of jokes even in unnecessary Moments just Like in fights.And They showed us Zeus very weak I mean Even DC used Zeus very good then Marvel. Yeah I know that DC showed up Zeus for few Seconds or Minutes only but less then Marvel. Marvel Gave him 8-10 Minutes of Runtime only and very Bad..Christian Bale is Osm in his Role he did a lot of Hardwork for the Movie you can Understand it while watching the Movie and about Chirs Hamsworth is He Gave is best I mean his acting is Just like back Movie. Taika Watiti is just Directed like Thor 3 Maintain the same level of Drama , Emotion and Action but Comedy is too Over.....

title: Finally a good post-credits scene
text: Finally a good post-credits scene (especially second one).Jane Foster is the best character in movie. Not.Zeus was hilarious.Soundtrack is phenomenal.

title: sooo funny!
text: Love this film so much, it's so funny. I can stop laugh with my bf lol. Maybe watch this film again is a good choice!! Recommended! Hehehehehehehehehehehehe.

title: Christian Bale was a star on his own
text: No one is expecting a serious movie from Marvel, but this one was more like a shallow comedy movie.There are some good ideas and moments but most were lost because of rushing and trying too much to be funny.I would give it five stars only, but I added another one because Christian Bale was a star on his own.

title: Very Poor Writing
text: Taika Waititi ruined the whole movie. Whole movie is just compilation of jokes. Talking about the action , it is just worst. Bale as Gorr was just underutilized. Marvel disappoints this time.

title: Disappointed
text: A story for children! Too much hype and this crap??? It was like a parody of original Thor. Jokes were felt like thrusted in the plot and the storyline on its own was too boring, We expected a very strong villian and permanent deaths for major characters in a very tragic way.

title: Good
text: I read so many bad reviews of this film so wasn't expecting much but I quite enjoyed it. At times the jokes were not that amazing but it had a upbeat theme about it all. It wasn't my favourite Thor but I did enjoy it.

title: Good if you like funny Thor
text: If you enjoy funny thor you will enjoy this movie. This movie is similar Style to Thor RagnarÃ¶k as it bye the same director and similar characters. If you did not like that movie you won't like this. Now too why I rated it a 6 out of 10 and not higher. I liked how each thor movie and each appearance had a new version of thor and was kind of disappointed that this Thor was sorted of the same as his previous movies in endgame and thor RagnarÃ¶k. I would have preferred like an older version of him maybe they will do that in another thor movie or a cameo. I just thought also some of the jokes and action's scenes were all from the trailers and promos and nothing really big or funny came out during the movie that I did see from the trailers. Some good stuff though I did like that they brought back Natalie Portmans character Jane Foster and Valkyrie and Korg which I loved but overall that's why I gave it a 6/10.

title: Profoundly Disappointing
text: I really wanted to enjoy it, but it made me want to leave after 20 minutes. I am actually appalled at the amount of good reviews online. I know the movie is supposed to be light hearted and a comedy, but it still fails in an astonishing fashion. IT IS SIMPLY NOT FUNNY. I was not the only one to think so either. It was really painful to hear the silence in the cinema after most of the supposed "jokes". The pacing was terrible as well, with most of the movie not driven by plot points but by what jokes Taika Waititi found funny; some were rehashed old jokes as well. There are good actors in this movie but their characters are stupid and too goofy for us to appreciate them. Thankfully, Anthony Hopkins' character is dead, otherwise we would have heard him tell fart jokes. The dialogue is the worst part by far, with most lines sounding like they were written by 4th graders. Bale is an amazing actor and his character was one of only good things about the movie; however, his ark was also understandably limited and a little superficial. The random cliche cgi monsters did not help the movie either.I would have been satisfied with a simple parody-like superhero movie, however this one failed completely in almost every aspect.PS: I think the movie should be rated somewhere around the 5/10 range but I gave it a 1/10 because of how much I disagree with the current rating.

title: Entertaining
text: Waititi have managed to blend in comedy, romance and action in equal measure rather entertaining.But apart from two scenes there is not many scenes which makes you go wow.Overall it was a great experience.

title: Thor 4 is more of a comedy
text: Being a comedy is great and it was definitely a fun movie so I don't regret it in that sense but it lacks any strong storyline and it felt all over the place with little impact really.

title: Expectations are a terrible thing..
text: ..and yet, this is all so very familiar.Lots of silly jokes (the goats get old really fast), an average villain plot, and no real stakes at any point. Add the fact that beings die (cheaply) and some just don't (a lot), then powerful Gods that become inconsistently useless for the sake of plot. I'm tired of mediocrity. No amount of colorful scenes will make this work, waititi. The worst part is that it uses stories that were written with buildup, intent and merit for a Comic.. and it feels like they were mushed and summarized onto an average script for the sake of substance. That is not to say Chris and Natalie didn't deliver on the emotional tones! It was the part I enjoyed the most.. But it feels ultimately hollow and unimportant.It's a decent watch, in the same vein as the first Ant-Man. The masses might like it (although the theater I went to was mostly silent).You can see naked Thor in the trailer.. so, just wait for the Disney+ release.

title: Calm down
text: For a 4th thor movie, it was pretty amazing. It has some fresh ideas (great humor!) and some linked to the past mcu movies. Definitely fun to watch. Dont listen to the bad reviews, they're too critical.

title: Taika watiti showing off what he is capable of.
text: This movie is so much fun which I was expecting just watching the trailer. This is probably the best Thor movie to date but I have a few problems with it. One, The dialogue with Jane and her problems doesn't really hit for me and another thing is that this movie is a bit too similar to Ragnarok in the sense of cool epic shots like the one with Thor awakening in Ragnarok. All those scenes are great to look at but lose their charm after a while. Otherwise, Chris Hemsworth, Christian bale and Taika watiti are at their absolute best in this movie. Visually this is one of the best MCU movies to date. If you have strayed away from the MCU like me, give this a shot, it's worth it.

title: Uninspired and uninspiring
text: Despite the wealth of talent and plenty of money for visual effects, the whole movie felt flat and borderline boring. A few nice moments, but not enough to make this anything other than a mediocre MCU outing. Tired but mildly entertaining.

title: Bombedy
text: Too much silliness. Bale was good but not enough to look past the many over done comedy scenes. Hopefully Watiti and Hemsworth return to the balance of Ragnarok in their next projects.

title: Potentially one of the worst movies I have seen
text: I have no idea how this has such high reviews. It's one big bad joke of an acid trip. There is barely any character development and you never care about anything that is happening because it's all played off as terrible jokes. The character development that does take place is almost in reverse of what was done before. They took ragnarok and turned it into a cartoon like candy covered world. Thor is like a little kid that doesn't know what to do and in many instances the graphics look sub par. I kept having to stop myself from frowning at the ridiculousness of the entire thing. Why do these reviews need to be soo long.

title: Almost as good as Ragnarok
text: The movie was mostly fun.Some of the jokes didn't land.It lacks some of the impact the previous installment had, and did not put enough weight on the final battle.The kids narrative took up too much time for my liking, but did however deserve some of their screen-time.It's a must watch for all who loves Marvel, Thor, or Chris Hemsworth.

title: Very interesting, that's for sure...
text: I'm a huge Taika fan, but this was my least favorite film/ show I've seen from him. I wouldn't be surprised if It was revealed that he was very rushed when making this movie. With that in mind, I did still enjoy myself. And I actually really loved the scene in the Shadow Realm. That was awesome.

title: Silly, boring and a bit of a joke.
text: I was highly disappointed by this film. It tries too hard to be funny but ends up just plain silly. The only positive is Christian Bale, who gives a strong performance, otherwise a total waste of time. Marvel, what were you thinking?!

title: Love it
text: I thing is a good movie great scenes its not like ragnarok of course not ita something els that whats makes it special people ecpect to be thw same as old marvel movies but there will never be movies like old marvel moviws this movie love of thunder is the best marvel of 2021 and 2022 great movies.

title: Taika is destroying Marvel
text: Terrible Terrible movie. The plot holes and lack of consistency with the characters and timeline is shocking. It looks like all Taika is good for (apart from repeatedly flashing his name every other line in the end credits) is satire. And yes, it's funny in part, but we're not laughing with you Marvel studios; We're laughing at you as the credibility of all your offerings is disembowelled one character at a time by self grandiosed charlatans like Taika Wahiti. Such a shame. Generations of comic book heroes destroyed by an unthinking egopath.

title: Only review you need to read
text:
While it wasn't nearly as good as Ragnarok (and i know some people don't like Ragnarok), it is still better than Thor 1 & 2. I will say that i enjoyed the music they put in the movie (despite my hatred towards guns & roses). Christian Bale delivered a solid performance as you would expect and honestly the acting overall was good. I'm disappointed by Taika on this one because it seems like they maybe gave him too much control. It was basically a throw away movie to make money. And that's not always a bad thing but it really didn't do much in my opinion to move Thors character ahead any. The colors and shots were nice. Plot was maybe too rushed while also kinda throwing in scenes that were completely unnecessary. Seems like
most movies are shooting for 2 hours worth these days when it really isn't always necessary. Natalie portman is a bad actor i believe after watching this, but also could have to do with the fact that she doesnt really do cringey comedy much. As far as people complaining about how cringey the movie is, that's what it was made to be. It's supposed to be a mildly cringey 80s style Rom-com but it even kinda failed at the Rom-Com side. If the whole cast would've been killed by Gorr the God Butcher i don't think i would've felt anything. And that's the general feel of the movie, not a lot of feeling or heart put into it. Is it still worth the watch ? Well yeah of course but it's not gonna be a classic or anything and hopefully after the bad press for the movie, disney will get their act together. 6/10 if you consider Ragnarok 10/10.

title: Great Premise for the sequel
text: I thought the movie was ok. Thor's character is evolving in each and every movie. The climax and the post credits scene set a great premise for the sequel. All the lead actors have done their part and as usual, Chris Hemsworth saves this movie in many many moments.However, here are some negatives according to me.1. Too many jokes. More than half of the scenes have jokes in the every dialogue. If not for Chris Hemsworth comedic timing, most of them would have fallen flat. Ragnarock was a perfect blend of comedy and seriousness which this movie lacked. We get it. Marvel wants jokes in their movies. But I felt this was an overkill.2. Gorr's character. It is severely limited. If you are expecting a Thor-Hela kind of duel, forget it.In this movie, Gorr is too weak for Thor. One of the fact we enjoyed Ragnarock is Hela and Gorr's limited and undercooked character might make this movie just passable for some. Whilst Bale's acting was great, there is no heavy impact of his character in this movie and this is due to writing and his limited screen time. If he is shown as THE GOD BUTCHER and comes just for 5mins in the first half and 10mins in the second half of the movie, you don't feel THE GOD BUTCHER's intensity and impact.Overall solid movie for me.PS, please reduce the jokes in the next movie Taika.

title: What are you doing Bro?
text: Movie theater was filled with kids below 13 pretty much sums up the current state of MCU. Fluffy animals , Voldemort resurrection (what a wasted potential for Christian Bale) talk talk talk kiss kiss joke haha joke kiss haha blue eyes yellow eyes the end.

title: The Best of Thor
text: A great thor movie show his full strength and powers and good entertainment as on scenes and dialogues. The cast was perfect the villian was good except his look dialogues were perfect on every timing.

title: I found it funny, however ...
text: If you are a real fanboy of these comic book productions, I'm not sure you'll appreciate this film. I like "stupid funny", so this movie worked well for me. I especially liked the screaming goats (smile)! However, if you're looking for a more serious treatment of these characters and stories, you won't find it here.

title: Disappointing...
text: Being a huge Thor fan I was left bitterly disappointed with this film. The jokes felt childish...almost forced and a little bit stupid. The story line was weak albeit Christian Bale's performance as the God Butcher was brilliant.I'm not sure what the role of Guardians of the Galaxy was in this movie but felt totally unnecessary and the villain was hardly given any air time.Overall not a good movie and possibly the worst film in the marvel universe.

title: Thor part four
text: I was disappointed with the first Thor movie because it was over praised and was not that good. I have not seen the dark world or Ragnarok.I went to see this movie because I love Natalie Portman. Also in this film is Chris Hemsworth as Thor, Christian Bale as the villain, and Russell Crowe as Zeus. The actors are good and likable.I would say that this film is better than the first Thor. But it is silly and childish and cartoonish at times. Still, the film has some entertainment value and I enjoyed the performances. Not as good as last year's Black Widow but still a decent Marvel movie.

title: What have you done Marvel?
text: IMO, one of the worst marvel movies to date, there I was thinking I'd gone to watch a superhero movie.Except what I got was a poor comedy at best. Certainly won't be rushing back to watch this again !!!

title: Falls a bit short but still entertaining
text: A corny love sidebar, half empty plot, and underdeveloped character arcs is mostly made up for with good humor, entertaining tropes, and cool visuals.

title: Forgettable
text: It wasn't a great adventure and it didn't move the universe forward, so why did this movie happen?I was looking forward to the jokes but they mostly didn't land for me. It really didn't have the comedic chemistry of Ragnarok.There were a few really cool scenes and some of the jokes were really good, but I was pretty bored throughout. It was all the right ingredients without the magical execution.

title: THOR
text: Great Thor movie but not better than Ragnarok. This movie had a lot of potential to be better than Ragnarok but just wasn't, but still a great movie that we recommended watching!

title: Thor Love and Blunder
text: Thor Love and Thunder is the fourth entry in the Thor franchise and it is a step down from the previous. I feel like Ragnarok did a better job at the comedy. I find comedy in Love and Thunder just didn't land properly. As well, I feel like Gorr the God Butcher was underutilized in the film. I feel like he wasn't used enough in the film and it doesn't make him feel like enough of a threat. He's the GOD BUTCHER and he doesn't seem to fit the role. I do find Christain Bale does a good job as always but it doesn't help the flawed script.I find the CGI in Love and Thunder is a little more spotty than Quantumania. I'm more likely to pick out a worst CGI moment from this movie than Quantumania.Out of the Thor films, my favorite ones are the first and Ragnarok. I find Love and Thunder is a little more watchable than the Dark World. It's definitely more memorable. I do find the post credits scenes in Love and Thunder is good enough setup for the future and would like to see the continuation. I hope that a possible Thor 5 does better than this one and possibly be on bar with Ragnarok. Taika Waititi seems to kinda overstayed his welcome as director, so probably best to get a new director in for Thor 5. I'm alright with him staying as Korg but not as director or writer.

title: I TRULY enjoy 'superhero' movies & TV shows but I only have 1 word for this 1
text: "REFUND!!!" (NOW an afterthought (so yes, more than 1 word).... WOW! That was so **SO** bad! SUCH a disappointment. OMG! OH...MY.... GOD!!!! I cannot believe I wasted 2 hours of my life waiting.... HOPING....(& I'm not religious)...***PRAYING!!!*** that it would pick up....... I guess I can stop now...WHAT A LET DOWN!! I am however SO VERY happy about 1 thing.... IT'S OVER & I can begin my long...my...VERY long road to recovery from being subjected to watching that POS!!! Here's another "P"...PS.... I am 55 years old and I have never,,,EVER in my entire life felt....well...compelled to add my opinion about a movie, TV show or anything...never...ever. But if I can save just ONE person from WASTING....*THEIR* 2 hours then I have done my good...no,,,my EXTREMELY good deed for the day. All joking aside. Do what you want. Make your own decision(s) but if after reading this you still choose to waste YOUR 2 hours, just remember you could have NOT knocked off a couple of years of your life by the AMAZING1, SHEER disappointment you'll surely be experiencing for not heeding this/my warning. (Just wasted ANOTHER 30 minutes on THIS BS. WOW!!ðŸ™„

title: Did not Top Ragnarok
text: This may be the silliest movie in the franchise but is relatively heavy at times. It is very hot or cold with some very cheesy undertones. The plot of this movie can be appreciated because it is not predictable. However, it seemed like some of the humor was overdone and some scenes were cringy.The action scenes were overall pretty awesome. The cast and acting was top shelf. The cinematography was also top notch but there were some tacky wardrobe choices for side characters. The soundtrack selection was fitting but lazy for the most part.Overall this movie tries too hard to be a crowd pleaser. Some early Marvel fans might think Disney's influence over the direction of the Thor saga is blatant and is cheapening the experience. In addition to Multiverse of Madness, Love and Thunder is a good indicator that future MCU films are out with the old and in with the woke new.

title: Thor: Love and Thunder
text:
THOR:
LOVE AND THUNDER7.3 out of 10.00You can take humor too far and it appears that you're trying to be funny. Yikes! That's this flick. Thor: Ragnarok, may be my FAVORITE MCU flick, because it has a nice balance. Love and Thunder, missed that mark. It disappointed me. And I was hyped bias going into it. There are cool elements: It's absolutely a Thor AND mythology flick. Little to no connection to the MCU. That did work for me. The run time is good and it is NOT a bad flick, it's just kinda like, OK, I am a fan, I will see it. But I was not amazed. And THIS flick, should have been AMAZING. The guardians are under used as well. Basically a cameo. So, there are things lost. Bale, may be one of the best villains MCU has served up. His performance was wonderful. If you're not a fan, you can wait till Disney +. If you are a fan, it's in theaters now..

title: Stop it Marvel
text: "Thor: Love and Thunder" hammers its way into theaters with a 6/10 rating, and I must say, it was just okay. Chris Hemsworth and Tessa Thompson deliver charismatic performances, injecting humor and heart into their characters. The film editing keeps the pace lively, balancing action with quirky moments. Its strength lies in its exploration of themes like identity and legacy, and the film certainly doesn't shy away from the over-the-top comic book fun. However, it falters with a somewhat convoluted plot and a sense of dÃ©jÃ  vu from previous Thor installments. The music adds a bombastic flair, and the cinematography captures the fantastical landscapes with vividness. "Thor: Love and Thunder" may not be the most thunderous entry in the Marvel Cinematic Universe, but it delivers a decent dose of cosmic superhero antics for those seeking a fun, if somewhat familiar, adventure.

title: Had potential, but was covered up by jokes
text:
Thor love and thunder, is the fourth installment of the Thor franchise (set in the marvel cinematic universe). It was a fun film to watch, but every time a depressing scene was shown there was a joke right after. It tried to one up Thor ragnorock, with its jokes. This movie should have been simple, with a few jokes here and there, not everywhere. I like this film but it's not as good as I wanted to to be.Expectation:8/10
Reality:6/10It's a good film I recommend watching it. It is not as good as Thor 3 but it's still a good Thor/MCU movie.

title: Worst Thor and Marvel movie
text: Literally the dumbest movie you will ever see. Taika Waititi is an absolute disgrace and must be kept away from Marvel from all costs. He has ruined the Thor franchise completely. I used to think that Thor Ragnarok was a disaster but Thor Love and Thunder has absolutely managed to outclass it and showed us how bad a movie can be. Plot, VFX,3D Animation, acting , dialogues, you name it. It is really surprising that this movie couldn't have a single thing right. It's saddening to see a great actor like Bale be a part of this absolute cesspool of a movie. My deepest condolences for the people who actually went to the theatres to watch this utter nonsense.

title: Two fun hours at the cinema
text: A very colorful movie, with a lot of comedy that entertains, but there are also a lot of fighting and action scenes everywhere. Colorful and very lively, that's how I would define the film. Two fun hours at the cinema.

title: It's pretty good, but I liked Ragnarok more.
text: So I saw Thor Love and Thunder today. It was a good, pretty fun movie. Probably my favorite aspect of the movie are the visuals. It really feels like I was watching a 80s album cover come to life a lot of the times. Other than that, not too much to say. Also, the ending was very interesting. Although, Ragnarok still remains firmly as my favorite Thor movie. Definitely still worth a watch. 7.5/10.

title: It was surprisingly good
text: I did read some not so good reviews, and honestly haven't liked any movie in Phase 4 (except Spidey which is Sony). But, this movie was quite good. Its a nice mix of emotions and fun. Even non-MCU fans will be able to relate. No complexity, just a nice movie.

title: Average Marvel Movie
text:
Spoiler free
Good thing - it question their gods, Christian Bale's acting as always. Relation between thor, mjolnir and stormbreaker. Emotional climax
Bad thing- the movie wasn't serious to its plot and long climax.

title: At least Bale was awesome.
text: I didn't like the fate of one particular character and it's story. The comedy part was a bit to childish, too much, like a grown man went to far or didn't know how to be funny and sometimes not original.Bale was awesome, we want more Gorr. Not enough time for one movie.Still had a great time at the movies with some nice people.

title: Watchable but adds zero to the marvel universe
text: Overall It's a watchable movie, but it really adds nothing to the marvel universe, and makes thor, one of the marvels strongests characters, look pathetic at times.Marvel is losing it's touch.

title: Best comedy movie for this year
text: There is a lot of comedy in this movie, don't miss it because it is worth watching.You can watch the whole movie with a smile it doesn't let you get bored. I can recommend it.The only downside is the plot development or character arc. It was much better or thrilling power if they focused more on the Gorr or action scenes.Gorr backstory is a minute long and the climax (final fight) was..... Not well written.But still good movie.

title: Fun Thor Movie With Decent Story
text: Don't know what's wrong with some of the reviewers, this is pretty fun Thor movie. The action, magic, emotion, good soundtrack and a decent storyline, its all there.Sure some (NOT all) jokes miss their mark, but I still liked this different take.Especially loved Jane's role in this, Bale as Gorr is pretty good too as the antagonist. Both of them have major roles in the movie and do equal justice to their characters.Don't skip watching this just because of some stupid reviewers, this is a pretty good movie with a good message.Trust me, if you love Thor, you'll maybe not love but will really like the movie.

title: Absolutely one of the worst films I have ever seen
text: How this movie ever got made or was released is beyond me. It was absolutely horrendous. There were at least two or three times I wanted to just get up and leave because it was so bad. What a waste of time money in town. AWFUL movie. I would give it a zero or negative rating if I could.

title: Just wait till you see
text: "Thor: Love and Thunder" is more or less a victory lap for all that director Taika Waititi achieved with his previous Marvel film, the often hilarious, rousing, and plainly refreshing "Thor: Ragnarok." And while it has too many familiar flourishes and jokes, this entertaining sequel is still a force for good, with enough visual ambition and heart in front of and behind the camera to stand on its own.

title: Taika Waititi is indeed the egotistical hack you suspect he is
text: As per title. Nothing but Taikas ego and vanity on full display. Doesn't care about prior MCU narratives or how the films "feel".Too busy making everything slapstick comedy like he does with every film he ruins.Dudes a hack who has overstated his welcome if ever there was a welcome to begin with. Christ I hope he never touches Star Wars.

title: THOR FOUR IS TO DIE FOR
text: Okay, maybe not, but it's a hell of a lot of fun. If you liked Ragnarok you'll enjoy, if you're one of the few people that didn't like it because it made Thor "goofy" then you need not bother seeing Love and Thunder because Waititi's excellent sense of humour only flourishes further.I don't want to spoil anything but if you like to have a good time at the movies then this is for you. If you're a sourpuss and want to deprive yourself of a good laugh then perhaps look elsewhere.Oh the film also features amazing action sequences, a killer soundtrack and a whole lotta heart.

title: Korg's storytime
text: Another brilliant movie by Taika Waititi! Korg's retelling of events to children, makes this movie so much fun. Clearly, Taika did his research, and all of the people saying it's too over the top... the joke is on you, it flew right over your head! Try taking another watch, remembering that Korg is narrating the story to children from beginning to end. Don't thank me, thank Taika for being the filmmaker we have all needed, wanted, and loved! I will say while GnR isn't my favorite... it does seem to be Korg's... I'm not sure what other band would've worked, but good for them for getting this 2+ hour music video!

title: Horrible stupid silly script - pathetic Thor
text:
I'm a big fan of Thor and love the prior films but this disaster of a script by Taika is simply pathetic.I went in with an open mind but the sophomoric childish humor and lack of a real story makes it feel like a parody of itself. Poor Thor becomes this silly caricature of the hero and the only person that feels like a real character is Christian Bale who luckily actually acts like a true villain.Imagine a nightmare cross of Guardians of the Galaxy and Dumb and Dumber with a Soap Opera Thor
behaving like a silly fool - and throw in fatty Russell Crowe as a silly Zeus with a hilarious pathetic Greek accent and the topping is 2 large goats with annoying screams.A total train wreck that I had to turn off in the middle because it was intolerable and Taika selection of music gets old fast. And I grew up in the 80s
Eat my hammer Guns n RosesWatch it for the cgi and Christian bale - and for the Children ( yes that is the main crux is saving the children of fantasy Disneyland Askard ha ha ).It makes one wonder what Taika and Disney are smoking these days and what kind of disaster will be created by Taika with Star Wars.1 star because Zero not available.

title: Idiotic, Shallow and Disappointing!
text: Honestly, most actual fans will find this film to be a frustrating disappointment if they are being honest with themselves. It's completely shallow and as badly written as a comic book movie can get. Thor is nothing but a mindless buffoon and for a character of his consequence that is inexcusable. Jane Foster is handled well enough but is also shallow as her story arc is undercut by joke after joke after joke. You can say the same thing about the entire movie itself. It's like the director was required to put a joke a minute into the movie no matter the situation. What results is a shallow mockery that is a notch above Batman and Robin but certainly a low point in the Marvel cinematic universe.

title: Not as good as it should be..
text: While there were parts of this movie i liked, there were also parts i didn't! The jokes was a little too much and i wanted the movie to get a little more dark and serious! I also expected The Guardians to be in the movie a little more! Christian Bale was great as Gorr but underused! Not enough screentime.The romantic plot was mixed. I would say that the movie has a clear directorial style and vision, like Doctor Strange 2. Unfortuanally, like that One, it feels messy. Great soundtrack and it is visiually stunning, but without an engaging plot and characters, it feels hollow.Overalt another Phase 4 movie that you might enjoy, but also forget soon after.

title: Thor always most powerful and never lose a battle
text:
Started off well and the introductions were very nice and cool - a lot of expectations added up seeing them.The history of Gorr was changed and a very tiny backstory for him. Thor life history was narrated very comical and anyone who did not watch the previous 3 movies will understand. In fact any audience without knowing any back story can catch the concept. Mighty Thor or Lady Thor character was nicely used and good weightage for her as well. Zeus part was cool and most funniest. Valkyrie was also filling and the stone character also.Pros I felt:

Mjolnir & Strombreaker

Running time - below 2 hours and I'm frustrated as I wish even a 3 hour movie

Lot of dark scenes - it is minimally visible in theatres
The shadow army is not worthyWhy I cried a lot on cons is because I expected Gorr like a terrific villain and he was just mummified with less preference. Even Thanos who was killing humans had such a built-up and character width - Gorr who kills Gods have just 5 mins of story.However ending was made emotional as always and good leads on the post credit scenes..

title: Disappointing - Worst MCU film yet
text: This was by far the most disappointing MCU movie yet. Too many jokes in the movie that it is just not funny anymore and literally gives you a headache. Disney needs to just go back to normal and abandon their stupid woke agenda and focus on making good quality movies that are worth people's time. Make Disney Great Again!

title: Marvelous marvel movie
text: Thor love and thunder is my favourite film of all time. The action and comedy is awesome. Natalie portman and chris hemsworth are great. It deserves 10. There are many people who are complaining about fun well that is not true. This movie is awesome. Taika waititi made a great work as korg and as the director.

title: Marvel please listen to your level headed fans
text: Dear Marvel,We love you. We really do but this is turning into an abusive relationship. The honeymoon lasted tremendously long and now I'm torn on us. You say it's going to get better but you do nothing but joke joke joke. We want something serious. Something that matters. Something with stakes. There is such a thing as "too much fun." Hire some good writers who aren't afraid to write something different. Something that means something or it may be time for us to go our separate ways.Love,A level headed fan.

title: A huge waste of potential
text: The way this phase has been going, I hadn't had my hopes too high. I'm so glad I didn't.So disappointing, awful plot and the CG when compared to earlier movies like iron man 10+ years ago is just embarrassing.

title: Very good
text: A good movie with a very pop plot and extremely funny characters, you laugh and cry too. Many special effects and many actors in part. Very good movie. Waititi is a guarantee ðŸ‘.

title: Disrespectful to Stan
text: There's no question that Disney or one of its affiliates paid for this films 7/10 rating, and in spite of the countless negative reviews, that rating hasn't changed. This film is atrocious, and an intentional insult to Stan Lee and his legacy. It's literally the equivalent of drawing a mustache on the Mona Lisa because "someone" thinks it's "funny". Film, like all art, is forever, and permant contribution to our culture. Pity Disney didn't consider that prior to releasing this.

title: Please keep Taika Waititi away from the MCU
text: Rule 1: "Don't take the p%^&".Thor has always been a serious character in Marvel. The great thing about the MCU was the way in which they mixed some humour into the life or death business of super-heroing. Think of examples like the back and forth over Captain America admonishing team mates for "language" in Age of Ultron. The opening scenes of Iron Man with Stark's interaction with the soldiers in his Humvee. Even the two-handed scenes between Thor and Hulk in Ragnarok, a movie in which limits were tested. Those limits are over-stepped in Love and Thunder, especially, but not only, in the scenes where Zeus is presented as having the personality of a spoiled kid. We all know that super-heroes are fantastical, but the first rule of super-hero movies should be "Don't take the p%^&".

title: Conveniences, plot armour, forced humour....
text: ...but still kinda enjoyable, personally. There's no build-up for the event or anything. It's so straight-forward. At least they got the theme of the movie right, Love & Thunder. Not enough exposition to care for anyone. I know people hate it, for instance, Eternals. But I loved it. The humour. Some hits some doesn't. Same ol' MCU jokes but over-the-top, in this case. But it was expected since it's a Taika movie. It was great to see Natalie returning, love her. And so was Hemsworth, Tessa & Bale. The acting was great. Visuals, the usual for an MCU movie.
