title: What a stupid mess.
text: After a very promising first 20 minutes the movie falls apart into stupidity. Clearly Jane is on a ramp next to Thor. The height work is laughable. I don't mind the movie being funny but I don't want it to be stupid. This is just stupid.

title: Another enjoyable MCU action/comedy
text: 'Thor: Love and Thunder' (or Thor 4) is a bridge between 'Avengers: Endgame' and 'Guardians of the Galaxy Vol 3' and is not really linked to any of the other recent MCU films/TV shows, but it does a really good job of building on 'Thor: Ragnarok' and the spirit of that film, including making Valkyrie (Thompson) and Korg (Waititi) the two main sidekicks of Thor (Hemsworth, who both ground him and add humour.The plot is based around Gorr (Bale) having a sword that can kill gods, set-up well in the first 10min, and at the same time, Jane (Portman) being back as "The Mighty Thor" and being able to wield Mjolnir. A lot of this is explained in nice quirky montages, courtesy of Korg. There's plenty of great cameos - from a lot of Aussies too, since it was filmed here - but the biggest (not a spoiler) is Russell Crowe as Zeus, who has a semi-important role, and is great.Love & Thunder is very fast-paced, using the soundtrack excellently - especially four Guns N Roses songs - and it's amazing the difference of "the vibe" during/after 'Thor: The Dark World' and 9 years later compared to this film. The black and white scene is excellent, there's plenty of battles and whenever it starts to get too serious, there's some well-placed jokes. The ending seems fitting and leaves you happy to see where Thor's journey takes him.

title: Some of the jokes fall flat but I enjoyed it
text: The overload on humor fell flat. It was overkill. Glad to see Natalie Portman had a bigger part. Good action. Nice pacing. What accent was Russel Crowe putting on? Greek? ðŸ˜† He sounded like a Russian crime kingpin. It was laughable. Overall a good time at the theater.

title: Poignant story ruined by cheap jokes
text: What could have been a poignant story dealing with grief and loss was ruined by too many cheap jokes. Tone it down. Less is more. The soundtrack was underwhelming. Also, Jane deserved better and Natalie Portman is better at drama than comedy. I think the only thing that was good in this movie was Christian Bale. But, because this is a Marvel movie and he's playing a "disposable" villain you already know how this ends without me needing to tell you. For shame. Why does Marvel have the tendency to kill of the three-dimensional villains that are actually interesting? They should keep pumping out complex and flawed villains, same as heroes. Otherwise, what's the point? For us to be bored to death? Mission accomplished. Marvel: Please do better.

title: A great fun, an action packed adventure, the go-to Superhero movie to watch this summer
text: My No Spoilers Review for Thor Love and Thunder1 Christian Bell was phenomenal at his role of Gorr the God Butcher. He carried the movie. For a moment I thought he was playing the Joker. He would've made an amazing Joker. He's such an amazing actor.2 This movie was visually stunning. The VFXs were well made. The fighting sequences were pretty good. VFXs did the heavy lifting. My personal favorite is the fight on the colorless planet that they showed in the trailer.3 They added a lot of story before the classic MCU opening credits. I even thought it was one of the ads the cinema was showing. I would've missed the opening of the movie if I didn't know that Christian Bale was in the movie.4 The movie ended on a high note. It made you excited to see what's coming next. Both easter eggs were meaningful, unlike the second easter egg from Doctor Strange MOM. I'm not gonna talk about the first easter egg since it's gonna be spoilers. The audience were cheering when the second easter egg was out. It was worth the wait.5 It's not until the end of the movie that you'll realize which child they were talking about when they used the "Sweet child of mine" song. Also the meaning of "Love and Thunder". I thought it was a nice touch.6 Personally I think there are too many jokes in the Marvel movies. Sometimes I didn't get the joke and got frustrated, sometimes I enjoyed the jokes, sometimes I didn't.7 The movie took inspiration from two of the best Thor comic books. Jane Foster the Mighty Thor's story and Gorr the God Butcher's story. The main issue is that Gorr didn't get enough screen time. In addition, the character development of Valkyrie and Jane could've done a better job. What's more, the plot was kinda predictable, since I've seen plenty of the Superhero stuff, I could see where they're going with the story, mostly.Final Verdict 8/10. Inspired by two of the best Thor's comics, with stunning VFXs, with an amazing performance by Christian Bale as always, I would strongly recommend this movie. Even though the script could've been better, it doesn't matter. The audience won't care once they've seen the exciting ending and two easter eggs, they would walk out of the theater with a smile on their faces.

title: I like 80's rock, but still...
text: Welcome to the Jungle seemed a little misplaced.Sometimed when I watch a film, and the special effects flash across the screen, there's yelling and plenty of sound effects, I think to myself: "I should check my phone, maybe there's something interesting". This was one of those films.Jokes? Yes, very bad jokes.Action? Sure. Not very engaging.Sentimental? I guess it tried, but I did not cry.The age of superhero movies might not come to an end for the next few decades, and I will probably keep wachting when they arriwe on streaming. But I'm not buying an overpriced ticked to watch them on the big screen.

title: To Much zany not Enough Story
text: Where Ragnarok's humor led to places and felt well placed Love and Thunder was zany for the sake of being zany. It felt like every scene had to have a dose of zany shoved into it because..well it had to be more zany. I think that just because you can doesn't mean you should. And Love And Thunder shouldn't have. The heavy storyline that starts the movie is underwhelmed by the humor that is smashed into the story for what sometimes felts was funny for funny sake. Christian Bale is a massive bright spot in this one and the music is outstanding if you are a Guns and Roses fan. Over all not a bad film but if you have seen one scene with a screaming goat the you have seen them all.

title: The true spirit of the 2020s + Awesome soundtracks
text:
Much as I like to hold yesterday's trends sacred, one ought to keep an open heart to what's happening right now and this is exactly what this movie did.Unchained by a sophisticated plot, writers found room in other areas to give the film some beautiful contemporary colors; the nonsense yet witty scenarios, the crazy yet clever characters, the nothing matters unless the things that matter, on a superspeed run to bring on literally everything there is on the platform; from sassy Zeus to The Game of Thrones inspired chair of a thousand scissors for the rock king!!!For someone obsessed with cinema for a long time seeing these top-tier, old-school actors like Russell Crowe and Cristian Bale in a somewhat different atmosphere is the cherry on top of the cake!Don't forget Matt Damon as fake Loki =)) super hilarious
Lastly my deepest regards to whoever chose Guns N' Roses songs for the movie's soundtrack
"Welcome to the jungle, we got fun and games" ðŸŽµ

title: The movie feels to be very rushed
text: This movie could've been good if it wasn't plagued with pointless, over the top childish and dumb humor that creeps in every 2 minutes and completely ruins the story. After a very promising first 20 minutes the movie falls apart into stupidity. The movie feels to be very rushed. Director is over reliant on unnecessary and childish humor. Also some of the ideas Waititi plays around are fun and enjoyable, such as the 80s inspired rock-costumes and the designs of many aliens. The score and soundtrack are really well implemented. The soundtrack is really good, all the songs are classics that fit the tone and style well but some could have been used better. The only good thing about the movie is the soundtrack.

title: THIS MOVIE SHOULD HAVE A 100% RATING
text: Honestly, if you didn't enjoy Love and Thunder then you either haven't been paying attention or are truly dead inside.This film delivered on every level. First time I've ever cried at the start of a movie. And was then switching between sobs of joy and sorrow until the end. Thank you, sincerely, to anyone that had anything to do with it.A true Marvel offering and a credit to filmmaking. I have created so many accounts just to leave positive reviews. This is what a Marvel film should be like and what a Marvel film can be when it isn't interfered with. Multiverse of Madness suffered because they had to cut so much out of it, this is a beacon of what can be achieved through creatively honouring source material.It has love, it has heart and it certainly has thunder. I cannot recommend it enough. Don't be a dickwad when you go see it, enjoy the experience, open your cold, dead heart to this wonderful film and it will reward you with a deep, emotional, hilarious experience.I truly hope that there are more movies like this. I would generally say that I would love an extended cut, that's certainly the case for MOM, but honestly Love and Thunder was perfect and I don't want them to change a single thing. Taika, Chris, Tessa, Natalie, Christian, Papa Feige and anyone that was a part of this movie, thank you, thank you, thank you from a true MCU fan, thank you!

title: Thor the god of Whining
text: I have to say I loved Ragnarok. There were many great jokes, and i loved Valkyrie.In this movie there was a great threat, an amazing antagonist, the thing with the children, a good Jane foster story arc, and the beautiful Valkyrie. I expected a lot from the movie. But the movei was tarnished with bad jokes, that wasn't even funny, and a whining Thor, who just wanted to "spend a night" alone with his hammer Mjolnir. All the threat, all that happened with Jane in the film, all those amazing characters were just secondary over this whole Mjolnir thing. All the thing became meaningless, like all the good stuff was thrown away to a trash can, and Thor became the God of bad jokes and Whining.Thor was serious for 2 minutes throughout the entire film. Like he didn't even care about all the stuff that's happening. This ruined the serious mood of the film and the threat that was lurking in the universe, as well as Jane's condition too. All the drama just went straight to a trash can.PS: We wanted a lot more Valkyrie... we deserved her, and she deserved a lot more screen time.

title: Doubled Down On What Made Ragnarok So Good... and It Was Too Much
text: Horrible pacing and drawn out, unfunny, overblown jokes ruin some cool aspects of the story. They just took everything good about Ragnarok and blew it up x1000.When you overuse something special... it loses that magic.They really had something great with Christian Bale as Gorr and they squandered it. He SHINES in every single scene, but he is absent for a large portion of the film.The first 20 minutes are a complete waste in my opinion.The biggest culprit is the pacing. It feels every bit like every single idea Taika has left for Thor thrown into one film.Hugely disappointed considering the cast they put together and the talent on and behind the camera.

title: COMEDIC FORCE!
text: One of the most enjoyable MCU romps in a while. I had a good time throughout the film. There is a lot of fun stuff. Waititi is a great directorial and comedy force. But would it make any real difference to the future of the MCU if this film didn't exist? No. Not really.

title: You may finally given into the desperate marketing and give it a pity watch
text: Do not expect anything, if you want to clear your head then you can use the movie as white noice. Make sure you sit far enough from rest of the ppl in hall so that you can browse your mobile in peace.

title: Disappointing...
text: I've only almost walked out on a movie twice. Never did I think a marvel movie would join this list, but this one did. Juvenile writing, obvious gags. Christian Bale was great as always. Other acting was fine, but lackluster. Zero chemistry between Thor and Jane. Even poor sound mixing when Enya is louder than the narrator. Total waste of way too much money.

title: I really wanted to like this movie
text: I'm disappointed. I really wanted to like this movie but the storyline just didn't make sense. It had to many comedic lines that was overkill. It seemed silly at times. I wanted more THOR and less comedy but more villains. Hoping the next movie is better. Stick to what works.

title: Thor Love And Kiddo's
text: This is not Thor Love and Thunder but Thor Love and Kiddo's, this movie was super fun and enjoyable I love the jokes in this movie, the story was good until the kidnapping kids it was kinda weird but ya it's still funny and fun. Love the CGI and the visual effects but the scene when Thor with the guardian of the galaxy it was looks very fake like it was super look like a studio. But if the movie was very fun and enjoyable doesn't mean that the movie was that good. The things I love about this movie it's because the movie was super colorful.

title: Billy Maguire
text: It's so stupid movie, I regret watching this movie. It's a very stupid movie. I regret watching this movie. I advise you not to waste your precious time on this stupid movie.

title: Most Thory Thor that ever Thored.
text: Brilliant follow up to Ragnarok. Let's all be thankful that Taika is directing these great movies because Hemsworth might have hung up his hammer already if they continued making boring Thor movies like 1/2. This movie was full of good action, funny jokes, great character moments and world building. Bring on Thor with Taika for a 3rd.

title: Thor is back!! and even dumber than before!!
text: I had high hopes for this movie, but after watching it, i felt that it didn't really fulfill them. The movie was alright. It was fun to watch but had so many plot holes and tried to be comedic. Thor (who was already dumb in ragnarok) is even more stupid in this film. The only thing that really saved this movie was christian bale's performance.

title: Most boring Thor movie yet.
text: Bad direction. Not the best of Taika Waititi's work. It is visible that his focus on this one was very light and was busy with his other creations. Very weak story, very bad direction and not at all a good Thor movie. Also, during the second half of this movie, I was trying to not to sleep so bad it was so boring. As incredible the Thor Ragnarok was, Thor Love and Thunder is on the opposite.

title: Movie was a good watch nothing too groundbreaking
text:
This is a good movie just to watch when you are bored I'd say Chris and Christian carried this movie but the cast was mostly solid a good portion of the humor gives the film an uneven tone when you go from a super serious scene to a funny scene the movie needed a little bit of time to breathe since it was less than two hours Christian Bale could have been used better and could have been developed more but he was great when he was on screen the evolution of characters was very mediocre has they made Dor into a joke unlike previous films
Overall this was a good lighthearted watch that could have had better writing and better pacing.

title: WOOOOOOW !!! What I Wanted Like An Endings In Thor: Ragnarok It's In Here !!! SUPER FAN MY THOR !!!
text: First, They Showed Us Thor: Love And Thunder's Official Teaser, I Felt Bad, So Bad, Cause The Scenes Were Bad For A Super-Hero Like Thor And I Was Waiting For 4 Years For This, Then... Yes, I Was Shocked. But, In, 05.24.22, ( One Of My Best Days Ever ) The Official Trailer Was Posted In The Whole Internet, I Watched It In The Morning, And I Prefered To Watch It Some Hours Later, Because... You Know, The Morning, Our Mind, And ICE !!!Yee, When I Watched The Featurettes And The Tv Spots, I Don't Really Wanted To Wait, Then This Day Comes, And I'm Glad I Watched THE BEST MOVIE EVER !!! GO WATCH IT GUYS, DON'T TRUST THE BAD REVIEWS OF BAD HUMAINS.

title: Back to simple Marvel
text: It was a strong 7. It was a fun movie and a breath of fresh air to finally move away from the dark and brooding MCU for a bit. No multiverse, and the stakes weren't as universally high as they usually are (although still a really good villain), but it felt great to have an MCU movie like that again. Admittedly, it felt a bit rushed, and there were a few moments here and there that teetered on the brink of parody instead of comedy, but still a solid standalone movie. Lots of laugh-out-loud moments, though, and definitely one worth rewatching multiple times.

title: Passable, But Not Sure What It Wants to Be
text: I came into the movie with such high hopes with Lady Thor and Gorr finally making their debut. But all we got was a tone-deaf mess that never knew when to be funny or serious (and honestly forcing most of the comedy). And not only that, neither Jane nor Gorr got enough time to flesh-out their characters in a more meaningful way and have them just be another throwaway Marvel villain and a disposable side character. And at this point, I'm honestly sick of Valkyrie and Korg since she's just annoying and he's trying way too hard. By the end, I felt the same way the Guardians felt in the movie, sick of Thor and wanting to leave as soon as possible.

title: Just awful. Taika stop making movies. Please.
text: There is too much humour. I didn't even like Ragnarok for the same reason but this one is a disaster where there is not a single serious scene with Thor. Comparing to the original comic book enrages me even more since it's a remarkable piece of art and I blame it all on Taika Waititi for ruining it.

title: One of the worst MCU films
text: I haven't been so bored at the movies in a long time. The movie has very bad and childish jokes (the one about the speaker, the naked thor, duh...) and the story in general is simple and predictableWaititi has become a parody of his own movies.

title: It's funny but aimless
text: The plot is meandering and the characters always go for a laugh even at the expense of character development. Why do all Marvel movies feel so "blah" now?

title: Taika Waititi went the other way and ruined Thor again.
text: Thor Ragnarok was a welcome change to the overly theatrical, Shakespearean Thor. It managed to blend serious story points and dramatic moments with Waititi's sense of humor. It worked because the movie was serious and the consequences were real.However, with Love and Thunder he overdid it so badly that none of the serious moments were given any room to work and everything was a stupid slapstick joke. Since people loved the occasional one-liner from Korg in Ragnarok he is now in every scene and narrates the whole movie. Now, suddenly, he has large amounts of dialogue and it doesn't work. This can be said about most of the movie - the dialogue is lackluster.Natalie Portman's return was a nice welcome but even her part was turned into a joke and something tells me that it was money rather than the quality of the script that brought her back to the franchise.Tessa Thompson played Tessa Thompson in yet another movie and in this one she played the part of the background matte painting of every scene she was in. Zero character progression with zero charisma.Christian Bale was the highlight of this movie but his character felt so disconnected from the whole thing with tone and dialogue that it felt like I was watching two different movies at once.In conclusion, it felt like I was watching a one-off parody of a MCU movie with no ties to the existing story.

title: The movie is too short
text: I felt the movie is too short for the story. The beginning is quite paced,seems they edited it in hurry. Otherwise, the movie's got great cast and the ending is quite nice too. The music and sound can be made alot better as Thor: Ragnarok.

title: MARVELS final goodbye to its fans...
text: After a ridiculous "Eternals" and a, lets say, messed up "Doctor Strange" (What the hell is the character of Charles X. Xavier doing in there?), the other Titles that came out were average at best now this. A Marvel Thor Movie needs a bit more than the right actor and costume. It needs most of all a decent storyline. Well Marvel...Good bye and many thanks for all the great movies of the past. We had a fantastic time. But all good things must come to an end and this is it for Marvel. Keep on making films for Box office revenue only instead of thinking about your fans who made the whole thing possible in the first place. I'm sure the shareholders will thank you. And in the end they'll leave the sinking ship and this will be it for a great piece of American pop culture. Thank God Stan Lee doesn't need to see this any more...

title: Thor is to silly now
text: I'd say it's what I expected but more silly goofy parts then necessary that makes Thor look weak ans can't be taken seriously. Similarly to how Hulk is now.Bale is great in the film and steals each scene he is in. I enjoyed the ending as it is different than most Marvel movies end.

title: Yesss
text: Ive waited so long for a classic marvel movie. So good. Beautiful. Funny and exciting! I must say i think its one of my favourite marvel movies - loyal to the characters and the spirit of marvel. Thank you.

title: Awesome fun seeing favorite characters but rough story execution.
text: There was a ton I enjoyed about the film but there was a fair amount of cringe worthy moments that will be too campy for many viewers. Ragnarok was a slicker film that walked the fine line of being serious and too overly jokey and didnt fall. Love&Thunder has a difficult job not stumbling. Love&Thunder story decisions especially with the children plot elements was tough to digest. Overall a very enjoyable film and if you are an MCU fan. If you enjoy Thor, Jane, and Valkeryie as characters you will enjoy it even if the film doesnt quite reach its full potential.

title: Not garbage
text: This is not garbage like other reviews suggest, as watching garbage is so much more fulfilling than this.I really like the Rangarock and unfortunately this is terrible comparing, seemed like a parody of parody of Thor and Olympians myths.

title: hugh clap for Christian bale
text: Man its scene catcher like marlon brando in god father i cant move my eyes from his face and expression.....good one by marvel after no way home.marvel need actor like chris bale... and Hemsworth is funy and movie is little emotional some times it feals good.

title: Funniest MCU Movie!
text: One of the best films in 4th Phase. If you're not a Taika Waititi / MCU fan, this definitely won't do anything for you, but if you love them I'm sure you will thoroughly enjoy the latest God of Thunder adventure. It's a solid Marvel movie with a lot of humor, but Christian Bale plays the anti-hero who stole the show when he appeared. Chris Hemsworth and Natalie Portman have done their bit very well. Nice Background music too.

title: Only the 2nd film I've ever wanted to walk out of
text: This is by far the most disappointing movie experience of my life. I love Marvel. Except for the Eternals, I've loved every Marvel film, even Thor 2. This film however was an embarrassment and really tough to watch. 15mins in I wanted to walk out but I was in the middle of a row.Thor has become the unfunny village idiot and everyone else just reprised their roles for an easy paycheque. It had so much potential to be epic, especially with Jane coming back in as Thor. But there was zero Marvel magic to it, and her story was completely overlooked and rushed.Bale was the only worthy thing about this monstrosity, but his character and performance were completely wasted.Don't bother seeing it until its free on Disney+, and even then, make sure you're drunk so you don't remember it the next day !!

title: Messy but still watchable
text: It's like Thor Ragnarok had a lovechild with Disaster movie, which then ate 30 metric tons of sugar in one go. Film was quite fun to watch but all over the place in terms of plot and tone. Also an oversaturation of Korg (who I thought was one of the best characters in Ragnarok) barging into the scene with a silly quip made him irritating after 1hr 30minutes of viewing.However, Christian Bale was a very good villain and you can see he was the best actor in this movie by a long way.

title: Different, entertaining and emotional
text: Not the best marvel movie but It was good and entertaining. I didn't like the humour in some scenes because i think didn't match there. Also i was disappointed from Zeus. I was expecting something more exciting with this character. I liked very much the amazing visual effects. The battle scenes with Gor were also good. Christian bale was awesome.In general i enjoyed it. Of course it's not the best movie but it is fun to watch.

title: ugh...
text: I want 2 hours of my life back. This one and Multiverse of madness were somewhat anticipated and they both turned out to be dull, uninspired, cringe as hell and terribly unfunny. A couple entertaining moment in boring and dumb 'story'

title: Undoubtably one of the funniest movies this year
text: I don't believe I have laughed this hard since corona came around. The acting is amazing as expected from such a cast. And the insanity of Taika Waititi comes through greatly in this masterpiece of a super hero comedy. The jokes are so on point, from the over the board goats to Russell Crow's unexpected accent. Waititi manages to surprise us in many ways in every production he does. Thank you so much for reminding me why I love moves. I didn't think once about all the negativity that is surrounding my life right now, while watching this nor for the rest of the evening. Action, comedy, directing, dop, everything was just on point here.

title: Loosing the Marvel feel
text: Christian Bale carried this movie to the finish.A poor comedic script, and directed like a Peewee Herman movie.Overkill with the relationship chat with weapons.Jokey cheesy lines fell from the sky like War Machine.Zeus was a let down.Flamboyant would be the word.Not a Marvel experience.

title: They never seem to learn
text: In all fairness a truer rating would be between 5* and 6*, but it might eventually get there. At this point, I'm very tempted to believe a good percentage of the ratings are not genuine; the comments reflect a much grimmer situation.I'm not even going to comment on the movie itself, but on the approach and wokeness is written everywhere.The world does not need protection from fictional, unreal things. So worry less about how not to offend people and be more inclusive, instead worry about how to encourage and motivate them to overcome their weakness and reach their true potential by reflecting a world that is true and in that world people need protection from wars, viruses, incompetent governments, inflation, raising costs of living and so on.

title: Was Fun ...
text:
Laughed a lot.. This was a totally different experience from marvel . Overall the movie is packed with Love, Emotion mainly and eventhough the action scenes are very less but its a blast
Overall enjoyed
Great Acting by all especially christian bale
Don't Miss both end credits scenes.

title: Disappointed
text: It's hard to watch a film of one of the most powerful superhero , considered a god , was turned into a comedian. I really don't know where in the way Disney got lost with marvel superhero movies and turn them into comedies, if This is the path for the legacy I highly advise Disney to hire Jim Carrey for their next superhero movie.Thor is a mythology god ! The son of lightning! A mighty warrior who saves the universe, and in this movie he is just a clown. The line of the story is not bad at all ! But the focus is just wrong ! Even Russel crow was soooooo bad ! His character is so lame , the mighty Zeus is turned in to a low budget standup comedian by the powerful Maximus decimos meridius, such a disappointment.Highlight : the music is cool ! For me , a xgen, mixing guns and roses to the movie was nice , but in the other hand , I grew up reading comics were Thor was one of the biggest heroes of all time. I guess I will be mad for a while. Hope the next marvel movies don't turn this way! It would be a shame for the franchise.

title: A Complete disappointment - not even a joke anymore
text: Honestly, I don't know where and how to start .I'm a marvel fan, I have watched all of the previous films and series several times, I'm not a newbie to the superhero world . This movie was different. Such a catastrophe for the marvel franchise. There's no plot, writing, directing or special effects ! They cast some of the greatest actors of this and the last decade but they gave them awful scripts and roles , making them terrible. No need to specify about the plot , I do not think that there is one actually. Writing isnt even a thing here ,they probably just improvising some silly sentences. Special effects? More like a copy of an old version of unreal engine . Not even cinematic CGI , with the actors in all fighting scenes to be graphics . I'm really disappointed, not only with the current situation but with myself too . I just spended 2 hours and 10 bucks of my time and money to watch one of the worst movies of the decade . Actors of a high level and huge budget were wasted .If you haven't seen this movie , DO NOT . This was the greatest mistake of mine because I didn't read any of the comments before watching by myself.Also I feel sorry about all this people in the cinema, who where tricked by this money - earning movie system. Goodbye Marvel (and Disney)

title: Great performances save a weak script
text: I don't hate the movie, Taika Waititi really knows how to make a fun and entertaining film. This film is very entertaining, it's full of jokes and excitement, but the pace is little too rush, they could've described some more on the characters development, or little more details to explain some plot point. But instead it was just little rush to fly by some quick explanation while there are many new things introducing in this film.The plot was losing little direction at the second act and the solution of defeating the villain is little too simple and weak...it makes me feeling like playing games of beating the final boss by getting a high level weapon, period.HOWEVER, I'm very impressed to actors/actresses performance where they bring out outstanding performances in here. Christian Bale performance is so amazing even we all have seen many movies of him, but he could still bring out such expressions that you can't find any of his past films. I'm very VERY impressed. Natalie Portman can still bring her great act in here, she's never disappointed. Chris Hemsworth and Tessa Thompson are doing alright, not bad acting, but doesn't bring out anything interesting. Chris has better performance on his last Thor film than this.In the end, this is still a good entertaining film, but it's little waste not to develop something more complicated plots instead just too simple. I probably rate this film 7/10, but because of the impressive performance from Christian Bale, I would rate it 7.5/10.

title: A basic Taika Waititi movie.
text: Taika Waititi does what he does best. Takes a couple of serious topics amd wraps it in comedy to lighter the mood. All tho the movie is good. It does real rushed at some point. At some it was even underwhelming.The performance by the main cast did not disapoint in any way with the two standouts being Christian Bale and Natalie Portman.You will always get atleast 110% from Christian Bale and this time is no different. Bale steal every quiet scene he is in, and manages to connect the audience with his charector in a very short time.We get a new side from Natalie portmans Jane Foster. The Jane Foster we get is both tough but also vulnerable. Just like Christian Bale, Natalie shines in her quiet and emotional scenes.

title: A Silly Mess of a Film
text: After the refreshingly funny & heartfelt Ragnarok, this one is a massive letdown. Unfunny Jokes took center stage and every Character Development & emotionally deep moments were ruined by stupid comedy. Great characters like Korg & Valkyrie, even Guardians were utterly wasted. Christian Bale plays a really intriguing Antagonist but he is hardly seen doing anything in the film. Chris & Natalie have never had any meaningful chemistry, so the whole plotline falls flat. CGI is shockingly awful. The only time you feel something is in the climax but thats just too late. A rushed, unfunny mess of a film.

title: A fun parody.
text: This film felt like a parody to me... there were things I did enjoy; however, it was a mess. This was probably the choppiest Marvel Movie I've ever watched. It feels like Taika had a bunch of random scenes filmed and then later in the editing room put a blindfold on and pinned the tail on the donkey to choose which ones they kept in. I wish we saw more with Gorr the god butcher. Christian Bales performance was absolutely outstanding. Altogether, I think this movie was okay. It's a movie for the mass, to please everybody. Nothing about it is groundbreaking in the world of film and cinema. At least kids will now have a cool Thor skin to play with in Fortnite. This was definitely made for kids/ adults with low attention spans.

title: Updated opinion on second viewing
text: When I first watched this in the theatre I was disappointed. I loved Taika Waititi's take on Thor in Ragnarok, feeling it was the perfect blend of comedy and serious and was looking forward to L&T as a follow up.I was disappointed at how goofy Thor was made to be, and it seemed to rely too heavily on that goofiness, and toward the humour rather than a careful balance.On rewatch though I realized that most of the goofiness came from Korg's version of the story. When we hear Korg as an active narrator, Thor is this two dimension version of himself whose heroics are described as Korg understand heroics.Arguably, the entire movie is from Korg's point of view, however I think we slipped back and forth from being viewers of Korg telling a story, to viewers of events as they happen. Thor is a bit of a lunkhead at times, and as we expect him to be at other times, and those are the key moments of change between listening to the story vs watching the story unfold.Outside of those moments, the movie has the same balance as Ragnarok does which was easy to enjoy once that distinction had been set. Why I missed it on first viewing I can't possibly say.Yes there are a couple of scenes that had a little too much silliness injected (i.e. Zeus prancing down the stairs seemed to be an odd humorous choice in the scene), but these were few enough to ignore.I also remember being disappointed with Gorr, and yet even though most of what he was up to was off screen, when he was on he was much more frightening than I'd given credit for first time around.I don't think I gave it more forgiveness the second viewing, just saw it with eyes with more understanding on where the silliness came from. Is it Marvel's best film? No where near, but it definitely lacked the disappointment I felt on first viewing.TLDR: watch this movie with the understanding that when you hear Korg narrating, it's going to be a sillier scene than when he isn't.

title: Sub par for something not straight to Disney plus
text: For those wanting the magic of Thor Ragnorok this movie falls short. Without the supporting ensemble of The Hulk and Loki from Ragnarok, this movie failed to fill their shoes. Christian Bale's superior acting couldn't "Bale" them out of being tied for the worst Thor movie ( The Dark world). Jane Fosters reappearance has reassured why I didn't miss her in the previous movie. If the producer wanted another lead comedy/ action movie star, another leading lady should have been folded into the mix. Can someone tell me if Chris Hemsworth is over or under acting? His performance is on same level as in the forgettable Ghostbusters or Men in Black movies. Just the same recipe, getting bland.

title: Something went horribly wrong
text: Bad jokes, bad pacing, bad characters, bad soundtrack (literally 3 from a single artist, with one playing at least twice on its own), bad references, all equal a bad time.I absolutely loved thor 3 it gave the character a serious boost, and I was absolutely ecstatic to see what they could do with his new lease on life.What they did was make the (somehow) worst thor movie yet. Yes. Its worse than the dark world.I dont know what happened, everything was too short, massive decisions made no sense at all, there was an absolute hampering of the quality of this film to make it the shortest mcu film to date.I love taika waititi, i loved his vision for thor in 2017, but for me this was a total bust and it was unbelievably disappointing. Hopefully he can find his mojo again soon.

title: Not bad as people saying.
text: It's not that bad as critics and other people said. The performances and the light atmosphere were very good. If there's a little negative thing to say is that they should have made it more serious in some parts.

title: Thor: Love and Thunder Review
text: Marvel has been doing pretty rough lately concerning phase four, and with Thor: Love and Thunder, it stays consistent with that sentence.I found the movie to be lacking in terms of concluding the character's arc and pretty unmemorable for what it's worth. The comedy was much more amplified (most of the comedy didn't even stick for me) and felt incredibly awkward.There are good things about the movie, like Gorr, who I enjoyed throughly with what screen time he did have. And I found Jane Foster's story to be pretty interesting and more enticing than what we were being presented.Chris Hemsworth was great as Thor, but the writing given to his character is a huge disservice to what was supposed to be his "passing of the torch", and it's a huge let down. They almost stupefied his character to the point that it's a parody of who Thor is.The rest of the movie was ok at best, serviceable and somewhat fun but I wouldn't really go as far as to say it's the saving grace of phase four. I think at this point, us Marvel fans, are going to be hurting for some quality films from the studio until they can get things situated and planned out better. Because as of right now, there's not much hope for the future of the MCU.

title: Fun with a giant but
text: I hate the forced multiculturalism of the Thor franchise, particularly with a Norse god and his home. So yeah, with a heavy dose of a totally useless "Valkyrie" and the always "should live in Wakanda" Heimdall, you have to try really hard to get past it.If you can, this isn't a bad movie. The Jane as Thor was better explained than I thought it would, great to see Darcy, if only for a minute, and Helmsworth was great as usual. Christian Bale was awesome and interesting to see them weave in Greek mythology too, but I'm guessing if they go very far with that, I'm sure half the Greek gods will end up sassy black people as well.Some people correctly criticise that there's too much humour in this movie, but it calms down after a bit. At first I thought the movie is was going to play out like a satire of Thor, but like I said, they reign it in after a while.All in all it's worth watching - you have to take it for what it is, a dumb fantasy movie, no more no less.

title: the comic book look
text: Greetings again from the darkness. With a steady stream of Marvel movies and TV serials, maintaining coherent and connected storylines has become challenging. In fact, it's probably best if fans take these at face value, rather struggling to connect the dots, only to end up frustrated. Perhaps no one understands this better than Taika Waititi, the director behind what many (including me) consider the best MCU film, THOR: RAGNAROK (2017). Waititi and co-writer Jennifer Kaytin Robinson once again embrace the blend of quick quip comedy and expected action sequences, supplemented this time a love story.The pre-opening credits sequence provides the backstory for the film's villain, Gorr the God Butcher, played by Oscar winner Christian Bale. Gorr has spent a lifetime worshipping the Sun God, only to realize his worshipping has occurred in an actual God-forsaken world that costs him dearly. Gorr ends up learning the lesson of 'never meet your heroes', and this confrontation gives him the power and curse of the Necrosword, and sets him on a revenge mission to kill all Gods. We have to respect a villain who has a legitimate claim to his mission - it's not just a thirst for world domination. Gorr wants the Gods to pay for their ambivalence.We then pick up Thor Odinson (Chris Hemsworth) as he has been fighting with the Guardians of the Galaxy since the end of AVENGERS: ENDGAME (2019). With no shortage of characters who excel in comedy, this sequence shifts us into laughter and light-hearted mode after the bleak Gorr opening. It's this pacing that holds for most of the movie ... Waititi never lets things stay too serious for very long. Soon, Thor splits off from the Guardians, as he returns to New Asgard, being run by King Valkyrie (Tessa Thompson). Now based on Earth, New Asgard is a theme park and tourist attraction. One of the features is the theater acting group we've seen previously, and this time Matt Damon, Luke Hemsworth, and Sam Neill are joined by Melissa McCarthy as Hela. While this is going on, we learn Thor's old flame, astrophysicist Jane Foster (Oscar winner Natalie Portman) is now an author being treated for Stage 4 cancer. A trip to New Asgard provides her strength as the shattered Mjolnir hammer magically re-forms in her presence. Jane's story boils down to whether she wants to try to extend her life through science or live every remaining day to it's fullest.Gorr kidnaps the Asgardian kids, forcing Thor, Valkyrie, Korg (voiced again by Waititi), and Mighty Thor/Jane Foster to track him to the Realm of Shadows. Their plan is to stop by Omnipotence City to request assistance from the almighty Zeus (Russell Crowe). They are shocked to discover that Zeus is little more than a colorful televangelist with a Borat accent performing a whiz-bang show so that he can get on to the next orgy. Zeus refuses to assist with an army, but he does manage to chain Thor and strip him nekkid centerstage. The good guys nab Zeus' golden lightning bolt and head off to rescue the kids and confront Gorr.In a reverse Wizard of Oz twist, the films turns to Black & White when they reach the Realm of Shadows. It's an eerie environment befitting Gorr. Bale is certainly at his best when he is terrifying and menacing, although the writing is a bit inconsistent for the character, and sometimes it drifts into Pennywise mode, a definite drop in suspense. The action sequences are fine, but really nothing we haven't seen before. And that's probably the biggest issue with all superhero/comic book stories these days. Anything new must come from the story or the characters, and we know the characters far too well at this point.Waititi's version delivers many laughs throughout. Among the best is the odd relationship between Thor and his hammer Mjolnir and his axe Stormbreaker. Thor's jealousy of his ex-hammer hooking up with his ex-girlfriend is almost as funny as Stormbreaker's jealousy of Thor trying to steal back the hammer. Also cool is Thor's homage to Jean-Claude Van Damme, and the look of the Altar of Eternity, where one last wish is granted. Maybe not as effective is the apparent Guns 'n Roses fetish or Jane's struggle to come up with a catchphrase. Sure to be a divisive element is the recurring gag of bleating goats ... I found them hilarious, but many won't. Another piece that simply didn't work for me is Ms. Portman's performance, especially in the scenes with Hemsworth. Her comic timing can't match his, and it's a match that just never clicks.Obviously, the characters originated from the minds of Stan Lee and Jason Aaron in Marvel Comics, and it's Taika Waititi who brings his unique touch to the project. Since he directed THOR: RAGNAROK, he won a screenplay Oscar for JOJO RABBIT (2019), and I've been a fan of his style dating back to EAGLE VS SHARK (2007), and on to the brilliant HUNT FOR THE WILDERPEOPLE (2016), and TV series "What We Do in the Shadows". Waititi is scheduled to direct a Star Wars movie in the near future - one surely to be divisive among that fan base. As for this latest Thor movie, it may be tonally jagged and have a few too many zippy quips for some, but it manages to be silly and tender and emotional, while having the look and feel of a comic book come to life. Stay for the two end-credit scenes.Opening in theaters on July 8, 2022 (Thorsday)

title: I cant believe how people are so critique with this movie, but not with MOM
text: It was an awsome movie. Like all Thor movies, it was a comedy combined with his road to become a better person and the understanding of himselfe and his place in the universe. It wasn't boring at all.The film deserves a grade of 8 to 9, but I will give it a grade of 10 only for the people who give it a grade of 1. I'm sorry that people don't understand something well done and don't realize the direction of all the Thor movies so far.What makes me mad is that people give to this movie number 1 rating or 2 becouse it was a comedy or it was funny or i dont know what got into them, when to MOM they give rating 10 just because it was made by Sam Raimi. Sad...

title: Lovely and thunderous
text: Gorr finds that his god refuses to save his daughter, doesn't care that the rest of his people are dead, and only cares about himself. So it is no wonder that he grabs the Necrosword and vows to kill all deities. Christian Bale gives his best performance since American Psycho, and at the risk of being blasphemous, I believe it's actually even better than that one. No, really. For more than two decades, I didn't think that would ever happen. While he has too little screen time, he's probably the best thing about the entire film.For one thing, while all of the action looks cool, it's only when he's involved that we feel any sense of danger. And another, he manages to tear the movie out of the rut it's otherwise stuck in, of humor that is marred by an insistence on being a constant throughout the running time, and the feeling that the talented cast, like in Thor 3, are trying desperately to outdo one another, all of the time. I realise that not everybody thinks the romantic comedy aspect works. Personally I thought it was great. You can tell that these are people who can act, who enjoy working together, who share immense chemistry, and who have shared a lot of screen time by now.This features a lot of risque references, a little strong language and brief nudity. I recommend this to big fans of Ragnarok. 7/10.

title: Disney/Kevin Feige/Marvel Please Wake Up!
text: Simply put Thor Love & Thunder is an incredibly bad movie. The CGI is over the top, the writing & storyline is incoherent, there are too many forced jokes, the chemistry between the actors is non existent, and there is cringy forced messaging.Disney, Marvel and Kevin Feige need to wake up, because they are destroying their characters and the MCU as a whole. Whatever goodwill they had with the Infinity Saga is gone. After watching this movie I felt they stole my money.Marvel needs to level set and get back to the basics when conceptualizing & producing their movies. They have the potential to be great, but at this point Disney/Marvel is just a movie mill to get content out there. Total lack of quality.

title: Wow wow wow
text: Im disgusted by these 2s and 3s reviews. This movie was straight up awesome. It was funny, adventurous, packed with action and just amazing. Taika waititi and chris hemsworth delivered again.Why i have given this an 8 and not a 9/10 is of three reasons only, the film went way to fast and the action felt a little to comedic. And ragnarok was better.Overall awesome movie no doubt i laughed so much.

title: Hot. Steaming. Pile of garbage.
text: Ah dear.a complete eyesore earsore gutsore.Everywhere hurts.Why does every franchise that was once good and with direction have to take a nose dive and explode into flames.

title: Highlights A Problem with the Whole MCU Project
text: After 'End Game' essentially drew a line under 'Phase 1' any subsequent movie featuring those characters, really is just a frippery, or worse, a cash grab.This movie underlines that sentiment to the extreme.Yes, fun and colourful but doesn't really add much, if anything,

title: What's not to love?
text: Like Ragnarok, this Thor outing is yet again the comic book come to life on the silver screen. It's cheesy, it's corny, it's colorful, it's lighthearted & completely over the top...hey, it's Thor, baby. You want an Oscar caliber movie then go see The Dark Knight. This hits all the right notes. Chris as Thor is more jacked than ever. Jane as lady-Thor surprisingly worked for me. Christian did all he could w/a lame, generic villain. Tessa stole every scene she was in. So, Thor has 4 solo movies now...I better see Enchantress AND Beta Ray Bill next time! No excuses! Oh, great music choices as well.

title: Enjoyable
text: Christian Bale was excellent and the rest of the cast did a good job. Lots of action and comedy. But geez Disney did you have to put in the story about Korgs being made by two dads?? My 8 year old nephew asked me how two men could make a baby. I mean was that really essential to the story??

title: Two Words..........
text: This film is completely the definition of writer clash. You have Taika's comedy and quirks that make his films stand out while the other writer has a serious sense. The God Butcher seems like such a serious bad guy and they don't treat him like that. Russell Crowe was weird in that film. But the comedy was funny, the characters all likeable, and the action was decent. Overall its a film with a writers clash very visibly and has its issues. But it sill has fun.

title: Disappointment
text: I was all hyped when this movie was announced because at that time I was all into marvel, binge watched all marvel movie and YouTube video about those movies and comics. Two comics I particularly remember was that about Gorr and Jane becoming Thor. I was all interested in that. Even I had hope until the trailer showed up but when I saw the movie I got only disappointment. This has to be a worst movie I ever saw, the writers don't respect the previous mcu movie, source material or even their own fans, what a shame!

title: Too short backstory Backstory

Too much comedy was not necessarily required. Korg was waste. Bale, portman, thor, valkiry great. Story seems below average. They made Zeus joke. They should have done betterOverall not bad.

title: "Love and Thunder" could have been great, but weaknesses prevent that
text: Yesterday evening I watched "Thor - Love and Thunder" in the cinema. Here is my personal impression of the movie (minimal spoilers to the initial situation of the story).Briefly to the initial situation of the story (minimal spoilers to the first 15 minutes)The opening scene shows Christian Bale as Gorr in a dry desert on an alien planet together with his little daughter. Both lack water and Gorr prays to his god to give water to his little daughter, which of course is not heard. More I do not betray at this point.The plot around Thor begins at the point where Endgame ends: the Guardians of the Galaxy go on an adventure journey into space together with Thor and Korg. Unfortunately, this is only touched on at the beginning for the first ten minutes, until Thor and Korg say goodbye to Guardians to pursue their own goals, namely to follow a distress signal from Lady Sif, who speaks of a "Godslayer." At that moment, a rather adventurous (but also often silly) journey through space begins.Plot / Storytelling / PacingThe plot is very exciting and interesting from the starting point. I was hooked from the first second, which was due to the brilliant opening scene that grabbed me emotionally right away. Unfortunately, however, director Taika Waititi gives the plot too little time and scope to fully unfold. The same goes for the characters. There are a tremendous number of exciting and interesting character moments and developments, but unfortunately a lot of things are dealt with too quickly or even off-screen, e.g. The "emergence" of Mighty Thor, which is a shame. The same problem has already "Thor - Ragnarok". Waititi is simply not the right director or he wants too much and then makes it only half but nothing whole.Another problem, at least for me, is the exuberant humor and the extreme gag density, of which unfortunately only half really ignite for me. Many gags and moments are genuinely funny and made the whole cinema laugh, but again many other gags hardly struck a chord with anyone in the auditorium. Also, too many gags often destroy great and emotional moments of action. Why is that, Mr. Waititi?Overall, a much lower gag density would have done the film a lot of good, as well as a 30-minute longer running time to give the characters, their developments and especially the plot more time to unfold.Actors / CharactersThor is of course great as always and I just like him as a hero a lot. Chris Hemsworth simply IS Thor. This role is tailor-made for him. Unfortunately, Waititi makes him a joke in some scenes. Of course, Thor has always had humor, but this was in Thor 1 & 2 and also in Avengers 1 & 2 never exaggerated or inappropriate, but was used skillfully. Here, on the other hand, he constantly cracks jokes or he lacks for his age (1,500 years) far too often the words or he is "babbling". You just don't know this from him in such an extreme way from the first films. It's as if he sometimes lost his ego, only to find it again in the next moment, only to lose it again afterwards. Why is that? It disrupts the flow of the plot and his development tremendously.Korg, as always, is rather THE jokester par excellence, which I don't really like. I would have gladly done without the character. Korg adds nothing to the plot and he is not important at all. He's seemingly just there to give Waititi an appearance in the film.Seeing Jane Foster again is really great. And Natalie Portman's performance is better than ever. She plays convincingly and has really worked out really hard. Suits her and in the role of "Mighty Thor" I like to see her. The name though is just ridiculous. Her name is JANE! And Thor is called Thor! MjÃ¶lnir has nothing to do with that at all. Why can't she just be called "Mighty Jane"?It's also great to finally see Lady Sif again. It's just a pity that it's only a very small appearance again. I would have liked to see Thor and her talk it out, since they haven't seen each other for years.Zeus is again completely different than I had imagined him. And unfortunately his appearance is much too short.Gorr, however, is the absolute highlight of the film. Christian Bale plays the role absolutely great and steals the show from everyone else. And what I find particularly good is the rather horror-like way in which his scenes and he himself come across. It gives you goosebumps, or at least it gave me goosebumps. I really like the fact that Gorr is also a very ambivalent and charismatic character.Here we really have one of the best antagonists of the entire MCU. Unfortunately, we see far too little of him. If you already have such a strength to show, why not show more of him and give him even more space and screentime to develop? Once again, I can only say that Waititi has simply not shown a good hand for the plot and the duration of the film. It can simply be done better.Overall, all the characters are great again, but unfortunately Waititi doesn't know how to make and get more out of them. He has the right ideas, but implements them far too clumsily and hectically.CGI Animations / Action ScenesThe action scenes have been varied and well staged. There aren't any action scenes that made my jaw drop, but they're certainly respectable and varied, especially when Thor and Jane fight together.The quality of the visual effects (CGI) are at the highest level, as they were in Eternals, Guardians of the Galaxy or Captain Marvel. Top-notch. I've noticed that the visual effects from "Industrial Light & Magic (ILM)" are always a lot better than those from other effects studios. Every time CGI quality didn't convince me that much, "ILM" was also missing in the credits. In any case, really great and very successful.Camera / Coloring / Scenery / EditingI liked the camera work. You always had a good overview of the action during fights and they were skillfully staged. But also apart from that the shots and scenery are sometimes really beautiful. It was also worked a lot with total shots, which I always find great. I also find the color scheme of the film fantastic, which covers everything from brightly colored to dirty and gloomy to black and white. I also love the contrasts, which are often a real eye-catcher. I'm curious to see how it looks on my OLED TV with Dolby Vision. That will certainly be a mega sight. There's a lot of variety for the eye here.MusicThe soundtrack is okay and sometimes pretty cool. Unfortunately, not every piece can convince me and thus the music leaves a split footprint in my ears.ConclusionAs with "Ragnarok", "Love and Thunder" has the same weaknesses: The too hectic plot, too little character development and the far too high and often unfunny gag density. The film doesn't take itself seriously enough, especially Thor as a character is a bit too intentional for me here, but not skillfully funny. Thor is no longer the Thor from Thor 1 & 2 and Avengers 1 & 2, who took himself more seriously and who also talked less nonsense. Gorr as the ambivalent antagonist, however, is just perfectly cast with Christian Bale and, when he does show up, easily takes every scene for himself. I would have liked to see more of him. "Love and Thunder" could have easily used 30 to 40 minutes more running time, which could have been used to not let many actions happen "off-screen" and to give the characters and the plot more opportunities to develop and evolve.Overall, however, I came away from the cinema extremely satisfied despite the weaknesses. I'm already looking forward to the second viewing and would rate the rewatch value as high. However, I can't completely ignore the weaknesses, because they make the film enjoyable again and again. Without the weaknesses, I would have easily given it the highest score. I look forward to the already announced sequel and hope that then again another director may turn it, who does not make such a silly comedy.8/10 points - High rewatch value.

title: SO much potential, such average execution.
text: A small part of the MCU magic is captured, but it's a very small part. WAY too many attempts at jokes and complete inconsistency about the vibe of the movie. The balance between action, love, and jokes is weird and just feels off. A couple of scattered, random LGBTQ references that feel forced and are awkward, regardless of one's opinions on the matter. The action scenes are good and have the classic marvel feel, but they are scarce. Bale's character was great, but was also scarce. Could've been amazing, but was sadly average.

title: Made my day
text:
I just enjoyed it fully cz after watching dr Strange i lost my all hope from mcu movies
Hopefully it didn't disappoint me at all
Everyone should watch this if you are a mcu fan or not
It's action emotion and comedy awesome
Just little irrigation which bother me much that the little Asgardian scene's it's like so much melodrama for me although the villain is not powerful as much as hela.

title: Fun ride and visual treat
text: Doesn't take itself seriously at all. Completely free to do whatever it wants.I had low expectations because I read a few average reviews, but happy to find a very entertaining and spectacular ride. With all the stress and division in the world, it's good to let loose with a movie like this.We've seen so much Thor and Marvel characters, so it makes sense to just open things up and have a jam, so to speak. Play with characters, jump around in the sandpit of the Marvel universe and have some fun.That's what this is about. Fun. Over the top thrills. Escapism from the real world of wars, politics and sinking economies. Thor is great and really holds it together, and a few surprises thrown in.I really can't understand some of the grumpy reviews, this is the good stuff.

title: Shallow. A Lack of Depth
text: Overall, the movie fell flat for me. I watched Ragnarok before seeking Love and Thunder. I laughed all the way through. Unfortunately, the magic did not carry forward. There was nothing new in this movie. Aside from Jane becoming a Thor. Though, that story was not told well. It was the more interesting of the stories and it got very little exposition. Everything else was regurgitated from movies past, and done in a very slapstick way. Ultimately, I was not entertained by this movie.

title: Really a Blow to the Thor Brand
text: Actually I wish I had not gone to see it ... it was cheesy and very disappointing. It was like a spoof on itself. Compared to the previous films on Thor it was literally insulting like we were being punked for both watching it and spending money to see it.... I wish we could have gotten a refund. It really hurt the Thor brand.

title: Weird acting..:
text: I felt the whole time I was watching an extended Saturday Night Live skit.The film was really funny, but I felt it went way too far into unnecessary gags at the cost of the characters believability.They made Thor too dumb and as a result it was hard to buy into any real sense of risk or danger for the characters. They seemed to be laughing their way through a crisis so as an audience it was hard to care.Thor is my favourite MCU character, it's a shame they're taking away his depth for a cheap laugh.

title: It's like a bad parody of Ragnarok
text: It is what Austin Powers 3 is to Austin Powers 2. It's okayyyy, but on the heels of Ragnarok being so good, Love and Thunder is very disappointing.The Actors deserved a better script... particularly Natalie Portman and Christian Bale whose talents were noticeably wasted.

title: It should be rated G.
text: Love and Thunder is a reminder to all that the comic book properties have been bought and owened by Mickey. Warning. Don't expect a film with challenging drama, an intriguing story, nor innovation in practical effects like DC films from MCU films.

title: Little bit okay !
text:
From the starting the movie felt rushed,
Everything was too quick, maybe they could've increased the runtime plus the Guardians was barely in the movie
Atleast a post credit abt them would've been fine
I can say they end quite well, that Thor got someone who he was looking for but can't say they did good with Christian Bale.

title: No Stakes/Too Much Comedy
text:
I can't lie and say I wasn't entertained. This movie is visually appealing and is light hearted.Now let's get to the negative...
They wasted one of the best villains in marvel comics. From the design of the character possesses originally to the least amount of screen time I think I've seen for a villain. Gorr was butchered period ended of story.TOO MUCH COMEDY
I thought marvel would have learned from Guardians Vol.2 not to over for it, but I was wrong. This film may as well be listed as a parody comedy film. Sad to say.Ragnarok was lightning in a bottle. Thor should have a thicker serious tone in my opinion. I have full confidence his next movie will be much better.

title: Skip this movie
text: There is lots of things missing in this movie, but for me the main dealbreakers are the massive amount of cheesy oneliners that get thrown around in lack of a cohorent script. To cover this up there is an equally massive amount of 80s/90s nostalgia which gets dull quick. There are too many bad jokes that could've been acceptable if they would've been used once but they get dragged througout the entire movie...On the plus side it should be noted that Christian Bale could play a stale piece of Toast and still deliver an award winning performance.

title: A solid adventure that both satisfies and saddens
text: "Thor: Love and Thunder" is the 29th film in the Marvel Cinematic Universe and the fourth solo film to focus around the Marvel superhero Thor. Directed and co-written by Taika Waititi ("Thor: Ragnarok", "Jojo Rabbit") and again starring Chris Hemsworth in the lead role, it continues the God of Thunder's journey throughout the universe in a solid adventure that both satisfies and saddens.After the events of "Avengers: Endgame", Thor (Chris Hemsworth) has been in outer space with the Guardians of the Galaxy, visiting distant planets to help out their inhabitants with any problems they are facing. Some time later, Thor is forced to part way with the Guardians after he receives an emergency signal from New Asgard back on Earth. Upon arriving home, Thor is informed that a being known as Gorr the God Butcher (Christian Bale) has come into possession of the god-murdering Necrosword and intends to wipe out all gods from existence, with the citizens of New Asgard next on his hit list. With this new danger looming, Thor hurriedly recruits his associates Valkyrie (Tessa Thompson), Korg (Taika Waititi), and his old flame Jane Foster (Natalie Portman), the latter of whom has taken up the mantle of "Mighty Thor", to stop Gorr from his deicidal killing spree.Since he was first introduced into the MCU back in 2011, Thor's solo films have been, to put it mildly, a mixed bag. The first two struggled to find a harmonious tone, with an inconsistent blend of out-of-place comedy and unnecessarily dark moments preventing them from becoming memorable additions to the ever-expanding Marvel Cinematic Universe. In fact, if it weren't for the amusing antics of Loki (Tom Hiddleston), I assume most people would skip these two films without a second thought. All of this was rectified in 2017 with "Thor: Ragnarok" finally striking the right balance between humorous and serious themes, all of which can be traced back to the involvement of Taika Waititi. All of that remains here in "Thor: Love and Thunder", as it thankfully continues everything that made its predecessor such a great inclusion to the MCU.Though it doesn't deviate too much from the previous film in terms of tone, this one still retains the same amount of fun and energy that all the MCU fans crave. Here, we get to see Thor as a more upbeat character, who has worked through many of his personal insecurities that were holding him back following his fight with Thanos years ago. He is more optimistic and sure of himself, and despite causing the occasional collateral damage like most superheroes, he always finds ways to make up for it (or at the very least TRIES to).I like how over the course of three prior solo outings and four "Avengers" films, Thor has since developed some of the most relatable humanistic traits in the whole MCU, which is interesting considering the character is supposed to be a perfect god. We've seen him go through a wide range of personality changes, from self-important deity, humbled defender of Earth, depressed wreck haunted by his mistakes, and now a man contemplating what his future might bring. But it is in the latter example we see Thor delve deep into what is arguably the most important emotion of all: Love.Considering the film has the word "Love" in its title, it stands to reason that it will be the overarching theme its main character will grapple with. Long time MCU fans will remember Thor's original love interest Jane Foster, the astrophysicist from the first two movies whose belief in a scientific explanation for everything is shattered when she meets the God of Thunder for the first time. Though the two seemed to hit it off at first, certain factors prevented the pair from going any further, leading to their break-up and, in turn, her not appearing in the third film.Foster returns here with a vengeance as she makes up for her absence with her new identity as "Mighty Thor". Watching as Thor tries to comprehend the sight of his ex-girlfriend donning not only similar attire to him but also using a repaired version of his old hammer Mjolnir provided some amusing comic relief upon their reunion and the way he handles this situation shows how far he has come as a character. He now truly feels a love for someone unlike anything he has felt previously, allowing the story to take their relationship to levels not seen before.In addition to implementing all of these new romantic elements, director Taika Waititi also uses his eye for visual detail to the film's advantage. He shows us brightly coloured locations such as the Omnipotent City, a sprawling metropolis populated by various other gods, including Zeus himself (played by Russell Crowe). Waititi uses this place in particular to show how these gods all have different attitudes to what their titles may suggest. For instance, some of these gods actually care about the well-being of the less fortunate while others just find their positions nothing more than a burden. These moments allow for some quirky universe-building that only a film set in the MCU could properly pull off.But it's not all vibrant environments we get to see. There's also the Shadow Realm, a sinister place lit only by the colours of black and white. When our heroes arrive at this menacing location, the film starts to resemble those classic colourless feature films, tapping into that old school feeling of people exploring somewhere frightening. The movie's antagonist Gorr appropriately considers this place home and his dark intentions suit it to a tee. The way in which Waititi is able to balance these two polar opposite locations alongside one another is testament to his talent as a filmmaker and goes to show that his presence among the MCU staff is a welcome one.Returning to the role after a three-year absence, Chris Hemsworth demonstrates how much he has evolved alongside Thor as a character, going from a stoic overpowered god to a fun-loving hero not afraid to show his sensitive side. Hemsworth uses his signature Aussie larrikin likeability to bring out the amusement factor that makes what I call the "Waititi-era" Thor a more endearing hero than when he was first introduced. His scenes with Natalie Portman as Jane Foster had a believable warmth to them, which is surprising since I always thought they lacked chemistry with one another in the first two films. I guess it was simply poor writing in those movies because with the way the pair interact here you'd swear their relationship always had this much of a spark to it. With that in mind, Portman is clearly enjoying herself more this time, considering she has a more physical role in the story than before. It's nice to see her occasionally one-up her co-star during the film's action scenes as she manages to hold her own when the going gets tough.I also think Christian Bale did a good job as the film's main villain Gorr, a man hell-bent on causing the extinction of all gods. Knowing how talented an actor Bale is, it was nice to see him provide the character with more dimension than your typical MCU antagonist. Without venturing into spoiler territory, Gorr's backstory is shown to be quite tragic, immediately clueing the audience into why he is on this genocidal crusade in the first place. The best types of villains are the ones who think they are doing everything for the greater good (like a certain purple Titan wielding a gauntlet), and I did feel sorry for Gorr once I understood his motivations, although this of course doesn't justify him wanting to murder the innocent.Now four solo movies in, it's great to see how a hero like Thor has finally found the appropriate balance between a powerful god and a regular person. Though I think there is little else that can be done in future films to develop the character beyond what we have right now, we can still appreciate him for what he is already - a genuine person with relatable flaws. And that is what I believe to be one of the reasons why the MCU has been successful for so long - it shows that heroes, even literal gods, are capable of going through legitimate growth and changes to become better people. That and the casual humour of course. Either way, it has proven to be a winning combination.I rate it 8/10.

title: Not deliverying up to it's hype.

Overall it's a pretty weak movie even by Marvel standards.On positive side, Bale did 200% of whatever he got with the script and absolutely stole this movie.

title: Serviceable "fourquel" has Waititi's style but lacks purpose
text: I've always found Thor to be one of the weaker A-list MCU characters, but I appreciated Taika Waititi's vision for "Thor: Ragnarok." His quirky humor, great soundtracks, and attention to deft pacing and comedic timing made that film, while far from perfect, a unique standout that helped create a fresher vision of Thor as a character that not only would ultimately set him up for "Infinity War" and "Endgame," but provide a blueprint for how directors could still put at least a somewhat unique stamp of their own on the Marvel formula. I'm not necessarily a hardcore fan of Waititi ("Jojo Rabbit" was not for me,) but still appreciate his idiosyncrasies and interests in using humor and irony to pepper stories in unexpected and distinct ways. With that said, given that I enjoyed "Ragnarok" and also love Christian Bale (who plays Gorr, the film's villain,) I was hoping this sequel would deliver. While it's not terrible by any means and a fine way to kill two hours on a hot summer day, it's much more forgettable than its predecessor and adds vanishingly little to the MCU as a whole.The film deals with Thor's post-"Endgame" whereabouts, including his partnership with Jane Foster (the "Mighty Thor.) Its primary plot line, however, centers around him and Jane having to rescue a group of kidnapped local children from the wrath of Gorr, a vengeful father who wants to kill all the gods. As anyone who saw "Ragnarok" and remembers its light, breezy, irreverent tone can imagine, the tone is emblematic of that film. Yet while the film can sometimes be entertaining, it just doesn't work anywhere near as well as "Ragnarok." The humor doesn't feel fresh and instead feels rather forced, the character development is surprisingly rather weak, and the stakes never feel convincing. There are plenty of ways to do comparatively lower-stakes MCU movies in a more interesting way (like "Shang-Chi,") but instead this feels more like a Disney+ miniseries concept than a theatrical movie in terms of plot depth and relative impact to the greater MCU. Even its themes of romance and the impact of interpersonal relations on the psyche feel blandly explored, and the emotional core there is in the story feels rather weak compared to "Ragnarok." To Waititi's credit, the film is deftly paced at a notch under 2 hours managing to never feel too long nor too short, he does serve up a good soundtrack (highlights include classic Guns and Roses songs,) and a few scenes have CGI visuals that are a cut above your average Marvel movie. Yet these stronger elements unfortunately don't match up against the film's relative sense of purpose or even a strong, original plot. Christian Bale is very good, unrecognizable, and menacing as Gorr, but he's almost criminally underused in the story, to the detriment of the broader narrative as a whole. Recommended for theatrical viewing only to devoted Marvel fans; everyone else can wait to stream it or skip it entirely. 6/10.
