title: 7.5/10 - Don't believe all the low reviews
text: First off, is this movie perfect, the short answer is no. However some of these reviews are way lower than expected. It's a fun movie (at times gets a little bit silly yes) with some cool themes, and a relatively interesting villain. As previously mentioned it is by no means perfect, but there's no way these is being seen as 'the worst' or 'one of the worst' marvel movies.Feels like a lot of marvel fans expect every film since infinity war/endgame to be on par with them. Yes marvel has fallen short on a few of the shows/films since, but this is a good watch and shouldn't be compared with the likes of Thor 2 etc.

title: Horrible script and childish
text: I usually never write a review but after leaving the cinema while people applaud and go in here and see such a high rating, I have to. The film is disastrous. Terribly childish. Feels like a parody movie. Has the feeling that Taika has been given free hands for this film and he chose a path that became too much.To see great actors like Christian Bale and Russel Crowe say yes to this is just a disappointment.

title: a fun marvel movie??
text: Sorry to say this but I've always had a hard time watching Marvel movies. Movies and characters need heart behind them and it feels like a lot of them lack this heart in favor of fan service and ways to make the most money possible. Most of them are overly dramatic and the jokes that do make it in don't usually land for me. But I remember watching Ragnarok with my family and... laughing? Didn't even know who Taika Waititi was until earlier this year and was surprised to see he wrote the one Marvel movie I enjoyed. As expected, his 2nd Marvel movie didn't disappoint either! Honestly, Gorr wasn't the most compelling villain but he served his purpose. Christian Bale needed more screentime!People often forget that storytelling doesn't have to be constant doom and gloom to have an impact on people. Taika does a great job balancing comedy and drama in his work and this movie is no different. Comedy makes tragedy hit that much harder and it's great to see this in a Marvel film !!

title: Lighthearted, witty, with some sad bits. I laughed, I cried: it moved me
text:
For me, I judge a movie by whether I was entertained. From the beginning, to the end, I was entertained. I wasn't sure exactly how it was going to end either, which means the plot was, while not exactly deep, not completely obvious.Great movie? No
bad movie? No
Good and entertaining movie? Sure
Do I feel like I wasted my time? Not at all.Memorable? I finished watching it and can still remember the plot.Will I watch it again? Possibly, in a year or two.Was it better than other recent offerings from the MCU? Better than most, yes.Did I fall asleep watching it? No.Did the plot keep moving? Yes
Was the plot deep and full of intrigue? Medium
Was it as good as Thor Ragnarok? About evenI liked the emotional bits and the love story between Jane Fonda, Jodi Foster, Jane Foster, and Thor.I liked the focus on what matters most in life.Most of all, I like that I was surprised by the ending.Love wins, every time. It may not be glamorous, and it may be a journey of pain to get there, but Love, selfless self sacrificing Love, always wins.I think we are at a point in our societal evolution where a large portion of society is focused on finding enemies under every rock. Many have cited the "female Thor" plotline as problematic. To be fair, it was in the comic books, and to be fair, the hammer chooses who is worthy not by gender or other characteristics, but by the content of their character. We have lost sight of the idea that the content of someone's character is important. We have become wrapped up in identifying with one ideology or another, or identifying with one group or another based on subjective criteria. One thing this film does, either on purpose or as a byproduct, is illustrate that a person's value is in what they give to the world around them, what positive impact they have.A wise man once wrote "If I speak in the tongues of men or of angels, but do not have love, I am only a resounding gong or a clanging cymbal. If I have the gift of prophecy and can fathom all mysteries and all knowledge, and if I have a faith that can move mountains, but do not have love, I am nothing. If I give all I possess to the poor and give over my body to hardship that I may boast, but do not have love, I gain nothing."

title: It's just okay which isn't good enough
text: The start of this movie was flat out stupid, the design, the story it just looked awful and whilst the villain did end up doing alright it set a tone that this wasn't going to be a film you'd assume loving would be a guarantee.The guardians cameo felt pointless, teenage groot is the worst out the 3, it just felt like a waste. I love the humour Thor has but it used to be occasional, this film tries it every step of the way, endless jokes, the weird goats that literally lost it's comedic value by the second scream. Jorg was funny but also when you realise he made the movie he has a surprisingly big part.The story was just ok, chemistry was a bit off, you just didn't particularly care about the extras. The mayor of his homeland was meh, fights were just deja vu and the rest was just a bit aimless and pointless.Did I laugh? Yeah! Did I enjoy it? I'm unsure, I was mainly disappointed/confused. The end credits with the guy from Ted lasso and Valhalla were probably the least interesting I've seen.Truthfully that should be it for Thor stand alone films, as good as he is, his worlds just dull especially without Loki, I assume maybe there will be some cross over with Valhalla? Either way I can't say I'm bothered and most people I heard seemed deflated. He should just be part of the big films and leave the solo ones.Sense Stan sadly passed I've found marvel films to have dropped off hard, this was a full on comedy and nothing like the original 3 where comedy was there it bits. Stan wouldn't have liked this, but from passable like Spider-Man to middle of the road like ten rings to the awful eternals and venom and whatever dr dull was. Marvel had a run of unbelievable films which no longer seems a guarantee. DC have black Adam which looks fun, be nice to have some competition as the Batman and morbius films were dull as hell.Is this the begging of the end for them being guarenteeed hits? After 5/6 mediocre at best films, I'd say yeah.

title: Unremarkable - Why cast Bale and not use him more
text: Really unremarkable content from Marvel continuing a trend lately of no real story just mashing characters to have scenes for laughs or to have someone's favorite character have their few minutes of screen time. Not sure where this is going and how their current model is going to work if these films keep getting to a billion and Disney execs get what they want. Its going to take fans saying enough and voting with their pocketbook along with shareholders saying we invested in you to do great storytelling not just churn content and merchandise. And no apology for the cynical comments. It's clearly them banking not getting great writers.

title: Much good then expected
text: The film is once again very light-hearted. It is certainly going for laughs more than anything else. Consequently the tone is very safe and no one ever feels like they are in much genuine danger. Which is a shame because Christian Bale plays a particularly menacing (at least visually) villain.There are some fun cameos along the way as usual. The film is pretty well paced too. It doesn't really have a period which I would say dragged. If you enjoyed 'Ragnarok' then you are almost certainly going to have a good time with this one.

title: Very much a self parody.....But better on 2nd viewing.
text: 5 years ago when Thor: Ragnarok came out it was received very well. It was a more comedic but very sharp Thor film. Director Taika Waititi brought his very peculiar sense of humor to the MCU and it was refreshing. With Love and Thunder Waititi goes even further into comedy. So much so that the film feels like a self parody. I am all for silliness in superhero films but if you want an audience to be emotionally invested in a story you have to take it at least a little seriously. The film starts off as a full on comedy and the 3rd act gets serious but again, the shift in tone is jarring. Chris Hemsworth I'd good again as Thor and Natalie Portman is back as Jane Foster Thor's love interest. They have a good chemistry but again it's all so silly that when the film gets serious we should care more. Christian Bale plays Gorr, the God Butcher. He is the villain and is the best part of the film. A really good performance that is taken seriously but the rest of the characters are so busy being funny that it seems he belongs in a different film. Bale's great villain is sort of wasted. Is it entertaining? Yes. There are some really cool visually touches and yes some of the comedy works but I wish that the film would have been more of an adventure and less self parody....Grade: B-

title: love it
text: I loveThor seen it tonight with friend love it humor was great recomend it you are mavel fan.i love it the effects were good and action was was awsome.

title: Yet another mildly good movie from Phase 4 Marvel
text: Review : 6.5/10The bad phase of Marvel ( read : Marvel movies after Endgame ) continues again and Marvel fails to capitalize on great MCU characters like Spiderman , Dr. Strange and now Thor. Despite having polarized reviews I personally liked Thor Ragnarok and it was the best movie in the Thor quadrology in my opinion. Atleast the slapslick comedy worked out so well and the chemistry between Thor Hulk and Valkyrie were so likeable.In Thor 4, A similar premise was there. There's a goofy team up, A well made villain character and some quirky events with goofy characters ( Grandmaster , Zeus ) but Taika failed to recreate the same magic as the team up was so muddled , Gorr had less time but Bale made good use of the character and Thor meeting with Zeus was so ridiculous.B&W scenes between Gorr and Thor were surprisingly good and sequences involving Stormbreaker vs Necrosword were good. The crew tried to save the movie but except Hemsworth and Bale , others were not contributing much to the movie. Some comedies were a hit but most of them fell flat. Movie was mid till Thor escapes from Zeus but it was okayish after that. As a Marvel fan , I'm worried about the future of Phase 4 after this.

title: Very good...
text: "Thor: Love and Thunder" is an Action - Comedy movie and the fourth movie of the Thor franchise in which we watch Thor, Valkyrie and Jane Foster trying to stop Gorr the God Butcher who wants to vanish all the gods.I enjoyed this movie very much because it had plenty of action that was well combined with funny moments. There were also some dramatic moments that changed the plot and the concept of the movie, something that I did not expect and it was a nice surprise. The direction which was made by Taika Waititi was very good for one more time and he did an excellent job on the way that he presented the evolution of the story after the events of Endgame. The interpretations of Chris Hemsworth who played as Thor, Christian Bale who played as Gorr, Natalie Portman who played as Jane Foster and Tessa Thompson who played as King Valkyrie. Another interpretation that has to be mentioned was Russell Crowe's who played as Zeus. All in all, I have to say that "Thor: Love and Thunder" is a nice movie and I highly recommend everyone to watch it.

title: Whiplash in Film Form
text: After the last few appearances of Chris Hemsworth (Thor) in the MCU, I could not wait to see where his epic tale would take him next. I could not be more disappointed to find out that it took him here. With so much trauma, growth, and development being thrown out the window, this film turns our hero into a simplistic fool that cannot possibly have stood toe-to-toe with the Mad Titan and lived to tell the story. With a great director and great actors, you have to wonder how no one stopped the ridiculously childish humor, the unnatural pacing, and the story that goes from drama to comedy and repeats faster than you can blink. There are some redeeming features, such as some of the visuals and the little we see of Christian Bale (Gorr), but they are wasted underneath the burned memory of screaming goats. Everybody makes mistakes, unfortunately, Taika made this one.

title: More useless propaganda.
text: There's no such thing as a female "king".In previous films there was a queen and also females titled "lady" such as thors mother and lady sif. Marvels woke agenda can't allow terms like those to exist. So "lady thor" is now "mighty thor" which is actually one of thors titles. Queen valkyrie is king valkyrie. Which is odd considering "valkyrie" is already a title. Just poorly written garbage with gay forced in for no reason at all.

title: Thor Dumb and Thunder
text: Don't get me wrong it is enjoyable and entertaining, but in the grand scheme feels like a step backwards with Thor's character arc. To many jokes that take away from the potential this movie had.

title: Either I am growing older Or MCU is becoming more Childish
text: It's surely a disappointing one from Marvel, After a disastrous Ms Marvel show i expected something concrete from Marvel. The Movie is full of comic punches even at the more intense scenes. Christian Bale did a fantastic job at God Butcher but there is just not enough of him for my appetite. Gorr fails to represent himself a Threat at any level to Thor or any other god because we don't get to see the depth of character. The movie feels to be very rushed, it was like watching 4 mini episodes of a single series. The climax was just way more obvious. The Only saving grace I think was of Mighty Thor Arc which was executed beautifully otherwise it was all just a filler for phase five MCU.Watch it once for the sake of continuation if you are an MCU follower rest you can easily skip it. title: An Amazing Movie!
text: One of the best marvel movies I have ever seen! I thought the cast was amazing, every single one of them did a wonderful jobb.It had lots of great action sequences, the comedy was amazing, hade a blast at the cinema while korg and thor were mouthing of jokes even in the most serious situationes.The villain (Christian Bale) did an amazing job, he really made the movie more exiting while playing sort of a horror character.It was an emotion packed movie and a must watch for any Marvel/Thor fan.

title: Fun
text: Definitely a fun movie with a lot of great cameos and jokes. The film was almost too funny in moments where it didn't need to be. I think Christian Bale gave a great performance as Gorr but was underutilized. Also would've liked a little more from the Gods. Loved Jane and Valkyrie though! Overall a fun, enjoyable film but it fell a little short for me compared to Ragnarok.

title: So many jokes = one big joke, this movie.
text: Trying to make a joke every line gets boring fast, so because of this the movie truly felt like one big joke on the fans and all the people who pay money to watch it. Half the amount of dumb jokes and fill it will good writing and it would of been better.Love all the Thor movies but this one, disappointing.

title: THOR - Love and Confusion
text: This movie didn't know what it was - at times a comedy, sometimes a kids movie and even an Asterix movie with over the top silliness (including special effects), especially with scenes with Zeus, for example. It even seemed to try and tap a daytime soap with melodramatic stagings. Maybe this is all due to Waititi and Hemsworth being unrestrained this time and unfettered from the Marvel restraints which helped to make Ragnarok a more perfect balance of comedy and drama and greater success. This was less than the sum of its parts and tried to do too much with too little, never allowing its audience to go with the flow. There are great performances and some brilliant cameos, for those who have loved Hemsworth's Thor history, but it lacks the cleverness of Ragnarok and ends up being clunky and a pale immitator of the Marvel movies leading up to Endgame. In trying to please everyone at all cost, this leaves a confused mess and bring the Thor greatness of Ragnarok back down to earth with a thud - where The Immigration Song was inspired in Ragnarok, too much Guns and Roses just led to a land of confusion, and a Universe that may have been blown by all the colour and lights. Even a nude rendering of Hemsworth can't distract from its obvious flaws, though it was a nice try. Time to go back to the drawing board to hammer out a better Thor, for those who love the God of Thunder. This movie does him a disservice.

title: So bad
text: Very poor writing and direction Of all the Marvel movies so far, this is by far the worst. There was nothing in this film worth saving. If it were not for the fear of missing something in the overall story arc, I would have stopped watching this several times. Honestly, this was beyond disappointing - it was painful.I think it's time to abandon Hemsworth and move in a new direction. The incessant desire to be funny.never worked. The entire film was a train wreck. I feel bad for the Guardians cast. They seemed to participate awkwardly - as if they knew this was a complete klinker. This movie would be overpriced in the dollar bin.

title: A proper MCU adventure!
text: A wacky and wild bonanza of the funniest fun and some genuine beats of character development to keep the otherwise basic as all get out/hero vs villain plot compelling.Christian Bale is superb a Gorr. Despite being trapped in a wildly generic villain arc, he does wonders with what he's given!Natalie Portman too is a good bit of fun, perhaps for once enjoying herself in these movies.Within her newly dubbed role as Mighty Thor she conjures up more than a few surprises to justify her character's radical turn.But this is Hemsworth's show and he's a man who loooves any spotlight where he can be as absurd and against hero-type as humanly possible.Taika Waititi, no slouch either in the out-of-his-mind department, aids his leading man's every whim and throws curve balls left and right (to Hemsworth and the MCU in general).Yet, despite the two's almost transparent attempt to push things beyond the scope of reason or...taste, Thor still comes out the other side with hero statues firmly in check.And you can bet that's no accident.

title: Good story but too "campy"
text: The story behind Love and Thunder was great. The execution left a lot to be desired. Taika Waititi took the fun parts of Ragnarok and made the whole movie that way. This would be great if Thor was nothing but a joke. Ragnarok had the perfect balance of comedy and serious action story telling. Love and Thunder felt more like a B rated summer camp low budget movie. I expect more from a big Blockbuster hyped movie. The cgi, special effects, soundtrack, costumes, etc were on point. I would chose other Marvel movies over this one when looking for something to watch. That being said if it came on TV I would not turn it off.Do better with your story telling Taika Waititi.

title: Wonder
text: It's really amazing. Christian bale acting is simply superb. Welcome to MCU. Ending is absolutely superb. I wonder next part of THOR and Guardian of the galaxy.

title: Every things was joke
text: Christian bale's Gorr was great but he wasted in a joke movie. This movie one is of the worst movie in marvel cinematic universe. Natalie & Hamsworth look good.

title: Exactly what Taika fans want and expect
text: Going into a Taika Waititi movie then writing a review about how it's all a joke is like going to cadburys world and being disappoint at all the chocolate, this movie is everything I wanted it to be but with the added bonus of tremendous heart. Bale is wonderful as the villain, creepy, fun, dark, broken, seeing Portman back is fun and she obviously enjoyed the lose script, she seemed to be having the time of her life but it is Hemsworth and Waititi just plain messing around which is the most delightful. The jokes flow second to second each more surreal and unmarvel like from the last but much like ragnorok it's the stunning visuals that really standout in the movie, it's just beautiful. Waititi's eye for this world is unlike anything else happening within the Marvel cinematic universe. These movies standout in a very formulaic world and I for one feel they are a total breath of fresh air. Absolutely adored it.

title: A Good Time
text: It's not winning an Oscar but it's a good time! Great action sequences, funny moments throughout, good performances from the entire cast and THE BEST post credit scene in quite some time!

title: Thor: Love and Thunder boasts a bittersweet story about finding peace and love in suffering and pain, but it fails to reach its full potential.
text: If you enjoy reading my Spoiler-Free thoughts, please follow my blog to read my full review :)"Thor: Love and Thunder boasts a bittersweet story about finding peace and love in suffering and pain, without forgetting the necessary thunderous action that reaches its best level in a long sequence surrounded by a breathtaking black-and-white color palette.Christian Bale stands out with a terrifying performance as one of MCU's best villains in recent years, while Chris Hemsworth and Natalie Portman share excellent chemistry. Visually distinct and with a unique soundtrack, the formulaic screenplay benefits immensely when focusing on the complex arcs of each character.Still, the continuous comedy bits - far from the hilarious creativity of the past - deny further exploration, removing emotional value from the third act. The action featuring generic CGI shadow monsters holds predictable issues, and an irrelevant plot deviation only serves as a teaser for future content.Overall, Taika Waititi succeeds yet again, but this time, he fails to reach the full potential of the premise."Rating: B+

title: Stop with the forced comedy!!
text: I'm sorry, but after Endgame the Marvel movies have went down hill for me. This movie had so many plot holes and pointless scenes and for the love of "gods" STOP WITH THE FORCED COMEDY!!! It's getting extremely annoying!!! I'm probably the only one that didn't like Ragnarok, but even I prefer to watch that over this mess of a movie! And WTF was the Guardians even there if they weren't going to help?? Like go away! Ugh.

title: Stop being so serious, it's a fantasy film.
text: I decided to write a review to filter out all the negativity. ITS A FANTASY MOVIE. It's meant to be funny, are you forgetting the comedic personality of the central character of the film? The fact the director is RENOWN for being a comedy film director?This is now up there with my top 5 favourite marvel movies of all time, it's hilarious, it's light hearted, ITS FUN. Stop being so serious and laugh a little. That's the whole point of watching a taika waititii film - duh?

title: Thor is destroyed.. Marvel is not interesting anymore.. with increase in no of weak characters and old characters losing their charm.
text: Thor is more like a clown, you won't be able to believe he is the same guy who sttabed thanos in chest. Who fought hulk twice. Iron man once. I mean, wtf. It's just comedy with seldom fighting scenes. Russell Crowe, such a big actor plays another clown like character, with you won't believe such a small role in such a big movie, perhaps he has more to continue his funny clown like villain role in coming marvel movies. You see, Marvel has grown to become just another big brand with nothing interesting left to offer the audience coming to theaters with high expectations, bcz of what I said in title, increase in number of weak characters and old main league characters losing their charm.

title: Absolute disaster
text: What can i say.... Weak script, weak acting, pointless use of Guns&Roses in soundtrack, attempts to be funny that aren't funny. I think the actors aren't bad actors, bit they're just not showing good acting in this one but i guess with a script this weak that's a challenge.Gets 2 stars instead of 1 because of the well done special effects.Wouldn't recommend, absolute waste of time. Lasts about 1 1/2 hours too long. Not worthy of Disney imho.

title: I LOVE Natalie Portman
text: I just got out of Thor Love & ThunderSPOILER-FREE**** SPOILER-FREE**** SPOILER-FREE****Not as good as it could have been, but I liked it a lot more than Doctor Strange & The Multiverse of Madness. I think it has more comedy than Ragnarok, so if you didn't like Ragnarok, you probably really won't like this. But it got some huge laughs (see it with a packed crowd) and I did laugh out loud a few times. There is also some great use of Guns n Roses songs.Of the cast Hemsworth is great, I love this version of Thor, as opposed to one from the first two movies. Bale was superb, he was very creepy when he was onscreen!! Natalie Portman works in a way I didn't expect. I LOVE Natalie Portman, but I never cared about the Thor and Jane relatiinship. I was surprised at how much I got into it and their relationship in this one. Russell Crowe is clearly having fun, but he won't be for everyone. Tessa Thompson is no fun, but that's how her character is written, so it's not her fault. Where was the bad ass from Ragnarok?It's tone is a bit all over, the comedy is so front and centre it kind of takes away from the seriousness of what is happening and it is serious at times.The Jane/Mighty Thor storyline seemed a bit rushed and I'd have liked more Bale, but overall, I really liked it a lot and will be seeing it again.

title: Hugely disappointed Marvel fan
text: The true Marvel story seems to have lost its creativeness & luster due to this new age Disney business plan! Hopefully they won't trash Guardians of the Galaxy 3 as well!

title: Worst movie ever
text: That was a disgrace. Scenario non existent , effects uniinspired , childish humour , even if it was an avengers parody it would be bad. Christian Bale held his place in all this massacre of cinema art, a true professional indeed . I couldn't believe how bad it kept going scene after scene .. Spare yourselves and your love for the MCU universe and don't watch it.

title: Funny as hell, but not as good as the first 3 Thor Films
text: 'Thor: Love and Thunder" is, like most of the Marvel films since Iron Man died, only intermittently amusing, a bit wobbly in its storytelling, thin in its emotional impact and more geared toward spectacle than coherence. Thor's latest planet-skipping adventures are built around the party-rock atmosphere of several Guns N' Roses tracks, notably "Sweet Child o' Mine," but, alas, the song's refrain "Where do we go? Where do we go now? Where do we go?" is all too apt for the movie's directionless, make-it up as we go along style. Here are a lot of things I love about Waititi's approach to Thor, but my favorite is that they are now comedies. While "Ragnarok" was packed with jokes, I think "Love and Thunder" embraces the comedy aspect even more. The trailers let us know there would be plenty of laughs, but it also felt like it may try to be a bit more serious. Well, thankfully, that was the trailer, not the movie. "Love and Thunder" is listed as an action, adventure and comedy. What it actually is, is a comedy with some action and adventure. I laughed out loud so many times and just when you start feeling like things are getting serious, you get a perfectly timed gag and the tension is released. Often times when a movie is trying to be funny or full of action, the filmmakers tend to sacrifice story and emotion for spectacle. This is not the case with "Love and Thunder." Waititi understands in order to make the jokes land and the action hit, you have to care about what is happening. I don't want to give anything away, so I'll be vague here, but there is a rich story filled with love, wanting, loneliness, heartache and sorrow. These heavier elements create a story we're invested in as an audience, but it's balanced expertly with humor, adventure and plenty of spectacle. I cared about Thor, Jane and even Christian Bale's Gorr. Waititi and his team created relatable characters, strong storylines and plenty of drama. We've had a few opportunities to see this, but Hemsworth is a brilliant comedic actor. His timing and delivery are pitch-perfect and make for an egocentric Thor with a heart of gold, and you can't help but love him. Hemsworth was the perfect choice for this role and it's ever more evidenced in "Love and Thunder." We all know Natalie Portman is a fine actress, but her chemistry with Hemsworth is palpable and she brings a certain sense of humanity to the film that is essential to its success.

title: My favourite among the four Thor movies
text: I never understood the love for Ragnarok and don't understand why people are getting underwhelmed by this one. Ragnarok had a better story than this one but the style undermined that story even though it was still better than the two Thor films that came before, both of which were also good imo. Here the style and the story meshes so well together. The ending felt genuine and touching, something that I felt missing in Ragnarok. Chris Hemsworth and Natalie Portman were a treat to watch in this action rom-com.

title: There's no need for this film
text: Of course there are few funny scenes and few visually stunning sequences. But in the end it feels empty, like we wouldn't miss anything even if this film wasn't made.Also, I don't understand why Marvel doesn't make a proper 3D film when they have all the resources they need. Converting 2D film into 3D and then throwing it on our faces for more money is straight up cheating.

title: Another MCU movie that defeats the DC universe.
text: This fourth Thor movie has a lot of action scenes, a lot of special effects, a lot of very well done locations, funny characters and a good storyline. Really good movie, great Waititi. Recommended.

title: How is this 7/10?
text: What a dissapointment. A very much missed opportuniy after the long wait for it. How this is even remotely possible to have an average rating of 7/10? Blend, empty and frankly, annoying. I'm actually sad I spent money on this.

title: A Mixture Of Romance, Fun & Emotion
text: First, the run time of the movie I'm not much happy about it because the story of Gorr is long in comics it takes time to tell a perfect story but that doesn't mean this movie is awful. There were lot scenes which ended too fast I actually wanted to see more from those but anyway let's hope we'll get an extended version of the movie.Overall the Movie has a good storyline which filled with romance, emotions and mostly lot of fun. I love how they showed the love story between Thor and Jane it was totally romantic. When it comes to CGI and VFX they have nailed it. Some scenes were totally unexpected like credit scenes they were really exciting. It's probably worth watching two times in theatre. Don't care about those who downgrading the film just get the experience of your own!

title: One of the most visually pleasing Marvel films
text: I'm firmly of the belief that expectations are making this movie seem worse than it actually is. Ragnorak was surprisingly fresh and grew on you with repeat viewings. Love and Thunder I think will do the same. Watching it a second time was a more pleasing because I could pay attention to the shots and the editing, not having to focus on where the story was going. The nuts and bolts of the film are on solid ground. It is well put together.The plotting is not as tight as Ragnorok, that's for sure and some of the joints are held together merely with cheesy jokes that aren't always funny, but it still has its moments.To surmise, even if it doesn't quite meet expectations on the storytelling front. Visually it is one of the best to come from Marvel. Turn off the sound and give it another look.

title: Collossal Disappointment
text: This movie could've been good if it wasn't plagued with pointless, over the top childish and dumb humor that creeps in every 2 minutes and completely ruins the story. This movie felt like dumb and dumber in Asgard. Thor fans will be disappointed.

title: Taika Waititi's Worst Film To Date
text: Taking all that was good & refreshing about Ragnarok and overcooking it to the point where all of the good stuff is rendered useless, the 29th instalment in the Marvel Cinematic Universe has its priorities all over the place and has no idea whatsoever about what made the previous entry such a vibrant cosmic delight. The story does have a heart but it is buried beneath all the vapid goofiness that's overdone to the point of annoyance.Co-written & directed by Taika Waititi (Hunt for the Wilderpeople & Jojo Rabbit), Thor: Love and Thunder isn't devoid of the flavours that made its predecessor work but the balance is certainly missing this time around. The film looks & feels like its own parody, for Waititi here overdoses on his own style and fails to properly handle the drama, romance & comedy elements. The premise is promising but when it comes to execution, it is lacking in restraint & consistency.For a $250 million production, the imagery & visual effects look as underdeveloped as they are uninspiring. Editing focuses on all the wrong stuff here as the film could've done more with less Korg, less eccentricity, less quips and certainly more emphasis on developing the dramatic bits. Every now n then, it does strike a heartfelt chord but with the narrative being a tonal nightmare, the effectiveness of those moments is either vastly diminished or wholly nullified by the silliness on display.Overall, Thor: Love and Thunder isn't entirely the disaster that many are calling it to be but it is definitely a step down in quality & coherence that the last chapter exuded in spades. The story isn't without its merits but they are few n far between. Enormously underwhelming & downright forgettable, the film showcases Taika Waititi's worst tendencies as a storyteller, certainly ranks amongst his weakest directorial efforts, and suffers from problems of its own makings. In short, Marvel Studios' latest is as empty as it is cringe.

title: A little flat
text: I loved all the previous Thor movies before this one. This one just didn't hit the mark. It feels like Marvel has lost their way. This movie was just okay. Giving it 6 star might even be a little generous. I think the director fail to deliver. The acting was fine but you could almost see the actors strain to meet the vision of the script. Ijust never got lost in the story.

title: THOR THE WASTAGE OF TIME
text: I seriously don't know what is wrong with Disney these days to spoil such a lovelable superhero movie in such a pathetic way. I give 1 point only for Christian bale who topped all the boring characters in the movie. Too much comedy and unnecessary humor filled in the dialoguesdestroyed the whole thematic and dramatic experience of the movie.

text: WHY WHY WHY... Did i wait until the end..? title: Meh
text:
Too much comedy

title: Silly, often cringy, and even annoying sometimes
text: The worst Thor movie and the worst MCU movie so far. Good CGI, music, pictures, sound. As usual. And the fight scenes are good. Even the idea of a god killer is decent. And well done. Dark, slightly scary. But way too many flashbacks with narration. Especially about unimportant and uninteresting stuff. The cast does its job despite the awful dialogs. A humourous approach to the Jane & Thor topic was OK. But the uninspired, cringy humor is really killing the movie. Wasted money and potential. Should have been a bit more mature. Good thing I didn't waste money in the theatre for this one. The last 5 minutes were good. Watch and decide for yourself, but be warned.

title: Produced by a school friend that could never stop joking
text: We all knew someone who couldn't stop with the jokes, to the point that it becomes boring and irritating. That's what has happened to this Thor and his story line. There is no substance, only fluff, but not in a good way. Superficial and lacklustre. Such a shame. Marvel is done!

title: "All God's Must Die"
text: Thor Love & Thunder was an entertaining movie as far as Thor movies are expected to be, although I felt this movie focused and relied more on the comedic side of things rather than diving deeper into the characters origin. Gorr The God Butcherer (Christian Bale) was magnificent, truly a standout performance. Chris Hemsworth is great at playing Thor, he invests alot into the role as we've seen over the years and hopefully more to come.I'll admit I was skeptical at first in the decision of bringing Jane Foster/Lady Thor back into the mix as her character has had no relevant screen time to the story for many years but I was wrong, she was brilliant. I couldn't help but ponder where Loki was, I was expecting a reunion/ a confirmation of Lokis possible survival for Thor but nothing. I know its all a plan and I have faith it will be incredible! I can't wait to see Thor return on the big screen, I'd highly recommend this one, not the best ever but still very entertaining!

title: Like a fart on a funeral. Taika what was that?!
text: I heard that Taika Waititi was a big joker, and I like that. But this time something didn't happen at all. "Love and Thunder" has way too high contrast between drama and jokes. Like Taika shot two movies at once--a drama about Thor and his lost love and a parody on Thor movies; and randomly mixed them together. And the jokes? Jesus Christ, reasoning the jealous axe with tickling it for relaxing the tense were awful. If it was a complete parody in Mel Brooks style, that would work, but this is a part of the official Marvel Cinematic Universe, Taika! What have you been thinking about?! And why the hell did the studio allow you to make THIS?!As a result we got an awkward and chaotic story, a set of scenes poorly stiched together with awkward and inappropriate jokes. Some moments were really good, like Russel Crowe as Zeus or Christian Bale as Gorr. But in general it's really the worst part of MCU so far.

title: Why is everyone whining, this was hilariously epic and probably the best superhero writing I've seen in a long time.
text: Sure it was cheese, but it was Pule cheese, the best there is. I'm shocked how many reviewers can't count past one, because production value alone is worth at least five stars. I really wasn't expecting much with all the negativity, but wow was I pleasantly surprised! Just when I thought the industry ran out of superhero writing ideas, this little gem comes along, and we were all in tears laughing so hard. Even the story-telling narration was a brilliant touch and elevated the plot and the laughs. The entire screenplay had everything and something for everyone. The humor, the romance, family dynamics, and so on, everything imo was perfection. All casting and performances were outstanding. The almost 2 hour runtime flew by with the excellent pacing. The set designs, S/VFX and cinematography were amazing. The score and soundtrack were spot-on. I can't wait to see this one again, as it's now one of my favorite superhero films of all time. If you haven't seen it, ignore the whiners, this is one heck of a fun, entertaining and hilarious popcorn flick. It's a 9.5 rounded up to a perfect 10/10 from me.

title: Awful!
text: After how bad Doctor strange 2 was I didn't think marvel could get any worse!No story at all. Did not laugh once I would not waste an evening watching this.

title: A 7 out of 10 my ass.
text: At best Thor: Love and Thunder is a 4.out of 10. I'm a HUGE fan of Taika Waititi, and of the Marvel Universe. Thor: Ragnarock is my favorite Thor movie, and one of my top five favorite MCU movie, but Love and Thunder is just an absolute train wreck. A total swing for the fences, and a miss. Unfortunately it seems they were swinging for fences which most likely border the Three Stooges Universe, and nowhere near the MCU. Is Love and Thunder worth watching? Yeah there's some entertainment there, but don't go expecting a top notch MCU experience. Lower your expectations a lot. Otherwise you're in for a big dissapointment.

Absolutely hilarious and fantastic. It's a hell of a lot of fun. I couldn't stop laughing ðŸ˜‚
And great messages to kids! This is the 4th Thor movie but it still has the funny vibe from the previous one. Can't wait for the next Thor movie.
