title: Felt like a cheap money heist joke
text: Lots of cheap jokes, you can see the set being really cheap at times... made for the money not for the plot.Cheap chick flick with jokes for the kids and the younger generation. Basically Marvel ended at endgame, what comes after is just a bid to make more money on the franchise.

title: Exactly as advertised
text: Thor L&T was exactly what I felt I was promised.Unreliable narrator helps frame certain scenes.Horror elements were handled well and effectively.Romance elements were legit.Action was solid.Ending left me emotionally conflicted but hopeful.

title: A decently fun but out of character movie for the God of thunder.
text: First off I enjoyed Ragnarok a lot. It gave the character Thor much more personality and made him more fun then the other marvel characters. Sadly though this movie over does every single good thing Ragnarok did. The plot jumps around and sometimes just doesn't make sense and Thor is a total idiot in this movie. The running gag was annoying and some of the characters that reappeared in this movie display why they should have only been in ONE movie. The main problem I have with this movie though is the villain. Gorr the God Butcher is a terrifying but a enjoyable villain to watch on screen. Yet we only get a few major scenes to enjoy Christian Bales performance! One of the first MCU villains I wanted more of! Overall the movie is just okay. If you want a few laughs and a few cool fight scenes definitely watch this movie. If you are looking for anything deeper than that steer away.

title: Taika waititi comedy special
text: Marvel movies just dont feel like movies anymore. They should have just stopped after endgame. They carried their poor quality from series to the movies now. Its like they are feeding off of old fans.

title: Tries to replicate the magic of Ragnarok, but fails
text:
Sigh. This was a solid 6.5/10 for me. And I wanted to like it so much. I think Ragnarok is too much to live up to.First the good. These are the two best things about the movie:
The bad:

title: Brought down by the first third, much stronger second half
text:
Thor: Love and Thunder suffers for the first 30 minutes from a very meta-like, over-joked, and outright silly dialogue and storyline. Strong performances from the whole cast try to bring the viewer into the movie, but fail mostly due to too many jokes, and to much screentime for Korg, who's only purpose is to add a joke to every scene.The second half however definitely speeds up and brings the perfect balances of action, character-development and emotional dichotomies which carries the movie to finally start. The plot only really starts in the second half, and brings the joy and balance of Thor: Ragnarok, and a satisfying conclusion to the movie.Overall, Thor: Love and Thunder is brought down by the silly first half, but restabilises to bring about a very watchable and enjoyable movie.(Better than most of the last Marvel movies like Dr. Strange in the Multiverse of Madness, Eternals, and Morbius)
Still, a very enjoyable and fun movie.

title: Complete Disappointment
text: If you loved the other Thor movies, stay home and watch them again. This was by far one of the worst Marvel movies to date. The plot was all over the place, the acting other than Christian Bale was just God awful.

title: Enjoyable Movie
text: I really enjoyed this movie. It was a fun adventure and also a sweet love story. Jane had a really good story and I'm glad that she got to become Thor. This was the best Thor movie in my opinion, and also the best phase 4 movie (not including Spiderman: No Way Home). It was true to the characters and moved the plot forward in significant ways. I'm also glad that the focus didn't drift onto the Asgardians of the Galaxy, keeping the plot simple and focused.I'm hopeful that future phase 4 movies can reach this level of quality, as I was disappointed with some of the previous movies, including Doctor Strange and the Multiverse of Madness, The Eternals and Black Widow.

title: All the hatred, but why?
text: So, I was pending about this review that should I write it or not. Because, I can see that so many people hates this, but I don't really know why.Of course, it was not a literature, not even close to that. Sometimes the jokes were awful, but basically, it was not that bad. Average story, not bad characters, funny acts. They gave some hidden meaning as well, to think about it. But basically, it is about joy, and for that, it is good.You can laugh, you can have a coke with some popcron and just relax. Smile, laugh. I pretty much enjoyed it. I think all the 4 main character were good, they did what they had to. Especially Christian Bale. He was really great. Maybe the whole movie was a little bit childish, but it was not that bad, come on.

title: MONEY WASTE,, DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY, TAKE MY REVIEW SERIOUSLY AND SAVE YOUR MONEY
text: Worst thor series movie how can be ruin such series like this seriously, you are making serious action movie and you mix with lots of comedy without any sense what rubbish.

title: A definite step or two down from Ragnarok
text: Waititi's humor worked really well in the previous film, but here it's just too relentless and forced. Some it lands, but a lot of it doesn't. The worst part is that every character seems to basically behave differently from how we know they should be acting, because every line is delivered as though it's part of the same joke. The effect is rather bizarre and it's often difficult to tell if we're watching what's actually happening in the film's present tense or if we're seeing some re-imagined and embellished past tense, like the Korg narration that periodically crops up in the film.Bale's performance is really the stand-out element here. His motivations are something we can sympathize with and he brings a level of quirky intensity that's often lacking in these MCU villains. Ethan Hawke recently said that he thinks the Marvel films are actor-friendly but not director-friendly, and this is a good example of how putting quality actors in front of the camera and letting them do their thing can pay off. It's a shame that the rest of the film seems to hell-bent on undermining all of the serious drama with a strange often misplaced sense of humor. It's hard to say if this is the weakest Thor so far, as it's still probably better than Dark World, but it's not as good as the first one and definitely not as good as Ragnarok.

title: Phase 4 going bonkers
text: Spoiler Free Review although Marvel spoiled everything.The worst mistake is to reveal a lot of things in trailers & teasers and after the movie releases, marvel start releasing more clips just after one day.Extra Mistakes-MOM was coming out before NWH but it didn't so the whole script was changed + 40 mins cuttage (Illuminati was really trash even my fav Xavier).Ms Marvel- 2,3,4 episodes very slow, no hook points.By my opinion episode 5 was even better than 1st.Thor Love & Thunder- GOTG very less screen time, atleast 25 mins should be there. Plus, in a movie on character like Thor, we need a full to action all the time. Half of the time was just like a slow romcom.I think Kevin Feige should just check what their editors are doing. The editors are idiots and I think they even didn't cross-checked by watching the selected movie clip.

title: Any review saying this was bad, disregard it
text: This movie had its comedy and its serious scenes perfectly timed, plenty of action and an impactful story go in to the theater and you will enjoy it all the people giving this a two didn't even see the movie.

title: Fun although
text: The movie was pretty fun but most of the comedy didn't land with me but it was great to see Natalie Portman again and Christian Bale as Gorr the God butcher was amaze balls, Gorr was a great and understandable villian and probably one of the best of the MCU. The guns and roses soundtrack was cool too. Overall fun movie. Thanks Taika.

title: Please stop
text: Please just stop. The MCU at this point is a dumpster fire. Same exact problem as Doctor Strange. The movie is 2 hours of nonsense, no stakes, everything is a joke, all the characters are annoying and unlikeable. I would rather watch the worst anime on earth than this garbage.

title: Plot holes and a lot of filler screen time
text: You'll be disappointed if u figure out all the plot holes and other mistakes more than i was, in big it was a great movie, Chris Hemsworth is an amazing actor.

title: Too much comedy, not enough peril
text: It is possible to put humour into a superhero movie without undermining the gravity of the threat being faced. This film fails to do that.Most of this film feels like a parody of itself. There are way too many jokes, most of which fall flat. Thor himself has become a joke, feeling more like Homer Simpson than the God of Thunder. Christian Bale does a good job as the God Butcher, but his role is almost side-lined by the other characters. And Russell Crowe feels like he is doing a Saturday Night Live sketch.There is a scene in one of the comics whether Captain America has been nominated as leader of all superheroes against a galaxy threatening enemy. Another character objects, on the basis that Cap is one of the least powerful beings present. Thor steps up and says something along the lines of "Captain America is a man whose every action is the embodiment of honour; I would follow him into the jaws of Death." *THAT* is the Thor that I want to see - one who values honour and courage above all else (even physical might), who considers petty mortal concerns beneath him, even though he sometimes finds himself succumbing to them.Sadly, the MCU character is moving further and further away from that character.

title: Unwatchable
text: Comedy is cringe and out of place, doesnt hit like ragnarok . A lot of stuff didn't made sense, except from gorr given that most norse gods are more like trolls than gods. I was about to dozing off most of the time. Heck, how do you take one of the greatest comic book villains and one of the best actors alive and still butcher the movie just because "comedy"

title: Once again the Fanboys miss the point
text: Was this the best Marvel movie? No. Was it as bad as these butthurt katekeeping fans want everyone to believe? Also, no. There is a lot of ridiculous in this movie and it's to compensate for the heartwrenching parts. Just because it isn't verbatim comic book cannon doesn't mean it's a bad story, and just because it's a different style of movie doesn't mean it's bad cinema. There are a lot of A list performers who knocked it out of the park. Bale, especially has the talent to make the viewer sympathize with the antagonist and Natalie Portman redeems herself by making Jane 100% less annoying than she was in the first 2 Thor films. The cameos are cute and funny and I appreciate that the movie doesn't take itself too seriously. A pretentious film can be good but it's very rarely fun. Obviously you don't have to like this movie, but if you never even give it a chance then you're going to hate it no matter what. Let go, laugh at the stupid parts, and appreciate the deeper moments.

title: Boring
text: This movie is bland. The only redeeming quality of this film was the poorly written jokes where I couldn't help but force a pity laugh just because I held out hope that this movie was more than that. The re-introduction of Jane Foster, who was always wasted potential in my opinion, was a smart decision on marvels side. Despite this, in the end, just like in MoM, she was just filler or a hook to build more hype for the film.This movie throughout the first three quarters was around a 7, but the final quarter rivaled morbius-level bad. It was cheesy. If felt like I just payed Â£5 to watch children fight alongside Thor at the YMCA. Disappointing, to say the least.

title: This is a Blasphemy to the whole Thor Francise
text: The whole movie an unfunny JOKE!!Natalie Portman return one last time because she gets to be a main character.Taika Waititi made a very good movie with free guy but he really done a trashy job with this one.The plot makes completely no sense with a total disregard for the original comic storyline. The only take away from the comic is the wokeness, which is glaringly annoying.First of all, the plot is told patronizingly to the audience , not shown.Jane Foster just "magically" gets to wield Mjonir, there is no struggle, qno reason for this is adequately presented. Which is a downfall to alot of movies.Christian Bale gives a good performance but sadly can not save this... thing.Tldr: Please save your time and money. It is more entertaining to just get your money out, light a fire, and watch the smoke rise from the burning Paper.

title: Taika, Hemsworth.... and Bale
text: First off, it is a Taika Waititi film so of course is gonna be a light-hearted, full of jokes movie. Viewers should know what they are stepping into.Then again, Thor Love and Thunder is a fast paced movie that delivers a fun watch for the entire family, with epic and hilarious scenes. Our Thor is still this goofy, cool dude/god that Hemsworth manages to deliver nicely and with charm. Bale is a supreme actor and is menacing when his Gorr is on the screen. His character has a great arc but its does feel like it needed more screen time. Would have been nice to see some more butchering from the God-butcher.Aside from that, the movie offers once again the freshness that Thor discovered in "Ragnarok", with the great addition of the Mighty Thor and usual Valkyrie and Korg shares.It is worthy.

title: Not the best, almost the worst...
text: This movie is an example that Chris Hem has chemistry only with Tom Hiddleston's Loki, or the other avenger's actors, with anyone else in this film it is just not there. Bale, Tessa and Natalie do want they can with very little given to them. I am amazed that this screenplay was push forward with all the time given by the pandemic. Even the actions scenes are just rush or incomplete. This phase 4 films are not going well, beside Spider Man:NWH.

title: The only enjoyable thing during the movie it was the popcorn
text: 1. Stupid jokes in a can, an excuse for product placement.2. Direction nonexistent, script written on the knees while on the toilet. An ode to superficiality and consumerism.3. Even the actors are sick of it. Except for Christian Bale.

title: Second Place to Ragnarok
text: You know I love all of Taika Waititi's stuff, but this fell short for me. It felt rushed and the comedy and story needed a bit more development. I hear there is a ton they cut out and I hope when it's released they release that too. Thor is still a snack, and the humor that is there is solid. I wouldn't say it's the worst Thor but Ragnarok is still the better one.

title: Marvel is in dire need of a darker approach to the MCU
text: Giving it a 7 because I love Natalie Portman and Christian Bale.I mean, you bring in Christian Freaking Bale, who gives an amazing performance as always even with so little screentime, and you choose to overshadow his character in the name of unfunny jokes? I mean, c'mon... You proved you can do better than that.Marvel wants to go dark, it's clear, they almost did it several times and it would do them good. But they're not bold enough to do it so they rather spend their time with childish humour trying to appeal to kids when they could very easily be dominating the industry even more. MCU fans grew up, Marvel, so maybe you should too.

title: lighting does not strike twice
text: Ok I knew from the start this movie could not out do Ragnarok, but it is not boring like Thor Dark world. The problem is this movie has too much humor and it subtracts from the amazing acting and effects. I like the movie but I would not want to see it again if that makes sense.

title: Great Movie, but not to great in action!!!!
text: I loved the movie but I was expecting to seen more actions and more participation from the Guardians of the Galaxy in this film!!! I think they tried to create a storyline similar from the Guardians and actually they forgot the actual first two Thors storyline formats. They implemented to many funny scenes and moments. I wanted to see more action from Gorr!!! I read his story and I think he got a great story to tell to the audience but they focus more about Thor path!!!

title: Fun!
text: Despite this film receiving rather a mixed reception, I really enjoyed it! Taika Waititi's style of comedy and directing just fits with me. This film definitely is not perfect, but it is exactly what I wanted.One of my absolute favourite elements was 'Gorr the God Butcher', as the villain. Christian Bale gave such an amazing performance, which shone despite the character's small amount of screen time. There is a particular film sequence that involves his character which is extremely well executed visually. I really liked the direction they took the Jane Foster character in! It genuinely surprised me at points and built upon previous films.The film does seem to move at a rather quick pace. It never really stays in a singular scene for too long. This does somewhat prevent further character development and leaves you wanting a bit more of certain characters. It definitely adds the film's humour, as it does not dwell on jokes that didn't land as well as others. Overall, I would recommend checking it out!

title: Worst marvel film ever
text: The whole thing was a mess from start to finish, tried to be a comedy I think but I hardly laughed at any of the jokes, the villain was dull and awfully overacted by Christian bale, this is one of those marvel movies that never really did anything to move the marvel universe forward and personally think it was an utter waste of time.

title: Thor love and thunder was amazing
text: A perfect thor movie unlike the others with a perfect balance of comedy, romance and action. Christian bale was so good as gorr the god butcher. Chris hemsworth as before rocks as thor. Natalie portman was superb playing the mighty thor. Korg and Valkyrie did a nice job as a supporting charecter.

title: A very weird movie
text: I think they took the reaction to ragnarok as an all-seasons pass to wacky, resulting in a strange mishmash of good and nonsensical, and arriving at whatever this is. Ragnarok was great, but this movie just confused, waffling between internet memes and a very compelling but not fully fleshed out (cuz of all the jokes shoved in) villain, and a compelling story of love and loss in Jane Foster's character. Jokes are great, too many jokes just ruins the very serious and compelling parts of a movie and cheapens them for the audience.

title: Terrible Direction for the MCU
text: I don't think I've ever seen a move that is more desperate to be funny. It is nonstop forced humor that isn't funny. There is only one dramatic or serious moment in the entire film that isn't ruined by an attempt to be funny. It's basically slap stick comedy.

title: The ones who make the little prince too big? Or those whose best book in literature is The Picture of Dorian Gray?
text:
Many of the Phase 4 productions of the Marvel Cinematic Universe have had rather bittersweet endings and different messages, but the ending of "Thor: Love and Thunder" offers a more positive overall message. Thor has spent years trying to ignore his trauma from his conflict with Thanos, and Gor sacrifices his life to avenge his daughter's death against the gods.However, the end of the movie is not about Gore or Thor winning, but about them realizing that there is something more important than revenge and their battles. Thor decides to spend his last moments in Jane's arms rather than fight Gore, and Gore decides to bring the girl he loves back to life rather than commit mass murder. Ultimately, the film explores the fact that love and acceptance are greater forces than revenge and war, and this is a step forward in Thor's storyline as he gradually moves away from the crazy conqueror and outlaw he was in his first film.Thor's fondness for Mjolnir and his jealousy of Jane who uses this weapon is one of the common jokes of the film. So it makes sense that Thor takes Mjolnir back at the end of the movie and gives the Stormbreaker to Law. However, there is a deeper meaning behind Thor's use of Mjolnir. Throughout the film, Mjolnir shows Thor's feelings for Jane and his longing for her. By using Mjolnir at the end of the movie, Thor shows some kind of respect for Jane and thanks her for helping him grow and develop his character.Reuse forever
Eternity wasn't mentioned in the Marvel Cinematic Universe until Thor: Love and Thunder, but it was in the comics. However, the Marvel Comics version of Eternity is somewhat different and is the next priority in the Marvel Universe after the Living Tribunal. Apparently, the doors of eternity were locked before this, and it is not clear what their role was before. The Marvel Cinematic Universe devised a law so that the first living being to reach eternity could have one of his wishes fulfilled.The film's dialogue suggests that this is a one-time deal and that Eternity cannot be used again after Thor: Love and Thunder. However, now that the gates of eternity have been opened, this entity may seek to use the power of the remaining beings for its own purposes. Eternity and Infinity are often associated with Galactus and have significant similarities in some images, and Galactus may also appear in the Marvel Cinematic Universe.Who gives hits? The ones who make the little prince too big? Or those whose best book in literature is The Picture of Dorian Gray?

title: Terrible
text: Its worse than Immortals...what an terrible film......you are taking the public for brain dead people...no depth...no script...no intelligence ...pathetic...

title: A very solid, fun movie.
text: In my opinion, this movie is slightly overhated. I'll get the bad things out of the way at first.It has WAY too much humor, to the point where it's almost unbearable at times. It is very obviously rushed, with some characters like Jane not getting nearly enough development. It has some very shoddy CGI at times, but nothing outright horrendous. Finally, it suffers from a weak first half littered with too much childish humor and not enough focus. The plot is a little too simplistic, but it does the job.As for the good. The acting is fantastic, specifically Christian Bale as Gorr. He absolutely steals the show. Tessa Thompson, Natalie Portman, and Chris Hemsworth all deliver great performances too. The soundtrack is also amazing and it had me jamming out all throughout the movie. The visuals for the movie are very unique and diverse. Gorr is one of the best villains in the MCU, his sheer presence is terrifying. Sad we didn't get more of him though.Overall, you have a very fun time for all ages. A solid 7.5/10 from me.

title: Too goofy, rushed pace
text: I was very excited for this. Unfortunately this was a letdown. This one movie had way too much goofy comedy and not enough depth to balance it out, seems like three movies rolled in till one in which the pacing was way too fast.

title: Batman & Robin.....
text: If I want to watch a silly super hero movie I'll watch batman and Robin. That's enough.This is some weird combination of the worst from Adam Sandler and the best from Marvel (make of that what you want)They absolutely trash the characters and their archs of the Mcu for cheap laughs. You might chuckle but it feels stupid afterwards.Christian bale is goat though. Sadly they ruined Thor like they did Hulk... Urgh.

title: My favorite Thor movie so far.
text: Thor is one of my favorite superheroes ever and I felt excited for a new Thor movie. Upon watching it, the acting is very awesome and light-hearted. The storyline is so memorable and interesting. Therefore, I'm genuinely surprised there's a balance between comedy and seriousness within this superhero film.Never expected Christian Bale to play the role of a brutal supervillain who goes on a crusade to kill all gods as revenge after what he's been through in the opening scene.Funninly enough the iconig Mjolnir returned but in Female Thor's possession while Thor himself uses the Stormbreaker in the invasion scene. This is by far one of the best MCU movies I've seen in my whole life, too enjoyable and I feel intrigued with its storyline.

title: Childish movie
text: I am not sure what happened in the Directors head but the movie was quite childish and farcical. The jokes were bad, forced and on the wrong times. How will anyone take Thor serious after this movie. Very disappointing.

title: Don't listen to these losers..see the movie!
text: People giving this movie horrible reviews are clearly just miserable low life's with nothing going for them. This movie is fun through and through, great humor (god forbid it's not emo like The Batman). Go see it! You will love it! You will laugh and just have fun! So comical how people take a Marvel movie so serious. Pretty sure Stan Lee's intentions weren't to bore and scare everyone to death. Be imaginative.

title: Thor Love and Thunder Review
text: The movie seemed slow at times. The jokes made it enjoyable and Christian Bale killed it as Gorr but the ending was unsatisfying. It didn't seem like a necessary movie and although it wasn't bad, it just didn't really connect. It felt like it needed more, but less.

title: This was... terrible.
text: This was an embarrassment to the MCU, to the late Stan Lee, to Disney.Heavy on cheesy quips, jokes, and one liners. The writers tried far too hard to recreate the fun of Ragnarok, of Guardians, etc. Previous MCU movies had serious action, great visual effects, an interesting storyline, and the occasional humorous moment. Love & Thunder seemed to shoot for being a parody of the MCU lineup. Pointless action scenes that did little for the franchise, a boring storyline, with stabs at humor early and far too often. Many of our favorite characters whittled down to nothing.The soundtrack had potential. Lots (and I mean LOTS!) of Guns & Roses, with even a character named Axl. But like the humor, too much means too much. By comparison look back at Avengers: Endgame. Appropriate music selections throughout, to include that final scene of Cap slow dancing with Peggy Carter to jazz. Something for everyone.The end of the credits tells us "Thor will return." He's one of my favorites, but if the next effort is the same as Love & Thunder, just let the franchise enter Valhalla and spare the fans the agony.

title: Tries WAY Too Hard to be funny
text: Thor: Love and Thunder, is a very basic movie that is often very predictable. The first 30 minutes are quite sluggish and full of recaps from previous movies. Making the titular character a "funny guy" often distracts the audience from the truly emotional moment. This film biggest problem comes from it's need to make the audience laugh. This film tries way too hard to be funny, often feeling like they should've added a laugh track. The ending of the film feels very lazy and slightly ruins a character that needed a satisfying ending. Unfortunately, this is still one of the best Thor movies (because the first two movies were not good), but it does not live up to the comedic timing and charm of the film that came before it.

title: Good scenes
text: It has some periods where you get distracted but art is to see. The concept derives out of the cover and cinematography plays good along with colors. A rich based sciencefiction movie with a lot utopian characters and landscape. Not a brilliant concept like we saw in Ragnarok but still has its' ways vibrant. The cast is pretty strong and can be accepted to watch sometime but there have to be made a special look to one character that is being represented by Christian Bale.Seing Christian Bale in that role is marvelous. He is one of my favorite and has a way to fit in roles. Body and mind together.

title: ABSOLUTELY AWFUL!!!!!
text: I walked out of the movie theater about half way thru the movie! It was awful, disgraceful and a total waste of my time and money! Don't waste your money and if you like the character Thor and/or any of the other Marvel movies, then don't even watch this movie! Yuck!

title: Thor: Love and Thunder
text: The Marvel Cinematic Universe juggernaut rolls on, but instead of returning to the well with the same formula designed to maximise box office and make truckloads from licensed merchandise, 'Thor: Love and Thunder,' breathes new life into the clichÃ©d genre. It's polarised audiences, thanks in no small part to the surreal vision of director Taika Waititi, that re-imagines Thor more as a goofy layabout than as an omnipotent deity.After teaming with the Guardians of the Galaxy in Avengers: Endgame, Thor has become restless, so he strikes out on his own to find his purpose. Chris Hemsworth reprises his role as the God of Thunder and is clearly having a ball milking the role for laughs. He's threatened by Gorr, the God-Butcher (played fantastically by Christian Bale) a ghastly, reaper-like bogeyman who suffers a personal tragedy, causing him to seek retribution against all gods. Tessa Thompson returns as the female warrior Valkyrie, now the King of Asgard, and Waititi reprises the role of the softly-spoken rock warrior, Korg. Thor's old flame, Dr. Jane Foster (Natalie Portman), reappears as the super-powered Mighty Thor, thus complicating matters. This triggers flashbacks of their domestic life together and the basis for settling unresolved feelings.Waititi has carte blanche to make a romantic comedy with superhero elements, rather than the other way around. Credit to him for having the deftness to balance the levity with the pathos in a style that doesn't diminish either. The sentimentality isn't fully convincing, but his heart is in the right place. Waititi's modus operandi has been to stay true to his idiosyncratic brand of absurdist humour. The arbitrary and whimsical jokes come from beyond deep left field. Every scene is a set up for a gag, whether it be a pair of screaming goats, or the infinity ice cream cones (infinity stones, geddit?), so when a very familiar figure shows up as Zeus speaking with a thick Greek accent, well why not?The film's costumes and technical expertise is top rate, which is to be expected given the budget for this blockbuster. A brilliant, vibrant colour palette livens the proceedings, with mythical and fantasy elements fused into a vivid and gorgeous spectacle full of scintillating battle scenes and special effects. When a song from the 80s rock band Guns N' Roses starts playing, it's just another incongruous element that shouldn't work, but it does. All of these disparate pieces make this an amusing and entertaining romp, giving the Marvel Cinematic Universe another colossal shot in the arm.

title: Funny but forgettable
text: Loved seeing what the characters are doing but it could have been an hour special on disney plus rather than a film. Had some funny parts in it but it was mostly a stepping stone in the marvel universe.

title: Horrible script & worse story
text: It's like the directors/producers purposely set out to make one of the stupidest movies ever made. Why does every movie since about 2017 have to be the most "woke" most "progressive agenda supporting" instead of a great coherent movie that tells a story in an interesting way? Horrible movie that will only be seen and approved of by a small set of people. I hated this movie & request a refund.

title: FULL OF FUN, LOVE AND UPGRADES BUR STILL NO PERFECT
text: Thor love and thunder goes the same direction the last Thor movie did, just in a more epic and lovely way, the second best film of phase 4 by far, the villain breaks the tone, and in a good way, the best villain Thor has got since Loki, the cg is not perfect, marvel needs more attention on it, the performances don't disappoint being Christian Bale the best one, I will recommend to go to the theater prepared to laugh, cry, knowing is a taika waiti film with stupi things all around but doesn't disappoint, also the colors and the photography are awesomeI can say I didn't like Thor Ragnarok but I loved this one, is not perfect but it filled my hearth with joy and excitementStay till the end for the two post-credit scenes because both of them need to be seen!It is not a action movie with comedy it is a comedy with adventure and actionENJOYPD: the music played in this movie was 100000/10.

title: Not the best nor the worst
text: Surprised that there was only minor wok vs in this Disney movie. Without the wok BS it would have been better. Alas Disney just can't help themselves.

title: Better than the 1st 2 but still the same problem
text: Chris Hemsworth is an Aussie beau hunk, maybe THE Aussie beau hunk. And that's a good thing. Natalie Portman is an Ivy League Academy Award winner. And that's a good thing. The two don't mix. At all. The whole Ragnarok redux wasn't a problem. It worked just as well this time as last. It can't fix two leads that have no chemistry. Zero. Still, they are both great individually, the rest of the cast and crew deliver excellent work, and I'm still faklempt over the end / post credits. That new intro music is terrible. Tear Rib Bull. THAT'S gotta go..

title: (Barely) Above Average
text: Powerful themes, strong performances, & robust laughs do the heavy lifting in yet another (barely) above average Phase 4 MCU entry, brought down by the too-common uninspired fight sequences & weak post-credit scenes. #nitrosMovieChallenge.

title: Kind of uneven...
text:
The first part of this sequel is full of jokes, is zainy, wacky and has a light tone. And that works. The second half of it is more serious, with extra stakes, action sequences added and a few emotional moments. And that works too.What doesn't work is that the filmmakers haven't figured out a way to match these dark and funny bits together in a way that fits. There are numerous false sacrifices that don't raise the stakes. Weirdly enough they did this in the Amazon series The Boys as well - and that's a problem.The actors do look like they are still enjoying playing the characters. There were a few, such as the Guardians of The Galaxy, that should have stayed longer. And a few others, such as Korg and the Asguardian kids, that overstayed their welcome. (Waititi plays Korg, so for some reason in this film he gets most of the dialogue)
Valkerie was sadly underused and Jane's feelings towards her illness should have had more screen time.Thor is back and he's here to stay, which is a good thing since I do love his character. But overall this follow up to Ragnarok could have been much better since it had all the ingredients to be. They just weren't used right.

title: Disappointment
text: The movie had no substance, the movie only seems to have some depth whenever christian bale is on screen add to this his extremely small screen time.Hope Marvel learns from this blunder and in future give us a proper movie and not a SitCom.(that too third grade)

title: Fun & Action... but too much pointless humor
text: At its heart, and yes, there is a lot of heart here, THOR: LOVE AND THUNDER is a fun, action-filled Marvel movie that is one of the better ones to come in this tiresome post-ENDGAME phase. This is a movie where the hero's journey is is purposeful and resolute, not only for Thor Odinson but Jane Foster as well. To get on that road, though, takes a lot of patience.As fun as LOVE AND THUNDER is, the movie is also childish, idiotic, superficial, and features way too many Guns-n-Roses anthems. The first twenty or so minutes, where Thor goofs off with the equally-juvenile Guardians of the Galaxy, would tax even the strongest of Asgardian gods. Once the threat of Gorr, the god butcher, arrives on New Asgard's steps, the heroes' quest begins - and that is a most satisfactory story.Taika Waititi makes use of Chris Hemsworth's generous smile and biceps in a familiar and comfortable manner. Thor takes on the mantle of leader and proves he is quite sufficient in the role. Smashing and thrashing and joking (maybe a touch too much of the levity this time around, though) leads to a successful, and actually unsuspecting, ending where you are craving more.First and foremost, Thor is a hero. Hopefully future appearances of the Thunder God will focus more on this aspect and keep the over-the-top humor in reserve. Maybe for a rainy day.

title: Weak movie
text: They ruined a good plot.You don't even need to see it to continue to follow the story line.Way to silly.Enough with Korg character has its course.Narration was dumb .Guardians served no purpose.It was a movie for pride month (it was forced and poorly done).Marvel has no idea what do.

title: Excellent for what it is
text: I saw in IMAX a few hours ago which was mostly great, the action is top notch, surprising amount of comedy, along with so so writing although Christian Bale is one of the best things about the movie! Very enjoyable Thor despite anything Love and Thunder is epically entertaining should be praised a fair amount. Well directed fun Marvel experience that has the right elements a bulk of the time! Has an amazing soundtrack that flows well with everything especially the glossy colorful scenery. I understand the hate as well but there's a lot to enjoy.

title: Thor: Flush and Blunder
text: Terrible waste of Christian Bale. This movie feels like Taika Waititi wanted to do a comedy / parody using the cheesiest, dumbest humor but was stuck with characters from the MCU. People giving a 10 to this mess are either bots or totally paid by Marvel. Never thought to see the day that I would hate a Thor movie.

title: Too Taika?
text: This movie is deeply silly, maybe too silly, too fast-paced, but still filled with things I love. I want more Christian Bale and Natalie Portman than it gave me, but I suppose wasn't disappointed that I got out of the theater in under three hours. An alright Thor flick, but not his best outing.

title: Another letdown by Marvel
text: Kevin Feige needs to re-evaluate the direction of their Cinematic universe and the quality of the content they are churning out. Because it looks like they have shifted their strategy from quality to quantity. It's been not even two years into Phase 4, and I have lost count of how many shows and movies they have released. And looking at the upcoming slate, there seems to be no slowdown.Anyway, coming back to this movie. Taika Waititi is an excellent director. But this movie seems like a rehash of Ragnarok, but ten times worse. This movie is full of jokes in every scene. And most of them don't land. And given that they are in almost every scene, you really can't connect with any of the characters or feel for them.I feel bad for Christian Bale because did an excellent job here with what he was given. And the remaining characters had nothing to do except appear alongside Thor and be a part of annoying jokes. The major focus of this movie seems to be setting up future projects. I wish Taika had focussed on improving this one first. And lastly, this movie probably also suffers because of the short runtime because it tried to jam two best Thor's comic storylines in a movie that's barely 2 hours long.

title: Its a great movie
text: Its as cheesy as it gets! Great movie Highly recommend! So many haters must be such a crap movie Disney has double its money.If you like Guardians of the Galaxy and Thor it has a good mix between both!It fix very nicely in the MCU universe and a good feeling movie. title: Funny but has the weirdest tone
text: Like, it feels like they take so many things that should be dramatic or big and grand and turn it into a joke here, causing the actual dramatic scenes (like the ones with the criminally underutilized Gorr the God Butcher) into really strange sights. Still very funny and has great action sequences. I'm a sucker for trashy entertainment I guess, because I enjoyed this. Overall rating it a LIGHT 6/10. Not bad, but disappointing for a MARVEL movie, especially a Thor movie.

Firstly #chris was good to watch in a little crazy character ,natlie was too cool of mighty #thor mjolnir scenes were good to watch and atlast #christian bale was great to watch as a gorr great actor .overall a fantastic movie of Marvel.

title: Ok.. just ok
text: Doesn't hit the levels Ragnarok had. The comedy is there but sometimes way too much. If this movie had more 'darker' scenes like it had at the end.. it would have been a 9 for sure.
