title: Literally a big joke
text: Plot holes everywhere with thinhs that do not make sense. Empty story full of unecessary jokes to try to fill in the gaps.Thor is a god for god's sake.. thor would never be this dumb as this movie makes him be.

title: Asgards Golden Hour
text: Overall, it was a fun and viewable, comedy was a major focus seemed by the director/writer Taika Waititi blending with the mood of horror suspensed by the antagonist of the movie Gorr The GodButcher (played by Christian Bale).Felt an overdose of humour added into the script which fits in well with Thor (Chris Hemsworth) but seemed a bit forced which distracts the main emotional intentions near the end of the movie. Natalie Portman's character (Jane Foster) had a brilliant execution of being brought back into Marvel after years from her last appearance.Love and Thunder was perfectly expressed due to the end of the movie with major sacrafise and sympathy for one and other. Gorr was portrayed astoundingly, making him one of the creepiest mcu villans to date.Runtime could of been extended as I had a huge interest in Gorr himself, wish to know more of his backstory. Felt rush in certain segments.CGI did wonders with the golden palace, action sequences, shadow creatures etc.Wish to of seen more of Valkarie and Jane's bond of sisterly friendship!Recommend !!

title: Worth a watch
text: The storyline is mediocre, humor is just right for me, same old Marvel I'd say. Couple of visually beautiful scenes. Christian Bale has once again proven his amazing acting skills, eventhough his villian character is introduced to us poorly.

title: Good marvel movie
text:
I genuinely really enjoyed this was worried with the bad reviews but people take comic book movies way to seriously it was funny, action packed and moving
Good job!

title: Enjoyable but not great
text: The movie had amazing cgi and all actors played their roles with success. The biggest problem of the movie is its pace and the fact that it needs time to tell people some jokes. In this way it reduces time from the basic plot and the movie feels a little rushed. Nevertheless i enjoyed the movie but i think that thor deserves something better.

title: Better than I thought but still one of the worst superhero movies of all time
text: I had very low exceptions. Seeing how they dumbed down Thor and made him into a slapstick joke I did not even want to see this movie. So when I say this was better than I thought I mean I thought this would be a -10/10 movie and be so horrible I would not be able to finish it without falling into a radioactive vodka-chamber. So the good news is that this is not THAT bad... The bad news is that this is still absolutely terrible.The good with this movie is that it expand the Marvel Universe somewhat, we get to see some new things, some new worlds, some new characters. The cinematography is pretty great and the CGi hold pretty good. I also think the Jane story was a lot better than anticipated and I almost did not hate her.The bad is everything else. The dialogue is atrocious, the attempt at humour is for children who has never seen a movie before, and the story is beyond contempt. This movie is also very short and it feels very rushed, very cut off like they wanted to make 40min more but did not have the budget or the studio hated it so they sliced of 5min here and there. And the acting... sorry but this is probably the worst acting I have seen in any Marvel movie. Every scene feels forced, and every actor look like they do to not want to be in this movie.Almost all the negatives I mention above I would blame on the director which leads me to my main complaint; the directing is absolutely horrible. This is badly put together, badly edited, too short, badly told and if actors that we know can put in a good performance do not that has to be blamed on the director.Everything else I mainly blame on the script. OMG this is so badly written, absolutely horrible. This movie is written by a 12yo blind and deaf fan of bad humour and then it has been added to by Darth Kennedy who was brought in to polish the script. Then directed by a childish man-baby lacking anything resembling an intellect.I give this 2/10. I do not think Superhero movies can get worse than this. This is on par with the worst of the genre and I cannot phantom who can honestly like this.

title: Pretty disappointed
text: I was pretty disappointed with this movie once I had finished watching it. I expected this to be as good or even better than Ragnarok just because I thought the movie, being once again directed by Waititi, would compare. However, just simply not the case. Im giving it four stars because I still found some enjoyment with some of the jokes, that I might have found funnier than others, and also because of Gorr. Even though Gorr could have been WAY better overall, I still found some enjoyment off of watching him. Also, not a big fan of the whole Mighty Thor thing. I was always a big fan of Jane too, so yeah I was really disappointed.

title: It sucked
text: I was just so disappointed. So much hype for so much let down. It felt like the whole thing was one big joke.The comedy was cheep and not funny at all. Speaking of cheep comedy this entire movie is exactly that cheep comedy. They ruined an extremely important villain in thor's characters encounters. The only good part was christian bale but even a diamond can look bad when it's covered by dirt.

title: This film is many things.
text: First let me start off by saying that Love and Thunder isn't as good as Ragnarok...That being said, that is merely a testament to how good Ragnarok was. This movie was fun, exciting, and surprising. Though, as movies have usually gotten longer recently, I was surprised that this movie was a little shorter than usual, leaving less time to pace and flesh out the story. It was still fun to see, but far from perfect.

title: Ok movie ...
text:
Really disappointed..looked like a regular Disney movie rather regular marvel movie... only good part was Christian bale potrail of gorr .. that too was little underwhelming as they didn't use him to full extent... overall they literally shot bullet points of the whole
Script (if there is any ) into a movie ...

title: Weak and boring
text: I had low expectations going into this, but when the film began my hopes lifted. I knew I was in for some goofiness and I can swallow that from this director, but he flushed all his bathroom humor he could while still garnishing a PG-13 rating. Marvel films have been family friendly for the most part with battles earning the -13, but this is every bit for the sexual innuendos as it is for the violence.While that's a disappointment that's not the reason for the 3 stars I'm giving it.My level of disappointment was in the movie as a whole. This film serves no purpose other than to make Disney money and get Thor thin again. There was absolutely no character growth in this film. It was full of laughs and there's some very cool elements "whosoever be worthy..." is probably the pinnacle of enjoyment for me, but it falls flat against the movie as a whole. It's just empty and things in it that should wow us, like big name actors playing big name characters, leave you instead with greater disappointment.I took my 11 year old to see this and we talked about the adult themes that were unnecessarily thrown down our throats and why they were inappropriate and why his siblings will not be allowed to see it. These things serve no purpose but to bring raunchy humor into a useless comedy, that said, he loved it and had fun.It is fun and full of action, if stupid action flicks are your thing, then this is for you. If you're a Marvel fan and love the character and plot developments this is inline with Ironman 3 and (Indiana Jones 4) in that regard, the Marvel universe can exist without it, but even that movie has more heart and worth than this waste of time comedy.Save your money, tell Disney to get back to their story telling roots and make better films. This is a must miss. (I can't believe I'm saying this about a Marvel film, man I'm disappointed!)

title: Slow start, good finish
text: Frankly the first third of the movie is sllllooow with poor dialogue. Then the pace picks up and scenes become livelier. Enjoyable? Yes. Would I see it twice? Not likely.

title: It was a fun way to spend a couple of hours
text: Ah look, it was a fun movie that could have been more. Like other reviewers I found the comedy off putting and used way too much. It broke the pacing, cheapened the heart moments and made Thor the butt way too often.My favourite Thor is Ragnarok, where the comedy helps the story and doesn't make a monkey out of the hero ALL the time. In L&T this version of Thor just comes off as dumb and self absorbed.Yet when the personal growth comes I just didn't care that much because they spent so much run time making Thor the joke.Everything else was pretty good. Couldn't fault the performances, the effects were top shelf, the sprinkle of teasers for future movies probably a bit merrr.It's worth a watch but not a rewatch.

title: By very far the worst MCU movie so far.
text: This movie was just... ridiculous by so many aspects. There are a few, very few great moments, but which are absolutely not enough to save the film from its director, his color frenzy, and all the ridiculous fluff surrounding the story, that generally make the movie fun, enjoyable, more interesting, but in this case seem like repeated and clear attempts to make the audience cringe.The main story in itself had so.freaking.much potential, and they completely wasted it, got completely lost in derision. Seemed like a sarcastic parody of itself... Lame. This one I'm clearly not going to watch again any time soon, if ever...I feel like it needs a 1* just to try and counterbalance the throng of fake votes made on this site to artifically increase the score of that crap.

title: Not as good as Ragnarock.
text: Too much of a good think can ruin anything. In this case it was all the jokes, it was just too too much! Also most were terrible kiddie jokes. Except for one over the top orgy joke. This is the second Thor film that mentions it. We get Taika! Given all the serious issues of loss and death, the film should have been more serious. Christian Bale was great but they underused him. With Bale being one of the best actors Marvel has ever had, he should of had a lot more scenes. Another great actor Russel Crow was a complete joke! Overall, the film felt rushed and there wasn't any character development. Can I also ask what is up with the CGI in marvel movies/shows lately. It's becoming soooo bad! They hit there peak with the Avengers on how realistic it was, since then it's been going down hill. They are going down the DC path.

title: Bale's Back
text: Bale's back must be hurting after carrying this movie. Natalie Portman as Mighty Thor was awesome to see but Bale stole the show with the little screentime he had. The rest was too over the top and tried to recapture what Ragnarok had.Mid Credit scene makes me eager to see what's next!

title: Yikes
text: With such star power and serious acting ability how on earth didn't somebody yell STOP? This isn't working! Write a script worthy of the actors who clearly did their job in preparation for this mess. All the blame for the much anticipated and highly hyped Thor: Love and Thunder lays at the feet of its director/writer Taika Waititi and I can't believe I had to write that. Often brilliant, all I could think of was why he didn't pass if he didn't want to make another Thor movie! I'm actually worried that someone will get the wrong impression that there isn't a story to tell about Thor when I'd pay to see this one again with a good script and with proper use of the available talent. These movies are made for young teens and enjoyed by adults and this turned me back into an early teen stomping my feet and yelling in my head at the screen for the lame jokes, the pitiful use of Russell Crowe, the tragedy of the lack of use of Christian Bale, (he finally has been given the right role to bother with a Marvel movie and you butcher his story?), the very indifferent story given to Natalie Portman to address the situation she is living in, and on and on. Why were The Guardians even there? Another complete waste! How do you manage to waste Chris Pratt and Brad Cooper too? Not to mention the star!! Hemsworth worked unbelievably hard to prepare for this movie and even he was wasted in this nothing burger, poorly conceived and genuinely indifferent direction with no story, certainly not one worth telling, of what could shoulda woulda been THE blockbuster of the summer! WHO LET THIS HAPPEN!! I'm very worried that the wrong people will get the idea that there isn't a Thor story left to tell when this actor, who has basically dedicated his career to playing him and cares every bit as much as Benedict Cumberbatch does about portraying Dr. Strange, won't get credit where it's due because so much trust was placed in the wrong director because he had a hit with Ragnerok. He keeps saying he didn't want to make it again when that's exactly what he did! This story called for a script that took the material seriously, including humour that hit the target instead of lame 6 year old jokes! And mostly it needed the time, that extra 40 minutes given to Dr. Strange, to fully give Gorr the time he needed to show us his rage and anguish becoming the God Butcher, there's never been an actor better qualified to play a character with the depth of this one (think Oscar Isaac as Moon Knight, where was Christian Bale's chance to bring his incredible performance out of the shadow because he was robbed of story time?). And also time to truly let us feel that Natalie's Jane Foster was the love of Thor's life who this all powerful god could do nothing to save? Where was their moment? Honestly Mr. Waititi, I don't think you wanted to make another Thor movie period and you should have been big enough to pass on it or get help when you knew your script wasn't nearly enough to properly serve the characters in a movie that clearly WASN'T Ragnerok but an epic tale which you admittedly said you filled with every single suggestion received by 6 year olds. How could you? How do you sleep? You're the king of comedy in New Zealand but you're more than that, you can be overly silly but you're extremely intelligent and must have known this was headed off the rails early enough to save it from a near complete disaster! WHAT WERE YOU THINKING???

title: Quite fun
text: The story whether what I have expected (I watches no trailers) nor predictable.The Movie is definitely worth watching but it has a relatively meaningless story, that gives not much to the whole Marvel Universe.Still really enjoyed watching it.

title: A hurricane...and not in a good way
text: Unlike Waititi's Jojo Rabbit, this film jumps between absurd comedy and emotional drama so suddenly that I found it difficult to laugh or feel sad.I didn't have high expectations going into this film because I'm not a huge Thor fan, so while I wasn't disappointed in the movie itself, I am becoming more disappointed in Marvel.Many have said Christian Bale is one of the best parts of the film, but I think his performance is about as inconsistent as the film itself.The film takes a while for anything significant to happen. The excitement slowly increased as it came to an end and left me pretty melancholy after viewing when I was expecting a lot more laughs and light-hearted fun.Love and Thunder's unoriginal story, below average action sequences, and bizarre tonal shifts, make it difficult to feel any emotion at all.

title: A Joke of a Movie
text: This move tried to make everything a joke. Serious parts, funny parts, cute parts, sad parts, everything became a joke. They tried so hard to make it different and stand out, that it just became annoying and very cringe. They also seemed to make the male characters just stupid caricatures of themselves. The women weren't treaded much better. There were scenes where I groaned because it was so bad. Skip this movie in any case.

title: Taika has done it again
text: Not only has he brought back the quintessential humor that made Ragnarok such a success. He was able to paint a masterpiece with not only top quality acting from Christian Bale and Natalie Portman but also cinematography that allows you to be transported into the MCU and really believe you are there. The balance of heart, humor and heroism makes this movie a must see not only for MCU-fanatics, but for all movie lovers alike.

title: Ok but not great
text: Not sure where MCU are heading, it's a typical baddy from no where, fight him and can't beat him then final scenes they beat him, funny at times, my 12 year old gave it it a 6.5/10.

title: One Of The Worst
text: This was one of the worst excuses for a movie that I have seen in the last five years. The dialogue was idiodic, the acting subpar, and the plot............well there was no plot.

title: Not my favorite Thor movie
text: After watching the successful Thor Ragnorok I think we all had high expectations. But this movie fell flat. I liked about 40% of this film and mostly due to the cast. Everyone was superb it was the script and dialogue that killed it. Felt this movie was more suitable for Disney Plus release to be honest. Other reviewers said it best when they mentioned the movie was pure fluff, no substance. Jokes that weren't funny, storylines that were rushed...underused villain. I felt they did a disservice to Christian Bale who is always amazing in everything. He was a good villain but Loki remains my favorite. Natalie Portman was great, this was her best role in the Thor franchise yet. Dare I say, I think I liked Thor 2 better than this one.

title: Bit of a letdown.
text: Funny, but it felt like every line was trying to be a punch line. I love Taika, but it seemed like he got ahead of himself and needed something to reel him back in so the story could go a little deeper. Granted, it is a superhero movie but when you cast Christian Bale as the Vilain the movie can't be all fun. It was good but not as good as it's predecessor. Keep the silly but add a serious undertone and it would have been great. Add some more depth to Thor and it would have been great. A little more of the God Butcher's build up/journey would have been great. It just needed more and felt a little rushed.

title: Wrong choice of director, Thor needs fixing
text: Thor has way more potentials than this, the last 20 minutes were only the actual enjoyable minutes of the whole 120 minutes movie, the storylines and the character can be waaaay more improved, the director insisted on making the main character less charismatic that other second tier characters, which is very lame for a "god".

title: Better Than Any Other
text: "Don't get influenced by any bad reviews guys" . Its a very good movie with perfect combination of action , drama and specially light humour. Music was amazing , Vibe was next level. CHRISTIAN BALE Did A great job giving his character a dark touch OMG . Believe Me Its Worth Watching ðŸ’¯ðŸ’ž.

title: Ok
text: First 5 & last 5 minutes where both heart breaking & heart warming, the rest of the movie however felt rushed & bit goofy . It's a 6/10 for me. As a Thor movie it's ok but for the last instalment of the Thor series I expected a bit better.

title: Disney ruins everything... again
text: This movie is ridiculous. Cringe scenes, bad (really bad) dialog.. The only thing I actually appreciated was Bale's character... Everything else was a shocker for me. Disney came along, and Marvel stopped being serious. The first Thor movie deserves the oscar for best picture if compared to this..

title: THE BEST THOR MOVIE EVER GOD
text: This story line was extremely powerful, it was tight and secured story line, the interpretation of every aspect of the story is just amazing I can't even describe, there are lot of surprise bombs in the flim (it's not like unexpected characters, but unexpected story turn). Coming to the cgi which was really good and I really appreciate it so much, and the most favorite part is the AMAZING MUSIC OMG LITERALLY I LOVED IT SO MUCH. Overall this movies is filled with entertainment and is literally so pleasing, the most important thing is it is worth watching!!! It's so freaking hyping loved it.

title: Poor Thor
text: What have they done?? Tried to add too much comedy to the point it was cringe worthy. A million miles from all the other Thor movies. Getting fed up with how over the top movie makers are nowadays who are trying so hard to push diversity, so much so it's embarrassingly obviousn.

title: It's ok
text: Thor: Love and Thunder is the fourth installment in the Thor franchise and the 29th in the Marvel Cinematic Universe. While it is an entertaining movie, it may not be the best Thor movie or the best Marvel movie overall.The film has a more lighthearted and comedic tone compared to previous Thor movies. Some viewers may find it a bit childish and not as action-packed as they would like. Additionally, there are some cringe-worthy moments in the film that may be off-putting for some viewers.However, the movie does have its strengths. The performances from Chris Hemsworth, Tessa Thompson, and Natalie Portman are all excellent. The chemistry between the characters is palpable, and the humor hits the mark more often than not.Ultimately, while Thor: Love and Thunder may not be the best Marvel movie, it is still an enjoyable and entertaining film. Fans of the Marvel Cinematic Universe should definitely check it out at least once to see how it all unfolds.

title: Not great but still better than Ant Man
text: Same old mistake by recent MCU films over the past few years. Too much was spent on the humour which was a complete hit or miss in this film, that doesnt happen often actually I really cringed at some of it. How about the story? Its a simple and classic Thor story, very enjoyable but they should've spent more building it. I do feel like we were robbed of some more Christian Bale excellent performance.

title: jumanji
text: I think Taika Waititi is not an ideal candidate for the franchise. He has a magical ability to make sad/tragic story to a childish comic charade. This movie is for 11-12 yo kids. They just have to close their eyes 2-3 times and that's it.

title: I laughed so hard
text: This was a great movie. Bale made a terrifying villain and I loved to see Thor trying to win in so many humourous ways. The relationship with stormbreaker was brilliantly done. The choice of using Guns N Roses was perfect. I honestly don't know what people could dislike about this movie except maybe it was too funny!?

title: So Disappointed
text:
The movie had a fairly good plot and I did enjoy the movie but...
there were way to many dark scenes making it almost impossible to make out what I was supposed to be seeing.I was so disappointed this movie could have been the box office hit of the year had they spent a bit more time on ambient lighting. I heard the movie and had to guess in my mind what I was supposed to be seeing on the screen in front of me.I know it takes a lot of time to put together the graphics along with real live actors but had they taken the time to do this right they could have made millions more.I loved the humor in the movie and but I've read some think its cheesy well damn let me see you write a movie and see how it turns out. Glad I went to the drive in to see it had I spent the price of a walk in theater I would have been pissed.

title: Please avoid, make an effort to avoid
text: Sad and unable to mince words. This one is absolute garbage. Audience panned Dark World which wasn't even half as bad as this. It is hard to imagine how exactly were the executives were ok to put this on screen and still everyone had the audacity to make sky high promises in interviews.And yeah, this is how you completely waste someone of Christian Bale's calibre.Taika needs to understand where to draw a line. If a formula worked for Ragnarok, it doesn't mean doubling down on it would be double the fun.

title: Thor as it should be
text: Taika Waititi (and all the cast and crew), if you're reading this, thank you for this movie!Everyone, this movie is amazingly funny, you just need to keep your mind open.All the MCU movies are trying to be soo serious and clever at the same time and it's not working anymore. This Thor is like a perfect parody of the whole recent MCU universe and the genre and it feels to me like at this point it should be.The puns and references are great, cameos are truly funny and surprising, there's not really moments where you'd want the movie to go faster, overall it's just really hilarious. It doesn't happen to me often that I'd be laughing out loud during a movie.Kudos!

title: Nothing to expect much
text: Everything are fine. Just some parts are not very attractive at all.Same all same all Thor still doing what Thor will be doing.Seem can guest the moves.

title: Dont waste your time
text: This movie tried too hard to be a comedy and thats not marvel. I mean alittle comedy is good but this one had it through out the whole movie. Thats why people call this movie a joke and it is lol. Dont waste your time at the theater for this just wait lol.

title: Fun film with great costumes & fx
text: Thor: Love & Thunder was a fun-filled adventure. The great costumes & effects stood out to me above all.While it was fun to watch, it felt like a very long "what if" episode or if the director was given a sandbox with toys and told "go", come up with something.Script and pacing were all over the place. So many of the moments and comedy were so forced, that they killed many of the scenes. While I don't mind the Thor films going with a more "comedic" tone or being self aware that it's not taking itself too serious - there was just too much. The characters, plot and story become a joke. I didn't feel for any of the characters at all because all the "emotional" moments were barraged with jokes every other second.Acting was great as usual and it was nice to see Thor's story arch come full circle to where the actor can potentially retire and the young avengers take over. The story itself was very underwhelming. It's the same message and story we've seen told hundreds of times before.A fun ride overall with some decent moments but far from the best.

title: Very disappointing
text:
I left the cinema half way the movie
Seems like a Thor parody, reminded me of the 300 spartans parody
Does not give you that vibe of superheeo movie, childish script to say the least, way to focused on comedy, bad jokes, scenes moving to fast from one to the other, and the list can continue...anyway very dissappointed.

title: Best marvel movie
text: Wow I was blown away with how good this movie is. I laughed I cried I was shocked. I enjoyed every minute of this movie. I would highly recommend anyone see this movie.

title: Too much of a good thing
text: Thor: Ragnarok revitalised the character after a lacklustre second instalment thanks to it's humour and willingness to embrace the absurdity found in the comics - grand space opera, weird creatures from the stars, and a sense of humour throughout. Thor: Love and Thunder pushes that just a little too far. The movie is essentially Thor's story filtered through the perspective of beloved supporting character Korg, but this is the movie's flaw. No sincere moment is allowed to stand without being undercut by a quip, a sight gag, a silly interruption. There's no emotional solid ground, so you can never become fully invested in the story. The cast is great, the characters are interesting, the setting is compelling, the concepts are intriguing, but the story's unwillingness to allow a moment of seriousness makes even the funny parts less enjoyable. It's not a bad movie, I had fun while I was watching, but you can tell that it could have been much better.

title: Silly, Not Funny
text: I feel like the quality of Marvel Studios movies are steadily decreasing. This movie turns Thor into a joke. While there are some serious moments, the rest of the movie might as well have been written for young children. I love Taika Watiti, but I feel like someone should have reined him in on this movie with the question of 'really?' That's what you want to do in this scene? So your audience is five years old?

title: Tries too hard to be a comedy
text: Not funny. The jokes are way too over the top, and who likes screaming goats anymore? So annoying! When the story gets serious, it's really good and I love all the Christian Bale storyline, but I hate hate the forced comedy. I think it's time for a new director if there are any future Thor projects. There are also dumb cameos that don't need to be in it. I laughed zero times when they showed up. Phase four of the MCU has been hit and miss and this one was mostly a miss compared to others in phase four, with Shang Chi and Spider-Man being the strongest in my opinion. Eternals was the worst, but this one was not too far off.

title: Love and Lack of direction
text: It's hard to tell what this movie is trying to be. Stupidly "funny" or really dramatic, the underdeveloped villain and the quirky moments make this movie just a big scratch on the head. It's not terrible but it just could have been a lot better.

title: Too much of a good thing
text: While I really enjoyed the last THOR film, RAGNAROK, LOVE AND THUNDER proves that you can have too much of a good thing. Waititi goes all out to make an absurdist comedy here and inserts himself into the film way too much, not only co-starring but narrating the darn thing too. And a little of his trademark humour goes a long way, as it turns out. The storyline's okay, Hemsworth is very funny too, but Portman's return is mishandled and her character arc so serious to be completely at odds with the overwhelming goofiness elsewhere. Good CGI and a great Christian Bale can't disguise the all over the place nature of the storyline.

title: Utterly disappointing
text: I loved Thor Ragnarok. Absolutely loved it. I also like Natalie Portman and Christian Bale, so I was really looking forward to this movie, even more so than Doctor Strange. I was disappointed. It's very, very boring. The guardians are somewhat wasted here, Jane's story is not good enough, and Christian Bale's character is boring and uninteresting as a villain. I really think this is one of the weakest MCU offerings. Probably on the same level as Thor The Dark World, which is unthinkable given how much bigger MCU has become since that movie came out, and that it has the same director as the excellent Thor Ragnarok. Eternals failed because it doesnt have interesting characters. This movie has familiar characters, but I think they are not utilised properly. Very disappointed.

title: Absolute drivel from start to finish
text: I have never heard of Taiki Waikiki or whatever his name is, but please don't let him near a movie ever again! He is credited with being both writer and director, you're joking right. This steaming pile of nonsense didn't have a writer - both the script and what passes for a plot must surely have been dreamt up on the day of shooting. God and I thought Ad Astra was bad, it's a classic compared to this. I've given it 2 stars because of Russel Crowe's Greek accent.what a waste of my time and money!!

title: Loving this Thunder!
text: An absolute package of Emotional, Comedy and Action and better than Thor 1 & Thor 2, Ragnarok is on different level ofc. Gorr Aka Christian Bale Stole the Show for being the best MCU villain (not in sense of Power). The only reason I'm disappointed with this film is that we are not in MCU, its M-She-U where Mighty Thor is given more importance in whole movie & Thor is used as Comedy Figure in almost every scene in 1st half.A Good Movie, Must watch on Big Screen to enjoy the creativity.

title: Just Shut Off Your Brain and Enjoy The Movie For What it is
text: It isn't groundbreaking or exceptional but it is very enjoyable. Thor has become more of a comedy than an action film but sometimes it's nice to just enjoy a film for what it is. It is Thor being Thor getting into another adventure. There's a nice appearance from the Guardians of the Galaxy but ultimately it is about Thor and how he discovers who he is.A tip for when watching this. Don't take it too seriously, just enjoy it!

title: Thor: Childish and Unspectacular
text: Other than Christian Bale, the movie came off as movie made for tweens. The comedic relief felt childish. Disney is doing a horrible job with the Marvel franchise.

title: Lots of fun!
text: I really enjoyed this movie! Reminded me a lot of the style of Thor: Ragnarok. Lots of color, humor, and laughs. A nice lighthearted and hopeful movie that is a nice change from so many of the doom and gloom projects out lately. Thumbs up!

title: What the heck?
text: I am a massive Marvel fan. Our whole family is. I never ever thought I would leave a cinema after watching a Thor movie wondering what the heck I had just watched. What on earth were they thinking? It was just one bad joke after another. Such rubbish. And apparently there's going to be another one! I just hope they realise their mistakes and do a ton better job of it when it comes to writing their script!! I for one feel like I'll be questioning whether to even go to the cinemas to watch any more if they continue to go down this path. Very very disappointing.

title: I thought it was great. Not perfect, but great.
text: Yes it's more like a comedy. But I enjoyed it all. It doesn't always work, but most of the time it does.The movie is the same formula as Ragnarok. So just action and jokes, combined with serious moments.If you liked ragnarok, you'll like this. If you didn't, you'll probably hate this. I'm excited to see what's next for thor.

title: Marvel just made a joke of this
text:
The plot itself is pretty decent - 8/10
But the approach Marvel chose really does not fit it. It's just too big of a comedy. I usually love Marvel's sense of humor, but this is just way too much.The end is also extremely disappointing. Definitely worth watching. It's Marvel. Just don't expect to be blown away as usually.

title: Shouldn't be a comedy
text: When you think marvel, comedy shouldn't really come to mind. I know Disney's taken the marvel franchise into a more "comedy" oriented route, but it doesn't work.The soft jokes that the director waititi and the writers put in this film are not funny. Caddy shack 2 had better comedy in it and that movie was horrible. That, coupled with the applause breaks they felt they needed to put into the film, makes this a very bad comedy.A movie that included gorr as the villain should have had a darker more adult tone to it. Disney is afraid of making such films, but it deserved to be a darker more structured story. The comedy just doesn't land.If you like marvel films and have to watch them all, just wait till it's streaming to see the film. I do not believe it's worth spending money to see this movie. Let me reiterate; it is NOT a good comedy.

title: Opposite of what the other reviews say. Not for movie snobs.
text: Ok, not every movie Marvel/Disney makes can be Endgame. Let's get past that. For some reason, Eternals is rated higher. That movie blew. This is a very lighthearted, sometimes serious, epic movie. It looks great, although sometimes the colors are over saturated, but maybe they meant to do that. Please just expect that with the Disney influence, that these newer marvel movies may err more on the side of being over-silly. Still had a solid plot and it's easy to watch. The guardians scene is hilarious. Jane and Thor are a power couple as well. This film also was a tear-jerker. I experienced all emotions while watching this...good watch! Still better than a lot of bs on netflix.

title: Abysmal
text: I have been going to the cinema every week for the last 20 years (except covid) so have seen thousands of movies. I have only ever walked out of 2 movies because they were so so bad and this one came very close to being number 3! Absolute childish rubbish, Marvel has truly lost the plot of what a good movie is, I cannot believe it came from the same people that made Avengers and Iron Man. The only saving grace was Christian Bale who made an excellent baddy. Do yourself a big favour and give this a miss.

title: Thor: Love and Thunder Review
text:
Thor enlists the help of Valkyrie, Korg and ex-girlfriend Jane Foster to fight Gorr the God Butcher, who intends to make the gods extinct.Thor: Ragnarok is not only the best Thor film but one of the best MCU films in general, so Taika Waititi had his work cut out for him in Thor: Love and Thunder. So did it live up to Ragnarok let's see.The cast is all around great and the chemistry between Chris Hemsworth and Natalie Portman is on full display. They really brought their relationship to life in this one and I feel they handled it much better then the first two Thor films. But I do feel that certain plot points involving their characters were rushed and didn't deliver the emotional punch the writers were looking for. Christian Bale is the standout for me (which is exactly what I expected), his performance as the gritty intimidating Gorr is amazing and why I wish we got more of it. The vast majority of Marvel films have the issue of not focusing on the villain enough and this film is no exception. Every scene involving Gorr is incredibly well done and if they were to have given me more of that it may have been the best MCU film but the constant shift in tone taints the overall quality.Every scene that didn't involve Gorr was very comedic and I felt that the comedy was not handled well for a number of reasons. First when you set up a movie with a villain as dark as Gorr, you need to keep the tone consistent and this film did no such thing. There were a lot of well written jokes but they didn't at all mix with the overall story. Gorr has one goal and that is to kill all the gods and he does some pretty messed up stuff to achieve this goal so to take that premise and intertwine it with a romantic comedy you get what is a very weird feeling movie.The visuals are across the board great and one fight sequence in particular may be one of my favourite from the MCU. The music is very on point throughout the entire film as they pair the awesome action sequences with amazing classic rock hits.Overall Thor: Love and Thunder is a good film. Thor and Jane finally receive their deserved development and Christian Bales Gorr is nothing short of menacing. But the lack of a consistent tone makes for a weird and at times frustrating watch that taints the overall quality of the film.7/10
B+

title: Funny and Fun
text: Looking for a good follow up to Thor Ragnarok? Enjoy super hero films with goofy humor, quality fight scenes, fun banter, and great rock music? If so - this is your jam. Now if you don't want any of that, and prefer dark, serious, strong and gritty - this is not your jam. Go watch any of the DC Films.Legitimately a FUN movie. Not a serious movie. (Similar to Thor 3 and Guardians of the Galaxy.) Concentrates more on the laughter than anything else, which is something I prefer and enjoy when it comes to Marvel films. Cheers.

title: All's Fair in Love and Gorr
text: This movie is overhated. There. I said it. There is a lot to love about this film, and here's what I think:1) Gorr the God-Butcher: Christian Bale delivers an amazing performance as the sympathetic villain Gorr, who after realising Gods are useless, goes on a killing spree of deities (unfortunately, not enough God-Butchering on-screen). Every scene with him is instantly better for his presence.2) Guns 'N Roses: The soundtrack is filled with GNR songs like Welcome to the Jungle, Paradise City, and the perfectly timed use of November Rain's outro, that successfully gives me chills despite that the scene is literally a bunch of kids fighting monsters. Made the moment a thousand times cooler.3) Thor and Jane: I love the rekindling of Jane and Thor's relationship and the themes of love they carry, as well as loss.And the screaming goa-... No, the screaming goats definitely overstayed their welcome, haha.Overall, while this movie certainly does have problems, it is a really fun film and definitely isn't as bad as the reviews would have you think.

title: Fairly typical silliness
text: Standard Thor film from the MCU, with plenty of humour and CGI to spare. Hemsworth is genuinely amusing as usual and Crowe gets a laugh or two, but Portman largely struggles with the comedy. Natalie is quite believable as the Mighty Thor however, and has some OK moments. Bale delivers the best villain since Thanos and the GNR soundtrack rocks. Fairy typical silliness overall. 6/10.

title: Don't waste your money
text: Hands down the worst marvel film ever ! I thought morbius was bad but this takes it to a whole new level! Acting was appalling. Trying to be funny when it wasn't! Just hands down a painful watch! It was literally cringeworthy. Absolutely gutted as I'm such a marvel fan. Wouldn't waste your money and time on this at all. I've not walked out of a cinema in my life until now !

title: Silly God/Goat
text: Round two ... my internet really pulled one on me. I had the complete review written and then it ... well it went away. So from the start - and probably a bit different than the other review I wrote. A bit like the Thor you get here. Taika reinvented him for Ragnarok - and he even went further with this installment.You have to dig what he does - and his humor too of course. I understand that some do not like the humor. You can't fault the movie technically speaking though. Ask (your) kids - maybe you got a bit weary, but they surely haven't. And the darkness that Christian Bale brings to his role (great as always of course), will not faze them either.Bale who gets introduced first in the movie. Might be a (new) trend for Marvel. Giving us the bad guy, before we see the good guy(s). Moon Knight did the same (Ms. Marvel did not of course), but let's keep an eye out for that.Bales character is not alone when he gets introduced. There is someone with him. And while you may want to forget about it. Bale will not let you. He will keep talking about that character - so much so, that you may get a bit annoyed. But there is a reason (or two, no pun intended) for that.Everyone except Bale can show off their silly side. Adding a bit of gravitas from time to time. But the darker tone and mood is kept for Bale and his character. He may not have much screentime, but the movie called Thor (whoever that might be - you probably have seen the trailer so you have an idea I reckon).But apart from reintroducing characters to us, the movie is also reintroducing the Thor (movie) mythology to us. So if you or the little one you are with or whoever have not seen the previous movies, you get a "what happened" at the beginning. Not everything will be rehashed. There is another flashback kept for later in the movie.This is the fourth Thor movie and aside of Hugf Jackman as Wolverine, no one has played a comic book character as long as Chris Hemsworth has. And the latter has gone through quite the transformations. I understand if you are not into the humor.I myself had an issue with another character (that you may already know is in the movie). The portrayal and the accent seemed weird to say the least. But even though I had my own preconceptions about that ... I'll call it character, I understand that Taika only wanted to do his thing. I did not know he was part of the Marvel comic book cannon to be honest, but I am not as involved in the comics as others are.So while there is not much story here (getting from point a to b and all that), there are a lot of cool set pieces. And a lot of weird (Taika) humor. Like him expanding the God universe if you want to call it that. Which is sort of the scene I was talking about above.It all makes sense in the end though and for me the balance between silly and drama did work. You have to suspend your disbelief, maybe drink a little bit of that kool aid and just go with the flow.I for my part am happy Thor is back. At the end of Avengers Endgame, no one seemed to know (apart from Kevin Feige probably), if any of the surviving (and available, no pun intended to the "old" man, who passed on ... well you know what) characters would return. So seeing Thor get into the Guardians of the Galaxy ship really made me hope he'd return. I thought it would be in a Guardians movie, but it's them who were in this ... at least for a little bit. A funny little bit that is.And then you have the end credits scenes. People should be aware of them, but still some get up and leave. As with most MCU movies (minus Endgame), you get some bonus and look into the future. One scene during the credits and one after ... both are promising and really great to say the least.So sit back, relax and let the (mostly) lightness wash over you ... it would be a shame if you couldn't. I just had to laugh, because there is a moment where Thor is naked. You don't see a front shot of that, but you do get to see his behind ... uncensored, if that means anything to you. It's another joke and it does work quite well too (no pun intended).Edit: almost completely forgot a few important things. One thing I am surprised by. Well the non reaction from people who are into religion (no matter what kind) that is. Because the movie essentially is critisizing almost everything about religion. It does make fun of Gods ... no pun intended. This is more than the silly depiction of Thor. This is kind of an atheist ... well heaven (another pun I know). It is underlying, but it is not subtle to be honest.And of course the music - Guns N Roses for the win as some might say. Music apparently played a big role during the making of the movie. And if you don't mind classic rock as I reckon people would call it now ... well you could do a lot worse.

title: Too much miss, too little hit
text: The overall idea of the plot was good, but the execution not so much.A big chunk of jokes didn't land, and a big chunk of those that didn't land I even found disturbing/awkward, because they lasted too much time. It was like they started with the punch line, but just didn't stop. The first 10 minutes of the movie is especially filled with this type of humour, which even made me consider leaving the cinema.Christian Bale's performance was the only noteworthy thing about the movie, outside of maybe the visuals I guess, but he didn't have enough screen time to really carry it.

title: Watiti's fingerprints are all over!
text: Let me start by saying that this movie won't be enjoyed by all equally, however, for those, like me, who are a fan of Taika Watiti's other work, you will love this movie!The characters are given just enough of an emotional arc to bring some occasionally tear jerking drama, but the humor is what sells this movie. Sometimes the humor is so dry it's painful, which of course means I couldn't stop laughing. Everyone talks about how wonderful Bale, Portman, and Thompson are and they are absolutely right, but Thor is still my favorite. Hemsworth nails the dramatic and the comedic in rapid fire. It's actually astounding that the movie can be so damn lighthearted and dry in its humor, often to the point of satire and even spoof, one minute and then switch gears and make your tear ducts activate the next. It shouldn't work, but for me it did. Again, this hits so many of the same beats as Ragnarok and Our Flag Means Death and Jojo Rabbit and Hunt for the Wilder People. If you loved those movies as much as I did, you won't be disappointed. Frankly though, if those movies weren't your cup of tea, then neither will this.

title: "Thor" is more rambling than love or thunder.
text: The Marvel movies are leaving me with the feeling of "oh ok, another movie". I no longer feel that exhilarating energy I felt before.Taika Waititi showed in "Jojo Rabbit" that he knows how to use humor as a tool for resilience when dealing with difficult and very sensitive topics. In this case, I believe that Marvel's heavy hand has destabilized the dosage."It's not that he misses, it's that he doesn't get it right" PERFECT DEFINITION ðŸŒ·Thor: Love and Thunder is better than Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness, but not by much."Just don't make mistakes who don't." Very well said. I think the worst thing about people is always expecting the closest to perfection from others, when we ourselves don't even get 10% of what we really want.Marvel no longer cares about the quality of the movie itself. The content machine cannot stop. Connections to other movies, cross-references, Disney+ series hooks, and post-credits scenes. Everything seemed fine until Phase 3 of the MCU. In phase 4, which started with the Black Widow movie, everything went wrong. All movies are more concerned with taking the fan to the next movie. The biggest proof of this was Doctor Strange who managed to make a solo movie that doesn't develop character and that Wanda is practically the star of the movie.After Endgame the MCU became a Netflix! Quantity ALWAYS, quality ALMOST NEVER! If I hadn't liked Ragnarok, which the critics loved, imagine this one being massacred! It is a pity!Grade: 6.4/10.

title: What a mess!!
text: I would rather watch Thor: The Dark World on repeat for the rest of my life, than sit through that disjointed attempt at comedy ever again. 90% of the "jokes" (if that's what you want to call them), of which there are entirely WAY too many, fall flat.

title: It's fun but too much stupid attempts at comedy big it down and stop it from really hitting its stride!
text: Yeah too much of everything kind of, like for example the screaming giant space goats, it would have been funny as a one-off joke but it's something that pops up throughout the whole movie! And this movie really assumes you must love Korg a whole lot because he has not one but three patronising narrations that open and close the movie and bring you up to date with what happened between here and Endgame, and I didn't like those scenes very much as they just didn't do it for me and felt like a lazy attempt to condense the story and get it moving faster, one would have worked at the beginning of the movie but it's overdone, and so is Korg grossly, I thought he worked much better in Ragnarok because he and the schtick approach was new and was done much better and just enough for it to not be to obnoxious in that movie, but here I felt sick of him within moments and he way overstayed his welcome and was just annoying as fk!! Urg it's like the movie was made for severely attention deficit people who can't sit still and take in a movie for like two minutes, it was terrified of slowing down even just a little and just letting the story breathe for a while, the rapid fire jokes were for me having a bad effect on the more serious aspects and the pathos, I thought it clashed horribly when it would go from her as the lady Thor to sick and dying in the hospital, you simply cannot plonk something as deadly serious as freaking cancer in a movie like this and expect it to work, it's like having Billy get a brain tumour in Gremlins 2! It felt like there was a really good movie in there somewhere, just between Thor Jane and Gorr but it didn't focus on that enough, I really didn't think Natalie Portman and Chris Hemsworth has any chemistry at all in the original movie but here I thought the opposite, they're a little older and things have changed a lot since that picture and she seemed more relaxed than before and I liked her as a warrior woman I thought it was cool, I was surprised by how she ended up at the end I thought it was surprisingly sad, don't worry about her coming back in any sequels folks! Christian Bale was surprisingly awesome and very creepy as the villain, I thought he came off as genuinely insane and lethal, I wanted more of him, he was probably the most threatening villain in a marvel movie yet. I also loved how his story ended as well, never expected to see one of the biggest cosmic entities of the Marvel universe in one of the movies, kudos to Taika for not having Eternity crack some goofy joke, although I'm sure it was severely tempting! There was definitely some awesome things in it, I loved the visuals and some of the huge locations, and the hall of the gods and the silly Zeus was where I thought the comedy did work really well and I liked that scene a lot with Thor declaring the gods cowardly and ticking off the most lazy Zeus ever, look forward to see where that leads in the future. I was overall slightly disappointed with this, it took what worked for Ragnarok and cranks it up to eleven and for some that might work but for me the comedy was mostly just annoying and obnoxious, frequently stopped the movie dead and prevented it from really ever taking off in a big way, this overstuffed cosmic mess of a film proves that Mr Waititi is capable of overestimating his strengths as a director and also that he could really do with learning a little restraint! X.

title: liked it enough
text: After suffering a devastating lost, Gorr (Christian Bale) seeks to destroy all the Gods. Thor (Chris Hemsworth) must save the children of New Asgard who have been kidnapped by Gorr. Jane Foster (Natalie Portman) is dying from cancer. She is chosen by Mjolnir to be the Mighty Thor. They are joined by King Valkyrie (Tessa Thompson) and Korg (Taika Waititi). Russell Crowe makes a memorable appearance as Zeus.This is trying very hard to be funny. Sometimes it is funny. Sometimes it's a little awkward. It's a little worst when compared to Ragnarok. I never bought into the Thor and Jane Foster romance. Basically, Jane turns into a girlie puddle in the presence of Chris Hemsworth's muscles. It's fine but it's no Romeo and Juliet. At least in this one, Natalie Portman has many dimensions to play. Her character has so much more. With more daring, this would be a two person journey. Thor could really dig into his relationship with Jane. In the end, I love these characters and I like this movie enough.

title: A Popcorn Flick
text: The first two Thor films were dark, one note and a little dull. All that changed when Taika Waititi took over the director's chair for "Thor: Ragnarok". Full of bright colors, poignant humor, and a complete reinvention of the character, "Thor: Ragnarok" is one of the most beloved stories in the MCU. Similarly, this film is bright, cheerful and flashy. It falls more in the comedy genre than action, which is both positive and distracting at times.The villain in this movie, Gorr the God Butcher, is one of the most fascinating antagonists in the MCU. His story is compelling and just looking at him will run chills down your spine. Christian Bale ("The Dark Knight") nails his portrayal of the character and is one of the highlights of this movie.The film does a great job of recapping Thor's experience over the last decade and sets the stage without having to hop on Disney+ to watch the predecessors. The supporting characters are likable (especially Korg), the humor is exactly what you would expect from a Taika project and the runtime is well balanced.This is the first installment in the Thor franchise without his brother, Loki, and the absence is felt. Apart from Gorr, some of the new characters introduced were overly comedic and took away from the heart of the film. The second act was weak and focused more on setting up future installments than staying in the present.If you have seen the trailer, you know that the Guardians of the Galaxy are in this movie. Unfortunately, we will have to wait until "Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 3" in 2023 to see them in action, because their screen time is extremely limited.There are moments with real character development and complex emotions, but those scenes are undermined by an onslaught of jokes. Personally, I love Taika Waititi's style and humor, but it might be too much for some viewers."Thor: Love and Thunder" is a popcorn flick. It is upbeat, visually impressive and transports you to another universe. The humor might be a bit excessive, but it's a break from the traditional MCU mold. In my personal rankings, I have this movie just below "Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 2" and above "Ant-Man and the Wasp". It's a solid entry in the Marvel Cinematic Universe and a lighthearted theater experience.

title: How to ruin a great franchise!
text: What I do not understand is how such great talent agrees to participate in something so worthless and down right stupid. Some will try to defend it under the premises of humour but I'm sorry there is no defence for this movie. The only good thing about this movie was the popcorn.

title: Why the hate?
text: This movie is lots of fun! Easily top 10 MCU films in my book. It's nice to have a more laid back story leading up to what's to come.. this is why I come to the movies.. I laughed, I cried and I laughed some more.. go watch it and know it will at the very least make you laugh a lot.

title: It is a parody of itself.
text: I now understand all the hate that movie has been getting from all the Marvel/Thor fanbois - they wanted a GTA4 but they got Saints Row 3 instead!!! I think the only way to watch it is to establish this is a parody (even if it isn't, just assume for your own sake it is) and just watch it, expecting nothing more than 2 hours of spoofs, silly jokes and other movie references. I am not going to rate it, because I would have to give it two rates: a proper Thor/Marvel movie - 2/10, a spoof/parody - 5.5/10 (had few laughs).To summarise - all the usual aspects of a film: acting, script, plot etc. Are on par with Marks brothers' movies. Humour is somwhere around Benny Hill and Mister Bean - you will get few laughs, but that is definitely a no-brainer.

title: Thor's latest outing is an easy if forgettable watch
text: In 2017 Kiwi writer/director Taika Waititi changed the direction of the up until then po-faced Thor in surprising and commercially beneficial ways with the wild and inventive Thor: Ragnarok but proving once more that you can't always capture lightning (thunder?) in a bottle, Waititi's return to the solo Thor universe with Love and Thunder provides a carelessly fun few hours while also continuing Marvel's recent trend of feeling like a brand that is at present slightly aimless.With no surprise that Waititi and his main man Chris Hemsworth bring the same manic and off-kilter vibes to Love and Thunder that they delivered with Ragnarok, fans of the pairs first wild collaboration are sure to find much to enjoy this second time around with an abundance of insane characters (literally one that is a Bao Bun), colorful action and quirky humor but there's something a little off here that holds their newest venture back with tonal imbalances, a so-so story and a feeling of pointlessness all apparent in a relatively quickfire venture that at least never tries to outstay its welcome.Following the exploits of everyone's favourite Asgardian god as he gets back in shape and venture's around the known and unknown universe with The Guardians of the Galaxy, only to find his life upturned by the arrival of Christian Bale's Gorr the God Butcher and the return of Natalie Portman's Jane Foster, Love and Thunder has a lot of ground to cover through its runtime and Waititi never allows anything to linger too long in the memory and while there are some nice highlights with a trip to a city of the gods run by a fairly hilarious Russell Crowe as Zeus one such moment, there's also a feeling a lot of good material happens off screen with both Jane and Gorr's arcs in the film feeling they could've done with some screen-time and fleshing out.Portman's much-hyped return to the Thor world has some nice moments but her transformation into a weapon wielding god happens with fairly little build-up or time in the spotlight feeling like a missed opportunity while as good as he is (give this man a monologue to chew on any day of the week) there's a feeling like Bale could've had more too do as Gorr, a villain that could rival Thanos given the time to shine, Bale is having a blast going all out in his first foray into the Marvel universe after crossing over from the DC space but much like Foster's arc in the film there's a lot of Gorr's experiences and exploits that happen off-screen here, holding Gorr's first cinematic outing back from becoming an all-timer.At days end Love and Thunder is a film that many are going to love, while some will dislike it even more than Ragnarok's new directional take on the chiseled god but there's no denying there's an aimlessness happening here that even the most dedicated of Marvel fans couldn't deny with a sense Marvel needs to unveil its overall plans fairly quickly and Waititi to keep pushing himself as a director ensuring his style and mannerisms don't continue to dwindle.Final Say -A mindlessly enjoyable film with sporadic moments of brilliance that coasts by on its easy-going charm and charisma, Thor: Love and Thunder marks an intriguing period for its titular character and its brand name company as begin to wonder more than ever what the point of everything happening really is?3 rock babies out of 5For more reviews check out Jordan and Eddie (The Movie Guys)

title: Adventure Time
text: Okay, I can totally understand peoples criticisms with this movie, on the other hand I found many parts of the movie very fun and entertaining.I'll start with what I liked, Jane was way more enjoyable than I anticipated and so were the goats. AHHHHHHHH. The action in the movie was really good, the visuals and score were also quite good. People say they just made Thor stupid but I think he's just hiding how he feels, he beats around the bush but even a god can be scared to open themselves to people, my highlight was Gorr, REALLY good performance, I wanted more !!!! I think Les's can be betterMy gripes. For a god butcher, I would have liked to see more than one god get slaughtered because Gorrs presence was frightening, the comedy, I like marvel comedy and have never complained, this movie has too much, it was like the Big Bang theory laugh track, a bit too much, the ending fell a little flat and just seemed to be shoved at you very quickly.An enjoyable movie but I wouldn't be rushing to see this one again any time soon, 7/10.

title: At this point, Thor become a movie for kids
text: I don't know, I'm disappointed, mixed feelings.. does anyone know if Disney has bought Marvel? I know that marvel is a subsidiary of Disney but Marvel has always had its own style up until now anyway... you notice that disney has started to decide more in the marvel movies.. for example Korg when he tell a story about his two fathers who managed to give birth to a stone (which nonsense, sigh).. This Thor movie felt more like an old Disney movie i saw when i were 9 years old (23 years ago). At this time i was tagged and liked the cool budget effects without noticing how poorly made they were. That's how it was in this Thor movie now 23 years later. There was no context and no serious mission either, I think this was one of the cheapest movies Marvel made and it's made for kids?. The movie felt like a parody of a real Thor movie but the bad thing is that Chris Hemsworth is parodying himself? I must say, however, that the film had a very few serious and good moments that are worth mentioning (NOT).. the whole movie warth a 2a nothing more.

title: A film filled with fun!
text: If you want a film that's fun, silly and unashamedly self-deprecating, then this film is on the money. It won't be an Oscar winner, but then, when you sign up to watch films like this, you shouldn't be expecting anything deep and meaningful to be at the top of the list.There are some fantastically funny (and very silly) moments throughout. I'm a father of two kids and its fair to say we all loved it and it's not easy to cover all the age ranges in any film. I think Taika has got it spot on. Thor's character has grown, and he's become a caricature of himself now, but what a character! He's lost his purpose and is finding his way! The unpredictability makes it all the more fun! The ensemble of supporting characters add to the fun as well.If you want a serious film, then don't sign up for this. It's supposed to be fun. I wanted fun. It was fun. If you want a serious film then don't sign up. Simple. Some of the absurdly low reviews are clearly from people who went into it looking for something else; where is their sense of fun?Thoroughly recommend! More of the this please!

title: What a waste.
text: Marvel has surrendered to the woke mob and filled this movie with woke nonsense. A little bit of silliness is funny, but they went WAY overboard with it here. Don't waste your time and money.
