title: The worst marvel movie!!!
text: This movie is without a doubt the worst marvel movie, ridiculous, pointless, with a very bad story. Taika Waititi ruined Thor.Thor is the god of thunder, a warrior, an avenger, here he is nothing more than a clown, a bad joke, the jokes every minute are boring and take away the seriousness of the villain and the plot, there are ways to be funny but this is just ridiculous!!!Taking advantage of the multiverse they should act as if this had never happened and perhaps create a "worthy" thor in another universe!!!

title: Comedy, comedy and poor comedy
text: The movie is all about comedy, comedy, and some more comedy.This kind of movie should be Sci-Fi, Adventure and not I repeat not comedy.It is totally unenjoyable movie to watch, acting is fine by all actors/actresses, but the obvious script and directing are not for this type of movie.It ruined the MC's vision of good Adventure and Sci-Fi movies.You just gotta have a proven script for Sci-Fi movies, this isn't it.It's a complete waste of good casting.I hate that nowadays movies don't have a plot, they are so fast and you gotta concentrate so much instead of having fun watching the movie.

title: Too much Taika influence.
text: After watching this, I felt a little let down by the excess of banter and comedic undertones. The other reviews tell me that I'm not alone. In short, too much nonsense and not enough meaningful plot or character development. The Guardians appear for a few scant minutes early in the going and Christian Bales Gorr is woefully underused, and spends precious little time onscreen. The movie is a 7/10. It's funny and enjoyable but should have been so much more.

title: Definitely worth seeing but doesn't quite reach the height of its predecessor.
text: This is a tough movie to explain. I can't say there was a part of Thor: Love & Thunder I didn't enjoy, but I also left the theater feeling unsatisfied. There were great parts! The space goats and Thor's jealous battle ax were highlights. There was a big fight scene with some of the best special effects in a Marvel movie to date. But the ending felt sudden and disappointed me, while the movie overall lacked something that made me connect and care about the plot.

title: Edited to death, and beyond....
text: Coming from a place of voracity and enthusiasm for the MCU, to say Thor L&T was a disappointment would be an understatement. Honestly, giving it a 6 even feels generous. This movie fails on so many accounts; pacing, story building, character development, and so on. Even with so many great tools at their disposal (high caliber actors, effects, director) they still managed to destroy whatever this movie could have been by speeding the plot along to try and meet a 2 hour run time. Christian as Gorr was completely wasted.. his presence in this story felt completely arbitrary, and disposable. The only exciting thing from a fan's perspective was the introduction to the cosmic abstracts, which i'm hoping will be further expanded in future movies.So my advice would be to come into this movie with low expectations, and hope it exceeds them. But in reality this movie ranks very very low within the MCU's body of work. It's definitely within the top 5 worst marvel movies, without a doubt. It seems i'm not alone in saying so either.

title: Worst Marvel film ever
text: This movie is a parody, a poor one. The storyline is too simplistic. There are way too many LGBT references. It seems like a manipulative propaganda. The movies is most surely targeting children, but it's better to keep it away from kids.

title: What We Needed After Endgame
text:
After losing Tony Stark and Black Widow I was eager for a movie from the MCU that embraced the humor. I figured Taika Watiti would bring the funny and still provide a wild ride.Christian Bale did an amazing job. He makes a terrifying villian and takes on the mantle of the serious scary stuff well. I must admit to some jumping in my seat at his scenes.Russell Crowe is clearly having a great time and I'm here for it. (Did anyone else think he could have busted out the Windex at any moment?)
Tessa Thompson and Natalie Portman did some serious work building hero bodies. Props to them! So much for the old belief that strong women aren't sexy.This movie is great!

title: It felt so weird
text: The movie was funny, but it had this weird pacing that made the movie feel so weird, and when the climax of the film happened I wasn't sure if it was the climax or another part in the film, structure was all over the place. I am really disappointed.

title: Our Gang really had fun watching this
text: We all know now that the hardcore Marvel fans hate it when the MCU films don't take themselves too seriously. But for us it was a fantastic experience, lots of humour, good action and still, big emotions, regarding the couple and the villain. The story was interesting, and we'll obviously see a much darker side of Zeus in the future. The cinematography is excellent as well. Great EntertainmentPhase 4 is so interesting because it's much more varied, in the themes, the heroes and their stories. This obviously brings a lot of new fans, but confuses or bores some of the old ones. I love it, they don't repeat the formula of Phase 1-3, so it stays fresh. Good Job, Marvel.

title: Can't Wait for the Next One!!
text: If you wanted more of the magic from Thor: Ragnarok, it's here in spades. By virtue of his design, Christian Bale's deliciously hammy performance, and the delicious shadows swirling around him, I couldn't keep my eyes off Gorr the God Butcher. I could listen to this villain talk for ages. He and his plot take our heroes to some of the most visually creative locations and set pieces we've seen in the MCU thus far. When set to the great Michael Giacchino's score and a perfectly-fitting hair metal soundtrack (lots of Guns 'n Roses with a dash of Dio), you're fully whisked into a world that could only happen in comic books. It's just a notch below Ragnarok due to the occasional leap in logic (one in particular towards the end comes out of the blue). However, this is for sure on par with Thor Odinson's best adventures. Taika Waititi was born to direct this lovable himbo space-Viking. I can't wait for the next classic-rock science-fantasy trip. If those end-credits teasers are any indication, there's plenty more to explore with the God of Thunder.

title: Thor love and blunder
text: Complete waste of time , money and patience .. this movie is a parody of itself , taika waiting has ruined the franchise. No plotlines , all good scenes ruined with unnecessary attempts of what they think is humor .. thor made to look like a bungling bafoorn , Bale tried his best to bring something into the movie but didn't get enough screen time or dialogues to make a difference.

title: Actors and their kids cook up an entertaining Superhero movie.
text: Right away this Marvel movie comes across as different. It is more whimsical and has more humor built into the script. All of which, for me, make it a more fun movie and the almost 2 hours passes rather quickly.What is it about? Well Thor has sort of gone into semi-requirement and has a beer belly. But when he learns that a rogue god is on a mission to kill all the other gods, and gain immortality for himself, he gets re-energized and rounds up the band of superheros to fight to make things right.As you watch more and more of these they begin to seem all alike, until this one, which has much more fun with the topic. And the town of New Asgard with all the kids, incidentally played by many of the children of the main actors and the director.Not a memorable movie but my wife and I enjoyed it at home on DVD from our public library.

title: Just plain fun
text: Love and Thunder doubles down on the success Ragnorak had and just tries to be a funny and light movie. Whereas Ragnorak had a little bit of something for everyone, this movie clearly targeted a much younger audience. The film doesn't take itself seriously at all and the pacing is probably the fastest we've ever gotten out of the MCU. Whether or not this works for you or not is completely subjective. I would've preferred a more mature approach to Gorr and Jane but that just isn't what this movie was going for. If you're expecting a complicated and nuanced story you won't be getting it, but if you're looking for a fun and heartfelt movie that is exactly what you'll get.

title: Not but favorite Thor movie but not as bad as people will have you believe
text: A lot of people seem to be hating on this movie but it's actually pretty good. The criticisms seem to be because its too comedic and maybe it is but its still a fun watch. Chris Hemsworth is great as always and it was nice getting Natalie Portman back as Jane. The action is done very well and visually this movie is stunning. I do think Marvel has spread themselves a bit thin and its beginning to show in a lot of their MCU series and movies but I still don't understand the dislike of this movie from a lot of people. The average movie goers who arent obsessive with the MCU will more than likely thoroughly enjoy Love and Thunder.

title: 6.8 .. Good, but tried really hard to be funny
text: Christian Bale saved this film from being a total flop in my mind. I liked it as a movie but, as an MCU movie I have a higher standard. I expected more. It reminds me a lot of the new suicide squad in that it pushed to have a joke every frame. All the acting was pretty good, just the lines and the story was not quite to the standard set IMO.Another thing I want to point out was that some scenes are visually stunning with the color patterns. All in all it's a pretty funny, average movie.

title: Marvel is dead in cinema!
text: Marvel had a good run to the end of Thanos. After that, they make less than mediocre movies, tv shows that are just fan service, and horrible video games! Sad to see.

title: Great film ! 8/10
text: It follows the same marvel formula established by the great Kevin Fiege, who is the main reason Marvel studios is so successful and is my FAVOURITE film franchise. The Taika Watiti humour and directing style is same as Ragnarok, although I enjoyed Ragnarok more, this still holds up to be an awesome Thor and entertaining marvel movie overall. Thor is one of my FAVOURITE marvel characters and ONLY Chris Hemsworth can portray Thor in this exceptional way. So all in all I'm satisfied with what I got in terms of Story, performance, action, visuals and emotions. I only wish it was longer and that the comedy was toned down SLIGHTLY so that it focus more on the story and the build up to the final confrontation between Thor and Gorr.

title: It's so bad
text: I love Marvel however, this movie has damaged my love. There is no plot. The movie makes no sense. There's no explanation given for anything that happens in the movie and every scene. It's just like them trying to find a plot there's no character development. In fact there's character regression. The other Thor's are really good but this one is trash. Even the villain doesn't make sense. Literally nothing is explained. I think they spent all their money on cameos and cgi because I don't know where else it could have gone. Really a tragic downfall to this no longer awesome franchise. Natalie Portman is an amazing actress but something went wrong in this movie. She really hit rock bottom with this movie.

title: What Gorr does in the shadows.
text: I really like it. I dint get all the hate tbh. We even saw the movie in another country, so not my native language subtitles. Anyway I think there needed some positive on this list.

title: Falls short
text: A movie riddled with convenienceI have to say, the portrayal of women in movies are starting to be less and less likeable. Can't remember when last I actually sympathize with one in a movie. Don't get me started on the men, but at least thor had some development already established.

title: Thor clocked out and traded in.
text:
Thor must stop Gorr the God Butcher from eliminating all gods and save the children of Asgard.Where as Thor: Ragnarok was a colourful cosmic adventure, director Taika Waititi's Thor: Love and Thunder delivers a fun outing, packed with one liners, quips and puns; but it's tonally off making Chris Hemsworth's Thor a buffoon, even more so than in previous films. Unreined Waititi and
Jennifer Kaytin Robinson's high-stakes plot and drama is overshadowed by comedy and far removed from the feel of the Marvel Comics.There's a handfuls of humorous cameos including Matt Damon, Sam Neil, Melissa McCarthy, Luke Hemsworth and Russell Crowe along with the cast of Guardians of the Galaxy to name a few. Despite a great effects, soundtrack and score even with Christian Bale's solid performance trying to ground it and death themes throughout, Waititi's offering desperately falls short. Love and Thunder becomes almost a parody played for laughs, hints sarcasm, trading in adventure for book of shoehorned jokes.Overall, if you're completely checked out it could be a cheap blast, but it's a sobering reminder that character is everything and even with a solid director and big budget it's possible to still miss the mark.

title: Thor Found Himself But The Movie Sure Didn't
text: This movie was all over the place with what it was trying to be. It was to goofy to be taken seriously even when it tried to be. And it went over so much material that many scenes such as the opening didn't get enough screen time to be properly shown and connect with the audience. This movie needed a longer run time by maybe 15 minutes. I loved the ideas just the execution was bad.

title: Popcorn and âš¡
text: Enjoyable for all the right reasons.Well directed, great mix of action and comedy with a bit of dramatic Valhalla thrown in. An amazing hard rock soundtrack, and visually stunning.Best Thor yet!

title: Young avengers here we go
text: It filled a gap left by the pandemic and was enjoyable but not great. Nice themes, quick exposition and some moments that needed more.More young avengers introductions which is a little distracting but over all. It's a watchable film ðŸ¿ a.

title: Very fun movie
text: The movie was very fun, lots of humour and the cinematics looked amazing. Bale's take on Gorr was really good and frightening. Overall a great movie and I would definitely watch it again. Taika Waititi has done it once again!

title: What i expected
text: The last thing we know about Thor is that he became some sort of clownsy character, and that is what the film gave me, a God with a lot of super powers but also a lot of jokes. Valkerie was taken apart, which i do not liked, and Natalie Portman role was okay but something was missing, idk if the problem are the jokes idk but it was weird. Besides the scene with the kids was super fun, really took the film and push it to another level.

title: 2 Thors 1 movie
text: Thor Love and Thunder was an absolute blast! It most a bit too fast for its own good. It's hilarious most of all. The action is very good. But the movie doesn't take its time with the serious things as it should. Natalie Portman and Tessa Thompson were my stand outs. Christian Bale was pretty great as the villain too! Not quite as good as Ragnarok, but I enjoyed it and had fun with it. Bonus points for Thor being naked as well!

title: Decent enough movie
text: Hats off to Christian Bale! Bale was great in this movie which kept my attention more than anything else happening in it. It was a watchable movie but a bit silly at times.

title: Rushed and Weird
text: Don't want to sound mean, but it gets really annoying and sad to see Thor as a goofy dummy over and over again. The plot was weird, rushed, with tonns of unnecessary jokes that were not funny. There were a mix of "serious" and "funny" moments which were executed very poorly and made a film look like a mess.Cast is great, sound is great, visuals are also great but the plot and the atmosphere ruins it for me.

title: Thor the Joke Machine
text: Having not seen "Thor" since the first installment, I wasn't prepared for how director Taika Waititi had restylized the franchise to become more of a joke-infested comedy as well as a CGI-saturated epic adventure. It was funny at random moments with a few unexpected celebrity cameo appearances, but the constantly comic approach was maintained at the expense of the convoluted Asgardian adventure storyline. It also meant sacrificing the heart that would have us empathize with the fate of the principal characters. Chris Hemsworth still plays the title role in the manner born - though the rest of the cast felt somewhat less committed to their roles, even Christian Bale as the malevolent evildoer and Natalie Portman returning in superhero form as Thor's love interest. The souped-up climax was such a textbook MCU exercise in eye-rolling excess that the ending was robbed of its innate poignance.

title: A parody of MCU films
text: This movie never takes itself serious at all. Any time I think the movie is going to move forward they increase the humor. It really comes across as a parody of hero films. The story was there, it just didn't make it to screen. The actors were fine with the material they had to deal with. It was just again, no one took the roles serious. Let's go for laughs at every turn. A little humor goes a long way. This makes The Three Stooges look like a drama. Gorr could have been a worthy scary villain but instead is just a sad revenge filled man. Thor is trying to be a Thor clown at all times. I cannot even figure which character I liked it this movie.

title: It's ok, my kids liked it.
text: As far as a self contained movie goes, it's ok. It's got shades of mad max 3, lots of guns n roses (not a bad thing), a little Harry Potter and a really weird (possibly offensive) accent from Russel Crowe. My kids enjoyed it, but like others on here have mentioned more Christian Bale, a bit less Korg, and a tighter story would have been a much better movie. I like the arc Thor has been on, and Ragnarok is one of my favourite films, but maybe the time spent with the gotg has got to Thor, but continuing his Arc to where the film ends could have been better.

title: It's a comic book film.
text: This film is aimed at, written, directed and starring those of a certain age recapturing their inner 10 year old. It's fun and not serious, but does have serious moments. Has one of the worse Italian accents since allo allo. Worth the watch.

title: Weak side characters hinder this flick heavily
text: For me this one is barely 7/10 but it could be much better than that. There is a lame or boring scene for nearly every genuinely great one. There are things to love here. Crowe and Bale are very good, though the latter is somewhat unutilized. Portman and Hemsworth are okay, or even decent.However the most utilized side characters are horrible. They have nothing to do in the script, they are just there. Korg is so forced and shallow that his character singlehandedly ruins many otherwise decent scenes. He is just an idiot, and a tiresome one. He's been in like 3 movies by now and we don't know anything about him, except that he is dumb and overstays his welcome. Valkyrie, while a bit more interesting has also next to nothing to do here. They take way too many screen time from others who are more deserving.I get it, you need some funny sidekicks for these kind of movies but none of them is funny. Taking a couple of the Guardians of the Galaxy on the road would have been so much better, because they are actually good characters. Rocket and Groot worked so well with Thor in Infinity War, there was chemistry there. There is none with Korg and not much with Valkyrie. It is a huge missed opportunity to play around more with the cast of GotG and this God Butcher fella. Korg is also some kind of a narrator and it's just not working. The stories he narrates should have been explored and shown instead. Feels like both him and Valkyrie were there just for fulfilling a political agenda.On the other hand, Thor and Jane worked for me and they had some genuinely good moments. Some of them unusually real and deep for a Thor movie and I'd like to see more of these. Same goes for Gorr. The bad guy had a believeable motivation and all the main characters evolved a bit.The jokes and the dialogs are passable, the plot is decent and the action is mostly good. I would like to see a cut with much less Korg and Valkyrie and more Thor and Jane. And more Gorr and Zeus as well, of course. This multiple Thor thing is a bit silly but executed well and there's also a strong hint why it happens(though it can be missed easily).It's a fun movie with some parts on the more serious side. It's still the second best Thor installment for me and it could be on par with RagnarÃ¶k if the side characters wouldn't be a waste of space or outright annoyance. Goldblum, Hulk, Heimdall, Karl Urban and even Valkyrie were so much better in that one. That's the only difference for me, though it affects the movie substantially.This would be a slightly above avarage movie if not for some genuinely heartfelt and good scenes. Those make this a weak 7/10 for me. With better side characters this could have been on par with RagnarÃ¶k.

title: Not nearly as bad as the cry babies say
text: It wasn't the best MCU movie and it wasn't the worst. It did feel a little empty and kind of rushed but still enjoyable and funny. MCU fanboys are becoming more unbearable than Star wars fanboys.

title: Went too hard with comedy
text:
I am a huge fan of Marvel movies. I have grown to expect action, beautiful special effects, Wittiness, heartbreak, and some laughs.While this movie did include all of that, the balance of it was way off. There was way too much comedy, and not enough wittiness to pair it with. It felt more like a Will Ferrell film than a Marvel film; dumb humor.I'm not a fan of the type of comedy Will Ferrell plays. (Except Talladega Nights and Barbie! There's always an outlier!)
This for me was one of Marvel's worse films, if not the worst. This was an outlier as I believe Marvel puts out 9/10 to 10/10 moves 95% of the time.

title: Love it for what it is, craziness
text: My wife and I enjoyed this movie which is supposed to be the purpose, so I'll start there. The screaming goats we thought was hilarious because she loves Taylor Swift and I showed her the old screaming goat meme tied to her, so we loved it, but certainly understand it wouldn't be for everyone.As a movie, if I'm turning into a critic, it's all over the place and mostly mindless. Christian Bale seems out of place as he played his role seriously and amazingly. Was disappointed in Zeus. I think Russell Crowe is a great actor and played the silliness that is this movie well, but he's far gone from his Gladiator days for sure. Zeus is supposed to be powerful and look as such, but Crowe is just a silly old fat guy. Again it does go with the movie to be fair, but I'd prefer this have been different personally.They shoved the gay stuff in your face a little, as is apparently now a rule for all movies to fight....whatever they're fighting, but considering other ways it's been done this wasn't terrible. I mean the guy is a collection of rocks after all so go for it I guess. Valkyrie was expected, and think she's that way in real life anyway, so again check the box Hollywood, bravo.Overall the movie is basically an action comedy, so expect that and it's plenty enjoyable if you're up for it. If you're expecting anything serious, Bale is great but that's really about it.

title: Electrifying!
text: Love and Thunder really is an absolute hoot. It is unapologetically tongue in cheek while still packing in some solid emotional heft.It boasts a plot that crams in a lot yet never feels congested. The foundations and structure of the plot do follow the typical Marvel formula, but Taika's script and direction make this film feel nice and refreshing.Speaking of Taika's script it is very sharp and funny. Mix this with Hemsworth's comedic timing and delivery and you get a match made in heaven, so this is definitely the most I've laughed at a Marvel movie.Hemsworth really looked like he was having the time of his life playing Thor in this film which was so fun to watch. Natalie Portman back in the MCU and with such a badass role was brilliant to see.Bale played a pretty good villain, nothing outstanding but there was some decent development there and he brought a sufficient level of unhinged menace to the role.I will say the action was never particularly inspiring and I would have liked to seen more of Bale and have that role fleshed out a bit, but these criticisms are relatively minor and don't detract too much from the quality of the film, which for the most part is top notch.If you throw yourself into this film with reckless abandon and are happy to surrender to Taika Waititi's quirky and goofy humour then you will have a blast.

title: Love & Thunder indeed
text: Reading these reviews... :-/ seriously people really need to lighten up!This is was fun movie and I know that's all I was expecting when going to see it and it didn't let me down. I laughed through out and left the cinema smiling, I absolutely love Taika Waititi's humour, Korg is one of my favourites. I was still chuckling at this film hours later..Christian Bale was an awesome addition to the movie. There's one fight scene that absolutely blew my mind, I think it's one of my favourite fight scenes in the whole of MCU franchise. There's also moments that will get you in the feels.Over all it was a fun roller coaster of emotions with an awesome soundtrack to go with it!

title: Not as bad as I was expecting
text: So I didn't see this until it came to Disney+, partially because of the negative reviews it has gotten. I was pleasantly surprised and loved the humor. The movie is indeed irreverent and I agree that it is strange to see the irreverent humor laid across the more serious aspects of it. That said, humor is one of the ways we cope with tragedy. That's kind of its main purpose in our psyche.To me, this film kind of sits in the series like Moonraker does in the James Bond series. It doesn't really have a point and is panned almost universally, but if you switch your brain off and watch it for it just for fun, it's enjoyable (at least if you have an open sense of humor I guess). I can see how most MCU diehards will hate it, because it does not really advance any overall plot or develop the characters in a way that is meaningful to the overall universe.One strength of the film is that it continues the overall trend of Thor being the most tragic yet most developed of the major MCU characters. He has had to deal with the most loss and the biggest psychological challenges of the series as a whole. I think what he does here, given the new challenges he faces in that way, is a very good depiction of how we should try to live our lives. Thor has been through a lot, but he just keeps pushing forward, and I think that is a testament to his character and the portrayal, despite all of the other parts of his story and this film. Natalie Portman and Tessa Thompson's roles fit into this perfectly, and they all look like they are having fun.I think the biggest problem here is not the film itself. It is that the MCU set such a high expectation for an overall storyline with the stones/Thanos, and doesn't really know what to do next. It has become a series of episodes that do not clearly link in the storyline. I think a lot of MCU fans are struggling with that, which makes sense given how tightly most of the series fit together previously. So again, you do have to just switch off a bit to really enjoy this, but for most people I think it will be enjoyable to do so, as long as you don't mind the screaming goats (which I found hilarious).

title: A lot of great actors in a garbage movie.
text: It's like Hollywood took a giant dump of money on a movie set and said, "Here ya go." It's easily the corniest Marvel movie that I've ever seen. Plot sucks. The only good thing I have to say about it is that it's kind of trippy.

title: Good film
text: Outrageous rig from Hemsworth. Cringe at times like all marvel films nowadays. Gorr was sick. Valkyrie was so cringe. Jane story was decent. Second half way better than the first. Credits scenes were both very cool.

title: Criminally unfunny
text: I'll be honest I went into this movie with abysmal expectations and you know what, I enjoyed it. It was nice seeing these characters again and of course the new characters. Christian Bale was a highlight in the cast giving the best performance in the movie.The main issues with this film is that it's simply not funny, a comedy is supposed to of course be funny. Hearing the cinema audience laugh at every joke whilst I sat there in silence for the majority of the movie honestly made me feel like a paid audience was watching the movie because I can recall about a couplke ocasions I actually felt like laughing.And don't even get me started on those screaming goats, they were funny for the first time but with every appearance the joke became cheaper and ultimately become a nuisance. There are also some huge tonal issues in this movie which at this point are reflective of the MCU as a whole nowadays. There are few minutes on screen without a joke, again that would be fine if the comedy was top notch but here it really isn't. These childish jokes ruin otherwise serious moments and give the impression that everything in this movie is a joke. Thor Ragnarok did a great job of shifting it's comedic tone when necessary and overall gave a highly enjoyable viewing experience, I don't know what happened since then but my gosh did they not learn from the sucesses of the previous movie, instead they cheapened serious moments and turned everyone we loved into a joke. The film itself even made a joke about Thor's lacking character development as of recently. A self aware movie can be great but it really isn't so funny when a character becomes completely incompetent.Overall, as entertainment if you turn off your mind I'm sure you'll have a good time but by most other metrics this fell flat.

title: Were those jokes?
text: Reminded me of a drunk guy on open mic night who thinks he is funny. They didn't land one good joke and tried way too many. Just a dumb movie because the writers suck at comedy. The villain was good.perhaps the writers could have written the rest of The movie like they wtote for the villain it may have been good. Also the cgi was weak. Can't complai about the music that was the best part. Natalie portman was good as the doctor but totally unconvincing ad thor. In her defense the writing was so bad I don't think she had much of a chance. But i think she is just not superhero material. Kind of mousy.

title: A jock an absolute joke ðŸ˜
text: Man I'm really gutted to say this .I had high hopes for this movie but it ended up being a an absolute joke of a movie. They made Thor look like jocke.

title: Disappointed
text: Following Ragnarok this was a disappointment. It was good overall but not as good as expected. I just hope this isn't the future of movies where we need to know every character's sexual preference. Seems unnecessary because it won't move the needle as much as they think it does. I still don't care about anyone's sexual preference. I guess that makes me a bad person.

title: Thor's cosmic adventure has enough thunder and laughs, but enough boring love too.
text:
Thor: Love and Thunder (2022):
Movie Review -Marvel Studios' Thor: Love And Thunder, starring Chris Hemsworth, Christian Bale, Tessa Thompson, Russell Crowe, and Natalie Portman, introduces you to some new Superheroes, Gods and Villains. Some of them are too good even as newcomers, while some are too predictable as the old ones. From the trailer, you get the overall idea of the script, be it characters, suspense, or adventure, and the final outcome doesn't go beyond that, except for one thing. However, it makes sure to fulfil all the criteria of Marvel's Superhero Entertainer, which leaves you satisfied by the end. Love, Thunder, and Laughs: Thor's cosmic adventure ticks all three boxes, despite a few boring aspects. I wish Thunder was in the lead, though.Thor 4 starts off with an introduction scene of the antagonist, Gorr, who becomes the God Butcher after his God fails him. We get back to New Asgard, which is quite like a corporate city and visually lavish, where Korg (Taika Waititi) keeps telling the legends of Thor, aka God of Thunder. Thor (Chris Hemsworth) attempts to find inner peace after losing the love of his life (three times, OMG!), but must return to action to prevent Gorr from murdering the Gods. Valkyrie (Tessa Thompson) and Korg join his army, and then appears Thor's ex-girlfriend Jane Foster ( Natalie Portman), aka Mighty Thor, with Thor's ex-weapon, Mjolnir, to support him, of course.Thor: Love And Thunder might just bore you with typical romance and illogical reconciliation (you might even end up asking why it was there if it wasn't supposed to make any sense, and you won't even get answers), but it covers the loss with explosive action and thrilling adventures. It's a topic of discussion why every superhero film should have a romantic angle to spoil the structure. Of course, not every superhero film can be intellectual like "The Dark Knight", and Marvel never wished to match Nolan's intelligence with their money-spinner entertainers. Yet we have that boring romance, parting and reconciliation just to look down and check if our popcorn is finished or not. Thor: Love And Thunder has many moments like this. It's unfathomable how Thor and Jane's love story was left incomplete before the mighty assembly of Avengers, and how it suddenly pops up in the post Thanos era. 8 years or something, as Thor says, who was counting anyway, and what was she doing in the meantime? One of the most pressing questions is why the Guardians of the Galaxy suddenly disappeared. Let's not expect any answers from Marvel.Coming to performances, Thor: Love and Thunder is blessed with Christian Bale's supremacy. He is truly deadly and dark as Gorr and makes you forget many former villains with his impeccable presence. Thor, aka Chris Hemsworth, gets back into his old shoes again and the size still fits him. Not just the physical transformation, but his verbal transformation also clicks well. This time he is more funny and child-friendly, that's some good change after "The Dark World" and "Ragnarok". Tessa Thompson and Taika Waititi have limited space but do well, whereas Natalie Portman is charming as Mighty Thor and damn boring as Jane Forster. I was expecting Russell Crowe to spread a surprise, but the screen time and role both came out quite underwhelming. Nevertheless, he has a surprise for you in the end credits scene that might just erase previous low grade marks.Marvel's cosmic adventure is visually splendid, and you don't expect anything less in this department, at least. But still, Thor: Love and Thunder goes beyond expectations to leave you in awe with some enchanting and colourful visuals. This may surprise you, but Thor: Love And Thunder also has some dark visuals, and they are unexpectedly awe-spiring. The background score and cinematography seemed okay, while the editing remained crispy most of the time. The tedious romance could have been trimmed a little and easily been replaced by action scenes or comedy to make it more engaging, but what's done is done now.Taika Waititi will be remembered for bringing a bewitching change to Thor's universe with "Thor: Ragnarok" (2017). This man pulled Thor out of a dark and intense world and made him more funny and amusing with his commercial vision. With Thor: Love and Thunder, he continues the flow and keeps you smiling all the time. Taika has increased humour and children-oriented theories that should widen Thor's reach to different age groups. However, he fails to make a theoretical sense. But who cares about that when you are watching an MCU product? Chuck the brain, let the chicks and eyes enjoy the show. As a whole, Thor's cosmic adventure is as entertaining as you'd expect, with some new surprises in store.RATING - 6/10*

title: An Improvement on Ragnarok
text: Maintaining the God of Thunder's comedic appeal in film, the latest in the Thor franchise much succeeds it's predecessor.It's not a patch on the first generation of Marvel movies, of course; material is constantly and unnecessarily being merged, misconstrued and manipulated (in true Disney form), but it does well in bringing back and reuniting those loveable characters that were so missed in the third installment... as well as inorporating some wonderfully hilarious cameos from much-loved Hollywood actors.Comprising brilliant CGI visuals and a soundtrack to rival Guardians of the Galaxy, Thor: Love and Thunder is a welcomed addition to the MCU and well worth a watch... if only it didn't command a lack of respect from trying too hard to be funny.

title: Thor no more
text: What the hell happened to Thor?! I went to see a Thor movie and they've turned him into a dummy. This is character digression at its finest.Christian Bale was wasted, he's supposed to be a god butcher, they even refer to him as the god butcher but you don't see any butchering.Lots of childish jokes that aren't that funny, I like a bit of humour in the MCU but nothing in this movie felt natural.

title: Guys It's much better than people are saying
text: Wow.. people can whine!First of all this film is pretty good! No it's not a masterpiece, and yes there were instances were the comedy was forced and not very funny, but there were also some very funny parts.And some of the serious moments like the Jane/Thor romance and Jane's illness. I found them to be touching.Jane's chronic illness in the film was something I didnt expect of Marvel, and I thought it was a good subject to show. People can't always be strong and be a heroes, people get sick sometimes and it's good to talk about (like Jane and Thor did).Also the part were Thor says something allong the lines: nobody knows for sure what tomorrow happens, its about living now. It hit pretty close to home, also because of having someone close to me with a chronic illnes. Thus I really appreciated this theme/part of the film.Good action, beautiful colors and CGI.The part with the children army of thor, yeah sure it was kinda funny and weird. But also endearing and I felt it had heart.What happens in the end of the conlusion, no spoilers, but I thought that was kinda meh.Not talking about the epilogue though, with Chris/Thor playing opposite of his Daughter India. Which was really cute and heartwarming.And India was just very cool in her role, and great and natural acting (looking seriously talented).And great chemistry with her dad (duh).And people linking this to narcissism of parents, just stop. Its worrying that you can find these things in something authentic and natural like this.*So all and all, I understand this movie wont touch and impress everyone, (for me it did do it) but what I think is certain, there is more than enough good things you can say about this movie.So people, stop whining so much. (And saying spiderman no way home is better than this, is ridiculous)Thank you!

title: The Best Thor Movie Yet
text: After Thor: The Dark World was rated the worst marvel movie of all time for obvious reasons such as idiotic plot, badly coordinated action sequences and barely any action, Thor: Ragnarok changed the game entirely and soon became one of my favourite marvel movies. I had pretty high expectations for Thor: Love and Thunder and they were unsurprisingly almost 100 percent met! Taika Waititi's funny sense of humour is prominent- playing Korg and he stars in it whilst also directing the movie! The movie was action-packed from start to finish and it was really cool to see Jane return again. Chris Hemsworth was great as usual. It is probably in my top ten movies of 2022 and I'd highly recommend it to any Marvel fans out there!

title: Great Christian Bale performance!
text: Funny jokes and good performances, especially Christian Bale, as Gorr the god butcher, gives a great performance that elevates the movie to be worth watching!

title: Ignore the negativity
text: Genuinely funniest film I've seen this year. Terrific visuals (couple of wonky cgi scenes aside) and a large cast firing on all cylinders.TW even manages to add some heart and touching moments in this, something he completely blew in Ragnarok.Soundtrack, GnR & the score is great too.I've no idea why there's so much hate.. oh yeah... cos it's Marvel and the internet has decided it's had its time in the sun.Do yourself a favour, watch the movie and decide for yourself.

title: Two very different films.
text: Half of this film is silly and sometimes genuinely amusing. The other half potentially very moving. But together the halves don't work together and the film is a mess. Taika Waititi needs to go. Hate how he's made Thor a joke character. In the end it wasted the Jane story. In many ways this is reflective of the whole post-Endgame MCU - it cannot decide upon a tone. Dr Strange 2 was the same - the mishmash of ideas basically cheapened the more emotional moments. That film could almost be forgiven due to the covid challenges and enforced change of direction, but this had no excuse. Sort it out Kevin!

title: Horrible
text: Moved from action into a not accomplishable comedy... with horrible jokes that don't make you laugh. The plot is a joke! SAVE TIME AND MONEY AND DON'T GO WATCH THIS MOVIE.

title: Not sure how this fits into the new MCU but I enjoyed it
text: Overall a very entertaining and funny film. Good action sequences, good story, great soundtrack and effects, and genuinely a fun movie. While I loved the Mighty Thor as Jane Foster I was sad to see it done in such a quick fashion but I understand there's only so much you can do. Valkyrie could have been more involved but she was given great dialogue and still remained a great onscreen force. Only negative was the poor choice of accent by Russell Crowe as Zeus and me not quite understanding how this movie furthers the new stage of MCU, but the end credit scene was very well done and a great send off/in remembrance of a beloved character.

title: Great movie,very entertaining
text: The funniest Thor movie by far, they really changed Thor from the first movies and made him much better in my opinion.Many comics references and the lore was great.Left me excited for the next movies from marvel universe.

title: I Don't Understand...
text: From the beginning to the end, everything is a JOKE, and this is not me complaining about the film calling it a joke. Literally, every character and plot device in the film is a joke. You have Chris Hemsworth who CRUSHED it as Thor in all the previous films and the story does not seem to remember any of the story lines or arches in the previous films with Thor. He does not go on a journey or evolve, instead it feels like a parody of the character. You have Oscar winner Natalie Portman coming back to play Jane Foster as The Mighty Thor with the comic story arch which should be a SOLID HOME RUN and the character is written as a joke, why? Last, the film has Oscar winner Christain Bale as the villain Gorr The God Butcher as he is barely in the film and like the other characters is written as a joke. It is one joke after another after another. I don't understand what the director was thinking. He has the budget, the characters, the talent in front and behind the camera and this is what was given? Taika (director) you are better than this!!!! Kevin Feige (President of MCU) where were you? How did you let this happen?? The film has its moments, but my God all the unfunny childish jokes take away from those moments. Also, MCU, Hollywood.. please stop saying you have LGBTQ+ characters if they are represented in 1 second moments that can easily be removed in other countries. This is not representation, it is baiting. I hope Thor stays around and goes under another director.

title: The worst Marvel movie ever
text: I cannot believe people paid to make this movie. I'm a HUGE Marvel fan and this was so disappointing! I just don't understand the purpose of this movie. It was like watching a Pantomime.

title: Marvels first proper comedy?
text:
If Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness was Marvel's first horror film, then the latest Thor film is it's first Comedy. It was such a stupid film that felt like a 2 hour SNL parody but full of many laugh out loud moments.It was nice to see fan favorite Taika Waititi's Korg get some screen time, I only wish Jaimie Alexander's Sif and Kat Dennings' Darcy had more than just a cameos! Side note it was very cute to see Chris Hemsworth's entire family (expect Liam) in this movie.For a film that takes place mostly on a green screen, the CGI isn't terrible and the makeup and hair is done well (except for Natalie Portman 's wigs...)
For a very comedic film, the ending was super sad and heartwarming. I'm excited to see where it will lead and what adventures are to come for Thor and his team.Final thoughts, Chris Hemsworth body in this film is incredible and I can't wait to see him as wrestler Hulk Hogan in the upcoming biopic.

title: Average at best
text: I expected more from this movie. Taika Waititi is a good director at making serious theme matter with comedic acts to it. Even if act plays it off funny, the context is rather sad or depressed, which is why I like Thor: Ragnarok and Jojo Rabbit. However, this movie did not land on its subject matter and takes jokes as the main focus. There are some enjoyable moments of the movie, but it sometimes felt forced and not engaging. Ragnarok, Infinity War, and Endgame was a great switch around for Thor, but this movie dumb down this character and now just embrace him as a joke. I seriously believe this is the movie that's going to hurt the MCU. It's an enjoyable film but nothing to experience again.

title: Thor: Love & Thunder - Not Worthy just Cringeworthy
text: I think everyone would agree that Thor: Ragnarok was the best Thor film by a good distance and one of the best Marvel movies.Thor: Love and Thunder is a very, very poor follow up. The Avengers: End Game restrictions on the narrative of Ragnarok have been removed and it seems that Taika Waititi has been given full creativity for this shambolic follow up.Awful humor and poorly placed jokes litter the film. Shoddy set pieces, terrible CGI and a really bad story ruin this follow up. More so when you compare it to the last Thor film.The film is filled with forced McGuffins from the first minute as the A to B story is forced from point to point. There is no jeopardy in the film whatsoever.Considering that the Gorr the God Butcher run and the Jane Foster run are considered seminal in comicdom, this film has done more damage to Thor on and off screen than if it hadn't been made at all.Actually, the best thing about the film is the soundtrack. And they didn't even get that right with a handful of Guns and Roses songs and not even a mention of Lady Lightning by Bang Camaro. Probably because its on the Peacemaker soundtrack.Actually, go watch that instead.

title: A nice blend of action, comedy, and emotion
text: Awesome acting, wonderful and thoughtful plot. Filled with action and sprinkled with comedy. Tugged at the heart strings. Can't wait for the next one!

title: Fine but feels ultimately pointless
text: I am not sure that I can continue having hopes of expectations for Marvel films to come together into something cohesive. The franchise is clearly just churning out one-off films that don't amount to an overarching story with purpose the way that they used to.With that said, Thor Love and Thunder was fine. There were some funny moments, some good action (though not really enough in my opinion), the cast did well, and the cinematography matched the caliber of Ragnarok.Small spoiler, but I did expect the Guardians to play a bigger role in this movie. They were hardly in it at all. I felt the movie would have been strong individually as well as to the MCU if they were a bigger part of the story. It seemed like that's what was coming between Thor and the Guardians after Infinity War/Endgame but it totally fizzled out.Bottom line, you can watch this or skip it. It really doesn't matter, unfortunately.

title: Trying to be too much funny and ending as a parody
text: I want my money back! As a big fan of the MCU this is an insult to our intelligence. The movie is shallow and stupid and tries not more than to be funny.The only one who does a magnificent work is christian bale who's serious and good acting wasted in the shell of comedy and stupidity!

title: Good second half
text: This film tells the story of Thor and his team fighting a villain that is determined to destroy the heavenly world.The first half tries very hard to be funny, but I don't find it funny. The jokes are predictable and stale. In the second half, when Thor is mostly wearing his superhero cape, the film gets a lot more interesting and captivating. I actually wish that the first few scenes are cut, as they are really the weakest link.

title: Campy
text: This is so camp. I love it! This movie was so much fun! Good acting, amazing visuals, and a great time all around. Has its moments, but it does not take itself too seriously. Please dont go in expecting Thor: The Dark World.

title: Another Final Frontier
text: Of ALL the Trek movies, this had to pay homage to...Star Trek V?! Now, yeah, V has kinda grown on me over the years and it's definitely no longer the worst one. But still, Thor: Love and Thunder is helluva lot better.In a rare occurrence, the Thor quadrilogy joins both the Spider-Man Home Movies and the Mission: Impossible franchise as the few series that gets progressively better with each chapter. About half-way through this, I thought I liked Ragnarok more. That all changed in the highly enjoyable final act.Thor is BACK, baby. Well, from his Dad-Bod ways and as he's helping out the happy underdogs across the universe, he discovers both Love and Thunderous rage from a God-Butcher. Pray Thor makes it out of this one.The funny thing about this movie that reunites Chris Hemsworth with Natalie Portman: I wasn't 100% looking forward to that reunion prior to starting this adventure-comedy. Truthfully, she is NOT one of my favorite actresses and I'll get right to the point: She practically steals Thor's Thunder throughout this film. She was spectacular and my favorite part of this movie. And this may be my favorite role for her.Now, that said, I thoroughly enjoyed Chris Hemsworth - he was having a ball and it shows he really enjoys entertaining the masses as the title character. The rest of the cast was equally awesome, except, well, The Bland-Batman.I mean, Christian Bale as the Baddie. He was fine, but really uneven. He almost acted like the Joker/Riddler at some moments and then menacingly quiet and composed the next. And back and forth he went. Unfortunately, he was never likable enough to gain ANY sympathy from me - even though his character had well-defined motivation and depth.While this had a KILLER soundtrack, was absolutely hilarious and is technically better than Ragnarok, it's not by much and it's a perfect companion to that third one. Needless to say, if you loved Ragnarok, this will have the same impact for you. And you might as well forget those first two Thors. Just stick with the two best: Ragnarok & Love & Thunder.***Final Thoughts: I HATE that Marvel makes us stay through the credits. Literally, it's my least favorite part of the MCU. BUT, every once in a while, an MCU chapter will change my mind, albeit temporarily. You simply MUST stay through to the very last few seconds. I liked the first one pretty well and LOVED the last one.

title: Pretty decent movie but..
text: #ThorLoveandThunder 7.7/10Its a pretty decent movie but it doesnt explore the story or Thor character nearly enough in my opinion. It didn't do the best job at raising the stakes of the possible threat & the pacing doesnt really allow you to fully absorb everything happening. I feel like the antagonist should've been explored more in depth. Wish we could've gotten to see the death of more Gods & speak on have the antagonist speak on their intentions more. The fighting scenes also weren't anything new from Thor. I did however like the other ways that different powers were shown throughout the movie tho. Jane fosters Mighty Thor is actually one of the most refreshing aspects of the movie. Overall I have to say I enjoyed Thor: Ragnarok more than Thor: Love and Thunder. But this movie is still worth the watch.

text: The Marvel Cinematic Universe became The LSD Universe???? It went from very good to VERY bad. Love and Thunder = B MOVIE(MAYBE C) marvel makes so much money that they make way too much and don't have time for a proper plot. Dr strange 2 ..omg what a crap movie.. maybe people from 10-16 like this. title: Scary for kids 8-9 years old, but they still liked it
text: Oren 8 years old gave it a 4 out of 10, because there was too much nightmare fuel. Still it was better than Thor (2011).Dani 9 years old gave it a 9 out of 10. Better than the original, the end was very emotional. Not a 10 because it was a bit scary.

title: Taika need to tone down a few notch on the jokes...
text: This movie has the most jokes-per-minute of any marvel movie. Too many memes and silly jokes that drag out while crucial, life-threatening situations await to be dealt with.Overall, a fun movie but please stop trying to turn movies into silly comedies!!

title: The beginning of the end for the MCU (waay too woke)
text: Absolutely horrible. I was shaking my head in disgust the entire movie. The only redeeming parts of the movie was how Jane Foster because worthy of Molnir and Christian Bale. Get woke, go broke Disney!

title: just never quite finds it...
text: The franchise remains in Waititi's assured hands as he becomes the first director to helm more than one film in the series, unfortunately it seems like he's trying to use much of what worked in Ragnarok while at the same time trying not to totally repeat himself. Thor is still without a clear path or plan, but must take action to thwart the machinations of a madman (Bale, who deserves a lot more screentime) out to butcher all Gods. Thor also gets a blast from the past when he reunites with old flame Jane Foster--now bonded with his old companion Mjolnir. Even after three previous entries there's still a lot to work with here, but so many of the key characters are mishandled, the bulk of the comedic bits fall flat, and the ex-lovers chatter gets tired oh so quickly. After a promising opening the movie stumbles into tonal uncertainty as it veers between silliness and seriousness but never convincingly establishes what's at stake or manages to feel consequential. It's redeemed somewhat by the fantastic visuals and a third act that's pretty good, but the unevenness of the finished product and the limited use of so many great characters makes it curious as to what was left on the cutting room floor. **Â½

title: Not bad but tries too hard to be ironically funny
text: This is an ok film but not your standard marvel movie. Most have some quite good humour but this one seems to just want to be a full super hero comedy. Sadly it just comes across as though it's trying too hard.It's worth a watch but it's by no means a classic.

title: This movie is the weakest and worst movie of Thor movie series.
text: The story of the movie is very simple and the screenplay is very weak. There is nothing much to watch in the movie apart from some action scenes within the movie. The movie has comedy dialogues but they are forced to laugh. The movie lacks a lot of entertaining scenes. This movie is the weakest and worst movie of Thor movie series. I don't know why this movie was made.It would have been better not to make this movie. This movie made money only because of the hype of this movie. The actors in the movie have performed well. The previous movie in this series was also amazing. There is no background score in this movie. The villain of the movie is not that much of a powerful. Family movie. Finally, watching the movie is nothing but a waste of time. So my advice, don't watch this movie.

title: Still better Ragnarok than Love and Thunder
text: Thor finds himself the target and target of Gorr the God Bucther who wants to destroy the gods. However, he did not expect that his ex-girlfriend Jane Foster had become Mighty Thor with his Mjolnir. Together with Valkyrie and Korg, they go on a cosmic journey to confront Gorr.Thor: Love and Thunder is the 4th film of Thor's journey in the MCU and is a large solo film series in the MCU. This film still seems to use the same formula from Ragnarok, starting in terms of comedy, colorful visuals and flexible acting. The film is set after the events of Endgame. However, it is really unfortunate. Despite thepost-Endgame story, there are many changes from Thor's character development in this film which is much looser and has a great sense of humor. This is a bit of a weakness of this film even though this film is quite entertaining. Too much comedy is brought and the humorous impression of Thor has an impact on the limited character development in this film. Starting from Gorr the God Butcher who should get a large portion as the main villain. Gorr's appearance here is quite extraordinary, but the lack of performance in the film does not give a scary impression in the movie and even sympathy for his motivation is not felt. Then Jane Foster's transformation into Mighty Thor is also a pity. Supposedly, we can see Jane's problem here which can be explored more deeply. Likewise with the presence of Zeus who actually makesadi boast in this film.Overall, the film performs entertainingly . It has a story premise that is less convincing even though it has brought Thor's biggest enemy. The conflict of the story is less deep. There are many conflicts that should be able to be explored far away. Many plot holes occur with the impression that everyone has understood the world of Thor. Both stories and conflicts are less capable of being densely constructed and fused. Love and Thunder became a rock n roll film for me with a memorable rendition of GnR's skirt music. A little disturbing part of the film, visuals from Axl or Astrid and annoying goat sounds.

title: Mostly nonsense, unfortunately
text: Disappointing to say the least. Visuals were great as usual. Fight scenes were stale and there was little done to keep them fresh, mostly typical Taika Waititi's use of children in strange settings. Humour was significantly more forced in this movie than Ragnarok's more natural flow. Story-wise it was pretty cookie cutter except even more empty. The audience felt no connection to Jane Foster as she's been absent from almost every marvel movie thus far. Other emotional connections happen abruptly, characters decisions are made on a whim with no reflection. I'm not looking forward to Taika Waititi's direction on the upcoming Star Wars after seeing this disaster unfortunately.

title: A great entertainer.. ðŸ˜ðŸ˜
text: This movie Thor Love & Thunder is a good entertaining movie,with lots of comedy, good action & great visual effects. The best part of this movie is it is very light & it won't bore u even for a second. The performance of Christian Bale, the character of jane foster was great... Chris Hemsworth with his axe & mighty Thor with the hammer was great to watch... This movie is a complete entertaining package ðŸ˜ðŸ˜

title: Love Avoids a Blunder
text: With 2017's Ragnarock Taika Waititi took an MCU also ran and made one of the franchises few must see movies. He doesn't quite manage to capture lightning in a bottle twice but he does deliver a perfectly acceptable blockbuster.In many ways Love and Thunder is one of the Marveliest of Marvel movies, something in bad guys past (admittedly something pretty terrible in this case) makes him go all genocidal and to complete his evilness he must find the magic macguffin while the heroes try to stop him via some snappy banter and middling action sequences. The film stands tall in that it has funnier humour than most of its stablemates and a villain that leaves their mark. You'd need to look far and wide to find an actor put in more work with so little time than Christian Bale as god shanker Gorr, elevating a character that could easily have been another Malekith the Accursed into one of the franchises most memorable villains.While Love and Thunder has no problem balancing its jovial tone with a menacing villain it is less successful at adding a stage four cancer story to the mix. The physical transformation in Natalie Portman's Jane from wasting away patient to shredded Mjolnir wielder is impressive and Portman looks like she is actually enjoying being in one of these for the first time but the story doesn't half bring an Asgardian size elaphant into the room. It's pretty hard to believe that in all his travels through the cosmos Thor hasn't been to one place he thinks might have a shot at curing cancer.A rather subdued film by Taika Waititi standards and there is no doubt the Marvel formula has been worn so thin its transparent but there is still fun to be had and Thor gets a satisfying end to his story.

title: Cringeworthy humour lets it down
text: Let me start by saying. Christian Bale and Natalie Portman's performances were exceptional. The overall story was good.But! It was let down by the non-stop cringeworthy humour. As the movie went on it got worse and worse - it ended feeling slapstick & childish... I was embarrassed for them!Sad really, I'm a massive Thor and Marvel fan ðŸ˜¢ðŸ˜¢

title: I LOVE IT
text: Who are these people writing bad reviews? I LOVED IT. Full of surprises and twists and super funny and really sad and very beautiful. Loved everything about it and Natalie Portman did AMAZING. I was so amazed at her performance and the dept she brought to the story like damn. CANT WAIT TO SEE MORE THAT ENDING SCENE LIKE DAMN????

title: Disappointed
text: One of the most disappointing marvel movies, so much comedy, disrespect for the Vikings' gods, and sadly i watched one of my best actors having a bad role like why was Christian Bale overacting, as a marvel fan I'm waiting for a dark movie of thor.

title: Should have been great
text: With Jane Foster picking up the hammer, and the hard hitting story that intails, along with the loss and heartbreak of Gorr's story, the only thing that stood in the way of this film was the goofy off the wall antics that are a staple of Taika's films. It really just was the wrong person for the project. As a director he is usually brilliant, but this film felt split between two worlds. In parts brilliant, and in parts eye rolling cringe worthy jokes that laboured the point too long and too hard.

title: This is insulting
text: It's a joke to the other movies. I don't know what they were thinking with doing something this incredibly cheesy. The costumes are ridiculous, the story is ridiculous, the sets and fx are ridiculous. They used to treat these comic book movies with respect. Thor is supposed to be inspiring and strong not behave like a child. But this... this is like a nasty april fools joke made by fans. The only reason I didn't give it lower stars is because these are good actors. Whoever wrote and directed this piece of garbage should be fired. This could have been so much better.And why does Natalie Portman look so weird? Christian Bale did a great job as the bad guy. I'm surprised any of these great actors agreed to do this movie. They are so much better than this.

title: Great entertainment
text: Yes, it flirts with being cheesy and some of the jokes get recycled a bit too often, but this is a solid chunk of cinema entertainment.Thor has changed so much from his early Marvel appearances - this is mostly silly fun, with a couple of battles, some excellent guest appearances, creative visual and musical references, and a light pulling of the heartstrings.Well worth the Â£4.99 ticket.

title: Must see for the plot
text: Thor love and thunder had major ups and downs. One of the major ups was how good the special effects and cji was. But personally the down for me was how corny some parts were like it sometimes felt like a DC movie. Another major ups for me was how good Christian Bales acting was for Gorr. But idk why the writers tried to make the comedy 10x better than Ragnarok. All and all Thor Love and Thunder is still a must see.

title: Negative example of less is more....
text: Too much unnecessary jokes. Strange sudden change in mood. Might be it would be better another one write the plot for the director. Chris Hemsworth and Natalie Portman tried hard to save the film. Rich color used as usual.

title: Epically bad.
text: Should go down in the annals of one of the worst movies made. The humour is bland. The only reason I gave it a 1 - is because Christian Bale was great - despite the writing and directing. Mr. Bale was the only good part of this movie. If the humour was smarter, the writing had more depth, and let Portman and Bale do more - it may have been redeemable. I watched it on Disney+ and wouldn't be willing to spend money in the theatre for this drivel. I love Marvel - but this movie was not up to par compared with any of the main Marvel movies and definitely not even close to any of the Black Panther movies.

title: This start a new era of movies
text: This film might not did it perfectly, but genuinely there were so many things that was done differently about this movie. I saw a completely different perspective making this film. So more realistic characters with emotional aspects illustrated with great sense of humour. It shows how people really get impacted with events around them, and interestingly how they can take themselves out it and gain a greater more powerful personality. I love how deeply Chris Hemsworth played a hurt character and how well he found purpose on life. But in most movies everything is exaggerated, even hopelessness. This movie showed me an experience in life and how amazing you can still be even though you might have been hurt. Thanks loved it needs more films like this.

title: better than i expected (maybe 7.5?)
text: I saw the commercials and thought "eh" but I liked it. Of course it has cheesy one liners and humor was unnecessary at some points(it is a marvel movie) but the visuals are stunning and Christian Bale (Gorr) gave a great performance. I would've liked to see more of his menacing character. The message was nice and it's a very happy movies- with serious elements. I would've liked it to be longer- so the serious moments could've really made it's impact- the serious moments felt almost rushed. If you liked Ragnarok you will like this movie. The colors and black and white scene was awesome. I feel it's becoming a trend to hate on marvel movies now- it's not the perfect film but I enjoyed it.

title: Disney is Destroying MCU.
text: Christian Bale is Legend. But Rest of Movie is Not much Enjoyable as expected. This time Thor is Much like Mickey Mouse that Thor. There is Still time save MCU. Please don't Destroy thor Character, thor was my once Favourite character. But now he is just Babysitter who's Weapons can be lifted by anyone even kid WTF. Please don't Spoil Thor.

title: Taika nailed it!!!!!!!!!!
text: When i watched thor ragnarok I thought that his movies couldn't get better than that. But I was proven wrong by this one. This movie has everything. The comedy, the action, the acting are all peak in this one. Also, Christian Bale is the perfect Gorr the God butcher and I don't care that his appearance is different from the comics, Marvel has done it many times! Also Jane Foster is so much better than the previous movies, forget the way you know her cause this is Taikas Jane. Her chemistry with thor has been improved as well!!! I ADVISE YOU TO STAY FOR THE CREDIT SCENES, YOU WILL GET SOO HYPED ESPECIALLY FROM THE FORST ONE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

title: Comedy In Darkness
text: The movie is better than part one and two, but Ragnarok still have the best screenplay among the four parts, the CGI and cinematography are supermassive, and the negative about comedy in the movie looks coming from Saturday night live, which wasn't good, I think what saves this movie is Gorr by Christian bale he gives the best acting in MCU, I have seen this performance in comics movie from two Heath Ledger and Joaquin Pheonix.There are details about his character he wearing white, not black like in comics and I appreciate that because from his wearing I understand his motives, one last note about his cloth it looks like Kylo Ren's suit in Star Wars sequel.The movie introduced new cosmic-level threats like Eternals and Loki show and Wanda in doctor strange 2. But the problem in thor 4, I didn't feel there was any threat.

title: A huge step in the wrong direction
text: Thor: Love and Thunder feels like an absolute disaster of a movie, taking all the positive aspects from Thor: Ragnarok and focusing on mindless humour.The movie is poorly written and lacks any coherent plot. The screenplay is a mess of contrived dialogue, nonsensical character motivations, and lazy storytelling. The movie attempts to be a comedy, but the jokes are forced and unfunny, falling flat at every turn. Even the action scenes, which are supposed to be the movie's saving grace, are poorly choreographed and unexciting.The performances of the cast are wasted in this movie, with even veteran actors like Chris Hemsworth and Natalie Portman unable to save it. Hemsworth's portrayal of Thor, which was previously a highlight of the Marvel Cinematic Universe, is reduced to a caricature of itself, with the character reduced to a bumbling, unfunny joke. Portman's Jane Foster, who was previously absent from the MCU, is given nothing to work with, reduced to a love interest and a plot device.The new characters introduced in the movie are poorly developed and forgettable. Tessa Thompson's Valkyrie, who was previously a promising character, is reduced to a one-dimensional stereotype, and her role in the movie feels tacked on and unnecessary. The villain played by Christian Bale is a paper-thin caricature, lacking any depth or nuance, he is set up as the big bad however is quite underwhelming despise the efforts of Bale.The movie's visual effects are unimpressive and feel like a step back from previous Marvel Cinematic Universe movies.The CGI is often poorly rendered, and the movie's use of practical effects is uninspired. The film's overall look and feel are underwhelming, lacking the epic scale and scope that fans have come to expect from Marvel movies.In conclusion, Thor: Love and Thunder is a terrible movie that squanders the potential of its talented cast and adds nothing to the Marvel Cinematic Universe. The movie's poor writing, unfunny jokes, forgettable characters, and underwhelming visuals make it a complete waste of time and money. Fans of the Marvel Cinematic Universe would be better off skipping this movie altogether and waiting for something better to come along.

title: Odin bless you son âš¡
text: First of all, hello thor fans, the movie is good quality, fun and good despite the strong cast. It was beautiful from start to finish, it's not boring, of course, there are deficiencies, for example, there are too many characters or because Thor is a very strong Marvel character, he had to take all the responsibilities.still, the score should not be that low, it should be at least 7.2 and at most 7.8 because people with low taste in movies also give low scores, so the number decreases.apart from that, it's good to see zeus there when the movie ends, he's not dead, he'll be back, there will be a continuation of the movie and will this time be thor's new enemy, Hercules, or will he be friends and fight against a new villain in the coming minutes, which will be a surprise and odin bless you son :)

title: Love and Slumber
text: Unfortunately, this movie put my wife to sleep. When the house lights came on, I looked around and saw a few girlfriends/wives doing the same thing. This movie is a real treat for the eyes, there are plenty of chuckles and lots of famous Taika ridiculousness. Bale is great and I really enjoyed the bonus god (no spoilers).Alas, this movie suffers the same thing that a lot of comedies do -- some jokes are just too long. I think it could work a lot better if it were a good 20 minutes shorter.

title: It's Like It's Own Parody
text: I really enjoyed Ragnarok. That made me waiting this movie with hype. Plus, those trailers were awesome.But the movie itself was a huge disappointment.Bale did an amazing job as the God Butcher, but his screen time was too little, meanwhile Korg overstayed his welcome. You're not that funny, and you're not important, Korg!Portman also did a good job, while Thompson was like there for the cash.Thor's goofiness was still good, but his character struggles about love and emptiness seem so sudden for me, and executed in rush that leave me with no sympathy.But the biggest problem of this movie is the jokes. Too many jokes that makes this movie is not like a Marvel Studio's Thor Movie, but a parody of Thor Movie.

title: Extremely Misguided
text: This film was a disaster the minute it started. The director and writers should NEVER be allowed to do another Marvel movie again. It makes Thor look like a complete buffoon right from the start with showing him working out and getting back into shape with the narration done by Korg. Then it seems like the director and writers went into the comic book and spliced a bunch of stories lines together to make this movie. It was a real shame too because Christian Bale was great as Gorr and if they had gone with a more dramatic theme, it may have worked better. Also, the way they introduced the Olympians was way off base and didn't give those characters any dignity either. Lastly, the costumes and theatrics were way over the top and completely tacky.

title: Superb and better than Ragnarok
text: Don't believe the idiots posting 2,3,4 for this movie, it rocks and it's just great fun. Exactly what Thor is supposed to be. Natalie Portman is phenomenal. Highly recommended.

title: Failed attempt to make a Thor edition of Spaceballs
text: There are movie series, and there are parodies of movie series, and somewhere in between those is Thor: Love and Thunder, which attempts to be both a big budget superhero movie and a silly comedy that hits somewhere between the Muppets and lesser Mel Brooks.A lot of the very silly humor is strained, with Thor often being almost absurdly dumb, although I never tired of the screaming goats gags. To make it worse, this broad, silly humor does battle against serious issues like cancer and child death.Parts of the movie work, like a child-army action scene in the last section, but attempting to make a movie that is as exciting as Black Panther, as funny as Blazing Saddles, and as touching as A Star is Born was doomed to fail.Director Waititi managed to pull off impressive tonal shifts in Jojo Rabbit so perhaps he thought he was up to creating this Turducken. But there was serious intent behind that movie and this is just a popcorn flick with an everything-but-the-kitchen-sink approach.Still, it's got some good action, Natalie Portman manages to pull off the combo of pathos and badassery Waititi so desperately wanted, Russell Crowe is genuinely funny (who knew), and if you like superhero movies you might as well go ahead and watch it. Just don't expect too much.

title: Marvel is heading down hill fast
text: This movie pained me to the point where I almost got up and left.When you think of Thor, god of Thunder, you think of an immensely powerful, put together, and charming being. The first movie really did a phenomenal job of displaying this. Unfortunately, this movie makes him out to be a sad, depressed weak loser, which was sad to watch. This felt more like a drama than an action movie. I miss the old Marvel movies which displayed characters as they were depicted in the comics. This is anything but that.I also want to point out the CGI. This movie has some of the worst effects I've seen in a high budget movie in a while. We're talking PS2 level graphics here. They are laughably bad, especially for a company with as much technology and money as Disney.This movie was a good display of the direction that Marvel is going. Rushed, cheap, poorly made movies with a bad plot and unlikable characters, put out as quickly as possible to continue generating as much revenue as possible.

title: A Marvel movie for the rest of us ...
text: I'm not really a Marvel movie fan. All those CGI fights bore me very quickly and the movies often take themselves much too seriously, IMO. All respect to those who are into the franchise, but it's not for me. My taste runs more to LOTR, and much of the Star Wars series, even Harry Potter.I have followed the Thor movies within the Marvel franchise, after very much liking the first one. My expectations for this, the fourth Thor movie were low. What else is there to say on the subject?Basically, the movie blew me away. Everything worked for me. The movie brought back the feeling I had as a kid in reading Marvel comic books, many long years ago. Too fantastical, even nonsensical, to be real, but inviting at the same time. I really like that the director went camp with this one. Well, mostly camp. Because, there's also: cancer, basic existential questions and Gorr to balance off the levity.I'm still wondering why this worked, because the tone of the serious scenes was so different from most of the movie. But life is like that isn't it? Light moments, levity, and then cancer, death, and those existential questions about the life we're living. So maybe those shifts aren't unrealistic after all.The various elements of the movie were all at a very high standard. Loved the colour and the sets. The cast was sterling, especially Christian Bale. And Guns 'n Roses' music fit exceptionally well. This could well be one of the movies that becomes a favourite for me. The ones that I've seen 5 or more times; there aren't all that many. But first I'll see how viewing number 2 goes, and that will be soon.

title: Most enjoyable Thor film imo
text: Really fun to watch. Waititi's writing and direction is funny, we'll-timed, and creative. It has exactly what I want in a Thor movie: humor, classic music, LGBTQ+ representation, the right amount of tenderness, and plenty of himbo energy. If you like Ragnarok I think you'll really enjoy this one.

title: Terrible plot and premise
text: This movie goes wrong in almost every way. Some of the dialogue is just ridiculous and inane. It's like a caricature of a marvel movie, not an actual marvel movie that has heart and soul like most of them do. Don't waste your time and money.

title: Another great addition to Waititi's work
text: I really loved this movie. I have been finding the MCU pretty stale recently but this film really did it for me. Super funny with classic Waititi kiwi humour. I get that his comedy isn't for everyone so if you do find his jokes unfunny, you'll probably not have such a great time with this since its very reliant on its comedy. Me personally, that's what I came for and that's what I got.I also really like what they did with the characters of Gorr, Thor and Jane.
