I wasn't so much a fan of Jane before this film but her characterization made me love her this time around.Visuals, and performances were great as is usual with marvel. You're in for a treat with the fight sequences, which are shot and choreographed fantastically.The reason I didn't give it a 10 was because I think some romantic/emotional moments needed some time to breath and the beginning was really fast paced which is okay but it skimmed over some stuff. I would've like to see a touch more of the guardians, but that didn't really hinder my overall enjoyment of the film very much. A couple nit picks and plot holes too that I can't explain without keeping this review spoiler free.I don't suggest going into this film expecting a standard MCU film because that is not what you're going to get. Its fun, its fresh, its hilarious and it was the best cinema experience I've had in quite some time.

title: Bambili Thor
text:
There is such a word in my native language. "Bambili"
After the 3rd movie,Thor became "Bambili". Visually it was a great movie, the script and the dialogues trying to be funny were bad. Gorr was great, his motivation was great too. Christan Bale gave a great performance. The first half of the movie tries to be funny, it's ridiculous, it's bad, but I like the the second half. I only laughed at a few scenes. Overall I didn't like the movie. The goats were not funny at all, they were constantly shouting. Is this funny? Yes, it was at first scene but unnecessary to show it 145 times. It's like a parody movie. And this scene... Korg. Didn't he have a mother in the previous movie? Does he have 2 fathers now ? What and Why ? What are you trying to do ? Somebody force you for this ? Come on. . .Anyway, Christan Bale was perfect.The movie was kind of enjoyable but not good movie.By the way Natalie was ok.

title: Stan Lee would be upset
text: I'm not sure what I just watched, but the only reason I'm giving the movie a 3 was because of Christian Bale and Matt Damon.It's upsetting to watch a franchise go down hill, but this was worst trying to ever happen to Marvel. Awful acting, kidnapping was the whole movie and Natalie Portman needs to retire.Very sad day for marvel.

title: Silly but enjoyable
text: Seriously what do you expect from a movie titled Thor Love and Thunder. It's silly. I'll admit some jokes don't land but it's self aware enough that it almost knows it's being goofy. There's a dumpling god and a rock god sitting on a throne of scissors ffs. I'll admit the love ark between Jane and Thor could be seen from a mile away and it follows the whole "evil character possessed by an evil object" trope that the mcu seems to latch onto recently. But if you go into this not trying to nitpick every detail of the realism and humor of a story about a space viking you'll have a good time. Also Christian Bale as gorr is just great, 10/10 performance for him.

title: Weak and predictable story
text: You can't expect a story line like this from Marvel. MCU is trying to create movies which DC making five years back. It feels the movie was made forcefully, cliche jokes were added and little scope for acting.

title: Cristian Bale nailed it!! Classic mcu movie loved it!
text: Classic mcu movie! Similar to Ragnarok! Great performances and effects! Very fun to watch Action comedy and Drama!Something good is going to happen in the future!

title: It's fun but it's not great
text: At times this film is good and at times it's really good but then at other times it's just meh. It's definitely better then the 2nd film in the series but it's not as good as the last film. Where the film lacks is the villain they could have done it better and executed it better. At times the film is stop flashy and so much going on. The story is the main down fall what I loved is Natalie Portman but eve that could of been done better. It's a good fun film but it's nothing better.

title: Driving a stake through the heart of a great franchise?
text: A great cast, acting and effects are overshadowed by a lousy script and poor direction. This movie has no idea of what it should be. Is it a fantasy film? A comedy? It doesn't accomplish either.The previous Thor movies pull the audience into the fantasy of the MCU. The characters, plot and action all made the fantasy seem real. No opportunity for this to happen in this latest Thor installment. The numerous interjections of attempted comedy only succeeds in snapping the audience out of the fantasy world that they planned to be a part of.Thor is one of the favorites of the MCU. Hopefully this film will not be the end of the Thor franchise. Never - NEVER should this director - writer team be allowed anywhere near another MCU installment again.

title: This was fun
text: I wouldn't call it the best Thor movie, ragnarok still holds that title, but it was a great movie in true form to the Marvel universe.Long live the screaming goats!

title: Not what the reviews are saying...
text: I knew of the disdain for this film before I watched it so I wasn't expecting much, but I really enjoyed it! Was it Ragnarok level? No. But it was Thor. It doesn't take itself seriously, it has humour, fight scenes, and a story.Could it have been better? Sure. That's why it's not a 10/10. But it entertained me, made me laugh, and even made my chin wobble slightly at one point. Oh and there's naked Thor!). That's what I want from a film, really.It's better than the first Thor, so I don't get this hate on this. I think some people just want to hate on it because Jane became The Mighty Thor. And I'll probably get lots of "unhelpful" marks on this because I a) enjoyed it and b) said that, but c'mon there was so much hate on it before it was even made for that reason alone.Just forget about the seriousness of Infinity War and End Game, switch off your brain, and just enjoy an amusing film for 2hrs.

title: It's ok if you are not a marvel fan. Otherwise disappointing.
text:
1. The jokes should be limited
2. Thor didn't get any wow moment in the whole movie to remember.3. Gorr had to get more screen time. (Bell's acting is awesome)
4. We didn't get any surprise moment.5. Actings are awesome.6.coloures are amazing.7. Worthless jokes.8.overall a pop corn movie.

title: Perfection.
text: The only thing they could've done better with this movie is not deleting the scene where Valkyrie licks her sword and generally having more ValkyrieðŸ˜©ðŸ˜­ðŸ˜­

title: Messy, and could have been a lot better
text: Although not a terrible film, it wasn't great.I feel like someone needed to take another look at the script and just tighten it all up a bit.More ridiculous that the other films, and by the end it gets too silly, they go too far.

title: It's not as bad as you might think...
text: The story overall is quite nice, the beginning is really good, and the ending finishes on a good note.The only downside is the comedy, all comedy in this movie is completely unnecessary.Props to Christian Bale though! Exceptional performance on his end.

title: Okay, I suppose....
text: It was kind of ok, I suppose... Reminded me of Joel Schumakers Batman movies. The attire was comic book-esque and not in keeping with the other movies, lackluster VFX, an overload of jokes that most simply don't land. In a swing away from the style of the two previous directors, Kenneth Branagh and Alan Taylor, director Taika Waititi brought his "quirky comedy" aspect to the movie, not sure if this is what was needed but should have been expected.Sadly, for the movie, not enough of Christian Bale's Gorr the God Butcher, who was as usual, absolutely brilliant in the role. Without him this movie would have stunk the place out for me.

title: Pedestrian sequel
text: Pedestrian sequel which didn't add much to MCU altogether. Taika Waititi purposely offered interesting choice of 'colors'. While some of running jokes felt aimlessly, Thor & Jane brought heartfelt moments together. Bale gave a hammer-blow performance.

title: A Worthy Sequel
text: Thor: Love and Thunder is not the same breathe of fresh air that Ragnarok was. However, Chris Hemsworth continues to shine as Thor, delivering excellent comedic bits along with the big action scenes.

title: Not only is this not a good Thor film. It's not a good film.
text: With review I'm going to try and not speak about anything to do with comic book accuracy, mainly because in short you can definitely throw any of that out of the window with this movie, and instead I am going to just focus on the film itself and why I don't like it. First of all I just want to say that Thor Love & Thunder is the first ever comic book film I watched where there felt like there was nearly zero at stake. The tone of the movie is just so all over the place, the dialogue was something that my 8 year old nephew could come up with, the story seemed good on paper but was not executed well and that could be because there might be a lot of things removed, the pacing just made me feel like I was watching this for almost three hours when in all reality it was among one of the shortest of the Marvel films. Wrap up all of these issues into one big bow and you got a product that feels like actually two separate films in one movie. I briefly scrolled through some of the other reviews on here and saw plenty of complaints this time around on Thor's personality, and how he's just in a full on idiotic form. In recent years, I have been feeling very strongly about this matter and it is in full effect within Love and Thunder to the point that it is blatantly obvious. As someone who did not care for Ragnarok I was not expecting a majority the humor to resonate well with me, I wont lie and say it was totally and purely awful, I think Waititi definitely nails the Guardians of the galaxy's humor well, not as much the Thor humor though. I didn't find most of the jokes in the movie funny and I think its safe to say that it appeared that my screening did not find most of the jokes funny either between the friend I attended with actually expressing to me he felt like he was almost "forced to laugh" at many of the jokes and the lack of the audience expressing a sign of laughter on most of the jokes. As it is, for whatever reason it may be, the runtime was restrictive enough as it was in a movie with a lot to accomplish, If only more time was focused on developing certain plot points, relationships, characters (especially Gorr the not-so-God butcher), and adding necessary details instead of focusing what joke they could nail next, I believe the impact that the audience was supposed to feel walking out at the end would have been greater, made more sense, and maybe even I would have liked it more.

title: Fun film with a deeper meaning
text: This film started off with tears, ended with tears, but I laughed through the middle. It was a fun Thor movie with little clues to the end sprinkled throughout. The directors choice to go black and white for a certain part of the movie, was so well done. I really loved this films ability to make you connect with the entire cast - heroes and villain.

title: Good but Waititi a little overexposed right now.
text: Good 'ol Taila Waititi up to old tricks again. His humor is so hard to put a finger on. It is subtle and understated, at times silly but always unique. His new wacky Thor is ultimately better but maybe a bit too much in this one. Big Natalie Portman fan here and it is fun too see her jacked as Mighty Thor. Ragnorok was so good it was an uphill battle to reach that zenith and fell a bit short. Solid effort.

title: It's rubbish
text: Bland story. Dull characters. I just couldn't care about them. It's a childish film, with silly jokes all over the place. Thor acts as a perfect imbecile all the time. Most of the story is about saving a bunch of children and defeating the bad guy. And of course, throw some woke nonsense to rub our noses in. The Marvel films just went slowly downhill. And I think this is the last of them I watch in the cinema. I just can't be bothered with Disney anymore. The film is so bad I can't even spoil it! It's already spoiled. Don't waste your time. Watch something else.

title: Don't understand the hate
text: If you liked Ragnarok, you'll love thisI thought the humour was great, especially anything goat-related. Didn't notice the short runtime but would've been more than happy if they included any more!All the actors were great, the Zeus scene was great fun, and Bale was brilliant as always!Doctor Strange was underwhelming because it was hyped up to be so much more than it was, where Thor 4's happy just being a good fun adventure, and they absolutely nailed itNot sure if because of the disappointment of DS2, a lot of marvel fans are coming in negatively to Thor, it's a blast so hopefully gets the credit it deserves!Definitely give it a watch!

title: Worth a watch, but not a rewatch
text: I think comparing this movie to ragnarok is unfair to the merit of the contents, but while watching I couldn't help but feel as though the similarities to ragnarok made it less of its own. The action sequences were good, Christian Bale and Russel Crowe were fantastic, but the seemingly nonstop need to pack joke on top of joke, often at the expense of the movies more serious tone with Gor the God Butcher being a genocidal maniac, brought it lower than ragnarok in my book. Worth watching, but I wouldn't go out of my way to watch again.

title: What a trash !!!
text: Absolutely a trash movie , by far this is one of the worst movie produced by marvel ...No story , no acting , it is like they made this movie over the weekend!!!Complete waste of time and money, half of the theater left during the first 45 mnts .

title: It's too loose to be a staple film in the Marvel Cinematic Universe.
text: Thor: Love and Thunder focused a little too much on the comedy aspect leaving much to be desired in the straightforward plot.This movie does a terrific job of introducing us to more of the gods in the marvel cinematic universe leading up to many abrupt emotional teasers.Although the film did have some laugh-out-loud moments showcasing Thors' relationship tension with Stormbreaker and MjÃ¶lnir or random screaming goats, it got carried away, which led to the comedy feeling corny. It did have some decent battles showcasing the mighty Thor's hammer.It's too loose to be a staple film in the Marvel Cinematic Universe.Just as the movie Poster suggests, a lot is going on in this film., from the revival of Thor's love interest with Jane to The Guardians of the Galaxy making a non-encapsulating cameo, screaming goats, the gods, and the Gorr( the antagonist). Additionally, I'm still trying to figure out how Jane became "a Thor" I know she may be a chosen one or worth but turning into Thor is pretty wild.Ragnarok is still the best Thor movie in the series.Thor: Love and Thunder feels like a filler episode of your favorite anime. You will gain some pleasant moments from the movie, yet you won't be exclaiming to everyone that this is a must-watch! The first after-credit scene makes me hopeful for a fantastic sequel to this film.With that being said, Entertainmentsparadise rates Thor Love and Thunder a 6/10.

title: A CLASSIC THOR
text: First of all, after almost 40 movies we need to accept that MCU has own style of making movie.Thor is a wonderful exam of this. Thor has more fun and unrealistic character in comparison with comics. I was complaining about the Thor movies until this. There were a lot of unnecessary jokes in movies. However, in Love and Thunder, jokes and other adventure emotions are balanced well.About acting, Christian Bale shows us his quality again. His story, aim and emotions displayed well. We can understand his mentality in movie. Same situation is also for Lady Thor.Action scenes are enough for me and Thor's emotions, his journey on finding himselves displayed well.On the other hand, scenario has some mistakes according to other movies. Additionally, I learned that movie was almost 4 hours in origanlly but it cut almost 2 hours from the movie and we can understand this in movie. In my opinion, these interferences affect movies in bad way.Finally, Love and Thunder is my best Thor movie. However, MCU should work on their cinetographies. They have money and experience for it.

title: Thor Love and Blunder.
text: What an absolute pile of S***, unfinished cgi, terrible writing, boring from start to finish with a couple moments that made me think, hey this isn't so bad to be completely disappointed in the next scene. Welcome to marvel phase 4/bore.

title: Brilliant, funny, romantic rollercoaster ride
text: My rating for Thor: Love and Thunder is a solid 9/10 best Thor film yet. Just been to see Marvel Studios Thor Love and Thunder at the ODEON Cinemas in Mansfield IMAX screening. Absolutely loved it one of the best Marvel Studio movies ever, well I say that every time but it is. A very eventful roller-coaster ride I loved every minute to ever second of it. Tons of laughter with Thor's goats "AHHH", Chris Hemsworth is so funny as Thor best guy to play the character and Taika Waititi as Korg brilliant an absolutely hilarious character so funny every thing he saids. The whole writing and production to the actors and actresses, and the director Taika Waititi so funny he knows how to get a lot of comedy in a action packed adventurous film buff especially a marvel film love him. Ever song fitted perfectly with ever fight scene best music ever they defo know how to pick the perfect songs the music department brilliant. Thor: love and Thunder is a serviceable entertainment that coasts off a game cast who could've done more. I don't agree what other critics and reviewers are saying that it's got a lot of resemblance to Thor: Ragnarok. The most humorous characters in the film were Thor Goats and where many jokes land and many do not amongst the triumphs it's a proper comedy detour to the home of the gods Omnipotent City. It's has the one of the best marvel villains and the most scariest Marvel Studios villains ever 'Gorr the God Butcher' (Christian Bale). All the CGI was spot on from the villains goons zombie like shadow creatures to the home of the gods to the really good part the shadow realm when it goes like (Monochrome) brilliant. Absolutely loved the ending tho not saying anymore but say to the end as always 2 credit scenes one post credits and after credit scene. My verdict Thor: Love and Thunder is more Waititi than Ragnarok. It's had a very good strong opening to the middle then to the end brilliant, and it's smooth and colourful to the very end and I loved how they kept true the the comics with one particular storyline for one of the characters of you don't know then go and watch the film now if from uk and in cinemas around the world July 8th.

title: Thor : Love And Thunder
text: Overall the movie is good.It Would have been better if the Movie has been 15 to 20 Minutes longer.The Comic Elements are good but not in every scene.

title: Spoof movie
text: Taika Watiti failed this movie with his incessant urge to try and be funny. The whole story is filled with plot holes and stupid humour. And it's not even that funny - watching it in the cinema, there was barely a ripple of laughter throughout.He wrote this trash and the only purpose seems to be that Korg is centre stage throughout. Completely ignores the previous films and the best review came from someone else after the movie, it should have been advertised as a spoof.

title: Unlike Anything That MCU Has Shown Us Before; Matched With A Rocking Soundtrack
text: Marvel Studio's Thor: Love and Thunder officially redefines the definition of film and on-screen art. Taika Waititi's background as a painter can be seen throughout the film, through the use of a vibrant color scheme and specific tint isolation. This is incredibly aesthetically pleasing and, quite frankly, nothing that the Marvel Cinematic Universe has shown us before. Matched with a rocking soundtrack -- Appetite for Destruction from Guns N' Roses, Thor: Love and Thunder is quite literally an "appetite for destruction."Thor: Love and Thunder picks up after the events of Avengers: Endgame. Thor (Chris Hemsworth) is still tagging along as one of the Guardians of the Galaxy. After all his paths have been severed from his battles with Thanos, he finds himself without a pathway. In all of his thousands of years of living, this has never been a concept that Thor has had to tackle. This puts him on a journey of self-exploration. Although, obviously in the Marvel Universe, that can only last so long when the new villain Gorr the God Butcher (Christian Bale) comes to town. Gorr vows that "all gods will die." Thor recruits the help of his ex-girlfriend Jane Foster (Natalie Portman) who seemingly became a Thor herself. These two learn to work together to defeat Gorr and how to navigate the world while rekindling their old relationship.Thor: Love and Thunder emphasizes the idea of "love" in the title because that's how audiences will feel about the film's color variations and banging soundtrack. Christian Bale completely steals the entire show as Gorr the God Butcher. In every scene he is in, your eyes are glued to his worldly-like presence on the screen. Although he is terrifying, the audience will not be able to get enough of him. Christian Bale finds a way to make this a Christian Bale film and not a Chris Hemsworth film. As much as Gorr the God Butcher's storyline is golden, which is ironic given his black and white color scheme, other branches of the film feel unnecessary. During the film, certain plot points are used that feel somewhat like a cheap excuse to move the story forward. The characters spend a solid 30 minutes exploring something new, yet later we learn that it has no overall impact or relevance to the story. Part of the film is wasted on the focus of Zeus. It may be comedic and light-hearted in the moment, yet it almost feels like it is only introduced to help set up future Marvel projects, rather than focus on the film we are currently watching.If the title doesn't make it obvious, the film deals with the theme of love persevering and expresses the concept that relationships aren't forever, but the love behind them is eternal. Following previous Marvel content Thor: Love and Thunder continues the trend of pushing PG-13 boundaries and getting darker. When I say that Christian Bale is incredibly terrifying, that is really true. Marvel does not hold back on his character, especially when a large part of his role is about abducting children. Given that, plus the barrel of intense action throughout the film, this film is not to be taken lightly.I give Thor: Love and Thunder 4 out of 5 stars and recommend it for ages 12 to 18, plus adults. You can find Thor: Love and Thunder raining its way into theatres on July 8, 2022. So make sure to check it out!By Jude A., KIDS FIRST!

title: Overused comedy and Mediocre Villain ruined the movie
text: When you hear Gorr The God Butcher, you expected something villainess and terrifying.But he's hardly been seen killing a god . And the rest of the time, he fought with the Team Thor in which he did bad.Marvel lack of villain is really wearing them out and the fact they used actor like Christian Bale is also bad as their potential is wasted most of the time.Like Ragnarok, as the movie has everything be it loss, action, a good villain, comedy, a little romance, and Loki (which is a huge advantage tbh).Love and Thunder also has these things but overused comedy ruined the movie.The loss is present but it doesn't feel the same as we felt with Odin demise.Thor lost Mjolnir in the last movie and in pretty bad shape but he returned and that's how a movie should be.Thor goofiness was good for a little change but that's not how his personality should be.A like the visual effect but that only work for some extent.I am guess we will be seeing another sequel and I hope it would repeat the same mistake as this one.

title: A film that will cause further division of fans of the MCU
text: This is a very different movie compared to the last one that's been released, i've seen a lot of reviews talking about the contrast between letting the directors make their movie and continuing to telling the "MCU" story. Think the last 2 movies including Dr Strange MOM has the same issue. These are movies that are created by their director to be completely 100% stand alone. Phase 4 of the MCU doesnt feel like the start of something new like phase 1 did.Will say that Hemsworth and Bale are still and always be the standout actors for the film. Its still so surprising that he has such perfect comedic timing, downside is that the script went 1 step to far in making Thor an Idiot. His whole arc from Thor 1 to Endgame that he went from the arrogant god to caring about everything and everyone, not letting collateral damage come to the forefront but within minutes of movie starting this has just been reverted. Bale as Gorr was great but earning the title of the God Butcher was a step to far, seems as though this was a Mordo set up from Doctor Strange level threat than actually the epic level threat. Only seeing the first god actually killed on screen was a disappointment. Thinking that Russel Crowe being signed on for 1 movie i hoped he might have been the shock that earnt him the title. Side note Russel Crowe as the campest version of Zeus ever was a great edition to the movie.Thinking this is where the movie falls down, the comedy in Thor: Ragnarok was perfection and trying to capture lighting twice doesnt always work out. There were some standout laugh out loud moment... Korg but there was a lot of jokes that didnt land. Either cringe or taking away from the story. This could have been a 2 part story which would have been even better. So much of the story was rushed, Janes redemption but also demise was so quick for such a poignant story line from the comics. Then the Goats, it was funny for the first 3 times then they needed to shut up!Im not going to say that i didnt enjoy the movie but i think i've fallen into the trap of overthinking what could be shown in the movie and ultimately being slightly disappointed. I'd love for the team to return to do the next movie and just hit the heights that Ragnarok did.

title: A Few Haiku Reviews
text: This film plays as a Mediocre improv show With an optic feastOrPadme becomes Thor In a sword and sorcery SNL cartoonOrSo don't get me wrong I'm bought into this movie But no Ragnarok~jodawa.

title: 3 cans of garbage
text: Bale is good. Screaming goats dumb. Lady Thor was not interesting though she should've been. Thor granting others his powers was a nice touch if you want to just make stuff up for laughs. Overall lame AF. Better of watching Captain Marvel again as that sucked way worse than this dumpster fire.Congrats MCU. You played yourself.

title: Worst marvel movie
text: Big disappoitment by marvel!no action,bad jokes,very bad script!the only good things were the scenes with christian bale!without him the review would be 2!maybe the most flat marvel movie ever!

title: 7.5/10 - I was pleasantly surprised!
text: I was one of the few fans who seemed to prefer the first 2 Thor films to Ragnarok & the more comedic direction they decided to take this franchise. Knowing this had the same director & having watched all the trailers, my expectations were low...though as a huge Christian Bale fan & a Marvel fan I felt the need to at least watch it once. I have to say I was pleasantly surprised by how the tone of this film seemed to be a happy medium between original 2 & Ragnarok. It worked! It's not an excellent superhero film, and certain elements were underutilized, but it was enjoyable! Seeing Jane weld the hammer was so great - I'm glad Natalie made a return! And for the record, the MCU doesn't deserve the brilliant actor that is Christian Bale. He absolutely nailed this role soooo well, but his performance almost seemed too good for this film. All in all worth watching & after some solid Marvel duds we've been given lately...this was a welcome relief.

title: Christian Bale Is 2022's Best Supporting Actor in a Good but not Great (Probably The Worst!) Thor Film
text: Bale should be nominated for his work in this film and he should win. He is that good here. Now if only the rest of this movie could've followed his lead. That's a movie worth watching. It's almost as if, by tone, there are two separate films going on here. There is the dark and tragic storyline of Bale's character, and there's the rest of the goings on of this movie which is silly. Almost too silly. The differences are jarring.The movie is also too long. Not long for a Marvel movie but could still stand to shave of 15-30 minutes. That's how much time is spent on wasteful things.I wasn't crazy about the last Doctor Strange and I'm not crazy about this film. It seems the MCU is going down but what can we expect? It can't go on forever. Sooner or later there will be some stinkers in the stable.This movie gets a 7 because it's a Marvel movie and Marvel movies still look great.How much longer can the MCU get by on just its looks?Probably not much longer.

title: Awful yuck movie, hated it ðŸ¤¢
text: Taika Waititi should not be doing Thor movies. All characters appeared lunatic & high on something. Wonder the staff dragged weed / pot between shots!! To continue to act in it. Only Jaimie Alexander's role had genuine nuances from 1st movie & her shots were sober. Rest cast were high on drugs. Either Chris can't act or got a free pass from TW to do whatever the hell he wanted. What is the need to make more Thor movies ?? Why can't Marvel invest creativity on newer comic book characters? It deserves only 0 rating, don't waste time on disney+, theaters or elsewhere. Marvel's movie quality is poor.

title: Sweet Child of Mine
text: My favourite movie of 2022I laughed, felt shivers, almost cried, but most of all - felt thunder in my skin!!The movie has all elements of a great comic book - a dark and powerful villain, a situation in distress, the hero forming a team and saving the day, and most importantly, rocknroll!!! The humour is awesome and reminiscent of Ragnarok. The love triangle amongst Thor, hammer and storm buster is hilarious - as are several other things.Go watch this movie to feel like a kid again who had a love for comics!!PS - This is such a fresh breath of air after comparing to all other Marvel things which have become a soap opera these days. Dr Strange was so awful!

title: Fun but ultimately too funny?
text: In Ragnarok, Taika strikes a really good balance of comedy action and drama. Here he does that to a degree, however, I think he bogs it down just a little bit with all the jokes he tries to implement! The acting is great though. Chris Hemsworth is as good as ever, Natalie Portman is really fun, Tessa Thompson plays Valkyrie entertainingly, and Taika as Korg has quite a few laughs but ultimately was just too many for me. The standout of the film is easily Christian Bale. He stole every scene he was in and I wish he was in the movie more! He's really not though. His presence is felt but not seen nearly as much as it should be! Would still recommend this film though!

title: Definitely not for Kids
text: As a father, I will be embarrassed if I take my kids to watch this movie. This is not for kids. Disney forgot that children dream of being superheroes.

title: Tonally Inconsistent, Yet Enjoyable
text: Christian Bale was the best part of this movie, when he was on screen the movie felt like a film. However, when Bale was not on screen, every other scene needed to have a joke. With the film being a comedy, a character called the God Butcher really did not fit. The movie can still be enjoyed as a fun mcu outing with great performances from Hemsworth, Bale, Portman and Crowe.

title: only getting a six for christian bale
text: I can't say i'm surprised with the quality of the movie after seeing how marvel is just mass producing anything they can think of without any regards towards quality. The effects were subpar at best. I've seen fan edits that seemed much more realistic than what the movie tried to convey.I've never liked any of the thor movies but watched them to continue understanding the plot. Love and thunder was cringey, the dialogue made me feel so icky and the only thing that saved this movie was christian bale. He acted like a REAL actor, delivered his lines so well, definitely got the part WITHOUT being cringe worthy. Truly the only reason i kept watching.Aside from that i hope taika wititie never makes another marvel movie. He was great in jojo rabbit but perhaps he should focus on being in the movies rather than directing them.

title: Gentle comedy skits for teenagers but 2.5hrs long
text: The jokes got old, characters existed solely to extract mundane cheap laughs.This movie was so boring that, by the 1 hr mark my friends and i got up to go get wasted in a nearby bar.This concept of superheros with quips every alternate sentence for 2 hrs has gotten very old.I think it's time we all moved past superheroes.

title: It needs improvement
text: Don't get me wrong on this review. The movie was fine, but i saw so many lost opportunities. The history line was great and there were some amazing actors that could have made the movie so much greater. It was really a lost opportunity in so many directions. Christian Bale is a great actor and one thing that I liked, was that only his character brought ''realness" to the movie. It was only where he was part of the scenes where u really could not take the eyes of the movie. His character really was made out of a good reason and it lives space to think. On the other hand Nataly Portman as Jean Foster was a great fit and she portrayed so well the character. But the downfall of the movie and what needs to be fixed in the next ones was the parody. There is nothing wrong when fun moments are added during the movie, in my opinion is better because it gets your attention but should not be overdone. From the beginning to the end it seemed more like a parody and not in a good way. Was totally disappointed in this direction. There were of course really funny moments but mostly is was over exaggerated. So many important and powerful scenes where wasted and were turned into jokes. It made the move feel very very commercial. Like a strategy only to attract the audience and taking it further away from being a good movie. It seemed in many moments like I was seeing Deadpool (but not in a good way). Deadpool was a successful movie of course but this doesn't mean that you have to turn every marvel movie into a parody. It looses its meaning. Thor is not a parody movie and please keep this in mind in the other ones. Was really excited to see it, but when I left the cinema I was totally disappointed. It really looks like the only intention was to win money and the content was not important turning it 100% into a commercial movie. Incredible cast but so purely guided.

title: Phase 4 is a disaster
text: Eternals , ten rings and this are all major flops. I found the scene with the gods majorly uncomfortable to watch. Might be the end for Disney's golden cash cow.

title: Fun
text: I really enjoyed this. I do not believe it is better than Ragnorak, however, it certainly has some high points, whether that be comedic or emotional ones which perhaps exceed anything in Ragnorak. Overall it is a strong stand alone film, especially if you love the franchise and taika. I think it is a good thing it isn't stale and just trying to be Ragnorak 2.0. It takes risks and this should be admired.Worth a watch, has the potential to be some people's favourite film and to perhaps let down others who had set themselves too high expectations.

title: A Passable but Underwhelming Adventure in Thor: Love and Thunder
text: I was let down a little by this movie but I try to start with what I liked. Love and Thunder still looks good, it has the same kind of visual sensibility that helped Ragnarok stand out from the pack. The fight in the shadow realm has some nice cinematography and choreography with the action. Jane's return is also intriguing from moment one, I can't go far into spoiler territory but they do find a new angle on it to make Jane as Thor unstoppable yet vulnerable at the same time. The rest of the plot isn't as unique or fresh but the creative team handled her character's return with a lot of tact.Writer/Director Taika Waititi brought the Thor movies back into the limelight with Ragnarok and a lot of the legwork was done through putting the focus on the comedy. It kept things breezy and Hemsworth can pull it off so Ragnarok avoided getting bogged down in the drama like The Dark World did. That mindset is present here, but it's regrettable that most of the comedic bits in Love and Thunder just aren't funny. Do you remember the screaming goat video? Hope you found that funny and get ready for that joke 10-20 times. Think Thor getting jealous over Mjolnir being reformed and ignoring Stormbreaker isn't awkward? It's actually hilarious....right? Humour is subjective but I can't remember the last time I saw a comedy in theatres where there was such a low hit rate with the jokes. Love and Thunder feels like it's trying too hard to replicate the spontaneity and surprise that Ragnarok had up its sleeve to diminishing returns.The MCU has larger names but I'm of the mindset that Chris Hemsworth is one of the more underrated actors in their stable. He's got all the physicality, he's capable of running the emotional gauntlet and he's really funny when given the opportunity. Love and Thunder gives him the chance to reunite with Portman and he's absolutely game, he smashes the bad guys and tells the jokes as required. It was nice to see Natalie back too, her departure from the franchise was very unceremonious and she's given more to do in Love and Thunder. She's a good addition to Thor 4 and her character felt like the most original part of the movie. Tessa Thompson is still doing her thing as Valkyrie, she's still got great chemistry with Hemsworth and while she's given less to do than you realize, she holds up her end of the bargain. Ditto for Christian Bale who gets a chance to be more hammy here and there but other than the opening couple of scenes, he's left playing the same couple of notes on the piano for the rest of the movie. He's a great actor and I thought he deserved more to do just like Thompson did. The Guardians are in and out of this movie so quickly, they're respectively fine in their bit. Casting Russell Crowe as Zeus was a nice twist and while he's clearly having fun, I thought the bit went on too long.As much as Waititi re-energized the franchise with Ragnarok, the end result with Love and Thunder just isn't at the same level. I had heard going in that the critics were nitpicking and that Waititi was making such weird and refreshing choices with the material. When the credits rolled I was just confused. What was so daring or different in this movie? There are macro plot beats (Jane's return, the city of the gods maybe?) that go a different way but the movie recycles a similar aesthetic, presents us with a largely two dimensional villain and it's the same old search for the Macguffin. To my surprise and while I think Taika is capable of incredible work (Jojo Rabbit was a huge surprise for me), this is just a lacklustre script and the film presents itself as more quirky and edgy than it actually is.If you had told me at the start of the summer that I was going to like Madness of the Multiverse better than Love and Thunder, I don't know if I would have believed you. Maybe expectations were too high but I feel like Waititi and his team just couldn't capture the same magic twice and what we were left with here was a decent looking and passable effort that was underwhelming overall. Most of the comedy falls flat and the story failed to keep me interested. As much as I enjoy Hemsworth as this character, unless we're partying with the rest of the Avengers, I'm not sure if we need another Thor solo adventure. Maybe we've had our fill of Thor beating people up with G&R playing in the background?

title: Warning: It's a Thor parody!
text: Although I realy enjoyed Taika Waititi idiosyncratic style in Jojo Rabbit, It doesn't work for a movie like Thor. Previous Thor movies where never too serious and already had plenty of humor. Making a parody of a character like this just feels fake and turned the whole movie into a somewhat childish joke. The relationship between Thor and jane is very different from previous movies and I should probably tell you the director has taken a lot of artistic liberties with their back story. Thor is turned into a goofy Homer Simpson-type of loveable Idiot and the entire first half of the movie feels very empty. Some parts do get a good laugh but for me the whole movie was far too silly and childish.Positives: Christian bale makes great villain and the visuals are great (even by marvel standards).Not for serious fans. Woman and children seem to be the target audience here.

title: 6.8/10. Recommended
text: That's the third MARVEL movie in a row i have watched the last days, i mean, of the latest phases. There is a slight but constant, drop in quality. Judging from the other new movies' reputation, it's safe to say that they failed hard to keep up with Phase 2 and 3.It's better than BLACK WIDOW and ETERNALS. If you lower your expectations, you will enjoy it. Yes, jokes are forced and THOR: RAGNAROK seems like comedy gold, a G. O. A. T in comparison. There is a lot of mediocrity here. Maybe this movie targets very young audiences, i mean, if i was 10 years old, i would probably love it. It's too naive and silly.However, there are some positives. As many people have mentioned, Bale is great. Portman is a very good actress too, and she doesn't disappoint. Russel Crow was funnier than i expected. I found these goats very funny too and Korg was a likeable character. Hemsworth is always a charismatic presence. Furthermore, i got used to this movie naiveness and i liked a lot the final "battle". Guns n roses were a perfect choice, as a 90's kid, their music always brings me joy. Finally, there were some lines that made me laugh. (Jarnbjorn vs mjolnir, etc).So, lower your expectations, forget previous phases' existence, and you will probably enjoy it. Still, this Phase failed.

title: It's a live-action cartoon!
text: If the Marvel movies from the early 2000s were too serious, then modern ones are reduced to the level of daytime animated series, jokes for the 10 years old kids without heat and emotions, a ton of graphics and costumes. There is nothing wrong with that, it's just that the concept itself looks not serious. Chris Hemsworth clearly lacks dramatic acting skills, Natalie Portman and Christian Bale shows why are they Oscar winners, for this cartoonishly comic movie their acting is top level. For a god-killing boogeyman villain, Christian Bale appears only in third part of the movie. This film was created as pure action entertainment, there is practically no depth in the plot.

title: Missing Something
text: Thor: Love and Thunder is a vast improvement on the previous entry. Ragnorak was a poor film so I felt like this one needed to be a step up.The absolute highlight of the movie was the performance of Christian Bale. He was fantastic, adding much needed depth and acting quality to the show.Chris Hemsworth was his standard self and it was nice to have Portman back but she felt like the character misfit the movie.The action sequences and special effects are good enough but they are monotonous and too much of a crutch for the plot (as will ALL superhero films at the moment).Love etc rebuilds a little of the magic of Thor but has a long way too go to return it to its lofty origins :)

title: Dumb and dumber
text: This movie was a joke. Literally.. Not because it was a comedy. But since it ruins the characters to make fun of them instead.Utterly disappointed in both taika and Chris since they are good enough to make a good story.

title: Funny & Emotional
text: This is the best Thor film to date, we had a villain with a meaningful back story, perfectly acted by Bale, he was scary and intense at times, and managed to switch quickly to Erratic and energetic. The visuals of this film are some of the best, you have these beautiful bursts of colour throughout, contrasted by this somehow bright black and white tone In the alternate realm. Thor continues to experience a roller coaster of emotion, and has surprising, yet satisfying arc. Natalie Portman was a surprise, she delivered a decent performance, showing two sides of the same coin. The overall storyline was satisfying, there are moments I wish had happened, but it's not a deal breaker. The highlight for me was Russell Crow as Zeus, it feels closer to what Zeus was probably like compared to other depictions. Highly recommend seeing this film, it's not about fan service, it delivers an enjoyable and comedic experience, whilst adding a sense of horror, not as extreme as Multiverse of Madness.

title: A Fun but Flawed Adventure
text: The film is a visual feast, with stunning CGI effects and colorful costumes that evoke a retro sci-fi vibe. The action scenes are thrilling and inventive, especially when Thor and Jane team up to unleash their powers. The film also has plenty of humor, thanks to Waititi's quirky style and Hemsworth's comedic timing. The supporting cast is also great, with Bale delivering a menacing performance as Gorr and Portman proving her worth as a superhero.However, the film also suffers from some flaws that prevent it from reaching its full potential. The tone is inconsistent, shifting from silly jokes to serious drama without much balance. The plot is convoluted and overstuffed with subplots and cameos that distract from the main story. The character development is weak, especially for Jane, who becomes Thor's equal without much explanation or struggle. The film also relies too much on nostalgia and references to previous MCU films, which may alienate some viewers who are not familiar with them.Overall, Thor: Love and Thunder is a fun but flawed adventure that offers some laughs and spectacle but lacks depth and originality. It is not as fresh or satisfying as Ragnarok , but it has fun moments that will please fans of the franchise.

title: Standard Marvel of late...
text: ... green screens, weak writing, big budgets, silly jokes and famous actors.Very weak storyline/writing and underutilized acting potential leaves a disappointing film afterwards.

title: It was a high-budget comedy from MCU.
text: I think they lost the equilibrium on this one. Thor (1) was ok but every intro of MCU character is ok film, 6/10. Thor (2): the Dark World was not bad and kept strictly Thor world with Thor story characters, it had its own style, so for me it was 7/10. Thor (3) Ragnarok was great, they hit the sweet spot with action and comedy and adventure, from me 8/10. Thor (4): Love and Thunder, in my opinion 6/10. That's because it got a bit too silly by having too many silly moments, a bit too long of silliness, a bit too far with silliness, but jokes were not bad. It was a fan movie ti watch, no doubt, but didn't give a feeling of the blockbuster spirited marvel movie. It was a good high-budget comedy from MCU.

title: Thor 4: Diminishing Returns
text: Feeling much more like Disney+ "content" than an actual feature film, the only thing Thor 4 accomplishes is putting more bland characters on the screen for more time. My advice: want to see more Thor? Rewatch Age of Ultron. Want more Korg or Valkyrie? Rewatch Ragnarok. Want more Jane Foster? Just watch Thor.Save your money, save your time, but most importantly, save these characters by skipping this colorful slog.

title: It's no Ragnarok...
text: Ragnarok, for me, was the best Thor film, potentially stand-alone MCU film there has been. This falls short of the mark. The humour isn't the same, although the goat's did bring a few chuckles. Valkyrie was more an under-used sidekick whose humour didn't land, but Christian Bale as Gorr was the standout performance, but with little screen time.It also felt like a tribute to Guns N Roses, as FOUR songs were used, three of them in a row.Not quite sure where this new phase in the MCU is heading, as nothing has been the same since Endgame.

title: People like to complain....
text: Alright. Here is one of the instances where I'd just like to say something I saw on YouTube that I really agree with. Never mind the critics. This is a fun, enjoyable Phase 4 film that perfectly balances (a lot) of humour with some really dark undertones and upsetting scenes. I'm trying hard to keep this spoiler free, but some scenes are just so powerful (especially nearer the end) and Christian Bale was just.... incredible. Who cares about the character design? It's not even that bad! He was menacing, ruthless, but not evil enough to be irredeemable. Chris Hemsworth was amazing as usual, and Natalie Portman played her role SO WELL. So on this one I say don't scroll to any more reviews and watch the film without being a hardcore film critic and criticising everything, And enjoy the film for what it is. If I could I would rate this 8.5/10 but I will round down because 9 is VERY high, and reserved for films like Endgame. Stay for both post credit scenes! There are 2!This is a great movie.

title: From dadbod to godbod
text: Thor: Love & Thunder is the next installation in the Thor franchise, once again with Taika Whatiti behind the camera. This can be seen because his style is characterized by a lot of humor and many colors. There is a counterweight to this humor, namely Christian Bale's Gorr the God Butcher. A good enemy whose motivation one can understand.Thor has never really been anything to me, but I can easily see the qualities in the film. The humor also got me a few times, it should have.Marvel has so far not released the best movies this year - so it's exciting to see which direction the development.

title: A very fun yarn in the spirit of Marvel comics
text: I knew nothing about the storyline or this film, but I thought it was brilliant tbh. Natalie Portman and Chris Hemsworth reprise their on screen relationship superbly, and Taika Waititi did Marvel proud. Not to mention that soundtrack! I kept waiting for Jack Black to appear tbh. Hilarious cameo's and lots of fun make the film great for parents and kids to enjoy side by side, although Russell Crowe was awful and seems like a shoe in because of his name, so many better choices for Zeus out there, what were they thinking!? Overall it is a great addition to the Marvel universe, and the door is of course left open to continue adding to it. Let's just forget about Russell Crowe please. Think Green Lantern vibes Marvel.

title: God Butchered the movie.
text: Would've been a beautiful movie if they stuck with the God Butcher comic. With the three Thors of Christmas past. Young Thor from the past, present Thor and King Thor. Or even a more amazing tv show with more detail.Gorr gave me goosebumps in the comics and definitely shows you thors true nemesis. It is beautiful.I've never watched a movie that was better than a book or comic.Disney is just creating garbage and trashing everything that was or can be good.I remember when they used to be magical.So just like in your popcorn bucket they just reheat it and turn it into some gross instead of making it taste better and be better entertainment.

title: So Torn
text:
This is a good film but serves no real purpose in the MCU plot lines going forward,
Thor is now a comedy and a very funny and good one but where as most marvel films have light hearted moments throughout this really just makes you laugh throughout, it's romantic and genuine Natalie Portman is awesome as both a sickly cancer patient and kick ass mighty thor and Hemsworth really hams up the lost puppy just trying to do good.Bale great villan! Plays the role to perfection and I'd expect nothing lessCameos are fun and plentifulSo in summary as part of a MCU saga I don't think I works at all, but as a standalone series hell yeah keep em coming!I'd like to see another one as a natural follow on.

title: Ratings so far are generous
text: I am absolutely gobsmacked at how bad this film is! When I saw the ratings were over 7 it still meant that it's not going to be best film but still enjoyable and entertaining. Well.... It isn't! This is the only film I have ever walked out on and that's saying something since I sat through the train wreck Eragon.The story is weak, the acting is some of the worst, the jokes are frequent but terrible, and the screaming goats get old reallly fast!It was so boring and it felt like it was trying too hard to be Ragnarok and it just wasn't working.I really really wanted to enjoy this movie as I'm a big fan of Marvel and Thor but with 45 minutes to go I just couldn't take it anymore.

title: Entertaining and vivid. But it can't quite decide what it wants to be.
text: The first Thor (2011) is one of the best superhero films ever made. It had a clear storyline, great special effects, a great cast all around with a fine pick for the lead role (Chris Hemsworth), a stirring musical score, and a director (Kenneth Branagh) who knew how to lean right in to the mythical grandeur of the Norse gods. Yes, those were the days. Now in this fourth Thor film where are we? Norse god? No, a 'space Viking'. Serious warrior? More of a lovable doofus with muscles and a magical axe. It's all very entertaining and easy to watch -- things never drag, and visually, Love and Thunder is as striking as almost any thing Marvel has come up with. The Shadow Worls, the Hall of the Omnipotents, and the mysterious Eternity are terrifically well done things to look at. Also, for a cast that includes Natalie Portman and Christian Bale (and an over-the-top Russell Crowe cameo) how can you go wrong?So I enjoyed it. Go see it, you'll have a good time. But I also came away thinking that underneath the hood, this movie is fighting with itself, and for that I look right at director Taika Waititi. This thing can't decide what it wants to be. There's a lot of straight-on situational and romantic light comedy, which is fine, but the deep problem with that is that when things suddenly NEED to get serious (as they almost always should in superhero films; after all, the word 'super' is there for a reason, and saving the world/universe goes with the territory), it's hard to be convincing about the necessary shift in tone.Look at the other 'best' superhero films of recent years: the first Iron Man (2008). X-Men 2 (2003) and Days of Future Past (2014). Spider-Man 2 (2004) and Spider-Man No Way Home (2021). Wonder Woman (2017). The first Avengers (2012) and of course the big Infinity War/Endgame pair. What do these have in common? Yes, they have great characters and production values, but the ultimate key is that all of these films take themselves seriously, and that's how to make a fantasy world work. They lay out a storyline where the stakes are high, and then go at it straight on. If the movie can't even suspend its own disbelief while it's rolling then how can the audience do it? Waititi seems to want to have it both ways, or all ways, at once. Are we watching a sendup of superhero films or the real thing? I had the same issues with his Jojo Rabbit (2019), which was brilliant in certain ways but a chaotic mishmash of tone. It was less than the sum of its parts.Just to get the rest of my complaints out of the way, the first half-hour felt quite odd; the actors were delivering their lines in a quippy, offhand way as if they were in an episode of Seinfeld or Friends or whatever the recent equivalents are. And I was looking forward to seeing more of the lovable Korg and his off-center dialog that was such a fun part of Ragnarok, but it just fell flat this time. Tessa Thompson as Valkyrie was sadly underused and it looked almost as if she wished she was somewhere else.By this point, the Marvel film universe has almost completely disconnected from its original comics source material. (Case in point: it was very cool to see Eternity introduced as one of the Ultimate Powers of the universe -- he's rendered extremely well, just like the first appearance in the Doctor Strange comics. But he seems to be used as something like a wishing well, which is pretty trivial. Really, guys?) Right now it feels as if they are making up stuff as they go along, and interestingly, they are starting to run into the same storytelling complexity problems that the superhero comics have had for decades: continuity and retconning. If there's a Grand Plan for Phase 4 and 5 it's sure hard to see what it is.

title: Not bad as everyone says
text: I recently watched "Thor: Love and Thunder," and it surprisingly exceeded my low expectations. Taika Waititi's humor, although not consistently hitting the mark, brought a light and entertaining tone to the MCU. The characters, especially Thor, the Guardians of the Galaxy, Jane Foster, and Korg, showcased undeniable charisma, contributing to the film's appeal. Skillful editing kept the pace smooth, allowing me to lose track of time, and the narrative arc around Jane Foster added a compelling emotional dimension.On the flip side, the plot felt somewhat formulaic, lacking the innovation of "Thor: Ragnarok" and unfolding predictably. There was a noticeable missed opportunity in exploring more depth in the main storyline and secondary characters like Almighty Thor. While Christian Bale's performance as Gorr was commendable, the character's writing fell short, preventing Gorr from becoming the formidable Marvel villain he could have been.

title: Not bad at all, could've been great though
text: Since the beginning of the fourth stage in MCU until now, this film has contains the most accurate quotation from the comics.A comedy vibes similar to what appeared in Thor Ragnarok which i personally considered it one of the best works Thor movies, but here the comedy was relatively more visible, Not always in a good way.Marvel succeeded in presenting a high-ranking villain with this work, carrying a purpose, a cause, a tragedy, and a painful past that was perfected by the actor Christian Bale, as expected. The element of drama was effective in the story, as the film revolves around the character of Thor completely this time, Thor is the most person who has loved people taken from him in MCU so far, starting with his mother, then Auden, then his homeland, Asgard, then Loki several times, and with this film it took more from him than before, all of this and still takes from him more at the end of the successive tragedies until the All Father character is formed and enters the MCU.With that being said, now come to the negative points of the movie. Some of the comedy scenes were inappropriate within the context of the scene and had no meaning. Taika Watiti tried to create a second Ragnarok inside the movie, but the importance of the story and its depth are not commensurate with this amount of irony, especially beside the presence of gods. The last fight had a few bugs and although it was fun, at one point I felt like Christian Bale's presence was just a way to attract viewers with his debut. After all, Love and Thunder isn't much better than Marvel's first-class work, but it's an enjoyable and worth watching movie experience, that's for sure.

title: How the hell can you like this movie!?
text: What was Marvel thinking? This movie totally baffles me. It wasn't a comedy. It wasn't a good action movie. It had no pulse, no emotional connection, disconnected plots, The acting wasn't good, it felt nothing like the last Thor which was great. I thought about walking out a half a dozen times but held out hope...wasted. I can watch a bad movie, but this made me look around like I was in the twilight zone or something. Marvel movie as long This might be the worst MCU movie made. I don't get how it has a 7/10. The same people who somehow liked the trash movie WW84 would probably like this and don't care about quality or continuity or purse, just a fake laugh (aka Tik Tok). Just a stupid movie. Waste of time.

title: A missing ingredient, Loki, but still enjoyable.
text: I think the kitch comic feel works much better when it is offset with the darkness and witt of loki, that mix made ragnarok so special. Now the comedy comes off somewhat flat at times.However, there were quite some hilarious moments in the movie, and the action scenes with lighting and thunder and guns and roses music in the background does compensate, making the movie an enjoyable experience.

title: Not Quite Enough Love or Thunder
text: Another week is under our belts and with it came the next big summer movie release. Marvel's Thor: Love and Thunder. My excitement following the success of 2017 Thor: RagnarÃ¶k and the return of Taika Waititi as not only director but also co-writer has been palatable as well as guarded. With only an hour fifty-nine-minute runtime, the return of so many established characters, along with the introduction of new storylines, combined with the "late in the game" onslaught trailers, clips, and other hype I was more than a bit fearful we would've pretty much seen the entire film before it actually hit the screen.Both valid takes as it turns out.Thor: Love and Thunder is indeed a fun, summer romp of a film that delights in many ways. The light-hearted to downright silly comedic beats, plenty of expected as well as unexpected call backs, fast paced action, and a storyline with heart at its core for my time and money put Thor: Love and Thunder in the same realm as Thor: RagnarÃ¶k.Sweet.Same realm but not quite the same level, however.The less is more runtime definitely keeps TLT from hitting the full RagnarÃ¶k level of enjoyment. Not all the comedy is a solid hit, but more importantly the drama and the emotional elements aren't given the time to sit/breathe making for a less impactful viewing experience that's emptier than it should be.Christian Bale delivers as the "Big Bad". I just wish there had been more Gorr to feast upon. The same can be said for Tessa Thompson's Valkyrie and Natalie Portman's Jane Foster/Mighty Thor. The chance to really delve into and expand on their characters never quite comes to fruition and while seeing them is enjoyable it's also frustrating as a result. The character development remains only skin deep here. A truly squandered opportunity.Then there's Russell Crowe. I can't even begin to wrap my head around that one. Better than his outing as Henry Jekyll in 2017 The Mummy but still... If nothing else, what the hell was up with that accent? I'll leave it at that.Moving on.Good visuals. Strong direction. Then there's the soundtrack. Ahhh, the soundtrack. An around the world and back snap for certain. Guns N' Roses takes me back, ABBA makes me happy, Mary J. Blige is never wrong.Thor: Love and Thunder as a whole is a bit of a mixed bag, not unlike all the Thor films. Fortunately, there's more good about it than bad.Did I want more from it overall? Yes. Did I enjoy seeing it on the big screen? Yes, again. Can I recommend you head to the theater to check it out? Again, I'm going to say yes. Go for the fun, go for the joy of catching up with the familiar characters and for a glance of seeing where they may head in the future. Go with the right mind set for a summer movie experience but be sure to stay for the 2 end credit scenes.Thor: Love and Thunder is a 7.5 for me.

title: Terrible Movie
text: It's hard to know where to start. The storyline is woeful, the dialogue is trying for humour but misses by many country miles, the cast are trying hard I feel but even they can't breathe life into this utter mess of a movie. Watiti is I believe trying for humour with emotion but fails on both. The key emotional moments just left me cold, the overwhelming barrage of attempted humour completely strips away any emotional connection with the film and the poor plot/story undermines everything. By far the worst Marvel film to date, this was an utter car-crash of a movie. Please reconsider letting Taika Watiti direct a Star Wars film, on this evidence he will ruin it.If you enjoyed Ragnorok and are thinking of going to see this film...DON'T..!

title: Enjoyable but nothing more
text: Let's start by saying that this was enjoyable to watch, unlike Jurassic World Dominion which felt like you were assaulted by a physical manifestation of Hollywood laziness. There were funny moments here and there, Christian Bale's performance was very good and Russell Crowe...Russell Crowe is in his own world in this movie, in a good way.Sadly, Waititi's indulgence could really be felt sometimes, with him leaving the camera on for the actors to improvise in between scripted scenes. The humour, personally, felt really flat most of the time except for, again, funny shots and lines here and there. Chris Hemsworth is always good as an actor, but a good actor can't camouflage bad jokes. The predictable MCU moments are here, clichÃ©s tropes and plot points...it's not like the other movies didn't have that, but where Ragnarok felt fresh and different, this one really doesn't hit the same.Overall,6/10 recommendation for mindless fun but with all that money on the screen, this could've been much better.

title: Sweet but bland
text: Thor Love and Thunder is a normal marvel movie, it is certainly enjoyable and fun to watch, but it lacks that sense of suspense. The reason it gets a 7/10 is because you can't really go wrong with a Thor movie, but compared to the previous Thor movies, this one is more family friendly. If you're looking to enjoy an evening with some friends, then this movie will definitely do the job. But if you are a but marvel fan, you will notice it is not the same level as Spiderman FFH or Dr. Strange MoM.

title: Serious story weighed down by forced humor
text: The overall story of this movie was very good. The issue I felt was really the tone. Very goofy humor in this didn't feel right for the story. In ways it reminds me of a Darin Morgan episode of the x files, self parody. But the difference with a Darin Morgan x files and this is that this movie the humor/parody angle feels forced and not appropriate to the Jane foster storyline and even gorrs. It's an enjoyable film but would have been better if the director took a serious approach to the story over comedy.

title: Way to Ruin a Franchise
text: Very disappointing addition to the Thor franchise with such a pondering, predictable story. I won't give examples but decided to leave the theater early rather than waste my time. Sad that movie creativity is a thing of the past.

title: CGI can't compensate bad writing/directing
text: I really liked the trailers, so I went in, however it was not worth the money. Yes, there were some fun parts in it and I really liked the (underdeveloped) Jane Foster arc - but the plot overall was too messy, confusing, relying too much on cgi, completely forgetting a truly cinematic story. The last series I watched was Stranger Things - and the quality differences in writing, directing, cutting etc. Are astounding. Can't Marvel do better? I'm a bit bummed to write this, because Thor would've had so much potential. It's mostly ridiculous now - and unfortunately not in a good way.

title: Unfunny Terribly Scripted Junk
text: A nowhere piece of junk - the infantile director and totally amateurish writers can't even decide if its meant for adults or children. In either case, it's just ludicrously bad.Good actors are all the way wasted on caricatured acting and silly dialogue that even a ten year old will yawn at.You should be paid to watch this crap, not the other way round.

title: Thor
text: An amicable feat of chaos and wonder, adaption and redemption, storytelling and visualization, love and thunder. Truly amazes all around in every aspect.

title: Not a huge fan of the comedic Thor
text: The last two Thor movies have had too much slapstick comedy. I understand that Thor is supposed to be melancholy after Avengers, and humor has become his way of dealing with it, but these last two movies seem to have gone overboard with the corny jokes. Thor looks like a adolescent moron, not the god that he is, even a melancholy one.

title: what happened here?
text: I didn't love Ragnarok buy at least was a competent MCU product well finished overall. But this is a mess. Mess of script, mess of story, mess of dialogues, mess of bad and unfunny jokes over and over. I feel sad for Bale and Natalie. Wasted characters. Wasted time. Just, why.

title: More thunder in the action than love of the story.
text: I liked this film. Filled with gags, sometimes too many. Christian Bale as Gorr provided for one of the greatest MCU villain portrayals, just under Josh Brolin's Thanos. Just under-utilised with the lack of screen time. Hemsworth, great as always. Nothing more to be said there.It's becoming more apparent that the MCU is slogging out all the phase 4 content with no intended climax and incentive as to how everything will connect.I'm starting to dislike Marvel's underuse and constant filtering of villains and good actors who only appear in one project, never to be seen again.

title: 2 mighty Thors
text: I liked Thor (2011), I did not like Thor: The Dark World (2013), and I liked Thor: Ragnarok (2017) because it was good new direction for the character. Thor: Love and Thunder (2022) was the same as Thor: Ragnarok (2017).Chris Hemsworth as Thor is still great, but Thor in the movie can act stupid and can be cringey at times even though he does have good moments and cool action scenes.Natalie Portman as Jane Foster/Mighty Thor was good. I liked how she became Mighty Thor because it was like how she becomes Mighty Thor in the comics. She was cool in action scenes, and she has good scenes so you can feel what she is going through.I did like Christian Bale as Gorr the God Butcher because you do get a backstory that helps you understand him, he can also be creepy and intimidating. The problem is I would have liked to see more of him because he is not in most of the movie.The relationship between Thor and Jane Foster/Mighty Thor was still good and they work well together. The problem with the movie is that it can get too cheesy with its jokes, and it can get cringey, but there are jokes and dialogue that are funny.The movie has an 80's feels to it, the Guardians of the Galaxy are only in some small scenes, and the action scenes are fun to watch. The 3rd act can get stupid, but it is entertaining.Thor: Love and Thunder (2022) is like Thor: Ragnarok (2017) in many ways, but I liked Thor Ragnarok (2017) more than this. Thor: Love and Thunder (2022) is fun and entertaining to watch, but you might not like this if you did not like Thor: Ragnarok (2017).

title: Decent But Disappointed
text: Similar to Ragnarok this film was absolutely hilarious. Unlike Ragnarok it was not well balanced. Natalie Portman was great here. They actually gave her something to do. Christian Bale was great in the scenes he was in, however he was extremely underused. Overall, Love & Thunder was enjoyable but if it had been longer it could have been one of the best MCU films.

title: One of the worst Marvel movies I've seen
text:
The worst of the worst .Stupid script
amateur VFX , I know few YouTubers that can do special effects 100x times more better than this movie, and char animations.Stupid jokes, the jokes are a joke ! :)Waste of time ! And money ! , I left after half a hour ! Was that bad - first marvel I left the cinema.

title: marvel fanboys made this better
text: I dont get the hate with this movie, they expect characters to stay the same for each movie, its like the go to see the movie and expect it to be exactly what they thought. Why cant a main character change and have a mid life crisis. This movie was great, dry humour and bale was fantastic. Id love to see the directors cut.

title: WHY TAIKA?!?!?!?
text: The story was good but.....Some comedy scenes after serious scenes was just so pointless...and gor should've been more powerful and there should have been a good fight between them, I mean the story was good but just some scenes were so useless...I mainly check the story which was good and Gor's story was good,but all thanks to taika that some scenes ruined the films rating ðŸ˜‰ , I was a thor fan for a long time, I still am but just the rating made me so sad I waited 4 years for it but it was disappointing, I'll give it a 7.5 out of 10, if gor was more powerful and some comedy scenes were removed then I'd probably given an 8.5 out of 10.....please change the writter in next thor if it comes, his direction was good but no need for him to writing.

title: Horrible
text: The stupidest Marvel movie yet and I thought the Eternals were bad. They made a mockery of a great Marvel hero with corny jokes. Don't waste your money and wait for it to be free on Disney+

title: Congrats Taika Watiti and crew
text: You get my 10 star rating here for bringing back Love! I was dismayed with the beginning. But I was in tears near the end. Everyone needs love. So true and Thor has got it.

title: Good movie, flat jokes but great ending.
text: The beginning was OK, but felt rather weak, and the movie tried SO hard to be funny that it all felt kinda flat, Thor and Janes lines felt a bit awkward.The ending was great though, the last maybe hour (from the shadow realm and forward) was fantastic, and Bale was SCARY as a bad guy and really made your skin crawl. The relationship between Jane and Thor was beautiful, especially the hospital scene.All in all, would've been a great movie if they skipped the flat jokes and awkward lines, and also brushed up on the SFX a bit, because some parts looked SO bad, especially the first fight. The fight on the shadow realm was beautiful though, I loved the B&W and how mjolnir and the bolt made things a bit colourful while the rest was all gray.

title: Absolutely terrible
text: Can't remember the last time I disliked a movie this much. I've never thought about asking for a refund, but I did tonight.Christian Bale did a great job, everything else was a complete joke and waste of time.

title: Still entertaining, but it's no Ragnarok
text: A fun action fueled good time. Chris Hemsworth is great as always so is Natalie Portman and this was definitely my favorite thor movie with her. Christian Bale was fantastic as Gorr & I really liked a lot of the set pieces especially on the climax. I will say though a lot of the humor was pretty excessive and some was just downright dumb. I laughed many times but stuff like the goats constantly screaming got old fast and thor pouring beer on Stormbreaker almost made me facepalm. Despite that though I can't act like I didn't have a great time. Ragnarok was better tho.

title: Good but chasing
text: While I appreciated and looked forward to the 80s themed love and thunder it was good at its best and not so much rewatch-able at its worst. Majority of the elements I would consider alright 6/10 overall, but there was stuff lacking that pulled it down.First off the start felt pointless and so did the attire changes. It set the tone for the remainder of the movie to follow suit in some bad habits with the movie constantly trying to be a comedy (with most jokes just falling flat. Not all were bad they just weren't funny either with only maybe 1-2 laughs out of the entire movie worth of puns/jokes/comedic elements.) it just took away any type of feeling or investment into the darker parts of the story that had real substance to be deeper and great. It just felt like the movie was chasing the formula of Ragnarok and it failed to capture it completely. This thor was less heroic and more like a parody of what he started off as.A huge drawback that would polarize some is the screaming goats in this movie. To me it was annoying and would be part of the reason I wouldn't be quick to rewatch this movie.Christian bale delivered and had he been included into a more serious thor movie would have been an amazing fit into the arch/storyline. He did his job but everyone else seemed like they just showed up put on their suits and read out some comedic lines to get paid. It felt cheaper and just flat.I think the movie had the right idea, wrong director, and missed the mark of excellent because of it.6/10 - Alright movie but below marvel movie expectations and not the most rewatchable one either. It's just in line with the majority of phase four which just hasn't hit the same level as the predecessor movies and phases.

title: This movie is a Bad Jokes All around
text: Clearly this is one of the worst movie that being produced by MCU, since Taika Waititi taking over, the Thor Franchise has become worst and worst with every title produced. There is no meaningful moment build in this movie that connect audiences with the storyline events But no more than series of Bad Jokes. Just Hopes that the Box Office were bad enough so Kevin Paige could start thinking of a replacement for him.

title: REALLY??
text: 1/2 star for the GOATS and 1/2 star for Bale.Laughed at all the high reviews . I suppose that's what this generation likes..This was garbage. Cross between Dr Seuss and the Notebook ! YAAAAWN!Might as well have Jim Carrey play Thor with all the one liner quips . Movie theatre was packed , saw people leaving the theatre around halfway. My 12 and 15 year old even wanted to leave . Lol !! I said we are staying because I paid 45 bucks , so we are gonna see this garbage through.PS. Hey Taika , stop trying to copy James Gunn with the color scheme and throwing in retro music. Your comedy is a joke . You ruined Guns n Roses. It did not work in this movie at all. No one laughed at the parts that was suppose to be funny except the goats . Please stop directing Marvel Movies or anything comedy .PLEASE !!

title: Top notch entertainment ðŸ‘ŒðŸ»
text: Where you think this character could go after so many sequels, prequels, guest appearances, multi universes and what not? Yup, exactly here. And it works just fine. Is Thor a caricature od himself? Yes. Are all the characters a comic version of themselves? Yes, and it all works just fine. The storyline is super tight. Acting flawless. The action scenes just enough done. This is a top notch entertainment with seriously not a single flew. Tbh, I was so reluctant to watch it just because of so many serious super heroes movies that are just ridiculous. This is ridiculous supervisor hero movie that is seriously good. Love. And thunder ofc :)

title: Summer fun
text: The Thor series gets another story ahead. No high expectations just for the summers. Personally enjoyed the action and comedy elements. But movie feels like it doesn't contain a big event like marvel movies do. Some jokes may get too goofy. A good point is Christian bale as the villain absolutely thrilling performance the kids in my theatre ran away. Chris hemsworth is good as Thor like expected. Some good emotions were blended with the story about the female Thor's illness. The director has not full filled expectations like the 3rd part of Thor being the best. The climax is ok doesn't feel huge. Action pieces also ok noting new to get excited. Overall a fun summer entertainer for me. One time watch from marvel.

title: Half Parody, Half Dark Drama, Whole Train Wreck
text: This movie is all over the place. The battles are what I would do if I was spoofing a Thor film. Gorr and Jane have tragic stories that are completely undermined by the cheap humor.
