This might be the worst MCU movie ever.They tried to wrestle with the idea of the nature of gods and failed miserably in making it interesting. What is the nature of God? This is embarrassing take on the age old question.

title: The God Butcher
text: The last worshiper of God Rapu, Gorr (Christian Bale), crosses the desert with his daughter that dies of thirsty and starvation. He reaches an oasis and sees Rapu that mistreats Gorr. The powerful Necrosword choses Gorr that beheads Rapu and he promises to kill all the gods. Thor (Chris Hemsworth) and the Guardians of the Galaxy are fighting Sif and Dr. Jane Foster (Natalie Portman) is under treatment of a stage IV cancer on Earth. When Gorr kidnaps all the children of New Asgard, Thor, Jane Foster with Mjolnir, King Valkyrie (Tessa Thompson) and Korg go to the Omnipotence City to ask Zeus (Russel Crowe) to join an army of gods to fight Gorr, but Zeus don't care to his request. Now the quartet needs to fight Gorr to rescue the children and avoid the God Butcher from reaching the Etenity's gate."Thor: Love and Thunder" is an adventure that aspires to be funny, but most of the scenes of comedy are unfunny. The adventure is not bad, and Gorr is a creepy villain. The corny conclusion is silly, with Thor raising the daughter of his enemy. The American Jane Foster reaching the Valhalla is hard to be understood. My vote is six.Title (Brazil); "Thor: Amor e TrovÃ£o" ("Thor: Love and Thunder")

title: Boring
text:
Not good movie
Felt like thir was acting all the way in
Nothing serious and seems more like cometdy and stage play
Time waster.The story was staged up
And kind of you can make out what's gonna happenNothing new.

title: A fun movie with a heavy topic
text: Thor love and thunder is a very fun movie Here are some the highlights the villain steals the movie his backstory is the first thing you will see his story is very heart-breaking and sad and his part is very scary. The ending is very sad and and emotional and you need to stay after the movie because this movie has two stingers at the end the best way you should watch this movie is on the big screeen.

title: Do yourself a favour and don't watch this movie
text: It'll be 2 hours of your life that you'll never get back. It has a (bad) joke about every 20/30 seconds which becomes so utterly draining and tedious. The lore of these characters is completely abandoned, particularly Tessa Thompson's character who was a force in recent Marvel movies but has been reduced to a cliche in this. It felt like an episode of FRIENDS with the schlocky zingers coming at you one-after-the-other. All it was missing was a laugh track, I swear.Not only that, but the story is a complete bore. The ending is so ridiculous it might as well be a children's tv show - and sadly it was the only part of the movie that's not trying to make you laugh.

title: What are the critics talking about what a great movie
text: Took my daughter to see this movie She's 11 years old and we both enjoyed this movie extremely great movie action plot everything was good. Movie critics are just that they are movie critics I don't even think they watch this movie. This is the best Marvel movie that's been released this year.

title: High Expectations but letdown
text: Thor Love and Thunder was a movie that I extremely exited for. I recently watched Ragnarok and was hopeful that the movie would follow suit in terms of its art and comedic direction.Love and Thunder does this too a certain extent but not fully. The vibrant colours of Ragnarok are still present which awesome however the comedy is very stale. Korg was amazing in Ragnarok and quickly became one of my favourite mcu characters, However, he overstays his welcome in Love and Thunder. I can only describe him as too quippy, which ultimately leads to his jokes being dry and unamusing.Christian Bale as Gorr is terrific. His acting is terrific and works tremendously well with what little he is given. And that is what's key, how little he is given. Gorr is greatly underutilised. In my opinion, Gorr should have been far more violent and dark than he was, truly juxtaposing the light hearted and virbant nature and colours of our heroes. His backstory is fantastic but is not developed upon enough I believe.Finally, the heroes are great as usual. I think Natalie Portman as Mighty Thor is amazing, and I think that she is used far better than she was originally. Chris Hemsworth once again devilered a good performance as Thor and Tessa Thompson, like Bale, was amazing but underutilised.Overall, this movie tried to hit the same strides as Ragnarok but feel short, which is dissapointing given the potential with Mighty Thor and Gorr as additions to the casta and the overall direction the film good have taken.

title: Absolutely terrible
text: Not sure which demographic this movie is aimed at, normally I love these films but this is absolutely awful, the whole cast just look like they're acting, not once do you feel drawn into the film, the costumes are to perfect and for some reason just look like fancy dress attire, it's like a big glossy mess!Completely unfunny humour which doesn't work, bad direction, terrible script, rubbish cgi and over use of guns and roses.Not sure why all these amazing names signed up to be in this film sure they must be regretting that decision now.Managed to scrape through about 30 mins of it before having to turn it off and put something else on as it was just un watchable!Spielberg this director is NOTI recommend you just avoid it or if you have to watch it then do it only to satisfy yourself how terrible it really is!

title: Yet another Marvel movie
text: Being the 23rd MCU film, not counting the myriad miniseries, it's difficult to find anything exciting about a new entry in the series. L&T seems more like a farewell to the Marvel Universe as it once was, especially since it is likely to be the final "solo" project of any of the original Avengers. It contains a lot of broad humor, some pathos with the villian, a lot of Easter eggs and in-jokes, and some decent set pieces. Unfortunately, it all seems as though everything was included in order to check boxes on a list. What it does, it does well, but there's nothing NEW. (After 23 movies, how can there be?)Christian Bale does well with his sympathetic villian. The scene where he confronts the children is chilling, and the children deserve kudos for their frightened reactions to his performance. It's fun seeing actors like Sam Neill, Matt Damon, and Russel Crowe in their cameo roles. Original Thor movie characters Lady Sif, Darcy Lewis, Heimdall, and Erik Selvig are each nicely included with brief appearances. The soundtrack is suitable for the movie, and led to a brief conversation between my wife and myself whether ABBA would ever open for Guns n' Roses.It is all a lot of fantstic icing on a very small piece of cake. Nothing about the movie is bad, per se, but there isn't anything particularly outstanding either. The days when an audience could expect something original from a MCU film are definitely over.

title: Funny and Empty
text: Has some funny moments, but lacks epicity and doesnt add anything new. You can delete this one and nothing happens to the MCU universe. Christian Bale acting was interesting, but Waititi didnt get his best.

title: Too cheesy
text:
The last Thor movie was great. But this one tried to do the same recipe but jumped the shark.The cheese factor was too much. And a lot felt near cartoony.It picked up near the middle and faltered here and there. But if it wasn't for Christmas Bales performance , and Chris hemsworths name in the credits, O don't think I would have stuck it out.As of late, I think the last marvel thing that was good was the tv show Loki. But a lot if misses in the very thing else. Maybe marvel has run its course.Add for 600 characters
The last Thor movie was great. But this one tried to do the same recipe but jumped the shark.The cheese factor was too much. And a lot felt near cartoony.It picked up near the middle and faltered here and there. But if it wasn't for Christmas Bales performance , and Chris hemsworths name in the credits, O don't think I would have stuck it out.As of late, I think the last marvel thing that was good was the tv show Loki. But a lot if misses in the very thing else. Maybe marvel has run its course.

title: Over the top in silliness
text: While the Thor franchise has been one of my favorite, the latest entry falls flat. I can usually overlook the Woke Agenda when the story is good, this just...wasn't. Love and Thunder has NOTHING that made the other movies great. And Zeus skipping down the stairs?!? Scene after scene of inane drivel. I wish Marvel would get back to telling great stories with legendary characters.

title: Sick of watching the same movie? So am I. Thank you Waititi
text: I had sworn not give a penny more to Marvel/Disney after Multiverse of Madness. Luckily, a movie critic recommended this assuring me that this time it worked.Beautiful colours (and even beautiful when they're not there, eat your heart out Zack Snyder). Such a fun adventure with a cast that keeps it moving but giving it time to more heartfelt scenes.As it happens with a lot of movies that want to target as broad an audience as possible, sometimes the female leads/villains are """empowered""" but through classic male gaze (or even worse, using maternity as the end all be all for motivation). This movie just flows naturally, it cherishes its characters and doesn't make a mockery out of anything, while still poking fun at the genre and the tropes.The music might feel a bit overused, but if you enjoy eighties movies, this might be right up your alley.Mythology nerd? This movie got you covered, with winks here and there.Not completely caught up with the MCU/previous Thor movies? The recap at the beginning is the best one I've seen so far. No two characters giving expository dialogue, it's just performance within a performance.It's an adventure comedy and I'm quite baffled at the amount of negative reviews accusing the movie of... being... too funny? It was such a fun and genuine experience.I just hope other people can see the difference in mediums and watch this movie for what it is and not for what they wish it had been.

title: Enjoyable enough but pretty shallow
text: Firstly, Thor: Love and Thunder is a huge step down from Ragnarok. The jokes continued go get sillier to the detriment of the story.Christian Bale was great as Gorr but was under utilised and felt like he was in the wrong movie. He would have been better served in a 2 hr 20 min deep dive into what it means to be a god and work on a deeper level to challenge thor to think about the duty of the gods to their subjects.None of the events had any real weight and didn't really linger after the conclusion of the movie.This was the best use of Jane Foster and her overall arc for the film was well done and there was a better chemistry between Natalie Portman and Chris Hemsworth this time around.There were some strong visuals, particularly the sequence drained of colour except for the lightning of the weapons and Gorr's eyes.Overall the story had potential for something deeper but most of those moments were played for laughs (some of these worked, others did not). This leaves me losing confidence in the MCU going forward with 4/6 phase 4 movies being at best decent.

title: Wastes all the goodwill established by Ragnarok
text: I gave Ragnarok a 10 and it's one of the only MCU movies I seek out for repeat viewings. It's stylish, hilarious, balanced, and treats the source material with dignity.I saw the trailer for Love and Thunder and immediately wanted to see it opening night, which I rarely do anymore, but thought this warranted a big-screen viewing.Without spoilers, my opinion of what we got is too much silliness and irreverence and poor writing, pacing and plot in the first half of the movie that dampens the very exciting and fun second half.A very important plot point happens in the cold open in a very fast vision, and multiple plot developments happen off camera, yet we get a multiple moments of on-screen gags like Natalie Portman coming up with catch phrases, Stormbreaker being jealous of Mjolnir, the Zeus lightning bolt show from the trailer, and easily ten minutes of goofy flashbacks narrated by Korg that get old really fast. There are times that it apparent that director Waititi just likes the sound of his own voice (as Korg)As for the acting: Christian Bale's Gorr is the only character that works; Natalie Portman looks out of place and amateur trying to be Chris Hemsworth, Tessa Thompson barely gets a line in despite being King of New Asgard, Russell Crowe's Zeus sounds like Borat and made his scenes unwatchable, and Chris Hemsworth goes full himbo Thor.Where Ragnarok felt like a love-note to comics, Love and Thunder felt like everyone involved believes Marvel Comics and the MCU are undignified and something to be mocked.As for content, if you are taking kids be aware that there is a lot of sexually charged dialogue, a scene about orgies and when Chris Hemsworth is disrobed a lot of jokes about the size of his genitalia.

title: Taika Waititi nailed another fun Thor adventure in a stylish action packed sequel.
text: 5 out of 5 stars.Thor: Love and Thunder is an awesome superhero sequel which Taika Waititi brought his style and energetic direction that is fun and action packed.The film has plenty of action sequences throughout. Taking Thor, Valkyrie, and Almighty Thor who is Jane Foster (Natalie Portman) going on a space adventure to stop Gorr the God Butcher (Christian Bale) who is hellbent on killing all gods.The plot is great. It covers theme of finding self purpose, love, and meaning. The film does have a lighthearted theme. Even the opening sequence of showing Gorr and why he became the way he is and his motive for killing all gods was a neat addition of giving some emotional depth to the characters. Same goes for Thor who is trying to discover himself as well when he starts off with some space missions with Guardians of the Galaxy which they were trying to get him to go on his own.The film is fast paced and moves quick from one set piece to another. The visual effects are colorful and awesome. The cast ensemble is great. Christian Bale delivered a great villain performance and stands out compared to other villains with his horrifying and creepy performance.The film does have some fun and dumb humor just like Ragnarok from Taika Waititi script which the actors seemed to be having fun with improvising and adding a little humor every now and then.Michael Giacchino music score is also a great addition to the Thor film as well. The film has two scenes in the mid and post credits which was worth it to see where it can go next.Thor Love and Thunder is a fun action packed adventure that shines and stands out as a 80s rock em up marvel adventure.

title: Bale saved this movie
text:
When the performance of one actor exceeds by far that of the movie it can only make one wonder what could have been if everything else would rise at the same level. Lost opportunity is the only words I can think of.By trying to continue building on the foundation he pored during the previous movie Taika Waititi not only came short but missed also a huge chance of achieving something few have. Instead of trying to repeat a success, to make a new one from scratch on a different level (he is surely capable of)
He tried to contrast humorous characters with serious dark notes in order ro create a funny, then again serious movie and achieved only to reveal the nakedness of mediocracy. Kristian Bale made sure of that.

title: More a parody than comedy
text: Bad jokes nobody laughed in the cinema too. Actors tried to make jokes but it didn't come across at all, in fact it sometimes seemed uncomfortable for them to do. Very messy story line and imagination. Sorry this one was really bad.

title: It's a nice watch that's all
text: I laughed throughout the movie and probably that was part of the problem for me it ain't a terrible movie but it was not a carry on from ragnarok what was a great movie with the right mixed of comedy this one at times felt like a spoof movie.

title: Typical Summer Superhero Action with a Nice Emotional Punch
text: Reviewing this movie is made difficult with the subjective bias against the comedic formula that the screenplay uses incorporating The Guardians of the Galaxy characters for the first half of the movie. The plot unfolds with a slow opening of a tragic survival story and the introduction of a new menace threatening the universe. Then the story uses a juvenile-level narrative flashbacks and adds a romantic dimension along with the threatening menace which by the end of the movie becomes like Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness a strong redeeming climax that helps to greatly lift the overall assessment of the movie. For those unfamiliar with these characters, a number of well-known actors offer up some surprising, disguised performances, perhaps credit to their acting abilities and make-up, except for surprise appearance of Matt Damon (uncredited) whose presence is almost always impossible to disguise. In sum, Thor is an enjoyable, summer romp that does not break any new ground, but Chris Hemsworth makes great use of his light, comedic lines. Mostly tame, off-beat almost overly cute humor along with the typical fantasy action sequences describe this movie, but it is the relational moments that shine.

title: It may as well be a care bear movie
text: This movie was so sugary sweet, I got a cavity. If you want a super silly cartoon of a live action film, then watch this farse of a movie.There are very serious, emotional issues covered in this and they gloss over all of them like a 1970's Saturday morning cartoon. There was a huge opportunity missed to have incredible emotionally riveting character development and story telling. The only silver lining is Christian Bale's performance. His character was the only one that I felt anything for. I really felt his pain and struggle. I didn't feel it with Thor, Jane Foster or the others. I definitely didn't need to WOKE references either.Even the 80's heavy metal soundtrack couldn't help.

title: Loved every minute of it.
text: I'm a constant fan of superhero universes and I always go to watch what's new but with hugely varying degrees of satisfaction. This was right up my alley. Not chaotic as we have come to expect lately form superhero movies, but a good script. A solid storyline with excellent jokes and equivalent performances. I'd watch it again. And that's saying something.

title: Boring. Bland. Bad.
text: Snooze fest. Very few moments which were kinda good. Silly one liners ruining the flow. Some visuals were wonderful in bits and pieces but most of it bland. And they dont even know what to show and what not to show in the trailers. Literally spoiled one of the main moments in the film. The marvel universe is getting bigger but I kinda feel they are losing the plot. No content. Nothing. I camt believe it is the same director who directed ragnarok. Huge disappointment. Would have loved to see more of meik. Lady Sif is a joke in thor universe. Gods are weaker and out of context. Everything is out at the mercy of Gor. He is better than all of you. Huge let down.

title: Enjoyable, never bored
text: I felt movie was so good. With lots of fun and i didn't get distracted at any point. Went to watch without any expectations. Came out with more satisfaction than spiderman no way home and doctor strange Multiverse of madness.

title: Feels like a Family Guy parody of Thor
text: A fun and enjoyable romp for Thor, Jane, and Valkyrie. Gorr had a decent arc, too. But it felt like the creative reins had been significantly loosened on Waititi since Thor: Ragnarok. This is a lot less serious than the other MCU movies we've had, and not quite as cohesive a story as before. Throwaway two-hour movie that doesn't make you think, and doesn't command your undivided attention.

title: Great Film manifesting Peace in the World.
text: Another great super-powerful film - with the profound message that if we all work together, we can manifest World Peace super-fast :)This of course also applies to healing the world on a physical level - as indicated in this fine story of heroism and love - such as finding a cure to cancer, which I'm sure we will, if resources and scientific research are channeled properly and all of us billions of people work with solidarity, empathy and love.NB: As the new leader of the Russian Federation, I will do everything in my power to finally end this dreadful war, by restoring diplomacy and dialogue with our neighbors in Ukraine - so that we can commence with the withdrawal of our troops from Ukrainian territory and start Peace Talks.Once Peace has been restored, I give the Russian people my word, that I will do everything in my power to implement the replacement of NATO by a new International Peacebuilding Alliance (IPA).In the IPA, the top priority will be Peace and Nuclear Disarmament, where both Russia and the US will be instrumental to manifest the Universal Declaration of Human Rights (UDHR) and the UN Convention on the Rights of the Child (UNCRC) in the International Community.We would like to emphasize that we are expecting the United Kingdom, Russia and the United States to fall in line with this new International Peacebuilding Policy :)

title: I liked it
text: Love and Thunder was not as strong as Ragnarok but I found it entertaining. The film had a somewhat good dose of humour. I loved the funny awkwardness created with Thor and Stormbreaker and the screaming goats were funny. Chris Hemsworth was born to play Thor and does well in carrying this film. It was great to see Jane Foster (Natalie Portman) play a hero figure who was equal to Thor but with a sad twist. It was the most serious film in the Thor film series with Jane having cancer and the death of the villain's daughter at the start of the film. I felt they could added a bit more humour, used the Guardians of the Galaxy more and perhaps Zeus and the gods could have teamed up to fight Gorr. I was not impressed with the black and white fight scene on the planet that looked like the Moon. This was far better than Doctor Strange which was disappointing and it had a great soundtrack. Overall not all bad.

title: Definitely the worst THOR movie made so far!
text: Definitely the worst THOR movie made so far!I have seen all the prior THOR movies and enjoyed them all (some more than others but at least the prior ones were entertaining)----but this one was a complete disaster. An incredibly extra cheesy bubble gum movie that really comes off more like a movie for small kids along the lines of Buzz Lightyear--and is nothing like the prior enjoyable THOR movies.

title: Best in all Thor movie
text: This's the best of all 4 Thor movies. I don't know why people don't appreciate it.It's smooth, it has action, it tells a great story, it has bale as the villain, it has a great ending, for every character in it. What else you can expect? I'm so touched by the little girl, happy for her. Such an unexpected twist in the end, yet make sense.

title: This was a movie.
text: I find it hard to rate Love and Thunder. As a movie, it was mostly entertaining. Thor felt like a kids' movie that used the the s-word more times than acceptable to make it PG and the goats...the goats really made it feel like a kids movie. I'd rate it a 7/10 as a family movie.As another entry into the MCU, I'm giving it a 5/10. Mighty Thor/Dr. Jane Foster's storyline was fine if not too rushed to make me feel anything. The intent was there without any of the follow through which is a statement that could be used to describe most MCU movies being made now. This movie is just another cog in Disney's movie manufacturing company. The market is over saturated with too similar superhero movies and it's been showing for some years now.

title: Christian Bale is great in this
text: -It was great seeing aging Natalie Portman in this. She shows a more vulnerable side of herself in this movie which was great.

title: doesn't beat ragnarok but still fun
text: Marvel is starting to give their directors more freedom when making these films, because with out context you can tell that this movie was directed by Taika Waititi. This movie is visually stunning, it can be bright and colorful at times but also dark when it needs to be.Christian Bale does an amazing performance as Gorr the god butcher, I wish he had more screen time because we only see him kill one god, and I was hoping that he would kill a lot more.Not all the jokes in the movie land for me some were kind of annoying but it was only a few.Fun film if you like Taika Waititi's style of directing then you will probably like this movie. 7.5/10.

title: Loved it!
text: The characters and cinematics were amazing! I can't wait to watch it again! It had me laughing and crying.Really fun film and exactly what I was expecting for Thor 4. So many easter eggs!! I highly recommend watching a few breakdown videos. Very excited for what's to come!!

title: Best of Guns N Roses?
text: Further evidence of the quantity over quality policy currently adopted by Disney for most of the franchise brands they now own. Since 'End Game' with the exception of Spider-Man we mostly have been subjected to quite poor MCU outings whether on the big screen or TV and Thor 4 is no exception.Thor 4 tells the story of a god killer seeking revenge on all gods due to enlightenment that his own god never really cared for him. Thor seeks to prevent this and you can probably guess the rest.Whilst the overall story is is fine and could have resulted in a fine movie, it's executed rather poorly here. Having thought about it somewhat I think it boils down to poor writing. The prologue which sets the scene for the bad guy is ridiculous and lazy. The script leans heavily on the humour throughout and only some of it lands. The character of Thor which started out as a fish out of water, has transformed to full on Michael Scott. And whilst the movie does deal with some serious and weighty issues theres never any emotional turmoil for the viewer. It just is what it is and the movie suffers as it progresses because of this.Performances overall are particularly lacking and dare i say it a very lacklustre performance by Natalie Portman as Jane Foster. The casting of Russel Crowe as Zeus was interesting, but his mock generic european 'Greek' accent was frankly bizarre and off-putting. Christian Bale will be highly disappointed that this is the MCU movie he took on.Axel Rose will be happy with the movie as the soundtrack was basically a best of Guns N Roses and he also gets name checked by a character who insists that he's called Axel for literally no reason whatsoever.To conclude, it is watchable and somewhat entertaining in that huge big budget superhero way we've come to expect but this is comfortably the worst MCU movie to date.

title: Awful crap
text: Forced jokes, zero chemistry between thor and jane, seemed like a movie written by kindergartners! Longest two hours of my life, marvel lost its superpowers.

title: This is worthwhile addition to the super hero genre that's a must see for fans of the Marvel Universe
text: Thor: Love and Thunder (2022) is a movie my wife and I caught in theaters last night. The storyline follows Thor post Thanos searching for meaning. Meanwhile Jane Foster, his one true love, is back on Earth, dying. In her research she discovers Thor's hammer has healing effects and she tracks down his shattered hammer. The hammer, recognizing Jane, rejoins and turns her into a female Thor. When a God killer emerges in the galaxy destroying worlds and religions everywhere what better to stop it than two Thors?This movie is directed by Taika Waititi (Jojo Rabbit) and stars Chris Hemsworth (Snow White and the Huntsman), Natalie Portman (The Professional), Christian Bale (American Psycho), Tessa Thompson (Creed) and Russell Crowe (Gladiator).I'm not sure what I liked better, the legendary GNR soundtrack or the screaming goats...both stole the show. There's very little not to love about this film. The cast is well selected and Bale's villain is perfect in every way (cause, attire, makeup, etc). The special effects, CGI and cinematography are all classic Marvel and tremendous creating wonderful environments, characters and action scenes. The Guardians of the Galaxy opening was a perfect way to kick the movie off and the dialogue throughout is spot on and hilarious. There's also some memorable cameos sprinkled in here and there and they did a pretty good job with pacing as the storyline unfolds well and doesn't feel drawn out like a lot of super hero movies recently.Overall this is worthwhile addition to the super hero genre that's a must see for fans of the Marvel Universe. I would score this a solid 7.5/10 and strongly recommend it.

title: Was this supposed to be a joke ?
text: I was very confused, as I thought a, watching a marvel movie full of drama and action, instead I was watching a comedy, I mean it was fun and entertaining, but the whole movie was a joke. Taiki did a fine job with the pervious Thor movie, but for this was, he must have been drunk, and Disney needed to release the movie to meet a deadline and make some extra $$$. All characters were funny except for Christian Bale' character of course. I think all those big actors they either were desperate for a role, or must have owed Taiki a favor, else they wouldn't have been in this film. The movie was funny and entertaining all the way, that you would expect a funny happy ending, instead, you get a rather sad and dark ending.

title: Horrible and I love Marvel
text: I may be done with the Marvel cinematic universe.The whole movie just felt like a joke. It was more like one of those cheap thrown together spoff movies that Hollywood pumps out to make fun of other film franchises. Even the serious parts felt campy and like a bad comedy.Compared to prior MCU there is constant language which was never really present in prior movies over the last year.Talk of group orgies. Also new.Nudity. New.Constant and over used "inclusion". Largely new.

title: Enjoyable but they made it too casual
text: I am a really big fan of Thor. No doubt thor ragnarok was just awesome and it blew my mind. This movie has good action sequences but they focused more on love than thunder. Thor is all about thunder. And I think that all the limelight was on Jane. Chris hemsworth as usual played thor really well and so did Natalie portman. Christian bale really did a marvelous job. So the acting was good. I think this is a movie which you should watch at home. At the cinema you will feel that not the typical thor movie. So this is a casual movie which you can watch by yourself on a rainy day. I didn't like the ending because they made it alittle tragic but an okay movie after all. I think its better than the first and second part of Thor. But everyone has their own opinions.

title: Thor: dumb and dumber
text: Not the best of the Marvel's Movie...without Christian bale the movie is a joke..he carried the whole movie. No big fight scenes..post credit scenes meeeeeh. If your children crying a lot just take them to the movie so you can have your 2 hours without stress.

title: Fun romp
text: It was a fun ride. CGI is pretty good, story straightforward, action rather ok. Nothing especially ambitious which means it's a shame that Christian Bale was wasted on this. Won't satisfy Marvel edgelords, but if you're not one, it's not a time fully wasted. Movie doesn't treat itself seriously so the humor exists but doesn't necessarily land. It has a good pace.

title: What a disappointment
text: Poor taste! Many expletives, inappropriate contact for children AND youth. Bad comedy and writing ruined this Marvel movie. The only good thing about this movie was Christian Bale as the bad guy. What a way to continue to ruin a character like Thor. Will not EVER buy or watch this one again.

title: A roller-coaster of emotions
text: It is a, by far the most WTF movie I've seen so far. Not surprisingly though since it's Taika and his funny and twisted way of telling and mashing up stories together. Even though I love all the Thor adaptations, this part is the furthest thing from the original Thor movie, and it's still great. This movie made me laugh my buttocks off, get excited, cry out loud and question my whole life and knowledge of the Norse myths. Not liking Russell Crowe much before this movie I was also impressed with his acting since it was something I've never seen him do before. He is actually hilarious. I am not really keen on the cancer story and it was hard to watch that part since a lot of my loved ones were sick or died of cancer but I love the moral of the story. It was a meaningful and fun piece with a lot of soul and charisma... And a lot of love and thunder. I will definitely watch it again.

title: Marvel is losing its mojo.
text: The first four phases of the MCU seemed very strategically and often brilliantly developed, devised, and directed into a cohesive whole. But now, between "Dr. Strange and the Multiverse of Madness" and this mess of a movie, it seems like producers and writers are simply throwing ideas against the wall to see what sticks. And what stuck kind of stinks. Thor has become like Ross on Friends: He started out cool and interesting, but the writers have turned him into a total goofball. Thor's humor is great, but not when goofiness becomes his chief defining characteristic. The basic plot had potential, but the development of it is mostly ridiculous. To avoid spoilers, I'll simply say that some of the new gods introduced in this film left me scratching my head. The backstory that is included about Thor and Jane is poorly conceived and lacks any compelling substance. While the woke content in this film is relatively minor, what little there is feels entirely inorganic, like it was forced into the film in order to appease political activists. And, while there is a never-ending barrage of jokes in the film, very few of them are very funny. There was very little laughter in a rather-full theater (especially after the first 20 minutes or so). The film still features beloved characters, and the action sequences are good, so 5 stars.

title: Absolutely great!
text: Haha, loved it, all these carcases of humans hating on it just take themselves too seriously and fuel their ego by jumping on the snowflake train that has been going around the world for several years now.The movie is a great interpretation by the director and I loved every second of it. Haven't laught with so much appetite in a long time!

title: Upset
text: You know, I paid a lot of attention to this film since its announcement, but what I found was that it was different from what I expected. The plot is somehow not that exciting and boring, you know thor is funny, but too much comedy makes you sick. The story that is presented is also not very interesting. I was looking forward to the big fight of Gorr and Thor, but that's all I got. I gave 8 points only because he is Thor, but for the whole story it is 7.

title: Thankful for Waititi's departure after this...
text: I went into this movie hopeful, but was left disappointed. This movie starts out strong with an introduction to Gorr and his daughter. It's a good, simple set-up for his tragic motivation as the villain. There's tension and emotion. Unfortunately from here, Waititi takes every opportunity to undercut any tension or drama from every scene. He saw that his trademark silly humor worked for Ragnarok and he dialed it up to 11 for Love and Thunder - to the detriment of the entire movie. Gorr kidnaps a large group of children from New Asgard, and considering the magnitute of this act, Thor and Valkyrie coming off as entirely unphased and jokey about the situation absolutely destroys any sense of urgency or consequence that should be present. And despite the potential Bale had as Gorr, he comes and goes and is entirely wasted instead of remaining a lurking threat among the MCU. Despite losing a significant Thor character by the end of the film as well, that outcome is predictable at every turn and the plot as a whole seems totally inconsequential in the long run. While Ragnarok was able to portray some weight to the loss of significant characters, Love and Thunder can't take itself seriously for even a moment. The visuals, while very much the kind of over-the-top comic book visual style I enjoy, come off as significantly cheaper than it's predecessors. The green-screen is horrendous and the CGI characters and creatures stick out sorely as if they were made 10 years ago. The action and wirework is much sloppier and obvious this time around. The only graphically stand-out moment is a brief battle sequence in black & white.The last gripe I have - and this is insignificant and personal - is the use of Guns N Roses in the soundtrack that completely ruins some of the more exciting moments. God I hate that band.All-in-all, this was not a good Thor movie. It wasn't a good Marvel movie, and it wasn't a good movie in general. This movie made me want to go back to Dark World just to clense the acid-trip color palette from my mind. Unless you have kids, or have the cognitive functions of a (12 year old or younger ) yourself, I see little reason anybody would come back to this movie for a second viewing.

title: Very bad and disappointing
text: It's so unserious made and it's like a kid shoo ! So disappointed from Marvel studious ! Previous Thor movies was so much better! This is absolute disaster! Even the movie makers didn't know some obvious facts such as Astrid is a girl name not boys! Many mistakes in plots! Waste of money, time and energy!one of the worse movies from Marvel studios! I had so much more expectations from Thor movies to be serious enough not a big joke! I would give zero out of 10 but unfortunately the lowest point I can give in rating is one! As an adult I expect the adult show not a kid show as a marvel fan ! I am so disappointed!

title: It was pretty great.
text: I think this movie was pretty good. I really liked the pacing, and the jokes were not too much at least for me. I liked the characters and the setting, and I think the story was interesting. I also liked the ending, but I think it could have been a bit longer. Overall, I would recommend this movie to people who like comedies.

title: So marvel is a children show now?
text: What happened? Why everything has to be so childish? They are ruining marvel shows. That love theme sucks. Felt like a teenage comedy movie.Please hire good writers.

title: I feel like I literally watched a different film to these other reviews!
text: My first ever review on here and feel compelled to let people know all these wannabe armchair critics are insane! I literally laughed so much during this film, I absolutely loved it and thought it was another amazing marvel film and one of the best recent ones. Certainly better than Dr Strange. No idea why any marvel than would dislike this film.

title: No better than Thor 2 & 3 for sure.
text: I was not expecting this type of juvenile humor. I hoped the action would be serious and nicely done but no. Too much comedy in this, what happened? So we need to change this to make the phase 4 better going forward.

title: Where This Era of Cinema Is At
text: Thor Love and Thunder is probably the biggest Marvel disappointment of them all, and yet again Disney is at the helm of squandering creativity and adventure for bloated CGI, mindless world building, and terrible quippy dialogue.There's not much of a movie to discuss here, but I'll say that engrossing entertainment on the big screen began to dwindle when Disney took over Marvel and Star Wars. Remember what it was like to walk out of a theater beaming with delight over a memorable film? Embrace the nostalgia because that feeling will never present itself in films like this.What a mess, Disney.

title: Didn't stand the expectations
text: I was so exited after watching the trailer. But after start watching I was like something is missing, maybe it'll get better sometime, later. But alas this movie also disappoint me like doctor stranger. Without strong story only VFX can't save a film the last few marvel movie is the proof. I so sorry to say but being a marvel fan I'm very disappoint.

title: unexpectedly Great
text: After the multiverse of madness, I didn't expect much from this movie, but daym, it was an amazing movie with decent story and magnificent visuals, if u liked ragnarok u will enjoy this one.

title: It's All a Big Joke
text: This is my first review. This movie was utterly awful. The pacing. The tone. The filming. The writing! The overuse of Guns N Roses. I couldn't take anything serious. The only relief was the action scenes or when Christian Bale was on screen. This actually felt like a high level executive gave their child a chance to write the script. Or a group of children.So many inconsistencies and there was a lack of feeling. I like the humour in MCU movies typically, but not when it is ramped up to 3000 here.

title: Have to appreciate Taika Waititi humor
text: I thought it was hilarious, but I also love Ragnarok and most of Taika Waititi's shows and movies. Go in expecting a very silly movie and maybe you won't be disappointed like most of the folks I've asked.

title: Walked out
text: This is the first Marvel movie I have walked out on. I just couldn't stand the continuous flat jokes that really seemed pretty juvenile. The script was terrible. I think I hung in there for about 45 minutes, but was so disappointed that I had to leave. Right after Zeus shows up at the God gathering.Bale's performance seemed to be good from what I saw. Neat seeing the stage actors again. But, that's it. No real stakes from what I saw, nothing about the Mjolnir vs. Stormbreaker thing even made sense, no emotional connection to characters...About $25 with the typical popcorn and soda right down the tubes.I really enjoyed all of their movies, enough to see them multiple times at the theater. Sadly, this film was the first film of any genre that I have bailed on in over 30 years. And I'm pretty sure that I won't bother finishing watching it when it's out on Disney+.

title: Not BAD, but...too "Disney"
text: 6.4/10. There were a lot of good moments and the movie is nice, but I felt it was geared too much towards 7-10 year olds. I felt like I am watching a Disney movie about a prince saving princess and the Worlds. There was not enough umph for adults. Some funny moments, a few cool cheesy fights, but felt lacking a bit in all of those. Don't get me wrong, it wasn't BAD, but wasn't as good as all previous ones.A side note would be about the 3D version which is what I watched. It was so "bland". If you are releasing a 3D movie and you know colors will not be as vibrant, why not crank it up a few notches for the 3d version, so that when you wear glasses it would show up at least somewhat colorful?!? Just common sense, no?As another side note, and this is just a personal opinion, the screaming goats maybe was not the brightest idea. AVX Dolby in theaters it was noise piercingly loud, I saw A LOT of people covering their ears. It was not a pleasant sound at all, and while it was sort of the idea, it was just TOO LOUD.

title: How to ruin a great franchise...
text: Taika Waititi took the legacy of the Marvel franchise from Stan Lee that was FANTASTIC, and basically **** all over it. Worst MCU film by a long shot. And the only movie that I will refuse to buy to add to my collection of every other MCU movie.It was a given as a blockbuster - with the amazing weight of the prior movies behind it and the cast of good actors, you'd think it impossible to ruin. But no, he did the Disney 'Kidification' to it.Good core story line bones but made trite and weak by no storyline depth, broken continuity of disconnected movie phases they didn't connect and were hugely different - from comedy to DC-like dark action and back, and NON STOP attempts at comedy lines in EVERY piece of dialogue! Marvel stories just don't need or want that. Occasional, yes. But not every piece of dialogue should be a setup and delivery of attempted gags.The main actors should be ashamed that they sold themselves out for the money on this movie, and lack of integrity to the franchise values.And Disney took what should have been great action for older children and teens (and us adults who grew up with it) to try and appeal to the mass young children. Who may like it now, but this movie will have no longevity, as it's exactly that - a movie you may like as a young kid, but would be embarrassed to own up to and ever watch again as a teen or adult.Needs a remake by someone like Peter Jackson who crushed the LotR and Hobbit movies.

title: A fun movie that lacked focus.
text: As someone who has not read the comics these superhero movies are based on, it's interesting how I picked up plot points from some of the recent comic arcs prior to their cinematic debut. Case in point, I knew for a while that Jane Foster (Natalie Portman) became Thor for a while for medical reasons. In Thor: Love and Thunder (2022), this somewhat recent plot line from the comics combines with the modus operandi of Phase 4 of the MCU: wrapping up the loose ends from Phase 3 of the MCU.Doing a victory lap after his well-received Thor: Ragnarok (2017), Taika Waititi still brought his trademark comedic sensibilities to this movie but seemed to falter a bit with the much heavier themes of the God Killer (Christian Bale). In fact, I was expecting a bit more out of Bale, considering how dedicated he is to his roles. Don't get me wrong-there were still a bunch of really great action sequences in this movie, and the revelation of a council of gods is a profound theological can of worms that I'm sure will come into play in future films.The real problem with this movie was its lack of focus. Sure, it tied up the Jane Foster storyline from the first two Thor movies, but the only thing it really set up was a potential addition to the "Young Avengers" that Marvel keeps hinting at but not confirming is coming. Without knowing what this enormous Phase 4 of the MCU is headed toward, it's difficult to justify movies like this. Still, Love and Thunder was a fun action comedy to turn your brain off to for a few hours.A fun movie that lacked focus, I give Thor: Love and Thunder 3.5 stars out of 5.

title: Satisfying watch
text: Love and Thunder is good but still somewhat lacking. The flow is awkward and the editing seems disheveled. The funny lines are bland jokes and don't really add substantial humor to the conversations. The special effects are dull, but the camerawork and the color is actually rather great.The characters were hit or miss. Thor is now portrayed as a moron and does not seem like his usual character from his many other appearances in Marvel movies. That said, Chris Hemsworth does deliver a fantastic performance and his comedic timing is always excellent. Unfortunately, it is not enough to redeem the film. Zeus was not as exciting as he could have been. Jane Foster had decent chemistry with Thor, but her backstory is shallow. Gorr, played by Christian Bale, was a good surprise and was quite unsettling as an antagonist. It is too bad he wasn't in more scenes, so he didn't seem that ominous.Overall though, the action was superb and the final conclusion was satisfying to watch.

title: The reviews here are true
text: It really is boring and I am scoring it a 4 more out of nostalgia and a few average moments.Maybe MCU is a becoming a victim of its own success, Phase 4 as they're calling it sure seems to be. If you were disappointed by Dr. Strange you'd be disappointed by this as well.They're doing a few formulaic things in every movie that only work the first time - you cannot keep squeezing the same lime forever - that one's out of juice and getting stale.Also, don't show heroes enjoying violence or taking it lightly.

title: Taika sprinkles his magic ....
text: This film is pure Taika - if you don't like his sense of humour, you won't like this film.But for us, it was absolutely perfect. Probably our favourite of the Thor series, and thoroughly enjoyable all the way. Excellent use of GnR too.

title: The villain saves the day
text: Normally i love Marvel, and their shenannigans, but this felt like a movie trying to be a Cartoon. There was a lot of cringy moments, but i'll give credit to the villain of the movie, which i wish had a little more depth. The outcome of the movie would have been better, had the rest of the movie been as Well written as the villain.The movie rushed through the seriousness of the state of the co-protagonist, which lost a lot of character for that. Everytime it Got serious, they brushed if off with sitcom-like jokes, which broke the illusion of what was at stake. I hope for the future of Thor in the MCU, that they dare be serious when needed.

title: Thor: cringe and cringer
text: Oh lord, what is happening to marvel movies in 2022?This movie was a dire attempt at entertainment.After the first 10-15 minutes I was expecting a scene where someone wakes up from a very bad and comically acted lucid dream, but they never did.It was like pantomime acting or reality TV acting. It reminds me of those awful infomercials at 3am. Imagine that but it's 2 hours long and they butcher the characters that you have watched for over a decade.What on earth was Taika thinking, he's better than this. Did he really just think "Ragnarok, but more Ragnarokky?"

title: Hilarious
text: It's very funny. Sometimes, to the point of being overly silly. Good villain that's not just a copy of the hero. I hope they release an extended version with a lot of the cut stuff.

title: Worst MCU film so far
text: Lots of reviews describing this as "a joke of a film", but doesn't a joke have to be funny?This tries to dial up the slapstick humour to 11 and fails miserably with just about every misguided attempt to crack a joke. And it's constant.Thor was the movie that introduced me to the MCU, and this has nothing to do with that film. This is just a bad parody of a fantastic movie.The one bit it does do well is the villain: Christian Bale's dark and menacing presence is so well done, but his scenes feel so out of place. It'd be like having Clarice interview Hannibal in the middle of Naked Gun 33 1/3The MCU has definitely been on a downhill slope since Endgame, but this feels like the actual end now.

title: Another Entry on the List of Mediocre Phase 4 Movies
text: Thor Love and Thunder is the latest Thor movie, as well as the latest Phase 4 MCU film. As far as the Thor movies are concerned there hasn't been one I flat out dislike. I enjoy the first movie. Dark World is okay. Everyone hates that one, but it had some hype moments for me, and I was never truly bored in it. RagnarÃ¶k is one of my favorite MCU movies. So, I was somewhat excited for this as it has the same director attached. Although, my excitement dwindled after seeing Dr. Strange 2 and seeing the reviews for this film. I personally have found Phase 4 quite disappointing. The only entries I think have actually been good are Spiderman No Way Home and Falcon and the Winter Soldier. Everything else has ranged from okay to incredibly subpar. Dr. Strange 2 especially has been one of the most disappointing MCU films for me. This movie, unfortunately kind of follows suit on that trend.I will say that I was never bored in this film. Other films like Dr. Strange 2, Black Widow, and Shang-Chi gat pretty boring in places. This film is fun on a dumb action movie level, so it has that over other Phase 4 entries even though it probably is on par with them on a quality standpoint. There first twenty minutes of this movie in particular were really strong. I was always entertained, though that's more to do with the actors than the writing. Chris Hemsworth is such a charismatic actor that you love to watch even when he's given garbage scripts. I really like the villain here. I love his design, and Christian Bale, as always gives a good performance. I found myself sympathizing with him a bit, which is more than I can say for most MCU villains. The film, like RagnarÃ¶k, is beautiful to look at.Many people hate Jane as a new Thor, but I didn't mind too much. Jane as a female Thor did not surprise me, as I know of her from the comics. This is actually the most I've ever like Jane in these movies. In the first two she was just the token love interest character, especially in Dark World. Here she's given much more to do and is given a sympathetic arc of her own. She also didn't outright steal the show away from Thor, which is what I was afraid of happening. I will also say, the film's ending surprised me. I did not think it would end that way, especially since the MCU has been becoming more woke these days.On to the negatives now. The other gods featured here are terrible. Zeus and the Greek gods are a complete joke. I'm a Russel Crowe fan, but he's awful here. This is his worst performance that I've seen from him. You know you screwed up when the Percy Jackson movies did the Greek gods more justice.Also, just like in Dark World, the humor is very hit or miss. RagnarÃ¶k had this problem to an extent, but the jokes in that were more hit than miss for me. Plus, you had Loki or the Hulk for Thor to work off of. You don't have that here. You have the Guardians of the Galaxy, but they're not in the movie nearly as much as the trailers led you to believe. Much of the humor fell flat for me here.Overall, Love and Thunder is harmless fun. It will entertain you while you're watching it, but it certainly is not one of the more memorable MCU movies. I'd say it's on par with Dark World. Sadly, much like a lot of Phase 4, this film feels very much like a throwaway entry. The only MCU movies (and show) that has felt impactful in terms of the whole MCU are Falcon and the Winter Soldier, No Way Home, and Eternals. Everything else has felt very much like filler.

title: Deeply disappointing
text: As this series goes on, it leaves the idea of nobility behind and makes the cast a bunch of rambling fools in search of a quest. The first Thor film may have been over-serious, but it pulled at the character in different ways and gave it depth; Thor had a genuine soul. This one reduces the character to a running joke about incompetence in anything but fighting - it's as if Marvel (Disney) made the series for a younger and younger audience each go round. All the characters are slight and one-note, the is plot thin and moves fast but randomly, like a drunk on a country road. It's such a shame - the original was about family, trust and honor - there's absolutely nothing honorable here. It just feels like a quick cash grab.

title: It's cheesy, awkward, cheap and I love it.
text: Thor Love and Thunder is parody of itself. I like this film for the same reasons you hate it. It is not basic marvel movie beacuse it is not even a marvel movie. It contains lousy writing that is effective, terrible jokes that are humorous, and an empty story that makes me fulfilled.

title: Was hoping fur Ragnarok but was Ragnanot?!
text: Far too many jokes which were repetitive and drawn out. Ragnarok had a good balance of Taiki Waititi and the MCU but this felt like it was trying to hard to be a Taiki film.If anyone had seen the Daryl shorts it felt like an extended version of those in parts.

title: Awful
text: I was a big Thor fan as a kid in the 70s. He's a buffoon in this movie. They made this franchise into a comedy. Very disappointed. If I watched this back when I was a kid, I wouldve cried.The writers of the movie should sit down ad watch all the '60s cartoons to get a grasp of the character "Thor". Maybe then, they'll get it.

title: Perfection
text: Funny with great music. Solid storyline. Like all Thor movies .. outstanding. Best Superhero flick this year. A must see. Check it out for sure. Saw it in a packed theater on opening night.

title: Good.
text: Good as long as you are not comparing with Thor Ragnarok. Visuals are great, performance of lead characters are great. Thor love and thunder is for those audience who looking two hours fun.

title: This is so wrong
text: What the Phuket Thailand did they DO TO THOR?!?!Note to self: when the trailer is mediocre, the movie HAS to be bad.No exception here. Poor Christian Bale. The only real acting.Please, save your money.

title: Love & thunder
text: I'm a huge fan of Marvel & i hardly ever have anything bad to say about the MCU, but this was a letdown, i reckon. "Ragnarok" Was easily one of my top Fav marvel films, so was very excited to see this one, but this wasn't gone into that Potential, in my Opinion.

title: What they say about Too much of a good thing??
text: Or, how about the more the sugar, the bigger the sugar crash. Besides another killer soundtrack with this Marvel flick paying an awesome tribute to Guns n Roses, L&T also displays uber-fantastic FX. So what went wrong? L&T intersperses too much silly unnecessary comedy , some of which flat , tired and not funny and too little action. However, when the action arrives , L&T delivers just fine. Unlike its predecessor Ragnarok which perfectly blended great action, FX and comedy , L&D ODs on attempted humor and gets lost while leaving the viewer begging for the stuff that made this particular franchise food of the gods. Disappointed and left empty. To footnote, Christian Bale's performance, per usual, is definitely a major plus!

title: Worst Marvel Movie after Black Widow
text: Save your money guys. Don't go on cinemas to watch this pile of garbage. It's filled with lame jokes and Russel crowe's Zeus is laughable. The movie only comes alive in last ten minutes and even Christian Bale is not able to save this movie.

title: Thor, yep that's my kind of superhero!
text:
Probably the most entertained I've been with any of the Marvel movies. Everything worked for me, each character, even the villain, was super in their own role. Christian Bale was brilliant and wowzers for Natalie Portman! But man, Chris Hemsworth is so dope, I hope he nevers leave the Thor Universe while I'm alive to watch it...we'll done to the
King too! The comedic direction was 100 percent better than it has been for any of the marvel movies in my opinion, and Chris Hemsworth just hammers it with every line. It doesn't always have to be smashing, lasers and cgi to have substance so I enjoyed all the laughs.

title: Fairly entertaining !
text: As a neutral, I have enjoyed the movie but felt the action sequences were very underwhelming and predictable. However, Chris Hemsworth's performance really carried this movie with some fine humour in a emotionally charge display. Beside this, Christian Bale and Natalie Portman have both nailed their respective roles and made this movie lightening thrilling.

title: Comedy?
text: Wow.This is the abyss.The final nail in the coffin of the MCU franchise.This movie is merely a slapstick comedy version of a totall unimaganitive MCU story.I thought it could not get much worse after "Wanda Vision" and the "Dr. Strange: Multiverse of Madness" but Disney managed to drop the ball, yet again.Everything they touch appears to turn into a gigantic heap of smoking turds.Please, do not waste time nor money to watch this abomination of a movie...unless you want to see Thor's naked backside.What a colossal disappointment.Gosh, I am SO GLAD I cancelled my Disney+ subscription for 2023.

title: Ooooh... Sweet Goat of Mine!
text: I loved this movie! It was the right blend of comedy and action. I appreciated the acting throughout. Most Marvel movies are thin on plot except Logan and a few others, but they are still entertaining. The plot is thin but the action, comedy and acting carry the movie. I did not watch the last movie in the Doctor Strange franchise all the way through. It was not simply not interesting and hard to follow. Thor Love and Thunder kept my attention through the entire movie. It did not feel long because it was very entertaining.Don't believe all of the bad ratings. Enjoy this movie for the entertainment value which is very high! This was a great addition to the Thor franchise.

title: DISNEY RUINS ANOTHER FRANCHISE!!!
text: Just saw THOR LOVE AND THUNDER at a $5 bargain matinee showing and trust me it wasn't worth the money or the time. One of the worst movies ever made! Boring, silly and stupid turning beloved heroes into idiots! The GUARDIANS OF THE GALAXY were lucky they were out after ten minutes but we in the audience had to set through another hour and fifty minutes of this dribble! You have been warned!!!

title: Not bad, but not great either
text: I have given this a 7 because i have always loved Thor and there are some good elements; Gorr is menacingly scary, Korg is funny as ever and there are some beautiful visual effects. Sadly there are lots of things that if changed could have made this the best Thor movie yet.Firstly the jokes; some were on point, like the banter between Thor and Star-lord, but i think we could have all done without Beer being poured over Stormbreaker and those damn Goats. Taiki does realise we're not in 2012 anymore right?Then there's the plot holes and some are pretty big. The biggest; Gorr baiting Thor to a trap by kidnapping kids, when he believes all Gods are selfish. Great logic there Taiki.Lastly and most unforgivably, both the Guardians of the Galaxy and Gorr are both massively underused. The GOTG are widely loved and provide funnier humour than Thor, especially when together and Gorr was played so well by Bale. We really should have seen him butchering Gods, otherwise he just looks menacing but there's no context.If this movie had have been made more darker, like The Batman, and focussed on Gorr, it could have been fantastic and if the GOTG were in more of the film it could have been hilarious. Unfortunately as it is, it's simply mediocore. Lets hope Taiki doesn't ruin and more movies, Star Wars is bae for me, Waititi, i'm watching you.

title: Too many empty holes to fill
text: Sadly Bale's great skills wasted in such a way. His part is done fairly enough. Though i believe some must have scenes from Portman's are not included in this movie.

title: Good and average
text: I thought there where some good parts and mainly just average parts. Thor 3 was definitely the best Thor by far. I Think the script was not very good and the actors weren't to blame. I love Chris Hemsworth. Without Chris this movie would be a 5/10. The fight scenes where also very boring and not enough action in them.

title: This is a successful experiment
text: This movie tries to answer what would happen if we put Homer's Simpson Brain in Thor, and the result is pretty accurate. Here we see a version of the God of Thunder that makes mistakes everywhere he goes, he destroys things he's trying to save, and is so stupid even Star Lord has to explain things to him.Bale's performance is pretty good though. It's pretty evident he's giving a solid performance, not only because he's trying, but also because all the other characters are a joke, so the actors don't even have the opportunity to display their skills.Bale's character is the only one with an interesting development and his motives are easy to emphasize with. We can't say the same about the other characters, returning characters are a mere carcase of what they used to be, and the new ones are there just to make fun of them.

title: Fun movie ignore the bad reviews
text: Really enjoyed it. Not sure why it's getting so many mixed reviews. Good balance between humor and almost horror like at times. Only complaint is I didn't want it to end. 1 hour 50 minutes is too short!

title: Hmmmmm... Not quite what I wanted.
text: My whole score goes to Christian Bale who I feel was very good, but let down by a very kiddie film. I like some jokes, but there was just too many, and a lot weren't that funny. Ragnarok got it just right, and was excellent, but this is no Ragnarok.It's not a bad film, it's quite entertaining and visually good. I didn't have the urge to turn it off halfway through, but I think you now expect a high level of entertainment from Marvel and this just didn't cut it for me.I normally watch Marvel films several times, but I can't see myself watching this again. It's a shame because I love Taika Waititi and I'm a fan of all the actors, but this just didn't work for me.I got the impression the actors probably all had a lot of fun making this, but I didn't have quite so much fun watching it.

title: Chaotic Script
text: Yeah.... I really am struggling to describe this movie. The level of confusion is unlike anything I have ever seen in the marvel cinematic universe.The whole script is an absolute mess. Lacking in clarity and direction. Visually pretty as always, but my what appalling story telling.Right now, having seen this twice, I cannot properly describe the path of the plot. Disjointed and rushed and incoherent.I am hoping this is the last Thor movie because it feels like it's been squeezed dry of any discernible quality. Ragnorok had character and quality sequence. This is an extremely poor follow up.Disappointing.

title: Absolutely hilarious
text: Brilliant film... Absolutely hilarious and fantastic. Doesn't abandon the comics or the true spirit of fun! People are way too spoiled and jaded and expect everything to be super serious. Highly entertaining!We need more movies like this one!

title: Oh Taika
text: Lazy, lacking in plot, empty jokes, wasted characters, long drawn out fight scenes...really not that good. It was frustrating and kinda boring.I blame Rita Ora.

title: Worst Marvel movie I have ever seen.
text: I don't expect such a bad movie from Marvel. This movie is Marvels worst movie. Nothing is good in this movie. I have decided that in future I am not going to watch any movie of Marvel. Marvel is fulling Us.

title: Taika Waititi, please it is enough, don't direct Thor 5
text: This movie was a failed attempt not only with the storyline but with the humor and comedy angle too. In movies like this occasionally subtle comedy suits but Taika Waititi is now on a spree to make it a Mr. Bean movie out of Thor. I think Marvel should stop hi now.Moreover the entire movie serious plot if your remove out of its total less than 2 hr runtime would not me more than half an hour. Rest all scene are forced and unrelated attempted comedy just to make it a filler scenes. Horrible writing, horrible plot and horrible execution. If possible wait to be released in Disney+ and watch it there as the whole movie anyway doesn't fit with any sort of continuity w.r.t Phase-4.. it was more of a standalone movie with no connections to anything.

title: Unnecessary hate for this title
text: If Taika Waititi is directing, then you can safely assume it is going to be very tongue in cheek ..... get over it!!It was serious when it needed to be, and it was light hearted entertainment for the rest of the show. It achieved what it set out to do. It told an entertaining story with a fair dash of humour.It never set out to redefine the genre and achieve awards notoriety. It is a nice addition to the marvel entertainment stable, but it wont set your marvel world on fire.It is more fodder for the 'bread and circuses' stage of our societies existence and that is all.You won't take anything away from this movie, but you will be, to a degree, entertained.

title: Forced goats
text: The screaming goats did not work for me. I just didn't get why they were supposed to be funny and I feel they were overused throughout the film for a quick laugh but they felt cringy to me for the same reason.Also, for some reason it feels like this is a fastforwarded version of a longer movie, maybe that's the problem of wanting to include too much plot into the movie.

title: Fun movie!
text:
What is wrong with all these people that are rating this movie so low. It's a Thor movie, it's funny! Its Taikai having a good old action/comedy movie. Nobody broke any actors arms to play the parts that they did. It's a great movie to laugh to. Like Joker said in "Dark Knight" "WHY SO SERIOUS?" Laughter really IS the best medicine! Christian Bale doing his impression of Lord Voldamor, The screaming goats and Korg being only a head.Valkyrie: "GO on my signal"
Korg: "What's the signal?"
Valkyrie: "GO!"
Even though Eternity is in Thor and not Dr. Strange, it still is his 1st appearance, it works. I was hoping to see Adam Warlock...maybe soon.

title: See something like this happen alot on a TV show
text: AGT! They have an act come out and blow our minds! (Ragnarok) Maybe they even hit the Golden Buzzer! It's fresh, it's exciting, it's all new. Then the next act, or movie comes out! It's not fresh, it's a lot of the same thing! Then you start to compare it to the first example and find it lacks in a lot of areas. Timing, story, villain, jokes. If there wasn't a Ragnarok, this would be considered a fun, but rather quick movie. I also noticed the Ad campaign online actually might be hurting it! It does not live up to the hype! Zeus was funny here and there, he was not Robin Williams! I must have seen 20 paid articles which were really ads trying to convince me it was the best comedy cameo ever. Too much hype, mailed in direction and story.

title: Remarkably bad
text: At first I thought the dialogue was joke, but then I realized that was the movie. Still liked Hemsworth, but it rung hollow. Funny in a way that had no depth or introspection.

title: All that glitters is.... Love
text: MARVEL's been on a slightly confusing path post endgame. The focus has definitely been on the Disney+ content as mentioned by Kevin Feige in majority of the press conferences. Both Spiderman No Way Home and Dr Strange Multiverse of Madness were about exploring the multiverse concept mixed with nostalgia. While the other TV shows are exploring many new characters and storylines, we wonder how much of them will get integrated into the big screen releases. Amidst all this, Thor Love and Thunder somehow comes off as an unexpected breeze in the midst of a multiverse storm.Thor Love and Thunder definitely lives up to its expectation as to what was shown in the trailer and also manages to surprise you beyond that. The plot is about Thor taking on the new nemesis Gorr The Godbutcher while also exploring more on his life and love. The movie is not so heavy on action but it doesn't necessarily need it as well. Although the humour element feels recycled from most of the previous MARVEL movies, there are some really funny moments. The movie kind of carries the vibes of initial Thor movies and isn't as chaotic as Ragnarok. Michael Giacchino's score is impressive as always and the use of rock music to enhance the action sequence works once again.Thor Love and Thunder is all about characters and their arc. Chris Hemsworth continues his charming ways of playing Thor and at this point of time he's just living it. Natalie Portman's comeback as Jane Foster and also Lady Thor (or should I say Mighty Thor ;-)) is backed by a very strong reason. She may have had some issues with MARVEL in the past but I believe the script has been well adjusted to overcome all those things. Tessa Thomson as Valkyrie probably although a bystander is uniquely funny. It is Taika Waititi as Korg who takes all the cherry on cake with the majority of the humour associated with his character. Christian Bale is without a doubt impressive as Gorr The Godbutcher and also has a great character arc to support his performance. Most of us may feel he may lack a bit of screen time but considering the movie runtime it is just about fine. Along with the above there are multiple funny and interesting guest appearances in the movie including that of Russel Crowe which fit well.Thor Love and Thunder may not be an action adventure extravaganza like some of the recent MARVEL movies, but it is a movie with character and love. Lots and lots of love.

title: Average
text: A very uneven film.. Some parts are quite good, some parts are ok but some parts are also terrible.As many have suggested Christian Bale is great. He could have been more frightening but still.Natalie Portman works surprisingly well in her new take on the same character as well. The background was way too quick but I enjoyed the storyline.The rest of the cast is acceptable as well. Chris Hemsworth is as good as the script allows him to be. Etc.But what's bad with this movie and makes it one of the more forgettable in the MCU is the "comedy" parts. They are more awkward than they are funny and just brings the movie down. Unfortunately. It's more embarrassing than anything else.Too bad since I actually think the story was better than I expected.6/10.

title: Visually striking; comically and emotionally inconsistent! [+60%]
text: The movie is, by all means, a two and Â½ stars but an extra Â½ goes to Christian Bale who puts his heart, soul, and body into an underwritten character. With confusing character arcs, a good chunk of humor not quite hitting the highs you expect, and the lack of stakes, Taika Waititi's second Thor flick severely lacks the liveliness of Ragnarok. The GOTG cameos don't mean anything, and the entire scene with Russell Crowe's Zeus simply makes for a subpar comedy sketch. Heck, I'm sure Sam Neill, Matt Damon, and the Asgardian performers could've come up with something much better.The MCU continues to struggle with its inability to write off characters even when they're dead, and it's the case with Love and Thunder too. Jane Foster, her sudden cancer, and her mysterious connection to Mjolnir all remain underdeveloped aspects in the film. There is a constant back-and-forth when it comes to tone, and somewhere between humor, drama, and darkness, my interest levels waned. What keeps it engaging, however, is Waititi's visual craft. He creates both a colorful and a colorless world within the same film, and the GnR tracks are perfectly placed.

title: Terrible parody of itself
text: Well they have finally destroyed yet another franchise. I love these types of films when done well, but lately the marvel universe seems to be written as a terrible 1970s parody of a big budget film. The writing is poor and vacuous. It's like a school year 7 drama lesson on improv. I seem to be writing a lot of reviews like this these days. So why is Disney running all its franchises? All the lead actors in this are playing it as though they are in a low budget children's TV series. Thor is bad enough, but when e get to zeus, I can't believe how far both actors have fallen. I am so glad I didn't see this at the cinema. It seems to me the special effects budget outstripped the budget for a script. Save yourself some misery and don't watch this.

title: Not the best and not the worst either but had FuN.
text: Certainly a movie where everyone in your family kids can enjoy without even seeing previous thor movies . Being a marvel fan of comic books and following movies it would have been a bummer to watch thor dwell too deep in PG era Jolly person. But actually i felt this movie was okay and there is no point in hating it . Did well to give jane foster a role to justify her which was emotional till the end.Expected a nice villain fight or a reveal but ended a forgetful experience. To be frank it's a good movie not the best but enjoyable .

title: A joke, but not a good one
text: This movie is a joke. And it shouldn't be. Taika Waititis humor is (I have to say it) childish and it ruined "Thor RagnarÃ¶k" for me as well. And Thor has eventually the IQ of Homer Simpson.But the worst in this movie was Russel Crow as Joker/Zeus. No wonder nobody ever prays to him. If there is a Thor No. 5 .... please give me my Thor from the beginning of Marvel movies back.I really miss him.

title: Very very very not disappointed.
text: Thor Love and Thunder was AWESOME! My apologies for the positive comment. I know the internet is filled with negative reviews so I figured I'd give it a try and say some nice about a movie. Great story. Sad and sweet. Definitely see it and stay til after the credits.

title: Overall fun experience!
text: Overall Thor Love & Thunder was a fun experience. The movie oscillates between the romance between Thor and Jane and mission at hand to defeat Gor the God Butcher. The jokes are hit or miss with some jokes funny and other jokes that miss their mark. Set your expectations, and you won't be disappointed. Don't expect an epic battle between Thor and Thanos. This is a lighthearted story that moves slowly but eventually reaches its end with a few laughs along the way.

title: Christian Bale is great the movie is waste of time
text: Two stars just because great performance of Christian Bale the rest is poor weak movie even in the Marvel genre! If no Christian then 1 star! Waste of time!

title: Funny, enjoyable also a short movie
text: Thor: Love and Thunder is a pretty funny film. But when I was watching it, It finished too quick. In my opinion, there wasn't enough action but a lot of comedy. I must admit that I enjoyed this but it shouldn't be Thor's movie.If you want to smile in a marvel movie, you can watch Thor: Love and Thunder. 7/10.

title: Kill Yr Idols
text: Watched this with one of my sons who wanted to check it out in spite of the spate of negative reviews he had heard about in whatever multisocial mediaverses he treks through. Perhaps even here it seems.We watched it on a Friday night. The popcorn was implied, it's a Marvel movie, so yeah all of life is at stake, or is it all of afterlife. But Taika is the man behind the curtain and the green screen pajamas, you know he's going to be clever but in a good-hearted way. There's a contrast of mortality, for mere humans as well as for the powerful beings.And no, I'm not talking about those powerful beings here flexing their reviewing might with "1" reviews (or the begrudging "2s" whose Mothers used to sing them Guns and Roses lullabies. I know you wanted this movie to be more of a crossover between Agnes Varda and Abbas Kiarostami, maybe next time.Not to digress, but how has this actual world become all about the outrage? Even Spinal Tap did a few unplugged gigs.Speaking of outrage, I did catch a few minutes of the alternate version where Sonic Youth's early music was used as opposed Axl/Slash - and man that scene where Lady Thor takes out a certain son of a carpenter. Not sure I understood the whole pro-life is actually tied to ur-death motif. /sBack in the actual film, I did find an interesting contrast of superheroes and deities, granted deities that are pretty much no longer worshiped by anyone. Christian Bale was captivating on screen, and Taika does bring in some pretty big stars (and their kids per the credits).I get that it's not just incels who struggle with their impotence, and that while we may want heroes (or even hope against hope for honest politicans), life ends up being more complicated and disappointing than that.Love may feel like a treacly antidote. But like this film if you approach it more eager to appreciate than annihilate, and you toss in a few laughs, even some at your own expense, you can worry later about What the Thunder Said.

title: Overly unserious and sarcastic
text: The constant sarcasm and jokes in this movie are tiring. Filmmakers (especially Marvel) are hesitant and afraid to make meaningful, serious movies.
