Instead, Marvel has opted to try and entertain the audience by bombarding them with jokes every three seconds. The result is an excruciatingly dull movie that drags on for two hours.

title: Enjoyable and Fun
text: Lots of people saying it feels empty just want a boring slow film it's fast pace action and good acting brings this movie to another level, I seriously think people think that all movies are supposed to be dark and slow.

title: I love this movie
text: The movie was great. I know there the fun and action were missing but the movie was more developed by his funny moments, villain and the introduction of new characters.

title: Trying to hard and lost its way
text: After Ragnarok they thought they had a magic formula but here they lean way to hard into it and it blows...... lame jokes lame effects just over the top all round .......it doesn't work despite the casts efforts.Waititi thought he was a god but this was a very very mortal directorial performance.

title: Watch movie without exception
text: Watch movie with a neutral point which gives u a great movie experience if it is ur first marvel movie u experience a large scale visual wonder in theatres.

title: Wasted
text: Christian Bale was fantastic. And this movie could have been as well. But it seemed rushed. Would love to see the extended version. But in my humble opinion. It's still a fun movie. But it could have been a great one.

title: Cool!
text: Okay, an overall pleasant movie! Did not reach my high expectations in the least, but I love Thor & I love Marvel, so it's a 7/10! Christian Bale deserves an Oscar for this!

title: Brings the thunder, but not so much the love.
text: I liked Taika Waititi's last installment of the Thor series, Ragnarok felt like a fresh and exciting direction for the character in the Marvel Cinematic Universe with a good balance of humor, heart, and presenting the best replication of Jack Kirby's visual style in live action. However, even as I walked out of the theater after seeing that film, I didn't think it should be established as the standard for any and all Thor stories going forward, but it looks like many in Hollywood and its own writer/director Taika Waititi thought very differently, and as a result lightning doesn't strike twice.Firstly, there are many other epic stories from Thor's comic history that would make excellent blockbuster cinema and work fine in the continuity of the established Marvel Cinematic Universe, yet they decided to use more recent runs as the basis for its story - not that that is a bad thing per se, but it's still disappointing.I did like Natalie Portman quite a bit as Jane Foster in the first two Thor films and found her chemistry with Chris Hemsworth to be very good, so I was fine with Portman returning. Gorr the God Butcher being brought in felt like an interesting idea for the screen and Christian Bale playing them raised expectation, and then you have the introduction of other Gods with Russell Crowe as Zeus and that just excited the Marvel Zombie in me, but unfortunately Taika Waititi seems to be in-love too much with his brand of filmmaking and tries to recreate Ragnarok all over again and does anything but succeed in their attempt at doing so. The movie has too much humor to the point where any stakes and drama lack impact, and it will echo memories of the superhero movie duds of the late 1990's and early 00's with its desperation to entertain the viewer.I personally think there is still a lot you can do with Thor and his lore for the Marvel Cinematic Universe, but Taika Waititi should hand the directing duties to someone else - personally, I wish Sir Kenneth Branagh would return and reclaim this franchise. Branagh's 2011 introductory film was a solid representation of the Thor character and his cast of characters, it's operatic and Shakespearean drama coupled with genre filmmaking worked fantastically.As it stands, I would rate this as the worst Thor entry to date, even worse than The Dark World - because even that had more going for it and didn't treat nearly everything as a joke.

title: It really is not that bad.
text: Wow critics are pretty harsh on this one. Yes, it is definitely a much weaker movie than Ragnarok and I understand how disappointed you can be if your expectations were pretty high; I happen to be in the same boat. But not taking its predecessor into account, this is still a fairly fun and entertaining MCU flick. Is the overall tone a little too lighthearted especially considering the supposedly seriousness of the villain? Probably. But I think it is still in line with what we can expect from a Taika Waititi Thor movie. All in all, I would still recommend it; just know what you're getting into and you will have a good time.

title: Glass half empty
text: This film promised so much but delivered on very little. It seemed to be trying to hard to get a laugh. For example including a God of Dumplings? That was just stupid. The fight that I craved between Zeus and Thor still might materialise in future films but Thor swatted him like a fly so I am not expecting much. They did succeed in making the film funny, but when you try and get a laugh in pretty much every scene then you are going to get a laugh sometimes aren't you. The saving grace in my opinion was the performance of Christian Bale as Gorr the God Butcher. He was outstanding and really got you hating the character but feeling sorry for him In equal measure.

title: Disappointingly ridiculous
text: I loved Ragnarok and I thought the balance between action and comedy was perfect. Love and Thunder loses that balance and the forced, often ridiculous, humour made this film seem like a spoof film mocking the MCU.We saw a lot of Thor's deeper and more complex side in the last two Avenger films and it feels like they washed that away with this one.Hemsworth's acting was great but I think it became the Taiki Watiti show.

title: Marvel one of the best love & comedy based movie...
text:
Oscar-winning film-maker Taika Waiti's provides one of best superhero movie. This is one of the another styling movie. In this movies described thor life journey ...
Superb acting of every character...
Chrish Hemsworth provides his peak performance in this movie... christian bale surprising everyone to his acting... natalie Portman best performance in this movies...
This is perfect combination of loveâ¤ & thunder â›ˆðŸŒ©âš¡.. movie...

title: It felt like watching a kid's movie
text:
It felt like watching a kid's movie. The silly and unnecessary jokes, the lack of drama..
The only good thing about the movie is christian bale's performance.

title: Thor: Love it
text: Comedy, action, story and GOOD entertainment.10/10Why people rate this movie as a 6.8, it was because of the jokes? Ok, maybe they should spend 10 minutes so show more, than more 10 minutes in comedy but come on...I saw the movie at the cinema, Lisbon, Portugal, the room was room, and pretty much everyone enjoyed it.Anyway, Im ready for the next Thor movie ðŸ˜‰

title: Too Funny But good
text: Taika watiti def went too comedic on the movie however it isn't bad as everybody says it is , Christian bale did a majestic performance as gorr with the body language , the cgi was good except for the floating head part .

title: Come back Tom Hiddleston!!
text: One of the stark differences between this movie and Ragnorak is the absense of Loki. Thor's character seems to need that competitive dynamic. Also the writing for this movie just isn't working. Major moments are simply glazed over in order to quickly get to the next scene. At one point all the heroes do something incredbly cowardly and we aren't supposed to notice. A lot of attempted comic relief is not landing. And the film score is very "blah." The GnR tracks are also not motivated, and pretty obviously an attempt to hit on a trend. While the villian has some backstory, his power has basically none, just another glazed over detail. That being said Christian Bale brought it. He's so good everyone else's performance seems to dwindle. If we're keeping score here the Loki series blows this out of the water.

title: Boycott
text: For the record I am boycotting Disney because of their insistence of shoving the LGBTQ agenda down children under a certian ages throat.My objection is casting choces. The Norse Gods represented Noweigans and at that time were fair skinned. While Tessa Thompson is a fabulous actor casting her as Valkyrie to show diversity is lame. Now I know there will be protests over this but Iron Fist's girlfriend was African-American if she were portrayed by an Caucasian actor I would be the first to protest. Same for the character Sunspot who was bi-racial. Can you imagine they do a move about "Luke Cage Hero for Hire" and Dolph Lundgren was cast as the lead? Stoopid**Misspelled on purpose.

title: Awful. Just awful.
text: Next to Halle Berrys - Cat Woman, this is quite possibly the worst Superhero movie I have ever seen.Christian Bale's epic performance was wasted in this joke of a movie.It was full of cheap laughs, clearly meant for Children not its usual audience.

title: Great fun.
text: This was great fun! We were laughing the whole way and having a blast. It was nearly Deadpool level humor with great call backs and focusing on this movie and not setting up over 9000 possible future movies.

title: 1 for Gorr the God Butcher/Christian Bale!!!
text: Marvel what are you doing?!To create a new Thor movie was ridiculous idea. You could make a series that tells exactly same story as this movie. You could use characters more efficiently and shape story more slowly. The humour rate in this movie was very silly, even in some very dramatic and tragic scenes there were jokes. This affected whole story and movie very negatively. I cannot believe some people say that this is the best Thor movie. Ragnarok is the best Thor movie and even one of the best Marvel movies. I didn't see that much Thunder but I see a lot of love. If u are really big Thor fan, then u should go and see this movie. But if like Thor but want to watch better things, then u don't have to go and see this movie. It effects MCU not much. The only thing about this movie was Gorr and Christian Bale. Another bad Marvel movie!

title: Good entertainer
text: Movie was a full comedy package. The blend of comedy and action was too good. My belly was hurting while laughing at each and every comic scene. The story and the climax was little bit weak but overall a good entertainer.

title: Dissapointing but not bad
text: The new thor movie love and thunder has good directors, good art design and great actors, but it still couldn't go beyond being another unimportant movie in the universe gorr is great thor's story is not bad the action is one of the best but the movie brings mechanics that may be inconsistent for the future to the universe the quality of humor has dropped and the first half is not good, but the movie picks up in the second half, but in the end, it is a production that is stuck between sentimentality and comedy.

title: A LITTLE UNDERWHELMED
text: Just like Multiverse of madness, the movies fills like it has scenes plucked to reduce the runtime. You always feel something is missing.The movie also over-exploits the success of the first movie, abusing some elements which made the movie insensitive. To me, the movie is among the top10 movies in the MCU, but it could've been better.

title: All time low or possible tie for worst marvel film.
text: A great cast for the most part however even they couldn't save this disaster.Why does Disney/marvel insists on ridiculing legacy characters. I am so disappointed with recent offerings from Disney/marvel am seriously considering just giving up and not bothering to go see or watch any future cinema or Disney+ offerings, the only thing Disney/marvel appear to be good at in recent years is disrespecting these legendary characters i imagine they made their money back by the time we got to see iron man 3 so their not too pushed about staying true to the creators original vision and or expectations. There is a huge fan base out there who are been left out who hept these characters going through thick & thin.

title: Very well done
text: A classic Taika film that was very well done. Lots of comedy, beautiful cinematography, and pulls at the heart strings. I expect nothing less from his work and I thought it was one of the best recent additions to the marvel cinematic universe.

title: I didn't hate it, but I didn't love it
text: I am a huge MCU fan and I really wanted to love this, but it tried way too hard to be funny to the point it was cringey. There were some likeable moments and some parts that made me laugh, but after a while it felt as though I was watching a movie aimed at children and also written by children. Sadly, the once mighty Thor has become a joke, and has been deliberately weakened in order to build up the two other female characters in order to be woke and inclusive; It's ok! A powerful man can still rescue and damsel in distress, some of us still like that concept! Speaking of woke and inclusive, it tried too hard at that too, where it almost felt forced and was only included to simply tick a box. Didn't like the talking to his axe and hammer, just stop. Gorr was a brilliant dark villain but it felt like he didn't belong in this film. Such a shame as it could've been so much more, but it just felt a bit too silly.

title: 1 star too many
text: Another silly silly film filled with woke nonsense - give it a miss. Do better next time. Written and directed by someone with the mind of a 7 year old... drink at least 2 bottles of jack Daniel's before watching...

title: I really don't understand the negative reviews
text: This movie is so refreshing to watch. There are three parts really. Comedy, love and some amazing fights! Love and Thunder seems very appropriate name when you finish watching the movie. The only element I found missing was Loki. It would have been a perfect 10/10 if he was there. Nevertheless, it's still a lot of fun to watch. Oh and the score! I had my eyes watery and had goosebumps several times! I like how they kept Thor at the center of the whole movie. Also, we finally see why Jane and Thor grew apart. It's basically just a classic Thor adventure(like an average Rick and Morty episode). If you're taking it to seriously, you're doing it wrong.Loved every scene of Christian Bale's Gorr! He's just a phenomenal actor!Deserving 9/10.

title: No
text: Christian Bale was acting. Not sure what the other 1h 50m was. I liked Ragnarok so I had hope for this [can't call it a film]. This was not Ragnarok. This was Ragnaroks outtakes, at best.

title: Destroyed the Thor series
text: I have enjoyed all the previous installments. This part however was so disappointing. Felt like a comedy movie and it lacked depth.Was nice to see some character development from Thor . I think killing of Zeus was unnecessary. Overall I feel the production quality of Marvel has really diminished. Phase 1 movies were the best . Ms marvel and she Hulk were a failure in my opnion. Seems with every installment of Thor his body seems to getting beefy and more muscular.Hopefully the next Marvel movies will be better. I have no idea what else to add in this review apart from the fact that , this movie is for those with a lot of time to spare.

title: "You flicked too hard, damn it!"
text: Staying in the same vein as its predecessor, LOVE & THUNDER is full of silliness, quirky characters and daft action. Frustratingly the stakes feel rather low this time around and anytime anything meaty comes along, the jokes take priority, for better or for worse. Narratively, just like Thor himself, this forth instalment feels just a little bit lost.Fun though.

title: Exactly what I expected...mostly.
text: I was super excited for this movie, I love Ragnarok and the idea of Jane getting to become the mighty Thor was awesome. Christian Bale being in it obviously interested me as well.I'll say this right off the bat, it's got issues, and it's not as good as Ragnarok. However, I still had a blast watching it and Gorr the God Butcher was a fantastic villain. My issues with the movie mainly surround the pacing, it went by SUPER fast. The movie didn't allow you to hang out to a scene for long before it moved away. Where this movie shined was with the villain, and unsurprisingly giving the name of the movie, the dynamic between Thor and Jane. I won't get into spoilers, but this movie does have some emotional moments. However they get kinda overshadowed by the fast pacing and the comedy. If you liked Ragnarok, you might like this. Either way, give it a shot, it's got a great theme and...Michael Giacchino did the score and I'll watch everything he does.

title: Feel like screaming like a goat...
text: What did I just watch... very disappointed. This movie was only about half as good as Ragnarok.Korg wasn't anywhere near as funny as he was last time, and for some reason, now is a pile of rocks that has a sexual preference?The CGI was absolutely awful - the worst yet in any MCU movie. Those other gods were total trash.Crowe was so out of place it was jarring. Hated his character.Bale's character was really good, but he needed a better movie, his gritty character and story arc did not mesh well with goofy Thor and company.Thor seems like he is no longer the strongest character in his own movies, he's become comic relief to powerful females characters.I gave Ragnarok a 10/10, Taika, you failed me on this one!

title: Good movie
text: Lighthearted and funny. I liked it, it's entertaining and funny in the subtle way that Taika works his magic. It's a MCU movie and a really good movie to follow Ragnarok. Thor will be back!

title: WHAAAA I FEEL GOOD!
text: Ok the first thing I have to address is the goats, every single time they screamed all I could hear is "WHAA I FEEL GOOD". And that by itself cracked me up to no end. Now as for the movie, it was ok, it was the same 30% corny 70% hero thing most Thor movies are. I think the dialog could have used a good once over, and the story wasn't really as engaging as the other ones. It just didn't seem on par with the other ones in terms of hero value, but I mean this is a long going franchise, it was inevitable that it would fall off eventually. The acting was good as usual. I give it a modest 7/10, it did what it was suppose to do. I really like that they made kids be part of it, it's a new twist and good to introduce kids into the marvel universe and let them feel godly.

title: Parody, not comedy
text: This movie is one big joke. It's not a comedy but a parody (of Thor, Zeus, Marvel comics). And horrible Zeus, a unnecessary and undignified thing - definitely not funny. Dislike.Why they must ruin every character, every god, a serious scene and a theme, why everything must be a stupid joke? A parody, nothing more.

title: Hilarious and action packed
text: A great comedy and full of full characters, a few twists, fun action, and the music ties it all together.It's colorful. They're giving all the Thor characters the development that they should've given in the first two movies. The villain is well done. And it gives us something to look forward to in future Thor movies.

title: It's was good but not good
text: It was a good film and everything but it had a lot of floors. "It's a thor film" it just didn't feel like a serious film and with the story, it should have been.

title: Horrible
text: I read all the bad reviews but watched this movie anyway. Christian Bale was brilliant. He was on point all the way. Sadly everything else missed the mark. Why do they keep making Thor sound like a moron? Too many attempts at comedy throughout the movie. Disney, please stop injecting lgbtq references into movies. It's blatant, unnecessary and didn't add anything. A well written script would be a better option. Stick to the story and make it action packed and entertaining. In all I think it was an extremely disappointing portrayal of a movie.

title: Entertaining and easy to watch.... as usual
text: The Thor series has become more and more comedy and this sequel shows it all.I really enjoyed this, fun to watch, no need to worry about any sad events, just enjoy it.

title: Fun movie
text: I actually enjoyed "Thor: Love and Thunder." While there were a few odd scenes and the opening caught me off guard, it was overall a well made movie that entertained me for two hours, thus I am rating it a 6/10 like the previous Thor sequels. I liked the music and the sense of humor, I know not everyone does, but I did. In fact, Hemsworth is a great comedic actor whose manner has really defined this modern Thor character. I enjoy the slight silliness; I don't need overly dark and serious superhero films as some people do. I also liked him in "Men in Black: International." And even playing a real bad guy in "Bad times at the el royale" he still can't help showing off that odd sense of humor and his fit body of course. Obviously not everyone likes these Thor movies and that is ok, but I do, and I'm not a big superhero genre fan. Though I don't like some of the flashing lights and stuff, but that was really only an issue in the first film of the series, which is why I rated "Thor" only a 5/10.

title: The Overt Feminism is both Insulting and Cringe
text: I love the contrast of humor with drama. Bale gave an amazing performance and his story was interesting and touching. The visual effects were also amazing and the worlds they continue to create are beautiful.(The below feelings are my personal ones and personal review of this film and I apologize in advance If you really enjoyed those parts, they just aren't for me.)But as a female who is also a scientist, I am insulted. The feeling of forced feminism means they are either poor at writing female characters or they are only doing it to check some boxes, lacking genuineness and realness.Female characters should not feel so forced. For me personally, the whole idea should be to normalize not emphasize. What happened to the Gemora of female characters....

title: There is hope!
text: Proof that after a slew of seriously disappointing (in my opinion- don't kill me!) releases, the MCU can still give us entertaining, emotional, awesome movies. But! If they want to do so, then it's clear that they'll absolutely HAVE to get 100% behind the director's visions, and trust them to make the movie that they want.Also, to talk about the actual film, it's amazing. The acting is great from all the leads, the directing and cinematography is stunningly beautiful. Like, I had to wait weeks and weeks to see this in the cinema after my original trip got ruined, but it was absolutely worth it. The story is everything I wanted it to be, and more honestly. And after seeing the film, I really think that Thor is one of the best characters to have come out of the MCU. Sure he had a bit of a rough start, but as the films have gone on, he's gone through such an amazing arc and character development that he's really become one of the all time great superheroes.Overall, this film pleasantly surprised me and broke my heart in the best way possible. It was emotional, thoroughly entertaining, and totally awesome!

title: A Comedy Action That Gets Action Right
text: Thor Love and Thunder is Ragnarok's much worst sequel. This movie is a 2 hour film with mainly the same 3 or 4 jokes over and over. Thor Ragnarok was one of my favorite MCU movies too date so I was so excited for this. However it misses on 90 percent of the comedy, and while that sounds like an extreme, this film is basically a joke after a joke from the first time we see Thor to the end. It never stops. While the comedy was horrible though you have to give credit to the action and visuals in this movie. They are tremendous and truly fun to watch. The standout here was Christian Bale, his portrayal of Gorr was incredible and he stood out as an actor in this movie. Jane Foster as the Mighty Thor works really well which I wasn't expecting and the universe it starts to make cannon in the MCU is also a huge plus.Overall Thor Love and Thunder is a bad comedy mixed with a great action film and a standout performance. I think that earns it a slightly above average rating and is not worthy of a rewatch for a long time.

title: Worst marvel movie ever

All the unnecessary jokes and humor in the movie made it a utter dissapointment. Complete waste of time and money.

title: Ignore the wannabe critics

Hilarious and heartfelt with excellent action.Yes a film can be funny and serious and also great.Really don't understand why everyone just wants to focus on small negatives and pull everything to pieces.It's just a great film - enjoy it and move on.The biggest criticism I've seemed to see is that the film is too funny... image that, being mad a film made you laugh too much. Ridiculous.(I understand not everyone will like the jokes and this film isn't for everyone and that's fair enough but if you didn't enjoy it - that's fine. Why feel the need to try and tear something down piece by piece and ruin it for others? title: Enjoy it for what it is.. Roll credits
text:

Go in expecting the next AIW or Ragnarok and you're aiming way too high..Roll credits..

title: Circus show filled with clown acts

Almost all of the dialogues are filled with silly one-line jokes and the main characters come off as non-believable. Making the men look weak and the women look strong; is this film a victim to woke agenda?Not worth the time.

title: Gorr Never Butchers Any Gods
text: Let's begin with what seems to be the biggest criticism of this film, the comedy. Having seen Taika Waititi's other films I felt fairly prepared for there to be a joke every 5 seconds, not every joke landed and there were moments when jokes didn't fit the tone but overall, I wasn't too distracted by it. I think this film failed in a lot of other ways but for me at least the overabundance of humour was passable.What I wasn't such a huge fan of was how rushed everything felt. Alright, maybe rushed is the wrong word, we spent ages watching the stuff that I was less interested in and then just skipped over the stuff I was there to see, namely Gorr. Gorr is the villain, played excellently by Christian Bale. Bale is one of the most talented actors alive so you would imagine he would be given time to show off, for some bizarre reason though, we never see Gorr the God Butcher, Butcher any gods. He kills one early on and then is relegated to off screen evil doing, while we instead follow Thor and his gang on their merry adventures. Whenever Gorr was on screen I was excited, but they only gave him like 20 minutes of screentime. Chris Hemsworth as Thor, Natalie Portman as Thor 2 and Tessa Thompson as Valkyrie were all good, but come on. None of them come near to the charisma that Bale brings to the table. So not only did the film just skip over all the most interesting parts, which reportedly were filmed but just not used in the final cut, but then the rest of the film is just a mildly entertaining comedy? I was disappointed.The best scene, that single handedly dragged this film up from a 5 to a 6 for me, was when Thor fights Gorr on a planet with no colour. The way this was shot was so different from the usual MCU fodder and actually seeing Gorr in his element was great. If the film as a whole had been as inventive and interesting as this one scene then I might have had a brilliant time. It wasn't and I didn't so before I finish I'll just throw in a few nitpicks just to kick this film while it's down.When Thor and friends seek help from other gods, the majority of the gods feel like really boring designs, they could have had so much crazy stuff here but instead just had a couple weird designs and played the rest safe. There are two goats, they annoy me and aren't funny. Thor's outfit is actually painful to look at. Just a terrible design. Korg is treated as a main character, he was better in the first when we just got small bursts of him, here it starts feeling like too much at points.This film isn't terrible but it just lacks in a lot of places, the ending was nice enough and certainly tried to get you more emotional than anything else in the film but it was difficult to feel for the characters after an hour thirty of them just quipping. Also all emotional value was ruined by the post credits scene.

title: Lower your expectations and enjoy it
text: It leans a bit too heavily into the Ragnarok style of humour with some forced comedy and yes, it is largely inconsequential to the rest of the MCU... However, there is still a lot to enjoy when you view this as a Taika Waititi film, and not a Marvel film. In this post-Endgame phase not every movie or show has to directly lead to another epic event, and this can certainly be enjoyed on its own if you don't go in with the high expectations of a Winter Soldier or Infinity War-level film. The stakes are much lower, so try to relish in the fun!

title: 7/10 Not Sure What Everyone Expected
text: Thor's development (or lack thereof) over the years is consistent here. I'm not sure why everyone is giving this movie such low reviews when the basic structure of Thor's character and movies have been pretty consistent!I appreciate Thor's humor, wish they didn't "dumb him down" so much...it was expected though!The movie was fun. Entertaining. Lots of laughing out loud in the theater. Exactly what I expected, I was not disappointed.

title: How is this 7 Stars?!?!
text: This movie was absolute garbage, seemed more like a skit without an overall story or direction. Also, how is it almost 7 Stars when the average looks more like 4-5 at best. Fluffy for periphery to go spend money on this 2hr waste!

title: Rom-comedy-drama
text: Christian Bale in the MCU? Wow I totally forgot he was playing in this movie, his performance was incredible. Director Taika Waititi has an unique style to combine comedy + seriousness, you either join the crazy ride or you'll be left out.I had a good time with Thor 4.

title: Why is this rated lower than Doctor Strange 2
text: Sure. Thor: Love and Thunder is a mixed bag. The jokes are weak and the story is... lacking.BUT, it's still a hell of a lot more rounded than Doctor Strange 2.Regardless of the issues, I enjoyed this movie. There was no point in Jane Foster being in it, and it was all just too self-congratulatory for me. Taika is a good director - and I know this is like going to the Cheesecake Factory and saying something is "too cheesecakey" - but he's too Taika Waititi and needs a bit of someone / some other director to tone down his more obvious traits.The story was dumb and made little sense, and was SOOO contrived. These things would fail any decent screenwriting course for being filled with ridiculous plot holes and contrivances. Not great.But still way better than Doctor Strange 2.

title: Waititi can make some horrible movies... This is one of them
text: It looks very pretty and the few scenes that have Christian Bale in are watchable. Otherwise it's a car crash. Ragnarok worked because it was a good comic hero story with a clever thread and it didn't take itself seriously in a good way. This movie quickly becomes a parody of Ragnarok which is saved only from oblivion by the performance and character of Bale who is the only character the audience is able to get any empathy for. Oh, and if that wasn't bad enough, it is crass in is attempts to throw the now obligatory-for-Disney dollop of wokeness into the plot also. One to avoid.

title: Movie was not a waste of money
text: Movie was not a waste of money, it was worth a watch however I don't think it was better than Ragnorak. Ragnorak made a potential possibility for Thor's cinematic future. I am not saying it was like Thor the Dark world, but Taika Waititi used similar concept as Thor Ragnorak, in other words you won't be expecting much if you've already watched Ragnorak. The climax was different though. Not blaming Taika Waititi as he himself had saved Thor's future.

title: Great story, direction and screenplay

Natalie Portman and Tessa Thompson played nice supporting roles. I also liked Taika Waititi's voice (Voice of Korg). Christian Bale just nailed it with his action. title: Thor dumb and dumber
text: Thor is an absolute excuse for a greek god in this eye wrenching movie. I personally have a condition of which there is a possibility I lose my eyesight during this movie I prayed to the god almighty my condition to come to fruition and my eyesight to leave me forever. I would have been happy to lose my eyesight knowing I have seen beautiful people and pieces of film but now I am just afraid of the impending doom that this might be the last piece of media burnt into my brain. This movie feels like stubbing your toe but not physically feeling the pain just being mentally distraught. This movie makes me won't to climb in a tree and scream at people walking past. Not because I enjoy scaring people but just to know if the worst thing you can see is a weird guy shouting at you from a tree branch or a two hour movie in which gods become cucks. Not for a second did I enjoy this movie but Thor do lightning so 6 stars good job.

title: Just don't
text: I LOVE Thor but this was NOT the Thor I know!! Disney once again strikes with its wokeness ruining Thor, making him into a moronic, love struck buffoon while pushing girl power once again. The story was weak, the special effects were so-so, the acting was just bad except Christian Bale who did a amazing job as Gorr. title: So much fun.
text: I get that people didn't like it being silly a couple of places. However over all it was really entertaining. I really enjoyed watching it. If you go into it realizing it is an action comedy movie you will enjoy it more.

title: Great addition to the MCU
text: Taika Waititi gave the Thor movies a real breath of fresh air with Ragnarok and the same spirit continues into Love and Thunder. This movie was a lot of fun, only complaint I have was that I would have loved to see more Christian Bale. Bale's performance sold the character of Gorr, an extra 10 or 20min on the runtime with more Bale would have been great. Overall great movie, love the direction Thor's character is taking.

title: The End of an Era?
text: My theater was quite throughout the whole movie: no one was laughing, no one was cheering, and no one shed a tear over moments that were supposed to be sad. The movie Love and Thunder is to Thor (the first movie) and the super hero genre as Spaceballs is to Star Wars and the sci-fi genre. It felt like a parody of super hero movies, not once taking itself seriously. I like jokes as much as the next guy, but to have one every minute that undercuts the moments of the scene is ridiculous to the point where it was no longer funny. For the sake of being a comedy it lost sight on world building and actually presenting a plot worth the price of admission. Marvel has been on a decline during phase 4, with movies like Thor: Love and Thunder now seaming to be a quick cash grab that people will buy into because of the name Marvel; a name that used to be fun and exciting, knowing how to balance the different tones of both its own individual movie and the cinematic universe.In summary:For the jokes I give a 3/10 because it undermined some heartfelt moments and action, though there was some good lines in the beginning.The plot is a 1/10 because it follows the new Marvel formula so if you have seen one Marvel movie then this movie will be EXTREMELY predictable. In addition it feels rushed with heavy expositions dumps every now and then, with the ending feeling unresolved and incomplete. However, there is one moment that was decent but I will not elaborate just in case you still wish to see Love and Thunder as that way I don't ruin the one enjoyable scene in this movie.Rewatchability 3/10 because, as with all other Marvel movies, there may be some easter eggs scattered throughout this film. So if you are into that then it can be rewatched. However, it is not that fun of a movie as a whole, which was disappointing.Overall, don't wast your time and money. Buy ice cream or something better.

title: Thor: Like and Thunder
text:
I enjoyed Thor: Love and Thunder. Some people act like it is worse than Thor 1 and 2 but it really isn't that bad, it is flawed and slightly underdeveloped but a fun nonetheless.The Good:
I generally liked this film. I thoroughly enjoyed some of the visual jokes in this film and thought Taika Watiti as Korg, Chris Hemsworth as Thor and Tessa Thompson as Valkyrie were the standouts when it came to the comedy. As well as I thought some of the cameos were very fun. Not to mention Christian Bale as Gorr was really interesting and thought his origin was very interesting but I will talk more about him soon. And I think some of the costumes were quite good as well. As well as the main theme of love was thoroughly explored in a fun and interesting manner.The Bad:
I liked this film but that's not to say I wasn't slightly disappointed, especially after the gem that was Thor: Ragnarok. I also felt that when it came to Thor's main costume in the film that it wasn't great, it wasn't as awful as it looked in the original posters but it still wasn't great And don't get me started on the helmets. For some reason they decided that instead of having practical helmets, instead they just used CGI and you can really tell, it does not look good. And I was very disappointed by the lack of Guardians of the Galaxy in the film as Thor joining the Guardians was one of the most interesting things to leave us at t he end of Endgame and they were almost not in the film. I thought Gorr was a very interesting villain and I thought he was even more interesting than Hella from Ragnarok but I still think Hella was a better villain as Gorr just wasn't explored as that well as he could of been. I thought his introduction was really good and so were all his scenes but I think he just wasn't in the film enough. As well as I felt they were missing a whole third act of the film and the final battle felt a bit weak until the end of it.Overall I think if you are fan of Ragnarok then you will enjoy it enough but it definitely isn't as strong as Ragnarok in any of the aspects of the film. However it is still a fun watch.

title: Properly Villain not explained
text: Gorr deserve their own movie.Over comedy. Wasted of Thor character and Gorr's connection. Mighty Thor's intro was very bad. Zeus is the god of the sky in ancient Greek mythology. Zeus was very funny. Zeus did not show fare well.

title: Too short. No time to breathe.
text: You can tell a lot was cut from this movie. It moves too fast for any emotional beat to land. It's a shame, because Christian Bale gives an amazing performance, but he needed more screen time. Hemsworth is good as always. Portman and Thompson have surprisingly little screen time as well. Russell Crowe seems to be having a blast. Kong is in the movie too much. He's better in small doses. Some of the cgi is really bad. Overall, movie is too short. I would have loved to seen a 2h. 30 minute version.

title: No one has a sense of humor or wonder anymore
text: Great movie! Funny from start to finish. Writing was great, characters were great. It was just a good time all the way around. Everyone complains about it for being silly or not comic accurate or whatever. I don't care what they say. It felt like when I was a kid reading comics and there was a sense of wonder and whimsy. The movie felt like the writers said what if we could do this or that crazy thing and just did it because they can. It's their universe and they were playing in it. In today's world, no one appreciates this kind of thing anymore. It all has to be diverse or inclusive or politically this or that. People today demand their particular flavor of activism be the main point of a movie. If they don't get their way, well then they need to destroy that movie and it's cast and crew. I feel sad for those who have lost their childlike wonder. Their world is darker for it.

title: Thunderous return
text: Chris Hemsworth is back for the first fourquel in the Marvel Cinematic Universe with Taika Waititi returning to direct and the original cast returning for a comedic space romp that sees the Thor series finally embracing the Norse mythology and embracing the other gods sprinkled throughout the universe. This time around Natalie Portman returns to the series as the central character taking on a version of Mighty Thor which allows for some great romantic comedy tropes to come into play. The action is bigger, the laughs are louder, the premise is outrageously camp showing there is still life left in the Thor series, Thor : Love and Thunder is the best MCU movie in the current phase, and perhaps the best Thor movie of the series.The movie picks up slightly after the events of Avengers Endgame. Thor has his eye back and has joined the Guardians of the Galaxy as he is feeling empty and searching for meaning in his life. Meanwhile, New Asgard has settled on Earth and become a major tourist destination for the world to encounter the Asgardian's lifestyle. When Thor (Chris Hemsworth) is told of a monster Gorr (Christian Bale) equipped with a sword that can kill gods is on a mission to eliminate all gods travelling across the different realms to do so. Thor must enlist the help of Zeus (Russell Crowe) and bring his friends Valkyrie (Tessa Thompson), Korg (Taika Waititi) and his ex-girlfriend Jane Foster (Natalie Portman) to stop the slaughter and save the gods and children of New Asgard.The MCU have been taken huge creative risks lately with projects like The Eternals, Doctor Strange 2 and the array of Disney + spin-offs that don't centre around main characters not delivering the billion-dollar blockbuster hits and near-perfect critic scores the studio is used to. Thor is the first character in the MCU to be given a fourth solo film and while there are many ingredients here that make it worth it, the return of Natalie Portman to the series, and to take up the mantle of Thor seems worth the money alone. Director Taika Waititi has taken the ingredients that made Ragnarok popular with Korg and Valkyrie returning and blending them with the cast of the original movie to deliver a story that won't result in the end of the world (well human world at least!) Taking the fight to the gods in different realms is a clever tale to tell and with Waititi's whacky mind to write and direct, only accelerates this turning into a blend of campy 80's inspired action that will make you laugh, sometimes cry and a reminder of the power of Marvel comics characters when done right.Hemsworth remains settled as the character, cracking out the one-liners at every turn. Bale was a great addition as the torn father turned murdering psychopath able to summon shadow monsters at the click of his fingers. His performance was outrageously campy and felt like a mix of Arnold Schwarzneggers Mr Freeze in Batman and Robin with Ray Fines Voldermort. There were times he appeared and it was incredibly creepy and threatening, and others where it felt outrageously camp. Portman's return was warranted with an extended backstory and throwback scene explaining the reasons they broke up and why Jane feels the need to reach back out to Thor. Portman and Hemsworth were not a solid sell in the first two films, here the balance of power has shifted and their relationship is understandably different and fortunately feels more authentic.Visually the film is clearly sticking close with its 80's poster promises and trailer. There is a heavy neon aesthetic that is mixed up a bit in a few parts of the film. Waititi plays with black and white in the Shadow realm and allows the visuals to transform offering a different vibe and the shadow monsters to feel like creepy characters from an old black and white horror movie. It is good to see the studio trying different things, particularly in a movie that is bursting at the seams with colour and light for the majority of its two-hour runtime.There are a ton of throwbacks to romantic comedies as Thor and Jane explore their new relationship and the possibilities that it may bring to each of them. Thor feels lost and clearly still loves Jane. Jane has a life-altering decision to make and must choose between life and love. This would be the first film in which their love story feels earned and the pay-off is extremely bittersweet.The action scenes in this do feel a little light. While they are chaotic and loud, you can almost see the wires as the different characters fly across the screen or embark on large leaps and rolls set against the CGI landscapes. This is particularly true when it comes to Portman possessing the power of Thor. A few tumbles and hammer swings are effective, but after a few times, the cracks do appear. This is the same for Hemsworth who doesn't get as much to do action wise this time around when it comes to fighting sequences.Russell Crowe is the big addition here with the character of Zeus revealed, his take on the ultimate god of gods is different to say the least. Donning a white Australian trying to do a greek accent comes through as Con The Fruiterer from The Comedy Company (for your reference if you don't know click here) This may sound like a negative, it is actually incredibly funny and his take on Thor and the god-killer is a great addition to the story.Thor : Love and Thunder is everything that I wasn't expecting from this film. It does offer a large neon world with a romantic comedy space romp with the characters from the franchise we all love, yet still remains to hit all the emotional beats it needs to and solidifies Natalie Portman's return to the franchise. While this won't be to everyone's liking, there is so much thrown at the screen, so quickly, it all just kind of works. There are two credit scenes, both worth watching so make sure you stick around for both. Thor : Love and Thunder is the best film of the current phase of the MCU, with a refined pallette, two screaming goats and the original cast back, director Waititi takes the Marvel concept of gods and puts his own unique spin on it resulting in a gloriously camp romantic romp through space.

title: Jane Foster is bad ass
text: First thing, Natalie Portman kills it, Jane Foster was dope, she was so good. The movie isn't terrible it's very fun & enjoyable however there are some dumb things that happen, there are some dumb jokes at bad time or just doesn't work. Christian Bale is very good in this his character is very strong and powerful, & it worked for the most part. title: THE MCU sucks now
text: Pretty terrible movie and pretty much all MCU you movies are just going downhill trying to be forcibly funny to 10 year olds and terrible writing. Most of Janes line were horribly written and super cringey honestly upset i spend 25 bucks to watch in theaters.

title: Ragnarok it ain't
text: Waititi caught lightning in a bottle with Thor Ragnarok but did not succeed in recreating the magic with Love and Thunder. I kept trying to determine if I was disappointed with Love and Thunder because of how much I loved Ragnarok or because this movie just wasn't that great. A little of both is the best answer. The best Ragnarok bits seemed like ad-libbed gold. The funny bits in Love and Thunder seemed forced or too carefully fabricated to be cutesy. Christian Bale's performance was great. His screen time highlighted, in a negative way, how light the rest of the film was. The mix of actual story vs generic hi jinks was off.Helmsworth is committed (jacked for the role). Russell Crowe was entertaining if we can all agree that the heavy Greek accent is acceptable. Natalie Portman does not seem capable of being funny in a film (SNL shorts the exception to the rule). Tess Thompson was great.

title: A fun marvel sequal
text: This was a pretty good sequal, and for the first marvel character to have four movies, this thor outing was entertaining but at the same time a few things felt off. The guardians of the galaxys scenes felt they didnt fit as if the actors were not even on set filming it. Always nice to see them though, especially mantis. Jane foster comes back after last seeing her in thor the dark world and I loved her lady thor outfit. It was good seeing her scenes and how she communicated with thor. Crowe as zeus was a nice touch too and as always korg provided the comic relife. It was still a good thor film and I liked the music aswell. There was some good action and a good cast and overall a decent enough marvel film, better than strange anyway.

title: A big missed oportunity
text: Chris, Bale and Portman are at the top of their acting in here. There are a bunch of scenes where they really transmit their sadness, their passion and their hate. I really liked that. There wasn't enough of it, sadly. Disney's sticking to the old Marvel formula of ruinning a beautiful scene with a dumb joke or a funny gag and then looking directly at the camera going "hahaha did you expect that joke about rocks making babies in the middle of a deeply emotional character scene?". Horrible.I just didn't like it at all.This movie is made for kids. It was so much better when the movie was in my mind, now that I've actually seen it I'm beyond dissapointed. But I'm finally done with the MCU so hooray! I have zero interest in any of the upcoming movies. So now I can save my money and maybe buy some good books instead.

title: Epic
text:
The movie is just awesome......the editing, the story, the vfx, the action just EVERYTHING is epic. You can have every emotion in the movie.....it has everything....
Perfect rating from my side.

title: Thor: Love and Thunder Review: Fun, Vibrant and Emotional
text: Thor: Love and Thunder is a heck ton of fun, and very vibrant in colour! It is so awesome with a lot of what it does. BUT- I do think Ragnarok is still better, though this movie is amazing too! Taika Watiti is a Legend, as he directs this movie perfectly and what is does with Jane Foster and Gorr The God Butcher is a huge feat. Christian Bale is perfection in the role of Gorr, and Taika Watiti finds a way to turn Jane from bland and boring to a very awesome, likeable character. And I don't think this is a Spoiler, as it's been revealed before: Jane has cancer in this movie, and what the film does with it is very great and full of emotion. Chris Hemsworth as THOR IS JUST AMAZING!! Most of the jokes land, though there are some moments that didn't hit with the audience. Overall.. a very fun time at the movies, and I can't wait for what's next for Thor!And also, did I mention: The Post-Credits Scenes are worth staying for!

title: Oh man, where do I even begin...
text: The jokes in the movie were forced in and most were cringy. Thor's character arc is essentially reset. Too many plot holes, too cheesy. A failed rendition that tries too hard to be Ragnarok and fails miserably. And the ending with the true meaning of Love and Thunder? Seriously? Phase 4 has been a huge letdown for the most part. 2 hours wasted.

title: Botched first act and underdeveloped villain
text: Marvel Studios' Thor: Love and Thunder finds the God of Thunder (Chris Hemsworth) on a journey unlike anything he's ever faced - a search for self-discovery. But Thor's retirement is interrupted by a galactic killer known as Gorr the God Butcher (Christian Bale), who seeks the extinction of the gods. To combat the threat, Thor enlists the help of King Valkyrie (Tessa Thompson), Korg (Taika Waititi) and ex-girlfriend Jane Foster (Natalie Portman), who - to Thor's surprise - inexplicably wields his magical hammer, Mjolnir, as the Mighty Thor. Together, they embark upon a harrowing cosmic adventure to uncover the mystery of the God Butcher's vengeance and stop him before it's too late.Returning to the franchise after helming 2017's Thor: Ragnarok, Taika Waititi has once again put his unique stamp on the connected universe, creating a film that only he could. With Ragnarok, Waititi debuted a madcap rock-infused adventure romp with a far less serious Thor, creating a break from the previous two films that while, with moments of brilliance, didn't quite live up to the character's potential. Here in Love and Thunder, Waititi brings the same manic energy but slightly tempered, choosing instead to deepen the relationship between Thor and Jane Foster. The result is a film that is true to its name: love and thunder, bringing plenty of humor, action scenes, and a generous helping of character development.While there's plenty to like in Love and Thunder, the film is not without its problems, namely in its villain and its pacing. The first act is a jumbled mess of scenes, hopping all around the galaxy without giving the audience time to settle and orient themselves. The opening scenes lack the emotional gut punch of the original Guardians of the Galaxy; where James Gunn made us immediately care about young Peter Quill and his relationship with his mother, here in Love and Thunder, Waititi doesn't take the effort to fully develop the relationship between Gorr and his daughter. That, plus the subsequent scene after as Gorr meets his god, make for a rocky start to the film that takes a while to recover from. Speaking of The Guardians of the Galaxy, the team appears more as a reminder that they exist and a nice treat to hold us over for Volume Three than for any real plot specific reason, outside of them receiving the initial distress call. Each member, with the exception of Star Lord, gets one or two lines before they take off, making their inclusion for the most part unnecessary. Once the film settles, which unfortunately isn't well into the second act, the ride becomes smoother and more enjoyable.Thor: Love and Thunder doesn't do much to further the overall development of the Marvel Cinematic Universe; much like Ragnarok only has a scene of two that props up Infinity War, any longstanding ramification of Love and Thunder are either unclear or nonexistent. Not that that's a problem; the main focus should always be on the film at hand and not the tie in possibilities (looking at you, Age of Ultron). Still, while the fourth phase of the MCU continues to remain murky after the events of Love and Thunder, there are hints of future antagonists for the God of Thunder to clash with down the road.Starring Chris Hemsworth in his eighth outing as the Thor Odinson, Love and Thunder brings a return to form for the chiseled Australian actor. Gone is the flabby dad bod of Avengers: Endgame as the character emerges from his slump and continues to find his purpose in the galaxy. With director Taika Waititi choosing to tap into the previously unharnessed comedic abilities of Hemsworth, Thor as a character has become immensely more charming, if not a bit dumber for the sake of the jokes. This dumbing down of a person who was initially presented with the Shakespearean gravitas of a demigod wrestling with becoming king has ultimately suffered for the drastic change of tone. While Hemsworth seems to enjoy this lighter, campier version, the silliness of his nature juxtaposed against the seriousness of events can at times create a tonal imbalance that was present in Ragnarok and is again present here in Love and Thunder. Still, Hemsworth is never more loveable or dashing then when he's playing Thor and if it's a role he wants to continue to revisit, then it's a role that's guaranteed to keep the audience returning.As for returning, Natalie Portman makes her way back into the MCU as astrophysicist Jane Foster, the first character Thor meets while banished on Earth back in the franchise's first film. Initially unsatisfied with the direction of Thor: The Dark World, Portman departed and has only reappeared through cut footage in Avengers: Endgame during the time heist. Fortunately, lured back by the promise of becoming The Mighty Thor, Portman's grand reentry into the franchise is a bittersweet one: years have passed and when we pick up with Jane Foster, time has not been kind to her. As Jane suffers her battles, Portman once again proves that she's a top-notch actress, delivering the gravity, the humor, and holds her own in action scenes with Hemsworth. The chemistry between the pair is better here in Love and Thunder than it ever was in the first two Thor films; whether that's due in part to having new writers and directors that understand the source material or due to the time the characters have spent apart is inconsequential, it's great to see Thor and Jane mix it up again in both action scenes and in the classic will-they-won't-they trope that only works as good as the actors' commitment to it. Thankfully, in this film, both Portman and Hemsworth commit fully and almost all of their best scenes together over three films are collected in this one outing.Unfortunately, the restoration of Jane Foster's character comes with certain sacrifices, namely by way of Valkyrie, our favorite scrapper from Sakar. King of Asgard, thanks to the denouement of Avengers: Endgame, Tessa Thompson's presence is almost completely overshadowed by the return of Jane Foster. Thompson, equally as charming and charismatic as Hemsworth, doesn't have much to do in the film; a good bit of her time is spent observing Thor and Jane from the sidelines as the pair attempt to figure their relationship out. What little screentime she gets is mostly as a background character with a handful of lines. There's no development to her whatsoever beyond being a beleaguered ruler of her tiny fiefdom who longs to still mix it up in a good fight. Thompson's talents are mostly wasted in this film, which is a shame since she's featured so prominently in Ragnarok.Possibly the most underserved character in the film is its villain, Gorr the God Butcher. Played by Christian Bale of Batman fame, the actor jumped universes to embody one of the most menacing and problematic villains of recent Thor history. With a moniker like 'the God Butcher' and the means to do so, Gorr could easily have joined the ranks of Thanos or Killmonger in terms of threat level and sympathy, but the end result is instead a weak performance backed by weak writing. Far from Bale's best work, Gorr the God Butcher goes missing from the film for entire swaths of time as the heroes traverse the galaxy looking for help in defeating him. He comes alive far too late in the film's third act in a brilliant black and white set piece but by then the damage is done. Instead of a fascinating and complex antagonist, we get something akin to a Phase 1 villain with decent motivation but little development. Bale suffers for it and the film itself suffers for it.Written and directed by Taika Waititi, his second entry into the MCU, Thor: Love and Thunder once again has his fingerprints all over it. Waititi's trademark humor and oddball characters are on full display throughout, delivering a movie unlike any other in the cinematic universe. Where the filmmaker has stepped his game up, however, is in the cinematography department; he, director of photography Barry Idoine, and the visual effects team have managed to create some of the most visually stunning interstellar scenes the audience has been privy to within the MCU so far. While the Phase Four films continue to suffer from some spotty CGI, and Love and Thunder is no exception to this, it's clear that Waititi has thoughtfully crafted a movie that, while less colorful than Ragnarok, is still full of Walt Simonson-inspired treats.Overall, Thor: Love and Thunder takes the zaniness and camp of Thor: Ragnarok and doubles down. Taika Waititi's love of classic rock shines through again as the audience is treated to a number of well placed needle drops and cheer worthy moments. With a visual palette that completely differentiates itself from the rest of the MCU, Waititi has created a film that manages to stand out as one of the more distinct looking films in the oeuvre. Chris Hemsworth and Natalie Portman's chemistry is undeniable, and after almost a decade apart, it's a delight to see the pair together again. Even with its botched first act and underdeveloped villain, the film is still a fun ride in theaters.

title: I really wasn't expecting it to be that bad
text: Was really hyped but the film ended being a big pile of hot unfunny and pointless doodoo.Thor is stupid and everything is overly woke.Zeus whole plot point was unnecessary and cringe.Not enough Christian Bale.

title: Not much serious villain spoils the fun ...
text:
RATED 7/10
Language: EnglishOne time watchable action drama. Went with so much expectation and movie is not upto the expectation...The Thor comedies are looks like more silly and lot of flashback sequences irritates the first half.... The second half was too good and somewhat fulfills the action and GFX expectations....

May be because this butcher kills the unknown gods only, all the known gods are just wounded and survived. It reduces the seriousness of Christian character very much...Wasted.Go with low expectations, you will like it.

title: Tried too hard
text: The movie is not bad but they tried way too hard to make it comedic and it's too much and doesn't fit the genre. Also the wokeness elements of this film are just destroying the film. We got a lesbian identifying as a man (king). We got aliens made of rocks who 2 men make a baby. Gross and stupid. We got Jane who becomes the Mighty Thor (a man character) stupid and illogical. Just make a good movie and don't try to please what you think you need to please. Men are men. Women are women. A super hero movie like this is not a parody. This film could have been so much better.

title: Too little humor
text: I had hoped for more in Thor: Love and Thunder. Less funny than the previous movie, sadly. There is some funny moments but there is too long parts where the comedy is just missing. There is too much focus on emotions and seriousness. Also, the childrens acting did not work well and made the movie even awkward at times. Then add special effects with variated quality, sometimes great and other times pretty horrible. When it comes to music is Guns N' Roses for sure great, but gets overused here so it just feels misfitting. Watchable and fun at times but expected more from a move directed by Taika Waititi.

title: Evidence that Taika Waititi hates Marvel and is using Thor to bring it down!
text: This movie is a parody of the Marvel Universe at best. Taika has clearly decided the Marvel Universe is dumb and wants everyone to agree with him.Thor, a viking warrior, has been fully reduced (having been begun in Ragnarok) to a mindless blond bimbo. Even Jane Foster, a supposedly respected astrophysicist becomes dumb when she becomes Thor.The attempt to weave very serious content through the ridiculousness just misses the mark entirely.Disney is allowing the new directors to take the MCU in to the abyss they allowed the Star Wars Universe to be dragged into in the sequel trilogy.Thank God for the series propping both universes up.

title: Worked this time but next time pls make it more serious.
text:
The first part of the movie was meh, buttt the ending was much better
Thor Love & Thunder is an solid 7\10.Was a little dissapointed that the other gods wern't treated more seriossly.

title: Nope
text: Like Ragnarok this is a joke, another villain opportunity wasted. Taika has ruined this series. The humor was too childish and that was pretty much it.

title: It's official, you can't please Marvel fans
text: I really don't understand the hate this movie is getting. My wife and I were laughing almost the entire time. We've seen every Marvel movie and show to date and thoroughly enjoyed this movie. It wasn't the best ever, but it was fun and the CGI and filmography was fantastic. People need to stop going into these movies like it's Endgame.

title: EAT MY HAMMER!
text:
Thor (since Endgame) has been teamed
up with the Guardians of the Galaxy and contemplated who he's going to be/what he's going to do with himself now. While this is happening, Thor hears stories about gods being killed and people everywhere suffering in the aftermath. The GotG decide go to help who they can while Thor & Korg return to New Asgard (Gorr's next target). When they arrive to a battle happening, Thor sees a familiar sight,, Mjolnir!!! He gleefully extends his hand to receive his old weapon/friend, but Mjolnir flies right past him,, to be recieved by the Mighty Thor (regular Thor's old flame), Jane Foster!!!!Thor (the first movie) was great / Thor the Dark World was pretty good / Thor Ragnarok was out of this world!!! This one (Thor Love & Thunder) was pretty good too,, not quite as good as the Dark World (imo),, but still pretty good. Glad to see Portman back in the mix, and how she & Hemsworth get to bring the story of Thor and Jane Foster the closure it deserved. Christian Bale was incredible and I wanted to see more of him as Gorr!!!Not great by any means, but still enjoyable and worth plenty of lols. 6.8 rating.

title: A waste of time
text: A type of movie you would want to show for a birthday party with a bunch of 10-12 year old kids. When you go to see The minions.. you expect the Minions. When I went to see this I was expecting something else.

title: Fun movie compromised by pacing and wokeness
text: I'm a big Thor fan and I love the earlier MCU movies. I was very excited for this movie. Visually it was great! Chris Hemsworth is both dramatic, jacked and funny. Sometimes, I agree that he was too goofy, but still funny. Christain Bale as Gorr the God Butcher was fantastic! Perfect role for him. Could have used more of him in this movie. His character needed more backstory to make me care more for his rage and to see his intelligence. The ending of the movie was perfect. Good message, warm and inspiring.My strict criticisms are more about why we needed an Earthling to be Lady Thor, why it has to be Thor's ex, and why they needed Korg to be male if two males can make baby Korgs. Natalie Portman is a very capable actress and plays the human character very well, so I can imagine the Disney writers and producers saying "Hey, let's screw up this story by forcing in some gender inclusion and feminism regardless of how it compromises the characters."Well... the effects are that the impossibly brilliant, brave and 'worthy' Dr. Foster and Thor had little chemistry on screen. Thor had better moments with his old hammer. Remember that they met by accident, and then she turns into Lady Thor on her own. She was like a smaller, weaker looking Thor but ironically, just as effective with Thors hammer. It's like Disney lifted this character out of "Dr. Strange and the Multiverse of Madness". Dr. Palmer (Rachel McAdams) was the ex-girlfriend of Steven Strange. She turned out to be impossibly brilliant, brave and emotionally superior in that movie thus ruining the dynamic between those characters. What is with Korg? He was funny before, but now he's just a rock face the writers kept around to inject some trans-wokeness into the story.When will Disney just focus on making a good story again or do we need to suffer through hasty written stories with forced ideological elements that few people really to want to see?

title: I love it!
text: Nitpicking MCU Fans, I despise them! Thor was finding his place. Gorr was upset with false Gods that killed his daughter. Personally I love how they created Love and Thunder.I can totally understand how Thor was going through a relationship with his weapons and yes it was silly. The seriousness with Jane, shouldn't be a joke. Gorr had a creepy presents. He was played by Christian Bale, which I thought he did a terrific job!However it was not as terrible as Captain Marvel. Above average I say.

title: Lacks depth and proper development.
text: Thor: Love and Thunder is a fun watch but unfortunately, that's all I can say on the positive side. It does not rise up to the level of many of the previous projects produced by Marvel Studios, especially its predecessor, Thor: Ragnarok. The story and cinematography feel rushed, like there was a pressure to finish the movie in under two hours. The story also, did not contribute towards anything major in the Multiverse Saga.

title: Cristian Bale, only one and unique
text: Nothing new in story, screenplay, action and visual effects. Same old cock and bull story. Totally, full of jokers in superhero costumes. But yeah!! Bale did well his best as expecting. This time Thor dissapointe2d all. Same as Portman character.Peoples are tired to watch Thor in same looks. If Cristian Bale didn't his role this time Thor might be box office bomb.

title: Spectacular!
text: It is an amazing movie that succeeds to live up to the name of its predecessor. It has captivating visuals, and I was really happy to see more cool lightning landings like the one in Ragnarock.Gorr the god butcher is a well written villain, and he actually is kinda scary too. Not "you'll have nightmares" scary of course, but more like "this guy is serious" scary. There is also very mild blood violence in the movie, to a point where it's cool for children to enjoy but wouldn't dissapoint an adult who came there with no serious expectations for gore.The ending is surprisingly unpredictable, and the final battle is equal -dare I say better- to ragnarock.My only setback is how they handled Korg in some moments, and thor's relationship with his weapons is a little cringy. But these all pale to insignificancy, because this is a great movie.

title: Six because they using Guns N Roses songs!
text:
The movie was 3/10
Guns N Roses 9/10Pretty Visuals and settings. A bad plot. The main villain has an interesting motivation, although poor execution in terms of character arc. Thor and Val and Rock man are still likeable characters.Gorr was a decent villain in concept but in literally every fight he got absolutely annihilated. The scene of literal children using the power of Thor by channeling it through stuffed animals made me reconsider my existence. One of the post credits scenes was of Jane Foster entering Viking heaven. Oh yeah, she has cancer in this movie, and it's treated like a joke. Throughout the whole movie she keeps saying it's no big deal, and the movie will occasionally become serious only to jump back to a joke immediately after. For instance, Jane and Thor are having a genuine talk about her cancer and then haha screaming goat. There are these screaming goats in the movie by the way, and that's the whole joke. That's it. They scream very loud. Isn't that funny?Why i got the atmosphere this movie was just like any other teenagers flick. Weightless.

title: Hollywood trying to de-gender Thor .. failure
text: The last attack on Thor as toxic male alcoholic loser .. to this unfunny trash ... I hope the producers lose a ton of money on this as they deserve to go broke for going woke and destroying one of the great comic heroes of the decades .. shameful.

title: Thor: Jokes and Thunder
text: Thor: Love and Thunder is not a bad movie at all, in fact it manages to entertain, but the movie has TOO MUCH jokes! Some of them work but the vast majority don't. The movie tries to create some serious and even "scary" moments with Gorr and it even works sometimes, but unfortunately the mood changes drastically due to the forced jokes.The acting was great, everyone played their characters really well, especially Christian Bale, who was amazing.The photography was incredible, there were frames of the movie where I wanted to take a screenshots and save them as a wallpaper and the direction was also excellent as expected.Overall the movie could have been better if it had taken a more serious tone, but it's still a cool movie to watch.

title: No
text: MCU back in a day had some sense. Everything introduced had some sense and is well explained. Now in phase 4 most random sh#t is thrown at us. Zeus, seriously? Palace of gods, tf? Me personally, I dont like it because its clear sign writers are running out of ideas. This is hot mess with terrible terrible comedy. Thor in infinity war and this one are not same characters honestly.

title: Heartfelt!
text: Thor: Love & Thunder is a heartfelt, funny, romantic, and amazing superhero film that welcomes newcomers to the MCU and Thor as much as it does add to the nuance of the character for returning fans.

title: Missed Potential Due To Odd Tone
text: Despite great potential and some brilliant performances, Waititi's second direction of Thor is wide of the mark. It seems unable to find the genre it wants to fit in, keeping the same humour from Ragnarok, but mixing it with horror in Bale's Gorr. Neither genre is able to build momentum, meaning typically funny scenes, which would have landed in the previous film, have far less impact, yet the comedy is too constant to allow any other tone for the film.For the most part, the performances of the cast are brilliant. Hemsworth is in phenomenal shape and perfectly encapsulates the Thor character that has come to be the norm, funny and zainy but able to pull the emotional parts off easily. Portman makes an excellent return, displaying the contrast of frailty and power superbly. Bale is outstanding, its a shame Gorr isn't allowed to flourish in a darker context given Bale's performance.Crowe, for me, had a very dodgy 'Greek' accent, and was used as comic relief in a time when it wasn't needed. Zeus was wasted as a whole. Axl/Astrid was also particularly rigid playing Heimdall's son.There is a period around the halfway mark in the Shadow Realm where everything becomes infinitely better, and Bale is able to shine. The use of colour (or lack thereof) is powerful and is the only time where a clear period of terror/darkness is created. They are great scenes, and everything appears to improve, even the CGI.The CGI largely looks pretty good, but particularly during the early stages of the film does appear less crisp, as is frequently becoming the case in MCU films released in this period. However, screen ratio is used very well, often switching, but without much rhyme or reason. Taking up the full screen does make those scenes look particularly good though.The story is from great source material and holds up, but often isn't executed the correct way, and characters feel a little twisted to fit the comedic tone. That's the issue with Love & Thunder, it does not replicate the fun success of Ragnarok, and doesn't have a lot else to fall back on.

title: A lot of heart, a lot of fun - sometimes too silly
text: Overall I really liked the message of choosing love. And there was a lot of heart and soul in this movie. But it also was a little undercut by the jokes sometimes. And I liked most of the humour but there was some jokes that were really corny and unnecessary. I actually really loved Natalie Portman as Mighty Thor. She was a great addition. I didn't particularly care for Christian Bale as Gorr though. He was borderline camp for me. I was a little disappointed with the after credits scene. First one reminded me of the GOTG 2 scene with Adam Warlock. And the second one was unnecessary. Overall though I had fun with the film and enjoyed myself.

title: I don't understand all the criticism, it was great!
text: Before I went to the theaters to see it, because of all the bad reviews i've saw off it. I can agree on it having some flaws or having a not-so-great pacing, but it did a whole bunch of things that other MCU movies could not. This movie proved again how much flaws weigh more than the actual great things in the movie.The building was great. Gorr has the best indroduction for a villain we've ever gotten in the MCU. Seeing reviews saying Gorr has too little screentime confuses me, I think it was nice as they did it. There were no unessecary plotlines in this movie, which other MCU movies are known for.The movie was visually stunning, even more than Ragnarok. The action was nice and well choreographed. The character had nice development, and I loved that Jane finally had something to care about. After this movie you actually know something about her. About the pacing of the movie, I am not so sure. I had the feeling it was a bit too short maybe. The other Gods in the movie were done very nicely. Both credit scenes set up great things!Just stop looking at what movies miss to give you, but look at what they did give you.

title: An Above Average Mess Of A Film
text:
One of the most hyped films, Thor: Love and Thunder is out and I have now finally had a chance to watch it and here is my review for the film. The premise of the film sees Thor attempting to work himself out when he must team up with his ex Jane Foster in order to stop a new enemy.Main Character
Chris Hemsworth has now played Thor for 11 Years and he could play the role in his sleep. He is great in this film and he is just so good as the character and has made him into a really fun lead character. Thor had a great story arc in Avengers Endgame and it kind of continues here with his character getting an interesting deep dive with a continued progression which is good to see.Supporting Characters
Natalie Portman as Jane Foster was a pretty dull part of the previous Thor films but I actually liked her here and I definitely feel like this is the best she has done. Seeing her take up the role of Mighty Thor is really entertaining and seeing the two Thor's in action adds something fresh to the film. The story between the two of them is well handled and I thought this was the most chemistry that Portman and Hemsworth have had. Tessa Thompson is back as Valkyrie and she is pretty fun once again, her character doesn't get much development but she is always entertaining and Thompson is clearly having a lot of fun in the role. But there are some falters here, Christian Bale plays Gorr The God Butcher and it just didn't work for me. He was a dull villain who wasn't given enough time for you to really care and Bale switches from intense to goofy too often for me and it just makes his character feel inconsistent. Korg is one of my favourite characters in the MCU but he is in this film way too much and his overuse of comedy is too forced and takes away from the overall product. I think it shows that he is best in smaller doses and they shouldn't have him as front and centre as he is here.Story
The story is at its best when it focuses on the relationship between Thor and Jane. There is some real drama here mixed with some nice humour, in interviews it was claimed it would be the biggest part of that film and it succeed here. But the story just feels incredibly rushed and a bit all over the place, it tries to balance really serious moments with comedy and it really doesn't work at all with an ending that also didn't quite work for me.Script
The script is actually quite funny, its not as funny as Ragnarok but there are some chuckle worthy moments. There is some good drama here that is actually quite dark which I don't think people would be expecting to see here. But the film goes way too hard on the comedy and it just doesn't work, the two things clash and create this mess of a script.Style
The film looks really good, the action is pretty exciting and in this day of age the CGI looks really good. Seeing the two Thor's in action is really fun and made the action scenes a bit more fun then it would have been if it had just been Thor. But the film isn't paced very well, it clocks in at around 1 hour 45 and it feels rushed. Also as good as it is, there wasn't one action set piece that really stood out for me.Overall
