Overall, Thor: Love and Thunder is an above average film that has its moments but it falls way short of expectations and I think only big MCU fans will appreciate it as much as me.Rating - 6/10.

title: Benny Hill: God of Thunder
text:
I watched Ragnarok again the night before seeing this.It's one of my favourite Marvel films, just the right blend of humour, action & character development. The relationships between Thor, Loki, Valkyrie, Hulk & Korg are well observed, funny & touching.Now we have Love & Thunder & I couldn't wait to see what Taika Waititi did with Thor in this new adventure.The answer, I'm sorry to say, is make a complete joke of him.I love the underlying humour in the Marvel films, it's what makes them infinitely more watchable than most DC efforts in my opinion, but here the joke wore very thin & very quickly.Cast your mind back to the original Thor film. Chris Hemsworth played him brilliantly, from reckless joker to Earths saviour through his sacrifices.He's a character we all love because he's a God yet utterly relatable & fallible.Well in this he's a clown from start to finish. Every scene with him another opportunity for a cheap gag.Well I'm not laughing & honestly, there wasn't as much as a snigger from the audience today.Christian Bale, one of my favourite actors, is criminally underused when there was the potential to turn Gorr into the next Thanos. Why cast an actor of his credentials & do so little with him?& please, please, please, for the love of Zeus (see what I did there) can films just be made for entertainments sake rather than the current trend of having to fulfil an agenda. 'King' Valkyrie, Korg (who can only mate with other males)
It's just unnecessary tokenism & clumsy.I wondered where Marvel would go after Endgame, & with the exception of Shang Chi & No Way Home, the answer is rapidly downhill, reaching optimal velocity with Thor: Love & Thunder.I shall keep everything crossed for a return to form with Wakanda Forever.

title: Too much sillyness
text: In an interview Taika said "This movie is like we asked 5 year olds what they want and said yes to everything". It is NOT. I don't think any 5 year old would ask that kind of perverted sexual content.The "silly" aspect of Ragnarok had worked because of its deep characters and it had balanced out the burden, the terrible tragedy of Thor. It had so many tragedies and redemption.Love & Thunder follows the same path, minus the tragedy, deep characters and any sort of redemption. I didn't care for anything and anyone in this movie.Ragnarok was hard to watch in theaters because of all the laughter. This one didn't have that problem. I think I laughed once or twice and smiled a couple of times more. The room was silent otherwise.The ending was terrible. Maybe it is because it was too easy to guess. In about 15 minutes, I knew exactly how the movie would turn out. That's not always a bad thing but it doesn't help either.All in all, the movie is naked, like Thor at one point in the movie. Very shallow content on top of vulgar street humor.Then why 6 points? The actors. Chris Hemworth is as charming as he always is as Thor. Natalie Portman and Christian Bale are both accomplished actors and they don't disappoint despite the extremely shallow script they were handed. Tessa Thompson is very good at bringing seriousness to the show. She is truly the Queen (King?)Watch the movie with zero expectations and you might have some fun. Expect another Ragnarok and you'll be sorely disappointed.

title: Tries too hard to be funny
text: It's not even over yet, currently writing this after an hour in. It's awful. Tries too hard to be funny and it really isn't.Negates against any really story. What a waste of time.

title: Hard to explain... worst Thor film except for Christian Bale
text: Yes... that's it. Christian Bale NAILED his role in the film, tbh was the only good thing about this movie, other than that, the film was awful. This joky formula Taika has been putting on these last Thor films has already ran dry. Idk I felt this film was too pushy that actually felt forced, they took off all the seriousness and focused issues Thor experimented on the first two films. Luckily for Taika, Ragnarok turned out to be (in my opinion) a great movie, but he wanted to repeat the same formula on this last film but went too far, he just overpassed the limit that it felt actually cringe. I really liked the dark scenario for Christian Bale's scenes but they ruined them with even more silly jokes moments later on.

title: Leaves you wanting more.
text: Thor: Love and Thunder continues with the adventures of Thor(Chris Hemsworth), after the events of Avengers: Endgame(2019). Thor joins forces with Valkyrie(Tessa Thompson), Korg(Taika Waititi) & old flame Jane Foster(Natalie Portman), to fight Gorr the God Butcher(Christian Bale), who plans to eradicate all gods.Thor: Love and Thunder is a mind-blowing film. Director Taika Waititi has knocked it out of the park yet again, after Thor: Ragnarok(2017). The action set pieces are awe-inspiring. The visual effects are fantastic. The 3D is eye-popping, especially in IMAX. The humor in the movie is guffaw worthy. There are also emotional moments, that differentiates this film from its 2017 predecessor. My favorite movie in Phase 4 of the Marvel Cinematic Universe, after Spider-Man: No Way Home(2021). Chris Hemsworth is outstanding as Thor. Hemsworth goes from strength to strength each time he plays the God of Thunder. Natalie Portman is spectacular as Jane Foster/The Mighty Thor. Portman's triumphant return to the Marvel Cinematic Universe surpassed my already sky high expectations. Chris Hemsworth & Natalie Portman share effortless camaraderie together. Christian Bale is unforgettable as Gorr. Bale's performance makes his character one of the best villains in the Marvel Cinematic Universe. Tessa Thompson is excellent as King Valkyrie. Taika Waititi is hilarious as Korg. Russell Crowe is superb as Zeus. The supporting cast is great. The cameos are memorable. Thor: Love and Thunder is a must watch for Marvel Cinematic Universe fans. Go, have a whale of a time watching it on the big screen. Can't wait for the next Thor film!

title: An Underwhelming Mess
text: Thor: Ragnarok is a truly great movie that perfectly balances action, comedy and emotion through an interesting story. This movie was a fun mess. The main focus was on the comedy and action throughout a decent story that went downhill in the final act. It's decent, and Christian Pale (sorry, terrible joke) gives a great performance as Gorr The God Butcher - an interesting antagonist with a great motive. Like I say, the movie had a pretty great start with a solid first two acts. It just goes way downhill after that with a bad ending. Giving it a 7/10 is me being generous.

title: Nice movie
text: Amazing And entertaining movie, from ALL the Thor movies, this one is the nost funniest and better made. Disney made a Amazing movie, worth watching it on theaters. Well done!!!!!!!!!!!!!

title: Movie fought to be serious or funny
text: Most of Thor's entry's have been a huge relief compared to dark world. I loved Ragnarok and Thor in endgame. Thor has had a great balance of seriousness and humor up until this point. This movie constantly fights with it self to be funny or serious at the wrong moments. Christian Bale did such a great job but was done dirty by inappropriately placed humor where it should have been a serious moment. Overall entertaining and would recommend watching it, you will laugh. But you will be disappointed in the plot, ending due to poorly placed humor and just a bad ending.

title: Fun but not a patch on Ragnorok
text: I really really wanted to love this but I just couldn't. Chris Hemsworth is perfect in the role as ever and there are some fun scenes and lines but overall it just feels formulaic and, at times, kinda boring.The Jane Foster storyline works well but the Valkyrie character is just reduced to stupid and Christian Bale's bad guy is just a silly joke with no real menace or threat.I'm still happy I went to see it but wish it had been so much better.

title: The creators flat out admit this is bad
text: Director - Taika Waititi: "In the moment, you're like, "This is the greatest thing that anyone's ever filmed in the history of filming things." And you get into the edit. You're like, "I still kind of like it." And then, after about six months of it being in the movie, you realize it was fun on the day but it doesn't have any business being in the movie"Thor - Chris Hemsworth: "It was Taika at his craziest. Taika, normally, is kind of at an 11, so you can do the math there. He described it as like he'd been given the keys to the kingdom, and someone said, 'Here, if a seven-year-old was making a movie, what would you do?' He said, 'Well, I want to put this in it. I want to do this. I want to try this.' And everything he suggested, I said yes to, and then we had this insane film in front of us."Story - the core plot of the movie is actually good and has a lot of potential. However the scenes advancing the plot are few and far between, edited to be as short as possible feeling rushed. Each plot scene is then undercut with a comedy scene that immediately follows. Serious plot points aren't given room to breathe the way they were in Ragnarok. This movie plays like a clown dancing at a funeral.The worst issue is that the comedy doesn't work like it did in Ragnorok. Taika Waititi appears to be a one trick pony like M. Night Shyamalan. He doesn't evolve, he just gives you more of the same. All of the comedy is basically "look at this random thing" e.g. The goats bleat dozens of times for a supposed laugh. Just like Shyamalan, Waititi inserted himself into this movie. His character Korg unlike in Ragnorok is now one of the main characters present throughout the plot.Performances - The performances were good. Chris Hemsworth literally embodies Thor, Christian Bale is amazing and plays a complex and sympathetic character (too good for this movie). The rest of the cast does a good job as well.Visuals - Overall the best way I can describe them is a supersaturated rainbow splashed all over the screen. Visuals however are poorly done. The movie uses new tech that projects the background behind the actors. Problem is that in all the close up shots, it looks exactly for what it is. Actors appear in the foreground superimposed on the environment. Try watching the trailer in slow motion, you'll see it. Overall it's underwhelming for a modern movie and disappointing for an MCU oneOverall - This movie commits the worst crime of all: it was boring. You can't invest yourself into the story as it's constantly uncut by jokes and you can't enjoy a comedy since the jokes don't land, seemingly targeted at very young audience.Unfortunately I have to give this 1/10 judging by the MCU standards.

title: Goated movie (quite literally....)
text: Might be one of the coolest MCU projects yet. Christian Bale shines as the antagonist. The visuals are phenomenal, and the background score is amazing.

title: Huge diversion
text: WAS a fan of Thor movies, walked out of this one with my kids. This one was stupid and off course. Not like the lead up movies at all. Inappropriate for kids and unnecessary agenda pushing.

title: Loved it I cried
text: I love Thor so much. This movie made me laugh and cry! It was freaking awesome please go watch it! Instantly one of my favorites. Christian Bale is amazing and did so well. All of them were terrific. I don't know why a lot of people are saying it felt empty I feel that everything tied together to the very end. :') Also there are 2 end credit scenes just FYI.

title: If you liked Ragnarok, you'll like Love and Thunder
text: Thor Love and Thunder is exactly what you'd expect from a Taika Waititi Thor film; same style, pace and comedic tone as Ragnarok.Although the movie is relatively short for the MCU (about 2 hours), I enjoyed the brief glimpses of backstory along with the new story arc of Jane Foster (Natalie Portman returns) and the introduction of bad dude Gorr played by Christian Bale. Some of the jokes seem forced and the opening sequence with The Guardians of the Galaxy wasn't up my alley but I can understand that fans will love to see this and it continues the Thor story very well.There are small cameos about half way through the movie that are pretty hilarious!

title: Disney ruins everything he get his hands on
text: In all honesty I have never see something so stupid and disappointing.I'd not even know where to start.Do not waste your time and money on this disgusting B movie.

title: Enjoyable Fun Experience
text: Very action packed, enjoyable movie. If you like Thor Ragnarok you will enjoy Thor Love and Thunder. Great casting, great cinematography, very humorous and overall really great. The pacing was a bit off though wish the movie went for at least another 30 minutes and a bit more of a bactstory to Jane Foster and Gorr the God Butcher.

title: It's really hard to put a finger on this
text: Previous Thor movies were not by any means great, heck you could say only one of them was good and that was just before whole infinity climax mess.But they did play critical part in building plot and character, and so does this movie.The fact is, Thor is practically now independent entity of main MCU cannon. The way I see it, before we get anywhere near where this new stage is going, it's more of a comic relief then serious plot.My issue is that they tried so hard to make "modern" Journey comic alike. Feeling but with a movie cannon instead of comics, resulting as many pointed out, really really lame jokes and wasted potential.Performance, production and overall CGI aside, the entire plot was like a side show, just to change a direction and somehow invent purpose of keeping Thor as part of universe, and maybe some small part in the main cannon.The whole Jane and Thor love saga, got it's conclusion and.in a way, it was lame and crafty way to put a final touch. Now the question is, are we going to stop pumping 70% of video tape, lame jokes and actually focus on building stronger plots and characters?I really love marvel and I sticking with it, for that reason alone, I am no where near diehard fun, hence I am losing interest with each new installment rapidly and this new trend needs to stop.

title: Watchable and enjoyable, yet a bit too cringe.
text: While DC is way too serious this movie was too funny, borderline absurd.At least it was detached to the MCU storyline, of which you have to know all the pieces and bits now to understand a simple movie.And that's probably its biggest strength that allows it to be too much.A lot of missing opportunity and character development replaced by insignificant plot such as the "romance" Stormbreaker vs Mjolnir.Perhaps a "laissez-aller" due to Ragnarok success and focus on the next project or family (talking about Waititi). Or maybe some Disney influence?Despite all that the movie is very enjoyable. Don't take it too seriously, trying to find the secrets of the future of MCU, take a chill pill and you'll have a good time.

title: Just Boring
text: I love Thor movies but this was way too boring and trashyChristian Bale and Natalie Portman were superb however!It's just the story and screenplay were forced and boring.

title: Rock-solid follow-up to Ragnarok
text: The pacing is solid, the jokes land well, and this movie shifts right to the drama without missing a beat.It's nice to see a bright, colorful, optimistic comic book movie for a change.

title: Its just a mediocore
text: I expected to be as great as the Doctor Strage 2022 but it turns out that this one is just a mediocore Marvel movie. The previous Thor movies are way better.

title: Another political cog in Disney's liberal pocket
text: Why does Waititi feel the need to support a political agenda? These movies should be free of current politics. Such a shame. The only really good thing about this film is achristian Bale. The humor and acting was forced and sub par.

title: Top 3 MCU
text: This film is incredible. It's a perfect balence of light, dark, comedy and seriousness. Gorr the God Butcherer is such a great villain. The music choice was also excellent. There are so many great things I can't go into without some spoilers but this film is incredible. I'm going back to watch it three more times.

title: Not as bad as people say.
text:
Movie was ok. Definitely not 10 stars but not
1 star either. People unfortunately expect
Too much now a days. Very sad to see these low ratings. I give it a 7 as that is an accurate rating..

title: It's all just a joke!
text: If you want to see a Marvel comedy then this is the movie for you! Unfortunately I liked the Marvel Movies that had some substance to them with a balance of comic relief. Christian Bale is the only actor that is not totally ridiculous! I was so excited to get back into the theater only to be severely disappointed!!

title: A Vacuous Confused Mess
text: A good subject, but a very broken story. The character has no personality development. Kept telling jokes that weren't very funny. It's childish and boring.

title: Unfunny to me, but doesn't deserve the panning
text: Thor reunites with Jane Foster.This is an okay Marvel adventure that for me is not as bad as people say, but it had the potential to be so much better.As a story I think it starts and finishes very well with some good emotion, comedy and moments for several characters. However, what happens in between, particularly the humour I found to be very hit and miss. I do appreciate though that humour is in the eye of the beholder and others may find that it works.There is one concept associated with the Jane Foster character that was a great idea and the most serious aspect of the plot. Having this in a screenplay that tries to be mostly funny could have worked had the comedy been better, however for me the jokes are not strong enough to pull it off.The funniest parts involve the Guardians of the Galaxy characters interacting with Thor. From then on it relies exchanges between Thor, Valkarie and Jane to entertain. The actors do a great job with the lines, but I don't think the banter is funny or witty enough during the majority of the scenes.The scene involving Zeus is not overly bad, but again I didn't find the material good enough to be played as much for laughs as it is. Personally I think they should have done it as a suspenseful dramatic sequence, with light elements of humour and have the heroes emerge triumphantly to the same piece of music.Christian Bale's performance is a big positive and he brings to life one of the better MCU baddies. Chris Hemsworth leads it very well. Natalie Portman is good and so is Tessa Thompson.As you would expect from a Disney product, the visuals are quite spectacular, but for me scenes of superheroes battling various computer generated monsters all blend into one these days. There is a memorable sequence involving children in battle that is the best moment of spectacle for me.

title: Entertaining, but only to an extend.
text: Thor: Ragnarok (2017() was an improvement over its 2 predecessors, because while those films took themselves too seriously, Ragnarok (and director Taika Waititi's special type of humor) devised a very entertaining third film.Unfortunately for this new film, Waititi, coming off of an Oscar win for "Jojo Rabbit" and the success of comedy series "What We Do in the Shadows", got even more creative freedom, but I feel he pushed too hard on the comedy and on the constant silliness.The film loses momentum really quickly, and the jokes stop landing halfway through (the use of screaming goats is fun one time, but they are shown 10 times throughout the film).Chris Hemsworth and Natalie Portman seem like they are on a bad SNL skit and their acting is too over the top.On the other hand, one of the strongest elements is the villain played by Christian Bale, who seems menacing enough, but his screen time is relatively short.Entertaining, but only to an extend.

title: I am sad that Taika chooses not to continue in Marvel
text: I've been waiting to watch this movie for a while. And this is also the first time I have written a review for a movie on Imdb. Even though I have watched almost every movie ever made; I feel compelled to write something for Thor: Love & Thunder.For those who have not encountered Taika in his true form; or maybe have just learnt about him, you need to understand a few small things. Instead of describing what you ought to know about him, watch these movies instead - "Hunt for the Wilderpeople", "Boy" and "Eagle Vs Shark".As someone who grew up with the cinema that inspired Taika, I understand how amazing this movie is. And I also understand why most people find this movie strangely discontinuous (be it through humour or tone or anecdote).Taika's ability to direct a movie has always come across as ultra-subjective; from the point of view from one character. This distorts the reality of what the viewer experiences. It shades it. Colors it. And gives it a true comic realization. "Jojo Rabbit" was one of the best examples of this. Another movie that most people didn't quite get; 'a small boy that has an imaginary friend that is "his" idea of Hitler'. There are details in this imagination that shows that "Hitler" is purely from the point of view from someone who doesn't have all the facts. He tells a story based on what he thinks is real. This gives the story comedy, satire and tragedy all at once.This is what Thor: Love and Thunder is. It is a story based on Korg's idea of what happened. We felt the same in Ragnarok when Thor told the story. Everything has a 'shade' based on the recollection of one person (if you are unsure of this, watch Ragnarok again with this in mind). And that person shifts the story to be reflective of themselves (characteristically speaking).If you are going to watch this movie; try to imagine that Korg (everyone's favourite character from Ragnarok) is telling us a story.This is a fable.Accuracy is not required in fantasy.

title: Thor: Love and Blunder
text: I have to preface the review by saying that Thor: Ragnarok is one of my least favorite MCU movies. In that film, Thor completely shed the Shakespearean grandeur that was given to him by Kenneth Branagh, and the character transformed into a generator of quips. In some aspects, Love and Thunder doubles down on that, and it also does some things better. The end result is a serviceable product that can entertain you for two hours, but the character of Thor deserves so much more.For a movie that so ostensibly identifies as a comedy, the majority of Love and Thunder is painfully unfunny. Taika Waititi seems to genuinely believe that the joke becomes only better if you keep on repeating it throughout the whole movie. The best example of it is Korg, a character played by Waititi himself. He was loved by many after Ragnarok, but the movie keeps shoving him into almost every scene until you become sick of his shtick. In the interviews, Waititi likes to mention how he wants to avoid cliches, but his writing of the dialogues is full of them. For example, a joke based on contrasting Korg's naive and childlike behavior with him suddenly starting to psychoanalyze Valkyrie's drinking issues using pseudo-deep speeches. Last time a joke like this was good was in one of the earlier SpongeBob episodes.Even the comedic performances seem stilted. It's like Waititi decided to cut the real takes from the movie, and then replaced them with bloopers, which is why so many scenes just feel awkward and not really genuine. Waititi uses comedy to deflate drama so often that even the moments that are supposed to feel epic feel empty, because you stop expecting the movie to be serious. Only the romance between Thor and Jane somewhat overcomes this problem. Their story has real stakes, and Hemsworth and Portman are able to elevate this material even higher.Christian Bale is undoubtedly the best part of the movie. However, there is no continuity between Gorr we see in the opening and Gorr of the rest of the movie. Yeah, the dark forces gave him a sinister motivation, but there was this sudden shift in personality as well. It could've been built up better, and maybe it was. Apparently, many scenes were cut, and it's possible that at least some of them contained important character development for Gorr.The action scenes and the soundtrack are good. There are some bad VFX shot, but the dynamic color palette of the movie makes you ignore it. Together with Thor and Jane's storyline, as well as Bale's performance, these elements make the movie watchable. However, they may not be enough to make it memorable.

title: Gag reel of a movie
text: Too many ridiculous ad lib jokes. Hemsworth playing Chris Pratt playing Thor. It's an episode of Everyone Loves Raymond but with Thor. I assume they thought reproducing the last Thor movie antics would resonate, they were wrong. Thor and Zeus are both cartoon versions of what they should be. Hard to identify with much less invest in the dramatic storyline with all the cheesy jokes. The MCU has lost its way, though I'm sure they will still make money. The last several productions, including Love and Thunder, have been bad.They are going to need Jon Favreau to direct a Thor movie in order to revive this franchise.

title: Awesome
text: Just Go WATCH The movie if you like ragnarok you def gonna like this one. Everyone saying its a comedy circus its not. The jokes are on point and action is really awesome. Each and every actor gives their 100% performance. Thor relationship with his ex hammer and current hammer is great idea btw. Oops spoiler. Idc what everyone saying its so entertaining and treat to watch.

title: Thor movies get funnier get over it n enjoy!
text: People with bad reviews acting surprised of the humor of this movie should understand that every Thor movie has been more n more on the humor/sarcasm side! Even all the guardians n iron mans followed the same format! It's a great balance of action/humor/kid friendly movie! Marvel is for the family not some serious dark n boring Batman movie! (Except with bale being Batman of course)

title: The Gods must be laughing
text: The funny thing is, thereÂ´s actually a good movie buried somewhere deep in this mess. Thor has some entertaining value and thereÂ´s a couple of genuinely funny moments but it itÂ´s not enough to redeem one of the worst movies of the MCU. The pacing is atrocious, thereÂ´s no depth to characters or moments, scenes cut and bleed into each other with no moment to spare for breathing or relevance. Theres this sense of lack of focus on the creative team, making the film unbearably light toned like it was made for 12 year old's. TaikaÂ´s style is still here but the story telling was truly a one trump card and on the 2Âº movie it all comes crashing down. Like thunder, not love.

title: Ragnarok is better.
text: It was entertaining... That's about it. The story felt all over the place and the ending left a lot to be desired. Overall, it was an average movie with not a lot to offer, but good if you can turn your brain off. I'd still rather re-watch Ragnarok.

title: Childish
text: This movie is comical and falls into stupidity.For a super hero who needs to be worthy to wield his weapon, he has many pathetic faults.Possibly made for 10yr old audience.Some average action scenes but nothing special.This movie borders on stupidity and makes Thor look like a clown.Very disappointed ðŸ‘Ž

title: Marvel makes a PG13 movie for kids......40 year old men get upset.
text: Marvel makes a PG13 movie for kids......40 year old men get upset.Guys the movie don't deserve so much of hate. It was good movie and my 8 year old kid didn't complained.It was funny, action , vfx etc all were good. More over you get Christian Bale with his awesome acting chops. What else do you want.

title: Good movie for the Kids really Bad for The God of Thunder
text: When i was going to the theater i was lowing my expectations of this movie when it starts it has some nice effects but as soon it starts and counting that if you are reading this is because you like good movies, good stories, good scripting and every ingredient that makes a good recipe for a movie, well this is not the movie for you. Every character is writen to make happy people that i dont know who they want to make happy.Everything is poor, kind of ridiculous, is a nonsense all the time, even Christian Bale and insanely good actor who plays Gorr a good villain in the marvel universe hit the ground bad when you realize that you cannot respect him, because what is a villain that doesn't make any damage?.Thor is that kind of movie that doesnt add anything, you will find lame situations, cringe, not a single epic moment, bad fights and lack of purpose in every choice of the main characters, i even went out of the movie room because my food order was incomplete i was out like 10 minutes and when i came back i realize that i didnt miss anything, is the kind of movie like home alone 3 a nonsense that only rest over a good name that is the Thor Franchise, if you really like good movies this is not the movie for you maybe a kid before the 8 years could like this nonsense but probably not you, I suggest you wait until it's on streaming and lower it on your priority list if you have any other thing on your list to watch.

title: Absolutely Dope
text: Freaking hilarious movie, Christian Bale as Gorr is amazing, whole cast was amazing. Chris Hemsworth shows us once again why he's the one and only Thor. Top 10 MCU movie for sure.

title: Tries to be funny but isn't
text: It's just annoying how the movie feels like a sitcom the whole time, it tries to be funny in every scene except with Christian bale and it becomes repetitive and boring, I just wanted it to be like all the other Thor movies but it didn't deliver, it's like the director wanted to take it a different direction and failed miserably, the actors did what they were told and did it the way they were supposed to and the effects were great, the plot would have been good but it was spoiled by the constant lame humour all the time, all we needed was an audience laugh in the back ground every time someone speaks.

title: Too Much
text: Taika went overboard with goofy Thor. It was an absolute perfect balance with 'Ragnarok'. It could be argued even that one was a bit much, but for the most part it was thoroughly enjoyed by everyone and is regarded as one of Marvel's best outings. The same cannot be said for 'Love and Thunder'.It was nice to see Portman back, and her story line was well done. Christian Bale who is one of the best actors of this generation just didn't have a lot to work with.It's still entertaining, it just loses its way in trying to make a joke every fifteen seconds. The serious moments are so few and far between that the viewer forgets they even exist within the film.

title: Pros and Cons, but good entertainment.
text: So it took me some time to get around to watching this one due to alot criticism and dislike for the film from the audience and I'm going to put it down like this... Thor love and thunder may not have been the best marvel movie to come out but it is by far not the worst one. Yes the CGI was a bit much at times and a lot of the plot was made up of some pretty cheesey dialogue with more then the usual amount of jokes being made, but I found the majorty of it to be alot of fun to watch. There are pros and cons to this film 100%... Christian Bale 10/10 performance definitely was the highlight of the actors on this film maybe almost under utilised with Chris Hemesworth of course playing a fantastic Thor, Tessa Thompson and Natalie Portman also respectively playing there roles well. All up this movie is good fun and entertaining, the story line needed a touch up but that certainly didn't get in the way of enjoying this one. Big suggestion dont let what people are saying about this flick spoil it.

title: Fun Time
text: This was a response I gave to somebody that said this movie is great because it is a romcom and doesn't understand why anybody would expect otherwise,"I guess when I hear a story about a god butcher destroying the galaxy and the love of my life tragically dying from cancer, my first thoughts weren't, "can't wait to check out this new rom-com."That being said, I don't have any investment into marvel comics and went in blindly to see this and both my partner and I had a blast. But I would have loved to of seen the movie that Christian Bale was acting in because he was a fantastic god slayer for the criminally small amount of screen time he had."

title: The Shark
text: I think It's safe to say that Marvel have finally jumped the shark with this movie. It was a mess and made no sense in the context of the MCU. It also introduces lore that is ridiculous.

title: Wonderful MCU addition
text: I'll start by saying this movie is not for everyone. If you like action and plot this movie is not for you. But if you like funny characters and memorable lines then you will love this movie. I think some people expected too much from this movie and it's how come there have been a few bad reviews but overall this is a really good addition to the MCU. The MCU has changed since it's first movie and whether that is a good or bad thing is yet to be seen but Thor love and thunder is a great addition.

title: Disappointing
text: This is mostly a zany comedy with a lot of unnecessary cutaways and weird breaks in the storyline. Plot holes and unexplained sub plots that don't fit. Poor directing and overall just not that great of a movie. Very disappointing.

title: Best marvel yet
text: Best comedy marvel movie ever..very funny jokes ....wow action ..best acting of cast Thor Love and Thunder... emotional and comedy and romantic and action and best acting.

title: Almost that "fun"
text: I think I get it, it's feel like stand alone movie. Taika really expand his own universe, try a lot of stuff. Which for some pov, it's great. Become something totally fresh.But on the other hand people follow this franchise for a reason. It's stay for this long for a reason, people loved the formulaTo be fair, the scenery have some beautiful scene ever on marvel, loved the music too, brave writing also.But I feel like it's being hold to secure something, if it meant to be all out just don't hold anything. With that the movie will either totally loved or hated. But I think that situation worth to try.

title: Worst Marvel movie to date
text: Nice one Disney, you've almost put me off going to see another Marvel movie ever again. What a truly shocking bore fest Thor Love and Thunder is, the great Stan Lee must be turning in his grave.You just couldn't help yourself pushing your woke agenda on a franchise I've loved since I could pick up and read a comic book. I half expected Mr Tumble to come walking out any second such was the infantile unfunny "comedy" you seem to think this character needs since the brilliant Ragnarok.How me and my son managed to stay through to the end credits is anyone's guess, it was only the large tub of popcorn weighing me down that kept me from walking out in disgust!

title: Great & Bad
text: I had high hopes for this movie after the last installment of this series. I feel as though the movie start off strong and had a great balance of the funny moments with those that were serious. However, as the movie went on it went downhill.

title: Should be 6.5 really
text: Strange one to rate as the first half is pretty poor with way too many jokes which just made the scenes of threat or action ineffective. Second half was more serious with a bit of humour which was the right balance.There also seems to be an obsession with Guns n Roses which is always not loud enough to add energy to the action scenes.Christian Bale was the best thing about the film and is in the second half much more which probably accounts for the second half being much better than the first. All in all the film is a mixed bag as if it was written by two people with completely different ideas of what it should be. A comedy in the first half or action with a bit of comedy in the second half.

title: Good old fashioned fun...
text: Initially when I saw the trailer for director Taika Waititi's 2022 "Thor: Love and Thunder" movie, then I wasn't overly impressed. And I have to admit that this wasn't a movie that I was going to be rushing out to the cinema to watch.But now that it has become readily available for the streaming masses, of course I opted to watch it. Granted, I am not really much of a superhero movie fan, but I do watch them for their entertainment value. And Marvel Studios do tend to make some entertaining enough superhero-based movies.Writers Taika Waititi and Jennifer Kaytin Robinson managed to put together a very entertaining movie here. And I don't really understand all the grief that this movie has been getting. But hey, I suppose every movie franchise has a group of toxic fans. I was genuinely entertained by "Thor: Love and Thunder". And it turned out to be a good combination of archetypical superhero movie mixed with comedy. I liked that particular approach that director Taika Waititi took with this movie.The storyline was good and well-written. It definitely felt like a "Thor" movie, and also like something you would find within the pages of a Marvel comic book. So thumbs up on that accomplishment.Something that really impressed me with "Thor: Love and Thunder" was the cast ensemble. This movie has so many talents on the cast list, granted lots of them in smaller roles, but it was such a great cast ensemble. But the real stars of the movie were the two giant goats. They just cracked me up.Visually then "Thor: Love and Thunder" was everything you would expect from a Marvel Studios movie. Lots of great visuals, vibrant colors, fantastic costume designs, amazing sets, and so forth. So you are in for quite a visual treat here with this movie.As for the music in the movie, well, that was a mixed bag of nuts. The score was good, but the songs in the movie, well, not so much. I just didn't find Guns 'n Roses to be a particularly fitting band for a movie such as this.I am rating "Thor: Love and Thunder" a solid six out of ten stars.

title: Dry overall
text: The film wasn't anything special, I would recommend you wait a while and pirate it so you dont fund Disney and their phase 4 rubbish. It is more of a rom-com rather than anything else and it was quite obviously aimed at women judging by the dry humour. Christian Bale's performance was pretty good and that was the only thing that kept me from walking out.

title: Very beautiful movie .. one of the best..
text:
Got goosebumps 100 times.a wonderful moment when thor gives power to childrens and good screenplay
Chris Hemsworth is amazing in his role .My money has not wasted. Movie fulfill my expectations... Disappointed from reviews.

title: Fun, but thats just it.
text: Its fun movie, its MID movie unfortunately, Christian Bale performance is top but the story... too much Jokes, to forced ti be Guardian of a Galaxy it lost the THOR senses unfortunately, this feels like ASGARDIAN OF THE GALAXY MOVIE instead of Thor. Fun to watch tho, but so far Phased four really are disapointed. After the Avengers END GAME , the MCU really go downhill ... i thought after get but and obviously having so much budged DISNEY can do better, but nahh... the only good on phased four is Moonknight . Thanks DISNEY for Nothing! Really, bring back the Old style MCU... this is kinda nonesense. Such a waste of acting skills of so many good actors and actress !

title: A slapstick Thor movie
text: I am MCU greatest fan as I followed every one of the movies and tv series. This is my first written review on MCU movies. I never felt any urge to write as I enjoyed almost every MCU movies and TV series even if the reviews from others were bad. However, for Thor 4 - I am truly disappointed so much so that I think I need to write something. It is a slapstick Thor movie with stupid and not funny jokes. Christian Bale's Gorr is wasted and it would have been one of the great villains in MCU if the movie is a little more serious. I am so not looking forward to Thor 5.

title: Good movie for what it is
text: If you are coming to this movie make sure to watch the trailer. If you come in expecting a goofy movie with lots of comedy its pretty good. Even though the comedy gets excessive, it is still relatively funny at some points. It is not anything like the original thors and the comedic turn they took with this movie I dislike. (semi spoil) Towards the end little kids got thors powers and fought off literal shadow demons. It seemed stupid and felt like a disney cartoon. But the cinematography was beautiful. And christian bales performance as The God Butcher was amazing definently gave this movie an extra star for having a great villian and great actor. Overall the movie was enjoyable and entertaining to watch. Very comedic,very goofy, but very entertaining.

title: I think a better title is...
text: Thor, a night at the improv.Why, why, why does Hollywood always fall into the same pit? What made the first 3 phase's a success was partly the humor, not the only reason. This mess only had "humor" and left everything else out, you know things like plot, story, characters, you know the things that made the first 3 phases enjoyable.There were 2 jokes I smiled at including even a chuckle. But for the life of me I can't remember what they were now.I know I'm not even close to being a director, writer, producer or anything else regarding making movie, but I do know what I like, and subsequently what I am willing to pay for, this ain't it. Hollywood more is not always better. Less fall flat jokes more movie. Let's see if you can stay out of the same old trap sometime.

title: This movie is the ultimate self aware super hero satire
text:
This movie is a satire. It's not a marvel movie. It's not a rom com. It's not an action juggernaut. It's
a spoof of all the above. This is not a movie that doesn't take itself seriously. It's a movie that is seriously trying to not get made. Every scene and every joke is made with the intention of Disney/Marvel sitting it down. It's like the play in The Producers. It feels like Taika and company knew that this movie had no expectations and that marvel and its fans Will accept almost anything at this point. I love the romance angle being about the weapons and shunting every characters emotions off to the side just for Korg to over explain every detail so we can move onto the action. This movie doesn't care at all about what anyone wanted or expected. It serves one purpose: to question the validity of super hero movies and then amount of quality, attention, and detail it takes for people to actually be tricked into thinking they're good movies. This movie is the ultimate self aware super hero satire.

title: Taika Waititi does it again
text: Many people were afraid of what this film would do: replace Chris Hemsworth with a female Thor, destroy the legacy of Marvel's greatest hits, foul the spring of superhero purity and so on and so on. It's good that Waititi didn't give a rat's behind about anything and just made an entertaining film instead! If you liked RagnarÃ¶k, you will probably like this one, too.It's not all perfect, though. The first half an hour felt like a long exposition on an amateur theater stage. The next half of hour seemed like every friend of Taika's showed up for a cameo and a free lunch. The film never takes itself seriously, which is either good or bad, depending on your expectations. Also, it felt like a lot of stuff was crammed into one hour and a half and maybe a two hour movie wouldn't have been so... staccato.Yet the pros are stronger than the cons: Christian Bale did great with the few scenes where he got to act, there was a lot of humor and the Guns'n'Roses theme of the film helped a lot with the heroic battle scenes. Hemsworth's charisma was at full strength and even Natalie Portman's character, usually a filler with little agency, was interesting and fun. Too bad about Sif, who had like two scenes in the entire film and didn't leave it intact.Bottom line: a godly rock'n'roll extravaganza, bordering on parody, but entertaining. Just don't try to take it seriously.

title: So Bad
text: Ok,so if we take a look at the most important thing in the movie imo which is the story...it's so terrible and I didn't enjoy it at all.The characters wasn't built well like thor with the dark background is now a clown and the bad guy wasn't serious at all..shouldn't I be worried or afraid from or any real serious feeling at least.The comedy was a lot in a bad way and I didn't enjoy it...I didn't even smile.What the heck is going on with marvel?!!!And Zeus in the movie I believe he is totally different from the comics so I expect if there a new movie of thor and zeus it won't be good cuz u had just built the character in a bad way either.Idno how marvel is going to do a good avengers' movie and I can't even see good characters....look at she-Hulk...mrs.marvel. What the heck man.

title: Funny and sweet
text: Having seen lots of the rating so far I have come to a conclusion, some people just LOVE to hate and it's pretty sad. I would give this movie a 10 just to compensate but will stick to my (rather generous) 8. Thor L&T is exactly what I was expecting and hoping, a lighthearted, sweet funny movie aimed to out inner child with a bit of rom com, a pretty decent baddy (Christian Bale will always do his job mightily) and a few hilarious cameos (the mid-credit scene made me explode), not to mention great Guns'n Roses themed soundtrack. Please stop complaining that Marvel lost his touch after Endgame, you know what? The new phase might be not aimed at you, hardcore fan that checks every detail by the book, perhaps to a new generation of 12 years old. Beside, Chris Hemsworth is comedy gold and I will never get tired of it. Thor L&T made me leave the cinema with a big smile on my face, and that's enough for me.

title: weak and at times boring
text: I've watched this film opening night, when watching the movie I thought it was just medico. The film relied on mostly comedic gags, which were barely funny. The action scenes were uneventful, with my sister falling asleep during the middle of the movie. So yeah, Thor: Love and Thunder is one of the weaker entries in the MCU.

title: different but a really good watch
text: Totally different from your average marvel movie but i so super sweet, i loved it. Thor embarks on a journey pretty different from anything he's ever faced its a bit goofy and silly LOL but is ultimately a quest for inner peace. However, his retirement gets interrupted by Gorr the God Butcher, a galactic killer who seeks the extinction of the gods. It is probably best to call it a Marvel 'comedy' because you cant take the plot seriously but its visual effects and Marvel authenticity do not disappoint, I know people are saying its bad but its honestly just not what they are used to when it comes to Marvel, especially with the image of Thor that is in everyone's mind before watching the movie. I have no bad words about it besides my personal dislike to the female Thor, but the ending was absolutely beautiful and I think I can call it a classic.

title: Had very high hopes but all ruined
text: Ofc christian bale did a great job of portraying Gorr but the background for Gorr was so...bad(in the comics it's much better but who cares about comics). The movie was supposed to be a a bit dark and serious but it turned out like a joke. Wtf was wrong with Zeus, how was he THAT weak.

title: My Review of Thor
text: In many ways this movie kind of surprised me and my girlfriend. From the get go the film was mostly focused around making a fool of in our opinion one of the coolest/strongest marvel character, on muiltiple levels made him look like a fool. It essentially was a 2 hour film that made a joke of his character mixed with action. But the movie wasn't all terrible. It was enjoyable to some degree and made us laugh with as well many battle scenes that left us on the edge of our seats as well as the sweet ending that left us pondering what's to come next especially with all these new youngsters entering in... but overall we gave it a 6/10 because all though we would like to see Thor in a more serious role/being taken more serious the ending reeled is back in and gave us im enjoyment that the beginning didn't. Wasn't the worst MCU Movie but definetly no where near the best.

title: Light-hearted mixed bag, just add muscles
text: Short and sweet: the movie rides on Hemsworth's charisma, it looks good, and Bale offers up one of Marvel's best villains. Given the doomerism in the world today, my thirst for succinct escapism was quenched, and I had a few good laughs. Job adequately done as far as I'm concerned. This would be rated higher if not for the soundtrack, which completely baffled me.Remember when "Thor: Ragnarok" opened with Led Zeppelin? I thought that was a novel change of pace; it really set the tone and melded nicely with the character depicted as a rock god. "Love and Thunder" had a different take apparently, and it's stocked almost entirely with Guns and Roses. It is absolutely awful.

title: Christian Bale is the only good thing about this movie.
text: I won't spoil anything for anyone. I don't even like to watch movie reviews until I see a movie or show on my own. I loved the mcu franchise, but as time has gone on these movies are nothing more than a money grab now. This movie seemed so weird, it was like two different films that didn't blend well. Christian Bale was amazing as usual. The rest of the movie was slapstick. In this economy I would think twice about spending your money to watch it at the theater.

title: Entertaining enough
text: Tugged on the feels, laughs, looked good and had good acting from Bale, Hems and the usual cast. If you don't expect a top 5 Marvel movie you should have fun watching it.

title: MCU is swirling the drain
text: The best part about this movie? The trailer. If you've seen the official trailer then you've seen the best parts of the movie.I have thoroughly enjoyed every MCU movie so far. I was hoping for something along the Ragnarok lines, but this was horrid. This thing is swimming in "B" movie waters.With Disney at the helm I should have been prepared for the underwhelming writing/plot/directing etc. - the movies humor is targeted towards tweens. There aren't any witty subtleties one would expect from Marvel. Knowing what I know now, I would have waited for it to come out on a streaming service. Do not waste your money! The theater was only about 1/4 full on a weekend which should have told me something. If my wife who bought the tickets wasn't sitting next to me I would have left half way through or at least started reading the news on my phone and finished my popcorn. The audience never laughed or anything. They were like how Drax describes his wife in the second Guardians of the Galaxy movie. It was amazing that people were so quiet.I found myself tuning out and looking at my watch for most of the movie. I hate writing a review like this for a MCU movie but with enough reviews like this maybe Disney will do an about face on future MCU movies. The fact they took a strong character like Thor and reduced him to a bumbling fool to elevate others in the movie was sad.

title: Well it seems like a bad movie,
text: Which was cheesy and ridiculous, bloated with bad cgi actions and dialogues right from start, but it actually isn't. The rating obviously a reflection of people that were overwhelmingly seeing those problems and yet failed to grab the true meaning of the movie. This is actually a good mockery of the people in power or authority, and those who follows them blindly without questioning, well as the people who worship false idols. The other great message of this movie is the choice and struggle between love and hatred, and the consequences it would cause. Of course the movie is full of bad actions, silly conversations and costumes with cgi quality of commercials with bad composing, which was quite the result of changing endlessly by marvels directions which has ridiculously little time for the artists to execute, but actually by the meaning of it this movie deserves a better review and credit, which was way better than soulless and empty ones like shangchi and black panther.

title: And is it too much to ask that Thor have just ONE unqualified happy ending???
text: "Love & Thunder" is like a fun but forgettable filler comic - silly, short, bright, diverting, feigning import, & largely lacking substance. The biggest problem is the incessant humor fighting against the uber-serious themes. I miss Branagh's Shakespearean self-seriousness that used to ground this character. Don't get me wrong; it's often quite funny, but when there are ten overly self-aware jokes every minute, some are bound to work.

title: Who is this for?
text: I'm obviously not the target demographic for this film. It was just awful.Way too many odd comedic attempts that only children would enjoy and slapstick violence to make sure everyone knows it's a live action cartoon.Marvel movies have become so bad - when will it end?No real drama.No real suspense.Yet, the cancer angle was more adult and seemed real and emotional. Why not make this a true focal point of the movie?Hit garbage.I doubt I will see another comic book movie again.

title: Respectfully Disagree with Creative Choices
text:
Cinematography: B+
Some great things were done with light, darkness, and color. I know shadow monsters are supposed to be shadowy, but there could have been a way to make them a little more distinct from the background for the purpose of viewing.Sound: B+
Technically very good. I thought some effect could have been used on Gorr's voice to draw us in more.Plot: A
I really liked the storyline. I thought it was stronger than Spider-Man: No Way Home, which was a much better movie. How the story was executed was a bigger issue.Pacing: C+
It didn't seem overly long or drawn-out, and it didn't do too much ADHD editing. Some of the exposition was superfluous and came at the expense of scenes that should've been included.Screenplay: C-
I would have enjoyed more scenes of Gorr before he encountered Thor to build a level of dread and tension. It seemed as if Waikiki were too concerned about breaking the tension that he didn't allow it to build. Some of the problems with the dialogue overlap with the acting. The tone was a little too campy. It wasn't Schumacher Batman and Robin levels of camp, but it was a little much. A lot of the jokes didn't quite land. The goats were funny, but they quickly became tiresome.Acting: C-
I know Hemsworth wants to show his comedic chops, but Thor plays so much better as a straight man, both for the purpose of the story and for the comedic elements. It didn't seem like there was a straight man in the bunch, which made it a little tiresome. One of the worst things actors can do is try to be funny. Hemsworth and Portman, who are both very good veteran actors and can do comedy, seemed to have been trying too hard with some of the banter. Tessa Thompson probably did the best job of striking the right balance between earnestness and comedy among the heroes. Christian Bale was Christian Bale. I think audiences were robbed of what could've been an even better performance by how the story was executed. Russell Crowe was enjoyable as Zeus.Other: The effects looked nice, but I judge current comic book movies by how well they mesh live action and CG elements. I thought the meshing could've been a little better. I think future directors should consider using practical effects and set pieces to a greater degree if possible.Overall: C.

title: Entertaining yet fails to recapture the magic of ragnarok
text: Very stylistically similar to ragnarok - taika waititi's brilliance in combining heart and humour shows again. It differs from its predecessor though, in that it lacks the strong narrative this time around. The villain is awesome but the movie lacks an identity. Ragnarok was able to play off the tone of its predecessors and flip the script, but this time it feels more like a repetition than anything new- lacking a good reason for this story to be told.

title: Son...I am disappoint
text: I was looking forward to this movie but unfortunately, the way it came it also went...the whole thing felt like the Matt Damon and Sam Neill play never ended but it trickled into the main movie.I'm not sure I remember a scene where things were a bit serious, maybe when Thor was pleading with Zeus but then Zeus' accent and mannerisms took care of that.Christian Bale's performance was the only solid in the movie, although wasted, it was nice to see Bale's grimaces again, guy is on a different level, apparently, he would've never done this if he wasn't mortally pressured by his kids which is totally understandable.I like the whole cast but I will take this as a Christmas music video before Christmas, I even missed Korg and Miek, they always worked in my books, I should've added more of that than ...whatever was added instead.

title: Terrible
text: As a huge Thor fan I had a high expectation for this movie, especially after seeing the trailer, unfortunately all the magic from the third movie was lost here. This movie not only lacked any kind of excitement or drama but it also took away any enjoyment I'd had previously in other marvel movies, the movie went for comedy way too often with jokes that weren't even funny, the movie lacked heart and soul and if this were the first Thor movie I wouldn't have watched any of the others.

title: Fun.
text: I don't understand the hate at all. These must be the same people who love "The Batman". I thought the whole thing was fun. Bale was spectacular as Gorr, he walked the line as weird and creepy and evil and scary. All cameos were enjoyable, I even enjoyed Melissa McCarthy as Hela. The idea that Zeus is this Greek weirdo was fun for me too. You all must have been watching something else. I can't believe the complaint about the CGI, this movie had the best CGI of all the Marvel movies. The Eternals to me wasn't very good, I understand the complaints about Multiverse of Madness (although that was pretty good too me too), but this just feels like people are just looking for something to complain about.

title: Very funny, but very far from a movie you'll remember
text: It's funny, very funny.It's not serious in the slightest.Each character is in some for or another, a comedian.If you want OTT comedy with OTT action and loads of guns n roses music, watch it. If you want a serious comic book movie with plot and depth, avoid it.I really hope this isn't the direction marvel are going to take with all movies from now on, because they really, and I mean REALLY dumbed down Thor and made him look like an idiot with muscles.As for the god killer, Bale performed incredibly and created a very haunting character. At least for the first 3/4 of the movie anyway.

title: A Watchable Movie with Christiane Bale stellar Performance
text: "Thor : Love and Thunder " starring Chris Hemsworth in lead role...One word : Marvellous....Thor the God of Thunder âš¡ is on his mission after the split from Avengers...He joined with Guardian of Galaxy and was on a journey in saving various universes from evil goons....Then comes the God of Butcher on one hand, who is on a mission to slay all the gods & on the other hand Thor comes across his life his lady love James Foster...How Thor balance his love & his God of Butcher elimination mission forms the rest part of the movie...Marvel Studios always comes up with new forms of their story telling & in no way it fails its marvel lovers.....Talking about the performance, Christian Bale whom I loved as Bruce Wayne here he totally surprised me...He just lived to that character as God of Butcher..Lastly, end credits which couldn't be missed and was worthy enough to wait...

title: Too fast .
text: The movie was fun , especially for kids . They will greatly enjoy watching it . But for adult marvel and thor fans it was annoying , disappointing..... A huge disappointment . The movie was too fast to feel anything for any character . There wasn't enough time to think about the new characters . Gorr , Lady thor got too little time .... Also thor had no character development .... we saw totally nothing of guardians of the galaxy.... Actually failed to meet up the expectations. The franchise is going down with every single movie . But if you watch it with a kids simple mind , you can enjoy the film just like me ðŸ™‚ ..

title: So much potential.....
text: This film had so much potential but the film landed FLAT. Sad. Thor's character and power did not grow. He got in shape and that's it. The movie needed more time to have a decent story that an audience could be emotionally involved. Everything felt very rush with cheap laughs. Marvel films since Endgame have gone downhill. From Eternals...ughh... to this. Not enough for films to be seen with just Marvel name alone. Kevin Feigi needs to right this sinking ship.

title: Oh, what the hell?!
text: Ever wait for a movie to come out and it's a bitter disappointment? THAT'S what this movie is to me! It came out today on Disney+ and I was so amped to see this one! IT'S MOSTLY STUPID! Sure, it's got a few serious moments, but again mostly stupid and goofy! So far, this is my LEAST favorite Thor movie. The other ones had a few laughs and funny moments, but this one was obviously written by a gag writer! The beginning starts out with Thor on another world with the guardians of the galaxy, minus one member, (I'll let you figure out which one...) and it just gets stupid from there. I'm REALLY glad I didn't go to the theaters to see this. RAGANOK was better than this! And by the way, the ONLY reason I gave this a higher than 4 rating was then ending made me misty. NOT cry...just, misty. Peace.

title: Fun; but shouldn't have been a comedy
text: It was a good movie. But there's so much wrong about this film like the fact that it's a rom-com. It shouldn't be a comedy with someone as dark as Gorr as it's villian. The movie felt too short. They definitely could've expanded the runtime by adding sequences of Gorr killing Gods since it really lacks that considering that Gorr's is literally called "The God Butcher". It was very strange and made zero sense for Mjolnir and Strombreaker to have feelings. And Gorr should've lived for at least one more movie. Christian Bale's performance was too good but unfortunately he didn't get as much screentime as he deserved. Overall, it's a solid, fun movie. But that's the problem, it should've been more serious. If that's not a problem, you will certainly enjoy Thor: Love and Thunder.

title: Awful
text: Even if you shut off your brain it's bad. None of the jokes land unlike Ragnarok which was a 9.5/10 for me. Moreover, it's rushed and inconsistent with it's own lore. The most appealing part of the film (gorr) could've used more screen time for proper development. The overutilization of levity has truly become quite annoying in marvel movies lately.

title: WORST MCU FILM EVER #BANTAIKAWATITI
text: With all the budget, great actors, great storyline. Even all these couldnt save this film all because of ita director, as a hardcore mcu fans, this is the worst MCU film to date. Its so empty, the plot is stupid, the jokes are unfunny that its humorous. Taika really think that he can get away with anything just because he can. This just shows that he didnt even like the characters, he really destroys thor into a dust. How can you destroy such a perfect character, thor was really hyped up from thor 1 and through all the phase 1,2 and 3. To me, he was the best when he was king thor in avengers infinity wars. #hatetaikawatiti.

title: Really enjoyed it and found entertaining
text: Was shocked with all the negative reviews. I went in there open minded. I really enjoyed it. All the acting was great. The jokes throughout made it very entertaining and such a laugh. The story line was great and easy to understand. I personally really enjoyed this film and would recommend to others. I don't know anyone else would could have played Gorr any better other than Christian Bale. He is the only one who would fit that character so well and with all the great action involved it made it interesting. I did find it quite scary at times with some of the scenes involving him so did wonder if children would like to watch it. Chris Hemsworth definitely made this film a laugh. Overall I would recommend!

title: Waste of talented actors
text: Ragnarok was so good. Jumping off from that and adding in Christian Bale, Russell Crowe, and the Guardians cast meant this should have been fantastic, but it wasn't. It was just okay. I can't think of an answer to, "What was your favorite part of the movie?"

title: Dropped The Hammer
text: The MCU Thor is completely different from the comic book version. While the comic book version is a well respected, epic and powerful character the MCU version is the complete opposite. Kevin Feige has allowed Taika and Chris to run-a-muk with the character to the point where he is clearly being mocked. It is unfortunate because Thor could have been Marvel's Game of Thrones sans the f-bombs and sex scenes. Love & Thunder was difficult to watch. The ill timed, drag on, and eye rolling gags spoiled an epic story from the comics. It was also not necessary. Man of Steel reintroduced Superman without forcing the humor. As is the problem with the MCU, Kevin Feige needs to accept that not everything has to be funny.

title: RUBBISH - Waste of talent and my time
text:
Summary:
1. Horrible humor + nonsense "story".2. Thor lost all his intelligence, charisma and whatever is left from phase 1.3. Taika Waititi is overrated.Disney should look at Iron Man 1 and Captain America: the Winter Soldier for inspiration. We need more grounded films.Adding childish monsters/puppets (see the beginning of the film), screaming stupid goats and many other unnecessary dialogs just made this movie unwatchable.

title: Enjoyable as hell
text: If you are cool with a full on Taika experience this is wonderful. Hilarious and at times poignant in earned ways. If you hate fun then this isn't a movie for you.

title: Bad and boring meaningless humor!
text: Other Thor movies were so much better. But this Thor has been so badly directed and embarrassing bad and stupid humor it is a pain to watch. A shame of all good actors playing in it!! Director must go back to director school, please! Hire a British director to add some good humor in it. Even the story line makes no sense, and has nothing to do with love as mentioned in title. Special effects are too overwhelming and not impressive. No idea who financed this movie but he probably had too much money. Maybe if it did not have any humor at all in it, it might have been a much better movie. Sad sad sad.

title: A mediocre movie
text:
Christian Bale looks perfect with acting, a lot of comedy , emotional scene doesn't hit hard, love factor is less, Not a perfect ending
But also being a marvel fan I recommend u this movie, A good one time watch movie.

title: Fun movie (even if a bit too silly at times)
text: TLT has received mixed reviews upon release, with praise directed at the visuals and performances and criticism towards the screenplay and overuse of humor. I fully understand people's complaints about the humor but I still had a great time with this movie. At times, it does feel like a spoof of Thor, which does undercut the movie's serious moments(which it does have a few of). However, it's just hard to hate a movie that I saw with my loved ones and put a great smile on my face. And let's talk about those aforementioned performances. I wasn't sure what I'd think of Lady Thor, Natalie Portman did very well in the role. And while it was nice seeing Thor and Jane reunite, the real standout here was Christian Bale as Gorr the God Butcher. He was extremely creepy and intimidating, which is a slight departure from his performance as the caped crusader but a welcome one nonetheless. If you're looking for a fun time, go see this movie, but if you thought the humor was cranked up too much in Ragnarok, then you definitely won't like this one. Overall, I rank TLT above the first two but not quite as good as Ragnarok. Rating: 7.5/10.

title: An utterly terrible script that has ended in the worst MCU movie ever
text: What was the point of this movie?It's storyline can be summed in 2 lines - Villain's daughter dies because of an indifferent God, so he decides to kill them all; Thor has to stop him.The writing is just so terrible that no amount of CGI can save it. Christian Bale' character didn't even have enough meat on it despite the fine actor being at its disposal. Thor (the original) and Korg are just interested in giving goofy lines devoid of seriousness in anything. Natalie Portman's Mighty Thor (was the rejection of her being called Lady Thor some woke statement, btw?) was equally bland despite her looking great.In 20 years the MCU was built under Sony, there hasn't been a movie as terrible as this one. It basically has nothing to offer.If this is how Disney wants to carry the MCU forward, good luck. People will lose interest in the MCU before long. You can't pull all the Spiderman actors for a nostalgia trip again to the cash registers again.

title: To be fair it is missing something.
text: However, I was entertained!It's a side ally of what most expect from an Marvel Action flick.But the comedy is fresh and hits 80% of the time if not a little too consistent.After reading many reviews I expected garbage which this is not. It's funny charming with a oddly deeply moving performance by Christian Bale.What's got everyone's knickers in a twist is so very much deeper than this film deserves ( a 2022 thing ) and I feel it's suffering because of that alone.It's not gonna win any awards but it's worth the price of admission and it got me through a large bucket of popcorn with extra butter, choc top, Tangi Fruits ( I wish) and a extra large soda water.

title: WELL.....
text: I love the Thor movie's but this was down right stupid. Thor seemed to be more of a comedian than a super hero. It was to many one-liners (jokes) that was so unnecessary. To much going on with this film. Less is More I always say...........

title: SUPER ENTERTAINING!!!! ðŸ˜„â¤â¤
text: Thor-Love and Thunder is one of the most entertaining MCU movies ever. I loved everything about the movie. It was funny, emotional, dark, and epic. Don't listen to bad reviews, some people always want MCU movies to be intense and serious which I feel is quite boring. You cannot expect every movie to be of the same level. Also, there has been always some comedy in Thor's movies so I don't get why some fans are disappointed. I understand Thor's behavior sometimes is silly and childish but this is what makes his personality more interesting and funny, and I always want him to be like this. Another thing which I loved about the movie was Gorr-the God Butcher. He was such a creepy villain and Christian Bale nailed this role. Hence, I thoroughly enjoyed watching this movie, the post-credit scenes were also interesting and I can't wait to see the next chapter!! â¤

title: Jumbles Genres. Poorly Written Protagonist
text: Was disappointed that Thor, a superhero, was stripped of his clothes, and mocked. Why do that to a hero who so many boys love? This was intended to be funny?Sad to see Thor, a superhero in a superhero movies, loose his hammer, lose his title as exclusive title as Thor, and have hardly any fight scenes.I'm not sure who the target audience is, but it doesn't seem to be superhero fans. In fact, I would say it comes across as a film that antagonizes its fan base and is attempting to make them like something they don't like. It's getting alarming why a company like Disney would keep doing things against their customers/ Fan base's will.

title: Taika is a genius
text: Don't listen to the haters of this movie. This is a fun romp filled with great humor. Taika Waititi is one of the best filmmakers out there. He knows how to balance the emotions of the film and his tonal mastery is on full display here. Every actor is giving their all in here. Gorr is one of the best MCU villains to date. Speaking of the MCU, this film stands alone which is fantastic. It's insular, tells it's own story without relying on the larger MCU which really works for the story. It's a modern mythological drama, filled with the same emotional beats and moral lessons/quandaries as the Norse and Greek tales of old, but, again, modernized. I loved it and I can't praise it enough. Forget the haters. See this in theaters while you can.

title: Thor Ragnarok was a refreshing Film, this was just Childish.
text: I actually really enjoyed the last Thor film as it was freshing and the comedy worked as the theme (e.g. Villan, other characters and the overall story) were more light hearted. However, this film could have been a great film, if they had taken themselves seriously for 1 minute and took time to write a good film.Yes you get some good laughs but you honestly wonder if this was worth the hundreds of millions and years spent on it. Would HIGHLY recommend not watching it in the cinema, I wasted Â£20 watching it in Imax!

title: Ex fan.
text: If you've read the other negative reviews, then you've read all I had to say. Very disappointed. Bad script, too much silly humor (not funny), too much Korg, even Chris Hemsworth was a disappointment. He was physically jacked, but seemed to mail in the performance.

title: Too much of a comedy
text: I really thought it would be better because I love Chris Hemsworth as Thor. I am not a fan of the comedic aspect taking up so much of the movie. The entire Zeus part was so cringe-worthy.Christian Bale was epic, totally my favorite part of this movie.Thor movies lately have become more of "let's see how many laughs we can get .It has some great moments , but it was just too many scenes trying for laughs.

title: Decent but..
text: Bale was good in it, Hemsworth was good in it, everyone was good in it but it felt empty. Love the fact that they made gorr look nothing like the comics. Willing to send money on the special effects on Korg so Taika had a part and thor had a sidekick but cheap out on the main villian. It had its funny moments but why were the guardians even in this movies tasting? If you were late in the concession line you probably missed them. Probably a little disappointed that marvel continues the slow rollout of characterstoo. Starting to think marvel is more worried about pumping out cookie cutter movies than putting the effort into following what the guys who actually created these characters built. Up next Thunderbolts...with 6 characters with the exact same skill sets. Yawn.

title: Love and Hate
text: Ok, so trying to follow up on Ragnorak is a losing proposition no matter how good the follow up is. Ragnorak is simply one of the very best MCU movies there is. While they failed to get close to Ragnorak's greatness, they did manage to still make a pretty decent movie worthy of being in the MCU.I was worried at first because I HATED the first 15 minutes or so. The use of the GOTG just seemed to forced and mis directed, but after that they did manage to redirect the energy and pump it up a notch.My only criticism (other than the GOTG issue) was the inserted woke ism. I come to the theaters to get away from the issues of the world for 2 hours and just enjoy myself....now this isn't a unique Love & Thunder issue, its a Hollywood issue so I do give the director a bit of a pass for that.

title: Garbage

title: Masterpiece!10/10! Go watch Asap!

title: Disappointing

Thor doesn't resemble himself at all to his first two standalone movies. Taika Watiti managed to turn his character in complete and utter joke. Such a waste, considering how big a potential this character was.

title: Great movie

title: just 1 star for Christian Bale
