title: Has its ups and downs
text: I am a Taika fan but cognizant that sometimes his humor falls flat or feels cringy. There are more than a few flat and cringy moments in this movie. Thor: Love and Thunder would have worked better if there had been fewer forced jokes and more serious moments. The opening battle scene was chuckle-worthy but the phoned-in delivery by the crew of GOTG was a hint at what was to come. Don't get me wrong, I thought the acting by the main actors were fine. But they didn't seem completely sold on the script or the dialogue and didn't have the heart or nerve to tell Waititi. So it's off to work they go, delivering their lines the best they could, hoping that the audience would go along for the ride after 2+ years of Netflix at home. The 3 or 4 times that I actually laughed were honest laughs but the majority of the time, I was wishing that Taika would dispense with the attempt at humor and just get on with the story.

title: It is a relaxing movie with sense of fun
text: I m checking the reviews and I don't understand the comments or the expectation of the people. It's a nice movie, funny enough with really good and professional actors. After all ,the previous marvel movies have had similar plot and "seriousness". Every time the same thing... so boring!!!!I could say this time it was a nice surprise for watching something different ... Good job, good acting!! Look forward to seeing the new one with the same actors. Btw, for those who voted 1/10, get a life. Nobody wants to read your negative opinion. Also, regarding the music; it rocks!!! More Dio next time!

title: Great Thor movie, but really suffered from same major issue.
text: Thor Dark World is still the worst Thor movie. But this one is next. The problem with this movie is:1. It's the same subplot with Thor "finding himself", which is overdone at this point.2. The dark/sad tone and moments of this movie is often overshadowed by the humor. Which just doesn't work well as even in the darkest moments, they follow it up with some cheesy joke that just feels out of place.3. The humor is great as always. But sadly many of the jokes end up feeling less funny and more cringy. The tried to hard.4. The goats..... people either loved them or hated them...strongly. And they really went over board with the goats to the point of the joke lost its charm afterawhile.5. While Bale did an amazing job as Gorr. Again, the serious/dark nature of him was still lost or less effective due tot he constant humor. The contrast really threw things off.6. The story overall sort of felt all over the place and almost rushed. I hate to say it but the best parts were in the trailer.7. Lastly they really pushed the bounds of "out there" ideas from the comics. It had its moments of corniness where many said it was overboard. For example one of the gods we meet is literally a cartoony looking. Boa is the dumpling god. He has a anime look and smile. I laughed, but many thought it was just stupid. Moments like this were to much for most audiences it seemed.In the end, I personally enjoyed the movie. But I can see why so many felt the movie had some issues. I love Thor, I just hope in the future they resolve these issues. I think part of it may also be Taika Waititi's role in the making of the movie. As great as he is, sometimes he needs to have some more restraint.

title: wrong director wrong movie
text: On how we make everything funny in the movie. Very itchy.watchable only for christian Bale and guns n roses music. If the director hadn't doubled down on the comedy in the first movie, we'd be watching a better production.

title: Reviews seem too harsh
text: I get how people are feeling about this movie and phase 4 as a whole. However, to me this movie is very good. It's funny. It's wholesome. It gets a little dark. Others have said the jokes are juvenile, but so what? Being childish isn't a bad thing. This isn't just a movie for adults. It's an enjoyable movie if you're not trying to pick apart every last scene and judge it.

title: Saddening
text: Speaking as someone who jumps up to see every Marvel movie and T. V. show possible, this was just painful. There was no depth and any pieces that should have been serious were ruined by throwing in jokes that just didn't land. When I saw Ragnarok in theatres, people were laughing and cheering. With Love and Thunder, I think I heard 10 people laugh in a crowded theater?Russell Crowe, thank you for making this SO MUCH WORSE!!! The acting was awful, accent horrible and character development atrocious. Zeus was supposed to be the most powerful god and then a past-his-prime Russell Crowe came out, started talking in whatever accent he thought that was, and my husband and I just looked at each other and sighed. I truly hope that they NEVER use him in this role again. It hurt to watch.Christian Bale was probably the best part of the movie, but I agree with others that the "god-slayer" didn't really do enough slaying.They truly did Natalie Portman wrong in this movie. Everyone got their hopes up and she could have been incredible, but the writing just didn't push her to her full potential.Marvel, PLEASE stop trying so hard. Everything about this felt forced. Just like certain parts of Dr. Strange and Eternals felt forced.Overall, the worst Marvel movie I have seen. Hands down. I wasn't worried about the future of Marvel, even after slightly lackluster Dr. Strange 2 and Eternals, but now I am.

title: All gods must die
text: This wasn't as good as Ragnarok but still good. It was disappointing though. I thought the pacing a too fast and they could've dialed back on the humor a bit. Some of the jokes didn't land either. Christian Bale's Gorr the God Butcher was underutilized, but whenever he was on screen, his performance was spine chilling. He was definitely a better villain than Hela. What would've really added to his character is if they had shown him slaying the gods to show how much of a threat he is, rather than having it done off screen. The strongest part of the film was the dynamic between Jane and Thor. Their dynamic in the first two installments was lackluster, but in here we get more emotional weight that works so well. Natalie Portman was fantastic as The Mighty Thor. Overall, this wasn't as bad as some were saying it was but it's nothing groundbreaking either.

title: I really enjoyed this one
text: I wrote this comment cuz I see lots of negative ones, that don't reflect the overall score, right? I think they was written by die hard fans of whatever their are fanning. But I just wanted to see a movie, and I really liked this Thor.First it was funny. Like laughing out loud funny. Good jokes. Second the action was nice, non of this over the top endless fights. title: Hey, is that the Necrosword? That's cool. I've only ever read about it in stories.
text: Thor Ragnarok gave Thor's world the shake up it / he needed to keep the character interesting. Undercutting the requisite heroism with sly, at times anarchic, humour, Ragnarok delivered one of the freshest and best movies in the MCU.So how does Love and Thunder get it all so wrong? One word: Comedy. Whereas it's predecessor balanced the story and action almost perfectly with it's humour, here Thor's world is turned into an almost slapstick farce with every actor involved seemingly out to prove they can do 'comedy ' (yes, even Natalie Portman, unbelievably). Unfortunately, most of the humour falls flat as a pancake.Love and Thunder also manages to waste two of the biggest recent storylines in Thor's comic history and squander one of his best villains in Gorr the God Butcher. Thor himself has been reduced to a bumbling man-child, who spends the entire movie staring at Jane Foster like a lovestruck teenager with a hammer fetish.Talking of fetishes, someone involved in the film also has a serious Guns 'n' Roses obsession. The band are plastered all over this movie to a distracting level for some bizarre reason - tunes, posters. T-shirts all feature prominently, with even one character insisting he be called Axl! No doubt it helps Slash's retirement fund, but it's just another strike against the film.Overall, it's a massive disappointment and Thor needs a giant course correction if the character is to stay relevant and have any real heroic purpose within the MCU.

title: Nah.
text: Felt empty... Bale was great as always but... they should stop it before its phase 400, And you need to watch 78 movies to understand the storyline. You notice its money they want because the story...meh. 3/10.

title: Why can't they get a Thor movie right?
text: If I could give half scores, it's a 6.5.They don't seem to be able to get a Thor movie right, which I don't understand considering how AMAZING the cast is.Hemsworth is one of the best the MCU have to offer, he plays his character immaculately - and yet they still cannot hit a home run. Which is a HUGE disappointment.It's a decent movie, but forgetful. Extremely forgetful. The storyline was shallow, there is good humour yes and I get that it's a big part of the show, I love the comedy aspect but I need a properly told story with it - and I'm not getting one.Some elements were just silly, and the whole film seemed more concerned with how many one liners they could fit into the 2 hrs (which felt SO RUSHED, why not longer?), than they were with creating a storyline that the cast and characters deserve.I personally believe James Gunn is the man for these movies, but that's just me.If Thor is returning - give him different writers and different directors, because the current ones are failing to produce what could be a masterpiece.

title: When a director and lead believe their own hype.
text: Taika Waititi and Chris Hemsworth made the film they wanted without little consideration to character, fan or franchise loyalty and the end result was a film that cared more about lining up the next naff joke than telling a story.Unless Jojo Rabbit was a fluke and Ragnorak had more external input than we realise, TW clearly can make a good film when he wants to. Unfortunately it seems what he wanted to do with his latest Thor offering is either push the boundaries as far as he could, or dump on a franchise so much that it's beyond repair, or both. The result is a slap in the face to fans and another dent in Marvels credibility.Stick to vampire spoofs and stop vandalising comic book characters.

title: Not to be taken seriously
text: Love and Thunder is as enjoyable as its predecessor Ragnarok, but hammers away at humor to the point where the more serious aspects of the film feel like the break. This film is not meant to be taken seriously, and in many ways it makes fun of the superhero genre by further highlighting the already exaggerated and ridiculous nature of them. However, considering the serious topics the film revolves around, some may find the humor to be tasteless.

title: One of Marvel's top villains
text: The humor here is a little silly, but on brand for Waititi. If you enjoy laughing, and don't have a stick up your butt, then prepare to laugh. The visuals and music, despite losing some of their novelty, are still intriguing. The best part of this though is Bale, his villain is complex and frightening. More importantly, he juxtaposes Thor, a worthy god, perfectly. I was worried this was going to be a disjointed story, but it isn't. It is unique and doesn't feel rushed, and that is saying something for how much is here. The overall movie does leave you wanting more, but I for one am thankful for the barely under 2 hour runtime.

title: Taika and pretty much everyone else didn't really care
text: Totally completely irritating, the cadence of conversation making it obvious direction was pretty much the same for every jokey conversation. Thor is hard to like, heck all the good guys are hard to like. Bale's gorr is the best part, but totally underused. This is a movie that proves that the MCU has lost perspective. The decline on cohesion and meaningful stories is obvious. Maybe Feigi is burning out, but unless MCU does some serious reflection, it may be killing itself.

title: Bad
text: I'm getting more and more disappointed in the Marvel cinematic universe. Once I was completely delighted and even admired some films. Then the pictures became average, but they could be interesting. Now I see Frankenstein's monsters on the screens more often, screaming, trying to squeeze something out of themselves.It's always very difficult to find the line between humor and drama. And if the cinema can show both faces in one work and find the right edge, then it's just great. Taika Waititi has already missed the second time with a film about Thor. And if in the last picture it was still possible to really laugh or be sad, now everything is very bad (at the same time I just adore his film 'What we do in the Shadows'). Why, after a really sad scene, immediately give out a humorous, which is not even funny, but stupid? And so on throughout the film. It knocks down the whole pace of viewing so much that the finale is just bland and non-working. Our children have been kidnapped here, and we immediately move on to the idiotic showdown of Thor and Jane. Seriously?

title: Overuse of humour
text: My biggest takeaway - overuse of humour, and I'ma big fan of comedy. I loved the original Avengers because it was unexpectedly funny, but it hit the right balance of humour, drama and action. Even though, as an Aussie, I can relate to the humour, some jokes fell flat, almost cringey. I felt for the actors, particularly Chris Hemsworth, having to deliver some lines as best they couldI don't think I've looked at my watch before during a Marvel movie wondering how much longer there was to go, but about halfway through I found myself doing this.I wouldn't say it was a bad movie, I still enjoyed it, but it definitely not up to par with what I've come to expect.

title: Empty emotions

title: It's a largely okay movie pumped out by the MCU conveyor belt.
text: This is a great example of the MCU fatigue.This one feels like Taika Waititi wanted to inject more fun into his film but for me just came off as gimmicky and I got bored with the humor after a few minutes. The story is kind of just meh and the visuals are really bland but that is a staple of the MCU these days.Passable film but I was expecting more from Waititi.

title: Love and Thunder Makes a Loud Noise In the Theater
text: We've been waiting for this, Streamers. Thor: Love and Thunder has finally been released in theaters. The MCU is back before us with more content that we've been clamoring for. This movie follows Thor as he enlists the help of King Valkyrie, Bestie Korg and ex-girlfriend, Jane Foster, to fight Gorr the God Butcher, who intends to make all of the gods extinct.You know with these MCU movies we have to talk about the storyline and the bigger picture. First, a newbie could definitely just watch this movie and not be completely lost about what's going on. As Korg narrates at key points in the movie, he's able to bring us all up to speed. Secondly, I'm no comic book expert but to me this movie doesn't move the universe along that much if at all, which is good. I feel everyone is too wrapped up in how it plays into the phases and multiverse and blah blah blah, which just causes people to not be immersed in and entertained by the product in front of them (*cough cough* alluding to what people did to the Dr. Strange movie but no one asked me, so I'll move on). Lastly, this movie is full of heart. Thor, Jane, and Gorr will pull on your heartstrings throughout in unexpected ways. While some of their plot points weren't fully fleshed out, I recognize that it's hard to make these movies feel important after the emotional depth in Endgame. Nevertheless, Taika's direction and the writing definitely tried their best to fill the movie with heart and humor. Let's move on to the cast.Christian Bale does his thing as Gorr. He's so creepy in this. Bale has a way of slithering across the screen and being menacing even though he's not necessarily physically imposing. Marvel could've taken this to the next level in dastardliness, but it seems like the MCU is building to an overarching Big Bad and don't yet want to give us that Thanos-like figure. Who knows? We may have seen that Big Bad already, but the MCU hasn't truly featured them yet. Anyway! Thor, on the other hand, while goofy and fun, campy, and still beastly, he does come off a bit too corny. And, it's hard to say because some of the exact same moments are definitely going to be moments that people enjoy. The same goes for Korg as well. Taika does a great job voicing Korg, but at times it's a bit much or unnecessary. The fact that he narrates a lot of the movie could be a turn off to viewers. Korg is great in small pebbles but the whole rock mound gets a bit annoying. Our friend, Jane Foster can be annoying too but her bash head Thor-ness is definitely fun to watch. Marvel definitely found a way to make Jane come into her own and not just as a Thor carbon copy, which I enjoyed. I wish I could say the same for Valkyrie. They didn't really let my girl Tessa really shine in this movie. After Ragnarok, I think we wanted that boss chick featured again. Unfortunately, she was more of a bell and whistle than a co-star. Those are the people you come to see but there are a bunch of small characters that either melt your heart, annoy you a bit, make you laugh, or want to see more of. Srangely that mixture, actually gives a movie life. It's just Marvel doing Marvel things making you want more.Long story short, Thor: Love and Thunder while maybe not Ragnarok doesn't fall too far from the tree. Marvel, Taika and Kevin Feige just continue a strong MCU/Thor Franchise. This movie will make you laugh, hold on to your seat, awe at the action, suck back thug tears and more. Thor gets a bit corny but not enough to make me say don't see Bale's creepy Gorr the God Butcher. Love and Thunder will make loud noise in the theaters so grab that big box of fresh popcorn and enjoy.

title: Silly comedy, you can watch
text: Overall Marvel phase 4 is very disappointing and this film is disapointing too. I love Taika Waititi style and how he combin comedy and drama, but in this case the comedy is in way higher levels. title: Ouch!!
text: What has happened?? Thor may have some funny "moments" in the MCU, but the director managed to make Thor's greatest superpower in becoming a full time idiot. Plus, ever since Disney has become "political" they seem to forget the whole reason Stan Lee made most of these legends...to tell an amazing story!I mean, we watch and read about superheroes to get away from the world not bring more of its political agenda in it.Boooooo!! title: Awful
text: This is a Guns and Roses concert sponsored by Skittles. With a slugfest of bad storytelling, bad acting, bad jokes, senseless cameos, and terrible costumes, it's an unintended parody, and not a good one at that. It's a clown show monster mash on a Celestial Viking ship. This rotten apple will surely spoil the whole MCU barrel if not disposed of properly. I feel the pain of this breakup but my Thor love is over with this recent infidelity. What a shame that I waited this long for this bloated celluloid LSD trip.

title: A great First and Third act Let Down by the Middle
text: There is a lot to really enjoy in Love and Thunder. Good villain. Jane is back. Interesting plot. And then in the second act it feels like the Santa Clause 3 with the tooth fairy and Father Time. Improbable things even for an MCU movie. Or maybe it felt more like the Lego movie with all the heroes in the great hall. Either way, it killed the momentum and made it a farce before act three where it came back down to earth. Bale was great. Portman was good as well. It's just unfortunate that odd story devices were introduced to the movie. Overall, not the worst Thor movie, but nowhere near the level of Ragnarok. Waititi might be getting a bit of a big head and taking his directing a little too far. Bottom line... if you like Thor you will find things to like. It's an enjoyable movie with many great parts. It just has parts that really drag it down as well.

title: Was fine but mcu should do better
text: Looks like we have another divisive MCU film yet. Let me start the review with saying Thor: Love and Thunder's first act (or first half,) is indeed not great. The humor falls flat a lot, the CGI is questionable at times( this is actually a problem throughout the movie ) and I just couldn't shrug off the corporate-lifeless feel during those parts. I was patiently waiting for the movie to move onto the more interesting scenes. And luckily, the movie did! (Sort of)When the movie entered the 2nd act and started to focus less on comedy and more on action and emotions, my investment improved quite a bit. (Even though jokes were still there and they were still kinda cringe, but they were better than before) The battle of the Shadow Realm has one of MCU's most visually interesting choices, and I actually had to hold back my tears during the final moments, did not expect the villain to be the heart of a MCU movie. But Gorr definitely would have benefited from more screen time tho. Since he was basically absent during the second act. Even though the movie does have some emotional moments during the final act, I'd say one of the biggest problems of the movie is the lack of tension / urgency. A character supposedly dies or gets injured badly, but turns out it is not a big deal later on. Also, The movie sort of feels like a 'Stepping Stone' type movie. While the movie overall was fun, I don't think there were any meaning ful arc for Thor. After watching the movie I am more interested in directions the Thor character can go after this one.Overall the movie definitely could have been better, and lowering my expectations did help my experience I think. Same thing happened with Eternals last November. But just like that movie, it was overall a decent experience. I don't know about my feelings about the movie after some time passes tho.6.5/10.

title: I expected worse
text: Let me put it this way. I expected worse. Lately, Marvel movies haven't been reaching the quality they once did, so I wasn't expecting anything special, and that's probably why I'm not disappointed in the finale. It went by pleasantly quickly because there was a lot of action, which I thought was pretty epic in places, but there's just one catch. Story-wise, it's not such a joy anymore. There is a lot of humour. A lot. That's a classic with Marvel movies, but here there's perhaps I would say a little more of it. I generally don't like a lot of jokes in superhero movies. I prefer more serious superhero ventures, like Christopher Nolan's Dark Knight trilogy, but that's beside the point. There were several times in the story where one character was speaking to tell the story and that bothered me. I don't like it much and rarely like it, but sometimes it's cool, but here I didn't like it. Then as I mentioned the humor is really over the top here, which wasn't my cup of tea either. I don't want to spoil, but story-wise it wasn't a total win either. Well it was saved for me by the aforementioned action, which I enjoyed and which Marvel can and probably always will, except for Eternals. That was pretty damn weak in my opinion and Thor: Love Like Thunder is still fine in comparison. So, for me, a good movie that although I would recommend to Thor fans, I might not after all because it gets quite the hate. It's hard to say. My friends were really disappointed with this movie. I'm satisfied though and for me it was fine.

title: Massive disappoinment
text: I loved Thor: Ragnarok. I thought the humour in it did a great job counterbalancing the really dark subject matter (destruction of Asgard); the humour enhanced the film. I went to see Thor: Love and Thunder giddy with high expectations, but was immensely disappointed.The quality of writing in LaT in comparison to its predecessor is like particularly sordid fan fiction by someone who completely misinterpreted what made Ragnarok so great. (It's worth noting that Taika Waikiki did not write Ragnarok, only directed it. And none of the screenwriters from Ragnarok were involved in the making of this film.)There is no real plot. Dialogues are horrid, chock-full of very forced out-of-place elementary school level "humour". Directing, editing, and even a lot of the CGI feel like rushjobs. Most acting is bad. The only one who seemed to put real effort into this was Christian Bale, who unfortunately has very little screen time.To sum it up, Love and Thunder is an astonishingly bad movie. It is nothing but a cavalcade of bad jokes, pointless meandering, glaring plot holes, and degradation of the character that was Thor.

title: Its Lucky it Came out AFTER Dark World
text: This is a really weak follow-up to the magnificent Ragnarok. After the highs of Ragnarok, this movie is really a letdown. Only Dark World saves it from being the worst Thor movie.Chris Hemsworth is back as in-shape Thor. There is a silly montage showing him getting back in shape. He is bouncing around with the Guardians of the Galaxy before returning to New Asgard when it is in trouble. Tessa Thompson returns as King Valkyrie and quizzically seems incredibly disinterested in the role. Natalie Portman is back after missing the last couple of movies and she is supposed to be taking over the mantel of Thor. Even Jaimie Alexander is back as Sif, but her role is so small and inconsequential, I'm not really sure why she bothered. The new villain is Christian Bale as Gorr, the God Butcher. He is okay in the role, but the character doesn't really elevate the movie the way Kate Blanchet did in Ragnarock. Even Russell Crowe gets dusted off to play Zeus...yea, the Greek god. And its cringe inducing.Oddly, there is almost no chemistry between Hemsworth and Portman in this sequel. Their romantic scenes have no spark and Portman seems so detached. I got no sense that they were in love. The events in the move have almost as little spark as well. There is nothing that hasn't been done in prior movies and it felt so blah. If this was not an established part of the MCU, this movie would have bombed...hard.One highlight is Matt Damon, Liam Hemsworth, Sam Neill and, even Melissa McCarthy, as the Asgard actors doing plays about the events of the previous movie. It was pretty funny, but when the highpoint of your movie is a small callback to the previous film, you might have a problem.

title: Christian bale Carrie
text: Fun movie but not a good movie worst marvel movie so far the only reason I give it 6/10 is cause of Christien bale he Carrie's the movie so this movie is baaad.

title: Doesn't need to be amazingly written or plotted. It's fun!
text: Thor: Love and Thunder was a fun, enjoyable Marvel Studios flick that showed not every MCU movie has to tie into a major plot line for the next big team up or villain.This movie is almost its own side story within the MCU. It has very little contributions to the rest of the MCU and has little impact. And, honestly, I like it that way. It feels refreshing, light, and easier to watch for viewers who have not kept up with the MCU's ever-increasing library of projects.This movie does not have an amazing, touching, or perfect plot. There are logical fallacies, there are lazy plot devices, and there are so many cliches done over and over. But that's OK. Because this movie never wanted any of those things- it simply wanted to deliver a hilarious, Thor-centric story from Taika Waititi's amazing directing mind. These other reviews are insanely idiotic for not understanding the point of film- it is purely based on enjoyment.This movie has an objectively weak plot. I will not deny that. But it was never intended to be anything more. This movie is a Romcom, through and through. Shallow, maybe, but hilarious all the same.And just like Thor has done before, I say "another!" to you, Marvel Studios. Thor's not finished quite yet, and this movie leaves me excited to see where they will bring his character in the future.

title: Terrible!
text: Very disappointing! Very stupid! And whoever decided it was a good idea to cast Natalie Portman as some sort of goddess needs to give their head a wobble! Worse marvel movie yet!

title: What a huge surprise
text: To be honest, I am sick and tired of most of the neverending line of even more superhero-movies. More often than not, they are pretty bad "movies" with non-existing plots, but an overload of CGI instead.The first Thor-movies were okay-ish because of their sense of humor and often tongue-in-cheek dialogues.Still, I could have done without any more of them. Or so I thought.Whoever put it into Taika Waititi's hands, will hopefully have a say in more of the coming movies.This was pure comedy, sometimes even slapsick. Neither the movie itself, nor the characters take themselves seriously at any point.I can totally see, where the relatively low rating (6.6 at the time of writing) comes from.If you really liked the "old" Thor movies, or Marvel in general, this might come as a shock to some.It's very different and even more over the top than the "Guardians", but with just as good music.I for one, was entertained throughout and will likely watch it again soon. Not because it was a "Thor"-movie, but because it was just great fun to watch.All I am saying is, GOATS!

title: Comedy all the time
text: The expectations were high, Thor Vol. 4 and there are the Guardians of the Galaxy in in? That must be a great movie. And on top of that, Taika Waititi again as director? Perfect!It's a funny movie. The character of Christian Bale is interesting and I'd like to know where the evil actually came from, such information could give the whole movie more content. Could.It's like a long movie of about 3 hours reduced to 2 hours and they cut all the good scenes and left the funny parts only. I still don't understand what Marvel/Disney is up to. Just produce a couple of movies to make some money? Possible and understandable. But the result is precisely that, unfortunately. Watch the rates on imdb, currently this movie has a 7.0, but it's more a 6.0 movie.

title: The irreverent fall of Thor and Marvel
text: Undoubtedly the Marvel Universe has nurtured us with many interesting and entertaining movies. But it's already been months, if not years, that each production is worse than the previous one including TV series. Rehashes, threadless plots and increasingly meaningless. They had already given us an irreverent and, for me, unpleasant line from Deadpool, but this installment of Thor is really falling into a pit of mediocrity; I was tempted several times to leave the Cinema. The film has a great collection of great actors who I don't know how they agreed to participate in this fraud (They are only reason I gave one more star). It had a lot of potential, especially with the return of Jane Foster, I think that if Mr. Stan Lee came back and saw what they were doing with his "Universe" he would send them all to an alternate one. I had already promised myself not to see more of Marvel, but I thought Thor is Thor, I never imagined that they could do something so bad and without head or tail. RIP Marvel!!

title: A Breath of Fresh Air for the Genre
text: The first 1/3 of the movie or so, I wasn't really feeling it. Then all of a sudden it felt like it found its footing and it transformed into something special. If you want a typical superhero movie that takes itself very seriously this isn't the movie for you.I'm so glad this movie wasn't a bunch of people in tights acting like this latest super villain and their menacing CGI Army is as serious as, well, cancer. Which isn't to say it doesn't have a super villain, it has a sensational one that Christian Bale really poured himself into. And to be share, it has plenty of CGI minions, too, but here all of that fades into the background and the movie really finds itself when it becomes a story about two people coming to terms with their past, present and future. Life, as it turns out, is what happens while you're busy saving the universe.If you want something different, you just may find what you're looking for. Thor: Love and Thunder wears its heart on its sleeve and doesn't apologize for it as Taika and friends dare to tell a story about loss, love, and the search for meaning, with space goats and somehow, they pull it off. I found it to be a breath of fresh air.

title: Almost felt like a parody...
text: Firstly, this is an entertaining movie. That aside, I wondered if I was watching a rehashed 1990's romantic comedy rather than something belonging in the MCU. Granted there are some fantastic set pieces and battles, but unfortunately the storyline and humour level are way below what I was expecting, given the last Thor movie was Ragnorok (a riot).Some great cameos playing the 'actor' parts of Thor, Odin and Loki, but the biggest shock was Russell Crowe as Zeus!Fortunately there are not too many out there who still worship the Greek Gods, but I am certain there will be some areas of 2022 society that consider his portrayal as blasphemous.Overall, a decent couple of hours entertainment, but don't expect it to influence the MCU in any way going forward.

title: Boring with no imagination
text: One tone actor Hensworth is so boring i fell asleep . They guy can't act in any decent, Thor is it for this guy . Mind you I want his money . As for the movie it's the same old superhero cliche tgats been done to death . Unfortunately CGI has made actors and directors lazy that hoes hand in hand if the lack of imagination.

title: It's not great is it.
text: I love Chris Hemsworth as Thor, I can't imagine anyone else playing the part but the comedy is ruining the franchise, it's getting more and more slapstick.It is entertaining in parts and I thought Christian Bale and Russell Crowe were both very good, but I was disappointed to only see the Guardians of the Galaxy for a few minutes, I am not a fan of Tessa Thompson at all, she is way over rated in my opinion, And didn't Natalie Portman once complain and say she didn't want to be in these movies? So they decide to make her female Thor? Terrible idea, she's another overrated actor.Oh and I hated the screaming goats.

title: Overall a great movie
text: This movie has great moments and great comedy, however a lot of scenes and story points in the middle feel odd, as well as an ending with a slight twist, that isn't all that. This shows promise for the future of the MCU but cuts branches down of what could've been in the future as well. I'd still rewatch and enjoy the movie, but all shock factor is gone after the first time watching it.

title: Not that bad
text:
It's actually a good movie it's not bad as ppl describe it
Let's break down
Storyline 6/10 not the best one
CGI & Graphics 10/10 yeah Marvel got the best CGI
The villain 10/10 Christian Bale gave life to the movie he's the brightest thing u will see in this movie
Leading characters 8/10 Except for Zeus yeah he's bad
Music 8/10
Ending 10/10 The ending and Christian Bale the biggest reason's u should watch it
So far it looks like a very good movie so where's the problem yeah u guess it its the cheap Comedy who ruined the whole movie with the story
Comedy -10/10.........................................

title: Still (not really) worth to watch
text: I'm starting to feel the MCU really lost it in writing a decent plot for their theatrically released products after Endgame. I would say Marvel knew they has a lot of loyal fans so they wouldn't bother to write a decent plot for their films anymore because they knew people would still watch their films no matter how bad they are going to be.Visually, the film was really great alongside with the scoring. While the characters and the story line felt very rushed since the first phase of the film, should've been extend the duration to avoid those problems. Unnecessary jokes also ruined some good moments for me throughout the film.Marvel's CGI quality has been getting worse and worse since Black Widow released (excluding Eternals), and Thor: Love and Thunder has the worst CGI quality so far, on par with No Way Home.

title: if you liked previous Thor movie you will love this
text: Yup colorful, full of jokes movie. That was quite a good experience to be on this journey together with Thor. Sadly, I had huge hope for Bales bad guy, but it wasn't so bad, but I had feeling that it was inspired by Joker. I feel that despair, but I was not so bad. MCU is lacking a real bad guy like it was Thanos.Overall, I was pleased with good vibe, colorful script, looking forward for a Taika Star Wars title.

title: Top marks for Bale, less for the other
text: Taika Waititi has a problem. In the wake of the amazing Thor Ragnarok, where does he take the franchise? Most of the original MCU Avengers have retired, yet the sparkles, the Lord of Thunder, is still putting in the work to change odd bod into god bod. Following all he has lost - parents, brother, friends, planet - he has a lot of issues that he needs to work out. And into this mix comes Gorr, played by an amazing Christian Bale, who challenges Thors strength and other emotions, with his own quest. And in the middle of this epic grudge match of god and god killer, steps Natalie Portmans Jane Foster, reintegrated into the Marvel fold following the falling out over Patty Jenkins, and given a much more beefed up role than just the scientific side kick and love interest. Her transformation is straight out the comics, and not to be questioned, though given all the space magic we've seen in previous films, it's good to see Kat Dennings asking some good questions.But the main conflict comes from the Asgardian weapons; despite throwing Mjolnir to Captain America in End Game, it's obvious he still pines for the only object that properly pull him off and there is a lot made of that, to the point it does get juvenile. In fact, quite a lot of the script reduces the thunder god to a doey eyed hippy, which placed against the sinister Gorr - channelling a combination of Voldermort, Marilyn Manson, Joker and other creepy bad guys - makes the story leap from yelling goats and All Spice adverts, to shadow monsters and dead gods. Russel Crowes Zeus sounds like Borat, and while his scene is one of the better set pieces in the film, it does feel like it could have gone bigger.Marvel have access to a vast array of computer generated content, and there are some amazing set pieces, space ships and battle scenes, though I was left wondering if they'd tried deaging Hemsworth and Portman, that left neither actor looking that great.It was a fun pop corn film, with plenty of comedy and action, though tinged with sadness that Bale didn't get more screen time,.

title: Not good
text: Seemed to be written by 6 year olds, for 6 year olds. Jokes are relentless, very forced and not as funny as Taika clearly thinks they are. The storyline is extremely weak. There is so much awesome material to use with Thor, and such potential to make grand epic adventures, but instead they choose to make basically a parody. Christian Bale tries hard to save this but is not given enough screen time . Overall this movie is utter nonsense, tries WAY too hard to be funny, and proves that phase 4 has a severe quantity over quality issue.

title: MCU FANS ARE GETTING BITTER
text: I can understand why many hate MoM, Eternals, Ms. Marvel, or Hawkeye. But i really don't understand why many hate "Love and Thunder", cause i truly love it. Y'all love "ragnarok" but dislike "love and thunder" while both of the movie being very similar. For me Love and Thunder is even richer and more creative. I think it's not MCU quality that is reducing, but the fans expectation that's getting higher. Y'all get stuck on endgame and want every new movie to be on endgame level. Instead of setting the standard, we should focus into the new/fresh idea that MCU bring to us. We are on the new build right now, it's like intermission after the peak. Don't get too rushed.

title: Cringeworthy But Still..
text: Plenty of characters got almost no screen time.. that was my biggest issue.. and some got way more than most of us probably wanted. And yes there are scenes that are overly stupid...But. I was still thoroughly entertained...

title: Waste of money
text: Waste of time and money. Audience and I laughed only once during the movie, which was the hammers scene. The story is really boring and meaningless. We ladies even walked out during the movie. Can't believe this was made from Marvel. Don't understand why they put Jane into a woman version of Thor, absolutely ridiculous.

title: Flawed Thor movie
text:
Well, this is the first time I wasn't very impressed with a Thor movie... I have a lot of good things to say about it but it had flaws as well... many flaws!Visually, this was a great movie. Settings were amazing and it looked like a real Thor movie. I suspect, not having read the comics of Thor (yet), that this movie came closest to what the comics look like...
We get a lot of new characters (lots of Gods) and see some return (lacking a few familiar ones as well, as they died in previous movies) like Lady Sif, Darcy Lewis, Erik Selveig and of course Jane Foster... and this movie has one of the best villains ever brought into the MCU, Gorr the God Butcher!But they don't use him and his acquired powers enough. The focus on this movie lies too much on the comedy side and the relationship between Thor and Jane aka Mighty Thor. That's all fine, I love both, but this movie needed more scenes where Gorr did the butchering! It's not until the third act in the movie that we actually see Gorr do his thing, when fighting Thor, Valkyrie and Mighty Thor!The movie has some Guardians of the Galaxy kind of vibe at the start and then it strays away from that path as well... so it feels like we are watching three different kinds of movies in one, which is a bit confusing if I'm honest. So yeah, it has flaws.The music by Giacchino is spot on, so that's good!My favourite scenes are the meeting with Zeus and then the climatic battle with Gorr... those will remain in my memory best...
So not a bad movie but I expected more, if I'm honest...

title: Too much cheese!
text: Overall this was ok. Visuals are always stunning and I really liked Jane's story arc.Just too heavy with the jokes! That works in GotG but not Thor.

title: Mystery Science Theater 3000 Proof
text: Marvel/Disney has to decide if they're trying to make good movies or just have a good time at viewers' expense. Like many of their other movies, Thor: Love and Thunder hovers on the cusp of being good, but can't seem to get out of its own way. Everyone involved seems so focused on having a good time making the movie that they have forgotten that the movie is for the audience. The Mystery Science Theater 3000 crew could not do a treatment of this movie as everything they mighty say is already said. Potentially great themes are wasted in this way. Why should the audience take it seriously if the movie-makers don't?That said, one strategy for enjoying the movie: going in expecting a 2/10 movie and you'll be pleasantly surprised.

title: Ruined
text: Disney is systematically ruining the MCU with its wokist nonsense.Just like star wars and every other film they churn out it is designed to appease the 0.05%

title: Hilarious wild and compassionate ride!
text: A perfect balance of humor, dread, action, and love. Definitely one of the better marvel movies out there. Such a diverse universe of characters and tropes that range from different species, religions, and backgrounds with finding no two alike. The ending was fulfilling and graceful. Can't wait to see how they continue the story!

title: Huge dissapoinment
text: Those jokes... like this annoying random guy at the party who thinks he's funny and keeps joking while everyone just dream for him to shut up. As a big enthusiast of MCU, I'm super disappointed. I kept thinking it was like someone was trying to follow the mood of Guardians Of The Galaxy but was just really really bad at it.

title: Really good
text: Loved the movie great cgi and the cinematography in the shadow dimension was amazing but Gorr's backstory seemed rushed in the beginning if it was up to me i would've spread it out through out the movie.

title: Fun & Enjoyable
text: Based off initial reviews I was expecting to walk out of the theater demanding my money back from Marvel and Disney, but that was far from the case! "Love and Thunder" isn't on the same level as "Ragnarok" but it is far from the MCUs worst. While the plot could have used more work, and the rise of Jane could have been developed more, this was still a fun and humorous viewing experience with great visuals, especially in the costume department. All of the actors do a good job, and it's especially fun to see Natalie Portman in a superhero roll.

title: for children only
text: This film was very disappointing. It seems to have been written for pre-adolescents. Thor was a bumbling fool most of the film. I wanted to walk out early but stuck it out. I really believe that the the MPAA rates films to make sure people are old enough to watch, they should also rate them for ages, like board games do. This film should have been ages 5-16.

title: Enjoyable but huh?
text: This movie is enjoyable. You can laugh all the time. You can say it, a comedy movie in a superhero disguise.The CGI was ok, the scoring is good, and the plot is ok.I enjoyed the first-hour movie laughing because I knew thor is a funny God and he's strong and whatever but it got me like "what" when he easily knocked down Zeus and stole his thunder. And so on. And I think this movie lost its villain potential.I enjoyed this movie so much but I can tell this isn't Marvel's best movie. There are a lot of things that they can make better.

title: Good
text: First off it was nice to see Thor again! He made the movie. But after that there's not much to say. Definitely not the Thor I remember. That's ok. He has transformed through the times and he still great.

title: Love, tragedy and over the top comedy.
text:
Thor's affable and humorous personality is such an enigma in the MCU considering that with each movie he ends up losing something dear.1. His mother
2. His father
3. His home - Asgard
4. His brother - Loki
5. His Hammer
6. And now finally the love of his life - Jane.Yet the character perseveres through in a almost romantic and jovial manner! The movie overall is good but seems lacking or rushed.The antagonist Gorr is great but not epic. Jane as Mighty Thor is good but could have been great.Thor himself is at best going through the motions.Zeus is weird and silly. Unlike the Liam Neeson version, here he is almost bafflingly lame for a god of his stature. The comedic tropes are cool but now stagnating a bit. If this is the first Thor movie you watch then it is decent and pretty good but after having watched Ragnarok it felt like this one missed its mark. Still it is an entertaining 1 time watch and it has its moments.

title: Worst Superhero Movie Ever?
text: I'm a fan of Hemsworth, Bale & Portman and a huge fan of the Marvel Comic Universe, but this movie was awful. Great actors did what they could with a putrid script, laced with unnecessary, irrelevant content. In the modern era, the first Fantastic 4 movie held the bottom spot, but I'd much rather watch that and the 1977 Spiderman TV movie over and over and over again, than to have to sit through this movie ever again. Please get rid of Taika Waititi and Jennifer Kaytin Robinson and never let them write any superhero movies ever again. I will never get that 1 hour and 58 minutes of my life back.

title: The Punch That Marvel Movies Needed
text: Never before has a Marvel movie existed that contains all the elements of a Marvel Movie while being so fun, witty and laughable. Taika Waititi has made a movie which brings together the epic nature of Thor with a ridiculously funny and unbelievable script. Yes, it might seem childish and offensive to the franchise, but let yourself like it, this movie is really a work of art.

title: Missing Loki
text: The glaring thing between the first three Thor films and the fourth is that Loki is not a part of it. The relationship between the brothers was complicated and compelling. It made dialog between them rich and often comic.For a time I've felt the proper titles should have been "Thor and Loki" since Loki was an integral part of the films.That's a major difference in Thor Love and Thunder and Thor Ragnorok. Ragnorok is often attributed to the director, but I believe it wasn't just the comedy as much as finally a return to the close relationship between they shared at the beginning of Thor.'Nuff said'

title: So silly movie
text: One of the worst movies I have seen lately, what a stupid story and a stupid action movie ,any movie Disney participates in makes the fans lose their passion and interest to continue following their heros.I think Disney need to get out of cinema business so we can get back to movie theaters.I expected to watch a nice action movie ,found myself in kids cartoon movie like film,what a lame .And they have to add their touches to ruin any movie .Seriously,it is a bad movie .

title: Weird ?
text: Almost every part of the film including the editing was done in a shallow manner. The writing wasn't too horrible, but the movie became absurd due to an excessive amount of jokes. My experience wasn't saved by the visuals or the soundtrack, but it was still on a pretty good level.

title: Almost worst marvel movie
text: Thor wasn't build up to expectations worst Thor movie. Weak script weak graphics jokes wasn't funny do not waste your time and money.Almost worst marvel movie Ever.

title: Enjoyable rollercoaster
text: Watched in 4DX. 3D element was cool.Overall I enjoyed this.Most of the humour hit home.Its action packed and moves at a fast pace. A bit too fast - I lost my way in the middle - too much going on, then it came back together again.The over use of Guns n Roses songs was a bit tiresome - the songs are 35 years old and been used in loads of other films to similar effect.Taika Waititi is very talented but he is at risk of becoming over exposed here - his humour is everywhere, he is the narrator, he voices a main character...The film has a taste of "we can do absolutely anything we want and back it up using some kind of link to ye gods because we are clever" - I like that, but I have seen others dislike it for that reason.Christian Bale is good. Nice to see Russell Crowe and his comedy accent. Natalie Portman is great.Seeing the Guardians of the Galaxy at the beginning kind of reminded me I'd rather be watching a movie about them!I think its a very different Thor movie to the first couple but I enjoyed it.

title: Good one time watch
text: The Movie Above is above Average. It is a good one time watch but disappoints because I had higher expectations. Many scenes were cut. I don't know why they wanted to keep it under 2 hours. The comedy in the film is good but it lacks good action sequences. Chris Bell has done a good job as Gorr but Gorr is not given proper character development and gets very less screen time.

title: Out of tone
text: A disappointment I would say. It had the means with a great villain and Jane's character arc to be serious but we make another funny and a bit dumb movie. It had the potential to be something great but it was just mediocre. As a huge marvel fun, I am very frustrated. I think they are focused on making more than making it good.

title: WTH did I just watch?
text:
Dumb, simplistic, cheesy, dumb, badly written, dumb, did I mention DUMB???? Oh, and boring. I think it was supposed to be funny, but nah. Dumb!The writing is so bad, I have to wonder if this was some kind of joke! It's actually insulting to my intelligence. Also, badly acted. Good lord!Astrid... Axel... Astrid... Axel...T: Zeus
J: THE Zeus?T: Yes
J: ZeusZeus...Horrible timing - comedic or otherwise. Costumes that seem intentionally Halloween-cheese.The emotional parts of what Jane is going through are contrived and simplistic, much like everything else.Even Christian Bale's talent couldn't save this dumpster fire!

title: Taka waititi is an artist
text: Taka Waititi, I will never forget your name. You are a real artist. The classic Thor adventure takes place in a humorous and balanced context. Everything indicates that there is some kind of perfection in this film. Imagination is experienced in a completely enjoyable way. But the key of the film is Gore and his characterization which makes the film even more high. We have less here than ever, certainly less entertainment and more art. Less than ever because advanced entertainment tools are not used according to the audience's wishes, and when we say that we have a work of art here, it means that we are actually facing a balance in their feelings and romantic characterization. It is really the best joke that we can give an example in the history of cinema. Taka Waititi is a stylish director. And having a style is an important thing that makes the image form and uniform. The story does not suffer from false emotions that destroy the entire structure of the story. I mean, it doesn't deviate from the beginning of the movie to the end of the movie. And that focus is what Taka Waititi has perfected. Even in the great stories that we read from classical literature, for example, this focus is not present in the entire structure of the story, and this point is very important. There is drama from the beginning of the film to the end of the film and that is what makes this film a masterpiece. And again, we have to consider that we are watching a Marvel movie. And the ground for doing such work is hardly prepared. Another thing is face painting. The facial expressions of the characters in the film stimulate our senses in a wonderful way and serve the script. Taka Waititi has won an Academy Award and several Emmy Awards for hit series. But clearly his best work is this movie. No matter how many times we see the movie, we are caught by more things. And this means depth. Artwork must have depth. I always keep this point in mind that the work of art must have depth. Not by flipping the script and creating artificial complexity in it. The depth of a work of art comes from a complexity that is not artificial. For example, in this movie, the three main characters deepen the story. The rhythm of the film also gives depth to the film. Chris Hemsworth adds emotion to the film. Natalie Portman gives it a deep sense of humor and Gore balances it. Everything in the film becomes form and there is no trace of defects in it. Let's face it, Marvel needed a change. Now the She-Hulk series had an excuse. But why should such a movie get so much hate for no reason. It's not just about Marvel fans, hitters have a problem with work form.Result: The cooperation of two big companies, a professional director and an excellent acting team seems to be quite successful. And it leaves no doubt that the maximum result we can get from a cooperation in 2022 is something like this.Any opposition to such a matter only makes it worse and does not stop it at all. Of course, the last part of the sentence is also dependent on several other things that do not fit on this page.

title: Colorfull but Average!
text: Its vibrant and so colorfull with it the silly jokes it sometimes made me think its a kids movie but with too many adult punchlines. The story was decent but the execution felt little rush, The old characters return jane and her friend and sif with it thor's journey with guradians was nice, The CGI was too brilliant specially the golden temple and some gorr's scenes they were eye-pleasing,The gorr was awesome but it felt underused just like other marvel movies villians, The zeus and other gods portrayal was little amature-ish and with gorr's arc it could be awesome but the whole terror was missed with the fun vibe of movie and with the jane's arc although it was good on paper it needed more runtime to proper cover all the plotlines without that it felt kept going just like that although The Love and thunder reveal at last and the final act was amazing, the mid credit was awesome and end credit was decent. Overall it was a missed opportunity but a decent movie!

title: Look at the box office
text: This movie was very heavy and involved us at every moment. I don't want to say which movie it is better than. But I have never seen anything like this. I see more of it every day and this movie has fascinated me. It doesn't let me think about anything else. And I only watch this movie for a few days.Thor and his adventures have fascinated me like crazy. No poem can properly describe the beauty of this show. Every moment it becomes more beautiful and reaches its peak. We have succeeded in developing the seventh art. The criteria certainly did not feel the sting of it. This movie is extremely heavy. There is an outpouring of feeling in it. Like a canvas painted by a painter in the 16th century. How is such a thing possible? This movie is extremely heavy. Every moment it gets heavier and it can no longer be tolerated or it is hard to bear it. How is it that this film is so beautiful and at the same time so heavy.Thor does not feel pain but is full of pain. He does not show his pains. Taurus is shy but smart. He speaks like a real hero. He is very shy in love and does not miss anything. Everyone loves him. This movie is very heavy and there are different emotions and feelings in it.

title: This is no Ragnarok!
text: The previous movie Thor: Ragnarok is comfortably one of the top tier MCU offerings. Primarily due the injection of some really excellent well written and performed comedy aspects. To me it seems that this new offering was determined to pile more and more comedy into it and as a result the movie is unbalanced and can't quite make its mind up what it is! There is still much to enjoy but there is a missed opportunity here. Thor comes across as a bit of a buffoon essentially. Natalie Portman is the heart and soul of the movie really and gives an excellent performance. Christian Bale is a menacing, scary villain but we don't see enough of him and the ending is rather contrived and poorly thought out! Tessa Thompson is underused too. As I said there is still much to enjoy but maybe next time a little less humour and higher stakes for our hero is called for!

title: wasted opportunity
text:
I think taika is not the correct director for Gorr's story line.He is supposed to be a butcher and here in the movie everybody is laughing.It was supposed to be serious for some time atleast instead it was full of mediocre humour
Bale did justice with his role.Otherwise there is nothing in this movie
nor its a good standalone neither it serves anything to mcu.

title: Funny but with many flaws
text: The initial Thor movie introduced the Marvel hero to the cinematic masses. It presented a bit arrogant prince, his family and his world. Thor 2 is one of the most underestimated movies of the MCU universe. Thor is now more mature and his relation with with brother is developing marvelously. Thor Ragnaroc was the best Thor movie, with great plot, music, CGI, and a main hero who was reaching the peak of his wisdom and power.The first problem with current movie, is that it doesn't seem to belong somewhere. It seems stray like the rest of the MCU movies after Endgame. It's behind Ragnaroc in almost all aspects, except from humor which may be good, but it starts to destroy the recipe for a balanced movie.The second problem is the backs and forths on Thor's character development. By now, he should be wiser and stronger than ever. Instead, he seems to be as naive and arrogant as in Thor 1 and as strong as.. Thor 1. That's not good.I think Watiti falsely let his protagonists to be so relaxed and silly on the shootings, and this applies both to Chris and Tessa.On the other hand, if you want to simply get entertained with some good action and want to have some good laughs, well - with the exception of the sad substories - the movie is hilarious and I caught myself unable to breath on a certain fight scene with certain sounds from certain animals.I just hoped to see something better, and maybe a small Loki appearance.For the rest of the cast, Christian Bale as a consumable 1-movie villan is great, and as a Greek, I surely wasn't offended by Russel Crowe's accent. I was only offended by the trailer describing and promising a different movie than the one I saw! But it's still good!

title: Movie flattered to deceive
text: Personally I think the movie was a bit of a disappointment after the hype. Let's begin with the positives however.PositivesBale put in a stellar performance as Gorr. I am glad his children convinced him to do this role. A villain with an actual legit motive. How about that ! However it does feel like he is a little wasted in the movie, and the usual decent performance from the cast. Portman is impeccable as Thor.The vibrant visuals and the soundtrack killed it.NegativesThe movie seemed so rushed and fast paced it feels a little messy and the plot just seems kind of weak. It does attempt to slow down and delve into the more emotional side of things between Thor and Jane.. But it is still at least much better than the pile of heap that was Eternals lol. A forgettable movie in my opinion that lives in the shadow of Thor Ragnarok.

title: Overconfident director tries lame comedy.
text: I heard Waititi doesn't read comic books to make these movies, which measns this cocksure director feeds his typical and repetitive garbage comedy into these great comic book stories. Gorr storyline is one of the best Thor stories and one of the best comic stories out there, but Waititi went his own way of changing charcters and story to present a dull movie. There are lot of going on this movie but only serious charcters were Jane and Gorr. Others are acting witlessly through out the whole story. Minute after minute, Waititi hits us with a lame joke that tend to break the story's consistency towards seriousness.

title: Another masterpiece from Taika Waititi
text: L&T is another Waititi masterpiece. 10/10. Guess the "critics" don't like Taika anymore. Movie has it's ups and downs, but overall, I love it. Taika rarely dissapooints me. Ragnarok, Jojo Rabbit and now L&T r all masterpieces IMHO.

title: Third Act Woes
text: I absolutely love everything Taika has done and Thor 3 is one of my favorite MCU movies - but this one has 3rd Act problems.In a romantic comedy, of sorts, the relationship was taken for granted and not built. A kiss and a few montages doesn't magically make us feel their love.Too many distractions in final act kept the audience from being with Thor & Jane to really feel those powerful moments in the end. An extra 15-20 minutes of relationship building would have gone a long way. And I say this after watching Thor 1&2 with Jane before watching this one.Also Zeus/Russell Crowe was just weird. I get that you wanted to make him "different," but you got the Gladiator to play Zeus and you took away his commanding presence/voice.Still... many great laughs along the way, Hemsworth is always great as Thor, Bale was great too, shadow monsters were cool, and imagery mind-blowing. If it all meant a tiny bit more, it would have worked.

title: Total Campy Fun
text: All camp and a whole lot of fun. Lots of cameos from the Marvel Universe. Thor is charming. Thor is beautiful. Thors are mighty. Thor collides with a quest for love. My exit interviews, of approximate 20-25 people, yielded scores from 8 to 10 (with two 11s). I had a blast! I give this movie a 9 (total campy fun) out of 10. {Marvel Superheroes}

title: Decent Fun
text: There isn't a whole lot to say about this film. There's a good amount to like about it. The electric guitar tracks are great and give the film a consistent vibe of childlike fun that compliments the action. The action itself is well done, the visuals are absolutely breathtaking and the comedy I found to be significantly better than Marvel's average attempt.However it was otherwise very average. The plot was incredibly linear and didn't have the character depth to adequately fill the gap that left, and I found the antagonist to be overly basic for a character who has gone through as much as someone like Thor. That said, the film is occasionally quite touching, particularly at the end, which is the most important part.Overall this is a very simple feel-good action movie and a good bit of escapism, but definitely not a masterpiece.

title: Lightning doesn't strike twice for Waititi and friends
text: I am admittedly a big fan of Taika Waitit, and I liked Ragnarok quite a bit, so I was pretty excited for Love and Thunder. Unfortunately, after watching it, I can only say that it is a mere shadow of its predecessor and is lacking in many departments that make this movie anything more than a fan-service sequel that cannot stand on its own as an individual film.The film is of course not without its pros. Christian Bale does not disappoint with his introduction to the MCU as the villain Gorr, with a powerhouse performance that makes the character both a sinister, vile being but one who you also sympathise greatly with due to all the things that happened to him. Natalie Portman is also great as Dr. Jane Foster who shows she can kick some ass and there's good chemistry between her and Chris Hemsworth. Korg is as usual always a treat whenever he is on screen, and the brand of silly Waititi humour is still charming more often than not, with the story also sneaking in a surprising amount of emotional depth at various moments.Where the movie falters the most is that it just seems too inconsequential and devoid of substance. Many of the character developments are rushed, including that for Gorr and Dr. Jane Foster, where there is enough exposition to know who they are and what they want but not nearly enough for me to be attached. Gorr is supposed to be this monstrous god-killing being but we are hardly shown any of that in the movie, and for Jane we barely get to understand her backstory and her past relationship with Thor (apart from some flashbacks). Coupled with some more hastily rushed through scenes that includes a weird cameo from the Guardian of the Galaxy and one fight sequence with Thor, where both parties are not seen again for the rest of the movie, I found myself caring less and less as the runtime went on and was just left feeling hollow and unsatisfied when the credits started rolling.Overall, fans of the original Ragnorak will still find things to enjoy in Love and Thunder, but the latter only has the spice and seasoning of style and humour without the main course of proper story and character development. Still, you will probably have good fun watching it because it is a Waitit movie. Here's to hoping that his next venture will be a bit more inspired than this one, however.

title: Finding it hard to rate.
text: I'm finding it hard to rate as there's parts of the movie I really enjoyed & I was never bored during it, the storyline itself is fantastic, cannot fault it at all and there's some scenes in there especially at the end that are great, but execution of the storyline is not always great, there's so much unnecessary silliness that at what first I smiled at soon wore thin, it's never ending, in moments that needed to be a bit somber or serious it's just there and rips you out of the moment.Bale is great, creepy as hell and also found myself and I'd guess others too found a lot of sympathy for his character.CGI is typical phone it in marvel phase 4 production, the little care they're showing it now I think is an insult to movie goers.

title: Huge disappointment...
text: Christian Bale is awesome, the fights are good... the rest is terrible... I would've loved to see the same story but not as a cheap CW comedy. It seems like a huge waste considering the budget and the cast.

title: The mighty Thor has done it again!
text: I absolutely LOVED it. It was well put together with lots of comedy, action and love.When I first saw Gorr the God Butcher, I was like, where have I seen this Batman mouth? Then, I came to realized it was Christian Bale. He nailed the role! The way he crawled, spoke, and sneaked... making the character extra creepy and freaky!Natalie Portman was great too with her role. She looked buffed. And of course, how could I leave out the mighty Thor. Buffed and still a comedic genius. In short, this movie was worth watching on the big screen!Looking forward to more from the franchise! :)

title: A thunder arrives
text: In Taika Waititi's most recent adaptation of "Thor: Love and Thunder," there are both serious stakes and humor. The humor, especially the mocking man-mountain, really makes it. The way the tone alternates between profound seriousness and deathly seriousness won't be to everyone's taste. Taika Waititi, the filmmaker of "Thor: Ragnarok," deserves praise for treating everything as lighthearted entertainment. The "great bits" are Turn-the-Tide brawls set to Guns'n'Roses' Greatest Hits, and they only occur once in each of the film's three acts.

title: Keeps getting worse
text: Each Thor movie keeps getting worse. My wife actually convinced me to see this one as she loved the first Thor and was excited to see Jane as Thor (and because fat Thor is gone). But even she hated the movie. Jokes weren't funny, too much profanity for a "family" film franchise, mentions of orgies and gay rock creatures? Bale was actually a pretty awesome villain but it's wasted on this joke of a movie.Really, after Endgame it seems like Phase 4/5 MCU films' first priority is pushing minority characters and progressive ideologies at the expense of entertainment and good storytelling. What a shame.

title: Pretty crazy
text: Pretty crazy describes Thor: Love and Thunder pretty well. I was a bit overwhelmed at the beginning of the film and didn't really get into it until I found my way in. And with the humour, which is sometimes very crazy for some people, I could imagine it being too crazy. But it did pick me up.I think the story is well done and the villain is understandable. The film has some good emotional moments too. You shouldn't expect too much from the Guardians in Thor: Love and Thunder or you might be disappointed. So let the madness overtake you, I can recommend the film.

title: From an Action series to a comedy...
text: Thor: Love and Thunder is the fourth installment in the Thor series. I have only watched the fourth one and I think this was a great action comedy! Marvel tried definitely to make something else and they did. I have never seen a movie like that in Marvel. Great humor, great script and dialogues and the story is catchy and interesting, with good sudden changes and fine romance. After what I have heard and read, Thor was an action series which wasn't mean to be a comedy. But this movie, it was a lot of it! A lot of ironic quotes, slapstick and much more! I think this movie is a great starter for you if you are new to this universe. You do not have to watch it chronologically, because they explain everything in the beginning and I think you will have a great first impression! Why do I give it 9/10 instead of 10/10? Because it was a post credit scene, that is a sneak peak for the next installment, but I think this movie ended so well that continuing it will be bad. That's the only little problem. But without that, it is great!

title: Bit too much of a... good thing? I don't know.
text: Thor: Love and Thunder does its best being a true sequel to Ragnarok but the key elements are missing this time around: and that's Thor's buddy-relationship with his brother Loki. Christian Bale's character is like a stand-in for God of War's Kratos in terms of archetype, make-up and also fees like a 'campy-go-grumpy' stand-in for Tom Hiddleston's iconic trickster.There's stuff that works here, and stuff that doesn't. It's like a birthday cake that's got too many flavours in it all at once instead of being squarely triple-choc or vanilla; instead it tries overdoing the sweetness without distinction of flavour or craft. That's Thor: Love and Thunder, a film that tries being more by doing the exact same thing pretty much. It's feel-good without ample risk, but at least the typical MARVEL sense of fun is still there. It may not be inviting for anything particularly inspired, but this Thor film is determined to reinforce the character as a mainstay from here onward.This film has spark, but no real sense of awe beyond the action spectacle. Thor may not be as tried-and-true as other more established superheroes out there, but there's clearly room for improvement in the future.Thor: Love and Thunder gets 3/5 stars. It's the standard MARVEL-fare that's become a to-be-expected box office hit.Clearly MARVEL's formula is being called out by some; it works for others, but some see through the innately formulaic structures starting to get in the way of these adventures feeling fresh and inspiring. It's not a bad film at all, but long-standing characters deserve (and don't have any real right to be denied of) character development and expanding the creative horizons of their respective world.Even satisfying candies refine their formula to make themselves feel less 'complicit' with ordinariness from time to time.

title: Like bad fan fiction
text:
Couldn't wait for it to end. Extremely disappointing, since Ragnarok is one of the best MCU films. This one has a big Hiddleston-sized hole - he was a great foil to Hemsworth's Thor.Tessa Thompson and Kat Dennings are both underutilized, Hemsworth and Portman continue to have zero chemistry, and the jokes felt like a comedian who is opening a set - and bombing. Just an all-around train wreck. I'm just
disappointed that I paid for tickets and given the MCU's record as of late, next time I'll wait until I can stream it.

title: A lot of fun and lots of surprises!!
text: It's a super entertaining movie! I was surprised to see Christian Bale. I feel silly saying he did a great job because ..duh.. he's Christian Bale LOL. The cameos were hilarious! A few corny scenes here and there from Thor himself but I think that was intentional. I enjoyed seeing it in the theater with my family. I appreciate the laughter and smiles :)

title: Disappointing!
text: Way too sarcastic. Thor was a serious movie before. I don't know what's wrong with marvel, but they are getting worse day by day after End game. It's more of a comedy now. They are destroying every character. I was expecting a better movie, but disappointed.

title: Comedy without meaning, but with its moments
text: 70/100This is a hard film to review. I'm not sure what it is about Thor L&T but I just didn't find it that funny. I felt like they tried so hard to push jokes out and they often didn't land with me.I think there were too many jokes right at the start, it became obvious that the dialogue only served for humour reasons and because that failed to land with me it took away any storytelling or narrative immersion.The film is still entertaining and it definitely gets better by the second act, even the comedy improves once 'Jane' is introduced into the story alongside Thor. There are great action scenes and the film definitely doesn't feel too long. I think it's the perfect length.The villain is the best part of the movie, Christian Bale portrays his character extremely well. I will say, it felt very clear that Natalie Portman had only been contracted for one marvel movie. Immediately we are met with her character in a terminal situation which implies she won't be returning after the movie concludes. Maybe they could've made it a little more subtle.Overall, this movie is alright. It's funny at times and has enough action to remain entertaining and compelling, with some neat cinematography here and there, but not the greatest marvel movie I've ever seen.

title: Kept watching for Bale
text: The beginning of the movie was promising... And then it quickly went into the over-saturated comedic relief we are bombarded with seeing in most Marvel movies now. Moments cannot be their own, tragedy, astonishment, shocking, no. You have to "lighten it up a bit". Sometimes you need to let a negative moment just be a negative moment? This comes across as just another "amusement park" movie.The character development is simplistic, dull and shallow for most of the movie. No complex conversations or complex thought processes of approaches are taken toward the adversity. The story wants to be deeper, but it's rushed in important scenes and crammed with filler jokes and unnecessary banter . Bale almost seems to be overdoing his role, until you realize the other characters were just written so poorly in the story, compared to his.I love Taika's other personal projects, but I am not a fan of his Marvel projects. Seems like they (Marvel or Taika or both) really wanted to make this movie more for the kids than the original audience. That would explain the avoidance of adding anything more profound and simply making it entertaining enough (but Disney and Marvel have had many profound engaging G and PG-13 rated movies in the past, to have an excuse).
