title: How Tonal Inconsistency can Ruin a Film
text: Expectations were high when the movie was announced, with many fans looking forward to Jane Foster's Mighty Thor being brought to the big screen. And I have to say, Natalie Portman brought a much-needed breath of fresh air to the character. Like most characters in the previous two Thor films, Jane Foster felt very bland and her chemistry with Thor wasn't believable. However, in Thor: Love and Thunder, we see the two spend time together doing normal things a couple would do. This makes it all the more heartbreaking when we see how they broke up and cathartic when the two are reunited.Before watching the film, I was most curious about how well Christian Bale's acting would mesh with Taika Waititi's direction. And I have to say, Bale is perhaps the best aspect of the film. Not only is he a master actor who's rivaled by few, but Gorr is a genuinely interesting character. If there's anything that everyone can agree on, it's that Phase 4 of the MCU has some of the best villains. Gorr's character motivations are very clear: he wants to kill all gods because he believes they are inherently selfish beings with no regard for their followers. If you take a look at various religions across history, he has a point. Gods are often portrayed as morally ambivalent and are not paragons of justice.When I watched this movie, I felt like I was watching two different movies at the same time. The scenes with Gorr are very dark and somewhat horrifying, with Gorr becoming more and more corrupted by killing gods. Bale's performance wavers between camp and downright horror, hell, he'd even scare The Scarecrow with how terrifying he can be. Yet whenever it cuts to Thor and his friends, it's always bright and colorful. These cuts almost felt like sensory overload in how different they are. Not to mention the plethora of typical MCU-styled jokes littered throughout the film detracting away from any tension. Which brings me to my next point. The lack of tension in the film. I never thought for once that any of the main characters were in any mortal danger.Besides this lack of tension, I felt that Thor's goofball nature is dialed up even more in this film compared to Thor: Ragnarok. Thor was funny even when a situation doesn't call for it. Although Chris Hemsworth is naturally funny, seeing Thor act funny in dangerous situations started to grate on my nerves. While Waititi is a very talented filmmaker and actor, and the performances, especially Christian Bale's, are superb, Thor: Love and Thunder feels hollow compared to some of the MCU's other Phase 4 films. With conflicting tonal shifts and excessive humor at times when it wasn't appropriate, it appears that lightning seemed to have missed its mark with Thor: Love and Thunder.

title: Worst Marvel movie?
text: This is up there with the worst marvel movies I've ever seen. And I've seen externals! It's a tacky affair with no sense of direction and no real message. The script is cheesy and is riddled with terrible, out of place dad jokes. Not even Christian Bale gets a pass, that is how bad the acting is. And what's up with that AWFUL accent Russell Crowe is doing?The story is all over the place, boring, empty and presents several logic flaws. The cgi is horrible and the grey shadow realm filter just felt shoehorned in because all the movie is focusing on is visuals, and it hardly pulls that off. This movie is beyond a tragedy.

title: Enjoyed at most
text: Seen more than many negative reviews, I thought it was enjoyable, screaming goats cracked me up!At points it felt the pace was a little slow, a tad more action would of made it even better! But definitely worth a watch!

title: Rushed and empty
text: The story wasn't great and it felt rushed and empty. The part that felt the most rushed were the characters especially Gorr and Jane. Cgi was ok for the most part apart from a few scenes where it was just garbage. Fights were either very short or in dark places where it was hard to see what was happening. Soundtrack was pretty generic. Overall it was an ok movie with some problems that was relativly fun to watch.

title: It felt like Harry Potter 1
text: It was nice over all but a lot of the movie was cut off.I am looking forward on watching the full 4hour version.And over all I felt I was watching the first Harry Potter movie.

title: Slapped together woke BS
text: This movie does not fit into the legacy of the other movies- it's weak in its story line and way too much side razzle- dazzle. Thor is jacked in this movie- that is good- way better than skinny or fat Thor, everything else in the movie is a reach or is trying to be woke. title: Less godly to Ragnarok but still great
text: Much messier in execution compared to Thor: Ragnarok, but the humour and style of Taika Watiti keeps it going strong and Russell Crowe was a highlight. Also good uses of music too.7.5/10.

title: Lacks real emotional connection
text:
There is just something that feels off with this latest Thor iteration. Thor: Ragnarok got the mix of comedy, story and playfulness just right. This one goes too far on the parody side, and makes fun of itself too much. Worse, the comic side does not mesh with certain parts that are meant to give weight to the story. It just feels off and some of the comic elements just don't work.It's not terrible, it's just not good either.The good bits.Christian Bale is amazing, much of the time you forget it's him. Gorr the Godslayer is actually an interesting bad guy, with pathos and reasoning behind his actions.Hemsworth is good and has fun, I particularly enjoyed the emotional issues between him and his axe. However, at times he plays it too light and it just becomes one long self reverential joke that you are sick of half way.Korg is fun, but could have done with some paring back. He begins to grate as it goes on.The bad
Russell Crow as Zeus with awful Greek accent that is more racist than anything. I mean Thor doesn't speak with a Scandinavian accent nor do any of the other Gods. Doesn't help the part is pretty crap anyway.The goats. Funny for maybe 30 seconds, after that I wanted them in a stew.The mediocre
Postman's issues as an actor rear there head, she's ok but vacuous and unconvincing as lady Thor
I loved Valkyrie in Ragnarok, but she is often under used in this and lacks the park in the previous movie.Goes on too long, could have been paired back.So in the end it's not a terrible movie, has some fun but ultimately just feels a bit off and too self reverential. I think the gloss on Waititi is finally wearing off and he is doing too much, and a lot of the same.

title: It's only gonna get worse
text: Absolutely deranged, inconsistent, broken piece of colorful garbage released by disney. All familiar characters defiled and humiliated. Nothing makes sense, humor can be appreciated only by drooling morons or kids up to 10 years of age.I predict that every next segment of the mcu will be worse than previous. Truly a conveyor of disney's product line. Quantity over quality.

title: Okay so why the hate?
text: First time review but what's the hate with this movie?Okay so Thors an egotistical, self absorbed rock God. Okay I understand people wanting him to be more serious....he's Thor! But if every Marvel movie takes every character so seriously.....then things will get boring, quickly! Now if you dont like a God's fighting dramatic fight scenes (with a sick soundtrack) , throwing thunder around like no one's business , finding love with another sick ass charter to the MCU! Great actions scenes, great laughs interesting storyline that was very unexpected. A great watch and a lot of different emotions! A must watch!

title: Just for fun
text: This installation of Thor is just a fun movie. You enjoy the jokes, the ridiculousness of other worlds and other gods. Thor is no longer the serious honorable viking god who used to be funny cuz he was too serious in casual situations... he is now intentionally goofy (not sure if I like that)There is good use of Guns'n Roses songs which I grew up with. Even my children think it's catchy, good intro to some oldy rock music.Some serious plotlines were wasted, though, unfortunately. The God Butcher (Christian Bale) is a badass villain, and the return of Jane (Natalie Portman) could have been so much more. I feel these two were wasted in what some reviews have already harped on... a silly movie. And so, the dialogue was not such sharp comedy, but mostly goofiness for cheap laughs. Even the remaining Asgardians seem like a bunch of refugees of idiots. That's why this movie is just for fun while waiting for more serious developments in the Marvel Universe.

title: Thor: Love & Thunder
text: Marvel has finally jumped the shark. They have had no idea what to do with their product after Engame. I thought this would have something to do with the multiverse seeing as that's the route they've decided to take but nope, nothing here on that whatsoever.The film is essentially a "comedy" but not one joke was funny. I laughed at the movie rather than with it. This movie really pointed out that these movies are very goofy and should be not taken seriously as with older films. The scene with Russell Crowe, I laughed so hard at the embarrassment all these actors must've felt doing it. In front of a giant green screen acting like complete fools to entertain no one.Speaking of the CGI, I'm not sure where Disney put all their money into this because is wasn't for the CGI. Everything and I mean everything in this movie is built In a computer. I'm pretty sure even the hospital scenes with Natalie Portman were in a green screen room. At one point in the first act Thor & Mighty Thor are talking and I swear they digital deaged both Natalie Portman & Chris Hemsworth to make them look better. I know they do this in movies now to get rid of wrinkles and stuff but it was so blatant and distracting I couldn't help but be baffled at what I was seeing. This is by far the worst effects I've seen in a marvel film hands down.That leads me to the action scenes, first of where were they? Whenever someone had to fight I honestly could care less. It was so boring and the villains shadow monsters were completely trash and forgettable. The action is not existent in this. It's really beautiful people standing in front of a green screen improvising every single word of dialog. I'm truly embarrassed for this film.So Thor, he honestly should've ended his screen time after endgame as well along with Ironman & Captain America. I don't see how he fits in the future of the Universe at all. If you were going to keep him around I would've much rather of seen an entire film with him with the Guardians of the Galaxy & working with James Gunn. Speaking of, no one should direct the Guardians of the Galaxy but James Gunn. The scenes with actors from that film are all off with a different director. All the characters just felt off in this movie and that lives and dies with Taika Waititi. Now I like his films, he is a great filmmaker and funny in general but the tonality of this film is just all over the place and he really isn't a great fit for this anymore.Now the only and I mean only saving grace in this film is Christian Bale hamming it up in spectacular fashion. The film was only ever good when he was on screen. Far and beyond the only interesting character in the entire film and he's honestly barely in it. Just a complete waste of his talent.So from here I have no idea what marvel is doing. Their "storyline" is all over the place since Endgame. They better figure it out quick because this was just a mess from beginning to end.

title: It's alright, but if it were the last Thor movie, I'd be fine.
text: I don't mind there being humor in these movies, but this just felt kind of looney, and not in a good way. I laughed at a couple of things but I didn't laugh that much at all throughout the movie really. And that makes the approach taken with it that much worse. And let me just say that the running gag with the goats was not that funny at all. I don't think there was one time where I was actually laughing at it, but I was amused by it once and then every time after that I was just like "okay it's old now". I liked the performances, and I think the movie mostly looks good for the most part (although I do think these movies are starting to look the same now). You got Christian Bale, one of the greatest actors in the world to be the villain. I don't like how he was used here. Bale was great, but Gorr the Butcher was a disappointment. Taiki Watiti said he was going to be the best MCU villain ever. I know that's the kind of thing that directors say about their own movies, but I at least thought he was going to be one of them. I understood his motivations, but as a villain, he didn't really do anything. He was hardly in it. The "god-butchering" took place off screen. And Russell Crowe was a cartoon as Zeus. Honestly, as much as I love the Guardians of the Galaxy, they didn't need to be in this either. They were used to be part of the set up concerning what Thor was going through but I'm not sure if they really had to be. I feel like they just did it so that fans can get a whole hype train going before the movie comes out and say "oh the Guardians of the Galaxy are going to be in too!" and then they're in it for like 5 minutes or so. Speaking of them, let the Guardians of the Galaxy be the Guardians of the Galaxy. What I mean by that is I feel like the direction that the Thor movies are taking are because they want to emulate the success of the GotG franchise. That franchise deals with humor better though because it feels baked into the personalities, whereas with this movie it brought things to a halt at times. This movie needed more balance and nuance. If this is what we can come to expect out of Thor movies going forward then I'm not really looking forward to any solo outings with the character, even with what the mid credit scene suggests. I did like some of the action in the third act though.

title: Another enjoyable outing for Thor, but ...
text: This is a welcome return for the God of Thunder, playing up the comedic tone established in other recent outings but also giving us a reasonably scary and compelling big bad in the form of Christian Bale's Gorr the God Butcher and a moving depiction of Natalie Portman's Jane Foster struggling with cancer and finding her inner hero. It's fun to see Thor's interactions with the Guardians of the Galaxy and great to see him fighting back from the rock bottom he hit between Infinity War and Endgame. Chris Hemsworth does a lovely job of depicting Thor as a superficially oblivious heroic meathead, while giving us glimpses of the character's underlying vulnerability and brittleness after his world and family has been systematically destroyed. He, and the rest of the cast, give us plenty of laughs along the way. And, perhaps unsurprisingly, the chemistry between Hemsworth and real-life daughter India Rose as Love at the end of the film is just adorable.Unfortunately, despite its many good points, the film is marred by self-indulgence. Director Taika Waititi's character, Korg, who I've enjoyed in previous films, it turns out is better in much smaller doses than we get here. Too often we descend into cheap jokes or clunking parody, eg about Thor's "dad bod" at the start of the film and Russell Crowe's cringeworthy Zeus. At its best, the film successfully both upholds and affectionately sends up comic book heroism, but it sleepwalks too often into the obvious gag or cliche. I do hope we'll get to see Thor again, but also that the mixed reception to this film will be the wake-up call needed to prompt a more thoughtful and interesting approach to his next appearance.

title: Not the best but not so bad...
text: While this wasn't the best Marvel movie, it wasn't as bad as a lot of people made it to be. It was ok. Found myself on my phone a few times.Hemsworth acting was great and so was Portmans.Bales acting was great but I just couldn't connect to his character much. That character could've been much deeper with such a great actor, he should've had more screen time to furthur explore his arc. It was a missed opportunity.The whole Zeus thing could've easily been excluded. It didn't do much for the story IMO. Weakest link was probably that.Other than that I thought it had a good balance between comedy, action and drama.

title: Time to drop the hammer?!
text: And you thought Thor 2 was bad?!Entire cast phoned it in, but the script was also trash. Endgame really was the end of marvel movies. Thanks a lot Thanos.

title: Good enough
text: I thought I was bored of Marvel movies but this movie changed that a bit. Definitely an improvement over the last 2 or 3 movies of the MCU. Hope they keep improving the writing instead of rely on cameos.

title: Could've been better
text: The movie was empty in many sort of ways. The love theme in the title with the introduction of the Mighty Thor was not upto the excitement of the fans. Of course Natalie Portman was great at the role and the emotion at the end saved the part with some sentiments. Tessa Thompson as Valkyrie was really good.The extreme use of humour was enjoyable upto a level. It was way too many jokes and because of that the plot and sentiments didn't worked well. Along with another reason that was the pace seemed to be rushed.Christian Bale nailed his role and that made the movie epic.

title: Waititi = one trick pony
text: I'm starting to wonder if this movie is some kind of epic piss contest from Waititi to see how bad he can get before someone has the balls to fire him for good. Really this person has an Oscar?!

title: Entertaining but hollow
text: A late review, but better then never. Thor, well an Asgardian god, after all the battles and fights, coming with a twisted humor and different from previous editions.Thor coming up with jokes and liners in this edition, the seriousness is not there and with all this attempted humor, you may find, this beautifully made experience a bit hollow.Regardless, it is a must see movie, long way from Thor I through avengers till here, so it is not suppose to be missed.Yes, there at some points in the movie that you really wanna just get over the movie, but the end is worth it.Guns N Roses songs did put up a different flavour and taste into the movie. Just that didn't like the way Zeus was presented.Furthermore, there can never be a better Thor then Chris HemsworthPeriod.

title: What Walts Watching
text: What I liked about "Thor: Love and Thunder"...it's killer big hair soundtrack.What I didn't like...the daggy dad jokes that just were too try hard and so corny i swear I could see a corn cob hanging out of the mouth of whoever uttered those unfunny lines.You will laugh in this movie because the Kiwi director & writer, Taika Waititi is at it again after the success of "Thor: Ragnarok".They've given him cart blanche and he sold his soul.Chirs Hemsworth goes from Dad bod to Dad jokes in one training session in which he's amassed the most muscle ever for Thor.So much so his co-star Chris Pratt from "Guardians of the Galaxy" is ashamed to stand too close in scenes because he looked puny in comparison to the Aussie All-Star.In a nutshell: Thor enlists the help of "King Valkyrie" (Tessa Thompson), "Korg" (Voice of Taika Waititi ) and ex-girlfriend Jane Foster (Natalie Portman) who becomes "Mighty Thor" ( no spoiler alert it's in the trailers) to fight Gorr the God Butcher, who intends to make the gods extinct with his mighty Necrosword.Christian Bale as "Gorr" is one of the best horror elements of this stand alone Thor movie that doesn't really propel the MCU along anywhere.Frankly though I'm finding the fight scenes in Marvel a bit of a snore fest after 29 of these movies...time to shake it up as Tay Tay would advise.Watch out for: Russell Crowe as "Zeuss" in the naked Thor scene.Why is it not cultural misappropriation when a Kiwi can bung on a terrible character Italian accent (sounds more like the Mario Brothers)?I'm confused.The whole Guardians bunch drop in on this flick not just "Peter Quill" and wait for a special appearance from 2 other actors in the end credits Easter Eggs.I just wonder what Stan Lee would think if he were alive today to see whats happening to his creations.Maybe he'd just laugh all the way to the bank like everyone else involved in this project.It's already made its ridiculous $250 million budget back in just over one week at the worldwide box office.Which is great for the Australian film industry because a lot of it was filmed here in Oz at Fox Studios in Sydney.A part of me thinks Thor should have stayed in retirement in the New Asgard.

title: THORoughly enjoyed it but...
text: The latest entry in the MCU and in the Thor universe doesn't disappoint but neither does it wow. I absolutely loved Cristian Bale's performance, he genuinely is one of the scariest MCU villains in my personal opinion. I loved the Chemistry between Chris H and Natalie Portman, and the fact that Natalie became the mighty Thor was also pretty cool. However, apart from good performances, and some good cgi the film was missing a bit of magic. I can't quite put my finger on it, but something more was needed to make this film absolutely amazing. I would say people should definitely watch it in the Cinemas but also that they should wait.

title: Why so many haters?
text: Do people not like to laugh in the movie theaters anymore? What did they expect from Waititi after Ragnarok?This was exactly what I expected and it did not disappoint. I missed not having Loki and The Grandmaster, but it was still fun! I can't wait to watch this few more times with subtitles when it comes out on Disney+!

title: I dunno!
text: I rate it 7 because I like it but sometimes I dont get how their universe works? We all know thor travel and conquer other worlds, have seen magical beings or magical things but can't cure sick Jane? I dont know if other worlds have cancer too? When thor knew Jane have cancer they got back to earth to cure her cancer Thor didnt think any other worlds who have so advance technology or magical potion or something that can help Jane, But NO we gonna get back to earth that we all know who dont have technology to cure cancer. That's the only issue i got about this film it feels like the drama between thor and Jane are force. Sorry about my english. English is not my mother tounge! Hope you understand.

title: Horrible
text: The plot was so cartoonish and felt more like someone had a political agenda and needed it into the movie at the cost of the plot. Thor was a bumbling fool the whole time and the plot was ridiculous and jumpy. Loved the idea of Jane becoming a Thor but it didn't need to emasculate Thor to do it.

title: A fun Thor adventure
text: One of the main reasons to go to this movie has to be Gorr. This is because Christian Bale really plays the part very well. I'd say that Gorr really is one of the best MCU villains.Jane's return is also really, really good. Jane is also more fun in this movie than in the previous movies in my opinion. I just think the reason why they become the mighty thor is a bit disappointing.There is also a lot of fun humor in the film. You must love it. If you didn't like the humor in Thor: Ragnarok, you're not going to love this movie.I honestly think this is one of the MCU's most emotional movies. The ending in particular almost made me cry. The story ends really sadly.

title: Missing something...
text: I already knew going into it, Thor: Love and Thunder would not be able to match the lightning in a bottle that was Thor: Ragnarok. But from what I had already gathered online, if you are a fan of Taika's humor, (which I am) you'll enjoy this.And I certainly did, though this was perhaps the first time in a while i actually felt a Marvel movie was going TOO fast. I often feel like they're drawn out, but this was almost breakneck speed. Normally I'd be all down for an economically produced picture, not wasting time from one scene to another, but knowing the source material (largely Jason Aaron's comic run) there is a TRILOGY of movies worth of story that could have been made. And by cramming it all into 2hours, it felt like just about everyone was underserved.So, I still like Thor: Love and Thunder. I had a good time. Money well spent. But I was hoping for something with a bit more depth, a bit more substance, and I yearn for what could have been.

title: A god movie that is god awful
text: Marvel finally went too far and turned Thor into a comedy instead of a superhero movie...and they failed miserably. Marvel completely wasted the talent of Christian Bale, arguably one of the best actors in Hollywood. The GOTG were just a ploy to get people to come watch the movie because they are only in it for about the first 7-10 mins. Definitely the worst Thor movie so far.

title: It's Fun, and that's about it
text: The ongoing adventure of Thor after Endgame.It fun, I'll give it that. The characters are all generally enjoyable, I think Gorr is a better Marvel villain. However, like most other reviewers say, it's not the most deep or introspective piece. It's simply a fun action adventure movie.It's probably still worth a watch, and it may gain more attention over time, but for now, really only die-hard Marvel fans need to watch it.

title: Cool
text: "Thor: Love and Thunder" has all the ingredients to be the best superhero movie: a simple righteous ideology, a classic male lead, humorous adventures, action sequences. Excellent action, good soundtrack, and especially, a great villain.

title: WTF is this garbage?
text: 15 minutes into the movie and almost threw up. Marvel over exageration with idiotic jokes ruin something that could be good. Not funny at all, total waste of story and visuals. Bale is the only one appearance in this movie that gives a break on some level to stupid jokes.

title: A different kind of a marvel movie
text: To be honest the movie was not what I expected, it was quite different from the normal usual marvel movies that we have all watched so far. I know that a lot of people didn't like it so much but it was not that bad like people are saying in the reviews here. It is more of a parody than an action movie. I found the humour very funny, the movie wasn't taken itself too serious and why not trying something else? I mean it is not like I wanna have all marvel movies made this way, but 1 or 2 marvel movies like this once in a while why not I would find it cool.Christian Bale as a villain pretty much nailed it again, he is so incredible skilled at incorporating characters, I just love watching movies where he is in.The movie is worth watching it, but be prepared to see a different kind of marvel movie than what we used to watch :)

title: Not the best but still enjoyable
text: I quite enjoyed it, was shorter than expected but overall a good movie.It's better than the second but anything is hard to top the last one.Best Marvel movie this year by far and looking forward to where Thor takes us next.

title: Thor is an utter farce
text: First time in my life I've ever walked out of a film half way through.Every moment played for laughs, I just felt my heart sink every time something looked like it could be really cool, but then turned into yet another joke.There are no words.

title: Frequently entertaining; welcome back Jane!
text: THOR: LOVE AND THUNDER (2022) *** Chris Hemsworth, Natalie Portman, Christian Bale, Tessa Thompson, Taika Waititi, Russell Crowe, Jaimie Alexander, Chris Pratt, Dave Bautista, Karen Gillan, Pom Klementieff, (voices of Vin Diesel & Bradley Cooper) Frequently entertaining Thor vehicle in the MCU with the still-nursing-his-heart Avenger facing an intergalactic crisis with the threat of Gorr The God Butcher (scary good Bale) hellbent on a vendetta to wipe out the gods that be and kidnapping the children of Asgard as collateral damage. Enlisting the help of his ex, the cancer stricken Jane Foster (Portman in a welcome return to the fray) who has embodied her own version of The Mighty Thor in the process, they team up with their old cronies Valkyrie & Korg (Thompson & writer/director Waititi) to do justifiable ass-kicking battle. While the visuals are still triumphant buoyed by a Guns'n'Roses jukebox the film labors until its final (and surprisingly poignant) act.

title: Childish mess
text: In short: way too childish, way too many clichÃ©s, American humor is very questionable (and very predictable) - and I am American. Bale - yes... The rest could rest. Effects are great, but seen some and they don't glue this movie together... A bit messy... quite a bit... Sigh!

title: Too many gags...
text: Great individual performances from the incredible cast but unfortunately the themes of mental health, relationships and grief which could have made this film excellent were completely lost in the shockingly bad gags every that seemed to assault you every ten to fifteen seconds. The Thor Ragnarok style humour is there but it's sandwiched in between so many puns, gags and dad jokes that it just becomes desperate. A real shame as I was so excited to see this... as stated previously Bale, Hemsworth, Portman and Thompson are excellent and there are some wonderful cameos from Russel Crowe and others but the script let them down. It's worth a watch if you're a Marvel fan but don't expect a masterpiece.

title: It's okay, but quickly becoming another marvel formula
text: Same time as Ragnarok and the same jokes. Not a bad movie but not as good as Ragnarok. Everything just seemed to be lacking something, the film seemed a bit empty.

title: Super fun! Why can't movies just be a good time?
text: Colourful and Fun!The 4th Thor film and 29th in the MCU. Covering themes of love, loss and grief.Chris Hemsworth returns as Thor, with Tessa Thompson, Taika Waititi returning. With Natalie Portman, Russell Crow and Christian Bale. All performance is brilliant as always.Thor seems to be the go to MCU films that are just fun, which I believe is needed. Just a switch off your brain and enjoy and laugh. Feels a bit like a extended music video for some 70s and 80s rock classics. Who wouldn't love that.Yes the costumes and props look over exaggerated and clunky but it's a film about God so what do you expect.I have a soft spot for all the kid scenes, super cute! If you've seen it you know what I mean.Just because it's not majorly thought provoking doesn't mean it's bad.

title: Almost worthy
text: There is a great MARVEL worthy story in this movie which has been lacking in the last few things they've put out. There is also a funny movie in here. This movie seemed to be a compromise between two factions that wanted a good marvel movie and a comedy. It didn't suck, but it didn't have a consistent tone and I could never get engrossed in the movie because it kept shifting between world ending kid murder and silly jokes. I like both both but you got to pick one.Disney, get the footage and make another two movies and publish them on Disney plus. Do one with the dumb scenes and another with a real marvel movie. Both could be enjoyable and you'd get tons of views plus social media will have a great debate on which should have been the real movie. Cost you nothing.

title: Embarrassingly bad
text: Thor Love and Thunder is a massive failure. Like Ragnarok, it doesn't take itself seriously. Unfortunately, in this case, the jokes are just not funny. So while Ragnarok carried its audience along through its humor, Love and Thunder fails to do the same, and the audience is left staring at a not funny film that doesn't believe in itself. Soon enough the characters abandon the screen and the worst risk of all superhero movies materializes: all you see is grown-up people in superhero costumes. It's embarrassing for the actors (aren't you a bit old to be wearing superhero costumes?) and by reflection, for the audience.I find that poor directors can hide their weaknesses for so long, and Takia Waititi is one such director. His most famous films, Jojo Rabbit and Thor Ragnarok were generally weak, but went by, disguised in some humor that worked okay. Without that artifice, the gaps of Waititi as a filmmaker are fully revealed in this new Thor.

title: PLEASE learn how to enjoy a movie
text: There is no doubt movies will never hit EVERYONE's spot. People have different visions and expectations, and can't always please them all. Dr. Strange in the Multiverse of Madness was too dark, this one was too fun and joyful, Eternals had both but was perceived as boring. There's just no winning is there?Thor has been through A LOT, from losing his whole family, to his home, his friends, the love of his life, so this could have gone two ways: shutting down completely and becoming a shipwreck of a man, or try and move on and help others in need so that no one has died in vain fighting all those villains. He chose the latter and began all sort of adventures filled with action and humor. This is what this film was. A great, amazing story and a fun watch, we got a bit of everything and I for one am extremely excited to see the next one. Taika Waititi is gifted, talented and I do hope he directs the next ones as well.Those 1/2 star reviews are irrelevant, don't listen to them. Go enjoy a great movie and keep an open mind.

title: Love and Blunder (It's a parody right?)
text: I'm really not sure what they were trying to do here... it's a funny movie but I don't think it was supposed to be. If you took out Christian Bale's performance "Love and Thunder" is more akin to SpaceBalls than any Marvel movie. The "comic relief" feels painfully forced and it gets old quick. There was a lot of potential here for a fun Thor movie but it came across as more silly than anything else. The plot was there but the script seemed like it was written by a 14 year old who likes fart jokes. It could have been worse but it also could have been a lot better. Overall disappointed hopefully Marvel can recover from this one.

title: Entertaining
text: This film is all tongue and cheek. It never takes itself seriously. That was an attribute that I appreciated most of all in the film. There is a central theme to the film too, it is about the toxic nature of hatred & holding on to grudges. It offers embracing love and forgiveness before it is too late.It did pain me to see Russell Crowe as an over-the-hill Zeus. I guess I will always picture him as Claudius Maximus from Gladiator.Christian Bale was phenomenal as Gorr. He really had the best transformation. I didn't recognize him until much later in the film.Chris Pratt looked a little scruffier than I last remembered him.I usually am not a big fan of CGI. However, in this film, they really did an amazing job with both the CGI, lighting and color grading.The humor is a hit and miss endeavor. Sometimes it hits the mark, other times it can be cringy. The story really isn't that great but since this is a comic book film, I wasn't expecting great writing. It's rare to see any good writing in a comic book film.It's a fun watch. It exceeded my already low expectations. It was better than the impression I gotten from the trailer.

title: At last good one from MCU!
text: Thank you all guys, who lowered my expectations with your negative reviews!I had a lot of quality Thor/Thaika Waititi fun!Cast is awesome! Great villain! Decent story and beautiful visuals.Waaaay better than Doctor Strange. In every possible aspect. That one gave me an impression, that we can bury MCU, this one - exactly the opposite.Good sequel to Thor series and MCU in total.

title: Jokingly awful
text: Christian Bale smashed it. Poor Hemsworth was wasted on a poor script, child like quips and forced fun. It felt like going on a school trip with your physics teacher who tried to make science just as entertaining as drama.

title: Why the movie is absolutely masterpiece
text: One of the best comedy and adventure movies. I think it was even better than Billy Wilder's comedy movies. Who's watching some of these movies, doesn't want to think about any other movie. To perfection You see, everything is found in this movie. The depth of the story, character, dialogue, rhythm, what else can a science fiction movie do. Dad, let go of the previous bulls, Martin was right when he said that it is a game city, it is different. This is a movie, now someone wants to think that it belongs to children, and someone will tell me why it was not like previous episodes. Marvel came out of its replica mode. Marvel is changing, but the change is not bad at all. It has not been successful so far, but in a film like this, I see that we are on the side of an artistic director who knows the language of cinema. The movie definitely has a direct impact not only on Marvel but also on the entire science fiction cinema from now on. But the important thing is that the movie itself has become a masterpiece. If we want to look at it objectively, we will hardly realize that it is a good movie and we have to watch it several times, but if we look neither objectively nor subjectively, we will realize that it is a masterpiece. From an objective point of view, this movie is not as memorable as a show, but with our second view, we deeply accept that the movie is either a masterpiece or it doesn't suit me at all. Enough of the weaving philosophy. Regardless of any asides related to previous Marvel movies, there are scripts here, not humble remakes of outdated sci-fi. Sorry. ...

title: A solid story that touches on themes of grief and loss that finds itself suffocated by directorial excess and an overly jokey tone
text: While working alongside the Guardians of the Galaxy, Thor (Chris Hemsworth) and his companion Korg (Taika Waititi) part ways with the Guardians after learning of a distress signal from his Asgardian comrade Sif (Jamie Alexander). As Thor comes to Sif's aid he learns someone known as Gorr The God Butcher (Christian Bale) has been murdering the various Gods throughout the universe using the Necrosword and now has his sights set on New Asgard on Earth. Once there Thor fends off Gorr's shadow monsters alongside New Asgard leader Valkyrie (Tessa Thompson) and is met by surprise when he learns Jane Foster (Natalie Portman) now wields Mjolnir which unbeknownst to Thor was a last resort by Jane to stave off her aggressive cancer. When Gorr manages to abduct the Asgardian children, Thor, Jane, Valkyrie, and Korg team up and set out to find help from the other Gods and stop Gorr's rampage.Shortly after the enthusiastic reeception and box office success of Thor: Ragnarok, Taika Waititi and Marvel executives reunited on a greenlit fourth Thor movie. Many of the cast were interested in returning including star Chris Hemsworth who credited Waititi with revitalizing the character after initially growing exhausted with the role. From a business standpoint it just makes sense to give Waititi another go at Thor given that Ragnarok was the highest grossing and best reviewed film in the series, but while Ragnarok struck the balance between its humor and taking its story reasonably seriously, Love and Thunder stumbles hard with its tone often feeling at odds with its thematic material.If there's one thing I think many people will agree on, it's in Christian Bale's performance as Gorr The God Butcher in that it's probably the best villain we've seen for a standalone Thor movie yet (keep in mind Loki didn't go full force until the first Avengers film). The opening sequence where we're introduced to Gorr traversing a desolate wasteland with his daughter who dies of starvation and thirst in his arms only for Gorr himself to find the God he worshipped is indifferent to his suffering makes him a sympathetic villain and his transformation through the usage of the Necrosword makes him an intimidating villain with a lot of depth. In many ways it reminded me of a better version of villains like Ronan the Accuser or Malekith who had very similar motivations but were paper thin in comparison to Gorr.Unfortunately, that's where we have to transition to the weak points of the movie, of which there are many. Right out of the gate the movie has an abrupt tonal shift from the ending of the scene where we see Gorr's corruption to a montage sequence where Taika Waititi's Korg narrates a heavily abridged version of Thor's life glibly discussing character deaths in a rather offhanded way which transitions to Thor still with the Guardians of the Galaxy who are really only an extended cameo. Despite the lingering threat of Gorr the movie overplays its comedy to an obnoxious degree with Korg now having warn out his goodwill from his restrained usage in Ragnarok to terribly running gags about a pair of screaming goats Thor uses as transport who aren't funny and just annoying. Jane Foster is given a richer role than previous incarnations as she's not only taken on a separate mantle as Thor but is battling cancer but rather than explore Jane and Thor's relationship regarding either of those two points, the movie thinks it'd be more interesting to see yet another terrible running gag of Thor's weapons acting like his ex-girlfriend and currently girlfriend with Stormbreak now jealous of Thor's hangups with Mjolnir now loyal to Jane in what's less a running gag and more a limping gag. The sad thing is, if you look at the nuts and bolts of the story it's pretty solid. The main problem that takes the movie down is in the fact is afraid to let our characters have any stretch of pathos that isn't interrupted by a stupid joke. But there are at least a few scenes that hit emotional resonance such as the ending.Thor: Love and Thunder has all the right elements and a really good villain and performance from Christian Bale, but the overly jokey tone makes Love and Thunder very much the Yin to Ragnarok's Yang. With that said: I don't think this is a worse movie than Thor: The Dark World because I will remember Love and Thunder (both good points and bad) but I still struggle to remember The Dark World. It has some issues that weigh it down to being the weakest Thor movie alongside The Dark World but both movies aren't great just for different reasons.

title: Marvel has stepped up its villain game lately.
text: Taika Waititi amps up the zany craziness of Ragnarok to unbelievable levels in this film, both for better and for worse. The movie is often hilarious due to how unpredictably absurd it is, but sometimes suffers due to the overbearing need it seems to feel to always have jokes in every scene, regardless of whether they fit in with what's happening in the movie.But, this is nothing new for Marvel. I only bring it up because it happens far more often in this film than in any other Marvel outing.What is new in this film (and quite fresh) is the villain. Christian Bale gives a surprisingly both creepy and heartfelt performances as the God Butcher. Right from the opening we have a deep compassionate understanding for why he does what he does, and the conclusion of the story gives him a very satisfying conclusion for his journey as well.I just wish there was more of him. He gets a great introduction and a great ending in which compelling parallels are drawn between him and Thor, but throughout the rest of the movie he's just "evil possessed guy." The motivations are still there, but I wanted to see more of what he was doing and how his possession was affecting his mind or personality.I was worried about how Jane would be as "Lady-Thor," and thankfully her presence in the movie is warranted. She's written into the story in a way that both makes sense and actually amplifies the emotional stakes, which are sadly nonexistent in a lot of these Marvel films.The action is mostly pretty good, but kind of a mixed bag. The camerawork and selective use of colors is fun and frenetic, but the overuse of CGI is sometimes far too noticeable and makes the movie look...cheap. Cheaper than any other Thor movie. Cheap is not a word I like to use when describing $200 million movies, but there isn't a better one to use for this.Endings are hard to write, and the ending of this film (no spoilers) both works and doesn't work. There's a satisfying payoff to the themes of love and loss, but at the very end the story asks us to care about Thor's relationship to a character who we have not seen and know nothing about.It's a sweet and charming ending, but it left me feeling...colder than I think the filmmakers wanted me to feel. And that's because they didn't put in any work throughout the movie to make me feel as satisfied as the characters in the movie are by the ending's outcome.I do recommend this film, for Christian Bale's performance and for Taika Waititi's very distinct (if flawed) absurd method of telling stories with a lot of humor and heart and ambition. A lot of ambition.

title: The most fun I've had since Thor: Ragnarok
text: This was the most fun movie I've watched, maybe since Thor: Ragnarok. This is an unabashed laugh out loud comedy, but with a lot of heart. And it ends on very high notes (including the final post credit scene) unlike Ragnarok does. (Not saying L + T is better than Ragnarok because that film was epic in scope and I possibly prefer it, if only slightly more so).In the previous Thor films, I honestly didn't think Chris Hemsworth and Natalie Portman had good on-screen chemistry, but that changed here. Wonderful chemistry between them. I'm glad they fixed that.The screenwriting is probably this film's strongest aspect for me. Taika Waititi & Jennifer Kaytin Robinson nailed the plot, the structure, the dialogue, and the pacing. Taika Waititi's comedic timing shined in directing. I loved the reoccurring gag with the screaming goats.Finally, that 80's rock n roll theme and the gorgeous end credits. This really dialed up the fun to 11. It's that vibe that I hoped Wonder Woman '84 was going to bring but failed miserably to deliver.As I'm getting older there are few films I will spend the time to rewatch, but 10/10 I will watch this again.

title: Normally love Taikas humor but..
text: It was to much. And I really enjoy his humor in Ragnarok. There it was the perfect balance between humor and Story and acting. But this time it felt like he wanted to make this awesome humor twists (like with Jeff Goldblum and conversations between Hulk and Thor in Ragnarok) to make a Movie out of it. You couldn't take anything serious anymore. It totally lost the Drama structure, felt more like a Parody. But still.. 6/10 because it is enjoyable and I love the MCU building up again.

title: Woke and Blunder more like!
text: What an absolute let down! Much like Wonder Waman was awesome and Wonder Woman 1984 not so much this feels similar, RagnarÃ¶k was brilliant! Love and Thunder definitely not! Am pleased I was shouted to see this movie or id be pissed off wasting the money to see this Garbage oh and by the way a King is a male and the female counterpart a Queen, just a mess of a movie.

title: Watchable but manage your expectations
text: The bottom of the barrel in the Thor franchise. A few quips are good. This movie has way to many attempts at humor. The movie is watchable but just barely. As many movies before it the movie can't decide if it is a comedy or a drama and ends up being neither. Marvel needs to do better.

title: Thor 4 lives on with Guardians feeling
text: So after watching Thor 4 Love and Thunder, I have to say that this film was good. This film had a palace of story and action scenes.Thor 4 does have a lot of comedy scenes with Thor. We get to see a small bit of the Guardians with Thor.Thor 4 feels like a Guardians Of The Galaxy film which is what the director did for Thor 3 and it worked for Marvel and it has worked again. Just does not feel like a Thor film but I liked it a lot.Can we please first talk about Christian Bale who acts as Gorr who is the best part of this film as he was amazing, he saves this film and for me is the second best marvel live action villain. Christian Bale really brought his character to life, you can feel the pain and hate he has towards the people who let him down.It was good to see Natalie Portman back as Jane Foster and as Lady Thor. She was good in this film and brought her character to life.Chris Hemsworth as always does a good job with Thor, being so funny and just make this film watchable. He is too funny in this film but for me I like it but I would have also liked to see him in a bit of a serious role like how he was in avengers 3. We also get to see Thor dealing with the events of Avengers 3, 4 of the people he has lost and see his past coming back in his life.The problem with the last two Thor films is that they have made it to feel like a Guardians Of The Galaxy film which beings that this film can't be taken serious or you the fans can't take Thor as your serious hero like Iron Man and Captain America but I love that Thor is made to be different in the films.I think comic fans who want better storyline like Captain America 3, Avengers 3 or the Batman films, will be tired of the same marvel comic movies that have a simple story with no character development, but marvel films are different to DC Films. If you are looking for a film that has a good balance of comedy, action or if you're a Thor fan then watch this film. The soundtrack is good as always.

title: The Immasculation of Thor
text: I remember the first Thor movie. He was ultra masculine, tough, courageous, it was a real testosterone fueled adventure.Fast forward to 2022 and Thor has been on estrogen now for a number of years apparently too much toxic masculinity. The guy is a bumbling buffoon who is impossible to take seriously anymore. He's had his testicles removed and this is the result. The worst thing is every male character in the Marvel Universe is in the same cross hairs of this evil unseen force. This is undoubtedly the most menacing foe our heroes have ever faced and one in which they are unlikely to recover from.Surprisingly however, spiderman no way home seemed to buck to trend and was arguably one of the best marvel films ever made with wokeness kept to a bare minimum. With the box office reflecting that.You'd like to think Disney would get the hint that the vast majority of human beings are against this woke agenda, however they look more likely at pushing the switch and going into overdrive...

title: Entertaining
text: I like the flow and progression of this movie. I like the way the transitions flowed. They did a good job story boarding this. I found it entertaining and not boring. I didn't like the very beginning of the movie.I think they are making a negative comment about God? Maybe pushing other narratives.I guess if there's criticisms to this movie they are all true. I was just entertained and not bored though.So..I guess for this one I'm not getting too philosophical.

title: Praise Odin. The MCU got some of its mojo back.
text: With the inconsistent screen offerings from Marvel lately, I tempered my expectations for Thor 4. Fortunately, I ended up having a great time at the theater. If you've seen the trailer for this movie, that's exactly how it felt the whole way through (and the run time was under two hours). Taika Waititi had his fingerprints all over this film, so if you're a fan of his like I am, you might find it a fun ride, too.Chris Hemsworth reprises the titular role, who has been on a journey to find himself, so to speak, as he finishes up his tour with the Guardians of the Galaxy and heads back to New Asgard to see how Valkyrie and the rest of his people are holding up. Tessa Thompson provides a grounding force, as his friend Val, for the god of thunder to hold on to as things quickly go topsy-turvy for the now-fit-again Avenger; after the events of "Endgame," he got back into training and turned his "dad bod into a god bod," as his other buddy Korg (played by Waititi) put it.While I believe Gorr the God Butcher to be one of the better MCU villains, both because the character was written with a relatable motivation and because Christian Bale is amazing in anything he is in, it would have been nice to see more of him in the movie. My understanding is that there were several scenes cut out because they were too dark or scary for the general audience that Marvel prefers to attract, but I think it would have been worth it to enhance to story. If we actually see Gorr mow through different gods, we not only would see how powerful that necrosword is, but we would see how much pain he is in to want to serve up so much death.It seems, though, that doing something like that would have taken away from the Jane Foster storyline, so I understand the decision (but still disagree: just make two separate movies!). She becomes the Mighty Thor herself when Thor's old hammer, Mjolnir, calls to her. Foster, a role reprised by the mighty Natalie Portman, is dealing with some major health problems, while Mjolnir (I'm surprised the spell check on my computer doesn't have a problem with that word) is in a bit of shattered state itself, so they appear to help each other out.Keep in mind, even with the topics of death and deicide, Thor 4 remains a comedy, through and through. While the visual sequences, 80's rock cues, and screaming goats might be better experienced in a movie theater, watching this at home (when it moves to streaming) will get you most of the way there. Just make sure to turn the volume up.

title: Still afraid to kill main characters
text: This fun, thrilling, and action packed adventure follows Thor, Valkyrie, Korg, and Jane Foster tracking down the God Butcher. Excellent performances by Natalie Portman and Christian Bale whom both stole the show! The story pushes Thor and Jane back together but fails at the romance between them. Also, the movie seems to be afraid to kill off characters. I counted 5 times where I thought a character died but simply recovered by the next scene. On a good note, the mythos and action were ramped up as you would expect in a Thor movie! Post credit scenes paved way for future stories to be told. Overall, fantastic superhero movie with a couple of bumps in the road.

title: Gorr Blimey!
text: "Thor: Ragnarok" is, for me, one of the highlights of the MCU so far. The broadest comedy of the series and almost a reinterpretation of the character of Thor that sticks to this day. So, anticipation was high for "Love and Thunder", perhaps too high, as having seen the film it's a 'like' rather than a 'love' for me.Having received a distress call from Lady Sif (Jamie Alexander), Thor (Chris Hemsworth) returns to New Asgard in time to intercept an attack from Gorr The God Butcher (Christian Bale). He is not alone though, as alongside Valkyrie (Tessa Thompson), Jane Foster (Natalie Portman) has taken the power of The Mighty Thor by reuniting the shattered Mjolnir. Though they repel Gorr's attack, his minions kidnap the children of the town forcing the three heroes to begin an assault, but not before they look to the other gods for assistance.For me, the problem wasn't too much humour, or too weak humour. I thought that Christian Bale's Gorr was a compelling villain and like many MCU antagonists was justified in his rationale. I liked the performances, even some of the ones that people have found controversial, such as Russell Crowe's Zeus. I thought the film looked excellent and the transitions into the black and white sections were great. I think my problem was that it skirted over a bunch of ideas without ever going deep enough on any of them, particularly when some of them have been anticipated for a while. Asguardians of the Galaxy was fun whilst it lasts, but over before the film really starts. The kingdom of the gods, again amusing, but lacking in cameos we might have expected (Khonshu?) and really not much more than a way of padding the film out. Even Jane Foster's Mighty Thor isn't in the film enough to be explored properly. I appreciate that not all actors are willing to do nothing except play their Marvel characters, but I'd have preferred two separate films, one for the adventures of Thor with the GOTG and another full film for Jane to become accustomed to her powers, then have them reconnect. I'd also have liked slightly fewer call backs, the attempt to recapture the Immigrant song moment is overdone, as are the returns for the acting troop.Again, I don't think that this is the disaster that some other reviewers have made it out to be but it's certainly not all I hoped it would be.

title: Time waster
text: Watched Thor Love and Thunder with/for my 10 year old. He seemed to enjoy it. Movie was boring but coffee kept me awake. Parental guidance: The film has nudity (male) for a few seconds and occcasional kisses and several sexual references - I don't know why it was necessary in a children's movie.

title: Decent
text: "Thor: Love and Thunder" was definitely a step down from "Ragnorak" in terms of being a fun and goofy Marvel movie. This one tried to be a little more sentimental. Gorr the God Butcher (Christian Bale) could have been a lot stronger of a villain. There's a lot of "could haves" with this movie; it could have been funnier, could have been more sentimental, could have done with more spectacle. This is just another run-of-the-mill Marvel movie.Chris Hemsworth, Natalie Portman, and Christian Bale are all good here. Korg (Taika Waititi) is again the standout character, I love the comedic relief he brings. The movie starts off strong and ends strong but it's very messy throughout.Side note (and I'm not sure if this was just the theater I went to), but there were some weird audio issues like the sound mixing was off. The volume was very low at points like I couldn't hear a thing, and there were points where the music or the sound effects drowned out the dialogue and it was hard for me to hear what the characters were saying.Overall, not bad but no where near the level we've seen Marvel produce at. It's just very average and gets a couple extra points merely for the Marvel polish but there's nothing here, really, that is redeemable or warrants any sort of in-depth discussion or analysis.

title: A heavy burden to bear, this thing called continuity.
text: In Ragnarok, Waititi, Hemsworth et al had a certain looseness that made for an entertaining hero movie that did not feel like one. Tessa Thompson drinking herself off an entrance? Gold. Thor hijacking Gamesmaster's ship (Don't touch anything")? Another gem. Love and Thunder certainly began with hope when Thor throws his cloak at the beginning of the movie, but by the third song recycled from the Appetite for Destruction album alone (there was no other hard rock band they could use in a hard rock themed movie?), the film was showing its wear and tear. That's not to say Love and Thunder is a bad film, since the cast is all staying true to character, the pace of the movie is on point, the colour, the design, the shade... Love and Thunder is in fact a sharp movie, but the film itself is handcuffed to way too much continuity that has to be answered to.A god worshipping soul loses all faith when unanswered drought claims his daughter. Answering to a cursed sword's call to seek revenge, all gods are put on notice as they are starting to be exterminated. Thor, who returns to shape and spirit after his latest trials, has a target on his back as he holds something of value to this God Butcher.What I do like about Waititi's approach in Love and Thunder is the use of the children. Say what you will about the climax (it's a superhero film, people), Waititi's movies have usually featured kids as the protagonist and Love and Thunder could have used more of their screen time, particularly with Gorr, or have them enjoying New Asgard. What we get instead are some very tiring cliches bogging down an already heavy film. In the face of cancer and abducted children, we didn't need to know Korg's mating rituals. Thor's romance over a former flame (not Jane) was also adding to unnecessary screen time. The key that made Ragnarok feels effortless was the successful banter between characters and parties that made the plot hold. Love and Thunder, though flashy and full of heart, misses that same effortlessness, making for a sometimes tiring watch.

title: Felt like a 119 Mins Trailer!!!
text: Of all the Marvel movies that I watched and loved, this one felt like complete bonkers. The movie was very very very very rushed. Kind of patchwork of scenes and with no real purpose. Loved the music and Hemsworth's comic timing other than that it was weird.Cameo's had no purpose and if avoided wouldn't have made a lick of a difference. More or less felt like an obligation fulfilled by Taika Waititi. Don't get me wrong, I absolutely loved Ragnarok but this is, as I said "Bonkers".

title: Didn't quite finish it well.
text: I think this movie had alot of potential when the trailer and the cast were released. It actually went quite well and was pretty smooth without much plot holes in the whole marvel timeline.Only downside for me was when the final fight scene ended I wasn't left feeling wowed or satisfied. With so much build up and hype, it's very much normal for us audience to expect an ending befitting the show. This afterall, is a superhero show.I did enjoy myself but not as much as I expected or hoped for, esp with Thor being my favourite marvel superhero. Anyway thanks to the whole production team and cast for their efforts in filming this movie, better luck with the next one!

title: You are not the Thor we're looking for!
text: Thor Love and Thunder feels more like a comedy then a superhero film under Taika Waititi's direction. While Ragnarok made it work this just didn't feel like a Thor film. I miss the feeling one got from watching Thor or Thor The Dark World.Being a marvel film the movie has a massive budget and it looks and sounds amazing. The cast is really great and it's an enjoyable movie all told. However it just doesn't feel like something I want to go back and rewatch multiple times.I will give the film a decent 6/10 rating. The acting is fine, the VFX and SFX are great. The story is not terrible but could definitely have been done in a much more enjoyable manner. The comedy was overdone and gave me a headache after a while.Thor fans will still enjoy it and seeing Jane Foster wielding Mjolnir is interesting to say the least. All in all, worth a watch but be prepared for what you're going to get.P. S. It feels very rushed, like a rollercoaster ride without time to actually enjoy any of it or give enough time to it's characters.

title: Guess a lot of people aren't catching the subtext
text: A lot of reviews saying the humor is too much. Of course there is a major play towards humor: the remaining parts are basically laying out the real joke on mankind, religion. How gods are basically not listening or will raise a finger to help the people who give them their praise and life. Really drives it home in one line Gorr utters in the end. On first watch, I too felt the humor was a bit much, but upon discussing with a friend of moments I liked, I realized how intense the subject matter was, and how cleverly Taika Waititi hid it. Go and check the Christian reviews, all hung up on the homosexual notes and "false pagan gods" (their actual words) yet not even noticing the defiant cry at the absolute useless nature of their own religion. I am definitely looking forward to a second watch, being more aware.

title: Gorr: Revenge and Shadows
text: Christian Bale delivers another amazing performance. Without him this movie is just a bad copy of Thor: Ragnarok. I was expecting to laugh so hard that I couldn't catch my breath, instead only a few chuckles could be found.I'm not sure what is going on in the post Infinity Saga era but the MCU is on a definite decline. This movie should've been the sign of great things to come but instead it's just a mediocre money grab.

title: Tries to be to funny
text: Bale is one of the better villains of the MCU , with a really relatable motive, Kudos there. Acting is good despite the all the times the movie shoots it's self in the foot with ill timed jokes.But sadly the whole movie is overshadowed by the constant barrage of jokes after jokes , it all feels forced. We are at a point where it just ruins the story and the immersion of the movie. Reminds me of old Mel Brooks movies...

title: Was this a Mel Brooks spoof?
text: I'm disappointed to say this was a poorly presented movie.. the humour was bordering on the 'ridiculousness" of a Mel Brooks film. There were a few laughs, and the actual storyline was ok, but there wasn't the witty subtlety of the previous movies. Thor himself has somehow become extremely dumb, the guardians seemed to have forgotten how to play their own characters, Valkyrie is all over the place, and, realistically, only Natalie Portman's performance as Jane saved the movie. Before the opening titles ran I began wondering if it was actually a "Pure Blond" beer commercial and not the start of the movie, considering the poor acting and amateurish feel to it.There was never any real tension or conflict, and a poorly developed character arch for most of the roles.Sorry, I love Marvel and I hate it when people are so negative on new movies or series'.. but this didn't even feel like it belonged amongst any of the rest of the MCU - it was entertaining, a bit of fun, good action sequences and an acceptable plot.. it just didn't have the usual 'finish' of the Marvel universe movies and appears to be made for children.

title: A Self-Paradoy that Fails as a Movie
text: The day before I watched this film, the teacher of a screenwriting class I was taking lectured about what a writer should not do when creating a movie. Let's just say that the writers of Love and Thunder did not pay attention because they broke pretty much all of the rules (in a bad way), producing this hot mess of a movie. The script is awful, Jane becoming the Mighty Thor relies on total randomness not previously set up in the universe, the tone constantly shifts between over the top violence and comedy, and the characters are not serious people. Christian Bale as Gor tries throughout the film but even he cannot save this movie from becoming a self-parody. I guess this is what happens when the studio rushes production and cranks up the absurdity to 1000. What a shame; I am a big Thor fan and really wanted this movie to be good.

title: Not a hater
text: It was a very good film. I am the only one who didn't laugh. The end was very good and sad. I will see it again when it arrives on digital. I actually put it 8.5. In my opinion that film is better than the previous (ragnarok) pls don't kill me...

title: Love and Thunder is okay
text: One thing this movie struggled with, is runtime, it was way too short and the story felt rushed it had a bit of a hard to building a good narrative, the jokes were good and funny, Chris Hemsworth did a great job as Thor of course, and I enjoyed seeing Natalie Portman reprise her role, they both did good.Christian Bale did an amazing job as Gorr the god butcher, and he put his all into this role as he always does, definitely one of Marvels best villains, but his character didn't exactly fit the mood of the movie, his character was more horror feeling and scary and his character would have worked better in probably Multiverse of Madness. But in this movie it would go from goofy and silly to intense and dark when Gorr would come on the screen.All the other characters were kind of pointless, we see Russell Crowe as Zeus for a short period, but his character didn't serve much purpose to the film. Definitely more of a casual watch but still enjoyable just try not to think too hard about everything going on.

title: Welcome Aboard
text: Welcome to the Marvel Universe Thor: Love and Thunder and it's great to have you aboard. I love how they keep the comedy aspect of Thor going. Waititi takes you on a journey, from feeling somewhat awkard in the beginning, to laughter, and than sadness. In addition to Hemsworth's amazing awesomeness (my wife was in heaven for one particular scene), Portman and Bale were great in their roles. Waititi also brings great visual colours and a perfect soundtrack that makes you want to raise your fist in the air.

title: Funny twist in franchize
text: I liked it - mostly because I'm fed up with how "serious" all of the franchize bacame. There are many funny moments in this movie, kind of self-parody sometimes. But GOATS - oh man - goats rule! My kids favourite element of this movie. Hilaroious idea and I'm kinda glad they pulled this off cause it looks like somebody - when writing the script - said "let's add screaming goats to this" - and someone else said - yeah - this is gonna be cool! And it is! The film is not very serious, even though mr Bale is really good at being evil. You can expect "Avengers assemble" stuff or you can just - for once - take the thing out of your bottom and enjoy the silly jokes and silly mood sometimes. It's fun. It's ok. Treat it as light entertainment and you'll like it.

title: Where is this going?
text: Why is this movie, just like the previous one, being directed by a comedian? Where is Marvel heading with Thor?This movie is so out of balance with a great and dark performance from Bale and the ridiculous circus on the other end. It just doesn't match/The first Thor movies had a great balance of drama, some romance ,overcoming personal issues, action and a pinch of humor. Now it's like watching a parody.If Marvel is going to ridicule its own heroes, I guess it will end soon for them.They can spit out as many movies as they like at this high rate, but it doesn't benefit the quality of them.

title: Ragnarok Wannabe
text: Goats! Thor embarks on a journey unlike anything he's ever faced -- a quest for inner peace. However, his retirement gets interrupted by Gorr the God Butcher, a galactic killer who seeks the extinction of the gods. To combat the threat, Thor enlists the help of King Valkyrie, Korg and ex-girlfriend Jane Foster, who -- to his surprise -- inexplicably wields his magical hammer. Together, they set out on a harrowing cosmic adventure to uncover the mystery of the God Butcher's vengeance.Chris Hemsworth is still great as Thor, but there's too much goofiness now. Although Natalie Portman had a really big role this time and she did really well portraying that role, her acting seemed a bit off in some scenes. Gorr (and with an incredible performance by Christian Bale) is one of the greatest MCU villains, so he definitely needed more screen time. Also, the little cameos were really fun to see.The movie had a fun and promising start, but it got really slow and boring in some scenes towards the middle leading to an underwhelming ending. Despite all that, the post-credit scene was pretty exciting.The movie attempts to be funny with some successful laughs, but it's packed with many jokes that are really foolish to the point where the movie gets quite silly.The CGI (especially the floating head part that everyone is talking about) is very bad compared to "Thor: Ragnarok".Score:7/10.

title: Taika Waititi gets a D- what say you Mr. Waititi?
text:
Directing a movie with a 250M budget takes skill which is why
Taika Waititi doesn't get a F. Next time, Taika Waititi needs to make 4X the movie on 1/2 the budget. Scarcity seems to stimulate creativity and excellence.Taika Waititi is better than this and I am wondering if the executive saps pressured him into writing and releasing junk.We know he has all the writing ability, leadership in the director's chair and amazing actors and artist to make a masterpiece so what happened?Christian Bale was the one shining star in this production and his character has almost 0 screen time taking out Gods.

title: Lighthearted
text: Really Enjoyed the movie. Very Likeable characters, lots of laughs and touching on serious things too. Great soundtrack. Christian bale played a Brilliant villain. Perfect ending.Great to see some of original characters taking on the roles again.

title: Too much comedy
text: Ragnarok is my favorite MCU movie, so I was both hyped and cations for this one. Unfortunately, taika really "over-egged the pudding" with Love & Thunder. A classic case of getting good feedback for one project and then thinking you can just turn everything up to eleven to make the next even better. It just tries way too hard to be funny. Also, as much as I like Natalie Portman, she just can't do this type of comedy.It's a shame because this movie is quite poignant in places, and could have been a great emotional ride. But the act of cramming in as many gags as possible really takes the edge off any deeper meaning the story could have told.On the plus side; Christian Bale is amazing. Really, really, amazing. Again though, I feel slighly embarrassed for him that he put in such a great performance against so many dumb jokes. Russell Crowe was also hilarious - I never knew he had a performance like this in him.All-in-all, I was entertained, and I did actually LOL a couple of times. I just wanted to yell at Taika to dial it back a little.

title: Cringe!!!
text:
I was just a bit interested at the beginning but then it al turned into a huge parody of a parody of a parody,
Thor is funny but i got into min 12.. and i had to stop
too much is too much .. a real joke.Thor is a strong man in battle, we know Guardians of The galaxy characters are also funny but you can identify when enough is enough,.. compare this movie to the First 2... you just get tired of it... Hulk was disappointing too, if you like the movie.. ok its your opinion, its not the first time i really cant watch a marvel movie to be honest,, Captain Marvel Hulk and this one are huge flops..

title: The fact that MCU fans hate it, makes me love it even more
text: Unlike most other MCU movies, this actually has a story, depth, and thoughtfulness. If you don't like Taika, but you like the mundane writing and plain vanilla feel of most other superhero movies, this isn't for you. The absurdity, cleverness and ability of Taika to get the best acting from this cast is storytelling at its best. I feel like it was made for me.

title: Reactionary forces
text: The U. S. government has always wantonly distorted and fabricated facts, and tried its best to spread all kinds of rumors and information, inciting separatism and subverting the regimes of other countries. Most of the outbreaks of international unrest are behind the planning and behind-the-scenes promotion of the US reactionary forces.

title: To many silly jokes
text: I love Thor in past. This was good action but ruined by way to many silly jokes. I hope marvel don't continue like this. But Christian bale played the bad guy very well.

title: This movie killed the MCU for me
text: Watching this movie is like eating Peeps: it's all air and no substance.Don't get me wrong, I did find most of the jokes funny, but it came at the expense of the heart of the movie. I think back to it, and it all just felt so hollow.While Christian Bale's opening scene was really compelling, I already got a sense of problem of the movie to come. His role was greatly reduced and rushed, to the point where the villain doesn't appear for what felt an entire hour. His arc particularly at the end felt like it came out of nowhere and not given any weight that it should have.Ever since Endgame, I've been progressively feeling that Marvel burnout. I think I've reached my breaking point. The MCU has officially written itself into a corner. Where do they even go from here? There's nothing left. There's no direction, and I'm just done. I feel like I've eaten a crate full of Peeps and I'm now sick to my stomach. About the only left I care for use Guardians of the Galaxy 3, and I'm not sure how much I care for that anymore.Please, I just want to watch anything else than Marvel and Disney anymore, but it's so hard to avoid when even previously competing blockbusters like Avatar is now owned by Disney!

title: Good not Great
text: While I do think this is one of marvels better phase four movies they are still treading on thin ice. This movie is a fun time but most jokes do not land, and there are so many jokes. I will say one scene's that had me laughing out loud is the retelling of the previous Thor movie in the same way and style they did of lokis death in Thor ragnarok. Christian Bale Does steal the show as the god butcher who is excellent in every scene just wish there was more of him. Ragnarok is still the best Thor film but this one is second and beats the other Thor films by a mile I would definitely recommend a watch Luke I said, good not great.

title: The Short Horse

title: Superhero fatigue has definitely set in...
text: Looks like not only the audience is finding superhero movies are no longer interesting, the writer, director etc are having fatigue as well coming up with a good one these days. Maybe Thor is signalling the downfall or end of superhero movies, at least for the big screen. They should still be high demand on the small screen for another decade or so.This is definitely the worst of any marvel or dc movies, the director seems wanted to cover the original movie and a parody of that movie, all in this one. There jokes and comic moments just follow one after another in the first hour more than action scenes. Worst I fell asleep the last 30 mins, woke up and was told I didn't miss anything good.

I've got what I wanted from it. Just feel really sorry for Taika. He won't probably make any more movies for marvel due to the movie rating.

title: Not very enjoyable

title: Carry on Thor
text: This is Carry On Thor. You just need to have Sid James as Thor and it would be complete. They can't seem to take it seriously. Thor is the butt of all the jokes and Jane Foster is also Thor. I was tempted to call this nice CGI but shame about the plot. There's some battles and suchlike and they're pretty good but it proceeds towards a less than dramatic ending. So I'm giving an OK 6/10.

title: It was boring
