The "funny" scenes weren't that funny and it felt like the scenes were always missing something. It can be a good movie to watch at home but i don't recommend going to see it in cinemas.

title: The bad reviews are harsh
text: Enjoyed this movie, funny, enjoyable and a good family movie! Is it a smart movie no but it's enjoyable and entertaining! I think many of the low reviews are from geeks too invested in the comics. I thought from the reviews that I would be left bored instead I laughed a lot, clearly from the last thor movie they realised funny was a good go to so People complaining it's too funny are abit silly! Who doesn't like to laugh ?? Plus I loved seeing Natalie Portman again, love her and loved Christian bale as a villain ðŸ‘ plus thor back buff is a win. So ignore the low reviews! This is not boring nor a b rated movie. Just enjoy it and think of it as a fun movie.

title: Fun movie
text: Full of laughs and heart warming sequences. I had a good time in the theatre and was struggling to understand the backlash it keeps getting. It's not a perfect movie by any means and certain characters deserved more screentime/development. However if you go into the cinema just expecting a good time rather than a multiverse altering Marvel storyline, I think the experience will be enjoyable.A lot of people are calling it a rom-com but it surprisingly also delves into the theme of family (specifically father/daughter) which I thought was interesting.

title: Mixed bag but overall enjoyable.
text: I have mixed feelings about this one. There were things I liked and enjoyed about it but also things I didn't. For me the biggest issue was the first act. It felt rushed and could have used way more. For instance, I would have liked to have seen more backstory with Gorr but also more with Jane as well and what she was up to with her cancer diagnosis and all. Another thing is they should've actually showed her initial transformation into Mighty Thor, they had to have filmed it, I know they filmed it. Also her first meeting with Valkyrie and their relationship. Another thing I wasn't a fan of was the stuff with the Guardians. I just didn't care for that section and thought the jokes were a bit overkill at times.What I did like and enjoy was the little we got of Gorr the God Butcher. I liked Thor & Janes interactions/relationship in the movie. The flashback to their breakup was a great sequence. I also enjoyed several of the fight sequences and the ending. Thought it was unexpected and surprising. Curious as to what's next with that ending.All in all, I think this movie could have used a lot more of a lot things and a lot less jokes. It was mainly lacking the balance that Thor: Ragnarok possessed. Which is its main problem. Regardless, I still had a fun time but left wanting more in areas.

title: Another Fun Popcorn Movie from the MCU
text: The Thor series of movies were ones that I wasn't fully interested originally but have become my favorite of the original group of Avengers. This one also pulled my interest with the villain being Gorr and played by Christian Bale. This one I watched with Jaime as there are certain superhero films she will still watch.For this movie here, we are first introduced to Gorr as he is given the Necro Sword that allows him to kill gods. He goes about this hunt after dedicating his life to one that turned his back on him.Thor (Chris Hemsworth) is still hanging out with the Guardians of the Galaxy. They split ways here as Thor learns of Gorr, who is known as 'The God Butcher'. This pulls Thor to Earth. He goes to New Asgard where King Valkyrie (Tessa Thompson) is in power still. Korg (Taika Waititi) joins him.There is a wrinkle here that I picked up on from the subtitle, Love and Thunder. Jane Foster (Natalie Portman) has cancer. She is slowly dying and it feels like she is giving up the fight. Darcy (Kat Dennings) wants her to reach out to Thor, but things didn't end well and there is unresolved feelings.The two of them run into each other when MjÃ¶llnir calls out to Jane. Thor has a big surprise from this as well. He might be a bit jealous. Thor enlists the aid of those that will join him to defeat this new threat that is killing gods and there are none that can escape his wrath.Now that I've recapped this movie, I did want to say that this another solid installment. What I noticed here is that this one is another dark take while also being whimsical. Jaime wasn't even entirely sure if she liked this one as it seems to be more comedy than others. I was looking for the best way to put this since The Dark World and RagnarÃ¶k also have dark elements too. This seems to be a thing with Thor movies. I should say that I like the comedy aspects as it made me laugh.Then back to the darker elements. Gorr is a great villain. I'm not familiar with the comics so I don't know about him as a villain. It is interesting since he uses a weapon called the Necro Sword that would be right out of video games I've played like Final Fantasy. I like that aspect. It also brings interesting powers. Gorr also kidnaps children. I never feel like they're truly in peril. I still like it.I'll then go over to the acting. Hemsworth is great as Thor. I like that this movie makes him a bit more human which is good. Bringing back Portman is good too. There is good heart and emotion there. I like Bale as the villain. He fits that role well. Thompson and Waititi are solid in their supporting roles. They're both great with the comedy. We also have cameos by Russell Crowe, Jaimie Alexander, Idris Elba, Chris Pratt, Dave Bautista, Karen Gillan, Sean Gunn, Dennings, Stellan SkarsgÃ¥rd, Luke Hemsworth, Matt Damon, Sam Neill, Melissa McCarthy and Ben Falcone. We also get the voices of Vin Diesel and Bradley Cooper as well.All that is left to go into would be with the filmmaking. This has good cinematography. There is good contrast between the place of the gods to the desert we first see Gorr and then even going to the shadow realm. There is a lot of CGI, but I come to expect that. This has Disney money so it looks good. We also get a heavy dose of Guns-n-Roses which I wasn't expecting with the soundtrack. This is worth a watch and one of the better movies during the Marvel Cinematic Universe for Phase 4.My Rating: 7 out of 10.

title: Easily the worst movie of Marvel.
text: Watching Thor : Love and Thunder movie is just waste of time. The Christian bale is the only one character who hold us to watch the movie. Inspite of the Christian bale's performance the movie is the No .1 from the below.

title: Better the second time
text: The first time I saw Thor 4 I'd built up in my head what I wanted to see and I was disappointed. The second time I gave it another shot with a different perspective and it was way better. It's almost like the director is a Deadpool trickster making his own movie within a mega corporate movie franchise machine.The whole cinematic universe is cool, but you need to seperate this one from it a little to appreciate the style. Love and Thunder is trying to be its own movie while tied up to this mass of other movies and tv shows, even the other Thor movies.Also fast forwarded Korg's bedtime story recaps, that helped a lot.

title: Waste of time and Money!
text: I would say that the writers of this farce were definitely overpaid. This is evidenced by the amount of hallucinatory drugs they could afford to ingest while coming up with this movie. The dialog was dreadful, the plot silly and the plot twists were, well, twisted. The Mighty Thor has been reduced to a "Cartoon" character...he ranks right up there Daffy Duck and Elmer Fudd. The list of otherwise excellent actors in the film is long and distinguished. If they continue playing these types of gigs they will soon be relegated to the scrap heap of "B", no, make that "C" movies. I thought that having Loki move on was a positive. Now I kind of miss him. Overall the highlight of the film was...well, there were none. Why 2 stars? Well some of the music was not too bad.

title: One commedy too far.
text: The story of Gorr, an Necrosword is probably the one story Waititi shouldn't direct. His idea to lighten up Ragnarok was somewhat good idea, but Love and Thunder is a complete flop where cringe comedy, and over painted costumes badly clash against the dark theme of Gorr and Necrosword.From Thor's costume being blasted with few too many paints, and looking like a toy, to overuse of jokes, the show just falls apart with every minute. I mean, how many times they will overuse the whole MjÃ¶lnir/Stormbreaker "drama" joke, to then make an absurdly cringe scene where Thor pours the beer over the Stormbreaker, and scratches it, like it's a dog.In the end, the only good parts of the movie are the beginning which depicts how Gorr came to be the host for Necrosword, and the ending where they all stand before Eternity, and we are witness the final resolution.

title: I liked it
text: I loved Ragnarok and it's still my favourite Thor movie. This one would be second. They recycle a lot of what worked in the last movie (eg similar tone and how they use the soundtrack), and don't introduce much new. I'm ok with that. They threw absolutely everything they had at Ragnarok, Immigrant Song was practically made for a Thor movie, so that is hard to follow up.After Infinity War they had to spend time getting Thor out of his funk, and I think they've done that here. I'm glad they were able to bring Jane Foster back because they had never really addressed what happened there. I hope they do another because I'm excited to see where a Thor with a purpose ends up next.If they do another I hope Tiaka uses Iron Maiden for the soundtrack. Run to the Hills would be epic during an action scene.

title: Too many bad jokes!
text: Lack of fluid story telling and too many bad jokes ruined the flow of this movie. I felt no connection between Thor and Jane. That should have had a more serious tone and been delved into more. There should have been more scenes with Gorr.

title: I really really loved it, even though I didn't expect it!
text: Tbh, I really didn't expect much from this movie when I saw the trailers, even though I love Thor, Taika and Chris Hemsworth, but it deemed like it's going to be cheep mindless comedy. I was absolutely utterly wrong about that and I was never happier about that. I LOVED IT!Love and Thunder is beautiful, colorful, wholesome story about pursuit of happiness and purpose in life, even if you live for thousands of year or if you're just a simple mortal doomed to die in the near feature, what is it that makes life worth living? And, I don't know, maybe it's just me and where I qm in my life right now, but the end of the movie and the final message hit just the right spot and I couldn't stop myself from crying. I laughed, I cheered, I felt the romance and love, I cried and jn the end I left the cinema with such a warm feeling in my heart â¤ I really really really loved it! My friends and I qre definitely watching it again on the weekend ðŸ˜

title: Enjoyable but hazardous for future.
text: Thor wasted, Mighty Thor wasted, Christian Bale wasted, Gorr wasted, Weak story,Not so good direction, Okie but sometimes forced humour, will impact the future of MCU in negative view. Zeus was a joke. Future not promising. A one time watch after keeping brain aside. Came from a marvel fanboy.

title: Choose what type of film this is
text: Taika Waititi did a fantastic job at transforming the Thor solo films from forgettable and dull to the lively fun and enjoyable Ragnarok. Whilst this drastic change was very welcomed at the time, the idea for this film , including the casting of Christian Bale who is known for his intense and serious characters, doesn't match Waititi's style. The film had very contrasting scenes so close together, going from the wacky comedy the director is known for to very dark and intense ones straight afterwards, then vice versa all too quickly. Bale did a phenomenal job as Gorr, safe to say he is the best marvel villains to come out in phase 4 yet overall the film was too goofy for such an intense character as Gorr. Chris Hemsworth also did his thing and wasn't let down by his performance and Portman's character Jane Foster is no longer the boring side character to add a little spice. Sadly, although I love Korg, he had too many corny jokes that came quite tedious and a legthy amount of screentime for a side character especially compared to Valkyrie which was a shame as Thompson is great.All in all I think Waititi was perfect for the revival of the Thor franchise yet this film needed less of a balance between goofy and dark themes as simply, the villain did not suit the film despite his brilliant portrayal. Maybe Sam Raimi would've been a better fit with his tendencies to make things a little more intense.

title: Hot steaming garbage
text: I have not been disappointed in a movie this much in a long time. Gorr the God Butcher and Jane Foster's Mighty Thor are wasted in a movie that never takes itself seriously, but still expects you to care about it. The emotion did not hit anywhere as close as it was supposed to because everyone in this movie acts like a clown. The God of Thunder acts like a moronic idiot and there is no fun action to salvage the movie.Taika Waititi revitalised Thor in Ragnarok, and the character had some incredible moments in Infinity War, but this is a complete step in the wrong direction.

title: Worth a watch
text: I think the some of the reviews are being very harsh. This is a very fun movie... high art? Of course not. The best in the Marvel cannon, no. But, it is extremely watchable and fun. It is a comic book movie, don't expect too much.

title: It was okay. It didn't wow me
text: First off, I feel rotten tomatoe's rating was fair. This movie didn't wow me like Ragnarok. The director of Ragnarok tried to replicate what he did but I believe it fell short.Pros- The movie was funny, Bale was amazing as Gorr, loved Portman as Mighty Thor, great story setup for the origin of Gorr, great effects.Cons- I felt Bale's Gorr didn't get enough screen time to develop, overutilized the same comedic stick throughout the movie, story as a whole was kind of weak, for a 2 hour movie everything felt rushed, The Guardians were a delight to see but not needed. They could of used that extra money they paid them to be in the movie for something else.Overall this movie was okay. It didn't wow me. As I was watching this movie, I thought the 4th installment is not going to be great or bigger than the 3rd. I reflected on the recent MCU projects and still feel Dr. Strange 2 and Now Way Home were far superior to this movie. Not just on the cameos but story, story development, rythmn and chemistry with the characters. Definitely not worth rushing to go see it. Catch a matinee or wait for streaming. Contemplating whether I want to own it on Blu ray when it comes out. It's a one and done for me I think.

title: Enjoyable, but had opportunity to be better
text: I think they went a little too PG there when there were plenty of opportunity to have more emotional depth. It could be mix of serious vs. Comedy scenes rather than almost complete comedy. Otherwise, movie is enjoyable and does have a good plot.

title: The Hate is Proof of a Toxic Fandom
text: I know this is going to be an unpopular sentiment, but I feel like the huge amount of hate for this movie is proof that the majority of the fandom is still just a bunch of cishet white boi edgelords who only want to watch movies about people who look exactly like them playing mary sue heros who never do anything wrong - folks who feel threatened and emasculated by Jane and Valkyrie.After seeing all the bad reviews, I went into this cautiously, and I was pleasantly surprised. Sure, there were a few scenes that felt a little bit rushed, or ever so slightly too irreverent, but the humor was there. The heart was there, the action was there. Everything that makes a great Waititi movie was there. It's a good movie. Certainly leagues better than the first few Thor films. I think a lot of those white boi fans were just feeling to insecure to see it.

title: seriously???
text: No depth. No real soul to this film. Feels like it was made as a joke. Bale is amazing and Damon & Crowe gave me a giggle, but the pace of the film & "Thor's" ridiculous overacting left us feeling sort of ripped off, even though we saw the movie for free with our shared Disney+ account & Google TV. I can imagine how someone who paid for it might feel. It's not for kids, with Thor's butt & swearing throughout the film. Not intelligent enough to be an adult film either. Great opportunities & costumes wasted by fast edits and interesting characters left with crap screen time. Axl was a hit, tho other kids all seemed wildly inexperienced. A vanity piece masquerading as Marvel. After looking forward to this for a year, I'm deeply disappointed.

title: Maybe the best Marvel Movies in Years.
text: What people claim to dislike on the movie is that it has a lot of funny almost slapstick humor in it. The thing is this is a common practice and called "comic relief" when you actually have serious, heart breaking arcs in the movie.The movie really doesn't have a lot of "wokeness" in it. Its there, yes, but there is no marry sue. Almost the whole story is developing natural and makes sense. King Valkyrie? It's only mentioned once in the whole movie.The main Characters Thor, Jane and Valkyrie all have arcs that make sense. Valkyrie is reminding everyone what is her current state building up for maybe the next movie, so its not great, but its there.We also get introduced to some new characters with future potiential.I really enjoyed the whole runtime. The finale including the postcredits scenes are very rewarding.

title: Why is it Mid?
text: I usually rate marvel movies 9.5's or higher but from 2020 to now I've been rating them below 7.7 the only one that Executed really well Was Spider man no way home that was a 10 for me No uncalled for scenes but ACTUAL scenes that pertain to the plot of the the movie it. title: As thin as it is enjoyable
text: There's not much here, really. Japes. Some beautiful scenes. Great music.So you remember the amazing scene in Ragnarok when Thor realises his true power and unleashes thunder and vengeance upon Hella's horde on the Bifrost as Immigrant Song blew the absolute roof off the score? This movie chases that moment from beginning to end. In its favour, it does manage to get tantalisingly close several times.However...It's... It's a really thin movie. Not Waititi's finest. Also not a bad movie by any stretch. Thin. But immensely fun and enjoyable. Sit back. Stop complaining. Pop some corns and crack some brews. Let yourself have a good time.

title: Terrible
text: It is never a good sign when I am rooting for the main villain to kill all the heroes.It is also not a good sign that freaking Deadpool did a better cancer story than this.One of the most irritating movies I have seen in a while. Annoying in terms of how every character (except Gorr) is a comedian and annoying how much potential is wasted.The movie felt like Saturday Night Live sketch stretched out to two hours.The movie could have been a dark finale to the character of Thor. I mean, this is the same god who lost his mother, father, brother three times, his home, and lived with guilt for five years after failing to kill Thanos the first time. If that wasn't bad enough, his ex-girlfriend Jane Foster is dying from cancer, and on top of that, there is a new villain who seeks to kill gods. Again, this could have been a dark finale, as he is the most tragic character in the MCU, but here he's just a goofy idiot. Chris Hemsworth has comedic chops, but they did this character dirty. They turned Thor from "Thor making jokes" to "Thor is the joke".Christian Bale always delivers, and he was creepy and campy as Gorr the God Butcher. His storyline is the only serious part of the movie that unfortunately gets undeveloped with very little screen time. His character work was rushed because at the start he worth ships the gods, but as quick as a light switch, he wants to kill every god possible. Since he is called The God Butcher, you don't see a lot of God killing. The ones he does kill in the movie were an afterthought.Natalie Portman was good, but sadly the dramatic elements of her character didn't pull on my heartstrings. On the other hand, there are some cool action scenes with her, even though it's strange how fully experienced she is in fighting with these powers despite how recent she got it.The whole movie is one big joke, with no clear focus on what storyline it wants to go. The short runtime does not help either, as it needed more breathing room for development like character work and story.I could talk about the visual effects, but I will not since the visual effect artists have been through enough already. Seriously Marvel, treat your employees with respect.The Guardians of the Galaxy team are there with no purpose than to help Thor lose weight, and then they leave.Director Taika Waititi went way over his head with this one. One of the most unusual inclusions of these screaming goats in the movie for no reason and there keep repeating the joke of them screaming. Like, WHY????Is it me, or do the recent Marvel movies feel like quantity over quality? There are like a factory machine, pumping out many movies and an endless line of TV shows. The runtime clocked in under two hours, with this movie and Doctor Strange 2, and yet I felt those movies needed more time to breathe and flesh out the characters because everything feels so rushed and, in a hurry, to end.Balancing comedy and drama are a difficult task to get right. If a movie has a serious tone while not being a good movie itself, there is a potential for it to be funny and enjoyable. If a film has a comedic tone while not being funny, then the movie would get boring very quickly.Overall rating: The movie has everything it needs to be fascinating, yet it still turned-out paper thin.

title: Don't listen to others.
text: You're going to the movies to see this movie because you like Thor and the MCU. If Ragnarok is your favorite Thor, then it still will be and this will be your second favorite. It has it all, and yes it's thrown together in only two hours, could have used an extra twenty in my opinion, but it moves quickly. We're guided through the plot which is a tad demeaning. But it's delivers!! In every way you want! Action, comedy, heart and a fine farewell.Had to chime in because these reviews of 2s and so on are ridiculous. And while Bake gives a phenomenal performance, as always, if you've seen the film it's Natalie Portman who steals the show. But I sadly believe that is also the reason for the low reviews.As always go see it yourself and decide but if you enjoyed Ragnarok you'll thoroughly enjoy this film.

title: Taika Waititi ... man you should choose between director and actor

Taika you really wasted a good story and good actors.Kevin feige needs to do something about all this empty stories .Even the trailers and advertising clips had better ideas behind them .There is no connection between the story parts and thats when you are going to check your phone and see whats the news.For sure in the way of making good movies feige needs to control his directors more.And if marvel wants to keep going up its better to find young people with fresh ideas. Like what thor did in End game.In the next part of movie we have no mention to Thors mother who is the reason why thor is working hard.The back story of thor and jean was bad. title: Russell Crowe is terrible
text: A bland film, not enough Tessa Thompson or Christian Bale really. Hemsworth is ok but Crowe, wtf. Is he a pastiche, ironic, supposedly funny? = nope just rubbish. Don't bother. Soundtrack was best thing about it.

title: Chris Hemsworth Should Sue Whoever Was Responsible For This POS.
text: What a travesty. Quit watching at the 48 minute mark. Love Chris and a couple of the previous Thor movies, but this actually made me look fondly on the time I ripped my knee open in a bicycle wreck when I was 11. I understand the need for humor, and have quite liked most of it in the previous films. It's a nice take on the character, but oh my god, this was just boringly stupid. It wasn't just me either. I was sitting there watching this, being privately disgusted, when my wife asked me "Are we gonna watch the rest of this?". I didn't say anything, just clicked it off. So glad I didn't see this at the theater. I'm not going to see another Marvel movie that I have to actually pay money for after this.

title: Just alright

title: Great movie

text: Thor: Love & Thunder is a great movie even better than Ragnarok. Chris Hemsworth was born to play Thor. I'm gonna get back to this movie when is gonna be release digitally.

title: So bad that you have to see it to believe it!
text: I am still in shock over how bad this movie was: a lot of time wasted on pointless scenes with stupid dialogue and at the same time major holes in the script and questions left unanswered. Christian Bales' wonderful acting as the "god butcher" was the only thing that kept me from walking out mid movie. At times the dialogue was so awkwardly bad that it made me cringe. I still don't get why they were trying so hard to make it funny...so much so that it ended up with the feel of a parody. Such a shame!

title: Fun, but only average, Bale was great of course
text: A little too campy, but sort of fun. The Gods were jerks, so I didn't mind them going away, and Christian Bale was wonderful, of course. I almost didn't recognize him. Not too long fortunately, so it's worth seeing if you are bored or enjoy a bit of campy silliness. I enjoy watching Chris Hemsworth, he's always charming and funny. Taika Waititi the very definition of silly and camp and I did love the rock guy he portrays. But, if it wasn't for Mr. Bale I'd have fast forwarded a few times or shave stopped watching. A little too campy, but sort of fun. The Gods were jerks, so I didn't mind them going away, and Christian Bale was wonderful, of course. I almost didn't recognize him. Not too long fortunately, so it's worth seeing if you are bored or enjoy a bit of campy silliness. I enjoy watching Chris Hemsworth, he's always charming and funny. Taika Waititi the very definition of silly and camp and I did love the rock guy he portrays. But, if it wasn't for Mr. Bale I'd have fast forwarded a few times or shave stopped watching.

title: Good but too much happening
text: This movie had some enjoyable parts but had a lot going on that took away from the movie as a whole. I really enjoy the comedy but I think Love and Thunder focused on it too much. Majority of the film was jokes and then it seemed like they tried to cram the import stuff into the last 30 minutes. Again, a fan of the comedy aspect but they could have focused more on the plot and everything going on while throwing in jokes instead of all jokes and throwing in plot.The cast was great as usual and Bale did an excellent job as the villain. I think I would have liked to see more of his character, as it seemed he was thrown in every now and then. Hemsworth is always amazing as Thor. His character has gone through a lot of self discovery and changes since the first movie and Chris does a great job portraying all of that while still being funny, serious, charming and mighty Thor.Overall I did enjoy this movie but it could have used some help on getting the story together.

title: GOOD CAST, LAZY STORY, WEAK MOVIE
text: Felt like the worst movie in the MCU, like they didn't even tried to make more than a little lazy story to sell with a nice cast.Fun at times, and then we realize we'll be force fed the humor we didn't want to.Overall we got practically zero story from this, looks like a 2hour long remix of memes and Guns and Roses music, which are good, but does it really make it better tho?Christian Bale, awesome as always, nailed the character and elevated my opinion of the movie.For plot reasons ultimately it felt that even thought he made an awesome performance, Bale character seemed to be written in a way he CANNOT actually bring any harm or threat to the main characters, and his mission carried zero consequences.I didn't think this was fit for the character.

title: Perfect, complete and unremovable
text: Believe me, I'm not saying it emotionally, but it seems that Russell Crowe has been practicing his entire acting life to play these few minutes in this movie. You see how well it turned out. I thought his best performance was in American Gangster, but now I see that in this movie. Here he plays the role of the myths of Zeus. Chris Hemsworth has become one with his role. It's like he has really become one of the gods. The music of the film is the only flaw that can be criticized. Bill is the best role after Batmans. Or at least he played a negative role. Of course, it wasn't bad in the American psyche either, but there his role was more of a black comedy. That film was not very well defined, but here it copes well with the negative role. In Ford, against Ferrari, his role does not suit him at all. He did not belong to that movie at all, not that he is a bad actor. The climax of the film's masterpiece is the presence of the Asgardians in the gate of Zeus. Here we have so-called delicious inserts, like the movie Silence of the Lambs, with the difference that the history of this deliciousness has been used up, but here we are dealing with an original movie. The delicious inserts of this movie fit in the format and do not look ridiculous. As in the movie, Jodie Foster's name is mentioned to some extent. The peak of this deliciousness is the inserts we have of Russell Crowe's face. And performs a mythological role for us completely. The ending of the movie is also unique. Disney paints mise-en-scÃ¨ne very well. It seems as if he has done what he misses in making the best animation in this movie. I say a mythological and since fiction film.you don't do the right thing with your hates.

title: A moderate decent film
text: Thor :Love and Thunder has a slow kind of kick Start but has a very poor build up and not many jokes creates a seasonal downfall. Performance is also another thing, acting done my thor and Jane seems very practical performance..however Christian Bale( Gorr) did a much better job than just carrying the movie forward. Director Taika Waititi still plays a good story and his role as Korg.

title: A real let down!
text: My partner and I have for years always looked forward to MCU releases scheduled throughout a calendar year and heading to see some incredibly good cinema, that allows the audience thrilling escapism for 3 hours!This latest release just makes you want to escape your seat and be elsewhere, using your time more wisely....washing up, watching paint dry.....anything but sit and watch this!Personally Thor Ragnarok has been one of my faves and I also have really enjoyed a lot of other films starring or directed by Taika Waititi, to the point I thought he was so reliable that I would have watched anything that he had involvement with. He makes quirky films, with excellent storylines and always seems to get the balance of humour right......so I'm disappointed to write, along with many others here, that this movie contains none of that and he seems to have lost himself and the magic he once brought to film, and this film just has a sense of showing-off , nothing more, no substance whatsoever!This movie will leave you walking out of the cinema dazed and confused because it just never takes off! I've never walked out of a Marvel screening feeling anything less than blown away and wanting more! The really wow of terrific writing and plot twists!This isn't a film, it tells no story, it is simply a showcase of silliness, with no plot and Christian Bales talents are absolutely wasted with very little screentime - his character was meant to be a main player, but you quickly forget about him and just get lost in being mesmerised with recycled jokes and the feeling of being underwhelmed.I never thought I'd rate an MCU movie less than a 7 or 8 but this is a 3 at best.

title: Thor love and thunder brings lots of thunder and lots of love
text: While Thor love and thunder can sometimes feel like a parody of itself it still has a ton of heart,action,and comedy to make this film a worthy addition to the sprawling MCU.

title: Similarity with Jojo Rabbit too apparent
text: Consistently inconsistant plot and CGI. Poorly developed scenes, no depth in the plot. Lacked thoroughness.Good music. Christian Bale's performance was truly brilliant, pity that he didn't get more screen time.

title: Juvenile scenario but great musics and actors.
text: Full of famous actors left and right, Thor love and thunder did not go through a fantastic scenario. Although, it was fun to watch, good to see amazing actors like russel crow or Christian bale. Was awesome to ear sweet child of mine as well.

title: Not the best MCU Movie but get me excited
text:
Was a good movie
Had a few laughs, but everyone thinks all the new MCU films is End Game quality.But we have to remember we are building again...But some good visual landscapes and view things that gets me excited of what we will see in the future.

title: Actors are not acting.
text: Allow me to explain the title.Actors looks like they're allowed to act however they like, no direction was involved, if there was then Taika did a really bad job.Everyone is out of character, Yeah It's the same Thor that lost everything and now acting like clown compare to Avengers Infinity war / Endgame. And wow they actually managed to make Zeus to act like the parody version of Matt Damon's Loki.CGI looks horrible, The 2nd fight when Thor was fighting besides Jane- their faces looks like it was deepfaked. That floating head looks like a parody movie, I understood it was made for comedy purpose but again that was really badly done.Speaking of Parody- comedy is forced, dialogues are pathetic, writing is just bad and overall a really badly directed movie.

title: I absolutely loved it
text: Wow, I loved this film. It's funny as hell in a Flash Gordon sort of way, and is also genuinely heartfelt and moving. It's wacky and zany and just ludicrous; all things that I love in an adventure.Chris Hemsworth is improving with every film and is the most charismatic and funny I have ever seen him. He is definitely catching up to Ryan Reynolds in the 'wittiest actor around' stakes.I laughed my ass off at the string of witty jokes and situations.Valkyrie, and particularly Lady Thor were just wonderful.Zeus was a complete nutter!Gorr was a very interesting and tragic character.The Gods were portrayed in quite an interesting way here: basically, most of them are jerks, especially a certain one.I would say that is the most fun I have had at a marvel film, or any film for a long time.It is perhaps not a story that stands up to scrutiny if you are really looking at it as part of the development of the mcu history; it really does nothing in that regard.But....If you leave your critical brain in a jar at the door, and just want to have some fun, and maybe a tear or three (I cried), this might be just the ticket.

title: Eh, pretty good
text: At times, you get very curious about some of the additional world building and hope they expand on that. But then they just forget about it and move in to the next thing. The film feels a bit rushed, and there is a higher amount of humor to this film that it feels forced at times. None of the actors do a bad job, in fact Bale's performance was amazing, and the plot is done well, it's more that the tone keeps flipping around and that what kills it for me. Overall, still a good addition to the MCU.

title: Should have stopped at trilogy
text: I had high hopes for this film , a continuation of the marvel universe, unfortunately this film struck the wrong chord near enough from the titles, tried to be too humorous and failed, the few action scenes helped make this a 5.Good to see Jane & Thor together again but not enough to save this film.

title: Great movie
text: Don't know what the fuss was all about. People saying it wasn't a good movie? It's better than Doctor Strange: Multiverse of madness. People have been slamming marvel ever since iron man died. Just get over it. The movie had all aspects. Good story, good humour, good action, good music. Go watch this movie with an open mind and you'll love it. It's always a treat to watch Chris Hemsworth and Christian bale in action. A boring movie will divert your attention for a bit, but this movie grips your attention throughout. Lovely writing and great acting. Needless to say, the graphics in marvel movies has always been top notch. Excited to see where the story of love and thunder goes from here. Looking forward to the future movies of the ongoing phase.

title: Forgettable at best, empty at worst.
text: I had alcohol during the movie, and I was a bit high as well.Theres several attempts for humor. I dont know if im just tired of the marvel type of humor. But I did not laugh once. I don't think the movie made me feel anything other than an hour or two is going by.The romance is there, for some parts its portrayed in a "rom-com" movie like when they're doing comedic outdoor activities and what not. I can detect the endearment in that, it just did nothing for me.The action is there, you get a medium shot, a wideshot, slow mo. Flashy colors and such, all that is just fine nothing special at all.The settings are visually interesting. Theres a location with lots of golds and yellows, so the character's blue, green or purple outfits contrast with that. The most interesting setting was a greyscale location where sources of light will reveal color. That was fun to look at.The soundtrack containing the licensed songs are just fine if you like 1980's rock music. Score composition was barely noticable until the final 20 minutes.Theres two giant screaming goats characters who are basically plot devices. The screaming becomes obnoxious after a while.

title: Its more for kids
text: I can imagine that kids will like this movie so much and me as a kid would have liked it too. The movie is funny and the action is good but the story...mehh it could have been better. To compare Thor Ragnarok was way better but this movie was better than the first two Thor Movies.

title: most reviews are being too harsh
text: I gave it a week before seeing it in theatres and didn't opt for imax this time around after hearing it wasn't as great as expected so i didnt want to get stung with expensive tickets for a film i might not enjoy.Needless to say i did enjoy it and so did my partner. It isn't ragnarok but we still laughed a couple times, the story was ok and the action sequences were decent. Also it was nice to see portman come back and own mighty thor.Yeah it isn't perfect. Yeah there's a bit too much forced comedy, yes gorr should have had more screentime and development. But the film doesn't deserve all these 1, 2 and 3 star ratings people are giving it. Its no less than a 6 in my opinion but ill give it a 7 because it was better than black widow but not quite as good as multiverse of madness.In summary, a bit too much humor, not enough gorr. Natalie portman was good as mighty thor, good soundtrack, good action sequences and an ok story.7/10.

title: something is missing
text: The best of all the "Thor" only movies was the 1st. From start to finish, it had my attention. But with Thor:L&T, along with Thor:Ragnorok, something is definitely missing. So what's changed? Not the actors. How about the director, producer and screen writers?So that's all I have to say, I guess I'll just paste my comment to meet the minimum requirement for number of words.The best of all the "Thor" only movies was the 1st. From start to finish, it had my attention. But with Thor:L&T, along with Thor:Ragnorok, something is definitely missing. So what's changed? Not the actors. How about the director, producer and screen writers?

title: Full of Unnecessary comedy
text: The Movie failed to deliver on the promise of introducing us to 2 of MCU's best characters Mighty Thor and Gorr. Director just made this as a spoof movie for all fans, in same way this was a waking moment for me stop caring that much for MCU movies. This was my last MCU theatre watch.

title: One of the best MCU films
text: The movie is just amazing. Marvel fans would absolutely love it. It's just awesome. I loved it. And a important information for the Marvel fans. There are 2 end credits in the movie. So be seated.

title: Religious zealots may not approve but an awesome look at Gods and Myths!
text: Another entry into the Superhero films' hall of fame by the same director as the other entry: Ragnarok. This time laughs and love in equal measure as action and universal travels, through Korg's unique style of storytelling.We find Thor where he was last seen, in the company of the Guardians, but a number of fatal occurences around the galaxy force a separation: the Guardians on one ship, Thor, Korg and Taylor Swift's goats through Stormbreaker's Bifrost portal to the New Asgard. Here, Thor, Valkyrie, and a new and improved Jane must confront a new evil: a powerful force intent on ridding the universe of Gods because of his heartbreaking circumstances. As always, Thor alone cannot conquer this evil so he must travel great distances to find an army.And here the religious zealots have a hissy fit, as the gods depicted are depraved, self-loving idiots led by an indulgent Zeus, played brilliantly by Russell Crowe (I'll have to wait until it is released on DVD to pause the line up of fabled gods to see if the more well-known ones are there, but I expect they are!). Without support, they take what they need from the gold-bleeding heathans and try to confront the evil head-on, themselves.Taika Waititi's self-deprecating humour and spectacle on show once again, knocking Hollywood's heavyweights onto their knees! A superior storyteller in all aspects: design, stylings and music beyond anything that has come before!! A true masterpiece in the individual Superhero spectrum- Avengers in his hands would be a comedic Dirty Dozen: worthy of awards! He has broken all molds of what sequels should look like: this is not dark and dreary like Star Wars: The Empire Strikes Back, nor fun and happy-endingly as Return of the Jedi, maybe a pinch of both. Having a Star Wars film in his hands in the future is very promising!The returning list of characters, actors and story arcs is impossible to detail from just one viewing and would spoil the surprise and fun for first-time viewers, but suffice to say it is superb! The whole experience is shockingly, breathtakingly fun to the nth degree! A must-watch for Marvel fans of all ages!

title: Entertaining without standing out.
text: "Thor: Love and Thunder" is a high-budget production that doesn't know how to take advantage of it. The script is bland and full of easy jokes that manage to entertain without more than highlighting. The cinematography is successful in much of the footage but there are a couple of scenes where it looks overly amateurish. The performances are decent, Natalie Portman stands out as usual and Christian Bale puts in a good performance without obviously being the best of his career. A movie to see and only remember one scene or another.

title: Enjoyable but uneven
text: I really was excited about seeing this because I LOVED LoVED Ragnarok. Unfortunately it seemed good, then ok, then great, then yawn then good and ended up being nice. Waaa? Natalie Portman is fabulous but has weak lines and they completely underutilized a lot of actors in the movie, not counting those cameos. Maybe the Director needs to stick with Directing and not writing screenplays?

title: Spoof?
text: It had a promising start, which turned underwhelming.Then, it got goofy.Then, it got predictable.Then, it got almost interesting again, but again underwhelming.And it went on like this the rest of the movie. Promising, but ended up underwhelming.If this was a spoof of itself, it would be brilliant. But it isnt, they just made a few (alot) jokes to many.The bad guy they could have made so much more with, but they chose not to. Same with the Thors.Actionscenes were decent, some of them good, but its the parts between the action that was poorly executed and filled with bad comedy and "on the nose" dialogue.Watchable, barely.

title: Taika succeeds again
text: Amazing addition to the Thor film franchise. It may not be for everyone but it's something different within marvel and kept it fresh. Hemsworth crushes it and had me laughing and smiling from ear to ear. The film also had real stakes which I admire. Cannot wait to see where Thor goes next.

title: A parody it is indeed
text: Nobody likes a goofy Thor. But what many people don't realize is that this story was told through the eyes Korg -- an alien rock species who has a world view that is vastly different than that of humans and gods.The comical portrayal of the story and the exaggerated speech have many resemblance to a theater play.

title: So bad
text: Such a lame movie. The only good things were Christian Bale & the 10 minutes of the Guardians of the Galaxy characters. This movie tried WAY too hard to be funny and had so many plot holes. Please don't waste your time. Just go rewatch Thor Ragnarok instead.

title: Gorr and thunder
text: I really like this movie. It was pretty funny and interesting.I really liked how they made the combat in this movie, it was so cool, fitting, and exciting.The story was built almost perfectly for me, and the end got a lot of hype for the next mcu movies.The actors' performance was amazing, especially bale, he played gorr perfectly, wish we had seen more of him. A perfect villian for a perfect movie.It was definetly top 5 mcu movies. Very excited for more thor coming up.

title: MARVEL HAS GOT TO GET BETTER
text: This was such a disappointment!!!!! I don't know why it's so hard to follow the comic and put it on screen. I don't know what I just witnessed. It can't be this hard it just can't be. If Marvel keeps this up they are going to end up in the garbage.

title: Christian Bale and Guns N Roses saved this movie.
text: Ughhhh so disappointing!! My family & I are huge Marvel fans and were super excited to see it. We loved Thor Ragnarok, so we couldn't wait to see what followed it. There were sooo many cringey attempts at humor that this movie came off as embarrassingly hokey. Almost as if they were trying too hard. Pros: Christian Bale and the movie's soundtrack. Also, Tessa Thompson. Kick ass actress and character. Cons: Silly attempts at humour and Natalie Portman's over acting. Her scenes were pretty painful to watch. Aside from Black Swan, I can't even with her. In summary, I'd wait for this movie to become available on Disney+ rather than spend a small fortune on it at the theatre.

title: Nothing Special
text: Thor: Love and Thunder is the latest film showcasing Thor in the MCU for 2022 and one that though was highly anticipated, is one that does not live up to its expectations. This film is cheesy and something that does not show the power of what the Marvel Cinematic Universe can do which is quite the disappointment. This ultimately felt like a film that someone decided to do simply because they had an idea and said why not make a movie, instead of doing research on the character and create a story that fans would fall over for. Thor seems to not have much to live up to anyhow as his films never quite pull their weight in the line of films for the MCU and this one is by far the weakest film of all of them. Though, the film still has its exceedingly mild humor and is enjoyable, it is nothing to talk about.

title: Where is this going ?
text: Absolute shambles of a Marvel Movie.Christian Bale deserves better , a waste of his talent.Taika Waititi should not have directed this. There was absolute potential in this story but it was made to be a James Cordon joke performance.

title: The best Thor film
text: Whilst narratively it isn't the strongest of the phase 4 films, Thor: Love and Thunder unlocks more potential and character throughout.I laughed, I cried and overall I enjoyed what it was. To anyone criticising the films overuse of comedy - come on, it's a light hearted take on rather dark themes that I'm pretty sure we as individuals use comedy to mask the struggles.

title: Ok entry into the MCU
text: While I went in with high expectations to the movie after the last Thor movie this one fell flat imo. Thor the mightiest Avenger was turned to comic relief beta male.Now I don't blame the Actors; Helmsworth and Portman have great chemistry, would love to see them paired up in something outside of this genre. Bale is magnificent, I did not even realize it was him until the credits.I think the issue I had was two fold; one Thor wasn't Thor. Reduced to a Hollywood version of a man which these days is pathetic. Second, and my bigger issue, is they sacrificed story for jokes. Ragnarok hit a great balance between comedy and action. This one really did not have the right mix of ingredients for me .

title: Parody
text: Wow, I watched this directly after Avengers Endgame and the shift in tone was extraordinary. I cannot believe this is a genuine Marvel movie, it feels like complete parody. It's clear everyone making it was having enormous fun (except Tessa Thompson, who looks and sounds like she'd rather be anywhere else), but it's a huge shame that it's not such a fun film to watch. It is absolutely all over the place.Granted, in the Avengers, Thor had become the subject of mockery, but this film takes it even further. He is supposed to be a strong hero but he is just ridiculous.I'm surprised Natalie Portman agreed to come back for this given how different it is from the original Thor movies in which she starred.Christian Bale is excellent as a duplicate Voldemort, intent on killing Gods. His storyline is the only one which has any sense of a proper narrative and is marginally satisfying.After 90% of the film is self parody and daft jokes, it suddenly has a very heartfelt and sentimental ending, which it simply does not earn.Marvel must be drunk on the success of Ragnarok to give the creators of this film such creative leeway as to make this film which is a spoof pretending to be a proper Marvel film.

title: Ragnarok on LSD
text: Zany, funny, weird, my favorite kind of movie. There were some slow parts so I gave it a 9. I'm not one of those die hard Marvel fans, but I love Taika Waititi, and you can definitely tell that they gave him a lot of creative freedom. My favorite part is that they aren't just like every other Marvel movie, but that's why a lot of Marvel fans I know didn't like it. I don't care about the characters, or the other movies but this is a movie I would actually rewatch.

title: Just Gorr and the gods
text: Gorr the god butcher performance was too good and very nice to watch but the movie was like a DC movie.I would have loved it was a little scary or horror a little.The director wasted the the villain talent by not displaying any fight scene with any gods apart from against thor. I was desperately wanting to watch a death match against Gorr and any god fight just to see how he kills them. The movie was blunt and Gorr had powers that can manipulate shadow. With that kind of power how can he not win.I always love marvel shows especially all the ones this year like doctor strange and spider man but not Thor like thatðŸ˜”

title: So much hype for nothing..
text: I was patiently awaiting this movie to release, just to be disappointed. After Thor: Ragnarok, they ruined Thor's original persona, and i prefered his pre-ragnarok persona. A person doesn't go from a serious character to a school jester in just a few hours after say 40 years in the carreer. Especially if it's a god that has already lived for 1500 years and suddenly goes from a millennia old Asgardian talking in the old ways, to suddenly a modern school jester in just a "few years". And didn't thor learn from his first film to not be narcissistic? This movie just falls back to almost worse narcissism, same with Thor: Ragnarok where he doesn't give a crap about Banner's feelings, just "me and my people".Way too many bad jokes and uncomfortable scenes that i just skipped through on disney plus, too much guns'n roses, and bad pacing.Just didn't feel it with this one. So it will not be included in my way too often MCU reruns, just like with spiderman.

title: Ridiculously fun.
text: Thor: Love and Thunder.Thor ,Jane Foster his ex girlfriend and Korg the Valkyrie are fighting Gorr the God Butcher ,who's seeking for the extinction of the Gods.Thor : Love and Thunder is a ridiculously fun space viking movie and I have to admit that it was a very unique and unusual experience .The story isn't that interesting to be honest , a big threat again but this time the villain had some really convincing motives and I really appreciated it .However , it felt forced to be funny while they could made it more serious and it would have been more impressive .There were so many jokes ,more than a Thor movie usually contains, but what was bad about is that I barely laughed once.The idea of making such a horrifying villain in a ridiculous atmosphere is unusual to see of course but unusual wasn't enough .The poor Christian Bale took it too serious while everyone else was having fun. Especially Chris Hemsworth because Thor was far from being the usual charismatic Thor .Finally ,I must say that it had its moments and wasn't that bad , Marvel has to do something about its next projects and hopefully we'll receive what we deserve and what Marvel used to offer .

title: YOU GOT YOUR ZANY COMEDY IN MY MCU FILM...!
text: The latest MCU film starring Chris Hemsworth as the God of Thunder. Hemsworth has dropped the weight he had put on in Endgame but gained more in the form of the Guardians of the Galaxy who he's hitched a ride with to pass the time having adventures with but things are at a lull for him as he contemplates retirement but then Gorr: the God Butcher, Christian Bale, is wrecking havoc across the galaxy murdering deities in an effort to extract revenge on higher beings who let him down when his daughter perished from thirst even though his prayers were loud & often. Meanwhile back on Earth, Thor's ex, returning champ Natalie Portman (not seen since The Dark World), is suffering from stage 4 cancer & she's at the end of her rope until she decides to make a trip to New Asgard for a cure which comes in the form of a reconstituted Mjolnir & her becoming the Mighty Thor which sends main Thor into a tizzy since he wants his woman back (& his hammer as well). What's a god to do when his plate is full? Taika Waititi is back (after directing Ragnarok) bringing oodles of his absurdist humor & kitchy visuals (a lot of it reminded me of 1980's Flash Gordon which I think Waititi is making a new animated version of) to bear w/the jokes & gags coming a mile a minute (just by the sheer volume not all of them hit the bullseye) & w/a game cast even the stingiest of Marvel fans will give up a smile.

title: Felt like a parody
text: I love Thor ragnarÃ¶k and i usually like Taika Waititis work, but this completely missed the mark.The entire movie, especially the first half, felt like a parody and was way too unserious with jokes in almost every scene. Some of the jokes felt straight out of a SNL skit. The constant trying to be funny made the whole movie childish and dumb. Some of the jokes were funny, but most of them weren't.I feel like Thor movies should be funny, but it also needs to feel like a story and not just a parody.I love Korg but even he got annoying after awhile because it was just too much.Valkyrie and Jane was the best thing about the movie.I still enjoyed it, but it was definitely the worst Thor movie so far as well as one of the worst Marvel movies. The best experience i had today was seeing the Avatar trailer before the movie.

title: Solid 9/10 movie
text: The movie was great, started off a little fast based but that got fixed later on. The whole movie was hilarious and Hemsworth did a great job at that. Korg as the funny side character was also great. The goats too, I was laughing throughout the entire movie.Christian bale does a fantastic job as gorr, the backstory, the authenticnness was all amazingJane foster coming back as she-Thor was amazing too, at first I wasn't sure about Natalie Portman coming back but now I'm glad she did.Taiko has done an amazing job reviving the Thor movies from not so good to my favorite mcu movies everTo be honest my expectations weren't that high after seeing most new mcu movies and thinking that they were just ok, but I was way wrong, this movie couldn't be any better, it gave us what we all wanted to see, something even Spider-Man no way home was kinda lackingOverall the movie was amazing, all the characters were good and either made you feel big emotions or laugh. A new classic marvel love story/rebirth/comedy.

title: Love & Hate Relationship
text: First and second act of the movie are mediocre. It seems as if Taika Waititi was given too much control this time around. Far too much comedy to the point where you think you're watching a parody instead. Gorr isn't given enough screen time to the point where his name, "Gorr the God Butcher" is earned. The audience has very little reason to fear him and to think our heroes are in any real danger.Third and final act is phenomenal and truly does its best to carry the movie. Very few Marvel movies have a better third act. Thor L&T FINALLY takes itself serious with SOME comedy sprinkled in. Jane Foster and Mighty Thor are handled VERY well and there truly is a great chemistry between her and Thor. Definitely a highlight. The only somewhat negative thing to say about the third act is the way Valkyrie's character is handled in the end.All in all, an okay movie that easily could've been great with some tweaks. Hemsworth, Bale, and Portman all gave great performances.

title: Those who expected too much might end up disappointing themselves
text: Story isn't complicated and kind of simple .But, I would love to watch more Gorr aka Christian Bale. For me, MCU did injustice to his character, he should have some more scenes. Most surprising thing for me was, I never think of watching Dr. Jane playing as Mighty Thor however,it's amazing to see her playing and carrying on this role so perfectly. And, Thor is usual best to do some actions or comedic scenes whatever he gets.But, sadly, the story wasn't good. So,the artists haven't much to offer though they played the roles so gracefully.

title: "the stakes never acquire much urgency in a movie too busy being jokey and juvenile to tell a gripping story."
text: Allow me to start of by saying that it's a worthwhile watch at the movies, as the visual spectacle and jokes will keep anyone well entertained during its runtime.But I have to address the elephant in the room which is it's jokes. Don't get me wrong, the movie has a lot of very good jokes I genuinely laughed out loud, but the movie was so focused on delivering jokes non-stop that it became a parody of itself.The fourth installment in the thor franchise didn't bring anything new to the franchise and didn't proceed the bigger mcu story.Despite the great casting which I loved each one of them the weak script didn't give them the range to fully unleash their abilities espically the GOAT Christian bale the Thing is ... he's the only one who tried to bring any amount of seriousness to the movie, and was severely underutilized. He was creepy and intimidating. His character had the right motivation for what he was doing. He had everything a good villain needs. I'm not exaggerating when I say that in the almost 2 hour runtime of the movie he was present about 25-30 minutes in total , which was short for me we needed more of him .I love taika waititi style of directing from Thor Ragnarok and I loved it here too , I loved the cinematography and the soundtrack was amazing and give the vibes of the 80s.At the end Thor Love And Thunder is not a bad movie but they could've done better with this incredible cast .

title: Trying to be too funny. Terrible writing.
text: This movie was absolute trash. Just unfunny, woke, terrible writing trying to add modern twists to the story and make it "relatable ".Waste of money and time.

title: "Thor: Love and Thunder" does not innovate and follows the studio's usual structure and formula and the feeling is of wasted potential with the themes and characters
text: Taika Waititi is once again in charge of the production, bringing his comedic approach, half parody and half sketch, which transforms Thor into a kind of crazy Flash Gordon. Many critics and a good portion of the public really liked what Waititi did in "Ragnarok", presenting us with a pastel space opera bursting with color, rock, humor and lots of action. Unfortunately, the sequel fails to reach the same level of quality and fun as the previous film. The film's main problem is that the plot has a lot to deal with in its two hours or so of projection. And it is precisely this ambition of wanting to deal with so many materials at the same time that becomes a double-edged sword for the film. Thor, Jane and Gorr have their own narrative arcs (with Jane and Gorr's being particularly interesting) that share the screen with King Valkyrie dictating the future of New Asgard, with the typical New Asgard gags and with the usual expansion of the Marvel Cinematic Universe. It's all very good, but the narrative has difficulty balancing all of this - and the production having four editors working on the film in the editing room didn't help.One of the negative aspects of the work begins with the Guardians of the Galaxy. In terms of continuity in the MCU, it's strange that the group of heroes is basically a footnote in the film. It would be genuinely fun to have an adventure between them and Thor, especially in regards to the chemistry between Hemsworth and Chris Pratt. However, considering the salary of some actors, the script that is already bloated without the group's participation and even the work to reconcile the schedules of so many artists, it is possible to understand in terms of production why the Guardians' participation is quick. But the main problem with the sequence is the fact that it is only the first of many isolated blocks of the film, with Taika structuring the narrative in a fragmented way. We have the block in New Asgard, then in the pantheon of gods, later in the Shadow Dimension and so on. It is a script full of "mini-adventures", which are types of sketches, all disjointed and poorly connected.The director is unable to explore the different scenarios in depth as he had done on Sakaar in the previous feature. Take, for example, that whole sequence with the gods, where the full potential of a truly crazy nucleus is restricted to a discussion between Thor and Zeus (Russell Crowe), with the Greek god doing some dances and the Asgardian team defeating some soldiers without expression. The New Zealand director's total lack of creativity is unbelievable, summing up his cinematic approach to showing Thor without clothes and placing Crowe in a totally embarrassing role. The scenes in New Asgard, despite being fun with the Disneyland thing, follow a similar path, little exploring society or any aspect of the people of Asgard so that there is more time for the play with special appearances by Matt Damon, Luke Hemsworth, Sam Neill and Melissa McCarthy. Even the dramatic segment of Jane Foster's (Natalie Portman) return is handled with an irritatingly superficial narrative economy, problematizing the issue of cancer in just four scenes. There is no time for anything in this film, for the characters to be developed, for the adventure to breathe and for all these space scenarios to be thoroughly enjoyed.The second problem is the way the narrative makes transitions between adventure blocks. Taika simply has the characters travel left and right through their weapons, demonstrating an immense laziness to build a truly organic story. There is an obvious sloppiness in the conduct of plots and the use of certain characters in the work, such as the exclusion of Valkyrie (Tessa Thompson) from the final act, with the character being completely unnecessary and underused throughout the production, and also in the way Gorr is used as an antagonist. The script uses the Butcher of the Gods in the worst way that an antagonist can be developed: he is there more to move the plot than to be a counterpoint to the hero, so much so that we rarely see Gorr and Thor have any kind of interesting dialogue with each other. It's a shame, because the god slayer is a conceptually interesting character, far from being Manichaean and Bale, despite some occasional histrionics, is really committed to the role, even giving more dimension and nuanced empathy than he received from the script. There is a sequence that sums up why Gorr doesn't work in the film: when the villain makes that trap to catch the Stormbreaker, Waititi's direction is very efficient in creating a macabre atmosphere at the character's entrance, accompanied by wonderful monochromatic photography, a soundtrack sinister and a Bale committed to the character's psychopathy, and then Thor makes a joke about a dentist. It's so anticlimactic, it completely breaks the construction of the scene and, worse, it takes Gorr's threat off the table.Just like all the scenes with the villain, we never feel any real threat coming from the villain, disappointing everyone who follows the character in the comics, to the detriment of the absurd need to try to insert jokes every five minutes into the script. There is no weight in the threat of the villain, nor in the dramas (see how much drama could have been extracted from the plot involving terminal cancer). All of this is broken with a joke, not always as well inserted as in "Ragnarok". This time, the jokes seem to be inserted in an inorganic and forced way, it is as if "Ragnarok", praised by many, was written again with much more exaggerations in all aspects, especially in narrative convenience and humor, which this time does not work so well. You see: the joke with the goats screaming is funny the first and second time, but it gets diluted when done for the thousandth time. It's as if the script doesn't know when to stop and loses control as the plot progresses."Thor: Love and Thunder" will receive a lot of criticism because of the humor, but the comedy is not a problem as a proposal. The potential of the work is, in fact, very high, and could have been an even more insane version of what we saw in "Ragnarok" . The criticism lies in the lack of creativity of Taika Waititi, and also of co-screenwriter Jennifer Kaytin Robinson, in the narrative construction and cinematic approach. Waititi even gave interviews saying that the film was the craziest he had ever made and that he didn't it shouldn't have even been made. Where was all this madness? The action scenes are mostly generic, like the sequences on the streets of New Asgard and in the center of the gods, where the heroes defeat faceless armies, or the clashes with the Gorr himself that doesn't have any inventive choreography beyond the clash of weapons. There are some interesting visual ideas, like Mjolnir shattering, the Thors fighting together, the army of children taken from the best children's films, and, of course, all the block in Dimension of Shadows, but these are sparse moments and which, honestly, seem more like a merit of the technical team than staging ideas or any minimally memorable set-piece from the direction. It is, in fact, a creative and noteworthy film in terms of production design, but the impression given is that the director and screenwriter was working with a lot of freedom due to the prestige achieved previously, and does this work on autopilot to offer some kind of brand or expressiveness that we saw in his previous productions. After the film's release, Waititi said that he only made the Thor films for the money and that he had never read any Thor comics as a child before making the first film. Perhaps this explains the feeling of sloppiness when we see this production.Regarding the story itself, "Thor: Love and Thunder" does not innovate and follows the studio's usual structure and formula. However, there is one plot point that proves to be useless and irrelevant to the overall narrative, being merely a marketing strategy to sell the upcoming film. The main objective of the protagonists is not fulfilled in this deviation and something that was supposed to be essential ends up becoming a kind of MacGuffin in the third act. The action set piece is easily forgettable and Russell Crowe's interpretation becomes an unbearable caricature, using an accent so absurd that it ends up removing all seriousness from his character, damaging an eventual powerful presence in future works. Finally, the action of "Thor: Love and Thunder" meets the minimum requirements. The black and white sequence takes the trophy, the first act with the "Guardians of the Galaxy" brings good levels of entertainment, but everything involving generic CGI monsters born from shadows... I understand the intention of trying to save time and money with "remains" of visual effects, hiding the imperfections in the darkness of the night - a well-known workaround - but, unfortunately, most of these scenes become a sometimes-incomprehensible mix of CGI, where it becomes difficult to understand what is really happening.Despite all the problems, the film has its funny moments, like the screaming goats and Jane looking for a catchphrase, and there are several interesting themes regarding mortality, fatherhood, romance and purpose that fill the dramatic arc of a character who becomes made him truly curious behind the jokes. The script is smart in subverting some things, from Gorr's dilemma, the sacrifice of Mighty Thor and a truly beautiful and cute ending with the protagonist becoming a big daddy. In the end, phase 4 is heading towards being the least connected phase between MCU productions, whether in theaters or on Disney Plus, where at this moment the focus is on leaving the darker and mystical side of "Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness " aside to focus on the more colorful, playful and flashy side of "Thor: Love and Thunder".

title: A few cool things, mostly lazy retread
text: This movie could have been so much better. It was a great potential concept for a theme to play with. But it just never made much effort in developing the details of the story so they would be meaningful in any way. Instead it just comes off as a rushed and cheap story with plot devices so convenient you can't help but roll your eyes. It wasn't terrible but definitely a misfire and a wasted opportunity. It feels like this could be the last Thor although the ending and character leave plenty of room for adventures to continue. But I feel like the second half of phase 4 has just been really weak. I don't see there being another Thor movie anytime soon considering the plans marvel has unveiled. Unless it's one of the unnamed titles they have planned.

title: Falls short of Thor: Ragnarok
text: I loved Ragnarok, and in a direct comparison this film is a letdown. Taken as a stand alone film it would be good. Overall I rank this movie better than the first Thor movie and way better than The Dark World.Christian Bale gives his all and creates an Oscar worthy villain, the story is good, the score is great, but the humor is off. In Ragnarok the jokes were not overdone and they fall in perfect sync with the story, in Love and Thunder they feel forced and misplaced. Its like they are trying too hard to be funny, it hampers the actors performance and really lets down all that Bale brings to this movie.

title: Not good
text:
A brief list of problems with this movie
1. It's a movie by committee, which means it exists for the sole purpose of making money. They have to check certain boxes, make sure everyone is happy, and not offend anyone.2. It takes itself pretty seriously until they decide to throw in a joke, which is about every 90 seconds
3. Christian Bale is a great actor (from Empire of the Sun to American Psycho), so let's give him almost nothing to work with, aside from (yet another) "I want to destroy everything" bad guy
4. Everyone loves Guns n Roses, so we should play four of their songs! But not any of the deep cuts, just the hits at cliched parts of the movie (and even name a character Axl)
5. Russel Crowe: It doesn't matter that his Greek accent sounds more Italian than anything else, people like him so maybe they'll like this movie.6. Screaming goats.

title: Too much Lethal Weapon 4, not enough Lethal Weapon
text: So, this might age me a bit, but anyone who knows the Lethal Weapon films knows the original was a gritty, violent cop drama with some comedic moments that by the 4th film had turned into a comedy with a few action scenes thrown in. That's how Thor: Love and Thunder felt. An amazing cast is wasted on a story that tries too hard to pull on your heartstrings, has too many comedic moments that fall flat and even the action scenes pale in comparison to scenes in past movies in the series. I turned it off more than once and forced myself to finish as a fan of Hemsworth, Bale and the Thor movies. It was fun, but forgettable and I don't see myself going back for a rewatch. Skip this and if you're needing that god of thunder fix, throw on Thor Ragnarok again.

title: Just insulting
text: This was an absolute epic JOKE of a movie. Bad scripts, bad acting, wasteful scenes that don't add to the story at all, bad CGI- just a dreadfully boring movie all around. It was as if they threw this together in a month and put it out knowing people will still go and spend money bc it's Marvel... This was insulting and probably the last Marvel movie we will see in theaters.It's as if they weren't even trying to make the movie good bc it was just bad all around. Worst movie I've seen all year!

title: Fun, pain and dying in battle
text: I go into these films with the expectation I will be entertained. I don't visit spoiler sites or go in with the hope that X will appear or Y will happen.So, I thoroughly enjoyed this. Is it Ragnarok? No. Nothing is.Taika continues to be a god. Fickle, living his best life and not pandering to his worshippers. As it has always been.

title: Probably the biggest waste of money ever
text: I am not saying this is the worst movie of the year. I am not saying this is the worst superhero movie. It is just a big waste of money and absolutely no reason to make a fourth movie about a loved character.Taika waititi destroyed Thor Ragnarok with unnecessary bad humor and this time he decided to do it more. The plot is good enough but there are no stakes, it just goes on. The ending is the pretty weird(Why don't the writers ever read the comic books they are adapt?) People get stabbed, music changes to serious but they are fine seconds later. The love story is blander than the first two thor films. The action shots are boring and focus too much on closeups.The worst part is the pacing. It is 2 hours long but just feels rushed at points. If they remove all the babble and jokes, and focus on the plot, it might have turned out great.

title: Had so much more potencial
text: I love comic parts such as guardians of the galaxy brought, but it really could have had more challenging stuff, and a better plot... Aftermath it was enjoyable and I really liked the ending.

title: You Have Lost Your Way
text: The first and the second Thor movies are boring. But Taika Waititi change everything for the third installment. Now everybody love Thor. But after watching this one, I think Thor has lost his way.This movie amp the comedy up too much. While it's nice to see funny movie, but if it's too silly then it's no good. The third has better balance between comedic and serious scene. This one feels shallow and meaningless. Honestly without Christian Bale as God Butcher, this movie would be a disaster.But is it that bad? Not really. As usual we see Thor God of Thunder in action. He looks stronger than before. Accompanied by Korg, Valkyrie, and surprise surprise, Jane Foster who now has Thor power and wield Mjolnir. As I said Bale portraying Gorr is the best thing here. He outperform other actors and actresses. The action as good as usual. So is the CGI. Russel Crowe as Zeus is fun. And we also get to see The Guardian of the Galaxy team in action.They say Thor will return again. But I hope he will not be this silly again.

title: "So this is my vow. All gods will die." - Gorr
text: Thor has being trying find purpose in his life following the defeat of Thanos, traveling the universe helping the Gaurdians of the Galaxy. But with the emergence of a new threat who seems determined to rid the universe of all the gods, Thor goes out on his own and reunites with an old flame.There are plenty of mixed reviews for Thor: Love and Thunder so when I went to see it myself I was not sure what to be prepared for. It's certainly a very chaotic movie, moving briskly from one emotion to another and not really fixating on anything for a prolonged period. It made the film feel disjointed to me, I was unsure what emotion I should be feeling at times. There is a lot of character arcs at play but outside of Thor himself the other characters only get fleeting screen time and therefore I struggled to connect with them. The action scenes were okay but certainly won't rank up there with the MCU's best, infact one of them may rank with the MCU's worst - the kids fighting at the end of the film. The humour was consistent I will give it that, not always smart humour sadly often childish but it was throughout. And Natalie Portman did a fantastic job as Mighty Thor/Jane Foster, she looked great but also I believed her. Although not every emotional scene involing her hit the mark, there was one that did during the final fight of film and I admit my eyes got a little teary. There was one thing about the whole movie that just felt off... the CGI. It was too bland, and came across as cartoony and not at all realistic. It really did take me out of the film at times.Final Verdict: I'm really not sure who this film was targeted at - certain scenes look targeted at children and others were cheesy adult humour. The Jane Foster aspects of the film were pretty good and my favourite aspect although the emotional stuff didn't always land. It's a mixed bagged and my least favourite solo Thor film.

title: Con the fruiterer
text: When Russell Crowe looked for inspiration for the accent of Zeus, surely he looked no further than Con the Fruiterer. (Google it). Russell hams it up with his mock Greek accent but sadly every joke falls flat. And that accent is symptomatic for the rest of the film. Wrong in tone and trying hard to be funny but nobody is laughing. Ragnarok somehow nailed the right amount of action and comedy but this movie misses the mark.

title: The overall movie is better than previous Thor movies
