text: The character of thor is good and also attractive, but the new mighty thor is also very good. The main focus of movie is the villain and it's purpose that he wants to kill all the God of the world. When you know the reason of his this act definitely you will start loving him.

title: Feels like another transition movie
text: Just like how Ragnarok was sort of a transition movie for infinity war(albeit a good one), this one feels similar, a prequel perhaps, for the next Thor movie. It touches ever so slightly into the emotional themes of love and romance, but ultimately falling short of what the title asks suggests. Furthermore for an action film, it just doesn't seem enough. It's trying to be both an action and a romance, but failing on both aspects. Still, while I'm not really a fan of the ending, it's a decent and enjoyable film with a few witty moments here and there.

title: Too much unnecessary humour
text: When the movie is literally about God butcher, you would think it would be a serious movie but nope. Too much unnecessary humour has ruined the movie, it's like they doesn't trust the audience how we will handle intense scenes, so they undermine scenes like that by adding unfunny fart jokes. Not worth your time and money.

title: A Another Great Thor 4 movie 4 Phase 4!
text: I just got home from watching the Marvel Studios new movie 'Thor: Love and Thunder in the IMAX! I can say it was very good and probably the BEST, Thor movie yet. It's Enjoyable, Fun, Funny, Good Fighting Action, and Good Heart! I Laugh, Jump off my Seats, and some emotional too.Chris Hemsworth as Thor was Incredible!Natalie Portman as Jane Foster aka 'MIGHTY THOR' was so Great!Tessa Thompson as Valkyrie was good!Christian Bale as Goor the God Butcher was so scary and creepy but did a very good job!Other cast in the movie did good too!

title: Enjoyable, but not memorable in anyway whatsoever
text: Christian bale was the best part about this movie, he gave a good performance and it's the only thing that was done right in this movie. It had its moments but it was mostly jokes and a good 60% weren't funny. The cgi on the floating head is abysmal, how did they think that would pass, it's terrible. It's literally so bad, it became a meme for like a month.I don't know what I expected from marvel, all the movies nowadays feel like blatant cash grabs. I did like Christian bales character a lot though, he was cool and as I said before, the only good and memorable part of this movie.Really marvel, just give it a rest.

title: Trash, stop this, marvel
text: I didn't even finish watching the movie, I can't, I was embarrassed. It's all a joke, and bad. Pathetic and it gives me absolute pity, I hope Marvel realizes that by this way the only thing they are going to achieve is to destroy everything good and fantastic that they have come to do, if they have not already done so, because it seems that there is no turn back.

title: more comicky than ever before
text: Be aware. It is more comic like than any other Thor before. Lot of humor is cringy, because Thor himself is cringy. Ton of pop culture references, especially 80s and 90s rock and heavy metal.There is one hue factor missing. Thor was working well with Loki. Thor was cocky and cringy where Loki was more sophisticated, more agile in words. There is no character in this movie balancing Thor. He is like a rockstar. Believes in his super awesomeness and there is no character that could slap him back to reality.Bale is awesome actor and his performance was top notch. This was best antagonist of any Thor movie. Way better than Hella and had enough of backstory and motive and his powers were well justified and grounded in movie reality.I did laugh my ass off few times, but my friends were quite disappointed. This Thor might be good movie for comics fans, but not so well for movies fans. Marvel will loose some audience on that one and hope it is not general direction for upcoming marvel movies.

title: Heartfelt, fun, and enjoyable
text: Last we saw Thor Odinson (Chris Hemsworth) in 2019's 'Avengers: Endgame', he had relinquished the throne of Asgard to Valkyrie (Tessa Thompson) and set out with the Guardians of the Galaxy to chart his own path. Now, in 'Thor: Love and Thunder' (his fourth solo film), when a vengeful man (Christian Bale) with a serious grudge against the gods of the universe begins killing them off one-by-one, Thor must part ways with the Guardians and put an end to the slaughter. This time, however, besides King Valkyrie and rocky sidekick Korg, he has an unexpected new ally fighting by his side in the form of ex-girlfriend Dr. Jane Foster (Natalie Portman) who, by wielding his former hammer Mjolnir, has become the Mighty Thor! Thor and Jane's relationship takes center stage here, as this film is essentially Marvel Studios' first romantic comedy, and director/writer Taika Waititi (returning from 2017's 'Thor: Ragnarok') and co-writer Jennifer Kaytin Robinson breathe new life into said relationship and truly make you want to see them get their "happily ever after". Chris Hemsworth's and Natalie Portman's chemistry is great, and I cared about these two more than I ever have before. The comedy was pretty hit-or-miss for me, but thankfully most of it landed. It's just as silly as its predecessor 'Ragnarok' (perhaps even more so), but there are also some really emotional moments that balance out the silliness. Unfortunately, the story does often feel rushed, and definitely could've benefited from being a bit more fleshed out. However, I absolutely LOVED the ending! I've also seen some criticism about the film's CGI, but everything looked real and convincing enough for me, so I have no complaints about it. The cast is a delight, and Hemsworth's Thor continues to be a highlight of the MCU, but Portman's Foster and Bale's Gorr the God Butcher really steal the show. Jane/Mighty Thor is such a likeable character and is impossible not to root for, and Gorr is honestly one of the creepiest, most unsettling movie villains I've ever seen, yet he's also sympathetic because of his motivations. We sadly don't see as much of the latter as I would've liked though, and I wish he had a bit more screen time. The film is also amplified by a rockin' soundtrack full of some of Guns N' Roses' greatest hits. Overall, 'Thor: Love and Thunder' is a heartfelt, fun, and enjoyable rom-com adventure, and a worthy inclusion to the MCU.

title: Bland and not heroic at all
text: Love and Thunder was chaotic, all over the place, messy, filed with lots of weird dialogues and punchline with a not so strong storyline.The film is particularly disappointing given that it's directed by Taika Waititi, the nimbly funny New Zealander who made Thor's previous installment, Ragnarok, a smash hit and generally has a strong track record of mixing tones, swerving from silly to sentimental with practiced ease.The return of a major actor such as Portman should feel compelling, but she's simply part of some busy wallpaper. Bale and Crowe are instead the film's biggest standouts, because they dare to supersize their performances.To summarise, Love and Thunder offers the usual lightning-streaked action and tossed-off gags, but this time, there's not enough heft behind the flashiness.My Rating: 4.5/10.

title: Fun but frustrating
text: Needed more Gorr, less Korg. Needed more Valkyrie, less jokes. Christian Bales character could/should have been explored more. Feels like a great actor was underused. Russel Crowe as Zeus was disappointing. Natalie Portman is great but she doesn't have the charisma of Tom Hiddleston.Where Ragnarok had exceptional humor, this one missed sometimes. The Mjolnir/Stormbreaker relationship was well done and probably made me laugh the most.Still entertaining, but I understand the frustration of some fans.

title: Not Ragnarok
text: Well my wife didn't even like it and she is a huge Thor fan. I didn't like it, and I enjoyed Thor the Dark World....so...there's that. It was just too silly. I'm all about comedy, but it was just too over the top. The jokes played out pretty quick and just got annoying. Christian Bale was good. The story could have been good, at least most of it. But man the over-the-top silliness. It was almost like watching a Thor parody, like if the Scary Movie guys made a Thor movie. Some recycled jokes showed up that were funny in Ragnarok...you know...the first time we saw them. I feel like Ragnarok was so good because it was fresh, a brand new take on Thor, but that obviously has limits. Twas was my least favorite of the Thors...yep. I actually just re-watched Thor 2, aaaand I think it's better. In L&T's defense, I had very high expectations after Ragnarok, perhaps too high. Maybe I'll revisit it when it streams, but for now, nah.

title: Finally saw this, it's WAY not bad
text: Taika is great, especially as the dude made out of rock, if not a very funny and talented Director and actor.I particularly welcomed the return of Jane Foster, and I was a little bit surprised at the way that they brought her back. I distinctly remember Mjollnir being back in the possession of Thor and Captain America after Thor stole it from the Dark World timeline... of course, the Asgardians could have scooped up the pieces left over from Ragnarok, but where is that other hammer from Avengers endgame? Maybe it is not really a plot hole, I don't remember where that other Mjollnir got to. Did Steve Rogers return it?And then it is always great to have the Guardians of the Galaxy involved, this was before Guardians of the Galaxy Vol3 and Nebula's transformation into one of Tony Starks Nanotech projects. I honestly liked her before when she was still partly RadioShack shelf rejects.And compared to Ragnarok, although there is a lot of humor in this film, it does have some serious drama.But there are a number of absurd complaints I've read in several dupe "reviews". Let's go over these, shall we?1) It's FUNNY.To not like a movie because it is FUNNY? That is the main complaint that I am reading, oh, this is no good because it is FUNNY. Wait, what?There are some new gimmicks in this film, nothing was wasted. And so Thor assembles a new means of transportation through by Bifrost. Out of... Watch the movie to find out what it is made out of. But it's funny!2) NepotismI also read a number of complaints regarding "nepotism", wait, what! That's a big so what! I don't care who plays what or who, or if they are the son or daughter of some cast or crew member. Yawn. And honestly, I did not know when I was watching the film.Christian Bale almost reprises his role as the American Psycho. - at first, we believe that this person is irredeemable. But in a major, unexpected twist, well, you will have to watch the film in order to see what I'm talking about.The film starts getting very serious toward the middle, of course it kind of slightly bothers me that Thor is still a little bit goofy after the events of avengers endgame. But then again, this is also within his character. He was handed a major loss in endgame, and this was his reaction. So, as far as I'm concerned, he is dealing with that loss, which changed him irrevocably.This is a much different Thor than the person that we met in the first film. And The Avengers. That serious person... Which is totally expected after all the character has gone through.And these changes were just for films, the comic book numbered in the hundreds, and the character was always ever-changing, even then.Remember when Thor resided within a geek that had to yell "ODIN" at a hammer which would then turn him into Thor? The character has changed a lot over the course of maybe 40 or 50 years. And then some of his power was siphoned off into another character named Bloodaxe, which was a spinoff title that only lasted a couple of dozen issues- it was related to West Coast Avengers, which then became Force Works.It's kind of like how the Hulk was always dumb and residing within Bruce Banner. And hulk has gone through a lot of changes. There was a time he was dumb when he was human, but smart when he was "The Gray Hulk"- but back then he went by "Mr. Fixit", he accompanied Wolverine in a few issues. Anybody remember The Hulk versus Thor? It is now called "the return of the Incredible Hulk"- at the time when it was originally broadcast, it was called the Hulk versus Thor, or probably simply Hulk vs Thor. And some of the dialogue from that TV movie found its way into the first Thor film.3) CGI?Another complaint was with the amount of CGI, which you can barely tell these days. And this complaint is made by people who don't realize that there are still a lot of practical effects and real, physical locations and objects, even in this film. I'm getting really tired of that old complaint. If we have the ability to make realistic, digital set extensions, then we should use them always. But even with a lot of digital set extensions, a lot of the detail is real physical props, and other real artwork.I like that this movie focuses a lot on the Asgardian children, and it shows their true potential- including the son of Heimdall.I like that this film pulls back from the inanity of Ragnarok, although this film includes some of that silliness.I thought Ragnarok was way over the top, but I did enjoy it. But this film has that same over the top feel at least at the beginning, but it also is balanced with some heartbreaking things.The final complaint and I see this a lot is about "the writing"I want to ask the people who wrote those reviews, have you ever written for television? Have you ever written for Broadway or the theater?You can't just sit down and spew unplanned stream of conscious, everything has to be planned out and mapped out, especially with television.And it's even more difficult with a film.And so the question I finally have is: are these reviews taking an extremely long time to post? Because I don't believe I have put anything into these reviews that are anything near as bad as what I have read recently.

title: Feel sorry for Bale
text: Seems the more Marvel films get made the quality dips every time, if it wasn't for the performance by Bale, which is outstanding, this would have got turned off half way through, the comedy of Hemsworth just gets on your nerves and is so forced I couldn't remotely find it funny, it ruins the film in my opinion, the odd joke or bit of humour if good, but trying to make every scene funny doesn't work, which is a shame as I'm a fan of Taika's work, Korg even over does the joking.As an overall film it was enjoyable, the story was well played out and little easter eggs add to the quality.Back to Bale, he made that role, the darkness of his acting shows how good his skills are, and even feeling sorry for him at the end.And i had to watch it as i cant get this deep into the MCU and not keep going, fingers crossed the next instalment is good.

title: Random Bits Generator
text: Its not a 1 but why not? I had fun with it, what makes me sad is that they dont care anymore, its like events generated at random. I dont wanna spoil it, so I will sum it up real quick like this: We need a bad guy, so lets just make a quick, shallow and convenient way for him to pop up. Why not bring Nat and Mjol back? Lets just make a quick, shallow but dramatically morbid and convenient way for her to pop up. We got Russel Crow? Guess what? Lets just make a quick, shallow and convenient way for him to pop up. Guardians, jokes, Matt Damon, action, them all pop up like this.

title: A weird mixture of a film
text: Some nice moments and set pieces, a few laughs and good scenes, but ultimately far too much silly, almost slapstick comedy mixed with grief, loss and dying.Some MCU films get the balance between action, comedy and emotional scenes right, this fails badly.A potentially great villain woefully under used offering very little perceived threat; Horrible cuts and jumps to different scenes with little explanation or exposition; Awful plot points that, when viewed in context with the wider MCU, make absolutely no sense.Would have been better as a shorter side arc in another film or series. Disappointing.

title: A disappointing follow up to Ragnarok.
text: Thor: Love and Thunder (2022) follows Thor as he goes up against a new villain who aims to kill all gods. He enlists the help of his friends, and a new unexpected hero. Unfortunately I really wasn't a fan of this film, and I just ended up getting really bored while watching it!Firstly, the cinematography was fairly decent but there wasn't much to talk about. I really enjoyed the black-and-white that was used in the film, it was tasteful and set an interesting tone. My main issue in terms of visuals comes with the CGI, which I thought was poor and some of the worst we've seen in the MCU so far. I'd expect more, as they obviously had the budget needed.The acting was good, and the characters continue to be as loveable as they always were. Chris Hemsworth is charismatic as Thor, and Natalie Portman really put her all into her performance, however I feel her character was rushed and wasted. Christian Bale was intriguing as the new villain but once again, I feel his backstory was rushed and felt incredibly basic.The humour for this film felt forced, and I much preferred Taika's approach in the previous film, Thor: Ragnarok (2017). This was a shame as I really enjoyed Waititi's previous works. A few of the jokes made me cringe, which most definitely wasn't what I expected.The music was fitting, but Guns N Roses seemed to be almost the only music used, therefore it got old quite quickly and had less of an effect as the film went on. I can't really remember the score, so I feel unable to comment on that.Lastly, the pacing was messy, and the tone was confusing. The film was both fast and slow, but It didn't balance it very well, and the film completely lost tension for me because of this. My biggest problem was that I couldn't tell what tone the film was going for, and the tonal shifts were too often and abrupt.

title: Misunderstood just like Taika himself
text: After rewatching it J still think this is a misunderstood movie. Taika himself is misunderstood genius. Although he's got a great sense of humor his creation like this and Jo Jo Rabbit, recently Our flag means death are not comedies. Everyone expected this movie to be something like Ragnarok. This is a great drama with some action and comedy. I think he did a great job as always. Don't understand the hate at all. I really enjoyed in the cinema and now owning it on digital as part of my collection. I took one star off because I cannot stand Melissa M, annoying, untalented not funny.PS the worst MCU movie is still Dark world to me I could only finish watching it once and never could finish rewatch it.

title: Alright I guess
text: Marvels taken a dip since endgame. They have become lazy. Yes spider man no way home was amazing but that was the last straw. Thor was fairly enjoyable with jokes that landed and some that were not funny at all and extremely cringey.The acting was meh but the graphics were great. Rate a 6 out of 10.

title: Wait for the Disney+ release!
text: By far the worst of the marvel universe movies. I think the story had a lot of potential but they tried to get too cute and funny with it. Thor has been reduced from and Asguardian God to a caricature.

title: A thunderous applause for Thor: Love and Thunder
text: Taika definitely delivered a spectacular movie.The jokes really provided comic relief, and Chris, Natalie and Tessa was amazing on-screen.Some great stars returned for this production and it was really great to see them as well.Definitely enjoyed the soundtrack throughout the movie.My only biggest concern with the latest movie trailers pertaining to Marvel Studios is that a lot of detail is revealed through the trailers, and it makes it very difficult to walk out of the cinema feeling surprised. The trailers reveal many big moments too soon.The only other concern is Marvel Cinematic Universe (MCU) Continuity as no indication has been provided of the direction in which the MCU is going..

title: Entertaining but Empty
text: This was a fun film. But lacked cohesive storytelling and felt like a ton of random scenes spliced together to try and make this movie. It felt rushed and left me wanting more. Christian Bale's villain was the best performance but was overshadowed by too much humor and lack of storytelling.

title: Ok?
text: It is worth to watch but it's definitely not as good as ragnarok but it can be quite boring at some points.this is my first review on this app so you don't have to trust me but please don't say I didn't warn you.

title: Subpar comedy but a great villain.
text: We did not get a second Ragnarok. I constantly had the feeling that they overdid certain aspects of the last movie. The comedy was over the top in parts.However, the actors did a great job in my opinion. Natalie Portman is great in her role and besides a pretty good Zeus, we have a great villain in Gorr.He could have had more screentime but if you try to tell a love story a comedy a tragedy and the main plot at once, you will have a problem showing everything you want. Bale did an awesome job in my opinion.

title: I just didn't feel it
text: An underwhelming film which should have been awesome, especially with the soundtrack during the iconic battle scenes, but it all felt a bit flat. The special effects were colorful but blurry, the humour rarely landed, the silly moments were too silly, the battle scenes too dark and the emotionally moving and horror moments didn't fit with the light hearted bumbling superhero vibe. The plot was good with a well-rounded villain and the acting performances were good, but overall, it was nothing special and I was bored by the third act.

title: Thor: Love and Thunder
text: Thor is one of my favorite characters in the Marvel Cinematic Universe. Although not all his films were perfect, the direction that has been decided to take with his character has been an emotional and awesome reinvention of what used to be a character that lacked an interesting personality. This film builds upon the events of the previous films that Thor has appeared in and develops a character study of a man who has lost everything and is now in the midst of an identity crisis. This is brilliantly illustrated through the black comedy approach brought upon by director Taika Waititi who is able to balance the sillier aspects of the story as well as the dramatic undertones that breathes life into this film. The visuals are stunning, injecting the world of the Marvel Universe with color and life that is the equivalent of candy for the eyes. The performances are amazing with Chris Hemsworth owning his role as Thor by injecting an admirable balance of comedy and tragedy. Natalie Portman's return as Jane Foster was perfectly handled with her character arc being an emotional beat and justification for the previous films that she appeared in. However, Christian Bale as the antagonist, Gorr the God Butcher, was undeniably one of the film's greatest strengths. His performance was an artistic approach never fully explored in the MCU, delving into an emotional and sinister angle that makes him easily the best villain Marvel has produced. Although some may argue that the film is too silly for its own good, the comedy is brilliantly balanced with drama that will leave the audience in amazement at what it was able to accomplish throughout. The implications of what can happen next in the story of Thor left me in anticipation of what can come next for this hero, and I cannot wait to be there to see it throughout.

title: Everyone's being a little too harsh...
text: Compared to the rest of the Marvel movies and tv series' this is one of the better ones. We are in an "after infinity wars phase," there does have to be some build-up to a real bad guy and there does have to be some filler movies. If it was just action movie after action movie, you all would still hate Marvel and would complain they have lost their sense of humor. To me this movie actually felt whole, at the end the movie felt complete, unlike some other marvel content thats come out recently (i.e. Falcon and the winter soldier, multiverse of madness, and even moonknight). Thor has never been a serious character and we have to remember that, he is supposed to be silly. Similar to Shakespeare's plays Thor is the jester/the clown, he is there to break up all the darkness and distress. The first Thor movie was not serious either and guess what: the bad guy in that was a f'in tin-man! Gore is much better. My only criticism is that I wish they fleshed out his story a little more, showed him kill more gods in person and made it a little more, pun intended, gore-y. Do I think marvel need to lay out its timeline a little better and get to the point of phase four already, yes. Marvel is slacking in their game plan, don't take it out on Thor.

title: These people need to stop and take some rest to come up with a proper movie
text: I do not understand who's coming up with these stupid ideas and what's more baffling is that that someone's approving these and actually making a movie out of it.After Endgame, I don't think MCU has come up with a proper movie. Half of this movie is crap and poorly made attempts at comedy. The might Thor has been reduced to a stand up comedian with poorly written jokes. The concept of Gods and Asgard have been made to look like Disneyland.Overall, avoid watching this if you can. It's just a waste of time.Also this requirement of 600 characters is stupid. I mean why force someone to write an essay. 300 words should be more than enough.

title: Corney
text: That's a word I haven't heard or used it a long to time. The movie is like watching Superman III after getting into the first two movies. It's entertaining, but not a traditional suspenseful Marvel movie. Take it with a grain of salt.

title: It was okay.
text: The movie was great to watch because of Thor, Mighty Thor, and Gorr. My favorite performance was Christian Bale as Gorr. The bad thing is they needed to add him more. He was underused and got wasted. I loved the movie a lot and would watch it again if I wanted to. The movie was a 7/10 for me. Mighty Thor did a really good job and I enjoyed her being in the movie. Thor was really good in the movie and this is one of the times he was the strongest. Gorr the God Butcher did a really good job too. He was really cool and Christian Bale's acting was phenomenal. Christian Bale being in the movie made it much better for me. I'm a big fan of him.

title: Appetite For Asgard
text: I was filled with a mix of anticipation & worry about this film. Waititi has been weaving a wonderful path through the MCU but the advent of Jane Fonda/Jodie Foster was the big unknown.I need not fear. This was a massive, colourful, mad, funny, quirky, Guns N' Roses video which made me smile all the way through.Excellent casting, excellent cinematography, poor pacing at times, great dialogue. A very enjoyable, if inessential, entry into the MCU.

title: Not the worst not the best
text: Not worth going to the theater for. Predictable and woke. Weak in every way. Hopefully it's the last thor. Dr strange multiverse was beyond bad. I guess after making a billion dollars with endgame marvel gave up on quality. Now it's just marvel tricking fans into paying for hot garbage. I'll never go to the theater to see a marvel movie again.

title: Better than all these intelectual wannabe comments
text: Film is great. Christian Bale takes over the movie, but all acting is great, humor is light-spirited and don't care about peoples comment. Enjoy and make your own opinion ;)

title: Predictable but fun
text: It's Thor.I often forget the 1st two movies are even I the franchise. I wanted them many years after end game.Ragnarok I could (and have) watched over and over again. I love it. My kids love it. It got my partner into marvel.This is a feel good, in some ways, very predictable film.Bale is the 1st, in my opinion, genuinely scary bad guy in the marvel franchise and my son was not a fan. For me that's what made it a 7 as he carried the film for a long time and brought balance to the "silliness" of what was going on.Too much humour is probably a fair assessment and you'd hope they'll learn from that for the next one.

title: nicely heartelt thor
text: To me it was a funny and warm superhero movie. I love the decunstruction of evil, moving past simple binary conceptions. That, e.g., is sth imo dr.strange's last movie failed at leaving it very flat, where it could've actually profited from some more narrative depth.The storyline and the character of thor are both quite elaborate by now and need no introduction. Hence, bringing into focus the whole topic of suffering as, i.a., a motivating factor behind the antagonist's actions was a lovely cherry on top of a well-rounded, true to itself sci-fi comedy.Definetely sth i'd be up for watching again with a friend!

title: It wasn't bad
text: Not as I expected. But it wasn't bad. It was a average movie. I think this movie should have been more long. Marvel could have showed more things.but overall it was average. If you ask me if it is worth the money. Well it depends on who is watching. Because everyone's test of movie's are not the same.

title: I'm done with Marvel
text: I think I have been patient enough, but since Endgame almost nothing good have come from Marvel. Phase 4 has been disastrous. No direction, bad scripts, bad character development, bad CGI. And it took several films but people finally seem to start to notice. Captain Marvel, Shang Chi, Eternals, Strange 2... and now this. I wonder what changed. It seems evident that someone in Marvel who knew what he was doing has been sidelined, because the drop in quality is very noticeable.

title: The God of Thunder Returns
text: Thor Love and Thunder continues Thor's story after "Endgame" as he seeks to find meaning in his chaotic life. When Gorr "The God Butcher" starts killing all of the gods of the universe Thor must put together a team to destroy Gorr along with his magic Necrosword.The movie, Directed by Taika Waititi (Thor Ragnarok) is filled with many jokes and is overall intended to be a fun film. Taika's humor is filled left and right throughout the film, but surprisingly he adds a bit of heart as well. Gorr is a well written character and is played wonderfully by Christopher Nolan who delivers a believable and creepy villain. With all the films so far none has given Thor a good ending. The movie created a perfect surprising ending that just works really well for Thor's character.Unfortunately the film is far from perfect. Some of the jokes tend to fall flat when pushing a little too hard for a laugh. For a film that the whole family should enjoy, there is quite a bit of unneeded content as well. The story line was good but we've seen Thor so many times it can feel kinda bland.Marvel seems to be at a stand still. Ever since it reached its peak with endgame it seems the storytelling has been quickly falling apart. Love and Thunder is definitely one of the better Thor movies but at times it can be just plain meh. Unpredictable. Kinda like thunder itself.

title: Good enough.
text: I enjoyed the film, but I fear that they tried to turn it into too much of a comedy.Gorr was a great character, just wish they had given him more of an angle than what he actually did in the film.Decent follow on, but no Ragnarok.

title: Mediocre
text: I love marvel l, however that was slightly underwhelming. I found it good but nothing crazy. I think bale did a great job and there was enough comedy in it to make it funny, but it lacked seriousness and a good story. Marvel lacking lately they need to step back up.

title: I guess it lived up to its title...
text: I'm going to make this one short, because the movie just came out and i don't want to risk spoilers.Right off the bat, this new Thor movie is really poor. It's not so much bad as it is just mindless. There's no intention, no direction, the movie feels as lost as it's title character who still has a lot of growth to do after his bro phase in Endgame. The film's plot is so bizarre and shallow that it's immensely talented cast is wasted. The jokes are so inconsistent that I can't believe Taika Watiti, a future comedic legend actually wrote this movie. In my opinion, Christian Bale was spectacularly let down. I was very excited for his character, because I really enjoy his work and in my opinion, he is one of the most talented actors working today. What we got was unbefitting for someone of his range and caliber. Overall, Thor: Love and Thunder is as bad as Captain Marvel for me, but for the exact opposite reasons. The movie has way, WAY too much personality and ambitions, and it falls short of being memorable or coming remotely close to its ambitions. Instead, the movie comes off as more shallow then a baby pool and fails to justify its existence. Anyway, that's my attempt at a spoiler free review, I hope other MCU fans enjoy this one more than me (although that's looking doubtful).

title: So you thought you were watching a Marvel Movie?
text: I used to be a big fan of the MCU back when it all really blew up with Captain America: The first Avenger and ironman. But since the Sequels and the Avengers ive grown tired of the Marvel formula. Granted, action packed, 75% CGI superhero movies with a splash of comedy and silliness is a blast for a while, but it gets old quick.But this one is a Taika Waititi movie with marvel characters. Taika is a strange Director and writer, and this shines through the entire movie. Its sillier and has an almost B-movie Vibe to it. As is Custom with marvel, a lot of CGI is used to create fantastical backdrops and non existent locations. Taika's choice of characters and interactions in many of the less serious scenes can look a lot like people standing and talking in front of a greenscreen. I love how he seems to choose this Odd B-movie Vibe in a Triple A production, but to me it adds a lot to the comical atmosphere.I get why you would be disappointed, if you expected another Marvel movie. As a Taika Waititi fan I had a blast through and through. Hemsworth was more Hilarious as Thor than I had ever seen him before. Christian Bale delivered a Fantastic performance as Gorr. The "Drama" was Odd and mostly slathered in this Taika's strange sense of humour. But still managed to deliver some suspense and heart warming moments.As a man that would rate most of the marvel movies released within the past 8 years 5-7,5 if generous, I am happy to rate this one a SOLID 10/10. One of the oddest and funniest Marvel movies I have seen to date.

title: Cool but nonsense
text: The story doesn't make sense, but there are some scenes (Zeus, black and white, final battle) that are pretty good and the comedic bits work for the most part.I admit that the first act didn't work that well for me (except the great intro) and I would have loved to see more from Bale's character (always great when in scene) and to feel more on the emotional scenes. However, yeah, if you don't think too much about this film, you can enjoy and have a fun. Not Ragnarok though. But enjoyed it more than Strange 2...

title: Worst Marvel Movie EVER
text: I actually left the theater. The acting was horrible (even for Marvel) and it took an hour to get the story. The humor was typical, but was in an attempt to carry the movie vs a story. Do not waste your money.

title: Like they hired a 15 year old as creative director.
text: I have been a fan of the thor films, me and my fiance in our early 30s have stayed up to date. But this just lost it way. It has that feeling of your really old dad who is trying to "stay hip" and just over does.all the cliche cool and funny things. Not a great watch at all and unfortunately just cannot recommend it. All the dialog and jokes are just overdone, as thought up by a 15 year old (and not a popular one at that). They took all the serious element out of it that you come to expect.from the previous movies and just decided to appeal to the extremely child young market. I guess that's where the money is.

title: Too Much Love, Not Enough Thunder
text: Marvel did not quite amp up their action and story arcs in "Thor: Love and Thunder". However, there were only a few dull moments. The movie was fun, funny, and curious, especially with its new character redesigns and plot twists.Taika Waititi did a good job directing this latest film in the "Thor" franchise. He also wrote a neat script with Jennifer Kaytin Robinson. As a fictional character, Thor was originally created for Marvel comics by Stan Lee and Jason Aaron.Barry Baz Idoine, the cinematographer, was the biggest winner in this film. Both Michael Giacchino and Nami Melumad's musical scoring was great. Nigel Phelps' production design was amazing. Good work also by the art direction and set decoration teams. Mayes C. Rubeo did superb work on costume design. The hair-makeup, VFX, CGI, sound, and stunts crews also brought their A-game.Thor, played by Chris Hemsworth, was amazing - his comedic timing was also on point. Jane Foster, aka Mighty Thor, played by Natalie Portman, was a revelation. Gorr, played by Christian Bale, was mindblowing. King Valkyrie, played by Tessa Thompson, was great. Korg, voiced by Taika Waititi, was memorable. Zeus, played by Russell Crowe, was brilliant - his every scene was masterful.Memorable cameos by Sam Neill (as stage-actor Odin, rather interesting), Matt Damon (as stage-actor Loki, rather funny), Luke Hemsworth (as stage-actor Thor, rather fitting), and Melissa McCarthy (as stage-actress Hela, rather hilarious).All other cast and crew did amazing work in "Thor: Love and Thunder" now streaming on Disney+ Hotstar.I loved how Waititi implemented and then balanced several captivating and entertaining angles and elements. As a result, an almost-2-hour movie felt half as short. That said, "Thor: Love and Thunder" did not live up to the standards set by previous "Thor" titles.Making a superhero out of Jane Foster was the best decision for this movie. Portman hit it out of the ballpark. This was in keeping with the comic books, including "WHAT IF? #10" (published in 1977), which saw a mortal Jane Foster transform into Thordis, the Goddess of Thunder. Goes to show how progressive that small slice of Marvel comic history was to have made such an empowered character all those years ago.In the movie, Thor's love for the dying Jane was strong enough to ensure that MjÃ¶lnir (whose shattered pieces were still on Earth) found her worthy to wield the deific hammer, thus saving her life for the time being and granting her fresh purpose. They covered plenty of key relationship elements between Thor and Jane, and it was fun to watch. But aside from Thor and his love, MjÃ¶lnir itself saw something in Jane, and therein was the real gift of all.As a villain, Gorr the God Butcher was an excellent addition to the cast. Christian Bale was stupendous in the role. He's going to be a hit among atheists. In truth, Bale was the best thing in "Love and Thunder". His character brought great meaning to the story.The movie contained a few fan-crazy moments, and two more-than-interesting post-credits scenes. I particularly loved the rock-n-roll elements. Somehow, despite having more than a few corny and clichÃ©d elements, "Thor: Love and Thunder" did not fail to use them all to regale and entertain. It was good fun, though it wasn't as great as some of the "Thor" movies that preceded it.

title: taika go to hell
text: Movie was garbage and left halfway through it, all this garbage like king valkyrie and female thor, all the childish jokes, give me a break and go to hell, can this be the last woke superhero movieenough is enough lettting taika get a hold of these projects, let him get in his orgies and threesomes, not direct any more movies.

title: Enjoyable and had me laughing & crying
text: Most of the reviews on here have been completely negative, but I thought the movie was great. I enjoy movies that make me laugh and out of the 4 Thor movies, the ones Taika Waititi did were my favorites. I loved seeing Natalie Portman as The Mighty Thor. The movie made me laugh and also made me cry (not quite End Game crying but still cry). I plan to watch it many more times to come.Overall I do wish the movie had been longer as there were definitely some storylines that felt rushed, but still a good movie in my opinion.Definitely take the reviews you read with a grain of salt and make your own opinion on what you think.

title: Dumb and Dumber sequel
text: Marvel starts this year to fall stairs down.... There arent more historys to Tell so they burn ALL HIS heroes down... For The Record i didnt laugh even one time in this poor and empty movie. And The screaming goats Go to hell...

title: Amezing Movie
text: I recently watch this movie in theatre and it's really amazing but some parts of this movie disappoint me. Please bring back our old Thor. Gorr need more screentime and backstory.

title: Just no
text: Taika Waititi needs to be removed from the Thor franchise. Like, he needs to be removed yesterday. He ruined the franchise with his humor that isn't even funny. And Hemsworth is part of the problem, too, because he likes it this way.

title: THOR - LOVE and BLUNDER
text:
THOR Love and Blunder...I mean Thunder (I guess).I'm just gonna sum up the movie with this metaphor. You go to your favorite fast food restaurant. You order the XXL cup of your favorite beverage.They pack it to the gills with ice and you can see all that sweet liquid sugary goodness cascading down all those cubes; looks so refreshing.Then you get distracted by whatever and you come back sometime later....take your first sip and nearly gag because it's not the happiness you expected. Its not that sweet yuuummy yuuummy yuuummy that
you paid for. It's completely watered down. Yep, that's what this movie was.Oh, you swish the cup around and you get a couple of good sips, but man, this watery one just gets on your nerves.This movie should have been sliced up in six episodes and put on Disney+ right after the Ms. Marvel series. The disappointment reminds me of Men in Black International, which coincidentally has the same two
costars/
I like the classic Thor we started off with. Then Ragnarok gave us comedy Thor, which was fine (I guess) because he was still KewL. But, this movie they tried the same formula and it didn't work....even some
of the same slapstick Ragnarok scenes. More so, disappointment about a few things that I expected to occur, but didn't--sad.The trailer made me think this going to be at least a fun movie to watch. The Guns and Roses Sweet Child of mine took me back to the echos of Led Zeppelin Immigrant song in Ragnarok and that got me
pumped up for this movie. Sadly, it did not translate well for me in appliacation. When you go, try to sneak in some crackers because a lot of cheesy jokes are going to be served during the movie.You remember in school when you had all semester to write your term paper and now it's due tomorrow and you haven't even started?So now you gotta throw something together real quick...that's what writing in this story kinda felt like andI feel in some way about Marvel serving me this
Golden Corral dish inside a Ruth's Chris restaurant.

title: BEST THOR MOVIE EVER! Don't listen to haters!
text: This was the best Thor imo above the rest and one of Marvel's top tiers! Natalie Portman was amazing and all the action, scenery, story and all just superb and Bale was amazing as always. Despite his funny memes when you watch the movie you feel for the guy and his role was one of the best "villains" so far unlike Thanos. 100000/10!!

title: Embarrassingly Terrible
text: We are big marvel fans and this was the all time worst movie we've ever seen in a theater. The story and dialogue were so embarrassing we asked for a refund but the Regency theater manager refused.

title: Really????????
text: Taika Waititi has a great sense of humour, and to a degree it worked in Ragnarok but that's where it end's... His approach on this 4th Thor movie is tired, annoying and hopelessly awful!

title: The MCU needs to change
text: The same old story with these MCU movies. I hate basically everything they represent and the main producer behind these films, Kevin Feige, is the literal demon that ruined cinema as we know it. He represents everything wrong with the film industry.This film is the same old garbage repackaged with some new fun ideas. For starters, yes I laughed quite a bit during many moments. You can definitely enjoy this film purely from a SNL skit perspective. Also some of the ideas Waititi plays around are fun and enjoyable, such as the 80s inspired rock-costumes and the designs of many aliens. The score and soundtrack are really well implemented.However aesthetically this film is one of the worst offenders. Rarely have I seen this much bad CGI in such a big film. The action ranges from ok to atrocious. The shot language is extremely bad and stale, not a single ounce of dynamic and movement. Just basic green screen single shots and reverse shots. Where's the ingenuity of "Hunt of the Wilderpeople?", it all looks so fake and textureless. Gave me Robert Rodriguez mid 2000s green-screen movie vibes, but without the charm.Every scene taking place on earth in an interior set is one of the most bafflingly looking things I've ever seen.

title: Just loved it
text: Didn't expected much after watching the reviews but the movie was just wow. If you like to spend some quality time then just go and watch the movie and you decide if its good or bad.

title: Bale's performance wasted in a movie full of silly jokes
text: I'm disappointed that I wasted my time but I'm also angry that Cristian Bales performance was wasted in a movie full of silly jokes and plot holes. This could be epic but was largely disappointing.

title: Great movie!
text: A lot of angry reviews from insecure teenage boys here, but don't let them fool you. They are angry because Thor isn't behaving according to their warped idea of what masculinity is. They don't seem to get that Thor's over the top masculinity has always been a joke. Anyone displaying such "masculinity" is doing so at least partly because of insecurities, that's the whole thing with Thor. That's what makes him fun and relatable, and it's why the Thor movies are lighthearted and don't take themselves seriously.I think the ideal audience is a little older. I'm 40 and it was perfect for me. We get some 80's music, Thor matures a bit and realizes what's important in life, really great performances from Russel Crowe and Christian Bale - you hardly recognize them, good action and the movie has a nice message. Throughout the whole movie we get a lot of jokes and there is this lightheartedness about everything. A movie to watch if you just want to waste some time and have fun, especially if you don't take life too seriously.I'm giving it a 10 to compensate a little for all the teen reviews, it's actually more of a 8 for me.Don't miss this movie because of the reviews, give it a shot and judge for yourself.

title: Such a letdown
text: Ragnarok was amazing, easily top 3 for me when it comes to Marvel movies. Love and Thunder...I don't even know where to start. First, what a complete letdown. At times I couldn't even believe I was watching a Marvel movie. It felt like a parody movie. The jokes weren't funny and felt so forced. I was literally cringing in my seat. For the first time in my movie going experience, I left to use the bathroom. I have never done that for any Marvel movie. The dialogue and even the plot was just so bad. I don't know what happened but man do I hope they change it up because I can't sit through another movie like this.

title: Really funny!
text: Really funny and excellent to see with the kids! If you are looking for a serious super hero movie, this is not an option but It's the perfect if you want to laugh during 2 hrs.

title: This movie is not worthy
text: I try to not be overly critical of movies, and generally I'm able to just sit back and enjoy movies but this one was very mediocre at best. If you've ever had the experience of being around someone who's insecure with themselves and is trying way too hard to be funny and entertaining so people will like him/her and they just come across as obnoxious and annoying. Well, this movie is something like that. Now, there are a few scenes where I laughed, but overall I didn't enjoy the movie very much and I wouldn't recommend it.The story was weak. I don't want to spoil anything so I won't give specifics, but there are several scenes where I initially thought "Oh my, how is this person going to get out of this situation" and the solution turned out to be some unexplainable and ridiculous solution that doesn't make sense and happens to be very convenient for the given scenario. Its just lazy storytelling in my opinion.

title: Badass and really fun, definitely worth a watch (or two, or three)
text: So glad we got more Thor!!!!This was badass from start to finish. Even the post credits scenes were awesome. As expected with Thor, we have campy humor and great music (although they probably could have mixed it up a bit with the artists. I mean it was good but one can only enjoy so much G&R in one single film). My only real complaint was how extra corny Zeus was, but that was forgivable. Christian Bale was great. Im glad he came back to the mcu. Love was played by Chris Hemsworth's real life daughter which is super awesome. I'm going to watch this many, many times just like Ragnarok. I hope we get a lot more Thor in the future because he is honestly the most enjoyable (besides guardians of the galaxy) in the entire MCU. Ignore the bad reviews, give it a chance!

title: Appalling.
text: This is the first Marvel film I walked out from half way through.Leaving the film was a relief - it was torture to watch.Jumbled plot, forced humour, annoying characters.

title: Not as good as expected
text: This was average. For me it was all over the place and I was expecting better but Marvel films have gone down hill for me and I prefer DC. Could be due to Disney. It tried very hard to be funny but failed for me. It was stupid funny which I don't find funny. Nothing really stood out that you can talk about afterwards. Bale was excellent. He usually is. Crowe was also great but nothing could save this. Script was dreadful. Everything else was average for me. Eternals was far worse and Black Widow also poor just as poor with cheap production. However, they got good reviews which makes no sense to me. I'm glad, at last, people are starting to realise Marvel is in the decline but it took them too long.

title: Really? Really?!?
text:
What an absolute craptastic movie. Thor has become a joke, Bale's talents are wasted, the CGI is horrible, and the entire storyline is pathetic. Whoever green lit this film should be run out of town on a rail.If you are thinking of giving this movie a watch, ask yourself these questions:
1 - Am I planning to stay awake through the movie?2 - Do I have hopeful expectations for this franchise?3 - Would I be offended by seeing the character of Thor reduced to a dumb joke?4 - Am I over the age of 7?If you answered "yes" to any of these questions, you may want to rethink your choice of movie. Maybe you can find a theater showing a matinee of "Space Jam: A New Legacy". It would probably be better.

title: Embarrassing
text: Taika Waititi managed not only to write a movie with the intellectual prowess of a 4th grader but he made Thor a joke in his own movie. The series has become a parody of itself. Gone are the days of Kenneth Branagh's attentiveness and competence. Even Thor: The Dark World was light years above and beyond this absolute pile of garbage.The only enjoyable part I think is seeing the mighty Marvel fall under the incompetence of Disney.And, as a gay man, the inclusion of all the "LGBT" dog whistling was pure cringe. But, I expect nothing less from a company that sees it's customers/fans as total idiots.Thank the gods I did not pay a single dime to view this trash.

title: Struggled to get through this movie in theaters
text: Oh god - I struggled to get through this movie in the theater. They went too far on the parody side - and nothing was taken seriously. They spent way too much money on the cast and not enough on the writing. The writing was sloppy, things didn't logically follow and the plot was not well thought out with no nuance.Fight scenes weren't that good either :( and as a friend said, what is with all the shadow monsters these days...

title: Balanced the silly with the serious
text: Was a throw back to silly Thor but again all part of the Thor arc. 2 hours flew by, Crowe and Bale are tops. Portman surprising good. Its the next step from Ragnorak and endgame. Much better than the scores being given.

title: They tried too hard.
text: I love marvel. I have loved all of the past marvel movies and shows even if they had a few or decent amount of flaws I didn't like. However, this movie tried too hard to make us laugh. Nothing was taken seriously aside from Gorr (Bale did an amazing job). Ragnarok is a top 5 maybe even 3 marvel movie for me because it was funny when it had to be and serious when it had to be. That made it a perfect blend. This movie had my hopes very high just to be a big disappointment. Hopefully, Thor can make a huge comeback. Hemsworth did his job, but it was bad directing in my opinion. Too many jokes, short amount of time for stories to develop, not enough seriousness for scenes that should have been serioues, and not enough Gorr.

title: how to explain
text: ClichÃ© after clichÃ©, empty phrase after empty phrase... honestly, I've never seen anything worse than this. It's as if the entire dialogue was written in one afternoon!! There are over 500 empty phrases in the entire film, completely irrelevant and already seen in almost all other Marvel movies. I'm trying to understand who gave more than 1 for this, only children up to 7 years old?!I only have to congratulations to Cristian Bale's on his acting, The man has strayed into the comedy of the film. We are used to him devoting himself to every role, and it was the same here. I would not comment on the rest of the cast. All in all, a waste of time and money, if there is a way to get a refund for this I will definitely go for it, I feel cheated watching this.

title: It's a Comic Book - FINALLY
text: I've read several of the reviews on here trying to figure out what movie the other reviewers were watching. Were they thinking they were going to see some great drama, or masterpiece of film history? This is a COMIC BOOK, people! This one FELT like a Thor comic book brought to life, with over the top action, images, and enough humor to appeal to everyone who hasn't had their sense of humor surgically removed. (Like many of the reviewers on here, apparently.)

title: Surprisingly boring
text: I've been sincerely trying to figure out how I could be so bored during a Thor movie. Sure, there were plenty of comedic moments that I really enjoyed. Sure, the movie established stakes. Sure, there were visually stunning action scenes. But I was mostly just bored. I loved Thor: Ragnarok, so being bored here felt even worse.I was bored because I didn't really feel anything during the movie. I felt little-to-no tension, joy, love, fear, triumph or doubt. Partially it was an emptiness in the writing. Part of it was the excessive use of comedy. Part of it was a lack of immersion.Immersion was broken due to inconsistencies in power levels, character portrayals and comedy. I hated how Thor was made to feel so incompetent throughout most of the movie. He's always been heavy-handed and non-chalant, but from the very beginning of this movie he is portrayed as excessively reckless and frequently in need of rescue by the flawless and unreasonably strong female characters. Somehow Thor was never quite strong enough, and somehow Lady Thor and Valkyrie were always just strong enough to accomplish whatever the story needed them to. Comics and comic-book movies have always been loose about character's power levels, but it was very weird how characters like Thor and Zeus are portrayed. They tried so hard to make all the strong men in the movie into jokes (and all the women in the movie into unstoppable, flawless heroes) that the entire movie felt like a joke.There was too much Korg, too many goats, and not nearly enough Christian Bale. After Multiverse of Madness and this, I think I'm done watching Marvel movies in theaters. I'll wait until I can stream for free and check the reviews beforehand.

title: Nothing more is expected
text:
Good stuff. Seen in 3d and it delivered great quality visual were really good more of 3d scenes were expected yet this is niceNothing more is expected
Waiting for the next versionThor: Love and Thunder 2023.

title: What is actually happening here?
text: As big fan of the previous movie and of taika's previous movies I was very disappointed after seeing this. I feel like the comedy was very poor, nearly to suit American audiences, Thor was made out to be almost stupid as well as Jane who was seen as an intelligent person in previous movies. He tried to hard to make everyone funny which didn't work. Also Taika with his up in popularity has found even more self importance giving himself a main role rather than just a cameo. And what's with the screaming goats. Definitely went on a bit. Bale saved the movies with some proper acting. He gets all 4 stars.

title: What has happened to Marvel Studios?
text: Far From Home was literally the best thing after End Game. What has happened to Doctor Strange MOM & now Thor Love & Thunder? What has happened to the writers? What has happened to the Script writers, Screenplayer & dialogue? This movie was a joke. & also lame jokes which were everywhere for useless reasons. I don't understand what has happened to the best Studios in the World. Making awful movies like this. Highly disappointed.

title: Over-reaction
text: People who are saying it's "too comedic" or "not serious enough" should know those are not even good reviews. Not every movie needs to be some super dark serious movie. It's a comic book movie. What happened to just enjoying a movie and having fun? I greatly enjoyed it, and as a lover of goats, I greatly appreciated the addition.The little nods and details to different mythologies and legends were also pretty awesome to recognize. Don't regret seeing it one bit.

title: Getting tiring
text: It is a waste of talent. When you have a cast that is capable of so much more, and even a director and production team as well, it is getting tired dwelling on the same themes that have been done better elsewhere.There is no new ground or true entertainment value in this sequel of a sequel of a sequel of a sequel.I think Disney should regroup, retool and find a better way of approaching their IP. I am sure they won't as there no threats to their monopoly, lease it all from DC, so they will continue to churn out the same old, same old.Many of these super hero movies are becoming a lot too much cheese in a lactose intolerant population.

title: nothing groundbreaking just a fun little thor movie
text: A fun camp action comedy with romance. While it wasn't as great as ragnarok, it's still better than the majority of the other marvel movies that have come out recently. Tailed delivered once again and though it might not be a perfect masterpiece it was still super enjoyable and entertaining.

title: Too bad...real disappointment
text: The writers should give their money back, and the producers and director should be forgoing salaries while begging the studio for fogiveness....if this was a moderate to low budget movie, it would be passable, but with the a slew of big names, 250mil budget, tons of back story to work with and decades of Marvel comics to draw from, this should have easily been a fun popcorn flick. But it was flat, jokes were tired, actors uninterested, accept Bale and Hemsworth, both tried hard, but were given play-dough and told to mold the David. I went expecting black widow or capt Marvel average movies...but so much worse...sad that it Ragnarok was followed by this...don't even know what to call it. UGH! I'll settle with Ugh. Don't waste the tix, wait to stream online.

title: Another moving Thor film that has me a lil intrigued to see more Marvel
text: I've really enjoyed the last few Thor's, I've felt they have been a great mix of thriller, comedy and imagery that helps makes a non-fantasy/superhero movie fan like myself keep entertained and also wanting to talk about the film after.This last one was definitely one of those ones, the darkness and tragedy of the love in the storyline was so real and nice to see. I cried, I laughed and I didn't get restless like I usually do when watching genres I'm not really in to.All the cameos were amazing and a great surprise, all very entertaining and funny. The villain was absolutely unreal and you kind of understood where they were coming from when they were trying to ruin everything, which I think is a good message in this day and age.

title: Thor: Cringe and Chunder
text: No one asked for this big man sized pile of rock copralite..Should have given the money to a 100 film graduates to make a movie and encourage fresh talent with new ideas.. rather than this bloated waste of electricity churned out by Dozeny..They have completed the transition to the McDonalds of movie making - made well enough technically, conforms to a standard required by the lowest common denominator and will suit 75% of the public out on a first date - but certainly not contributing to the nutritional requirement for healthy growth and imagination.Good job though Mr Bale - I hope your kids enjoyed it.

title: Too much of too much
text: The thing that worked with ragnarok was the amount of seriousness to comedy and the fact that the comedy in ragnarok was well written. It had been edited and tuned to work for the movie and it's characters but marvel just decided to not give any overlook to taika's new movie "love and thunder". One out of every ten jokes rammed into the script land. Everything is so out of place. Natalie Portman role while she is lady Thor is so awful and weak that you forget that she's actually a very good actor.Was very disappointed with this movie. Too much of too many things. Like an exhausting dream after eating too much dairy. Only good part was Christian Bale. Was genuinely freaked out by his character.

title: Thoroughly enjoyable.
text: From the start to the end, I was fully engaged. Not a single dull moment! The comedy, the action, the villian.. all of it was worth every second. I will be watching again ðŸ˜Š

title: Not sure if it was a paradoy or an actual Marvel movie
text: They butchered Thor and the Marvel franchise with this one, nearly walked out of the theater. The story had potential but it didn't deliver. The movie had so many cringe worthy scenes. It was like watching a parody of the Thor franchise. Yes, I do like subtle comedy in Marvel, but every other scene with obnoxious jokes is not the way to go. No character development what so ever. My advice watch the marvel movies till end game and leave it at that. I guess they turned Thor into a very bad comedy and the other reviews say enough.

title: Right review
text:
Christian Bale is going from a DC superhero to an MCU villain, and Gorr the God Butcher is going to be one of Marvel Studios' more complex villains. Gore's purpose is understandable, and Waititi provides a sympathetic foundation for the character before turning him into a malignant menace to the world as the butcher of the gods, which is one of Thor: Love and Thunder's great strengths. And it leaves you with the question, do you hate or sympathize with Gower? Christian, like Hemsworth, is on fine character lines, playing Gore as a well-intentioned (albeit twisted) but increasingly corrupt zealot, and while Bill's emotional scenes are great, watching an actor who As an antagonist, it's even better.Secondary characters in the movie love and thunder
Love and Thunder is full of other familiar faces, most notably the return of Korg (voiced again by Waititi) and Queen Brunnhilde (Thompson). Brunhild (aka Valkyrie) is a fun guest cast member, and her presence makes us think of a solo Valkyrie movie in Thor: Love and Thunder review. Showman Russell Crowe's haughty take on Zeus is an original and outstanding farce, a strong case for Gore's grudge against the gods. Her addition should excite fans who want to see other Olympians in future MCU installments. However, moviegoers hoping for plenty of screen time from the Guardians of the Galaxy should temper their expectations. It can be said that this case alone is one of the weak points of the Thor: Love and Thunder movie review, because during the teasers and the beginning of the movie, it excites us in such a way that the Guardians of the Galaxy are going to play a major role in this. Thor: Love and Thunder review reveals that this film is a collection of the power of the shadow of Gore as well as a fascinating match for Thor and his friends, setting the stage for unique combat interactions that require equally unique solutions. Have (which fans are sure to love). However, some viewers may wish that the villain (and his lead actor) had been given more screen time (especially since it's been confirmed that several gore scenes were cut for the short duration of the film
In our latest review of Thor: Love and Thunder, Waititi delivers a film that is as moving as it is funny, apart from his charming acting. Waititi once again creates a raucous comedy, but unlike Ragnarok, the filmmaker also packs in a truly poignant message about life and love. It's a message that ultimately informs and evolves the main character and his ex-girlfriend-turned-superhero, a storyline that spans the decade and sets up interesting new threads that could be pulled in future MCU films.

title: I feel bad for Scandinavians
text: This movie has effectively neutered what we know of Thor and that's fine because all is not lost, once 20-30 years pass and Disney loses it's limp grasp on the franchise, someone, somewhere will revive this once epic hero.For me, this movie was about 15 minutes in length, the very first 15 minutes where Christian Bale absolutely knocked it out of the park, the atmosphere, the powerful acting, brilliant. I would give the first 15 minutes an 8/10Continued watching and stopped watching after about 40 minutes. Pure rubbish, horrible attempts at jokes, it was basically a campaign to emasculate.Like the subject says, I feel bad for Scandinavians the world over, but fear not, this 'Thor' is but a half hearted mockery in the hands of imbeciles, true fans understand and remember 'THOR' proper.

title: For a true fan of the character, this movie results offensive
text: I personally wonder how the cast (who were all perfect and did what they could with what there were handed over) did accept to play these parts. Even more intriguing is how Feige did agree to put the approval stamp on this painful nonsense.Do you know of that friend of yours that trying to be funny all the time turns into being unbearable? Well that is Waititi here. He is trying to put a joke in every single line, turning Thor into a bulky clown. He is also writing himself too much screen-time with a character that shouldn't be more than anecdotic, and creating delusional conflicts (with the weapons) which kill the whole point of what the movie should have been: A story of violent revenge fuelled by grief and the feeling of betrayal.Betrayal... Well, that part, Waititi manage to evoke it, at least in me.The cast is good, as they are all top professionals, but the goofy handling of the story ruins everything. It is truly disappointing that Zeus was ruined in such a way after how long we have been waiting for the Olympians to enter the MCU. Didn't anyone involved ever read a single page of the source material? What were they thinking?Now I am not sure anymore If I want the X-Men or the Fantastic 4 to arrive at all!!What is good on this movie? Bale and Portman mainly. Both have interesting characters with dramatic story arcs to deal with, however, the whole tone of the movie ruins those arcs taking away all the weight of their personal conflicts.Speaking of conflicts, and back to what I mentioned before... The delusional one between Thor and his axe must have been something decided after a very wild (drinking rampage) night out. Otherwise it can not be justified. The same could be said about the final scene with the kids being involved...Summarizing: the wrong director and the wrong tone for a character that should be handled with a lot more seriousness. This movie completely ruins the main character, a great villain (that has no screen-time to face a decent foe before meeting Thor) and nearly everything else that it comes in contact with.Ragnarok, was watchable but not Good, so no reason for Waititi to return. If there is ever a new Thor movie, lets hope that before writing a single line they sit down and watch "Vikings" three or four times to start getting a point of how a norse epic setup is meant to be handled. And if that is too dark for you, then at least something in the lines of 300 or Gladiator, but please no more "Thor: Clown of Thunder".PS: Dear Mr Feige, please deliver us a Thor movie that is in line with the seriousness and quality of "Captain America: The Winter Soldier". Thanks.

title: This movie is literally a marvel creation
text: Every so often in "Thor: Love and Thunder," the 92nd Marvel movie to hit theaters this year the studio machinery hits pause, and the picture opens a portal to another dimension: Its star, Chris Hemsworth, embraces wholesale self-parody, a pair of giant screaming goats gallop along a rainbow highway and Russell Crowe flounces around in a flirty skirt and Shirley Temple curls. As the movie briefly slips into a parallel realm of play and pleasure, you can feel the director Taika Waititi having a good time. It starts with a pasty, near-unrecognizable Christian Bale, who, having been relieved of his DC Dark Knight duties, has signed up with Marvel as a villain with the spoiler name of Gorr the God Butcher. Waititi quickly sketches in Gorr's background, giving it a tragic cast. Believing himself betrayed by the god he once worshiped, Gorr is committed to destroying other deities. It's potentially rich storytelling terrain, particularly given Thor's stature and Marvel's role as a contemporary mythmaker. But while Bale takes the role by the throat, as is his habit, investing the character with frictional intensity, Gorr proves disappointingly dull.Please visit my website link in bio.

title: Boring and trying to be funny
text: Not sure how this is rated as 7.1 at the moment because it is nowhere near that in terms of quality. Apart from Bale, film has nothing. No jokes land and it seems like a someone's pet project rather than a movie. Way too dark and 3d makes it even worse. Awful cinematography and seems like step down in CGI than even movies that came 10-12 years back. Half baked attempt with next to nothing to write home about.

title: Love is Love, and Thunder
text: After reading tepid reviews and ratings I prepared myself for overexposure to the Thor:Ragnarok goofy humour.And yes, it is there in spades, but I kept waiting for Thor:Love and Thunder to suck until after the post-credits scenes. It didn't. I freaking loved it.Added to the awkward banter is Russel Crowe's cringy impression of Greek god Zeus. However, look a little deeper and you'll see that it is masterfully held back from being offensive.That's the thing about T:L&T. There's a lot hidden under the awkwardness. From a director who refuses to treat superheroes with reverence comes an irreverent study of love.What happens when love is betrayed, lost, denied, or is not what we expect? Can you love a memory? An object? What about an object with a sense of humour and great timing?Well, it seems, what happens is that love changes. It adapts. Not always in healthy ways, but it can change from those too.In terms of performances, Christian Bale turns a minor role up to eleven. That's not to say the rest of the cast are slouches. They really do share the confusion, doubt, and relief of their characters.If you didn't like the movie the first time, I urge you to rewatch it with 'love' in mind.Could the people who made Guns 'n' Roses cool again since 'Terminator 2' really make a dud?

title: Lost
text: The movie was trying to be funny at the beginning, but had no direction from the start. Many Disney moments, but doesn't work well with Thor. May have to rethink if I want to see the next Thor comedy hour. It had a bit Wizard of Oz moment with Zeus.

title: Great movie!!!
text: I loved everything about this movie. It was funny, sweet and full of great action. I loved how the Guardians were incorporated, how Jane was woven into the story, Gor the Butcher, the god lore, all of the flashback screens, the cameo appearances.... just loved it all!!! title: Fan of MCU not of this
text: Few laughs here and there. Thors character is okay here other then this I have to mention Christian Bale is definitely the best performance. Not worth paying to watch it at the theatre.

title: Absolute ðŸ’© don't waste your time and money!
text: I don't usually do reviews but when you look forward to seeing something in the cinema and your paying a hefty price now days you wanna walk out of the auditorium satisfied.
