title: Ignore all the bitter whingers
text: God! All the whinging and harping on the negatives. Just watch it and enjoy the story. It's got everything and for a change is light hearted. Cameos everywhere and the references are great! More goats please!Sick of negative people ruining everything with their doom and gloom agendas. Just enjoy! Some amazing twists that I won't spoil. As always a phenomenal soundtrack! Chris Hemsworth is a god!Lovely to see everyone returning and there was a beauty to the craziness. Taika Waititi is a master at mixing genres and does funny and poignant within seconds of each other and they work so well. I loved the film and look forward to more. Bring it on!

title: My least favorite Marvel movie
text: This movie seemed like a parody of all the other Thor movies and Marvel movies as a whole. The jokes were lame and overused. The whole thing from costumes to lines to sets felt like a bad cartoon. The best part of this movie was 100% Christian Bale and his character Gorr The God Butcherer. With serious elements it felt like this movie just tried way too hard to keep it light and it turned super campy.

title: A feel good superhero comedy!
text: It's no secret that I loved what Taika Waititi did with "Thor: Ragnarok"; he made me fall in love with Thor again after really getting bored of the character in "Thor: The Dark World". And I am so happy to report that he has done it again with "Thor: Love and Thunder"! I still love his comedic take on Thor so much, it still works so well for me, and I was thrilled to see that he finally was able to make the Jane Foster character, as well as her relationship to Thor, work so well and come off as so likable! I finally cared about the relationship between Thor and Jane as well (for the first time in the MCU); I was so happy to see that the elements that didn't work for me in the past were able to become something so much more in this film, and I fully attribute that to Taika's skills at writing great characters and great relationships! He is especially skilled at blending his signature style of silly comedy with some heartfelt emotion, and that is on full display here! There are moments where the film had me laughing so hard, and then in the next scene feeling like I was on the verge of tears... and it didn't feel forced at all!This movie just made me feel good! Throughout the whole film I was smiling, and by the end even despite the few flaws it has, I left the theatre feeling happy and much better than I did when I went in. It has such lighthearted fun, while also dealing with dark subject material, but the playful way Waititi tells his stories with so much heart and humour just makes you feel so good while watching... it truly is such a blast! I love this film to death, it feels like an 80s action sci-fi space opera crossed with a rom-com, with a little bit of rock ballad mixed in! And it felt like such a perfect tone for Thor! The movie is a beautifully told love story about finding meaning and living in the moment with a lot of emotion and catharsis focusing on themes of change, spirituality and religion, and as I mentioned, finding meaning in one's self. I thought Taika wrote a wonderful story, brimming with so much great humour (if you liked the comedy style in Ragnarok.... you'll love this!) and lots of awesome action and emotion. I just can't get over how well it all worked together, I fell head over heels for it!Like I continue to say, I love how Waititi blends comedy and emotion. Despite how silly the movie can be (and I love that), it never sacrifices the story for a joke. In fact, the jokes and silliness seem to have an underlying thematic exploration beneath them; we start to see Thor as someone who uses humour to hide behind his problems and insecurities. The film really did a good job at articulating Thor's inner pain through the humour, it was brilliant. We see characters express themselves in deeper ways through comedy than they could normally. Plus, I just really like Waititi's comedic style and tone, and find it's unlike anything else we are used to seeing in comedy currently. It works so well for me... every joke and gag here had me laughing out loud. And the emotion of the film is so poignant too, from the incredible opening scene with Gorr, to small dialogue scenes between Thor and Jane (I loved those moments, they were quite well written). It hits so well and with so much impact, and doesn't feel forced or tonally off in any way... Taika just has a gift for blending these tones!It shouldn't be a stretch to say that I felt this film was written so cleverly and with so much heart! I thought it told a great story with some impactful meaning and some awesome comedy. It could be cheesy at times, but I loved that, it felt like it matched that 80s rock ballad style perfectly! There were also so many storytelling decisions that I found to be quite bold for Marvel. Heck, the film opens with a scene discussing religion, faith, and the notion of gods in such an intelligent way, questioning whether gods are worth worshiping, while also establishing our fantastic villain, Gorr the God Butcher. I truly found him to be quite sympathetic, thanks to some great writing, especially in that first scene, as well as Christian Bale's incredible performance. It's not an understatement to say he delivered one of the best performances we have seen in the MCU, and he has become one of my favourite villains among Thanos, Killmonger, Loki and Wanda! Bale commands the screen, he was menacing and terrifying, and yet still had moments where he was really funny, on top of showing an emotional/sympathetic side! He had this Pennywise-like sort of cheesy, creepy vibe to him which I loved; I just couldn't get enough of Gorr and Bale's performance. He also looked phenomenal too! But I think that leads to my biggest complaint for the film... we only get a few Gorr scenes, and while Bale kills it every time, I could've used a little more! And that brings me to my next slight issue... structurally the movie does feel a little messy at times, and scenes feel very rushed at the beginning. You can tell it was really cut down, so much like with Gorr, I would've loved to see a few more scenes added in, the movie felt like it needed an extra 15 minutes at least. It still works quite well as a final product, but I found myself longing for more and feeling like we were missing scenes here or there at many times throughout the film. An extended cut honestly wouldn't hurt the film, and because I loved literally every scene we got in the movie, I'd be so happy to see even more!The soundtrack in this movie was phenomenal. I loved Giacchino's score, and the heavy metal version of the Marvel fanfare was also really cool! But my absolute favourite element of it was the Guns 'n Roses focus! Waititi made great use of classic songs such as "Sweet Child O' Mine", "Welcome to the Jungle" and "Paradise City". I thought it was really cool to have to focus on one band, as it made the movie sound more cohesive rather than jumping around to different sounding music. It did however use a few other songs, and I love the use of Enya's "Only Time" and ABBA's "Our Last Summer" over some really fun montages, the latter of which is what really made me care about Thor and Jane's relationship. I love how we got to look back at a time when they were in love, and see all the mundane activities they got up to instead of just the superhero conflict stuff we saw in the last movies. The stripped down approach helped to make me finally understand why the relationship was so important to Thor, and seeing him reconnect with and come to terms with his current relationship status with Jane was quite perfect. I also loved how they compared this relationship to Thor's relationships with his ex-hammer, Mjolnir, and his current axe, Stormbreaker, and the way they personified the weapons was so funny to me! Chris Hemsworth really sold those scenes so well too! In fact, he sold everything Thor did in this movie perfectly, from the great action to the hilarious comedic moments. I really felt Thor's pain as he was looking for purpose in the universe. And did he ever look the part here... his muscles are HUGE. He is just perfect in this role and I love how he has evolved the character over the years! His chemistry with Natalie Portman here was phenomenal too, again, this is the best they've ever been together. I loved Jane's story, and while it was so cool to see her wield Mjolnir and take up the Mighty Thor mantle, it was the underlying emotional elements that worked best for me!Now, putting aside everything else, I truly enjoyed this film purely for how it made me feel. Because it made me feel good! I went in expecting a good time, and not only did I get that, but it actually improved how I was feeling as I watched the movie; I left feeling better than I did before I saw it! It just made me happy, it made me smile and laugh so much, and even the emotion found a way to touch me in really profound ways. So yes, I may be more forgiving of this movie than some, but for me it just worked so well and really made me feel good! So if you want a fun time at the movies that makes you feel good, I'd highly recommend "Thor: Love and Thunder". I love it to death, and honestly I have no specific reason why, I just felt so good after watching it and find it so unashamedly loveable! It may not be for everyone as it does use a niche style of comedy, but it sure worked so well for me! I just loved how happy it made me. It's unlike anything else in the MCU and really treads some new ground, so thank you, Taika Waititi, for this movie that brought a little extra light into my life! And genuinely, can we get Thor 5 like right now? I need to see it so badly! Loved every second of this and laughed so.

title: Lost it...
text: The balance of humour was completely lost. As if it were being forced at every opportunity until the movie (reluctantly) had to have a serious moment... Almost true of Taika, who started with humble, good films with subtle humour, but now appears a changed, ego centric Hollywood man. I loved Ragnarok, but was it this success that changed him? The core storyline could have made for a great film, but the script was poorly written and felt very rushed. Weirdly, I almost feel embarrassed for Christian Bale and Russel Crowe appearing in this film... such a shame.

title: Thor Movie? Really?
text:
I was very excited to watch another Mighty Thor movie! Love and Thunder intrigued me. All other Thor movies had greatness as Thor battled his foes along side other action heroes with plots changing throughout; but I thought this movie was supposed to be about super heroes against a super foe and their cohorts.Instead...
What I watched was a slap stick goofy parody laced with other agendas installed towardbthe end that really, I'm getting sick and tired of seeing and hearing. Done with Marvel if these agendas continue!!!!!Please straighten up and create Thor movie/series like the first Thor or like Ragnorok.

title: Chris Hemsworth and Natalie Portman's Chemistry Saves You Throughout the Movie !!!
text: A lot is happening in Thor: Love and Thunder. The premise is two-fold, with Thor (Chris Hemsworth) waging a war with the Gods to save a bunch of kids from the hands of a butcher named Gorr (Christian Bale). At the same time, he is also navigating his rocky love story with Dr. Jane Foster aka The Mighty Thor (Natalie Portman). Along the way, Thor encounters some old friends, makes some new ones and goes from flexing his big guns to doing a full Monty in a matter of minutes.Director Taika Waititi's personal take on pop culture, music, fashion and humour is pretty evident throughout the 120-odd minutes. Mind you, the film has some genuinely funny moments, but most of them don't actually involve Thor. You will see a lot of familiar faces from Thor's universe and multiple references to previous films and some cross-over moments. In fact, one of the best scenes in the film is a long show-reel that introduces Thor to the audience.What the film excels at is giving the audience a bang for their buck. The VFX, the sets and action scenes are top-notch. In fact, the fight scenes that involve The Might Thor and Gorr are some of the best choreographed moments in recent MCU history. Russel Crowe's Zeus act is hilarious and looking at him you can't help but wonder if this was the guy who once played a Gladiator.Christian Bale is rock solid as Gorr and menacing in most parts. Natalie Portman and Chris Hemsworth have great chemistry and their comic timing is on point as well. The soundtrack, especially the late 80's rock tracks, adds flavour to the big scenes.If you don't compare it to Thor: Ragnarok, then Thor: Love and Thunder is enjoyable. There are classic goofy Thor moments and then the larger-than-life action scenes. Here's hoping the next Thor movie feels more organic and wholesome than just a pit-stop to making a quick buck for the bosses at Marvel.

title: Don't Give Taika Waititi Money!!!
text: Don't Give Taika Waititi Money!!! Or you'll end up with a film like this.A horrible @&ÃŸ&# of a movie. It's really just the most pathetic excuse for a film. Just terrible.AND SO MUCH FUN!!! Mel Brooks finally has a worthy successor! Just imagine this with practical effects in the 80's with glitter and without C. G. I. Goats."Stylistically this film does a lot. Guns'n'Roses music figured prominently.""The major end-scene may conform to Marvel standards, contuation results in more 'slightly Pythonesque" humour.""Well done".I'm not saying "go see this motion picture". I'm saying GO HAVE FUN!

title: Silly, childish and not impressive
text: What happened to the great surprises, action and subtle jokes that was the Marvel universe? The new Thor is a mix of a childrens movie, silly jokes and stupid characters spiced up with the occasional action but nothing that makes you jump out of your seat like when the first Marvels came out. A thin story all about a Thor acting like a love struck teenager with a pre-teen humor that takes up way too much of the movie. For Waititi fans who likes his humor, this might be a good movie. To me, it ruins the experience. Cut out the unfunny love story bits and you have maybe 30 minutes worth watching. Well, all good comes to an end.

title: Go see this, it's a blast !!
text: I too, felt compelled to leave a review after reading all these negative reviews. This is my first review in years if not ever. The negative reviews here are silly and way off mark. We go to movies to escape, be entertained, to laugh, to cry, to cheer. This movie delivered ALL of these things. The love story was sweet and emotional. The ending was both heart wrenching and heart warming. And it's Thor. Just sit back and enjoy it !! I will see it again. Please just go see for yourself. And just expect another great Thor movie.

title: Dreadful and a waste...
text: Christian Bale was amazing and had some great acting, which sadly was wasted in a film pushing too hard on being funny. The film was empty all around, and honestly, just raised expectations on us viewers which were soon crushed.

title: Great
text: I thought this movie was great! I had fun watching it and that's all that really matters, I've seen a lot of reviews saying it's pretty fast paced which I sort of agree with, but with all of the movies that have come out thus far in stage 4, I think it's one of the least fast paced.Overall super enjoyable and a fun watch for the family!

title: Marvel You can do better
text: Looks like Marvel is still in revamp stage after avengers endgame..thet are still looking to find the right tuneThor love and thunder is Fun at parts and cliche most of the run time.There is absolutely No soul in the movie and The CG is big letdownChristian Bale is good at his own space.

title: Excellent movie
text: I think Thor: Love and Thunder was an excellent movie! The comedy really reflected Thors personality.Definitely not what I expected but my expectations were surpassed. I would highly recommend watching it on the bases of the main characters personality and not comparing them to the genres of other MCU films as it has its own storyline and feel! The ending was a very well done segway into setting the scene for the fifth Thor movie. Although I feel the plot of the movie was predictable it still had me at the edge of my seat.The music was fitting to the scenes and gave us more of a feel into the meaning of the moment.

title: Superfun and funny
text: Don't listen to all of these sour comments. It super fun, humorous and has great music. It's marvel people, if you can't appreciate it go watch a freqking documentary.

title: Is this for real
text: I am in the theater right at this moment and I can't help but wonder who told the actors to act as corny as possible. This is beyond a doubt one of the worst superhero movies I have ever seen. You will instantly regret paying good money to see it. Remember when Matt Damon made the movie funny because he over acted well now he is the least corny person in this film and all other actors are grand over caricatures of their characters. This is horrible, I have my wife's sweater and the only reason I can't stay soundly asleep is because the horrible noise which accompanies the horrible cgi, wakes me up all over again. Christian Bale forgot how to act, Natalie Portman, seriously and Chris - you were horrible. Save your money.

title: Thor is God of Comedy!!
text: Marvel has really forgot there way in Phase 4.How can they even allow to do this to iconic character like Thor.Trying to introduce comedy in every scene.God the Gor Bucher was not upto the mark at all in the movie dispite good acting by CB.All GODs were shown so stupid. They are GODs not clowns to create a circus.

title: A sparkling visual spectacle to be experience in theatres!
text: Oscar-winning film-maker Taika Waititi's approach to superhero movies is directly in contrast with the edgier, darker turn most franchises have taken off late. While Robert Pattinson's smash hit "Batman (2022)" showcased a grittier, more ground-level caped crusader, "Spiderman: No Way Home (2021)" and "Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness (2022)" ventured into the multiverse, opening up psychological thriller and horror elements for the MCU. Taika's unique blend of colorful storytelling and quirky comedy had single-handedly revived the Thor franchise which was down in the doldrums after the disastrous "Thor: The Dark World (2013), infusing fresh new life and zest into the character with his quite fabulous "Thor: Ragnarok (2017)".While continuing in the same vein, leveraging his star man Chris Hemsworth's natural gift for sarcasm and comedy, Taika adds new elements to the arc in this edition, calling in not one, not two but three Oscar-winning performers in Natalie Portman, Christian Bale and Russel Crowe. The story follows Thor after the events of "Avengers: Endgame (2019)" with the God of Thunder seemingly reduced to a shadow of his former self, tired of his superhero adventures and suffering from a lack of purpose and meaning. He is, however, forced to take a break from this existential angst after Christian Bale's "Gorr the God Butcher" unleashes fresh hell on the universe, seemingly on a rampage to hunt down every God he can get his hands on.Armed with a mystical superweapon known as the Necrosword and the intensity and screen presence only an actor of Bale's caliber can bring in, "Gorr" is a fresh new interpretation of antagonists in the MCU and a fine adaptation of the classic character from the iconic "Thor: God of Thunder (2013)" comic. Waititi's storytelling brilliance doesn't stop there, as he warps in another fan-favorite comic book arc, that of "The Mighty Thor (2016)" where Thor's lady love Jane Foster becomes a female version of the God of Thunder and blends it neatly with the Gorr mythology.The writing, by Jennifer Kaytin Robinson and the director himself, is continuously engaging and is peppered with unexpected surprises to keep you on the edge of your seat. While the core story arc is painstakingly told, Taika pays close attention to expanding the universe as well, throwing up some juicy easter eggs that will be cannon fodder to the fans for months on end as well as teasing some universe-shattering extensions to the MCU in the mid and post-credits scene. That an upcoming story arc might feature one of my favorite comic actors in recent times was an absolute joy!Despite this apparent plethora of characters he has to work with, Waititi manages to keep his script tight and engaging and most importantly, short with a barely 2-hour-long runtime. With scenes involving Jeff Goldblum's "Grandmaster" and Peter Dinklage's "Eitri" cut at the editing table to accommodate this, there will be a significant section of the fandom that will wait with bated breath for the full directors cut version of this fine film. "Thor: Love and Thunder" may not rise to the groundbreaking levels of Ragnarok, but backed by solid performances, delivers wholesome entertainment and a visually grandiose theatre experience. Recommended!

title: Natalie Portman , Christian Bale effort become a big joke..............
text: Marvel best known for action not goods story ( expect some tv series ) but this movie action , story , plot everything is terrible . Very bad direction with stupid some story become wasted Christian Bale and Natalie Portman's effort and doesn't blossomed and those way they's character become effectless just a character just they come , fight and die , nothing others happened . In finishing this movie want to add some emotion but stupid plot mak it boiled .If parallel universe truly exits , i hoped their become make a good thor love and thunder movie , their they see the greatest mighty thor and best villain Gorr the God Butcher.

title: Enjoy it and don't take it too seriously
text: The story was well done imo with Christian bale as the villain. I'm not that hard core into marvel but found this thoroughly entertaining and humorous. Fun times for me.

title: MORE OF A FART THAN THUNDER
text: Really puerile humour and weak boring story. Confused as to what it was all about. Cancer, feminism, schoolboy humour. A real mess.Loved early Thor but not this. Love Hemsworth but now he really is just taking the piss.Waititi should stick to his TV comedies, which I love, and leave superhero movies alone. He has literally lost the plot. ðŸ™„

title: The End Of Thor
text: What was that lol. First time ever i considered leaving the theatre 15min into it. Empty movie, no proper story. Bale was amazing, and he gets the 1 star.

title: Terrible.
text: More of a feature length SNL skit with a budget than an MCU movie. A parody of superhero movies that seemed to draw inspiration from Spy Kids. It seems to try to pander to all audiences, and ultimately delivers to none of them. Jane had potential as a superhero only to be sidelined. Christian Bales acting and character was amazing and didn't fit in this movie. Wish I didn't watch it. Hopefully this isn't the tone that Disney is setting moving forward with the MCU. Disappointing.

title: Don't get the hate - this was excellent!
text: Thor: Love and Thunder is an excellent film. It's hilarious, has a great villain, and Chris Hemsworth delivers, as usual, as Thor. The movie once again deals with Thor looking to belong to a family that cares about him, and in doing so he has to rescue a bunch of missing children and reconnect with the old love of his life who now wields his Hammer and has become a new version of Thor. Thor evolves in this film to a father figure, and it's beautiful and funny and heartfelt.

title: Want my money back
text: The movie was a waste of time. I should have waited for it come on Disney plus. I don't know why they had to ruin Thor. I am feeling bad for my wife though, I made her watch this movie.

title: Best 2022 comedy movie
text:
Loved it so much because it made me laugh so much i palmost pissed my pants. Drama part was excellent too. Loved Christian Bale in it and Russel Crow as Zeus. This was the best comedy movie of 2022. Lots of people dont understand director Taika Waititi(Thor: Ragnarok, What We Do In The Shadows, Jo Jo Rabbit etc....) but he made very good comedy movie in it's own way, and that is probably the problem with Marvel fanatics. They dont understand it because they expected mindless action pavked with little humor..
You who gave it low rating, go for another try and watch the movie again. It is worth it..

title: Yet another Marvel hero turned into a punchline
text: Despite bad reviews, I wanted to form my own opinion and decided I would give Thor Love and Thunder a chance, how wrong I was not to listen. Every moment is turned into a joke for cheap laughs, Gorr barely had any screen, the script seemed all over the place. Not a fun movie yo watch only giving it two stars because of the fantastic performance of Christian Bale.

title: Empty crowd with walkouts.
text: First time I have seen so many people walk out in the middle of a movie. I hope they got their money back.My Dad picked it for his birthday. He hated it. Loved the other movies, and we both couldn't stand this one. No point to this movie except to suck all the money out of Thor that they can. This should have never existed. Save your money and stay home. Even the 3d was bad.

title: Marvel's descent to chaos
text: The multiverse plotlines and the insane success of Marvel these days, has made their content become empty, shallow and a mere eye candy experience.The best word to describe this movie is soulless; a fast-paced story that doesn't allow for the plot to evolve organically, a goof fest of characters that are simple comedic versions of their own selves, terrible jokes, ridiculous scenes (the kids in the final act...) all of it wrapped in decent CGI to make it easily digestible.Taika Waititi did the hardest thing which was to recover a character with a boring couple of movies and making the third one the best adaptation for the character itself and for its place in the cinematic universe, but this second time around he simply over did it, I felt nothing for this film, it's an empty experience with good imagery.If you stay for the credit scenes you will see how pointless the final part of the film is, and it had the potential to do some sort of redemption but it's again an empty gesture... Also, the reason I don't score this lower, is the fantastic performance by Christian Bale (nothing surprising here) and makes me sad that they wasted such a great villain in a movie like this, a great achievement not from the acting department made possible by Bale and Portman but also for the villain's background story, one of the richest I can recall from the MCU.Wasted potential, Marvel and Disney are sitting on their pile of money making this Phase 4 which has been overall very underwhelming, I know this won't happen, but they should either give audiences a break from Marvel or just reinvent the Universe and explore other characters and directions.

title: It is just fantastic.
text: It is just fantastic. No matter what other reviews tell about that ok, it is too much comedy. This film was hilarious, heartfelt and beautiful. I laughed a lot of the jokes, I cried at the emotional moments.

title: Letdown
text: After the pure joy that was 'Thor Ragnarok' I was really looking forward to this instalment, but it just ended up being a disappointment. Christian Bale, who I thought was his usual excellent self, could not save a film that had way too many jokes, cheesy, cringy special effects and the huge overuse (which isn't necessarily a bad thing) of GNR songs. It appears that someone also thought it would be really funny to have massive goats who make constant screaming noises, and these noises became very annoying, very quickly. Russell Crowe as Zeus was quite forgettable, and Korg is in danger of becoming the Jar-Jar Binks of Marvel. I have been a borderline MCU fanboy since the original 'Iron Man' film right up to 'Shang-Chi' but unfortunately it feels as time goes on, everything the MCU is churning out is becoming weaker and weaker.

title: Interesting take
text: Enjoyed the film for the introduction of Jane Foster's Thor. Not what I was expecting, but liked the film for being the character to the big screen. Wasn't sure another Thor was necessary even though he is my FAVORITE Avenger. Definitely worth the watch.

title: Terrible!
text: Worst Marvel movie to date! It's ridiculous and lame. The constant jokes are very cringe worthy. The acting is by far the worst as well. And let's not get started on the CGI!!! Way overused and looks terrible! People complained about The Eternals movie being the worst, but it's spectacular compared to this drivel. Actually, The Eternals should set the bar for cinematography and great story telling. The Thor movies need to stop! And they definitely need to find a different director if they plan to make more movies. We need more movies like Logan and less movies like this. Terrible, terrible!!!!!

title: Tone deaf, Silly in a bad way
text: This is a popcorn movie that you're not meant to take seriously, while I'm fine with silliness a lot of it here is in very poor taste.The infinity gauntlet that caused half of humanity to just poof for 5 years? Yeah lets make fun of that tragic event that people are in-world are still recovering from as a one-time gag in an ice cream shop name.Our heroine has stage 4 cancer and dying, because that works so well with none stop silliness and fifth grade level humor. Cancer.... and they keep reminding you of it. Cancer and chemo is supposed to be funny to anyone?Thor is now a parody of himself and all the personal growth he got from the past movies is gone, he is now a clown that happens to have some powers.The screaming goats meme from 10 years ago was funny though. I laughed at that. Also the boat goat vehicle was creative but that's all the credit I can give the movie. All the key moments like Jane realizing her powers, gods dying...etc all of them are off screen, all you get to see is the silly fluff.

title: Best Thor movie of the series
text: I was pretty shocked by this movie. I went in thinking it was going to be horrible. I had a free ticket and absolutely nothing better to do. It's probably one of the better movies in the MCU. Natalie Portman shockingly pulled her weight in this film and did a great job. The last film she did a great job acting in was The Professional, which is a shame. She's coasted off that film ever since and it was cringe-worthy.There were some parts where they tried to overdo it at the beginning with the Guardians, but thankfully, someone did damage control and the movie got less cringe-worthy as time went on. The cameos are pretty great as well.Highly recommended.

title: One of the worst, most inane movies I have ever had the misfortune to watch.
text: Unfortunately it is not possible to give a 0 out of 10 rating, otherwise I would have rated this movie 0/10. If it is supposed to be a comedy, it fails, not a single person in the theater laughed once for the entire, agonizing length of this dreadful movie. If it's supposed to be an action movie, it isn't. If it's supposed to be a love story, it is incredibly weak. If it's supposed to be a superhero movie, it tarnishes the genre. Just do yourself a favour and don't watch this movie. 2 hours of my life that I will never get back.

title: Just Enjoy the Film
text: I thoroughly enjoyed this addition to the Thor franchise. It was campy but not cheesy. It was fast paced (not in a bad way). It was hilarious. The soundtrack was stellar. I loved the visual effects. Christian Bale gave a tour de force performance as Gorr. Russel Crowe completely owned his scenes. Natalie and Chris had wonderful chemistry. Tessa was still badass. Loki was definitely missed. Of the Phase 4 films, this one is at the top for sure. Does it top Ragnarok? I think not. But it's pretty darned close.Thank the Gods for Chris Hemsworth's cakes.

title: The pendulum has swung too far the other way
text: The Thor movies can't seem to get the balance right. Thor was serious, Thor 2 was too serious. Thor: Ragnarok was goofy, and Thor: Love and Thunder is too goofy. It feels like kids wrote the screenplay. Its tone is wildly inconsistent, the story doesn't make a lot of sense, and they maybe should have cut a joke or two instead of leaving in everything every writer submitted. When screaming goats are the funniest thing about your film, you should probably try some rewrites. I did smirk a few times, and Christian Bale really puts some effort into his character, but this Thor: Love and Thunder mostly fell flat for me.

title: Same nonsense repeated again and again.
text: It's feel like I have watched a movie written buy bunch of kids. Why are they making a goofy Thor's parody movie? Christian Bale's character was awosome which is obvious but if you have read the comics, they did't build that character too well.

title: A Mighty 'Thor' Movie
text: This was another solid entry into the MCU. A solid story with great action, acting, and humor. Really enjoyed the performances of Thor (Chris Hemsworth), The Mighty Thor (Natalie Portman), and Gorr the God Butcher (Christian Bale) all around. Korg (Taiki Waititi) is one of my favorite Marvel characters, and it was good to see him receive another time to shine in the spotlight. The performances of Valkyrie (Tessa Thompson) and Zeus (Russel Crowe) are entertaining too. Some scenes in this movie were really interesting, and I am looking forward to watching them again later. This movie has been receiving lots of bad reviews, but for people on the fence, I encourage you to check it out as it is lot a better than you may expect.

title: Nonsense - not really even entertaining
text:
This is yet another installment of the drivel from Hollywood/Marvel. While it had more Thor than Strange was part of his 2nd movie - this was not coherent, in fact rather it was whimsical, directionless, and complete waste. I can only give credit to Bale's performance as he seemed to be the only one who was trying. Everyone else was a hollow representation, a shell of the character. Too bad Bale was coming from another film to put the 100% to this - although it wouldn't have saved this trash.Every attempt to be funny was a miss to me. Everything that was meant to have meaning was meaningless. Everything that was supposed to have a reason, either didn't or was explained in the dumbest way possible. This is just another installment of Propaganda Marvel films, and the complete ideocracy that has become Hollywood today. They do not care, everything is a tool to spread the messages that want. Nothing is sacred, nothing is nuanced, or complex. When it should be complex, it's pathetically simple. Like if you wanted to break into CIA HQ in Langly, it's not a problem because what you need will fall in your lap, and all the guards are completely inept. Oh and like an Epstein - the cameras will magically "not work". They think you are this dumb that you should be eating this puke pile up and be saying, "thank you, may I have another?"
The film has so much to go over but not without spoilers so I simply say miss this one. Miss it entirely. Don't bother with it even in streaming, as it was a complete and utter waste of time. I'd rather have watched grass grow, at least I could contemplate the meaning of life and have got more out of it.

title: Critics are fake, it's Amazingly new
text: Just watched Thor Love and Thunder, as a Marvel holic this film served as they promised, something new and perfectly done. Comedy romance and emotions there is all, use of colours, lighting is very well. And about some critics I can say it's something personal with them because film served very well. Whole film and every scene was perfectly designed. And no doubt on acting Chris Hemsworth, Christian Bale did there best like always.But a little thing that downgrade the movie is it's humour it was good but too much, on serious moments little jokes don't do good. And dialogues were little downgraded in compare to other Marvel movies, but these are very small things that doesn't matter much. Plot and story was well delivered. They cleared doubts of fans and other things.Overall film was a masterpiece good. Story telling, plot, colours, lighting even dialogues except on few moments were all very well.

title: If a zero rating were possible.
text: For the sake of rating, let's say I've watched 10,000 movies in my life; Thor Dumb & Dumber would be the worst. Nothing worse than a writer who thinks they're funny. So many little cutesy comments that they obviously thought were funny in Ragnarok that they had to throw in dozens and dozens more. Quite pathetic.I grew up with Marvel Comics. This trash ruined a perfectly good franchise.

title: Once great set of movies "thor" now a children's movie
text: Clearly they made this script and humor geared to children. Me and my wife actually made fun of it. How can you take the prior movies that so great with a good good direction, then completely change the target audience. The jokes was lame, and something you would expect from nickolodeon. I hope the next movie/movies will actually return to the original age audience then this. I am glad I waited to see this, instead of paying a lot of money in the theaters. Your kids will probably love this movie, but if you are an adult.. You will be very disappointed. Also, seems like Thor regressed into an idiot.

title: A treat to the eyes
text: Finally marvel had produced something worth watching in phase 4. The movie is absolute joy to watch, the story will keep you hooked, the performances are awesome as well. As usual Christian Bale nailed his role and some of the scenes in the movie will make you scream and clap as well. The movie is as good as the Ragnorak, kudos.

title: TERRIBLE
text: I will never see another marvel movie again because of this. It strayed so far from any semblance of plot and ruined the characters that marvel has spent years building up. It was beyond cheesy and filled with forced jokes that not a single person in the theater laughed at. I will never get that 2.5 hours of my life back. Marvel has gone downhill and clearly put no effort into this movie. It was like they hired seventh graders to write the script.

title: Definitely The Best Marvel Movie All Year
text: Thor: Love and Thunder wad Definitely my most anticipated Movie of Phase 4 and I will say it delivers. Thor doesn't take a back a seat in this movie like I thought he would. Jane was a wonderful addition to the movie and I'm Excited to see where her Character Goes in The Future as Thor. It was also nice to see Korg,Valkerie, And The Guardians Return since we have not seen Them Since Endgame. Gor The God Butcher in the Mcu I didn't think would be portrayed well Here. But he was portrayed amazing. Christian Bale delivered an Amazing Performance as Him. And for the first time in a very long time this is the First Marvel Movie where you don't need any context or Knowledge of The Greater MCU to Enjoy which I respect and it feels like it's on Movie. So Yes Thor: Love and Thunder is a Fun Time and Thor Fans will really Enjoy it 9/10.

title: Honest review!!!
text: Please someone kill me. I enjoyed all 3 of the thor movies. After he got a haircut in the third i didnt care for him being casual and making jokes.In this one he is a clown, boring, stupid.You will regret watching this if you have a brain. Honest.RIP Thor and the rest of the marvel movies.

title: Trash. Save your money.
text: What a disappointment. Marvel has gone south since infinity war. Loved all the films up to Spiderman No way home. After that, it's all gone down hill.

title: I went to see this movie for Natalie Portman. She looks amazing !!!
text:
Thor:
Love and Thunder
IMAX opening day ,
I missed the 3D showing so IMAX it was !!!I went to see this movie for Natalie Portman.Thor: Love and Thunder on IMAX will feature almost 35 minutes of expanded aspect ratio exclusive in IMAX. The film was shot with IMAX-certified digital cameras and audiences will experience the 1.90:1 aspect ratio, providing up to 26% more picture compared to the regular screen.I went to see this movie for Natalie Portman
She looks amazing !!!Natalie Portman Enjoyed the Challenge of Getting Buff for 'Thor: Love and Thunder'
Her workouts consisted of boxing, skipping around, core work, and weightlifting. And because she was working out so rigorously, Portman, who is a vegan, had to switch up her diet so she could ensure enough protein intake to gain muscle as opposed to losing weight. She trained for 10 months !! And it shows .Thor: Love and Thunder is a very fun film. Taika Waititi delivers tons of good, gregarious fun. 8/10.

title: Thor - now also for kids from 4 to 10
text: Thor....so funny. A lot of slapstick, jokes, child-friendly action, funny dialogues......my kids enjoyed ig a lot.Bit exciting? A terryfying bad guy? Real good breathtaking Action? Powerful?NoooooooIts for kids and for kids its nice.

title: SIMPLY FUN
text: Let me get this off first the goats worked and so did all the jokes. Marvel had its streak of disappointing movies but the Thor series stays afloat with its latest addition, Chirstian bale was okay. Seriously had a great time laughing. Worth the watch at the big screen.

title: What a terrible terrible shame
text: Let me start off by saying I absolutely loved Thor Ragnarok - it was pure entertainment from start to finish. I enjoyed the first 2 movies too.Love and thunder is generally terrible and it makes me sad. The first 10/15 minutes were quite promising but it went downhill fast, with only a few fleeting moments where you think, maybe, just maybe, it will get better.Christian Bale is the least scary bad guy in a movie ever.So many annoying drama school kids in this film. It's like a Disney club convention. Not all kids ruin movies (Logan, the sixth sense) but they do in this one.The humour that worked so well in the other movies just doesn't work here. It's like everyone is trying too hard and it's all a bit forced. Some of it is genuinely cringe-worthy.Russell Crow as Zeus...no, just no.Absolutely no threat or genuine excitement.My son said marvel is ruined now because its been 'disney-fied' and sadly he's right.

title: oh how the mighty have fallen!
text: You have to see it to believe how bad can a Marvel movie be(come)!It's sad to see great actors pull great performances in a sort of a parody movie that can only become a running joke as time goes byI could get into details but I prefer to forget this all together.

title: Completely stupid...
text: ...yet nonetheless highly entertaining. The jokes are never-ending as is the action. Christian Bale outdoes himself, and do all the cameos. I'm not a Thor fan and past films have stayed on the stupid side, but this one crosses the line into parody and immense fun.

title: This was great
text: The music was awesome and fitting, the acting was fantastic, the inclusion representation, the visuals, the storyline... all well done. It was cool seeing Christian Bale's kids and Chris Hemsworth's family in it, too. I loved the fact they gave Korg more lines and spotlight. It was such an action packed and emotional journey. Enjoy it!

title: Woke as usual, goofy and childish humour
text: Interesting how Disney and their screenwriters insist on trying to make all females into these brilliant too-cool-for-school characters with some handpicked masculine traits, while the males are just handsome, smiling, harmless and clueless goofs with somewhat feminine behaviour and jokes. The humour is, as usual, targeting 12-year-olds and nerdy 20-30-year-old females.Tessa Thompson is trying so hard to be tough and cool in her roles that she turns out not to be. A bit similar to the problem that Angelina Jolie and Rihanna have had in other movies. Would be better If she instead tried to learn from her colleague in Westworld, Thandiwe Newton, who effortlessly makes her character an interesting badass because she doesn't try so hard to be - she just turns out that way.Thor is at some point shown stripped of his clothes from the rear, which the female characters are spared of in the same scene. Fair enough, but it's funny how Disney at the same time recently censored Daryl Hannah's bare rear-end in Splash. Don't the woke and the feminists realise their almost comical double standards of objectifying men while women are too holy for the same? Oh the irony.Other than that - interesting to add Zeus to the story although underwhelming. Bale is a good actor but isn't a memorable villain in this movie - not his fault though. Marvel-movies struggle to create great villains for some reason, apart from Loki.

title: Ruined by a poor director
text: Overall, the movie had some promise. It would have been great to build up the character of the God Butcher. Christian Bale is amazing as the twisted antihero and he deserved better.But, what a waste of a movie.The Guardians of the Galaxy are in it, but not really.Zeus is also in it, but not really.Regulars like Hiemdall or Lady Sif are a blink and a miss, which is also pity since both are established characters.My take is that Taika Waititi should stick with directing comedy films only. He really has no understanding or love for the Marvel Universe, to churn out this drivel of a movie.The way Zeus is treated as a character (supposed to be an equal to Odin in the comcs) or how the Pantheon of elder gods is shown is really cringeworthy and shameful.Only saving grace is Gorr, played in ernest by Bale and he required more character building, back story and screen time.By far, his is by far one of the WORST ever marvel movies. Totally unworthy.

title: Am I crazy because I actually liked it
text: I don't see where all of the negativity is coming from. This movie was great although not quite as good as Ragnarok, it still had it's own good moments.The plot was interesting and presents a serious theme of loss and moving on as Thor deals with his painful past, so I don't get how it's being called overly goofy when the theme surrounding the goofiness is so heavy and presents a good contrast to all of the jokes and silliness.I also liked the jokes and it kept the movie from being too serious and boring. The jokes never ruined the seriousness for me, no one did a dance while someone died, it was handled well and the emotional moments didn't conflict too much with the goofy moments.Overall I enjoyed it, like Thor Ragnarok before it, it is one of the better Marvel movies made. It's funny but also serious and emotional and I'm glad I saw it instead of assuming it's bad and not worth seeing as the internet has led me to believe.

title: Horrific
text: This movie is a disaster. The 2 I've given it is justified. The pace is way too quick for the movie does not even feel close to 2 hours everything just hits you one after the other. They did not ease into character introductions and had no connection to any of the other Thor movies. It was horrific. This movie is pure comedy and the action and CGI is terrible. I feel like I wasted money on it. It's very predictable right to the very end and the other does not have a consistent story line to it. I am completley and utterly disappointed. It needs at least 2 hours and 30 mins to make it a better movie. Feel like I've wasted money on it.

title: A Very Fun Experience
text: Being a huge fan of the Marvel Cinematic Universe, I must say that the first two instalments of the Thor franchise haven't been anywhere near my favourites. When Taiki Waititi was brought in to direct Thor: Ragnarok, he injected some much-needed life. Since then, Thor has been a much more enjoyable character to follow and I now look forward to seeing him every time. Hearing that Waititi would once again be back for the fourth film excited me a great deal, but I also knew it would be a very hard task to top the third film. Thor: Ragnarok is one of my favourite Marvel films, and while there are more than a few moments in Thor: Love and Thunder that harken back to what made Ragnarok great, it's not quite on the same level for me. Still, Thor: Love and Thunder is a genuine blast at the movies and here's why I recommend checking it out.Picking up after the events of Avengers: Endgame, while still being a sequel to the Thor films, the premise here is that Gorr (Christian Bale) who now wields a sword known as the "Necrosword", has a mission to murder every God in existence. After having killed many already, Thor (Chris Hemsworth) is next in line. With the addition of a very well-done story that brings back Jane Foster (Natalie Portman), this film has a lot going for it. The villain storyline and Jane's storyline are both serious elements of the film, but otherwise, this is just a straight-up comedy, through and through. I liked the tonal shifts throughout the film because Taiki Waititi knows how to tread that line, even though a few moments tread a little too closely.If you were a fan of the silliness in Thor: Ragnarok, you'd probably love watching this film, but I will say that Thor: Love and Thunder dials it up to a hundred here. From giant screaming goats to a love triangle between his axe (Stormbreaker) and his "ex-hammer" (Mjolnir), I was laughing throughout. This will absolutely be a deterrent for some viewers though. Marvel is known to have a lot of comedy sprinkled throughout their films, but this one probably takes the cake for the amount of humour. The humour landed for me about 90% of the time though, so I had an absolute blast.Christian Bale is a fantastic addition here and is completely committed to this role, even though I wish he had a little more screen time. Where his storyline goes by the end may also leave viewers dissatisfied, but I kind of love how it concluded and I can't wait to see where those last few story beats lead. On top of that, I will say that Natalie Portman brings her A-Game here. I wasn't a huge fan of her in the first two Thor films, but her reason for being in this film was easily the best aspect of the movie for me. Again, like Gorr, I just wish a little more time was dedicated to her storyline. This is a film that clocks in at under two hours, but I believe an added 20 minutes or so could've fleshed everything out just a little more.In the end, this is the most fun I've had with a Marvel film in a while. Taiki Waititi's kinetic energy is on full display here, more than I've ever seen before (What We Do in the Shadows included) and Chris Hemsworth commands the screen with his portrayal of Thor, as always. The jokes fly a mile a minute, but I enjoyed that about this film, even though I was worried it would ruin my enjoyment. I do feel that it suffers a little from having multiple storylines and not quite enough time to explore them all, but I was ultimately satisfied with how everything played out. For being such a big story, I will also say that the scale of this one felt a little smaller than the rest of the Thor films. It almost felt episodic at times. Overall, Thor: Love and Thunder is absolutely a must-see if you enjoyed the silliness of Thor: Ragnarok, but some may be turned off. I personally give it a big recommendation because I had a lot of fun.

title: Just horrible.
text: To go from seeing two outstanding movies in Top Gun and Elvis to seeing this, it truly makes you wonder how much longer the MCU has. This film felt like a parody movie with how horrible the dialogue and cinematography was. I am all for comedy in Marvel movies but the "jokes" kept on coming after every single line. I would be surprised if a 7 year old even laughed at them. I think every actor (even Bale) got their paycheck and read line for line with zero effort just to get off set as fast possible with how awful they were. Please do not waste your money on this.

title: One of the better recent Marvel films..
text: I had a day off today and caught up with the marvel movies I'd not seen.Black Panther Wakanda Forever and Thor Love And ThunderI watched BP earlier, found it a bit dull, a bit ploddy and BP doesn't show up till last 20 minutes and doesn't do much when they do.Thor, on the other hand, is a great entertaining marvel comic book movie.It's silly, it's fun, it's action packed and has tons of 'stuff' for fans to see and pick apart.Christian Bale is also absolutely amazing in this film, he's having so much fun chewing up the scenery that I'm annoyed he died, I'd love to see him back again for more.A great fun and action packed ride.

title: A big joke.
text: A big joke. If I didn't know better, this movie was made by a seven year old. Even the actors didn't look like they were into it, except for Bale. It was too childish.

title: Why the Hate? A Blast!
text: Thor Love and Thunder is a very funny, at times touching, also beautifully shot film. As a fan of Marvel, I believe this movie is a worthy addition to the Thor movies and the MCU. I feel confounded reading some of the negative reviews. Rather I fully believe this movie will do well at the box office and most viewers, including fans of Thor, will enjoy rewatching it. My main criticism is that some of the side characters were underutilized. Still, within a massive film and MCU universe, they contributed a lot. Overall, this mighty film delivers as a summer blockbuster blast!

title: The Best Way to Describe This Movie in One Sentence
text: Thor 4: God of Thunder is nothing more than a really bad, two hour Saturday Night Live skit minus the good jokes. (my apologies to christian bale who did all he could to save this movie from embarrassing itself)

title: What a waste.
text: Terrible acting, terrible story line, save your money and watch Ragnarok again. This movie is so very disappointing.it's the worst of the MCU movies by far.

title: Good, but could have been even better
text: Love and Thunder had a lot of potential and could've been one of the best MCU movies of all time, and while I found it enjoyable and fun, the humour could have been toned down and needed to be more balanced. The movie doesn't quite match up to Thor: Ragnarok, but it was still significantly better than Thor (2011) and Thor: The Dark World.As the literal God Butcher, Gorr should have had many more scenes of him killing gods rather than just showing the effects of his mass murder, but Christian Bale still portrayed the character very well and it's a shame a lot of his scenes were cut and the movie was forced down to 2 hours.

title: Pretty Great Thor Movie
text: I really do not understand the negative reviews upon Thor: Love and Thunder, but I thought it was pretty great. Christian Bale as Gorr the God Butcher played as a great antagonist with good acting and the storyline was entertaining. Chris Hemsworth did not disappoint as Thor in this movie. In my opinion, I would definitely would watch it again.

title: Ignore the Marvelsnob haters.
text: Great movie. Start to finish. Entertaining. Paced well. Tons of great jokes and references. Only reason people are hating is because it's not an MCU movie as much as a stand alone Taika-Thor movie.

title: STUPID
text: LOOKS LIKE MARVEL FOUND A MOVIE TO COMPETE WITH DC WONDER WOMAN 1984 for pre-teen girls.It is a fact, Marvel and DC are marketing movies for the masses like junk food.

title: Hopefully Disney don't ruin Marvel like Star Wars
text: After how brilliant Ragnorok was, this is a massive let down. The comedy tries to hard, Thors costume is a disappointment. I understand inclusion and diversity and it should be shown on screen but when you can very clearly tell a film has forced some stuff in because it was film at a peak in cancel culture it doesn't exactly sit well then either. They need to find the balance between just chucking it in and leaving it out completely.Christian Bale is by far the best thing about the film.Overall, I wouldn't pay to watch this again unlike with previous Marvel films. Hopefully Disney doesn't ruin Marvel like it did Star Wars.

title: How is this lower than the dark world?!
text: I really don't understand the harsh ratings for this film. After reading them myself I was preparing to see an awful film and boy was I surprised. I loved it and even my very stubborn husband enjoyed it.Yes it has a lot of humour but this was to be expected after Ragnarok reinvigorated the Thor saga with this kind of take on it.Christian Bale did a great job as the villain and I can see why they changed how he would look due to a certain dark wizards resemblance.Zeus' accent is a bit iffy but I've heard worse.My favourite part was the use of the music, the November rain scene especially.Overall we enjoyed this film and in my opinion it isn't deserving of some of the ratings. It is funny and light-hearted but still has plenty of the Thor action scenes we'd expect. If you prefer the earlier films 1&2 then this probably isn't for you. I expected a predictable ending due to the characters but was pleasantly surprised, the only element missing was a certain mischief maker but I get that omission.

title: Too campy and stupid. Dumbed down too far.
text:
Very disappointed in this. Too campy, stupid and not really true to the characters as they were in previous movies. Jokes should augment a story not replace it, and this just felt like a medium for Taika Waititi's one-liners to the detriment of everything else. Didn't deal with serious issues, just made bad jokes that felt wrong. It had some funny moments and some interesting action scenes but overall
a disservice to what had gone before. I honestly didn't like where they went with it. Just dumbed down too far and now appears to be targeted to 8 year olds.Looks like the end of the franchise to me.Don't waste your money on this fluff.

title: Top 10 of stupiest movies
text:
One of stupiest movies ever. I hope that I will never see again Cristian Bale in a movie like this. For others is fine, but for him is slur.slur
Slur.slur.slur.slur. Slur. Slur.

text: People who gives 1 star are definitely DC fans.People who gives 2 to 6 stars are fake Marvel fans who only become a fan after the hype of Infinity War and wants everything to be like Infinity War or Endgame.People who gives 7 star are reasonable but still a cry babyPeople who gives 8-9 are real marvel fans.People who gives 10 are Disney Princess enjoyers who recently decided to watch mcu.

title: Ridiculous
text: It was ridiculous, even for a superhero movie. That is two hours of my life that I will never get back again. I just don't understand the high ratings that movie has got as it is total manure. It is ridiculous, I can't explain how bad it. I would rather shove raw chilly in my eyes and drink cat urine than watch this drivel. These ratings must fixed as there is no way this film is more than a two star film. It is so bad that it should be in the top ten of terrible movies ever made. It gets one star because I can't give zero though that is what it deserves. I feel like I had a lobotomy after watching this movie.

title: I cant believe so many bad press on this film
text: This film was not as bad as critics all complain it was, I feel this was not an amazing film but it certainly was good enough to enjoy.Maybe some people are too uptight? Too serious?I found this a fun and entertaining film that also carried heartbreak and it also dealt with his personal feelings although quite short but the intent is fully visible as he has to rebuild himself and the loss he suffers just made it a more powerful movie.Not to mention their were some very outrageous moments n scenes but they were so fun filled & its nice for a change as it clearly had a very big Guardians of Galaxy type of vibe too it.Also the ending credits like holy bleep! I knew it!! I totally kept thinking during the film like what if this happens in this film and introduces this new hero from the comics??? I was so excited to see it happen.Overall it kind of felt like the movie was to short for his story length but they did their best to wrap up the film and theirs many subtle positive messages in this film that u can pickup on.

title: Stan Lee would NOT be happy!
text: This is by far the worst Marvel movie yet! Screaming goats?? REALLY?? Thor reduced to a babbling goof?? I can't really say anything good about this movie! I re-watch all the Avengers movies multiple times. This film is going to be one and done!! I hope they don't make any more like this!!

title: Made me feel like a kid reading a comic
text: This movie is so much fun, I had a smile on my face from the beginning to the very end. Not only is this movie funny but Bale is by far the most frightening villain in the MCU universe so far. The Thor romance resonates strong but and illustrates the current human condition of fear to love. It will be a shame if Waititi makes no other Thor movies because he uses Chris Hemsworth comedic skills so well. I do fear though that many movie viewers these days suffer that same fate as Gorr the God Butcher and do not know how to love, they feel hate is something of value. The negative reviews of this movie only serve to illustrate that people are ego tripping and can't appreciate beautiful things. I would love love love to see the supposed original 4 hour edit. Thank you so much Taika Waititi xo.

title: Constant try-hard "humor" is painfully unfunny
text: There are two characters in this movie which sum up how I feel about it. The screeching, unfunny, and highly irritating pair of goats.Every scene they are in, they make this awful strident shrieking noise which I think would be useful torturing POWs.Think of this and apply it to the whole movie in terms of humor and that's how you'll feel. Annoyed, rolling your eyes, and annoyed again.About 10 minutes into the movie, I was wondering if the poor attempts at 2nd-grade level humor were going to be persistent throughout the movie. Indeed, they were.This movie is the equivalent of a hyperactive, irriating babysitter reading you a bedtime story replete with ridiculous facial expressions in the loudest, most unlikeable voice possible. You might like it if you are 6 years old, but for adults who want to be entertained, it's simply uncomfortable.The movie is rife with unfunny, forced, ham-fisted jokes which feel completely out of place or were written by mediocre minds who wanted the movie to feel like Airplane or the Naked Gun but failed abysmally. I wanted to stop watching halfway through and see if anyone else on IMDB found the constant barrage of eye-rolling corniness as annoying as I did.Almost every review I've seen so far points out this exact thing. The movie tries too hard to be witty and cute, but comes off as contrived and forced - so much so that I didn't care for the plot.The only redeeming feature of the movie was the main villain played by Christian Bale. He nailed down the role, I enjoyed his expressions and motivations. Other than that, the constant "fist bump" humor was tiresome 10 minutes in (can we please get rid of that annoying rock sidekick?) and we got nearly 120 minutes of it.Not against humor, I'm against it being used out of place or out of balance with the rest of the movie. This movie could have been good if there were more counterbalance - weigh the humorous moments with more ponderous ones.This is something director Waikiki has yet to grasp. I almost feel like he's whacking me in the head constantly with Stormbreaker with all the unfunny jokes.

title: Thor: Time to Retire
text: This movie tries so hard to be good; but, fails miserably. I giggled maybe three times. It's just not that good. Entertaining? Yeah-as long as you are not prone to nod off. I nodded off twice.In this installment, Thor (Chris Hemsworth) enlists the help of Valkyrie (Tessa Thompson), Korg (Taika Waititi), and Jane Foster (Natalie Portman) to fight the bad guy of the week, Gorr. Why? Because Gorr, God Butcher, intends to make the gods extinct. And, apparently, only Thor really cares and he comes out of retirement. Frankly, it's time to retire the Thor franchise.Chris Hemsworth reprises as Thor who continues the whole I am dumb but strong vibe. Natalie Portman's portrayal was lackluster although the stylist gets points for those beautiful curls. Honestly, I did not know who played the bad guy until I saw the credits. The character had hints of Christian Bale and then I realized it was him. Wasted performance for sure.Other than that surprise, there's really nothing of interest here. It's enjoyable; but, so empty. My only joy was trying out the D-Box seating. It was slightly gimmicky at first; but, I soon started enjoying it in flight scenes. That was a nice change. There really wasn't anything nice about Thor: Love and Thunder.I rate this movie a solid C.TW: Language, Violence, Partial Nudity#MariosMovieReviews.

title: Thor: Bore and Thunder
text: I'm a huge Taika Waititi fan. Everything from What We Do in the Shadows to Thor: Ragnarok. But let me warn you, this film is quite awful. I don't mean to be harsh. But it is quite quite bad. The story line is incredibly weak. The pacing of the film is horrendous. The one-liner jokes hardly ever land. There is little to no character development, the movie provides nothing to add to the MCU. I will say, however, Christian Bale's performance was amazing. He really went above and beyond to achieve such a gracious role for a horrible villain. But that being said, his role was wasted in a joke of a film. Natalie Portman didn't deliver. Chris Hemsworth was, well, just Thor. And everything else just didn't add up. It kind of reminded me of a Robert Rodriguez Kid Flick. Next.

title: Slapstick stupidity
text: Firstly, I didn't like Thor: Ragnarock due to all of the comedy in it that I felt was totally out of place, jarring and utterly pointless. If you enjoyed the comedy of Ragnarock, my review may not be relevant to you.Love and Thunder amplifies the comedy 100-fold. It is non-stop, utterly cringey and completely stupid. I can hardly remember the plot because it felt like that was the last consideration and it was more like a way to string comedy set pieces together. It was like Saturday Night Live as a superhero film.Natalie Portman and Christian Bale were pretty decent in their roles, for what it's worth. Chris Hemsworth was horrendous but it felt like that was due to the director's vision of Thor being an obnoxious idiot.If you like listening to goats scream every 5 minutes, this has at least one thing for you, otherwise I'd avoid it.

title: I loved it! Not as good as Ragnarok, but I loved it!I
text: T's a bit nick picky, but it is not as good as the last Thor movie. I always expect these marvel movies to get better and better to the point that they put the movie before it to shame. Still, this sequel to the Thor branch of the Marvel cinematic universe franchise did not exceed expectations. It had action, adventure, and humor, which I was expecting from Taika Waititi, who also directed Ragnarok, and that was great. Still, in Love and Thunder, the humor outshined the action-adventure. Not necessarily entirely a bad thing because the humor was so on point. Never did I feel a joke was dropped that did not deliver the laughs it expected, but I do feel these laughs came at the price of the action-adventure, which was lacking. The visuals in the movie were epic. Waititi knows how to film a sci-fi Fantasy, especially one that pays homage to the 1980s (although the constant use of Gun and Roses songs was not as spectacular as using Immrgant song by Led Zepplin twice in Ragnarok). As the movie progressed, the visuals got better and better to the point where a complete introduction of a marvel comics character making his first full appearance in the cinematic universe was breathtaking. Waititi was working that camera. The performances from the whole cast were good. I could go on about how great Chris Hemsworth is as Thor and his fantastic chemistry with Tessa Thompson as Valkyrie but what impressed me was Natalie Portman's return as Jane Foster (AKA Thor). I was not expecting much from the actress who seemed bitterly glad to end her ties with the franchise, but from the moment she appeared on the screen, she was dynamite in my book. I love every minute of her. Also, Russel Crowe's run as Zeus was enjoyable. It solidified everything this movie was about, and you can tell he enjoyed his role. Well done! Overall, Thor: love & Thunder was laid out like a comic book. As easily as I sat in the theatre watching, was easy as if I had sat in my living room reading it. I don't think any of these movies ever did a comic book story arch as great as Love and Thunder did, and that's what it got going for it! Worth taking a look at!--

title: No more Taika, please!
text: I love Thor and have always been a Marvel fan but Taika Waititi is ruining it with his childish humor that doesn't end. It's like watching your 4 year old son repeat the same joke over and over just because you laughed at it the first time. I literally couldn't stop my eye rolls. The rest of the cast was amazing and the story line itself was great but the immature humor and childishness pulled everyone down and ruined what could have been a great movie. Christian Bale was brilliant as was Chris Hemsworth and Natalie Portman. Tessa Thompson was a standout for me, she has brilliant screen presence. Reduce Taika's roll and get a new director, don't let him drag this into ground.

title: Ruined by a amateur director
text: Thor is a Marvel character not a parody. This was clearly a parody. Waitit gave us the worst Marvel movie.i hope the next Thor will be a proper superhero movie not a comedy or movie for kids.

title: Underrated.
text: People got too much of attention to phase before Endgame. Thats the problem. Come out of the endgame era first. I loved the movie as usual. Nothing to complain. Its a new beginning. So it takes time to build up. New era. We have more surprises in store. Its going to be totally different. Good start to the next phase of Marvel. Emotions and some good comic relief. Will become a classic as days pass. People will realise the worth of this movie lately for sure.Fantastic CG. People complaining about CG is just that they didnt realize the dark bw portions are a part of the movie. What else cud u do to this? Its well made in all parts.

title: A little too much love
text: Love and Thunder is a glorious misfire, a tone-deaf amplification of the first movie dead set on delivering more of everything that made Ragnarok such a welcome change at the time. Most of the time it's a painfully unfunny screwball comedy where Thor's role as the village idiot is amped up to eleven, while a running joke involving screaming goats and Lady Thor's search for a suitable catchphrase make up the rest of the movie's many, many moments of levity. This is juxtaposed with serious moments involving terminal illness of a character the producers thought needed some sort of undercooked closure. The budget, which could eradicate hunger in a small eastern European country, is mostly wasted on achingly blinding CGI that gives the film the sheen of a Saturday morning cartoon. Most of the supporting cast is utterly wasted, including Russel Crowe's buffoonery as Zeus and Tessa Thompson's Valkyrie, who the writers couldn't find anything noteworthy to do but is in the move anyway. Christian Bale turns in a stellar performance as the movie's villain, and his backstory would've made for a more interesting movie than the one he's in. Taika Waititi is clearly having a blast but others should steer clear of this over-indulgent mess.

title: Epic. Awesome. FUN
text: Come on, guys! Come on, critics! Please stop looking too deeply into these movies. Thor: Love and Thunder was an enjoyable and action filled film with tons of laughs and exceptionally choreographed battle sequences. It's pretty clear that Taika Waititi doesn't try to make serious dramas or tear-jerkers. I guess all I'm trying to say is, can't we just have fun with these projects? After all, superhero comics are pretty crazy at times too. Whether it comes in the form of cheesy one liners, hilarious scenes, absurd character designs, or screaming goats (my personal favorite) let's just enjoy marvel :)

title: Leading the way to "Idiocracy"
text: It's so stupid and moronic, it's almost beyond words. Zero acting, awful jokes, not-so-subtle-hints at lgbt political correctness that simply has to be present these days in (almost) every movie. The gods travel on the rainbow ('cause traveling on a white beam doesn't help anyone), Korg teaching us how two dads can give birth to a child ('cause one dad and one mom giving birth to a child is just too mainstream these days). I was sad to see once great actors (Russell Crowe, Natalie Portman, Christian Bale) being involved in this awful, awful joke that stands for a "movie".

title: A Thor parody
text: They really did butchered Thor here. Its feels more like a Thor parody than a Thor movie. Too much cringey jocks and less acting. Had great potential but they destroyed it. Thor has became like he was in first thor movie... Dumb and arrogant.

title: If you're a marvel lover, DONT WATCH
text: Hands down the worst marvel film I've ever watched. I've never walked out of a cinema, but after 45 minutes, I couldn't watch anymore. Thor is one of my favourite marvel characters but you can tell this is not a proper marvel film. It was cheesy to the point of ridiculous.

title: All these haters must've watched a diff't movie...
text: ...because Love & Thunder was so much damn fun. It was whacky & weird, funny but serious when it needed to be, and just had a good vibe with heart. Christian Bale gave Thanos a run for his money as one of the best MCU villains. He was a guy who was wronged, seeked revenge but ended with redemption. Not some one-note one dimensional villain. His performance was "all in" and he didn't phone it in like a lot of actors do in the big pay day comic book films. Hemsworth was the best he's ever been as Thor, and his storyline with Jane was filled with complications, romance and was the core of the film. Taika's writing and directing was great. The music, cinematography, production design, were all great. The cast of supporting characters were all awesome as usual, including a hilarious Russell Crowe. This was the best MCU movie since Endgame. For real. Great solo story that has it all.

title: What the...
text: It's sad to see the MCU headed this direction. The first four phases were some of my favorite movies of all time. But at this rate, I'll be done with MCU very soon.This felt more like a cheesy spoof of the MCU than actual MCU content. Thor is a made to be a complete incompetent doofus to make room for Jane and Valkyrie to be the strong female leads. Yet both of their characters are still lame, weak and uninteresting. Nothing to blame expect the subpar script writing and directing.The whole script is disjointed and awkward. The humor is completely insufferable. Rolled my eyes multiple times because the jokes were so god awful.

title: Is Taika reading this review?
text: Not entertained by this at all, except for Christian Bale's performance. Not sure if Taika can be bothered to read reviews from fans on here. It seems that his much-deserved success has given him the excuse to be "too funny" and "trying too hard" to please people (studio, fans, not fans, critics, etc). Messy plot holes aplenty. Meh jokes. OTT cringe. Thank God Stan didn't have to watch this. Can someone else direct any new Thor films in the future, please?

title: Good movie, everyone who thinks otherwise needs to pull their heads out of the clouds.
text: Huge marvel fan, was very excited to see this movie until i started reading all the poor reviews. Went into it a little skeptical but ended up loving it. It was funny, the action scenes were great, the villain was great, the romance was there but not overwhelming. I don't know what everyone expects from a movie these days, but there is no reason to knock this movie. Thor has always been a jokester! The jokes had me and my wife laughing throughout the movie. Incredibly enjoyable!! Don't listen to all the chumps that were expecting to see the greatest movie ever filmed and were so disappointed that they felt the need to trash this movie in a bad review. Go see it and enjoy it!!

title: A complete joke
text: Of the view good moments in this movie I enjoyed however the rest is a complete joke.Next to not a serious moment in the movieA disappointment written my a narcissist director who failed to understand that no one wants this much kork in a movie.

title: Good Entertainment
text: Welcome change with a funny entertaining movie in an MCU that sometimes takes itself too seriously.Story technically, unfortunately, there is often no common thread and it is a bit confusing.

title: Enjoyable and fun
text: Very enjoyable and nice outing for the full family. The acting and humor was on point, Loads of funny scenes. We laughed and cried,was an emotional roller coaster. One of the better ones. Can't wait for the next project!.

title: Please give us back Marvel we loved
text:
As many reviewers mentioned this movie cannot compete with previous Thor movies. Almost all movies i used to love from Disney and Marvel were recently ruined( new bad directors and producers?)
Every movie is packed with someone's UNNECESSARY agenda about race, gender, sexual preferences. With them trying so hard to force something on other people they forgot what they were paid for- to creat an interesting entertaining story.I used to be excited to run to movie theater for premiere- now i don't even want to waste time watching it for free few months after.Its sad. Good actors also wasting their time playing in this silly movie.

title: The title was accurate to the movie
text: If you loved ragnarok you'll love this one for sure, it was truly a Taika Watiti movie to the fullest . I loved the jokes but at moments it was getting repetitive and I wish there was more god slaying from gorr but Christian did an amazing performance. All that aside this movie was fun and had amazing action sequences and it was a love and comedy story more then a Marvel movie which is unique .

title: Thor became a clown :(
text:
Too much comedy, Thor became a clown :(
the story is shallow.Christian bale was the best thing happend in that movie.I'm very disappointed.Marvel two years ago was something else, Now I can feel the ship sinking.

title: Entertaining
text: First time in a while I have watched a Marvel film and felt entertained. Certainly it is is less ambitious than some recent marvel films, but the humour is excellent and the action and plot are straightforward. I don't need bloated back stories and convoluted plots, I buy tickets to be entertained and this does it well.

title: Stan is rolling in his grave
text: Hard swing and a miss. You know when you watch a B movie and an actor is over acting so bad that you feel embarrassed for them? This is what it felt like watching this film. It brings quite a bit of shame to Thor and the Marvel universe. The jokes are forced and often childish, the CGI is poor and the emotional parts are empty and ineffective. I mean, God of dumplings? This was obviously made as a comedy and not a serious film, but they failed hard at that too. I feel bad for everyone whobare real fans and had to watch this. I don't know if it's because disney unfortunately owns the rights to Marvel but if it is, they should be ashamed. They've taken a Marvel movie and turned it into Space Jam.
