Stan must be rolling in his grave.

title: The death of Marvel.
text: Clearly, people are too hard to impress nowadays. Or DCEU has a massive comment writing budget.The movie is a comedy, not as good as Ragnarok, but funny nonetheless.I definitely laughed throughout the movie, and all the uptight amateur movie critics clearly didn't like a superhero movie that took jabs at superhero tropes.Is it a 10/10? No. But, come on. Crazy how many 1/10 ratings there are. This is not a 1.There are some pacing issues. And the comedy should dial back in more serious situations.But, action is great. Funny throughout. Villain is complex. I would recommend to those Marvel fans who haven't built such crazy expectations.

title: Marvel movies after phase 3 are disappointmens :(
text: Whenever i recall the thor entry scene in wakanda from endgame, It gives me goosebumps but after the endgame, phase 4 is totally nonsense. If phase 4 is for kids and teenagers then it's good but people 18+ do want comedy but it must have a limit. Phase 4 series are good i mean miss marvel and loki are the best but please don't just create nonsense movies.Message for Marvel is => Your fame is protecting you so far (in phase4).

title: Terrible
text: I was a great MCU fan but the last movies are quite disappointing. This is one of the worst so far. I managed to fell asleep TWICE! And I used to loved this kind of movie... Taika Waititi disappointed this time.

title: Just, "good" BUT could have been, "Great!" 7.5 out of 10 rating
text:
Just, "good" could have been, "GREAT!"
...as many other reviews have said there were just too many jokes. There were too many moments that weren't written seriously - when it would have worked much better if they were. ...unlike many of the user reviews tho - the movie was still quite good despite all that! ...it really makes you wonder why (Writer/Director) Taika Waititi always goes a bit further than what actually works?! ...like for instance - the MCU Thor doesn't get Earth references and such and he can be a hot-head but Waititi makes him a flat-out idiot (which he isn't in the comics) and isn't like that in the first Thor movie and the first Avengers movie. I guess - maybe - they figure the comic Thor would be too bland/boring (and maybe that's true) but does he have to be a complete idiot?!Anyway, the story was actually good... Christian Bale (as the main villain, "Gorr") was excellent - both his acting performance and his written role, same with Natalie Portman (as Jane Foster), Tessa Thompson (as Valkyrie) and brief appearance by the main cast of Guardians of the Galaxy. Unlike some posts on here I VERY much liked Russell Crowe's interpretation of Zeus. It was a surprising and I thought very interesting - almost - Wizard of Oz/Man Behind the Curtain portrayal of Zeus.The special effects were very good (altho not great)... the music was very good altho a bit too much Guns N' Roses songs (i think 4 songs!)
Without spoiling there was a great use of Thor's unspoken of abilities (that he does with the children of New Asgard) that was pretty awesome!! ...as well as what he does (unknowingly) with Mjolnir.The ending was actually quite moving (seriously made me misty) and the 2 post-credit scenes were pretty awesome as well.This movie was a 3 out of 5... a 7.5 out of 10... and a 75 out of 100.If they cut out some of the jokes and make it a little more serious it could have been been MUCH better. ...still a good/fun movie.

title: Why Taika, why?
text: Making jokes is fine. Even bad ones. But this movie is a mash of uninspired scenes. It does not take its story or characters seriously. Except for the third act... Usually Marvel movies have a third act problem. This movie has terrible first and second acts. Christian Bale is really good but completely lost in scenes that all have a different tone. Korg overstays his welcome. Valkyrie could be much better, but does not really have anything to do. I could go on and on. Disappointed. So disappointed...

title: Don't listen to the haters
text: This film is fun for the whole family! Thor is better than ever and Jane is an absolute blast. Don't listen to the haters just enjoy the film for what it is and have fun.

title: Major potential wasted
text: What a sad unfortunate slap in the face this movie was. Everything was there for it to be great. I think it could even be easily edited into greatness with a directors cut. Too much humor, unfunny cheesy humor. Hamfisted woke messaging shoved down the viewers throat. Korg has two dads, Heimdall's daughter is a boy now... Changed his name from Astrid which is a traditional female name that means divinely beautiful to Axl. If that wasn't intentional, that's certainly what it came across as. Also Valkyrie made several loud hints to her attraction to the ladies. None of this would matter or be a problem if it felt organic and not like the producers forced it all into the movie at gunpoint. Dint get me started on poor Christian Bale. He gave this movie his all and they sharted in his face. I'm about done with the MCU. On a scale from 1 to 10. NO WAY HOME being a 10, this would be a 4 at best. I'd give it a 2 if not for Christian Bale. He gets a 10. I doubt he will ever work with Disney again after this.

title: Gorr The God Butcher Rest all Mere Comedians
text: Disappointed By Marvel,There was some useless humour in the film,Didn't meet the expectations And God Christian Bale Just Made this movie watchable once.

title: Reasonably entertaining movie
text: You saw some bad reviews here. I will tell you it's mostly because of their expectations were not met. As soon as I saw Taika Waititi as director, along with the trailers we've seen, I just knew it's gonna be a comedy-comics-nonsense mashup. In that perspective, it's a fine movie. For simple laughters.Granted, it's not Waititi's best creation. But it is definitely not as bad as some reviewers graded one or two stars. It's not a MARVEL movie. It has the characters and the brand, but don't get it in line against End Game, Dr Strange, or any of those big box office pictures. I bet my arms and legs your young ones would like it. With that in mind, sit back and have a little fun.

title: It's an action comedy, with heart.
text: I Don't get the hate, this movie is so much fun. It's clever, funny with emotion. I'm a big movie fan and can appreciate this for what it is. Great fun. Go in expecting a fun movie that will make you smile and you will love it. It's a comic book movie and it knows it. Enjoy it for what it is. The writing is clever, great one liners and brimming with humor. Russel Crowe as Zeus was a real pleasant surprise and didn't disappoint. Everyone in this movie knows it's a fun film and is making the most of it, even so there is excellent acting talent on display notably Bale but also Portman and Hemsworth too.

title: Not as bad as everyone says but still not that good
text: Man some of the humor really doesnt work like those goats constantly screaming. Also some bad effects like when *someone's* son contacts Thor it just straight up bad. Needs more villain because he was the best part, especially that one scene on the void planet.

title: worst marvel movie
text: Simply rubbish movie very typical story this is worst thor movie oh sorry worst marvel movie. I am very disappointing in Taika Waititi. How can you write something like this and think its funny. I have seen your work before and never have been disappointing.Christian Bales part was fine. Not good but fine.

title: Comedy, drama, action, epicness and LOVE
text: I liked it a lot. Despite the fact that the film was supposed to be a comedy because of how the character has been treated lately turning him into a clown, it has drama, action and epicness... And a lot of love. The villain is well-constructed, his origin-to-end story arc is very good, though I'm sure comic book lovers will say he sucks. The scene with the empowered children was a perfect touch. Using Zeus for the issue of inclusion and progressivism was funny, not forced at all; and the thing about Korg makes sense because he's just rocks. The Jane Fonda arc... I mean, Jodie Foster... I mean, Jane Foster and what she did at the end was fine, and the scene with Thor was very emotional and deep. Taika Waititi definitely convinced me this time, he gave us a good installment.The mid-credit scene was very interesting, let's see what happens with Thor's future, and the post-credit scene was satisfactory.

title: Simply the worst
text: Based on the first 45 minutes only, this was the worst film I've ever (partially) experienced and I have never walked out of a film before. How can so much money be spent on something this bad. The writing and direction were awful, the acting was third-rate and the special effects questionable. I don't understand how actors of renown can want to be associated with this twaddle. It's a slap in the face to the fans of the series which should have stopped at the cringeworthy Ragnarok.

title: Fun but predictable
text: In classic Taika Waititi form, Thor: Love and Thunder is joyful, light hearted and filled with dry humor. Christian Bale provides a wonderful performance alongside the rest of the cast. The entire plot was fairly predictable after the first 15 minutes, however it is a welcomed change from recent releases .i.e. Multiverse of Madness. A fun way to spend 2 hours in the theater, but not life changing by any means. Similar to Ragnarok with its vibrant colors, great soundtrack and comedic undertones. Personal rating of 8.2/10.

title: Awful, just awful.
text: Big fan of the Marvel films. This is the worse of them by far. It's the only one I've ever wanted to stop watching. It made me cringe so badly.The acting is poor, the script is worse and the storyline (accepting that this is a superhero film) is dreadful. The film tries for laughs but misses at almost every attempt. The film laboured trying to play on Thor's emotions and insecurities and in the end he comes across as pathetic and annoying. This is a shame because previous films have got the balance about right.And those goats. Just pointless. And annoying.The only plus side is some of the soundtrack.

title: Thor: God of Thunderous Enjoyment
text: 10/10Cool bad guy with a mythological weapon. Christian Bale does a great job as always!Absolute fun with goofy moments thanks to Taika Waititi including some NZ Maori references! Kia Ora Bro!The immense enjoyment I felt watching this movie was from the beautifully alien vistas our heroes visited, intangibly emotive themes and how can you go wrong with a "Guns 'n Roses" sountrack?!Definitely worth watching multiple times!I repeat! Definitely worth watching multiple times!~~I write this in memory to my good workmate, also named Thor. He sadly passed away a day before writing this. After every movie I would tell him I liked his most recent movie and he would joke that he was glad I liked it. I am going to miss asking him where his hammer is. RIP bro.Always take care of yourself and those around you. God bless.

title: A hero entering battle after battle with a smile
text: Like other MCU films that seem to find this domain currently interesting, this Disney movie too shows a hero discussing parts of himself through lessons on sacrifice and acceptance. What gives this one a spicier flavor is Chris' rendition of an ever upbeat broken hearted God seeking solace through saving others.

title: Full circle for comic book movies
text: These movies started as a joke and overtime got better and more serious and in line with our world just watch logan. Now there back to this mess and its a shame promoting children in war. Crazy.

title: AtLeast 8 great scenes!
text: Giving 10 due to low rating to justify the wrong.I'm From India and its first time it's released here the earliest on the globe(MCU) and i can't understand the low ratings.Watched the movie on big screen! And the audience applauded more than me half the time. We have to understand here that after Ragnarok and guardians that the director like to keep it light hearted and comic here and that exactly what he did and people loved it.Could make this review longer as theres a theory by my friend that marvel is making all this for the new generation so liking is as likely. But thats a debate for another decadeðŸ¤žðŸ¾ðŸ˜‹

title: Completely mediocre
text: This was the most paint-by-numbers films I've ever partly watched.It gets 1 star only and solely because I didn't watch all of it. I came back later to try and finish and gave up a second time out of boredom, and DNF gets an automatic 1 star.The film itself deserved maybe 2 or 3 from what I saw.Thor is finding himself for the third time in 3 movies. He's millennia old and has to 'find himself' 3 times in 8 years. What a loser.Then boredom happens, the screaming goats are funny for 2 minutes but it drags on for ages and is so repetitive the gag gets really old really fast.It has no time to breathe, the themes are love and loss and death and terminal cancer and inevitable loss, but there is a cheap gag every 30 seconds so we're not supposed to care at all about any of that.This is a film which seems to be aimed at, and written by, a 7 year old with ADHD.

title: Spectacular!
text: They really knocked it out of the park with this one.Filled with fun and joy, we really get to know Thor and friends.All the different personalities involved including the Guardians of the Galaxy make this a great watch through and through.Even the hammer and axe have so much personality that it's felt without them ever saying a word. Not to mention their impeccable comedic timing. ðŸ¤£This and Doctor Strange: In the Multiverse of Madness are slowly introducing the concept of multiple universes/realms and the sheer craziness that unfolds out those setups. This gives us a taste of the absolute madness that is going to be Phase 4 and the clash between unfathomably great powers that is about to happen.Overall an amazing spectacle to behold and well worth the 10 stars.

title: Worst Marvel Movie Yet.
text: At this point, I mean, I don't even know what to say. NEVER have I been so insulted with a Marvel Movie that I wanted to get up and walk out. Thor: Love and Thunder made me feel that way.It is just terrible. The tongue-in-cheek comedy isn't funny. The costumes are dumb. I'm still trying to figure out what the story was about. Why would a bad guy who wants to kill gods go and kidnap children? Exactly. He wouldn't. They replace Thor with Jane Foster, who makes a mockery of the hammer and the "Power of Thor". It's sad.The writers at Marvel/Disney have gone 100% Woke. Seriously. It's so bad I just can't even take it anymore. From this point forward, if I watch a trailer and read reviews that say a Marvel movie is this bad, I am skipping it.Putting the tickets and food together, I spent $102 taking my wife and 2 kids to see this. ALL FOUR of us thought it sucked. - and it takes a LOT to make my kids say a movie sucked. I will NEVER do that again.HORRIBLE.

title: Loved it
text: After not really enjoying Multiverse of Madness at the cinema, I wasn't sure what to expect with Thor Love & Thunder, especially after Thor Ragnarok was so good. Thankfully I'd manage to avoid spoilers this time as knowing part of the story would have taken away from it. I wont say too much but I really did enjoy it, and felt it did move Thors story forwards.

title: No story
text:
Awful piece of trash
Taika Waititi has ruined the franchise of Thor , he had no story for this movie
Over stretched scenes, Lame comedy
I can say one thing for sure that Kevin Feige is just going for money, not caring about the quality of the picture.

title: Disney at it again
text: First Kenobi, now this?The only way to send Disney a clear message is to stop buying their products.They don't read the reviews or listen to the fans, they look at the $$$ you give them and decide that what they've done is very successful.

title: Taika ignore the rewies please!
text: Everybody who knows movies of taika knows that he got special humor.And for me, who watched the movie 3 Times, I have to say that I enjoyed it everytime.The love Story is not the best but not the worst too.All jokes worked for me and I felt great all over the 2 hours.Thought its to less screenplay, but you balanced it perfectly and I had really much fun. My friends been also positively surprised.Thanks Taika, great work again!

title: Woke contradictions
text: Nice try but no. You can't just remake Korg with two dads when in Ragnarok you said he had a mom. But typically cancerous woke agenda: stupid af.The rest of the movie is meh .. Jane is a nice take on Thor but also the transformation ... Which didn't happen when someone else picked up the hammer.Valkyre is just a sad filler in the show.Zeus is a disappointment and seeing Russell Crowe in it , the gladiator would cry.Keep throwing money and cgi.

title: Loved it!
text: I had a fantastic time watching this movie. I enjoyed all the humour (I'm also a Kiwi and I'd say our humour gets lost on a lot of people outside of NZ/Aus/UK). Also enjoyed the heartfelt moments. And of course the rocking soundtrack & 80s vibes. Awesome job Taika!

title: 4 for the Christian Bale
text: Too much jokes, weak story that give up on everything was before Thor 4. Now Thor is a clown with a cape, what a mess :(Thor 3 was a much better film and we are all expected story to be more than previous cause to Christian Bale in this film, but it turns out as one more empty joke.

title: Good grief
text: If this child of a director had gathered every shark on earth, bound them together with rope to form a massive living island, then strapped a rocket to the QE2 and used it jump clear over them, it still would not have been as dumb, pointless and offensive as this movie.The director clearly *loathes* the MCU, and thinks its tales are beneath him, but that won't stop him destroying the franchise as he cashes those tasty, tasty Mouse cheques.Yet again, the mighty Thor is reduced to a series of punchlines and dick jokes. He is now so narcissistic and stupid he happily does whatever he wants, whenever he wants, with no regard for others, or good script writing.The director of this movie should be sued.

title: Just what I needed
text: Fantastic. Bale crushed it. Jane kicked butt. The goats omg. If you like Ragnarok this is for you. Waititi gave me what I had hoped for. Truly more than a comic book movie, it explores love and loss-rather successfully. Hemsworth was born for this role and shines in many ways. I loved it!!!!

title: Av
text: Let's just say this was very average and had way too many cringeworthy bits, I wanted to like this but on multiple viewings I just found it gets worse. Bale is not on screen for long enough, Hemsworth is less to blame but I feel it needs new direction as Takia has outstayed his welcome and did anyone else find the goats annoying....? Bland just bland. Tries to be way to funny and just isn't and I didn't like how there's a new Thor in town which makes our Thor seem less important cos anyone who's deemed worthy can be Thor, I mean it makes Cap wielding the hammer less important and the bloody goats, what's with them,.......

title: Disappointing and mind-numbingly dumb
text: Title: Thor: Love and Thunder - A Marvel Adventure that Misses the MarkThor: Love and Thunder, the latest addition to the Marvel Cinematic Universe, unfortunately falls short of expectations. Despite its star-studded cast and promising premise, this film fails to deliver a captivating storyline, leaving audiences wanting more.One of the most glaring issues with Thor: Love and Thunder is the apparent lack of depth in the writing. The plot feels rushed, as if the writers hastily threw ideas together without much consideration. This rush to create a cohesive narrative results in a disappointingly shallow experience that fails to engage viewers on a meaningful level.The movie is plagued with numerous plot holes, leaving the audience scratching their heads and questioning the logic behind certain character motivations and actions. These inconsistencies disrupt the immersion and make it difficult to fully invest in the story. Additionally, the film seems to rely heavily on unnecessary downgrades compared to other Marvel movies, failing to live up to the standard set by its predecessors.While Thor: Love and Thunder attempts to charm viewers, it often falls flat, coming across as forced and ultimately lacking in genuine wit and humor. The attempts at comedy feel contrived, missing the mark and contributing to the overall feeling of disappointment.It is unfortunate that the film fails to live up to the quality expected from the Marvel franchise.In conclusion, Thor: Love and Thunder fails to deliver on its promising premise. With a rushed plot, numerous plot holes, and a forced attempt at charm, the movie falls short of its potential. While some may find elements to enjoy, it ultimately falls below the mediocre mark.

title: Masterpiece!!!
text: I've always loved Norse mythology. Their gods and cultural beliefs have always intrigued me. Thor is one of my favorite Norse gods so these movies about Thor have always resonated with me. Everything about the trilogy and now this one. I was always at the edge of my seat in this movie. I like Taika Waititi's vision of Thor. He's interpretation of the character is a breath of fresh air in the MCU. This makes the god of thunder very relatable. Truly an enjoyable film, in some ways it felt different from most MCU films, and while it didn't turn out to be as groundbreaking to critics as it's predecessor, it proves to be the perfect superhero movie for the summer. Many others before me say that it didn't have enough story, but let me tell you what it lacks in a "stellar" story it more than makes up for in action, humor, outstanding visuals, pop culture references, cameos, and overall creativity. While I was a little surprised not seeing Gorr do as much god butchering on screen, Christian Bale makes up for the character's limited screen time through a powerful and albeit creepy performance, one scene in particular reminiscent of Pennywise from It, and his powers are unbelievably awesome. My only real complaints is are there is too much focus on the love story between Thor and Jane Foster, the first part of the film feels somewhat rushed (though I did enjoy the action packed '80s style fight), and of course without Loki, it just didn't feel the same. Best of all, the mid and post credits scenes make me optimistic for the future of both Thor's story and the MCU overall. My complaints are few and my thumbs are all the way up to the heavens to join the gods themselves ðŸ˜‡. Highly recommend this film, and please, don't worry about what others think, go see it and make you're own opinion ;). Also, Russell Crowe as Zeus was both powerful and hysterical, respect for holding the Greek accent ðŸ‘I loved every second of the movie and I hope the MCU will rivit us with more amazing works.

title: Shallow and Boring
text: This movie set itself up to be an absolute knee slapper and a good time after following the success of the previous film, but we were wrong. The plot was so bland, the side characters was uninteresting, and worst of all the jokes so so unfunny.

title: Marvel factory has a quality problem
text: It was just watchable however I was glad when it was over. Quite a few walkouts during the film so not just me. The marvel franchise needs to focus on quality not quantity.

title: Movie feels incomplete, could have been a tv show episode
text: This movie felt more like watching a tv show than a movie. It was rushed, had poor pacing and the story had little time to develop. Christian Bale did great as the villain, with the little screen time he got.Most of the story didn't make any sense, definitely an MCU slap together, they probably finished the whole movie in a week. Outcome was a lazy money grabbing Marvel. It's not terrible but not worth watching.I know in all marvel movies we aren't supposed to take the plot seriously and overlook most silly things but they really put you to the test with the things they present here. Magical evil sword, mysterious shadow realm, some thing called "eternity" which will grant any wish. Truly marvel laziness, they have become spoiled knowing they can peddle any nonsense in they movie.

title: Made for 5 year olds
text: The movie keeps trying to make you laugh, but the jokes are made for 5 year olds. Acting is similarly lacking. This should have been done as animation for kids.

title: Love is granted
text: I would say honestly cuz Thor just found another love his usual mjonir finally after all these years of absence, finally love breeds love, but i noticed that all the scenes were more comedic than d intended action, that's why i won't be seeing the movie again cuz it's not worth my second time once is enough, but what the hell if was fun seeing Thor again in action i hope the sequel would be a hundred times better than this one, just hoping that marvel will bring back that spark that made it sour like it did before, keeping my fingers crossed.Still looking forward to more reviews like this so there's more where that can't from.

title: Great story with unnecessary jokes
text:
"Thor love and thunder" gives you everything you'd expect. Maybe it gives you to much...
If you're a 12 year old, the jokes wouldn't bother. But as a 24 year old, i wanted more dept.Don't get me wrong, the movie has dept and you see the characters grow.The thing that botherd me were the childish jokes between the serious moments."Thor ragnarok" found the perfect balance in that but i feel like this movie took it a step too far. (sadly)Christian Bale gives us an amazing performance and keeps the movie interesting.Taika waitit is for sure a great director and knows what he's doing but he had to much creative freedom. Korg is sometimes too much and needs to be toned down.Chris Hemsworth still knows how to play thor but i missed the broship between him and loki (Tom Hiddleston), it felt empty without him.Nathalie Portman also did a great job playing thor, maybe she had the greatest character development in the movie.Tessa Thompson as king valkyrie was great but felt like a rushed story, she could be more in the movie. Less korg and more valkyrie...

title: The Bad reviews act like they haven't watch a marvel movies lately
text: There are ALOT of bad reviews on this movie and it feels like it's a lot of people went into it expecting it to be a dark gritty serious movie...that's not marvel. It was funny, it had its intense moments, it's scary moments. Honestly I think it's the strongest of the movies in the new phase. It is a bonkers movie, don't get me wrong, but if you go into it know that I think it's quite enjoyable. I leave this review because honestly I don't think people know how to just enjoy a movie anymore.

title: 3 is being nice here!
text: What a load of garbage! I like the other Thor movies, but since this is a PG-13, you would assume that the dialogue and interactions would appeal to a broad audience instead of just kindergarten kids! The humor in this is just so lame. Sure it had a few laughs in-between, but that's about it. Also, the movie is 2 hours.. it could've told the story in 1 hour, and it wouldn't have been so unbearable and boring to watch. My wife and I always stick around for the scenes in the end credits, but in this case I told her: If we had seen this in the cinema, I would've waited for you in the car when the credits started. Not impressed.

title: Dumbest MCU film, but so what?
text: Look, this film is properly bonkers. But, you know what? I didn't care. It made me and my family laugh and we had a great night out.Don't expect a cinematic masterpiece. It's not a serious film. Instead, switch your brain off, relax and just embrace the lunacy.

title: Not a Marvel Film worth watching
text: It's made for kids, the dialogue is childish, there's entirely too much unnecessary humor. It never once felt like a Marvel Film. I don't write reviews, seriously... it's been a while, but this movie was such a let down. It didn't hold my attention and I'll never watch it again.Natalie Portman had super cheesy lines, everything happened too fast in her plot.Christian Bale was awesome though. His entire story was pretty interesting and that held my attention for the most part.The Zeus stuff was just... straight up for kids. Goats and kid humor.Thor was cheesy the entire time.Isn't this the last one too? Such a let down.

title: Movie Premyy honest review
text: If it's not one of the greatest creations of MCU then in my opinion it is not the worst either. It was a fun, humorous, light-hearted superhero film with great visuals and action. Though it will be more impactful Christian Bale as Gorr would have more screentime. Overall l, it's an enjoyable and electrifying experience. Highly recommended!

title: it used to be one of my favorite
text: I donÂ´t know why the producers decided to make Thor a comical character, after the story joined the Guardians of the Galaxy (GOTG) I got really disappointed. The only thing that makes GOTG interesting is that it gives a background story about Thanos, but I think it's too much Disney like, the talking animals, songs and poor jokes. I used to like Thor so much because the story is darker and mysterious. Now this attempt to make Thor a funny character is the opposite of what makes him a interesting character, I usually like the Marvel movies, they often have a great plot and the best thing is the special effects but they definitely can improve on Thor.

title: Average
text: I'm still awaiting a direction for Phase 4 and this still has yet to provide anything.Thor is my childhood hero and I'll be honest and state that I enjoyed this film alongside all of the other MCU films and TV. However, I won't remember it. There is nothing that really sticks in memory or excites me for the future.Watiti is brilliant and hilarious but there is too many jokes in this film and alongside the lack of direction of phase 4...?There are some very good moments to enjoy but it's about time for a new direction for Thor or even bring Mr Branagh back to put their beloved character back on track.

title: Have fun, this is it, serious movie the go see Oscar nominated movies
text: I usually don't write reviews. But man people love to hate. This movie was fun, good story, good moments. Think of it as marvels first Rom-com. Portman and Bale are amazing. But all the acting was great. It's a marvel Thor movie, not exactly Shawshank Redemption. I go to be enjoyed, entertained, and laugh and get emotional and appreciate all those around me. A really good Marvel movie.

title: Worst Marvel yet
text: 2 hours of a forgettable story. Chasing laughs with weak jokes and poor writing. Shame really, felt as if they have tried to out do Ragnarok and as a result the plot and characters have fallen to the wayside.Save your money and wait for it to go on Disney plus or something.

title: Don't watch this garbage
text: As the Rock once said, it's the biggest piece of dogs**t. When I look at the old Thor movies where he was jumping around fighting demons from hell, kicking Hulk and all kinds of other stuff and watch this, my stomach twists. How did someone from Marvel look at the scenario and said, people will love this I don't know... Nothing surprises me from them anymore... We didn't have good film from Marvel in like 3-4 years or so, everything is around CGI and special effects bit story wise my 5 year old nephew wouldn't want to watch this... Maybe they will sometimes look at the ratings their movies get.

title: The hate is not warranted
text: I'm not sure why everyone hates on this movie. There are so many terrible mediocre or less marvel movies out there. Thor movies have consistently been better than most of the other marvel movies and have only gotten better each time. The actors are all at the top of their game in this. A couple jokes are weird and there wasn't enough Kat but otherwise to witness such emotion given in such a short time is wonderful. The use of color is excellent too. After watching all the recent marvel movies to catch up i saved this one for last and was so glad i did. It was like a breath of fresh air on a sunny day. This isn't just a marvel movie it's a great film.

title: Mess
text: This film, could have and should have been very good. They had a villain with so much potential with Gorr and he's wasted in a bad comedy film. You can see most of the actors are making the lines up as they go along. Mostly the script comes across as unfunny waffle. Also some terrible cgi doesn't help. Also a ridiculous a-list cameo is painfully hard to watch.For me, the makers have tried to dial everything up to 11 from Thor Ragnarok and it doesn't work. Ragnarok had a good balance between comedy and action. Love and thunder doesn't. Really lazy filmmaking in my opinion. I'm very disappointed in the film.

title: Very wholesome
text: This movie was just super fun and heartwarming, I dont understand all the bad reviews. In my opinion this was better than Ragnarok. The story was pretty solid.

title: Pushed
text: This Thor felt very, pushed, it was trying to be funny but it wasn't working, the jokes were empty and boring. It was trying to kinda tie up loose ends but it didn't succeed. Everything after Endgame feels desperate and in need of money. The best Marvel movie this year was Wakanda Forever and this does not beat it by a long shot. It was trying to appeal to old Thor fans but it failed horribly, I mean I wanted to close the screen and watch a burning log of fire instead. It's a 3 because it can appeal to a very small percent of audience and it it still was a Marvel movie, especially a Thor one, It meets a minimum requirement. I recommend it if you are hardcore fan or a parent that wants to watch a movie with it's kid.

title: There will never be another Ragnarok
text:
Adding on to my first review (below). The more I think about this film the more I hate it. I can't believe they butchered my favorite character and really made an awful movie. I wish I never saw this film. It's not funny, the plot is not good. The villain is not fleshed out, the characters don't work. It sucks. It just makes me sad. Original rating was a 6 but now it's a 3. Which means I hate it. It has even made me like Ragnarok less somehow. Wouldn't recommend this film to anybody.Original:
Weird review for me to write. MCU fanboy and Thor is my favorite. But I'm starting to think the M in MCU stands for 'mid'. Nothing has been able to recapture the life and raw emotions that I got from Ragnarok and Infinity War. I didn't come in with Ragnarok level expectations, and I didn't hate the film, but it was just alright. And I can't help but compare.Thor 3 had moments of laugh out loud hilarity coupled with plenty of iconic badass Thor moments that made me want to jump out of my seat. It also exposed the viewer to plenty of plot while maintaining super high stakes and tension the entire time. Close to a 10/10 for me.This movie had a couple good jokes and a few badass moments but nothing that gave me that shiver up your spine, jump out of your seat feeling. This would've been fine if there was high tension, but it just wasn't there for me.That being said, I enjoyed the romance plot (which I didn't expect) and the ending was satisfying. The scenes where they played with color were pretty cool. Bale was a pretty good villain.If this is what the MCU is going to look like from here on out, I'll still watch, but it hurts me a little to see potential not realized.

title: A genuine 9/10
text: This movie, like all action/comic book and Marvel movies had it's flaws. That being said, I can't understand the bad or even mediocre reviews, that might be due to the simple fact that everyone experiences movies differently. Speaking for myself: I laughed I cried I was entertained the whole time and I found the plot and aesthetics to be a heartwarming (REFRESHING) change of pace for the MCU. As a marvel fan, my expectations are always high and I wasn't let down. As I said before, everyone's experience will be different. It's for THATTT reason that you should see it and decide for yourself!!! :) !!

title: Amazing Movie To Enjoy
text: Thor love and thunder movie is one of the best Thor movie ever made since Ragnarok I extremely enjoyed this movie and I'm definitely going to see it again I guarantee the movie is worth seeing and It's one of the best marvel this year I definitely recommend everyone who is a fan to see this movie.

title: This Was Too Silly, Left Me Disappointed
text: Thor has always been a tough character to pull off (in the film and in the comics), and I feel like the MCU movies figured out a way to do this really well in previous movies. The first two, are a lot darker, and the humor is peppered here and there. With Ragnarok, they cranked up the humor, and in my opinion made one of the best movies in the MCU. All the elements really worked in that instance. The balance of comedy and seriousness was perfect. With "Love and Thunder" I feel like the film makers said "People loved the humor in Ragnarok, let's do that all movie long!" Unfortunately this just made for a silly movie. This is a two and a half hour comedy, that just comes across as cheesy and silly. Some really intense events happen to the characters and the universe as a whole, but none of these events feel like they have any weight because of the onslaught of silly jokes before, after, and occasionally, during them. This is really unfortunate because you have an absolutely amazing cast (Christian freaking Bale as the antagonist!) that is pretty much wasted on a goofy movie. My wife thought this was one of the worst movies in the MCU (and one of the worst we have seen this this year) and she has previously loved the Thor movies (mostly because of Chris Hemsworth being shirtless and Idris Elba). Not even a super jacked Hemsworth made this enjoyable for her. I enjoy comedy, and think the MCU typically does a great job of finding the right balance. There were some elements of this film that I really enjoyed however, that balance is totally absent in this film. I had been really looking forward to seeing this movie since I saw the first trailer, with Guns N Roses blasting in it, and I was really disappointed in the final product. The film makers just went too hard with the humor and it made for a silly, weightless movie.

title: So disappointing
text: The is no respect for the Thor character. They have made this once hero a laughing stock, a joke. I hate that the writers make Thor , a dumb blonde. So sad that there is lack of creativity. The first Thor movie was the best one. Acting wasn't great either.So happy I did not go to the theater to watch it but saw it on Disney plus.The only good character was seeing Jane Foster as the female Thor. Oh, well I have this was the last Thor movie, unless the writers or creators plan to redeem themselves and make Thor, a true hero like he once was. Maybe a little research may help. Thye should start watching the old television cartoons of Thor. In fact thor was a doctor in the 1966 cartoons, they can check it out in youtube. So Thor was not a dumb blonde but an intelligent doctor.

title: I loved it!
text: Im not a huge marvel fan but I have seen most of it. Havn't watched anything since Loki and this was the only thing that's really caught my eye since then.I was grinning the whole way through and cackling like an idiot every few mins. It had a perfect balance of up and down and christian bale is scary as hell.If you loved the last Thor movie, I'm pretty sure you will love this. Same humour just turned up to max silliness. Great fun, but also very moving and wholesome. Loved it!Really struggling to understand why the ratings are so low to be honest. I would just watch it for yourself and make your own mind up rather than listening to 1 star reviews of people hating on it.

title: Thank you! Taika Waititi
text: First of all, I love what Taika Waititi done in this film. Contrast between colorful and grayscale. CG looks great, amazing costume(very satisfied) and fun story(maybe pace too fast but acceptable)Chris Hemsworth still charming as Thor(and I love this "try not too serious Thor"). Natalie Portman is very talented in Mighty Thor character and Gorr - the villain that make me feel sympathy more than hate.The biggest weakness of this film is each characters' appeared time that I feel not enough such as Gorr and Mighty Thor. Maybe if These characters have more time to show their own story before into climax scene, audience will more pleased.Worth to watch it with family! Thank you Taika and all crew for this fun experience!

title: Entertaining
text: Seeing the negative reactions, I'm wondering if I saw a different movie.It's not a dark overcomplicated super serious movie but never tends to be. It's good entertainment.I truly enjoyed it, liked the humor and the fighting scenes but it felt rushed, it needed a bit longer, my humble opinion but the pace is good and never a dull moment. Music is a nice throwback to my younger years.Christian Bale give an ace performance portraying Gorr the Godbutcher. Didn't mind him having the human face, he's just that good! Only wish he had more screen time, hence the movie feeling rushedNatalie Portman does a superb job as the mighty Thor, she nails it. I really like her in this role. Fighting together gave just that little extra.And I just love Chris Hemsworth as Thor, together with Valkyrie Thompson, gives us a nice duo.I also was suprised how well Russel Crow did his role as Zeus, you could really see he's enjoying this part.Cameo was a nice see in the end credit scene, don't miss them! (There are two)I really can recommend this movie, just don't expect Infinity War/EndGame kind of movie, that was the finale of the three fases that came before, so you kind a have that in mind before you go. It's all building up to something, you can see that in this movie, tying the series (animated as well) and latest moviesGo see and enjoy!

title: What a mess!
text: In 10 years, Marvel studios managed to do something most thought impossible. They took beloved characters from the comics and made decent films about them and their adventures. These films became anticipated and dominated the box office, making the characters household names. Now, we have this...A strong, well developed character made to look like an idiot! In his first three films, Thor went from overly serious and arrogant to humble and humerous. Now, he is an absolute bafoon, completely at the mercy of those around him, particularly the female characters. Thor is no longer a heroic leader that earns the respect of other heros. His power as a god, isn't even his anymore! It's free to anyone who's open to recieving it, you don't even need to be worthy!The story attempts to pull on the heart strings but fails as there is a unfunny joke or sarcastic comment being blurred out every 5 minutes. It gets old really fast.The only part of the story that starts well and holds your attention, is that of the villain, played by Christian Bale. His performance and initial stages of his path in the film, are interesting and handled well. Sadly, this doesn't last long as he goes onto to randomly appear, causing a little bit of carnage, before things wrap up for him! A real waste of a great actor doing his best with what could have been a great villain.Anything pleasing about this film, appears in the trailer... In fact, I'd goes as far as to say, the trailer is better than the film!Another nails in the Marvel coffin.

title: Top 3 worst mcu movie
text: Movie was so bad I had to express my frustration somewhere so I'm writing my first review ever in Imdb. They turned Thor into a clown. There were few instances where he acted like a grown up. They abused the movie with overuse of jokes which most of them were unfunny. The only good things about the movie were the second battle with Gorr and Christian Bale's performance.

title: Comedy element was too much.....
text: Very good production, Christian Bale amazing performance, but personally didnt like the element of comedy from the all other characters,it was too much. It was an adventure regarding a God in the marvel universe and now became just a weird comedy.

title: What film did everyone else watch?
text: This is nearly as good as Taika's first Thor film, and in some ways better. I guess I can see why the rating was low: Most people enjoy a different type of superhero movie than I do.This year's "The Batman" was a surprisingly pleasant entry from DC. In my opinion the best Batman adaptation that has been done, I really enjoyed the dark take. But most of the Marvel films that go in such a serious note are fairly boring. This included the Iron man films, the avenger films, and the first three Thor movies. None were very enjoyably.This movie on the other hand was immensely enjoyable.Again, depends on the type of film you are looking for.

title: Watch it, but don't expect to much, disappointing
text: Very different to the the previous Mcu movies, trying way to hard with the humor and fall very short of the bar.Certainly won't be watching it again or buying it.

title: Just so bad
text: Not much else to say, this movie was awful. A real shame, I'm a massive fan of MCU but this was just absolute dross, worst MCU movie by far, not sure what they were thinking?!?!? A real shocker, hopefully they learn from this!Story was all over the place and just completely contradicted previous story to try and fit agendas. A joke was funny so they ran the same joke in to the rest of the movie which just makes it annoying and shows the lack of thought involved.We all know MCU peaked with Endgame but the hope was still there that they could produce good films but this falls so short of the mark, like unimaginably short, I never thought it could get this bad.

title: Light hearted MCU comedy was a fun ride
text: So I went in with extremely low expectations as Ive pretty much written the Phase 4 MCU off as a lost cause. But this movie, unlike every other phase 4 film, was actually engaging and enjoyable the whole way through. Unlike Dr Strange 2 it doesn't rely on the audience coming with fresh knowledge of crossover content from Disney+ shows. Instead, we get cleverly narrated recaps of previous events through one of Thor's side kicks telling tales to children.I was pretty much smiling the whole way through, even if some of the "jokes" Were repeated a bit too much, I still laughed. There were also plenty of sad moments and the romance between Jane and Thor really felt much more powerful this film than the first two, were they behaved like awkward teenagers.I viewed it in Dolby Cinema btw, but I feel like this film is probably better on IMAX as the sound quality was not that noticeable.Not the best MCU movie, but the best since Engame. Definitely Worth watching for Marvel fans.

title: Unfunny comedy movie
text: Thor: Love and Thunder successfully manages to be not a superhero movie the same time as not being a funny comedy movie. It may be good for a one-time watch as they tried to do too many things with this one.

title: Disappointing. Not a Superhero Movie.
text: It was terrible. We really wanted to like this movie and the previous first two Thors (Thor and Thor the Dark World). My family and I have been watching them in order so we didn't miss any plot points and story lines but this Thor Love and Thunder and Ragnarok were just simply hard to watch. I don't get why these movies were comedies and then had serious parts, even my kids were like ummm this is stupid. I didn't even watch till the end of Thor Love and Thunder because it was that ridiculous. It had funny parts but I wish they would of did different/separate spoof movies and kept the regular Thor movies like the first two, which were very good and was looking forward to the other being like those. My kids thought "It's my birthday" line in Ragnarok was hilarious but other than that it was really hard to watch, I hoped that the movie Thor, Ragnarok was just the "comedy one" but no they ruined it with continuing with that theme unfortunately. I really don't want to watch them as a comedy because the Superhero movies all had funny lines without making the superhero look like buffoons. Its kinda sad because the of what it could of been but now the Thor movies and Thor just look like ridiculous, silly buffoon characters and takes away their strong, upstanding, fighting the bad guy quality and really makes him look weak. May as well have him just walking around talking and acting like a monkey the whole time since you want a superhero that has muscles but has no character and basically a walking Buffoon. What a flop.

title: The 10 stars are for Mr. Bale
text: Watch this movie only for Christian Bale. I am not a super fan of super hero movies and i didn't want to watch this one. My kids who are super fans put it on after dinner and so i was there in front of the t.v. So why not watch it right?. From the get go Mr. Bale does amazing and as the movie progressed it is obvious that he is the one carrying this chaotic mess. Some CGI was bad, most dialogue corny and predictable and some scenes were totally unnecessary. What the heck happened to Chriss Pratt being hilarious? Why bother having them as cameos? The goats...what the heck was that about it just annoyed the hell out of everyone who was watching it not them per se, but the noise....i shudder to think of it. The ending was cute but it took so many u turns to get there if it hadn't been for C. B. i would of left and gone to my room. It should of been a stand alone movie woth him and Thor as a cameo or something because one is left longing for more of Mr. Bales' storyline. These Thor movies used to be good and now it seems like they are going for cheap shots such as stooping so low and using a age old tactic of undressing Thor and exposing him...would they of done that with Jane or Valkyrie? No they didn't as it showed that they wouldn't do it so why did they do it to the man? It was unnecessary and cheap. Watch this only to keep the praise of Mr. Bale going.

title: Possibly the greatest movie I've ever seen
text: I walked out of the theater stunned. My mind trying so hard to process what I just watched. Everyone else coming out of the theater was also speechless. I wish this movie was 5 hours long because I never wanted it to end! Comedy, action, visually stunning, sensory overload in the best way. I will rewatch this movie 5 more times just so I can try to grasp this incredible plot and put the pieces together of what I just witnessed. Love love love it, another big win in the books for Taika Waititi.

title: If you thought Ragnarok was OTT, you aint seen nothing yet!!!!
text: Dear me, where do I start with this?I have always enjoyed the first and second Thor movies, in particular the first. These movies established the character of Thor, a force to be reckoned with.Then Ragnorak happened, with it's over to the top use of comedy. I enjoyed it to a degree, but felt like Thor was getting nuanced. Well get ready for an even worse movie in Love and Thunder.If Ragnarok was too comedic, this just shoots up the comedy to 11. It seems the director was more interested in appeasing a certain community, then delivering a decent movie.Stay away from this atrocity, just watch the first two Thor movies, and pretend the rest didn't happen.The two stars are mainly for the cast.

title: Entertaining
text: Great movie. Funny (a little overboard) but none the less a solid mcu film. Story was really good and Bale was great. Ignore negative reviews. Overly critical of an otherwise entertaining film.

title: MCU's version of Batman And Robin.
text: Thor: Loath And PlunderWhat to say about the 4th movie for our lovable Norse God Thor other than "oh my god what have they done to my boy"? Oh how the Mighty Thor has fallen, from brave fighter and hero in the fantastic THOR 2011 movie to now being made a joke and love struck moron in 2022.Critics got it right on this one calling it Marvels version of the derived Batman and Robin movie from DC, because it is, its terrible almost a carbon copy.I dare say even Gagnerok is better than this but even that isnt saying much either.Phase 4 really has been a bust for the MCU with only one shining light.....Spider-Man No Way Home and that was thanks to Toby Maguire and Andrew Garfield being in the movie.

title: Electrifying
text: Thor: Love and Thunder is easily the best Thor movie of all time and it's one of the best superhero projects of the whole year, I love Thor as a character and I had high expectations for this film, but it was even better than I expected it to be.For one thing, this film is visually stunning, it's easily the best looking Thor movie, the cinematography is brilliant and the colors are absolutely beautiful, this film has a banger of a soundtrack and it's hilarious, Taiki Waititi's fingerprints are all over this film and it is so much funnier than Ragnarok, with bombastic action scenes and one of the best MCU villains.The entire cast is fantastic, Chris Hemsworth is as always amazing as Thor and I loved Jane Foster's character development, Natalie Portman is also phenomenal in the film, but the real standout was Christian Bale.Christian Bale is absolutely terrific in this film as the terrifying Gorr, he is exquisitely creepy, the film has an amazing and also hilarious ending that really brought fruition to Thor's character and I think was the perfect return to the beloved character.I'm gonna give Thor: Love and Thunder an A.

title: Worst
text:
Was a big let down
never expected Thor movie to be in such a pathetic state don't know how will they slaughter the sequel.It's literally like now Thor is some funny character
Thor 1 and 2 was fabulous piece of work.

title: I walked out it was so bad
text: This is a sad excuse for a movie. Just stupidity. Ridiculous plot. I have sat through several of the Thor and other DC movies and been entertained pretty much even though I go because it's what my husband wants to see. However, I couldn't take it any more after an hour and I walked out to wait for him in the car. He came out of the theater and said it didn't get any better. What a waste of time and money! All those A-listers should be embarrassed for being a part of this money-grabbing Hollywood production.

title: Great goats!
text: Thor: Love and Thunder: Another fun epic with some dark bits, but Thor (Chris Helmsworth) is so vain and conceited you'll always laugh. We even get an Assembly of the Gods (a bit like the SW Galactic Senate) in Omnipotence City where Zeus (Russell Crowe) rules the roost, The dark stuff come from Gor (Christian Bale) The God Butcher who is determined to off as many Gods as possible, he has some justification though. Also on the gloomy side is Jane Foster (Natalie Portman), she has terminal cancer but then is attracted by Mjolni which reconstructs itself and transforms her into a female Mighty Thor. We also get the Guardians of the Galaxy who help Thor (Helmswoth) deal with some fall out from Gor's activities. Great battles and skirmishes, Thor even gets a pair of giant goats to help him along with Korg (Taika Waititi) as his sidekick. A wonderfully imagined New Asgard on Earth (which has become a visitor attraction) comes under attack from Gor and his Shadow Realm monsters. This film is a fun epic adventure and doesn't over stay it's welcome with a 119 minute running time. Directed by Taika Waititi, who co-wrote the script with Jennifer Kaytin Robinson. 8/10.

title: Very, Very Bad.
text: Its another BS movie marvel has churned out knowing they have a core audience that will pay for any movie they produce. This is cinema not comics. Its actually crazy to think about the amount of money that was spent on making this bogus film.

title: Great film
text:
Frankly it's a very good Marvel and a very good film on the story of Thor
The music is great and some legendary rock titles go perfectly with the story of the film
The characters are endearing and the humor, concerning me I quite loved in short a very good film.

title: The MCU is dead
text: Don't even bring up prevous films. First films of characters tended to be good, then fine, now they don't even try. The collapse of MCU started with Spiderman trashing the set timeline, but whatever, I thought, well, take individual movies, sometimes.Still, however bad Endgame was, it at least carried an overarching narrative. What is the thing holding all these movies together anymore?But ok, whatever, individual movies.Well, ALL of the P4 films were simply: bad. Patheticaly bad waste of money. But what do I know, right? Profit is profit, even if the planet will burn down because of it, right?Then somehow this Genderswapped Thor sparkled my interrest. I looked at the poriginal story, and it looked magnificient. Ethan Hawk's character looked excellent in the promo. I didn't mind Cartoon Thor. I was ok with Natalie Thor (Nhor?).But Nhor joking all through the film, even in hooman form, not even a shadow of cancer, and suffering, and everything this story is about? I remember Jessica Alba from F4: "And then the director said: could you cry nice?"So I don't even anymore. #MCUisDead.

title: Keep your kids away from this
text: A bad movie by all standards. If that wasn't enough, we're continually exposed to all sorts of modern-day propaganda. I don't have to name it - you know what it is.

title: Even Better than the last Thor
text: Thor: Love and Thunder finally breaks away from a too predictable Marval formula.Leading the way is Taika Waititi who has before tackled serious themes by giving them to us to think about from a perspective of humor. In JoJo Rabbit the elements of of racism were broken down into their component parts to reveal how stupid, and funny, they appear. However, these elements are no longer funny if they are given power: even worse if it is state power.Anyways, in this movie we have male ego, cancer, broken relationships, loss of religion and kidnapping to deal with, far more serious than any Marvel movie to date, yet this movie was also somehow refreshingly more funny as well. The homage to 80s hair bands was perfect. Russle Crow was perfect. I wish that Tessa Thompson had had a bigger part, but it was nice to see Natalie Portman back. It's also nice to see Chris Hemsworth showing more range in his acting. Christian Bale is always great.I suspect that the swarm of 2,3,4 star reviews is due to the fact that there is greater representation given to same sex relationships in this film. Also there is a question put forth about the usefulness of wardshipung a god, while reminding us that all cultures have gods. I love these swarms of obvious down-votes; they always indicate an interesting movie.I give this movie an honest 8. Not trying to counterbalance the crowd.

title: One of the worst movies in recent times
text: The acting of the whole cast is cringeworthy. Bale and Hemsworth were an awful pairing for the war, as it looked forced and cringy.The worst part? Dry humor, which is as good as watching paint dry. Also, the kids in the movie were asked to punch above their weight to make this is a parody show.Morbius, Thor, Dr. Strange, all these recent marvel movies were only seen due to the brand Marvel. All were mediocre and avoidable cringe fest. They should do better than scamming people.Won't be excited anymore for Marvel. Pinning hopes on DC.

title: Much better than what people make it out to be
text: I get it, people wanted another Thor RagnarÃ¶k, they didn't get it, they're pissed. On the other hand, Dr. Strange Multiverse of Madness that had one of the worst chemistry between actors I've ever seen, horrible script, two of the most powerful characters in the MCU act like teenagers who can't fully control their powers, and it gets better reviews? The story was completely senseless and honestly the only redeeming part was the cameos we got to see, yet people rate it higher than Thor. This is an enigma to me.Thor Love and Thunder was GREAT. Yes, it had cheesy moments, but it was all made with a great sense of humor. The soundtrack was wonderful, it was the first time I ever enjoyed Natalie Portman on the big screen besides Black Swan, Christian Bale was as expected - phenomenal, the rest of the characters Thor interacts with throughout the film are colorful and full of character, and the goats. My god the goats. Everyone keeps mentioning how great the cast, the music and basically everything else is, but because the plot is a little weak, they just immediately give it a 6 or even a 4. As if Dr. Strange's plot was good? Are you joking?I went into this movie expecting a colorful, lighthearted well crafted comics-action movie and it is EXACTLY what I got. Great actors and performances all across the board, great music, great humor, great production.So yeah, this isn't a surprising Thor RagnarÃ¶k, but that's only because you knew what to expect this time. This movie is easily a 8.0+, even if the story wasn't that amazing, it was a great cinematic experience for what it was aiming for. It almost feels as if people would rate this movie much higher if it was another clichÃ© Dr. Strange / Captain America movie because it's just another junk MCU summer hit to consume, instead of something that has a little (a lot actually) bit of its own style and attitude.Give it a chance without trying to be a fabled movie critic, go to the cinema expecting a fun ride and you'll love it.

title: Ridiculous and predictable
text: Most every MCU movie is at least interesting and entertaining.This is unfortunately the bottom of the barrel. A few laughs but more headshaking than anything. Save that money and wait for it to go to Cable... Sorry is my favorite character but this is a bad treatment.

title: Embarrassingly bad
text: I was a huge MCU fan, but this was painful to watch.The jokes fall flat.The music, while good, just doesn't work/the timing isn't right.Both Zeus and Thor have been reduced to silly, weak little man-boys.All of the dialogue (but particularly the jokes and the diversity stuff) feels like it was written by amateurs rather than seasoned storytellers.I really wanted to love this, but I would have preferred spending my money on a couple of gallons of gas versus wasting it on this mess.

title: Very fun movie
text: I enjoyed myself throughout the whole movie. It wasn't particularly moving in my opinion, but it was very fun to watch, which is what I expected and what I came to see. I thought it had good humor, was visually appealing, and had a fitting soundtrack.

title: I pray this isn't canon to Earth 616
text: For reference, Ragnarok was the right amount of seriousness mixed with comedy, like staring doomsday in the face and trying to think of some witty banter to lessen the stress. Love & Thunder however, was joke after joke, and each joke was beaten into the ground until you couldn't even tell it was once a dead horse anymore. Even the actors didn't seem to take any of their roles seriously (either because it was part of the script and they weren't thrilled, or they just wanted to goof around), aside from the two serious moments in the movie that lasted all but two seconds before they rolled in another gag. I don't know what the director of this movie was doing, but directing this movie was not one of them. It would've been a decent stand alone movie with different characters/franchise, some weird multiverse bit, an exaggeration by Krog considering he narrates bits of the movie, but this movie is a step in the wrong direction if this is canon to Earth 616 of the MCU. I haven't been this disappointed in a movie since the live action Avatar the Last Airbender.

title: Not Marvel worthy
text: A thorough effort making Stan Lee turn in his grave, bad action, bad humor, to much bad humor, sucking plot, music for oldies, I'm never again go to a Marvel premiere, which I always used to do ... says enough.

title: Better than Ragnarok
text: Another Taika classic comedy with gut punches in the third act. The movie is beautiful and has amazing style. The fight scenes are amazing and kind of feel like an anime. Christian Bale's Gorr was creepy and scary in the best ways. The "short" runtime made the movie fast paced but it didn't feel rushed.

title: Empty instalment
text: Despite the excitement that I had for this movie , the film doesn't add anything to the Thor universe. The fight scenes were so lame . My fave parts were Thor and Jane . Apart from , everything is pretty much forgettable.

title: Wanted to become like Ragnarok
text: Love and Thunder failed because it wanted to be as Ragnarok. Bale does not get a lot screen time and we can not get to see how dangerous he is as in the comics how he just kills all the gods. Judges cut must be released so that we can enjoy it well . My personal opinion is it is a average movie not a great one but at some points it was worst.

title: Horrible
text: This is the worst movie I've ever seen. I am a total Marvel geek. I have comic books older than you. Hundreds of them. If you want to see a stupid movie that is actually funny, watch Dr. Strangelove or Kung Pow. Don't waste brain cells on this garbage.

title: Save your money avoid this mediocre drivel
text: It's hard to put in words how mediocre and nonsensical this movie was, my first Marvel movie where I couldnt wait to get out of theatre it was that bad. Everything is a joke and there's no stakes at all, full of filler characters like Valkyrie like why was she in this movie? What was her purpose? Krog was not funny at all.Also Disney's classic bait and switch technique from tv shows has officially transcended to movies, this movie was not about Thor at all but about Jane foster and her garbage Thor. Og Thor was just there as eye candy and being a bumbling idiot while the girls take care of business. Taika needs a break from movies his production of garbage content must stop here same for MCU just stop please.

title: You might Love the Comedy And Action This Thunder Brings
text:
LIKES:The Pacing At Times: Thor Love and Thunder once more puts us back into the fast paced seat of Marvel and keeps the foot on the pedal the entire time. Like RagnarÃ¶k before it, the fourth installment has the same energy and pizazz that Waititi brought us in the past and that makes for an energetic pace. It does not take long to get into the adventure element and he keeps things moving as fast as he can to keep you the viewer into the madness this particular film has to bring. He has brought other elements into the mix to help bring others in, but the pace is certain to be perfect for those with flash in the pan likes of the cinematic world.The Balance of Characters: Marvel has become accustomed to putting a lot into their phase 4 movies, with the last three films juggling a lot of characters and fan service into one installment. Thor's fourth installment has a lot of characters to play with and keep on the screen at one time and it does it surprisingly well, and perhaps the second best of the Phase 4 stuff to date in terms of this element. The Guardians have their fair share of time without being too stuck on the movie, while Thor's merry band of godly misfits each get their own time to shine on the screen and feel significant in some way. Our leading bad guy Gorr has meaningful moments in this film and feels like a well-developed character, while the other plot elements of the film get their own time and good use. It's a fantastic surprise to see how many people had their shining moments and a nod to Waititi for finding a way to juggle it.The Sound Track: Like Guardians, this movie may have one of my favorite track lists to watch a movie too. All the classic songs and epic energy is waiting to swallow you whole with the crazy vibes and perfect timing for inclusion in this movie. Odd love ballads are there during the calmer and more intimate moments, while the action packed moments once more pull from the legendary decades of rock and roll. It feels just like RagnarÃ¶k's execution on many levels, and for me was better at times with dropping the right song at the right time and kicking major butt with it. Even the orchestral work finds a place to shine, and the unique tracks for it, and unique spins, show that Waititi is just as ridiculously fun as he always has been.The Visual Direction/Sound Editing: With the budge and resources of Disney, big visuals are the expected norm at this point. While I can't say this is the most mind blowing use of their technology, I do have to clap my hands and nod at the worlds they created for this film. Thor's adventure takes a lot of new styles to heart in their quest, starting technicolor and trippy from the get go that we have seen in Guardians and then moving into something much deeper. The group managed to do so much with the use of lighting in this film, most of the time using it perfectly to really give the aura of the worlds they were trying to create. As seen in the trailer, there is an homage to the black and white film technique that I loved, and heading to the divine city of the Gods really felt like something out of a Percy Jackson chapter in the books. It's beautiful and the sound editing that goes with most of these scenes fully brings that extra emotional punch with it, be it robbing the scene of sound, or adding the sheen and heavenly shine of the kingdom of the gods.The Emotional Moments Of The Movie: Many of the Marvel movies have not really hit me with the emotional punch like other fans have. Spiderman has come the closest, and there are a scant few times of a few other things to get me to nearly form tears. This one though has the most emotional moments for me in a very, very long time. I can't say much, but the character development of Thor is really good in this film, and addresses a few things that movies like this tend to shy away from for the fantasy elements. You'll find yourself potentially in a relevant case for Gorr, Thor, Jane, and Valkyrie's trials and really feel the connection they were going for in their representation on screen. Again, I want to say more, but I can't for spoilers so let's keep going.The Comedy at times: Waititi proved you can have a lot of comedic fun with Thor and still have the Marvel element. For this film, he did that very well on many levels again, bringing with it some brilliant dialogue and timing that I absolutely laughed at in the film. As Korg, his delivery is just spot on and well narrated, sort of like the Barney Fife of Thor's band, that provides that kick you need to relieve the tension. Thor himself feels like the Asgardian we have known and loved for so long, and it really flows well in this movie to not be a drastic twist.DISLIKES:The Rushed Pace In The Opening: Like Rogue One, Thor's fourth installment has an opening that seems a bit rushed, choppy, and a montage more than anything else. It does the job and gives you enough of the story foundation to enjoy, but yet still seems a bit choppy and montage like that I did not quite enjoy. Much of it had to do with the Guardians inclusion and the Gorr's opening moves, alongside jane's story for why she is coming back to the universe. It's not the worst thing given the amazing acts to follow, but you can't help but wonder how good this film could have been with a little more time in the opening.A Story Element: I can't say much about this element without ruining the story, but another small quip, is why the solution to the problem could not have been used again for the final number. Probably to help out with the emotional punch mentioned earlier, probably another rule that I missed or don't know from the comic book. Regardless, the last part seemed to have a fix we could have used, but again I'll let it mostly slide.The Emotional Moments Can Be Tough: If you have a nightmare or sensitivity to some deeper story elements found in Dramatic movies, this film can be tough for you to watch. A warning more than anything, Thor's fourth tale hits some hard topics that do hit the emotional scale, but may be too realistic or hard to watch in the way they present it. It's realistic and makes sense, but it's also a grounding element that you may not want to see in a super hero movie.Some of The Political Push: Yep, we should not be surprised that Disney is still doing the checkbox checking in their Phase 4 installments. The Love and Thunder has a few moments of showing the political agenda off, some of which are naturally baked in, and others a little more of a push than needed for me. It's not the content more so the timing and placement, and though Waititi accomplishes the taste balance better than others, sometimes it gets away and seems to be a diversion not needed.The Visuals Sometimes Get In the Way Of the Action: If you are a fan like me, you like to get the full scope of the action playing out, like in Avengers or Winter Soldier. Waititi and his crew do this decently well, but there are times where the visual style or camera work gets in the way and feels like a cost saving step. The dark tones, how they are zoomed in and the CGI cramming sometimes don't come out as well as they had hoped for me, as they block the people doing the action. Again, it seems trivial, but with a little more post editing and lighting, I think the action scenes in some parts of the movie would have been awesome.A Little More Action: Yep, the action junkie wants more action, surprised right? It's a trivial moment given the other movies I've seen, but Thor's fight scenes in the middle and the end could have used about five to ten minutes more for me to finish those moments strong. The pillar is again the middle moment on the platform, all I can say again, which felt like it held almost the right amount of involvement and finish. The end scenes came close and still end well, but just a little more time with the music, the style, and the twist involvement would have really made this element perfect for me.The Comedy Gets A Little Excessive: By far my biggest dislike of the movie, was the excessive comedy that this part of the Marvel franchise goes too far for me in. If you want your comedy stuffed into every line, with running gags that keep going, Waititi made this movie for you. For others, there are times where the comedy is in your face, forced, and excessive to the point of losing the funny and going to the annoying part that you hope the element will stop. Sometimes it's the banter and the dialogue trying to shoehorn in, and other times it's some political comedy that just does not need to be in there when there seemed to be other options. My biggest irk of the comedy though was the famous goat yell, and just how excessive it became, only making me laugh a few times when he timed it well. Overall, this was the part that seemed a little too much for me, but for those who like comedy, you'll love it.The VERDICT
Thor's mighty adventure turned out to be better on many levels than I thought and really was the fun adventure the trailers promised. It's a movie with style, pizazz, and that Waititi magic many have fallen in love with, balancing a lot of elements to fantastic amounts in who they recruited for the ordeal. With a great soundtrack, awesome visuals, action that feels early Marvel, and character development, this film really has a lot for the fanbase to revel in and enjoy in the shorter runtime than you would expect. Though it does still have some elements I did not enjoy like a rushed paced story element, a little political moments that could have been tapered down, and excessive comedy at times, the movie really is a fun and good installment for me. This is a film worth the investment to going to the theaters and may be worth the full blown theater experience (Imax etc.) if you got the resources or access to it. Overall, this movie for me gets:Action/Adventure/Comedy: 8.5
Movie Overall: 7.5.

title: It's a must NOT see!!!
text: Arguably, the worst movie ever but definitely the worst superhero movie ever. Terrible script, terrible acting, and terrible direction which equates to a poorly produced movie.

title: Made for 7 year olds
text: This movie was bad, Some joke were funny but at the half way point became obnoxious. The story line and scenes did not work. The actions of the the main characters made no sense.

title: M she u
text: Kids, teens, women that's all marvel and Disney sees anymore.marvel had a good run but after endgame everything has been mid or bad. Martin Scorsese was right.

title: This was a Good movie.... Ignore the want to be critics
text: First of all I would like to say that this movie definitely deserves a higher rating... Does is deserve Best movie of the year? Of course not. Will the actors/actresses be receiving an Oscar for their performances? I highly doubt it. But does that mean it's a bad movie and that Taiki Waititi should be receiving all this hate? If you ask me Waititi did exactly what he was trying to set out to do. This is an Action-Comedy very much like the previous installment Thor Ragnarok which received very much praise. It had its amazing action sequences, maybe one to many corny one liners, a familiar but good story, and a great villian (Christian Bale can't fail). Chris Hemsworth did a phenomenal job as always. There isn't anyone out there who could take this role from him. Tessa Thompson was great even though she didn't have as much screen time but that was to expect with the return of a very special someone. When I saw Natalie Portman was taking on the role as the Mighty Thor I was very quick to jump to conclusions. I thought it was a horrible idea but Marvel once again proved me wrong. It was great seeing her back in action and glad she reprised her role once again as Thors one love Jane Foster. At the end of the day we got another follow up with the characters we have grown to love over the years with a lot of action, laughs and heartfelt moments. Now I am no critic myself and I haven't liked the recent movies Marvel has put out including Doctor Strange and the Multiverse of Madness but this one just doesn't deserve all the hate. Just because a movie isn't original and takes itself serious the entire time doesn't make it a bad movie. This is a movie about superheroes... Let's say that one more time.. SUPERHEROES!!!!! So if you are looking for something to pick apart for realism you should probably go watch a biography or documentary. Love and Thunder isn't a perfect 10 but a solid 7.5 in my opinion.

title: Absolutely awful
text: Bad acting, terrible CGI, cringe humour and WAY TOO MANY JOKES, weak writing, lazy story line. I think you get the jist. This movie is an absolute miss. So disappointing.

title: Has a fun 80's vibe to it.
text: Seems that the Thor movies keep getting better with each sequel. Seems like the cast and crew where having a blast making this, pretty much comes through on camera.Nice to see Jane Foster(Natalie Portman) return and become her own superhero. Chris Hemsworth always knows how to balance it out has Thor, the superhero part, the comedic, and the emotional part, and he and Portman still have beautiful chemistry. Tessa Thompson is also great, Russell Crowe really hams it up has Zeus. Let's not forget Christian Bale has the villain Gorr, he gives a enjoyable creepy over the top appeal performance. The effects are always fun also. I hope there will be Thor movies to come.

title: Orgies? Really Disney?
