text: Shame on Disney and their lack of any mora compass. Looking around during the movie while Russell Crow tells Thor "stay with us and drink wine, eat grapes and have orgies with us. Lots of orgies" was disgusting. I almost walked out the movie. That's not the only dumb sexual piece Disney forces on your children but it alone is enough to give this 2 stars. What a piece of crap.

title: Trying too hard for everything
text: Another girl power movie where female characters save the day, and male characters are no longer the protagonist, they are not either egotistical evils or lovable and laughable buffoons.The jokes are lame and forced, this is really bad.Stop destroying MCU!!

title: Lame
text: Disney is taking marvel movies too far again. It's just like the fast and furious series they just keep on making them. Also in every new Disney movie they always have to have some wokeism in the movie and always need to have some gay or trans person in the movie now as well. Disney please stop making movies and trying to groom kids. Apparently my review is to short so I will continue. In the original Marvel movies they had a serious nature to them this was just made to be a comedy. And a poorly thought out one as well. Story line was lame Russel Crowe who I usually like is a putz but I think that was the intent. I don't know I'm over this.

title: I've never felt more seen
text: Thor : Love and Thunder is an astonishing piece of diversity and inclusion. Being the first Marvel film to include a character of Greek decent. Crowe's portrayal of a fat, greedy and perverted Zeus is just the kind of role model young Greek boys have always needed. 8.94/10.

title: Love and Plunder!!!!
text: Absolute Crap!!! Why the constant bad jokes???Before I begin, I absolutely love Thor ragnarok and would rate it 12 out of 10 if I could! This on the other hand wasted a whole lot of time that I could have been using to do something so much more useful like counting every individual tooth of every zip I own just in case a very unusual situation arises where for the preservation of the planet we need to know exactly how many zip teeth we all have really quickly!! That would have been time much more well spent!! It banes me to say after being such a huge ragnarok fan that this is unequivocally the biggest load of old plunder that I have ever had the misfortune to have been lured into watching and I implore you to spend your time in a far more useful way (like counting the teeth on your zips!) or cutting your toenails, or pulling your teeth with a pair of pliers, or perhaps checking in detail the small print on all of your current insurance policies?Enjoy!!

title: How is this possible?
text: Thor was a best DC movie for me. Iron man was there also, others were great but these two were at the top. This movie is so bad that no sequel is possible. I never saw that in any other series. I never thought it was possible. That someone can make a movie so bad that the sequel is just not possible.

title: Bring the rainbow
text: I enjoyed this thor adventure, it had some great emotional and fun moments. It does have issues as well. Thor ragnarok is the superior film but this is still a solid adventure. The screaming goats were funny too. Bale, Portman, Hemsworth and Thompson all brought their A-game. This is still better than the first two thor films. I like this film more than multiverse of madness.

title: Goofy, inane, vacuous
text: The acting is goofy. The script is inane. The jokes are vacuous, and as unfunny as a failed joke could ever be.The soundtrack is lazy, using Guns 'n' Roses classics, and Enya (and probably more, but I switched this garbage off too soon to find out). This music is highly inappropriate for this movie, and damages the music. Enya, and GnR, or whomever owns the rights to their music, should be deeply ashamed for allowing their music to be used in this childish, drab, over-hyped rubbish - it's not as it they need the money. The music alone forced me to skip large parts of this puerile, waste of time, sorry excuse of a movie.There is a hint of a promising storyline in this movie early on, but the stupid, fatuous, self-parodying acting - primarily of the lead player (whom should have stayed in Home & Away where he belongs) - later on just utterly destroyed it, and any hope for a decent, worthwhile movie experience. The expensive CGI cannot save this movie on account of the talentless, insipid script, and embarrassing acting quality.Marvel needs to get out of Hollywood.

title: Great movie but we needed more screentime
text: The movie was very fast paced, with enjoyable humour and great visuals. However, the main problem I had was how quickly it ended. Some characters needed more time to develop and it felt like one of them just flopped and never lived up to their time.

title: Marvel does it again
text: Just like with Multiverse of Madness, Marvel has dropped the ball. The entire movie feels like a parody of Thor. Every scene is the movie trying it's hardest to drop some unfunny 1 liner jokes. When the movie tries to be serious, it just fails too. Wait for this to drop on Disney+

title: Too much corn-ball Taika humour
text: While a touch of Taika's farcical "What We Do In The Shadows" humour was splendid in Ragnorak, there's too much of it in this film. It's a non-stop corn-ball comedy hour full of jokes that could have been funny if I wasn't annoyed that they just didn't stop. All the corniness made it really hard for me to get invested in the characters. I just didn't care what happened to anyone in the film, I looked at my watch at least three times and was happy when it was over. Also, stop shoving the WOKE nonsense down our throats. It's so bloody annoying now. Thor was the best, most powerful and most thrilling marvel character and now he's the butt end of a joke, looking stupid so that everyone around him looks much smarter. Sad.

title: Dumb but fun
text: I think the movie had some good jokes where I laughed quite bit. The story was interesting. But the jokes sometimes ruined the serious tone of film in a few critical moments of the story. Though the story was fun to watch it was also predictable, "Good guys search for bad guy, and defeat him by the end of the story". If you didn't like Thor Ragnarok, you definitely won't like this, because it is essentially the same thing repackaged. Overall I enjoyed the film even though the story was predictable, I'd recommend it to the general populace who don't really understand what makes a good film, 8/10.

title: I just couldn't take Thor serious
text: After Thor Ragnarok, I was secretly hoping they had learnt from ridiculing Thor too much. Sadly, it got worse in Love and Thunder.Nearly every time Thor opens his mouth, he just has to crack a joke. There are a few perfect moments, but it was often too much.Since every time I saw Thor I expected comedy, it kinda took the real experience of a Marvel movie away.

title: This star is only for bale
text: The movie wasted his acting it wasted his perfect villian taika waititi should not have selected gorr as a villian if he had this in mind. Still Christian bale did his best youll love him when he is on screen but that's the sad part he is not there for a long time. Stop making nonsense.

title: The MCU worries me.
text: This movie is something else...Although it is mostly comedic, I did not laugh once.The jokes and gags had no impact at all.Thor: Ragnarok is one of my favorite MCU films, and I often enjoy Taika Waititi's movies, but this one was a stinker.Cristian Bale was completely wasted on this movie. His screen time was negligible.After the opening scene, I thought this movie might actually go to cool places, but I was severely disappointed.Phase 4 features six movies thus far.(Black Widow, Shang-Chi, Eternals, Spider-Man, Doctor Strange, and Thor).Four of them are either awful or mediocre.Shang-Chi is somewhere between ok and meh.Spider-Man was the only movie I actually enjoyed, and only because it is nostalgia porn.I may really quit watching Marvel movies entirely if this trend continues.I have already skipped most of their Disney+ shows, because they are not worthy of my time,

title: MCU Comfort food
text: Enjoyable addition to Thor's roster of movies. It's no Ragnarok unfortunately. But it's a fun ride. Happy to see Natalie Portman's character return, and I loved where this movie ended even if the execution wasn't as good as past MCU movies.

title: Comedy of the year! Parody of the original Thor movies
text: I know the MCU really started the trend of not taking their characters seriously because well, the source material is comics and apparently it should be treated as light hearted, feel good, even comical to an extent. MCU is the antithesis to DC's realism and intense Dark Knight trilogy. The franchise was a huge success using this formula. But the audience's response to this movie is an absolute rejection to what the studio has churned out for over a decade. The lack of respect to the Thor character is blatant and fans even casual moviegoers can see through it. This latest iteration of Thor is not even a theme park movie. It's comical and an abomination to what true cinema should be about.

title: And I thought Eternals was bad...
text: ... just when I reckoned Marvel movies couldn't get any worse, along came Thor: Love and Thunder. Wow, this Marvel phase of films has really sucked... please avoid this garbage at all costs!How do you make Chris Hemsworth, Christian Bale, Natalie Portman, Russell Crowe, Tessa Thompson and others look really bad on the silver screen? Simple, just employ Taika Waititi to direct another Thor movie. He really must have lucked out on Thor: Ragnarok, as this time around, his direction gives us a movie that falls flat from the opening scene and then manages to just about limp along, right till the very end, embarrassing all involved along the way.As the credits rolled, my wife asked "did a five year old write this one?" I understood where she was coming from, but I believe five year olds have far superior imaginations to the creative team involved here. Bottom line, Thor: L&T is just a really bad movie, period! As the curtains close, it states, "Thor will return"... let's hope if that's the case, that Marvel has the good sense next time to go with another director.George Clooney, finally I can forgive you for Batman and Robin.

title: Taika Waititi is back at it again
text:
Taika Waititi is back at it again, from the success of Thor:Ragnarok, comes Thor: Love and Thunder, which has just as much comedy and action packed as the previous film. Waititi executed most of his comedy very well, many jokes and situations had me and the audience laughing. Some were a little too much but not to take anything away. A problem some Marvel movies have, is placing comedic moments in the serious moments, I can assure you, this movie did not do that. Which highlights and makes Christian Bale as Gorr the god butcher feel so menacing. His performances, in anything he is part of are amazing and once again he is great in this film. Everyone was great, but for me, he was the scene stealer. Chris Hemsworth is amazing as Thor, but we done known that. It's safe to say, if you're not into rom-coms you won't enjoy this one. Marvel's deepest cut into romance so far and probably one of the most comedic movies of the MCU. If you weren't a fan of Thor:Ragnarok, you probably won't find this one that amusing either but if you enjoyed it, you'll enjoy this one as well.Enjoyment Rating: 9.25/10
Film Rating: 8/10Overall Rating: 86.5%

title: Marvel is changing and its humiliating
text: The only thing good about the movie and story line is Gorr the God Butcher. I want the real Thor, before Ragnarok, he was cool in Infinity war and Endgame. But why cant they stick with the Thor we know? This movie is a Joke.

title: Mediocre
text: Disney+ IMAX Enhanced Version1. Second time watching it and the quality dipped even more. In Disney+ release they improved and fixed a lot of unfinished and wonky CGIs presented in the theatrical release.The film destined to be a mediocre entry since the beginning. I didn't like how Taika Waititi made Thor unserious most of the time and that made some emotional moments felt bland. Waititi overdid some jokes and it was cheesy and cringey. Christian Bale delivered probably the only standout performance; not his best or decent work to-date. The ending was not satisfying at all.2. Second time watching it and the quality dipped even more. In Disney+ release they improved and fixed a lot of unfinished and wonky CGIs presented in the theatrical release.The film destined to be a mediocre entry since the beginning. title: Don't take life too seriously.
text: I don't know why a lot of people in the reviews expected an Oscar winner type of movie, it's Thor for god's sake, I laughed almost all the movie, yes, the jokes are kind of dumb but funny anyway. And Natalie Portman is just gorgeous, and Christian Bale well, what can I say? He is one of the greatest actors in this world and gives the movie that serious tone needed to balance things and he does it masterfully.Enjoy the movie people, enjoy the dumb jokes, enjoy life. Peace.

title: Gawd! This Was Aweful! First Bad Marvel Movie.
text: This was so bad, not sure why it was even released. Bad writing, bad story, bad jokes. They basically turned Thor into a lame moron. So sad...the first truly bad Marvel movie I've seen. No need to waste your money on this one!

title: Really great would really recommend
text: I love the writing especially the cast, i would recommend this movie if you know the MCU timeline because if you don't it really gets tricky to understand certain parts like the why the Guardians of the Galaxy is with him or why was he fat in the beginning of the movie, that's just my opinion about it, it's still a great movie for some people and that's about it.

title: Yes Zeus, this wasn't fest of nudity but it was fest of foolishness.
text: When the first scene came up, i thought we were still watching ads for other movies. When i realised this is the Thor movie, i said, this is going to be bad. The first 30 minutes is the worst Marvel has ever been. The dialogues between the GOTG and Thor felt like so strained. Also their jokes was just a bunch of cliches and mostly I didn't laugh. But as the movie continues, the stupid jokes somehow got better, the rythm of the movie went better and i started to get into the movie. And then, once again; goats. Whose idea was the put those stupid goats into the movie? They were really so annoying, every 3 seconds, they were just screaming. It was never funny and it was overused. They used goat screams like 10 times and all were bad. It made funny scenes cringe, it made serious scenes a foolishness. I never thought we won't see a worse Thor after the Endgame but writers made him so bad. Even if i want to i can't give you any spoilers because this movie don't have a story. It was just a compilation of unfunny jokes and Gorr was just a dissapointment. I really want my money back, this movie is far worst of Phase 4. I don't think i will be watching next movies of Phase 4. I never liked one, and if they try to sell these unfunny and boring movies, i won't be either.

title: Can't believe I wasted my time watching this
text: It feels like a bad imitation of a Waika movie / show. Like someone was a huge fan of "what we do in the shadows" (brilliant show) and decided to make a marvel movie. Idk what happened. The other Thor Waika did was great. To be fair the whole plot of his literal prop girlfriend (Portman) taking over the franchise, is hilariously bad. Hemsworth has become a iconic Thor. I'm sorry but you're replacing him with a a girl who looks like she's straight out of a romcom or period drama with CGI arms designed by an artist who doesn't understand proportions. Wonder woman was buff.. no need to enhance her physique to look more masculine. It's not like the hammer works on muscles lol.. it is magic that allows them to wield the hammer.Literally 99% jokes except the goats fall super flat. Or are downright cringy. The plot is boring and uninteresting and also basically kills the franchise. I imagine that even if there were people who wanted to see a Natalie Thorman, have lost interest after seeing this poor imitation of a Thor movie. Waika seems to have misunderstood what made the first movie good. Even the villain, supposed to be very intimidating. Just comes across as comical (in a bad way).Again this looks like a troll made a bad imitation. Don't bother watching. Thankfully I didn't pay for this lol. Not that I care about the money. I just don't want to encourage the buffoons at Marvel and Disney. At this point they seem to be switching to making "hate watch movies" and antagonizing their fanbase. Like netflix does with certain really bad movies / shows that they pump out sequels too because youtubers will make countless hate videos and the movies will get lots of hate watchers. It's really sad to see the industry like this. It's never been great. But I don't hink it's ever been worse than this. Every bit of creativity is being sucked out to check boxes.

title: Great Watch
text: Thor: Love and Thunder is a very fun watch that is also cinematically beautiful, and flawlessly transitions from a comedic to serious tone when necessary. This is exactly how comic book movies should be, or at least Marvel Comics for that matter.

title: Taika Waititi Did a horrid job and ruined a great hero.
text: This is the last film by Taika Waititi I'll watch. He turned a superhero movie into a comedy for three--year-olds with nudity.I sincerely hope that marvel finds someone else to take over Thor and they start making this a more serious hero and not a joke.

title: Can't expect it to be like Ragnarok at the start of a new marvel phase after endgame. Fresh start for the thor franchise
text: I think alot of people are going to be expecting this movie to surpass or get close to Ragnarok but are forgetting Ragnarok was one of the last 3 key movies to set up the finale of phase 3 with infinity war and endgame. This movie is the start of a new chapter and yeah it was a much more of a kid oriented movie but can't expect to much with most kids on holidays or about to be!! One for the family!!

title: If I was a 6 year old girl, I might have enjoyed this..

title: This is torture
text:
The movie is so bad that it is getting painful to watch it. Kudos to those who actually manage to watch it through until the end.It feels like they are at this point not even trying anymore to release worthwhile material and quantity over quality is the concept they are going with. SAD...
The movie is nothing more but a humorless parody of thor with bad skripting and it gets annoying really fast.The targeted audience here is definitely easily entertained, low in intelligence and in lack of standards. At least that is my explanation on how this turned into trash.I suggest that everyone with self-respect should avoid this movie and maybe consider to leave marvel in the past for good. Time to move on.

title: See it with your own eyes
text: You can't judge a movie after a few comments that you read online, because only your opinion matters. For me, for exemple, this movie is at the same level as ragnarok, maybe better(i'm still thinking about that), it's one of the funniest mcu movies, it has plenty of action, the characters are magnificent, especially Gorr, which Christian Bale brought to another level, and it has those goats.Conclusion: Is the movie good? Yes, pure comedy and if you expected sth else from it go watch the boys. It could've been better? Maybe, but only a few scenes like the ending which was ok. Top 10 mcu projects? Definitely.

title: Such a disappointment marvel
text: This sequel has many weaknesses and less strength, there too much agenda , marvel sucks at phase 4 such a disappointment from marvel like always, and gorr got disrespected and I didn't like his role in this movie.

title: Boring Love and Little Thunder
text: Neat visuals and a few chuckles aside, love and thunder is burdened by a boring story. Gorr is underutilized despite Bales performance and the comedy is extremely cheesy at times. The screaming goats....wow did that get old fast. Love and Thunder never takes itself seriously. Every scene is a setup for a punchline. A dramatic moment will play out and 5 seconds later que a joke. Because of this I couldn't take anything seriously and I found myself bored. Despite a visually striking fight scene in the shadow realm none of the action stood out. A disappointment.

title: So family friendly, Kids laughing when I saw this tonight...
text: OK very family friendly story for under 10-12's really most of the heavy adult stuff at the speed of the story won't be remembered until after 20th time watching with their friends and family. I mean 40 kids get power and fight monsters - and the comedy had kids laughing when I saw film tonight.Yes as an adult I could sense the ups and downs of the story, but so many times the details of what is happening or what will happen soon made for an amazing viewing.So many amazing tiny and huge details for comic readers from the 70 and 80's like me. Oh my goodness! Places in the film that will be paused and rewound are in the thousands... and the funny parts are for everyone.No nudity, swearing or sex/drugs. So only a few film students will pick tiny faults at this story...if you read Thor comics you'll love this movie!Hmm, I guess lastly is religion. IF you can't understand that this is a story, from comics, then probably not for you.

title: Marvel done Waititi style (again) - pumped with unadulterated fun & silly feel-good factor. Hammer time!
text: After the superb "Jojo Rabbit" terrific director / writer / co-star Taika Waititi smashes his second 'Thor' blockbuster: "Thor: Love & Thunder" which he pumps unadulterated fun into alongside Marvel's usual stellar cast (with too many A-List cameos to mention) & spectacular effects. Chris Hemsworth hams it up brilliantly as the loveably dumb titular warrior god who here must do battle with 'god butcher' Christian Bale, helped by the likes of Tessa Thompson, ex-gf Natalie Portman & a beast voiced by Waititi (but not by Russell Crowe (funny)). "Guardians Of The Galaxy Vol.2" is still the BEST Marvel flick, but this is up there, on silly feel-good factor alone. Hammer time!

title: Rubbish marvel turned into a joke
text: I don't mind comedy but this film tries too hard. Honestly watched it yesterday and just found it so stupid. It's like watching naked gun, very similar humour. What happened to some seriousness in a movie. You need to take a leaf out of GOTG they do it right.

title: The worst Phase 4 Marvel movie
text: Plot is really boring and annoying, sometimes cringes moment for little kids (2-5 yo). Just Bale saved the movie from thrash of year 2022.I really don't recommend spending money in cinema like me.

title: Don't Let The Haters Fool You.
text: Is it your typical marvel movie, not by a long shot so don't go in expecting it to be, its first and foremost a comedy but it includes some amazing dramatic moments as well as the intense action you would expect from a Thor movie. You may even question it at first, mostly due to the shock value of it not being what you would expect. Give it a chance. It's hilarious, it's experimental, it has in depth meaning and explores various facets of love and pain. I personally found it to be an amazing watch and highly recommended for anyone that can appreciate comedy and depth. IT IS NOT YOUR TYPICAL BLOCKBUSTER. But more so a work of art that stays true to the mythos. So please watch this movie and watch it for what it is and not what you expect it to be. So don't pay any mind to the haters, they probably went in expecting your typical non cerebral action flick and were given something to think about.

title: Assembly-line filmmaking at it again
text: A lot of people expected the fourth and supposedly final Thor movie to be a passing of the hammer, and I don't blame them for detecting a pattern within the latest Marvel Universe titles -- at least the ones that concern the original Avengers:So far, Steve Rogers has handed his shield over to Sam "The Falcon" Wilson, we've seen a new Black Widow in the form of Yelena, and I'm pretty sure we got a new, younger Hawkeye in the Hawkeye TV show (I'm not gonna watch that), which is to say nothing of She-Hulk. And yes, the trailers for Taika Waititi's Thor: Love and Thunder made it seem as if Thor Odinson (Chris Hemsworth), who now seems kind of a joke, was going to surrender MjÃ¶lnir to Jane Foster (Natalie Portman), his bland love interest from the first two movies. Why her? Because it was in the comics, shush.Hell, pretty much all of these changes mirror the comic books. Passing a superhero mantle from one character to the next -- sometimes of a different race or gender -- is one of the medium's oldest traditions, so I could certainly see why people expected us to get a "new" Thor with this film (because apparently, first names are now mantles to be passed forth once a magical hammer abruptly repairs itself).However, after the latest Doctor Strange movie ventured into the Multiverse and changed very little in the process (despite adding such supposed game-changers as America Chavez and other stuff that likely won't be mentioned outside of the Doctor Strange or Scarlet Witch properties), I was genuinely thinking that the trailers were showing us an alternate reality; one that will only feature in this flick as a throwaway adventure and then never be acknowledged again. I won't reveal whether Mighty Thor is a permanent mainstay, but will report that I'm nevertheless troubled by the general directionlessness of Phase Four. What's this all for? What's the next Endgame? And why is the plot point "Jane was snapped by Thanos and, due to a side effect of it, she now has cancer" not an Onion headline?As the film begins, Thor is out adventuring with the Guardians of the Galaxy but is forced to reunite with Foster, Korg (Waititi's character from Ragnarok), and other older friends when Gorr the God Butcher (Christian Bale, who gets the best scenes of the film) starts exacting revenge on all "gods". That is, of course, the aliens that inspired the gods and goddesses of Earth mythologies (now including the likes of Zeus, as portrayed by Russell Crowe, who has the power to flick away Original Thor's robes and give us a good look at that regained "god bod" of his). He's not going around slaughtering deities willy-nilly.But in terms of more truly god-like (omnipotent) figures, the film also follows in the footsteps of Eternals by bringing in some more of Marvel Comics' more "cosmic" characters, specifically Eternity, who is a personification of the entire Universe and the source of Gorr's power -- so there's a decent explanation for why he would become something so impressive as a "god" butcher. Whether Eternity is still at the mercy of the Time Variance Authority or an angry witch who can "destroy the Multiverse" is anyone's guess. Could Konshu and Moon Knight rearrange the stars that comprise him at their own leisure? Who knows? It's useless to think too hard about Phase Four media.We also reunite with Valkyrie (Tessa Thompson), who is the "king" of New Asgard while Thor is off with the Guardians. Much fuss has been made about the fact that the film calls a female ruler a king, to which more smart-alecky viewers will explain that Asgard is a made-up fantasy world and so it's not our place to question how the word "king" is used in their pretend space-Viking culture. Funny that "king" is apparently the only Anglic linguistic unit that's used differently whereas the rest of their language mirrors ours pretty straightforwardly, but whatever. Go off, kween. I mean, qing!Another notable "character", I guess, is MjÃ¶lnir itself -- which, like I said, makes a very sudden return and seems more interested in Jane than Thor. Its relationship with Thor supplies many supposed laughs. Is it an old ex? Old roommate? Estranged kid? Pet? Simple: It's whatever joke Waititi felt for at the time.Thor: Love and Thunder is very much another Marvel movie. Like many of the post-Phase Three additions, however, it does mostly allow the director to keep his voice. Waititi isn't as unrestrained as Rami was with Multiverse of Madness -- which strayed a little too far from the MCU mold for some fanboys -- but he's possibly even wackier here than with Ragnarok, and we're treated to some wild, interesting-looking worlds (particularly the nightmarish pocket realm of Gorr).The film has enough zaniness to go around and I do like Bale's "Come to Daddy"-inspired performance, but the VFX will often look incomplete, the dreaded Marvel comedy is worse than ever (capping many nice scenes with a cheeky wisecrack or silly character moment and so deflating them -- when it doesn't outright take older dramatic moments and treat them with all the dignity of a Seltzerberg parody), and some scenes are shot like some McDonald's tie-in commercial that managed to get the actors from the real movie involved. Much like fast food, however, you're not wrong for liking it; I'm not here to stop you. Having just seen the Tollywood epic RRR (which was both crazier and yet treated its characters with more dignity than this), my own patience with Hollywood is the lowest it's ever been, though I guess there's little to be done (even as the spread of RRR does re-ignite my faith).I just hope that you're watching this because you feel it genuinely enriches your incomprehensibly short time on this cosmic spec we so briefly inhabit -- the fact of which bolsters just how astronomically lucky you are to be alive to experience this age of art -- and not because you're too lazy and complacent to seek out whatever isn't Hollywood-approved product. And yes, that includes if you're watching it just for Buff Mommy Portman; I'm all for that.

title: Awesome and lighthearted. ðŸ‘
text: Chris and Natalie did have chemistry in this film. I did see them in the first film and The Dark World. Not RagnarÃ¶k. Christian Bale nailed the character of Gorr the God Butcher. title: Marvel Jumped the Shark
text: What have they done to Thor? Thor has been turned into nothing more than a character that only provides comic relief. He did this throughout the entire film. title: If you enjoyed RagnarÃ¶k you'll enjoy this one
text: One thing that shocked me about this movie was the pacing for it. This movie is on the shorter side when you compare it to the other Marvel movies and in my opinion, it works to a certain extent. The pacing goes at just the right speed throughout the entire movie, except at a few spots where the movie does come to a halt, and makes sure to keep the audience entertained from start to finish.Even if the pacing for this movie wasn't the greatest, the story for this movie is still interesting enough to hook you along for this wild ride. From the very opening scene to the last I was hooked wanting to know more and see what happens next. I will say though the story for this movie does feel like it tried to take on too much for this story. Like I said the pacing works to a certain extent and I feel like if this movie was just a tad bit longer some things could've been explored more. With that being said, with the two main story points in this movie, the movie does a good enough job of exploring those points and keeping the audience invested.This can also be attested to the actor's work in this movie which was marvellous. Whether an actor in this movie had five minutes of screen time to being a main character everybody was bringing their everything to this movie. Due to this, the audience grows to care for these characters and wants to see them succeed. The standout performances in this movie for me were Christian Bale and Natalie Portman, who plays Dr. Jane Foster/The Mighty Thor. Christian Bale originally didn't want to play Gorr and I'm so thankful his kids talked him into it because I can't imagine anybody else playing this role. He was able to switch between so many different emotions that made the audience both scared and sympathetic towards this character. The same can be said for Natalie Portman's performance in this movie where she shows how much of a badass Jane Foster is as both a regular human and as the mighty Thor. I do wish though that some characters got some more screen time such as King Valkyrie, played by Tessa Thompson.One thing that Marvel movies are really known for is their hit-or-miss special effects, especially their CGI, and the special effects in this movie definitely were a hit. Sometimes the special effects can start out either way and then slowly get worse or better but here they remain the same throughout the movie. I especially loved the CGI on the screaming goats who stole the movie.The special effects in this movie really do help out with the cinematography which also was great. The cinematography for this movie was gorgeous and helped the audience visually understand where exactly they are by helping create these grand worlds.Now, I know it's become a common thing to hate on the comedy in Marvel movies and I will admit that the comedy in this movie might not work for most, especially this one recurring joke, but for me, it worked. I really enjoyed the comedy in this movie as it still didn't overpower some of the more serious moments and would come at the right time. It also helps that this movie wasn't afraid to actually have serious moments in this movie and let them be just that serious moments.The final thing I want to mention is the soundtrack for this movie and how much of a banger it is. From the musical score, composed by Michael Giacchino and Nami Melumad, to the songs they added into the background everything worked for this movie. Please Marvel do more soundtracks with retro music.In the end, Thor: Love and Thunder isn't going to work for some but if you enjoyed Ragnarok you'll probably enjoy this one as well.

title: D- on D+
text: I couldn't finish it. I liked the opening but Waititi's "humorous" retelling of Thor's saga was unpalatable. Thor's companion's were very important in my era of reading the comic books and I was dismayed at their unmourned dispatch by the MEU. Mocking them as Waititi did in this movie was really maddening. That was followed by a flat, dull, and corny "action" scene with the Guardians and I was done. Waititi shouldn't be behind the camera, in front of it, or in the writer's room...apparently I need to fill this out a bit so I'll just point out that also in my era Marvel retold the Volsung Saga (Wagner's Ring Trilogy) with Thor as Siegfried. It was excellent. I wish they had gone there instead of going with the god slayer story line.

title: What is wrong with marvel
text: Why did they add Natalie! She is unnecessary in the movie , i didn't expect to waste character of a Thor in a script like this . Just read comics and save a trouble.

title: A really fun movie with lots of emotions
text: Great cast, Hemsworth knocks it out of the park once again with his performance. Taika Watiti remains one of my favourite directors at this moment time. Christian Bale is terrifying as the villain here and gives one of my favourite performances in the MCU and brings one of the best villains. I'm just not quite sure where else this Thor character can go now. Feels like a conclusion for his character.Overall I'm going to give Thor Love & Thunder a 9/10.

title: What is Taika Waititi doing?
text:
He's done some wonderful films, but this is trite empty rubbish. I think
Taika Waititi has become a parody of himself.Partially rescued by some charismatic actors (Natalie Portman I don't include you in that list) and what he's done to Thor is completely unnecessary. It was always great to see some humour, and to see Thor's portentousness undermined and put in its place, but now Thor is a complete figure of fun.Needs a change of Director or that's the end of this series for me, and as for Taika Waititi, he needs to go work somewhere less glitzy with smaller budgets on niche films.A major disappointment.

title: Ignore the haters
text: Not every Marvel movie has to be so serious people. Grow up. The whole audience was laughing and having a good time. It's not a Greek tragedy it's a movie based on comic books. You are the same people who have never watched anything more serious than a Sonic movie. Rant over and make sure you stay home on your high horse when the next Marvel movie comes out.

title: Cringeworthy and embarrassing
text: Disney execs got together and whipped up a strategy to destroy yet another fan-favorite. Any rating over 2 is a bot or paid. Unwatchable at times, Love and Thunder is more of a spoof on all super-hero movies. In its defense, there were parts when there was hope that a real movie would begin only to fall so hard on its virtue-signaling, woke face that even Nancy Pelosi would roll her eyes. Disney has officially ruined Thor at such a low level that there really can be no recovering (kids can become Thor now?....wtf). On the bright side, I'll never have anxiety while waiting for any new Marvel installments because, at this point, the few that are left are in line for the chopping block. RIP Thor.
