text: I was going to see this movie with low expectations since the last one was a meh movie, but this forced train wreck comedy is the lowest point in disrespect for the brand.The director needs to be punished for this, it's like a monkey wrote this garbage, Marvel is going down the hill with the standard.

title: The girliest movie evah!
text: Since Marvel can't make their female characters work with audiences, the next best thing it seems is to make their male heroes into stereotypical females from the 1950's.After taking the protagonism off from under the feet of Doctor Strange and Shang-Chi in their respective movies, next in line was Thor.They try Jane Foster's 'Mighty Thor' for size as the genuine hero, but it's Odinson that ends up being a new and revised 'male' protagonist. Here, he has been transformed into a subjugated and dumb bimbo that would make anyone, not just feminists, cringe if it were played by an actress instead of Chris Hemsworth.Thor Odinson spends the movie indecisive, dumb, pining for the love of the one that got away, being constantly saved by a more powerful character of the opposite sex, is overcome by really strong maternal instincts... and even likes dressing up! He has more costume changes than Lady Gaga at a half-time sports event.Marvel, I'm out!

title: Wow the things we Believe in this world!
text: I came to see Thor Love and Thunder to be entertained. I left feeling I have wasted 43 years of my life serving and Believing in God. This movie opened my eyes to the realization that there is no real God and definitely waiting to goto Heaven is a waste of time. Thanks Thor. I owe you. Gonna live my life to the fullest walk in my own path for now on!

title: No Straight-Man
text: No that's not a sexual commentary. I mean to say, everyone was funny and that's why it didn't work.Barry Sonnenfeld wrote in his book that he believes the reason he Wild Wild West was such a failure was because Kevin Kline refused to play his character straight, he kept trying to be to funny one when Will Smith's character was written to have all of the jokes. For contrast when he moved on to Men in Black, Will Smith's comedic role against Tommy Lee Jones' deadpan straight-man was a smash hit.In this movie you had 2 obvious characters who should have been the straight-man: Jane Foster and Gor. Instead Waititi had them doing schtick and trying to deliver funny lines. He couldn't resist the urge to wedge his juvenile sense of humor into EVERY POSSIBLE CORNER of this movie.And Jesus Christ I hate Guns 'n Roses, who's terrible idea was that?

title: I GET why it has so many bad reviews.
text: Well... the movie is different, that's for sure!A little ...too funny for a superhero movie, a little too dark for a comedy (which it is for the 2/3 of the movie) but all things considered, at the end, everything makes sense, the balance between comedy, action and drama is almost perfect and you get an A+ experience.One of the prominent things in the movie is of course the atheistic theme. So, I GET why the negative reviews from some people that got that vibe and didn't liked it.I for myself find it just GREAT that such a super-mainstream movie dared to "touch" sensible themes and offer them for an after-movie discussion.In general the movie succeed to offer fun, drama, action and discussion beyond, which is much more than you expect from a "plain" superhero movie with gods ðŸ˜‰

title: Boring CGI trash
text: Sorry to say this, but as a viewer who did not see Thor movies before and who is not familiar with all the Marvel Characters and their history, this movie was a CGI overkill and I fell asleep about 5 times during the movie.From the beginning to the end this movie failed to.create any interest in me for their characters and their actions. I suppose there was a lot of irony in it. Some I got and some of it not. The "humor" is on a very cheap level. The entire movie seemed to be created in a Computer. I wonder if the actors ever left the green screen studio for only one time during the work. And finally I can not tell what was the movie all about. Probably because falling asleep several times.BTW: I am not a Marvel hater. Not at all. I saw Black Panther already 7 times. This was a movie that thrilled from the beginning to the end.

title: A comedy that tries too hard
text: I really wanted to like this movie. I really did.It had parts that were interesting but just over loaded with unnecessary jokes. I thought the 3rd Thor had a perfect back and forth of Jokes/Story/Character Development. This movie did not.

title: Thor Love and Thunder Review
text: I loved all the plot, and all the actors. This movie was definitely overhated and needed more slack. The film well potrayed all the characters, however I didn't like the arrogant narccasistic characteristics potrayed by Zeus. I loved Russel Crowe and Christian Bale, appearing in the MCU, and the reprising cameos with Matt Damon and Liam Hemsworth. I loved to see another MCU hero worthy to weild Jonathan, and once again Taiki Watiki was yet to dissapoint. I feel like the Guardians of the Galaxy could have spent a bit more time on screen, and would have made sense for them to help in the fight when they asked the gods for help. Overall the film was good.

title: Thor: Don't Bother.
text: This film doesn't deserve more than the few words I have to say about it.The 2 stars are for Christian bale who was the only redeeming thing about this film, and it was a waste of Christian Bale and a good baddie.What ruined this film? Well it might have been that they had to make everything a joke. For the majority of it, you can barely get through 10 seconds without there being a joke. It just means you lose the good jokes because you were fed up of hearing the bad ones every second.The storyline could have been so good. It was a waste of the Thor and Jane Foster timeline, and like I said, a waste of Christian Bale and a good baddie storyline.It just annoyed me because it could have been so good. No, instead we got screaming goats and Russell Cross putting on an accent.

title: Great visuals but mediocre soundtrack
text: Couldn't pick up any form of theme. I loved Thor Ragnarok theme, but no memorable theme for Love and Thunder. There was some bad languages that were unnecessary and out of place.

title: Too much Goofy dialogues, very disappointed by Marvel
text: The entire movie Thor is just joking around and being silly, I mean in every dialogue which was complete unnecessary. Thor is meant to be taken seriously, not like a goofball. The Ragnarok had the perfect balance of comedy and seriousness, but this one was a utter crap.As a result, I couldn't take Christian Bale's character seriously. I was so excited for Natalie Portman to return but the script writing for her was terrible, and suddenly after being mighty Thor she can breathe openly in space travel? Really?Human screaming goats, Really? What was the point of Guardians? And Wasting Sam Neil and Matt Damon was completely unnecessary. And finally Russell Crowe's character as a goofball Zeus?I honestly think it would've been better off this movie not being made. It was torture to see our beloved Marvel character being destroyed. Wake up Marvel, either pull the plug on Thor or stop with this much goofiness. It was atrocious!

title: Marvel Jumps the Shark.
text: "Thor Love and Thunder" should be called "Thor: Marvel Jumps the Shark. Again."In the mad rush to appease politics the good writing takes a back seat. They want to say they've embraced a gay theme -but are able to remove it for a Chinese movie market that doesn't accept these views. So really- Marvel has not embraced gay culture. It's window dressing.The writing has become slapstick and unbearable. As if 70's sitcom writers were employed.Marvel has spiralled for years, riding its own glean instead of improving. Instead of digging more from their characters. So now we have this mess. Even before Endgame - which was a mess too-- Marvel had used up character arcs.Phase 5 will bring more of this mess. Hoping it can get a pass from viewers who are passionate for a brand name rather than a thoughtful future.

title: Taika delivers again!!!!!
text: My review of Thor love and thunder: (spoiler free)Director Taika Waititi delivers again with a Thor movie that can be appreciated on multiple levels. The 4th Thor movie is centered around Love and death . Taika takes us on a journey beginning with how cruel it may seem when love and death can be intertwined. Throughout the movie we are shown that these concepts may seem cruel, but interwoven, they create a beautiful tapestry that isn't defined by time. Of course with such a serious undertone, the story needed something to contrast it with. Taika used the same comedic formula he used in Thor Ragnarok which I absolutely love. The comedy with the cruel/serious undertone blended really well. During all of this we still learn more about the Marvel Universe, more characters are introduced as well as locations we haven't been to before. The cast did an awesome job in their performances. Christian Bale did well with his character as many people predicted he would. In my opinion only of course, I don't think a such a high profile actor was necessary based on the amount of on screen time and actual dialogue for that character.Overall I thought the movie was amazing. I would give it 4.5/5 Stars. The only thing I would recommend is changing the comic relief. I love Gorg and Miek and I know Taika loves being in his own movies. If he wants to keep using that style of comedic relief, I recommend bringing in someone like Awkwafina and maybe taking a backseat in that roll.Would love to write more but I'm tired...

title: Sadly a bad and forgettable movie
text: Taika Waititi's Thor Ragnarok is one of the best MCU films, but this successor should never has been released in that state. It is bad in all departments, be it love story, drama, distress, action or special effects. One of the main reasons is the fact, that there is zero chemistry between Chris Hemsworth and Natalie Portman. There is chemistry between Tessa Thompson and both of them alone, but we are not talking about a Jane Foster-Valkyrie love story. So basically the "Love" foundation of the movie doesn't work at all.Also the humor is also terribly childish. Thor Ragnarak had some smart humor, but here it is just bad and comes with a sledgehammer.Thor Ragnarok paid tribute to Jack Kirbys art and the comic history. But Love and Thunder made Zeus to a B-Movie character joke. And what about the visual department? Zeus thunderbolt weapon was atrocious. How could they release it without working on some special effects here? It just looks like a cheap wooden mockup.And the fighting scenes. Yes, the fight on the rainbow bridge in Thor Ragnarok with Led Zeppelin music starting to play is one of the best fighting scenes in the whole MCU universe. Close to the Captain America elevator fight. But here they just reuse the "jumping" act of Thor over and over again. Just plain boring.Overall, sadly I can not find any aspect of this movie that may rectify a rewatch. It is just a bad forgettable movie.

title: Worst of marvel
text: For a moment there I thought I was watching a parody of a Thor.More serious tone was required, It's high time Marvel understands that not everything is comedy in life. If we want to watch comedy we could sit at our home and watch some sitcom.Biggest problem of Marvel's phase 4 is all there main characters movies but the main character was completely sideline by other characters.I hope marvel makes some good changes in phase 5. Otherwise it will go down pretty badly in future but I genuinely think it will be hard to top Avengers infinity war as a movie.I don't know how taika waititi got this wrong.

title: year 6 essay
text:
What a disappointment
My 11 year old can write a better essay then this script with it's poor jokes bad lines and terrible comedy.Director/Writer Taika Waititi destroys Thor: Love and Thunder just like he did with Thor: Ragnarok but worse
Such a disappointment to see such a good character stripped of dignity and reduce to this new crazy world of lesser people
The Actors do a brilliant job with the Childish Script they where given but there should have been more input this could have been good if it was for the writers ability to write
final conclusion what a waste of time non-entertaining for Thor Fans whom like action manly content.

title: Dont read the reviews.
text: There are obviously no high expections from this movie because of the rating and also because there wasn't any good movie coming from Marvel since Infinity War. However this one is good. Why? Because the movie went so fast you dont even notice it. No, the jokes are not too much, the plot is not boring and the performances are good. Just go see the movie. 10 because of the so many bad reviews.

title: Very disappointing
text:
I'm a huge fan of marvel and Thor but this movie was the most disappointing movie I have seen in the 10 years I do not recommend using money on it
It just doesn't make any sense.

title: Blockbuster!
text: This is what a summer movie is! So fun, so visually spectacular. I came here with expectations and all were met. I'm not a Marvel or DC fan I'm a fan of superheroes in general. I love this movie. Watched it twice!

title: Fell asleep
text: First scene was the highlight of the movie, after that headache inducing toilet humour. Thankfully I nodded off before I was left with a full blown migraine.

title: Loved it! Aus/NZ humour is the best
text: Best marvel movie I have seen in a long time! The humour has the best aussie/kiwi spin and we laughed the whole way through! The beginning scene with Thor doing the splits between the two ships had me literally crying, and Russell Crowes character was hilarious as well. As my partner put it, Chris Hemsworth was 'put on this earth to play Thor.' Such a refreshing Marvel movie with less BS doom and gloom and so much fun!Couldn't get through 5 minutes of the new Dr Strange movie, I have no idea why it is rated more highly than this! I think the Aus/NZ spin will see it be a huge hit over here, maybe not so in America.

title: The worst from Marvel
text: A thunderous display of completely unnecessary stupidity. Not worth spending money on this one. Marvel could have skipped this episode and left it in the head of the writers.

title: Fun to watch
text: After a stinky sequence of mostly forgettable and at least one outright bad movie, the post-pandemic MCU gets charged up again with Vikings in Space. It's not the genius romp that Ragnarok is, but Thor, his goats, and his allies (including a PC UN of "Asgardian" children) hit their comic marks, the CGI monsters writhe and wriggle, and two controversial but also accomplished actors bring both a major and a minor villain to wicked life. There's a whole slew of love triangles and odd couplings playing atop a rock-and-roll score and aesthetic, too.

title: A movie to miss.
text: Another boating WOKE Disney movie. This is why Disney should never have bought Marvel. They turned Thor into an idiot to make the women seem smarter. Slow uninspired script.

title: Excellent film if you are looking for wacky and not Ragnarok.
text: Great movie from start to finish. If you are astute and realize that right after the opening scene Korg says gather round and let me tell you a story, you realize that this is a story which is remembered and not taking place in the moment. Thus there are embellishments and silly moments which I thought were fantastic. If you're into goofy and campy this is the superhero film for you. If you want another Ragnarok then look elsewhere. I feel this movie and the second suicide squad are two of the campiest and "not to take seriously" superhero films ever made and they are so entertaining because of that. Take a break from the serious films to giggle like a kid at the silly ones. Especially when the silly ones are incredibly well done.

title: I agree
text: Totally agree with all the 1, 2, and 3 stars reviews. I really enjoyed all the previous Thor movies... this one was, well lets just say, LAME.I gave it a good 40 minutes before i walked out. Told my husband I'd go cruise around the art & crafts supply store next door instead. I was thinking to myself, "I must be a stick in the mud" however i realized when walking out the majority of the viewers were teenaged boys and young men so maybe not! I didn't "get" the comedy one bit. Ya... it was lame.

title: WHY 9/10 ?
text: Well, I liked it, I liked it maybe too much. I understand the flaws, the mistakes, the stupid jokes, but it wasn't definitely a boring movie. Maybe there were too many jokes but this didn't make the sad parts ridiculous.

title: Not funny...actually pretty bad
text: In agreement with some other comments: The movie tries to be funny, but its not. To write a funny script takes a lot of skills, something thats been badly missing in the last couple years. Studios and writers have lost their mojo and their sense of humour. Most likely because everyone is afraid of getting in trouble, but thats what good commedy is..you get in trouble and laugh about it.Guardians of the Galaxy actually made a pretty good job of it.Lets face it: Love the actors, but the movie is terrible. Marvel is slowly but surely going down the toilet. At least they used to be entertaining...now they are just bad B movies with oversized production budgets and idot writers, controlled by scared idiot studios.

title: I went to a DC movie and got 3 bad jokes instead.
text: What an extraordinary waste of 250 million dollars. What an extremely huge waste of talent both behind and in front of the camera.Why did Russell Crowe get out of bed that day.They need to put Thor down before it ruins careers.Hopefully, Chris will move onto a whole new franchise or at least far superior movies.I can't help feeling that it was produced and directed by the same crew involved in the Sportsbet ads. And had the same matey feel to it. And the same tired jokes that Paul Hogan avoided 40 years ago.DC and Disney should have certain standards that have to be met before foisting tripe on an unsuspecting fans.

title: I loved it
text: People can be mad about this movie and I'd understand, few plot holes here and there, but I'd ask that people respect it was enjoyable too.The producers and directors may not have given you want you wanted, but they overwhelmed us with emotion. There were moments I was crying and laughing at the same time. The travesty of lose with the upbeat spark of hope. Repeated over and over again. It was marvel has always strived on, this was just a more goofy portrayal.It lacked some sustenance in character development sure, but they needed to invoke those intense emotions in less than two hours. That feels like the problem with every marvel movie, you just wish there was more- more time, more to the story, etc. I also feel like marvel is trying to insight some enjoyment after all the gloom and doom of end game. I'm still hurting from losing Tony.If you are looking for a movie filled with action, adventure, love, laughs, and a jealous StormBreaker, then this is it. It wasn't perfect, but I found joy in the chaos and will definitely be watching it again.

title: Disappointed in this movie and it's director
text: Thor: Ragnarok was almost the best movie in the whole Marvel series, but this time it's a huge disappointment. It's a cheesy parody without any weight to what's happening, and it's not even funny. Disappointed in the movie itself and it's director, who looks like can only direct a decent movie, if there are skillful writers behind the script. What the heck did they think?

title: No
text: This movie was just not it. And for the most part it came down to the story and the characters. The story was boring and not engagin and was not that into the romance either. This movie is defently a step down from ragnarÃ¶k in my opinion.The humour was probaly the best part but even that some times fell a part.A best way to describe it is that after the batman movie the whole cinema aplaude but after this movie no feelings were shared but disopointment.

title: Great Gillian but not a great film
text: Great villain, but poor film, unfunny goofy montages. Thor is just a joke now and now the all powerful God you tuned in to see.It's a well made film which is easy when you have 200million to throw at a Marvel movie these days, but a well made bad movie is still a bad movie.It's another background MCU film you can put on while concentrating on doing something else, but then again during Phase 4 what Marvel film hasn't?Not even excited for a team up or overarching story anymore...no direction...everyone thought at first it would be Secret Wars but now I lost all interest.Multiverse of Madness was bad, Spiderman was alright, can't remember any of the others it's that bleak in the MCU these days, same as Star Wars. Background bloat content now, no exiting plan or story we can watch unfold ready for a team up. No ultimate villain like Thanos, nothing...empty like the movie direction...

title: really enjoyed
text: If you liked thor raganork, then you will love this. Bale in this movie is incredible and it's a really fun movie to watch. You don't need to have much previous knowledge of the MCU to jump in and enjoy.

title: No more Mavel movies for me
text: I was a huge marvel fan, but it seems that every new Marvel movie is just worse than the last one.A potentially great idea that is ruined by bad jokes, woke culture, and unconsistent, rushed story line.Maybe some people find it still enjoyable, but as for me and everybody I know, the great Marvel era has come to an end.

title: Fun - don't take this movie seriously it's Thor
text: It's pretty in line with Ragnarok Thor - I enjoyed it. Yes there were cringe jokes, yes it was EXTREMELY random (like Monty Python high on THC listening to 80s rock Random)....but it was fun and sweet. Christian Bale was so creepy (like don't bring tiny kiddos level of scary ) but I loved him as the villain. Some of the heavy splaining backstory scenes recapping the Jane storyline were a little tedious but I understood why they did it (Thor 1 came out years ago, but w/ the recaps you didn't "have" to see it to follow the plot). The ending was super sweet and was fitting. ... And goats ðŸðŸðŸ˜‚ (note I was not a fan of the 2nd Dr Strange movie...but the new Thor would be worth a rewatch w/ friends to get a reaction ðŸ˜‚).

title: Car crash of a movie
text: I'd like to say this is the 'Airplane' version of the Avengers series, but that would be unkind to Airplane, even the sequel. The humour is forced and unnatural. An absolute car crash of a movie. Wait till it's free on terrestrial TV.

title: So Bad...
text: I honestly don't understand all the hype for Marvel movies and fully agreed with everything Martin Scorsese said. Hell, he was way too lenient with his opinion. These movies are all extremely predictable, mainly made of cgi, and contain the simplest of dialogues. Yet, they are always so hyped up in media and have mass grown-up followings. How? What am I missing?This movie in particular was worse than your average Disney film for children in terms of simplicity. As if it was written by a 12-year old kid, meant for an audience of up to 10. And why are these films sooo long? Make it 90 minutes, more than enough. This was such a waste of my time. Forced comedy, overused, cgi-filled fight scenes, a toiletpaper script, and a story that had so many plotholes and made no sense whatsoever. I will never understand how grown up people are treating Marvel films as cinematic gems. They CAN be entertaining but nothing more than that.

title: Thor totally fÃ¼xx
text:
Pretty early on, about 20-30 minutes or so into this second Taika Waititi Thor film I realized the significance of what I was seeingThis is not your typical Marvel film, nor is it intended to be. This is Thor for adult MCU fans, or even middle-aged ones. It's themes are heavier, it lightly lampoons cliches while pressing heavily into its ongoing narrative, and it's fun without being an out-and-out romp- there's actual dramaThis is a fun movie, there's a lot to love, to chew on, and there are actual stakes. The performances are great, and if they weren't, the side plots and auxiliary characters wouldn't be as compelling.The only character that is somewhat less compelling by design is Korg, who is simple comic relief serving as Thor's literally brainless sidekick, the Watson to his idiotic Sherlock HolmesThis film is special to the MCU for a number of reasons, but one of the more significant ones is Jane Foster's battle with Cancer, which is handled carefully and respectfully- her story is fascinating and might have succeeded more without its title character throttling the spotlight with his chiseled, handsome physique and charmGorr was a powerful and frightening villain, despite not fully receiving the development and screen-time he deserved, and Christian Bale's performance was incredibleI love rating the MCU, and in the wake of the amazing Doctor Strange In The Multiverse of Madness, I would say this rates close to the topFavorite line, "They mate for life... in packs of six."My off the cuff list:Doctor Strange In the Multiverse of Madness
Thor Ragnarok
Thor Love and Thunder
Thor Dark World
Avengers
Avengers Age of Ultron
Guardians of the Galaxy
Guardians of the Galaxy II
Spider-man Far From Home
Doctor Strange
The Eternals
Captain America Winter Soldier
Captain America
Ironman
Spider-man Homecoming
Ironman 2
Ironman 3
Thor
Captain Marvel
The Incredible Hulk
Avengers Infinity War
Avengers Endgame
Black Widow
Captain America Civil War
Spider-man No Way Home.

title: A mocking parody
text:
The jokes wearing thin. Too many gags, cartoonish characterisations and dull one liners.Could have been such a great story if taken even 30 percent more seriously. The director
clearly sticks to his comfort zone of comedy, anything outside that looks like its mocking the
material. Poor Christian Bale, he gives a great performance in an otherwise tacky comedy.

title: It's not as bad as some people say
text: I was going into this movie thinking that I wouldn't enjoy it due to a lot of the other reviews I was seeing online. But I actually enjoyed it. However I do have one major complaint being that the plot was a bit too simple. In my opinion though, this is the second best Thor film behind Ragnarok.

title: Comatose
text: An empty, with special effects overloaded dose of - nothing. I just can imagine that the paychecks are enough compensation for the actors to be involved in such a point- and artless mess. The whole movie looks like all involved (writers, director, actors, production crew) worked on auto-pilot and half-asleep. Terrible empty, this is and with every movie it just gets worse.

title: What were they thinking ?
text: Just watched this sorry excuse for a movie, and can only think the actors only did this for the paycheck, and not for the script. Did they even bother to read it?It seems that Disney has completely lost the plot, and are employing anybody to write/direct/produce a movie that will appease the "Woke" minority at the expense of the genuine Marvel fans. This is a total piece of excrement that is neither funny or exciting and is just plain stupid. I thought that they couldn't stoop even lower than "Eternals" but wow - This is even worse !!

title: Another Marvel indoctrination movie
text: I miss the time when Marvel made movies to entertain us instead to indoctrinate us with diversity ideology. At the London premiere Q&A, in response to the question "How gay will the film be?" the director said "super gay". This gives you an idea what the priorities of these people are. Same as in Doctor Strange 2.Also this movie is way too goofy, Gods are portrayed as jokes here. I love Natalie Portman and Christian Bale, but I hate this director/writer, he doesn't understand the material and simply lacks the talent.

title: Sit back, relax, and enjoy this film.
text: Went to see this movie with no expectations... and enjoyed the humor, Chris Hemsworth's performance, and the sometimes absurd but fun and engaging storyline. Hemsworth goes through an amazing body transformation for this film, as in the other Thor films, and thoroughly embodies and enlivens this character.

title: Disney destorys another franchise.
text: Disney, you took a beloved Marvel franchise and made a mockery and joke out of it, same with Star Wars. It went from serious movies with consequences, to clowns jumping around aimleslly with clown bad guys, bad actors, and bad CGI.How do you take a brilliant universe with hundreds of films and destroy it. Sell it to Disney.

title: Worst MCU movie to date
text: This movie turned Thor into a pathetic joke! Dark World was better. Christian Bale was the only good thing about it. It was idiotic gag after idiotic gag.

title: Gleeful undemanding idiocy
text: First of all: ADJUST YOUR EXPECTATIONS. If you really want deep, thought provoking tales I suggest you look away from the MCU in general (check out The Boys lol).If you go into this movie expecting to laugh and have a good time, then this movie delivers. The jokes are insanely childish at some points, but the experience of watching in a theatre and the audience laughter make up for it. The story is frustratingly unoriginal at best - we've seen something similar from nearly EVERY Marvel movie. However, if you just want a good time and some cheap laughs, this movie delivers.

title: All expectations are washed away now
text: It wouldn't be wrong to say that this movie basically focused on comedy. Hard to find what taika waititi was thinking. Ragnarok was slightly better than this. The only thing that was worth watching was Gorr the god butcher scenes. Other parts had unnecessary comedy which at some points wasn't even funny at all.

title: Bravo! Hilarious from start to finish!
text: A great breakaway from the recent cookie cutter Marvel movies. Went with the entire family, including my 75 year old parents and my husband and teenagers, who are hard core Marvel fans. We all loved every minute of it. If you are looking for the typical intricate , intertwined Marvel storyline, this movie isn't for you. But if you want to be highly entertained by characters you love, you will enjoy every minute of it.

title: Not even entertaining
text: I just have one question: Why does everything have to be a joke ? Like literally 98 % of the scenes include a joke. And awful acting so yeah, this one is baaaad.

title: An overplayed hand only wins so many times
text: This is now a tired franchise with this latest instalment being the smoking gun that reveals Taika Waititi as a terrible director.Thor needs to cease production and Marvel needs a complete reboot.Don't waste your time watching this.

title: Much better than people are giving it credit for
text: This is exactly what was promised. It is silly, filled with action, laughs, and heart, and most of all a great launch pad for the future of the MCU. Thor is an adolescent when the movie begins and grows up through heartbreak and tribulation, plus lessons on how to be a better God of thunder. Gorr might not be the same God butcher as the comics, but he is masterfully demented in his drive to achieve his end.Stop being gatekeepers of what a comic book movie should be...remember Luke Cage and Thor had a dance competition (complete with a Dirty Dancing lift) the comic books. Comics and comic movies don't need to be DC-level dark to be good. I think Thor: The Dark World proved that dark story lines don't work in Marvel films very well. RDJ played Tony Stark as a stand up comedian in a robot suit and no one batted an eyelash. Chris Hemsworth is showing himself to be an extremely capable comedic action star and we should be happy to watch him and his Co stars have an blast making us entertained.

title: Christian bales great performance wasted in a joke of a film
text: Man i waste my time on a stupid joke of a Film. Waste my money. Its like the Thor Episode in waht if. Please Marvel stop it. Thor 3 was so good. But These was horrible bad. Das.

title: God that was awful.
text: What an absolute waste of characters and actors. The story was, well whatever. The humour fell flat and I mean FLAT , it was what you'd expect from a 12 year old (no offence to 12 yr olds) there was literally groaning from the audience. Every character except maybe Portman's was horrendous. The God Butcher was about as worrisome as a stone in your shoe, an incredible waste of Bale. Crowe and that whole scenario was simply pathetic , what they did to Sif was a slap in the face, Portman did a decent job.That's me done with Marvel/Disney now. I haven't watched anything they produced since Endgame and I wanted to see this as it's basically closes Thor's arc. Seen and done, Marvel/Disney won't get another penny of my hard earned cash.

title: A disappointment
text: Was expecting so much more, but it left like an expensive snl skit on Thor. I don't understand how they let this happen. Thor is a bumbling idiot, the jokes never stop, and the goats remind me of Jar Jar Binks. I honestly would pick him over that incessant scream. The only characters who came out of this unscathed were Tessa Thompson and Christian Bale.

title: childish, hollycrap
text: This is another hollycrap-ic time-waster with loads of VFX that could admire kids a lot with sorts of plots that easily covers the kids but for adults, it is just a piece of crap and nothing else.Your money, time & energy could be saved if you would save yourself from watching this piece.One thing to note is that I read the cast only after finished watching the movie and I realised that it was Christian Bale in the villain role and yeah that's the only role you probably might like watching in this whole film, the hero, the Thor has become boring.I'm wondering how come the makers don't even review before letting these kinda films out for the public to have, let alone the public, don't they have the responsibility of seeing how their invested resources have turned into, this is one of Marvel's poorly made.

title: Good Movie
text: The movie is entertaining, funny, and somewhat of a RomCom. I can guarantee that you will laugh at least once. The humor can occasionally be bland and Thor is turned into more of a comedic relief than previous movies. If you enjoyed Thor: Ragnarok, then you will enjoy the movie. If you don't, then you most likely won't like it. Overall, I give Thor: Love & Thunder a 8.5/10.

title: How Could They Ruin Thor?
text: I never thought it possible, but this is the worst MCU film that I've ever seen. A cast of mostly A-list actors can't even save this pathetic script. In the real MCU, we at least have drama. We get the feeling that the characters might, at times, be in danger - even if they are simply comic superheros. This film, however, is so silly, weak and Disney-esque that it's impossible to suspend disbelief for a second. With the cheap-looking sets and poor CGI, it actually looks like a cartoon at times.Plus, who thought it was a good idea to give a character Stage 4 cancer? Really? That's the reality you decided to inject into a comic universe? It was horrific.I gave it two stars for the actors. Russell Crowe went out on a limb even if his character, as written, was ridiculous. Christian Bale is always good, but he was so filled with pathos that it felt like he was making a different film. Chris Hemsworth is a great Thor. I never thought we could see too much of him. This time we, quite literally, do. When you have a character who's that hot, we really don't need to see his butt.It seems that the creators, those who really know the MCU, just put their names on it without giving it their vision.

title: Forgettable and underwhelming
text: My wife and I walked out of the cinema feeling totally dissatisfied with the movie. It was weird. Wasn't funny at all (but they tried) and absolutely 0 action scenes. Was a fan of the previous thor movies, but this was probably the worst of all the marvel movies.

title: Critics are too harsh. This movie was loads of fun!
text: Maybe I'm not terribly sophisticated as a moviegoer, but I just had a really good time with this movie. Christian Bale is tremendous, and has a little bit of Heath Ledger's Joker going on, which is just perfect in obvious ways. He really steals this movie, but that doesn't warrant an indictment on the rest of the cast who are also tremendously skilled and wonderful. Come in looking for a fun follow-up to Ragnarok and Endgame and you'll find it!

title: Waiti ne kari tatti!
text: Horrible from start to finish. Post credits also worthless. Just marketing and hype. Marvel has fallen beyond imagination. Dissatisfied and disappointed.

title: Silly entertainment, bring it on!
text: Lets suspend pretension and pontification and just enjoy the ride!Superheroes are unrealistic and outlandish and tap into our willingness to suspend disbelief to be able to enjoy their stories anyway. Don't take it too seriously and you might have some fun! Or is because I'm Australian that i enjoy this humour without reservation?

title: A total disaster
text: It's awful. I kinda enjoyed the first 15 minutes, because it does not take itself seriously and is a bit meta, but then it lost me, I got bored and I didn't care. It also looks cheap. Poorly written and poorly directed. Basically this movie is a boring mess. Very disappointing.

title: Terrible
text: I felt compelled to create an account to warn people how bad this movie is. Huge fan of Marvel movies but this was actually hard to watch, very nearly walked out. Tried way too hard to make it funny, did not find a balance at all compared with other MCU movies. Storyline was all over the place and was pretty silly in parts too, if I could give 0 stars I would. Complete garbage. Expected so much more from Marvel.

title: Too much comedy
text: This movie is very good, it is the second best Thor movie, but the problem with it is that there is too much comedy, even while fight scenes, the heroes are making jokes. If not, the movie is entertaining and fun to watch.

title: At a low bar!!
text: This film had potential to create pain and also to decorate new asgardian future.... Overall film story is really average.. Gor character shade is mindblowing but portrait of that character in scenes and suddenly loosing remove sensitiveness of that character.. Also it had strong motive but execution is poor... Overall film feel like a childish and empty at a time.. Post credits also not offer too much... Film hype is too uncertain.. Character arcs also boaring and action scenes are ok ok... Comical wise film is good but at a point it deliver cringiness too!! Overall film is really so below average and gor the god butcher wasted and marvel future feel in danger due to females!! Lovestory is also poor!!

title: Bale Awesome...rest of the movie sucked.
text: Oh how to mighty have fallen...Marvel is making some pretty bad movies now. Should be a 0 rated movie but the scenes with Gorr made it into something. #wakeupmarvel #firetaika.

title: Which idiot made this movie?
text: Especially for this movie I created an account on IMDB.I don't know what they tried to attemp. But it is the worst Marvel movie ever. Luckily we had our doubts from the trailer already so we didn't bother to go to the movie theatre. The conversations are on mighty morphin powerrangers series level.Even dragging down Guardians of the galaxy with it.I'm even writing this during the movie itself.If you make a movie like this just don't bother at all.It ain't exciting, it ain't funny.... it ain't good. Like they made it for three year olds. Even the teletubbies are more excitingNot worth wasting your time for.

title: Goofs
text: When Thor visits Jane in hospital and drood a bunch of chocolates and treats from the vending machine - this amount changes drastically thtoyght the scene to almost gone by the end if the scene but no one has eaten anything!

title: Campy Fun a la Flash Gordon
text: To the people who are critically calling this a parody of itself - you probably didn't enjoy The Fifth Element or Flash Gordon either, did you? It IS a parody of itself, of the genre. Of the stuffy, overly serious and self righteous MCU. And a breath of fresh air in a film landscape full of overwrought biopics, disappointing sequels and excellent but emotionally exhausting dramas.I'll admit, it's not perfect in its execution. There could have been a bit more time spent on Thor and Jane, and I would have liked some more New Asgard content. But it was a thoroughly enjoyable experience from start to finish.If you want a serious MCU film along the lines of Black Panther, you won't find it here. If you want two hours of campy fun and lightning bolts, then you'll love this.Films can be fun!

title: MCU Humor Ruins It
text: I've disliked the direction Thor went into since Ragnarok. The MCU keeps making Thor a clown of jokes. Now in Phase 4, Thor is a wisecracking guy who can't stop making jokes every 30 seconds. I know Marvel is for all audiences but don't treat your all fans as babies. Christian Bale is absolutely wasted in this film and Korg is VERY unfunny.

title: Mess filled with bad jokes
text: I can't believe how this turned out to be such a mess of a movie with so much talent in it. Great director, top proven actors and we still get this as the final product. The only thing I liked about the movie was Bale as the villain, and everything else was bad or mediocre at best. That's interesting because usually most Marvel movies like this have everything good except for the villain, as a rule. The film looks like it was made by a 12-year-old child, a lot (too many) of bad and forced jokes, I was embarrassed and cringed at some scenes that are supposedly funny, and I haven't heard this much Guns and Roses since I was probably twelve year. Hmmm, what a coincidence!Basically, a very bad movie, made in haste, without much logic and plan, which surprised me. Definitely the worst Thor movie and one of the worst Marvel movies.

title: Marvel Still Got It
text: Love and Thunder is a reminder that Marvel can still get it done. It's funny, action packed, and even emotional at times. Much like Ragnarok this one feels like it's own little adventure, which is perfect for the MCU today. The score/soundtrack is amazing, and the visuals are really good. Christian Bale played a great and honestly terrifying villain. He had limited screen time, but he stole the show for me. Everything in Love and Thunder just worked so well. The cast played well off each other, and you can tell they have a real chemistry. Overall, this film is a relief that MCU fans deserve after a slew of mediocre films recently. A reminder that the MCU is still king.

title: Very disappointing
text: Who's the hero here? Chris Hemsworth or Nathalie Portman? Well she surely stole Thor's thunder in this movie. And come on making a joke on a missing arm!Jokes were too exaggerated and this is not the Thor we once knew. Too bad!

title: Brilliant film!
text: If you're one of those people who doesn't like actually watching a film and prefers to sit and analyse or compare it to comics then DO NOT WATCH IT! You know you don't actually have to right??If you just like to be entertained and you have enjoyed previous Thor movies, then this is a really fun and interesting film for you. I will concede it is a bit silly, but then the idea of a Norse god who fights aliens has to be doesn't it? I loved the story, I really enjoyed the humour, it was touching in places and sad in others, a well developed story and great addition to the series.To all the trolls who came banging their chests with their 1 star reviews, it is a movie, get over yourselves, if your opinions mattered why aren't you making better movies?

title: Jokey juvenile junk
text: Someone with a sword that can kill Gods goes on a vengeance binge to the navel of the Universe to destroy all the gods in one fell swoop - or something to that effect - unless the increasingly clownish heroes of the MCU can stop him. The film is one long series of extravagant images, childish jokes, and goofy sight-gags, to the point of almost being a witless parody of the worst excesses of the genre. The CGI is technically impressive but artistically unimaginative (an exception being the B/W sequence), the story is dull and derivative, the A-list cast is stuck delivering a D-list script that would have been at home in a 1970's Saturday morning cartoon, the climatic fight is cretinous (but not unexpected from a production company that once gave the world the Mickey Mouse Club) and the maudlin ending risible. I forced myself to finish the film (mostly watching with one eye and 1/10 of my brain (which was still more than needed)). The film is not just awful, its annoyingly and irritatingly awful but, sadly, it still made money, so I'll save a 1/10 score for the inevitable next installment.

title: Thor : Love and Thunder review, NO SPOILERS
text: Thor : Love and Thunder is good movie for viewers but I wouldn't call it a classic Marvel movie which makes Thor : Love and Thunder very unique. Thor : Love and Thunder has a good storyline and can produce strong emotions to the audience making it dramatic in certain places. Thor : Love and Thunder is a very dramatic movie but it can't be a Thor movie without some comedy moments, all comedy moments are placed perfectly in the storyline of Thor's latest adventure. The end of Thor : Love and Thunder should be on many watchlists and perfectly sets up for a thrilling fifth Thor movie, I can't wait for the fifth movie to come after Thor : Love and Thunder's ending.

title: Awful beyond all reason
text: I don't know why they keep letting Waititi turn Thor, royal prince of Asgard, into a quirky goofball but I'm sick of it. I don't want a "fun" Thor movie. I need Jon Favreau Iron Man realness. This movie had me rolling my eyes at how utterly dumb, silly and ridiculous it was from start to terrible finish. Disney is ruining Marvel movies by making them childish. This film is wonderful if you're 6 years old. For an adult Marvel fan it's a train wreck. Films like this will kill the superhero genre which people are already getting tired of as it is. I'll bet Hemsworth and Waititi are dying laughing when they think about how much money they were given to make such a stupid movie. Where's Christopher Nolan when you need him? I've seen less silliness in a Bugs Bunny cartoon. Bring back serious Marvel movies. Stop catering to little kids.

title: What A Mess
text: The fact this movie was written by Taika Watiti and Ragnarok wasn't says everything. The whole movie is a huge disappointment, spending way too much time on the jokes and not enough on the story. It was like they fired out every idea they had hoping something would land. This movie had so much potential but instead made every character look like an idiot and Thor was stripped of any depth from his previous films. All serious points of the movie were laughed off and rushed past. As many have said it was genuinely like watching a piss take of the movie itself. I love marvel but I've never wanted to leave the cinema more. Christian Bale was great with what he was given but it was a huge blunder for Marvel - he could have been a main villain for phase 4 giving it a purpose which seems to be lacking in a lot of movies in this phase. I can't believe this came out the way it did!

title: Flashy, Funny, Thor...y
text: Gorr, the main antagonist, is extremely easy to understand.His plight is justified and he makes arguments that are hard to dispute. This makes the interactions between Gorr and other characters all the more interesting.Chris Hemsworth is a delight as Thor's gags turn the movie into a tug of war between hilarity and cold blooded killing.With so many sharp turns in the story, it gets hard to track reasoning and explanation but the main plot is written in bold. While being a visual spectacle, Thor: Love and Thunder has lots of thought provoking scenes that are veiled behind humor and are washed away quickly, leaving it up to the viewer to make of what they see.This film is an excellent addition to the Thor series, and I recommend watching it if you are a fan of the man.Also his big ol' butt makes the big screen.

title: A mess.
text: I get that the tone of of this movie is more comedic, but every joke or gag feels extremely clichÃ© and forced, there's no balance.20 minutes in I was feeling so bored thinking I had to go through the entire movie watching how messy the story was developing, I already had lost interest and thought I was watching an SNL sketch or something.Some VFX were good but overall the movie feels so plastic and green screen-y, the wigs were really bad too, it really takes you out of the experience... and with all these years of experience Marvel Studios has I'm surprised how bad some shots looked, poor photography.As a big MCU fan I have to say this has to be one of the worst movies, if not the worst. You can feel in various aspects this was not made with much effort :(I'd recommend waiting until it's released on Disney+

title: A steaming pile.
text: Disappointing to see such talented actors eith such a potentially awesome story only to be let down by poor writing and directing. Weak jokes and a feeble storyline.

title: Guardians of the Galaxy - meets The Shadow Man - meets Coming 2 America - meets Shrek 2 - meets The Batman - meets All Might
text:
FINAL TAKEAWAY:
Overall #ThorLoveAndThunder gives Guardians of the Galaxy - meets the Shadow man - meets Coming 2 America - meets Shrek 2 - meets All Might - meets The BatmanThis was a slow growth of enjoyment for me, and I have to say it again (as I did with the last Disney-Marvel release)... you can REEEAAAALLLY tell the Disney touch on Marvel, and it's not always good. I don't think I particularly liked this film, but I also didn't dislike it. There were definitely some engaging and entertaining moments, the fight scenes delivered, and it was "fun" overall... but it just felt too outlandish and silly at times vs how it normally feels in the Thor universe (to me), and I didn't like that.Furthermore, and maybe it was just me, but it felt like Thor was treated like a prop vs a lead.SN: Make sure you stay for the 2 post credit scenes if you happen to check it out.OTHER THOUGHTS:
Highlights: Christian Bale, Natalie Portman, the fight scenes, the cinematography in the Shadow Realm, the goats, the thematic followthrough via Christian Bale's character, and the contrasting imagery and symbolism of the opening scene with Christian Bale and the ending scene in Act Three with Christian Bale.Could've Been Better: More intentionality with Thor's character with the theme from the beginning, a better balance of the humor with the heroism, and the majority of Act One.

title: Marvel is getting desperate
text: This is just a sign that they can't create any new exciting stories, something that will hold fans interest, so they figured let's try to make Thor a new Deadpool? At least they got a buzz... and even a bad press is a good press? Stan Lee is crying on the other side. Sorry buddy. And we all know why goats are there - so they can sell screaming goat toys. Good luck parents :)

title: It's painful to watch
text: The movie it's just cringe from beggining to end. It saddens me how low Thor has fallen, in the first movies I remember him having and arc, becoming a responsible guy, someone one could call king worthy and now, he's just a manchild doing silly stuff.Marvel directives must think that all that matters for this movies it's silly/dumb comedy and this movie it's just a series of bad jokes. In previous movies comedy was used to break tension, in this one, there's just no tension at all.If I have watched this movie in cinema, I would've left 30 minutes on it, it's really painful to watch. I had to pause it frequently and only ended up watching until the end cause it's a Marvel movie and I wanted something to enjoy, but the pain did not stop.

title: The best of Thor the worst of Thor
text: The silliness in the beginning of this movie almost makes you miss a truly heartfelt movie. A romance blossoms somewhere near the middle of this movie that actually gives it a believable center. If you don't let all it's initial lameness bother you and stay invested until then you will be rewarded with a classic finish that is unexpected in every way. In this left brain right brain struggle to make a movie the sane half finally takes over and wins your heart. I love this director when he's letting his serious side show. He is a great man struggling against himself. Sometimes he wins, sometimes he loses, but always he is worth watching.

title: 2nd Best Thor Movie
text: Thor Love and Thunder is a good movie. It is funniest Thor movie ever. It is funny and I really enjoyed it. It is a second best Thor movie after Ragnarok.

title: The worst
text: I originally wanted to give one star for this horrible horrible movie...but I was generous with two only because Christian Bale was amazing. Natalie Portman should have her Oscar taken away for her horrible performance. The whole thing was nothing hit a money grab.

title: Good but Too Much Humor and Short Time
text: The Movie was Good , No doubt about that . Another MCU movie that has potential and was Good in General . But it could have been Very Good , Great or Excellent even but the humor and short time ruined that.I would like to rate it a 7.5 or even 7 , but there is no .5 so, to sum it up , MCU is focusing on TOO MUCH humor , if the humor was kept minimum and the time was kept atleast 30-40 minutes longer thos would no doubt be one of the best MCU movie ever .It had the same problem with Dr Strange MoM , less overall screen time with characters , for Dr strange it was the overhyped Illuminati and for this it may Be Gorr or the off screen butchered Gods .Personally the screaming Goats were fine at first but then it felt like they were in every scene , important and serious moments weren't always there , and the time span is too short .I hope that MCU avoids this with Black Panther 2 and other future films , and focus more on seriousness and more movie time , atleast 2 hours 30 minutes .Overall the movie was good , but it needed more seriousness , screen time , and scenes with Gorr and less humor .

title: Someone forget to write a plot...
text: Overacting, messy but still to noisy to sleep to. CGI-hell from the worst drawer in Hollywood, but ONE star for the great use of Guns N' Roses at the soundtrack.... ZzzzzAll adults, do avoid!

title: Disappointing.
text: The writing in the movie was a huge mess. It felt slow but at the same time really rushed. In some parts there was so much cringe I couldn't handle it. The whole Zeus and Hercules and the gods, where did all of that come from? And the bald guy was so bad, I didn't like his character. It would've been better if thor's sister hela returned. The effects were also very bad in some parts. I don't know if the budget decreased or what but I feel like I watched a parody. I am really disappointed at marvel and I think is going downhill. Doctor strange multiverse of madness was better but I also thought the story wasn't it...

title: Terrible! B Movie Thor
text: So disappointing. Its the first Marvel film I've felt like walking out on and that was about 30 mins in. Calling it a B movie is probably an insult to B movies. What were they thinking? It's almost as if Chris Hemsworth and Taika Waititi have intentionally sabotaged the film to ensure they never have to make another one. Played almost entirely for laughs that just aren't funny, no emotion or drama and a waste of everyone's time, money and talent. I can't understand how the decision makers at Disney signed off on this, maybe they've put too much faith in Taika after the success of Ragnarok but he needed reigning in this time. Maybe it's time for Marvel to take a break and regroup or maybe we've had too much of a good thing and the movies have finally run their course.

title: Just So Much Fun
text: I gauge my movies on how entertained I was. Love and Thunder is just pure entertainment from start to finish. I don't quite understand all the hate it's getting, but if you just go into it knowing it's an action-comedy, you'll come out entertained too. I adore Taika's work and Ragnarok is still king, but he did it again with this wonderful new journey. Don't let the negative reviews skew your perception of it, the movie is so fun and that's really all that matters.

title: Wow. That was bad
text: You'd think that at some point, after having read the script someone in either the cast of in the Disney/Marvel Management team would have stood up and shouted 'NOOOO' from the bottom of their hearts in order to save dignity and Marvel honour.Alas, that did not happen. So here we are, staring into the abyss and watching what will be regarded in the future as an MCU catastrophic mistake.For the first quarter of the move I first thought I was watching a comedy spoof of a Thor movie. The scripting was cringingly bad and Chris Hemsworth' s acting was well below par. In fact, most of the cast's acting was terrible and I joked halfway through the film that the fake Asgardian thespians performed better than the key cast.Christian Bale's performance was outstanding though but he could not save this film, because a diamond dropped into a pit of tar can't shine. It had been speculated earlier that Christian Bale had no interests in doing more superhero or comic book characters and he should have listed to that inner voice before accepting this role. Then countering that rumour, earlier this year he said in an interview "...a good story is a good story. A good film is a good film. And a good director is a good director. And I'm open to any of those ideas.". Well, here we are and I think it's safe to say that none of three criteria listed above apply to this film (sorry Taika). Having said that, Gorr is a fascinatingly multi-layered character and Bale's portrayal is as good as it can possibly get, given the circumstances.I think that's why I manage to award this film 3 stars which without Bale would have been a solid 1 in my book.

title: EndGame was the end of marvel great movies!
text:
Every time marvel release a new movie after End Game its become more and more disappointed.. the movie wasn't great, it is weak, empty, no strong story! I think they tried so hard to make it funny.. and that's it!It is so sad to see all beloved character destroyed after their badass rolls in all marvels past movies.. EndGame was the end of marvel great movies! Im done
! Thor the love and thunder was the last one for me!

title: Great movie, can't understand the hate
text:
I really dont understand why people call this movie empty, it's about thor's journey to find something to live for not about affecting the entire mcu.Absolutely loved this movie easily one of my favourites it's enjoyable and funny and a great film
Taika did a great job directing and the acting is good aswell.

title: Tried too hard
text: I don't want to waste much time on this other than to say it tried to be too many things to an audience that wasn't impressed (first time I've ever seen people walk out of a marvel film), was trying way too hard to make a joke out of nearly every line, and became an unfunny parody of itself. Really really poor and disappointing after the amazing Ragnarok.

title: Amazing movie! Keep them coming!
text: Mr. Bale thank you so much for being here!And the director! You did a great job.What a wonderful movie.Boy!I just live the Villain and his white outfit that relates to the extremes of racism, the whole ending is just amazing.I love this movie!

title: Worst thor movie
text: Could've been better. Woke Disney ruined what could've been a fantastic movie. Was my least favorite Thor movie and not kid friendly like the other ones.

title: Is this a parody??
text: First of all: Sorry if my English isn't perfect. I'm from Europe.I love the Thor movies, but this time it was too much comedy. I didn't feel the action, magic and marvel exitement, because almost everything was a joke. It was so bad I almost felt sad. Is this what Marvel has become??And WHATS up with Zevs?! Isn't he supposed to be this huge mighty God?? In this film he came across as a stupid, goofy, dumbass.Christian Bale did a great job, and I almost felt sorry for him because he's excellent work was destroyed by a horrible script and movie.I'll Recommend that you skip this movie and hope that the next one is better.

title: one of best this year
text: It has two-hours of jokes and Guns and Roses! Saw it opening night with 5 friends and we loved it! Lost two stars for Disney's silly alphabet soup, so silly it got laughs for 5 attempts. Ladies were there to see Helmsworth strip down. He was his most buff ever. Jane got buff for this one too. Unlike Gal in Wonder Woman or Bree as Captain Marvel -- you could tell she put on 20 pounds of muscle. Great flick. Like the others, I will see it again!

title: Uber woke with weak acting and storyline
text: What a waste of time. I've always been a huge marvel and Thor fan, but this was a sad waste of time. Wish they would bring back good old fun movies instead of focusing on their weaving their agenda into as many aspects of the movie as possible and losing the plot along the way!!!

title: An Epic Fantasy Action movie with tons of laughs
text: I loved the movie! It was fun, action-packed, with some cool Easter eggs and cameos, great visuals, and a fantastic villain. Chris Hemsworth, Natalie Portman, and Tessa Thompson did a great job in their characters as they always have. Taika Waititi did a great job over the whole film and in his role as the hilarious Korg. And last but certainly not least, Christian Bale was excellent as Gorr!The movie was chalk full of awesome action scenes, hilarious moments, neat Easter eggs, and a superb soundtrack that was perfect for each scene.I recommend going into watching this movie looking for a getaway from some of the chaos and stress in our world. This movie does a great job of having dramatic moments with some humorous touches to lighten the mood. This is a bright, fun, colorful action movie.All that said, I have to emphasize - don't expect to see an intellectual mind-bender or dark action-thriller, though it has some deep/dark moments. Expect to see a a fun, hilarious, fantasy-action film that will have you laughing and pumped to head to the gym!

title: No substance
text: This was a very lazy movie. It was literally a joke. No substance. Felt like they think we are stupid and will pay for anything so why not. And maybe they are right. We are pretty stupid in a lot of ways. Just silly very weak story line. I was surprised that the main actors would agree to do something like that but who knows. A B movie.

title: Great Movie
text: Great Movie. Watch with no expectations and this movie entertain you with jokes. Great direction, fantastic acting by all actors, perfectly balanced power levels of thor. At the end great movie to watch.

title: Disney is ruining Marvel
text: I just watch this film and almost walked out. I loved the other Thor films and even though the Thor character has been increasingly comedic. This films story line seemed rushed and also made the guardians look foolish. Times when you would aspect some seriousness there was levity, actually I would call the oil a comedy. You can definitely see the Disney wokeness spilling over in the film. I wish I waited to it came out on cable.

title: Fun movie
text: I mainly rated this 10/10 to help bring it's score back up-- not sure why it's getting so much hate. I enjoyed it, Christian Bale did an amazing job. Ragnarok is my favorite but this one was still good. It was way better than Black Widow, even though they are both 6.7 out of 10 at the moment. The Shadow Realm had really cool look to it. There are a lot of jokes, so if you prefer a more serious movie, this is not for you.

title: Oh dear me....why...just why?
text: The only Marvel film I will never go back and rewatch.Pointless poorly written comedy.You get Christian Bale and make this mess....shame on you.Bale could have been one then greatest bad guys in the MCU....but becaus6for whatever reason they decided to turn the movie into a slapstick tv movie.God of dumplings.....god as in oh my god..why?

title: Woof
text: I'm a huge marvel/Thor/hemsworth fan. I had low expectations for this movie once the initial reviews came out. I was so sad and disappointed by this film. I almost feel gullible, does marvel/disney know we'll see these movies whether or not they're "good?"The plot was odd, the story weak, the script cringeworthy, and the humor was a massive let down...as in it was truly not funny to this fan.So save your money and catch this when you can see it for free. And hope we fans get better projects in the future-we deserve it.

title: Thor is a Comic!
text: I think this is very very silly, however people need to remember Thor is a space Viking based off of a comic! Now this Is a very fun movie!!Christian Bale was putting on an Acting Master class as he usually does!The only reason I didn't give it a 10 is I think Thor in ragnarok had the perfect balance between serious and silly, and Thor in this movie is just silly.... Constantly, even though Chris Hemsworth is brilliant at that I preferred the Thor character he portrayed in the previous films...... also the MCU really need to address why the rest of their heroes only get involved in world ending catastrophic events when it's their turn for a movie.

title: Too much - unfunny - humor
text: I'm 25 minutes into the movie and so far it's just being played for laughs - none of which have hit the mark. The actors are lethargic and their dialogue is cringeworthy. I've given up on the movie because I don't think it's going to get better and I don't want to have to sit through another 95 minutes only to be proven correct.Marvel's previous Thor movies have been serious drama interspersed with humor but when there isn't any drama, nothing suspenseful, what's the point in watching it?Chris Pratt is saying his lines as though he's been drugged, Natalie Portman and Kat Dennings don't even seem to care about delivering their lines and Christian Bale - who is usually a tour de force in whatever role he plays - is mumbling.That's 25 minutes I'm never going to get back!

title: Top Tier Marvel Quality
text: I don't really see what there is to dislike about this movie. I have seen all the MCU films and this would be in my top 5. It was hilarious, interesting and exciting. I loved that Korg got his screen time. It did have 3 flaws: The main villian was missed potential and should have trusted the comic aesthetic with character and weapon, another very significant character who led the gods had bad dialogue and accent, and third was the agenda was annoying and obvious in the film. I hate being cryptic but avoiding all spoils.

title: MARVEL STUDIO is just lost its taste post Infinity War / Endgame.
text: Don't wast time and money, it is just good enough to watch on Disney+ Hotstar. Forced comedy, no character development. They just keep depower main character like Dr. Strange in Multiverse of Madness, Here Thor needs another Thor(Female). I mean what's happening? I think this franchise is coming to its end now.

title: Really enjoyed this!
text:
In my honest opinion i think this is a solid 8, I like how they carried on Thors story from the previous films.Lots of laughs
Bit of a loge story and a touching scene at the end when he plays along side his real daughter.But when I see people giving this a 1 or 2 stars it makes me think have they even followed the story and are thry just turning up to watch Chris Hemsworth?So giving it a 10 to make up for the idiots scoring so low.

title: Like a children's cartoon
text: Just awful. I suspect that the 10 star reviews were only given 10 stars to "make up for" the (accurate) 1 and 2 star reviews. If this movie is a 10 then what is A Few Good Men or Schindler's List or The Departed?I couldn't make it any further than the first "action" sequence where Thor holds apart 2 cars or whatever they were with his legs in a split.This movie is for children. Like little children. It's basically a He Man cartoon. I don't see how an adult can find anything of redeeming value here. I saw Thor and The Dark World. While not anything spectacular they were at least entertaining and I didn't feel insulted. Love and Thunder is like 2 junior high schoolers did a cgi project for computer class.I downloaded it for free and I still want my money back.

title: I cant believe how stupid this movie is
text: I'm in the theater now and this movie is so dumb I had to come on here and express my frustration. Yes, there are some really good laughs, but not many. I enjoyed Ragnorok a lot, but this one is just dumb. And a lot of the humor is reminiscent of Joss Whedon's Justice League, trying too hard to force in lame humor.It's not as moronic as Spider-Man Far From Home, but it's definitely another disappointing release from Marvel.

title: Could of be SOOOOO Much BETTER
text: Could of been so much better. It should of been more dark with the Gor story line vs the Fraggle Rock RomCom it was.... I mean the internal pain of GOR and hatred of the GODS, the loss, the battle, THOR finding his power. I was just expecting something a little dark/violent/in depth but instead got a Sunday Morning Muppet Love Story of a Movie. Thor/Hulk/Rogue my favorite Marvel Heros so yes mostly disappointment for me.

title: Is it only me, or was this a good film!
text: I feel like it is only me who actually enjoyed this movie. I personally think this is one of the stronger phase 4 films compared to Black Widow and Eternals. It was meant to be a light hearted *jokey* kind of movie. Bale and Portman gave an outstanding performance, however the amounts of jokes in the film could have been less. The CGI was decent, and the overall pace didn't feel as rushed as the Multiverse of Madness. It showed a continuation from endgame (as Thor is with the Guardians of the Galaxy), which some of the Marvel Shows are lacking. The ending was very emotional, and the after credit leaves you excited for what's to come in Thor 5. This isn't a top tier marvel film however it definitely should be getting more love.

title: Worst marvel movie ever
text: I really hate the movie I didn't laugh I didn't feel sad I didn't feel anything except disappointment. This movie is the best representative of marvel new phase very bad, very disappointment recent movies they need to know when to stop. There are a lot of scenes the it's supposed to be serious and they filled it with jokes really really bad jokes. I will give the movie 2 stars just for one of my favorite actor Christian Bale he is the only good point in this movie and im very sad that he choose this movie to be for marvel. I hope they make last thor movie to repair what they did in this movie and end the character in a way suits one of the phase 1 characters.

title: Absolutely loved it
text: Thor Love and Thunder was absolutely fantastic. The comedy and action was top notch. The acting was great as always with MCU movies. Will definitely watch again.

title: Awesome Ingredients, Pathetic End Product
text: This movie has some really great elements.1) Natalie Portman is great as a very "human" super hero, Thor like powers with a cool twist, and pulls of a legit heart jerking performance.2) Thor having a very relatable experience and getting to walk with him through a hard part of life.3) Christian Bale was Amazing as a very creepy villain.4) A decent plot line.

title: Good Character Arcs for Thor and Jane
text: Under the Writing and Direction of Taika Waititi, the THOR franchise portion of the Marvel Cinematic Universe has gone in a more comedic, rather than Shakespearean, direction and THOR: LOVE AND THUNDER proves that this direction is a smart one both for THOR and for the overall health and diversity of the Marvel Cinematic Universe as well.Starring Chris Hemsworth, of course, as the titular THOR, Love and Thunder shows our demi-god hero at a crossroads in his life and career. Into this world walks his ex-girlfriend, Jane Foster (Natalie Portman) and chaos ensues as both are chasing the god-killer, Gorr (Christian Bale).This sort of premise set-up (and the fact that Hemsworth is playing THOR for the 8th time), could have fallen victim to banality and dullness, but under the watchful eye of Waititi (Writer/Director of the severely under-rated JOJO RABBIT), this THOR soars with the best of them and develops the overall arc and (eventual) pay-off of both Thor's and Jane's arcs precisely and (upon retrospection) in the only satisfying way that they could have ended. So, kudos needs to be given to Waititi for walking this tightrope and sticking the landing.Hemsworth, of course, is charming and buff as Thor and balances the action, romantic drama and comedic portions of this story well. Waititi brings more than just comic relief (though he has plenty of that as well) as the voice of Thor's buddy KORG, while Christian Bale is more than just one-dimensional (how can this actor be anything but interesting) as the main villain of this piece..What surprised me the most in this film is the portrayal of Jane Foster by Portman and how her character becomes the "female Thor" (that's not a spoiler, it's in the trailers) and does NOT become just "Thor's girlfriend". Portman has made no secret of her distaste of how her character became the femme fatale in THOR: THE DARK WORLD and refused to return to this character previously. Obviously, Waititi has been able to come up with a storyline - and an arc - that would interest an actress like Portman to return and Natalie nails it. She looked bright-eyed and energized by this part and by where her character goes in this film.And then there is Tessa Thompson's Valkyrie. This character is a strong part of Thor's story - and the story of the survivors of Asgaard (their destroyed homeworld). Thompson owns this part and is engaging and interesting to watch on-screen. Out of necessity, her character and story play a supporting role to the main Thor/Jane story, so her character didn't get quite enough to do for my tastes. But it did whet my appetite for a stand-alone Valkyrie film (make that happen Marvel).There are cameos and extended-cameos galore in this film - as well as TWO end credits scenes - so to mention them would be to spoil them, except to say that the GUARDIANS OF THE GALAXY play a pivotal role, but for those who came to see a GUARDIANS film, you'll have to wait for GUARDIANS 3 to come out next year - this is a THOR film.A very satisfying entry in the Marvel Cinematic Universe and while not a perfect film (it does try too hard, at times, to mine the same, surprise comic gold of THOR: RAGNAROK), THOR: LOVE AND THUNDER delivers a stand-alone Thor story that drives both the characters of Thor and Jane forward in a smart, intelligent way...and when is the last time the words "smart and intelligent" were used with a comic book film)?Letter Grade: A-8 stars (out of 10) and can take that to the Bank(ofMarquis)

title: Taika watati ruined this movie
text:
Forced jokes , no seriousness about characters death scene, immature funny scenes
Mighty Thor and gor saved the show
Even valkariye is presented as a joke
This movie should name itself
Parody of Thor"
"Taika watati ruined my favourite character.

title: Too many cringe moments
text: I wanted to enjoy this film but it was almost unwatchable after the first scenes with Gorr. So many cringe jokes, over and over again. There was some potential with the Mighty Thor scenes and other Gorr scenes, but those were quickly forgotten due to the overindulgence in silly quips, forgettable lines, and some really bad CGI (computer generated images/scenes). The first half to two thirds of the movie are some of the worst I've seen in a superhero movie, while the last third was better. Overall, I just didn't appreciate how low Thor has been brought down. I almost didn't finish the movie but I figured I'd at least give it a chance. 3/10 for me!

title: One wild ride
text: Truly enjoyed this Thor movie, which harkened back to some of the comic book series. It was funny and irreverent, which sometimes is just what you need. I laughed, cried, and enjoyed the whole ride. I get that for some it might have been too goofy, but comic books and their movies will cover a variety of emotions, styles, and genres.

title: Thorture..
text: It was not funny, and it was not exciting...Jokes were overdone, the villain was not convincing.It was just ok..If you are a 10y old kid you will enjoy it.

title: Worst Thor Movie
text: I only gave it 5 stars for Natalie Portman and Christian Bale being in the film. The rest of the film was a long joke. Maybe if Kenneth Branagh had directed it, it would have been a better, more serious film. Too bad.

title: What Could Have Been
text: The first 5 minutes of this film will have you believe that Phase 4 was going to deliver a masterpiece, but it falls apart immediately. With such great performances from Bale and Portman, it is hard to believe that this movie was not a huge success. It was extremely frustrating to see these actors give it there all, with some fun Guns N' Roses songs and references thrown in, just for the movie to fall flat.The tone was all over the place, going from lame jokes to dark and serious concepts in the matter of seconds. Hemsworth is fine but again the jokes became insufferable to the point where you just roll your eyes constantly. They go on and on with the result being a film that somewhat feels like a parody at times. The middle portion is complete filler just to get the naked Thor scene from the trailers in. This completely screws up the pacing of the movie and results in a rushed climax. The humor is okay in doses, but overtime it becomes annoying and takes away from the serious ideas that are put forth in the films main plot. Without spoiling much, I can say the ending of the film was also questionable and ruined by bad pacing. Honestly I can't see where they go from here but hopefully Marvel builds out an actual plot next time around rather than focusing on jokes first and worrying about the story later. Bale deserved to live long enough to become the villain in a better movie.

title: Personal Opinion as a Marvel Fan
text:
9/10 cinematography
8/10 Actors' performances
9/10 comedy/entertainment
