title: Writers: How much silliness do you want? Producer: Yes!
text: I love almost all Marvel Universe movies, but this one feel like it's just all over the place, it's a very goofy movie! I laughed out loud several times, but it's like they threw every bit of seriousness out the window and just went balls to the wall crazy with everything.It's like every new Thor movie has to be more over the top than the previous one, sooner or later it gets to a point where it's just too much. I'm still going to rate it high because I love the characters so much, but it's probably around 5 for most, it's still very watchable, it just a thin script and very goofy...........................................................................................................................................

title: Such a shame...
text: With Chris Hemsworth's incredible acting ability and with all the other work he has been involved in, we are a huge fan; regarding this ridiculos take on the role of a once well loved character (a fan for literally decades) the Thor of Stan Lee is nowhere to be seen even in dreams of yesterday. Stan Lee would have died if he were still with us, to see such a travesty on such a beloved character made to be a joke, a Very Bad Joke. Chris.... get out while you can.... this will make Marvel fans really label you as a pun to be associated with what NOT to be and with such talent outside of this and in the past roles as Thor as well of yesterday, please don't do this anymore if this is all someone is making it out to be. I am so disappointed in Disney (happens all the time now) and what Marvel has become... I'd hate to see you in such things anymore and would even rather them kill Thor than do this to him. Kat D. Is wonderful, but they gave her no parts, yet in the couple minutes I was still glad to see her and hear her. Christian B. Did wonderfully amidst such a travesty. Natalie... it was good to see her back, but they did her no justice. Great to see the GoftheG cast. Russel's role was a joke (bad). Melissa (Nope) Luke Peter Matt ... always good to see them... so many with great talent reduced to a bad script bad directing and producing and lack of respect and insight into the Marvel Stan Lee and company created and we all loved. Seems DC is switching roles and starting to take it all more serious while Disney's Marvel (Daredevil hopefully still excluded and remainin,g great with the team who made it all and with Jessica, Luke, Frank Danny and the great support cast of each Shades, Claire. John, Rev (R. I. P.) Malcolm.The Marvel I always loved slowly dies with each new instalment. I will always remember the Marvel while Stan Lee lived and became so awesome as to make the comics of my youth even better. Stan Lee -- Excelsior !!!! ...even if we are only going downward, your legacy will never be forgotten and will be very sorely missed.

title: No more jokes
text: Taika Waititi is an idiot who believes he did an excellent job, but it's time for him to rein in his arrogance. He turned the movie into a live cartoon. All the plots of the film are full of very childish lines and actionsUse the way of telling bedtime fairy tales to read out the film's synopsis, background, ending and development directly. It is very simple and easy to understand, and it is also very fooling. Watching the protagonist talking and telling jokes that they think are funny is kinda suffering. The Guardians of the galaxy have no influence on the main plot of the movie. Most of the time, there is even no science or story logic to explore.Thor and Zeus, these two men were portrayed without any divine temperament and completely turned into funny clowns. Doesn't Waititi really know that they are NOBLE GODS, not mortals? I don't see this man shows any respect for Norse mythology and original comic book.Even children who don't have any combat experience can fight and don't get hurt, which is enough to see how ridiculous the movie is. Every detail of the film emphasizes how perfunctory it is, but thanks to Christian Bale's outstanding performances, he became the only non-boring characteristic in this film.Nowadays, the balance of MCU between commerciality and artistry has been seriously unbalanced. There is no basic sincerity and innovation from creation to production. The quality problem is very serious, and the cost is highly compressed. Every work has been completely reduced to a product used to extract surplus value.If they go on like this, even the Green Lantern movie could be a masterpiece to them.

title: Just great
text: Sorry, This is just a great movie. It's crazy, it's all over the place, but it is truly brilliant. In a couple of years, this will be regarded as a classic masterpiece. Go see it.

title: This is a corndog of a film
text: Some people like corndogs; I'm not a fan. Over the years I've enjoyed the MCU films - some more than others - and I really wanted to like this one, too. NOPE. It was gaudy, messy, noisy and really, really long and pointless. I did, however, enjoy the soundtrack and Chris Helmworth's backside. Sadly, Disney has ruined the MCU and regrettably I'll never see DeadPool again.Unless he's wearing Mouskaears and bandishing a Elsa bubblewand. So.... enjoy the corndogs, I guess?

title: Worthy.
text: Kinda like dr strange 2, if you don't like the directors other work, this may not be for you. Besides that it's a fun, colorful movie full of laughs. The performances are great and every scene has a lot to chew on. It's biggest flaw is it may be a little too light hearted for the average "fanboy".

title: The most mediocre movie I have seen
text: This movie is one of the most mediocre marvel movie I have ever seen. I seriously didn't expect it from marvel and Taika. Watiti. I just hope that they do better in future.

title: Underrated
text: The plot followed to the main theme nicely, love and thunder. The movie succeeded to show the battle between two sides but dealing with love emotions. Although I thought of Thor kinda weak compared to the other films showing his power, it is almost covered by the screentume of other characters such as Valk, Jane, the rock dude, and other characters like Stormbreaker and the goats. People Enjoyable if you have liw expectation.

title: I recommend it.
text: I enjoyed this movie. I felt that it was a great addition to the story of Thor. There was: Action. Drama. Guest stars. It tied a lot of threads. I was recovering from back surgery when I saw it. While getting into and out of the theater were challenging, the movie kept me absorbed. I was definitely entertained. I would normally have given this an 8, but I felt like countering some of the naysayers was worth the extra point. Well worth seeing.

title: Two films
text: This is two film mashed together. One is a terrible rom-com, the other one has Christian Bale and is kinda cool.The film is all over the place, parts stupid comedy and parts a dark story of failing gods.

title: So much fun!
text: The bad reviews are for what? This movie has the death and war needed for seriousness mixed with comedy and jokes to keep your attention all the way through! This movie has all the stars and is nothing but fun!! Mighty Thor is awesome and has you cheering for her FINALLY, because she was a throw away character before. I loved it! Christian Bale is in a different role than ever seen, and Matt Damon didn't steal the movie! Russell Crowe was hilarious as Zeus. I don't know how anyone didn't love this movie... Tons of inside jokes and pure entertainment from beginning to end! Also the soundtrack is a greatest hits album!

title: Thor: Family Guy special
text: Thor Love and Thunder is best explained as a high budget, live action, Family Guy episode. The jokes are good individually and aren't bad per se but in the context of a 2 hour movie it comes across as frustrating and derailing.They try to bring it back to being serious in the last action sequence but by that time the audience has been lost.Movie is 2 hours but it simultaneously feels like it needed to be longer and shorter. Some parts just dragged while the interesting bits needed more time to breath.Went with 5 people (including myself), 4/5 did not like it.

title: Dial It Down
text: Let's start by saying that visually the film looks impressive, and the cast do their best. But this film is far, far too jokey, and not in a good way. There's nothing wrong with injecting humour into comic book films and indeed the first Thor film did so quite well, but L&T doesn't know when to stop. Even scenes that demand a sombre tone are undercut with more pointless jokes.Worse still, the characters are essentially made to take a back seat to the humour and this is unfortunate when most of it *just isn't that funny*. Thor is made to look like a dribbling idiot for much of the film, but that's ok as long as Waititi is able to cram more of his Fast Show Colin Hunt-style personality into the film. A character tearfully declaring their fear about their fate is diluted with dad jokes and karaoke.Basically this film should have been a cartoon, because it's already most of the way there.

title: Loved it
text: I'm from Sweden and have been told about the great Nordic gods since I was a little kid. Thor is one of them and the most iconic god with a hard backstory.For me is this movie something special. They take a lot from the comics and mixes it perfectly with real tales about the god, this makes it funnier.For example, he is said to have a sleigh with two big goats. So perfect!He's character in the old tales is mainly muscles, self-centred and the main man. This is perfectly shown by Taika and Chris Hemsworth.Thank you for making me and many others happy.I gladly laugh about Thor with you guys!

title: The only thing good is Christian Bale as Gorr
text:
What a waste of great and complicated character as Gorr in such a silly movie , there is no really story line just many clips of nonsense
It is really frustrating that the character of Gorr is done greatly by Christian Bale it could have been a really meaningful movie not just an non entertaining movie even
Taika , I don't know what happened why is every thing in this movie is so shallow
and I do not even know why Gradians of the Galaxy even in the movie except for several un funny jokes that was good only for the trailer
really was such a great disappointment movie from a director who I really loved his work in the past but not in this one.

title: It was fun to watch and really enjoyed it.
text: Wasn't expecting less but the story line was kind of shallow but all the jokes were on point and our group had a lot of fun. Bales acting was on point but was not utilized to its full potential.

title: Ironman 2 and 3 are better
text: Need I say more? This story had so had so much potential and they ruined so much. The only good thing I can say about it is they did Gorr the most justice, but even then there were problems.

title: Pantomime
text: I love the vast majority of MCU films, but this missed the mark for me. I am a little older though! The start was promising, but the silliness and bad jokes just went too far. The kids next to us seemed to love it and youngsters seem to be the target audience. If the next 20 odd Marvel films (like the last ones) all end up somewhere, this will be one you can skip if watching them all for a second time. For sure.
If you like Thor you would like this movie. I laughed, I cried, and I felt for the characters when they showed that being a God can mean you go through the same experiences as humans.

title: Missing some razzle dazzle
text: I was really hoping we would be treated to something like Thor 3. This one didn't quite live up to that hype. I'm not sure what the difference was, it just didn't have that magical feeling to it. The jokes seemed less funny, the effects didn't look as good. It was alright, just missing a lil' razzle dazzle.

title: 8/10 great movie
text: Gorr is great villain lot of funniness and lovey doviness/chemistry between thunder girl and thunder guy. Korg is very funny and I has good plot, great movie go watch.

title: So disappointed
text: This is the movie that should never have been made. Love the Thor universe in the first films. I dont know if it is the terrible mix of trying to imitate Deadpool and Guardians of the galaxy ( both amazing films by them selves ) or the script or the bad humor, but this movie doesn't work. Had been waiting and looking forward to seeing it and is left with utter disappointment. If their goal was to destroy the Thor universe that has been built over the years with previous movies, then they have succeded. I have to wonder how the many renowned actors in this movie would agree to the awful directing and worse humor.

title: Good, but too much liberal b...s
text: This would be a great movie (8-9/10) if not nowdays nonsense... And Thor shouldn't be joking in every scene, 24/7 joking (or trying) ruins this movie... Down scale "funny jokes" by 1/100.

title: Joke
text: This films the biggest joke in the history of mankind. It fights tooth and nail to make you believe Cancer is more than a PH imbalance in the human body of which requires more than someone pounding lemons and limes to alkalize the body cause you won't quit cramming sugar down your throat as though this were not 2024 and 99% of the human population had yet to discover Meditation & Yoga from this new invention called The Internet.What kind of Big Pharma Funded Film is this you've got going here!? You make movies based on what the so called stars look like, the writer said, oh well, Ms. Portman is getting up there in age so let's go with she's got cancer so it fits her role.All your films are the same debasement nonsense with zero creativity what so ever.The goats are cool.

title: This is great!
text: I'm not sure where all the hate is coming from, or if it's even real. This film is great. Fantastic soundtrack, fights and stories! It's not overly funny, it's pitched perfectly. Valkyrie is a great character and seeing her as King is a joy. Go have some fun and leave the real world behind for a few hours!

title: The king of worst marvel movies
text: Just the worst movie I've seen this decade. Trying to be funny this film becomes a joke of the joke and brings down Thors character with it, the guardians of the galaxy and any other character that is included in this film including the marvel franchise in a whole. Absolutely rubbish. Well done Christian Bale for giving this film a bit of quality though, but even he isn't able to save this. Every thing is treated as a joke. I loved Ragnarok, it was great even if that was pushing the limits of silliness at times. But Love and thunder is a film made for the age of 9 maximum. I miss the days of the original Thor and Antony Hopkins as Odin.

title: Torture
text:
I am not a fan of this type of film. However, I did enjoy the previous installments, especially the one with Cate Blanchett as the connivingly evil sister (or was she)? Chris Hemsworth is always worth looking at. In addition, with the computer enhancement of his biceps and triceps one can not get enough of the eye candy
Unfortunately, the screenplay was so banal, so ridiculous trying to stay interested was a sacrifice I was unwilling to make. So even though I was able to view this turkey on the big screen in a real theater, I extricated myself from my free admission seat without any hesitation and was happy to return to the real world.

title: Avoid this with all your might!
text: How to ruin a franchise - 101.This is by far the worst I've seen. Comedy, maybe? Far from funny...more on the ridiculous. Taika Waititi's isn't for everyone, as has been quite apparent across social media- it's not good news for Marvel. I think this parody is filled with thunderous disappointments. This pretense deserves the lowest ratings possible and shouldn't be applauded unless in late night SNL, along with fart jokes, beer purps, and bad lines and horrific acting. Half way through this (movie?), I felt sad that one of the coolest super heros is reduced to a side bar, a joke.I have the 2 stars for the visuals, which those technical wizards produced most spectacularly! The actors who got paid a lot of money to act like fools, sadly, made all these great special effects secondary.Avoid this with all your power.

title: Taika Watiti + Thor = Fun
text: To heck with all those hating this movie, man because of Disney. I'll be the first to admit Disney certainly ruins movies but this aint one of them.Yeah, Bale could have been fleshed out and used more, but overall a fun movie.And leave Toothgnasher and Toothgrinder alone. Their screaming made me laugh out loud.Everyone was great in this.

title: Really??? So Disappointed
text: I typically love Marvel/Thor movies. This was so corny, very slow, never really kept my attention and the story never got off the ground. Love the actors however the script made the actors seem like they were in a elementary school play. The CGI and special effects were really excellent, hated the music!! Way too much Guns and Roses. Better go back to the drawing board and get some better writers. A few jokes would have been fine, but too much made it tiresome and moronic. It was all I could do to finish it. I think I'll have to got back to the older ones for my Marvel fix. This review is not a reflection on the actors, again the script wasn't worthy of them.

title: Thor: Goats & Screaming
text:
I like Marvel movies but they keep getting worse. At some point I got so bored that I pulled my phone and start playing on it.You may have a good director, some good actors, some humor and some special effects but without a good story there cannot be a good movie.What's Bad:
Take a fairy tale/cartoonish journey narrated by Taika. Sorry, Korg. Add a lot of silly jokes and a lot of drama but fail to integrate them, don't add depth, jump quickly from one thing to another. Put some Hollywood political correctness (LGBT representation and strong woman stuff) on top and there you go.What's Good: The goats.

title: LOVED it, please continue
text: I love, love, love the Thor movies made by Taika. One moment was lmao, other moment crying, and really good story. The people who rate this down need to look into themselves a bit and find what's missing.

title: Fun, fast-paced, and Thor
text: Need to see this again because I want to. People expect too much after Endgame. Love Taika's take on Thor and would have liked the movie to be longer (more Gorr). Thoroughly enjoyable move.

title: I'm done with seeing Marvel movies in theather.
text: This is my first review on IDMB and it's going to be short.Honestly, I'm not some Marvel fan boy, but I watched almost every movie in the theater because of the pure enjoyment and, later on, 3D fun.But it stops with Love and Thunder.2 hours of of over using horrible jokes, empty story with few holes and over usage of the same cheap humor that you can see in new "comedy" movies is just not something I want to see or pay anymore.My wife told me nicely - you are going to get bored and pissed of like you did the last time you went to a Marvel movie and she was right.Wait for it on Blu-ray or whatever so you can stop watching when it becomes boring... like 5 minutes in.

title: Interestingly good
text: The humor is really nice, the story got home. I got to see the meaning of the title 'Love and Thunder' all along I thought it was going to be 'someone' getting saved in the end but its more of a rebirth to new powers and characters that wield them. At least I get to see Thor's mother fighting and Thor falling in love with a wolf-woman and damn would I want to be a Viking with the shiny armor and their fabulous weapons. The want to watch what Marvel will bring after this keeps getting more. I sometimes wonder will the characters ever end, perhaps not. Haha, I am waiting to see how Hercules will play a part in the next.

title: Never let Taika Waititi near MCU again. EVER!
text: He's clearly a talented director, no doubt about that. I enjoy his previously films - Boy, What We Do in the Shadows, Jojo Rabbit, even Ragnarok - they're brilliant. But in this case, he took what should be a Superhero action MCU movie and worked in bits and bobs of nothing more than trivial, silly humour.A joke, a quip, tongue-in-cheek teasing, a light-hearted break after hectic tension, yes, but this was just over-extended, irritating elements of crappy comedy that do nothing to add to the storyline at all.It's as though he had a list of funny gags and was determined to fit them anywhere he could, no matter what.

title: Pure entertainment
text: I seen alot of negative reviews about this film, I can only assume people struggle to enjoy films now probably looking for some deep meaning!Anyway this film is amazing and that's it!

title: Worst movie in a long time
text: I hated this movie. Luckily I saw it on the plane and could fast forward through parts of it. I love Natalie Portman and like Chris Hemsworth and I am disappointed that they did not protest against playing in such an embarrassing script. The movie tries to be funny, but it just doesn't seem to take any of it's characters or "plotlines" seriously. I haven't laughed a single time throughout. It was seriously just a waste of time and pain to watch. I wish I could get the two hours back to do literally anything else.And I liked the first Thor and generally somewhat enjoy Marvel movies...This movie was never funny.It was never really exciting.It had 5 minutes in the beginning where it might have turned into a seriously good movie, but failed that blatantly.The story was never gripping.There was no character development.Please for all the money you spend on making movies, spend a few dollars on the writers next time.

title: Great stress reliever
text: This is still a great movie for me. Verrryy fun and enjoyable to watch. Others boo-ing it just do not get the comedy sense of the movie. Such a shame.

title: Could've been amazing!!
text: Great movie but the comedy overshadowed the films true intention. I think it was a missed opportunity overall. Great characters that could've shined harder. I also feel like the storyline was all over the place. Good to see Thor back in action but sadly not like this. Who decided Thor was a comedian ? Just wow I'm grateful for the movie but disappointed in how everything played out.

title: cannot be taken seriously
text: An amazing performance from Christian Bale was wasted on this joke of a movie. At any moment, a drop of drama or suspense would disrupted by some try hard remark that made no sense to the scene.The Marvel community has attempted to adapt its characters to modern times, but this can have its downfalls. Thor's personality in Ragnarok was witty and new, but that movie knew when to tone down the corny parts to make it feel like a superhero film.Unfortunately, a lot of the important parts were lost under odd scenes that would build up and abruptly crash down after some stupid comment was made by one of the characters. Lacking consistency is one of my biggest pet peeves in a movie, but giving Love and Thunder a chance is not a bad idea.Natalie Portman and Chris Hemsworth have a natural chemistry you have to see on screen. Aside from a few issues, it's still a decent Marvel Movie which deserves at least one watch.

title: This isn't an action/adventure movie it's a comedy movie with silly overused jokes
text: The fact this movie is part of the mcu is absurd!If you really want to turn mcu movies into a comedy, do a better job in mixing action and comedy than they did here.And one last personal opinion: it wouldn't have saved this movie, but a movie about Thor doesnt feel thÃ© same without loki.

title: Why is everyone complaining??
text: I honestly thought it was a really good movie, I hadn't laughed so hard in a long time. I don't know why you people are complaining so much. Sure it doesn't set it up in any way but it was fun to me and my husband. Everyone in the theater was laughing and they seemed to enjoy it. The only movie that deserves terrible reviews is eternals.

title: Terrible movie, but fantastic acting by Christian Bale.
text: The movie were general TERRIBLE. I were disgusted by all of the miserable dad-jokes by Chris Hemsworth, the weird and not-funny Zeus and why the *bip* should Natalie Portman now play freaking Thor. title: I can't believe my eyes on how people are so critical & critique with this movie, but not with Marvel movies like Dr. Strange: MOM, Morbius, The 2 Thor films & Eternals.
text: It was an great & wholesome movie. It's was about Thor becoming an better & understanding of his life, himself and his place in the universe. It was an really fun ride that even my dad love it.This movie really earned an special place in my heart, I would rate it 9/10 for it's visuals, characters, The goats, handling serious topics like cancer, comedy(even though the jokes can't be funny), Bale's Gorr, the props & fight scenes only for the joykills & buzzkills for gave Taika & his movies harsh reviews.What made me very upset the most that they giving this movie 1 star reviews & videos about it being hot garbage all because Taika is an hack to the Thor movies according to their logic, and yet they gave Eternals, Morbius, Dark World & MOM 10 out of 10 for being directed by Raimi & Chloe, Morbius made some stupid memes about it's the best movie of all time & "It Morbin Time or Morbius made Morbillion Bucks , What an sad world we live in.We should be grateful that Taika directed these movies, otherwise Love & Thunder would been a flop just like 1/2: The Dark World.Like my mom always says: Form your own opinions & have fun.

title: Shark Jumped?
text:
Is this worse than the infamous studio interfered Dr Strange Mountains of Rubbish? Hmmm, borderline... but that should give you a good idea of where we are. Imagine a film full of all the bad bits of Ragnorak and you've got it. It's a shame - he's done some great work in the past but this is certainly not it.Can we please have the Taiki that delivered magic like What We Do In The Shadows, Hunt for the Wilderpeople, Eagle vs Shark - the very KIND Taiki that the world needs now!This is not that Taiki. This is a Taiki that has gone full unleashed Ego and this is not a good thing. His humour, which has always straddled the line falls largely misplaced this time, as it has none of the kindness and support of outcasts that go with it.There's huge bits where it needs acknowledgement of the irony... but none is given, and therefore we must take that the so called Good Guys are in fact just as much a bunch of murdering scum bags as the Bad Guys.Christian Bale's Gorr is a massively missed opportunity, from the opening scene - which has huge potential, the whole concept does.It's played by Christian Bale - one of the great actors of our age who make things shine, but here... well... it's all over the shop."Cram in another joke!"
Please don't... it doesn't work, and even worse it's inappropriate.Now... will kids love it? Most probably. So depending on what the target market is job done. However, as much as Disney will attempt to gaslight it's market post-fact whenever one of their awful misguided exec interfered rubbish gets the mauling it deserves and they act like the children the execs actually are that it really was only aimed at 8 year olds as was the original source - anyone that wasn't born yesterday know the target market for Marvel has always been 6+ all the way death.Will adults love it? Only the ones that don't want to think too much and have the sense of humour of an 8 year old.

title: Thor: Meh and Thunder
text: Man, oh man did I wish this movie was everything! The first trailer proved so hopeful!James Gunn and the Guardians; Meet Taiki Waititi and the back half of Thor: There is hardly a reason to go with "who gets creative authority".Just make it a group project and leave it at that.(Stop giving successful directors and/or writers almost-full control)Tessa Thompson was the best part of the film; Christian Bale fell short of dedication, character-development, and respect.After all, he was a gosh darn HUMAN in this movie.Hell, Natalie Portman's Jane Foster was better than Chris' main protagonistThis film was reminiscent of Dark Phoenix: A promise to the fans, yet turned harsh reality of an expensive movie with decent action sequences.I'm at a point where I believe RDJ and the Avengers development was what made the MCU so special and endearing.

title: I knew the Marvel kiddies wouldn't like it but us GROWNUPS did!! super fun film !!
text: I knew the Marvel little tykes wouldn't like this film cause it had 2 much humor and feeling rather than mindless action and macho crap. Bale was his usual BRILLIANT self he cant do a character and not steal every scene he is in and in every movie only time he was out done was Dark Knight and the villain ALWAYS out shines the hero. Loved the humor you cant get better than mixing comedy with any genre action/comedy horror/comedy THE BEST!! Hopefully we get a part 5 heck even Russell Crowe was hilarious. The whole theater was laughing and we all left after having a GREAT time and with the years weve had we NEEDED it !! Thank you to the WHOLE CAST AND CREW!!

title: Beware Thor's Backside is Naked!
text: I love Thor's Theatrical movies but I was shocked when Thor was naked. It is the part where Russell Crowe is on his Throne. The only part I didn't like was the women in those white outfits, which isn't sexy to me. The story plot was interesting and kept my attention throughout the movie. I loved the story where Jane and Thor, get together with a loving kiss. Awww However, I do miss his brother Loki. I'm glad Thor grew his hair back, he looks great! I don't think that any type of nudity is appropriate for children under 17 years old.

title: Seriously
text: This was... terrible. You can't have a film w/ so much comical relief that carries serious emotional motives & a villain that is a God killer. The elements for this film fell flat connecting any of it & it gets dumb quick. The chemistry between Jane & Thor is forced, they don't have a connection at all to even make it believable they do still even have feelings for each other. This film should have been dark, aggressive & emotional. Instead is overloaded w/ comedy expressed by every single character even by the extras, the tone is childish & the violence feels like there is absolutely no threat. This was tough to watch the longer it dragged on.

title: Very disappointing
text: Unfortunately Disney continues to ruin everything! They screwed up Star Wars, Pixar and now Marvel, very unfortunate as I lived Marvel comics. This movie and Dr. Strange in the multiverse are so bad it's not even funny! This was terrible. I've loved the Marvel movies so far, but this was a whole new level of bad. You know that feeling when you see someone do something super embarrassing, and you just feel uncomfortable? Yeah, I felt like that for most of this movie. It was like watching a bad high school parody. The jokes were poorly timed, the whole movie felt really off and the whole thing felt like a spoof the actors were in on. Glad I didn't waste my time and money seeing it in theaters .I won't be waisting my time or my money watching their movies anymore. I wonder if they will screw-up DeadPool 3?

Chris and rest of the cast made it fun and worth the escape. Not sure what other folks who didnt like it was hoping for. I think they may have issues with fun and being happy.

title: Just 1 or 2 laugh worthy movie nothing else
text: Movie is not upto the expectation. Was expected lot much from Gorr the god butcher but we get nothing. Taika thought its child's play literally. If same movie was to be shown with great details result could have been different.

title: Funny but too silly
text: I'm honestly a hardcore Marvel fan yet this movie was simply bad. I liked the jokes but sadly there were too many and that made the whole movie look silly to me. I liked the friendships between the characters but you can't really enjoy it because of the unnecessary jokes. I was disappointed:(

title: Toxic Fans, Get a Life?
text: I can't review the movie before reviewing the reviews. So many, so 'disappointed,' almost seems like reviews of people who watched the Thor film on their phones?Toxic fans take these special effects, consistent character actors, and stunt work for granted. It is a shame people watch pirated films on their phones and then complain that their image of a sequel isn't realized in the actual movie.

title: Thor is a joke. And not in a good way.
text: I dived into Thor: LAT with good hopes, despite the reviews, but still had to turn it off 30 minutes in.Firstly, dropping the Guardians in at the beginning was horrible. Chris Pratt looked like he'd been flown in for the day without any training or prep for the part and the rest of the team with very little to do bar flex their characters painted chops before waving to the audience and exiting stage left like some Christmas special.I honestly can't quite remember what happened beyond that aside from Waititi phoning in all the same tropes from the previous latter-Thor parady character skit. Naive, clumsy, arrogant, jolly Thor with his silly lines and childlike (childish?) wittering comedy skit. It's more SNL than Marvel. Awkward and unfunny. And once that comedy rock bloke starts chipping in the background, you realise you're just getting the comedy greatest hits from Ragnarok with none of the heart, peril or action desperately needed to bolster it up.Waititi clearly slid into first base with this one thinking he's hit a home run. Very arrogantly suggesting his quirky doesn't-take-anything-seriously is all we want to lap up. That's why he scored big with Ragnarok, right? That quirky cocktail of cheeky characters and awkward moments. You know that bit where two characters verbally tussle in an awkward comedy way? Thor thinks he's tougher than Hulk. Thor and Quinn's ego battle. These moments were funny as much as a joke is funny, but you don't get up on stage and tell the same joke over and over because it raised a smile once before. This injection of 'humour' is no more than an amateur comedian dying on stage to a room of groans. It completely misses the mark and I couldn't help feel that Waititi naively danced pied-piper-like into this movie believing his giddy audience would once again march to his one-note comedy tune like the dumb simpletons we are. Forget the typical Marvel formula or any real attention to bringing a worthy, original spectacle to the franchise. I doubt there was even a second's thought into giving fans the action blockbuster they expect. We're all just here to bow to Waititi: God of Quirky. The funniest guy in the room is here and you will laugh. Sorry, but no.The film reeks of poor planning and half-hearted production due to the sheer cockiness of the director's quirky (cheap, tired, clumsy, awkward) comedy routine hammering it past the finish line. It has all the impact of Bruce Banner diving confidently from the air expecting to land heroically as the Hulk, but all we get is the 'thunk' as he crunches head-first into the floor. No laugh, no pay off. Arrogant, ignorant and completely off-key, and rather than 'saving' the franchise, sadly cracks, if not shatters, the Marvel legacy.

title: Way better than the rating suggests
text: At times it felt like two different vibes, mostly because Christian Bale is unable to do any role "light" which made his scenes feel melodramatic. Russell Crowe on the other hand, stepped into a lighthearted role with zeal and he was awesome, which I wouldn't have expected. It had substance and levity. Definitely worth the watch.

title: a Comedy Movie
text: The only good things about this movie is the actions and CGI. The rest it just feels like a parody comedy film. As a marvel fan, I didn't enjoy it. It's a really bad MCU movie.

title: How not to make a sequel
text: I don't usually write reviews. But God it's so terrible. Perfect example of how not to make a sequel.Plot lacks a good story to begin with. It's more of a comedy and child show than a Marvel super hero movie.

title: Simply stellar
text: IncreÃ­ble all round. What a fun movie. And also such depth and darkness. Phase 4 is shaping the MCU next massive story to be bigger and better than the infinity saga. Every property so far has been fire.

title: Worst Marvel Movie
text: In my opinion, Love and Thunder is one of the worst Marvel movies. The plot is poorly executed and lacks emotional depth, while the jokes fall flat. The climax is underwhelming, and even the movie title is uninspiring. While I enjoyed some of the jokes, overall, it's a disappointing film.Christian Bale's performance is good, but he doesn't have enough screen time.In comparison, Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness was a good movie.I've noticed a decline in the quality of Marvel movies since Avengers Endgame, including Black Widow, Eternals, Doctor Strange 2, and Thor 4. I hope Marvel will return to their former glory.

title: All about the fun! Not a total disappointment!
text: This movie is a lot like Star Wars the Phantom Menace for me. Some might get annoyed that I compare this movie with that one but hear me out.Sure there are some outrageously silly and over the top things that can be annoying, a bit ridiculous, and out of left field, but it's all about the fun that the movie took me through with the action/fight scenes, the visuals/art that went into the movie, and also the villain (Christian Bale was GREAT and I really bought into his character!). This movie was very creative and I liked many of the decisions that the production team and the screenwriters made beyond the negative stuff (which I could mostly look past). I always like the character of Thor and while I wish I saw more of them, it was good seeing the Guardians of the Galaxy again too! I liked what they did with Thor and Jane and while not all of the humor landed some select things were funny! (The vending machine joke)

title: Weird
text: Everything felt weird!Thor's emotional journey was actually annoying for the better part of the movie, as his humour and reactions didn't fit. Actually all this humour didn't fit, as everyone tried to be the constant comic relief.Gor's whole existence on-screen won't take up more than 20 minutes, which is a great way to waste Christian Bale (acting spot on, could be as badass as Hela).Jane being Thor was interesting but never truly embraced by the movie, as she was needlessly goofy for no reason at all.Loved the colours and the music but the plot and the pacing (Dr Strange much?), were awful.Most of the scenes were simply fillers.I really loved Thor movies but I just couldn't see something so bad coming. Oh yeah, that post credit tidbit..please, just make it have more sense than this thing did.

title: A continuation of Ragnarok
text: Good movie. Don't listen to the haters; everyone's a critic today. If you liked Ragnarok, you'll enjoy this. Yes there comedy but there's also serious moments. It's a funny film where you'll enjoy.

title: Everything is a joke
text: After seeing the preview of the film, I was already afraid of what would await me, and unfortunately I was not disappointed. Thor's character was humiliated the most in this movie. I know some people didn't like his character in the very first Thor movie, but at least that changed by the end of the story. Oh and the story was interesting too. However, there is no story here, and no one should expect one. I understand that children are also part of the target audience, but serious topics were also replaced by a joke. Because the joke is good, it should be, right? But is it necessary in all cases? Do all characters have to be set up as silly and the seriousness is cheesy?Well, I definitely didn't get the sequel that it deserved and because of that I had a hard time watching the movie(cabaret). Of course, the sight was amazing, as we are used to from Marvel movies. The acting performance of the children was not good, but at least they had a good time on the set.I give this movie 3 stars and hopefully I'll forget I ever saw it.

title: Finally!
text: This movie got a lot of negative reviews because of the comedy but I believe this movie was a much needed break from all the heavy-emotional movies marvel has been putting out the last couple of years. It did feel a little rushed, it was obvious that some good needed scenes were cut off. Other than that, it was great to see Thor again! & to see him find a purpose again after all that he has been through!

title: Thor: Love and Thunder - A Lesson in Tonal Dissonance
text: Thor: Love and Thunder is a middle-of-the-road film. Chris Hemsworth, Tessa Thompson, and Natalie Portman all did a serviceable job with their performances and with the material given. The thing that sets this film back from joining the ranks of Thor: Ragnarok or other great MCU properties is in it's tone.This film conveys two opposing tones during it's runtime. On the lighter side of the tonal coin, we have the typical tropes we've come to expect. Quippy writing, glossy CGI visuals, and jokes galore. A lot of reviews on this film have talked about the jokes in Love and Thunder, and I watched it with that in mind. I found the main issue to be the frequency, not so much the quality. An average movie goer will enjoy most parts of this film.The deeper and darker tone is spearheaded in Christian Bale's Gorr the God Butcher. He really chews the scenery in any scene he's in and is sorely underutilized.While there is just enough connective tissue to hold the two halves of this film together, the dissonant and tug-of-war like nature of Love and Thunder really holds it back from being an MCU property I'd like to revisit soon.5/10.

title: Thor 'was' invincible. But not after this dreadful movie!
text: I was a big fan of the Marvel Comics Super Hero's, with Thor being one of those at the top of the list. But the company behind this movie, have just trashed Thor's reputation, probably irretrievably so.Thor is now a character that spouts childish jokes that are cringe-worthy. Jokes that must be predominantly aimed at 4 to 10 year old kids.It has all the trimmings that you would expect to see with your very young children when visiting one of Disney's Theme Parks. Overly saturated bright colours throughout, with plastic armour and clothing for everyone.Thor is dead to me now. Marvel Comics should be thoroughly ashamed of this abysmal movie!

title: Hilarious feel good unlike other marvel movies
text: This movie is probably receiving bad reviews from typical action/superhero fans but this movie is great. Chris/Thor shows a great amount of personality and wit. And the supporting characters work together greatly. The action scenes are not only endless fighting and are instead witty, fun and light.Visually it's also fun to see these kind of 2d scenes that reminds me of grand theatre shows or 2d games. It makes each scene feel like taken out of a comic strip.For anyone like me who's grown tired of typical superhero movies with endless fighting and cool catch phrases and tight spandex, then you're gonna love it.

title: Fun
text: People need to go buy a sense of humour. It's Thor! Since when has Thor ever been that serious. Yes its daft and a bit silly but that's nothing new and if you have watched previous Thor films this is very apparent. Me and my husband had a good giggle at this in parts whilst other parts were serious and meaningful. The end to me was slightly unexpected but on reflection it makes sense why they would do this. I take it the people who hated this film must also hate guardians of the galaxy as that's a bit silly too.....

title: Taika Waititi had an amazing material and botched it.
text: I was pumped for this movie because I LOVED Jason Aaron's comics. I love Natalie Portman as the mighty Thor and the whole idea around it. I think she's a wonderful choice for Jane Foster. But the movie is a mess. They had amazing material and the chance to show Jane Foster's Thor in all her glory but it ended up being a HUGH disappointment. I'm sad for the bad job they have done with Jane Foster in the MCU. She's a badass and doesn't get the right recognition. I loved Ragnarok and I wonder where Taika Waititi got lost doing this movie.

title: Very weak because
text: Didn't like almost anything beside the 'Jane' moment and rate it with a 4 just because it's UCM. The fun moments are too much and out of contest a lot of time. Story is good but it stays there as the movie does not go along. I Hope they don't repeat with the director.

title: Fast and fun
text: Loved it - fast-paced and hugely entertaining. Lots of awesome Waititi humour, but also a great action-adventure plot. I even enjoyed Natalie Portman in it, although I usually don't like her as an actor. I don't quite get those comments that say the story wasn't deep or serious enough... it's a dude in a glam viking outfit who fights with an oversized hammer - that's kind of a ridiculous premise and it's to the credit of Waititi, his cast and crew that they make the characters so incredibly engaging and likable.

title: Thank u taika for not doing the next thor
text: First i wanna start by thanking taika to not come back to direct the next thor movie !!!! Im so gratefull for this !!!! It is litterly the worst marvel movie out there ! I prefer al fantastic fours on replay then watchin this movie 2 times more ! Its such trash just skipp this movie if you love the mcu the only 2 good things are the music and the cgi and maybe the bad guy looks cool ....... i dont even wanna spoil anything cause its 2 bad to spoil tbh .... so the fact taika said im not comming back for another movie is a true blessing and maybe ...just maybe .... we can get another good thor movie.

title: Embrace the ridiculous and have a wonderful time.
text: Thor: Ragnarok was by far my favourite movie from the franchise and after reading the other reviews here, my expectations went downhill. This is the kind of movie where experience could be destroyed by the hype, so please give it a chance and go open minded.I see why the movie could be read as empty. There are so many jokes and a great chunk of them explore the movie's main theme. The message can get lost amidst the nonsense, but this movie is definitely NOT empty. It talks about loss and love in a fable-like set, bringing bold, heavy subjects through a wholesome but quick paced set. It doesn't give you time to suffer where you could, to a level that you even forget the drama because of a combo of silly jokes. But It feels GOOD! Life is not only about ups and downs, but also still manage to take the best out of it -This is something Taika is great at translating on his movie and with Thor, it just feels RIGHT. Maybe not the MCU movie fans wished for, but that's the Taika Waititi movie I wanted. Some of the acting feels almost theatrical sometimes but it fits well with direction and Hemsworth is having fun with exploring the sillyness. Christian Bale puts on a show with a believable and strong motivated villain, which balances the tone really well. Beautiful and well thought art direction, especially when the "MCU"greyness strikes. He translated everything to his own universe. Haven't laughed to the level of spitting out of ridiculous jokes for a while. They are nonsense at times, but most make sense and leads you to the movie's message. So if you liked Ragnarok's sillyness and childish humour, and want to have a great time, give it a chance and come to the theaters open minded.

title: Christian Bale saved this movie
text:
Christian Bale delivers a perfectly justified villain, perfect as always
I dare to say, he's the only one who actually acts in this movie, I already forgot everyone else.

title: By far the best Thor movie
text: Watched it twice and it gets better each time. The movie had heart, laughter and of course bad a$$ action scenes. Loved , loved , loved it all. Better then Doctor strange by far and that says a lot cuz I love Elizabeth Olsen.

title: This is so sad for MCU
text: Remember those photos of Taika Waititi, Rita Ora and Tessa Thompson? They looked like they were having a good time, quite high, completely relaxed.This film is actually a product of that relaxation. As if it was made by someone totally high and drunk, who is not aware of anything and everything is funny to him, even the little finger.If only we could forget him, but we can't, because the image of the cartoonishly Thor remains etched in our memory and will appear every time we watch all the earlier films where he appears. It's sad that someone approved this movie.And it's sad for those other directors who really put in the effort, whose films lost quality because of this Thor.

title: Take that Zeus
text: 10/10 absolutely amazing. Feeling blue? Come watch Thor. Did not feel rushed. It was a comedy, an action movie, mixed with a l feel good love romcon. You need to get away from everyday life? Come watch it.

title: God of blunder
text: A clunker. I can't even explain the first hour. Awkward slapstick until it became a super hero movie during the last 20 minutes. Zeus is such a minor part of Thor arcs, very confusing to insert here. At least Iron Man 3 tied to real arcs. This story was not a proud enhancement to Thor lore, is was a muddled mistake.

title: Disappointing like the rest of phase 4
text: I felt hugely disappointed. Taika Waititi exaggerated with the comedy, you can't have a movie with a tragedic villain like Gorr focusing so much on comedy. The story is very shallow, doesn't take the whole MCU lore anywhere just like the rest of phase 4, and Gorr doesn't get enogh screen time. If Feige's barrel is empty, maybe they should reboot the MCU already with Xmen and fantastic 4.

title: Screams in Goat
text: This was was a great, comedic, love story, that happened to have superheroes in it. Anyone who doesn't like this movie forgot how to have fun. Brilliant!*screams in goat*

title: Betrayal of Marvel Universe
text: If their intention was to produce the worst film of the whole Marvel Universe, then they succeeded. Truly appalling predominance of attempted humour that always failed to raise the corner of a mouth. It's been a betrayal of all who invested in the previous offerings. Only a few truly demonic scenes worked but 90% was made up of hackneyed dad jokes. Perhaps all involved didn't want to make another so chose to make such dross. Great fantasy is supposed to enthral and suspend disbelief. This latest offering just makes us cringe and have a sense of annoyance that we can't get the lost 2 hours back. From the first Thor which was magnificent, each subsequent film has offered increasing attempts at lame humour, until Love & Thunder which is achingly bad. Why oh why. The premise of the story had such great potential, with the agonised menace of Bale's character, to the tragedy of Portman's character. Instead someone thought let's make a comedy, where none should have been. 2/10 reflected the effects, which as usual where superb.

title: Fun but ultimately disappointing.
text: The movie was comprised of a bunch of scenes someone thought was funny or had good action, and stitched together with a generic villain plot line. Some of the scenes were entertaining, but when everything is made to be a joke or isn't taken seriously, nothing in the movie has any weight behind it.I also feel like nothing was explained, or at least it was explained poorly. Things would just happen and as the audience we simply have to say "okay" and just roll with it into the next comedy sketch scene.

title: Who is Thor?
text: A disappointment to say the least. Thor who, from what I've felt so far, has been a serious but funny dude comes off as stupid and childish in this film. In the beginning I hoped that it was the narration by Korg that we saw completely over exaggerated and over the top. But it was the actual events of the film; over exaggerated and over the top. It's a silly movie that misses out on every moment that could've been impactful. Looking back at the earlier films with genuine moments and seriousness makes this a joke towards itself.

title: Fun from start to finish
text: This is a great movie. Loved every minute of it. It was so much fun to watch and I can't believe they actually kept it that way all through the movie. The touching moments were great as well. Good acting, good story and great performances from the entire crew.

title: Such a disappointment ðŸ˜¥
text: I tend to be forgiving of both DC and Marvel movies because I am such a big fan. I enjoy some aspect of all of them, even the not so good ones. I simply do not know what they hoped to accomplish with this film. Reminded me of the old Robin Hood, Men in Tights. It was intended as a comedy parody of the original Robin Hood, nothing more, and I thought it was enjoyable. Seems this was intended as a comedy parody of the series, but was neither funny nor well thought out. This is harsh, but in my opinion it was the worst movie I've ever seen, and I've entertained some pretty bad movies.

title: The worst of all Marvels
text: Usually, I'm a fan of all Marvel movies... I even like to see the less successful ones again, but here... Honestly, this is the worst of all Marvel!It is even much worse than "Thor: The Dark World" which was the one that held this sad place in the ranking of Marvel films. At least he had the merit of respecting the basic material.Outside in Love & Thunder, the God of Thunder has become a crass betise, bordering on eating hay.Worse: the so-called "humor" of the film is at the level of what you can expect from a bad (and more) abominable spuff movie.And it's a shame because there are good ideas and exciting characters: (Gorr in the lead) has a really very interesting development potential. Same for Russel Crow's paunchy and decadent Zeus, but... This city of Gods? What the hell is this f.... idea? Has Olympus, like Asgard, also been completely destroyed?And then, wanting to stick his clumsy and sticky humor everywhere, TaÃ¯ka WaÃ¯kiki manages to scuttle his entire film with heaps of easter eggs of a subtlety equivalent to that of an incontinent one-legged Mammoth and even the immense talent of Christian Bayle like that of Russel Crow (who, however, we see, do everything they can) like that of most other actors, moreover, are not enough to save a film scuttled by a director who manages to do everything miss, scene after scene...And Marvel would like to entrust him with the sequel (and end?) of Thor? I hope they will change their minds soon because the God of Thunder does not deserve such an inglorious end!To say, it's the very first time, in a Marvel film, that I would have liked to be able to skip certain passages of the film.After a Dr Strange 2 that I really liked, it's a bad slap in the face that I took with this movie which is nothing more than a huge disappointment!

title: It's a good movie !!!
text:
Yes, i don't understand the hate and the low rating... it has some silly moments and scenes but it was a very good one... it has comedy, i mean a lot of comedy... it has emptions, it has amazing soundtrack, great great villain and performance by Christian Bale, good performance from Natalie Portman also...
The first half was a silly funny part but things gets more serious and darker at the second and better half of the movie. So dont't trust the rating that it holds right now, clearly is a way better movie than the second one.Watch it and see for yourselves that you will enjoy this movie very much.8.0 / 10.

title: Batman meets Thor = both loose
text: Another proof of decline in Marvel productions.Thor and Jane acting was great but the script or maybe direction was throwing it down too hard.Were it not for two randomly (and too often) screaming goats I would probably fallen asleep. I mean what happened ?I loved the reprise role of Matt Damon.Love story of the Thor and Jane was reduced to two minutes drama dialogue in hospital but instead we got lovestory between Thor and his axe. No kidding.The famous God Butcher butchered exactly one meaningless god and even that wasnt intentionally. Great actor as Bale was totally wasted on character despite him doing great.Hatred for all gods into "trust me bro" and "whatever, I didnt even care" in the end. That made no sense.The kid army was a surprise. I didnt see that coming.And I would like to see the sane (or any at all) person who would build theme candy shop based on mad maniac (Thanos) who almost wiped all life from universe ? Infnity ice cream or whatever. Iron Man must be staring from grave and be like : are you kidding me ?

title: WHAT is everyone complaining about?
text: This movie was hillarious, self-depricating, had lots of fun cameos/supporting characters, interesting visuals, great soundtrack, some half-decent attempts at promoting diversity and representation, Norse mythology references, and fun fight scenes: in sum, a fun summer movie to enjoy with popcorn. Honestly, don't know what everyone is whining about: Taika Waititi made you a fun movie to enjoy, just say thank you!

title: Falls flat, unfortunately
text: Although I think the lead actors put on a great performance, this movie fell flat for me. The plot wasn't very deep. I really liked Christian Bales performance, would have liked to learn more about his character. I don't get why Thor has become such a dad joke character...they did the same with Zeus. It's just dumb. This could have been so much better.

title: A Silly Marvel Movie
text: For the first 10 minutes of this movie I didn't know what to make of it. It seemed like it was a joke, sort of silly, and then it would get serious. But it never did. It didn't even seem like it fit with the first Thor movie - it is night and day different. The screaming goats in this movie looked like they were bad special effects from the 80s. And really! Screaming goats...wow. There were also some hairy birds that Thor was fighting in a silly way - and those hair birds looked like something from the Muppets. I have to admit I didn't finish watching this because it was silly. Just a silly waste of time. The new Ant Man was also bad. Wow, MCU is done for.

title: an enjoyable movie
text: It was a little different and enjoyable than the other films in the series. The Zeus scenes added a different joy to the movie. And the news that Hercules will be involved in the new thor episode, which has been eagerly awaited. But the efforts to show all the heroes of marvel as a whole series do not find their place. Each movie caused a discontinuity with the other movie. For example, Thor's ax is smaller in other series, and it has a series of negativities such as being big in this production. But when you try to watch every series like a new movie, this is the most enjoyable episode among Thor's series. Another issue that I will look forward to in the new thor series is walhala.

title: Jokes Went Overboard
text: This movie attempts a lot in terms of jokes and scope but ultimately falls flat. The recurring goat joke got really old fast. Ragnarok was a perfect medium but taika went to far with the jokes here.

title: Very good movie
text: This is little les that I was excepting but still a good movie.we can watch it and this contains many bad jokes but they can try to make it better.i hope this helps and Gorr is very weak in this movie.

title: Like a terrible parody of a Marvel movie
text: No story really, no plot timing, none of the comedy is actually funny, and there is way too much of it. CGI was executed ok but there wasn't good flow between scenes or it seemed rushed and colors were oversaturated.I liked Marvel because they would have a bit of comedy in an otherwise more serious action movie and wouldn't always take themselves too seriously (compared to DC for example). But this is just way too much, it's a hot mess and everyone just phoned it in on this one. I think it's the worst Marvel theatrical release I've seen. Whoever green lighted this should be fired.The only decent character and actor I would say was Bale.

title: Wildly fun!
text: Hilarious, sad, & tons of fun. Insanely well-crafted villain. The humor blends with the story & emotion. Great colors & lack of color. The mythological additions are awesome with beautiful set design.

title: No idea why people are not liking it... I loved it
text: Saw Thor : Love and Thunder, and felt that it was a really good movie. The jokes were not a lot, as against what people are saying. The acting by all cast members was amazing and visually it was spectacular. My suggestion for people would be to re-watch it with an open mind and it will surprise you.

title: What the **** did I just watch?
text: Why did they make a PG-13 movie that was obviously aimed at the 13 and under crowd? The attempt at humor was poor and done way too often. The action was frequently lifeless. After 2 hours, you are left perplexed at what you just watched and why you bothered.I think the problem comes from the Writer and Director being the same person and not wanting to admit any mistakes. Or maybe not being able to step back and see that what was written was not working. Producer Kevin Feige gave Waititi way too much leeway and not enough supervision even though financially this movie will be seen as a success.Christian Bale was excellent but the rest of the cast seemed lifeless and uncomfortable with the characters they had to portray. As silly as Ragnarok was at times, it shined compared to this piece of drivel.They should leave the comedy to the Guardians of the Galaxy who are much better equipped for it.

title: ENJOYABLE, IT CAN EVEN CAPTURE YOUNG KID'S HEARTS
text: I've read a lot of unbelievably negative reviews here about how this film made a huge disappointment. I thought to myself, why so serious? Chill!Me and my husband went home laughing and can't stop talking about all of our favourite scenes! Because there's really a lot! I even have new favourite characters/beings? Haha I'm not going to put any spoilers.It's so different from the other first two Thor Movies which are a bit darker and more serious but amazing of course! We are so happy how Thor can be so flexible!Thor didn't become a joke, he learned how to chill all thanks to his buddies!- Guardians of the Galaxy! Remember this awesome group? They're hilarious! (This is my own theory hehe).The movie is super funny and definitely NOT EMPTY! Cinematography and special effects were great, the sound track awesome, great acting from all casts- from the legend Christian Bale to the youngest cast! It is action packed, scary at times but also funny, romantic and cute! It is so balanced that it is enjoyable from start to end! Even CHILDREN will love watching it!Kudos to Director Taika Waititi! I don't want to put any spoilers but-if you've seen the movie you can read all the cool trivia behind it. You'll love it even more because it is special!

title: Very Disappointed
text: A kids movie at this point. Utterly upset at how this has come out. We could all agree that Ragnarok was a great hit and the new 'version' of Thor was funny yet also serious. For Love and Thunder, it's as if Thor doesn't know what serious means. He seems to be joking around at all times even whilst the lives of people around him seem to be in imminent danger. So upsetting at how marvel movies have become now. I miss the Thor in the earlier movies. The Thor that argued with his father about wanting to go fight in Jotunheim. This Thor is a child in a man's body. Wasted 2 hours of my time. Should've honestly just watched Minions.

title: What happened to marvel??
text: What happened to marvel movies?This movie is poorly acted, poorly scripted. It tries so hard to be funny, that it ruins the movie. It's cringe, bland.Absolute rubbish, I can't believe I spent ten years watching marvel movies for the action, storyline, serious villains and plot. To build an epic Avengers saga.Only for that to crumble.The villain is cool, has heaps of potential... Unfortunately it's wasted.Ragnarok was funny, because it didn't try too hard and was a refreshing change of pace to the saga, should never have been used as a platform for more of that style.The political correctness was inserted into the movie, again throwing LGBTQ into our faces... Gotta have one in each movie these days.

title: Marvel movies are ruined
text: What on earth was this film? I'm a huge marvel fan the Thor films are normally my favourite marvel movies but this is the worst one of them all. For some reason every scene they are trying to be funny and make it a comedy. The whole thing is a joke from start to finish it is not a marvel film. Also why are all the male characters acting really camp, its like they have all turned into women. The main story line is actually really good but the whole film is ruined from the comedy attempt. One thing I can say is if you like Romantic Comedy films you will really enjoy this one. Because thats what this film is, a Romantic Comedy.

title: This movie has everything
text: I loved every second of this movie. It was never slow or boring. It made me laugh and cry, entertaining and endearing. There were nice surprises throughout, and it was the perfect mix of comedy and action. Definitely one of my faves!

title: Tiresome and silly
text: Occasional silly humour can be effective in marvel movies to ensure the movie doesn't take itself to seriously. In this case the silly humour was relentless and tiresome and conversations to long. The acting was sloppy and almost purposefully amateurish. Could not help but roll my eyes at the writers insistence to introduce a woke message into every movie and series. The Big let down. Worst movie in the franchise.

title: My Scorecard (8.5)
text: Hard Rock and witty lines, loss and love, melancholy and comedy.Marvellous oxymoronic plot, rendered in an astonishingly visual way.This movie has it all, it remembers me of the first Deadpool movie, it was funny, it was sad, it had "thank god it all ended well" and "there are no real bad people, just broken ones" vibes.From CGI to acting, from goat memes to fatty Zeus, it all was a worthy homage to internet pop culture and real superheroes movies.This is what i look for if I want to see a Marvel movie. This is what I suggest to watch when you are with a group of friends. This is why cinema is still cinema and can never be beaten by television.Crazy good film, Super entertaining._____________________________________________SCORECARDIn a range from 1 to 5, i'll give a value to each entry written below. The final mark will be the weighted sum of each fraction:Subject (2.5) = 4/5 Development of the Subject (1.5) = 5/5 Direction/Screenplay (2) = 5/5 Attention (1) = 5/5 Recitation (1.5) = 5/5 Musical Score (0.5) = 5/5Final Mark: (2.5 x 4/5) + (1.5 x 5/5) + (2 x 5/5) + (1 x 5/5) + (1.5 x 5/5) + (0.5 x 5/5) = 8.5.I gave 9 cos i liked the film.

title: MCU on its way out
text: Way too much stupid comedy.Thor was a bad cross between Homelander and Boris Johnson. Plain and simple a baffoon.They wasted Hulk and their doing the same with Thor.It was a bit ott on the woke elements.Needs stripping back a bit and probably get a new director with new ideas.

title: What have they done with Thor.
text: Sad what they did to Thor. In Ragnarok Thor was funny, but he wasn't dumb. They turned him into that weightlifter guy "I pick 'em up and put em down" in Swartzenegger voice. Doh. Had potential if they hadn't made Thor such an idiot.

title: Loved it!
text: I feel as though people are mad at this movie for 3 reasons. Some say it tried too hard to be funny. I thought it succeeded most of the time. Then several are mad that they keep adding females to it. Who cares? The Mighty Thor and Valkyrie are in the comics. The last one is the only grip worth griping about. This film needed more Christian Bale. The MCU as a whole could have really benefited from casting him somewhere else like Khan the Conqueror. Another great addition to the MCU!

title: Parody
text: Although I appreciate taikas houmor, I believe it doesn't have to be implemented in every single second of the film.It also seemed more like a parody, rather than an actual super hero movie. I understand, that making super heroes seem more human, with flaws etc, brings them closer to the viewer, but you don't have to make them look like a complete fail. Plus a lot scenes felt a bit childish.Bales performance was incredible though.

title: A feel good movie ðŸ¿ðŸŽ¥
text: I don't understand the bad ratings. It's making me wonder if I saw the same movie. I really enjoyed it and appreciated the comedy aspect. It had sad moments too but it wasn't too soppy. This was exactly what I needed to unwind and laugh. I didn't get bored once. I also enjoyed the combination of actors.

title: Totally Disappointing Movie
text: I was so disappointed with this movie. I love Marvel movies and Thor has always been my favourite character. This movie was full of stupid, unfunny humour. They have turned Thor into an idiot instead of the mighty god of Thunder. I was very close to walking out of this one. I don't think I will bother watching the next one.

title: Mediocre at best
text: This movie feels like what would happen if you offered a bored taika waititi a bunch of money and told him to make a marvel movie. He dosen't care about the story, characters or overall continuety with other marvel movies. All he does is throw in a bunch of jokes, simple story lines that aren't developed at all and then calls it a day. All that is left for the audience is a move that feels too short, undeveloped, lacks a consistent tone and has a story with characters that are overall really hard to get invested in.

title: Worst marvel movie ever saw
text: I don't know how anyone put more than 1, the only who works here is Christian Bale which make an amazing job, but its like he was in a different movie, seems the only one who is taking seriously his role here. The rest is like the were in a different movie The tone, role's, script, anything has sense here.I can say without any doubts: They cut me 2 hours of my life that I could have used in a better way; its so bad in so many ways that I want to look someone to guilt: but No, is not the director, no, the real guilty here are the producers and executives who allows providing money to this crap, they are evil, evil human beings.

title: Give it a chance
text: Read all the neg reviews and nearly didn't watch it, but really glad I did. Is it perfect? No. Is there to many silly jokes and gags? Yes.BUTIt also had great action, effects on point, emotion and hands down the coolest villain MCU has had... Bale was awesome and GORE was good enough to have been a multi-movie villain.

title: It's a joke. A bad one.
text: This movie is a complete joke. There isn't a shred of seriousness taken in any part of this movie save for the first few minutes. It's actually impressive how little care was taken with this property. It's like Marvel gave Taika Waititi free reign and Marvel clearly didn't care what the end result would be. And it's hard to actually critique any one element of this movie because it's all so stupid. Acting, action, plot...it's all very meaningless in a movie such as this. Even the actors deliver their lines like they could give two sheets. I'm writing this as I'm watching it-and it just gets dumber as it goes-it really is shocking how silly and bad this movie is.This second iteration of the Marvel Universe is troubling. Its a Universe where characters are nothing but titles, easily transferred from one person to another. A universe where all the male characters...are now female...somehow...and all at the same time even. A Universe where you care little what happens ....or who it happens to. And, if this Thor movie is any indication, Marvel fans are going to be in for a bumpy ride. There used to be a time where it was unthinkable to miss a Marvel movie. I haven't gone to see a Marvel movie since Iron Man died....and as near as I can tell, I won't be for a couple of years at best.I just can't believe how bad this movie is......

title: Logic, history and respect murdered
text:
Poor comedy ruined the whole legacy.... For now...
Thor's struggle through his emotions made him look like a teenager. Maybe it was made for younger generation to connect with but the makers can't just show anything to grab attention of certain age group because after all he's a God who knows that he's a God.... Mighty Zeus was portrayed as if he was gay... How else could you fail? Could have been much better if they knew the depth of emotions shown in the film. After all they had Christian Bale with them... They could make a masterpiece but there it is, a poor comedy film in the end.. Casting, Editing, acting, all good but few points less for screenplay... made me sad.

title: Worst Marvel
text: The Karizma and Power of Thor is totally wasted this time... I think Hollywood is going on the path of Bollywood and will see a Major set back in coming future if it not corrects it.... Now MCU's movies feel liked money making projects and not for Creating Good Cinema..

title: An over-the-top Thor adventure
text: The first act is told as a legend, an "Epic Thor Adventure," we're told. The dialogue and action are often heightened like a play. The choice is over-the-top and fun. Or, depending on expectations, too odd and silly.Jane shows up and things settle into the main arc (there's still a love triangle between weapons). The ending pulls its threads into a story about love and loss. It's a fast movie. And while never narratively grounded, it's emotionally grounded. The ending has all the heart that was missing from Dr. Strange's arc. *Love and Thunder* is focused on fun, but maybe people don't want fun out of their summer superhero films anymore? We'll have to see.

title: Weakest of the Thor series
text: Choppy scenes and overdone humor make what could have been a really great movie into a just tolerable film. Christian Bale as Gorr is really a wonderful performance-when you see him. The movie wastes too much time on corny jokes and a weird narrator. Not worth a rewatch. I'll stick with the first three!

title: Thought its paw patrol...
text: Maybe I'm grown out of the Disney Marvel stuff; anyhow - never seen such a bad movie since Eternals, AntMan 3 and the latest Star Wars.The effects are like made by a schoolboy, story? No story at all. And the characters seem to live by their past. Only Bale does what he is well known for: acting like a star. He should be Thor maybe as he understands how to be cool, anyway.It all feels like a parody but not a movie anymore. Would not be wondering if the next step on Thor 4 would be a comic strip in the New York Times.No wonder that Disney made a loss of 9bn. $ since launch. It's a pity...

title: Exaggerated
text: Bad story, comics, scene, mixed feelings that spoiled my night. I don,t recommend at all, worst sentiment I had in my all life about this movie.No sense or story from start to end. Feel disappointed.

title: Great movie that most people overlook because of the comedy
text: Thor Love and thunder was a great movie for me and for majority of the story I enjoyed it even when it was dull it brought me back with stronger scenes but the problem that people have with it is that it's a marvel movie and people really only want it to be serious even though it's a comedy/action movie. The main reason I liked the movie so much was because of the symbolism and the accuracy to the comics with the main villain having a similar backstory to the comic version. It seems as though since it's a stage 4 mcu movie people immediately think it's bad without even watching it even though in my opinion it's one of the top 10 marvel movies out at this time. People should stop hating on a movie because of too much comedy even though the movie in question got more action focused when the action started and maybe people should actually pay attention to symbolism in movies Instead of always thinking like a brick wall.

title: Marvel by National Lampoon
text: This is the first movie I've reviewed here, and I had to do it because this movie was such a let down. I didn't realize National Lampoon was making marvel movies now! Thor has always been my favorite character even through the first two movies, but this movie turns him into a complete joke. When you have a villain this serious you can't have Thor apologizing to his axe for thirty minutes of the movie (which he does). I hope they don't make another Thor stand alone movie if this is how it's going to be!

title: Thor the bore
text: How can this film get so many good reviews?am I missing something? It was total cgi drivel.only good part of the film was seeing Thor naked, total rubbish.

title: Good, not great....
text: Just like Ragnarok, there are laughs aplenty and some great cameos in Love and Thunder. Unlike Ragnarok, there isn't really that much of a story and the genuine excitement comes in dribs and drabs. In short, the good is great, the not so good is pretty average. And here's why...If - and I guess it's really 'when' - there's another Thor movie, we need to wrestle the reins away from Taika Waititi. Great though he is, his comedic take on Thor has now run its course. We need a more serious approach to the god of thunder from this point onwards. Ragnarok had that balance perfectly, Love and Thunder leans too heavily on the humour. This obviously suits Chris Hemsworth but its to the detriment of the story here. Full marks to Christain Bale, whose Gorr the god butcher is an excellent villain, but we needed more of the drama his character brought to the story.So, good not great. We need more of Thor and less of the rest next time out, please.

title: Just no!
text: Where should I begin? I don't know what happened, but my god, I have the impression that this movie hates itself. There really needed to be a joke every 2 minutes, at least if they were good, but out of 100 I smiled at about 5,the goats were better than anything else in this movie, not to mention that Thor as a character is completely destroyed, a completely different character from the one I knew. Poor special effects, good villain wasted, generic story and stupid ending lead to one of the worst movies in the MCU. Thor: Love and Thunder is an unfunny joke that I don't want to remember anymore, I don't know what's going on at Marvel these days, but they seriously need to wake up!

title: Not great but...
text: I'll admit this movie didn't have a well written story. In fact, some plot points were pretty lazy and downright silly. However, I did laugh a LOT, I cheered a few times, there were a few great surprises, Bale's character was SO creepy, and I thought it had a good ending.Compared to some other new movies in the past year, I'd say Thor: Love and Thunder was one of the few I've found to be very entertaining. Sometimes a good movie doesn't need to be a "thought provoking blockbuster" to be worth the money.Ok, apparently I have to add more for this review to be long enough to submit. Hopefully this is enough.

title: Boring
text: This wasn't just bad, it was embarrassingly bad. It was boringly bad. What is going on with Disney? There seemed to be no story line or any substance whatsoever. Marvel used to be fun, now they're just boring and dumb. The attempts at jokes was as bad as the movie.
