Needless to say, I had to fast forward this one several times to be able to get past some scenes. And lo and behold, that ending - what a shocker (not).Disney needs to get back to basics. Marvel movies are about super heroes, not mamsy pamsy characters that just make one mistake after another.This one was just another huge disappointment.

title: Not half as bad as I expected.
text: I held off watching this simply because of the terrible reviews. However,after watching it,I regret doing so. I liked it. Yes,the general premise of the film is shaky but its a rare superhero flick that doesnt suffer from that problem. Is it dumb in places? Yup. It's certainly very colourful,bordering on psychedelic,and while this has upset many fans I enjoyed this. Mighty Thor? Beyond annoying a few teenage fans I dont see the problem with this character and thought she fitted in well. I also didnt think the "jokiness" was at all intrusive. Sure enough they dont always work but for me worked more often that not.Personally I would put this just after Ragnarok as the best of the Thor stand alone films. The first Thor was,I thought,a big disappointment while Dark World improved a bit but not much. Ragnarock was a big step up and this is not far off that IMO.All hail Mighty Thor!

title: Shame, disaster.
text: This is the first time I write a review, but I can't forget my disappointment and horrible emotions once I leaved the cinema. Expectations were too high, but the reality .. The whole movie there was an expectation that kinda "something's gonna happen now" but it didn't, and that's it. It's a disgusting hero movie. And how come Zeus is related with the Thor?!!!!!!!!

title: Not so bad after watching a few times!
text: Just edited my harsh previous review to a kinder and more forgiving one. I just watched this for the third time because honestly sometimes there is nothing else even having Disney, Prime and Netflix! I have to say that it's growing on me! Yes it's silly and hilarious but also deep and loving ! Natalie Portman is good as usual and the rest of the cast also does a good job! I guess we'll just have to look back at this version as being the silly one. The CGI are as usual amazing. I'm hoping for another instalment of the Thor saga and believe there are plenty of possibilities for a really good one ! Meanwhile I'll keep watching the existing ones!

title: Absolute trash
text: Forced humor, lazy script, terrible acting, overstuffed with nonsense. No one asked for this film. Another ball drop by Marvel. Thumbs down all around.Forced humor, lazy script, terrible acting, overstuffed with nonsense. No one asked for this film. Another ball drop by Marvel. Thumbs down all around.Forced humor, lazy script, terrible acting, overstuffed with nonsense. No one asked for this film. Another ball drop by Marvel. Thumbs down all around.Forced humor, lazy script, terrible acting, overstuffed with nonsense. No one asked for this film. Another ball drop by Marvel. Thumbs down all around.

title: Fantastic experience
text: This is exactly what I was expecting. I was longing for more of of the witty jokes from the mind of Taika Waititi. Love and Thunder brings amazing action scenes, touching moments and great music.

title: Pathetic
text: They should have warned us. We were looking forward to this THOR-Movie for quite some time now ... expecting a "real" THOR-Movie. Now ... without warning ... it's only a parody ... a bad one ... dragging the Brand Value of THOR down the drain. The whole flick, including the unbarably lame humor seems to target a whole other target group. It's a slap in the face for real MARVEL-Fans. In some scenes I even thought ... was this a vain attempt to bring Monty Python humor to the MCU? Even the CGI was below MCU--standards. THOR will be back? How will he recover from that?

title: Really really bad.
text:
Tried to be funny but wasnt. Tried to he an action movie but wasn't. This has really made me question watching any new marvel movies in future. If this is where the MCU is headed... I'm out!At their rate I'll be switching to DC, and that's saying something...
So so bad. Bring back action and proper character development. Totally pointless movie. Not funny at all just one cheesy cheap gag after another. I'm really disappointed what they have done with the characters. Stop this nonsense in its tracks now. Bring back the old MCU.... I really miss it. Whoever is responsible for this trash hang your head in shame!Avoid avoid avoid.

title: I enjoyed (in my opinion)
text: Just go for it ! I am not 'that matured' to give a 'matured' review of this film but as far as I had seen (I watched in 4dx) it was a roller coaster ride with strong effect. A fun loaded entertainer !

title: a Thor movie without Loki? at least give us a good script.
text:
Cheap humor terrible script, bad direction
Even if the quality of the movie was not so bad, I still could not be satisfied. Bcz Personally, I don't think you can have a Thor movie without Loki
You can't remove Thor's best feature, his brotherly relationship with Loki, and expect to not lose the audience that often loves Loki.I wish at least when they removed Loki, they didn't replace him with a Loki-like clown .I mean I wouldn't die if Loki wasn't in the movies, but Loki tends to be a lot of people's favorite part of the movies (especially Thor 1 + 2, and even in Thor 3), so I don't think it'd be a smart move to not include him.I think it's sad, but I think it might be better not having him in. If they just want to make a joke-Loki or a Loki everyone hates which is what they did with Thor himself. Thor love and thunder was all joke.

title: It's so much better than trailer
text: I missed the movie because of the stupid trailer, which focuses on the most stupid and not interesting moments of the movie and gives you a wrong impression of what it would be. Trailer I've seen totally misses the point of the movie. I missed the movie also because of the Thompson's tweet.But the movie is nothing like that. It has some stupid agenda moments, but they're not main idea (good for Marvel). I decided to give this movie a try after I watched The Marvels and liked Danvers which is woman who acts like woman, feminine woman, strong real WOMAN. Not the masculine woman type. Not sure what's the Marvel's plan with this woman though, but if too much agenda will appear, I will dump Marvel movies. They made a huge mistake with Eternals main character, I don't care about race or skin color (except for Snow White, her name tells why ðŸ˜„), but choosing an actress that don't know to act just because of the race is what I call posing. Few other actors were the ones saving movie. But let's see how it goes.Now, back to Love and Thunder. It is so much better than The Marvels. It's still not old good Marvel movie, but screenplay is not crooked. Also how movie is directed is much better also. Acting is better. Humor is in place like in good old Marvel movies. I now regret I missed it in the cinema. Not sure though that I would watch it for the second time. But it's definitely worth at least the first time.

title: Five minutes in
text: This is complete garbage. As the seconds tick by i get more and more angry watching this nonsense. Seriously what is this supposed to be? The last thor film was incredible, but this is just worthless. The me too woke things are something i thoroughly enjoy seeing in every single movie thats made these last few years. Thor wearing eyeliner is a fantastic touch to this already incredible piece of cinematic gold. My god i dont think i can get through this. The acting is awful. Its like the filming of this movie was a party and the cast didn't care to try at all. The dialog is poorly written at best. This is crap. Dont waste your time. Good lord please hollywood make some movies that are worth watching.

title: Bake amazing. Teaches them how to act.
text: Terrible movie. Terrible acting (besides bale). Terrible dialogue. Overall a waste of time and I want my money back.Terrible storyline/plot - seriously. Is this it for the MCU?

title: A great laugh in the series.
text: People are complaining that there were too many jokes for the film, but I think they are just caught up in the whole marvel hype. If you watch it as a Taika Waititi film rather than yet another marvel film you should know what to expect. Great film, most scenes felt like they had a purpose but also featured some light goofy humour, which is what separated the later Thor films from the series.

title: I wanted to live it but I couldn't
text: It's Tor! And only thing I get out of this movie that is kids are the hero's. Ok, it's a kids movie. I got fooled. Do marvel is now only do childrens entertainment? It had its fun moments but it's a family movie and I expected more. Children will never be heroes because they are children! Not even Tor is Tor anymore because the she human are?! And love, bad guy have one wish and he makes a small egocentric one on while having bad conscience. And Tor get with a daughter and happy ever after. Can't take it anymore. I'm done. I get the love andb family. But i want a northern god with action. Only good thing was Zeuz in the end. Are we not gods anymore? And from having to write 150 characters now we need to write 600 characters. I'm guessing it's because we should give up complaining about bad movies and shows now days. I will just fill upp the with 3 stars. Or after thinking about it. I give it a weak 2.

title: Not very good but not really bad
text: This movie is not what Marvel fans expecting. Some parts of this movie is really amazing and fun to watch but other some parts is very boring. We want our old Thor back, MCU make Thor a comedian. I don't think Taika Waititi is really serious about this movie.

title: Not that good.
text: I only gave it two stars for the two times I laughed. The humor was baboon type humor. Again, Disney cares more about being woke than they care about the actual script. If you are extremely conservative you must be prepared to know It had constant references to same sex relationships. Russell Crowe had a decent character, but definitely not a clean character . It's not for children under 8yrs old or younger, unless you want to have some awkward talks with your child. I am glad I did NOT purchase a movie ticket...and I'm glad iv canceled Disney Plus. I only watched because my subscription runs out this October.

title: Drama ruined for the sake of comedy
text: Love and Thunder, in my opinion, was very underwhelming. Ragnarok was a great movie, one of the best MCU movies, it balanced comedy and drama very well, this movie, does not. It's all over the place.The editing is choppy and scenes feel very rushed. The story is bland and uninteresting. It isn't bad, there are some good moments here and there, like some of the Jane stuff is pretty good and the flashbacks with her and Thor add much needed layers to their relationship. But that is all this movie has going for it. There was potential for an emotional movie here, with scenes that could have been real tear jerkers, but each of these scenes were ruined by some stupid, non funny joke. Taika is a pretty funny writer, but here his jokes fall flat 80% of the time. Chris is good with his line delivery, as always, but everyone else? Nope.Then there is the CGI... What has happened to the MCU movies after endgame? Aside from No way Home, every Marvel movie has had awful CGI, but the effects here are about the same as the recent MS Marvel show. Yes, they look that bad at times.The good thing about this entry in the Thor series, is Christian Bale. He is really good here, and he looks like he is having the time of his life. But his scenes are far few in-between. He doesn't show up much, but when he does his scenes are good. The villain itself is bad, maybe slightly better than that pathetic excuse for a villain in Dark World, but Gorr, is a disappointing villain.Overall, I think this movie is boring, it tries to hard to be funny, and in the process, ruins scenes that could have been great. It feels rushed, and the editing is choppy, poor visuals and an underwhelming villain. It's the weakest entry in the Thor movies, even worse than Dark World - don't hate me for that lol.

title: Everything you would expect from a thor movie
text: A little bit of humor, not Dave Chapelle style humored but just thor being goofy, a bit of action, and some sadness. Good balance. Nothing spectacular but a solid movie.

title: I Can't Believe This Was A Marvel Movie
text: They should all be embarrassed. That was a pitiful excuse for a movie. I lost count of how many times I thought 'This movie sucks!!'. And I have loved Marvel movies. So disappointing.

title: To quote Thor - "maybe we have lost our way"
text: Love and Thunder serves only to worry me for what else is to come in a marvel universe becoming more so colourful, light hearted and cheesy. The character Thor, like the Hulk has been diluted to comedy characters, a far cry from the characters fans for decades have come to really enjoy. I stopped watching this 2 1/2 hour parady half way through. Only surprise was not seeing the Wayan brothers adding to the parody....Love and Thunder serves only to worry me for what else is to come in a marvel universe becoming more so colourful, light hearted and cheesy. The character Thor, like the Hulk has been diluted to comedy characters, a far cry from the characters fans for decades have come to really enjoy. I stopped watching this 2 1/2 hour parady half way through. Only surprise was not seeing the Wayan brothers adding to the parody....So bad I reviewed it twice...

title: Trying WAY to hard
text: I am a fan of all the previous Thor films, I am a big fan of the character... and that's why I didn't like how they made Thor kinda pathetic in Avengers Endgame... and a pathetic comic relief at that. It feels like because Ragnarok was such a success, they assume that making a Thor film with more jokes is all it takes to make a good Thor movie. Story, character, and everything else get NO effort here! It's all sacrificed in attempt to get laugh! I'll admit that Ragnarok has some good comedy, but here it doesn't land nearly as much, AND Ragnarok's story so much better than the nonsense that is Love and Thunder. So the end result is a story even WORSE than Thor: the dark world that's down right failing to be as good of a comedy as ragnarok. I don't know if it's the worst MCU movie of all but it's easily my least favorite.

title: Waste of Time
text: This won't even be enjoyable when it's on Netflix, Amazon Prime etc. Really bad story line, humorless comedic lines fall flat. Save a few hours of your life and spend your time elsewhere than watching this bomb.

title: Enjoyable
text: Christian Bale really needed more screen time. I would have traded off some of the jokes for more character development and acting from Christian Bale. The way he performed or acted was amazing. It was like night and day compared to the others. He had some good scenes.Some of the jokes were pretty funny. Some were not. Korg was fun but he wasn't needed. Too much Korg I think. His jokes were kind of annoying in the end. Either that or he wasn't written well.Natalie Portman was pretty good at acting. Same with Valkyrie. I forgot her name lol. Other than that, it was a pretty good movie. I love the kids at the end, that part was really fun to watch. I give it a 10 because it was worth the money I spent on it.

title: Utter garbage
text: Used to be a big fan of Thor but it's direction is going the same disappointing path as Startrek,Star Wars,etc.and I don't think I will be watching any future films of the DC universe until they sack the current woke scriptwriters and casting directors and reemploy the original ones who produced the first two Thor films.I presume they were hoping that this new generation of film making using 50% women and 50% men to manage and produce films and introducing more diversity and comedy would appeal to the younger streaming crowd and make money though anybody who would pay to go to the cinema to watch this woke rubbish is beyond my understanding.

title: fu fun funder
text: I absolutely loved it can't understand the bad reviews had a ragnarock feeling to it and amazing music. Really funny great visuals packed with characters, reading the reviews I was expecting to be disappointed but was totally the opposite infact I'm going to go watch it again with my other son hope this review helps.

title: Another reminder that actor writer directors shouldn't be a thing
text: I won't bore you with a summary of the plot or a reason why this is a bad entry into the MCU (boy am I eating my words on Multiverse of Madness aren't I) but this.This has to be one of the worst movies ever made, from plot to acting to editing to directing and writing nothing works.I said it minutes ago to another guy but this is hands off the wheel at 90 mph levels of crazy. What is Marvel thinking?!

title: What a joke. Wasted 2 hours of sunny weather for this
text: I think someone at Marvel said "Let's take the seriousness 1 notch down" but they accidentally took it 1000 notches down. Its a messy joke. While there are children that have been taken hostage, rather than looking serious about it and work8ng towards it they're all busy cracking non-funny jokes and making small talk. All I was think was... SERIOUSLY???!!!!

title: Hypocrisy
text: Disney removed Daryl Hannah's rear end from Splash saying it didn't align with their values but have no problem showing Chris Hemsworths rear end to children?? The hypocrisy and misandry is blatantly obvious. Boycott.

title: Another great film by Taika
text: There's a lot of bad vibes towards Marvel nowadays. To be honest, I found Dr Strange 2 a bit disappointing and full of political propaganda, but I had extremely high expectations for that one, as Dr Strange 1 is my favorite Marvel film. On the other hand, the hate "Love and Thunder" is getting is nonsense. If you like Taika's style, you won't be disappointed.

title: Thor: Boring and lacking
text: One of the most boring movies I've ever see. Don't waste your time watching this mates! I want my money and time back :( Every new marvel movie is serie are sinking like a russian ship.

title: Fun wholesome and emotional
text: I'll keep it short, people posting bad reviews about this are probably dead inside. Yes it had a lot of jokes but there were big chunks where there was no joking at all, but these reviews would make you think it's a comedy sketch. If you are to grumpy to laugh at giant screaming goats then that's your problem. Even with the humor, the movie was more emotional than ragnarok was. Its definitely not an empty film.

title: Do not waste your money unless you enjoy meaningless dialogue and a story written by a 10 year old
text: The movie has beautiful special effects and visuals, generously i give that component of the movie 9/10.Sadly the writing of the movie is utterly atrocious. The story is contrived, disney is scraping the barrel and seem to be making it up as they go along. A 10 year old could come up with that story, it extremely basic and simple, not something you would want to waste time and money to watch in the cinema. I rate the story -3/10. Yes negative 3 because you could summarise it in 5 sentences its that basic.To make up for the extremely basic story, the director makes use of meaningless scenes with the most awful frankly dumb dialogue to fill the time required to make up the typical length of a movie. The dialogue is neither funny, natural, inspiring or memorable. Its basically filler so utterly contrived and unnatural, as if an 8 year old wrote it or it was meant for a cartoon targeted at 3 year olds. A third or longer of the movie is basically this mind boggling bad filler dialogue which i also rate -3 and this is being extremely generous (i guess it is in English and in comprehensible sentences)Thus averaging the excellent visuals with the awful plot and hopeless poor dialogue (9 -3 -3)/3 we get 1/10. DIsney seems to be busy destroying its brand and intellectual property. First Starwars and now Thor, just utterly pathetic and disgraceful !

title: I'm so confused
text: So confused by the people who are calling this a ten out of ten. It's basically on par with The New Mutants.The black-and-white portions were beautiful, and Christian Bale was perfect for his role. But all in all, the film was style (only occasionally so) and no substance.

title: Thor Entertains
text: This creative film totally entertains its audience! From well choreographed fight scenes, beautiful scenery, hilarious scenes and some tender moments. I loved this film! It made made laugh out loud! And Chris Hemsworth is witty and charming and fabulous eye candy. I'm looking forward to the next Thor Film. I know it will be spectacular!!

title: Extremely disappointed - a Thor B Movie
text: I do not recommend , like a totally trol movie , poor script , very bad jokes , idiot jokes , waste of money , I left the cinema before movie ends. My wife and my kid also felt exactly the same.

title: Don't look back in anger..
text: Very amused to see all the hardcore Marvel Fans cry about how taika waititi made Film that's "empty inside" and filled with "too much jokes". This movie shows how much potential comic adaptions still have got, even though we live in a time where marvel made it to create a style of filmmaking, that sucks every form of soul and creativity out of the Regisseurs and actors. Not only most of the marvel films from the last decade but also most of the marvel fans take their selfs way too serious..

title: Cant believe I wanted to see this disaster at the cinema
text: Thank god I didn't waste my money. Is this the beginning of the end for the NZ director? I CANT understand why this train wreck was made.The funniest part of the movie was the sound the goats made pulling Thor's sled.2 shining lights in the movie where Christian Bale who took the movie seriously and Natalie Portman who's bulked up body was nothing short of amazing. Her acting was streets ahead of the rest.The endless bad and unfunny jokes and the tortuous cameos by every actor known to man made it a mish mash that had me rolling my eyes time and time again.Can established actors really WANT to appear this bad?A hard pass on this disaster from me. Poor story, Too much CGI, just plain rotten direction and a disastrous script sealed its fate before it was released.I cant get this 2 hours of my life back sadly....

title: We loved it. Definitely more than Dr. Strange 2 etc.
text: The movie was funny throughout. Huge fan of Christian Bale and he exceeds all expectations as always. Worth your time especially if you follow the MCU.

title: Couldn't find any redeeming qualities
text: Thor: Love and Thunder (2022)This is quite possibly the worst marvel movie that I have had the displeasure of experiencing. According to Chris Hemsworth, this movie was written by a 7 year old child but I had no idea that 7 year old children were allowed to be under the influence while writing scripts. Phase 4 has definitely been a stinking pile and this movie is the equivalent of throwing a thunder bomb to explode that pile and cover the audience with "fun", "humor" and "entertainment".The film is about... well its literaly just a bunch of excessive CGI mess, unbearable toddler humor and a plot that makes you want to scream like those goats. The only good part is the prologue with Christian Bale and after the MCU title begins to roll, everything feels like an incoherent parody where literally everything is poorly made whether its effects, choreography, dialogue, editing or pacing. Thor has definitely hit a new low as he has been degraded to a clown at a kids birthday party who is there to dress up in a cheap costume, talk to hammers, act like a bambling fool and get paid at the end of it all.You were excited for Guardians? How about 5 minutes. You wanted to see God Butcher in action? Forget about it. Instead, enjoy 2 hours of a talking rock. How did Mjolnir get restored? Who cares. How did Jane all of a sudden become a Woman Thor? Doesn't matter. Just stick your head inside a meat grinder and have fun because this is "Entertainment" from the comedic genius Taika. The plot actually invents new gimmicks that contradict themselves and the previous movies. I was hoping that at least the climax would pay off but instead, its kids fighting the villain with shiny plastic weapons and in the end, love is the answer.What's bewildering is how actors like Christian Bale, Matt Damon and Russel Crowe agreed to be in this garbagio; I guess the writing and CGI budgets were spent on their paychecks. People who watched this in the cinema should have been reimbursed and given money to see a therapist after experiencing this abomination. Next day after watching, I sat and wondered if this film had any redeeming qualities and unfortunately, I couldn't find any.Movies.shmovies on Instagram for honest movie and TV Show reviews.

title: Couldn't ask for anything more
text: It had a very emotional plot, but the incredible humor established a lighthearted tone that kept me laughing the whole time. It had amazing world-building and one of the most unique villains I've seen from recent superhero movies. The soundtrack was unbelievable and spot on. If the rest of this MCU stage is like this, we're in great shape.

title: How is this 7.1
text: How many ratings did Disney buy for this to be 7.1. This is really bad. Many reviewers said it right. THIS IS A JOKE!!! Story it self could be fine but rhey decided to make parody out of everything. Natalie Portman didn't know how to approach this role in my opinion. Chris was there just for the muscle and bad jokes.

title: As a True Thor Fan, I Love This
text: Been a longtime Thor fan. Read decades of this comics. I've heard many complaints that this isn't Thor. Characters get reinvented often. They did it in Thor Ragnarok. This character is completely in line with where the character is in the MCU. Perfect progression. Makes sense.Even as a long time Thor fan, no one really likes the whole Shakespearian Thor thing. It's slowly adapted throughout the movies and I like it much better. So in terms of this isn't "Thor", shut up. It's a version of Thor like the thousands others out there. You think this sucks? Read Ultimate Thor.In terms of colors and the look of the movie, fantastic. Still very Jack Kirby like. Love it.Soundtrack, fantastic. Casting, fantastic. Chris Hemsworth is great as always. Love Natalie Portman. Korg is fun. Tessa Thompson is great. Huge Christian Bale fan and he's great.Story, fantastic. Combines elements of Jason Aaron's Thor God of Thunder comic run and the 2015 Mighty Thor run. Both were well executed and refreshed to still entertain.I didn't like the look of Gorr at first, but it grew on me.In terms of other complaints I've heard

title: obnoxious
text: This movie is boring, stupid without head or tail, and with no other meaning than to continue disseminating the woke agenda that apparently is an urgent priority for Disney and its "bosses". Not even the presence of an actor of the caliber of Christian Bale saves her from being an absolute and total waste of time. The only consolation I have left is that I don't spend money out of my pocket to see this mess, I earn some free tickets, but still spend money on parking, gas and food. Terrible, never in my life I think to see this movie again. The MCU feels more and more like a ship adrift, or worse, like a ship sinking.

title: Brilliant!!
text: This is one of the best movies I've seen in years. Yes it is more of a comedy that any other MCU movie, and me and my wife laughed through through most of the movie. And cried as well because the drama side was heart wrenching and.then poignant.The plot was quite complex and clever too. Not predictable or cookie cutter.People love bagging on comedies. You can see on IMDb that comedies get bad ratings despite people laughing through them. And worse, people hate mixed genres. But I love it that way.So decide for yourself instead of listening to the haters who won't admit that laughter is a good thing.My only negative criticism is that one of Thor's costumes was too comic book looking with pure red blue and yellow. Not shifting those to more tertiary hues of burgundy navy and bronze, like other Thor movies. But he also has fresh costume that were more amazing than ever.

title: Wow what a disappointment
text: Went to see this film today to kill some time and I have to say, what a pile of drivel. Thus film is all over the place, it has no idea what sort of film it wants to be. I guess due to all the wokeness in the film industry right now that they have tried to please all the people but failed miserably. Christian Bale plays a blinding role, too good and serious for this film. Thor looks like something from a fancy dress parade, more colours than a pride flag, or perhaps that was the idea. I usually love the Marvel films but lately, they have started destroying everything, hope they get back on track soon..

title: Waste of time and money
text: The movie makes no sense and is terrible. MCU is losing its grip and tries to make everything silly and funny, well, Idiotic if you wanna know the truth.There's no script and screenplay, it seems, they just went along making the movie and it seems like they had just an outline and sequences to touch as they go.The story is pathetic, CJI sucks big time and the plot makes no sense.Instead of writing good stories and making it believable, the movie just goes whacky and disrespects the predecessors with its nonsensical narrative.The whole thing about being a 'God-Butcher' and not showing any 'butchering' or the origin story where the antagonist says 'Gods don't care about humans' but kidnap kids to trap a god (ie Thor) makes no sense.Pass this one.

title: Pretty good
text: People are saying how bad and boring it is but it's a good movie. Some parts were a bit boring, but it's a good movie. I like it a lot and it's funny, people are just haters.

title: Half baked campy comedy with Marvel characters
text: Taika is a creative guy, and I appreciate hos sense of humor, however, he was not the guy for this movie. It was a badly stitched together bag of gags with a fever dream storyline. The only acting that shone was that of Christian Bale, (not for lack of a talented cast). Bale was absolutely brilliant. He was a wasted talent in this trash fire of a movie. Now, if you have pot and cookie dough handy, you'll get some giggles. Natalie Portman does what she can with the material. The characters from Guardians of the Galaxy are of no relevance to the story, Jamie Alexander seems to phone it in, in her brief appearances. Watch it if you have nothing better to do.

title: Risky attempt that didnt work out for Taika
text: Now i understand what people meant when they said you either love it or hate it. Unfortunately this route taken by taika fell short. The comedy bits coupled with that intentional soap opera acting was a bit overboard. Maybe it was the slight success of Jojo Rabbit that steered that decision.The script was just horrendous. Jane becoming Thor was absolutely unnecessary and had minimal impact on the story itself. Almost felt like taika said...hey lets just throw that storyline in there with no basis. The ending...wow. What a way to throw your whole script down the drain. Ever feel like you had to use the restroom but turned out to be a fart?Goats were lol tho. Oh and whos bright idea should we credit the post-credit scenes to? #wth?

title: I hate disney so much
text: They need to stop trying to own everything. We should be able to vote to delete a company if it gets too big. I don't know why they started letting viago direct thor movies but it was their only good idea ever.

title: Humor was great but
text: The humor was fantastic. Unfortunately, the agenda being pushed by Disney ruined the overall flow and enjoyment of the film. Sure wish Disney would go back to making entertainment and stop pushing their agendas on their audiences.

title: Hands down the worst MCU Movie I've ever watched
text: The comedy was so lame, it just didn't work. Screaming goats, two minute long fistbump all felt really bad. The movie didn't do much justice to Christian Bale. He didn't have much screen time. Viewers don't feel intimidated by the villain or feel concerned at any stage. Thor is like a dumb kid throughout the movie. If we go back and watch the first thir movie again, we'll be surprised how this character used to be. Zeus character was even worse. And the story doesn't make any sense, Thor can give his powers to anyone he likes now?! Why do we need Avengers from now onwards XD thor can just hire a bunch of people and share his power to all when needed.

title: Hilarious but dumb, fun with family
text:
First time writing a review so bear with me.Does it feel like a different movie? -YES
Don't take this one seriously, or you will hate it, Take it easy it is just a fun movieI treat this one as a spin off thingy,You know those shorter commedy versions, It wasnt that short although , but that is alright, it is a more of a family friendly movie, and hilarous at that,
but it wasn't so child friendly, many nasty jokes, and bad languageBut it made it funnier for those in their 16-30This movie would been a hit 9 years ago."I know you were trouble....(Insert goat screeaming)"

title: Great film if you're like 5 years old...
text: I'm not.gonna waste much time reviewing this drivvle, obviously it's a franchise and has had some funny moments before but think they tried way too hard to be funny. Millions probably spent with admittedly good cgi etc but lacking any substance other than a bad guy trying to defeat the good guys. My 12 year old son started complaining early on how lame it was and I told him to give it a chance but sadly it didn't get any better, just 2 hours I'll never get back...

title: What was that?
text: Well, I don't know what Thor this Thor is, but it's not the one you can take serious. Instead of "Love & Thunder" I would call it "Clown with Muscles"

title: Just stop!
text: Please for the sake of Marvel fans over the age of about 15, stop letting this man direct movies. Ragnarok was full of cringe worthy "comedy", but this took it to new levels. Taika Waititi, please please just stop.

title: Fire!
text: Great movie! The composition of the stars is gorgeous and their game is impressive, although the roles are episodic.. it's a pity that in Russia our North American friends banned it from showing)) thanks to all the actors, directors and everyone who participated in the creation of the film, for a good mood and a smile from ear to ear, at least for these not full two hours!

title: When everything is a gag
text: Nothing is. It becomes boring. I found nothing of value that was added to marvel or thor w this film. Was it cool that the universe was expanded w new characters w different twists, yes... was it good? No. Jeremy Johns and Chris gore said it best - it's a tv episode and it's forgettable. This was made for Disney+ content. What does red letter media say - 'consume new content'? Pft- pathetic attempt. I expected more from this director. Dr. Strange was a mess and this was a missed opportunity. Disney needs to stop w the divisive marketing and maybe hire better writers. The Batman and Robin of Marvel.The more I think about this "film" the more I despise it.

title: Thor has become an unintelligent simp
text: It's about 10% Thor and 90% Jokes and can't be taken seriously. This is far from Ragnarok good. I regret not waiting to watch it later on Disney+ since I pay for that subscription begrudgingly. I felt no sense of urgency from the "god killer". MCU films would make you anxious for what would happen in the next battle or adversity but you couldn't care less in this because it's trying to be a comedy but with stale jokes. Thor is portrayed as a meat head which has always been a part of him but that was always balanced out by being the strongest avenger and a force to be reckoned with on the battle field. He was always highly respected among his peers but in this he's mocked, made to be dumb, incompetent, having poor leadership and 2nd to "Mighty Thor" Jane Foster. This is worse than the supposedly bad Dark World. Was really keen for this movie and seeing the comic Jane Foster come to the screen but instead very disappointed. Would rather of seen Top Gun a 2nd time.

title: Fun and Entertaining Movie
text: Fun, entertaining movie with beautiful visuals.It was funny, crazy and held my attention the whole why through.Don't believe the nay-sayers... It's worth a watch!!

title: Garbage
text: Loved the first couple of Thor installments but this latest production was utterly horrible. Very dark and felt like I needed to take a shower when I got home. I left halfway through and realized Disney will never be the same. I think this is the last Marvel movie I'll ever watch! They just keep getting worse and worse! Don't waste your time or money. Junk!

title: Thor: Love and Thunder
text:
I'll start off by saying that Thor: Ragnarok is one of my favorite movies of the whole MCU. I expected this one to be basically more of that, and in some ways it is, but it hits different. For a while, it's just goofy, and not always in a good way. The jokes largely don't land as well, and it takes a while before it really starts to get going. But when it does, boy it REALLY goes. It's a lot more serious than I expected it to be, and the vast majority of the comedy ends after the first 1/3 or so, after which it's just one fantastic scene after another. There's one part about halfway through where we are treated to probably the most visually unique scene in the entire series, and it blew me away. From that scene on, the movie just didn't stop for me and I loved everything from then on out. Christian Bale absolutely dominates and really shows Chris Hemsworth up in his own movie, which is saying a lot because Hemsworth is as good as always. But we've seen him before about a dozen times, while Bale brings a whole new energy to it. Speaking of energy, there's Natalie Portman's Mighty Thor. I'm so glad she decided to come back, because she was fantastic and in no way did she phone anything in, in the least. She absolutely sold every line and action, and same goes for Tessa Thompson. I loved her in Ragnarok, and I love her here too.My only complaints about the movie:
1. It takes a bit to really pick up.2. Overall, it strangely feels about 20 minutes too short.3. Probably a result of complaint #2, but I thought I could've used just a bit more time with Valkyrie and Jane's Mighty Thor.I'd give the movie an overall 8.5, but since IMDb doesn't do half-stars, I'll round that up to 9.

title: So much wasted talent
text: As one of the few who didn't like Thor: Ragnarok, I could see the writing on the wall. They would double down on the jokes, never giving the plot or character moments time to breathe and turn it into a tiktok video style clipshow for the ADS generation.What I didn't expect was for them to mess up the plot this badly.The setup of this was actually interesting. This could have been good, if not excellent.Take the opening scene (not a spoiler): Christian Bale's people are left to die by an uncaring god. He watches his daughter waste away and die. When he meets his god, the god is a fat jolly guy laughing and pointing at a fallen guy with the "godkiller" sword. How convenient. He then mocks Christian Bale who promptly kills him. It starts serious, but ends up as a joke.There are several issues with this. One, it is said gods derive their power from people worshipping them. Why then is this god strong and jolly? It would have been far more efficient for him to be a decrepit loser without any power, and Bale to renounce him then as worthless.Similarly, (again not a spoiler, because it's revealed in promotional material and in the comics) Jane Foster is dying of cancer. Expositionary dialogue reveals Mjolnir chose her to protect her. But it's also draining her life when she transforms and kills her faster. Umm, what? Is anyone proofreading this garbage before they film it? This fully contradicts itself.Not only is Mjolnir functioning again after being destroyed before, rendering that entire scene moot, but it's now better because its shards work like a projectile weapon. Nothing in this has consequences.A better setup: Have Thor bring the ruined hammer to Jane so she can study it. Maybe the hammer actually gives her cancer. And then the appearance of the villain sets in motion that she must sacrifice her own life expectancy to save the day and her love. Now suddenly it has gravitas. Self-preservation vs being a hero. Characters that make hard choices are interesting. Characters who just goof around are not.The entire movie is played for laughs. Every potentially serious moment is turned into a joke (except cancer, they don't joke about that). Worse, the jokes are terrible attempts at noisy slapstick. Screaming goats, remember that internet meme from 2005? It's back. Several times.Most newer Marvel movies since GotG tend to be tonally messy, but this is Ghostbusters 2016 level. Constant talking and bickering about nonsense, endless wink wink humor, references to pop culture, and again with an annoying Melissa McCarthy.As usual, the movie suffers from Marvel bloat as well. Too many characters with too little to do. This could have worked nicely as a small, somewhat thoughtful little character drama with Thor and Jane mending their relationship as she makes the ultimate sacrifice and learns to appreciate what it means to be a hero, and why Thor wasn't there for her because he was... saving the universe. But no, we get the Guardians, Valkyrie who does nothing except the director and Lady Sif, who is treated as a joke as well (the one joke that actually made me chuckle).For once, the critics got it right. This movie is a tonal mess, the acting talent is wasted on a subpar slapstick comedy, and the Marvel downtrend continues.Side note: The CGI looks atrocious. Every scene looks like a bad LSD trip with mismatching colors all over the place. My eyes were thankful for a particularly desaturated scene later in the movie during which I found myself rooting for the villain. Christian Bale wastes a good performance and seems to be the only one not in on the joke, that this movie is essentially a Naked Gun style farce. They did him dirty.Now in fairness, it's been said the original cut was 4 hours. Maybe it was more coherent. Maybe they excised some interesting character moments and ruined the pacing. Justice League showed what studio interference can do to a film, and Taika Waiti has proven that he can balance comedy and serious with his fantastic Jojo Rabbit. Or maybe he simply lucked out with that one.

title: An absolute Mess
text: A movie that was trying to get some sort of SEO (search engine optimisation) point so that it could get up on the comedy search list.Unoriginal jokes and a ridiculous attempt at trying to fit every meme on earth into the story line for no reason what so ever. The comedy was childish and disruptive to the story, it had no flow.The action scenes were typical nothing out of the ordinary, a movie of this level should take the bar higher not do the same thing it did 4 years ago.It was some odd attempt at SNL/YouTube skits from back in the day.Throughout the movie you were just waiting for the moment this ridiculous drama will end and the movie will have something good about it, but unfortunately not, it was terrible all the way from start to finish.

title: Great fun and not just action CGI
text: Modern technology has taken over movies in recent times where action and CGI takes over with minimal plot. This movie I thought was more refreshing, yes there was comedy scenes which some may criticise and maybe they should have curbed back a little - but for me I thought the characters and a roving was great. More importantly the kids as well as adults were glued instead of being semi focused on our phones!The music goes well with the scenes and i thought Russell Crowe's character initially over the top but actually it worked well.It does not look like the Thor franchise will end soon and it does look like during credits another is planned and it seems it will follow the same line of direction. All for it.

text: You know that a movie is bad when the director feels the need to include a sexist, gratuitous nude scene into a PG rated movie just to generate a bit of "buzz". For the purposes of gender equality why didn't the sexist and hypocritical director make Natalie Portman do a nude scene? Sexist double standards.

title: Is this for real?
text: WTF did I just watch?.. At first I thought it was just a ironic, funny intro... But the whole movie is like a bad parody of the franchise, made for young kids. And let me tell you right away that they don't succeed in being "funny" by parody or irony, or whatever this is. Do yourselves a favor, and do not waste time on this movie. You also risk ruining the previous movies if you happened to enjoy them. It really beats me to figure out the point and idea with this movie. The characters are there, Christian Bale is doing an excellent job (as always) playing the villain, and the story aren't that bad to be honest. So why go and spoil it all with this style? :(

title: Don't listen to the hate, this is terrific!
text: Not understanding the hate this movie gets. It's fun, classic Thor moments, classic Thor humor, decent story, great visuals, and it all made narrative sense. No reason to call this movie a 3/10 or anything like that. Loved it and plan to watch it again!

title: The worst MCU film ever
text: If didn't know better i would say this was a making-fun-of-marvel comedy movie... its so bad it makes me sad to think of the waste of talented actors like Chris, Christian or Natalie in this thing... a childish bad humour on a even worse script. Horrible.I'm a big fan of Marvel since the times where there were no movies about them, i know the story of every hero from the comic books i love so much since my childhood...makes me feel sick to how this brilliantly created universe is being treated by Disney. Bring back the writers, the real screenplay writers that wrote every movie till Engame, the directors, the people who really know what their doing and that most of all, have the proper notion and respect that a Marvel story deserves.

title: 9.9/10 Due to lack of variation on the soundtrack.
text: Thor: Love & Thunder (2022) Was a pretty remarkable flick with all mainstream things considered. Acting, 10/10, script, 10/10, graphics and surprise theatrics 10/10, sympathy for the villain, 10/10, big-name guest actors, 10/10, conclusion, 10/10. The only complaint I really have (which is not much of a complaint) was that I typically enjoy a bit more variation on my flick's soundtracks. Don't get me wrong, it was a great soundtrack, it just lacked the variation I was looking for. I cannot see myself taking away too many points for lack of variation in a soundtrack when the film was entirely almost picture-perfect otherwise; for a purposely manufactured, summer blockbuster. So, without further delay, I will give Thor: Love & Thunder (2022) it's just reward of 9.9/10. You definitely want to see this one at your local movie house on the big screen, so that you can soak up all the thrills and action the way it was intended to be seen; as a mainstream summer adventure film with a bucket of popcorn. Try to keep that in mind and don't be so judgmental. We know it's not Citizen Kane (1941), ok, film school hipsters?

title: What was this supposed to be?
text: Pointless rubbish for the first 40 minutes. Then a glimmer of hope. Then yawn fest.Why have they decided to make Thor an idiot? And that's being polite. The jokes where lame, Korg character is the most annoying character since Jar jar Binks. Thor mumbles about being an absolute arse for ages before any story develops. Christian Bale does a brilliant job of giving us a worthy villain with a good back story in the first 10 minutes and then lame jokes, side ways glances, Goats screaming and that's about it. All the Guardians need to take a good shower to hopefully was Thor off them. Otherwise they are going to be pulled down with this tired franchise, which would be a shame. What has happened to Marvel? If it's Disney then someone needs to act now otherwise we are all doomed.

title: A Worthy Addition to Thor's Story
text: This film picks up where Thor:Ragnarok left off in terms of tone and style, and while falling a bit short of its predecessor, still delivers an entertaining entry in the MCU.An area where Love and Thunder really exceeds Ragnarok is the character of Gorr the God Butcher. He is without a doubt the best villain in any of Thor's movies and arguably one of the better ones in the MCU. A bit more screen time would have solidified that, but what we get from Christian Bale is fantastic. He is genuinely creepy and far more frightening than the average comic book movie villain. Despite being simple, his motivations are clear and relatable to the average viewer.However, the biggest area where this entry doesn't always hit the mark is its comedy. Love and thunder replaces a lot of subtle situational comedy in Ragnarok with more overt silly humor. While this isn't an issue for me, it is certainly not for everyone. This is the one area where I can see fans with high expectations coming out a bit disappointed. There is still some good comedy, but without Tom Hiddleston, Jeff Goldblum, Cate Blanchette, and the rest of the supporting cast of Ragnarok, Love and thunder feels like Chris Hemsworth working a bit too hard to carry the comedic weight. A bit less comedy and a bit more of a serious tone in some scenes would have went a long way.The rest of the supporting cast does a fine job, but ultimately don't add or subtract much from the movie. Jane Foster has some touching moments with Thor and a very cool intro as The Mighty Thor, but doesn't always hit the comedic vibe the film was going for. Valkarie and Korg are kind of just there for the ride and don't bring much to the table aside from the occasional laugh. Russel Crowe as Zeus is the exception and helps to keep the second act entertaining.The third act is where things really get good. We get good action and a lot of engagement with Gorr. There is an entertaining final battle and finale of the movie, which ends the film on a high note.Overall, after two viewings, I find Thor: Love and Thunder to be a well paced film with some good action and comedy, as well as some heart warming moments. It is an above average MCU movie in my opinion and is worthy of a watch for fans of MCU movies and light hearted action flicks alike.

title: Fun ride
text: A fun as hell ride that consistently puts a smile on your face and makes you laugh and while it isn't as good as Ragnarok it's definitely another great movie by Taika Waititi. This movie clearly isn't meant to be taken too seriously as many of Waititi and Marvel's movies but some of the serious moments work. Gorr is a good villain to an extent, he is definitely just a construct of the plot but Christian Bale's performance is enjoyable and at least he has an arc and isn't just bad marvel dude 32. The movie did jump around a lot and wasn't as focused and I think that's why Ragnarok was a better movie than Love and Thunder (and part of me really missed Loki being in these movies).

title: Thor Review
text:
Thor: Love and Thunder Review -
Minor spoilers
Pros:
Christian Bale. I mean everyone knew Bale is a great actor so this wasn't a shock to me at all. I thought he was great and I couldn't wait for him to come on screen every time. He has actually a very touching story. He was a lot like Vecna from Stranger Things. I only wish that he was a little bit more bigger and scarier and more animal-like like how he is in the comic book version. Only that part was a little bit of a letdown.The romance and story of Thor & Jane. I love the progress of their story, it was so sweet. The one thing that bugged me about the MCU was how they dropped off the character Jane Foster who was so important to Thor's life so I was so glad that they brought her back and finished that story. Their love feels very genuine, I thought they were going to make it silly and stupid but they did not it was actually very sweet.Not boring at all, includes characters. The movie is only two hours and so it is always action packed, there is no room for a long drawn out stupid scenes except for maybe one. I liked Valkyrie more in this one actually and loved the moments the Guardians of the Galaxy were in. Darcy and Dr. Selvig are in it as well as random cameos of Matt Damon, Luke Hemsworth, Melissa McCarthy, Russell Crowe and Chris Hemsworth's kids.Cons:
Completely forced moments of political correctness. It seems that Marvel is really trying to put LGBT characters in so bad they are giving it out to some of the dumbest characters. Korg, who is literally made of rocks is the gay one... Everything about it feels so forced it almost feels like Marvel has a team of employees with clipboards that look at every script and say " OK add a random LGBT character, even if it's a rock I don't care" and Marvel has to do it. Even Valkyrie kisses some woman's hand and it doesn't even feel romantic it looks like she's kissing her aunt's hand or something. Forced and super weird. Jane also makes a reference to how she doesn't like being called Lady Thor. Whether you are on the political spectrum of left or right I think we can all agree that the characters can be embarrassing for those moments.Too short. Really annoying how short the movie is. Christian Bale said there were a lot of scenes of his that were cut out and I would've liked to of seen those at least. The movie is barely two hours long and the time really flies by fast because the movie is very entertaining so it's disappointing how short it is, especially for an original character like Thor.The scene with Zeus. That was the scene they could've probably done without it was really weird, very long and kind of pointless other than to steal the thunderbolt. For some reason it feels like Marvel is cutting back on the amount of money they're spending on movies. In a way it feels like a Disney+ movie. They must be doing pretty badly. There are rumors that the visual effects team at Marvel Studios hated their jobs and a lot of them quit. Not sure if this is the beginning of the fizzling out of the original Marvel MCU characters.Still I had a great time though, I loved it. 8/10.

title: Garbage

title: Disappointed.
text: Huge fan of MCU but this was the worst as I had high hopes. They wasted a lot of time on jokes that weren't well timed and lacked delivery. The storyline was not great either. Bluntly put, blame lies in bad direction or whoever else interfered. All that cast was not utilized well. Please increase your budget as well.

title: Taika doing his thing and keeping Marvel fresh
text: For me it just hit the right spot.Knowing it's Taika I went in expecting it to be fun, silly, entertaining and heartwarming - it's exactly that. You can actually see people enjoying their work on screen.If you go in expecting a high testosterone action drama then you'll be dissapointed.It has these wholesome and playful moments in it that we are not accustomed to in Marvel movies from previous phases. This can catch you off guard. I think this is behind some of the 2-4 star raitings.It's a different direction then classic Marvel but that's what keeps it fresh. Not seeing the same formula from one movie to the next but taking risks and exploring ideas.Well worth a watch. Get your friends and kids - enjoy and let yourself be entertained.

title: This is a parody of Thor!
text: The story line it is adapting from the comics was awesome! Such a shame that Thor has been turned into a pastiche of himself. The comedy comes thick and fast, but doesn't always hit home.The Thor from Ragnarok is gone to be replaced by an imbecile with muscles. Even Fat Thor was better than what we have been given here! Ragnarok balanced comedy with tone, but Waititi has not managed to get lightening to strike twice here!Because of this, the more serious tones are done an injustice and there are more swear words in this one than any other, but have been shoe horned in.Christian Bale tries hard with the script he has been given, but even some of his scenes fall flat and seem out of character for who he is betraying and this jars.I love Marvel movies, and Thor Odinsson, but you could (and maybe should) give this one a miss.

title: A fun & cheesy movie
text: Thor has been far from the most serious of the Marvel characters. This film is an action, funny cheese fest with a decent sound track. Loved it and actually cried at one point which greatly amused my wife. The movie is total make believe treat it as such, go watch it and have some fun.

title: I feel sorry for Thor
text: The movie has completely destroyed the image of Thor that was built over the last decade.. He is portrayed as stupid and unable to act or think like a super hero.. Story line is poor and has lot of loose-ends. Only thing that kind of saves the movie is lot of "pretty faces doing funny things"

title: Another Waititi classic
text: I'm not sure what everyone else is complaining about. I, like everyone else in my relatively crowded cinema, thoroughly enjoyed and laughed throughout the entire film. I think perhaps a lot of viewers haven't seen many of Waititi's previous works, or don't get his sense of humour, which I think is very irreverent New Zealand/Australian. If anything I'd say Thor forgets to be a completely self-involved, arrogant spoilt god in parts of this movie and that's always provided good value for me.I found the early Thor movies to be some of the weakest of the Marvel movies so when Waititi took the helm, he brought life to the Thor series by not taking it too seriously. I mean, he's a space viking. Taking that seriously is boring. For those upset by the 'adult humour', maybe try reading about the ancient gods (whether Greek, Norse or Old Testament) and you might just find them a little more salacious and violent than a throwaway reference to orgies.I found Thor: Love and Thunder visually creative, well-directed with excellent comic timing, and it had fantastic performances from its actors. It's not another Iron Man, but neither is Venom or Spiderman. It's a Marvel universe. It should contain multitudes!

title: Where Ragnarok Came Easily, Love and Thunder Tries Way Too Hard
text: Fresh off saving the universe in the climax of that last Avengers movie (doesn't it seem like three lifetimes ago?), our mighty Thor is stricken by a heavy case of ennui. Granted, he's spent the past however-long running around the cosmos with his new friends in the Guardians of the Galaxy, righting wrongs and soaking up the adulation, so it's not like he's completely listless. He just wonders if, maybe, there mightn't be more to life as a living thunder god than cheap thrills and easy wins. That's where the villainous "God Butcher" Gorr comes into play. Having violently ended a great number of minor deities already, his vengeful blade now points squarely at New Asgard. Where, coincidentally, Thor's old flame Jane Foster has just taken up a form of godhood.Following hot on the heels of 2017's Ragnarok, the '22 model brings the whole band back together again with a few additional boons. Stunning visual effects, epic fantasy landscapes, belly-quaking rock'n'roll tracks, an irreverent sense of humor (trademark of returning writer/director Taika Waititi) and a decidedly loose connection to the greater MCU... yeah, this wants to be a successor to Ragnarok, all right. Shame, then, that it's just a high-profile case study for the law of diminishing returns.Without exception, every single component that so felt effortless and precise in the previous film is weaker and broader in Love and Thunder. Where the last entry was delightfully quirky and witty, this one feels forced and excessive. Where I was ready to stand up and cheer at the opening chords of Led Zeppelin's "Immigrant Song," the similarly climactic placement of "November Rain," either the third or fourth Guns n' Roses tune on the soundtrack, made my eyes roll. The ambitious visuals have taken a step down, the cast has lost its edge, and the story, though excessively simple, still under-delivers. Christian Bale is completely wasted as Gorr, acting his heart out in portrayal of yet another villainous afterthought whose sporadic barks are far worse than his bite. Natalie Portman is awkward and flavorless as an ex-lover turned rival; Thor seems more upset about being ditched by his semi-sentient war hammer. Even MCU heavyweights Chris Pratt and Chris Hemsworth have had far better showings, mutually saddled by a bland script.Love and Thunder has bits and pieces that work - a handful of laughs, a few visual nods to the source material - but those are light and fleeting enough to have fit into an ambitious short film. Everything else is either a well-intentioned whiff or a confirmed misfire. What in the world happened here?

title: None stop fun
text: Okay Let's get real, it was never suppose to win any awards. But if its job is to entertain die hard Marvel fans from beginning to end with great cameos, dry humor and lovable characters While sprinkling on great action sequences and a few heart felt moments, then this movie killed it.You... will ... be ... entertained.

title: A study on bad editing
text: There are a lot of complaints about this movie trying to be too funny. But this is the humour from Ragnarok, which sat very well and I actually found the humour a mild grace here (though far from a saving one.) Love and Thunder's biggest problem is terrible pacing and bad editing. Everything is cut together so quickly it seems to have no regard to building a narrative or giving any sense of challenge. It's hard to follow why any of the key plot points are happening and many of them have no consequence. Christian Bale's character is by far the most interesting and unfortunately unexplored while Portman's transformation comes unceremoniously and lands like a lead zeppelin. Such a shame for Waititi to not keep a plot on the rails while he's seemingly blinded by packing in big FX and keeping things light hearted.

title: Is The Marvel Universe becoming a joke?
text: Holy!!! I feel sad that the Marvel Universe is becoming a joke. This movie has a weak story and lack seriousness. Seems like Marvel relies on "poor" jokes, nudity and lame catch phrases.. what happened with the quality from eg. Captain America?I surely believe that the actors had more fun producing the movie than the people watching it. Maybe the final chapter of the Marvel universe should have been End Game.I would recommend people not to spending two hours on this movie!! You will for sure have more fun watching the old Marvels or even watching a whole other movie.To Marvel: don't let the Universe becoming a joke please..

title: Great comedy
text: This movie felt more like a comedy then a action movie which is fine with me. There was still a good amount of action in this film to balance it out. Not my favorite movie of all time but definitely a really good one.
