title: Why do people hate this?
text: I don't understand people's beef with this movie. I don't love Jane Foster, and I think she has no chemistry with Helmsworth, but she's fine. There's some cheesy dialogue. Otherwise, it's funny, exciting, never boring. Christian Bale is incredible. Tessa Thompson is wonderful. Taika Waititi really knows what he's doing. I think Marvel fans need to understand that not every movie is going to be a 180 minute fight scene with 20 A-List actors?! And thank god, that would be so boring. It's a comedy film, which means that it will be generally tied up with a neat bow. Let's hope we don't see Natalie Portman again. I had fun, it's fun, chill out.

title: So very very very bad
text: With each passing movie disney chips away at what should be a great franchise, the films just keep getting worse and worse. This is a straight to dvd/streaming service movie, and that's being generous. Hopefully disney will go bust a some pont and stop making this dross.Aviod this travesty of a movie unless you can see it for free and you want to waste a couple of hours of your life that you won't get back.The only minor redemption was gorr, Christian bale is the only character that provides any respite from the ham fisted Terrible terrible writing of the movie. Stop making this rubbish disney. Please.

title: Written by a 13 year old in 2010
text: The writing is awful. Screaming goats was the biggest joke? Instead of exploring the loss Thor has experienced and his growth, they make joke after joke. The level of his powers were inconsistent, the story was lazy and it was a sad send off to one of the better characters. Marvel is on a steep decline, and that is coming from a fan. Christian bale was severely underused, which is disappointing given how well he played the role. I am a fan of Taika but they way this was written honestly feels like he did it to troll marvel for hiring him. I think we have seen the last of the good marvel movies sadly.

title: Fun but boring
text: The start was slow,Korg's recaps are funny and the GOTG were enjoyable after not seeing them since 2019. When Thor meets Jane Foster the movies starts to get good. Christian Bale and Chris Hemsworth are amazing at there acting. Korg is the best character and the Gods home scene was definitely the best. The ending sets up a good look ahead for the future of Thor.

title: A wasted opportunity
text:
I think there is a truly good movie hidden somewhere in this wanting to come out. But it is chocked by all the cringe and bad comedy. This is the most schizophrenic movie I have ever seen, as every meaningful dramatic scene is instantly nullified by a worthless, pointless comedy scene.If this was made by a competent writer and director as a proper Marvel movie, like they used to make them, it could have been great. It contains all the right pieces scattered and broken, but unfortunately they are never put together like Mjolnir.Lack of talent really becomes obvious when you have all the right ingredients and you still can't make anything of worth. Because this is worthless both as comedy and as drama.Much of the criticism is dismissed with "Oh it's just a fantasy why do you take it so seriously?" or worse "Why can't you enjoy it for what it is?" I don't know, why can't you enjoy a bad meal for what it is? Why should a bad movie be enjoyed?Story/writing: 3/10 - a weak comedy containing hints of a good movie
visuals: 3/10 - muscle suits and mediocre CGI
acting: 4/10 - If the director doesn't take it seriously why should the actors? It's all a big joke
direction / editing: 3/10 - thank Zeus he is not coming back, but the audience might not either, the damage is doneOverall impression: 3/10I can't even recommend it as guilty pleasure. This is not so bad it's good, it's just bad enough to make you angry and gnaw at your senses. And give you that tickling feeling in the back of your head: What if it was made by people who respected the material and the audience?P. S: Natalie Portman had the opportunity to join the greatest female action stars, and be mentioned on one page with Linda Hamilton in T2, or Jessica Biel in Blade Trinity., Instead she will be forever known as the actress who wore a rubber muscle suit.

title: Like many said way to many jokes
text: I really kept hoping they would stop with the jokes but they just wouldn't knock it off. It almost felt like they were copying guardians of the galaxy. A few jokes were alright but most of them were terrible jokes, the story would have been much better without them. We all lived the prequels much more then this one. Sadly the comedy ruined the movie for our 2 families that went, so bad some wanted to leave. This has got to be one of the worst ratings I have given any of the marvel trilogy. I am truly hoping that the future of Thor is better then this. It truly was a disappointment for us. It was no wonder that Spider-Man no way home had the larger theater screen despite being an older movie.

title: Made Thor A Joker
text:
Watched it in 3D
Honestly for me The First Half of the movie is Piece of junk.That was like A Parody of any Thor movie I was Totally Annoyed The Comedy Scenes were Cringey and they Runied Tessa Thompson and WTF they Have done With Matt Damon
But then Somehow The Second half and Christian Bale Saved the Movie.

title: Entertaining, but a bit too much joking
text: I really liked the movie but: It's storyline was good, but all the joking caused me to lose compassion for what was happening to key characters; the jokes also diminished the gravity of the battle scenes. If they scaled back the quips and projected a slightly stronger serious tone, then maybe the stakes of the story would've carried weight.Christian Bale was a perfect villain to Thor's playful hero. But Thor was a little too cavalier at certain instances, and he lacked empathy when it was needed. All of the actors were spot on in their roles, even Zeus. But again, that much joking kept taking me out from having a vested invested with the outcome.

title: Seriously Disappointing
text: Yesterday I saw this movie at a theater. The first movie theater I went to in two years. The movie is an absolute disaster. It can't make up it's mind whether it is a kid's film, a comedy or a true super hero action film. In it's attempt to appeal to everyone it fails big time. It has destroyed the Thor franchise.

title: Campy, Fast and Fun
text: Thor Love & Thunder definitely will NOT be for everyone, however I found it to be an exciting and fun entry into the MCU. This movie is very light, in your face, and ridiculous, so I can see many people not enjoying it. It is essentially a Saturday morning cartoon turned live action, which I myself enjoyed quite a bit.Taika Waititi sometimes goes overboard with his ideas, and it seems there has to be a joke every 10 seconds (those damn goats). But at least he has Chris Hemsworth to provide many of these jokes, who is just naturally gifted in comedy and once again just embraces the role of Thor. Natalie Portman stands out in her return to Jane Foster, as she now possesses Mjolnir and is now The Mighty Thor, however I couldn't help but feel her arc was rushed and we as an audience were supposed to just accept her as Thor very quickly. Christian Bale is AWESOME as Gorr the God Butcher, but I feel we could've spent more time with him.My main criticism with this movie is its pacing. Everything comes and goes SO quickly, that you feel you barely have anytime to breathe. With this being the shortest MCU movie in years, none of these new inclusions have any time to breathe, and the plot FLYS by. Not that this plot is complicated at all, it's actually one of the most simple plots the MCU has had, and will only have any bearing in Thors arc, and not the MCU as a whole.Regardless, this movie is a very fun time, if you are able to withstand the campiness and comedy that this movie throws in your face 24/7. It won't be for everyone, but I personally enjoyed it for what it was.

title: The ONCE mighty Thor has fallen
text: This was once a great franchise. It would have been nice to take my 10 year old grandchild to but she would have fallen asleep. DONT WASTE YOUR TIME OR MONEY.

title: Hilarious and full of surprises
text: If you like to laugh, experience lots of actions, and spectacular CGI - this is your movie. I loved it. Even the stuff I didn't really like, I still found tolerable simply because of all the other good stuff this movie brings.I would love to see more of this, as in a sequel. Don't listen to the snobs who don't understand humor! This movie is awesome! It ROCKS!

title: 100% special effects 0% story
text: Movie felt very rushed. There was no story whatsoever. Just a dumb collection of cgi scenes with silly humor that 90% of the time doesn't work. Thor has become a moron with super powers who can't decide if he's a super hero or a clown. Christian Bale was the only one who was trying with some decent acting despite the cheap material he was given.Not recommend.

title: Such a waste of talent for cheap laughs
text:
Why oh why did the makers of this film miss such a glorious chance to use the talents of The Guardians of the Galaxy cast but more terrible they've blown probably the best Big Bad in Marvel films to fill the movie with cheap laughs rather than be a big hitting extravaganza
Love & Thunder bumbles along on the same path as the previous film but it could have been much much more.

title: Enjoyable but...
text: I found the movie acceptable, Thor Ragnarok had set the bar very high, unfortunately this movie is not nearly as good. I think it has good comedy and good fight scenes, and the plot of the movie was bad as well as the ending.

title: LOVE it!
text:
No crazy cameos or insane fan theories come true, but just a simple movie to enjoy.Christian Bale, as usual, put up an amazing performance. Colour Science and Cinematography work pretty well. The comedy turned out better than I expected, though can
be quite silly at times.That said, I still love every second of it.

title: Tries too hard to be funny
text: This is the worse in the series by a long way, it's trying to be funny all the time and just ends up being corny and annoying, Christian Bale stands out like a beacon his character is dark and he has a presence on screen that's not shallow.The effects are on point as always with these movies but again overdone to an extent that was not required and seemed to act as a filler for the lack of storyYou have to wait a long while before the movie actually gets going and by that time you might have switched off and gone to watch something more entertaining as there is no great pay off by staying to the end.

title: Disney Strikes Again
text: There was a lot of material to make this movie great, but they decided to go with a pile of feces, a ridiculous amount of bad puns and jokes, cut all the interesting scenes where Gorr would have shined, no Guardians of the Galaxy, and the worst is that Thor is a complete moron. But hey, we got "strong independent women" like Thor Jane and The Valkyrie. We also got a lot of Thor outfits for future merchandise. What a garbage of a movie!

title: Film for the next-gen of Marvel fans, not Thor fans.
text: Feige and co are obviously targeting a new generation of Thor fans, as he's here to stay. So I guess the rest of us are along for the ride. I understand why to some that is a bummer.Some of the humour is just that of a Taika Waititi film, has always been hit-and-miss, and subjective.Thor being goofy felt realistic. He's faced so much trauma and has learned to accept it. But he's goofy, doesn't know how to fit in, what to say or how to feel. It's uncomfortable to watch until the very end where he finally says something meaningful, because his life found new meaning.None of the 'woke' implications ever felt forced. Just the new norms, so get over it. It's a film for the next-gen of marvel fans. For all the new mums, dads and their kids.Infinity saga is over. Time to move on. Marvel is now for the current 13-year-olds. Not for us in our late-twenties, or early-thirties.Bale was absolutely stellar.

title: Thor: Love and Thunder
text: Thor has to do battle with new enemy Gorr (Christian Bale) who goes mad when his daughter dies and acquiring the weapon, the necrosword, which can destroy all gods, he sets out to do just that.Whilst Thor: Ragnarok laced its adventures with a good deal of enjoyable humour, this is really more of a comedy, and not a particularly good one at that, laced with some largely unexciting set pieces. The difficulty is that the comedy bounces around familiar ideas about the hammer vs the axe, Thor being a klutz, Korg being dry and witty etc but nothing new and indeed there are long scenes of plain waffle. The renewed romance between Thor and Jane is dull and not remotely touching and Portman's character including her rather odd reason for returning seems poorly written. There are a couple of good action set pieces and Russell Crowe as Zeus is fun, but overall this is just nonsensical, silly and a big disappointment after Ragnarok.

title: no love no thunder
text: Empty, boring, not much more to say about Thor: Love and Thunder. Nothing works good - the action not, the humor not, the effects are okay, that's the best part, the costume of Portman looks ridiculous.

title: Garbage Movie - not worth
text: Not worthy of going to the theatre and pay high price for the tickets. Wait for the movie to be released on the Disney plus, watch it on your TV or phone. Movie seems to be empty, typical marvel movie that same old CGI and hollow plot line. Personally I'm over it: sups movie are overrated.

title: My first Thor movie and I liked it
text: I really didn't want to see this movie as I'm not a big fan of the MCU, but I ended up watching it with my brother and it was very entertaining! There are lots of good things in it, like amazing special effects, great casting, a couple of jokes, and a reasonable contemporary story. Don't hesitate when you don't know what to watch tonight!

title: If you like subverting marvel movies, this is it
text: If you go into this wanting a cookie cutter marvel super hero movie, you maybe disappointed, but if you're completely exhausted by the marvel cinematic universe and just watching for a fun time, well this a fantastic outing.Best marvel movie since Iron Man 3. Really enjoyed that it doesn't take itself seriously at all. There were a few things that could be better, but all and all, I have to say this is a job well done.My favorite scene was the black and white part, the lighting and coloring was simply to die for, and completely makes up for the hokey cgi at the start.Thor in this movie is a very different character who who he was in the first two Thor movies. Same for Jane. I think overall, it's a better version of the characters.

title: Just Ok. Another miss by Marvel
text: I had high expectations from this one. But the Marvel streak of average movie continues.Missing the magic of Marvel that was there till the end of phase 3. Forced jokes, not much depth. Just a one time watch. I cancelled my second viewing of tomorrow.Marvel, get better writers.

title: The Dark World is no longer the worst Thor movie.
text: May be the worst MCU movie to date. A jealous axe, screaming goats, some Earth to the Moon flashbacks. This is just the tip of the sh**tburg that is Thor: Love and Thunder. The sad part is the story had the potential to make a very good movie and there were some missed opportunities for subtle humor (would have love to have seen someone's arm in a case in Valhalla...) and things like a laser eye bunny would even have been funny if we hadn't been beat to death with bad humor. None of this is really surprising as the MCU looks to be spiraling down to DC level. Kind of made the latest Sucide Squad look good.

title: Meet The Spartans
text: I already prepared myself for the humor in this movie. It is Taika Waititi afterall. It's a bit heavy handed. Some of the jokes were just super cringe. Had some great visuals through. I thought all the cinematography regarding Gorr was super inventive, and top notch. Wish they leaned more into the heavy metal stuff but what we got was pretty mint. Gorr as a villain was intriguing. Menacing. Jane's story was tasteful. Disappointed with how they handled certain characters without going into spoilers. While this flick was entertaining, I can't help but think this is more "Meet The Spartans" than "300". And Marvel Studios keeps doubling down on this type of humor in all their properties. So that's just their standard as of now.

title: Too goofy?
text:
IN A NUTSHELL:
Welcome back to the exciting world of the Marvel Cinematic Universe! In this new addition, Thor enlists the help of Valkyrie, Korg, and ex-girlfriend Jane Foster to fight Gorr the God Butcher, who intends to make the gods extinct.This hilarious and fun movie was directed by the creative and playful Taika Waititi, as well as written by him with writing help by Jennifer Kaytin Robinson. Stan Lee gets writing credits for his visionary Marvel comics. Man, I miss seeing his cameos in Marvel movies.THINGS I LIKED:
Chris Hemsworth was made for this role. He's bigger and badder than ever. His trainer, Luke Zocchi stated, "He is in phenomenal nick. He's the biggest he has ever been. He's the heaviest he's ever been. This extent of musculature required Hemsworth to eat at least 8 times a day during the entire duration of filming just to maintain all the muscle mass he had acquired." There's a scene when we see Hemsworth completely naked from behind and shirtless from the front. Speaking about his physique, admiring Chris Pratt called Hemsworth a man-God. Ha ha Chris Hemsworth's son Tristan is seen in the movie as the young Thor.Who doesn't love Thor? He has more stand-alone films than any other MCU character.The cast features five Oscar winners - Christian Bale, Matt Damon, Natalie Portman, Taika Waititi, and Russell Crowe - and two Oscar nominees - Bradley Cooper and Melissa McCarthy.To catch everyone up to speed, an entertaining summary features video clips from Thor's past movies, plus a few new ones to fill in the blanks.Wow, I didn't even recognize Christian Bale until he started to speak! Initially, he turned down the role but his kids begged him to do it. His performance is exceptional and what takes the parody style of the movie into an Avenger battle.It's so great to see the beautiful and talented Natalie Portman again. She looks amazing.I adore the Guardians of the Galaxy, so I loved their inclusion in this story.So much humor, both visual and spoken.Fun, rocking soundtrack.So many fun cameos like Matt Damon, Melissa McCarthy, and...no more spoilers.Lots of flashbacks and fun Easter Eggs for true MCU fans.As with all MCU films, keep watching during the final rolling credits for another scene and sneak peek at what's to come.THINGS I DIDN'T LIKE:
Not all of the humor lands. In fact, some of the cheap and quirky jokes get in the way of developing a powerful movie. Overall, the movie feels like a goof-fest and even a little embarrassing.What the heck was that accent supposed to be for Zeus? Russell Crowe's portrayal was way too silly and even disrespectful for the all-powerful Zeus.Christian Bale's character was interesting and completely underutilized. Korg had more screen time and lines than the villain in the film. Bad move.TIPS FOR PARENTS:
Some profanity
Lesbian references
Superhero violence.Various kinds of weapons were used.People die.THEMES:
Love and loss
Purpose in life
Self-discovery
Friendship
Loyalty

title: These movies are getting worse all the time
text: As a life long Marvel fan, I've come to look forward to all these movies. Thor was always one of my favorite characters in the comics, but in these movies, he's becoming little more than a punchline. I can appreciate the occasional joke here and there, but the last two Thor movies have disappointed on almost every level. Mixing Thor in with the Guardians (and their *mostly* well done slapstick) has had a very negative effect on his character. Not even Christian Bale's excellent villain could save this movie. So much time was wasted with the extremely poor jokes that his (Bale's) character was more a side story than the main story. Even Russell Crowe's Zeus was made out to be a bumbling clod for the sake of a few 'jokes'. The actual super hero scenes that were in the movie were great, but they were too far and few to save this joke of a movie.

title: Genuinely thought this was a parody
text: I'm really easy to please when it comes to films and love all the thor films and his featured parts in the MCU universe. But wow, shocked at the childish dialogue, forced acting by incredible actors and no break away from what felt like a pure parody of thor. I atcually had to press back to double check I was genuinely watching the new thor film. All the ingredients were here, great actor's including the addition of Bail and Crowe, great effects even guardians of the galaxy....but it was baked essentially into a parody of a film. I felt nothing, even in the scenes where I absolutely should have, yes thor films typically have a few moments of humour but through the entire thing? Most of which wasn't that funny, in fact some moments made me cringy uncomfortable. Crowe did make me laugh however as Zeus, although Crowes impeccable talent was wasted, making him a comedian god rather than the legend and myth we've all come to know...this film could have been amazing and I'm truly shocked at how much talent and opportunity they wasted on jokes and forced comedy value...so much so the film was turned off for over three hours whilst I cooked and ate dinner.. That shows how little invested I was.

title: Marvel Dead and Buried well done Disney
text: Since Marvel Studios was taken over by Disney and the sad loss of Stan Lee the decline has now reached a Rot!Disney has completely Destroyed Marvel the days of Daredevil the Punisher Ironman Jade Jones to name but a few are long long gone Marvel used to be imo the Number 1 in comic book fantasy series DC could never compete with! Now Marvel has turned so bad that they make even DC look great!This latest offering is pathetic as are the tongue in cheek attempt at humour which fails so badly rendering this movie to neither be a comedy or an action movie I wonder for how long Chris Hemsworth can carry on as Thor without dying of embarrassment at the scripts he is given!Hard to get excited anymore about any New Marvel offerings as time after time the writers fail and produce blandness and badly scripted blandness like this!

title: Not as bad as the reviews say
text: Christian Bale carried this movie. Wish he was given more screen time, his scenes and acting was phenomenal. If it weren't for him this movie would have bombed.

title: Disappointing Sequel!!
text: I am a huge fan of marvel, always loved The character Thor and Thor Ragnarak was the best movie among all Thor movies.Love and thunder was definitely most awaited movie and at the same i never been so disappointed with a marvel movie until now. Most marvel movies are now being able for the story continuity or else this movie would be a disastrous at box office.The worst is that they tried to make Thor some kind of comedy icon , the forced comedy in the movie is so bad I ended feeling disgusted by it.Please stop trying to make Thor look like a joker. We want an all powerful Thor not just the joker.

title: Poorly made comedy skit
text: Everything is a joke and nothing is important. I have seen kid shows that were more serious. The only reason I give it a 3 is Christian bale otherwise it was a fat 1.MCU is down bad lately.

title: More Gorr The God Butcher In Future even in Secret wars its OK but make him come back
text: Good movie but what's more good is Christian Bale's Amazing Acting the rest was OK the movie It's not better than thor Ragnarok but it is watchable,Overall I'll give it a 7.5.One of the problem is the length of the movie to short and what was good was the post credit. One of the problem where Some Lines they said like to make jokes that were meant to laugh at it but it just dosent after that Gorr part in the movie too short i Need more Christian Bale as Goor. Another Thing Zeus stupid role try to make it funny no it wasent Another Character wasted. Cgi Wasnt that bad like people were saying for some scenes.

title: Thor 4: More Thor
text: Such a disappointment. Great performances can't save this train wreck.Sure, Thor gets objectified which people on this website seem to take a great issue with. Who cares, none of it's real. Double standards, true. But oh well.He's juicing. Looks incredible but he's definitely on gear.Revolting & unfinished CGI. Of all the 'jokes' in the film the audience laughed at maybe two of them.Vin Diesel's voice appears as well. Vin Diesel is the worst.

title: What a joke.
text: This movie doesn't classify as a comedy, it is a parody. Like disaster movie or Epic movie it was a non spoof. I left the cinema feeling physically ill. Marvel is dead.

title: This movie is a joke, right??
text: Is this supposed to be a joke?? Cause I'm not laughing.The movie had great casts and was an adaptation of a good story, but what we got?? A character butchered by the name of God Butcher. Wasted 2 hours literally ðŸ˜‘ðŸ˜‘Had great acting from Christian Bale but his story was too weak and this movie didn't do him justice. And they made a joke out of Zeus. Sorry to say MCU is declining. We want good contents from them, not something shabby like this movie or Moon Knight(well it was kinda ok) or She-Hulk which is just hilarious. Well I was a bit excited about getting the Guardians but they had minimal impact in my opinion. So I'd like to look into their future projects.The visual was good but I don't see it's strong points otherwise. Good luck making good movies next time marvel & disney.

title: Marvel movies are going the wrong direction
text: This might keep younger kids happy, but as an adult, this movie is just way too silly. The first Thor movie was more on par for what Marvel fans would want. It seems to me that they are trying to do a clean version of Deadpool by forcing lame humor in it. Deadpool was hilarious, but I understand keeping other Marvel movies more kid friendly. But humor is NOT required if a movie is well done. It feels forced way too many times and most often falls right on it's face. Thor was not funny in the comic books. Nor was Tony Stark. But look what the writer's and directors are doing to these characters! FacepalmThis just may be the worst Marvel movie yet.

title: Pretty mich similar level of fun to third one.
text: I mean if you like Thor, you'll like it. If you like Avengers , you'll like it, Marvel you'll like it.Really enjoyed it ,didn't have great expectations I mean Marvel can't be perfect and maybe that's the key. I expect some good film and keep getting fantastic stuff.

title: Probably the worst marvel movie I have ever seen
text: Why would 1 make this movie. I don't ever remember the last time a movie gave me a headache. Watti should stop directing movies .................................

title: Gotta bring all the Love and Thunder!
text: I finally watched Thor: Love and Thunder. It was not bad, but still a pretty good Thor movie. Not gonna lie. Chris Hemsworth was great as he usually is, and Natalie Portman did great and she looked very beautiful in the film. Christian Bale did such an amazing job playing the best super villain Gorr the God Butcher, he's performance was on fire!Taika Waititi did a pretty good job making this movie so rock and rolling with load of action and comedy, and with incredible classic music and his best voice character: Korg.Best Thor movie in the world! But no spoilers for this movie. So... yeah.

title: A hollow shell. What a joke of a movie
text: This is, BY FAR, the worst MCU movie to date.I might have enjoyed the story, if I wasn't flooded by that endless diarrhea of jokes.I might have enjoyed the CGI, if I wasn't flooded by that endless diarrhea of jokes.I might have enjoyed the addition of some of my most beloved characters in the MCU, if I wasn't flooded by that endless diarrhea of jokes.I might have enjoyed the jokes, if they were actually funny.I counted 3 or 4 jokes that were actually funny. 3 or 4! Out of what felt like 12 gazillion. What were they thinking? Is this is a movie for 4 years olds? Made by 4 year olds?Thor: Ragnarok, by the same director, already made a turn for the worse but was at least mildly entertaining. Thor: Love and Thunder is not; I find it hard to find any redeeming value here.This felt like watching a 6 hour long unfunny version of the Naked Gun or Airplane. What is going on here? What happened to the MCU? Phase 4 is just plain terrible and this is rock bottom right here. Everything good about Marvel and the MCU apparently ended with Endgame.Thor has become a joke, a parody of himself. What an absolute stinker.1/10.

title: An action comedy with tragic ending
text: Every complain about the movie does not make sense. There are lots of comedy moments some of them really good. There some (not all) very good action scenes and by end the story ends tragically with the death of one of the main characters.Taika Waititi is an adult comedy director (not so much about sex) and it seems Disney forced him to tune down certain things and add some kids adventures to the mess.In any case the movie is entertaining, very well acted by almost everybody (Portman did not seem too secure for the part) and with mostly with good action scenes.What other thing could you want ?

title: SO BAD
text: The CGI was the worst I've ever seen. I really can't understand why they are making their movies with such poor quality.. That's always been something I've looked forward to in marvel movies. Now almost every single new marvel movie/ tv show I've seen in the past year have the WORST graphics. It's trusty disappointing. I felt like I was watching a really bad boring play with what little I could watch. Didn't even make it 20 minutes in until I turned it off. Waited patiently for years to watch this movie I've been so excited about watching this movie.... So disappointed. I really wish they would go back to the old marvel. I can honestly say... I'm done watching anytime marvel until they redeem themselves. Save your money and your time. It's not worth it. Do better marvel.

title: Did you guys not get the concept of this movie??? You are saying this was as bad as the dark world
text: You guys are s*** fans. Was the movie too funny for you or something? I don't recall where it had to be a serious film. Maybe rewatch it. It's a beautifully done movie and gorr wasn't meant to be a big bad in phase 4...so they nerfed him big deal enjoy movies for what they are.

title: A parody of Thor
text: Thor has always been my favourite Avenger.Ragnarok was vastly different in style and writing, but I still enjoyed it. This movie attempts to double down on the same formula with more "stupid Thor", cheap laughs and outright gratuitous sillyness.It has its bright moments here and there, but I can't stomach what they've done with the character.I'm probably not going to see anymore MCU movies in the cinema from now on, as they're increasingly bereft of heart, charm and what made many of the prior movies so good.

title: Fun Thor movie
text: This movie at times can be a little over the top but it's entertaining and has some good Thor action so thumbs up! Love Taika Waititi's Thor films for this reason.

title: It's nothing but a joke
text:
Whole movie is joke, it's very like I was watching stand up comedy,
Very disappointed to see the character thor like comedian, he is God and suffered alot in his life...
And Christian Bale (gorr) character is wasted..

title: Go at your own risk!!
text: It feels like lately that marvel has forgotten what makes their movies great. A great narrative which showed thanos take on the Avengers. A great saga and finally a great bookend to the 10 years of marvel. This movie has just fan moments and lately that's what all marvel movies feel like they are rushed to have few fan moments that honestly don't make any sense without the plot driving it.

title: Not as bad as lots of reviews say
text: Yes the jokes may be corny in parts the story was sensitive and well told I don't think it deserves so many 1 stars so I'm evening it out with a 10 it's not a bad movie to watch as long as you remember that this movie is different to other traditional marvel movies but Thor movies were always more comedic it's a enjoyable movie to watch.

title: Parody
text: Don't do my mistake and think this is a Thor movie. It's a parody, like Hot Shots, Scary Movie and alike. My score is only low because I thought I was going to watch a Marvel Superhero movie. This movie is not for an audience that know and enjoy the Marvel univers and want a dose of good entertainment based on the comics.Watch it for fun and see an alternative and cooky version of known characters and the producers imagination when introducing new ones.Characters are kind of shallow and props seems kind of cheap. Plastic armor and plastic weapons - like those in B-movies, which this might be.Waiting eagerly for movies based on the comics and sticking to the story - the original stories.

title: WOW! 10/10?
text: I loved it. GREAT MOVIE! Best movie of the year easily to me. Old people should really watch this! It will help my grandma to find her answers. I hope.

title: Boring. Pathetic. Unworthy.
text: Wow. The funny parts weren't. The serious parts were...but not in a good way. The acting, save for a few moments, was poor.Completely unworthy of the characters, the story, and the series.You have been warned.

title: Thor: Love and Thunder
text:
Awesome Movie, very colourful and true to the comics. Not sure why everyone is complaining
about being bad. The movie is fun, vibrant and good to watch.

title: BEST MCU MOVIE
text: This was by far one of the best mcu MOVIE EVER!!!!It has laughter, tears and actions WHAT MORE CAN YOU ASK FOR. All the people saying it was "empty" or "missing something" are the one who are empty inside. This MOVIE was amazing 10/10. I don't understand all the bad reviews for this movie, maybe we saw different movies cause this one was top notch. Thor has always been the funniest Avenger so it makes sense this movie was full of laughter. If you wanted something more "serious" go watch a documentary.

title: Worst marvel movie I've ever seen
text: I made an account here just to fully explain just how bad this movie is.So I watch some of these brain rot fun movies from time to time, but this one was borderline depressing. The storyline was non existent, it was obnoxious, and the special effects didn't even look good? It's like they had a low budget, couldn't even afford writers and just wanted to make a new thor movie. The villain isn't interesting, the humor isn't funny, the action is boring, and pretty much everything good in the first thor was undone here. It's like smearing poop over what was once a brick of gold.This movie is like a cheesy hollywood movie with the good parts removed, so you can't even enjoy it in stupid fun. And think about how much money went into this disappointment: what an absolute waste.

title: When humor and politics are dominant we get... this
text: A relatively terrible movie. The ending being its only saving grace. Forced humor and overbearing politics yet again. Marvel and Disney are on a losing streak here. With this and she hulk, we see what really matters to these "artists" now. Sacrificing artistic vision and story and atmosphere in the name of "inclusion". Of course they're calling Valkyrie 'king'. Of course she had a girlfriend. Of course korg has a boyfriend. Of COURSE. It's all just so forced and entirely unsubtle. This is not even bad compared to she hulk. So I'd still say watch this instead of that, but the major question here is this;HOW did we go from Thor: Ragnarok, to THIS trash? How? We are currently watching the fall of what was once a really well done take on a universe many have loved for decades. We're watching the MCU die by their own glider. As it were. No way home is the ONLY good thing to come out of this pile of politics ridden rubble in recent memory. May we cherish that sole venture as long as possible. Because from now on, it appears we have THIS trash to look forward to.If this, captain marvel, end game and she hulk are anything go by, this is the new norm for this "franchise". Forced eye-roll inducing cringe fest. I'm done. I'll watch spiderman, but I even doubt he'll be free of this garbage going forward. Our media is tainted.Long gone are the days of Sarah conner and Ellen Ripley. LONG GONE.

title: Needs a major edit
text: There needs to be another cut of this film, taking out half a hour of unnecessary jokes to make the movie decent (or at least watchable). Some major reshoots are also needed to maintain the continuity of the characters from previous movies, and not have them all feel like idiots.

title: Epic fun movie without all the depressing soap opera garbage of the past years
text: A refreshing, visually stunning film that was thoroughly enjoyed by all age groups in our visit. Everyone liked that it was not another depressing pompous soap opera where major characters are killed every now and then in GOT style. Lightfooted, fun yet filled with serious moments it can be thoroughly recommended.

title: What a bad movie!!
text: Guys, whoever green light this movie should really reconsider his next step. Totally waste of time, uninspired jokes, high-school teenage drama and cgi. Compared to this, the first thor movie is a masterpiece. Don't bother watching, this was clearly a easy-money offer for the entire cast.

title: Better than Ragnarok. Too short. Bad ending. Jane foster movie.
text: Should have had more Jane foster and more time diving into her character and the villain. Felt like the movie actually played a part in the Grand sceme of things, which Ragnarok was just a side story. I'm glad they showed that the villian was doubled sided that got corrupted by a certain sword. The parade or joke on God's throughout the movie was great, since god's have been criticized throughout human history. The mockery and critic on God's helped show other aspects of the human slash God relationship.Overall great movie. Jane foster was the only thing that mattered in the movie.

title: BORING with a capital B
text: They clearly were desperate to put anything on the screen and that's what they did. Just about everything after Endgame was been pretty weak. Eternals was the absolute tip of terrible.

title: Left so happy
text: Went solo to watch this one and had the best time watching it. I absolutely loved it. Idon't why people are complaining, it's so funny and fresh. Gonna go one more time to watch with family.

title: Dissapointed

title: And so it ends
text: Big fan of the MCU, big fan of Thor, Hemsworth and Taika, Bale but this was just meh.Too short, too many contrivances, not enough Bale, too much of the "the message".It's over, we all kind of knew if after Endgame, but this film rubber stamped it. All the films since have been average at best, and some way worse than that, Spider-Man was only elevated by the cameos.It's now quantity over quality, as the box office numbers suffer, it puts more pressure on the quantity, none of the new conveyor belt of stuff just announced at SDCC excites me.Let's get back to proper films, about drama and character across all catagories of movies.The MCU is done.

title: Why? What would make Disney ruin the MCU so brutally?
text: I have been a marvel comic nerd since I was 6 years old. Thor has always been a staple for me. Nothing about this movie speaks to any Thor comics I've ever read. Maybe something newly created resembles this.The best way I can sum up this film is an old school parody called space balls. This film is exactly the difference between space balls and Star Wars. It must be a parody. There is no other way to slice it. It's like the Director, if there was one for real? Decided I will just take all of the past Thor, Guardian and Avengers films and make unfunny parody's about that do not hold true to any semblance of comic or film. It's a joke, but in the worst sense of the word.Fluffy and woke, no substance and to top it off, across the board by far the worst CGI to date.I guess with the success of the avengers franchise, it means the powers that be can ride that wave for a long time and not continue to put out solid content.It should be the golden age of bringing marvel characters to life. Instead, Disney is doing its very best to make these films as cheesy and visually terrible as super hero movies of the 1980's.Bravo.

title: Fun Movie
text: Not sure what people expect anymore. This was a fun movie that opened establishing clear motives for the protagonist and frankly I loved every minute of it. I went in expecting just a fun action movie and it came off with so much more.

title: Nice Cameos
text: Went into the film with no expectations after reading some reviews, but really enjoyed it. Yes it was a little comical at times, but it was nice to see this kind of film in the marvel universe. Cristian Bale was excellent and some of the cameos were hilarious, like Russle Crow.

title: Underwhelming to say the least...
text: I really wanted to like Thor: Love and Thunder but this i the first Marvel film I almost left the theater. It's like a parody of itself. The pacing is of, the comedy gets old very quickly and many parts of the movie is just cringe worthy. So much wasted potential. Its more like an SNL sketch making fun of Marvel than an actual Marvel movie. I felt really let down as a fan and it really lowered my excitement for upcoming movies.

title: The dead of marvel world
text: There are ways to see this new marvel's product: the first one imaging a continuity with the past, the second is thinking to a Mel Brooks creation. In both you will fall in a shaming result . Thor became a stupid romantic character while Nathalie Portman is a female Thor despite a cancer that Mijolnir is accelerating. Of course Antony and sick woman could win against huge male monsters in alignment with the ne mainstream novel. We need to be host , there is something to save : the bad enemy Christian Bale offers a great interpretation. We cannot say the same for Russel Crowen poisoned in the ridiculous character of Zeus. We strongly hope to forget this movie as soon as possible.

title: The mediocrity of hero cinema
text: "Thor: Love and Thunder" is a film that constantly seeks to combine action and humor, and it misses both, the jokes are shallow, poorly executed, there is no punch and at a certain moment it seems that we are seeing "everyone in panic" but Thor doesn't have the same wisdom as the classic comedy anthology, because it still tries to take itself seriously and still tries to preach a totally infantilized humor, even the development of the characters is null, the construction of Thor as Natalie Portman is non-existent, the construction of the villain is done in three minutes - it's serious - we don't feel attached to any character, nothing works in terms of script here and to complete the action scenes are with a terrible CGI, we have a constant use of dark scenes to disguise the mediocre effects, with a weak choreography and poorly rendered movements, bringing in great actors like Natalie Portman, Christian Bale and Russell Crowe does not save the work, on the contrary, it makes everything just a little more embarrassing, as they all do their part. Cartoonish and poorly written soundings, not even the direction of Taika Waititi saves, the good director has some glimpses of originality, especially at the beginning of the third act, otherwise it seems that the feature was made in 30 days. The soundtrack is very good, but its sound design in the use of scenes is also poorly used. Grade 5/10.

title: A very funny and enjoyable parody
text: Really enjoy this movie, it is quite enjoyable in colorful visual aspect and there is never a lack of good action scenes and amazing special effects. The catch here is that the movie is very comedy oriented, giving it a cartoonish tone and it feels like a parody of Thor. Russell Crowe's Zeus character is too cartoonish and ends up contributing very little. Chris Hemsworth is still the best as Thor and Natalie Portman now has more participation. The relationship between Thor and Jane Foster brings this movie to life more than the first 2 installments and there is more chemistry between them. Christian Bale in the role of Gorr is an extraordinary villain, quite dark and with a good story that justifies his actions. Another exciting thing about the movie is the soundtrack, which includes Guns N' Roses songs that offer a really exciting moment. As much as this movie ends up being a parody, it manages to fulfill its objective of entertaining like any Marvel movie. My final rating for this movie is a 9/10.

title: This is why we love marvel movies.
text: This title makes us remember, we like marvel movies because they are the interpretation of the comics to the cinema.So, as the comics, MCU movies can have different styles and not all of them must be fit with the typical marvel equation.In Thor: Love and Thunder, we can sre the personal progress of two of the main characters and some more development of other secondary character, filled with a lot of humor, positive energy, but also not without heartbreaking drama.The introduction of new good and bad characters is done perfectly.This is the type of movies that don't make great changes in the MCU globally, but give us characters to care about in bigger scenes, that make us love them and enjoy every minute of the movie.I want to thank to Taika Waititi for this movie.P. D. (with concept spoiler, but can be see in the trailer): I like Thor's powers being more about god of thunder and not god of hammers or axes, like in Ragnarok. (Which we didn't see in Avengers)

title: Very disappointing
text: This movie actually is the opposite from the last movie of Thor.This movie try all the time to make you laugh, every single minute.It's boring and empty, we want to see movies that dark and have action.Stop trying to make us laugh all the time.

title: Just so sad
text: It's sad to see what's become of the MCU. This latest phase has so far produced a string of ridiculously bad movies, and I wouldn't be surprised if in ten or fifteen years these hold up about as well as superhero movies from the seventies hold up today: laughably bad.As a longtime fan of the comics, and a huge fan of all of the MCU movies up through End Game (and also the first round of TV shows on Disney+, as well as the Netflix shows and even all seasons of Agents of Shield), I am so sad to see it come to this. The writing has been horrible, and while I put no blame on the actors, I feel the producers and directors should be ashamed to have their names attached to these productions. And before I forget, the musical scores have been cheesy, canned-feeling, and abysmal, and the selection of popular songs lazy and unappealing. A very sad state indeed.

title: Worst movie of the year
text: The humor is bad as is the directing. The story line is unimaginative and thin. If this is the future of MU then I am done. The CG just seemed to basic and no creativity. I almost walked out of of the movie and only stayed to see if it got better, It didn't.

title: Did I Miss Something?
text: I felt the serious moments in the movie were over shadowed by the constant bombardment of jokes and gave it a parody/spoof movie feel.Christian Bales performance was amazing but again over shadowed by the jokes.I felt the story didn't flow. Many of the characters lost their credibility from previous movies and made storm breaker look like a week weapon.This was meant to be a journey of discovery for Thor. It felt like Deadpool on Red bull and I would put Thor Dark World ahead of this.Hemsworth definitely looked the part, played the part well (as in previous movies) and delivered the jokes amazingly. Good jokes... Wrong movieRagnarok was brilliant but Love and Thunder took it too far and it sucks that this is now in the MCU timeline...

title: Thor: A good movie reaching expectations
text: In a critical way. Thor: Love and Thunder is a good movie.The movie knew how to convey the plot of the story in the first few minutes. I managed to entertain myself the whole movie.However, with the movie's budget, I felt that the movie failed to convey a movie idea worth $250 million, even with the great quality of the CGI and the scenarios.From a first glance, I thought the movie didn't know how to make the most of the movie's villain.The film manages to follow an order and met my expectations. My final grade for this movie would be 7. However, I'm a big fan of the MCU, and Thor is one of my favorite characters, so, my final grade is 8.

title: Poor
text: Poor. Very very poor. None of the Thor films have been very good but this takes it to a new low.Terrible start to the to the film, really lazy. The CGI is quite bad for a Marvel film. After that it's just downhill and makes no sense throughout.Christian Bale is awesome. You wouldn't expect anything less from such an amazing actor, but even this can't save this film.You here a lot about how Marvel are destroying the film industry, which isn't a fair comment, but this film doesn't do it any favours.I'm struggling to find anything positive to say. I thought Eternals was bad. But this defo beats its to the punch.

title: This Movie Lives and Dies By Taika Waititi
text: The Good: Christian Bale as Gorr the God Butcher is probably the best thing about this movie. He hams it up a lot, but it feels purposeful. It's also fun to see him play the role of megalomaniacal villain and his motivations are very understandable, even if sorta under baked. Even the segment that takes place in Gorr's homeworld (dimension?) is easily the most visually interesting aspect of the film.Hemsworth is always good as Thor. He has great leading man charisma, but the way the character is treated as a joke for a large portion of the movie feels very strange and quite the departure even from Ragnarok, where "goofy Thor" made his debut. It's as if between that film and the two Avengers, he went down a couple of IQ points. Russell Crowe as Zeus was pretty fun, and I like how he was the sort of antagonist we don't typically see in these movies: a self indulgent, lazy narcissist.I also like the general comedic tone - to an extent - for the sole reason that it represents a change for the MCU. Just like Multiverse of Madness, this movie is really the product of an auteur, mixed with the MCU's requisite standards. While that might not sound good, it does mean the film feels refreshing and tonally distinct from other instalments, even if not always for the best.The Bad: As you're probably aware, Love and Thunder is basically a comedy. It's a funny movie, but it's almost trying so hard to be funny that it comes off as somewhat exhausting. Humour is obviously subjective, so what's funny to me isn't funny to you. I get it. But I think the humour here actively impacts the narrative.Bale's Gorr the God Butcher isn't a very threatening villain and despite some heavy stuff happening, Waititi seems intent on undercutting EVERYTHING with a joke. Jane has cancer? Gorr kidnaps children? The Gods are selfish jerks and maybe should get comeuppance? Difficult ideas are just watered down to the point where you can't take the movie very seriously.It's also hard to explain, but the type of jokes this movie engages in just...feels stale even by the end of the movie. I know in the depths of my soul that this movie will not stand the test of time. There are some jokes that are already dated that confusingly made it into this movie.As for the story, it's very basic and straightforward. Thor needs to stop Gorr and Jane is helping him. That's essentially it. Whereas Ragnarok was pretty clearly a commentary on colonialism and how societies will always, inevitably, have to reckon with it, Love and Thunder doesn't really go anywhere. It doesn't even have a premise; it's trying to be a romantic comedy, but has to also be a generic comic book action film as well. So what we get are both genres messily mashed together and the film never excels in either genre. I do have to say Portman and Hemsworth have pretty natural chemistry, but it's just not enough to carry the film.Tessa Thompson as Valkryie is just really bad. She seems completely checked out of the movie and her character has nothing to do. Watiti as Korg REALLY overstays his welcome and oh my god, those screaming goats. When I say that this movie has some jokes that are just run into the ground, it's these - three? - characters who are the worst culprits.I was shocked by how bad the visual effects were as well. Rumours about the toxic environment that Disney fosters for VFX artists are vindicate with this one. The movie has some very uneven CG, with several moments - some of which have already become infamous on the internet - when my jaw dropped at how bad certain characters and set pieces looked. It's not a good look for such an effects heavy movie.The Ugly: Waititi's distinctive style and sense of humour is all over this thing, and generally, if you find him and his stuff funny, I think you'll like this movie. But, whereas Ragnarok felt like a refreshing and necessary direction for the character to take, Love and Thunder feels like going in the direction for a bit too long and missing the destination. It's not a bad movie, but it's not a particularly memorable one and I can't imagine it gets better with repeat viewings.

title: Eat My Hammer
text:
Watched Thor Love And Thunder with Chris Hemsworth(Extraction) as Thor, Taika Watiti(The Mandalorian) as Korg, Tessa Thompson(Creed II) as Brumhilde/Valkyrie, Chris Pratt(Jurassic World Franchise) as Peter Quill/Star-Lord, Bradley Cooper(Nightmare Ally) as Rocket, Pom Klementieff(Guardians Of The Galaxy Vol.2) as Mantis, Karen Gillan(Gunpowder Milkshake) as Nebula, Vin Diesel(Fast 9) as Groot, Oscar Winner Christian Bale(The Fighter) as Gorr With Oscar Winner Russell Crowe(Gladiator ) as Zeus, and Oscar winner Natalie Portman(Black Swan) as Jane Foster/Mighty Thor.I watched was great Hemsworth,Thompson Portman, Crowe and Bale did phenomenal very Fun as well poignant but Hopeful Like Better also a great Opening scene with Thor as well "Eat My Hammer" also I thinkTaika Waiti's upcoming Star Wars Movie will be good he can hit Serious and funny at the same time that is his next project.Great Music By Michael Giacchino(Spider-Man:No Way Home), Cinematography By
Barry Idoine (Rogue One), and Direction By Oscar Winning Taika Waititi(Jojo Rabbit) Eat My Hammer 8/10.

title: One of the worst Marvel movies
text: It's hard to know where to start on how bad this movie actually is. I have literally had to stop and restart it three times and I am not sure I am even going to be able to finish. It's like this movie was trying to be forced into a position to make money, with terrible riding goofy effects and nothing that really seem to follow the quality of the Marvel movies that have previously been there. However when you do look around and see Shiho which is equally as terrible and you look at this movie maybe it makes more sense that Marvel is actually slipping in their quality of writing, directing and production. I recommend to not waste your time.

title: Not perfect but incredibly enjoyable
text: Is this the perfect marvel film? No. Is this the perfect Thor film? Probably not but it is an incredibly light hearted film that deals with a handful of serious issues. It keeps us engulfed in a universe that Thor has never been given before masterfully created by the wonderful Taika Waititi. He has once again created a masterpiece that finds Its own way to grip an audience it is not the action masterpiece that is Endgame or the nostalgia trip that was no way home it is instead an amazing viewing experience that will have the audience laughing as well as crying and hearing some of the behind the scenes news it only adds to the enjoyment of this film. If you haven't it is definitely a one to watch film.

title: A Marvel Parody
text: We LOVE Marvel. But wow....this movie should have never made it to the public. This was not a marvel movie - the only way to describe it was that it was more like a Marvel Parody. We were ready to leave within the first 10 minutes. Do NOT waste your time. Worst movie I've ever seen, the whole time we just kept looking at each other wondering if this was all just a joke and it was going to get better. It didn't.

title: An 80s Space Opera, sprinkled with Tim Burton-esque influences
text:
*SPOILER FREE*
Just watched it. A solid runner-up to Ragnarok.There was some heavy exposition in spots, but balanced by appropriate casting and momentum.I would have liked to see more of Jane Foster's arc on screen - as opposed to exposition, but it was still enjoyable. Taiwan directs action and music with seamless skill. Michael Giacciono's scores are also fast making him one of today's most versatile movie composers - he will be up there with the best in another decade. Great visuals. Less exposition and another 15 minutes of actually witnessing internal conflicts (Gorr) and Jane's journey are my only gripes. Better than the 6 out of 10 it is getting; definitely a 7.5 to 8.

title: Worst Marvel movie ever
text: The movie was bad. Every two sentences in the movie tried to be a joke and maybe two of them landed throughout the whole movie.I am very dissapointed in Taika Waititi. How can you write something like this and think its funny. I have seen your work before and never have been dissapointed.Christian Bales part was fine. Not good but fine.

title: Nailed it!
text: Liked: Chris Hemsworth continues to grow in this role.Loved: Natalie Portman nailed this!I went into this movie a little gun shy after being burned by Ragnarok. I may be in the minority of those that didn't like Taika's take on Ragnarok. It was too silly and all the jokes felt like they were forced in there. Now Love and Thunder did have humor and it was silly in some spots but they were better laid out. It didn't feel like that annoying kid in class blurting out dumb jokes trying to get attention. It was surprising. At one point it pulled on some threads that Jojo Rabbit pulled on. The title itself you think it is referencing one thing but once you finish the film you'll realize it's true meaning. I really enjoyed this entry in the Thor series. 1 mid and post credit scene topped off the film and both were actually very meaningful. Great Flick!

title: Don't do drugs, kids
text: I thought Ethernals and Morbuis are bad, bud damn, that was another level here. I don't know what did they smoke but this movie is ridiculous... not in the good way. Total waste of time. Feel bad for people, paying to see this in the TheatersThis movie looks like parody of MCU movies. The whole vibe is a total joke. It started soooo good with decent scene , and that opening scene was the only good thing here. Everything after looks like cheap parody. The Van Dam split (with Kung Pow vibes, tho Kung Pow is quite good for parody!) was so out of place. The movie was filled with ton of references , some of which were not even related to MCU and had no place there.And it's COLORFUL .... if you thought that Ethernals was with depressed colors, come here, here the saturation is +1000. CGI and visuals aren't bad technically, but kinda childish at times.The plot story itself wouldn't be bad, if it wasn't filled with so much random stuff. Dialogues were as stupid as they can be.Bale's performance is good, too bad it was wasted on such movie. The other casts' performance wasn't even good, just typical disney stuff...Sound was good.. but only good. You had decent surround sound and some bass... But nothing impressive. You'd expect amazing surround for such movie but no, not at all. Atmos sound was there just to say there is Atmos, but besides that you wouldn't notice if your height speakers don't work at all. The bass wasn't that low and impressive either.If you like Guns'n'Roses you'd give it 1 point more.. if you ignore the fact that all of the songs troughout the movie doesn't even fit the scenes and they are put there probably because someone on the team loves Guns :D.P. S. Hercules would NEVER obey Zeuss for no reason just because his father is angry and wants revenge :D Greek mythology 101. (2nd post scene)

title: Marvel is releasing garbage these days
text: Taika is a bigot whom cares more about making himself laugh than making a coherent film. The man is a joke and should be banned from Hollywood. I'll even go further to say that Feige is a crook whom lately has been rushing out these movies with CGI that looks like it was done in 2005 and approves scripts so cheesy and lazy that I'm shocked only the VFX artists have whistleblown about their treatment on set. Surely, this puts a strain on every crew member, including the actors. They must be getting paid handsomely enough to still be able to smile during their interviews. Terrible movie and shame on Marvel for their efforts as of late. It's 2022 and a company as HUGE as Disney is releasing this kind of stuff. Let that really sink in and if you're one of those people who thinks, "oh we should be happy and not complain", then you're part of the problem because if they're able to do the bare minimum and still sell tickets, what makes you think they're not going to continue to do so?

title: First time in a while I felt GOOD leaving a theatre
text: I cannot understand the amount of negative reviews. My friend, her extended family, myself and my family absolutely loved it. The first Marvel film in a while where I teared up at certain moments, got excited at others, and left the theatre feeling actual JOY.Context: I'm a hardcore MCU fan, love all the movies (some more than others), a comic reader, and I'm not even a huge fan of Thor. But I genuinely enjoyed this movie and haven't left the theatre that elated in a very long while.This is definitely a fun movie, how Thor acts (considered more comedic) is understandable as he grew up in the land of seriousness where they told great stories about great warriors, and now considers Earth a second home where he's learning to take life less seriously and be more humorous. Then, of course, his time with the Guardians.I LOVED BALE. Honestly love everything he does. I specifically loved how he portrayed Gorr's voice. Such a nice change to have a different style from traditional villains. Yes, it would've been nice to see him "butcher" more gods, but at the same time, adding that in might've messed up pacing - where would they have fit in this rampage?I was pretty happy with the ending, it's nice they didn't go with the traditional (expected) happily ever after route. After credits, like always, opened a couple of doors. I wasn't the biggest fan of the scene Thor gets stripped (as seen in trailer), but it's not really one of the memorable parts of the film so it's fine.

title: Horrendous.
text: What the hell did I just watch? The last two Marvel films have been utterly shocking to say the least. Their films are definitely on the decline, be that awful CGI/use of blue/green screen, terrible writing or pitiful attempts at humour that just come off as cringe.The only saving grace was Bale, and he had about 15 seconds of screen time.Long gone are the days of the original Iron Man and Cap style films.Hey, at least Moon Knight was good?

title: IT WAS PERFECT

title: Not that deep

title: A Joke

title: Spoiler free
text: Why Marvel ar makeing short duration movies!Excellent movie... But too much short when everybody get connected with the movie it was end... First half was really light and it's good, but when in second half the serious moment was set for a perfect climax it's too short to connect with the situation....

title: Getting Worse
text: To start with the positive:1) Gorr the God Butcher was almost a great MCU character. His story was the absolute best part of the whole movie. Unfortunately, he was in far too little of the movie.2) the goats were funny.Ok, that's it for the positive.Everything else was awful. While Taiki Waititi was able to insert some well timed humor into Thor: Ragnarok, he still kept with the character and his journey. Here, he tried to make EVERYTHING funny and completely destroyed Thor as a character. At no time during Ragnarok was Thor some stoned duffus as he was during Love & Thunder. If this movie is a legit part of phase 4, then the Thor character was totally destroyed and useless going forward. I would have rather Taiki kill off Thor in this movie and use Natalie Portman going forward (who was still awful, but at least it would be a new character) than for this version of Thor to be the version going forward.Completely ruined the Thor character and from what I've read about Taiki, that may have been his whole point.

title: Can we erase Taika Waititi?
text: This could, and should, be the film that ends Marvel. We all know that the franchise has been in decline for a while but this latest offering plumbs new depths. MCU was one hell of a franchise but the emphasis is firmly on the word "was". There have been occasional mid-steps along the way but no one has done as much damage as Taika Waititi. He has completely destroyed everything that he touches. Stop letting him be in films. Stop letting him write films. Stop letting him direct films.This is nonsensical, incomprehensible garbage of the highest order.For a franchise to work it has to be in the hands of like-minded guardians of the narrative. Jon Favreau was that guy for MCU, just like he now is for Star Wars, but his replacements have been beyond questionable.Time for this to be put out of its misery.

title: It's a Solid Film
text: Not sure why this has so much hate. Compared to Dr. Strange Multiverse this was an exceptional achievement. It's not as good as Thor Ragnarok but there are few Marvel films that are.

title: Naked Thor 4 and 1/4
text: "Please disperse. Nothing to see here." (c)Marvel has become completely lazy. For such millions, they shoot worse than some amateur films on YouTube. Recently, one antics, terrible simple and stupid stories in the scripts. And now they have slipped into the humor of the Naked Gun. The Naked Gun is good, but it's a completely different concept. The faces of the Guardians of the Galaxy team perfectly showed the state and perception of the audience of the movie Thor4. It's not even anger or resentment. This is fatigue. Well, honestly. Well, is there really no good screenwriters and worthy stories for films left in all of Hollywood? Why are you making such a low quality movie?

title: Ooft
text: That was the dumbest movie I have seen in a while. What a waste. Comedy? Well yes the movie was a joke. 2 stars for the production, effects, Bail and the music score. Everything else was terrible. Such a waste of a great cast. The first three were great this final instalment was just pure cheese. But not in a good way. I watched it with a few others and the sighs and ughs were commonplace. It is definitely a one watch movie. It felt like the whole movie was a kitsch imaginary cut scene or a bizarre dream that made no sense and is difficult to remember what happened after waking up. I think this may be a sign of the end of marvel movies. Time to move on maybe.

title: Marvel's First Comedy
text: Taika Waititi took another stab at the Thor movies after his huge success with Thor:Ragnarok, and while it was a fun ride, it wasn't able to top its predecessor. Thor: Love and Thunder was everything but boring. The jokes are shot off at every chance given, and the majority land well. In my opinion, it did the one thing Marvel fans are scared of: became a comedy. It was a fresh take on superhero movies in the sense that it didn't just have comedy, but can be classified under the comedy genre. Waititi has a brilliant, zany mind, and this movie really showed that. Christian Bale's Gorr the God Butcher was excellent, and truly a scary villain. Every character had good development as the movie progressed, and Chris Hemsworth was clearly putting a lot of effort into Thor's personality, which payed off. Plus, Natalie Portman's Jane Foster made an epic return, something anyone can get excited for. The movie also gave us a lot of new, exciting characters and things to look forward to in the future - something every Marvel fan loves. While the plot itself was a bit fast paced, and it kind of felt hard to keep up with the different scenes and settings at times, it still carried itself well. So while it may not be the best of the Thor franchise, it was still a blast, and definitely something I can't wait to see again.

title: Bale Was Amazing!
text: Christian Bale was amazing, and terrifying. But even he cannot save this bad collobration of couple of videos. This thing is a total mess, it made me sleep for the first time in my life while I'm watching a movie. Just remove everything except Christian Bale parts and I'll give it a 6.

title: Funny but what Thor needed
text: It was more humourous than the trailer made it out to be. I thought it would be a lot darker and kind of disappointed that they didn't play Bale's character more. I was still thoroughly entertained and enjoyed the experience. Thor got his lighter, fun movie and Jane got her come back.

title: Seriously marvel...!!! wasted whole movie.
text: We are really disappointed after watching the movie, This is not a real marvel movie, its like some school kids written the script and wasted the whole characters. Comedy doesn't suits everywhere, literally everywhere.

title: Most disappointing marvel movie
text: After Thor Ragnarok, everyone had expected that Thor love and thunder would top that or atleast be on the same level. Going with this mindset one could not be more disappointed. The movie feels like it's forcing it's comedy in each scene making the jokes lose their value, the movie moves along at a brisk space not explaining why what is happening is happening. I would sincerely recommend everyone to not waste their money on this movie, at this point the all marvel phase 4 movie just feel forced having no real connection to any plot.

title: Surprisingly good.
text: Thor: love and thunder follows Thor as he tries to stop a god killer while also dealing with his ex being Thor now. The movie had a engaging storyline with some great humour and action scenes with some great CGI. I think this Thor had the best character development for everyone and we got introduced to some new characters and saw some old. Thor is still badass as ever.I do have to say that some of the humour was forced.The main villain has a very sad backstory which really makes you connect with him.Chris Hemsworth is still badass as Thor but is also trying to find love now after pushing everyone away. Christian Bale plays the main villain Gorr the god butcher and he is terrifying every scene I saw him in he gave me chills running down my spine. Natalie Portman comes back as Jane Foster and is now Thor and she was surprisingly really likeable in this movie. She also had the best character development as well. Tessa Thompson is still Badass and had some pretty funny scenes but she did not get lot to do and she did not appear a lot in this movie. Taika Waititi is hilarious as Korg. And Russell Crowe as Zeus was the biggest jerk but funny.Overall Thor was good I enjoyed it and I think others will too but I think this movie had way to much Comedy in it.

title: Ac couple of laugh only but a waste of money
text: This movie tells you how Hollywood is running out of ideas and how old they are wasting millions of production money on useless films that are unnecessary and doesn't add up anything to the marvel world.

title: Horrible at the same time disappointing.
text: All I have to say is very clear. Thor: Love and Thunder seemed to me a parody / ripoff comey version of Thor franchise. I mean SERIOUSLY?! It was very hard for me to imagine that its a part of THE MCU Timeline. Story, script, direction was below average. But The Humor! Was too much difficult for me to swallow. There was no necessity to present Thor like this form, more like a comedian. I still remember the 'infinity war' version of him, those presence give me goosebumps! But Taika Waititi just successfully ruined the character. Only positive thing is Christian Bale. He nailed as Gorr! Outstanding performance as always. But his screentime was so little that audience must feel craving for more of him.The transformation of Jane was good, praiseworthy. But due to poor direction and script, these two characters weren't able to pull up the movie along. I'm disappointed, as a marvel fan, also as a movie lover/viewer.

title: Christian Bale !!!!!!!!!! Christian Bales great performance wasted in a joke of a film.
text: Christian Bales great performance wasted in a joke of a film.Every million Thor: Love and Thunder makes, is a million Marvel Studios and Disney has stolen, in the true meaning of the word, from fans. And believe me when I say that this farce of a movie is so vacant, that there really is nothing to spoil.

title: Not as bad as everyone is saying it is.
text: This movie is probably not going to appeal to people that take everything too seriously. This movie in my opinion was made in a much more stylized manner. The same went for Doctor Strange. I rate it an 8 star only because it didn't quite live up to Ragnorak. Also the Guardians only had about 10 minutes. Korg is absolutely hilarious. The screaming space goats may have ended up screaming 1 or 2 times too many for me. Solid 8, maybe 8.5..... These reviews leave me wondering if anyone rating it under 5 stars have even seen a 4 star movie before. Or just trying to "cancel" Marvel movies because of Disney being involved...Either way, I believe it's worth it to see it.(This is the first movie I've ever left a review for. I did it because these 5star and under ratings are ridiculous. It is absolutely deserving of at minimum a six star rating and that would probably come from a serious movie critic)

title: marvel just wants money
text: It seems like marvel arent caering to make good movies... they just want to make money.The movie was just bad. With no good plot and they should have kept it the way thor end in thor 3.Dont put your time and money on this movie because it is as bad as all marvel phase 4 movies are...

title: Lower your expectations and it will come out alright.
text:
Here's The 4K Lowedown on "Thor: Love and Thunder" (PG-13 - 2022 - Theater)
Genre: Fantasy/ComicMy Score: 7.7
Cast=10 Acting=5 Plot=7 Ending=9 Story=7
Imagine=9 Pace=7 CGI=10 Comic=7 Funny=6Thor's retirement is interrupted by Gorr the God Butcher, who seeks the extinction of the gods. To combat the threat, Thor enlists the help of King Valkyrie, Korg and ex-girlfriend Jane Foster, who to Thor's surprise wields Mjolnir."Technically, you have to actually die in the battle itself to get to Valhalla." I lowered my expectations on this and it came out alright in my book. There were some groaner moments for sure with the humor and acting of the film, but there was a surprise belly laugh that came out of nowhere which made me put a point back on. As far as the Thor films go, only The Dark World got a lower score. As an MCU fan it was a must watch for me and it will be a must buy. I would be hard pressed to tell anyone they have to see this in the theater or buy it on 4K when it comes out.

title: at best, a terrible attempt at a joke
text: Everything is a joke. Everything is meant to be funny. Nothing has value. All the characters are depthless and shallow. Cgi is terrible. The old gods are ridiculed at every moment. The usual woke stuff but tolerable up to a point.

title: Great movie
text: Surprised at negative reviews, I thought this was great! Really funny and Christian Bale was brilliant! Really enjoyed this, usual adventures and comedy that I've come to expect from Marvel.

title: Is this a spoof?
text: My wife and I turned the movie off twice and had to force ourselves to finish. This is what seems to be an attempted comedy with action? What ever brain cells Thor used to have are completely fried. The jokes are non-stop and most miss the mark, or take away from the story. This movie could not have been more disappointing. Honestly seems like a spoof film on marvel. Marvel was an action movie with jokes spread into it to take away from the sometimes heavy emotional moments. This is just a blubbering idiot saying giberish and swinging an axe. Sorry to see one of my favourite characters reduced to this.

title: Bale fan boys need to stop
text: The movie is THOR, not GORR! Bales part isn't even all that great. Alot of actors could have played that role. I dunno what's wrong with everyone these days. Everyone whining about this and multiverse of madness. Don't like it? Stop watching or at least STOP complaining. Seen way too many 1 and 2 star ratings on here. Gtfo with that. The world is full of entitled karens apparently. It's funny and has good action scenes, what more do people want?

title: A Joke
text: What did I just watch, was this some kinda of joke? When's the real movie coming out. Did some third grade class win a prize to write the dialogue for this. I only finished watching this movie because I paid $2.00 to rent it. And even then I almost fell asleep out of sheer boredom. If I woulda known it would be this bad I would have waited for it to come out on the Disney channel, that why I wouldn't feel so bad turning it off. The kids might like it, if they're able to understand it. Don't waist your money or your time on this movie. Now I'll have to watch the other ones to feel better about the franchise.

title: Very bad
text: This movie was not funny not serious and was like a cheap knock off of what once was a pretty good series. When we had had enough we finally just walked out. Wasn't worth wasting anymore time watching it. Very sad I always like Thor in the series. Love Chris Pratt. Sorry he wasted his time making this looser.

title: Rainbow In The Dark
text: It's sad, it's happy, it's silly, it's funny but most of all it's brilliant! I loved this film so much, I didn't like Ragnarok as much but this one, ha! It's so good! I loved how it was about finding love and peace with of course acceptance. Jane Foster's story fits perfectly into this film and really focuses on Thor's feelings and how he has to go on in life without her and keep living. It's about knowing that life is going to be sad and crap at times but there is always a rainbow bridge in those darks times, screaming goats may or may not be included.The sound tracks and action were spot on, hell yes Jane Foster kicked some butt!!Christian Bale's performance was haunting and broken, you feel sorry for him and understand why he is doing what he is doing, yet you know he has to be stopped.The Guardians being featured in this film is a bonus, I'm just so glad to see them again!They fit perfectly with Thor and his personality.The comical aspects of certain scenes make it awesome and yet "oh dear, haha!".I understand some may hate this film and not enjoy it, but all I can say is watch it with the same mindset of watching Guardians, it's going to be insane.

title: Come on now!
