text: First off. Christian Bale, as usual, great! Everything else was just utter nonsense. How and why are these movies being made? The first Thor movie was good and each one has gotten worse but this one was just utter nonsense! I have no clue what audience this movie was aimed at. I don't know what direction it was trying to head in and neither did the people that made it. Terrible jokes and puns that where just both unfunny , stupid and super annoying with touches of wokeness mixed in. You know Disney has to be sure to keep it's mentally ill woke people happy. After the recent Dr. Strange garbage and now this. Safe to say I am done with these types of movies and probably done with Disney.

title: Another score for Marvel, very colourful.
text: I enjoyed the last Thor: Ragnarok a lot so I was expecting something similar with Thor: Love and Thunder and I can't say I was disappointed. This new Marvel movie was of the same quality as the previous one. Very colourful, bombastic, spiked with again some good humorous scenes mostly because of funny one liners. The CGI's were again very spectacular. The cast consists of very good actors so you know you won't be disappointed by them. Christian Bale's character was creepy so credits to the make-up artists for that. The story is easy to follow, with a lot of action, no dead moments at all. If you're a fan of this genre of Marvel movies, action with a bit of humour, you won't regret watching this new Thor adventure. Up to the next one!

title: Childish and Pointless
text: Thor is a character with some humor, but what they did to Thor - Love an Thunder is childish enough to make the movie practically unwatchable. The foreshadowing was not good and it is confirmed, it is badly written, poorly directed and it is completely inconsequential and ridiculous. Pointless. What's the point of a luxury cast when the content is so poor that even the effects don't help to disguise it. And so begins the destruction of the Marvel Universe after the magnificent Avengers - Endgame. And this is sad. Disney was a symbol of quality that is now fading to a low quality standard, much forced by their political obsession and woke ideology, this destroys good storytelling, every time anyone forces a point of view, whatever it may be, destroys the creativeness and freedom art must have, this applies to all art forms. It's even sadder.

title: Shallow and Weak
text: Honestly, I was surprised at how shallow everything is in this movie. The main villain literally has a 2-minute origin and Jane Foster becomes the mighty Thor off camera. Everything felt like there were no consequences at all. It plays like a Saturday morning cartoon not an epic movie. Outside of one maybe two scenes, there isn't any excessive wokeness which is a redeeming quality. However, the lack of character development and depth makes this definitely a lower end MCU movie. The Guardians of the Galaxy are cameos at best and what they did to Zeus and the other gods is absolutely criminal. This is the weakest Thor movie. When Thor the Dark World is three times the better film you're heading in the wrong direction.

title: Pretty decent one....
text: The movie is pretty decent. I felt script of movies is the weak point and Taika Waititi tries to overcome it with the direction, he succeeded in it to sone extent. Some scenes made goosebumps in the theater. Bale nailed the characters of Gor and done a fantastic job. But felt sad that marvel didn't made a comic accurate look of for on the screen. Nowdays Vfx of marvel movies are upto mark I am totally disappointed with it. Over all good movie.

title: Terrible crap
text: I admit, first one or two movies where a bit of fun to watch, but this one is utterly crap. How is it possible to think people older then 6 should like this movie?Childless, comedian dramatic and so far far away from any classic Thor comic.Imagine a voice over, who talks you to the entire movie; an movie, filled with puppets, cheap effects and plastic looking costumes.This guy is built for other, more realistic action movies and series. Would have been a great Jack Reacher. Make sure he gets a serie like that, and he can make it. Don't let him make the same mistake as his Superman pal, who destroyed his career in the Witcher.

title: What's wrong with people !
text: My family know are Marvel movies and this is great ! I don't really get a lot if the reviews that people have left this is a great godlike romp in true Thor style with great writing and comedy from Taka Waititi LOVE.

title: This is how superhero movies were used to be made..for kids
text: Just like Wonder Woman II, Thor: Love and Thunder seems to have been written and produced by the same team who did the Power Rangers series from the 90s. Everything about this movie: storyline, acting, fights, dialogue, jokes, costumes, CGI etc are kids show quality. Makes you wonder what is going on at Disney for them to have lowered the bar so much. Only Chris Hemsworth's charisma and Christian Bale's acting made this movie bearable. Makes me feel so sad because it kinda ruins the previous Marvel movies just like what a bad ending does to what was turning out to be a great story. I hope Disney rights the ship soon for the sake of those movies and us who love them.

title: feels like sabotage
text: The really seems like a low point for the MCU. The premise alone is bad, especially since the movie goes out of its way to show bad gods. I was actually rooting for the god killer. Even Thor killed Zeus. The acting was amazingly bad. Most of the actors were far below their capabilities. The jokes were bad and nearly constant. Jokes were occurring even when the moment should have been serious. An example was when the children were kidnapped. Not a time for jokes but they were thrown in anyway.I stopped watching this failure half way through. I had better things lines up to watch.

title: Took my 8 year old to see this
text: My 8 year old daughter loved the ending and so did I. It's one of the few marvel movies I would happily rewatch, and let my children watch. Though probably not the 6 year old just yet, there are a few violent scenes that I'm not comfortable letting a very young child watch. I've seen most of the marvel movies and definitely prefer the more light hearted entertaining movies like guardians of the galaxy, so if you like those then you will enjoy this one. A lot of the more serious movies I don't bother rewatching and just watch them to continue the story. The adult jokes in this are not understood by children at all, so that doesn't worry me. Like most marvel movies it's long and my daughter was getting fidgety near the end but managed to capture her attention again with more action and fun near the end. Overall a really fun movie.

title: Weak and full of agendas
text: I can't say it's insufferable because i finished it and enjoyed a bit. But what i enjoyed was the appearance of alot of loved characters and actors other than that the story and the lines were so weak and sometimes childish like they wrote the whole thing in a couple of hours. Also forcing you on some things that are completely irrelevant to the storyline many times is annoying. I didn't like how it ended for the bad guy. It seemed a really not well written ending. We really need a good comeback from marvel because they've been doing a lot of rushed work lately which we don't really enjoy like their past works.

title: A fun, exciting and amusing adventure.
text: This film is quite underrated in my opinion as to what other reviews have to say. The movie knows what it is and does not hold back on the goofiness and comedy that IS Taika Watiti. An overall enjoyable and a refreshing take on Thor as to what we've seen before. Loved seeing Natalie Portman again as Jane Foster and the dynamic between her and Chris is something I've missed seeing. Give this movie a shot and don't judge a book by its cover.. (in this case, misleading reviews) hope this helped, have a great day :)

title: So disappointing. I almost quit watching.
text: So sad to see how this movie turned out. It's a slap to the face and makes great actors and characters seem cheap and laughable. It's just so campy I could barely get through it.I almost went to the theater to watch this but I'm glad I didn't. I would have had to walk out. Instead I saw it at home so I could ten-second jump through the embarrassing parts... so I was jumping through quite a bit.Breaks my heart.I'm wondering the logic behind this move into campy films? Is that what comic book fans are asking for? Because I know, as a movie fan, these last two Thor movies have really turned me off to this universe.

title: Pure garbage
text: I'm a huge fan of the MCU movies but I have no idea what happened here. Although the previous movies had a hint of humor here and there in the right place, this movie was that guy who tells bad jokes at a party while he laughs at himself. I'm not sure who pressed the wrong button to nominate this film for any kind of award. I only watch this movie for first 15 minutes and I was done. I understand that there should be a break in between movies however that should be use to tell a compelling storyline which until now has not been 100% accurate from the comics. The two stars was because of Christian Bale's performance was amazing.

title: Misleadingly hated, yet very beautiful
text: All the hate comments and bashings on this movie are groundless and meaningless. I don't know what the masses of audience expected, but this was basically Ragnarok 2, and Ragnarok was perfect. The only thing that is reproachable was the lack of tone and maturity, but its not an issue to be worries about. The movie was fun, fight scenes was coordinated well and CGI was on point. Plus, Christian Bale NAILED the role. Despite his relatively less screen time, It was sufficient to entertain me. Cool film.

title: Wasted potential
text: This movie had such a huge potential. I really tought this was going to be a great movie with Bale portraying Gorr butchering the gods and Thor trying his best to stop him.Sadly, it turned out different. I really liked Thor during Ragnarock and Infinity War and hoped he got his mind at ease and where back on track as The Mighty (and serious) Thor.The goats where actually great! I hope they both win an Oscar.Makes me really sad to see how far the mighty have fallen. Marvel is rushing everything and releasing tons of series and movies with bad storylines and uncompleted CGI. It feels like the crew never get to finish a movie or series before they have to jump over to next installment.Both She Hulk and Thor: Love and Thunder is a far step down the ladder of perfection. Especially if you compare them with Spider-Man: No Way Home and Doctor Stranger in the Multiverse of Madness which came out earlier this year.

title: Lots of fun
text: Saw this with my other half & our 2 boys (6.5 & 9.5) a couple of nights ago & we all loved it; even my other half, who is generally not that interested in superhero movies.I really enjoyed Ragnarok & was keen to see what Taika did with this one.I was a little bit concerned when the first reviews started coming in & some of them were less than stellar... but I actually thought the movie was very funny, well acted (for the most part - still unsure about Russel/ Zeus' Greek-Australian accent... but I guess it was pretty funny), told a good story, had great action scenes & effects, & was just generally lots of fun to watch.My other half even teared up in one scene toward the end, so it had some emotional depth, too.I guess you can't please everyone but we certainly enjoyed it & I reckon it's definitely worth a watch. Maybe just don't go in taking superhero movies too seriously & you won't be disappointed.

title: A parody of a Marvel film that should've been bad YouTube video.
text: 'Thor: Love and Thunder' has to be the worst Marvel installment I've ever seen. It felt like a parody of a Marvel film. It was akin to watching a non-ironic version of Rick & Morty if the writers couldn't keep track of the storyline and consequently filled it with plot holes to the tune of a GnR 'Greatest Hits' album. Seriously, I love GnR as much as the next guy, but that was ridiculous!The other reviews here seem to have had the same impression. The movie felt like a lazy, impromptu ripoff. These incredible actors could've easily improvised a better film.The I'm genuinely not exaggerating -- it was awful. I hate that this is canon.

title: From God of Thunder to court jester
text: If this is how his new owners see Thor, then I humbly suggest to hire Jim Carrey to play Thor. It'd be a much better fit. I read hundreds of Thor comics and what I saw in this movie has nothing to do with it. Thor is myth and honor, drama and sadness. Losses and epic victories. In this movie instead you see Gods dancing and mocking, you see Zeus using his weapon like a juggler at a Circus show. Thor Love and Thunder is the worst Marvel movie ever. By far. Point is it won't be for long, I bet Disney destruction of the Marvel Universe is far to be completed. Stan Lee is turning in his grave.....

title: Started a 6, rose to 8 and ended 9 stars
text: First 1/2 of the movie was okay, but a little boring and sluggish. But second half started good and ended great.Didn't expect it to be a love story, but it is. It was a real love story for Thor and EVERYONE in the movie. It was a powerful message that applied to everyone, both good and bad.

title: First Hulk now Thor!
text: Disney is really going out of their way to completely sink what's left of the marvel franchise.. The era is pretty much over now, but as long as there is a money to cipher from people, Disney will keep on shoveling mediocre content.

title: It was a great film.
text: Well the reviews of this film had been overwelmingly in the average to lower categories. It didn't have the greatest of plots but I tend to think about these marvel films to be like a bigmac as oppossed to an Gordon Ramsey made rump steak lunch. It had some great fun and nice action, the dolphin scene is escpecially breathtaking. The music was a great add on and like all mcu films, we got what we came for, a fun enjoyable experience. Hemsworth is still strong and the entire film had been fun and enjoyable, not too much too actually make it a GREAT film but like an evening at five guys, only haters will say they did not enjoy it. Overall, a nice film, particularly impressed by the theme music, the cgi and of course a perfect characterisation of Thor and Gorr by Hemsworth and Bale respectively.

title: This movie is a joke.
text:
It has so many jokes that aren't necessary. They putted forced joke as comedy relief. The story They chose to make this movie is good and it should be intense and serious movie. But they made it like a comedy movie every scene, every dialogue has a joke. There are none intense scene in movieIf you only remove Korg character from the movie it will become so good. Because that character has no place in that movie other than making jokes and giving background commentary. His commentaries are stupid and unnecessary.Thor - love and Thunder had been a great movie, if they had made it as it should be. Jokes are necessary part of movies but they should be limited, not everywhere.I gave it 3 stars because
1. It's Thor
2. It's MCU
3. It's story, story was good but the way they made it was wrong. Every story doesn't need jokes.

title: I'm so sad
text: Thor Ragnarok was such a fun and entertaining installment for the Marvel franchise. But he's a white male and we cannot have him being a hero anymore. Nathalie portperson was horrible, Just horrible. I'm sorry, but keep to Ballet and romcoms. You're Crazy eye candy and nothing more.

title: I expected better from a Marvel Movie
text: The worse Marvel adaptation so far, since Stan Lee passed away. The quality was much better when he was involved with the production of Marvel movies. The Marvel movies after 2019 just keep getting farther and farther away from his vision. In Thor, Love and Thunder, there just is not an adult in the room. It focuses too much on children ages 4 to 9 years old. What made all the other Thor movies enjoyable was that they targeted the generation that grew up reading the 1960 and 1970 comics. An adult has trouble understanding the theoretical physics of the time space continuum and quantum mechanics, so how is a child going to relate to these complex theories? Yet the movie is targeting young children as the demographic with these themes. At times I was waiting for the Muppets to dance across the screen and a romper room sing-along. The dialog lacked considerably and the acting for the most part was one bad liner after another. Christian Bale put in a great performance, only to be surrounded by characters that had no substance. What a waste of talent. Is this what we can expect from Marvel in the future; Marvel movies with the look and feel of Saturday morning Power Rangers? What was Taika Waititi thinking.

title: Give waititi a newspaper cartoon and nothing else.
text: This will be the last film he writes/directs that I watch. Could be an epic movie but constant piss taking ruins it. Bale was the only part worth a mention.

title: Just as good as Ragnarock
text: I really enjoyed this movie. It had a great pace. I never had that bored feeling through dialog etc. It did however feel at times that there were parts missing, perhaps to keep within time restraints? Who knows, but I liked it a lot.

title: Omg what a disappointment
text: Boring and the jokes are really stupid and not funny. What a shame. I loved the Ragnarok but this is super lame. So how much is one hundred and fifty characters..

title: Least MARVEL-ous movie marvel ever made
text: Very boring, slow and can't believe they made thor very very stupid and uninteresting. We used to love thor and they have made him stupid and now we cannot love his character any longer. "Mighty thor" is highlighted and she is terrible. This movie is more like a failed effort to replace real thor with a stupid female version. Nothing like the comics. In comics these two are two different heroes but this movie hints that they will replace OUR thor with his ridiculous female version.

title: Absolutely probably the worst marvel movie ever made!
text: I have seen every Marvel and DC movie and I absolutely loved Ragnarok. I must've watched it at least 50 times. I thought that it was a perfect balance of humor and action and it was...just perfect in every way. Thor: love and thunder, however, was awful. They tried too hard at the humor, and, I literally could not watch it any longer and I took a nap halfway through the movie and woke up 20 minutes later to catch the ending. My husband watched the entire thing and he said that he should have gone to sleep too because it was not worth watching. Save your money if you haven't seen it yet and wait for it to be free on streaming. I'm not going to necessarily blame the producers, but the writers should be ashamed of themselves.

title: The Best Thor Yet
text: This movie was great, Chris Hemsworth was hilarious yet was that "strong" badass Thor as well. Bale was a great villain. Had sadness, happiness, action, tad bit of ass but overall an amazing experience..much worth the watch.

title: Thor: Love & corny jokes
text: I cant for the life of me understand why would this movie portrayed the strongest avenger as clueless and weak. A lot of stupid jokes that don't land and child humor all throughout the movie. I went to see the mighty Thor movie, god of thunder ended up watching a bad rom-com sitcom.

title: Do not believe in bad reviews: go to watch the movie
text: I have been an avid marvel reader, have seen all the MCU movies, have seen all Taika movies and have seen all movies ranked above 8 and believe me the movie is fine, if you liked Ragnarok, you'll love this one and if the humor and absurdly things are there it is because is the brush of the artist that makes things different. Natalie, Chris, Christian and the rest of the crew acted perfectly fine. Just watch the movie and enjoy.

title: Weak!
text: This is the first review I have ever done, I don't do reviews but this one was so bad I felt I had to speak up. For such a star filled movie it failed on every level. I feel that I have less respect for some of the stars in this film after watching what they did here. I think that if I were Chris Hemsworth I would've turned this role down. This is by far the worst Thor movie out there and quite possibly the worst marvel movie yet. I am a huge marvel fan And I was extremely disappointed! I literally had to force myself to make it to the end of this film. I kept telling myself it has to get better... it just has too, Yet it never did. The only actor that did an even a halfway decent job was Christian Bale and I'm not even a huge Christian Bale fan. If this is where Marvel is heading I'm just at a loss and don't know what to do except find a new hobby I guess. All I can say is that it looks like Disney is just trying to destroy the franchise. I haven't seen a decent Disney film come out this year. As a fan, I don't know what's going on but I hope whatever it is gets fixed. I wouldn't even give this one a decent rating as a B rated flick. Please Disney get your act together.

title: It's a cinematic garbage
text: It seems everything goes wrong with this movie! Very bad script, screenplay, cinematography, editing, acting, dialogue. I mean everything. There are a lot of questions at every plot point. Like why Valkyrie didn't die with that powerful sword? Why gorr took those kids to eternal gate? There are thousands of weakness in the script. Very poor & disappointing script. It was so boring & unbearable that I wanted to leave it several times.The fun fact is, I didn't know the director & writer's names. I really don't want to. But when I saw the name, I wondered. How the heck Waititi made this movie? It's unbelievable!What happens to marvel?

title: Over the top and eccentric, but it's SUPPOSED TO BE
text: I loved it. Anyone who doesn't is taking it too seriously, kick back and enjoy the ride. Thor has never been better, his growth is unparalleled. From a juvenile in the first movie to the God he is now he has grown more in the last 10 years than he has in the last 3000.

title: Bad
text: Honestly the movie is enjoyable but there was way too much comedy. It was completely overboard the entire time and half the jokes never landed for me. Gorr the God Butcher was easily the best part of the movie though. Christian Bale was amazing and I loved Gorr everytime he was on the screen. Chris Hemsworth does solid too but I don't like how they made thor into a comedian.

title: Now it has to stop
text: It cant be more ridicolous than this. Using such good actors in this parody of a superhero movie.A joke once in a while is ok, but this has reached a lowpoint.I hope some of the actors will reject the offer to return in a Thor movie again, despite the salery.Let there be room for new superheroes, that isn't only put on for laughs. Marvel has totally sold it's soul for pure mammon.There don't have to be a sequal for everything, there can be an end of a story, an end that at least can be remembered for something good. A grand battle that ends with Thor's death. But it is to late, this movie ruined that oppertunity.

title: First Half Worse Than Amateur YouTubers Parody Videos!
text: Where to begin? I guess right from the start when it felt like I am watching a compilations of some random amateur YouTube parody videos, and NOT even a good one. Too much forced comedy for the sack of comedy. It's like Mr. Taika really wanted to stay true to those three words, Marvel Comedic Universe. Unfortunately, that's what majority of MCU movies have been for many years.I would like to think even kids are probably tired of forced lame cheap kiddy humor, like "story telling" and Zeus Court scene, but Box Office numbers tell a different story. Apparently kids, and probably their parents to some extent as well, are actually into this sort of cheap, lazy, lame and nonsense stuff. So, who am I to argue when they are making hundreds of millions, right?Enjoy if this is your cup of tea but if you already had it enough with what Marvel has been offering for last few years, then give this one a miss and in reality you won't miss much at all.The ONLY saving part of this otherwise crappy movie is Christian Bale's performance. Who probably just wanted to have his name on the list of Actors who worked in a Marvel movie, or maybe he was offered a ton of money to participate in this pile of crap. Bale, as usual, gives a great performance despite generic lame dialogues even for his character and tries his best to make sure audience get some of their money's worth.

title: Perfect film
text: My review. A lot of jokes, fun and action. Great film. Recommend it for families.My review. A lot of jokes, fun and action. Great film. Recommend it for families.My review. A lot of jokes, fun and action. Great film. Recommend it for families.

title: Terrible addition to the franchise
text: In isolation, this would be a forgettable high budget movie with incredible cgi and a terrible plot. In comparison to the previous Thor? An offense. Someone at Disney heard "oh the people liked light and breezy? Let's lean in" and forgot to write a plot to be light and breezy about. It has the air of a late 80s sitcom that lost the thread.I should mention that Christian Bale and his character should have made this movie. But it seemed like his adversaries didn't really mind him and instead focused on delivering bad jokes. It made me sad that I bought the tickets, and I love movies.

title: Christian Bale for an Oscar?
text: This IS a family film and it a SPOOF on Thor and his 'super hero' character...especially his supersized ego. Its light and fun and funny....but Christian Bale steals the show. As Batman, his talents were hidden under the cape and towel, but truthfully, his performance in this film is worthy of an oscar. His character is the sun, with everything else circling around him and he is marvellous (pun intended).

title: Just five star about fx effects and actors performances, with special oscar to C.Bale.
text: I was really bored! A character-degrading mockery of Thor, with a boring first-degree pastiche of no importance.Presence of the Guardians of the Galaxy for 2 minutes at the beginning of the film without interest. Why ?About actors:Thanks to Christian Bale who is awesome!Black or mixed-race actors for Wiking? Really ?! Are you completely silly ?Another Marvel blockbuster going down the drain like Suicide Squad!An episode that calls for another. I'm afraid of what's next...Please stop messing up Marvel characters!

title: Great movie for kids under age 4.
text: Its a movie for kids . A must negligible movie . Don't waste time who is thor and avengers previous movies. The originality is missing like a street drama. Street drama is better than this movie. So guys who are going to watch this movie can see another movie or hangout with friends such a joke movie. Its a good movie for children under age 4 they will see it like a cartoon. So guys saying for last time don't waste time to see this movie in theater or by ott platform . Don't try this at home or theater. I don't know why this legend actors acted in this movie i think they don't know the story..

title: Amazing!
text: Taika Waititi continues to amaze, and Tessa Thompson is flawless. I loved this movie so much. Probably not quite as good as Ragnarok, but easily one of the best MCU films still.

title: stupid agenda
text: This is the result of preferring a stupid agenda at the expense of beautiful cinematic art, why this insistence on presenting everything that is boring and incorrect, Marvel and Disney from bad to worse ðŸ‘ŽðŸ‘ŽðŸ‘Ž

title: 100% Pure Gimmicks
text: Everyone including me- came for the cast, and the return of Jane FosterI couldnt believe how bad they messed up such a great story and castJokes were forced and unfunny.GOTG served no purpose and where there just for the gimmicksWait for the stream, sit this one out!

title: My new favorite movie
text: I thought the movie was absolutely fantastic. Christian bale did a great job as gorr. It has great humor/one-liners. Taika watiti is so clever with this movie.Something I wish the movie did was put the opening logo right before the beginning scene. It confused me and I thought it was gonna be a Harry Potter movie because I thought that the whispering was parseltounge.Overall, great movie. 9/10.

title: Bale only good thing
text: Complete trash, a bad rom com. Christian Bale was fantastic same the only good moment of the film had to had the tension broke by cheap humour. Humour is not needed every 5 seconds, completely ruined the film.

title: Loved it!
text: Thoroughly entertaining and great fun! It's not an t art house drama as some dickheads were expecting giving 1-2 stars! Marvel purists? I love Marvel films and thought it was great. Must See. Don't listen to killjoys.

title: Such a blast; ignore the hate
text: Somewhere along the line, Marvel fans went from viewing films with the goal of being entertained to being wowed with twists and turns and larger scale connection etc.This movie is fun, funny, packed with action, and has one of the best villains Marvel has offered to date in the MCU. Ignore the hate and go have some fun and see this movie.

title: The worst superhero movie ever
text: What a piece of steaming poo. I can't believe some people actually enjoyed this. Just 40 mins in, and it's making me physically gag and cringe. Every line is a joke, every sequence is slapstick, it's a complete desecration of every character, an insult to not just the source material, but the previous movies as well. Thor is a bumbling fool, gorr is barely there, Zeus is a fat buffoon...i can go on, but it's making me nauseousI'm genuinely disgusted. This might be the worst superhero movie I've ever watched...and this is after I've watched Catwoman, WW84 and plenty other duds.Taiki is a hack who thinks that just adding cool songs makes a movie good.

title: Guys, relax
text: Ok, it was not a thor vibe movie and it was too much comedy BUT BUT we had at the cinema many good laughs, laughs that i do not get even on comedies and also it had its serious side too.Just enjoy what it is , it is not bad to be different.By the way Bale acting was amazing . This guy cannot act bad.

title: Comedy movie trying to tell us a dark and serious story.
text: A Thor movie that cant hold up to the first two parts and looses itself in trying to be comedic, yet fails to present a dark and in all matter serious story about grief, death and sickness.The only real highlight is the acting of Christian Bale, but sadly his character and screen time is reduced to a joke.A forgettable movie.

title: I think people are missing the point.
text: This movie actually explores love, loss, and sacrifice in ways that are tremendously moving and effective. I cried at the end, which I haven't done at any other Marvel movie.I will admit that the pacing in the first half is uneven, but the second half makes up for it.What this movie does, philosophically, is refute nihilism. What this movie does, artistically, is amazing color work and effective acting. What this movie does, emotionally, is show genuine human connection in the midst of chaos and loss.People are mad about the humor. I'm not. The older I get, the more clearly I know that in life, there is never any time or occasion that is so grim that nothing can be funny. Sometimes that humor can be heightened and made precious by the pain surrounding it. Sometimes it can be infuriating that the world is moving on and making jokes at your expense. Thor, Jane, and Valkyrie experience it all just in trying to survive loss and sickness. So does Gorr, whose heartbreakingly efficient origin story sets him on a path to try to undo the gods' mockery of his heartbreak.Try watching this movie without looking for things to sneer at.

title: What a waste.
text: What a waste of hard work. Lots of fair CG but blurry and dark in most places. A story about Thor, the god of thunder, Zeus etc etc should not be presented as a lame slapstick comedy / argumentative millennial love story. Christian Bale did well as the villain but Russel Crowe failed dismally as big daddy. A female Thor? Seriously? The PC approach just confuses the plot. A shame really.

title: Absolutely terrible!
text: I can think of nothing good to say about this except perhaps Christian Bale. Everything else is fearfully awful. It's not fun and lighthearted. It's painfully stupid at every level. I can't think of a likeable moment of this waste of my time. The characters are idiots. The plot is barely bearable. I can't think of a redeemable moment in this horrendous experience. I despise where they went with this abomination. Not all superhero movies need to be absolutely serious and realistic, but thesis a comedy of the worst kind. Marvelous it's ups and downs, but if this is the direction that they are going, gods help us all.

title: All I enjoyed seeing was Christian Bail and Natalie Portman
text: +3 stars for Christian Bale.+2 stars for Natalie PortmanA Soul-less movie except for Christian Bale and Natalie Portman (in some scenes).This movie was just too weak.It could have been so much better.Feel like they made it to appeal to Disney+ subscribers.I was expecting so much more but left feeling underwhelmed.Wish I could get a refund for my movie ticket.

title: A great Thor movie.
text: My daughter and I loved this movie. To me it was everything a movie about a comic book God should be. Aside from my disappointment in the Guardians not actually being in the movie, I completely enjoyed the show. I think that some of the people who gave low scores are too snooty film school for my liking. The recent hero movies have become way too dark and dreary (The latest Batman for example?)

title: Fun Marvel movie
text: Finally a Marvel film that's fun again. It's an amazing looking movie and it had me engaged throughout. It doesn't really do much for the MCU as a whole, but I think that's also its strong point. The after credits were very underwhelming though. Definitely worth a watch especially for fans!

title: Another Marvel Success
text: Great movie. Funny, heartfelt and action packed. Visually stunning and great humor. Very stylized and fun. Taika is a great director and also writes good scripts. Everything fell in place.

title: Total Craptasticness of Trash
text:
What can you say about this abortion?The WORST Marvel movie made EVER... That's saying something when you have movies like:
The Fantastic Four, Elektra, the other Fantastic Four, Howard the Duck... You get the picture.Thor Love and Thunder beats all of those for craptasticness.Humor is terrible.Laughable CGI... Looks like something made on a ZX Spectrum Home Computer...
Story and plot just as bad.... If not worse...
Think of contracting Herpes inside your rectum, then your eyelids followed by your inner Colon and then eyeballs....
Christian Bale is the only reedeming quality in this movie...Taika Waititi was on shrooms when he directed this abortion... If he wasn't? Good grief..... At least he directed one of the worst movies this past decade... That's saying something I assume.Stay away from this TRASHTASSTIC movie.It will give you Herpes.

title: Marvel really needs to get back on their feet.
text: Yet another lovable character destroyed. Thanks Disney.With each new release, I get more and more disappointed. These films and series are a cringy, money-making business. Even though I thought that only the Disney+ series would be terrible (which they are), it turns out that Phase 4 is a complete disappointment (except for No Way Home).It really saddens me seeing the movies taking the same route as the series. They are boring, shallow, and unoriginal. If I wanted a good old basic and predictable love story, I would've watched anything but this.Simply put, the plot is way too predictable and childish.

title: THOR LOVE AND THUNDER IS A UNEXPECTED COMEDY MOVIE
text: From the very starting to the end you will never wanted to Move from your seat its funny ðŸ˜, sometimes predictable but throughout the movie it put smile on your face...... watch it if you are mcu fan....

title: Great - I liked this better than Spider-man No Way Home
text: Why all the hate? I'd heard a lot of mixed reviews and went into this with lowered expectations, but the film was fun and had a great mix of comedy and action (though yes, with a little more comedy this time, but it was a fun ba;ance). Chris Hemsworth is great as always and Natalie Portman provided her best performance in the MCU so far. There IS more comedy than usual, but Christian Bale's character is an interesting take with interesting effects and visuals and several scenes that were quite affecting (my wife shed a tear). Highly recommended - don't believe the haters! This has no more comedy in it than the Guradians of the Galaxy, with a similar tone, so if you liked those movies (or Thor Ragnarok), you will like this one, too.

title: This actually got shown in cinemas!!!!
text: Quite possibly the worst Thor film I have ever watched. How can all these really good actors put up with such a terrible script? I sat through it because I had paid my money to see it but, really, I think I would rather have stuck pins in my eyes! Marvel Studios has seriously lost their way. I would add more to this review but the film is sooooooooooooooooooooo bad, I cannot think of even one thing that might make you want to watch it. Don't even bother downloading it, it's a waste of your internet bandwidth. The only highlight for me was Natalie Portman who did manage to make her part believable but, as for the rest, it was high much money can I earn!!

title: I am glad
text: I am glad I did not go to the cinema on this movie. It was lika a kids movie for little children...the magic is gone...what happend!!The other Thor-movies are soo much better.Glad I did see it on Disney + at home in my cozy sofaWhat was the movie-makers thinking about how can the make such a bad movie.Christopher Bale made a good role. He was good but still everything feels like a childrens movie.It felt like a lot of the actors hade to play a role of making fun of themselfs...in a bad way.Why do you have to write 600 words to leave a comment on the movie...way to much words for me......

title: einer der besten Thor Filme
text: I find the story very good, the funny ones like. The serious scenes are perfect. I like films with a funny and serious background and everything is right with the film. I can only recommend it, I celebrated it in the cinema.

title: Is this still the same Taika Waititi?
text: Is this still the same guy who made brilliant Jojo Rabbit, What We Do in the Shadows, Thor Ragnarok?This movie looks like a fever dream that a budget playwright tried to put into a play, got bored halfway through, and was just trying to finish as fast as possible with minimal effort.The pacing is abysmal. It's too fast to take in ANY scene at all. Some moments that could have been great too watch felt like an unfunny family guy cutaway.The dialogue is terrible. I'm not sure whether Tommy Wiseau advised on the script, but I definitely see his influence when the characters announce their emotions out loud, or say something unnecessary and obvious.Jokes that had a potential to be funny are so oversaturated they are tiresome. Honestly, I lowered my expectations to expect a simple dumb comedy, but even those expectations were let down.Shots in terms of depth and conposition are bland as hell. If typical Marvel despite all their faulta look great, this one looks like a cameraman was just shooting a school play without a second thought.Christian Bale is awesome. All the actors are fine, but only his character wasn't a comic relief.Better to avoid.

title: Hilarious
text: Laughed my ass off, enjoyed the soundtrack and how the film didn't take itself seriously for the most part. It also had some deeper bits, which I thought could've been better, but Taika Waititi gets a 10 from me for his humour. THE GOATS WERE THE FUNNIEST THING EVER!!!!I liked Christian Bale's look, really spooky, looked like the Grim Reaper x Voldemort, but I would've liked to know more about him, his backstory etc. I couldn't really connect to the pain that drove him to be the villain.I also didn't like how children were presented as the meaning of life and the most important thing ever. Thor replaced his love interest with the responsibility of a child. So predictable. Is there nothing else worth living for? And those kids being abducted and then poof! Becoming superheroes with no training, because they're precious Asgardians, the new generation bla bla - that also felt empty, although I appreciate the message that kids can sometimes be smarter than adults and change something for the better. I just feel like there's a lot of movies where having a child is used as a trope and it's a bit boring.Anyway, I digress. I also didn't like the fact that Zeus spoke with a Greek accent. He's an asshole and I feel like this is again an overused trope - to give the asshole an accent and to sort of link his foreigness to his bad morals. Easy joke to make as well.Also didn't like the joke about Thor losing his clothes and all the women sighing - I felt like I was in fifth grade again, when all the little boys thought that would be the most hilarious thing ever.I also believe they could've saved the mighty Thor, but it must have to do with Natalie Portman's contact or something.

title: Waste of potential
text: The character of Gorr the god butcher as presented as a concept is very interesting but heavily squandered in a film that only does humor and visuals right.A really forgettable movie in the end that could have been a lot more- but that's just marvel in a nutshell.

title: Stop...Just Stop.....
text: A new low for Marvel. A slapstick comedy with the worst written jokes and a lot of lights and screaming goats (yes, that 10 year old meme). Scorsese was right. This content (not a movie) can be compared to a 5 year old child's crayon drawing.The content pushes no story or character, but deconstructs all. Thor himself is written dumber and dumber each movie. Why? In his next movie he'll prob just be drooling and laughing at his own farts.All characters are flat and boring. Bale brings the only thing that resembles class to this content.Just another sign that Marvel is in need of chemo more than Jane Foster.Warning: This content will ruin Guns n Roses for you forever.

title: I liked
text: Good movie. Funny, lots action. Good actors, nice CGI. Original uniforms. I recommend. Go to the theater and have funny moments traveling in this Gods conflicts.

title: Irreverence to irrelevance
text: Easily the worst MCU movie.The movie tries so hard to be irrevent that it ends up making impactful scenes irrelevant. Scenes that should be taken seriously are just wasted with poor attempts at wisecracks. In addition, much of what is introduced is internally inconsistent with the events of the MCU; for example the existence of some Eternity force that is unlocked with Thor's axe... could have come in handy when Avengers were fighting Thanos. Surely they should come back to Eternity now every time they have to face a mega villain?The biggest crime however is wasting someone like Christian Bale, who gets a handful of lines and will be quickly forgotten in the list of MCU villains.

title: The best thor film
text: I watched this in cinemas and i have never wanted to watch a movie again more in my life the villain was good the action was brilliant everything about this movie was amazing.

title: The end of Marvel?
text: This movie was one of the most expensive movies ever, and the amount of CGI-effects and actor A-listers will never save this movie. The plot is thin, the humorous parts aren't funny, and the script is poorly written. You can't help but feel a bit sorry for all those actors who are meant to create a good result out of this. Even kids are now brought in to fight which makes it all even more cringeworthy.Talk of superhero fatigue is well within reach here, and Marvel (and Disney) seriously need to up their game if they still want people in general to care. We've seen the characters appear in countless movies and series. We've had sequels and prequels and everything in between. And enough might be enough now.

title: Thor comedy??
text:
When did Thor became a bad comedy with 3D as a background?I'm done with Marvel movies as they are becoming more and more ridiculous. I thought Thor was still one of the good ones, but no, they were able to ruin it.What a shame ðŸ™
It feels like all the good Marvel super heros are now just clown characters in really bad movies, it's a shame that the people in Hollywood feel this is what the public wants to watch.For me this is one of the reasons to stop watching Marvel and other so called blockbusters.Please bring back good stories and return the proper respect those characters should have..

title: Swords, Sorcery, Live Action Heavy Metal
text: Confused about all the anger and hate for this. I thought it was awesome.Laugh out loud funny. A compelling villain. A cool soundtrack. It told a good story that stands alone which I think is a nice touch in such a large MCU.If you like the director and Ragnarok this is a satisfying second helping.

title: I should have know better from the previews!
text: What was Taika thinking, oh wait, cash grab. Can't believe this came from the guy who did JoJo Rabbit....it went nowhere, fast and stupidly! Oh well hoping the new Black Panther can be a saving grace for Marvel this year!

title: Fun for the whole family!
text: I loved this movie. My son and my husband loved it, we laughed, we cried and we cheered. This movie is fun for the whole family! The actors and actresses were amazing because they are all great at their work. Christian Bale is an awesome villian, glad to see Natalie Portman kick butt, Tessa Thompson is my favorite, Chris Hemsworth is irreplaceable and Taika Waititi did an amazing job at directing and voicing Korgi! Russell Crowe was a hilarious Zeus and the all the children actors were great little warriors! Don't listen to the bad reviews because they don't know what they're talking about and taking things too seriously. Thor Love and Thunder is a great film!

title: Waititi is the real Godbutcher
text: What can you say after seeing the dumbest version of Thor? This movie understands absolutely nothing about the character or his world. Taika Waititi wants to do something different, something entertaining, something that breaks with the schemes and fails miserably in everything he sets out to do. The final product is somewhat sloppy, there is mistreatment of many characters, such as the Guardians of the Galaxy, and there are even ridiculous technical flaws, such as glaring continuity errors. The soundtrack is repetitive, the script is absolutely poor, simple, empty, full of inconsistencies, conveniences and jokes that don't land well. It's a disaster.Perhaps it's a lucky movie to be part of the MCU, because at least it's guaranteed high-quality visual effects, and it can afford to have a good cast that saves certain situations, but other than that, it's an irritating movie.I hope Feige never calls Waititi again.

title: If you laft at fat Thor, you should enjoy this too....
text: Ok, I'll admit this film was way more wackier than I expected. But I had a really good time and that should always be the priority for judging a film in my opinion. Don't forget, we had a fat Thor. This is just the next level. I laft a lot, the action scenes are cool and Christian Bale was really scary and so intense in his scenes ðŸ‘ðŸ»!Si go watch this movie.

title: What a waste of the first half
text: For me, the first half was an attempt to recreate the energy and comedy from Ragnarok...it did not work out well. The only thing that was consistently good was the action/fighting scenes. Majoritg of the dialogue in the first half felt like awkward conversation bcuz they were trying too hard to be funny. Christian Bale is also the only one that consistently acted good the whole time. After Thor was stripped bare was when it started to get better and less awkward. If I were to ever watch it again (very unlikely), it would be to only watch the action scenes.

title: Yes Yes YES YES
text: There is so much to love about this movie. Definitely one of the better marvels, much better than anything DC puts out. Open your heart and watch it and feel like a kid again. Love and Thunder will pluck at those heartstrings, but only if you got 'em.

title: I guess the target demo was 6-12 years old?
text: I was a quarter way in and trying to figure out why this was surprisingly terrible; seemed like a satirical SNL take on the genre, but then I realized, oh, this movie is not meant to be seen by me, it is for kids. Problem with the super-hero movies is that sometimes they are pure good movies, with no target demo, like the original Hulk movie, the first Thor, first two Avengers, first wonder woman, first superman with henry cavill, Joker, Dark Knight, etc., entertaining for both younger and older people, but you don't know until after you start watching. This version of Thor was so disappointing, I can't begin to express it; like some kind of amateur comedy skit. The whole Jane becomes a female Thor bit was ludicrous, made zero sense. Another huge turn-off was the woke junk that was so obviously shoved in by the studio's diversity officer, echh.

title: This movie was EPIC and HILARIOUS
text: Too many nerds on here that take superhero movies way too seriously downvoting this movie. This movie was super funny I was seriously laughing out loud. Making a Thor movie funny is the only way to get passed how nerdy it would be if it was serious. It would be terrible if they made it serious like a DC movie. That's why guardians and avengers are so good, because they're funny, have amazing stories, and cool actors. Taika killed again. People downvoting probably don't even like Jo Jo Rabbit and are more into movies like suicide squad.

title: So many unfunny jokes.
text:
The other Marvel movies had a good combination of serious scenes and jokes. This entire movie feels like it was written by a teenager who tries too hard to be funny.SUMMARY:
If Natalie Portman wasn't in the movie, I'd give it a 1/10.

title: Why the bad reviews?
text: I don't know what people want can never be happy. Was a great movie has action, humor, and emotional at times. It's a marvel movie supposed to be a popcorn entertainer and it was. People out here acting like it supposed to win an Oscar. I give it a 9 for what it's supposed to be. Would definitely watch it again and Is still one of the best marvel movies to date.

title: I don't understand low rated reviews
text: A lot of people are saying that the film is made to rushed, that some jokes are not even funny, that Gorr hasn't have enough screentime... Well I loved the film, I think the screentime is enough for Gorr. Great performances! In my opinion I think this one is the best Thor so far.

title: WOW! The MCU Is Dead. But, Women Love It! LOL!
text:
This Made Me Re-Think That New Doctor Strange Movie Was The Worst Movie and Final Nail In The Coffin Of The MCU. For Intelligent Male Fans Anyway. Women and Not So Smart Men Are Still Loving It. HAHA!And ALL You Need Know About This Sadly Written, Directed and Acted Wannabe Movie Is That IF You Don't Shut It Off In The First 20 Minutes, It Was Made For You And Your People. ;)
There Is NOTHING Good About This Movie. The Jokes Are Terrible, The Effects Are Even Worse and The Disney/Marvel/Star Wars PC Machine That Is Ruining Every Once Good Franchise, Is Alive And Well.Also, Keep In Mind That The Villain Is Mad At Gods Because He Was a Moron and Believed In Children's Stories/Prayed. Thus, It's The Gods Fault He Did Nothing, Except Pray. Which IS Doing Nothing.Great Villain.And Jane, Selfishly Looking For Mjolnir and MAGICLY Being So Worthy, It Puts Itself Back Together. So, She Lives. Is REALLY Pathetic. LOL!Keep Up The GREAT Work, Marvel.Storytelling Is Now At The Level Of Children's Books.

title: To me the best MCU movie
text: I've never been a fan of Thor movies. Watched all of them because I like the MCU, but never really got into Thor that much. In this movie. Taika Waititi brings us a movie filled with is iconic humor, that he seems to purposefully take to far every now and then, by not taking it self to seriously, and I see how that can pass as something negative to the audience. Battle scenes are great and Bale's as the god butcher is brought to the screen in masterfully way.Some people my find that for a marvel movie it lacks some part of the "formula", but everything it does it does well. The comedy is great. Where horror style bits come into play it looks and feels very well executed and the movie is incredibly enjoyable.As far as I'm concerned, as someone who likes the MCU but is not an hardcore fan, this movie is the GOAT.

title: A fairly disappointing film with some redeeming qualities
text: Thor: Love and Thunder doubles down on whatever worked for Ragnarok and in doing so fails to deliver a cohesive and heart-felt narrative to the viewers. The characters have been diluted to such an extant in order to extract humour that they have become soulless caricatures of their former selves.The film is almost a parody of itself and other films within the MCU. Not to mention the the endless plot conveniences, plot holes and borderline obnoxious depiction of Zeus and other deities.The only highlight for me was perhaps Christian Bale as Gorr who was an absolute delight to watch and milked every single scene he was in.Overall if you like films of substance I would not recommend this film. If you are out for fun and are looking for a light-hearted comedy, love and thunder may just be for you.

title: Thor: A man Childs love story
text: They turned Thor into a man child. It definitely wasn't marvel quality. The comedy reminded me of a show on Cartoon Network. I think they tried to give Thor his own kind of Tony stark funny. Which really didn't work, because he already had his own kind of comedy. I think marvel is trying to make their movies be relatable. Something already happening, when we see the hero's struggle. Almost like a died down show so it can be fit for kids. The plot was not focused enough on the villain, or the main message the movie was supposed to tell. The focus for at least 1hr 30min was Jane and Thor's relationship. More should have have been done rather then said.In summary it wasn't up to marvel standards, it was like power rangers. They had an amazing story line, but didn't go about it right.

title: Dont understand the hate, the movie just wonderful!!!
text: If you hate this but love Ragnarok you just lying to yourself or you just bandwagoning. Okey maybe the jokes are over the place and feels more silly than Ragnarok but the overall movie just better, better villain, story, and action. It has great moment and nice editing that it didnt feel boring. If you didnt like it as much as Ragnarok, at least you didnt say it the worst mcu movie, if you say this is the worst then other rubbish mcu movies didnt exist.If you love Thor 1/2 and hate this movie, you have dry taste and more prefer 'text book' movie. This movie is about creative possibilites and it works most of the time. This is exactly how Taika want to potray and i am with Taika, i really understand this movie. I like other viking movie like the Northman, but a good movie does not has to look groomy and dark all the time, in the light tone like this it can still deliver a good story and moment.Thor Love and Thunder definitely my top 5 mcu movies.

title: Know what you are watching and enjoy it. It was what was promised.
text: This is a Taika Waititi movie. So of course it would be funny, lighthearted and wouldn't take it too serious. A lot of people keep saying it is its own parody and yes. Again: Taika Waititi.Don't let it destroy your enjoyment. This is an adaptation of a few comic book storylines that I don't think anyone but Taika could pull off. Thor was never a really serious character, and they got a good adaptation of the Mighty Thor story arch, if somewhat reduced (and "reduction-ed") to fit a movie.But the real pleasure of this movie was Bale's performance. This is not Thor's movie, this is a Gorr's movie, and Bale stole every scene he was in.This movie was never meant to be serious, and the end product is exactly what it was intended (and what we were promised).

title: Another worst director and worst film
text: Taika is destroy thor character arc. In the comic thor is badass character . But after IW thor is another joker. Taika destroy his legacy. Plz marvel remove taika from another upcoming project in marvel.

title: Extremely needed, will watch again and again
text: The world is exceedingly depressing right now. I found this film to be a balm for that as it followed Thor through his quest to find meaning in his life. The last roughly half hour or so tugged the heartstrings and the ending was so sweet. Very happy with how Jane chose her own way.

title: Butchered all right
text: I just feel betrayed. Thor is an immasculated teenager. Korg is the Jar Jar Binks of the MCU now. Gorr is a butcher without a knife. Asgaard is an amusement park. And Zeus.....omg.... Zeus.....I might not be able to watch Gladiator the same way ever again....what if Thor was a total joke?

title: What is everyone complaining about?
text: 8/10. Solid. A truly enjoyable summer popcorn movie. There was laughs, action, laughs, explosions, laughs, tenderness, laughs, screaming goats, and laughs! It doesn't have to be Endgame to be enjoyable. I thought it especially poignant when Thor truly meets his enemy with his heart.

title: Lost Opportunity
text: A stellar idea that was mishandled to the point of absurdity.This movie's flow is all over the place, seemingly schizophrenic in it's execution, unable to decide what it wants to be and wasting a story that could have been something "worthy".Marvel seems to be suffering from an identity crisis.From a soundtrack that is mishandled, further disrupting the flow with songs being misused, scenes going from deadly serious to absurd, a protagonist that although over a millennia old, acts childish and incompetent, and an antagonist that could have been a memorable epic villain, especially when it was Christian Bale playing him, to another Marvel throwaway villain.It's nothing new, as Marvel has always shied away from serious issues in their previous movies, always following the few serious moments with a comedic scene, but this is on a whole other level of farcical.Hopefully they will dump Waititi, who is simply too focused on the comedic aspects, and give a more serious director a chance at the character. This of course will be futile if they keep writing Thor as a buffoon.

title: Have we gone from Marvel fatigue to Marvel exhaustion?
text: Disney is really draining that formula dry. "Marvel fatigue" is an expression people were using long before this particular bumpy movie in the studio's history, but it's especially applicable to a time when no more than a month or two passes without some new Marvel story hitting the market that now closes the gap between movies with television spinoffs beamed straight into people's homes via Disney+. What hope do these movies have to feel fresh or exciting when they're arriving at a pace to rival the clockwork release of their comic-book source material? This one feels like a parody of itself,childish and insignificant.

title: Really funny, really enjoyed it and had some fun!
text: My family and I really thought this was really funny! I also liked how it shows Thor growing as a man, from being reckless and arrogant in the first movies like a young adult, then growing through the years like his "20,30's" and now equivalent to a late 30's of someone who is lost about who they are and by the end has grown to be a father now and has kinda found himself and that really kinda reminded me of myself growing up (of course I got the dad bod and not the god bod lol) but it was nice to see for him. We had a great time at our local AMC!

title: Definition of mindless brain candy
text: The movie is honestly not that great. Not enough Gorr most of what he does is off-camera. The whole movie is extremely corny, it only has about 4 jokes that made me chuckle. The costumes where great and I liked the colors in them. The action is good and not to say spoilers but the ending fight is very very dumb. I honestly felt like the movie did nothing and it was a waste of gorr, Jane foster ,and time.

title: 1time watch movie..
text: Movie was great.. Cris Hemsworth was just way too amazing.. Loved the story but as an Avengers fan the movie could have been much better.. Cristian Bale's character Gor could have been used in a more serious kind of way i felt the character development was a bit less.. Natalie Portman was quite good as Jane Foster but her and thor's story was kinda predictable.. and yaa the other characters were almost good in short a good 1 time watch movie..

title: Cringe Fest
text: I really hoped this was going to be a funny follow up to the previous installment. Instead I ended up not being able to watch it and turned it off after 40 mins. The script, the acting, the costumes and the storyline honestly couldn't have been any worse if they had tried. Almost all of the jokes just feel forced and are absolute cringe to watch. I think they tried to fit a joke into pretty much every scene which takes away from the story line and turns the movie into an awful comedy skit. Thor has become an unlikable hero and a buffoon. I really hope Marvel get their act together and focus on the actual quality of their movies. This is truly one of the worst movies I've ever seen part of.

title: A parody? Don't bother.
text: It felt like they can not be bothered to write a good film anymore, no thought at all has gone in to making story. So they just resort to mocking themselves. What is even worse, they think it is funny when it really isn't, they are trying too hard to be something that it's not.Marvel films used to be great and a cool type of seriousness. They have totally destroyed their image now, I guess it is the very last drop of milk they have managed to squeeze out of the franchise.Goodbye Marvel, I won't bother watching anymore of your films, just such a shameful disappointing waste of time. It appears I'm not alone in thinking this.

title: Enjoyable and entertainment
text: I don't know why people called thor love and thunder is not good or ok type movie , according to me it's quit movie you can enjoy . I personally enjoyed this movie not as fan but as a movie lovers.

title: Like a bad SNL parody of Marvel
text:
First 5 mins of the movie was cool. Then it goes downhill fast...First hour is like a bad SNL parody of Marvel with a couple of good scenes backed up by Guns and Rose's music. Very cringy to watch but I stuck with it. They're trying to pass on amateurish writing by using the funny narrator technique. Nice try. But no...Last 45 mins is average Marvel fare with a couple of good scenes AGAIN backed up by Guns and Rose's music.Worst than Black Widow for me.Gorr the God Butcher gets most of the points. He's the only thing good about this!I give it 3/10
and I'm being generous...Without the GnR songs. It would have been a 2/10Marvel Zombies are the only people who are gonna like this piece of trash!

title: Must watch
text:
Good movie i love it and enjoye movie
Total paisa wasool movie and colore and cinematography is mind blowing this movie masterpeace of marvel studio and perfact direction taika watitiðŸ‘ðŸ‘ðŸ‘

title: Gross
text: You have a villain with the name 'Gorr, the god butcher" and this is what you come up with? Jokes were lame. Jane's story was weak. Whole plot was weak. The whole thing was weak. Thor was my favorite until now.

title: Cringe
text: I hate the word cringe. It's over used and not used correctly, mostly. But I couldn't stop cringing at the "humor" In the movie. Bale was good but under used. Plot points in this movie creates huge plot holes and creates questions for movies like Infinity war and end game.

title: Mighty soundtrack, love, thunder, but inadequate comedy.
text: While Thor: Love and Thunder certainly has the sufficient love and thunder to make this a worthy Thor movie, the comedy aspect lacks. Thor: Ragnarok, however, absolutely nailed it. Pure and simple, Thor: Love and Thunder was not as good as Thor: Ragnarok. It failed what Ragnarok did perfectly. My rating of 8/10 is generous. The comedy in Love and Thunder was trash upon garbage. The comedy is a new low for the MCU, and as a diehard MCU fan, the comedy aspect disappointed me, very much.

title: Refuses to take itself seriously-and that's a good thing
text: Quirky, over the top humor, not appreciated by everyone, but I loved it. I appreciate Hemsworth's portrayal of Thor as a ridiculously arrogant, self-involved man-child and still manages to be endearing.Honestly, the superhero movie story has become tiresome. This was different and I enjoyed the ride.

title: Thor of the Thunder
text: Thor, Thor, God of the Thunder, strong as he can be, watch out for the Kree! - sung to the tune of George of the Jungle, just a little referential joke. Still more creative than this movie's "jokes".What are you complaining about, Marvel fans? This is what you wanted, you loved Thor: Ragnarok and now Marvel Studios and Waititi gave you more of the same, a lot more.The truth is Ragnarok wasn't really that good, it was coming off of the terrible Dark World, not a very high bar to clear, so the fans and the critics showered it with unwarranted praise.The humour boils down to referencing screaming goat YouTube videos that were popular years ago and Korg saying "funny" things, also featuring Russell Crowe embarrassing himself as Zeus.Gorr the God Butcher, such a badass name! Shame we don't actually get to see him do any God butchering. Oh, well, I guess the movie already fulfilled the PG-13 quota with the Omnipotence City scene.There is a certain other superhero movie that tried to combine outrageous humour with serious things like life-threatening illness. Wanna guess which one? Batman & Robin. It didn't work then and it's not working now. When you're reminded of one if not the worst in the genre, maybe it's time for a few or more rewrites.

title: Boring....
text: Its a quite boring script, stupid jokes, bad acting cuz of bad directing. You may see that, if you have enough beeeeer and couple of drunk friends. Or you won't see that, just because.

title: Very funny, nos as much as Ragnarok, but still very good.
text: Don't get why so much hate, the movie is very funny, yes, Ragnarok was funnier but still, it's very good. And yes, it's not perfect, the villain is very underutilized and that is way too bad because he's a very good villain with a great story. The movie should've lasted half an hour more to explain more about him. Also more Jane Foster would've been better. Natalie Portman's scenes are great, she looks very good as Thor. Still? The movie is very good and very funny, Chris Hemsworth is amazing as Thor too.

title: Spectacle That Doesn't Make You Care About the Characters
text: The beginning and the end of the movie were the best parts. The villain is really creepy, so I won't be taking my kids to see this one. This is much darker than Thor Ragnarok, and the comedy is forced in the name of love and thunder. The writers managed (intentionally?) to possibly offend atheists and believers in a higher power with some of the dialogue. Disney once again managed to wrap adult themes in movies with children involved. If it wasn't so good looking, it would be 2 stars.

title: Genius. What more do you want?
text: Funny. Goofy. Serious. Everything all in one. It's a movie about a super hero, it's not going to change your life. Just enjoy it and be happy it's not another same old story rehash.

title: Great concept with halting execution
text: The script has a great premise, and I was absolutely loving hearing about not only of the inclusion of the Mighty Thor arc but also bringing Natalia Portman back with new shoes to fill. But her arc didn't feel important enough and comedy and jokes came in the way for the drama that in my opinion is equally as important as action and funny stuff.As said there was a lot of jokes. To many for my taste. They felt forced and were not well timed. But if you already know or like the style of Waititi it should not come as a surprise.You will have some laughs, the effects are good and will probably come home feeling like you got entertained. But I think we can ask for more. The pacing, directional choices and character motivations just don't make this into a good film. It's definitely not a movie that I'll be rewatching.

title: I don't get the hate
text: I have to say I went in to this movie expecting to be disappointed in some way, constantly looking for flaws and mistakes but I am VERY happy to report that I was in no way disappointed by anything. Let me just say, if you loved Thor: Ragnarok, you will Love this movie because this is purely and emphatically Taika Waititi's brand of humor. Every scene had his name written all over it. I loved every aspect of this movie. I thought it was very funny, which I do not have any problem with, that's my style of humor. I found every character enjoyable, I thought the story was fun with enough charm and heart to it to bring a little tear to your eye by the end. It was everything it needed to be and I was in no way disappointed. I loved it.

title: We have to accept that marvel movies are no longer made for audience more than 12 years old or with brain.
text: So I thought dr strange 2 was just maybe a slip. And that the MCU series are just bad because there is not enough budget to combine visual quality and meaningful content.But thor love & thunder showed that marvel films should only bring in money with minimal effort. The whole film is just a collection of stereotypical pointlessness. It's as if Taika Waititi didn't trust anyone to be halfway sane. Yes, I know, they still make a lot of money with that crap. But with a budget of 250 million dollars you can expect at least a little bit of effort with the script.I would not even recommend this film for children because I am sure that it is of a degenerative nature for the mind. I'm done with marvel. MCU only exists for me until endgame and the new spider-boy. I just hope they put blade in completely different hands and maybe start taking the audience seriously again. And not only the money from the simply knitted.

title: Movies is good but too much comedy
text: This movies is good. But there is a too much comedy. This not worth for Thor movies.The film fails to meet the expectations of a great sequel. The Director is over reliant on unnecessary and childish humor. Christian Bale's character is underdeveloped for the most part. Zeus is a forgettable character in the movie. Thor does bring some fun to the movie but it does not help the film recover at any point. I would not rush to the Theaters for this sequel.Marvel films have never been for a smart audience. But turning a character like Thor and many others into a Clash Of The Titans rom-com really seals the fate of this incarnation of the MCU. There really is nothing new here save for Thors butt, which nobody ever asked for. But serves to show just how low Marvel will go for toilet humor.

title: Get rid of the AGENDA!
text: Over time, Marvel movies have undergone changes that have caused some viewers to feel that the films have deviated from their previous status as enjoyable family-friendly entertainment. These viewers argue that the inclusion of subtle agendas within the narratives has been poorly executed, raising questions about the need to prioritize storytelling over messaging. While there may have been moments that resonated with audiences, they were not sufficient to make the films suitable for children. This dissatisfaction is expressed through a strong negative sentiment towards the current state of Marvel films.

title: Desantis bots destroying Disney
text: What else can I say about all the senseless negative reviews and criticisms? Not enough God butchering? Umm are you so dense that you want to see lots of irrelevant gods being killed on screen and waste of time to believe it? You want humor to be toned down and Thor be transformed into a wise King Arthur? You want Zeus to sound normal and serious? By the way I didn't see anyone laughing during the eternity finale. Not enough bale? Well the whole movie is about him, even the scenes he is not present in are about him. A convincing, serious villain to go with our light hearted Thors.This is a wonderful, fun, emotional, adventure movie with no filler scenes and no just-for-the-sake-of-exposition drag. If the negative reviews are not from bots then marvel audience has lost its head in trying to view every movie from an infinity war/endgame perspective. Those movies were a culmination of 20 prior films!

title: Wasted potential
text: Chris Hemsworth as Thor is my favourite super hero ever. Ragnarok is possibly my favourite film. So I was so excited to see this. But it never came close to fulfilling its potential. Christian Bale was amazing but was in a completely different film. His character was totally wasted here. It felt as though they made two movies. One poor effort at a comedy and one powerful superhero movie and mashed them together. But they got the balance all wrong. They've made thor into a parody of himself. He went from a god to a joke. Thor in this movie was just a buffoon. Bad joke after bad joke with no redeeming moments. Really disappointing.

title: THOR & JANE TOGETHER AGAIN
text: I always say I'm a mythology nerd,but looking at the complaints. Listen if You love Thor & Jane's love. You will Like it.i think it's the 4th solo from Avengers. We as a family loved it. Unless you're knee deep like Sheldon & Lenard, its a movie, ok not a document, enjoy it. 600 letters,no wonder sounded like complaining, back in school at 52. Lol. Thor is hot. Christian Bale will always be JC(Jesus Christ)from son of Mary. As for Zeus attitude, Thor crashed his arena for help. I'm not shocked by response,just impressed they put them together. The End You're crying. If you like their love story.

title: Disappointed with Thor Love and Thunder
text: It's a disappointing movie, they could have been a little more serious while making the movie. Lot of nonsense dialogues and irrelevant things. I had a lot more expectations from MCU.

title: Strike one for Waititi
text: Was this an attempt at Hot Shots 3? Not only were the jokes hit and miss (and more often a miss to be honest) but the frequency did not fit the mood and setting of the second half of the film (which actually wasn't that bad).And yes, the CGI was horrible. There are a few redeeming qualities (Bale being one of them) but they are too often drown in a sea of half-baked jokes. Waititi should not helm another MCU film (and he certainly shouldn't write one).Phase 4 has seemingly lost it's way. It lacks something that would tie all the individual stories together and last 2 films (which were among the most anticipated) were failures.

title: Utter rubbish
text: This film owes more to Carry On movies than it does to Marvel. It's all about the laughs, and has little to do with forwarding the Marvel storyline. The whole of this just seems like a tacky comedy. I don't know if Marvel is deliberately setting up the Thor movies as a comedy thread alongside the (only slightly more serious) movies. If so, fair enough, but I'll be according them in the future if that's the case.To to it all off, the storyline itself was garbage, Marvel really need to audit these storylines before letting them make a movie.Truly, this demeans the whole Marvel franchise that can't be fixed with a simple reboot.

title: Thor-like
text: Thor is becoming the greatest comedian in the Marvel Universe, jokes flies here and there all around. Quite Thor-like Thor movie overall, not fantastic but not disappointing too.Eat my hammer!

title: This Movie Sucks
text: To be fair, I'm not much of a Marvel movie fan aside from Iron Man, some of the X-men movies, and the surprisingly good Dr. Strange, but this is the lowest of lows. I took my wife because she wanted to see it, and I couldn't wait for it to be over after about 20 minutes or so. Bad character development, poorly-written storyline, over-the-top cheesy dialog and action sequences, and some woke nonsense sprinkled in the mix. It was so bad that I won't watch another Marvel movie unless someone whose opinion I trust happens to highly recommend one. I can't be monetarily supporting this kind of cinematic garbage out of principle, not to mention wasted time. 2/10 would be too generous. Really.

title: Empty
text: They tray to give it some message, but they totally failed. It was empty disaster.Main character was parody of him self.Other characters (include main villain) was hollow.Humor was childish.Waste of time.

title: Milking a dead cow, a official Marvel strategy
text: A potpourri of well-known characters that do nothing for the story, old musical mega-hits and worn-out humor.Don't waste your time. The story is very weak, stupid, pointless. The main conclusion of the movie is a deeply philosophical statement: "All you need is love, love is alla you need".Good visual scenes are copy/pasted from the previous Thor movies.If you have decided to throw away 2 hours of your time into a garbage bin and watch the movie, brace yourself for lots of loose ends, lots of wtfs.Some major heroes are shown in the beginning never to appear again. Many events have no follow ups... without mentioning the absence of logic in characters' behaviour.

title: Some Umbrella-Academy Vibes and a magnificent soundtrack
text: The film is special in a way and certainly not for everyone, as it is very humorous and even gets silly at times. The style of the film reminded me of Umbrella Academy, Deadpool or The Suicide Squad, as these films also combine humor with violence. If you like these kinds of movies, you'll love this one too. Also, there's no question that the film's soundtrack is killer! The story is not spectacular but absolutely solid. The film doesn't quite come close to Thor 3, but as a Marvel, Deadpool, Umbrella Academy and Suicide Squad fan, I really liked the film overall!

title: All style, zero substance
text: You got what you deserve, for praising Thor Ragnarok. This movie was already a joke and you gave Taika Waititi carte blanche to butcher the fourth one.I swear the movie can't spend 2mns without cracking a lame joke. Hey Taika, jokes are better when they're actually funny. It's 2022 and I can't believe we're still doing the "Yes you will - No I won't - Yes you will - No I won't" kind of joke, and expecting people to laugh at it.The villain is ok but could have been better if properly developed, and the divinity theme with him.

title: What happened?
text: This was really bad. Like dookie grits level bad. I don't mind jokes but, this was trying way too hard to be funny. The cgi was kind of poor, the fight scenes mediocre asf.
