I know the goats are from the comics, but they were annoying. Zeus was corny, Gorr was uh, interesting. Oh wow, how cute. Children doing battle. The slow motion stares at each other, sigh. What was Hawaii thinking? I wish this took a serious tone, seems like a wasted opportunity. As an actor, I wouldn't be happy with the finished product. I wonder if Chris is? I can't imagine what it's like to promote this bs. This seemed like a low budget movie. 5 stars for some enjoyable moments.

title: "So this is my wow. All gods will die."
text: By the time the Marvel Cinematic Universe enters the homestretch of its Phase Four approach to its slew of movies and tv series, I would have thought they had already hit their stride. Phase Four has not been an impressive side of the MCU, particularly the movies that have made their way into theaters worldwide. Black Widow was a disappointment. Shang-Chi was fun, but Eternals was pretty forgettable. No Way Home kept nostalgia alive while Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness was terrible. But these are just the opinions of one guy who feels like Disney was starting to scrape the bottom of the barrel.Then in walks Thor: Love and Thunder.Thor: Love and Thunder is the fourth installment of the Thor franchise for the MCU and finds Thor (Chris Hemsworth) on a journey of self-discovery. But Thor's retirement is interrupted by a galactic killer known as Gorr the God Butcher (Christian Bale), who seeks the extinction of the gods. To combat this new threat, Thor enlists the help of King Valkyrie (Tessa Thompson), Korg (Taika Waititi), and ex-girlfriend Jane Foster (Natalie Portman). To Thor's surprise, Jane inexplicably wields his magical hammer, Mjolnir, as the Mighty Thor. Together, they embark upon a harrowing cosmic adventure to uncover the mystery of the God Butcher's vengeance and stop him before it's too late.Directed by Taika Waititi (Thor: Ragnarok, Jojo Rabbit), Thor: Love and Thunder is one part Marvel popcorn picture, one part romantic comedy, with a sprinkling of death and destruction. From the beginning, when Waititi's Korg introduces us to everyone's favorite Space Viking through narration, the God of Thunder transforms from "dad bod to god bod" with comedy abound. Thor is busy helping the Guardians of the Galaxy save a planet to the tune of the Guns N' Roses hit "Welcome to the Jungle," while New Asgard has become a cruise port full of Disney cruise ships. By the time Gorr's presence is felt, Waititi provides fans with a whimsical look at Thor's life, creating a crowd pleaser of a movie that strikes a perfect balance of terror and humor.There is an abundance of cameos. There are surprises and deaths galore. There are running gags that generally would get tiring after a while, but they end up perfectly spaced out like a synchronized piece of music. The soundtrack boasts fan favorites like "Sweet Child of Mine" and "Paradise City." Bale's portrayal of Gorr the God Butcher is menacing and simultaneously heart-wrenching, a stunning villain that deserves attention just as Thanos did in the Avengers films. An incredible black-and-white sequence takes the principal cast into a quasi-reverse Wizard of Oz, adding to the moment's suspense. With the impressive Thor: Ragnarok and now Thor: Love and Thunder, it's easy to make the comparison that Taika Waititi is what Mel Brooks would be if the latter had a $250 million Marvel budget at his disposal.Taking the character of Thor and making him comedically entertaining is a feat that many storytellers have tried to do for other characters in superhero movies. But Waititi seems to do it with ease. Sometimes, these types of films can feel draining trying to keep up with every nuanced character that might come back in later films, but the newer Thor films have created a world where absurdity is focused on just as prominently as the tension on the screen.

title: The wrong direction forward
text: This movie can be understood to me as a misinterpretation of how to continue a direction that was working for Thor Ragnarock and GotG. The comedic elements of those films are an understanding that a universe that includes the unbelievable possibilities of space and the multiverse can't be taken so seriously as to ignore the ridiculousness of a talking raccoon and tree or a realm of space Gods on a floating disc with a rainbow bridge. It does the magnificent. Retaining the much loved elements of the comics and original idea of their writers and figured out a way for them to make sense together with out forcing us to pretend it works. Instead it coaxes us to attachment with the tree that can say one phrase using comedy and heart felt connection.Thor Love and Thunder assumes that people loved Thor and the space world of Marvel's IP because of the slap stick ridiculousness and retains only the on the nose qualities of the heroes and this particular part of the world. Some reviewer said that this was a good job at Marvel's first attempt at a romantic comedy and hey, that would have been great if they had pulled that off, or in anyway made it clear that was genre. Instead they had to teach me a new story they invented about some off screen romance that occurred between Jane and Thor. I'm all for implied story and life happening beyond the camera. Clearly things were left hanging with them, but make the movie about that. Show us the continuation of something made so complicated by the weight of having worlds and people rely on you to save them. Gor could have been more compelling and like most things in the movie the shadow realm and how mythical Gods can exist alongside Celestials goes without the slightest explanation. What exposition we are given is done so obviously as an aside it is painful. I get the attempted style but it was taken to level 18 as opposed to 10 and it didn't work. It seems like they asked Taika Waititi to take the breaks off from Ragnarok and give it the good old What we do in the Shadows treatment. I'm not really sure what I watched, but it was ridiculous and unless they ignore it when producing future films I'm not quite sure how it will fit.

title: Its a movie for kids.
text: They dont even try to do something slightly for grown ups. They completly butcher the character Gorr, the god butcher. They could have made this into bit of a horror. The god butcher is not even butchering gods. There is not one scene where he is doing it. Almost all the main actors had their own children in the movie. It is a childrens movie, from dads to their children. Just too many jokes, which then are reused again and again and again and again. It was painful to watch. After Endgame the MCU is just going down. The movies have no soul, no conflict, no purpose, no main enemy. So why bother and watch?

title: Reviews are way too harsh
text: Not sure why all the hatred for the comedic elements in the latest Thor. Yes, I along with my family had many more laughs in this film than previous Thor movies. Why is this a bad thing? Personally, I found the last couple Thor movies far more entertaining than the first two. This latest film felt more along the lines of the Guardians of the Galaxy movies (who appeared in this movie briefly). Overall, great action, comedic elements and story. I hope they continue on this same path in any future Thor movies (same director also).

title: Visually decent, otherwise whats the point?
text: It seems Taika wants to do comedy films, but why try with this? Uses the same jokes throughout the film in case you missed it the first time.He takes Thor and turns him into a idiot, there is so many times he is doing stupid things that when its called for sincerity it just falls flat. Portman was good but not used effectively, as for Russel Crows "Zeus", what on earth was the accent he uses i really could not tell, french? Italian? Russian? Who knows.Korg was a welcome addition to Ragnarok, but in this he quickly becomes annoying and his narrations got tiring.Waititi has made the worst Marvel movie to date with this poor effort, the only saving grace was Bale, Gorr was the only character that had any otherwise it would be a 2 star..it seems Disney are on self destruct mode and are looking to destroy a once great franchise, Kevin Feige and his woke views are leaching into these movies, so far the Marvel movies concluded with endgame, after that downhill.

title: Thor's back, way better then other phase 4 movies
text: Doctor strange 2 was quite bad, black widow was subpar, eternals was plain bad. Hopes were high on Thor, as Taika made in my opinion the best marvel movie last time around, Thor 3 ragnarok.(For me, closely followed by the first iron man and infinity war)There's again something fresh to Thor, a different style, something very important to keep the interest. Jokes land well and action is very empowering. Well almost all jokes, the theatre parody fell a bit flat this time around.Bringing the love aspect to the story gives a wonderful twist to the movie, engages you again in a different way. The chemistry between Chris's and Natalie's characters can be felt from the movie theatre seat.Guardians of the galaxy team is used as side characters, and likeably so, not going into too much of their story.Some cons, Russell Crowe's accent was maybe a tad too much, and I feel that casting of Christian Bale was maybe not the best for the role of Gorr, I felt he could been played a bit more pompous, instead of the more typical Bale way. Hela was a stronger villain last time around.One GnR song didn't also quite match a scene, but otherwise music was spot on.Left the theatre feeling the movie magic again, and I do hope they get to do Thor 5. Kudos to Taika for making still an amazing movie experience in this day of age.

title: Empty and not really good
text: It's a case of bate and switch. We wanted to see more of Thor but instead we've got OP Jane and Valkyre.I'm going to go right ahead and say it, We don't want known superheroes in female form. It's not good. It's not interesting. It's bad.Christian Bale delivers amazing performance as always, but unfortunately it's not enough to save this mess. Hope he'll reappear in another movie in some way.I'm tired of this "woke" politics being shoved down our throat. Listen to the audience and give us what we want, and we wil repay handsomly.

title: Another Marvel let down
text:
I feel like every movie came since Endgame is not worth watching. This movie is a joke. I think they deliberately make the Stormbreaker weak. It never had a Bifrost issue previously but why suddenly. There are only 2 points I saw in this movie.1. thor leaves the guardians
2. Thor uses the old hammerthe whole movie is pointless for all I care.It would have been a great movie if that broken hammer was picked up by the ghost rider (just saying).

title: I thought it was fun
text: After working hard all week I wanted some silliness - mission accomplished. I thought it was just mostly silly and fun and I liked the classic rock. Rather disturbed by complaints about "agenda". Did they mean didn't like the trans kid? Get over it. It's not the 1950s.

title: Really?
text: Honestly, what where they thinking? If this had been taken seriously and written as straight SF drama, it would've been brilliant. Whoever got it into their mind to make a fun parody of the film previous, must have been just released from a mental institute or taking some illegal substance.There are flashes of good moments, but the camp and trying to be funny aspect drives it into the ground. Maybe they should do a rewrite and release it again, then I'll probably enjoy it.What baffles me, au how on Earth, everyone signed up to this? The writers, the producers, the director, and most importantly, the actors. Maybe they just needed a break to get away from what they had done before, but this wasn't it. Hopefully next time, we'll get the real thing!

title: The story isn't anything unusual, but it was good
text: The forced comedy part was a bit annoying, receipt that, the rest of the movie was good. If they didn't kill off Gorr, it would've been a lot better, he was a neat and interesting character.

title: I can't believe this is a movie
text: Can anyone explain? Genuinely, why would they make this?Really confused and insulted.Unbearable isn't a strong enough word. It's like a deliberate shipwreck. It's a self mocking parody.The cast is full of big enough names that you'd think at least one of them would have had the decency to ask what in the world was going on? Seemingly not.I was convinced the opening 'GOD' scene with Bale had to have been a hallucination based on the horrific set, tacky CGI and mockingly juvenile dialogue however it apparently wasn't and the movie continued firmly downhill with the same gut wrenching 'play school' vibe.It's a STRONG miss.

title: DONT TAKE YOUR KIDS
text: Been a big fan of Marvel and the previous Thor movies. But, Disney's executive team has a new initiative to push LGBTQ in their movies and this is no exception. Unfortunately, it makes the movie more of a political promotion than it does entertainment. I will censor this type of material from my children as much as possible.There are some big name actors in this film, but the story failed to have much depth. Decent ragnorock-like humor, but, it was also excessive and seemed forced at times as a result.

title: Fun watch
text: I don't understand all the bad reviews and low ratings, I really liked it. It was funny, I liked Natalie coming back as Jane. I actually don't like Tess Thompson as an actress (that's just me ) so I was happy her role wasn't big. Rusell Crowe was hilarious as Zeus. Maybe people shouldn't take everything so serious and chill, enjoy the movie and don't overthing everything...

title: The only MCU-Movie I had to cry
text: Maybe Thor Love and Thunder is not the most spactacular or funniest movie in the MCU.But The Story about Gorr is so lovely and sad. I really love it.It is so refreshing, that the main characters in this movie are no super heroes. Gorr is the main Character. And I can really understand him. Something in you will break forever, when you are losing your own child.Maybe many User were not satisfied with this story. But if I see all other MCU-Movies, I realised, that there was no other Hero or Villain, wo was so full of pain. Okay. Maybe Clint in Avengers Endgame. But not really,This Szene in the Dessert at the Begin of Thor Love and Thunder was so heartbreaking for me.

title: Truly Awful. DO NOT waste your money or time
text: I've watched the whole Marvel movie catalog and this is by far the worst movie they've ever produced. Really I've never seen a bad Marvel movie, they're all pretty great.This one is so stupid so bad you just sit there asking yourself how these great actors would allow themselves to be in such a horrible movie.This is not like any other marvel movie with great production values etc. It's intentionally cheesy and looks like a B movie. Except for the humor doesn't land. You just keep waiting for it to snap into a normal marvel movie and it never does.I can seriously imagine these actors laying on their deathbed regretting that they did this movie it's that bad.If you have to see it just because you see all marvel movies wait till it comes out on streaming. There is no reason to see this on the big screen.

title: Gone the golden days of marvel. Totally childish
text: TBH i used to be a biggest fan of marvel, I used to say bro i see only marvel because they are best. Seems like endgame was a real endgame for marvel (except Spiderman but that's of Sony).Ms marvel cringe, and now this.It seems like there is too much of magic and it's leading marvel to kid zone. Like we see at time of iron man , it's all used to be technology now Jane becoming Thor, Thor giving power to kids and they were fighting with toys, wtf. Gots are flying. How the hell Jane foster reached there where Thor was fighting with Gorr in last scene. In starting Fighting was not serious, it was a joke and was there a need of this stupid stuff.

title: THORS ADORE ðŸ˜˜
text: Hello!! Thank you, Thor for the grand return and mayhem. The storyline was not perfectly crafted. Yet! It held my interest; the deep soul searching for Thor and him meeting Jan after so many years after the Thor II film. The film is fast past- and Zeus could have worked out a little for this movie but oh well!! It's all in contemplating for Thor but tragic for Bale as the God killer. So may plots to this film. They could have trimmed it a bit and tightened the storylines.Yet!! The movie came out with the fans loving Thor. I highly suggest it. And. I bet later on on. I expect a fan directors cut to come out. ðŸ˜‰

title: Most enjoyable of Phase 4 yet
text: The opening scene raises quite a heartfelt moment and very quickly establishes the villains motive which I particularly like here. It also raises serious theological questions to ponder , but the goofiness and lightheartedness of the majority of the movie allows you to avoid a dreaded car ride home debating the merits of religious beliefs.Perhaps some of the comedic relief is a little over the top, but in my opinion still preferable to overly dragged out battle scenes that make some of the MCU films 2.5-3 hours. There are also some nice Easter eggs and references to past films if you've kept up with everything.Most important of all Bale really excels in the villain role as Gorr and displays his malleability as an actor that few possess. For me, the villains are what truly drive superhero movies and here Bale by no means "butchers" the role; certainly one of the MCU's better villains. Only knock might be that it would have been nice having a little more screen time with him considering how effective he was in the part.Lastly the soundtrack was fantastic, highly recommend viewing in a theatre with upgraded speakers.Admittedly , Taika Waititi is a bit of an acquired taste as a director and took me a while to come around to, but I've arrived and am now quite a fan.

title: Just bored
text: I think i smiled at two jokes. This movie just wasnt good. It was like a spoof of a Thor movie. Christian bale was the best part of the entire movie.I loved ragnorok. Even the evil elf movie was better.

title: Fans are too entitled
text: Ever since Endgame, fans just expect fan service and cameos every second of every MCU movie. It takes time to rebuild a world again. This movie serves as an epilogue to Thor's pain and suffering. It's enjoyable and fun. Yes, it could have been paced a little better but overall it was a cool rom-com style movie.I also don't believe that Thor is a "joke" compared to the comics.Side notes: taking a single frame with heavy VFX that wasn't necessarily mind blowing and labeling all the CGI garbage is an argument that makes no sense. Finally, when did fans stop trusting Kevin Feige. He has plan. Just sit back and enjoy the ride.

title: Screaming Goats Says it All
text: What in the world did I just watch?!? What has happened to Marvel and the Marvel Universe/Multiverse? Since Endgame, I feel like much of their movies (I have enjoyed most of the series) have come down to everyone throw their creative ideas in a hat, draw one and make them randomly happen as they are drawn, Thor is no exception to this rule. I am less sad about the money I spent to see it than the time wasted.

title: Not the best but above average
text: Movie is good but it lacks some aspects of action in story that we usually associate with a marvel movie but that doesn't make it a bad movie. It's a good movie.

title: Tone deaf and turned off
text: Couldnt finish, its not bad acting just the tones all over the place, normally like marvel humour but this is too far. Its completely imbalanced which is a massive shame.Christian Bale especially did a great job but a lot of the characters just felt flat, despite multiple movies up to this point, theyd lost all their depth and character for a few jokes.It had such potential to be a good movie but if they had thought about the finished product then it could have been great. They ruined it for poor jokes all over the place that fall flat as a result. The humour wasnt there to lift from dark moments it just ruined them. Hope future movies are better.

title: Thor: Love and Thunder - Review
text: I am speechless. Taika, are you out of your mind? The director of the Oscar movie Jojo Rabbit, a very overrated one, but a good movie for sure, and one of the most entertaining movies of the MCU, Thor: Ragnarok, filmed this... how I put this right... just a big pile of mess, atrocious CGI, and the screenplay? Was he high or something? Absolutely nothing worked here, not a single pay-off or joke. It's literally an SNL skit or something. I would've written a better script - in a freaking day. Thor is just a clown here and when in Ragnarok, there was built a beautiful balance between dumb fun and epic fantasy comic-book movie, here? Here are those obnoxiously unfunny goats. Thank God those were in like 3 scenes. Some dialogue was so bad I felt sorry for the actors and for the whole movie. This movie should've been the standout of phase 4 and this summer, but it's literally the worst movie of the year, I cannot believe I'm writing this. I just. I'm. Nah whatever, let's watch some real cinema.

title: Bale nailed it
text: The movie as it is is an enjoyable fourth movie of the god of thunder. Taika did as usual and fills up with comedic scenes which sometimes felt a bit too much but also many small jokes that got me a good laugh. But beside taikas comedy and hemsworths character bale as gor was what made this movie a good one. The role as a villain was executed so perfect and his character portrayal was wow. I had to remind myself that this is actually the same guy who was the dark knight. Instead of leto he should have been the joker ( either die a hero or live long enough to become the villain yourself)

title: Unfunny snoozefest
text: If you liked Thor Ragnarok... Then watch it again and give this a miss until you are really bored and just want to watch something to pass some time.Terrible script, tried too hard to be funny and 90% of the jokes didn't even make me smirk.Christian Bale was fantastic. 2 or 3 funny moments. Worth watching but not at cinema.

title: the beat one yet
text: As someone who has see all 4 thor film I can honestly tell you that this one is by far my favorite it is the best one yet. This is a romantic comedy adventure and it is funny if you are a fan of Thor or marvel you enjoy this film.

title: Don't bother to see it
text: This couldn't even been worse if they used x-rated parody director's. Sad to see how low-key disney can drop. This was a total destruction of marvel movies with Thor sequels, I only get the feeling they want to end everything as bad they can with the whole franchise. We watched the whole movie and saw that there probably will be more to come that we won't even bother to see. Disney will not be subscribed on anymore after many of their last bad movies and the hope of changing is fading away quickly when you see sequels that are getting much worsen and far to woke even for me and my friends taste. Sorry for bad English for everyone who wants to complain on it but hey I'm from Sweden where we love our mythology.

title: Was This a SPOOF?
text: My family LOVES Thor and almost any Marvel movie, but they couldn't be serious with this one.Very disappointing and to be honest, this isn't a movie that I would say is suitable for children under a certain age either. This definitely wasn't as family friendly as much as the other Thor movies.It didn't seem as though we were watching a THOR movie at all. With such great actors, this was a poor film and story line. My son and I just kept looking at each other hoping for it to improve as it went along, but NOPE just got worse. If they meant for this to be a joke or SPOOF - they've succeeded.I'm sorry I even wasted time on this movie or even subscribing to Disney Plus just for this movie.I hope that this franchise isn't going downhill. These were some of the best movies out and now I dread even taking the chance. Don't waste your time on this movie unless you literally have nothing to do, and watched everything else on your movie list.

title: What the frack
text: This year Marvel has produced a couple of truly bad movies, but this is the worse so far. I was really and truly stunned by how bad it is. I really thought they couldn't make this lousy of a movie. The acting tends to be basically horrible overall (indicating the director was lousy). The characters almost seem to be act randomly without any purpose. The interactions are about as mature as middle school. The plot is inconsistent and the comedy is just not funny. There are a couple of serious themes that are jarring, when mixed with what seems to be attempts at silliness. I am really wondering how this turkey ever got any approval by anyone. This is work to be ashamed of. It seems as if Disney has given the command to destroy Marvel. There is an extra layer of awful here in that the Thor series has been fairly good up to this mess.

title: It's a comedy!
text:
And a comedy only...
How is it even possible to kill any form of artistic level like they did with this movie? Or to kill off all of nordic myths elements, using them only as facade for some CGI loaded, cheap, modern teenie level, zero brainer cinematic wannabe experience?Compare this with the first Thor movie directed by Kenneth Brannagh and you immediately see the difference, which is huge. The first part was a movie, this is a joke. A joke that got worse from one part to the next and now eclipsing everything you can possibly imagine about bad cinema, bad taste and bad movie characters.As said: it's a comedy, but a comedy to itself...

title: Rich in irony and pop-culture
text: Rich in irony and pop-culture: wildly entertaining as a meta-verse and as a send-up of the intense Marvel universe narratives. The ensemble cast is marvelous.The play-up of egocentricity and pop-psychology in Thor transforms his story into a Bildungsroman for the ages and for twenty-first century tweens, teens, and 20-somethings.The multiple narratives and the careening points of view provide comic catharsis. Understatement and self-effacement rule the banter and dialogue with subtleties and respectful innuendos wafting about. Meaningful homage is made to fantasy and science-fiction genres. The gestures and symbols, whilst being part of the narrative, are comfortably human and relatable.

title: I wish someone had told me how bad this movie is before!
text:
This movie is a complete waste of time!! The story isn't engaging!! Also what makes me angry is the fact that every moment I feel like they're trying to put a joke throat down (the movie does not urge curiosity). The good parts are some visual effects and sometimes I laughed at some jokes, but it wasn't worth watching 2 hours of film! (I wish I had seen a warning sooner!)
Well, they kept a significant part of the movie remembering old episodes, for me that shows the lack of content of this story. However, there are some surprises along "Thor: Love and Thunder", but it is not enough to save this one of being the worst Thor movie of the whole series. I am very disappointed in this movie.

title: I liked it
text: Maybe it's because I'm an old woman but I enjoyed this movie immensely. I saw Thor not as incompetent and emasculated but struggling with heart break, remedied in a heartwarming rather than predictable way. I agree the Mighty Thor arc detracted from the film, but not greatly. The film contains great elements of fun. Christian Bale, as always, was brilliant, and I disagree with the criticisms people have made that the ending was unbelievable (even in the context of a Marvel film) or wrong. Maybe being a parent gives me a different perspective on Gorr's journey. All up, my favourite Marvel film and I highly recommend watching it.

title: Meh..
text: I didn't have high hopes for the movie to begin with but I was still disappointed. Christen bell was highly underused. For a villain named God butcher, They didn't even show any butchering. But the most annoying thing about marvel movie nowadays is the lame slapstick comedy in every few minute. All the superhero acts like they are stand up comedian. They made Thor even more stupid in this film. It feels like marvel is questioning audiences judgement by making these low quality garbage in recent times. They have all these great actors yet they dont even use half of their acting capabilities. This was probably the worst film so far in phase 4 and I cant wait to see what we get next.

title: Thor: Rush and Blunder
text: I'll keep this short. This film was clearly two and a half hours long, but half an hour was cut out so they could have more showings. As a result, we are left with a rushed film that was weak writing, bad CGI and some painfully unfunny scenes.There are some good aspects; Thor is charming, Jane is great and Gor is a scene-stealer. But Korg is awful and Valkeryie is completely wasted.Marvel needs to take a look at themselves and stop going for quantity over quality.

title: There's a good movie hidden in here
text: I liked what Taika Waititi did with Thor Ragnarok. The lighthearted attitude worked fine with the serious attitude Thor has to the world and to himself. I said it a few times before - humor is probably the best cure for pompousness. But humor works best with set boundaries, most of these seem to be forgotten in this movie. And as far as I'm concerned it's plain shame since the serious part of the movie is one of the best I've seen in a long while. With Natalie Portman and Christian Bale both giving two of the best performances I've seen in superhero movies ever. And the rest of the leading roles didn't fall too far behind.But some of the jokes were so pathetic and pointless I felt like Taika Waititi got carried away by the idea of making Thor funny and pushed so far it almost ruined the movie. I get the point - most of the gods as depicted in our own myths are petty and even ridiculous, that would have been better pointed out in my humble opinion if they didn't play their roles as cartoons. Cartoons that look ridiculous and petty are almost commonplace. So - what's the point here did they feel the viewers wouldn't understand how pathetic the gods were if the roles were played straightforwardly? That means they wrote these roles all wrong. Did they feel there were too few jokes there - I don't know but if they did they were mistaken. There were already enough jokes as is, and still they kept piling more and more jokes - maybe they felt like the other part of the movie was too morbid so they wanted to counter it with an extra dose of jokes. That's the most likely explanation but in my book they were wrong to think so and that's mainly on Taika who lost a lot of points in my personal book for his poor sense of balance. I had to make a big conscience effort to ignore parts of this movie that practically made me cringe because the other parts were so good I didn't want anything to spoil them.Once again kudos to Natalie Portman and Christian Bale - they created real depth of character where only hints were written.

title: A Superhero Rom Com
text: "Thor: Love and Thunder" is a fun ride from start to finish. I love that we keep getting new takes on the superhero genre and in "Love and Thunder" we get a true super rom com with lovable leads and an awesome villain. I hope we continue getting Thor movies that change of the sub-genre.

title: So much fun
text: I went in with low expectations after hearing bad things about Love and Thunder but this movie was anything but empty.Its core theme is about love and finding something worth living for, sacrificing for, devoting yourself to. The performances are all excellent and the design and cinematography are incredible, much like Ragnarok.If I have one criticism it would be the need for more visual evidence of Gorr, the protagonist's, deeds as he travels the cosmos murdering gods. Bale was brilliant though and his menacing, corrupted performance was chilling at times.The jokes were plentiful and I understand some people don't dig that but I loved 90% of them and I would say the whole experience made me like Thor even more. It's for the lovers. Choose Love (and Thunder).

title: What's Disney doing? :(
text: So I absolutely loved the marvel storyline and especially the Thor storyline. But what Disney is doing is absolutely disgusting. They have somehow tried to create a comedy out of Thor.The character development in the marvel movies and Thor movies has been somewhat funny, yes, I agree. But it was often a form of humor, not a form of comedy. This movie seems like there has to be a joke in each and every scene, cringe jokes, the movie was rushed in too many areas and Christian Bale's performance was absolutely masked by the fact that the writers required it necessary to sprint through the entire movie. Ragnarok was awesome, this is just a waste of my time..

title: Good movie
text:
If you want to have some fun go to watch this movie.After doctor strange that was a little bit like a horror movie, its seems that marvel want to create a funny movie,
That reminiscent of the movie Guardians of the Galaxy.I enjoyed watching the movie and recommend to everyone!

title: Funny and light-hearted
text: If you're one of those die-hard fans with 500 comics on your shelf and have watched every MCU movie 5 times, you might not like this, and that's okay. As a casual viewer that doesn't typically enjoy these movies I think this is one of the best Marvel films to date.Much like Ragnarok this movie doesn't take itself too seriously. It's funny and light-hearted, and even the dramatic moments often turn into a sadistic/dark comedy. At times it truly felt like I was reading a parody of a Norse Saga rather than watching a movie.

title: When George clooney was Batman
text: This franchise has gone the exact way the Batman franchise went 25 years ago...until it went back to its dark and more serious roots..I found this movie ridiculous for anyone under the age of seven..and don't get me wrong these movies are based on comic books meant for children which is all this movie has to offer..immature nonsense perfectly harmless but lost on any adult audience...Disney are destroying the industry with this utter liberal appeasing garbage watch at your own peril people or be prepare yourself for severe disappointment.....let us please watch the Batman series made by Nolan and build on that for there lies the promised land of all encompassing entertainment for all ages..

title: A joke called movie
text: How can you make a movie so much dumb?I mean, you have Christian Bale, Natalie Portman and Russell Crowe, even if you don't have any script or director and let them be themselves the movie would be glorious, but you made a movie so bad that it wasn't even watchable. Thor was my favorite character but after this trash i should find a new hero. And let's talk about Tessa Thompson, is she even trying to be good? Why is she so hateful? Is it just me?? Action scenes were not entertaining at all, jokes were so so so dumb, and the movie after all was not something to recommend to a beloved one. Two hours of my life i am never getting back.

title: The emotional journey of a hero
text: After reading so many bad reviews, I had many doubts about the movie before watching it yesterday at the cinema.However, Thor, love and thunder, was such a nice movie that I had not to worry.The story focuses on the internal grow and development of Thor, from a still scared and lost man to a person that has faced some of his struggles and made peace with them.The story is entertaining, with a very relatable bad guy (a phenomenal Christopher Bailey), and a lot of very bad and pointless gods.Definetly a good way to spend two hours. I loved every minute of the movie and especially the happy ending!

title: this not a film
text: This not a film ... i dont smile at all, like a a store for kid before sleep.This not a film ... i dont smile at all, like a a store for kid before sleep.

title: "That's my hammer, and my look"
text: This was amazing! Sure, it was very very silly at times but it really tickled my funny bone. The story played out as you would expect with a god killing MacGuffin, but it was still fun to see the Greek gods in their selfish ways. The trio of Thor, Valkyrie and the Mighty Thor worked really well together and I would watch them all day.

title: Horrible, Horrible and Horrible
text: Thor should be somewhat of a dark mood and follow the first 2 films. I thought the 3rd movie was bad with the lame comedic jokes but they took it to a whole new level of corniness! I had to stop watching when they reached the Zeus scene as everything before is simply silly. Whoever wrote this storyline and made it so so so idiotic should be fired. I'd rather be bored than watching this awful movie. And please keep other marvel characters in their respective movies.It seems that Marvel are great at doing a first film of a certain character but when it comes to sequels they tend to butcher it all.

title: Truly dissapointed
text: Ragnar ok will remain to be the best Thor movie, love and Thunder is just a mess, it's all over the place and the dialogue is just childish. It had such potential with a lead actor like Christian bale, but the story and everything just feels rushed and put together in a rush without making gorr the villain he was meant to be as he was in the comics. I was so exited for this especially when I win tickets to an early screening, I am a huge MCU fan but love and Thunder has great visual effects but in regards to story and dialogue it's just a mess and as I stated earlier they didn't give Christian bale the time needed t truly depict gorr in comparison to the truly devious character he is in the comics its a major let down, because it would have of been the perfect chance to finwlly incorporate knull and thesymbiotes that are part of the true comic depiction, so I give it a 5 because Christian bale is just awesome and the visual effects but doctor strange in the multiverse of madness remains to be the best marvel movie released since infinity war.

title: I Love how guardians adds a whole new theme to Thor universe
text: Love and Thunder absorbs the energy of a relative who is going through a mid-life crisis. They are drawn to a variety of interesting hobbies, but most of them do not last. The impulsive motorbike either stays in the garage or returns to the showroom floor. Thor, as a character, continues to provide a shock of delight to the MCU whenever it is required. His character arc paved the way for him to branch out into various genres. Love and Thunder will remind you of fantasy adventure flicks like The Neverending Story, where the unbelievable may happen. At the same time, it may get in its own way by attempting to tackle as much as it does.

title: Feels like an episode of some Disney+ show
text: This feels like any random Disney+ show. So it means cheap cheap plot, meh cgi, a few fighting scenes and sometimes ok acting.Things just happen without much connection to one another. It's just this, then go there, get something, fight the bad guy. Really boring. Surprisingly this was the worst Christian Bale performance I've seen. He tries to be Voldermort/Joker, the creepy guy but comes out like a parody.Another proof that de MCU is dead and good movies are a dying breed. The worst part is critics giving it a good score and dumb audiences liking it. I suppose one is the result of the other.

title: The concept is extraordinary.
text: I'd been anticipating the release of this film for quite some time, and finally, all of my reservations were addressed. There were some expectations that were not met, but overall, I think it's brilliant.

title: I have to explain to my child what an ORGY is!!!!
text: Damn you DISNEY! STOP PUSHING YOUR GAY NORMALCY! I'm so upset at the content of this film. Super hero movies USED to be focused on the super hero and their mission. Now we have all this extra CRAP that's being pushed on us. I was so disappointed at how many uses of the "s" word in this movie. Not to mention my child next to me as he is watching and Zeus is talking about ORGIES! HOW embarrassing as a parent to have to explain what an orgy is to your child. I am absolutely PISSED off at Disney!!!

title: Worst Thor movie ever
text: They made Thor look weak and stupid nothing near the comics. Disney is coming up with bad movies. Marvel should had stayed independent. Also the story line is not really the best. At times the movie would make me get upset cause there was like no end to the bad comedy. I feel they didn't even try to make a good movie especially a Marvel movie. I was very disappointed in the whole movie. Disney should let the Marvel geeks just run the movies because that's what made Marvel great. This whole movie was horrible hopefully they don't keep making movies like this, I would rather keep reading comics.

title: Just a fun movie
text: I know substance wise this may be short of a lot of it's fellow marvel films but it's quite nice to just disengage the brain, have a laugh and enjoy the story. Christian Bale is superb and by far one of the best villains of the whole MCU and the rest of the cast are great as usualTo me Bale is why this is an 8 and not a 7. Worth it just for Gorr and his journeyGo see it and just enjoy it after the weight of No Way Home and Multiverse of Madness, this is just what was needed.

title: What did I just watch?
text: I'm still not completely sure what I just watched. The best description i can give is a bunch of cheesy jokes jumbled together, interrupted only by an occasional guns n roses interlude. If only it had been interrupted by something resembling a storyline. Even the action scenes seem tacked on, without any real motivation or goal. Actually, you know what it reminded me of? It reminded me of any of the times The Simpsons (or any other long running TV show) does a clip show. There's a bunch of random scenes and disparate locations crammed together, with the story just acting as an excuse rather than an actual vehicle.Taika Watiti was the right choice for Free Guy, but after this movie I don't ever want him touching anything with a serious story, serious subplot, or an accepted canon.

title: You were warned
text: This period of history will be remembered by those who survive it as a time when the Rule Book was thrown out the window and chaos reigned. A hundred years ago, monopoly laws prevented the concentration of media in corporate hands. Beach movies in the 1960s always included at least one lonely millionaire wandering around in the cast -- lonely because he owned a TV station or radio station or newspaper and could only sell it to another lone millionaire. The Clinton era changed that. Four conglomerates today own 99% of the western media. Disney buying Marvel was arguably the coup de grace. You now have companies creating markets for content rather than content for markets. Sometimes it works (WANDAVISION). Sometimes it does not. (THOR LOVE & THUNDER). But it is now their game. The rest of us have become merely players. ((Designated "IMDb Top Reviewer." Please check out my list "167+ Nearly-Perfect Movies (with the occasional Anime or TV miniseries) you can/should see again and again (1932 to the present))

title: Worst Marvel Outing so far
text: With Taika Waititi at the helm, I had high hopes, since I have seen greatness from his other work. Sadly, this pushed the self mockery too far, and became an embarrassment, instead of comedy, along with good storytelling.The story failed, or at least, was overpowered by the flat acting, poor comedic timing and too much dependence on disappointing humor.My eyes were tired, from constant eye-rolling at the embarrassingly dumb humor.Disney/Marvel has really dropped the ball, since Phase 3 ended, with about only about a third of its content being of any reasonable quality.The result being completely rudderless and more intent on wokeness than good storytelling and character development.

title: Definitely worth watching!!
text:
Thor: Love and Thunder
Just as the title suggests - we get to experience an amazing film which presents us a story with both romance and action thus making this masterpiece one of my top 10 favorite movies I had ever watched.Thor: Love and Thunder is a film based on Marvel Comics featuring the character Thor, produced by Marvel Studios and distributed by Walt Disney Studios Motion Pictures. The film is directed by Taika Waititi and stars Chris Hemsworth as the main character.The story of the film finds Thor on a journey to combat the threat which was made by a galactic killer known as Gorr the God Butcher who seeks the extinction of the gods. With the help of King Valkyrie, Korg, and ex-girlfriend Jane Foster, Thor embarks upon a cosmic adventure to stop the God Butcher before it's too late.One of the things I enjoyed the most while watching the film, was that the action and the romance that were presented were showed in a fun way thus making the film a comedy mixed with emotions and also some good action. In addition, I really enjoyed the interesting plot and the acting is really well executed. My only complaint is that there is too much focus on the love story between Thor and Jane and the first part of the film feels somewhat rushed.Overall, this was a fantastic film and a must see for any Marvel fans or just any movie fans in general. It will appeal to a range of people and I promise it will not disappoint.

title: Thank the gods I only paid $1 to see it.
text: It's no Ragnorak. Having Taika Waititi, clearly, isn't enough to make a sweet film. But, then again, the Jane love story was never compelling enough to begin with for me. This film is beyond campy and the flow is awful. The jokes are forced and not nearly as well crafted as Ragnorak. Russell Crowe acts way below his ability and is no where near the star power Cate Blanchett brings to Ragnorak. If there is another Thor movie, I hope if Russell Crowe returns, he works on his comedic timing. Overall, I just didn't feel the acting is as nuanced as Ragnorak, which is surprising given the caliber of the primary actors.

title: THORoughly Marvel-LESS.
text: How on earth did anyone allow this movie to be released. Total garbage!Obviously aimed at Wiggles fans, and maybe those with brain-damage. From the opening scene to the end, it possible to believe that the producers have something against Marvel, and might be the first official flop.

title: I saw Thor four
text: Good fun.Portman & Bale (& Crowe) are able to give the movie gravitas whilst Hemsworth & Co. & the many, many star cameos keep it zipping along.Suffers a little disjointedness from pandemic filmmaking (I suspect) but its heart is in the right place all along.Laughs, tears, & cheers!

title: Disney is great at making trash
text: Title pretty much says it all. Marvel movies officially suck and are trash like most everything else Disney puts out nowadays.Pretty much the only thing being made that's redeeming by Big D Disney is the Mandalorian but I'm not sure it's worth continuing to pay them just to see that. Oh btw they are hiking their rates again in December because of inflation I guess? Right. Just go see anything other than this.

title: What a disappointment
text: After the Avengers Infinity War and End Game, the MCU movies keep getting worse and worse... The Thor series peeked at 3 and then took a deep nosedive to get this low....After the Avengers Infinity War and End Game, the MCU movies keep getting worse and worse... title: Team Thor Delivers Again!!
text: Love it, hilarious and entertaining. Not gonna lie. It's everything and more you want & expect from Thor. Don't listen to the nay nays living to boo boo the sunshine for being too shiny and moonlight too bright.!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

title: Is This the Cutting Room Floor Pieces Stitched Back Together?
text: What an absolute pile of woke lefty brainwashing garbage! Utter pants!! In bad movie terms, this generations 'Battlefield Earth'. This is one of the very few movies I'd wished I'd not gone to see, I've seen some doozies but this wins, easily! Very disappointing. I think they didn't bother hiring scriptwriters but rather ad-libbed (badly) throughout the entire movie. Like the movie, I feel like I've been stitched up!

title: Are you not entertained?
text: I honestly feel like I haven't watched this movie enough, to have each & every memorable moment stuck in my memory banks for ever! Thank you sooooooooo much for this movie, each & every one of you!Did you like, get ahold of my childhood diary from the 90's & somehow find a way to cast all of my favorite actors in one film? With an opening scene having a Van Damn Split in it? Why didn't that alone get nominated for 6 NODs? I have no idea, but amazing job! Really.. You got the nominations, in my heart.If any other films are being shot with Italian American portrayals in it? Like Tom Hanks in Pinocchio? It should be mandatory to go get dialect lesson from Russel Crowe, & them having that same Play going? Who thinks of this stuff, really?? Having Mellissa playing Hella? (Which was originally played by one of my favorite female actors)I'm just really glad I got to see this, & even though I didn't get to meet the "old man" (Stan Lee) himself (like some of you did) because of the ongoing investigations he was facing while we were both in Seattle together? I think I can say that we had a type of universal connection? An Army Connection, & he would've loved how you included the children. From what I know about him? That was all he ever wanted, was to put a wholesome smile on kid's faces. Which every time I'm out & see his toys or anything like that? It reminds me of all our hard work that every single one of us put into making these dreams come true, & THANK you so much for making my dreams come true by doing this! Thanks..Guys, Girls? You have no idea just how immortalized these roles made you in our history books, Chris? If you see this? Your family? Thanks... Thanks for doing such a good job raising him.. Christian, thanks. Not just for this but for all the other amazing portrayals you've given us as entertainment to distract us from the major problems we are facing, or to remind us of tragic events that happened of the past so we never forget how far we've come.Chris (Pratt), still love you & they say never meet your hero's.. That's why I never sought you out... Star Lord..It was a great job on a mediocre film that was stretched to great lengths because of the amazing talent.I see you Tiki.. Killing it, all the from Free Guy to here, reppen it big for New Zealand... Thanks..Thanks for believing in me, sorry if I fail you.Just know I tried to warn them-

title: They have tried again, they have been wrong
text: Thor: Ragnarok is a good movie, it has the right humor, it's a dynamic movie, it's not boring, it's even short.This movie is quite the opposite, it has no sense of humor, in some scenes it borders on embarrassment, it is slow, boring and meaningless, it has disappointed me tremendously, I hope they correct this, if there is a continuation, I do not remember a movie that I've been so bored, and currently it's not very difficult.A shame, the truth is that it is not known what they wanted to do, but there was great potential in Jane Foster as Thor, but they were completely wrong, I hope they try again, Thor is one of my favorite comic characters, for It hurts me so much to write this review.

title: Just make this petition
text: There should be a petition to make this waititi to stop filming movies.There was a time that a film would be released and then it's parody would be released also. Waititi thought "well why release a movie and expect the parody after, while you can do the main movie a parody of itself?" And we got this....I don't think I recall I ever saw anything good from him. And I don't expect him to film anything good ever... He surely won't be missed in the filming business, nor he will ever be remembered, no matter how hard he tries to be remembered as the one who is wasting the money they give him to destroy a franchise and make the worst out of it.So, Waititi, do us a favor and change a profession, but I doubt with all the money you've got, you'll be in need to ever work again...

title: Random things...
text: The movie was extremely bad. Christian bale with a great performance wasn't enough to save anything. The script,ha, the script was random things to "do comedy". A big failure. Thor the mighty, in the movie,is not a god of thunder,an a warrior and a protector of earth and other realms. He is a nickelodeon comedian. And the political correctness, they are feeding us with a large spoon for 2 hours. There is no balance,no comedy ,no action ,no something new. And they have Bale. He's got the paycheck and...ok. And the trailer is the move . You can save 2 hours and see your hair growing... It's better than the "movie".It's ok marvel. Make movies for Sunday mornings and please don't wake me to see them.

title: Movie for the 2 to 10 years to watch.
text: First I excepted too much from this movie. Has a great plot with the God Killer and Jane being sick to be worked thru the movie but fails most of time. I kept waiting for Thor to wake up and show everything was a bad dream in the movie but no it crashed. Sorry I thought they wanted to make movies you want to watch several times but they failed.

title: A good, funny lighthearted movie
text: A great movie for all the family. It is funny with a good plot, great actors and i loved the love conquers all theme. It wasn't all just fighting like some marvel movies.

title: The trailer showed the best the film has to offer
text: Too hectic cuts, the plot is too rushed. In many places the humour doesn't work or is simply too stupid. Christian Bale's potential is wasted. Slowly, the Marvel train seems to be losing momentum...

title: Do yourself a favor, read the comic
text: Simply as title says, do yourself a favor, read the comic, it's really a great story about Gorr the God Butcher, Jane Foster as Thor, Unworthy thor etc. This on the other hand is really butchered and then butchered even more great story. One of the rare movies of this 'caliber' that I gave up half way through, kinda forced myself to watch other half later on on speed up, and glad that I didn't waste more time on this, it's B type of movie with big budget. So yeah, if you are interested in great story, good character development, emotional ending, maybe even some tears, someting worth your time, read the comic :D , and skip this pile of hot steaming ....

title: Horrible, in every possible way!
text: This movie (and some of the other recently released "Marvel" movies) should not be part of the MCU, it shouldn't even carry the Marvel name.Lazy writing, very stupid way of trying to link unnecessary and unimpressive characters to the previous movies just to make it pass as a "story".You can also tell they had absolutely no idea what they were doing from the extremely long (but absolutely unnecessary) dialogues. The movie has no identity, they keep trying to make it funny, forcefully. It's somehow a children's movie, but not really.The whole thing is a huge mess, and i can't stress this enough, lazy lazy lazy writing.

title: Nerds hate having fun
text: Great, fun movie. The nerds will give it bad reviews because Luke skywalker didn't kill the bad guy or something.There is a particular, stylistic visual sequence that is so rad and unique.The Easter eggs and cameos add some flare as well.Long live Taika Waititi and Thor!

title: The worst Thor so far
text: I have enjoyed all the Thor movies to date, my least favourite would get a 7 out of 10 until this one came along.I've always enjoyed the humour in the Thor movies, but this one simply misses the target in terms of humour and a decent story.It feels like the actors are either laughing at the studio for been paid so well for something so lame, or that they simply aren't interested at all.I knew Russell Crowe could be bad with accents...see Robin Hood, but his turn as Zeus, hamming it up like some old theatre lovey really is painful to watch.I have enjoyed the work of Taika Waititi, but this won't do his CV any favours been the writer.The beginning of the movie was messy, the middle quite boring, and the end felt like the hand of Disney at work.

title: Not as good as I expected
text: Taika waititi ruined zeus and made the movie too funny but christian bale carried the whole movie with his incredible acting performance as gor. Natalie Portman was amazing as Jane foster and raised the level of the film in every scene she played. Finally the ending of the movie was amazing and promising for the upcoming movies.

title: Surprisingly, better than Ragnarok!
text: This film was fantastic. It fixed Ragnarok's two biggest issues by introducing a far more compelling villain in Gorr, played with a truly frightening performance by Bale, and it didn't undercut the dramatic moments with humour like Ragnarok did. Love and Thunder isn't as funny as Ragnarok, because it focuses more on the romantic/dramatic elements, which were electric. But, the action is a lot better and the score is one of my favourites in the MCU. I also love that there's a lot of moments when we see the characters just being themselves, and it having nothing to do with the script. The action was surprisingly creative, the visuals were either very vibrant or very washed to juxtapose between Thor and Jane's lives (I liked that), and my favourite aspect was the score. Best score in the MCU. I just wish it was longer so we could flesh out the Thor and Jane's relationship a little bit more!

title: It works-those 1 stars reviews are apart from reality
text: Sure it's not as good as ragnarok but i think it deserves good rating as it tried to bring us one more crazy adventure of thor similar to ragnarok. I like the humour of taika and hemsworth ,sure they did not bring something really new or super different but i hoped for similar ,to ragnarok,tone and they.deliver so i am satisfied. Technical part as a whole works pretty fine some cgi imperfection could be found but who cares. I personally watch these movies to relax so it aquire its main purpose. Oh and i love the story telling. So yeah when i start writing review it was at 7 stars now i think 9 is more suitable for them. For all the people ,who did their job well ,they deserve it.

title: Nice movie
text:

We get to discover many new characters and places
