title: Disney disease spreading into Marvel Universe.
text: Looks like Disney disease finally spreads from Star Wars Universe, into Marvel Universe.It is the same pathogen, easily recognizable by common symptoms: no respect to the original material, pathetic writing leading to pathetic jokes and undeveloped characters. Bad acting coming from demoralization of actors having to deal with such low quality material.Pathetic, greedy, brainwashed corporate suits from Disney, spreading their disease, into yet another Universe.Could we viewers assemble and deal a strike into the heart of that pit of mediocrity, bad jokes and bad taste?Avengers!Assemble!

title: I am so disappointed!
text: I am a huge marvel fan, but I am so disappointed! Very bad! So many silly jokes! It didn't felt like a Marvel Movie! Time wasting! Why are you doing this to Thor character! Or what was with Zeus?!!!

title: I liked it
text: I feel like people these days thinks a "good" movie must be serious; delivering certain message, critcizing social phenomenons, or something else.It is good that there are movies discussing topics like that, but it's not a "standard" of a good movie.Life is hard already, a movie like Love and Thunder gives me 2 hours of joy without me looking down to my phone wondering when will the movie end, to me, it is good enough.It is not something epic, but it definitely deserves a better score.

title: Sadly its not a serious movie it more like a parody
text: I know it doesn't deserve that rating but i kinda had fun i just wish it was a bit more serious. The acting was great as always but they really need to work it out for the future. They are just throwing projects after projects and i really expect more of them.

title: Tries to hard, still fell asleep
text: I have absolutely no idea what the intention of this movie was, but I am glad that I skipped it in the cinema and waited for the VOD release. This is not good. The plot is weak, the humor is forced and the visuals are awfull.So far the marvel movies looked OK for the most part and I sort of tolerated the greenscreen third act. This movie is greenscreen pretty much 80% of the time and I couldnÂ´t care about anything that was happening because none of it felt remotely realistic.Some of the jokes were fun, but there were simply too many with not a lot of breathing time. In market mechanism if you have an abundand supply of something while the demand remains similar, the price of said item goes down. That model works very well here because the more jokes you have, the cheaper they seem and hence the laughs are not there.The plot? Basically nonconsequential filler with just a few events that have any kind of meaning. I am bothered a bit that there is a deus ex son of Heimdall out of nowhere with no previous mention whatsoever. I mean, the kid was fine and likeble in the movie but he comes out of nowhere, like pretty much any other plotpoint.There were a couple of things I did like in the movie but that would be getting into spoilers. The main characters work well with each other (except of Corg, get rid of that guy ASAP please) and the Villain was good. Overall I wanted to give 3/10 but bumped it up because of Christian Bale. If you are stuck on a long flight with nothing much else to watch, this is fine but I wouldnÂ´t go out of my way to recomend this movie to anyone.

title: Taika light
text: Thor Love and Thunder was fun, but not as good as Ragnarok. If you were annoyed by Ragnarok, you'll hate Love & Thunder. If you're in the mood for a joke filled film (that actually has some really dark themes) then you're in for a fun ride. 8.3/10, B. A bit too dumbed down (felt targeted at 12 year olds), but we laughed a lot.Also there was some bad green screening. Which is bizarre as this film utilized "The Volume" first seen in Mandalorian.

title: Another movie that says nothing
text: What a disappointment... This story has no impact in the MCU. This movie does nothing. The characters don't even evolve (except for the antagonist) It's 2 hours of fun. Everything is a joke, you can't go more than 1 minute without there being jokes. I didn't feel the power of Thor in this movie. This end comes out of nowhere and it is forced.I have to say we finally have a good villain, the battle on the planet/moon is one of the best I've ever seen and this art direction is amazing. Watching Guardians of the Galaxy is still fun, but that's about it. These are the only positives.It's a shame, because I had hope for this film. I really liked Thor in Ragnarok, infinity war and in Endgame. He had finally become a charismatic character, very well iconized, who had a good evolution. He was the character who had lost the most in the MCU. He was questioning his life and where did this Thor go?? I say it, this phase 4 of the MCU is the WORST! Uninteresting villains, stories that don't tell much, we still don't know where we're going with this phase, but we continue anyway.

title: Another weary shrug
text: The film is funny, there are nice moments and Christian Bale fits the role perfectly. I actually like that the story is so simple and actually quite small (or at least that's how it comes across), but here it just feels so shoddy and puny as the movie seems so uneven tonally and so comically episodic to me that I watched it just don't like it. No death or fate has any effect here and that more or less subliminal message that kids can be strong if they believe in it (or whatever) doesn't come across here at all, just comes across unintentionally among all the slapstick jokesridiculous style created by the film's staging, below, as well as almost everything in Thor 4.

title: A gay fever dream
text: Objectively, I can see why folks may not say this is a strong movie, but as a queer person I just loved everything in this movie. Yes it wasn't the strongest, but I will be thinking of Tessa Thompson as Valkyrie for the next year now.

title: Below average!
text: To be honest, I loved Thor: Ragnarok and I think it's one of the best Marvel movies, and by far the best Thor movie. Love and Thunder is just a poor copy of Ragnarok. At least it had a great villain, and Christian Bale's performance once again showed why he is one of the best actors at the moment. But even his great performance couldn't fill that emptiness when it comes to the shallow story. First 40 minutes looked like a parody. And the part with Zues and whole gods council or whatever it's called was like a Disney's kids show. With all the shabby costumes and shallow jokes. Also, they just wanted a way to give a farewell to Himdal and Jane, because they said they are bot gonna play these characters anymore. All in all, shallow 5 out of 10.

title: Mere of bleating fools than goats
text: Don't let the negative crew put you off this flik. Cannot understand the criticism of this movie, it has a bit of everything. Love, humour, horror etc, etc. Go, sit back and enjoy Thors guns, Korgs beauty and Gorr teeth.

title: Worst marvel so far...
text: Before watching I've heard that Christian Bale plays a good role, but the rest is kinda meh. Well, it's true. Except the rest is not kinda meh but more like kinda boring.The script, especially in the beginning of the movie is so weird and unorganized, it's just annoying to watch. Also, there is not too much good humor in it. My wife was on her phone half the movie listening and watching a tiny bit and didn't miss anything.So I'd call it the worst Marvel movie so far. We looked each other in the eye, thinking if any other was worse. Nope. This is the one.Maybe watch it to complete the story and stuff, but don't expect anything great.

title: People hate fun
text: This movie is about an alien who thinks gods in Thor's world have let him down but it's also about the main character. Gorr is the main villain who wants to kill all gods and Thor wants to stop that from happening. Gorr doesn't need a lot of movie time to be creepy and threatening to gods. We hear about his destruction and see the aftermath. Thor looks for other gods to help fight Gorr because he is has a sword that makes him as strong or more than the gods he's killed. Jane is back and has the same comic story but she isn't taking over for Thor believe that or not. Valkyrie is back and ruling Asgard but it's not a big part of the movie. Thor gets Jane and Valkyrie to help fight this powerful enemy. The Guardians of the Galaxy have a small part at the beginning and Peter gives Thor some advice Thor really tries to use. Korg the rock alien is part of this. If you like him you should like the movie. If not then it will probably make you think it's worse than Hitler. I don't know why some people really hate this. There is a good mix of serious and funny. The funny stuff doesn't overwhelm anything dramatic. This is a great and entertaining movie without "too many jokes" although if you are a very serious person you will probably not think so.

title: Everything is a joke, but nothing is funny...
text: This movie is a farce and the main character is rendered as a buffoon. I had heard bad things about this but I didn't think it could possibly be this bad.Christian Bale is great and most of the acting is fine. But what they're being asked to do is just complete nonsense. The plot makes almost no sense, and even when it starts to, another stupid or tasteless joke pops up to ruin the mood and flow.About the only redeeming factor could be some of the visuals. But Thor's costume is ridiculous and the CGI for Natalie Portman is weird.I could go on, but just ready yourself for disappointment if you're looking for any sort of depth or intelligent design. Truly a bad film.

title: Disney+ & Thor 4 = the death of the MCU
text:
Disney+ & Thor 4 have completely destroyed the MCU, with the rest of the horrible phase 4 movies. Thor should have retired after Endgame and the MCU should have gone into deep freeze.I really can't put into words how bad this movie is. Hemsworth has zero redeeming scenes. Scratch that, the oldest Hemsworth had the only redeemable scene in the movie because at least it was a parody....albeit a bad parody and a bit that didn't need to return.1. Zeus scene was the worst in MCU history
2. One great scene with Christian Bale can't overcome bland, story-less, humorless tripe.3. I hope Thor returns because this wasn't Thor!

title: Enormous Fun
text: I thoroughly enjoyed this movie and the two hours flew past! A little heavier on the comedy aspect than most Marvel Universe movies but that didn't bother me one bit. Lots of great cameos and guest appearances, most notably from Russell Crowe as Zeus being hilariously camp. Chris Hemsworth as good as ever, Natalie Portman marvellous! Also great to see the Guardians of the Galaxy gang in great form. I laughed out loud every time the Giant Screaming Goats did their thing. Excellent special effects as always and direction with genuine pace and flair. A must see for all the family ! Brilliant fun throughout.

title: Stupid and lazy comedy
text:
Where to begin? Finaly watched it after few attemps I fell in sleep. Only thing I like is soundtrack - but songs don't fit this mess of a movie at all. Wasted Christian Bale, wasted Natalie Portman, wasted Thor character... I guess "Engame" was trully last MCU movie if we don't count Deadpool and Guardians. But not sure Disney won't find a way to ruin those two franchises also...
Well, I'm going back to rewatching phase 1, 2 and selected movies from 3. The rest are better skipped I guess. Well, was good while lasted but MCU (good one) ended obviously. Time for something different - great era ended.

title: Enough with the marvel comedies
text:
The biggest problem with this movie is that it encapsulates all of the things I don't like about what marvel has become.Back in the days, there were 2 marvel movies, guardians of the Galaxy vol 1 and Ant-Man, which brought a new fresh comedic side to the marvel super hero franchise.Since then, marvel did not know where to stop and now all marvel movies and shows include this silly humor that was great with some movies but doesnt fit all.Thor really isn't the problem, it's the symptom....
Marvel should ditch this silliness and make darker films or at least not comedies. We had enough of this already.

title: How the mighty have fallen..
text: Easily the worst Marvel movie I have ever seen, poor CGI, awful dialogues, lame comedy & a joke of a plot.From the very beginning, there is no pacing, things just happen randomly, movie proceeds as if Marvel has taken decades to build the plot behind Love And Thunder.They have shamelessly emasculated Thor, the iconic god of thunder is nothing more than a deranged and depressed good for nothing joke now, Thor is constantly portrayed as someone dumb who just wouldn't take things seriously no matter who dies, his mother, father, brother, lover etcetera.Thor is now 1 dimensional and refuses to change no matter what.Makes you wonder what happened to Marvel, seriously what happened, parody movie SMH.

title: Loved this movie
text: Sweet and funny and makes your heart hurt. Hemsworth is very very good in this one, and the direction is better than ever. The humor is okay, not better than Ragnarok for sure.

title: Watchable but a little disappointing
text: Massive Marvel fan but this was a bit of a let down for me. It was watchable but sacrificed story telling for humour.Whereas Ragnarok was awesome and had a good balance of humour / acting there was way too much focus on childish humour at the expense of wasting the talent of some great actors. Christian Bale wasn't really given a chance to shine as he could of. Seems like Taika has been given a little bit too much free range and ran with it.After this Marvel really needs to start grounding the films again and bring something out more in line with the tone of The First Avenger, Winter soldier or Civil War as this is just getting a bit silly now and after this and Ms Marvel I'm starting to worry about the franchise I've loved for so long.

title: My favorite Thor movie
text: Let me preface by saying I am not of the comic book canon clan. Haven't read them and I don't care to do so.Now, I have always preferred the Marvel franchise over the DC franchise because the latter tends to take itself way to seriously for me. Marvel movies have that humorous, campy vibe from the very first Iron Man movie onward. Because of that, the Thor movies always felt out of place as they were the only ones always being so dramatic (some might even say melodramatic... I know I would).Thor: Love and Thunder finally got out of that pattern. I enjoyed it very much and felt the pure joy I feel watching other Marvel movies.People giving excruciatingly low ratings are probably bothered by the clear queer culture influences emanating from it, or they are bothered that it is not canon (IDGAF about that). They might also be too young to be affected by the 80's/90's nostalgia the whole aesthetic brings about. I would go as far as to say it clearly has serious Stranger Things vibes.The special effects might not be exactly seamless, but the cinematography is beautiful all around with some parts being really close to straight up genius, the acting is great and the soundtrack kicks ass.It's a very good movie and, according to my personal taste, it's the best Thor. Sue me. ;)

title: Cringe-fest
text:
Watched this last night on Disney+ and boy am I glad I didnt pay to see this at the Cinema.I will admit that I wasnt a big fan of Thor: Ragnarok when i saw that first time, but at least that had some interesting points to balance out the silliness that apparently Thor now needs.Unfortunately, unlike its predecessor, this film has almost no saving graces other than Natalie Portman who was entertaining as Jane/The Mighty Thor and Christian Bale who is genuinely sinister if not a little over the top.I felt like turning it off 25mins in, but stuck with it to the bitter end and really should have listened to my first instinct.Bad paper thin plot
Terrible incessant joking (feels like a bad parody/spoof)
the fight scenes were unimpressive
just badwill definitely steer clear of any Taika Waititi projects in the future, especially if he "writes" them.

title: Oh how the mighty have fallen
text: Thor: Ragnarok was a breath of fresh air for the Thor movies, turning a somewhat dull character into a fun but badass fan favourite. It would seem however Taika Waititi got the wrong message from Ragnarok's positive reception believing the comedy and fun visuals to be the sole reason why people liked it. So he decided to double down on those elements for this film.Thor: Love and Thunder is a huge step-back from Ragnarok where serious moments are always undercut by a lame joke and no characters are given breathing room or development. Thor as a character has regressed and is now a complete idiot. The badass, kind and thoughtful character who lost everything is now the bumbling, destructive idiot who lost everything. Jane Foster is back and her character arc has the potential to be really moving but unfortunately not enough time is given to her character and what she's going through. The most disappointing aspect is Gorr The God Butcher, played excellently by Christian Bale, but is never seen Butchering any Gods and is not in the movie enough. The scenes where he is present are probably my favourite since he never tries to crack some lame joke every five seconds. But his character is not given enough time to be fleshed out and so he feels pretty forgettable as a villain which is a shame because Christian Bale really gives it his all.Performances are solid across the board despite the crappy script. While Bale is the standout, Hemsworth is clearly still having a blast as Thor. Although I could've gone without his new multi-coloured and over-designed armour. This movie is probably one of the most colourful MCU entries but not for the right reasons. It's more of the zany style of Ragnarok but to a much higher degree often being unpleasant to look at. The CGI ranges from decent to downright laughable, but occasionally the film provides an aesthetically pleasing shot.Overall, Love and Thunder toys with great ideas such as the characters of Jane and Gorr, but it never gives their characters time to breath, constantly moving from one joke, sacrificing the characters and plot for the sake of it. This film is too ridiculous, it almost feels like parody. Strong performance from Bale aside, this is one of the weakest MCU entries to date.

title: Entertaining, Adorable and Excellent Villain
text: We might be feeling a bit of superhero fatigue but Thor 4 will reenergize it a bit. The movie is totally entertaining with lots of surprises and funny adventures. It may have added to much punchlines but overall it is a solid movie.

title: Childs playing,k7 rated...totally lost that 'Superheroes' feels
text: Thor 1 great, Thor 2 even greater,Thor 3 dissapointed,but might ok,Thor 4.. jsut kids playground, noway!1st script is lausy,totally lausy,and looks only point is that movies should seen all of kind weird clothers and masked actors...i can say cleary,DONT use scrits makers what doing that job Thor 3 and Thor 4,specially not Thor 4 movie,, its junk.Also, what i see for line,even chris not like it,not all!And he saying that he might acting Thor 5 only is its change totally..and i seen back to k16 rated and real Superheroes movie category,not junk kids playground.I see that Thor 3 and 4 riding only with Thor 1 and Thor 2 famous.Make Thor 5 please, but make it like its should be,Superhero way... not pointed for kids.

title: Not much enough like the previous 3 movies...
text:
Too sily, feels like it's own parody
Movie is okay. Christian Bale is awesome, Chris still can't act, but we never liked him for his talent, rest of the cast brings what they have to the whole movie is an average Disney factory work, everyone knows their job and they execute is as they should. The story has too many silly jokes. I know Waititi's style, but now he feels like his own parody. Like those Scream parody Scary Movies.Writing needs to be improved... Thor was a big 3 from avengers end look how they massacred my boy.... I'm afraid if they are going to lose their audience with this kind of writing.

title: Ridiculous
text: Appallingly bad film. Why the relentless Dad jokes that fall flat and ruin the underlying thread of the most basic of stories. Dialogue is abject and the performances struggle because of it. Stan Lee must be turning in his grave with fury, at what has been done here. Bale's character had so much potential, so why put it in this madness. Waste of time. It could have been so very much better than this nonsense. It had started from the black and white scenes and developed from there , then perhaps a decent film may have emerged, but I wish I hadn't spent the money and wasted the time on this colossal mess of a film. 2/10.

title: Thor
text: But in the movie Thor: Ragnarok, we encounter a completely different Thor. Thor in this movie is extremely funny and more sincere than ever. If you loved Thor's character in other Marvel movies, you may not be able to get used to him in this movie. I loved Thor's appearance in this movie. Because, unlike other Marvel superheroes, Thor is actually a God in his own right, so he is actually the person who should have the most original and gripping movies. And director Taika Waititi managed to make the movie Thor deserves.Taika Waititi's direction was simply amazing. Even though I wasn't a fan of his What We Do In The Shadows movie, I loved the intimate style of Hunt For The Wilderpeople, and we see a similar tone in Thor: Ragnarok (there's even Sam Neill and Rachel House from Hunt For The Wilderpeople in this movie!). And this sincere atmosphere has managed to offer something unique to the audience in the recent superhero movie craze.

title: God This SUCKED
text: Look, one of the reasons Ragnarok did so well is because The Dark World did so poorly. It was a breath of fresh air in both the MCU and within Thor's own films. That being said, I HATE that Thor is basically an idiot that needs to endlessly keep relearning the same lessons now. He's been reduced to the humor that Taika Watiti can bring.I much preferred the vibe of the first Thor, where he could be both serious and funny. Any seriousness of this film is largely undercut by the meh humor injected into it. The same can be said for Might Thor (Jane) though I do love both her and Valkyrie...it's just not a good film.

title: Only Bale
text: Extremely empty and childish movie, the only good parts were with Bale. Last thor movie was a lot better, they just tried to use that marvel goofy "humor" the entire movie, and it just became very cringe.

title: sorry but its too much
text: I tried very hard to continue watching this movie but after less than an hour of nonsense and jokes that aren't even close to being funny, I decided that I couldn't take it anymore. The story is put there with no actual script just scenes in random order and the battle scenes are neither epic nether first guardian of the galaxy funny but only a B movie or probably the worst kind of it. After watching that monstrosity of Doctor Strange 2 I say no more marvel but when this one came to Disney+ I said to myself: "Ragnarok was fun so maybe thor is a good choice to watch"... never do it again. Sorry Disney but I still don't understand how you decide to create movies like this and people that are older than 10 enjoy it....till Endgame, not everything was perfect but the movies were all at least watchable....no its impossible to finish them and if unfortunately, you buy a ticket to watch in the cinema you gonna spend the most awkward hours of your life asking why am I watching this?

title: It's bad when I give my favorite hero five stars
text: It's bad when I give my favorite hero five stars. Even the best soundtrack in three decades could not with me over with this movie. It is so much worse than "The dark world". The campiness that marvel is treating Thor with is a disservice to Chris Hemsworth. This character in this context, could easily be played by a young Tom Hanks. They were aspects of the film that were fulfilling and rewarding. I kept hoping that they would continue to drag that film up by its bootstraps, but each time it turned back into Barney's Playhouse. The treatment of "King Valkyrie "was ludicrous... I was under the impression that the Valkyrie identified as, It?, Shim? Or whatever name those people call themselves. Shouldn't there be an appropriate title for those folks of a different gender? Sex, Or whatever?King, would be an XY chromosome, queen would be an XX chromosome... Perhaps "enlightened ruler", "ambiguous human ruler", You know, something for the HIJKLMNOP++ chromosome. And why is she...im called "Valkyrie" throughout the movie. I mean what's Valkyrie's name? Even in the comics Valkyrie's name was Brunhild. Valkyrie was her title, her job description.Thor goes from being a total badass, to having more trouble with some old dude with a sword that he had with Thanos. And there may have been a rumor of some boy band/hipster Hercules??If you go to see the movie for the goats, You might like it...the goats were probably the best thing throughout the picture. Oh yeah, and there may or may not be a fight scene toward the end between "a bunch of the Worthey" and a bunch of ugly punks. That may be really worth watching.The character Russell Crowe plays?? All I can do is shake my head.Honestly folks if you took every interesting snippet and linked them together you might have a really cohesive 25 minutes worth of footage.You'd have a single episode of a sitcom. I'm really glad I waited for it to come to Disney+.

title: Taika Waititi At His Best...
text: Taika Waititi at his best is not to our benefit. Before watching any trailers, or anything about the film, soon as I learned he was the director, I knew this would be a film I would detest. God help the Star Wars film he's down to direct in 2025, if that even goes ahead.Waititi has an over reliance on childish humor and dialogue that doesn't translate well onto the screen. Regardless if the film is a Marvel or Star Wars, he never treats the lore or the in-universe settings with due respect; instead he turns whatever project he's working on into his own personal art project. That's what Love and Thunder is. It's Waititi's love letter.And this is one love letter you want to avoid.

title: 10/10 Christian Bale 1/10 Taika Waitti
text: Nothing more to add. Honestly i am just watching for the Christian Bale scenes everything else is just astonishingly bad directing and the script... my god i have no words. A 10 year old crack addict could have made a better movie.I know that the base storyline of this is actually pretty good but what they did with it is borderline psychotic. Just tune it down a little with the humor and it would have been at least watchable but this movies doesnt work when there is a joke every 5 seconds.Thor is an utter idiot who seems to be so far off and disconnected from reality that i believe it is a ironic display from Chris Hemsworth about Waitti himself.

title: love the cast, hated the sillyness
text: Its always nice to see the guardians cast and the thor cast. But this movie abandoned any good story telling and infused it with tonnes of sillyness. I mean i expect a few from taika waititi, but there was an overload of it. There were barely any scenes where he didn't try to make it silly. Good for a young disney audience, but for a seasoned mcu fan, this film isn't up to par.

title: Watch Rise of Gru instead
text: Remember Thor Ragnarok? How absolutely amazing it was? Well this isn't that sadly. Very cringe, with a somewhat Daddy Day Care theme. I'm glad I've seen it, but definitely was not Marvel at its finest. The Dark World might actually be better than this one.

title: Thor: Thighs of Thunder
text: The title says it all. Don't expect much from this movie which focuses on propaganda rather than story (the former being used as the primary driver at each point of the story). This doesn't come off as much of a surprise with Disney ramming their "not-so-secret agenda".

title: Thor no More or Hate & Blunder
text: Poor written script, slapstick humor, childish action scenes, and every line is made to be a one-liner joke.Christian Bale's performance was the only good part of the movie. That said, I did enjoy the screaming goats but only because I received a screaming goat gag gift for my birthday.They must have paid Russel Crowe a lot of money to act in such a poorly written character-role.Lesson learned - best to wait a week to see what the initial reviews are before going to see a movie.

title: It really doesn't work.
text: The reviews of this have been mixed and its obvious why. This movie doesn't really sit well within the MCU and it doesn't work well as a movie.The first problem with this is is that the tone of the movie is simply off. While a few MCU movies have humour as part of the overall story this is almost 90% humour, but its not really that funny.The music doesn't hit well either, there is an overuse of Guns n Roses which don't really fit well with the scenes they are used. Unlike Led Zeppelin tracks in the other Thor Movies.Even the look of the movie is off, while most of the CGI is ok what is striking is just how bad the other Guardians of the Galaxy look. I would go so far as to say they look unkempt and out of shape.There is a narrator throughout in a New Zealand accent, which was a novelty in the past but now feels tired and its quite an annoying voice.However the biggest disappointment is the emotional payoff at the end. The whole movie is set up for this and I really didn't care. This is the fatal flaw of the movie, particularly since Endgame etc handled this aspect so well. The ending is simply meh and you don't really care.The strangest part about this movie is that it looks like its had a huge budget but some of it looks really bad and it has to be one of the least satisfying movies out there. Antman did a much better job of being an engaging and satisfying movie without half of the effects and flashes this throws at the screen. I am beginning to think this director is getting worse and he is basically over hyped at this point.Even the post credit scene is a severe case of the who actually cares...

title: Turned the goofy factor up 1000%
text: Taika, why!? What have you done.You're generally a reliable source of quality content, I don't know what happened here but the ball was well and truly dropped. You'll never read this but I felt it had to be addressed.I was really looking forward to this film but decided to wait for the Disney+ release... so glad I did, I'd be feeling absolutely robbed if I'd paid for 2 cinema tickets for this drivel.I'll keep this spoiler free with generalised references you'd only know if you'd seen it. But fair warning just in case you're over sensitive.There are just so many goofy and silly moments the whole film feels like a parody. The goats, the floating jealous axe, the daughter wielding Stormbreaker (of Polystyrene), the needlessly long splits, the goats, the super kids, the goats (yet again)The film just sets itself up so goofy and silly that even when a moment that should be fairly emotional happens, it just doesn't hit at all and you can't take it seriously.This has gone down as the worst MCU movie to date in my book.

title: Thor: Love and Blunder
text: The MCU continues its fall from grace with the latest addition Thor Love and Thunder.As a long term Marvel and MCU fan I went into this project cautiously optimistic. There's no denying the MCU has been struggling to keep raising the stakes since the epic finale of the Infinity Saga with End Game. With Disney plus throwing hours upon hours of content at viewers with half baked concepts and lacklustre origin stories. I put my faith into Thors latest adventure being a return to form for the MCU and a continuation of the fun-filled adventures of Thor and his new compadres from Ragnarok.Its with great disappointment I have to confess this truly missed the mark for me. It might have been the childish jokes that seemed to be written by children, for children. It might have been the shoddy VFX. It might have been the goats. It might have been the fact this film just seemed to not have a second act all together. Just an introduction, nothingness and then something which attempts to tie together that introduction.This movie did have many of the things that made Ragnarok great, but whilst Ragnarok lent into more comical themes to juxtapose a really quite dark story, this film tried to make everything into one liner quips that serve no real purpose, other than to mildly entertain children.I do have to say I really did enjoy Christian Bales adaptation of the God Butcher and he was one of the very few things that worked for me in this story. Chris Hemsworth as well works as a lead character, his portrayal of Thor (although somewhat overly played for laughs) is enough to carry the movie with mild entertainment. On the contrary, characters I was excited to see such as Valkyrie and Korg were pushed to the background and really served no purpose to the narrative. You could have removed them completely and the film would have stayed the same. Natalie Portmans portrayal of Jane Foster did nothing for me either, she didn't seem like she really wanted to be there whatsoever.On the whole, Thor Love and Thunder definitely felt more like a Blunder than the thunderous heights I thought it would spring the MCU back towards. This film has done nothing to alleviate my fears that the Marvel Universe is continuing to fall from grace and this could be the beginning of the end for the Hollywood powerhouse. With stakes seemingly becoming smaller and smaller and the projects leaning more and more towards short lasting comical impact as opposed to narrative driven impactful stories, I worry that Marvels time in the spotlight is approaching the end.

title: Too disappointing!
text: One of the worst marvel movie ever . Dont pay for this movie. Why ?1 . Too childish. The fight scenes, the plot , the dialogue and almost everything else is like a high budget children flick. Not for a 30 year old like me.2. Bland story line. Same old typical villain. He is not interesting, and is typical run of the mill unfortunate guy, who finds an opportunity to take revenge on people who didnt do him any harm and decides to take it.3. Thor lacks the glamor of being one of the strongest Avenger. I mean its been sooooooo many years now, so he should be stronger ,smarter and more dashing . Eventhough he is 1000+ years old, he is dumb as a teenage boy with raging hormones.

title: Mediocre Comedy
text: The only focus in this movie are the jokes. Character development of past films was ruined. I did laugh a bit but the story, the characters just weren't there. Cash grab.

title: Marvel died with Stan lee
text: The only reason I didn't score lower is because the cgi was descent, that's it. One of the worst things a lot of studios are doing is trying to make their own versions of stories that exist already, and that's detrimental to the film. Henry Cavill nailed the character of Geralt, because the story stuck to the source material as per his request, and that's exactly why he isn't returning for a fourth season on the Witcher. Stan lee doesn't deserve to have his legacy tainted by self absorbed, self righteous, self proclaimed victims, ruining his amazing stories, stories that touched the lives of many, myself included.

title: Below Average movie
text: This movie has worst plot after shang chi. And has many cringe and boring scenes , only visuals are good. Don't go for 10* reviews looks like they are hard core fans of marvel.

title: Butchered the Thor movie series
text:
If you are of the rare kind who enjoys having kids scream in your face for 2 hours in a row, then this movie is for you!<3
That is what watching this movie felt like.This basically boils down to the most annoying, unimaginative and poorly written movie of the decade.A 4 year old may enjoy this flick, though so bear that in mind.On the upside, they manage to land around 2-3 good jokes in this movie (out of about 1500 attempted "jokes" spammed nonstop for its duration).I really did not like anything about this movie except the two main actors, based on their previous performances. The clowns from Guardians of the Galaxy could well have stayed out of this movie (and perhaps this movie is so terrible because it took influences from that movie)Just an absolute failure. 2 stars out of 10.

title: Thor : A Disappointement
text: Thor is losing his name , fame , power and all his true companions , movie has two sides , both sides are unacceptable, no big fight scenes , music is also not up to the mark , characters are not that strong , writting is damn weak , plots are misused .Weakest phase of Marvel .Disappointed with Eternal , thor , Ms Marvel .

title: Disappointing
text: It's amazing how badly Disney keeps treating the Marvel Universe. A wonderful cast was assembled and it was written and directed by the person responsible for Thor: Ragnarok and Jo Jo Rabbit which were both brilliant. The expectations I had were that this would be another of his excellent works. Apparently those clueless at Disney told him to create a movie in their likeness with absolute no appeal except to 5 year olds. Disney is slowly destroying Marvel but has accelerated their efforts with this mess. Disney needs to stay out of Marvel and remain doing what they have excelled at - films intended for preteens.

title: Last avenger from the Trinity
text: I can't believe how this movie went. Being the last one from the original trinity, this movie was supposed to take MCU in a new direction after introduction of new characters in last few films. However, what I saw was the weakest Thor movie to date with all God's turned into comedians. If not for Bale, would be a 1 star review.

title: It needed more Gorr the God Butcher
text: Why was Christian Bale so under utilized. He was the main hype about this movie. But felt like we only got to see him a bit in action. What made Thor Ragnarok so good was the dynamic between Hela and Thor. This falls completely flat in my opinion as the underlying connection between Thor being a god and Gorr being the God Butcher never really clicks, like you hope it would.

title: Made for Babies
text: Christian Bale is amazing. The ending is great. The rest is all fart jokes. I would highly recommend waiting for the Disney+ release on this one boys and girls.

title: Stupid and nonsensical. Doesn't do the character justice
text: Thor 1 is my favourite Marvel movie and one of my favourite movies of ALL time.This movie didn't do Thor justice and is just another really stupid 'M-She-U' entry. It can be 'stupid and ridiculous' but also funny JUST because the actors seems to be enjoying themselves. Ragnarok (Gagnarok) is also 'stupid but funny.' These pair of movies don't do any of the characters justice. They just make Gods into clowns (akin to the 'Woki-Joki-Loki' show). The villain could have been MUCH cooler and Hela was WAY underused unfortunately. The villains for the next Thor are Zeus and Hercules who are PATHETIC!! ðŸ˜‚ Pathetic just like Kang Kong the Clown in 'Loki!' ðŸ˜† Gor isn't the 'God Butcher,' Disney is! Hopefully Thor 5 will give both Thor AND Loki some MUCH needed justice with less silliness. The writing in these movies and the 'Loki' show was just pathetic and inept. They HARDLY explained ANYTHING that was going on from the sudden shifts of character motivation and emotions to bringing in MASSIVE figures like Eternity and not explaining them AT ALL and make ULTRA STUPID scenes like all the 'kid Thor's' and making 'everyone worthy.' It used to be a title that was EARNED!!! Now anyone, even mortals can be 'worthy of the Power of Thor' and enter Valhalla such as Jane who is a uncharacteristically hot-headed 'girl boss' who just brazenly 'takes over' as the 'superior Thor' as Sylvie took over as the 'superior Loki.' But luckily at the VERY end of that stupid show they made the REAL(ish) Loki into a REAL God. Still. Both of these characters deserve better! Maybe in Thor 5 or Avengers The Kang Dynasty or Secret Wars hey?

title: The only worthwhile part is Bale
text: The story is rushed, we're once again bombarded by Watiti's trademark garbage jokes, and Jane's sudden characterization is totally unestablished in previous movies. If you are at a low enough braincell count to have enjoyed Ragnarok then maybe you'll like this. Otherwise, save your money.

title: Sorry but it was a waste of time.
text: It is no secret that MCU movies are getting worse and this is the worst one yet. It was a combination of Xena: The warrior princess from the 90s, but in a form of a low-budget telenovela (even though I doubt this one's budget was low), all packed in an anime-themed wrap.It had bad dialogues. It was trying to be funny all the time, but with terrible jokes. The bad graphics was another issue. One could see the plastic everywhere. From their costumes to their weapons, to the CG background and props. The plot was also ridiculous and uninteresting. I wouldn't give it more than one star, but I gave it two for the sake of the actors.

title: The movie that killed Marvel
text: This is it, folks. This is the movie that killed Marvel. Not sure exactly what happened here, but the movie is an unmitigated disaster and highly embarrassing for all involved. Taika has seemingly gone into this movie without a lot of planning or preparation. The script is awful, boring, weak, with tone all over the place. This new chapter in the Thor series also throws all the past character development and lore out the window. I was so bored. While the movie was running, I was thinking of leaving, on my phone, and also wondering if I should ever return to the cinema ever again. Honestly one of the worst movies I've seen in recent times, and that's saying something because I've had to suffer through some real garbage. I suspect the crew think they made something wonderful. But I do hope at some point the word of mouth even gets back to them so they know they made absolute trash.

title: Awsome Story, Overbearing Silliness
text: Good acting, with what they were given.Good cinematography.Terrible, overuse and timing, of silly moments.Am I ever glad, I waited for it to come out on Disney+.My sincerest appologies, to Chris Hemsworth, Natalie Portman, and Christian Bale, who did thier jobs well, and all the other actors I did not mention.Good actors,over 90% of the time, are doing as they are told, and are not to blame for bad movies, So please do not hold this garbage against them.I gave this movie a 4, due to acting, and cinematography, and only a 4 due to poor script, editing, and directing, someone should have saw this trainwreck, and stopped it.This movie could have been amazing, and made billions.

title: The Mighty Snore
text: The reason I give this a 5 is because of Christian Bale, who did a really good job, but this is, arguably, the worst Thor of the series. The characters were wooden, it seems as though Thor has gone backwards in his views and demeanor (was he regressing because of the loss he feltðŸ¤”), almost to the point where he was, when he was first introduced.There was no real development of the villain or Valkyrie, and Korg was in there way too much. And for as serious as the issue with Jane is, everyone seemed to 'accepting' and there was little emotional upheaval with the main characters. And I thought the Asguardians were supposed to be so advanced as to be able to deal with something of this sort. It might even have been better if it had been caused by the Red Liquid from Dark World. But every issue just seemed to 'be there' to have a something to do.The City of the Gods was a big disappointment because all we really get to see is Zeus. Where were the Watchers (they would undoubtedly be there, if only to observe)?And the dialogue, especially at the beginning was painful. It was like the writers got bored, but wanted to give the actors more lines, and often it wasn't funny and made little-to-no sense.Guardians didn't even need to be there. That whole scene could have been cut down to 1-2 minutes and would have made as much sense.It really just seemed unfocused and random, to the point that the story was uninteresting and even boring. I kept waiting for it to pick up some seriousness and be engrossing, but, alas, 'twas not to be.My suggestion: wait for video/Disney+

title: Thor...What have they done to you?
text: I don't want to hear anymore about The Dark World being the worst Thor movie. Love & Thunder clearly takes that position. This really makes me sad because I've always loved Thor as a character and all three of his previous films. This fourth one is a mess though. It tried so hard to be funny, but ended up just being silly. It honestly felt like a parody of itself at times. I couldn't take anything seriously because it didn't take itself seriously. The whole Zeus scene is just dumb. I miss the Thor we got in the first two films, and while Ragnarok was a big shift away from those, at least it was successfully funny.This film just went the wrong direction. Korg was not only unfunny this time around, he was completely unnecessary. I kept wondering why he was even there. He added nothing to the film. Valkyrie is fine, though also not super important. Thor, Jane, and Gorr seem to be the only characters that matter in this story. These three are easily the best parts of the film. While I wasn't a fan of Gorr as a villain for this film, Christian Bale gives one heck of performance. This is also the first Thor movie where I liked Jane Foster. I never felt like the romance between her and Thor had any chemistry, but at least her storyline is interesting this time.And it's almost impossible not to love Chris Hemsworth as Thor, even when he's starring in a bad movie. But I am ready, and it sounds like Chris Hemsworth is ready, for a serious, darker Thor experience. A Thor who is more viking warrior than goofball. Story wise, Thor 4 should have ditched this weak storyline and instead kept the Guardians of the Galaxy as part of the story throughout the movie. The tone of the film would have worked much better with this team than with the team we ended up with. Also, Thor needs Loki. The two of them together create magic. Sadly, Love and Thunder is a rare MCU film that has almost no rewatch factor. Hopefully a lot of important lessons were learned here and we'll get another Thor film that's done right.

title: The same old same old
text: Honestly super disappointed. How many times do we have to watch Thor find himself? The best part of this movie was Christian Bale, he was phenomenal! He really leaned into the character and it seems everyone else became a caricature of themselves. The jokes felt flat and constant, I was cringing more than laughing. The movie felt disjointed and a mess.

title: Filler Movie?
text: Thor: Love and Thunder felt more like a "filler" movie. One of those movies made to keep you from forgetting the franchise before a well made one is released. Seemed like they tried too hard to make it funny. There were some Lol moments, but way too much cheese! There were some laggy parts also. Story was a great idea, execution left something to be desired.

title: Not good
text: This movie seems like a stand up comedy but it ends up being real life facts. I dont get the point. They should pick a genre they want to be in. Each shot of the movie is different fromn another. Please its a good production because its named Thro otherwise its is terrible. Story line as up and down.

title: Two Stories At War With Each Other
text: Thor: Love and Thunder is a bewildering film in which the final product is worth less than the sum of its parts. The two primary storylines don't mesh well, lots of big-moments happen off screen, and the jokes come at a cost to the characters rather than enhancing them. Truly, this is a puzzling follow-up to Thor: Ragnarok (one of my favorite movies in general) and Avengers: Endgame. I daresay it is a bad film.

title: Studio Contempt
text: I was really let down with this film and surprised at how poorly it was handled. Even promotional material of the director picking it apart was utterly bizarre and just told me the suits at Disney must have seen a half-baked product and fire it out, knowing it would make millions regardless. This film along with The Eternals seems to tout a new phase of Marvel media where they know it's going to make a killing at the box office so why bother polishing it and putting care and consideration into their work?

title: An Unrefined, but Occasionally Creative Film
text: Thor: Love and Thunder didn't seem interested in distinguishing itself as its own movie; instead, it acted as a continuation of the wildly well-received Thor: Ragnarok. I imagine Waititi felt that movie performed so well, critically and financially, that it was an open invitation for him to make the fourth entry in the Thor series even more zany. It's true that he has his own aesthetic, but it's an aesthetic that feels calculated rather than one that has naturally manifested itself as his career has progressed. Love and Thunder was overloaded with hit-or-miss jokes, while the dialogue felt obnoxiously simplistic, as though it had been dumbed down to a level appropriate for a children's book. Still, there were certain scenes that worked to perfection, like the cinematically blissful battle in the shadow realm. And although he didn't have as much screen time as I would have liked, Russell Crowe emanated pure likeability as Waititi's rendition of Zues. There is no doubt it would get my attention should they decide to pursue a Zues spinoff movie. As for another Thor movie, I'm indifferent.

title: Strange
text: The plot is presented in a very peculiar way and for me, it's the real problem of this movie. Although the actuation of Bale is impeccable, what Waititi tried to do it's similar of what Jojo Rabbit was and for this kind of marvel action's movie, it didn't got well. There's a lot of comedy and tragedy scenes mixed in the development of the story that confuses the way that you should be interpreting the movie and makes it feel so rushed. Also, the CGI felt kind of weird, but at least is enjoyable with the Guns N Roses in the back when the action it's on screen.You're not going to waste your time if you're a fan, but it's not the best on theaters to be honest.

title: It could be better.
text: The verdict is final. Taika Waititi let us down by not replicating his previous successes with Thor. It's the story of the missing creative spark that my Polynesian brother lacks. General rule: Don't lose your charm when you're in a hurry to meet the deadline. It's true! A lot of great storylines go unnoticed, which is a shame because they're some of the most interesting parts of the MCU. Thor is a likable character, but the sequels didn't do him justice. He has a good arc of growing arrogance to humility and humor. I think Loki is better in Thor because his motivations are stronger, his relationship with Odin is better developed, and we get to see his point of view, unlike Hela in Ragnarok. Simply put, he has more to do, and in my opinion, it's the best sentence.The plot is powerful and character driven. I think the problem with the franchise is that they lacked a clear vision for the franchise, so they decided to make it a safe and profitable business decision by making it a movie series focused on commercial success rather than artistic expression. Natalie Portman, was perfectly fine and the romance is cliched like an old 60's comic book but I think the problem with the franchise is that they had no direction on taking over the franchise, so they said lets play it safe profitable business decision. The use of visual effects and CGI is a little too excessive to mask the lack of comedy and drive the action scene with some humor. Despite its efforts, the work fell short because it didn't give the story any depth.Poumare Sio,

title: The god of thunder becomed a nany
text: This is the worst Marvel movie. The story is empty. I won't go on the cinema on the next marvel movie I don't think that Marvel is on the right track.

title: It's bad, I mean REALLY bad!
text: Decided to take my daughter to watch it as we both enjoy Marvel movies. Was watching the trailers and didn't even realise the movie had actually started. Disney wokeness shines blinding bright throughout this movie but it's not just that that ruins this movie, acting terrible, story terrible EVERYTHING about this movie is terrible. Yet again we are subjected to a movie that offers nothing and definitely falls into the 'would have been better off never being made' category. Save your money and time and give this trash a miss. Disney are ruining a once magical franchise.

title: Should be Renamed as Thor: The Fault In our Stars
text: As the first MCU film to feature a successful marriage of real comedy, visually striking action, energetic soundtrack and seriousness through its wicked antagonist, Ragnarok deserves the praise & reverence it has received over the years. The attempt to re-hash the same elements in Love & Thunder however, backfired as the film has been deemed a disastrous blunder.Taika Waititi's brand of comedy blew out of proportion in Thor 4, with jokes coming up dry and REALLY overused. Multiple scenes were delegated to Thor's love triangle with Mjollnir and Stormbreaker, which failed to sell in the hundred times it was pushed down the audience's throats. Thor also, has been unfortunately relegated as the film's annoying clown, throwing more cringy punchlines than actual punches. His love story with Jane Foster was non appealing as well, due to the absence of chemistry and on screen fatigue. Between the uninspired comedy and cloying romance, airtime was wasted, airtime that could've been spent to further the limited positives the film had, such as more of Christian Bale's Gorr or Tessa Thompson's King Valkyrie. Shameful!Apart from the glaring mistake to turn Thor into the next The Fault In Our Stars, there remains a long list of mishaps. There is Russell Crowe's sheepish portrayal of Zeus, those UGLY costumes and a clichÃ©d storyline to bring the film in deeper depths. The soundtrack, which put to good use some Guns N Roses songs, were good but feels EXACTLY like Ragnarok, diminishing the actual experience.Overall, Love and Thunder feels like its own parody. The film ultimately massacred Thor, its franchise's characters and the goodwill garnered by Ragnarok, by letting silliness take over to the point of annoyance. It wastes a terrific performance by Christian Bale and its relevance in the MCU is a serious question mark. This is easily Taika's worst film to date, and could be a mark that the MCU, is nearing its expiration date. 5/10.

title: Tried really hard to not take itself seriously
text: It is a Marvel film so it still has awesome effects and action scenes. They tried really hard to make Thor feel like someone entirely different. From noble, clever, funny and out of place to an overly-sensitive idiotic meathead. It took the direction from Ragnarok and Endgame and drastically turned up the volume. In an effort to not take themselves seriously they turned the entire movie and character into a string of jokes and punchlines.

title: Entertaining, but extremely silly and not much new to offer
text: I feel like they just made this to get another Thor title out and sell tickets. It really doesn't have much new to offer. The plot is rather childish and doesn't seem sophisticated at all. Not at all comparable to previous Thor movies. The third Thor movie was an amazing action comedy, and the first two had lots of surprises and interesting, original plotline.I feel like they just made this to get another Thor title out and sell tickets. It really doesn't have much new to offer. The plot is rather childish and doesn't seem sophisticated at all. Not at all comparable to previous Thor movies. The third Thor movie was an amazing action comedy, and the first two had lots of surprises and interesting, original plotline.

title: Not... the worst.
text: Honestly, I expected this to be terrible just looking at the reviews, but I was mildly surprised. It's no masterpiece, obviously. But for what it's worth, it wasn't too bad.There were moments of character and story development that I liked, but most were outshined by the excessive comedy. It completely detracted from the moments that were supposed to be important and meaningful.The progression of the story was also pretty linear. Not much was going on. I will, however, give a thumbs up for trying to create emotional connections, although most did fall flat. There just wasn't enough good build-up in certain cases/characters.And wow, I saw this most towards the end - the dialogue felt so forced sometimes. Some of those one-liners... absolutely jarring. It really did pull me out of the story.Overall, enjoyable. Not the worst thing I've seen.

title: Mcu lost it magic
text: Taika Waititi is a really good director and actor imo. Jojo Rabbit is very great. This one was a joke overall. Couldnt take it seriously. The best character of the movie was Gorr and he had little screen time. They made one of my favourite actor into their goofy movie a villain. Bad idea. The plot was actually interesting but terribly boring. Ending scene with the children getting Thors powers were hard to take seriously. Thor4 is the worst of the franchise and nowhere after Ragnarok. Still actually enjoyed sometimes and the beginning scene were cool. Gorr was pretty great. And the Sweet Child O Mine is a really great choice.

title: Could have been great
text: This has the sparks of one of the best Thor movies, but for some reason they not only kept it in the comedy realm, they went too far in that direction. God killer, Jane Foster as Lady Thor, monsters, gods, relationship tension, etc...the makings of a great action movie but they ruined it. If this wasn't Thor, and a movie with different characters billed as a comedy, I'd rate it much higher. I don't watch Thor for a bunch of bad jokes, thrown away roles that could have been amazing and a small spit of action. Probably one of the worst Marvel movies and if you watch a Marvel marathon, skip this one.

title: Disney must stop to cut these movies!!
text: It was an enjoyable movie. And yeah there was too much potential to use about this movie. But feeling like there is too much deleted scene from last run. And they ruined it just like Multiverse of madness... So, Disney must stop to ruin and cut these movies!!

title: Two hours wasted
text: Just garbage. I lost two hours of my life with this movie.This could have been a decent storyline, but the effort to bring campy humor overrode the story.All the original stories were great, but the writers are more concerned with trying to cushion the story with humor, and it just doesn't work. The best part of this movie was the soundtrack.Can we get some scriptwriters who can pull off the true storylines without all the bad attempts at humor?The first movie in this franchise was the only one worth anything. Any future movies in this franchise I will not even bother watching, even if for free.

title: 1st half sucks, 2nd half is great
text: This movie is dissapointing cause this movie is coming from taika watiti who is a competent director.Problem with this movie is the 1st half is just joke after joke like its an snl skit. Thor is being played for laughs most of the time, tessa is not given much to do, korg has those retelling scenes that remind me of awful michael pena scenes in ant man movies. Like Gorr kidnaps kids and we see thor making jokes infront of parents.2nd half is like a different movie with actual stakes in the story and i started to care what was going on with less unfunny jokes and a pretty great ending.One thing what is consistently good in the movie is christian bale who for a payday gig is giving it all with a really good perfonmance and it would have been cool if he had more screentime cause he is pretty lacking in the movie which is shame cause whenever he is on screen he just sucks you in the movie again.Also the VFX really sucks in this movie.Anyway mediocore movie, better waste the money on a burger or something or go support any other movie that is not a dumb blockbuster.

title: The script is thin, too familiar, and excessively campy, which causes the film to suffer before getting to anything of substance.
text: Thor: Love And Thunder was easily the biggest disappointment of the summer for me. I do like the trailers that got made for the film. The people that make trailers for films by Marvel Studios do a good job. The film itself, however, turned out to be easily the worst Marvel film so far. I didn't expect Marvel to release a film this bad, but it happened. This is the first Marvel film that I don't want to see again. I'd rather be apprehended by Elon Musk's private right-wing militia than to see Thor: Love And Thunder again. Well, fine, the film is not that bad. But I definitely don't look forward to seeing it again. What makes it bad is the fact that almost everything in it is played for laughs. Nothing can be taken seriously. There are too many jokes and too much silly stuff. I'd say that about a third, or at most half, of the comedy in the film is effective, but the rest is mostly cringeworthy. Christian Bale, as usual, attempted to deliver a good performance, but his performance got wasted on a film where it doesn't belong. Since this is a Marvel film, the costumes and the special effects that got made for it are good as usual. But, again, they're wasted on a misguided film. I don't know if it was Taika Waititi's intention to make the film this bad. It probably wasn't. He was probably given too much freedom to do whatever he wanted and this has resulted in something farcical. I like every Thor film by Marvel that came before this one. Thor: Love And Thunder has a 64% fresh rating on Rotten Tomatoes. It doesn't deserve this rating. The rating should be rotten, quite rotten. I've never trusted Rotten Tomatoes because of one simple reason. Most professional film critics in the West are not reliable. They are bought and paid for, they are politically motivated, or they simply don't know what they're talking about. Hollywood films have been getting worse for several decades already, but the professional film critics either don't realize this or they don't want to talk about this issue. Therefore, they award high scores to films that don't deserve praise, they clobber films that don't deserve to be clobbered, and they go about their jobs as if nothing has changed. This is why I almost never check what they have to say on Rotten Tomatoes. If Thor: Love And Thunder hadn't had some propaganda in it, I think that its rating on Rotten Tomatoes would have been much lower. Unfortunately, many people simply repeat what they read on a website like Rotten Tomatoes. If a film is certified rotten on this website, they think that it's a bad film. This is not how I think. But, anyway, since Thor: Love And Thunder is a film by Marvel Studios, I still went to see it in a theater. Not everything about it is bad. Some of the comedy works, especially at the beginning. The direction is misguided but fine. The performances by the actors are fine. But, overall, the film is a disaster because nothing in it can be taken seriously. In addition, the action is disappointing and almost non-existent. Of course, there is one thing that could have saved Thor: Love And Thunder in its present state, or at least partially redeemed it. This would have been an inclusion of Zeus's planned orgy in the end credits scene. Or we could have at least been shown how Rich Evans defeats Thanos singlehandedly in an alternate universe. But instead what we got was Zeus talking to his son Hercules about killing Thor. How disappointing.

title: Terrible
text: What a letdown honestly. To think that I had been waiting for this for years, like any Marvel fan, and walking out feeling like I wasted two hours on a half arsed kiddie movie that wasn't even funny. Ugh.I am a big fan of Taika's work (and Marvel films), but this really missed the mark for me. There were so many scenes that were cringe, the humour was so forced, the characters were dull and one dimensional that made it so senseless, stupid and unwatchable. How can Jane Foster get even more unbearable after being the love interest and "new hero".They didn't bother really working on the characters' story arc and just threw them around with fancy vfx and terrible jokes. All noise, but no substance. I love action packed flicks but this feels like watching a parody of a Thor movie. I wish I was exaggerating. Disney has taken all the general elements of a well funded but poorly written blockbuster movie riddled with clichÃ©s and churned out just another money machine. Not a real Marvel film. I kinda regret not watching the new Minions movie instead. If you're thinking of going to the cinema for this, I'd sit this one out.

title: It's a comedy that isn't that funny.
text: I like--no, I love Taika Waititi's work. But...this was bad. Okay, not bad, but not great. Not even necessarily good. The comedy is MASSIVE downgrade from Ragnorak, which was great, and it had some good moments, but overall...eh.

title: Too Hammy
text: The movie was way too hammy in its humor versus the wittiness that was Ragnarok. In Ragnarok, the humor always supported the storyline to move forward. This movie just had collected bits instead of a cohesive story - like a long SNL episode. Also the scene with the Guardians was such a waste. Thor just reverted back to his arrogant pre-Infinity War self?? It makes no sense. What was the point of all of that?? And Christian Bale's talent was absolutely wasted with zero God Butcher violence and eeriness happening. The entire movie was so very disappointing. Ultimately, it's like Taika unsuccessfully tried to make Thor a Monty Python frat boy movie with cheesy humor.

title: Not good at all
text: I expect much more from Thore movie; the story no good ; it was kind of for kids rather than adults; the story was full of crap ; very disappointing; I wish I didn't spend my money on that ; catastrophic.

title: Just a Sound of Lightning
text: " Thor Love and Thunder " has a slightly rocky path through the Marvel Cinematic Universe. The first movie reimagined Thor as a fish-out-of-water buffoon. Later, he reinvented himself as a romantic figure, and he became a full-fledged comedic figure in "Thor: Ragnarok." But after putting Thor through the wringer in the "Avengers: Infinity War" and the subsequent "Avengers: Endgame" film, he finally found his footing. That said, Thor has been in the Marvel Cinematic Universe for more than half a decade, and each of his iterations has been unmoored.Unlike the first two Thor movies, Love and Thunder was hyped to be more of a romantic comedy than an action film. But this movie as a whole is neither a romantic one nor can be considered as a comedy film. It honors Thor's long journey toward self-actualization while playing with the romantic comedy tropes. Love and Thunder does suffer from an uneven pace and a few clunkers.After the triumphant Ragnarok, Thor: Love and Thunder was expected to be an even better movie from director Taika Waititi, but unfortunately, the film fails to live up to its high hopes, missing the mark on balance and settling for a shallow tone that lacks any dramatic power.Yes Thor love and thunder is a disappointing disappointment for Marvel fans. What went wrong this time is that this so called comedic mashup fails high time to make you laugh. In fact some comedy scenes along with a tickle wont make you laugh.If we look into the flaws, the film is overstuffed with violence and weak comedy. Most of the jokes revolve around how dumb and oblivious Thor is. There are also too many telegraphed lines and jokes about Thor's obsession with his hammer. Not only this makes the movie a lackluster but there is no goosebump scene in this superhero genre movieThe film lays claim to being the best superhero movie in over a decade, but it fails to live up to expectations in several ways. The prologue has a strong emotional hook, and Christian Bale gives a believable scare. Then, the film wastes a wildly promising prologue and a tepid ending.The Marvel universe as we all know is very much inconsistent with the power its superheroes posses, In some movies they may have great power but in some other films it seems that the same superheroes suffers from Amnesia. They don't know about their powers or they don't use their powers when needed. Thor is a biggest example for this, Thor love and thunder movie has an interesting concept but is ultimately disappointing. Thor is the God of Thunder. But ultimately he is capable of doing nothing. We can only say that Thor Love and Thunder plot doesn't live up to the comic book's expectations.The entire movie looks so artificial by forced adding of ingredients, above all this the entire plot looks so loose. Character depth was rather stale, Gorr the main villain came off as both menacing but weak, and his whole characters story was rather shallow, Thor's character change by the end of the movie was awful. Overall Chris Hemsworth as Thor with his extreme goofiness is getting a little stale. The CG is consistently inconsistent from start to finish.Last but not the least the ending part of this movie is terrible.

title: Unexpected delivery
text: Story line isn't excited and too much low level humour. Story line isn't excited and too much low level humour. Story line isn't excited and too much low level humour. Story line isn't excited and too much low level humour.

title: Not Marvel's greatest movie
text:
I was a little disappointed when watching the newest Thor movie. I felt that except for the end, the movie didn't really add something to the storyline of Marvel. It was nice that you got the feeling that the movie was mostly made with and for fun, but sometimes it felt like they didn't take it seriously enough. There were a few moments where I laughed, but in general, it wasn't my type of humor.There were a few scenes, mostly towards the end, where it was unclear for me if the movie was made for teenagers/adults or little kids. A great part of the movie was certainly not made for little kids, but it seemed like they wanted to make it more attractive to kids with some scenes.The acting and special effects were excellent, as can be expected of Marvel ;)
Especially the acting of the antagonist (played by Christian Bale) was a 10/10.

title: Watchable, not enjoyable!

The original MCU fans from comic book days to the first MCU shows will be lost because of this childish Disney meets MCU series and movies, a waste!

title: Ridiculous roller coaster
text: I gave it a 2nd chance and wasted some 2 odd hours on this fiasco of a film.... Again, my mistake. Forced humor, sexuality, and accents (why Zeus had an Italian accent is beyond anyone's reasoning). By the way I wouldn't necessarily call that a spoiler. I believe it was written by 4th grade mentality. This film reminds me of Batman and Robin, it's just missing fake nipples embedded in the suit. One more disparaging note, Guns n Roses suck! Maybe they should have played November rain for all the action scenes it would've made as much sense. In conclusion watch Plan 9 from Outer space it's a much shorter waste of time.

title: The least impressive in the Thor series
text: The worst Thor movie factually and objectively. Even my LGBT friends weren't wowed by the movie. People are saying that it contains forced humour and they're right. At times, the humour was nonsense. I love me some humour and really loved Ragnarok but definitely Taika wanted to trigger some people instead of inclusivity. He wasn't making this movie for artistic and story purposes but to fulfill his agenda. Taika made Nebula scream and turned her character into someone who's just one scream away from getting slapped. The movie is only making money because it already has a huge fan base (people like us). Also Valkyrie calling herself king sounded stupid. Korg was extremely boring. Thor was annoying. Bale was so so good but overshadowed by forced humour and making Thor look well like Thor who could take anyone down but he couldn't even kill him himself alone. Natalie was actually really good too. I was impressed. Her actions were spectacular to watch. It was refreshing to see her wield mijolnir and she acted good. I enjoyed her Thor scenes more than Chri's Thor scenes. The children couldn't act besides the kid who plays Heimdal's son. It was a bit cring worthy to see them act. Valkyrie doesn't go to the final showdown with Gorr because she gets stabbed and says to Thor "well I think I lost my kidney so you'd have to go alone". Imagine saying this when a god butcher is hell bent on killing every god. This made absolutely no sense at all. A Wasted opportunity.

title: Utter disappointment
text: This film fails in all aspects to retain the status that Marvel had constructed for it's universe. This time the funny side of Thor went way too far. Unnecessarily though. And to think this is the super hero who eventually killed Thanos. It's almost disrespectful for the character had envisioned at first. And I get why they wanted to make a more light hearted film on this hero it just falls short compared to Ragnarok. Jokes are so petty and the whole plot inexcusably stupid.

title: A continuation of subpar marvel films
text: Thor: Love and Thunder further continues the frustrating Marvel trend of their films and shows becoming increasingly devoid of logic, believable characters, or coherently flowing plots. I thought Doctor Strange: Multiverse of Madness was terribly flawed yet Marvel managed to make an even worse film with Love and Thunder. Long gone are Marvel films like Ironman, The Winter Soldier, or The Avengers movies. Every single Marvel movie does not need a joke every 5 minutes or a bunch of goofy humor sprinkled throughout. Love and Thunder had some great visual effects and Christian Bale played a fantastic villain. Beyond that this is a film devoid of heart and is a overly campy and cheesy to the max. It took me three watching sessions and some fast forwarding to finish this pile of cinematic doo-doo.

title: Disappointed
text: I must say. I was really looking forward to this installment. Was a massive fan of Ragnarok, which combined comedy, fantasy and superhero storytelling perfectly.This film on the other hand- an absolute travesty. It seemed very much like an excuse to get as many A-listers as possible reading a poorly scripted film with some sad attempts at humour. There were few redeeming qualities in this film besides some fancy special effects. It was also quite overacted despite its stellar cast- though that is likely the product of bad direction y Waititi, who I suspect has for some reason taken the franchise in a different direction this time.

title: ALL GODS WILL DIE...!
text: Thor parodying Thor.Wait, are you pulling my leg? It's as if a five-year-old child was directing, who just pours all the ideas in there and doesn't realize that if he gives three seconds after the fateful scene the joke, he'll kill the whole thing. At the same time, we have a potentially really interesting villain, and even Thor's relationship with Jane Foster has interesting depth.

title: It had the potential to be great, but instead
text: Thor: Love and Thunder had the potential to be a great film. Both Thor and Jane Foster were struggling with difficult problems. The villain had a great motivation too. All the pieces were there. The film could've delivered a very powerful message. Instead, it decided to go for nonsensical humor.This movie is a bad comedy. A great comedy balances the serious and the comedic tones. Something is funny when compared with something else not funny. However, in this movie everything is comic relief. There's no straight man. All characters are joking.Thanks god I didn't waste money on a ticket, but watched this movie at Disney+. Otherwise I would be very upset.

title: Typical badly made and directed MCU film
text: Another forgettable, laughably bad MCU film Marvel Studios and Disney keep churning out to reap a sad profit. The only salvageable element of this film would be Chris Hemsworth and Natalie Portman's chemistry as Thor and Jane. The action scenes, jokes, and plot are so poorly written and designed, it gets boring FAST. I definitely preferred the first two Thor films over Love and Thunder. The direction was much more cohesive and the runtime didn't drag on versus this film which is a tedious slog to finish watching even on a first viewing. Not recommended even for MCU fans, which I can happily say I'm not one.

title: Waste of time, maybe just watch during lunch. Bale is the only highlight!
text: Such a bad movie and waste of time.Too much comedy that isn't actually funny at all.The film isn't taking itself seriously at all, so many cringe moments.Made Thor an idiot to ramp up the other leads.Nothing in the film regarding Natalie was touching.You'd get the impression the movie was written by a 6 year old.Christian Bale was awesome as usual, but disappointed to see him not being better utilized.Marvel really need a wake up call and start paying more attention to storylines, they're currently just living out of the good faith of Infinity War and Endgame.

title: Entertaining but a miss
text: Don't get me wrong the movie wasn't bad but it's definitely a miss. The positives, the characters, action, and cinematography were good. Jane was great, Christian Bale as Gorr was phenomenal he was a menace and a great villain. Thor and Valkyrie were good as well. The emotional moments were good as well. The negatives is that the comedy was a hit and miss more misses, some things didn't make sense or just weren't done well. This movie felt more like a comedy and it just didn't work this time or have a good balance. I'm a little disappointed by the outcome of the movie but it was fun and can't wait to see what's next for Thor.

title: Disaster and disappointing
text: Bringing in Melissa Mcarthy even just for a moment destroys everything!! Then on to childish acting/script and dialogues, bad fighting scenes, lame humor, giant goats screaming like little girls. This is a total disappointment and ruined what Thor was in the past marvel movies!!!!And not to mention the whole woke crap on top of it all, Jane Foster as the new god of thunder or whatever, jeeez, stop yourselves before it's, wait, it is way to late for that.And someone claimed this was the best Thor movie so far! He ruined it and made it the worst of them, maybe even the worst marvel movie.Bringing in Christian Bale didn't do enough to save much of anything!I will try to forget that I actually watched the hole thing I hope of something good!!

title: As bad as it can get
text: And I thought Eternals was bad - this sequel goes "unbearable" well beyond anything in the MCU. When did Thor become a comedy?The dialog was written by a kid probably and everywhere I turned they had a Guns n Roses song just because.
