I like the band but it felt forced.Did Christian Bale read the whole script? - he must be regretting agreeing to this although the couple of minutes his character appeared is what kept me awake.Saw it on Disney+ still felt like a waste of my ISP bandwidth. Since Marvel quality has gone down I will probably wait for all their future movies to arrive on streaming and watch then when I get extremely bored.

title: horrible in every possible way
text:
This film was horrible in every way the plot promised a lot, but everything is left aside to give importance to boring and mediocre characters (tessa topsson's character) thor movies were never even at least 70% faithful to the comics so you can never expect anything, especially from current hollyweird the only redeeming and sadly wasted quality is christian bale's villain otherwise l, this is so mediocre, cheap and tacky
I will not watch the next movie, since Thor will become a woman, enough of this nonsenseawful plots, awful storylines, awful cinematography, awful script4 stars for Christian balledont waste your time.

title: Waste of a great Villain
text: Shortly Said: Every single scene with Gorr is absolutely amazing. Everything else is just painful to watch.It tries so desperately to be funny but it just isn't...The goats, the Thor+Stormbreaker Love Drama, every single scene with Thor and Jane in it... or only with Thor... or only with Jane... Also the about 20 Guns n Roses references are so annoying...It is a shame that Gorr, such an amazing Villain, gets such an embarrassing movie to appear in. And it is also a waste of a great performance by Christian Bale...The Thor movies went from great to unwatchable and hit rock bottom with this one...

title: dissapointed
text: I set the expectations too high on this one. Turns out it's a silly movie with a lot of unfunny jokes for 12 year olds kids .Christian Bale tried to carry this movie but was helplessly alone.

title: Wait for this to come out
text: The movie fails. All the actors were great, but the writhing was HORRIBLE. There were way too many jokes trying to mix with really serious topics. The goats did not need to be as annoying as they were.Also when did Thor literally become dumb as a rock? It's really not cute anymore.The guardians should have never been in this movie.The God destroyer Gorr is never shown killing any gods ever besides the first one he encounters.Idk this probably should have just been another Disney show. Way too rushed.

title: How the mighty have fallen
text: Thor, the God of Thunder, is reduced to a tiny comedic relief in his own movie. They are now raising statues to the "real" Thor. Why? Oh, why? I don't think Russel Crowe got paid as I think he'd refuse to admit to taking money for the ass impersonation he was forced to do. Christian Bale was acting in a completely different movie; one which was serious, full of murder and revenge and sadness. The editing department took scenes from that movie and spliced them into this slapstick.It adds nothing to the MCU timeline.I wanted to say more, but just can't words to describe how bad it was.

title: Entertaining but a missed opportunity
text:
The Merits:
Throughout the movie I laughed, it was entertaining. There were no cringe moments. The stellar performances of the whole cast and their chemistry on screen and of course Chris Hemsworth's charisma keeps us hooked to our seats.The demerits:
However, the script does not do justice to Hemsworth's character. Ragnarok made us aware of Thor as a great superhero even without his hammer and Infinity war made him an indispensable part (second only to Iron Man) of the avengers for his courage and rage to fight against the evil supervillians. Sadly LOVE AND THUNDER portrays him as a charismatic dude who gives inspirational talks like the ones on TED talks.He somehow overshadowed by the weapons - Mjolnir, Stormbreaker, Zeus' thunderbolt and his own electricity. It is a missed opportunity to take forward his arc from Endgame. Thor did not reinvent himself and has a long way to go.The movie seems to be made for kids below 12.I sincerely hope the makers comeback with a solid script that deserves Chris Hemsworth as Thor and rest of the characters next time.

title: Parody?
text: If this is a parody, then ok, unfunny but fair enough. Except this isn't a parody and instead is a waste of 2 hours and an insult to its viewers. You can put the best actors you can find together but it won't save it.The props and special effects look cheap, very little money was spent of this movie as well as the plot and "humour" being a complete disappointment and failing to accomplish what it should.Cannot say a single positive thing about this movie, would give it zero stars if that was possible, the MCU has really been going downhill recently and should probably focus on producing one decent film instead of 5 terrible ones.

title: The start of the end of the MCU
text: Wow. Forced myself to watch this after putting it off. I had heard it was over the top childish and campy and a sad attempt at humour vs a good movie. The reviews were right. The first 20 minutes wanted me to just shut it off to put myself out of my misery and I did. Both my wife and I just couldn't stomach the lack of story, the horrific "jokes" the bad cgi and terrible acting.What a complete an utter pile of garbage. The funny thing is this was just the first of disaster after disaster. This, then Ms Marvel, the Marvels, madame Web. It's a quick downhill slide for Disney and the MCU. How far it has fallen from exciting engaging movies to crap I don't even want to watch for free. Good job Disney. You've ruined the MCU and killed it once and for all.

title: Dear Director: You're fired!
text: Love these actors and actresses. Sad to see them misdirected and trying to act out such a flawed story. This was a huge zero in the world of Marvel movies and absolutely no fault of the people acting in it! SAD. Did I mention, Love these actors and actresses. Sad to see them misdirected and trying to act out such a flawed story!!!Love these actors and actresses. Sad to see them misdirected and trying to act out such a flawed story. This was a huge zero in the world of Marvel movies and absolutely no fault of the people acting in it! SAD. Did I mention, Love these actors and actresses. Sad to see them misdirected and trying to act out such a flawed story!!!

title: A lack of thunder.
text: Yes some of the Thor films have garnered poorish feedback however I have enjoyed them all.....so far. Ragnorak the best looked like the opening of a new garish image which I loved.L&T came with big expectations and fails - seriously fails.It lacked the spark and self awareness of Ragnorak. L&T came across as overly self knowing; trying too hard to be amusing and laying on the un-funnies in quick succession falling flat.Bale for me was not dark enough and like many "baddies" just doesn't work.Some of the better bits were the "lovey dovey" bits between Thor and Jane/Mighty Thor.Throughout the whole film I felt as though I was watching an ok made for TV series.We know these characters of old but I didn't really empathise nor was I particularly interested in them.Thankfully I only rented this. I won't be watching it again. NB: I am a Marvel fan and have been since my teens (long ago) a Thor fan. Disappointed.

title: Failed to make me laugh
text: Back in 2019 comic-con, when kevin feige announced thor love and thunder with taika watiti returning as its director, i got very excited because i loved thor ragnarok very much. My excitement got doubled when Christian bale was announced as the antagonist marking his comeback in comic book genre after a decade.Coming to positives, the biggest plus point was Christian bale as gorr the god butcher but he got very less screentime. Natalie portman who was absent in ragnarok returns in love and thunder as jane foster and her comeback was meaningful. Some visuals were good.Now the biggest issue i have is that despite having so many jokes and gags none of them made me laugh. Ragnarok had several laugh out loud moments but i didn't even chuckle once at the jokes. Thor character is being made a joke film by film underestimating his might. Taika watiti fails to balance comedy and emotions, hence the final product turns into a mockery instead of parody.

title: Big disappointment after so much anticipation
text: Before the release, I thought this had a chance of surpassing Top Gun Maverick, presumably behind the December Avatar release for top grossing movie of 2022. After eagerly awaiting this movie, it didn't take long at all to realize that it would not be able to reach those expectations.I won't rehash many of the disappointments (plenty of others have already done a better job) but the writing & storyline were very weak, the jokes were stale and climax was utterly emotionless.Why Disney and the current phase movie directors & producers feel the need to emasculate the characters is mystifying. They are ruining Thor and have done their best to erase Hulk while replacing every strong male character with female teenagers. It's just sad and shows Disney's disdain for traditional Marvel character that built the franchise.Thor Ragnarok was full of humor and even though I personally found it to be excessive, overall it worked. This is basically a worse reiteration with no compelling storyline. The overarching gay themes are overkill.Thor is such a cool character but he's been relagated to a buffoon lately - although not Hemsworth's fault here. I place this blame squarely on the writers and "creative" side which is at this point, more aptly just cringeworthy.

title: Embarrassing Film
text: I watched this in the cinema and it felt like a drag.Stan Lee did not die for this, he's probably rolling in his grave at this absolute mockery of thor.Plot was disappointing and executed badly.This film made me want to gauge my eyes out.I remember going to see this film with my brother when it came out and then as soon as we left the theatre I had turned to my brother and said what an absolute waste of time.The fact that Korg monologued the whole movie was a horrible directing choice. That was never necessary and made the movie even worse.I will never get over how absolutely horrible this movie is and the fact that new zealand slang was included is foul. Coming from a new zealander It was a diabolical mess. It made us look like we don't know how to speak properly, adding "chur" to the movie is a good way to get the rest of the world to laugh at us, not with us.It made the movie a big joke and made a mockery of how we speak to the rest of the world. It wasn't funny at all and none of the jokes landed. Waste of money buying tickets for this pathetic movie.

title: Even worse than the last one, they really made the effort here
text: OK Chris can't act, his great to look at and a really nice gut but... Don't put him in situations where the story &script are awful and the supporting cast dont know why they're there. The las 8 or so MCU films have slid fats. Probable starting around the time of GotG II. Lack of creativity, comfortable position that everyone;'s going to lap it up etc, whatever. This really is the lowest of low point so far. Cringeworthy lines form the outset. Everyone just going through the motions. Even the visuals are uninspired and formulaic. Why, why, why... didnt it just bomb at the box office and send a message?

title: Under delivers as a high quality Marvel movie
text: My expectations were pretty high going in to watch this movie having watched and enjoyed all previous Marvel movies. I was disappointed with this one as there was just too much comedy thrown in which distracted the viewer from the main storyline. There were some good scenes but the quality of the movie just wasn't up to the standard of the latest Dr Strange (Madness of the Multiverse) movie which I've now watched twice. This is the worst of all the Thor movies and wish I hadn't watched it.

title: WHY?!
text: I use IMDB quite a lot, but this is the first time I have felt the need to write a review for a film, and it's not for a good reason.This may be the worst MCU film ever made. The Thor trilogy has always been one of my favourites, and Ragnorak is a masterpeice. But this?!Please, if you love Thor, don't watch this. Save yourself the regret and disappointment. The best characters are two annoying giant goats, and they aren't even funny.I left the cinema feeling like I had completed wasted my time and money, and with more questions than answers. Empty plots with zero emotion. Half mentions of a possible story that never began nor ended.Why did they bother.Only plus is the graphics, as usual, are amazing.

title: Pathetic and embarrassing
text: An absolute embarrassment to the Thor films - actors must b in mid life crisis - never have I ever seen a worse film and I've seen some woeful movies - won't get those 2 hours of my life back again ðŸ˜¡

title: Vintage Reviews
text: The movie is comedy romantic flim and whenever you feel there's a serious moment then suddenly the next second there's a joke . The movie is best for one time watch but Christian bale's Gorr disappointes us as he has got very less screen time and no proper setup . The movie feels rushed.

title: Parody goes too far!
text: Disappointed! I am so glad i did not go to watch this in cinema, it is on Disney+Parody goes too far, to the point where its not funny. Scenes that should be intense lack grip and tension, due to the failed parody. Its forceful and does not come through naturally; Lets leave that for Guardians of the Galaxy, works perfectly there.This film is also promoting LGBTQA+ which again seemed forceful and not organic, are directors/Marvel just trying to keep up with worldly affairs and incorporate into this in Marvel Universe, just like in Eternals. Please stop. It gets disrespectful.The best Thor has to be Ragnarok.Please note Thor shall not return.

title: Very disappointed
text: This film is literally its own parody. Too many jokes, VFX is the worst in the entire MCU, what really happened to this film? Is the worst film till now in Marvel, and it's getting worse every time they give us all this rushed projects.

title: garbage...
text: By looking at first marvel movies Iron Man, Thor, Avengers.... this one..... total garbage... just looking at first Thor Movie cant even compare with this garbage....

title: goofy movie that destroyed characters
text: Somehow they (the director) turned a can't lose big budget Marvel film into a goofy movie that destroyed characters and Marvel history. I had to watch this in four separate segments because I got bored and had to turn it off a bunch of times. I finally made it through the whole movie and I'm pretty disappointed. I thought the new Dr. Strange movie was bad, but this is worse. The only redeeming part of this movie is that the special effects were still decent. Anyone who paid full price to watch this at the movies theaters must be mighty Thor pissed. If you are still waiting to watch this I'd advise waiting for it to come out on cable, so toy can watch for free.

title: Very disappointing
text: I'm a HUGE Thor fan, I was soo eager to see Love and Thunder after years of waiting for another Thor movie..... bust sadly I was super super disappointed... I absolutely hate the direction they went with this movie, they tried making it into a "funny" movie but Thor is not supposed to be a comedy.... and there was just tooo much talking in some scenes and not enough action!

title: Thor: Trying Too Hard
text: Following the wannabe 'Guardians of the Galaxy' movie 'Thor: Ragarok', Taika Waititi goes all out with this over-the-top, try hard, jumping on the 80's revival bandwagon mess of a movie.Of course it's a Marvel Superhero movie, it's supposed to be over-the-top but this movie tries soo hard to be soo many things at once, it just ruins the movie.Thor has been transformed from being ignorant and foolhardy to a clueless, stupid idiot who's purpose in the movie is for comedy relief rather than action. This doesn't work when he is matched against the extremely dark and serious Christian Bale as Gorr (who's performance is too good for this movie).It tries desperately to be on trend with the 80's look and Gn'R soundtrack that feels forced (GotG already did it ...better) and Australian actor Russell Crowe plays the Greek God Zeus as an Italian in what feels like a pointless comedy skit is cringey adding nothing to the story.The Jane storyline is one of the most interesting parts of the film but is shoehorned into an already overfull, cameo heavy plot which is sullied for the constant need for more comedy and one-liners.It is watchable but once is enough.

title: What is marvel thinking
text: Marvel is thinking too big picture and they've stopped focusing on the smaller picture. Ever since they started really getting into connecting the entire marvel cinematic universe, the quality of their individual movies has gone down. It's disappointing because I know they can produce a good movie. They are looking at a complete puzzle and they've stopped focusing on the details of the puzzle pieces. You should be able to watch any marvel movie/ tv show on its own, and it should be enjoyable. But that's not the case anymore. You almost have to watch every single thing they release, and that's less entertaining and more like a full time job.Thor is one of my favorite superheroes in their universe, but this movie was a flop. I was excited when they released the title and commercial because I thought it would be more 70s/80s themed. There was hardly any reference to that theme at all. The humor was geared towards children, yet some of the scenes boarded on too in appropriate for kids. The best part of the movie was the stupid goats and that's not saying much because they were annoying.

title: Who approved this one?
text: Despite the promising desert opening sequence, Thor Love and Thunder is a complete mess. Although Christian Bale tries to be an engaging villain there is nothing enough to support him except the black and white sequence. Natalie portman too tries to make her part interesting with two type of performances but fails to impress. Coming to visuals, the golden temple sequence, black-white sequence are the only things to cherish.The whole movie suffers from usage of some b grade vfx and cgi effects which are evident in most scenes. The botched up pointless storyline, bad screenplay and much more leads to the downfall of the movie. None of the jokes land, all felt miserable. A lot of potential talented actors have been wasted due to such a lame idea.Whatever, the mid credits looks promising in the MCU future but this one is by far the worst disappointing movie from MCU.Rating:43/100.

title: I want my money back!
text: Another Woke Piece Of Junk From Disney.This movie is terrible. Cliche humor, bad acting, Hemsworth is a puppet. Disney sucks. They must be buying reviews because there is no way this POS is 7 stars. I want my money back!

title: A movie which is a parody of itself
text: The joking started (I think) in the guardians of the galaxy- which was a great movie and when marvel noticed that people responded well they started to push jokes to every other marvel movies and so it was inevitable that once they will overdo it. This is exactly what happened to this movie.It really felt like a parody filled with many forced cringe jokes. It totally ruined a great villian played amazingly by Christian Bale and it ruined the story line as well. What a dissapointment.

title: TRASH!!!
text: If I could give this 0 stars I would! This movie was complete trash!! I love Marvel movies, Thor, and I'm a huge fan of Chris Hemsworth and Natalie Portman, but this was a mistake of a movie! It was cheesy, useless, and a complete waste of time. Honestly watching this made me not want to watch another Thor movie again it was that ridiculous! The plot was ridiculous! The actors should've turned it down once they read the script. There was nothing funny or amusing about this film. It's 2hrs of time I'll never get back! What were the writers thinking? I'm so glad I didn't go to the theaters to see this. If you haven't seen this movie DON'T!!! You aren't missing anything.

title: Poor adaptation
text: This movie took the absolute best Thor story in the comics and turned into a bad, really bad comedy movie. Not a good CGI. I was literally so disappointed with this movie.

title: Glad I didn't buy a ticket to watch this
text: I have enjoyed the Thor movies that came before "Love & Thunder," but this one was just bad. I had heard/read reviews about the poor attempts at humor, but overlooked them because I always make up my own mind, and rarely agree with bad reviews from critics, especially about humor. However, I found this movie completely un-funny and I kept waiting for the barely-there plot to develop. I was interested to see how the Jane-as-Thor happened, and I'm not mad at that because although I am not a comic book fan, I do know that it was taken from the comic books as were the goats. I will say that the one thing I enjoyed was when the children got the power of Thor "for a limited time only." After watching the movie I read some positive critic reviews and cam concerned that they were posted under the incorrect movie title because there's no way a person with any intelligence could say those things about "Love & Thunder." If I had paid money to see this in the theater I would be seriously upset that I wasted my money on this woke garbage. Don't waste your time.

title: What is happening to marvel
text: Thor 4 seems to be a parody of some sort. The cgi is horrifyingly bad. The humor is forced and cringey. What a waste of Christian Bale. This seems to have been a skit on snl. 5 minutes into the movie and I immediately lost interest because the cgi and dialogue was so horrible. I enjoyed Thor 1,2, and even ragnarok was fun in some ways, but this movie is a whole different level of bad. Don't even get me started on the goats. I don't even know what else to say about this trash fest of a "film". Please skip this one if you have the chance. The MCU is just so, so bad anymore and this film basically sums up phase 4.

title: Can I have my money back?!
text: After the last Thor, I was hesitate to see this one. Bad writing, immature direction and horrible humor was allowed to be repeated yet again! I'm not sure of the direction Marvel Studios is going, but it seems they are mass producing and just going after the money and to hell with storyline and quality. OR they've overstretched themselves and simply can't create the volume of "quality" production they've committed to.

title: Walked out
text: Well okay, I didn't walk out because I was sitting at home...but if it was the theatre, I would have. I just couldn't justify sitting through 45 more minutes of everything being a joke, thin plot, horrible CGI and mediocre action scenes by Marvel standards. So I turned it off. I think the biggest problem with MCU right now is there's no larger plot surfacing like we had with The Avengers/Thanos/Infinity Stones etc., at least not one that I'm seeing. The biggest problem with Love and Thunder, a joke every line. It's like what my English lit teacher used to say about swearing, 'If you swear all the time, then it loses it's impact. If you only swear once in a while, it really meant something.' This movie meant nothing to me.

title: Expected nothing and still disappointed
text: Easily in the top three worst movies I've seen in my life. From unfunny and cringeworthy jokes, flat and rushed character development, non-existent chemistry between characters, massive shameless expositions to boring action sequences and bad cgi, this was a stinking pile of garbage of a movie.I like Hemsworth, I like Natalie, I like Bale and I liked most Marvel movies, but no one managed to salvage this disaster. I heard really bad things about this movie, but I thought it can't be THAT bad so I gave it a watch. It was so much worse than I could've ever anticipated.I'm honestly surprised someone gave it a green light to be released to cinemas. I you feel you're lacking cringe in your life and want to see Disney making a bad parody of itself, give this one a go.

title: I AM DISGUSTED
text: I am beyond disappointed I don't even know where to start. The last THOR was a piece of art, one of the best marvel movies hands down, and this was the complete opposite. What was that director on??? PLEASE DO NOT SUPPORT THAT DIRECTOR he cannot have lead on any marvel project in the future he has taken thor to the absolute trash. I am so sad as THOR is mr favorite character of all time this just makes me so sick to my stomach I just left the movie theater literally sick to my stomach, I seriously with my whole soul think Midbius was ten times better than this ðŸ¤¢

title: Aesthetic nonsense
text: I am so very glad I didn't have time to see this in the theater, but now am almost as sorry I wasted time streaming it. For the record, I adore Taika Waititi's humor, in both acting and and direction, and absolutely loved Thor: Ragnarok, but this movie is a mess.Visually gorgeous, but about as brainlessly bombastic as Thor himself back before he began his redemptive arc. Sadly just about every character was wasted, from Thor himself, to Jane and Valkyrie, to the blink and you'll miss it appearance of Darcy, and the almost...no actually painfully misused Guardians of the Galaxy.I am not sure what plan the MCU has for Thor after the way this ended, but I was left shaking my head in disbelief.While I haven't given up on the MCU....yet....this film was a major letdown, IMO. Ah well, there are still episodes of She Hulk to look forward to, silly as it is.

title: Yet another disappointment set up film
text: This movie was a disappointment. The idea that Thor is a giant goofball is a bad one. Waititi needs to stay away from the MCU. The movie is tonally deaf, pretty but shallow, and the finale is rushed garbage. A million jokes a minute but only half of one hits. Lots of setup for future perhaps better projects. Maybe it's time to retire the MCU and focus on letting some movies stand on their own.

title: A kin to Spaceballs, Airplane, and Scary Movie
text: It's like a spoof on super hero movies. It's a joke. I've seen better produced YouTube videos. This franchise was destroyed with Ragnarok. Wrong writers and wrong director for the Thor franchise. The villain was the best character because he was the only serious character. Such a disappointment but I didn't expect much after Ragnarok considering it's the same director. I really wish they had not changed the direction of the franchise. I loved the original Thor films. They were among my favorite Marvel films. Storytelling is cheap with poor narration and script boring and poorly written. I meant it when I said I've seen better produced YouTube videos. What a waste of money and resources on such a joke of a film.

title: Loved Thor - Not Now!
text: Taika Waititi has ruined the Thor franchise in my eyes, the humour is over the top and the story is not a patch on Ragnarok. Ragnarok was at the time a fresh take on Thor with a sense of humour that was befitting to the storyline, Love and Thunder however reads likes a bad eighties action, love story comedy. This is just my opinion however and I would advise that you should only watch this if you liked JoJo Rabbit. I'm sorely disappointed with Marvel for letting this happen to one of their much loved characters. All I can say is that if Taika Waititi does get get his hands on Star Wars I for one will not be looking forward to it.

title: Thor and disappointment
text: I was a big fan but this is the worst Marvel movie ever! Forced humor, bad acting, bad character development, Thor has become just an idiot. Gorr was wasted on a stupid movie and Zeus is not worth mentioning! Even the story about Korg does not match, in this movie he has two fathers, but in the Thor Ragnarok he talks about his mother and sister. One big disappointment!

title: Worst movie
text:
This could be the worst movie I have ever had the misfortune to see. It's trying to be one long terrible joke and it's not even funny. I'm not sure why you'd go
Full on comedy as you explore cancer and love and loss because I couldn't care for any of the characters whatsoever. I'm not sure why this director is so "in" rn. He's awful and the cgi was even bad. Reminded me of those terrible Saturday morning cartoons back in the day. Is camp back in? The lines are delivered camp and melodrama and the hemsworth person seems to think their brand is being a joke. But it's no longer funny. Move along now. I was embarrassed for Portman being in this quagmire. They are a better actor than tbis.

title: What was this trying to be?
text: Is it a bad movie? I don't think bad is quite the word I'd use. I mean, if you took this movie and showed it to people 20 years ago, it would have been something to watch. So there are a lot of things going for it that once was not a thing. But...Story is King.And I'm not sure where this is coming from. They were all over the place and nowhere all at once. Light. Not deliberate.Is it a comedy? Sure its got its moments, but not enough to call it that.Drama? Christian Bale did an OK job, but still nothing groundbreaking. As for the rest of the characters, it was too light to pull any worth weight here.Action Flick? Maybe. But I they just gave powers to whomever whenever it kinda fit. I love Natalie Portman, and sure, her becoming something of a super hero too is nice, but they never explained why. She just became one. And the kids, give them the power of the Gods and they fight like Warriors?And what about those Screaming Goats? What place did they have?All in all, the Story sucked. But its entertaining enough to watch once. After that, it will be remembered as just a High Budget Block Buster Cash Cow of a Movie...Kinda reminds me of the Triple A Gaming Dev's. Not making good games, just games that will sell on the name. We might be coming to the end of the Marvel Universe.

title: Worst marvel movie yet by far.
text:
Pardon my first trolling ever :-/
So glad I didn't waste a movie ticket on this and watched it with my sons Disney plus sign on. Disney execs and writers should maybe try harder on plot and dialog than on wokeness. The number of top tier talent in this film only exasperates how bad the plot / dialogue was. Thors pathetic self debasement combined with cheap meme humor and screaming goats that can be found on any social media outlet was overdone beyond belief. The only thing that brought this rating above a zero was Christian Bales excellent performance within a lost cause of a script. This was a movie worthy of a MST3K riffing and that's coming from someone who loves bad b space films like plan 9 from outer space.

title: An insult to Marvel fans, and the character of Thor
text: Ironically, Thor was always one of the most dignified of all Marvel superheroes. (Perhaps only Namor (Sub-Mariner) came close in nobility.) Thor was, after all, a literal god, and the son of Odin.Yet this movie insists on playing him as a simple stooge. In fact, the writers aren't satisfied with making us Thor a laughingstock, it paints the entire Marvel pantheon of gods as cruel, bellicose egomaniacs, worthy only of scorn.Marvel has always had humor, it's one of the things it makes Marvel superhero movies fun and make their characters (relatively) believable. But in the past, Marvel has always known how to balance drama, adventure, and occasional humor.This mess is a flat-out comedy, complete with screaming goats.The movie plays more like a parody or send up of a Thor movie, reminiscent of Leslie Nielsen farces such as "Airplane!" or "The Naked Gun".That might be OK for a 30-minute Marvel TV series such as "She-Hulk", but when the customer pays full-price for a movie ticket to see a major, $250 million superhero epic, they shouldn't have to put up with some imbecile making fun of the very characters they have come to see.And wacko humor is particularly ill-fitting for Thor, who, as mentioned earlier, was always one of the most sober and dignified of the Marvel superheroes.Will it ever be possible for audiences to take the character seriously again?While a few of the movie's moments are indeed funny (I must admit, the screaming goats were rather hilarious), it was far too often burdened with silly, repetitious gags, such as Thor constantly talking to his new weapon as if it were a jealous woman.And when the movie was forced to resort to the usual dramatic/adventure ending, it flubbed those rare serious moments as well, which mostly came across as illogical and unjustified.They should never let this writer/director get within a hundred yards of another Marvel film. He just doesn't understand the genre.

title: Natalie Portman is irritating...
text: I did not see this in the movies, but watched it on Disney plus, and oh boy, what a let down! I turned it off after 30 minutes. I completely agree with others that this movie is a parody, and a very bad at it. The constant forced jokes, and way too loud glam rock music. Although, I did not see one point in other reviews... That how IRRITATING Natalie Portman is! She is a bad actress, with an attitude, cannot portray a strong woman, strenght or character... She should stick playing neurotic ballerinas. She should have never bought back, the previous one without her was much better! If she is the next female Thor, this franchise is done for me!

title: Another garbage trope from Disney
text: Seriously is Disney gonna ruin everything we older generations grew up on? Can they not write their own stories? Instead the like to throw their modern politics and agendas into well established stories. I tried to watch this movie 4 times making about 45mins in before giving up each time. They've reduced thor into a whining simp... Disney and the other quota hire companies are destroying not only beloved franchises but also our society. I have no sympathy for them when the backlash comes they've earned everything they will receive. Watch at your peril... They seem to think they can grab and keep your attention with CGI and action scenes. Newsflash not everyone is hollow or ignorant.

title: Meh
text: Comedy was too much, poor jokes or acts; guest appearances went nowhere important and underwhelming action scenes. Too much Disney influence in this one. Bright spot was Natalie Portman.

title: Taika Waititi destroying the franchise
text: I'm a big fan of Marvel and Thor movies, and this is a complete disappointment. The poor direction, poor story, mainstream rock vibe and childish humor turns it into a complete comedy show. Thor is about story, culture, sprit and an engaging story that teases you into reading it. The last movies have been a complete disaster, there's no way to take this seriously. Thor can still have so much to tell, he has the perfect background to spark new creative stories, yet the director seems to try to prove the opposite, a tired fiasco. I hope Disney decides to revamp this in the future otherwise we are on the road to seeing another hero dead.

title: The worst Marvel movie, sadly garbage
text: The movie is between a sort of parody and a bunch of nonsense. Marvel is unfortunately declining. It was very disappointing, i don't want to add spoilers in the review but i would like to add that it was not worth it to watch it. I can imagine that with the end of Stan Lee Era and after Endgame, things will not be the same anymore.

title: Very Disappointing!
text: Nothing good to write about here. I don't think that I have ever seen a movie where so many acclaimed actors in such a poor movie!I it hard to see how this movie would be appealing to any generation!

title: How disappointing
text: I cannot emphasise enough how disappointing I found this comedy. I call it a comedy but I did not find it at all amusing. It has nothing in common with the original comic book character of Thor that I used to read as a child. I was a great fan of the Marvel comics but the latest Marvel movies are nothing but ridiculous. Why do they keep turning them into bad comedies?I don't think I will bother with any future Marvel movies because they are getting increasingly worse with formulated bad humour jam packed with special effects. The essence of a good superhero story is simplicity and hope. DC comic movies get better and better whilst Marvel movies just get more ridiculous.My advice, don't bother with this one.

title: What a Sham(e)!
text: This movie is a train wreck that somehow follows up some of the best movies of the past decade. How can you take Thor, one of the best characters in the MCU and make a movie that only gets good just as it ends? I get that there have always been jokes in the MCU, but this was full of horrible jokes that must have come from a beginner "comedians" that sold the jokes for $5 just to be able to buy dinner. By the time I actually got as into this movie as I could, it had like 10 minutes left. It's a shame that Dr. Strange can't make us all forget this ever happened. Who is Peter Parker is now the least of MCU fans worries, we still have to see Thor in the next Guardians movie too. I'm sorry but outside of No Way Home, and MAYBE Multiverse of Madness, the MCU should have realized that Endgame was just that. The endgame for an amazing run. Please stop now. The universe is crumbling beneath our feet!

title: Fun. But why did Zeus sound Italian?
text: A fun movie with a decent cast. After the last few, where I feel that phase 4 is mostly a failure, this one was a little too comedic. It was still more enjoyable than the recent Doctor Strange, and most of Marvel's TV efforts (Ms. Marvel is the best). But it wasn't a bad movie.

title: Too forced
text: Marvel needs to stop with the forcing of this whole LGBTQ thing down the fans face. It's getting to a point where it's so obvious and painfully excruciating to watch. This would be the second time if not more they did this now...in Doctor Strange and now with this Thor.

title: What a waste. Marvel is running out of ideas.
text: Sad when the goats are the best thing about the whole movie. Empty movie with bad over done jokes and really bad acting. Time for Marvel to let go the superhero movies for now. At this point the movies are coming to fast and to many to really care anymore about any of the new characters. This movie tried to hard to be funny and is now going up against gods that never die. What villan can be worst than a villain that cannot die or really can never be defeated. The boring is now setting in when I watch these movies and I find my self very uninterested in any further waste of my time to watch them if this is an example of what is still yet to come.

title: Wasted talent. Abysmal writing. Just awful!
text: What on Earth is going on with this movie?! It is awful! I'm halfway through & I'm already struggling to stick with it. Too many jokes that are badly timed, irrelevant & pointless. So far it just seems to be one silly mess. Bale is wasted in this bile. The writers must've been on a strike. I can't believe they all looked at this script & thought this was a good idea. For once, possibly the first time, I find myself agreeing with the critics. And thank God I didn't pay to see this at a cinema. Hemsworth is flat & unimpressive despite the muscled build, decorated with bar room tramp tattoos. Crowe as Zeus is a fat man. A gimmicky circus sketch who speaks with a nasally Russian accent. Zeus, is a Greek God! Not a Russian tyrant! Portman's character is just boring. I think if I'd been in the cinema, I'd have walked out & tried to ask for my money back. It is up there among the worst films I've seen. The only thing I liked was seeing Mjolnir with a different power & even that hammer acted better than most of the people in the film.

title: Ridiculous
text: Marvel has bottomless pockets and a clear agenda to see how much it can ruin its greatest heroes. Ironman was ruined. Hulk was ruined. Thor was ruined. Thor has been being ruined for multiple films now. On and on. Who's next? The one truly great movie that Marvel has ever made is The Avengers. That's the one time that Marvel got it absolutely right. Marvel has bottomless pockets and a clear agenda to see how much it can ruin its greatest heroes. Ironman was ruined. Hulk was ruined. Thor was ruined. Thor has been being ruined for multiple films now. On and on. Who's next? The one truly great movie that Marvel has ever made is The Avengers. That's the one time that Marvel got it absolutely right.

title: I felt like Marvel is making fun of the fans
text:
As a fan of the MCU, I can assure you that this is definitely the worst movie that Marvel has ever released and the worst piece of audiovisual material that I've ever saw in my whole life. The majority of the film is like a massive joke, which is one of it's main flaws because, certain parts of it that require a serious approach lose all of their
emotional weight and end up being just irrelevant. There's no story development to make, theoretically, important scenes feel important. Another point is: Gorr's development is equally very poor, which is sad due to the fact that Christian Bale is an amazing actor. They literally threw away one of the best villains of Thor in the comics and an overtalented actor. In the end, everthing is just totally forgettable and not worth watching.

title: A silly parodie
text: Thor: Love and Thunder is just a joke-train of bad placed very silly jokes.It can best be discribed as "Scary Movie" to "Scream" or "The nacked gun" to "Dirty Harry".Difference is, that the above mentioned movies were designed to be parodies.Music is good, but also out of place.For the characters, I felt they were always doing exactly not what a "real" being would do. It is part of the movies humor, but the main figures reactions are so not linked to their surrounding and the things going on, that it feels like a stupid sitcom, but without the laughter and without end.Clearly no recommendation from me.

title: There is no god.
text: Clearly the least amount of effort went into this film. The acting, humour, story, effects and continuity were just empty and terrible.This movie perfectly sums up the blackhole of talent sucking gravity that looms above the entire industry these days. You can't escape it.This director has failed miserably.

title: It feels like watching a cheap parody of Thor.
text: I love Marvel movies for being light and funny, I've been a marvel fangirl since day one and hardly ever complain about the MCU, but this has felt like a Thor parody, not Thor itself. The comedy was so cheap its timing felt exactly like watching Hollywood parodies, like Scary Movie.The characters with so much potential (like Jane, Zeus, Valkyrie and Gorr) felt wasted among the bad jokes.Although I really disliked the experience (it was such a joke that even the movie couldn't take itself seriously), I loved Natalie Portman and Tessa Thompson.Overall, the most disappointing is knowing that this is a Taika Waititi movie. How can a great director, great casting and a huge budget turn out this bad?

title: Borderline unbearable to watch
text: I need to be upfront and admit I'm not a huge fan of the MCU. I'm glad so many people enjoy these films, but I've always had a hard time getting into them. However, I really enjoyed the first Thor and thought the others were meh. But I went to go see this with my girlfriend opening weekend and couldn't believe how terrible it was.First off, in general Marvel has zero idea how to effectively do humor. For example, in all the Avengers movies, nearly every character is written as witty comedians who can bust out a one-liner at the drop of a hat. For Tony Stark, it's believable due to the character and RDJ's natural charisma and cockiness (meant in a good way). However, if everyone is witty - nobody is witty. There are so many scenes in those films where the bulk of the dialogue between various superheroes is nothing but sarcasm and quips. They even do it in scenes that call for a more dramatic approach, which is wildly annoying.I got off track, my apologies. So Love & Thunder continues this trend from the very start, and doesn't let up for the. Entire. Freakin'. Film. Again, moments that should be dramatic are ruined, because Marvel apparently has a quota on how many jokes or quips must be made per minute. The dialogue, in general, is no better.The lone saving grace (but not enough to ever make me watch it again) is, of course, Christian Bale. I found his scenes compelling and emotional, as they should be. However, the constant tonal shifts completely take you out of the movie.I'm genuinely surprised by the rating Love & Thunder has, most likely due to MCU stans. Good for them, I'm glad they liked it.

title: Disney woke propaganda
text: Disney is really reaching for the stars in terms of woke communist propaganda with this movieIt throws the idea God does not care about us, and throws the gay agenda far too many timesNo wonder it used for it Christian Bale, an actor who even thanked Satan during the oscarsNo wonder it ended up having to change CEO, as sales were plummetingA horrid plot that on one side has lots of jokes (mostly, bad), with chilren being mistreatedAnd please don't overdo showing how hot Thor's body is, it is becoming ridiculous.Disney is really reaching for the stars in terms of woke communist propaganda with this movieIt throws the idea God does not care about us, and throws the gay agenda far too many timesNo wonder it used for it Christian Bale, an actor who even thanked Satan during the oscarsNo wonder it ended up having to change CEO, as sales were plummetingA horrid plot that on one side has lots of jokes (mostly, bad), with chilren being mistreatedAnd please don't overdo showing how hot Thor's body is, it is becoming ridiculous.

title: Limitless absurdity
text: One of the most failed movies that makes you lose two hours of banality, I don't know what happened to Marvel, merging action with a boring comedy, and really it has nothing to do with comedy at all ,that movie is supposed to be action, not comedy.

title: Unwatchable
text: Love and thunder is a trash movie. The only issue here that most trash movies acknowledge that they are trash. That one does not.This is exactly what happens when director gets carried away by his own popularity.No funny jokes, atrocious cgi, bad acting and absence of any plot.I've finished movie only after 3rd attempt. And that's the first time I've watched MCU on a tablet because I did not bother to use home theater.This is not what fans have been asking for, I'm pretty sure. But with current MCU situation you better prepare for the worst to come.3 stars for: Christian Bale, 5 mins of Guardians of the Galaxy and Portman. And maybe Russel Crowe.

title: 80s throwbacks doesn't make a good movie
text: Well this was an unnecessary exercise. This actually made me tired of all the 80s throwbacks that are force fed into your faces. Felt like a kids movie, and if that was the case, then it is fine, but I think even kids will think this is too corny of a rendition. This wasn't even funny as a parody. Christian Bale as Gorr was a too generic of a villain, seen it before in dozens of movies and was a dime in a dozen. Marvel has become a money hogging scam and trying to milk this franchise as much as possible with nonsensical storylines. We should rate this honestly lower as to give a signal the audience is not dumb, we know what quality is and script writers needs to be more creative. To people who do love it, more power to you, have a nice life.

title: Worst MCU film so far :(
text: I had loved all MCU films so far, even Eternals, Thor The Dark World and Ant Man and The Wasp. But Love and Thunder is the first MCU film that left me with the feeling that something important was missing. The plot is too thin, it should have had more focus on the villain's motivations. The CGI feels as generic as ever... Not all jokes work, and they distract you from the story. The secondary characters are not given any really interesting to do. The ending felt forced and rushed.

title: This is tough to watch
text: This feels is obnoxious as all hell.Why is everyone in this film SO moronic (and I like the previous thor movies)Taika - please.Small doses of stupidity please!What felt fresh and natural in Thor: Ragnorok feels like they are trying to be funny and stunted and the editing in the title with Christian Bale is awful. The CGI is awful. I understand this was made in the pandemic but, if you couldn't make it better, why not wait until you could. Don't just realease it because of the "schedule".Thanks Kevin FiegeI was a huge MCU fan but this is, uh, getting really hard to stomach. Endgame absolutely SHOULD have been the end but if the MCU is to continue succesfully its going to need to be a lot less like this!

title: THE MOVIE SHOULD BE SERIOUS
text: The movie should add more seriousness it can't match the expectations the marvel should realise that they can able to give us more movie like infinity war,endgame, captain America civil war, spider man no way home.. they should focus on quality rather than quantity.

title: cringe worthy would best suit this desciption
text: After watching 30 minutes in, i felt the beauty of what makes marval's universe work(especially with guardians of the galaxy wishing thor safe travels)until it falls of the rails hitting notes that were unnecessary, especially scenes that felt the need to show how quick would it be to sum thanos's 3 trilogies in 1 movies with gorr akka "christian bale" who exceptionally held the movie together through devotion, pain and complex narrative that showed the secrets of what thanos went through. Then we have the forced love story that falls apart, while talking about unplessant mortality most humans sucumb to suddenly fals cringe worthy to meet every criteria to bring the audience in.

title: Poor execution, sloppy filmmaking
text: The cast was tight. Great performances, especially by Bale and Hemsworth. The pacing was on par with a commercial: little white space, way too rushed. The plot was scattered, at best. The effects were a bit forced, even distracting. The humor too infrequent. The 20th Century classic comic had little to do with the 21st Century glossy commercial for progressive social wokeness. TLT will be forgotten.

title: The only good thing about this movie ...
text:
Is (not surprisingly) Christian Bale.Natalie Portman did what she could with her part, which could have been great but ...
And Russell Crowe gets an honorary mention cause he rocked his current dad bod and had fun with the role.The rest of the movie is just ridiculous.

title: When it's good it's so good but when it's bad it's quite frankly awful
text: The comedy here is a mixed bag and at points it feels the team are sacrificing story for comedy to the point where the film feels almost like a parody. Gorr has some awesome sequences in the film but ends up being wasted and falling to the mcus victim curse, Jane is also a waste here. Choosing to adapt two of thors best comic storylines was bold and sadly it fails. The cgi and cinematography are great, there are some hard hitting moments but the movies structure is it's worst enemy. The pacing is all over the place at points you'll feel like you've just missed a whole scene. The action here is great and if you can look past the story issues it is a fun, comedic somewhat emotional ride. But it does make one wonder what is marvel doing?

title: Comic relief. Just sad.
text: So I guess Thor is now Marvels' "Comic Relief". And I gotta say, for me, it doesn't work at all. They take the Thor's character into the ridiculous, and it needs to stop. It's not funny, it's not interesting, it's just sad.And now instead of the Bifrost to move around the galaxy, they got some screwed up version of Santa's sled?I don't know who wrote this garbage, but please Marvel, or actually Disney.. Fire those idiots. This is completely ruining Marvel for me. Thanx a lot.I don't know who wrote this garbage, but please Marvel, or actually Disney.. Fire those idiots. This is completely ruining Marvel for me. Thanx a lot.

title: Comedy or Action Marvel movie??
text: Marvel!.. You became ehat you are today because you had enough serious storylines mixed with action & just the right amount of slight humour... I felt like i was watching a Mel Brooks production... Had i known I woulda stayed home & watched SpaceBalls for 50th time... So disappointing.

title: Tragic Writing...moronic plot :(
text:
Well i do not know what to say...stupid plot, bad acting (except Bale),...or overall a very disappointing movie.Romance was somehow out of line and out of the overall pace of the movie, fighting scenes are poorly done, costumes look like plastic toys, jokes are dull...it looks like it was made to be moronic on purpose.The movie has so many things in it and
and so very little momenta s to enjoy. I am not sure this is even a "pop-corn movie", and i say this not out of disrespect to the efforts of the team, but out of regret. If this is awaiting all the Marvel heroes from now, then it is the leas to say disturbing.Bale is stunningly good as always...lovely make up, lovely overall look and stellar performance.Russel Crowe on the other side is totally miss-casted, and did deliver something that i did not quite get, but as i said earlier the whole vibe was
somehow moronic.

title: Yikes...what the heck was that?
text: A few enjoyable moments, but not nearly enough to save this from being the worst in the Marvel Universe. Silly story. Ok acting. Cliche and predictable way too often. Very disappointed to say the least.

title: Terrible
text: Waititi is like a child who discovers a joke that makes an adult laugh the first time (Ragnarok) and then proceeds to double down and tell it over and over again, showing his immaturity and inability to grow up (Love & Thunder)After Ragnarok success this movie had the ability to catch audiences off guard and create a dark, gritty atmosphere in this successor. But Waititi fails on every level, choosing to make some slapstick comedy that feels void of substance and lacks a compelling or interesting storyline.Christian Bale was robbed of an excellent opportunity to play a truly dark character, we witness pretty much 0 God deaths from Gorr.Guardians of the Galaxy and Thor teaming up? Sounds amazing!! But was it? Who knows, we didn't get to see it!Waititi failed miserably with this movie and proved he's just a sub par director and man child with no range, a one trick pony if you will...On top of that, this film has some of the worst CGI and Waititi bloats it with the cast and crews spoilt kids most of which are terrible actors, robbing children who have been working towards a career of a life changing opportunity, just because it comes down to who you know.Glad he's been removed from Thor 5, he ruined Thors journey.

title: Taika Watiti is flaming out
text: Much like James Gunn, Taika Watiti's style is flaming out. His directing is ok here and there, but so much talent gets thrown away for too many jokes for the sake of having a joke. Similar to many reviews I've read on here, this movie is so empty of substance.

title: Bad movie
text: What is going on with Marvel. Each movie is getting progressively worse!! Save your money and watch Netflix movies!! Stop making movies if there is no story. Special effects will work only if there is a story.

title: Read the other reviews
text: I liked the story and the overall plot but the jokes.... and corg... have to go... it makes sense that Thor would be a bit broken after the events of infinity war/end game, but now completely change him into a bumbling idiot. Their are glimpses of the thor I wished to see, but whoever wrote this dry comedic movie should be slapped.

title: More SPACEBALLS and less STAR WARS
text: The more is more about trying to land a joke than the story or having any logical sens Even injecting Bale portraying Gorr into the fray seems a complete juxtaposition to the main intent which is to get a laugh at all cost including the dignity of the characters or the plot. Its like throwing everything at the wall and seeing what will stick. And the end result is one hot mess. Where the jokes landed well in Ragnarok which had a nice balance, this time the occasional silliness is relentless for the sake of cheap laughs rather than in the furtherance of the plot or story. And it feels more like the Director having a party and inviting all his friends than a serious attempt to respect the character of Thor and what's gone before parody similar to the "play within the play" which also lands flat this time as it is recycled for cheap laughs And in the end, the viewer is left lost at sea as a spectator to all the party guests in an orgy of lame jokes wondering how the whole is so much less than the sum of its parts. Even Korg's narrative can't put all the pieces together in any coherent way. And what's with all those kids (and I don't mean those screaming goats)??? There's little to love and any thunder is lost in all the gags and silliness.

title: Flash Gordon part 2
text: It appears as if Taika Waititi view of superhero movies stopped with his viewing of Flash Gordon. The firs 3/4 of the movie is nothing but over the top acting and bad slapstick jokes.Thor story line can be best of the MCU, but continually letting the director go off script ruins it. I understand Chris Hemmsworth (as a person) is funny but Thor is not intended to be the funny person. Taika Waititi made Thor a joke story line.Christian Bale is the only redeeming factor of this whole film.

title: Yawn
text: I had high hopes for this movie, but the expectation did not meet the reality. Heavy handed, tries too hard, not funny when they try, and a bit of a "religious" undertone about the afterlife. The story just wasn't as compelling as previous Marvel movies. I actually was a bit bored and we saw it on a Sunday afternoon, which may account for only 6 people in the whole theater, though we chose the 3 D version. Save your money and maybe stream it online, if you really need to see it.

title: Awful
text: Starts well and the music is awesome,plus Christian Bale,Natalie Portman and Russell Crowe are great actors. And that's it with the good parts.Then the movie turns into a joke,literally the worst MCU movie ever made.Firstly,everything is turned into a joke,even serious problems like losing a loved one or having an illness.Secondly,it's more of a family business,I mean,Chris Hemsworth literally put all his family in this movie(brother,wife and children),I hate nepotism so much.Even the look is for a low budget movie.Can't believe how great actors like Bale,Portman and Crowe played here,even their characters got ruined,also Tessa Thompson who did a good job in Ragnarok is done dirty here.Glad that the Guardians of the galaxy appeared for like five minutes,they didn't deserve to stay longer in this abomination.MCU movies considered weaker like Incredible Hulk,Thor The Dark World,Iron Man 2 or Captain Marvel are masterpieces comparing with this entry.Even X Men panned movies like Dark Phoenix are better than this crap.Still can't believe how good actors and great music like Guns'n Roses,Enya,ABBA or Mary J Blige got wasted.

title: No imagination
text: Taika took some big risks with Thor Ragnarok that made the movie great and tried to do the same here. The only difference is that he didn't stick the landing in this one... Big disappointment.

title: A BIG Waste of time
text:
The movie? A real joke
Acting? I would say good because when the script is trashy what actors can do. I cant blame them
Plot? Too much disappointing that i can leave marvel out of my movie list.Marvel used to make enjoyable movies but these days I dont think they want to do it or they are not creative enough anymore. And somethibg bothers me about this kind of movies. What they except us to feel after watching such a nonsense. Oh okay im gonna lose hope that God is gonna help me and change all of my way of thinking because marvel told me to. No we are not gonna do that so jokes on you buddy people are not as dumb as your new movies.Movies has a effect on us and we all know that. But its really disappointing that these days they dont make movies that will make us feel better or want to do better and not even something worthy that we can learn from them.

title: Almost painful jokefest
text: In short: This movie is visual stimulation over mental stimulation. In a 6:1 ratioThere are so many jokes throughout this entire movie. Nearly all of them about being dim witted or awkward. It was pretty obnoxious. I almost walked out, however the ending sentiment kind of makes up for most of it.

title: Disappointing
text: It's worth a watch and gets some laughs, but this movie is only good when it's serious and that isn't very often.I thought the end credit scenes were lacking and this like every other Thor movie was a huge missed opportunity. They need a different director.

title: Infantile, shallow, boring
text: Poorly written, dull-witted and juvenile. Christian Bale is OK, the main character laughable and not in a good way. I left the screening room half way through the movie.

title: Week narration, weak humour ruined a potentially good sequal!
text: Weak narration from the very beginning of the film (villain choosing evil over Gods for planet's suffering induced by God's). Humour throughout the film felt forced upon when none needed & story could keep afloat easily. Humour in Thor Ragnarok was quite natural & meled with the plot. This time not really. Thus only ruining the story telling. Also, Jane Foster role felt not properly developed & weak. Had hoped for a slight longer screen time with GOTG characters to spice up the movie which w'd have been better. Thor character (Chris Hemsworth) slightly weakened to make way for lady Thor but hope he's resurrected to his full potential for next sequal if it's to be made. Hope Director Taika Waititi doesn't repeat same mistakes.

title: Worst in MCU
text:
Please take the director's chair away from Taika Waititi.We used to deal with the serious God of lightning and thunder, but what do we have now? A fool with a low-quality sense of humor and an empty storyline.The MCU movies are slipping deeper and deeper into the abyss of disappointment, Chris Hemsworth is still good enough to play Thor, the main thing is not to let unpromising filmmakers destroy such a character.In the first Thor, we saw the hero's groaning
How a spoiled God learns how to be compassionate and responsible.And now a huge throwback to the fool.I'm still holding out hope for the MCU to be rehabilitated.

title: Lost in unnecessary jokes
text: The entire 5 is for Christian Bale. But unfortunately his awesome performance got wasted with all the unnecessary jokes and comedy. As the film begins the spectacular makeup work made an impact on me. I wish there were more of god slaying moments in the movoe, so that the potential of Bale could have been utilised. Bale looked frightening in the shadow realm but again nothing much happened. I have always enjoyed the Matt Damon's Loki cameo... He didn't disappoint this time too. But the overdose of jokes with Mjolnir and strombreaker is repeatitive and not so funny. When it comes to marvel movies we all wait for the post credit, and again it failed to impress me in both the post credits.

title: Mediocre
text: Way too goofy and overly formulaic. Christian Bale criminally underused! The poor quality of this film and of Ms. Marvel have led me, a long-time MCU fan, to worry about what lies ahead. Marvel has produced more duds than home-runs lately.

title: Marvel's fame is dropping like 2022 Stock Market
text: Anyone noticed how Marvel's movies start becoming F-Grade every single time they release something?They hired comedy movie writer to make Thor 4. Absolutely horrendous.Thor 4 has NO STORY.Thor 4 has JOKES EVERY 1 MINUTE.This feels like extremely well made SNL skit, not a Marvel movie.The world is ending and all they can do is joke around.Compare this to DC. DC has it all set. Hero movie = Dark atmosphere. If saving world is so easy and have time to joke around, then there won't be a bad guy strong enough to cause any trouble.I'm worried that they'll make future movies, even the ones with celestials a JOKE.Shame on Disney for making Marvel Universe a profit cash cow.

title: Don't waste your time.
text: Very disappointed in this movie. It was so silly. The comedy was horrible. I left the theater after watching for 30 minutes. Could not suffer through anymore. Some people will see it anyway. They have time and money to waste. I think I'll wait for it to come to streaming and smoke a joint.

title: Looks more like a spoof of a Thor movie
text: This movie is about 2 hours long and had this been on TV and I happened to catch it in the first hour and fifteen minutes, it is highly likely that I would have though it was a big budget spoof. Just bad comedy and the only thing I'd say I liked was the classic rock music and the Guardians of the Galaxy being there. Christian Bale is looking like Hellraiser and Matt Damon is in it, but barely and I don't know why he is even there. I couldn't take this movie in one shot, but it gets better focus after the hour and fifteen minute mark. Until then, even Thor's lines are just absolutely ridiculous attempts at humor. I've seen other productions with Taika Waititi's name on it and they were not bad...just maybe don't let him touch another Marvel movie. And if you plan to watch this purely to keep up with Marvel in case something important in a future movie plays off of this one, do yourself a favor and just look up the "Honest Trailer" on YouTube.

title: A movie trying too hard
text: Watiti delivers a movie that doesn't quite pack the punch, you were hoping for from a truly great Marvel movie, more of a eye-rolling tongue in cheek experience with very few redeeming qualities. The plot feels rushed and there can be such a thing as too many jokes. Sadly this movie is one of those bad jokes.

title: The sad fall from grace of Marvel continues
text: Fairly funny in parts for the first half of the movie, then when the plot needs to happen, it becomes a cringe inducing borefest.You can have humour, you can have drama and have poignancy but you cannot have it all in a superhero movie whilst trying to push 'the message' down everyone's throat.I felt no sense of dread or trepidation during any of it and in the end it just became the same as all the phase four Marvel movies....just a bunch of stuff going on. None of it made any sense, none of it made me care.I am done with Marvel. The awful writing from their TV shows has now seeped into the once great movies.

title: Why?
text: Oh...GOD! Make the Woke STOP! The entire idea behind the "Stwong Whaaman" part of this story line is...TERRIBLE!! Why? Why does the Woke MOB keep destroying movies? They need to go back to how they did these movies 10yrs ago! STOP force feeding "The Message" down our throats! Try making a movie with an actual story line, character arch, and ACTION! Hopefully after enough of these bomb they will go back to making good movies...Hopefully.The fact that people got, "Triggered" over the BIG C in the movie is one of the many reasons modern movies SUCK. The force feeding of every man is a Bumbling idiot and EVERY Woman is a "STWONG WHAAMAN THAT DON'T NEED NO MAN" is really getting old!

title: Goofy and Stupid Is An Understatement
text:
Talk about mixed tone ! The villain is Gorr the God Butcher but the whole thing is just a silly comedic effort.This could have been a great instalment in the franchise but between the ridiculously mixed tone and goofiness it's just an epic fail
And it's an epic fail even before the "agenda" and "the message" have jammed in at every woke opportunity
Marvel is dying fast and this movie is the proof.

title: Tacky Why?-titi
text: This might really be the final nail in the coffin that once was Marvel. Terrible storyline, a dumbed-down Thor, slapstick humor and crappy character development.Why do they keep doing this? Surely they must make more money doing good movies?But I guess the ideology is more important.Good thing I made sure Disney didn't get a cent from me watching this abomination.A shame how a once great franchise destroyed themselves in the name of wokeness. I truly hope that someone with some guts to stand up against the Hollywood mafia will turn this ship around and start producing quality content again.But since they have zero problem spitting on the legacy of greats like Stan Lee and Tolkien I somehow doubt it.And the goats, that got old real fast. Learn when to end a joke for heavens sake man.

title: This is the MCU now
text: Last couple of Marvel releases have taught us not to expect much. This one confirms it. Compelling to older audience with nostalgic soundtrack and random scenes doesn't help much, but did made me laugh. Chris is an awful but charming actor and still fits well, but Natalie could really ruin her career if she accepts another role like this.

title: Thor: Woke and Thunder
text: There's almost nothing good to say about this movie. One of the few savable things is Christian Bale's superb acting, which just feels wasted buried under one of Marvel's worst movies.Other than that it is unfunny joke after unfunny joke followed by woke stuff after woke stuff.Disney is driving the Marvel franchise down a cliff and there's no sign of them stopping anytime soon...

title: On of the worst movie... really bad.
text:
Everything about this movie is Over the top. Bad acting,
Bad CGI,Crappy script,etc. Please don't waste your time. The only thing i like about this movie is Christian bale.

title: Childish.. weak script - not funny
text: Garbage.. waited for this film, and was let down. My twelve year old daughter was looking forward to seeing it.. yet it was not a good sign when she takes out her phone several times during the movie to start a game or text her friends.No chemistry between any actor.Best actor was Christian Bale, but he was underused. Thor was turned into a buffoon, I guess the new formula is to take the manly Thor, turn him into a joke, an insecure moron, and thus elevate Jane Foster as the female Thor. I am all for woman power, but not by making men like idiots.The story was very weak and most jokes where not funny. What a waste. I think comedy should be done tastefully and balanced. This film was done as a parody of itself. Save money and watch it when it streams.. it is a one-time watch film.

title: Lame parody
text: A pathetic, 2 very long hours of lame parody...A " how to destroy a fanbase" manual. I will carefully avoid any Marvel movie from now on, and I used to be a fan.The line in the movie : " people need to be entertained" is very true, but don't assume all are idiots...

title: Too Short and Fast-Paced and Too Much Komdi
text: I haven't felt this much disappointment in years regarding MCU movies, and I didn't even expect much after the mediocre reviews. I was really excited back when I first heard the news of Christian Bale joining the movie, but just as I expected, he had little screen time and the script focused more on the comedy and throwing jokes at us every second than give us a good story.Like I'm sorry, but did I miss something, or did Gorr only have 3 or 4 brief scenes before his first actual encounter and conversation with Thor? Like it felt like he had even less screen time than Hela. He had only 3 minutes of "origin story" and "characterization" in the beginning and that's it, he doesn't come back until nearly 40 or 50 minutes into the film. Really really hate it and am disappointed in how they did not give the minimum characterization to this villain, or even to Jane for that matter. It felt like they deleted at least 10 minutes of Gorr origin from the beginning. The whole movie felt like it was a recap of a 3 hour or at least a 2:30-hour movie. Like it doesn't feel like a movie at all, and it's all because of the mediocre script.It's the same with the Jane situation; we're just thrown into her story and it doesn't get the development it deserves because of the short runtime and there's just a tiny little bit of emotional attachment to this character and not the amount of attachment the movie wants you to have. And it's because of the mediocrely written scrip, it's because of the short runtime that has lots of times for Thor goofing around with the Guardians and joking, and not establishing its villain and giving him proper screen time and giving him and Jane good characterization.The whole script is written so weirdly that it feels like it's only included the plot points but not the establishing scenes and the essential "let the scene breathe" scenes. The whole events of the movie happen so fast and they are joined together in a way that doesn't feel natural or like an actual movie, it doesn't feel like this movie has 3 acts, it feels like 1 or maybe 2 acts. And I keep saying "feel" because it's my opinion after all and I don't want to present them as objective facts.I guess some of the scenes and jokes are funny, but it's so overdone that looks like the movie was written by a teenager for 5-year-olds. Of course, I knew that the movie was gonna have lots of comedy because Ragnarok made Thor popular again and they found their golden formula with Thor, but I didn't expect them to turn Thor into a goofball. What is it with their obsession to turn every character into a Star-Lord and a Guardians of the Galaxy character? Thor was perfect in Infinity War, the Russo brothers knew what they were doing and they knew how to balance comedy and serious, and that's why all of their movies are 8/10 or more for me and that's the reason their movies are the top fan favorites among all the MCU movies.When you think about it, the story and plot structure of this movie is not too dissimilar from Ragnarok, but for some reason, that movie that was also 2 hours, felt like an actual movie, but this one doesn't. So maybe they should've kept the writers?It's funny that Taika said they have the best villain in the MCU, while I feel like even Malekith that I don't remember anything about, had better characterization and origin?! Like after watching the movie, all I can say about the character of Gorr, is that "he had a daughter and now he doesn't" and that's it. And this was supposed to be "the best villain ever"?! Even the most forgettable villain from MCU, Ghost from Ant-Man 2 had better characterization time and origin. Like I actually don't understand how they thought showing Gorr for 2 minutes at the beginning, without even showing what actually happened to him and his daughter and giving us a proper characterization, and then making him show up again after 40 minutes is good writing and good characterization and is gonna make the audience care. Baffling. I don't understand why they are deleting so much from the movies and making them only 2 hours that feel rushed and that they need more time for characterization and developing the plots and the characters, when they literally made the best-selling movie of all time with Endgame that was 3 hours? Even Spider-Man No Way Home had more than 2 hours of run time. So why not give Doctor Strange and Thor more time so they don't feel rushed!? At least Doctor Strange 2 still felt like an actual movie with a three-act structure and knew not everything has to be a joke. (Although arguably some of the most cringiest jokes of MCU were from that movie)Another thing I'm disappointed in is Michael Giacchino's music for this movie. I may have not expected much from this movie, but I had really high hopes for the music. And don't get me wrong, the piece is an absolute banger of a theme, but I expected at least 2 or 3 more themes? They uploaded the theme before the movie came out and I thought it was good and that there was also gonna be more in the movie, but it wasn't? It's just 2 or 3 other variations of the same theme? Really? That's it? Just one theme for the whole movie which occasionally is played as a sad and somber variation? I know that Doctor Strange 2016's themes were also mostly variations of the main theme, but they sounded different enough and had more themes. But this one only has one theme and that's disappointing to me. I wasn't really a fan of his Batman theme too, felt too repetitive and nothing iconic or memorable. Even his No Way Home had like some good different themes. I still wish he composed for every one of these movies (not Black Panther of course) andSo pretty much every aspect of this movie is a disappointment.What these movies need is more time spent in pre-production and I'm talking about pre-vis for the action scenes, I'm talking about more time spent in the writing room improving the scripts. How can this multi-billion dollar company not find good writers? Maybe bring back Christopher Markus and Stephen McFeely? Because they seem to actually know how to write competent scripts that might have cringey jokes in them too, but have serious moments too and don't turn everything into a joke and rush things by cramming everything into 2 hours.Also, have we not gotten tired of villains summoning minions and demon creatures to fight for them and they just sit far behind and watch?! Even Hela had a decent fight scene with the Asgardian army in Ragnarok and that me feel like at least they will do a good fight scene with Gorr, but they didn't?! Like do they not realize how boring it is to introduce an already underdeveloped villain with bad characterization and laughably bad origin scene, only to have him sit somewhere and just summon demons to fight for him? Like imagine if instead of Captain America jumping into the battle with his shield and fighting the bad guys, he just stood there and sent some random guys to fight for him. Or instead of Thor going around with his hammer and defeating enemies, he just summoned some kids to fight for him... oh! That was actually one of the coolest scenes though, but you get what I mean.My disappointment with Gorr is immeasurable and my day is ruined.In conclusion, Gorr had a horrible origin story (his origin is ok, but not presented well. Might as well just write his origin on a black screen and not show anything) and worse characterization. He made decisions so quickly and changed his motivation and his mind so quickly and so many times like a teenager who doesn't know what he wants. Jane had a bad characterization too because the short run time didn't allow her story to become more developed and they could've presented her story in a better way. The action scenes are nice but what is action good for when you have a really bad script? Thor is turned into a more goofball and an idiot than he was before. The music is nice but only has one theme. Gorr has really awful screen time. The movie doesn't feel like an actual film. There are not 3 acts here, it feels like one act. Too short and rushed and nothing gets developed in this short run time. They have time for jokes but not actual character and plot development and decent characterization.Thoroughly disappointed in the villain and everything else, and I would've ignored some of the other problems if Gorr was actually well-written, had a good origin story of more than 5 minutes, actual good characterization and development, and much, much more screen time than this.
