title: Worst Marvel movie ever.
text: This movie is so bad it is the worst Marve movie ever. Even Ms Marvel was better... I strongly advice this director to change it's carrear since directing is just not for him.

title: The worst marvel movie ever .The film itself is a joke
text: The movie feels like it trying to put joke forcefully where it should do that .It does not feel like marvel movies. In phase 4 the worst movies .It does not deserve 2star also but for Christan Bala acting giving 2star. The film is joke itself.

title: Bore: Crud and Blunder
text: A confetti cannon of stupidity.My working theory is they have a program that can go through a screenplay in detect story, character development and good ideas and can highlight and filter those and delete them and replace those items with goat jokes lots and lots of screaming goat jokes.

title: The only thing exciting here is Christian Bale.
text: Terrible movie. Was a fan of Watiti but he has burned on this. Wasted Bale's talent. Thor is totally emasculated and it's apparent Hemsworth is just cashing it in. Don't waste money on this.

title: Worst Marvel Movie Ever.
text: Not even sure where to start. I like the humor marvel adds to it's movies...it's quick one liners and such. They tried to make this a complete comedy? Made Thor ridiculous.

title: The worst Marvel movie ever!
text: It likes a bad comedy movie than a Thor movie. Direction and storyline is horrible. As many said it looks like a parody than a movie. Please MCU, don't make such movies.

title: A children's movie
text: This had potential: Actually a lot of it. A plenty good cast, the right tone of being "retro fun" and not taking itself too seriously, yet it pretty much failed. If I were a kid, I'd probably like it, because it has quite some moments children would enjoy; Yet the fact some monsters are quite literally slashed in half makes me wonder if they would be allowed to watch it.One of the weakest entries in the MCU, sadly. And that's not even talking about the wokeness; Did you ever wonder how the rock-people reproduce? Doesn't matter, they will tell you. It has absolutely nothing to do with the story, it really is just "sprinkled" into it. Why? I don't know. If it at least would've been wholesome, but it was just weird.

title: Wasted Potential
text: Natalie Portman and Christian Bale carry this movie, and it's a shame because not enough time is properly dedicated to either of their characters' tragedies. While nothing in this made me laugh, there are a few moments that stand out as hints of what this blending of tragic stories could've been.As a side note: No amount of ill-timed narration/monologuing will ever get me to buy into Jane & Thor's relationship.

title: Oh so bad
text: What a disjointed piece of work. I really liked or loved all the other Thor movies. This one has no rhyme or reason. Why where characters there and what where they supposed to be there for? The funny one with Hulk in it was funny. This one tried to do the same and went over the top stupid. It just didn't work. I'd rather see a serious end of the world drama scenario than this attempt at humor So sad and disappointing. I'm hoping that they regroup and take a look at what they've done here. Then attack the next episode with some changes that continue the story without having to resort to this type of foolishness.

title: Thor Love and Chunder
text: This film took everything that was awesomen about the Gorr and Thor series of comics and with the help of Taika White ET produce a steaming pile of goat droppings Absolute waste of an incredible opportunity, they might as well just handed the production to the Karens at Sylvia Young theatre school and Empress Karen herself Kathleen Kennedy... Stinky toes down.... I honestly hooe this gets rebooted.

title: Thor The Dark World > Thor love and thunder
text: Wasted my time ,energy and money on this one.Multiverse was quite disappointing and this one just levelled up the field of disappointments. They tried to make it funny and turned it into a joke. Potential of Actors like Christian Bale was wasted. The Dark World now seems better than this failed comedy film.

title: Worst thor movie ever!! Including dark world
text: Thor is one the OG Avengers and if his movie is such mediocre what should be expect from other marvel movies in pipeline. Christan bale was such a great actor gorr was such a great villain but they didn't utilise this to the maximum.

title: Worst Movie I have Ever Seen
text: This is a poorly written, poorly acted movies whose only redeeming quality was the antagonist. The creator clearly was so focused on infusing the movie with wokeness that they forgot to have a plot. Terrible show.

title: What Can I Say
text: Boring movie, forced agenda, more of the same. Hope they stop trying to make things that way. I don't have 150 characters, so I'm just writing anything here.

title: 2 screaming goats and a terrible illness
text: To be very frank, i had to push myself to get through this. Lost too many people due to that illness and it scares the crap out of me.So i really couldn't enjoy this this. Perhaps it was the point, with all the dark, colourless monsters and world. And perhaps it was one big metaphor.But the people i lost, who i was constantly reminded off didn't have a happy ending, or ended up in a better place. They are just gone and we are left with a black hole.So i am not sure what to make of this. I will not be watching this one again. Ever.For me it should have been more clear what this was about before i went in.

title: Not good!
text: This was definitely a huge step backwards for Marvel. Some comedy is good, but this forced humor everywhere! Gorr was the only good part and he wasn't even in the movie much for one of the best villains in Marvel.

title: Appalling
text:
I was absolutely devastated I'd bought a ticket to see this show. Every attempt of adult humour was an epic fail, I didn't just feel disappointed, it was embarrassing to watch. The frequent
use of the word s*it was tiresome and so in appropriate. A big name like Russell Crowe involved in such a poor movie surprised me.and I'm still thinking about how disappointed i was 3 days later as top gun was on and In hindsight I would have sooner watched again as my friend hadn't seen it, He suggested Thor rather than me watching top gun again. I apologised to him after knowing he could have seen top gun instead ðŸ¤¦ How this movie scored 6.4/10 mystifies me. Don't subject yourself to it...

title: The mighty Waititi
text: Thor love and thunder is one of the funniest and simple MCU movie.Christian bale Plays villain gorr really fascinating.His character add a depth in the movie.However story itself is quite simple and easygoing.All back stories were explained very quick. Who is this, why it's happened.They used majority time of this movie just Tails Waititing.Loved it. Feel I can watch it again and again.Just only tiny wish I can have from this movie is use more keys from previous movies.Don't just add new things like bang bang bang.We walked through decade with these characters.We want to know more step by step explore their story.But overall I really loved it.

title: New Zealand is a country of some great talent
text: New Zealand has brilliant music bands, great actors, and some great productions. 7 Periods with Mr Gormsby is one of my favourite TV series: it's intelligent, hilarious, witty, and not afraid to pull punches. You see similar wit in Flight of the Concords.Then you've got anything Taika Waititi. He is the opposite of everything I mentioned. Think of him as New Zealand's lowest common denominator. In the first 30 minutes, I counted one character in Thor: LaT that I liked (Stellan Skarsgard, who appeared for 10 seconds).I say the following in all seriousness. If you are of reasonable intelligence, do not watch this film without some form of mind-altering substance. You will need something to dull the pain.Generally speaking, I don't walk out through a film. I made an exception here. This was dreadful, not funny, and utterly low brow.I scored 3/10 because I saw that the general production was reasonable. The story and acting was dreadful.

title: Expecting bad turns out worse
text: Nobody every wasted Christian bale like this movie did,, bale and his character both wasted. In attempt to copy previous film they screwed storyline characters everything.

title: The terrible, horrible, no good, awful, nasty....... sequel.
text: All previous Thor movies were awesome derivations of the ancient Scandinavian myths and Marvel comics adaptations. They had style, great story telling, Marvel cinematic magic, awesome humor and soundtracks, and believable round characters.Thor: Ragnarok was an awesome movie.... although a far cry from Scandinavian myth - still.... Taika Waititi did a great job of telling the story - with a lot of awesome humor.Still...... Thor: Love and Thunder was a bust. Very little cinematic greatness at all. This movie was a black mark on every 'A' actor in the movie. The story was corny, cheesy, sacrilegious, disgusting, and worst of all....... not remotely entertaining. Very poor quality in every way.This movie does whatever it can to promote Disney's newfound socio-sexual politics - and to foist them on every child that is subjected to this wanton drivel. Clearly, the only purpose of this movie is to make Disney money - while destroying ancient myth, basic human values, the very concept of faith and trust, any type of traditional societal norms, and sadly....... classic storytelling. Thankfully, I didn't pay one red cent to watch this movie, and Disney made zero money from my viewing.May this movie be the beginning of the end for all new Disney/Marvel ventures - since they have willfully divorced themselves from the values and beliefs of their core audience (and everything their core audience stands for).

title: The movie was fun, but...
text: The constant swearing and innuendo feel like it was just added in the script by a giggling middle schooler and was more annoying than actually contributing anything.On top of that the fact that the stories in these movies don't make sense anymore and are filled with "Why would they do that?" moments. I miss movies having stories that were interesting rather than trying so hard to surprise the audience that they've become completely predictable.Then there are all the blatant moments inserted just to check the boxes to fit certain political ideologies. At least try to make it relevant to the story if you are going to throw it in.

title: Just meh with an annoying taika narration
text: This voice over of taika is super annoying. The rest of the movie is just meh. It is all over the place and a lot of obviously comedic moments shoehorned in. Not great... It is difficult to point out really great points in this movie besides Christian Bale. Chris Hemsworth is just an average actor but we knew that. Even Nathalie, who i generally tend to like in movies, is just meh in this movie. Most of it looks weird and off. I dont know what could have saved this movie but I like the quote of Chris Hemsworth as he described this movie as made by a child. I completely agree with it as there seems to be no structure, overly "comedic" stuff and just too much leaning on things that have nothing to do with the story.

title: Thunderously Bad
text: Marvel Cinemas have lost their magic. The studio has become so greedy and it has flooded the superhero movie market with garbage not worth watching. Each movie has been worse than it's predecessor and the quality has been lacking.There are no more Iron Man or Captain America quality movies anymore.I did not know if there would be a movie worse than Captain Marvel, but Morbius proved me wrong. I did not think you could get worse, but this Thor was the bottom of the Marvel universe.Natalie Portman is so bad in this movie - even more wooden than she was in Star Wars. It also did not help that the dialogue felt childish.

title: Hard to Watch
text: The overall plot of the movie was fantastic but the humor throughout the movie made it an absolute cringe to watch. This movie does not compare to any of the MCU movies thus far. Imagine the momentary jokes in each individual MCU film. Now combine them all and times that by ten. Just when you think there is a moment of seriousness... nope. Think again. I feel if this continues in other MCU movies, it will be the downfall of Marvel as a whole.

title: Christian Bale was amazing
text: Well Thor is become serious joke ! It's seems like Christmas movie for children, everything is joke joke and more joke, this character needs strength and seriousness, he is not comedian after all. However Christian Bale is the reason for 3 stars otherwise doesn't even deserve a star. Just watch it if you have really really have free time.

title: The MCU's Disaster
text: I never could've think that this film was going to be worse than the trailer. Good things about this movie? The soundtrack is amazing, for sure. The colours are stunning and the CGI on this thing is pretty good. And that's it. The story is super standart-ish and the comedy is very mediocre. Everything that happens in this movie is super predictable, and that could not be a bad thing, but it is on this film. The characters appear to have their personality destroyed. There were many ways to insert in there many cameos to make the movie better, but that didn't happen.

title: No entertainment at all
text:
Doesnt looks like watching Marvel movie.They not worked as Stanley.Not even strong graphics , no special turns, as Marvel normally do, disappointed by watching Thor LnT
RIP Stamley.

title: Utter Disappointment
text: It was painful to watch the revered character Thor, the way he was treated in this movie. Felt like a puppet in the hand of pseudo feminists. It felt like the script was written by a gen z teenager who as zero knowledge about the mythology and culture. It felt blasphemous to the believe the millennials have grownup with reading comics and watching movies of MCU golden age. Even after gaining too much power and wisdom from the struggle against the evil sister Hela and Avengers Infinity stones, Thor was depicted weak, stupid and discombobulated. I did not watched the trailer, to avoid any spoiler and I was confident about the Thor movies that I would not fail to amaze us.

title: Did they try to destroy a franchise on purpose ?
text:
I seldom write reviews, if ever but ...
This is probably the weakest movie in the MCU so far.All character built up for Thor in the previous movies, and now almost
completely destroy him. Thor is supposed to be a God for f. Sake.This whole movie felt to me like a parody movie of itself.Highly disappointed, hope they learn their lesson fast or the whole Marvel franchise is in dire danger.

title: well...i'm glad i'm not alone in thinking that this movie was painful to sit through...
text:
I don't know what they producers were thinking, going along with this script. Seems to be made for the 12 and under crowd. Lame...lame...lame.Lots of jokes. Not funny jokes, but lots OF them...
why they thought this guy should direct a Marvel movie is beyond. And it's REALly apparent, from SO many of the reviews, that i'm not even CLOSE to being alone in my disappointment and frustration...
the guy made one overrated, overhyped movie. And i was waiting for something as entertaining as something like an Avenger movie. Look at the cast, for the God's sake...how could they MISS? The answer is, no script worth working with, although the actors really seemed to be giving it their best.I'll be reading reviews first before going and spending my money, in these recession times, on any more Marvel movies.I can't believe they tricked people into making triple the money they sank into the movie...i guess NONE of us read the reviews beforehand, figuring 'how can it be bad? It's THOR!'.

title: Cheesy bad
text: So disappointing. With only a few exceptions (and the reason for a "2" instead of a "1"), the humor completely misses the mark. It boasts a solid cast in mostly established characters, yet they are wasted on a rough story with too much corny dialog. Christian Bale was a solid performance with a worthy backstory for his character. Natalie Portman's return was overdue and welcome but her integration was clunky. Chris Hemsworth is a great Thor but is embracing too much goofy behavior. Saving grace was we didn't spend the money to see it in theater. One hour and fifty eight minutes of my life I won't get back.

title: One of the worst Marvel movies...
text: Ever since James Gunn came crashing through with Guardians, Marvel has doubled down on the sarcastic slapstick style of Marvel movies with bad timed sarcastic jokes and tone deaf jokes at the expense of some great heartfelt scenes that were derailed by idiotic sarcasm and mockery of tragedy.This movie is no different, well sort of. It's devoid of any actual depth. So many bad scenes, it's like some child with zero focus wrote this movie, it's really that bad. The movie is another vehicle to push forth the eventual team up that Marvel loves to do, but lately, they've been firing blanks with their movies.Shang-Chi felt forced and had so many awful scenes, but because it's the first Asian lead super-hero movie out right now, it's hard for people to actually call it a bad movie, out of fear they'll be called racist. I'm a POC and I will tell you straight up, that movie is awful too.So is Eternals, Dr Strange 2, and even Spider-Man's last outing is less about Spider-Man and again, about him being the big sad about Stark and later, another loved one. Marvel just can't help themselves with their movies lately, it's become very little about actual character development and more about the jokes and just churning these movies out. They started quite well, but near the end of the whole End Game saga, you could see that they were running out of good ideas. I can see why James Gunn is also leaving after the last GOTG movie, at least with DC he has options, Marvel really only wants the same cookie cutter crap to push the next Avengers style of movie.I can't help but laugh at the Marvel's Suicide Squad type of team up that was just announced...Marvel, do better.

title: The worse Marvel movie I ever seen
text: I had hard horrible comments about this movie. I decide to see it in streaming. Well, my friends were right. Here the thor character (and most others) is ridiculous. All the "supposed" funny lines are good for children under 10. It is a movie addressed only to children and in my opinion hurts Thor character. The director (and the writers) should take as example the humour from guardian galaxy that can be appreciated at every age. It is worrying this decision that could be interpreted like the decision to focus the Marvel movie target only on children like I'm noting with star trek saga. Also the use of children is typical of Disney movie: often inappropriate to be enjoyed from adults too.

title: Worst MCU movie by far
text: This movie feels like a cheap high school play. The dialogs are bad, the acting is very bad, everything. Too silly for my taste. This movie had a lot to be a great movie. When you think of the plot, it's a great plot. But the movie turns out to be a comedy, and a bad one. This is not the Thor presented in The Avengers. Not even the one from the first Thor movie. I can only praise Christian Bale's performance. Not even Natalie Portman, who I love to see in movies. The fight scenes were pretty good. For me is the worst MCU movie by far. I canot understand how Marvel could let this movie out lie this. It is a joke. And it saddens me because my family and me are huge fans of all the Marvel movies. Not even my son, 11 y/o, like it.

title: THOR: Love and Thunder it'd a Frizzle
text: Thanks to having Disney+ I painfully sat and watched this bomb blow up in my face, yep! It was painful, it seems I was sitting on PINS and NEEDLES. Knew I should have put them away.The question I have is this, what in hell is going on over at Marvel Studios, Their MCU Phase 4, I believe they call this version of Thor. The story writers had no vision, the script writers had a story without a vision, the Director, really had no direction for this train wreck to go. This movie is so boring, you can actually take a power nap, wake and still be bored.I thought Raggie Rock was bad, this movie is so bad it makes Ragnarok look like a masterpiece, Nah, just kidding. This movie was neither funny, or adventurous.This is one of those movies, Marvel makes to pad their already bulging bank accounts. Please stop making bad movies, but then to, I could use another power nap. Hey, if you are reading this before watching the movie, I would tell you to save your time, then to, why should I be the only one bored, and disappointed in Marvel Studios, yet again.

title: What Age Is This For?
text: It was like watching an long Saturday Night Live skit. It was full of jokes and it seems like nothing was serious.Christian Bale did great (as usual)... but everyone else was "not good".Also, they know kids are watching this yet they use the word "ORGY" multiple times. Why? Why does that need to be added? Did not know it was in there so it was awesome having my 13- year old daughter asking me about it... (sarcasm). Then they want to show brief nudity... didn't need to happen.You can just tell they are shifting everything to be more woke - this may be one of my last Marvel movies to watch... well, was fun while it lasted.

title: Poor Actors
text: I am a huge fan of the MCU and never in a month of Sundays did I imagine I could walk out of a Thor movie. But I did. Disappointed does not begin to describe it. I write no more lest I insult those who liked it (which is not my intention).

title: So bad
text: I thought this movie was a disappointment. Marvel always seemed to do Thor wrong. The first Thor was bad, the second was better. Ragnaock was the best of them, but this movie was garbage. I almost fell asleep.I should've listened to my gut and waited for it on Disney+

title: This is literally parody
text:
Listen, this is literally a parody of what Thor used to be, the entire movie is full of bad repetitive jokes and nothing is took seriously.The major characters are depicted as a joke, their death is something "funny"
The entire story of the characters, their powers and thier iconic weapons are now a subject of jokes.I was very disappointed, it was good to watch some movie from a universe I enjoyed watching but I can sense a bitter taste after this circusListen, this is literally a parody of what Thor used to be, the entire movie is full of bad repetitive jokes and nothing is took seriously.The major characters are depicted as a joke, their death is something "funny"
The entire story of the characters, their powers and thier iconic weapons are now a subject of jokes.I was very disappointed, it was good to watch some movie from a universe I enjoyed watching but I can sense a bitter taste after this circus.

title: Why ruin this character's legacy with THIS?
text: From the first minute it is painful, non amusing (yet trying so hard to be) rubbish. I can only imagine what they spent on actors fees to get so many faces in the movie (ok i did chuckle seeing Matt Damon as the Asgardian Thesbian...but I am sure i see Mr Damon doing such cameos on so many movies these days).It seems like the writers have tried to make a joke out of every scene, but have never written comedy before.Just the sight of Crowe playing a chubby Zeus Playboy brightened things up... but that was not enough.All in all, a colourful take on Thor, which falls very short and makes Ragnarok look like a masterpiece (which it certainly is not)

title: Polar opposite of Thor:Ragnarok
text: Everything you loved about Ragnarok is so overdone here - I wanted to get up and walk out of the theater 15 minutes in. Wait! I was watching this at home - even worse 'cause now I can't just go home! It was that bad. Terrible script and plot, and it was not well executed. As everyone said, Christian Bale is the highlight of the movie, everything else falls short. Even Hemsworth was made to look like a foolish hero. The Guardians cameo was absolutely horrible! I thought maybe this was some dream sequence and they were just doing a parody of themselves and then it would get serious. No, this was the movie, as it was written! Ruined Sith, and really ruined Zeus! How did something like this ever get made? Who thought it was a good idea? I'm starting to think I'm still rating it too high...

title: The rear shot is only reason to watch
text: It was almost a parody of the other Thor movies. Like 10 year olds wrote it. Too many bad jokes and not enough story. It felt like they were gonna stop and say to the audience, "Look, we're so sorry, but we've got nothing. We just wrote ideas on a dart board and tossed darts." Natalie Portman as "Thorette" was insulting to the real talent she has in good movie. Chris even seemed to not really be into it. They made Thor act like a jerk. He lost the girl and his hammer, got an ax. Ax was jealous of the hammer. The role of Zeus needed to be someone more buff than Hemsworth. It was just painful to see a great franchise fail.

title: That was horrible
text: The only reason its not a 1 or 2 is because of Christian Bale. His character was pretty shallow too but his acting saved it and pretty much saved the whole movie too.Not even worth to write too much about it: simply a very bad movie....same page with the new Jurrasic Park movie.A bad mix of Expendables, Man in Black, 80s horrors - thats rather embarrassing, than scary - and a bad version of Monty Python. Horrible script, unfunny jokes, shallow characters.Thankfully waited til it arrived on Disney+ and did not waste money on cinema...The downfall of Marvell is significant since Endgame.

title: Nadir of MCU
text: I can't think of a worse superhero film. Reminded me of The Fantastic Four. It is supremely boring, with not a single action sequence worthy of being discussed and with characters that are as shallow as a puddle. It is hard to believe that a director as creative as Watiti has cone up with such tripe. He gave a thrilling new direction to Thor series with Ragnarok. Here, the film is so jaded. I have my sympathies with those who saw this in theatre. But spare a thought for those like me, who saw it or would be seeing at home. It is torturous for all of us. Easily the nadir of Marvel cinematic universe.

title: Pricey Cartoon Not Worth Your Time - Thor: Love and Thunder
text: If this had been the cartoon movie it should have been, I would have given it four, and maybe even five stars. But actors acting like cartoon characters do nothing but make the final product.....cartoonish. A marvel comic book from the 60s is more entertaining than this film. Every sequence is overdone; every line of dialogue is painful to listen to. Everything is a joke, so no one takes the plot seriously. I felt pretty much the same about the original film, but it was certainly much better than this exercise in the obvious. I could not recommend that anyone spend their hard-earned money on stuff you could see on TV reruns of cartoons. Pass on this one.

title: I wanted to enjoy this film but there was something off about it
text: I have to admit, I had low expectations going into this film. The quality of Taika Waititi's movies have been downgrading steadily. I'm a huge fan of his earlier work but you can tell his heart's not in it anymore. Either that, or this is a case of 'too many cooks' as this film was a weird mess.In terms of visuals, it was quite a stunning film. I didn't find it particularly cohesive in terms of visuals. There was a touch of bitter irony in the hyper-saturated nature of it all. It felt like a tired fever dream.There was too much Korg. Enough said there.Probably a little heavy on the humour too in order to mask the deficiencies in plot, substance, character development, etc.There was something about this film that was too cynical for my liking. The world is a very cynical place right now, and I understand how this can spill into art. However, this film felt like a very half-hearted attempt at entertainment.

title: Marvel on a slow and steady decline
text: A terrible movie with far too much comic slap humour and terrible characters in this movie. When I was first watching the film, I thought it was some sort of joke but I was willing to give it a go, the film is watchable just about but it gets even more ridiculous as the film goes on and on and on.Christian Bale's character as the God Slayer turns out to be nothing more than a child kidnapper which is just weird I was hoping to see Beta Ray bill, but alas he did not show up in this film.I would not recommend this film compared to the last instalment and just proves that Marvel is now on a decline.

title: Excellent Soundtrack, Terrible movie
text: Disappointment is the first word that comes to mind when this movie is mentioned.A great soundtrack can't make up for everything else. The movie looks more like some kind of parody, but it's just not funny. The jokes get tiresome and the movie is too childish, just disappointing.Christian Bale tried his best, but even he can't save this movie from mediocrity. I've skipped a few Marvel movies, because they kept getting worse and worse, and this movie convinced me to skip a few more.The film bores the viewer with unnecessary things instead of giving him good entertainment. The jokes in the movie are just not funny, they're boring, and the script could have been better.Unfortunately, the film turned out to be a complete waste of time. The cast is solid, the soundtrack is great, but that's about it.It's a shame, this could have been really great, and it turned out like this, just another disappointment.

title: This can't be the actual movie
text: This movie appears to be a parody of the actual movie. Maybe the reviews over 3 saw the film, if someone can point where the actual movie is available for viewing... thanks.Hmm.. too short. Has Marvel been revamped executively? If so, new hires need to be replaced. I don't know what they're going for. If not, someone should probably reach out and find out what's going on. The movie I tried to watch left me feeling awkward and wistful. It felt like watching someone trying to do what they were good at but no longer can. Marvel, take a break. Don't be greedy because I don't think your audience is going to keep watching this deterioration which defeats the purpose.Direction and screenwriting hands this film over to the bin.

title: How could you possibly waste Christian Bale?
text: Yes, It is visually stunning, the screenplay is fast-paced, and it's good to see Thor and his compatriots back in action, but what it lacks is profundity or substance so to speak. Despite having one of the fiercest villains i.e. Gorr (The God Butcher) at your disposal, how could you possibly ruin it?I mean, you had a performer like Christian Bale to play this character yet still you decided to not give him sufficient screen space? And for what? To make him look like nothing but a trivial expansion in your cinematic universe? Why? What were you thinking? Look, I do appreciate what you guys have done with Thor or Dr. Jane Foster, or even with Valkyrie, but what you have done to Gorr is inexcusable, I will not forgive.Moreover, I saw many others had conveyed their disapproval regarding the tonality of the film which did lean more towards a lighter, less gritty route and I too happen to have the same complaint. Just try to imagine this being darker and more serious; things could have turned out a whole lot better, I guess.

title: The worst Thor movie so far
text: It's not terrible like Wonder Woman 1984 or a complete mess like Black Widow. It does have some good gags and the budget is high enough so that it largely looks big and flashy. I did laugh a few times and no scene was lazily made. But this is a waste of time.I think the scene where they put in 2 gay relationships via the dialogue kinda says it all. It's where I knew the movie wasn't going anywhere. You can usually spot a bad movie by what it tries to be. Modern Marvel movies can be great if they focus on the comic universe and a clear story. But today most of them are just given to a director or producer. So you may get someone who wants to recreate a proper and great old story in the universe like Thor: Ragnarok that was a remake of a great cartoon. The first Thor movie was a start of the story overall. A small story set among real people. This instead if a mess. The director of Thor: Ragnarok now tried to make it into a full on progressive comedy so a lot of the powerful relationships and deep story turn into gags. Some gags do work, but it's just scene after scene being a gag. A ton of flashbacks and small scenes. With the story itself becoming a gag. It reminds me of the Ghostbusters reboot where they took the universe and made it into a giant joke focused on progressive values and feminism. I didn't hate the reboot, but I can see why fans of that universe hated it. So as I'm a fan of the Marvel universe I really dislike what they are doing to it here. This movie focused on female Thor and overall progressive values instead of trying to expand the Thor universe. It's catering to the ignorant masses who buy movie tickets because the movie is progressive. The female Thor even calls herself Thor for some reason. What a mess. At least give her another uniform and another name. Thor is the name of a male god in the Norse mythology. There are PLENTY of female names you could use here. Just have the same character with another name. They do next to nothing with her anyhow so what's the point? It's like the last James Bond movie where they made agent 007 into a Black woman. Why? Call her 008 and that's just fine. Don't lazily reuse an old character to score some cheap points.The movie also fails as much here is created from ground up. There are new gods, a new significant secret key, even the old characters are now comedic so their old personalities are gone. A lot of the story is now gags and progressive scenes with the old universe taking a backseat. Thor: The Dark World (2013) being much better than this movie says it all as it was universally disliked. Even though I didn't hate everything about this movie there are so many pointless cringe scenes that it definitely takes away from the universe. I have no need to watch more Thor movies and I regret watching this one.By the way. Some of the kid actors are horrible. There is a Black kid who is given a female name for some gag reason. He was horrible. Absolutely a mess in every scene. Which is weird as the director made the fairly fun Hunt for the Wilderpeople (2016) with a kid actor and has many other movies with boy actors. So what went wrong? I think everyone was just being lazy here.

title: Another disappointing effort by Marvel
text: Thor: Love and Thunder spends too much time trying to be a comedy without actually being funny. It works with the Deadpool films but not so much with Thor. They need to focus more on the drama, and what's with the Guns N' Roses fascination? It's sad when the DC film that came out this year (The Batman) is better than any of the Marvel films (Morbius, Doctor Strange and the Multiverse of Madness or Thor: Love and Thunder).

title: Wth is this? How they have even right to destroy a movie like this?
text:
So much forced stupid jokes, stupid storyline, complete waste of charaters and audience time. I was so hype to see another thor movie but director must have been high. I wanna forget that this movie even happend.They ruined Thor...
1/10.

title: Marvel? What?
text: Entirely non-innovative. Attempts to be constantly funny at the expense of tension but falls flat, with maybe one or two jokes landing. I was holding out hope that the MCU would pull together some large scale event in the future but I think it is safe to say the infinity saga was the last great era we had from them.

title: I don't write reviews
text: Like I said,I don't write reviews but this one is special. This has to be one of the worst superhero movies in the mcu,period. It felt like a bunch of school kids wrote the story. Even Black Widow is better. The mcu has fallen and it is really sad. The only good thing that came out of phase four of marvel is probably Spider-man,Chang chi and maybe doctor strange. The series they released was all so weak except Wanda vision,Loki and again maybe moon knight and that is about it. The mcu has some big holes to fill because they have butchered Thor,but still can't wait for Thor 5. O yeah,and the only good thing about this movie was Christian Bale. It was a total waist of his talent as an actor. I could say the same about Chris Hemsworth and Nately Portman. Director,Taiki watiti(Sorry if I spelled that wrong) is great but this movie is a hit and miss.

title: I want my money back!
text: I was so eagerly waiting for this Thor movie to release but later just straightway disappointed myself. The hall felt silent and all those who came didn't even clapped even for a single moment. Also just after the movie people left with this biblical nonsense which we waited for years.

title: Very silly movie! Disappointing.
text: The humour is poor and far too much of it. It is hard to take Thor seriously in this movie. He becomes the dumb blonde of the MCU. It's as though this is supposed be a parody of Superheroes rather than a serious movie with some comedy.

title: Movie fueling an ego
text: Clearly made fot chris' ego and familiy.Samen could be a lot better.I hate it. After thor ragnarok, which was great. This one is a joke.Fortunately we have bale and Portman znd thompsen to keep the movie great. If it was not for them, it would have been worse.It ie clear that chris wanted his family to be in the movie and him to be painted as great. It hurts the movie and story. And crowe with a bad Italian accent is Just a joke. I hope they wont be stupid enough to work further from this move and hope it ends here. They should have saved jane and go from there. Pity... dont waste your money on it.

title: Worst thor movie in all thor movies
text: The film fails to connect you from the story everything seems a mess suddenly jane comes suddenly gor comes no backstory of what they were doing nothing. Guardians why they were there what was the point they serve nothing blank. Eternity was an entity who can think talk take decision in this movie he was more like wishing well for visitors what is shadow realm no clue. Thor can the best character in MCU but you guys ruining every character it seems sadly in some years marvel will be only for the age group of 6-12 just because they don't need logic, story, good acting in a movie.Kriby would be rolling in his grave to see this MCU.

title: Marvel does panto
text:
