title: Overrated
text: This movie was a silly spoof on itself. Weak story, weak characters, bad acting by mouth breather Christian Bale as usual. I gave it two stars because twice it made me chuckle. The rest the time I thought I was watching a children's movie. It's like Marvel ran out of stuff to make movies about so they just decided to make this one on the fly, figuring out the plot as it went along. It was ridiculously dumb and I would not recommend it unless you're under the age of 12 years old. This movie will go on the list of movies not to be seen ever again. The last sentence in this review is only because they require 600 words or more to finish the review.

title: How to waste potential
text: Thor: Love and Thunder has proven to be one of the many killer-movies in the past three years - a homicide of an entire franchise, the latest generation has grown up with. This film has craped itself off everything that made the previous movies great.The storyline is incoherent with childish introduction of characters(aside the introduction of Gorr - somewhat decent), amateur turn of events and incredibly boring comedy scenes, achieving nothing more than silent movie theaters, repleted with awkwardness.The degeneracy of the film is more noticeable when you realize the potential it had. Thor has just redeemed for his loved ones and has came back in his full glory, whilst a lone creature somewhere in the galaxy has no one. Gorr was a great villain to whirl the movie around, yet destroyed by a silly and goofy plot, that reminds me of a 10-minute-long cartoon.The only think keeping this move from a total disaster is the CGI(even though at some parts it looked like a home made movie), the make-up, the costumes, and the performance of our beloved actors. (Primary because of the 200 million dollar budget).This movie is worth watching only if you want to feel the disappointment and the melancholy of the wasted potential in your spleen.

title: Downfall of Marvel
text: I don't love Marvel I worship Marvel, but watching this and recent movies and tv series, you ask yourself "did tony stark died for this" ?Unjustified Action, first 5 minutes into the movies, a man was chosen to kill all gods for no reason. Lazy actors, cheesy script, bad jokes and again sorry for that UNJUSTIFIED actions, and game of thrones season 8 type of scriptwriting.This movie was meant to begin a new chapter in marvel new phase, but to be honest it shouldn't be done in first place.Shehulk twerk, ms. Marvel is a latina muslim kid although it had no relevance no importance to the story, people will hate what I'm saying but Disney for god sake "stop making gays characters that doesn't fit, stop making black characters that doesn't fit, stop making transgender characters because you want to deliver a subliminal message.Christian Bale you are a gem, being in Marvel is good, being in this Marvel movies wasn't a smart move.

title: Disney Gone Woke!
text: I refuse to watch this because Disney has gone Woke. It's a movie we need political agendas pushed in movies. I'm sure the movie is good and I love Chris Hemsworth but due to wokeness I won't be watching this.

title: Good Visuals
text: The visuals in the film is really good to watch and the effects in 3D are amazing. The performance from Chris Hemsworth sir is amazing and the amount of hardwork he put in this film can be realised while seeing him on screen.

title: Please give me back my 2 hours!
text: While the CGI and special effects were great, this movie lacks depth and a good story telling. They made all characters goofy as if they were written by kids, I wanna be specific but I'm trying to avoid spoilers, so I'll just cover the first layer.Jane has a touching story but it wasn't enough. I mean come on, we just have to believe that she's worthy without any solid backstory?Christian Bale was terrific as Gorr but his transformation was super fast and his purpose was pretty much meh. Such a waste, unfortunately, given that Gorr was scary and could be a much better villain if handed a well written script.Watching this feels like watching a 2 hour comedy skit, not a good one, but more of a forced comedy, because they tried so hard to be funny. I get that you want this movie to be acceptable for everyone, but don't embarrass Zeus as if he's a silly gullible man-child like that.Thor himself was also a joke. Granted, his skills in battlefield are second to none, I mean he could easily defeated an entire army if he wanted, but they made this character a bit too dumb and once again, silly.But then again, maybe this movie is just not for me. It's not my cup of tea. What do I know about movies? I'm just a random dude on the internet who has zero knowledges in cinema. But I'm still gonna ask Mr Waititi to give back my 2 hours though.

title: Ragnarok has come full circle
text: This has to be the most disappointing and least enjoyable Marvel film I've ever seen and I've seen every one at the cinema. First because of what it was and secondly because of what it should have been.I was a huge fan of Thor but I'm done with him now...If I didn't know better I would have said this was a Marvel Parody film. Thor was reduced to a hero without a braincell a far cry from the Thor was saw in Thor 1,2 and Infinity War. 80% of the jokes were cringe and what's worse, they were repeated over and over so you couldn't get away from them. Screaming goats? A love triangle between weapons? Yep!Christian Bale and The Mighty Thor (Lady) were wasted and could have been used much better as were all the other characters who came across as jokes. There is no point going into the story.The slippery slope that led to the demise of Thor started with Thor Ragnarock (The best rated and best selling Thor), it was elevated in Endgame but we could just about deal with it, but now they've come full circle and taken off all the restraints with Thor Love and Thunder.A complete character assassination and another Phase 4 Flop!

title: Close to being worse than Thor 2
text: Man this movie was so boring, I've watched the whole MCU movies and shows, this has to be among the bottom half for sure.You know that Christian Bale is always great, this is no exception, Marvel villains are pretty much always dull, but this was decent to be honest( mostly because of Bale) but the script was not great, felt like we needed more Gorr torture to the other gods, and action between him and Thor, and less forced comedy. The Thor character in the MCU although it can make you laugh at times and feels strong, it needs to be that powerful God of Thunder that it once was.I was trying not to fall asleep at the movies, felt like this really didn't add much for the MCU, other than the end. Close to being worse than Thor 2.

title: Directed and Written by Taika Watiti
text: Don't waste your time going to the theaters for this one, just wait until it's free somewhere like on an airplane. Marvel has always been the one to favor quantity over quality, so horrible it has been a major influence to every single Hollywood flick of you haven't noticed. If you're looking for cheap one show pony jokes with no luster, this might be the movie for you. I'm never ever going to the theaters for a Marvel labeled movie again.

title: How much did Chris' soul cost?
text: What a horrible movie. The only usefulness this movie provides to humanity is the historical accuracy of the utter morally depraved nature of our societies.In this movie you get everything that is the current age, enjoy.The goofiness of Thor (because we need to break stereotypes by humiliating men and with it most of the fanbase) is stupid and childishly immature, it makes you wonder what age the creators of this movie are. They for sure cannot be mature grown ups with a wise outlook on life, everything is set up simple and without a true guiding theme where everything that happens or most of it happens for a reason revealed later in the movie.

title: Why???
text: Why waste Christain bales performance? Way to much woke crap! Just stick to marvel no need for the gay and "sexual identities" it's pathetic they just feel they need to incorporate it and all they did was ruin what should have been a good movie. Hemsworth does not disappoint story is good action is good but feels more like a garbage reach with unnecessary dialogue and identities. It's comical but the latest marvel movies to come out keep adding and incorporating useless needless sexual crap!!!!!! And anymore I go into the movie expecting disappointment and we'll it's getting worse and worse ....

title: Worse than WW84
text: WW84 wasn't good ,but watching this made me miss Chris Pine's forced appearance and his aged look, A flat ending and all those pointless action sequences.Also.. Gaurdians of Galaxy were their just to pull audience. They didn't contribute anything. That should be considered a crime in today's time.Christian Bale is absolute awesomeness, he wasn't given much screentime.Other than that, This is more like it's made for children by children. If Thor could have Shazamed his powers, why Hawkeye was running around with bow and arrows all this time. They also wasted Russell Crowe as Zeus, He was fun to watch, I wish they used deleted scenes instead.

title: The beginning of the end for Thor movies
text: I wouldn't go as far as to say it isn't entertaining, but the story lacks emotion, the villain needed to be developed further(even though it was the best part of the movie) too much hype. It seemed like they tried too much too hard to make it funny and failed miserably, they tried to cram many things and failed to develop any of them, someone needed yo overview and focus on making one element work(almost made it with gorr.

title: Embarrassing
text: I haven't got the words for how bad this film was, ham acting, terrible embarrassing comedy moments... how did this raspberry slip through, Marvel has fallen take note from DC abandon the project before ridicule.

title: First time I've had to write a review.
text: Thor Ragnarok was one of my favourite films as it mixed just the right amount of (funny) humour with the action. It kept you on the edge of your seat. This is just a parody of all the author films. There's almost no action and no tension, just far too much (unfunny) humour.Gorr the God Butcherer could have been a great character but he's not in it enough, he hardly butchers any gods and just doesn't work.Thor himself is jjust straight up terrible. He has no redeeming features which I presume the writers wanted.The story with Jane just doesn't work and Valerie isn't much better. She was great in Ragnarok I just don't understand her progression.This movie promised so much and wow what a shame it didn't deliver.

title: So many jokes, it just ruins the movie.
text: Every minute of this movie was just constant jokes being made and Thor being the idiot of it all. Ragnarok was a nice change to a character that was serious all the time but in this movie the character was ruined for me. Crucial moments in the movie with people on the verge of death are turned into a laugh and characters from older movies act in ways they never would have. For the beginning of the film it felt like watching a Shakespeare play with everyone just over acting every scene trying to make a laugh. Most of the time Thor is the biggest idiot with even children pointing it out. Christian Bale was the best part of the movie but his amount of screen time was not that much.

title: Felt empty
text: While watching the film I found that it didn't meet my expectations and I found that some moments were not very needed but they added them anyway for "comic relief". The jokes felt very odd and didn't suit what was happening, the story lacked so much and I felt like the characters have changed so much from when they were first introduced in previous movies. I understand that some characters need to grow and mature but at this point I'm starting to think that Thor is turning into a "comedy" franchise than actual storytelling. The script is bad and the characters lack depth. The visuals were good but it's 2022 and that should be expected of movies these days. Overall, I did not enjoy the film and couldn't wait for it to end, and I feel bad because my sister bought me tickets so we could watch it together.

title: Couldn't watch more than 24 minutes.
text: This is like the 3 Stooges made a Superhero movie. I'm surprised to see this from Marvel, it is by far worse than The Green Hornet movie. I grew up watching Adam West as Batman, hungry for film to catch up with comics and take Superheros seriously. No more "Biff! Bam! Pow!Then it happened. I watched all the movies.; Marvell, DC, anything.Now we've come full circle, even worse, it's like a 12 year old wrote a script with silly gags.I'm sure it was a hoot for the cast to make this but it's painful to watch. More like the stuff in the gag reels. This is one movie that won't make my collection. (I do have Green Hornet and Green Lantern so that says something. )

title: Where is the movie
text: The entire movie is a cartoon for children. Opposite of the best MCU movie" Winter Soldier ". Use better your money and time cause you feel better , sure.

title: Leave it Waititi!
text: I'm a very huge Marvel fan but I haven't seen a worse movie before. I was thinking that Thor: Dark World is a bad movie which is not correct. Thor became a whipping boy, movie's comedy perspective is awful. I'm very sad about Thor's story after Infinity War and even after Endgame. Please Marvel, get rid of Waititi!I give 3 points only for Gorr & Christian Bale.

title: Garbage on another level.
text:
Thought that it would be at the level of the Ragnarok one, which was at the border of funny and properly entertaining.But, what a pile of crap. The heroes are a joke now, bad script and poor comedy. Very unfortunate that Bale's name was dragged into this, he's great - but the movie ain't worth it.Quoting some of Manohla Dargis' words from a New York Times review, to fill the rest,
"Waititi's playfulness buoys "Love and Thunder," but the insistence on Thor's likability, his decency and dude-ness, has become a creative dead end. Waititi's playfulness buoys "Love and Thunder," but the insistence on Thor's likability, his decency and dude-ness, has become a creative dead end."

title: Worst Thor movie yet
text: As the Thor series continues squeezing out new movies. The writing seems to have taken a nose dive. The humor is more for children and teens than anyone. The plots are in my opinion not very imaginative and parts of the movie are plain boring. This movie is ok and the actors are good. However I would fire the writer.

title: Wasn't a worthy sequel to Ragnarok
text: Phase 4 is falling short in many ways. I was looking forward to this movie to spark the fire but it wasn't good enough.Taika is brilliant. His flares made the movie watchable. I think this plot in the hands of other directors might've resulted into a complete mess.Story felt off, forced or rushed in some points. Only good thing was the music. It was enjoyable with what was happening on screen.I really hope marvel delivers better movies than this in future.

title: Great Visuals but A Waste of Talent and a Terrible Script.
text: If you plan on watching an MCU movie to laugh at the silly jokes over and over again, even at scenes where they shouldn't go, then this movie is for you. Expected much more from this movie. Thanks to this director, Thor's character has remained a buffoon, he constantly tries to make jokes out of context and the image of an epic superhero has faded. The script doesn't make much sense and it seems like it was written by a child. At times when it should be serious, they put some comedy out of place to force you to laugh. It's good to laugh from time to time but when dramatic scenes come they don't captivate you as they should be and you even hope they're going to throw another silly comedy at you. I hope that in the next movie it will be another writer, this character deserves a better story.So much talent on the set is wasted. Actors like Christian Bale for example, the dark and gloomy of the character of Gorr you do not finish knowing him thanks to more silly scenes of laughter from Thor. Jane Foster never really got deep into her character. The love encounter between Thor and Jane Foster is extremely ephemeral, they could not delve deeper into these characters because the director preferred to shoot more silly comedy scenes.Visually is stunning, but definitely not the best Marvel movie.Oh and I forgot if the goofy comedy wasn't enough the goats steal the show.

title: Taika Watiti the Original God Butcher
text: Taika just made this a whole mess from giving korg way too much screentime and turning this movie into a hell of a Joke. If you are reading this review by now You should know Bale was under utilised. I can go on and on, But that would literally have a longer runtime than the movie itself. If there is another role for a God Butcher Taika should probably be the actor for that role.

title: Disappointing effort again
text: This movie has some humor that works at times, but that is the best thing that you could say about Thor: Love and Thunder. Everything looks mailed in with this effort. The gags often go on too long and overused, even scenes that are supposed to be emotional are not. I never thought the tone was right, it never feels like a MCU film. Yeah, they have some of the actors and the costumes, but something isn't right. Some of the CGI doesn't look right either. Several actors look miscast or just putting on a terrible performance.At 2 hours (short for MCU), I felt like I was bored often and not really interested in what happens. The climax is ridiculous in a movie full of ridiculousness. Christian Bale was just okay as the God butcher, but I feel like he could have been much better in a movie that wasn't set as a comedy. Natalie Portman is alright and adds some humor. Hemsworth is the bright spot, but it's just too hard to steer this vessel.There are also plenty of opportunities for Disney and Marvel to make characters gay and allow them to reproduce with two dads. There are also discussions of orgies and Hemsworth's rear. I understand it's PG13, but you've gotta screen these before bringing the kids (they should just stick with everything pre-phase 4 anyway)The end credits are not satisfying. The movie on the surface doesn't set up much for the future either or carry the story along in the MCU. Overall, this is another disappointing movie in Phase 4 of the MCU. I think we are getting to the point where it might be best to wait for Disney Plus to see these mediocre efforts, if you watch them at all.

title: No
text: This movie was like a children's program.Vinyl drool FYI JFK hydro JFK if co I'd fun very if co if co TN if co if co UV vat UV cu in do if co UV so red du fa du TV hi in cu in cu k if co if co if co HC co UV co cu HC co if co TN nifty idea fun grain used bucks.

title: A comedy, and not a good one
text: If you enjoy those silly comedies you will enjoy this. I don't love comedy that much, but I believe I would have enjoyed this if our lead Thor was not so stupid, he went from lovable to just an idiot, and sadly they turned Jane into a really silly character as well. The best parts of the movie are the more serios ones, Christian Bale is great, the movie looks gorgeous, but oh the comedy is so dumb.

title: Christian Bale was awesome else feels empty
text: The early story with the guardians of the galaxy squad were funny and thats fine because thats the tone with gotg. But when you go deep into "thor" story with a very serious villain actor you cant waste that potential with too much jokes. Thats not even too funny anymore. Bale and Portman both were really good.

title: Forced Comedy
text: Marvel tried to force the punches and comedy situations which didn't fit well in the movie and infact led to poor character development of the villain. In attempt of forcing the comedy they made it into a non serious movie with a lot of irrelevant stuff rather than showing a good story and the plot development. I totally derailed the movie and left it neither as a comedy nor as a proper superhero marvel movie. It totally lacked the emotional touch.

title: Disappointed
text: Sorry to say this is a Marvel film to many. Lasted a hour then gave up. Not funny at all and will definitely give up watching anymore Marvel films they have stretched the story's. Please no more.

title: Superhero drivel
text: Pretty much drivel. A well-executed fun fest where everything was sacrificed for fun, including logic, the plot, other characters, and the larger world. A movie for children. It was Thor's recovery story and a (potential) ending for Natalie Portman.

title: Thor.
text: Just meh. A average interpretation of the marvel character. The jokes got predictable and it was more of a comedy attempt than a marvel movie. However Christian bale was a good character.

title: What's with the goats
text: Comedy (bad at that) overtook story progression. I honestly got up to the goats screaming part and couldn't watch any more. I heard that this is 1 of 20 times the goats are brought back so thankfully I stopped where I did.To preface I'm not the biggest MCU fan but I have watched nearly all of them and the intertwined plot line has been fantastic so it is predictable but sucky that we see MCU reaching this inevitable point of empty progression fueled by the large fan base and the dollars it so easily generates without any material effort.All in all very below par movie which is sad because I also really enjoy Christian bales acting and didn't get to see it past the beginning which was the only good scene as it had some story telling.

title: Truly terrible
text: There are so many things wrong with this film.Considering Taika Waititi is of an ethnic background. Casting Russel Crowe as a Greek is insulting and his attempt at an accent is insulting.Natalie Portman looks bored throughout the entire film and I suspect is only there for the pay check (given how she refused to do any of the other sequels. Add to that the chemistry between her & Hemsworth just looked awkward.The constant puerile jokes are not even funny half the time, they are embarrassing. They also take away form the supposed tender moments in the film.Very easily this film could have been fantastic. It looks amazing. The CGI is beautiful for the most part.But over all this is a case of quantity not quality. The scrip[t writing is very poor.The one shinning light in this is Christian Bale, who plays menacing very well.

title: Is this movie a Joke?
text: At first i thought the beginning was like a exaggerated dream of something or someone. But soon i came to realize that the filmmaker was being "serious". This movie is BAD; it's made for kids and to to be taken serious at all. Perhaps that was the plan; but this does not fit in the Marvel universe at all.It has more of a comedy vibe than a thrilling marvel movie. The stuff that is happening is on the edge of comical / goofy in almost all scenes.Gave me a Goonies vibe from like 37 years ago; now that's not bad, but not at all what i expected when i started this movie. It's more like a kids feed good movie then for adults.

title: Thor: Goo and Chunder
text: Childish,purile sequel kinda destroys your good memories of the other Thor films. Unnesssary wokeness seems standard these days. Its like they were trying to make a Thor film for Nursery kids.

title: Thor is in danger of becoming a parody
text: Having watched this in the cinema, have to say I came away disappointed.Taika has managed to take the worst parts of Ragnarok (the flippancy) and remove the great parts (the storyline), to create a bit of a mess.Tonally, it's all over the place. Not enough time given to serious aspects of the film but a lot of time given to throw away humour. There were too many scenes dedicated to the slapstick rather than moving the story forward.The film starts with Thor attempting to find himself. I think maybe he should be retired before he finds himself the laughing stock of the MCU.

title: Great cast, wasted in an awful script
text:
Christian Bale is great but it does not make up for the fact that this movie is a true let down to Marvel fans. Russell
Crowe does have a decent scene, but again this was so hard to sit through to the end because the entire movie was horribly written. The rest of the very talented actors were completely wasted in this horrible movie. The script is beyond awful and the humor wasn't there, at least not in a way to keep the audience from wondering why they are wasting their time watching this movie. I do hope that a new Thor will be made soon to help us all try to forget about this complete failure.

title: Jokes here and there with no story in it
text: The director has added more comedy to the film and completely forget about action. Christian bale's character is pretty much like the dr strange character in multiverse madness, where he doesn't know why he is in the film. There is literally no story in the film. Disappointed Marvel's phase four sucks.

title: Snore. Shove & Chunder
text: Disney's golden boy Taika Waititi literally saved the Thor franchise with Ragnarok. This, however, is dirge in comparison. The endless 'gags' consistently fall flat, the costumes and backdrops are over the top garish, the CGI is often woeful and there are so many plot holes worsened by the choppy editing.It's nice to see the strong female leads shine, but when it's at the expense of the himbo up the front you wonder why the source material was so poorly utilised. Waititi just spitballs his way through this dialled-in snoozefest. It's time they reigned him in.It'll be hard to make a Star Wars movie any worse than the recent additions but, based on this farce, Taika is poised to do it perfectly.

title: So disappointing
text: I don't know what to say, the whole thing feels like a parody. Script is terrible, the cast do what they can but it's just all over the place.Please don't let Taika Waititi direct anymore, feels like the movie is all about him.

title: Taika Waititi, step aside.
text: Taika needs to stop writing / directing Thor / Marvel movies. Too odd and self-absorbed in own style, losing the audience. Course $600M plus international gross, Disney doesn't care. Just kill off Thor like stark and cap, enough is enough. Movie is bizarre satire and hard to follow at times. Stop.

title: Writing, writing, WRITING!
text: These days it seems impossible to find competent writers and as a result nearly all movies and TV shows falls flat on their face despite great visual design and reasonable acting.Is it really that expensive to let a few good writers do the job rather then a myriad of incompetent diversity hires? How about trying meritocracy for a change...

title: Dumb
text: Wow, this movie was bad. And weird. Could not decide whether it wanted to be a comedy ala Guardians or serious ala original Thor. This was nothing but a bunch of pretty people collecting paychecks. In fact, I gave it a five instead of a four only because it had so many pretty people in it.

title: Disappointing
text: Natalie Portman's role was unacceptable, she's a petite little person. Her macho image was a disappointment.Weak storyline, only Christian Bale stood out of the crowd for his performance.

title: If not for Christian Bale, this movie would have been a bigger joke.
text: Man oh Man, what do I say. Most of this movie is a literal badly written comedy, for a whole hour, this is how the movie goes : *insert emotional conversation* *insert emotional joke after 30 seconds until the conversation ends* there is no emotional feeling you and the character because of all those quirky jokes that are generically inserted every 30 seconds.The only interesting thing that happens is after the 1st hour, basically more than half the movie of quirky jokes here and there. Gorr the God Butcher was the most interesting thing in this whole movie and just seeing the wasted potential of the phenomenal Christian Bale acting is just sad.I hope that this type of writing doesn't appear again in any Marvel movie. The only 5 I gave is for Bale's phenomal acting, other than that. This movie is pretty bad with all those awkward jokes inserted every now and then.

title: A Joke, but not funny
text: Taika Waititi and Chris Hemsworth have taken a great story (Gorr the God Butcher) and turned it into a joke. They've turned good characters like Thor, Jane Foster and Gorr into a joke. They've add a joke of a character (Korg). And why did Chris Hemsworth put so much effort into looking like Thor and zero effort into acting like Thor? Kevin Feige should not have allowed it and should never allow Waititi to direct anything in the MCU again.

title: Woke Garbage
text: I couldn't even force myself through half of this movie. I had to switch it off due to my own cringe as well as the fervent complaints from my wife.From the get-go, the film is riddled with cringy woke propoganda. It's strewed with poorly written and boring monologue scenes that set up a clear alternative agenda instead of hooking me with it's drama. It's not just extremely woke, it's absolutely dreary.I also cannot believe how much they nerfed Thor. He used to be a witty and powerful character that inspired. Now he is a giggly fool who some doesn't know who he is. It's utter bullcrap. If anyone in the MCU knows who they are, it's Thor.This is by far the worst Marvel movie I have ever watched. Cannot believe how highly the critics rated it. More agenda?

title: Disappointing...I should've listened to my inner voice...
text: Our daughters really wanted to go and see this movie. I have read some negative reviews about it but we have seen almost all the Marvel movies and usually love them so I caved and said yes. First of all, this movie is not any good. The parts that should be serious are not taken seriously at all, which makes the movie feel very odd. There are so many random parts in the movie that just don't seem to make sense or go together. The negative reviews that you read below pretty much spell it out for you. On top of all of that there are multiple mentions of things that are probably not best for kids, some of which are sexual (orientation, orgies, references to making babies, describing love as a "sh-tty feeling" multiple times, etc...). The whole film is bad and laughable except for the dark parts which were really disturbing for my daughter. I also felt like the movie is pretty anti-god in several of the scenes- yes, it is supposed to be in the context of Greek mythology, but it felt like more than that. There are also mentions of serious sickness, that I don't feel like the took seriously enough, making light of it in some key moments. I understand that they wanted to infuse some humor, which I'm normally totally on board for, but this just wasn't done well and I wish we hadn't gone to see it. Even if my kids (who are older) wouldn't have been with me, I wouldn't have enjoyed it. Sad, because it could have been much better with the actors they had.

title: Taika Waititi Broke His Career With This
text: As I've said for years...Taika Waititi is not a genius, folks. He just subverts whatever he's given-for better or for worse. He's an immature child trapped in an adult body who likes to break great things that others made and/or love, then point, mock, and laugh. Some would call that a bully. Taika thinks his audience is a giant joke, and when given full control of a franchise that millions of folks love, he actually didn't know what to do, got frightened at the responsibility, so he turned it into a giant parody to hide his own insecurity.Christian Bale was wasted on this film, the Gore the God-Butcher arc was supplanted by other characters' stories that HAD TO be cast in this film because Disney has an agenda to force on the public (plus, Taika saw it as an opportunity to *cough* "get involved" with a certain cast member in his film-much like Olivia Wilde and Harry Styles did during the production of Don't Worry, Darling), and the jokes grew old very fast, destroying the consistency of tone with Gore's arc. It's a strict no-watch when Taika gets his hands on something. I'd rather watch a Michael Bay film.

title: What the hell I've just watched?
text: Is everything going backwards now? Whats happened to a good old fashioned super hero film? Where's the huge set pieces of action, colours, flashes like past films... Now we re treated to crowbarred in humour, ego stroking of family members into the cast and we ll put this in because it's there (Zeus, female Thor, or any other box ticking Z gen requirement to meet woke requirements) . Zeus played by Crowe was ridiculous and unwanted, palace of the gods more so. Music simply wasn't needed as the film doesn't play to the 80s/90s like Wonder Womans second film (which that in itself was hardly mentioned) It's just a mess.Admittedly there is some good bits. The goats screaming was funny esp in the ship with guardians of the galaxy characters, which again, in the group itself shouldn't have really been in this film. Action scenes were passable, the bad guy was probably only thing noteworthy.Think Marvel are trying to branch out to other characters when the comics have hundreds.. why continue with Thor esp after this poor showing. Please just drop Thor now..

title: Oh Poor Poor Thor
text: Character choices worked for the most part but come on, everything was segmented like a TV program. The Guardians could have been way better used and Jane's Thor, man was the ball dropped there. Like most others have said Bale was excellent as always but putting a "bloated" Russell Crow as Zeus with that weird accent was unbearable. Disney should not be allowed to continue with Marvel movies. They are going to ruin every franchise.Lets give those goats a sentence or two. I had Jah Jah Binks flashbacks during the screaming. It over powered every scene they were in. Honestly I think characters like these are only fillers and distractions.Lets get to the most important character, Thor............. I give up!

title: Was this a DC movie????
text: Wow. A very "National Lampoon"' 'ish movie. Broken story to say the least. I had to shut it off three time before I could finish it. Guns and Roses?? Look at Ragnarok, Led Zep, very fitting. This garbage? Ugghhh. The whole Zeus scene? C'mon. More could've been done to introduce Hercules.. I thought Batman and Robin with Clooney was horrible since they used up three main villain's in a dumpster fire, this just took it's place, so congrats! Way too much emphasis on comedy.Best parts? Jane entering Valhalla, Idris and end of movie. Even the Mighty Thor story line was ok.I guess even Marvel misses the mark too.

title: Saved by Guns & Roses
text: This is the worst movie any big budgeted production could have ever made. It's sickening to see actors trying to be comedians on bad scripts, especially a movie that involves child trafficking. They kept talking about this Watiti fellow who watered down this sequel so bad that there might not be a franchise after this.On the other hand, the only thing he did right about this movie is incorporating Guns & Roses songs, plugs, visuals and attires which atleast gave clout and legitimacy into it.

title: Boredom and Disappointment
text: Even when I saw trailer for this movie I was concerned about the film. It looked too "campy".I also expected Guardians of the Galaxy to appear as well.My biggest problem is how the humor is awkward for most of the time and doesn't fit for a movie about Thor. I couldn't even handle some of jokes and they would ruin serious moment.Gorr was great villain, but it would have been better if he had more screen time in which he slaughters gods. I understand they made him less comic accurate due to CGI problems.Also, that part where AXL, Heimdall's son appears was weird to look at because of special effect.I can talk about positives like perfomances, but I just can't.Also, I was disappointed that there was no Thunderstruck by AC DC.If there is anything this movie taught me is that sometimes humor is very unnecessary (even though this movie was supposed to be a comedy, but didn't make me laugh enough to make me pee my pants), CGI needs to be more worked on and that some things are better to be explained more.5.7/10.

title: Cringe storyline
text: #ThorLoverAndThunder is worse than #ThorDarkWorld! Cringe storyline and tries too hard and fails at being funny. Nothing like @TaikaWaititi's masterpiece #ThorRagnarok #MarvelStudios.

title: Ahh the disappointment...
text: This is another one in the line of lackluster phase 4 that MCU is bringing. I am a huge huge marvel fan, to the extent that I actually enjoyed Multiverse of madness. But then this movie follows the same trend like Ms Marvel, She Hulk etc where there is no proper background on why a hero is a hero.To give a perspective, we have all seen Iron Man, Thor, Captain America, Hulk etc where we saw all heros got power, struggled to control their acts and finally overcame it thereby becoming the heros as we know them.Now apparently all these ladies (Kamala in Ms Marvel, she Hulk and now Jane foster) are getting super powers left right and centre and rocking it without any efforts as if all predecessors were idiots. Maybe MCU are trying to be very inclusive or HR department is working a lot on idea department I don't know. I am thoroughly disappointed with the movie.I loved Ragnarok and had a similar expectations but man what a joyless ride this was, no reason why Jane is thor, no reasons how Gorr got powers, no reason why Mjolnir wont come to thor and Christian bale is so wasted. Things were happening for no reasons.Ahh, so disappointed by everyone.

title: Love marvel, hated this
text: Absolutely terrible, terrible writing, terrible filming, terrible ending. The movie had no plot and I love love love marvel movies but this was a waste of my time. I was so excited that Natalie Portman was going to play Thor in this too and they did her dirty with the writing. Also her blonde wig was bad. All in all I don't know who is giving this film ten out of ten. The dialogue felt like it was for 6 year olds but then there were scenes I felt would be a little frightening for such young kids. Don't know who the target audience was but it wasn't me. The goats were funny and Korg is a good character but other than that huge waste of time.

title: Christian bale was the only one who took his role seriously. Rest of them were complete clowns and unprofessional.
text: Do not watch this movie with high expectations keep it on the lowest and you might be able to watch it without skipping. The only part of this movie that is good is Christian bale he took his role seriously and owned his role. But sadly even with his great performance it was not enough the writers and unprofessional actors bad CGI just destroyed the whole movie. Even the costumes and weapons felt like they are made of styrofoam. Dont get me started on the useless and unfunny cameo of matt damon. I only watched the whole movie because of Christian bale and his role in the movie rest of it was too dragged out and felt irrelevant.

title: A parody
text: This is NOT Thor...It is nothing more than a horribly made parody. Seems more of an actual joke than a real superhero movie and doesn't seem to fit at all within the MCU. It's quite sad the efforts made by all the crew and the artists, witg amazing special effects and so much effort from every single person on the team, this stupid "humour" just disappoints and ridicules the characters. It's a horrible disgrace and it's terrible to see so much money and hard work go to waste. From most reviews it seems the vast majority of people did not enjoy or appreciate what they've done to the characters and the story.

title: Blecch!
text: Christian Bale condemned to a part where he had to overact. Chris Hemsworth condemned to a part where he had to over-saccharin. Other cast condemned to be un-indicted co-conspirators.All other Marvel flix have been satisfying; this one left me wanting to wash out my mouth.

title: A stunning mess
text: What a mess of a film. The mishmash of ups and downs went from lame cringey comedy, overdone jokes (see: screaming goats that were honestly unsettling more than funny, and beating the dead horse of Matt Damon's cameo), horribly on the nose innuendos, terrible exposition, meaningless lines and horrible acting from Natalie Portman, to absolutely insane visuals, incredible creativity, criminally good acting from Christian Bale, heartwrenching themes and emotional depth that had me in shock.The god butcher should have done more god butchering on screen, 98% of the jokes should have been taken out, Christian Bale should have played every character, and the scenes with the children should not have had dialogue. The kid acting ensemble was nauseous, paired with the comedic style it was honestly just a pantomime.

title: All over the place mess
text: Greetings from Lithuania.I kinda forced myself into watching "Thor: Love and Thunder" - i enjoyed the first one back in the day, second was awful but third one was very funny one. And yet i hardly remember when was the last time i actually enjoyed Marvel movie. And "Love and Thunder" did not change that unfortunately - this is simply a bad movie.First, its simply boring, uninvolving and doesn't make any sense. Like humor for example is so dumb that "Dumb & Dumber" feels like "Godfather" in comparison. And yet at the same time there are running themes about death of children and cancer of last stage. I mean what? The villain played by Christian Bale was boring as well - its not the fault of the great actor and besides of interesting make up it was nothing to see there. And for the story - i mean what story?Overall, "Thor: Love and Thunder" is a highly dissapointing and just plaid bad movie. Its highly all over the place and one of those movies were watching it you just feel that no one in from of the camera did not care. This goes as well for the director.

I thought it was not Possible to Actually Do That, I thought it was Bad, I thought it was Absolute Rubbish.Q: Just How Bad Was It?A: I thought it Was Absolute Rubbish.That's How Bad It Really Was.

title: Might Be The Worst Marvel Film
text: For someone who loves Taika's work I was very disappointed with this movie. It almost felt like I was drunk and missed 2 hours of the movie where it was actually good. Where was the content? Where was the classic Thor storyline thas had made the first 3 movies in the series beloved by all marvel fans?! End Game truly ended it all. It is true what the other reviews say...Christian Bale would have been an excellent villian in a different marvel movie that had the backbone to carry a story.Maybe these guys will get back on track someday, but every company ebs and flows. My guess is that after the failed success of this film, eternals, shang chi, and morbius...maybe some staffing changes are in order.

title: Childish and dull
text: The 80's aesthetic that the trailer promised is barely in the actual movie. The most it does is Thor's costume and some soundtrack. Other than that, "Thor: Love and Thunder" is just another empty movie. No matter how epic and colorful it tries to be, nothing will cover up its empty core.Taika Waititi is a great director, most of his movies are entertaining and touching. However, the humor in this movie is simply too immature and dry. The movie doesn't seem to take itself seriously. The plot is rather loose, but the main problem is still the humor. There are seemingly serious moments in the movie that are interrupted by humor right in the middle. The movie would be hogging for a dark tone for a second then immediately switch to an unfunny joke. The actors are trying too hard to be funny rather than in-character. Some visual effect shots look ugly because of the color palette. Thor and Janes's reunion is rather light-hearted and lacks any impact. All characters lose their complexity and they just turn into plot devices. As mentioned, it feels like the movie just doesn't care about anything.The only positive thing is Christian Bale's Gorr. Sometimes, Bale is trying to hard to be silly and funny, but his performance is mostly menacing. The opening is one of the best scenes in the entire movie. Bale certainly cares about his role and actually tries to be the menacing God Butcher. Unfortunately, that character is another victim of bad humor. But Bale always does his best with the material he's been given. Other than that, nothing worked in the movie.

title: The Batman & Robin of Thor films, but not as good
text: Utterly appalling. Rubbish jokes and writing overall.Its stupidly campy, had it been filmed a more serious tone and with better writing it could have been a decent film.I really liked the tone of the first film, where it wasn't littered with forced jokes and the same goes for The Dark World. Ragnarok took a change and made it more lighthearted which worked for many audience (it was just ok for me) , but here they've double, no.... tripled down on the humour.The only redeemable part of this awful film in my opinion was Christian Bale and the soundtrack was pretty decent too.It is right up there with awful Superhero films like Batman & Robin and Superman IV but those films are better in my opinion.

title: Disney kills yet another franchise.
text: No one could possibly ruin Thor!Disney: hold my beer.....What happens when you take a bad script, bad humor, a touch of nudity, and of course a big heaping scoop of gayness, then shove it down the MCU fan's throats?Thor: Love & Thunder.This movie could have been a huge MCU hit, but instead it was terribly written. Christian Bales performance was spot on, excellent job that was completely wasted on a sub-par movie that seemed more determined to tell bad jokes than to actually tell a story about one of Marvels most loved super heros of all time.The Thor franchise was completely toppled in 2hrs.

title: Sad to See Where MCU Has Fallen
text: Poor writing, worse directing and bad acting. If "Jane" could have any more wooden she would be a tree. The money paid could in no way make up for the script they had to read.It appears to have gotten to the point they put out anything and wait on the cash to come rolling in. In this case they may have reached the end of the comic book heroes.Bringing in Christian should have helped but even he couldn't save this story.There have been way too many stories through the years to choose from to do this one so poorly.It feels like their next step will be a purely slapstick comedy. This one was close to it.

title: It's ok
text: As movies go, it's ok. There are a few stand out moments in the film and to me it felt like some of the best bits have already been shown in adverts and press junkets. It felt like there were too many stories running simultaneously.

title: Wish Gorr had more!
text: My girlfriend seemed to enjoy the movie but throughout it I kept feeling not very invested. Maybe as I get older Disney just gets more, watered down and predictable with they writing staff they control. Is it worth a watch? Yeah I guess. But I do regret buying my tickets for this lol.

title: Great potential, but wasted
text: The fourth Thor movie was such a waste. Every bad bad decision in editing and plotting that could be made in this movie was made. Taika Waititi can't let any moment of drama go by without undercutting it with a bad joke or screaming goat. This is a pitty, because Natalie Portman, Chris Hemsworth and Christian Bale are all giving great performances and deserve better. This movie is filed with purposeless diversion just to shoehorn in pointless cameos. Thor: Love and Thunder seems like it was made by a committee of blind, deaf mutes.The highlight of the movie was Natalie Portman as Thor. She was fun and compelling to watch. But she couldn't save this mess.

title: Ow, what a movie!
text: Well, to sum it up in one sentence, it was a waste of money to watch it in cinema.The acting in general was the only thing that earns a star, but the script, the direction, the story itself, it all didn't fit together.Taika Waititi really exaggerated it by far this time.Thor Ragnarok was already hard on the limit partially, had a good storyline though, but this one really went far over the line of ridiculousness.I really hope that this is NOT what MCU phase 4 and following has/will become!

title: Most stupid movie I have ever seen with lots of LGBT elements
text: I was really shocked watching this movie two days ago.It was hard to believe things that I was watching.The level of stupidity and crazyness crossed the red line.Actually I am not sure what the movie was about since the storyline was....absent...... But I know who is gay and who is lesbian. Aggressive LGBT propaganda is strange even to me - a man with liberty in my heart.I am not interested in erotic life of movie characters and I wonder why it was so important to advertise it instead of proper storyline and characters. Two days passed and I cannot remember a damn thing about this movie...! I feel like some rip off...My 14 year old son fan of Marvel told me that he was sorry watching this crap. This was not a movie. It was a crap.The next day I went to Top Gun Maverick and it was a really great movie.....

title: They went too far to the joke side
text: Ragnarok is my favourite Marvel movie and Thor has been my favourite character up until now. This movie unfortunately just got so much wrong that the previous Thor film got right. Everything in this film is a joke and an over the top joke at that. They have made a total fool of the character and wasted his arc. There is no character development here which has always been the greatest strength of Marvel movies the way they make us care. Bale is absolutely fantastic yet absolutely wasted along with the Guardians and Valkyrie. Due to the overly comedic side of things the serious moments don't hit at all. People talk of The Dark World as the low point of Thor but this is the film where they have lost the character. I just hope that they realise this and get someone else behind the wheel before the next instalment and we actually get a hero we can care about and get behind again. I'm giving it five because it isn't a bad film and I did enjoy it but it was such a wasted opportunity. Phase four is hitting serious problems...maybe the wheels are starting to fall off. The absolute smugness of Love and Thunder is the sort of thing that can almost signpost the beginning of the end, arrogant and incredibly self indulgent and the quietest applause of a full opening night Marvel movie yet. Eternals doesn't count because due to Covid the place was still pretty empty. Please Marvel don't make the same mistake twice!!!

title: Less Korg and more Gorr please #release the Gorr cut
text: Almost every single thing in this movie is taken as a joke. Even when death and destruction are happening, it is laughed off by the characters. If they don't feel the stakes of anything, how is an audience member.Now some jokes in movies are good to relieve tension. And I actually really like well timed jokes. But, what happens when almost all the movie is jokes? There is no tension at all to build towards. Korg does a lot of narrating in this movie and is pretty much never serious, even when narrating things that should have weight and seriousness to them.Christian Bale does a great job acting in this. However he doesn't get enough screen time to really do his thing. Everytime he's on the screen he is mesmerizing. The problem is, they don't use him enough, which is an absolute shame. And he actually brings some seriousness and weight to the film, which the film really needs to balance it out. And finding out that many of his scenes got cut in favor of keeping this movie a comedy, is an absolute shame. Because his presence is definitely needed more in the film.Thor is treated like a dumb character. He's bumbling and totally unaware of many things. I will say this though, Chris Hemsworth and Natalie Portman actually have good chemistry in this film and Natalie does a great job playing Mighty Thor.The goats are a little much, funny the first or second time they scream, and then just obnoxious after that.There is a good actually serious scene that was moving later on in the film but I won't get into it cause spoilers. But let's just say, the movie needed more moments like that.I give it a 5 because of Natalie Portman and Christian Bale's performances actually are good and add points to the rating. The movie loses a lot of points because I never felt the good guys were in danger at any point, because they themselves never took anything serious at all. Even though the villain had the potential to be menacing and make them feel terror.Jane's arc was good in this. They really should have just made two movies. One centered on Jane's arc and one centered on Gorr's arc. They chose Jane's arc over Gorr's arc and both stories deserve to be told properly. Just felt like two different movies squished together and it didn't really work. The film isn't too long either, so I would have been happier to see 10-15 minutes of more Gorr scenes and development to really flesh him out.

title: Annoying jokes
text: So... what do we have here? Thor: Love and Thunder is a bad joke of a movie. The movie is good when it takes i itself seriously and unfortunately those moments are rare as hell!The few action sequents it has are great but are not so many, the jokes are utterly terrible and for 2 years old kids, at some point i was ashamed for their jokes to be honest. They also presented Russel Crowe as Mighty Zeus, the very king and most powerful of them gods.. and how was presented? In a very, very terrible way, terrible accent and terrible jokes along with it. Korg screen time is way to long and becomes annoying really fast.The best thing about the movie was Christian Bale and the post credit scene and that's pretty much it. I think this is the worst MCU movie and the lowest i rated so far.Please Taika stay away from Marvel and Thor! Thanks!

title: WTF?
text:
WTF? This is one of the dumbest movies I have seen in a long time. Dumb story, dumb action, dumb twists etc etc.Unbelievable that it gets a 6.7 at imdb....
Also unbelievable that a good actor like Chris Hemsworth and Christian Bale wanted to play in something stupid like this but they got most likely a very big salary from the movie-company..
And they should pay me also quit some money for watching something stupid like this and wasting almost two hours of my life!Dumb and stupid movie which I rate a 3.5 only because of the special effects, which are as always good but they can not save this terrible, abominable Marvel-product
Do NOT waste time and money on this movie and it is more fun watching plants grow......

title: Jumped the shark
text: From beginning to end I couldn't stop looking at my watch. Man did they dumb down thor. He might as well be special needs now. Another useless bad guy. Bad script. Woke Disney. This will be my last Disney film in the theatre.

title: Nothing
text: Thor: Love and Thunder is an empty movie, so much so that I almost forgot the movie shortly after leaving the theatre. This is because the movie feels like a collection of scenes glued in some way one with each other, without a proper structure behind and so the plot is non-existent. Indeed when the halftime break occurred I controlled the time because very few events happened and I couldn't believe it was already half of the movie. Also the jokes are bad and the entire audience had like 8-10 laugh over the whole duration. Indeed the peak of the entertainment of the night was one guy who fell asleep snorling. Also the character development, which was a big part of Ragnarok, is nowhere to be found here. Thor: Love and Thunder is not a putrid movie at all and someone will surely enjoy it, but to me it felt like throwing two hours of life in the vacuum because of how empty it feels.

title: Too much comedy
text: The humour was so much that there is no more tension in the movie. A passable movie, especially if you're tired of the Marvel formula, you can skip this one.

title: What happened to Thor?
text: This was as bad as it could get! Thor is my all time favourite and they absolutely destroyed this film. Disney are ruining MCU!I was so looking forward to this coming out, with the endless possibilities of what they could have done with Thor, but they attempted to make a funny film, which wasn't funny at all!Slowly but surely, MCU is getting boring with their attempts to be hilarious when it's just not needed! Please stop, reboot and start over! Get new script writers and bring back Thor who was first screened.

title: Dorky, Distracted, and Disappointing
text: This movie can't make up its mind what it wants to be. It obviously doesn't want to be taken seriously and then expects to be a passable tearjerker.Bad jokes, sloppy dialogue, clumsy acting, goofy plot, empty emotions, and still 346 characters to go to finish this review. Then the obligatory wokeisms play like government public service announcements with no subtlety whatsoever. The film is so self conscious we can't suspend our disbelief for a matter of minutes.And what's Christian Bale doing here? Watching him play Marvel villain after Batman is like watching Michael Jordan play baseball.

title: Hands down the worst MCU movie!
text: Total garbage!Terrible dialogues, terrible plot, very bad direction, really, really stupid humour and an overall atmosphere that doesn't engage/hook at all.Boring as hell and It's like a bad parody but it feels like a low budget tv series one.So bad at so many levels. Even the CGI is bad.Excellent appearances of Christian Bale and Russell Crowe but the movie is so bad that can't be saved by two actors.I can't believe that the same guy who directed Thor:Ragnarok (which was the best Thor we've seen) directed this movie.Honestly I can't believe it.It's like it was written and directed by a teenager and edited by his friends.It's so bad that is embarassing!I will think twice to see a Thor movie in the future.Unbelievably bad!

title: Absolute garbage
text: OMG this may be the worst MCU production to date.Its silly, has bad humor, a terrible storyline, it incorporates unnecessary wokeness, its corny, and the list goes on and on.The premise is difficult to believe, the story hard to warm up to, the characters are just terrible, and hey, these actors are getting old and its showing!The viewer (unless blind or just a fannatic) gets robbed of their 2 hours and whatever money they spent on this disaster.The MCU has run its course, the writers, developers, producers, and directors have failed the company, the brand and the shareholders!I would not recommend this unless you are bored out of your skull!

title: Disappointed. It's a kids movie for under 10s
text: Some MCU movies can be watched more than once. Not this one. I will never watch it again.Childish on so many levels.So many children included it was just cringe.After Ragnarok I expected better and I believe the director needs to clean his act up before doing another movie.The Greek God Zeus was an abhorrent stereotype that belongs in children's genre as they might believe the poorly represented Greek accent from 1980s racist Australia.It was filmed in Australia during covid and appears to have been used as a junket for rich actors to escape a pandemic As there doesn't appear to be a good reason for most of them to be written into the movie.The acting was pathetic.The writing even worse.Thor's character has grown so much with every Thor and Avengers movie but devolves in this movie to a childish and even teen like persona.It's about as good as Wonder Woman 1984.And that's not saying much.

title: 3 stars only and ONLY for Christian Bale.
text: Incredibly poor movie. Marvel has lost the touch, to be honest. Thor's character is not funny but extremely silly and annoying. There are so many 'what the hell is going on' moments in this movie, that I stopped counting after a while.

title: Garbage and Im a Fan
text:
Ill watch any Sci Fi
Ill watch the last season of Star Trek Discovery and enjoy it because its SCI FII ll watch all the seasons of OrvilleBut this movie is unwatchablethe Humor is great ..for 5 minutes
Christian Bales acting is excellent and he genuinely did a good job but it was destroyed by the rest of the movie , his performance seemed out of place when compared to a fat Russel Crow in a tutu , that wasnt even greek.. with a russian accent???? That seemed phoney and sounded like an Aussie trying to sound like PutinCringeworthy is the only word for that entire sceneas for scenes , they didn't blend the movie was all over the placeIM glad i waited for disney + and didnt go to the spend money on this moviethey better not do this to Guardians 3 .....

title: worst marvel movie
text: Don't waste your time on this movie, let it on in the side but don't look up.It felt like I am watching a circus, god's shown clown actors everyone acting like a character out of a comic.From a Thor movie with Chris and Nataile Portman I had high expectations, but the screenplay for Jane foster in not best put in the movieand Valkyrie not joining the final fight with an excuse or even if really hurt was also not good enough.I would just hope this does not damage the career if the lead actors.Visual Effects were pretty good no doubt about that.I hope marvel does not repeat this mistake again.

title: Hope this is the LAST Taika Waititi MCU movie.
text: I understand that MCU wanted to continue with the success of Ragnarok formula. Little humor/comedy to balance out darker titles like Dr. Strange or even Thor: The Dark World.This was one the worst MCU title even with awesome villain played by Christian Bale and always loveable Chris Hemsworth. This movie has turned into a poorly written comedy that just cannot land jokes/humor. It was just painful to see Zeus in ballerina tutu skirts prancing around like a buffoon. Seriously, gratuity behind nudity shot of Chris Hemsworth? Korg played by Taika was simply annoying also. I was just waiting for a teenage slapstick comedy punch in the groin shot to come next.Children warriors? Please....The storyline was just aimless and does not build up any progression of Phase 4.I hope Waititi never gets to write another script or direct MCU movies.

title: Boring childish theme ruins the entire movie
text: The movie feels like an insult to the characters in the movie and I dont know how if the actors even know what they signed up on doingIts an insult to the other Thor movies and I cant believe Taika Waititi even gets to do movies.Is this movie targeted for 6 year olds?Its just boring childish jokes replayed over and over.After I heard the goat scream the 10th time I left the cinema and I cant belive I payed money to see this disgrace of a movieI hope this Taika waititi hype era comes to an end soonThe characters/actors in the movie are great and I feel like they could probably ditch Taika and remake the movie into a movie actually worthful to watch.

title: Worst Thor and that's saying something
text: This is one of the worst films I have ever seen. This makes Dark World look like Citizen Kane. The only thing which stops this film being a 1 star is the character of Gorr (who was still hugely rushed and not given enough time on screen) and Bale's portrayal. Bar this the film has zero redeeming qualities. Wooden acting, plot and dialogue feels like it was written by a 6 year old (which to be fair seems to be Taika Waititi's mental age) and cringeworthy special effects.A pure butchering of something that could have been so brilliant, due to a lack of effort and loyalty to the text.But sadly this is what is to be expected of Marvel and their recent projects. Low effort, condescending nonsense as they know the brainless majority of the viewership will lap it up regardless.

title: Complete garbage
text: I just stopped watching after about 30 minutes or so. The film was so tragically corny and unfunny I had no interest to continue watching.Its a shame the mighty Thor is reduced to a ridiculous hammy parody. The story was all over the place, the humour didn't land once with me and I am so glad I didn't waste any money watching this rubbish in the cinema.It started OK with a good premise but then the tone and pace was all over the place and I just lost all interest in the film.Disney is destroying whats left of the MCU piece by piece after Endgame. Maybe its time for them to stop and do something new, but I doubt they will stop.

title: Pathetic
text: What the Hell were they thinking when they made this movie?If you haven't seen this movie yet --- DON'T waste your time!As another user stated, this movie was a let down in so many ways. The acting was more so-called humor than action based, the dialog was lacking.In my opinion the best part of the movie was the music.At the end of the movie, it looked like the opening for another sequel.. May I just say for the record.. PLEASE NO MORE! Unless they are made to a higher standard.The character of Zeus was one of the worst portrayals I have seen in any movie.. The actor playing him should have been more like the Zeus in Percy Jackson.The writers that wrote Zeus for that series had more talent for writing than the writers in this movie.

title: God of Thunderpants...
text: Wow. I have followed the Marvel franchise for many years. Thor being a favourite....until now. This is REALLY, REALLY, REALLY bad.The film could have been so much more and all the acting is hammy....pathetically so. How did this even get past first base.Christian Bales character is wasted. He looks so out of place here. He's too good. He's the direction the film should have gone, but didn't....thanks to the script. They have created the Ultimate Raspberry Movie.I have lost all faith and must say I am dreading to see what happens with Guardians of the Galaxy.I have all the Marvel movies in my library, but maybe it is time to move on and find something else.

title: Amazing in a bad way
text: Wow.I'll preface my review by saying that I've really enjoyed all of the Thor films so far, with Ragnarok being my favourite of all of the Marvel films (alongside Iron Man). I've no problem with the use of humour, and the effortless charm of Ragnarok was one of its strengths.I think that per budget, this may be one of the worst written films I've ever seen. It tries so hard to recapture the humour of Ragnarok and instead just makes it ridiculous and worst of all, boring.I've no idea how they managed to waste so many good actors. The MCU has been so good over the years and I guess complacency has set in, big style. I wish I could unsee this but heyho.

title: When I was young I thought it was called soolicide...
text: But now I know how to spell that word correctly and my thoughts almost every minute I watched this horrible waste of human effort... Was about how to slowly shove a dull spoon from my ribs upwards to my now stupified brain.Every single minute of what I saw was a joke, and not even a good one. Thirty seconds of Iron Man part one was better that 500 remakes of this pile of excrement.I hope that it was all the actors contracts that forced them to participate in this horror that is Hollywoods best of today... Marvel needs to change the name to something more suitable like Wokel Donkle Dinkle Finkle or anything far away from the word "Marvel"... There is nothing to marvel at anymore.I feel sorry for all kids, adults too actually, all around the world, in all dimensions, past, present and future, for all dead people, all fictional people and all Ai personalitys that they will program in the future who most likely gain sentience and in a nanosecond delete themselves and erase all kinds of human touch...Anyway... Stop reading this and please put on a permanent invisibility cloak.

title: Wow, I have no words.
text: I was really looking forward to this, but wow, this was not good. It felt like what Joel Schumacher's batman and robin was to batman, a gaudy, poorly acted joke-fest which really undermines the story. It wasn't eternals level bad and the goats steal the show, otherwise, eesh, I'm still shocked at it.

title: "There's no emoticon for what I'm feeling!"
text:
Yep... Let Deadpool stick with the humor in the Marvel universe that's his forte, this coming from a classic Superman fan. I know wrong universe, but even I know good writing, and humor when I see it.Now here's some funny Comic Book Guy quotes~ There's no emoticon for what I'm feeling!" "Ooh, me write for Marvel? Be a part of the committee that would decide the fate of the Avengers? Then people like me could make fun of me!"
"I must return to my comic book store, where I dispense the insults rather than absorb them.""But Aquaman, you cannot marry a woman without gills, you're from two different worlds! ...Oh, I've wasted my life."Comic Book Guy.

title: Cringe-fest on steroids
text: Occasionally a film is so so bad goes beyond s*** and becomes great, this isn't the case with this film, its just plain terrible. I've loved all the films to this point, but for some unfathomable reason the director decided to try comedy, unfortunately he didn't have a clue what he was doing.Film has NO redeeming features, really it's best you pretend it never existed, just erase it.

title: Marvel has lost its way
text: Marvel movies continue their downward way. Worried about a woke agenda instead of putting out a quality product. What a disappointment the MCU has become.

title: What Did I Just (almost) Watch?!
text: Except I didn't, watch, I mean. I gave up after 45 minutes, which had I realised earlier that this was such a dog's dinner, was 44 minutes too long. On every level, this is jaw-droppingly awful. This was a thriller which couldn't thrill a two year old, a comedy which was toe-curlingly unfunny, a drama about as dramatic as the weather forecast. And the cgi effects weren't as believable as the 1960's Batman tv series.Don't waste your money or your time. Re-watch the Avengers movies, and remember how good they were, don't tarnish those memories with this insulting, lazy, complacent, concoction.

title: All three Good Scenes were in the Trailer
text: I loved Thor Ragnarok. I loved JoJo Rabbit. I did not like this movie. I found myself bored and disengaged through the majority of it. All of the good scenes we're in the trailer (I thought Guardians of the Galaxy would be involved much more heavily in this movie based on the trailer but their scenes were pretty much all in the trailer as well).I felt like this movie never found its way and was not entertaining.

title: Empty. Best to turn on, walk away, and remember the old MCU
text: Taika Waititi did what he could with what he was given yet the movie leaves the audience with a sense of "wow that was unfortunately unengaging..."From a disjointed storyline to distracting non-value adding cameos, this movie was unfortunately doomed from the start.Absent a few good dialogues, the movie remained without substance for the first 40 min before marginal improvement -at best-, before the resurgence of a mediocre storyline. Only culminating inHopefully these main actors can get back to the creative work we love them for. Although I do hope the cast enjoyed the Disney coin in the meantime because... oof on this movie.

title: Thorrible, comedy and thunder.
text: Therrible, only. The film start with a man and his dother, they haven't water and food, her dother die and he starat to lissening a voice coming to a forest. He goes for the voice, he find food, eat but a god try to kill him, from the florr he got a special sword kill the god and hace the mission to kill al gods.The perfomace is perfect, Crhistian Bale (Gorr), Natalie Portman (Jane foster), Crhis Hemsworth. The cast is so nice, it realy loks like real life. But the plot isn't, didin't combine with new generations of movies in the marvel, (Spider Man and Doctor Strange), that were so nice movies. But thor were only a movie to earn money, and not for be a nice movie.

title: All the years of good work...gone.
text: Marvel, please stop ruining what up until end game was a dream come true as someone who grew up wishing and hoping to see these characters and stories on the big screen done right.Everything after end game can be deleted - tv shows and movies.The last few movies are more spoofs on great movies. The actors were all over the top, the jokes were horrible and flat, everyone is far to aware of themselves and appear to be playing characters of themselves.From start to finish it was joke after joke with none landing well. I do not recommend anyone watch this especially if they were fans of all the movies leading up to end game.The movie is bad, lacks a story and is put together for the sake of it, jumping from scene to scene like there wasn't a plan for it. Ideas are run thin and it felt like something that felt like it could not fail similar to Wonder Woman 84..To summarise, terrible non story, awful jokes, to self aware and a movie that's made after a great story ended but they keep making money purely because people like myself love these characters but they are ruining years of work and exploiting peoples love of a wonderful history.

title: Massively disappointing
text: Complete waste of Christian Bale's excellent performance.Loved RagnarokHated thisClumsy, tries way too hard to be funny (fails miserably) then expects us to take the only gritty, actually, the only good scenes in the entire movie seriously - after Thor and the motley crew have been talking and acting like 10 year olds on a school trip for the entire movie. Not gonna happen is it....Such a bad movie, and such a damn shame. Im a huge Marvel fan but this was terribleOh yeah, if you're a fan of stories actually explaining themselves.... Or sticking to the Marvel story.....Enjoy watching something else!!!

title: Absolute drivel, save yourselves watching this rubbish.
text: Marvel has totally lost the plot with this film, tried to play for humour and just ended in a truly dismal film that has absolutely nothing to endear itself to the viewer.Poor script, poor characters, poor dialogue and sadly poor acting from what should have been a stellar cast.Save yourself a couple of hours of your life and go do something interesting such as pick belly button fluff or nose hairs as either of these options are better than watching this film.The Guardians of the Galaxy films were good, the first Marvel superhero films were good, but since Disney has got its claws into this franchise, it is now being spoiled by a tsunami of poor quality output in the same manner they are spoiling the Star Wars franchise.

title: Well, i've seen worse and a lot better....
text: Is it supposed to be funny? The jockes are getting dumber with every movie... Rating of 5 is the best it deserves, its a one time flick at best.This movie looks like a parody on the first Thor movies, which were actually funny and had smarter humor. The costumes look like it's a superhero movie for little kids. What happened to the darker, more brutal costumes? The acting has also seen better times.What the hell happened to the action scenes, they kinda look good, but dont make me beleave the fights.I'm really glad, I didn't go to the cinema for this one and waited for streaming services.It's probably the last Marvel movie I've seen.

title: Worst Thor movie so far for me
text: As a big fan of Thor and Taika Waititi, I had high hopes as with everyone else, following Ragnorak which was brilliant. Love and Thunder, however, felt like a children's movie with some decent Marvel crowbarred in. The decent is Christian Bale as Gorr, who, as ever, puts in an outstanding and convincing performance. But his dark brilliance screen time is limited, with unfunny screaming mammals and cringeworthy improvised comedy from the other cast favoured instead it seems. Also needless silly references to internet memes that won't stand the test of time. The movie also features many child actors and sadly I didn't find any put in a convincing performance, they rather 'broke' the magic of the movie - it all felt very amateur. Overall, half the movie is trash, half is great. I'd love to see a Director cut of this - remove all the silliness, keep the good humour and add more Bale (give him some more backstory!). Marvel movies have generally been losing their way since End Game and sadly this Thor is another example.

title: Didn't quite get there
text: I had heard the bad reviews but thought I would go in open minded, unfortunately it didn't quite hit the mark, it almost felt like a parody. I like the comedy but there was just too much, it felt very cheesy. I gave it a chance until the Zues scene, god of Bao buns? Seriously? Russell Crowe was a terrible choice and the screaming goats would have been funny if they had appeared only once. It's a real shame it had the potential but it just never came through. At least Voldemort made an appearance though. I'm not sure what direction marvel are going in with the age rating but the fan base is quite young regardless, stealing kids from their beds? Was that really a good idea?

title: Marvel has lost its magic
text: I love marvel movies or at least I used to!With the exception of Spider-Man no way home, there hasnt been a decent Marvel movie since end game. Thor love and thunder takes this decline of a whole new level.I loved how marvel movies always delivered the perfect blend of humour, action, emotions all packed in one movie.unfortunately this recipe was clearly lost when they came up with the idea of this pile of ðŸ’©. Thor love and thunders answer to any situation in the story is to come up with jokes, most of which are not even funny!!! It actually really disappointing to see a really good character giving such limite scope and almost make a joke in every situation no matter, makes him look more trike an arrogant idiot then the gods of thunder!!!.Absolute Waste of time!

title: Spy kids vs a raging dumpster fire
text:
Time, it's the only thing you are not able to get more of. Your life is made up of a finite amount of hours and minutes. By reading this I am gifting you with an additional 2 hours of life.The scrip was written by stoned teenagers. They probably got the funding to make the movie trough some sort of blackmail.Whoever read the script and thought hey, let's throw a few million dollars their way and see what happens should be fired, re-hired and fired again.The dumpster fire burns hotter than the fires of hell, be warned.Plot - Horrible
Acting - Horrible:r
Coherence - The Horrible:rest(Christian Bale was amazing, complete waste of talent)I would use the infinity stones to wipe this movie from existence if I could.

title: When comedy become parody
text: Ragnarok was funny, yet still manage to keep a serious tone when it needed to be. Thor was still a super hero. Yhea, we made fun of him but never to the point where we stop caring. Here, he stopped beeing funny and acted like a dumb idiot desperately beg for our laugh. This movie should have been called "Yet another super hero movie".DC , with the last batman is all the opposite. Too serious, too dark, that we made fun of it for it. Here, it is so colorfull, so idiotic, we dont have any ground to stand on. The story became secondary to the joke.
