Christian Bale is trying is best to add tension to a movie that doesnt take anything seriously. Every scene he is in feel like an other movie. Once Thor take back the screen, we are back to plug the next funny joke.Yes, it is a super hero, flying trough the air with his mighty hammer... axe... And no, we shouldnt take it too seriously. Ragnarok manage to walk that line almost perfectly. The director took that as a blessing and went full parody resulting in this big farce of a movie.This one is the worst of the p4 so far.

title: What a goddamn mess...
text:
Looking back at what MCU used to be, i feel shame... All my heroes turn into shadows of what they used to be...
HEROES WERE BREAVE! HEROES WERE STRONG! HEROES WERE GLORIOUS!Now heroes joke around, are played as fools, they're weak and they're clowns...
Its a shame what Marvel looks like now... I used to take time off from work to go to the cinema when a new superhero movies was out, now i stand watching one on the couch at home...
It got to a point where i cringe so much i just turn off the screen...
Love and thunder... what a joke... i watched half a movie then i turned it off. That bad it was...
I likes Thor. Not as much as i liked Black Panther, Spiderman or Wolverine, but i enjoyed him on screen. Comic books were awesome too.To see this pathetic excuse of Thor makes me sick.Don't get me wrong, actors have no guilt in this.My 5 stars are all for Christian Bale. I regret not having the nerves to watch the rest of his performance, i know he did a terrific job.Other than that, whoever is in charge of making Marvel movies should be fired and never work in the superhero movies in their lives.It's incredible how Marvel invested soo many years just to piss on their fans with shows and movies like IronFist, Doctor Strange Multiverse of Madness, She-Hulk and Thor Love and Thunder... Its an insult and a slap in the face to all the fans that stuck to them for so many years.I were rich, like Bezos or Elon rich, i'd buy this garbage Marvel turned into and turn it into a R rated festival for the fans where there's no Holywood cinematic prostitution, a place where heroes are true to their identity and the way they were created to be.Sad.

title: Thor is the weakest of the MCU Movies
text: I had issues with Ragnorok after seeing it and the attempt at humor it had. But then this movie makes Ragnorok look good.The good part of this movie is that a true sensitive story lies underneath that when you find it shows importance of any part of life.

title: Disappointing
text: I expected too much from this movie but it was total disappointment, the story is basic and linear, all the casts did well its the one positive in the movie, everything was forced from emotion to comedy, too many unwanted emotional scenes, they just wasted the potential of gorr, i fall asleep while watching this one, overall its a mediocre same marvel thing, if you are marvel fan you can watch it but not for some normal audiences. Its a dowfall of marvel.

title: Dissapointed.
text: I think Ragnorak might be my favourite Marvel movie, so it's a shame how poor this movie was.Most of the comedy landed flat, and it's like watching two different movies when Thor can go from a complete idiot to giving a serious cancer prep talk. The balance was all over the place.So, good points, Bale was great but wasted with minimal screen time and Russel Crowe was fun as Zeus.Maybe they need to slowdown on the Marvel releases because the quality is starting to diminish.

title: So, So Bad
text: Not since The Predator have I been so disappointed with a franchise movie. I had my doubts early on but by the midway point it was full eye-rolls and willing it to end. The humour rarely works and just ends up feeling awkward, while conversely the serious themes are horribly misplaced. Christian Bale's villain was all over the place and by far the weakest in any Marvel film, with his motivations feeling glib from the worryingly poor prologue - honestly, what on earth was going on with that rubbish god-guy and the effects? Glib is a good word for the whole thing, really, with an end product that looks like zero rigour or care was applied to any aspect; a that'll do because it made Taika laugh approach.I was originally glad to see a blockbuster coming in at 2 hours but this felt longer than The Batman. Basically a piece of trash cobbled together with nothing working at all. It feels like Marvel is in decline since Endgame. Maybe they should change tack, and definitely go back to fewer films per year. Please.The 3 stars are for a couple of chuckles and Natalie Portman looking devastating in a blonde wig.

title: Thor: Love & Hate!
text:
OK, the film is a mixture of being 50% very good & 50% really truly dreadful.I've watched it once & enjoyed some of it, but the parts I really hated for being so ridiculous & so unbelievably corny & disrespectful, that means now I won't ever watch this film again unless someone was willing to pay me to watch it but it would cost a bit. I love Christian Bale but I hate the terrible Directing & writing, plus the main character arcs make no sense & devalue them all.Disney for some reason give people with really "no proof of the talent required" the power to write & direct a Marvel movie, in this case the power was given to Taika Waititi who ultimately does a dreadful job writing & also directing this film. With the big budget & a great cast of actors this film had real Marvel potential to be a great film but Taika Waititi was a poor choice.If Taika Waititi had wrote for a proper Marvel comic & came up with this exact story Stan Lee would have told him this was simply not good enough for Marvel, as the script does not make sense & in parts becomes too "silly".Now I'm all for a little bit of surprising "humour" in Marvel films as you would get in comics, but at it's core this is still supposed to be a serious universe that has serious consequences if the heroes fail & you have to feel that.By the end of the film the script & directing by Taika Waititi feels more like a parody of real quality Marvel films ( & comics ) which I find disrespectful.Now the film still gets 5 stars from me because parts of the film are really good & this is because of the acting ability of many of the excellent cast, for example Christian Bale is a truly magnificent actor whose overall performance in this film really is top notch ( I really feel sorry for him as a lot of the film script by Taika Waititi really ruined the film ) as Gorr is a great character.Chris Hemsworth as Thor is very good though the script seems to try to make him look more & more of an idiot ( as his character arc is declining here ).Some of the scenes Chris Hemsworth has to do are so poorly conceived & become so ridiculous I really feel sorry for him as we know he is a great Thor.Natalie Portman & Tessa Thompson both do OK however I feel the script they had to work with really did not help them to really show off their acting talent.Russell Crowe was not very good ( seems he does not understand that Super Hero films are meant to be taken serious ) as he acted in it like it was some kind of parody ( like he was supposed to be a parody or in a bad "panto" ).This was a very bad casting choice & when he arrives in the film it really does start to go more & more downhill from there ( Taika Waititi to blame mostly ).By the end of the film it starts to insult everyone's intelligence & becomes unbelievably farcical, as I certainly won't be adding this film to my Marvel collection as the appearance of the guardians of the galaxy at the start of the film actually gave the film a decent start but the script of Taika Waititi killed it.Disney have killed the Marvel movie franchise from being the juggernaut it was as simply they don't respect the Marvel universe enough to ensure it's image is protected instead they give directors with no previous big action super hero movie total control & just sit back as they destroy years of hard work that previous actors & quality writers & directors put in to build the Marvel Universe ( films such as Iron Man, Captain America & yes Thor ).The original film Thor (2011) with Director Kenneth Branagh & Writers
Ashley Miller(screenplay), Zack Stentz(screenplay), Don Payne(screenplay) must all watch this film & say to themselves what has Taika Waititi done & you have to ask what has co-script writer Jennifer Kaytin Robinson done?Jennifer Kaytin Robinson must take at least 30% of the blame though again if you look at her resume clearly she like Taika Waititi ( 70% to blame ) was no way qualified to write the script for this film, however their only defence is that if so,done offered you a boat load of money to do something such as write a film script why would you turn that down as the really idiots here are Disney.The Marvel films could have made billions for many many years but with these dreadful films killing off fans of the Marvel film series how much has Disney cost them themselves long term. Most likely they have lost Billions.So ultimately I can't really blame Taika Waititi & Jennifer Kaytin Robinson for taking Disney's money but if I see either of those 2 names attached to any future film or TV series I most likely will choose to give that film/show a miss.

title: thor: SOUND AND FURY...signifying nothing
text: There are movies that strike that great balance between tones and then there are movies like Thor : Love & Thunder.It's actually impressive how many times this movie swings for the fences, misses and falls flat on it's grinning face.Dramatic scenes sandwiched into elementary school humor. Trying so hard to be funny and desperatly pushing for memes and running jokes which are a nuisance even before the repition. And all I could hear in that noise is "Hello fellow kids..."There's a little storytelling device that's called 'Show don't tell', perhaps Disney/Marvel should use it sometimes on one of their villains. It became a cliche even in the phase one that their villains are cartoonishly underdeveloped. That they still haven't figured this out after Thanos is truly baffling.The soundtrack is as try-hard as the comedy, so there's no silver lining here unfortunately.At this point it would be more interesting to list the drugs that has been consumed by the director and producers, because they must have clearly been very satisfied with the salad of a story.m they delivered.It's a shame because the last Marvel movie by Raimi (Doctor Strange 2) had hints of actual good storytelling, if they just didn't have so many cooks in the kitchen to mess it all up.This feels like ten steps backwards compared to their last effort.

title: Not worth the time or money
text: Needed a little bit more screentime and a convincing storytelling. Taika thought that screaming goats and humor everywhere could sell the story but it didn't. Sometimes you have to force laugh in order to justify for the money you've spent on the tickets. Being a Marvel fan since phase 1, this movie was a disappointment to me.

title: Who is this film even for?
text: I really don't know where to begin except, this is probably the worst film in the MCU.Taika Waititi's take on Thor is one of a parody, a comedy along the lines of Scary Movie that has sunk to the depths of ridiculousness. How we have gone from Winter soldier, End Game, Civil War etc to this is a sheer embarrassment.The "comedy" is all forced, misplaced and desperate. Taika's constant narration is narcissistic and they spent so much time on poor comedy, even squeezing in 6 year screaming goat vines as a repetitive joke, over any real substance the entire film feels empty.I have no idea who this film is aimed at, because it misses every mark, neither funny enough to be an outright comedy, not exciting or riveting enough to be an action film, and so far removed from the source material it definitely can't be a comic book adaption, so what is it? If you like Guns and Roses, you might like the over use of their music for weight, but other than that, I take nothing from this shambles other than the mild annoyance of wasting 2 hours of my life.

title: Just a bit... meh
text: It's not good. Nowhere close to being a good film. Doesn't hold up against its predecessor and feels like they didn't know what to do with all their ideas so instead chose to just brain fart them all onto the green screen in a film that's far too long and poorly executed. Bale is as usual top class with his role; but in the end it all just seems a bit... meh.

title: Thor: CGI and Exposition
text: Rather than advance the plot through great story telling, this film decides to do so via expositional dialogue resulting in a final product that feels rushed and lazy. Every chance they get to have an emotional beat is immediately undercut by "humor". Rather than make a $40 prop helmet or have Natalie Portman lift a dumbbell, they CGI EVERYTHING and in Marvel 2020's fashion, their CGI only gets worse with each new project.Cut out 50% of the jokes and replace them with good story telling to advance the plot and add 20 more minutes of Christian Bale, and this film is a solid 8.Oh, and in case you forgot that 50% of the characters are gay, they will remind you about 5x throughout the film.

title: Not even 10% as good and creative as Ragnarok
text: After mucking up Multiverse, MCU continues the trend and ruins Thor (once again). The first two Thor movies were terrible. Then came Taika and gave a whole new exciting, quirky, and colorful life to Thor via Ragnarok (who served well in Inifinity War and Endgame). But, like the last Strange's movie, Thor too devolves way far below the expectations. I now firmly believe that this is the beginning of the end of MCU's successful run.

title: Has some value as Friday entertainment, but has child soldiers...? Really bad taste...
text: Do you know those days that you're just so tired from work and want to watch something uncomplicated? This might be the film for you!...other than that I think there are few values in it. It had some fun moments but no real depth och character arcs. The worst part of the movie were the child soldiers...I mean, wtf?! I get that it was meant to be inspirering and 'cute' but is was just poor taste tbh and made the whole film to a bottom tier Marvel movie for me.

title: Ruined by Diversity and Disney
text: This just felt like a kids' movie. A lot of the jokes are something a 10-year-old would enjoy. The story is just missing a lot of detail and feels rushed.Also, it feels like Marvel is now just making female versions of all the Male superheroes to satisfy some gender quota. Jane getting Mjolnir just does not make any sense whatsoever, and the ease with which she gets it is just silly. Yeah, I know they explained it in the movie, but the explanation just seems too convenient.The kids were the worst part of the movie. I believe since now Disney owns Marvel, they are trying to apeal to the kids. The kids reduce the seriousness of the entire movie. A lot of the scenes are just something that apeals to 8-12 year olds and the part where they all gain superpowers is just super cringey.Dear disney stop playing identity politics and trying to fill quotas in your movies. Just fire everyone that was part of this film and listen to the people who made movies before Infinity war.

title: Very strange movie about man with hammer
text: This story about a man in movie with very interesting hammer who living on alien planet I think. He have girlfriend Jodie foster helping him find love and thunder in world but other than this is not very interesting movie. Many things very hard to believe, about man and women who have electricity in bodies theirs and they can fly and do magic things but still have difficulty somewhy. Very difficult to believe because if they can fly in sky they can not have many problems. You can always leave problem if you can fly in sky. I must have total of 600 characters so I will write more to say that I like this movie more better than movie about green man who get very angry sometimes when he is hungry. Thor about thunder and love is worth watching if you like these kinds of things. But for me, not good movie about people which can fly.

title: Such a disappointment
text:
I cannot even fathom how bad this series ended up. It's a huge (bad) joke from beginning to end as characters behave and discharge pathetic one-liners and behave in a goofy way throughout terrible writing and sub-par CGI.I would never expect this from a high-budget movie. It's a shame that Taika Waititi's direction took Thor's character to a new low. Transforming his personality into a full-on idiotic form is beyond words.Taika and the writing team could have created something amazing instead, they came up with NOT an action-adventure movie, but a bad comic.On a positive note:
The movie's cinematography and color grading is well achieved and should be praised.Natalie Portman's perfect performance saves this film from an even lower rating.

title: Why?
text:
Seriously...
The number one question is why?Why was this "movie" not only made, but even thought up?It is "political pushing propaganda," disguised as a movie.So many awesome MCU and DC movies, from Spider-man no way home, to Jack Schneider Justice League, Wonder Woman, . I even enjoyed the eternals. Because it didn't go OTT.For example, Doctor Strange, was FANTASTIC, whereas Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness, was.. (be nice) yep... not good.Hollywood, Disney, they know what people want, and yet they
continue to push (let's keep it easy, so the review is accepted.) "politics."
Or rather "their politics" into fantasy movies..?Why can't they just stay with what brings in the BIG BUCKS!Look at the HUGE movies, that rake it all in.Again. Why?It is a mystery.

title: Thor: Love And Thunder - Good Story On Paper, But Execution Is Not Proper
text: A decent storyline with decent execution from the director. At few parts, the scenes didn't feel like a continuation of the previous scenes. I felt that the movie was a bit rushed too. Emotional connection was missed in my opinion. Decent watch.

title: Was this a spoof?
text: Because everything from serious scenes to emotional ones were made to look funny or is it the actors making the script feel like a spoof or is it the script itself. Every character especially Zeus played by ABC is a joke. I haven't read the comics so I am the last person to judge the story so I won't. But the film in its entirety is a very badly made one while the VFX is as good as any other Marvel film except for the Thor as a baby scene that looked pathetic. The shots including the VFX are beautiful and fun. But characters aren't strong. A film that has a confrontation or a fight between two or more people/ teams must have strong characters/ sides. Here the villain looks menacing in terms of make-up and/or prosthetics but in terms of acting like a villain, the character is a joke.

title: Yikes, what a Tonal dumpster fire
text: The script felt like it was written in a weekend. The tone is like an SNL skit. 80% of the jokes don't land. It's Joel shumacher Batman level bad.It wasn't completely terrible. But definitely not at the level of quality I've come to expect from the MCU.

title: Is this actually a Thor movie?
text: I would rate it a 10/10 if it was presented as Thor parody. As an actual Thor movie its pretty bad and I don't wanna be rude but whoever wrote it should be ashamed.The movie is just a bunch of bad jokes mixed in a pot. Some characters needed way more development and screen time, namely Garr and Jane. Jane's Mighty Thor really needs some clarification.A lot of things doesn't even make sense like why the hell do they need Zeus weapon?And the girl? Now either she is in every movie or Thor is a douche who promissed to look after her and didn't.Honestly I wish I didn't see it and I hope this is not the direction MCU is heading.

title: GOFTG painted in a hollow thor theme.
text: There is a scene in Idiocracy where the dude is sitting in front of the tv and watching people fart. That is pretty much this movie. It awes you with the beautiful pictures and distracts you from the fact that this movie is empty. But hey, don't take my word for it. Watch this movie again and after that, back-to-back watch the first one.Cast is great, looks are stunning, Christian bale is epic, the setting is there BUT the writing is utter garbage.Why are you aiming for the low hanging fruits? Why can't you just look at the comics and make a decent, well written storyline. Sure, put in some well thought after jokes, people will laugh, but for the love of this franchise, stop trying to make a sitcom out of this.

title: christian bale
text: I watched this movie because of christian bale. I have respect and he was the only guy who made the movie serious. The movie was a kids show. A lot of Marvel movies are so ironic that i can not stand on. Really without Christian bale the movie would have been a disaster but it already is. Don't watch it if you're looking for a serious content.

title: Just why?
text: I stopped watching when they got to the gods' meeting or whatever the hell that was... The start was promising and then it turned into such a mishap of cringey jokes that never landed with poor acting (no chemistry whatsoever, Chris played a parody of Thor and Portman was so out of place it hurt my eyes) and over the top CGI which looked like a several teens had a field day.Thor's axe had more charisma than the entire cast put together. Exluding Bale, Bale was good.I don't know if the movie got any better after the point I stopped watching, but I honestly don't care.I love Marvel movies, but this was just a waste of money, talent and time.

title: Very disappointing
text: Was looking forward to this movie. It was so cheesy in places that it's like a self parody. Possibly the worst marvel movie I have seen. Let's hope that it's a temporary glitch.

title: Lazy writing and execution
text: Very disappointed. Marvel should never disappoint. Ever.! Not with a multi-million dollar budget. Best part were the visuals and the goats. They went overboard with the jokes.

title: This movie deserved a more serious tone
text: I really liked the story, but the overall tone seemed a little too light-hearted when the events were anything but that. To it's credit, though, it did get serious for the most important part of the movie.I also wasn't a fan of the Guns N Roses music. Just doesn't fit the movie. Hans Zimmer or some other instrumental artist would be much more appropriate for this type of film.

title: Felt a little flat
text: This latest addition of the Thor franchise sees several key returning characters such as Natalie Portman (Jane Foster) playing a large role as her character is given more depth.After the greatness and success of Thor Ragnarok, it would be quite difficult to top that, and Thor: Love and Thunder does not reach the heights of Ragnarok nor really comes close.A five year delay (due to covid-19) is quite something and there was most definitely a lot of hype surrounding this film. However it feels somewhat flat.There are decent moments of action and good chemistry but it feels a little too comical and trying too hard to be funny. Whereas Ragnarok was naturally funny and engaging all the way through. The tone of this film should have been a little more serious, where it seems like it was a copy of Ragnarok.Christian Bale delivers a great villain but feels a little wasted. The other leads are still great but considering this is the fourth film, the freshness is gone. The brief scenes of the Guardians of the Galaxy was a welcome sight but it was very brief that by the end of the film, we completely forget about it and it felt almost pointless.Thor Ragnarok isn't terrible but it isn't groundbreaking and somewhat of a letdown considering the hype it had.

title: Death of Superhero genre
text: It is just another Marvel movie like every other marvel movie. You will enjoy it like a Snickers bar , as soon as you stop eating you will forget the taste in an about an hour or so.Visually , it is a nice movie , other than that , you get a movie filled with the most bland comedy only Marvel can make , characters are laughable without any depth and I am so full of it by now that I can for a 100% say. THIS is the Death of Superhero genre of movies.Same or even worse fate ( imo worse ) is coming for Black Adam.

title: Villain was only interesting part of this joke
text:
This movie is horrendous, Action is meager, story is weak the script was stupid, Bad guy was interesting but didn't do much with him. Acting ... was BAD, this I blame on the Director since all the actors can act. Even the CGI was not that good. What the hell were they thinking when they saw this script they immediately should have thrown it in the trash.I own all the Marvel Movies, Many older ones as well that weren't the best, but even they are better than this. This is the first Marvel Movie I will skip buying.Kevin Feige should be ASHAMED.Take my advise skip it, wish I had.#thorloveandthunder
#MarvelStudios.

title: Christian Bale shines in whatever that was.
text: The second Marvel chose to make Thor comedic relief and then elevate him to clown supreme was a huge mistake. Chris Hemsworth is really talented and can be very funny, but there should be a line somewhere for when all your superhero movies are infested with jokes. Marvel made this mistake years ago and they wanted to make each main character into a comedian.That could work with a few characters, but it gets exhausting when everyone is. Thor has the potential few other Marvel characters have to tell stories away from earth. Kenneth Brannagh had a really good approach to it, despite the movie having multiple shortcomings.What Taika has done with this is not only showing that comedy will only take you so far, but also the exhaustion and overproduction that Disney and Marvel are doing.Let your franchises breath. Let us miss it. Spend some time writing something worth the characters. Cause even having a performance as good as Bale, or Portman did and having as many cameos as this movie had can't save the tremendously boring and childish humor this train wreck had.Do better Marvel. I blame you, not them.

title: It's just plain bad!
text: Disney and Marvel Have allowed Taika Waititi to single handedly kill one of the better Marvel franchises. Branner gave it a smidge of humour and depth.... Waititi simply tried to make it too funny. No story. All over the place. I know people have rated Bale's performance but he's better than that. Crowe interestingly acted with truth and was about the only person to achieve that even if he did border on Borat at times! Please please please either find a new director or no more. Gutted.

title: Unfortunate to what happens to Marvel Legacy
text: I don't know if this film meant to be a Comedy, Cartoon or Continuation of Marvel legacy, doesn't matter, to summaries this move, it is a failure in every direction, wondering why such great actors (Bale, Hemsworth, Damon, Pratt, Crowe and many others) would accept to be involved in such a bad movie.So after Thor Ragnorok, Thor love and thunder , She Hulk, Dr strange In the Multiverse of Madness, what would be the next mess up.This movie's story line is silly, the jokes are even worse, I've always liked Disney and looked forward for their movie woks, I would we why they are doing this, they should realize that Marvel has always been producing the best movies ever, and now all the people I know is waiting for DC to make out of this fallback of Disney a great opportunity for them.

title: Closer to Thor the Dark World than Thor Ragnarok
text: I don't have much to add in here outside of what's already been shared by many thousands of other reviewers and viewers... This movie is a joke and doesn't take itself seriously enough for it's audience to suspend their disbelief and actually hear this dialogue without cringing. I love Waititi and almost all of his projects... But maybe there is such a thing as too long a leash even for the extremely talented directors? The core plot actually has the potential to make a great movie... The cast could have shone (Christian Bale as a god killer? Shivers) but everything failed to come together and I have blame the writing for that one.What did I like about the movie? I don't remember. I tried to forget each cringe moment as it passed. Such a disappointment and another bummer for the Thor franchise and a sign that the Marvel Cinamatic universe is loosing it's touch.

title: Movie
text:
Christian Bale is great, Russell Crowe has a good moment,
Hemsworth is good but this movie cannot be saved from a
terrible script, bad direction and stupid humour that
overstay.rip.

title: RA
text:
Wtf did I just watch? Every second of the move is worse than the one before. I started with; wel
It's ok, ok it's kind a funny, ok a bit to much, no that's not good, really, somebody just kill me!! I don't know where to start. From mumbling and dumb Thor to fat and unfunny Zeus, that did not need an accent. Jealous wapens, I mean really, come on!!! Why, just why!!! And I'm only halfway through. I can normally enjoy a marvel movie without comparing it to comics or any other thing. Just sit there an enjoy, but this was just to painful to watch. Or was it ment to be a parody to MCU? Cause then it's a 10!!Second half of the movie was bearable so, I'll bump it up to a 3 start. But it could have been so much better.

title: Wasted
text: The movie is trying to be to goofy and silly at all times. The majority of the jokes are forced, and even at serious scenes, they are making jokes that ruin the drama of the movie. Thor Ragnarok was funny, but didint make jokes at important parts. Christian Bale is wasted.

title: Nothing left to be said
text: Time to take a break from Marvel. What a waste of talent with all these great actresses and actors! Is Disney trying to fit every single Hollywood movie star in one Marvel movie, or is the other way around!

title: Thor: Love And Thunder Is For Me MCU Worst Film To Date
text: Thor: Love And Thunder is simply my biggest disappointment of the year, so far?, i think it will stay until the end of the year, but who knows, anyway despite the usual great MCU movie trailer, for the first time i'm leaving the theater so disappoint on an MCU movie, Thor: Love And Thunder is basically an awful romance movie where the main couples of the film have a superpower, Thor is mostly just a full unfunny comedian here, Jane Foster (Natalie Portman) and Thor chemistry is awful and their dialogue is just so cheesy, their chemistry is also not click for me in the first Thor but it's not terrible, and their chemistry is good in The Dark World but i guess that because Jane Foster did not appear much on that movie and only have a few scene with Thor and i don't mind it, and so i can safely give a conclusion that Natalie Portman as Jane Foster is just not good, Christian Bale as a villain surprisingly awful, Gorr is just a lame unbadass villain, he's not scary for me and he's not menacing, it is possibly MCU worst villain, from Ragnarok to Love And Thunder this movie is a super downer, if it's directed by different person it's still make sense but no it's still the same guy, Taika Waititi, in Ragnarok you got this version of Thor who are mostly still a badass just with a little bit of comedy and it works perfectly, a badass female villain Hela played incredibly well by Cate Blanchett, you got Loki which is one of the best thing in Ragnarok, you also got bruce banner, and the fight and the battle was fantastic, in this one only the first battle and the battle in Zeus place that i enjoyed, the rest is mostly a meh battle, i also wanna say that Lady Sif played greatly by Jaimie Alexander is probably MCU most underused and underappreciated great characters they've ever have, and she only have a very very small role in this one, much smaller role than she have in Thor: The Dark World, i love Lady Sif in the first Thor and Thor: The Dark World and not only i want her having a way longer screen time in here, and i also way much prefer her than Jane Foster, i think she deserve on the main team alongside Thor, Valkyrie, and Korg, and they did not do that, MCU really use her character so terribly, now let's talk the pros of Thor: Love And Thunder, the movie still have a few pretty good moments and the whole Guns N' Roses soundtrack that i like, i think the visual and special effects was great, Valkyrie and Korg was not awful in this one, they were ok, the last battle was also just ok, and that's about it, the rest i just can't stand it, so overall Thor: Love And Thunder is for me MCU worst film to date.

title: RDJ was right
text: What in the ...RDJ did carry these movies, I almost walked out of the cinema. Worst marvel movie so far, who directed this movie?? And why is there a bad joke every 2 minute. The movie was litterly cringe. The acting is terrible, the plot too. I mean, the movie focuses more on guns n roses than the plot. There was so many mistakes, the tempo is way too fast and the cinemagraphy was garbage. I mean a convo in this movie was shot so bad, just too angles haha! Terrible, it ruins marvel.

title: What a waste
text: I am only giving it 2 stars for Christian Bale's performance. What a waste of the character of Thor - turning him into a flake. It's like declawing & defanging a lion. Natalie Portman & Tessa Thompson are both just so annoying. Smug & so pleased with themselves.I couldn't wait for the movie to end.

title: WHAT A WASTE
text:
WASTED CHRISTIAN BALE
WASTED MIGHTY THOR
WASTER GORR THE GOD BUTCHER
WASTED ZEUS
WASTED AMAZING STORYLINEMARVEL IS WASTING ALL GOOD ACTORS AND CHARACTERS SINCE THE ENDGAME..
SONY WASTED MORBIUS AND JARED LETO .WON'T BE SURPRISED IF DC MAKE BETTER MOVIES NOW.

title: Tedious
text: Sat through this movie. Two stars because it made me chuckle a few times, but the constant set up from one joke to another got tiresome. The whole thing was like a run-on sentence with sloppy scene shifts and jarring changes in pace and tone. I imagine I missed half the jokes just because I am not into the MCU. The climax made me wonder why that wasn't the go to answer in the first place and a lot of the lead up to it was premised on constantly shifting rules that made no sense outside the scene they were in and were changed for a joke or on a whim in the next scene. It could be argued that it was meant to be more of an "emotional" journey, but even then smacks you in the face with inconsistency and unbelievable character reactions.

title: Wow, it couldn't be any worse.
text: Thor: Love and Thunder is another depiction of Marvel's most recent failures as a franchise, like what they've done to The Hulk, they've watered down Thor into a shadow of his former self, replacing him with a far more politically correct female counter part which replaces everything he does - of course, doing it better.This movie was different to watch, there were times when I felt like I needed to end the movie half way through for my own health, but I endured the suffering.In conclusion, Thor: Love and Thunder is another instalment of Marvels pandering, unwatchable and 'comedic' garbage.

title: My GOD This Movie is Bad.
text: Didn't like this movie at all. For the first time in however long i actually couldn't finish it. I got about 1hr 13mins into the movie (and this is whilst i skipped a scene or two).The story seemed fine in terms of the God Butcher character that Bale played, but the rest was crap.The comedy was not at all comedic and the acting in general was fine but not enough to save the movie. You know a movie isn't great when even Christian Bale's acting isn't very good in particular.Overall this movie is a perfect example of how Marvel have fallen in terms of movie quality over the past few years. The one and only reason i am not giving it a 1/10 is because the CGI was good and the design of certain characters was fine.Before i end this i must stress how poor the characters are developed in this movie. The Butcher character in his first scene seems slightly interesting but quickly becomes boring. Zeus (a character that should be awesome to see in Marvel) is utterly abysmal. His character is boring and not serious at all. One of the worst (if not the worst) MCU characters to date.I personally believe that Taika Waititi is the most overrated director in all of cinema. None of the movies i have seen from this to Jojo Rabbit have been even average and he gets praised to the high heavens. He was a better actor in Free Guy than director and even in that movie he isn't particularly great. I'm gobsmacked.This movie is poor in 90% of the categories you can rank a movie in, 2/10.

title: Dissapointing mediocrity
text: I've been a fan of Marvel works since.... Well, wow. Since early 90's cartoons. I've enjoyed their comics and works for a long time now.This is by far one of the weaker, bottom-of-the-barrel offerings movie-wise.Everything about this feels like tasteless pulp that's been mashed together. So far Thor 2 was, by comparison, the most weakest offering from the Thor chain specifically but oof, this one makes it look like a brilliant entry by comparison.I wanted to love the notion of the female representation in this film, and some of the concepts weren't terrible but everything else pressed in-between was just sad.It was just barely cohesive that it somehow functioned as a movie but failed in every other aspect. It was neither exciting, nor interesting enough to work for the title it was granted.It felt more like an attempt to materialize a steamy fanfic than actually pull together good story, character development and universal consistency for the final product to seem sane.What has happened to Marvel in phase 4? You started to derail before this point but... Boy, this is bewildering.I hope you guys bounce back, but, I worry you somehow will continue to make some questionable decisions that will impede in this effort.

title: Absolute garbage
text: Disappointing movie with lgbtq theme. I had to close my sister's eyes and leave early, because of the whole lgbtq thing they're promoting in this movie. No wonder it got banned in many countries.

title: Hard to take seriously
text: I thoroughly enjoyed Thor: Ragnarok. I enjoyed this one...much less thoroughly. This movie tried even harder to be funny than its predecessor, but trying is not the same as succeeding. It felt like a movie made mostly of tongue in cheek montages that occasionally remembered to add plot and stakes. Very occasionally. Why were the Guardians of the Galaxy necessary? Why did we need whole sub-plots about Asgard theatre troops? Why did Russell Crowe have to go THAT far with his whole schtick? Almost everyone other than Thor, Jane, and Gorr seemed like ironic cardboard cutout scenery. I appreciate the sense of humor, but it's not enough on its own. If the story (and really nobody other than Bale) doesn't take things seriously, why should we?

title: Death of a franchise
text: After all the excellent Marvel universe movies, we've finally hit rock bottom.This latest instalment feels like a National Lampoon parody of a Thor movie.The story and script is awful. The so-called humour is embarrassingly unfunny. The actors are just wasted in this mess of a movie.The film never engages you. It plays like a kids cartoon, of the worst kind. Childish in its approach to what weve come to expect from Marvel.Nothing about this movie works. Even the CGI sucks.Disney needs to up it's game and stop dumbing down this franchise or the Marvel universe will sink into its own pile of excrement.This is a shameful abomination.Avoid it at all costs.The end is in sight.

title: I expected nothing and I'm still disappointed.
text: This movie hates you!It is designed to mock it's audience. Every character in this movie has as much thought put into them as the characters in snl sketch. It is openly making fun of it's audience and anyone stupid enough to pay for a movie ticket.

title: Joke and Thunder
text: If you are waiting an epic movie , go back your home and watch Gladiator (2000) on Netflix. Because this movie it's a completely joke even in the vilain moments.Thor Ragnarok was much better.

title: Disappointment.
text: It just felt like a fever dream and I had the urge to leave the cinema after 30 minutes.Too many bad jokes, conversations felt unnatural, backstory for Gorr seemed kinda rushed, backstory how Jane got the hammer little to none.The cinematography was astonishing as usual and the story was ok but nothing great.I would even rate this movie worse than Thor 2.

title: Written by chikdren...
text: If this was written by kindergartners it would a step up.... This is so bad it just isn't funny.. you can tell Disney bought the rights to screw this up that badly.... It is complete disaster... No good parts of any kind here... no redeeming qualities... it is ruined... and now I have to keep writing because it has a minimum length... making Jane was. Good pjs let's get a girl in a lead time so we can make thing fair. It is so bad it is hard to watch... I had to stop half way through because I couldn't stand it any longer... omg I am fine with marvel... this is so bad it is hard to be believed... Thor and Jane fighting as a married couple?

title: Please read the book
text:
Thor is now an awful joke and parody of the noble god that exists in the comics. The Gorr the his butcher story by Jason Aaron is one of the finest Thor stories for years and I implore users of this website to try and read it just to see what the film could have been and what it certainly was not. Disney are now aiming at an audience that is far too young whilst forgetting the audience that has grown up and want something a little deeper and serious. The daredevil story 'born again' by frank
Miller is a master piece and I am sure that will be the next classic to be ruined by the Disney practice of dumbing down adult material. This Thor bmivie was a truly awful adaption.

title: Terrible
text: I'd give this less if I could, just the stupid screaming goats joke, that wasn't funny the first time and gets done to death, gives this a 1*.What would take it into negative numbers is that it's just a bad film, terrible writing and just not funny at all. How do Marvel keep getting things so wildly wrong from the great films that came before?And course objectification is ok if it's done towards a man, but the outrage if it was a woman!Korg was great in Ragnarok, but Taika Waititi forces him into this for his ego and it just doesn't work.Narcissism seems to reign supreme in this era of film making and it's making films dull and lacking in anything that gives it character.

title: Is this a parody?
text: What a shame. This felt like it was taking the mick out of the marvel films. A few one liners dotted throughout a film is fine but this was just stupid.Do yourself a favour and watch Ragnorok again instead of this.

title: The magic of Marvel and Thor is gone
text: Complete garbage. That's it.You should know that I love Marvel and The Avengers. But.. Nope. Not this time.It's very clear that Stan Lee isn't around anymore. The story failed big time and the "acting performance" was below zero. They can do better! And to put Chris Pratt in a 2 minute scene (okay maybe more than 2 but still...) and nothing more is pure blasphemy. I lost 2 hours of my life. So disappointed. The jokes? Well... they tried but did NOT score at all. Lame is what it is. S-O L-A-M-E!!!Christian Bale is the only reason to remember this movie. At least he went all in. Kudos to him.

title: A movie that was probably more fun to make than to watch
text: If you have watched the Lucifer series on Netflix, then you know what to expect from this movie. Like Lucifer, the Thor movies started with a more serious tone and adopted comedy in favor of suspense and drama over time. I can only guess why this happened in Thor: Love and Thunder. My guess is that the performers and crew had way too much fun making the film and forgot about the audience.My suspicions with Lucifer were that the cast and crew got very familiar with one another, and the show was more of an expression of their camaraderie rather than a show produced to entertain an audience. I suspect the same with Thor: Love and Thunder. Further evidence of this is the underdevelopment of Christian Bale's Gorr. He's the only serious tone in the entire movie. Bale is playing a serious role in a comedic movie. It's really out of place.Moreover, the film is flooded with childish comedy. The Marvel movies cleverly introduced selective comedy at its peak, but this movie's comedy is diluted and excessive. The entire film feels empty as a result.

title: Completely forgettable experience
text:
I think that Thor story is one of the better ones in Marvel Cinematic Universe. It has potential to expand (and it did) independently of the other movies. Thus, I decided to give a try for the 4th installment.Jane Foster entry into in the movie felt stretched, but otherwise fine. Christian Bale did a good job, but his presence in the movie is quite short. Thor was just the usual. The ending is a dumb cliche.Pros:
1. Decent cinematic.2. Music selection is good.Cons:
1. Poor humor.2. Use of children as child-soldiers by supposedly good guy.3. When not poor, the humor is just dumb.4. Uncreative story and plot armor all around.5. The sexist scene with Thor was completely unnecessary.I think the current rating of almost 7 is way too much. The movie is not good, but okay-ish at best. Graphics and acting can't do much to a horrible script. It's also disappointing to see the low moral level displayed by the director that's just spitting on the cultural progress of last decades.

title: They Did Bale Bad
text: Casted bale and didn't used him.. too much jokes... very less screen time for bale... gorr spending most of his time with children... worst thor movie.

title: Least favourite Thor
text: I really thought I'd like this one. The other Thor movies were all so effortlessly funny. But this one just isn't. Maybe it's because they were clearly trying so hard to make it funny and campy and to laugh at itself, but it just didn't measure up for me. One or two people in the theatre laughed out loud a couple times, so clearly the comedy style works for some.Didn't hate it, so I'll still give it an even 5.

title: Disappointed...
text: Why Marvel phase 4 is so frustration. I didn't go to the cinema with much hope, but it still made me sad, I really wanted to see the cosmic court and its members in the movie. Unfortunately there was so much nonsense about the movie Living tribunal and the others that if they were in the movie they would have made a fuss and Laughs,I think they made such a ridiculous scenario,Thor 4 could really bring great success to mcu and this universe It would bring a different concept. This was just a comedy movie for kids...in short...it could have been the biggest drama&lesson in the history of mcu and the beginning of great things, but now everything is a joke.

title: More like '4: Love and Thunder'.
text: 'Thor: Love And Thunder (2022)' feels like an absolute rush job. Seriously, it's like a half-hearted first draft. Lacking the charm, wit, wonder and chaotic energy of Taika Waititi's previous foray into the MCU, the film chugs along at its own meandering pace as it tells a simple story as straightforwardly as it can. Some of it has a lot of potential and some of it is even fairly good, but all of it is undercut by the almost oppressively unfunny screenplay that has no idea how to balance its tone. I could probably sue for neck injuries thanks to a couple of these instances of total tonal whiplash. The movie just isn't fun, either. It certainly isn't the sort of devil-may-care comedy you may expect from those involved. Despite a handful of jokes that I recall making me think "that's quite funny" (but, crucially, never making me laugh), the experience of watching this is a maddeningly straight-faced affair. I mean, it's like the easiest 'you laugh, you lose' challenge in the world, so much so that most of the humour doesn't even seem like it's trying to make you laugh even though it obviously is. The whole thing is actually kind of embarrassing, the equivalent of watching a screening of someone's University work that they clearly scraped together mere moments before they were due to present it. I'll highlight the few things that I feel work about the picture. Firstly, Jane's storyline has a lot of potential and comes close to being affecting on a couple of occasions. It unfortunately isn't capitalised on fully, but it's undeniably the heart of the story and brings the chemistry between Natalie Portman and Chris Hemsworth back into the fray. Secondly, Gorr's motivation is believable and his presentation is often fairly unsettling (thanks, in no small part, to the stellar work from an out-of-place Christian Bale). His introductory sequence is mostly stellar, until it eventually gets too silly for its own good, and the payoff to his arc is as mature as it is satisfying (despite the denouement's somewhat clumsy handling of its consequences). Finally, there are a couple of action sequences that are presented with distinct aesthetics that bring to mind the best work of Zack Snyder. The golden shower skirmish is probably the movie's most entertaining set-piece, whereas the gang's extended stint in the shadow realm builds on the flick's most disquieting scene to present a relatively eerie battle that's genuinely aesthetically interesting. Despite these limited successes, the picture is easily one of the worst in the entire MCU. Much like 'Doctor Strange In The Multiverse Of Madness (2022)' before it, it simply doesn't feel like an actual film. It has all the elements that ought to make for a strong superhero story, but it squanders each and every one to emerge as nothing more than an absolute mess.

title: Disney what have you done?
text: This is the worst Thor film I have had the displeasure to watch, they have absolutely destroyed the franchise. Many parts of the film were cringe worthy, with some lame acting, poor dialogue and unnecessary jokes.Christian bale, Chris Hemsworth and Nattalie Portman all gave good performances but were let down by poor dialogue and probably poor direction. This all distracted you from enjoying what should be a great fantasy thrill ride like the original Thor movies.The CGI was as usual up to standard and gave great visual effects and the storyline itself was good but poorly executed due to a badly written script.Whatever happened to the great MCU movies you could watch time and time again. Well it seems Disney have destroyed them and just churn out garbage that you would expect from far lesser organizations, what a shame!

title: Advice for Marvel: LESS IS MORE
text: Taika waititi made thor: Ragnarok and it was beautiful. It was spectacular with ample amount of emotion, sadness, rage and goofyness in all the right places! He just mixed up all the factors in this installment; maybe thought goofing around was the best possible way out when there's not much story to tell. Bringing back jane and mjolnir was supposed to be the omph factor in this installment but not much light in there as well. Chris Hemsworth looks tired, maybe haven't slept in days. Introduced zues in all of this just to further the storyline of MCU, and yes this is the last and most disappointing installment in the thor series. All in all its a watch and forget OTT grade movie at the max.

title: ATROCIOUS
text: This movie is a JOKE. It's great to see Christian Bales in the MCU, hope they bring him back in the future as other character. Cuz they just killed a perfect villain for the Phase 5.Other than that, at least keep Mighty Thor a little bit longer? Kill Thor might be a FANTASTIC&BETTER option right here in 4th film. Jesus Christ.

title: My hopes were so high
text: As a Thor comic book fan we were excited for the next chapter, but instead we end up with a hodgepodge of a movie. The storyline jumps all over, not maintaining any consistency. Many funny scenes but Marvel no longer targets the original comic book audience, instead they target the 1%. Sad days ahead.

title: I want my 2 hours back
text: Congrats to nitwit Taika who managed to destroy Marvel's Thor.I though that his Last Thor was bad. Well, I was wrong. I wonder what is the matter with people these days, especially to those who makes crappy movie like? What were they thinking? What is their agenda? To deter everyone from watching movies ever again? It seems that they are doing this deliberately, as I don't know what other possible reason can beMovie is completely dull and empty.Total waste of 2 hours. My advice. Rather go outside and enjoy 2 hours of fresh air instead of cinema paying for insanely bad movie.God, I hope they won't ruin Deadpool 3 once it happens.

title: Thor-Love and Blunder
text: Herr Waititi said at a Comic con,"I will destroy your Mythos,Baby!!!!...",and I think he just about managed it with this abortion of a movie....everyone in it should hang their heads in collective shame. Only good thing was Guns & Roses music ftd. Easily worst Marvel ever and I'm glad I've stopped paying money to see their tripe. I thought that 'Ragnarok' was pretty good,at the time and I also thought 'Jo Jo Rabbit' was quite an achievement but what Mr W was thinking with this Turdfest I cannot imagine,(...actually,knowing his Politics,I can..),suffice to say,us fans will vote with our wallets. Cheerio Numpties.

title: Disney is Ruining the Marvel Universe
text:
Whats going on here? Usually when I see a marvel superhero flick its a real treat, exciting, thrilling ,intense at times and even dark in some cases...Since Disney has gotten its gooey fingers on marvells movies, they have been Utterly destroyed and turned into Hallmark movies, comedic parodies and the heros completely emasculated...Look at Hawkeye, Hulk, and now Thor...whats next? Ruin Daredevil as well? This movie, I sat down to watch with my gf and 20 mins in we were both rolling our eyes and shocked at how shallow, stupid and childish it had become... we honestly couldnt even finish watching it,though i may try later myself...It was Painfully bad and thats really sad considering the high regard and respect marvel films had back in the days of infinity war and falcon and winter soldier...The decimation of an incredible franchise...the destruction of the marvel universe, more so than anything done by Thanos...so sad...
at least DC has kept it legit and Uncompromised.... Hard Pass on this mess of a film...Im shocked that christian Bale even wanted to be associated with it.

title: Just silly
text:
Only thing good about this movie,are Crowe as a comedian..hence 3 stars.Portman as a "female Thor"? Just one of the things that wasnt right..Really..not one of the tv-shows about those that survived "the endgame" are at all plausible (in that univers),nor is it interesting at all..
Regarding this movie..A LOT of famous actors..and several new we will (hopefully) see in the future..but this film is a testament to the fact that
it don matter who u get to act..if the script should be down the drain..never to be seen again.I loved Marvels Thor-movies more than the other films..prolly cause i'm from Norway :D but this last film is just..bad.

title: I miss when Marvel took their movies seriously...
text: This film is just one big joke after another. Even a majority of the action scenes had a comedic element to them. It was ridiculous! Any and all intensity that Christian Bale brought to the screen was crushed almost immediately by some unneeded joke or quip of some type and it just grew tiresome within the first 30 minutes and remained cringe for the rest of the film. Sucks because Gorr was probably the best and most interesting part of this film. The return of Natalie Portman would've been more welcome had they given her more to do than just say cheesey one liners and have cancer. It was just silly. Really wanted to like this one, but I feel like this was geared to make children cheer and adults lose brain cells. Just disappointing. 2 jealous weapons out of 5.

title: absolute garbage
text: Was this written by a 10yr old? Yes this is based on comic books but what happened here. My family and i enjoyed the MCU up until Endgame. Now its all been cringy bad humor and going down hill fast. This director and writer have to go. Disney has the money to put big names in the movie but that does nothing with horrible writing. I believe Stan Lee would be disgusted on what Disney has been doing to his creations. Taika should not allowed to be directiong anymore more future marvel movies. Disney what are we doing here? There is only one positive about this movie and it was the villian portrayed by Christian Bale. What a waste of a good character. Very sad to hear they keep this director on board for future MCU movies. Watch the movie but youve been warned.

title: Worst marvel movie yet
text: I love all the whole cast Christian bale did an astonishing performance. But the whole is just bad, it's far away from what marvel comic fans expect, from their comic to be live on screen, instead it would be a fantastic option for kids (you get this vibe just from the whole comedy style of the movie and the kid fight)it felt more like a Disney movie than a marvel movie). I think the influence that Disney has on Marvel helped the movies to go on another level, but this approach on thor is the worst. Please Disney if you want to attract the young audience make a new animated series or movie, don't destroy our films that we are waiting for years to see.

title: 1h 58m long joke
text: The movie is dumb AF. Disney"s strategy of turning sequels of successful movies into kids show is not sustainable.At first they might look good in the box office because it attracts the new generation of kids plus the old fans of the series (like me). But you can only trick us once. I won't waste my time on any of these movies anymore. And I am quite sure that no one else with a brain older than 12 will.A bunch of cheap not funny comedy moments one after the other, and tons of no sense. A movie completely empty of a reasonable plot. The movie is dumb, the actors all act dumb, and it's just a big waste of time and resources.Above all, the movie has ZERO impact or the avengers timeline, so really, don't bother watching it.

title: Borderline unwatchable
text: I for one quite liked Taika Waititi's Ragnarok, a little too comedic but still quite epic feeling, anyway that left me looking forward to his next take on the MCU. L&T on the other hand is a train wreck. I gave it 3 stars as I did actually get to the end. Thor is a complete joke now and I'd suggest that it'll be hard to get another movie green lit after this disaster.It's all just silly and I can't quite point the finger at the worst culprit, maybe Russell Crowes Zeus (was Zeus's thunderbolt was intentionally portrayed as a lump of unimpressive plastic, or was it work-experience day at the SFX office?), the anthropomorphic Storm Bringer's jealousy fell flat, terrible costume design, those goats, King Valkerie (yawn), the completely superfluous GOTG or the Thorification of the children. I guess I'm just not the target audience, but the 12+ rating it got feels at odds with the juvenile slapstick writing, however the swearing and violence do for me take it beyond what I'd let my 8 &10 year old boys watch.The only surprise here was the lack of straw man misogynistic takes on Portmans "The Mighty Thor" for the film to neatly takedown. Unsurprisingly in the end Thor's contribution is downplayed in favour of Jane Fosters, undoubtably to placate Hollywoods obsession with "The Message".I read elsewhere that Ragnarok was only directed by Waititi, but L&T was also co-written by him as well and that for me says he's not the right man for this type of movie. After initially being quite excited for Waititi's take on Star Wars, this movie just makes me think we'll get the same garbage we've had to endure over the past decade.

title: Taika dropped the ball on this one
text: The concept of this film must have looked great on paper. But in its execution Taika mis a few dozen steps or he just didnt care and I say this after watching the film and the making of this film (behind the scenes)First of all... The over-acting was excruciating to watch. The gaudy colours was a bad choice. The Guardians were wasted as a cameo.Secondly, the annoying goats screaming? Wth was that all about? ANNOYING!!!Thirdly, the decision to make every scene into a mocking contest of Thor Universe! Who decided that was a good idea? Every scene is a joke. And if you watch the "Making of Thor" you can see Taika saying "we didn't want to make a film that was joke joke joke" well thats what you ended up with all jokes and no laughs!The only good thing in this film was the Moon Fight between Gorr & Thor...Dont even want to talk about Russel Crowe!This film made the 2nd Thor movie looked really good in comparison.Im very glad I chose not to watch this film in cinema.3/10 just for the visual during the Moon Fight.

title: Turned it off
text: We don't enjoy where Marvel is heading with their storylines in Phase 4. When Marvel started it's films, they were after capturing the audience they solid story telling. No, it seems every Thor movie is more "out there" and just incrementally worse. If this continues they will be losing ticket sales. We are also getting tired of the of how every movie seems to have to hit social agendas, but this seems to be a Disney direction as of late. It's unfortunate, but we will spend our money somewhere else and we recommend you do the exact same. Maybe DC can step it up.Terrible movie. Terrible script. Played out characters.The only shining part is Gorr for the 10 minutes he was on screen.

title: Average build level
text: This episode was really childish and I expected more from Marvel.But with all these words, if we make friends a little, they really played a unique game.I am one of Marvel's fans and I watch everything he makes again. I hope he starts making new series of stories.It is true that Marvel's production style is science fiction, but some of the events in the movie are really a farce, and they need to spend more time on some parts of the movie and have more creative ideas in the story writing of the movie than childish things happen in the movie. To give.From here, I would like to thank all the constructive factors in the hope of countless improvements.

title: Mediocre
text: It is mediocre at best. The first hour is hard to watch. The exposition is much to long, everything is silly. Humour yes, but please chosen well. When the story gets some speed, the humour gets less intrusive and the story more interesting.Still, from 10 Jokes, only 2 really work. Pluspoint for Korg, the only character who is really funny and entertaining (as he was in any other marvel movie) . Another plus point for Christian Bale, I liked his acting performance and the emotions on his face.The costumes look very clean in some scenes and the CGI is not always invisible. Mediocre at maximum, as I said.

title: It makes no sense to me
text: When the short run time was released, people said not to freak out as not all marvel films need to be bloated 2.5h slogs... and so this movie comes out and is all tell, no show, and has too little of the main villain that we're all dying to see. It's also paced weird and is too much tell and not enough show.Just makes no sense to me. It was doomed to be inferior to ragnarok from the beginning.

title: DISAPPOINTED TO SAY THE LEAST
text: It seems as if Covid-19 wreaked a lot of havoc on people's intellectual being (not just the physical side). Also, the Entertainment Industry has severely lost touch with REAL PEOPLE. Instead of the fools on social media who (those of us with more than two brain cells to rub together know) will do or say anything - from the safety of their Moms basements of course - to seem relevant because that is the only attention they get, affording them a false sense of power. Since Hollywood is full of Wall to Wall narcissists we can all see who are really cowards because NO ONE has the nerve to make substantive shows - too controversial and they don't want to be "canceled". Which rolls back to this movie. The only nice thing I can say is that at least it isn't a remake/remastered older movie. This is the new phase the rest of Entertainment is taking - going back looking at shows that majority of people liked and literally film it again without changing anything but the actors. COWARDS and NO TALENT HACKS.

title: Stupid dad jokes
text: You ruined the hole experience of this with the stupid dad jokes. Too much is too much. Get a grip. It was a shame for almost every actor there... Marvel has jokes and very serious stuff. Learn to separate.It was noticable the uneasy of some actors on some scenes that seemed like bloopers instead of the real film.I will considering not watching nothing on the cinemas from Marvel, maybe it is better to wait for it on TV instead of paying. Thousands of good directors and you chose the millennial that does dad jokes.This is just to fill space. This is just to fill space. This is just to fill space. This is just to fill space.

title: Wow
text: I can't believe just how bad this was. I didn't expect it to be great, but I didn't think it would be this bad.Christian Bale was good, but it seemed out of place because the rest was so bad.More often than not I agree with the User Review Rating, plus or minus a star. It's currently at 6.6, but I think a 3 is generous.It made me chuckle a few times but they kept using the same jokes over again.Thor seemed dummer than usual, which is a plus for me because I think he's supposed to be.It was also woke, of course, and this made a horrible script worse. It also seemed cheaply made. Like the special effects and layout of all the scenes had a B movie feel.

title: Why so many jokes?
text: Was very excited but super let down. Seems as if they're trying to turn the Thor franchise into a movie for 3-7 year olds that will laugh at any joke. Can we add some level of seriousness to the film? First time every watching a marvel movie and hoping that it would end sooner.

title: Awful
text: Horrible. Horrible. Horrible. It literally felt like a parody movie. I didn't enjoy it one bit. I feel so bad for the actors for taking part in this. Christian Bale could have done SO MUCH more as the villain. Natalie Portmans character didn't make sense other than she was in the first movie... I know most thor movies are usually comedic but this was just over the top and I found myself falling asleep and not coming remotely close to laughing. I gave it 3 stars because Chris Hemsworth is nice to look at. Between this and the newest Dr strange I may need a break on marvel movies ðŸ˜‚. Thats....about it for me... I'm honestly surprised it has 6 stars on this app lol.

title: Keep disappointing us Marvel.
text: Seriously. What have you been up to over there at Marvel? After the top of Thor Ragnarok you head to the bottom. Get serious before it's too late. When you just throw out movies at some point you will pay the bill and people will turn their backs on you. You should name the movie as Hot Shots part three. You could use Mat Damon Sam Neill and the rest of the Asgard theater team throughout the movie. It would be cheaper for you. And you should respect your characters more like the rest of the gods. You didn't make Zeus dance only ballet. A little shame doesn't hurt. Christian Bale was excellent but unfortunately it was like he was in another movie since everyone else was acting in a comedy except him. Probably the director and the screenwriter got confused somewhere. Three stars only for the casting.

title: Cringeworthy
text: Absolutely disrepsects the characters and any emotional relevance the story has.They literally sacrificed the quality of the film for some cheap Adam Sandler jokes.Thor is such an interesting character and they make him dumb.

title: What did I just watch?
text: This is, by far, the worst movie from the Marvel universe. Full of jokes (bad ones) and dull plot.... I don't know what happened...And I thought that Shazam was bad, but this...OMG...

title: Who approved this garbage?
text:
2 stars for Christian Bale
1 for Chris Hemsworth
1 for Natalie PortmanNone for everything else.This is an appalling movie. There is no real storyline to speak of. The antagonist (the amazing Christian Bale) doesn't have a story arc. The protagonist has no story arc. In fact, there is no story at all.I can only wonder why this ever became a movie and the only thing I can think of is that the producers wanted a comedy/action movie. A movie that has plenty of action but is really funny and cool.Unfortunately, the action isn't all that great the people made this movie seem to have a definition of comedy that isn't shared by the rest of the world.At the heart of this movie, there's actually enough story. The protagonist has a good origin story and that's pretty rare these days.The movie makers could have taken a good script and elevated it to the next level. They could have made something really good. Instead, they seem to have "simplified" everything. The parts of the story that need fleshing out have been left bare and emphasis has been placed on comedy.And this is the worst part of the movie -- the comedy. It doesn't really exist. It's like watching someone who's learnt who hold a violin yesterday trying to play in an orchestra. It's painful, jarring, and frankly just plain bad.This is a good script turned bad by the executives. And in turning it bad, they've outdone themselves.

title: Not Worth Watching
text: As any other superhero movies, Thor movie is taking a "U" turn to be more of comedy sifi action movie. No a great story line and comedy scenes are also by force.. Very minimal role for the Guardians (Guardian of Galaxy). The movie just make joke of Gods.. The whole story is all about how to save the children of Asgardian. And in between, it shows all Gods are not good as Gods are the main reason for the Evil to come in picture..No doubt VFX are good as Usual. Not a great movie to watch in Hall.. Save money for better and watch in OTT. We missed the excitement when first 3 parts of these movie.

title: Overly political with no focus on characters
text: Just a lot of pointless politics without any real focus on the story or characters.It had some fun moments but honestly it was a constant fight to enjoy the fun and then be interrupted by pointless "politics"Just stick to your the story and make it about the story and not add random references to make it relevant.Super bummed.

title: wtf
text: Why gorr was so serious through out the movie .he didnt even say a single joke.gorr should have given some jokes then the movie will have been a masterpiece. Taika waititi has done a great job.he has made a god into a joker that was so fun to watch.the jokes was good although there was less jokes .chris hermsworth will surely get an award for his comic timing . This was humanity best ever movie.hats off to MARVEL.

title: A Multi Million Dollar Cringe-fest
text: Successful Marvel movies have a fantastic blend of action, humour and effects. Unfortunately this goes so far overboard on the humour that it feels forced and is a complete parody.It verges on ridiculous and has virtually ended the Thor franchise. It has a campy pantomime feel, which is fine if that's what you're in to but I find it really irritating.I have to agree with the other reviews and this movie was a huge miss.The writing and directing is abysmal and this is best avoided.My review is finished but IMDB needs 600 characters so here is something cool; dinosaurs ruled the earth for 165 million years, whereas humans have only been here for 6 million. The apocalypse happened with their extinction and we're merely the mutants that followed.

title: Enjoyable but not good..
text: What happened to Thor we loved??? Where is all the action??? It is unfair to compare it to Ragnarok, which is one of the best mcu films, but it is inevitable and I expected much more from Love and Thunder and Taika Waititi. This movie was something like a parody and definitely didn't deserve this villain! Congratulations to Christian Bale, his performance was outstanding and his story very interesting!I don't know what to comment about Zeus! It was ridiculous! Come on he is like the king of gods, not a clown..I really love mcu and wanted so much to like this movie, but it lacks depth and the characters have zero development. I miss phases 1 and 2 so much!!

title: Is anybody still left from Marvel?
text: You have to wonder if any writer that worked on the (Disney-less) Marvel movies is still working these days. This is utter garbage and has nothing to do with the quality stuff Marvel has produced in the past. The film has more in common with the Muppet Show then with Marvel movies.They are dragging the characters into the dirt. Why build up good characters when you bring them down with imbecile stuff like this? Marvel movies used to have real interesting characters that viewers actually followed. Not just as a perpetual SNL skit.They must have a way to inflate the viewer ratings. No way average viewers would give this a 6/10.The franchise is destroying itself...

title: Let's Make Thor a Bumbling Idiot
text: This seriously was such a garbage film. They took a smart, god superhero and turned him into a moron that rambles on for no reason. Everything about this movie was made for kids, not the people who want to enjoy the marvel comics come to life. And the screaming goats?! Give me a break. Thor Ragnorak had some clever lines that made it funny, but still serious. This one was just one dumb punchline after the other. The only good part was Christian Bale, and apparently he was the only one who knew how to act as well.

title: absolute garbage
text: Stupid jokes , cheap costumes and seems like this move has beed made for kids who is under 8... I thought Doctor Strange was a big failure but no this is a new outsider for me....

title: The screaming goats were best
text: OMG. This is without doubt the worst marvel film of all time. Who wrote this hot trash? Honestly if this is the best Marvel can produce, I'm out. Flat humour, boring plot and for the first time in my life, I wanted to walk about of a Marvel film. Really? A lightening weapon? Sappy romance? It just got worse and worse as the movie went on. I hated, hated, hated the screaming goats, but you know what? The screaming goats were the best. I'd soon be lock in a small windowless room with them than to watch this film again. Bad, bad, bad, bad. Whoever was paid to develop this assault of all that is decent and good should be fired!!!

title: Fourth Phase Garbage
text: I actually liked the last Thor movie even with the nonsense. It was fun and funny despite the repulsive Valkyrie character and moved along at a good clip. This movie failed to recapture the magic and is just another causality of phase 4 and their garbage approach to writing. The effects are fine but the plot is nonexisitant. It's lazy, disrespectful, and self indulgent trash. Don't waste your time. I feel bad for Chris Helmsworth having to first make fat Thor and now this. It's obvious he likes the character and wants to be there but the morons that Disney employs and their sexist ideas are continually forced into scripts that are weak at best.

title: Its own parody
text: Christian Bale is great as always. But the scripts are terrible, the humor is so deplorable that not once have I smiled.Taika Waititi make from Thor an infantile idiot and from the movie a new episod of "What We Do in the Shadows". It's a parody of Vampire movies, this movie is a parody of marvel movies.How did they let toTaika Waititi directing a Marvel movie or any movie after Thor: Ragnarok?Taika Waititi shouldn't write and directing anything (exept "What We Do in the Shadows").I can't decide which was worse Thor: Ragnarok or Thor: Love and Thunder.I hope we will see Chris Hemsworth is a real movie, because that kind of lousies will kill his career.

title: Vastly disappointing.
text: The action scenes hit fairly well and the special effects are Marvel's typical top-notch. Christian Bale delivers a phenomenal performance. But that's about all that works in this film.If they had spent half as much on writers as they spent on special effects the movie may have been able to be more than a 2 hour Guns N' Roses music video interspersed with flat jokes. Christian Bale's spectacular performance unfortunately only serves to stand out against the trash-fire of a script.This film is the cinematic equivalent of dubbing carnival music over Johnny Cash. I really hope there is nothing critical to the overall MCU story that would make this necessary for future watchers and that anyone following after can just skip it...they're better off.

title: Really, really silly...
text: It gets better towards the end, but it is a really silly movie and the plotting is ridiculous. It seems like the Marvel Universe is focused on parodying itself at this point. The entire GnR trope was twenty years out of date and the movie was mostly made up of worn out messages with no real creativity. The only reason that Marvel isn't entirely formulaic is that they keep introducing worse plots and poorer humor. Of course, Marvel fans still need to see the movies so that they won't be lost in the next one... or that is what Marvel hopes. Don't spend money to see this one. Borrow it or stream it.

title: Worst Thor so far
text: I've enjoyed the Thor movies, with the exception of Christian Bale doing a good job in this I though the overall movie was just poor to the point I thought why am I'm still watching it . I'm getting the sense these Marvel movies need to take a break for a good 10 years.

title: Same thing over and over again
text: This movie just showcases what is wrong with cinema nowadays.Visually they all look stunning, cinematography is almost impeccable.And then when it comes to dialogues, storyline and character-development they just throw it all away.Movies these days are all the same: the actors can easily be muted, just based on the music and what we see we all know what is happening, being said and is going to happen.And muting the actors would've been a good decision in this case since we wouldn't have heard this awful greek accent from Crowe.For me a swing and a miss and I don't think I will go see the next one of this level of moviemaking is going to be the new standard.

title: Even My Mom Cringed
text: It's the worst movie I've ever seen. I did have expectations after coming from the other 3 Thor movies which were decreasingly good, but still good enough for me to enjoy them. Sadly, this movie feels like it was made for 3-11 year olds, which is probably why it does have a high rating even if it is painful to watch for most people.Even my mother cringed when watching it as she was expecting something more epic instead of this. The movie doesn't take itself seriously, and the plot is so weird. Just throw a thousand ideas into one movie and tie it together.
