The part with the kids feels so incredibly cheap, like something taken strange from Disney channel.I think the biggest flop is that they tried to make it family friendly, but in doing that, they successfully made a movie for younger kids while totally forgetting about older fans (I'm thinking 14 and up).

title: Why Marvel failing again and with the great cast?
text: Cast of the movie far better than many others, Christian Bale, Russel Crowe, Matt Damon.. Yet it is far more relied on CGI effects. Most of the fights were meaningless and all of the critical moments throw away sake of some stupid creepy jokes. It does not make any sense, even strong director and cast entity of the movie become garbage.I was made a comparison based on cast while back, both new batman and thor movies have not been released, I was generated high hopes for the Thor movie and definitely sure about it will going to bring down batman movie. But the result is clearly opposite, maybe they are targeting different audience groups yet it is not explaining gap between scenerios. A lot of things happened, too much things happened, too much character only blinked to us and dissappeared. A bleak, frustrating, unexciting experience.

title: I'm sorry but the humor is too much man
text: The humor Is just so overblown that whenever the film has actual serious moments it just doesn't fit with the tone of the film. Taika Waititi made this movie for actual children where there has be so MUCH UNFUNNY COMEDY! The visuals and action are the only really great things about due to it being messy,Having a weird direction and humor that doesn't make you laugh. Jane also holding the name of Thor was ridiculous. Thats Thor's Name not a title! Seriously Disney I loved Thor Ragnarok and it's humor but this is just clownish.5/10.

title: Oh dear!
text: Christian Bale gives a great performance, which is wasted in this total dirge fest. Worst MCU movie yet as Disney slowly kill the franchise. The attempted humour just grates and descends into silliness, the multiple cameos seem to be there just for the sake of it. Really difficult to find anything positive to say, oh yes, I enjoyed the soundtrack.

title: Not Mighty Thor but a Mighty Cash Grab
text: Sticking with the one star rating because it won't allow a zero. Mighty super heroes are depicted as cartoonish comedic characters and cringy romance. Story is thin and forgettable. Only the Infinity image at the end was worth watching. Thor Ragnarok was great but unfortunately its sequel is a let down and forgettable movie experience. My advice...watch phase 1, 2 and 3 and forget phase 4. It is the Mighty Cash Grab! Save your money.

title: Enough with the jokes
text: Taika Waititi's idea of an MCU movie is machine gunning joke after joke to the point of cringe inducing nausea that makes for a confusingly painful movie experience. Ironically enough, as soon as the third act of the film rolls around and with the jokes easing up and dramatic tension is being sown, the movie shockingly (or maybe un-shockingly) becomes infinitely more relatable and interesting, ending on a very strong note. Unfortunately, I view movies as a whole, and having two thirds of the endeavour a trek of excruciating proportions probably chocks this up as a big loss.I have lost faith with the MCU after being a massive fan following the early successes of the franchise, and still cling to the hope that Marvel will one day realize their audience have become adults in the real world who are capable of enjoying movies at a more mature level.Almost a 3-4/10, but the strong third act helped bump it to a 5.

title: Multi-colored garbage
text: It's Multi-colored garbage., A parody to Itself. Taika Waititi should've been in control as he said In his recent Statement about the Director's Cut Movies.

title: Really?
text: Is this really all the better Marvel can do? For me this was the worst of the Marvel Movies to date. Not sure what they are thinking between this movie and the last couple of series it would seem they have lost how to make a good and entertaining movie or series. Things continue to get worse with each new release. Another couple and I will not even bother to look for or watch Marvel products.OK well I guess they have a length standard now so this was a waste of time as a movie. A serious waste of time. Seriously glad I did not spend money to see it.Bad movie, worst one yet, terrible in so many ways. What else can I say about this movie.

title: So confused
text: What am I watching here. If this was designed to be in the vein of Ragnarok then they are so far off the mark. If this is a spoof or a satire of Thor then they did a good job. Too many jokes and just plain silliness. The MCU has in general had it's share of humorous interjection but this looked more like a Monty Python sketch. This was the first time that I had a really hard time finishing a Marvel movie. Honestly if I had gone to a theater to see this I think I may have walked out halfway through. Bale's performance as Gorr was really good and really wasted on this hot mess. Hemsworth and Portman have such good chemistry in the Thor movies that it is a shame to use it on a sophmoric mish mash of comedy and melodrama like this. If there is another Thor film please, please get back on track because Love and Thunder makes The Dark World look like a masterpiece.

title: Thor
text: I would love Chris Hemsworth to make another movie of Thor just not that director of Thor Love and Thunder he made the movie a flop. But as well as Chris Hemsworth I would want Thor to have a bigger groth and deeper voice. Just get a better director no one likes over director of Thor, Love, and Thunder I forget his name his name his that boring. But yeah I'm really hoping soon there will be thor 5. I want action, fantasy but no comedy. When u hear the name Thor it sounds serious it sounds like thunder not laughter. Chris Hemsworth. Deserves a better director that knows how to do the job Properly like a man not like a child.

title: Very silly
text: Very silly and over the top in story and visuals. Movie moves at a brisk pace but slows down at the romantic moments.I think it tries to be a RomCom at moments but with lots of action.

title: The evening shadows fall on Marvel movies and shows
text: This movie has all the silliness of a cartoon, it sacrifices Thor's very rich experiences and backstory to tell jokes that arent even that funny.It really is a swing and a miss. Taika should have balanced serious story telling with his style of jokes as he did in Ragnarok, and take Thor to his next place of personal growth which I was so interested to see in this movie. Instead Taika makes EVERYTHING into a joke which really insults those who spent all that time invested in this character and hoping to be thrilled into something deep, dangerous thrilling and fun.There was real meat and bones for a good story here, but it was all played for the silliness and goofiness that is a slip on a banana peel corny weeeehooo joke. Yaaay Look at all the colorful visuals. Laugh now, wasnt that funny!That is pretty much Thor and the nail in the coffin for me for my interest in Marvel Disneys mediocre 4th phase.Nothing was as interesting as Netflixes Daredevil or Punisher, and the only movies of note are Spiderman, with Dr Strange having such a messy story that didn't make much sense, that I left the theatre thinking, that movie felt kinda dumb. How can I care for such sub-par entertainment? Everything they have done ranges from mediocre to just OK. And Taika's movie was mediocre.Sad I like his style but tone it down dude!Anyway that's it for me and Marvel! I wont consume or have anything to do with Marvel unless it is exceptional I am not interested. Really the sun is setting for Marvel. :'( The actors are great the story DUMB!

title: Wasted opportunity, time and money
text: If you look at it as a standalone movie with no ties to marvel , then maybe you might just be able to watch it , however because it is tied to marvel cinematic universe, this movie feels like they tried to give it a makeover of some sort , the music doesn't match the movie nor the dress sense or the comedy , if you watch all 3 thor movies you can feel like there's connections between them , however this one is a huge embarrassment , at times it feels like it was made for kids , whoever wrote this had no sense of direction, giving it style and music to make it look like it's cool is not cool , they have completely ruined thor , it's a complete utter nonsense of a movie to be kind , there was huge potential believe it , with bale as a villain there was lots of missed opportunities, other aspects of thor could have been kindled with it just feels like they ran out of ideas and just did whatever they felt like , there are so many villains they could have added and done. With this in mind ultimate thir and other thors could have been added , since they have already made it possible ,

title: A weak film that struggles to meet the highs of its predecessor
text: Thor: Love and Thunder felt inconsequential in the MCU pantheon and was a considerable disappointment coming off of my favourite MCU standalone film, Thor: Ragnarok.The MCU isn't good at strong emotional moments because they're often undercut by the overuse of CGI or the need to insert a joke every minute. Unfortunately, that seemed to be a focus for this film and it fails at that. For instance, the movie opens with some backstory for the villain who lost his in his devoutness to the gods. He meets his god to whom he worships, who ends up being callous and to the needs of his followers. The tension of the scene and weight of this revelation is undercut by the poor CG used to composite the god's face as well as the goofy acting in what should be a serious scene. Jane's illness is explored in little detail and seems like a plot device for her to end up with the hammer. The character was not redeemed from Thor 1 &2 as I hoped she would, and I really wished the relationship between the characters was developed for longer.Much of this would be okay if the comedy hit as consistently as the previous film (which is the funniest movie in the MCU imo) but unfortunately it didn't. Waititi's brand of NZ humour feels completely absent here resulting in a movie that's roughly as hit-or-miss as MCU's other offerings. Returning characters, like Tessa Thompson's Valkyrie or Korg, had less to do than in Ragnarok and felt like filler. What's missing were the strong character dynamics that fuelled much of the comedy from before, like Thor & Loki's distrust of eachother and Thor & Hulk's rivalry. They should have kept one of the Gurdians around or picked some other superhero from the MCU for Thor to partner up with.The action scenes were also less consistent in this one. I didn't find the climax as enjoyable as the rainbow bridge setpiece from the previous film, nor any as fun as the escape from the Goldblum planet.I also found the villain to be very agreeable since most of the gods that we see in the film are not worth saving, which is a significant flaw in the screenplay. They needed to balance this with some gods which exhibit some positive qualities.Some stuff I did enjoy was Christian Bale's performance as Gorr and the fight scene on the black and white planet. Russell Crowe's performance was unexpectedly funny but not quite as memorable as Goldblum's Gamemaster.I'm writing this review the day after and am struggling to recall much of it already. I expected much more from Taika Waititi and this is unfortunately the weakest film in his filmography.

title: Overly jokey and inert
text: I was very disappointed by this latest entry in the MCU. The movie starts out well with the opening scene starring Christian Bale as the "God Butcher". But then it goes downhill from there. Chris Hemsworth seems to be phoning in his performance, but he is also a victim of a bad script that tries too hard to be funny. I enjoyed the humor in "Thor: Ragnorak" but this one has too many jokes that fall flat and not enough action. The direction and cinematography are adequate but not inspired. Therefore, I can only recommend this one for MCU completists and/or "fanboys". 5/10.

title: Not needed
text: It was really disappointing that a thor movie could not give what we needed. I did not want to see children fighting with God Butcher(is he that bad, I do not think so), missing Stormbreaker(if they want to make a key, it should be Valkyrie or Jane Foster if only they do not want to include them to the final fight). And I believe, everyone will agree on this, Marvel making now short films and leaving us angry in the theater. This movie has also silly post-credit scenes.

title: Christian Bale is better than this
text: Did Christian Bale owe someone a favour or something ? I never thought I'd see the day he would join the MCU let alone such a bad entry. His performance was good as expected but not enough of him. Thor has to potential to be the best avenger but this solo feature is not helping his brand. Have we learned nothing from George Clooney's Batman ?

title: Terrible humor, terrible story, terrible movie
text: This was probably one of the worst marvel movies I've seen in a while. It seemed like in the last couple of movies they integrated comedy pretty well, but this movie didn't. Way too many jokes, some stuff didn't even make sense, like how thor could do half the stuff he did, but couldn't kill the "bad guy" of this movie (not tryna spoil)

title: Disney continues to lower the standard for Marvel films...
text: The first half hour or so has some funny jokes and pop culture references, starting off with a bang similar to the most recent Suicide Squad film, however, unlike the most recent Suicide Squad film, it completely loses momentum, and the rest of this film is utter, hammered garbage. Natalie Portman is fed an awful script, genuinely appearing uninterested in her role, and looks ridiculous as a female Thor - I literally pity her for having to appear in this filth, along with poor Christian Bale. If these producers had any actual brains, which clearly almost nobody working for streaming companies that make feature films does these days (Netflix is equally guilty of producing tripe features), when they read the proposed script and saw the name "Zeus" it would have been very clever for them to think to engage Liam Neeson in reprising his unforgettable performance as Zeus from Clash of the Titans, to the point that I might have given them one more crucial star towards a barely passing grade. Don't tell me Disney doesn't have the cash that this couldn't have been arranged, since Liam Neeson will seemingly work for loose change these days (not to detract from his work, he's excellent, but he appears quite easy to engage, similar to Nick Cage, who I also enjoy). Russell Crowe is utterly miscast as Zeus - his worn-leather face, stringy hair and obesity simply DO NOT CONJURE VISUALS WORTHY OF A GOD OF ZEUS' STATURE, PERIOD, to the GREAT detriment of that entire sequence. I'm surprised to see Christian Bale in such garbage, but none of the fault lies with him. The film has typically strong visuals (LITERALLY THE ONLY THING GOING FOR EITHER NETFLIX OR DISNEY THESE DAYS) but even the visuals are squandered, as mid-way through the film converts to black and white as they enter some sort of "shadow realm" thingy, and honestly, I feel they could have been more inventive making the visuals look good without using color. More routine, boring action sequences and bland storytelling ensue. Whatever, it's garbage, why am I making any effort going any further about it since Disney/Marvel didn't? Basically there isn't a Marvel film since Avengers: End Game, Deadpool 2 and Logan worth anybody's time. Looking forward to another actually GOOD Marvel superhero film ONE day, but at this rate I've accepted that IT'S VERY UNLIKELY...

title: Marvel dropping to DCU level
text: With the exception of Spider-Man and Shang-Ti, the last few MCU movies have lost the luster of the original group. The DCU (with the exception of the first Wonder Woman and Shazam) have been subpar. I feel Marvel is slipping to this level.For this most recent Thor effort, they draw from Ragnarok, which was definitely a great MCU movie. An appropriate amount of comedy and great scripting made it one of the better in the MCU.Love and Thunder's comedic attempts grow tiresome early on. Instead of a strong script, we get silly antics and one liners that do nothing for the movie. It does what most of the MCU movies have done recently: rely on heavy special effects and fail to really connect us to the characters. The Marvel movies in recent past were an event that people looked forward to, the crowds cheered, and we left the theater asking when the next movie was coming out. I waited for this to come out on Disney+ and was not disappointed. It was definitely worth waiting to see it at home (read this as sarcasm). Please Marvel, get back to making heartfelt stories and let the special effects take a back seat.

title: I can only say terrible
text: The special effects were terrible and Thor looked more like a clown than a superhero.If you want to see a normal comedy film, Thor Love and Thunder is a good choice, but if you don't want Thor to be destroyed for you, say goodbye to Thor after Ragnarok.Today, Marvel only tries to produce movies, and the quality of the movies is not important to it all.It didn't have beautiful battles and only Natalie's presence in the form of a superhero made the battle scenes different.In my opinion, the ending was emotional so that the viewer would forget the weak story of the film and sink into the end of the story.

title: Just as "good" as Thor Ragnarok
text: The dial-up-everything-to-11 approach does not a good movie make (Guardians of the Galaxy 2 had the same issues). The humor and characterizations are so over the top that it undermines any attempt at drama or tragedy.Thor is off to find himself, yet again. Yay! How many times are we gonna do the same arc? Chris Hemsworth is okay, although at times, his Thor is way too buffoonish.The movie can't seem to decide how it wants to portray Jane Foster's cancer. Imagine Batman as a campy comedy filled with unfunny jokes, then let's say, Alfred has some life threatening illness and... oh wait, that already happened. Nevermind.As for the main villain, I've seen claims in both the positive and the negative reviews that Christian Bale was "the best part of the movie, he was just underused." We must've watched a different movie. His screen time is the least of the problems, Bale is embarrassing as Gorr, he can't strike a balance between subtle and hammy, and as a result he overacts to Nicolas Cage levels, even Elizabeth Olsen had more nuance in MoM. We are constantly told Gorr is The God Butcher but the movie doesn't show us his deeds, so he never feels like a real threat.Giant screaming goats and Korg overstayed their welcome really quickly, small doses, Taika, small doses.If you didn't like Ragnarok (like me), you probably won't like LaT either.

title: Sorry ladies
text: ... but Natalie Portman was pure cringe throughout. I found her so hard to watch and her acting was reminiscent of Star Wars days gone by. She looks so uncomfortable as "a Thor" and she just kinda looks silly. A weird storyline to get her back into these movies and not a welcome one.Tessa Thompson's English accent ðŸ˜‘ðŸ˜¬ðŸ˜‘ it's getting worse with every movie!Russell Crown's cameo was rather enjoyable though and he did make me giggle.Christian Bale makes an unexpectedly great villain but his performance seems far too good for the movie he's in.I don't know why the Chris's interactions on screen are always so awkward and strained when they both play their characters so well separately but this movie saw them sharing scenes again with that same awkward tension on screen.All in all not a terrible film but not a good one either, and the addition of Thor numero duo spoilt it rather. As a woman, shoe horning ill fitting female heroes into films does not make me feel empowered or represented Marvel, especially when it's done in such a half assed and patronising way.

title: What a jumbled mess
text: I've never been a fan of the Thor movies, abd this did nothing to change my mind. It starts in what feels like the middle of a different movie. Turn it's just one CGI scene after another with little exposition or development. It's one stupid joke after another as well, as any drama it tries to build it defuses by trying to get you to laugh at it.There are screaming goats which are annoying to no end. That's a sentence I never thought I'd write.The plot is ridiculous. My favorite is a doctor breaking bad news in a hospital...to Thor next to a vending machine! And that's supposed to be a serious scene!Convoluted, jumbled mess. Had to stop to look up on the net whether I had missed anything because things were so scattered.

title: A comedy film that is not funny
text: I didn't understand the hype back then after watching it today. 99% of the jokes are unfunny, majority are obviously forced that it's cringe worthy. I only mildly chuckled with Russel Crowe in a skirt. The goats are not funny either. This is probably one of those films best seen in a theater so you can listen to the audience laugh track, but it starts to look really bad and the imperfections crack open under close inspection with no help.The acting on the majority of the crew is so bad that it feels like they shot this with only a few tries because the director has low standards on acting. I face palmed at the starting scenes of the child looking at the necklace looking 'ok'-ish and then suddenly at death's door a few frames later. That and the first god encounter was so bad and that was the beginning of the movie.Christian Bales' Gorr is probably the only saving grace of this film, plus the music. He did a good job but .. unfortunately he only had a few mins of screen time while the shoehorn crew Korg and diversity token Valkyrie had majority of the screen time next to thor, and these side characters don't even add to anything at all in the story.Lastly the CGI ... omg the floating head, what happened there? I loved the small-ish moon/asteroid where they fought though despite the problems with micro gravity. Bale is wasted, the cgi creatures was actually interesting(but unfortunately dies in 1-hit and easily pummelled by little children) , the final scene cgi is ok as well(the water scene, not the kids ... omg don't remind me, what is with Taika Waititi and kids).

title: Struck out again.
text: Made Thor a bumbling idiot, with Jane Foster follow suit. Valkyrie was more of a punch line than a role. Russell Crowe performance of Zeus was lack luster at best. Forced scenes around sexuality that had no place in the movie. 4 out of 10 for the movie and has in my opinion struck out with all the movies in this new phase. I hope they start turning things around.

title: Waste of time
text: The movie could have gone in so many other ways, and it did not live up to the hype. Very disappointed. Marvel has gone downhill since they killed off Tony. Would have rather slept.

title: Marvel, We need to talk
text: I absolutely adored Thor 3 for the comedy but also, and most importantly, the story and the journey that Thor goes through. I think that Taika thought that we needed more humor in this movie than in the last Thor film. If I had to give this film compliments, Gorr is a pretty good villain to have and is played wondrously by Christian Bale. Other than that, this movie has very little in terms of spectacle, no ACTUAL comedy, poor and dated looking CGI, and what seems to be a strong desire to make me despise the main character. If you are looking for a good Thor movie, I suggest you just go watch rewatch Thor 3. You'll have a much better time with it than with this film.

title: Absolutely terrible !!!!!!
text:
It's so sad to see the writers and producer kill the storyline and image of super hero's on movies today.I grow up on a time that super hero's we're just that SUPER HEROS, the good guys , an idol that kids could look up on for inspiration.This new movie is stupid dum and dark.( as a lot new super hero's making to the big screen
Today)
I fell bad for the new generation that won't have the opportunity to enjoy and look up to stories that inspire them on the future.Don't waist your money. Or time!

title: Thor 4: Time for Less Thor
text: Why is Thor so hard to get right? Thor 1, so average. Thor 2... We try to not talk about. Thor 3 was great and now... Yikes. I have to believe Waititi was being pressured by studio execs. I refuse to believe that he would've created something like this on his own. He's too good. This thing was a mess, it was awful. It really felt like big MCU trying to recreate Ragnarok but stripping it of its soul. Hemsworth is trying, Portman is amazing and even she can't save this from being a mess. Oh, and Bale... Bale is doing the best he can with what he's being given. That's just it though, I don't feel like it's on the actors, they each feel like they're trying but you can only do so much with so little. It's really hard to watch these Post-Endgame movies and not think Marvel is starting to circle the drain. Had a good run, but wow does it feel like we're grasping at straws now.

title: Very lazy
text: After a fantastic Thor in Thor Ragnarok, we now have a Thor that is, unfortunately, quite lazily made. While Christian Bale is very much in this movie for a solid 20 minutes, his performance is undercut by very poor dialogue, poor acting from his co-stars, subpar CGI, and a story that is very low on innovation, surprise, inspiration, and stakes as a whole. Gorr the God Butcher is a much weaker knock off of Kratos in God of War, and Thor should have maybe stepped aside and let Jane Foster permanently take the mantle he so unmotivatingly holds. If you enjoy watching the God of Thunder have relationship-problems with his hammer, axe, and a plastic lightning bolt, then this movie is for you. If, instead, you wanted an intimidating villain and a film with any stakes, this film misses the mark and seems aware it does so.

title: Very disappointing and tried too hard to be funny
text: I'm just going to be honest... I went into this movie knowing that people found it disappointing and sort of underwhelming for a MCU movie just because i'm a completionist and I have to watch EVERY MCU movie, else I don't feel complete. I mean for Christ's sake, I endured Morbius (which was bloody atrocious. The only half-decent thing about that movie was the damned after-credits). Anyways, this was everything that the people said. Disappointing, trying too hard at comedy which just didn't hit with me (Ragnarok was much much funnier), just didn't live up to any standards. Very sad, and hope that they'll save this mess with their next Thor movie (or series). It just kind of seemed like the director gave up on this from the start.

title: Bland
text: Terrible acting, tasteless story and the graphics for a new movie makes me feel like I've gone back to the early 2000s. The movie is ridiculously 'all over the place' as well as everything has been extremely predictable and cheesy. The attempt at added comedy didn't really help the movie as much as they probably thought it would. I wish I had more positive things to say about it. And for such a popular company, I expected better. But considering the last 10 years of Marvel movies, I can't say I'm surprised in the slightest. I like some of the actresses, and that's the only reason I'm willing to give 2 stars instead of 1.

title: It's gone too far
text: First of all.. the REAL Thor, you know the one from Norse mythology, ISN'T the god of lightning, but the god of war. I've let this slide, because of artistic freedom. But now they introduced another Thor. Female Thor, who's name is.. Thor. I don't know what they have been smoking, but it's not just weed. And the screaming goats? I chuckled the first time.. not the next 68 times though.There are so many throwaway scenes in this movie. You could remove half of the movie and nothing of the story would be lost. It's interesting to imagine what they come up with next.. a Hulk Thor perhaps? Why they needed to twist these characters into oblivion is beyond me.

title: They broke another one
text: What was that ? This movie was terrible . It really shows , that most times a good script is better than good actors (except Christian Bale , who I bet is already regretting his involvement . Actually both don't exist in this movie . Shocker . I wonder why nobody likes it . This is not what fans want . This is not what we deserve .I guess you need to learn the hard way . There were countless possibilities they could've gone , countless ideas lost . If you wonder why - Remove the shell protecting this .Go into the rabbit hole ... Deep , deep under. Future is in your hands . Fight for it .PS . I'm surprised I am not high writing this .

title: Thor characters is systematically destroyed
text: There is a feeling that Marvel is systematically destroying Thor's image since Ragnarok (which i love) but since then Thor is a comedian, and it is not funny, this worked nicely on ant-man but keep destroying Thor is becoming irritating. Iron-man, and captain America got their legendary closure. But for some reason the most powerful Thor and Hulk are going nowhere , put them in sitcom if you think they are too funny.Please MCU, give these 2 childhood characters a decent ending and end this torture for them and us.MCU must re-think the whole strategy if they want to stay in the market, ppl hate you now.

title: Horrible
text: This movie is total crap. Whiny Thor is portrayed as a total buffoon. When did Marvel films decide their movies are now comedies ? Well placed humor is great but this tries way too hard to be funny all the time which makes it NOT FUNNY. I'm a Marvel fan but I HATED this movie. The new Marvel Universe has pretty much lost me. They used to be serious adventures with well developed characters and story lines. Now they just feel like a very expensively done bad sitcom. Come on Marvel get back to superheroes being superheroes not whiny little wimps crying over an ex girlfriend and acting like a child. It's a sad day when Peter Quill is the most mature character in a Marvel film.

title: Marvel Cinematic Universe is Doooomed
text: No, just no. Nothing else but no.Boring, unentertaining. Got a little bit past the half-way mark and turned it off. The most bland, attempts at humor (no laughs at all). Stammering and awkward dialogue. CGI waaaaay sub-par.This should have been a straight to DVD release, or recalled due to cinematic defects. (Shouldn't there be a consumer warning posted on this hideousness?)Done with the Thor franchise, and if the dominoes keep falling the way I think they are going to? Done with the Marvel Universe now that Disney is destroying Stan Lee's legacy.Usually I don't even pay attention to the reviews of others until I see it for myself. I saw this train-wreck albeit half-way, and now understand what others are talking about.If Thor: Love and Thunder is a portent of things to come under the Disney... the Marvel Cinematic Universe is Doooomed.

title: A kids opinion in "Thor Love and Thunder"
text: The movie is "love and Christian Bale" , most of the film is a joke and Chris made bad acted Thor because of his "retired" personality.Christian Bale did an incredible film but it is just ruined by the bad details in the film.I recommend to see this movie to o understand the next marvel movies that have something to do whit the film. But you can of course enjoy it.Great music by the way.( My opinion) I'm a kid so I might be wrong.Cheers.

title: Not worth seeing in theaters.
text: This movie was good for the fight scenes only imo, storyline was predictable. The backstory at the beginning was a nice touch otherwise mid tier movie overall. Special effects were MID. Also the LGBTQAAIP+ sideplots were so forced.

title: Total Cr@p..
text:
Boring, Bad jokes, Long, Uninteresting,
No serious story or logic.. just whatever..,
Portman had no real reason to be in it..they just wanted a female thor..because why not..
Also the Guardians of the Galaxy had no real reason to be in it..they just wanted them in for a while..because why not..Only good things that made it a bit bearable to still watch..were Christian Bale, some great Guns 'N Roses songs and the good CGI.Waste of 2 precious hours of your life..
They should pay you to watch this..,
not the other way round!Ragnarok had almost the same style but it was quite good..
this one is a total FAIL..
maybe because it tried to have much more from everything..

title: Not awful, but nearly!
text: Although no money changed hands for me to see this, I still feel cheated.Russell Crowe's accent is as terrible as the story line, gags and script.The Guns and Roses soundtrack is the best thing about thisThe god butcher is nowhere near utilised enough, action scenes are predictable, dialogue delivered with mainly wooden expression, the good thing is it is not too long and fades into background noise quickly, jumping back in takes no effort as there is really no story other than get Gor.Never again will I part with cash to see a Marvel movie in a theatre, or buy on download / streaming service.The series of films put out by Marvel lately have been mediocre at best and at worse very bad.The frightening thing is Thor will return with yet another dire production, no doubt squeezing every last drop of cash it can.Please no more of this.

title: Thor franchise has become a joke
text: Do i really have to talk about this one? This movie is just garbage. Everything is a mess, the plot is very predictable and Waititi gives one of his worst directorial performance of all time (the goats were just so annoying). Mighty Thor is just one of the most useless characters in the MCU, and Zeus is treated like a joker for the entire film. The unique positive thing of this film is the performance of Christian Bale as Gorr, but he just appears for like 10 minutes in this movie, just another villain ruined by Marvel in this terrible Phase 4. Probably one of the worst Marvel movies of all tim.

title: Watch the Movie Itself Go Through a Mid-Life Crisis
text: THOR: LOVE AND THUNDER (C-) gives us a Thor struggling with an identity crisis (expressed through non-stop jokes) despite the challenges and growth his previous 8 appearances have sold us on. The film itself seems to be struggling with the same thing as it has transitioned to an all-out comedy vehicle with just two dramatic notes - love is good and religion is dumb. Taika Waititi's work here is like religious satire of Voltaire coupled with the schmaltzy humanistic ethic of Oprah filtered through the cinematic comedy lens of Tarantino & Shrek. The film isn't helped by a plot that is as engrossing and ad hoc as the obvious and non-stop CGI locations they travel to. Nor is it helped by action sequences as the film seems completely uninterested in taking the action seriously by giving it stakes or a respite from the non-stop comedy or unique/creative beats. I laughed at some of the jokes, but I found myself growing less and less interested in Thor and the gang that surrounds him. At the rate this universe invents ad hoc items (God killing swords and wish granting altars) that should have been mentioned in the Infinity War, brings back dead people, or retcons the tone/plot of past films - why should anyone care about anything. I hope this is as low as the MCU gets, but I fear it won't be.

title: Taika Waititi proving his inability to competently direct a Thor movie.
text: So much potential in casting Christian Bale as Gorr, and he is by far the best thing in this movie.Such a shame to waste that opportunity, because at times, this movie has really creepy vibes that would have made for a great Horror story. Instead, as soon as anything seems the slightest bit serious, there is a bad joke or dialogue befitting a character written by a 5-year old.Unfortunately this seems to be what Marvel wants to make now. Not clever writing or a competent Hero going through a story arc that differs from the last entry for that same character. Just a lot of colours, poorly written plot and dialogue and bad directing. I do not fault the actors for this movie. It is what the director wanted.

title: Thor love of Thunder
text: It didn't feel like the others it was like a big joke nothing like the better ones now I quit watching marvel. Thor is the biggest joke now.Also, I don't get why the Guardian of galaxies were in the beginning. I don't like how the movie is basically all about kids and how Thor and the other ones safe them and the kids and Thor stop that ugly guy. I Also don't like how Thor fake daughter can pick up Thor axe I know you don't need to be worthy to pick it up but it's Common sense that a person her age can't pick up Thors axe unless she has super strength. Idk I haven't watched the movie in 2 months.

title: 1 star for Bale and 1 for graphics
text: Those two were really awesome. But the rest is...absolutely disappointing. Like...come on. They hired a scenario writer from twitter (I'm not seriously, that's more of a joke but you know what I mean) and wanted a good result? 6/10 is too much for the movie. 4 or 5 is the best it can get. The first Thor movie was SO GOOD, the second one was awesome too...the third one was nice at best...and this one is just ew.Buy a bottle of wine or beer, some tasty stuff and relax. Maybe then this movie will become at least watchable. Skipped some most stupid scenes.Oh and the ending is LOL. Just LOL. I can't even tell you with words how BAD it is. So 4 or 5 out of 10 is the BEST this movie can get. But its honest grade is 2/10. Period.

title: Not as great as Thor Ragnarok
text: Who would've thought that the only MCU character (so far) to get 4 solo films would be Thor? The first Thor movie was an okay introduction and the second one was quite bland. In came Taika Waititi with Thor Ragnarok (2017), who made Thor a charismatic and fun character. Thor Ragnarok was no doubt one of the funniest and most enjoyable movies in the Thor franchise so far. It was no wonder that I was looking forward to Thor Love and Thunder when it was revealed Taika was returning as director. So did Thor: Love and Thunder deliver more fun or was this a big thundering step backwards?Firstly, Christian Bale was phenomenal as Gorr, the antagonist, in this film. He delivered an amazingly unsettling performance that made him incredibly creepy. He also delivers on the sorrowful moments as well that make him very sympathetic. Amazingly, he can be both frightening and yet kind of root for him. Natalie Portman finally returns to the Thor franchise as Jane Foster after being absent in Ragnarok. Her return is very "mighty" as she isn't just a doctor that is around but now a hero in her own right. It was great seeing her return and it's great to see that the chemistry between her and Thor (Chris) is still there. She has her struggles to deal with it and Natalie does an outstanding job of conveying the pain that she is going through. Chris and Tessa return as Thor and Valkyrie respectively and they are still great. Taika is still fun as the rock person Korg. Russell Crowe is pretty enjoyable to watch as Zeus as well. The whole cast did a great job in their performance.I also like the themes that are explored in the film. The exploration of love is a running arc for Thor throughout and I liked seeing him try to find "himself". There is also the theme of death in both Gorr and Jane's arc. It is handled wonderfully in both and I liked the resolution to it all as well. Legendary composer, Michael Giacchino, gives a colourful and bombastic score that works well for the movie. He also incorporates some great use of songs, similar to Guardians of the Galaxy, such as "Sweet Child o' Mine" by Guns N' Roses that just mesh well in the film. There are some pretty enjoyable action sequences but the most memorable is in the second act. There is a fight scene in the shadow realm that is just visually oozing with style.Unfortunately, the comedy in this movie does not work. I just found the comedy in this movie to not be that funny. Ragnarok had some laugh-out-loud moments but Love and Thunder just never get those types of moments. Additionally, a lot of the humour comes from Thor being an idiot. In Ragnarok, he was a lot more comedic but he had an arc and an important decision near the end. Here he is just a comedic idiot throughout and he never gets that sort of big decision as he did in Ragnarok. He does have an arc but it's very weak. It's genuinely a shame that the titular character has been reduced to a joke in his film. On that note, the comedy isn't as prevalent as it was in Ragnarok. Ragnarok was a comedy throughout with some strong serious moments sprinkled in. Love and Thunder mesh half a comedy and half serious and this tonal clash hurt the movie. The serious moments are when the movie is at its best but then a dumb gag happens and damages the moment.Christian Bale is the standout in this film but his character Gorr is barely even in the film. There is a whole middle act where he just isn't even there. He is also called the God butcherer but we don't even see him on screen actually butchering a god which is such a shame. Gorr needed more screen time to flesh out his character and show why he is a threat to the gods. They also don't show why Gorr killing gods is bad. There is one scene implying negative consequences but we don't see it either. This creates a problem where it feels like there isn't much at stake in the film even though there is supposed to be. The film just doesn't have much weight to it. In Ragnarok, Odin's death was meaningful, the brother's conversation was meaningful, Valkyrie's decision to help was meaningful, Thor embracing the God of Thunder was meaningful, and Thor letting Asgard blow up was meaningful. Love and Thunder just lacks a lot of these apart from one thing at the end that isn't even Thor.Overall, Love and Thunder is pretty disappointing. I expected something that was like Ragnarok but instead got something that felt like an attempt at Ragnarok. The comedy wasn't as funny this time and there are a lot more serious moments this time that is great but makes the comedy feel more jarring as it interrupts the moment. However, it is not downright terrible as there is enjoyment to be had here. It's just not a great Thor movie and definitely not as good as its predecessor. It's just okay and after over 20 MCU movies, okay just isn't good enough.

title: So goofy and absurd
text: How can this film possibly exist within the MCU? It is beyond corny, beyond goofy, has more one-liners and jokes than actual dialogue. An insane regression from Ragnarok.

title: Only created to make $$$
text: There's not much to say about the Norse god of Thunder's third solo film. At least, not much positive to say.In 'Thor: Love and Thunder,' Taika Waititi once again tries to push the envelope on how silly a movie he can make at the expense of Chris Hemsworth's once-beloved Avenger. Despite the addition of an extra-creepy villain (Christian Bale), the tone of this film is woefully dull.The combination of a nonsensical script, lack of even an ounce of originality and tired tropes results in what is perhaps the weakest entry from the MCU to date. And it's hard to see any other film giving it a run for this title anytime soon.

title: The whole movie is a joke. Literally.
text: When I started watching the movie, I was not expecting a amazing movie, nor was expecting a bad movie but a ok one. Instead, it came out as a terrible movie. The plot is bad, the people who made this movie ruined certain characters, but most of all, they turned the whole thing into a joke. The only good thing about this movie are the jokes.Maybe the people who made this movie wanted it to be a joke. Maybe they thought it would be better this way. But this movie ruined my MCU experience. I'd rather rewatch "Jurassic world Dominion" then to rewatch this movie.If you want to watch this movie for the LOL's, then you will like it. Otherwise, if you're like me, a person who wants a good MCU movie, don't watch it, as it will be a complete waste of time.

title: Disney Factory Making Movies
text: They have lost they're touch: i dont want sex or more gore.. just more meaningful story. You don't necessarily need death just more Avenues explored. They are Stretching the story thin.. and the attempts of keeping me around for this adventure is not working.

title: Bring Marvel Back
text: What a shame it is to see the figures which have been there since the 90s, who have been invested in so well over the years, thrown into the dumpster with this cheap over-parodic acting and scenes. I mean even the costumes now look like something the cast picked up from the local Halloween store. Why are you doing this Marvel? It's like they expect fans to just watch along every new set of episodes or movies unconditionally.I even had to stop the film a couple of times to actually check if it was the legit thing or a parody remake. Throwing jokes at literally everything isn't funny. The novelty of marvel films including Thor: LAT and basically anything after Spiderman: NWH has died :(I am utterly disappointed in where Marvel has been going with this and can't believe that my child based fanhood for the last 30 years has come to and end.

title: After watching this movie, I've decided to not watch Marvel movies and shows anymore
text: I was disappointed after watching Spiderman far from home and Dr Strange multiverse of madness, but this was definitely the worst thing ever. I hated everything about it from beginning to the ending. And ofcourse hollywood had to fill up the representation quota with unnecessary filler stories and characters. I used to love Marvel movies but not anymore. I'm not going to spend my hard earned money to watch a waste of entertainment like this one. How about you just make a good movie and keep the activism out of it? Is that so hard? Hollywood just loves ruining everything that people love. Save your time don't watch this trash.

title: Filled with lame repeated jokes and a Ton of Guns N' Roses!
text: Nowhere near compared to its previous movie; Ragnarok. Filled with lame repeating jokes, and a ridiculous plot. Uses more music than musical movies. Almost everything starts with a Guns N'Roses. Focuses more on side characters than the main hero. The visuals and cinematography were wonderful and had a great score.

title: This review is about Christian bale mostly
text: Sooooo I need to know if anyone else saw what I saw.... When I was a kid, I was obsessed with Newsies and I think Christian Bale used his newsies character for Gor!!!! The way he talks and moves, just like a Newsies dancing boy. It has me rolling the entire movie more than the plot and weird pacing. Enjoyable movie, didn't make any sense at all, the best part was seeing the gods at Olympus and how Natalie Portman looks her age!!!! She a gorgeous woman and I adore that she didn't have a beauty filter on her face the entire movie. 7/10 the last line of the movie made no sense. "Love and thunder" was not an appropriate title for this film.

title: 0 stars
text: What a waste of time.What is the problem with the new stage of the MCU, please make a movie again not a joke.I grew up watching this incredible films that really left you thinking, some were really dramatic, filled with action and romance. Now the movies are just comedy with nothing else, just trying to force every controversial topic, and not focusing on the story.What a waste of time. Im sorry for the kids, they will grow up with these type of movies and it is definitely not the childhood I ever want to have.All marvel movies have downgraded too much, and lots of people continue to watch them as the brand has already been created, if the first 10 movies would have been anything alike marvel wouldn't have half of the fans they have right now.The MCU is just on a great downfall.At least they killed Ironman and captian america, and didn't destroy their movies.Please create new stories and stop ruining the ones we have.

title: I've never rated a movie as '1' before - it's that bad
text: I'm not even sure what to say about this film other than, Are you kidding me? How did all of these film stars, with so much talent, get sucked into this mess? How did Disney ever conclude the movie should be made? (Wait. It made $400 million worldwide... Really? Are that many people so desperate for entertainment they will sit down to watch Russell Crowe do a routine out of The Marx Brothers?) I didn't make it through half of this foolishness, and then only because I have an intestinal virus. In full health, not sitting on the toilet, I would have turned it off during the Valhalla-gone-Disneyland scene near the beginning. I hope Chris Hemsworth and Natalie Portman never go near this franchise again. I know I won't.

title: Boring
text: It was so boring (especially the fight scenes) I wanted to go on my phone in the cinema, had to resist. Relies way too much on obvious humour, director clearly didn't know his role as a director.

title: Flight of Icarus
text: With Ragnarok they flew too high. But just like the myth of Ikarus, they lost their humility, they flew too high, the sun melted their wings and they crashed and burned.It's shocking that the people behind one of the best superhero movies ever made is directly responsible for one of the worst as well. But if you watch closely, you can tell why.They thought they are so funny the rest of the movie doesn't really matter. However, it was the other way round. The rest of the movie was what made Ragnarok great. The plot, the twists and the excellent cast. The humor was the enabler, which turned a great movie to fantastic.But without a decent plot, smart dialogue and decent roles, the humor becomes unfunny, comedy turns to farce. It's the same mistake they do with all these spoof parody movies like Scary Movie, Superhero Movie and so on. If it's just jokes, it ends up being one big fat nothing.They did exactly the same mistake, and Love and Thunder crashed and burned. It's a real shame, because this movie had potential. Now it's just a farce that back in the 90s would qualify as straight to VHS.A true lesson in humility for Mr Waititi and the Marvel Studios. People say go woke, go broke. But this one didn't fail because of "female Thor" or same sex couples etc. This one failed because instead of working on a hero movie, they worked on a spoof. If you don't respect the source material, the source material doesn't respect you.

title: A swing and a miss.
text: The movie is good mindless popcorn fun, but nothing more. They never spend enough time developing the characters. Just quickly jump from scene to scene.I think they could have focused more on Bale and Portman and left the Guardian's scene out.

title: Never again...
text: Iron Man killed Thanos and died for it and then Taika Waititi killed Thor.I had to force myself to watch till the end. Only me and the kids saw the whole movie. The adult side of our family doesnt have the patience for such garbage and everyone left within the first 30 minutes.This movie is one big bad joke. Or more precisely a mishmash of bad jokes put together one after another. Again and again and again and again. Imagine Scary Movie VERY badly done.Those 2 stars are for Christian Bales performance.Is there really no quality control in this multi billion franchise? If I ordered this movie to be done and the director would present me with this... well I would fire him on spot.

title: Garbage
text: Just when you thought it couldn't get any dumber than the last one or the one before it, they outdo themselves yet again. I highly doubt that any of the writers or producers have ever even read a single Thor comic. The script is pedantic. It's a real shame too, because the comic book series was awesome. Instead of writing about Thor they write a Dumb and Dumber sequel with dumb jokes and buffoonery. The first Thor movie was pretty good and then the writers and producers got full of themselves and over dramatize everything. It's similar to watching Gilligan's Island but there are a lot of people wearing capes. If they do make another one, it would be great if they would completely lose the theater scenes. They're the worst. I have no idea how scenes that terrible make it to production.

title: Oy...
text: Sadly, this production is quite frivolous. Irritating rather than captivating. Could not wait for it to reach its conclusion. I very much enjoy "RagnarÃ¶k" (and LOVE Taika's "What We Do In The Shadows") and the bulk of the earlier Marvel flicks but this comes off as a weak children's movie. Thunder a-plenty in terms of decibels cannot smother the fact that this is celluloid gossamer.The all Guns & Roses soundtrack (save a Dio tune during the credits) is a sign of desperation. Let's try to artificially generate viewer passion by injecting the so egregiously overplayed songs of one of the biggest rock bands ever. Sigh... Solid writing would have organically engendered viewer passion; like the scene in "Infinity War" where The Guardians rescue Thor. Very clever, captivating and amusing.I fear that the Disney overlords meddled throughout the production and that said film production zeitgeist will be the template for all forthcoming Marvel flicks. Obviously this would be tragic for each future Marvel production would end up Ewokified (MF loathsome Ewoks!!!). Reduced to cheap, generalized, lowest common denominator storytelling in an effort to maximize profits by being palatable to all 7.5+ billion inhabitants of the planet. I wish that this cynicism was not warranted but all the signs seem to signal this grim future. This would unfortunately mean yet another botched Fantastic Four implementation (Galactus as a !#Ã—^$/& "harrowing" cloud?!?! Unfortunately I cannot place a Captain Picard facepalm gif here).I hope that I am incorrect.Qapla'/Skol.

title: Marvel is getting crap day by day.
text: One of the worst movies made by the MCU. I hated it. The story was very bad and boring, the comedy was also awful. I watched it late but it doesn't matter because it left me disappointed. Zues looks like a joke in this movie, I mean why would you make such a mighty God look like a clown? Everything, from start to end was just crap. I used to be a fan of Marvel but now it's getting pretty boring and producing unwatchable movies. Another thing about Marvel is that I can't watch any one of their movies in peace because it has too many connections with other movies and TV shows (like Wandavison and Dr. Strange: Multiverse of Madness). I haven't watched Wakanda forever yet but I will and see if I can find something interesting to watch and enjoy.

title: Thor has come full circle
text: OK so I signed up specifically to moan about this. I understand the 'leave your brain at the door' argument but ultimately the mediocrity of this film is hard to ignore.Foremost complaint is they've turned Thor as a character into a total douchebag. He's right back where he was at the start of Thor 1, completely arrogant and behaving like a child, only now he's wacky and 'funny' to make it more annoying. Any development his character has gone through is completely undone. Thor has always been my favourite MCU character, but he's quickly becoming one of the worst.The comedy in this film is awful, and I doubt it was rewatched by anyone on the crew or they would've realised gags like the screaming goats got old very quick. It's also a bit from Rick and Morty on the planet with the screaming sun more or less, so it's unfunny, grating and unoriginal to boot. Everything is a joke which removes any sense of weight from everything shown, which only serves to lower the stakes and your subsequent interest and investment. The Palace of the Gods featuring Crowe as Zeus could've been spectacular as a bit of cinema but it was horrible from start to end. Every scene has a gag forced into it, it's irritating because you sit and wait for it to come then because it's expected it falls incredibly flat.Bale was excellent however so all the three stars go to him. I don't want to pointlessly review bomb so a 3 is fair. There wasn't much of him in it unfortunately, but what was there counted and it really captures you.After the mess that was Doctor Strange 2 and now this, I won't be going to any more Marvel films. I imagine a lot of the revenue for these films comes from people like myself who started with Iron Man 1 in their late teens and early 20s who now have babies or toddlers, making going to see these films way harder. I'm going to be much more selective with where my money and time goes.In conclusion, I would absolutely recommend this film if you are physically or mentally under the age of 12. Otherwise, just no.

title: Thor: Love and Thunder - A Badly Written, Colorful Disaster
text: I went into Thor: love and thunder with high hopes because of how good ragnarok was but i was very dissapointed. This movie is filled with so many jokes that really weigh the film down for me. The plot of the movie warrants a more serious tone but what we got was much different. The performances are mostly good with Chris Hemsworth, Natalie Portman, and Christian Bale as standouts. Christian Bale really carried this movie for me, and if it were not for Gorr and his scenes being as good as they were, this would have a lower score. Other than the Gorr scenes, this movie feels like some sort of parody of the MCU. The jokes aren't funny, there is an overload of colors filling the screen, and the writing is, at some points, laughably bad. This movie is, in my opinion, a huge dissapointment coming from he same guy who did Ragnarok.

title: Rushed, crammed, massive miss
text: To preface I am a massive fan of Thor and the characters development from the first Thor to Thor Raganarok. Ragnarok gave us a refreshing new look at Thor in a comedic yet thoughtfully appointed way. So naturally my excitement for Taika Waititi's second installment in the Thor series was immense to say the least. However, after watching the film its hard to say that the movie was anything but a misguided sci-fi comedy filled with corny jokes and a wayward plot that felt like it was written by Lennie from of Mice and Men. The plot jumped from scene to scene with little to no explanation of what's actually going on. The movie felt crammed and void of any sort of depth what so ever. I legitimately think you could have made four different movies from this one film and they all would have been infinitely better. Not to mention the absolute waste of an incredible villain. The character Gorr the God butcher had so much potential, but lack of character development and childish plot destroyed all hope for this villain. Even with all the stupid jokes flying around this ridiculous movie Christian Bale still managed to give a good performance as Gorr, and is the only reason this movie is remotely enjoyable. Thor Ragnarok drew the perfect line between comedy and a meaningful plot filled with beautiful character arcs that actually contributed to the overall story. Thor Love and Thunder spit on that line while crossing it. This movie felt like Talladega Nights set in space, but with worse jokes. Overall, surprised I managed to watch this entire movie with majority of my brain cells still intact.

title: Terrible woke tripe
text: Marvel yet again managed to destroy another superhero movie, complete lack of substance very contrived humour, which sadly fails over and over.It seems to me the studio says ok what's woke today, put that in the movie and double it. Two dad's, two mums.We want action, we want intrigue we want to be wowed, we do not want to be preached too, there are such a difference between marvel of today and marvel of yesterday. I gave this a try and really wished I'd just painted the walls to watch them dry.Movies are supposed to be about escapism this is like spending three hours at a Biden talk about how great his son hunter is.Truly dreadful rubbish -avoid like the plague.

title: Chris Hemsworth carries a shallow and PC riddled plot
text: You sort of walk away asking: who was this movie made for? I think there is a little bit of something to make everyone disappointed. Chris Hemsworth and Chris Pratt - in addition to the litany of great movies marvel has produced - give the later marvel movies positive momentum to perform better than they perhaps deserve, but if this movie / later marvel movies were released without the strong history of marvel movies they would certainly and rightfully struggle more than they are currently.

title: What were they thinking?
text: The MCU doesn't know how to do comedy, this childish attempt is painful to watch, none of the jokes landed and they do not know the concept of timing when it comes to comedy.The story is beyond meh, feels like filler and I wanted to see more of Gorr since it's probably the only actor having fun with the movie.

title: Waste of time.
text: You got Christian Bale in your movie as the villain, which can't go wrong. He's one of the best actors living. That's terrific casting. You decide to barely have him in the movie. Instead you have a bunch of bad jokes and bad CGI. Compare this to Avengers (10 year old movie) and tell me this looks in any way better. No, "it's supposed to look like this, it's a comic" is not an excuse for how bad it looks. Most of the fighting is against faceless monsters who also are defeated WAY to easy. And some "sad" stuff which is completely smothered by all the cringe. This was a waste of time.

title: Ridiculous even for a parody
text: This movie is a parody plain and simple. And ridiculous one that is. Christian Bale... well probably nobody told him and gave a good performance.Watch it if you really have nothing else to do . I wonder how did this came out to the movie theaters. I mean there are people that actually paid to see this?This movie is a parody plain and simple. And ridiculous one that is. Christian Bale... well probably nobody told him and gave a good performance.Watch it if you really have nothing else to do . I wonder how did this came out to the movie theaters. I mean there are people that actually paid to see this?

title: What I've come to expect from phase 4... disappointment
text: The film isn't good. But it's not terrible. It's watchable. About like thor the dark world. Except with Disney's overly obsessive virtue signaling and bad jokes at the wrong times. There is no asgaurdians lol. Even though the film wants thor to be star lord terribly bad. The whole movie just felt off. With no explanation given for how things are happening. WE HAVE DEFINITELY moved past the great marvel films of years past that got you hopeful for the future.

title: THIS IS WHAT HAPPEN WHEN
text: You make a kid friendly movie and then heavily slapping a LBTGQ+ movement in it. The need to push "Acceptance/normalcy" nowadays is annoying as hell. Here's an idea Disney, please make a Jewish and Muslim superhero too while u are at it, and get awesome actors to waste their talent on your crap movies nowadays.

title: Jane Foster plot line completely unnecessary.
text: Jane Foster becoming "Thor" felt very shallow. I was left with questions that I felt deserved more explanation. Christian Bale was phenomenal and engaging, but was otherwise rushed and underutilized. Russel Crowe was great. Hemsworth was funny but started to feel like a side character in his own movie by the end. The movie ultimately suffered from trying to do "too much". They would have benefitted if they would have scrapped the Jane Foster plot line completely.

title: Just soul destroying
text: I personally absolutely love the original Thor & Marvel movies & even rather enjoyed Thor Ragnarok where they started to turn Thor into a joke character ... but , this is absolutely dreadful beyond belief!!The writing is awful , the feel is all wrong , the comedy is so off the mark I actually sat cringing, I just felt awkward watching it because it was so trying to be funny & failing , badly.I was glad when it ended.I will never watch this picture again & am so very very disappointed!! Taika Waititi needs to walk for the good of everyone involved.Everything Disney is now to woke I don't think I can cope anymore ... I'm done!!

title: Thor is ruined...
text:
I was told by my friends that this movie was a joke, I decided to watch it anyway because I'm quite a big marvel fan. Or at least I used to be...
This movie is just too much Disney... like every other thing they've done lately... the marvel tv shows are terrible and so are the new movies... absolute joke... good performance from bale but the rest is very bad... why is Thor all of a sudden so lame and dumb? Literally everything Disney has bought has become so bad... first star wars and now marvel... absolutely unacceptable. Thor's first appearances he wasn't like today... old school marvel is much better. Everything after endgame is just extremely bad, too bad. It's all just Disney writing and it's horrible I really have no words for this... only good thing to come out after endgame was Spider-Man No way Home and WandaVision. Don't waste your time watching this movie... not worth 2 hours.

title: This feels like a 6 hours Disney plus series edited into 2 hours
text: The special effects feel like made for tv series special effects. Most of the jokes totally fall flat. Everything is undeveloped and has little substance. Gorr is not a great villain and his motivations are unclear. We never feel suspense or a real sense of danger. Still entertaining and not too boring but i am sure this will be on somebody's list of Marvel's worst movies ever.

title: Batman & Robin: The Long-Awaited Sequel!
text: I'm fairly certain this movie was inspired by Batman & Robin... the movie George Clooney still apologizes for.This movie is filled with too many characters/ideas introduced that never fully pan out, something that has been the downfall of a number of comic book movies for decades.They went way too comic book with certain aspects than they should given the overall tone of the story. It's not always an easy balance, but this movie veers far too into comic book tactics that don't work in a movie that has serious themes or even a dramedy. It's like they just wanted to throw in some cool stuff from the comics without worrying about if it fit with the overall story or served any real purpose. They needed to either go with a less serious storyline and villain or dial back the goofiness about 30%.The VFX are really bad as well. I'm not sure if they used different lighting because of the new VFX they used but the makeup/actors didn't look great in a lot of scenes either. Many of the costumes look wrong and I'm sorry, but those thick shoulder-pad style capes reminded me of Rainbow Bright's outfit from the 80's... not in a good way.The character of Thor in this movie was more like the character Chris' real life brother plays: the Asgardian act"thor" (see what I did there? Better pun than half that are in the movie, you are welcome.). I enjoyed Thor in Ragnorak, but they went too far will him just being a silly oaf at times in Love and Thunder.Christian Bale probably gave one of the strongest performances in the movie but his character still felt hollow and lackluster due to lack of development and screen time.It feels Korg becoming such a big character and so important to Thor is just taking up screen time so Waititi can feed his ego and make himself more important to the franchise. It feels cheap and time could have been better spent on the main characters. Not enough Valkyrie at all.I'm especially disappointed because Ragnarok was actually my favorite Thor movie and this was just a let down. Like others have said, I wouldn't be surprised if this was the set up for a children's series and/or even possibly to launch the career of Chris' daughter.

title: Law of Averages Prevails
text: I have been an avid MCU fan ever since Iron Man was released back in 2008.Since then I have eagerly awaited each release with baited breath and enjoyed the Big screen action experience with each new movie the only real blip until now was the disapointing but watchable 'Eternals'.I have enjoyed every installment of Chris Hemsworth as Thor, and really thought Taika Waititi took Ragnarok to the next level. But as I said the law of averages had to prevail, after 28 MCU outings the 29th is a major dud. It's a real hot mess, full of jokes that don't quite hit the mark, it's like Taika Waititi purposely set out to make a parody of the whole MCU. Heres hoping number 30 returns the MCU to all its glory.CGI is still very good and although I was dissapointed with the movie I'll probably still watch it again.

title: Ummm, maybe good for kids?
text: Just doesn't seem to "land".Despite the wonderful actors, it seems lazy, has too much going on, and is also somehow rushed.Also seems like someone thought Jar Jar Binks was a great idea, and made a new movie with that character idea in mind. That and Thor is apparently back to his childlike attitude and hasn't matured at all, mostly blundering around and seeming lost. A far cry from the character he had become, especially after his fathers death.Possibly one of the worst films in the franchise, sadly- unless you are a child maybe?Maybe this was just directed at kids, trying to entice a new generation of fans.While I cannot speak to the future, I can say this movie left a lot to be desired and was not even close to the excellence of (most) the previous movies.Heck, even the CGI seemed "low budget" at times.While I was excited to see this, it's a hard pass to watch again and I'm surprised it ever made it off the editing floor.

title: Too stupid for words, such a shame.
text: This is the first MCU film I have walked out of (turned off half way). Couldn't stomach the stupid parody jokes any longer. Not sure who it is aimed at, and maybe they let a focus group make important plot and theme decisions, but it misses the mark on all fronts.I may not even bother trying to watch it again, I cringed so much that I have permanent creases in my face. My wife loves MCU but even she could not sit through the entire movie.Some good actors wasted, I hope they got paid well coz this may keep them low profile for a while.Please don't make another Marvel movie this silly, it will permanently damage the brand.

title: Disney has ruined Marvel rip Stan Lee
text: I feel sorry for Stanley Lee he is turning over in his grave.Disney has ruined Marvel and I can no longer take it.I write very few reviews but I cannot stand by and watch this and let this movie get away with desecrating desecrating his memory.Almost everything about this movie is terrible.The writing , the acting , the actors and the directing unbelievably bad.I don't know why I gave it 2 stars I believe a one star would be disingenuous since there were maybe 10 minutes of the movie that had some entertainment but otherwise not not worth the 2 hours of my time. If anyone at Disney is listening or reading this please go back to the original Marvel movies look what they did and make the appropriate changes to future Marvel movies.

title: How to waste a great villain
text: I was so excited when I got the first footage of Christian BaleÂ´s villain.It even had a great-scary name: "The God Butcher", a good backstory and all and they made him exaggerated-goofy and not scary at all. And the whole portrait of the other gods felt so out of touch with any other movie that I have ever seen.Trying to "Jojo Rabbit" a Marvel movie is not the way to go. I really enjoy Taika Waititi movies but this one was hardly enjoyable. It felt like a really long and poorly executed parody of Thor.Such a poor story with such a good cast... It makes me frustrated. I hope this is not the future of MCU movies.

title: What did i just watched?
text: My lord what happend with the MCU? Is this movie for toddlers? I really don't understand those childish jokes, it doesn't do any justice for the Mighty Thor. He was always a serious character and really bringing it to the previous Thor and Avengers film. But this movie really made a mess out of him and hard to watch! Personally i don't like Portmans role in this film, she isn't really bringing the character. Unfortunately from all the movie's MCU brought us, this one is a flop and even 1 star is too much! I won't mind if Hemsworth put the hamer down, he isn't bringing any effort anymore. Please don't make another movie, his character is kinda of done. You should've stopped at the highest point!

title: Irredeemable. Marvel is finished in the movies.
text: Those are hard words for me to say. I spent decades buying comic books- all of the titles. Up until the late 90s, I had every edition of FF, Cap, Thor, Rom, Moon Knight, Batman, Green Lantern, Hour Man, Justice Society, Marvel Team-Up, Daredevil, X-Men. . . ALL Characters. Every month I would have 40 titles waiting for me at the comic store.After the ridiculous Howard The Duck, and the two terrible Hulk movies, two lousy Fantastic Fours, four lousy X-Men, and 5 medium temperature Spider-man movies, something magical happened; somebody got the the thing in order and went after actors who had a commitment to giving up a huge chunk of their lives to tell the story of these characters. Boy, did it work. Even the ones that were not the favorites (i.e. Thor's Dark World, and Iron Man III) were compelling enough to watch just to see what was going to develop and be featured in the upcoming films.Chris Evans, Robert Downy, Jr., Scarlett Johansson, Chadwick Boseman- these guys gave it all they had, and were VERY believable as Cap, Iron-Man, Black Widow and Black Panther. By the time Marvel released the first Avengers movie, and "The Winter Soldier" the way was paved. Everything that followed lined up more or less with a great arc, and they made reasonable sense. 'Guardians' knocked it out of the park, and so did 'Civil War,' which was more of Avengers III than Cap III. There were still some weaker moments, like 'Age of Ultron' but in all fairness, when you go back through the movies in order, that film suddenly (with the deleted scenes restored) makes a HECK of a lot more sense.Infinity Wars may be the greatest action film, superhero film, war movie ever made. In what reality would you expect to see 20 lead characters , all relevant to the story, all with good development and and such stellar acting? It doesn't happen. But Marvel did it."Endgame' gets a lot of fanfare, but between Guardians II, Captain Marvel, and the final film of the Phase three project, I could tell that the writing was on the wall. They systematically went about sabotaging the characters. The ridiculous Nick Fury eye incident, the terrible rug on Sam Jackson and the casting of the underwhelming Brie Larson as Carol Danvers instead of Teyonah Parris (or anyone else) as Monica Rambeau a.k.a. Captain Marvel was a crime, and a gigantic signal flare. The sappy waste of time that was Guardians II was meaningless, excluding the introduction of the character Mantis. The rest of it was just destroying Yondu and Star Lord, reducing Drax to base-level fart humor. Endgame Confused itself with time travel mixups, lots of dead time and the complete destruction of Hulk and Thor as super-beings with any kind of power or conviction. Pepper Potts whooped more A$$ than Hulk did.Now we find ourselves with a dreadful "Eternals," a very lowered-bar "Shang Chi," which might not have been so painful sans Awkwafina, pointless and forgettable "Black Widow," terrible Moon Knight series, terrible "Hawkeye" series, and a very mediocre "Falcon & Winter Soldier."The end is near for our heroes. I thought that the cheapening and humiliation of Chris Hemsworth's "Thor" had reached the bottom with Endgame, but was I ever wrong. Chris should have hung it up two movies back. He's truly no longer worthy to carry Mjolnir, having agreed to this rubbish.The terrible directing, the terrible acting, the terrible humor, the terrible screenplay all converge to form a pile of junk so half-haked it can't even be a hot mess.This is dreadful. It's disgusting.It makes me angry that I spent so much of my money throughout my life to keep these comic books going for decades, just to have these idiots destroying them as fast as they can.

title: Movie disappoints true Marvel fans.
text: There is nothing better in a movie than Christian Bale's acting. Made Thor the Joker. There was nothing serious in the movie. This is just a comedy movie. The movie should be remade, the character of thor and gorr is more powerful, the character of thor is not just for comedy, he should be shown as an avenger. Mighty Thor's role is fine in the movie which does not disappoint much.

title: Painful to watch at times. Amateur Direction. Woke overkill.
text: Considering the 3 chapters prior to this, which I truly enjoyed, I wish this film was never made. It was like a sequel to Spy Kids 12. The script, the direction, the pitiful humor, the wokeness, there is little to like about this movie. Hemsworth and Bale may be happy to pick up their checks but they've got to be embarrassed by it all. A movie that couldn't be salvaged by numerous cameos from Matt Damon to Russel Crowe. Plastic nonsense. I won't be watching the next one. I lost time that could have been spent doing anything else. Avoid it like the plague imho and anything else from this Director and Script Writer.

title: Love and blunder.
text: Wow, someone tried way too hard to be funny. In doing so, you pretty much ruined the Thor franchise. This movie was just a sad attempt to make this into a kids show.Liked Christian Bale, Russel Crowe was a bit of a clown. Having said that, this will probably go down in history as one of the worst Marvel Movies of all time. I say one of, because Disney still has room to F up more.

title: Just awful
text: I really don't know what else to say than they really need to keep that man away from any more Marvel movies.He has made a laughing stock of most of the characters, it will take something special to salvage Thor!!Good luck.

title: It's become a rubbish spoof
text: Way to totally ruin the Thor franchise. It's like a cheesy comedy spoof. Ths is like a fan-made film, where the fan hates the Thor character. The heroes of the previous Marvel films have become bumbling comedy characters tripping over themselves and become spoof caricatures.Hemsworth should hang his head in shame.Avoid this film. It's absolute rubbish.

title: How long will you watch a funny movie?
text: Needed a little serious movie.The GOR character needed to be better it seemed like a comedy moviear character needed to be better it seemed like a comedy movie.

title: a downgrade
text: Another villain wasted and it feels like a child's story compared to ragnarok, the movie has potential and it's been wasted. It could use a better lore than than this.

title: Filled with sick symbolism
text: Most younger audiences and those who are not aware of other cultures will probably not notice all of the offensive symbolism in this film. Suffice to say, it was perhaps the worst Marvel production so far. I felt nothing but sadness as I watched this travesty of art.
