Beyond that, the special effects were as always quite good, that is about all these movies have now a days. Sign of the times, I guess. If you're looking for a film that gives a good accounting of some of Marvels oldest characters, you probably won't find it here. Simply my opinion, I've had some time on this Earth and it is disturbing, these trends I'm seeing...

title: Jane Thor...
text:
This movie should have been entitled Jane Thor: a feminist movie about ultra-strong masculine women, and weak, bumbling, buffoonish men, whose only purpose in this satirical comedy... ahem movie... is to serve as props to showcase how "strong" and "awesome" the females are.Can this movie even be called Thor!?...
I mean... I know he's in it, but it's a female empowerment movie; it's not even about him.Damn!This agenda-driven push, to make men more feminine and women more masculine, is having terrible implications on society: women have become undatable/unmarriable, all because greedy corporations wanted to make more money, by being able to sell more to women.

title: Eww What is this abomination?
text: This sequel has lost its identity as a comic boss superhero adaptation. All bark, no bite. Too much unfunny jokes that they leave no gap for seriousness, epic and intense fight. The villain is meh, The superhero itself getting nerfed and dumbed down. Taika Waititi and Kevin Feige needs to fire themselves and step down from any comic book superhero adaption. What a trash! Even worse than Ragnarok. There should be no point for another standalone Thor movie if they could not even getting the details right. This is what happened when someone getting too much ahead with the woke culture and lose respect to the source material.

title: Adds nothing
text: Ragnarok explores the relation between Thor and Loki and Hulk, and introduces memorable characters like Grandmaster, Valkyrie and Hela. What does Love & Thunder add in these categories? Almost nothing!Using Guns n' Roses songs was enjoyable and follows the same path as Immigrant Song in Ragnarok... so cool but nothing new.I assume MCU fans enjoy when stand-alone movies adds something to the overall story? Ragnarok adds quite a bit, Love & Thunder adds (almost) nothing.Christian Bale was really good as Gorr, but the introduction felt really silly and the end as well. The effects associated with Gorr reminded me of the effects in the 1990 movie Ghost.The silly parts in the movie are good, but I lack any depth for this to balance with.

title: Geesum. This was desperate
text: I am watching this now and don't even know what to write.It's like watching a bad comedian practise their jokes in the mirror.Here is the formula they have used to write this movie:People like to laugh - make everything a joke and hope for the best.People like computers - make everything bad CGI. We need a lot of it so don't use the expensive guys.People love Thor - let's make two of them and make the man one look pathetic to fit the Disney theme of female heroines.People are dumb - don't worry about the plot, most of the audience will have their phone with them for entertainment.We've run out of expensive fabric. Let's polish some plastic and let them wear that.We need star power : get that guy Christian. He's good. (That worked actually )

title: Another flavorless Marvel Movie
text: I am going to say it, can we give the superhero genre a break. Disney is just spewing out these marvel movies as a cash grab. This movie just proves it! It's just sad.

title: Wacky & Meta Thor Movie
text: The theme for this movie was interesting & serious, but handled lightly & playfully.Asgardians lost their identity/culture to fit more with the movie's audience, specifically kids.Instead of only having breaking the 4th wall for jokes, we have breaking the 4th wall to change the universe as well.The production quality felt more like an episode of a tv show.Thor's & Jane character development was nicely done. Gorr was good but was underutilised. Stormbreaker's development just felt out of place.Disney will probably attract new generation of viewers, but this movie is just not it. Hope to get a more polished Thor movie before it ends.

title: Sooo disappointing
text: Wow that was disappointing. The last Thor was fantastic, the humour worked so well. In this it feels forced and totally breaks the reality of the established MCU universe many times.I am truly amazed it was allowed to go out as it was. Cringeworthy in many places. What a shame. The first 'serious' misstep so far for them I feel. Some of the recent movies were not at the level of the earlier entries, but this was far beyond that due to the parody like feel throughout much of the movie.

title: not great
text: Ragnorak was my favorite Marvel, I was very excited but this thing was a woke mess that had empty hitting jokes and made Thor look like a bumbling idiot. Christian Bale and moments of Natalie Portman was the only good thing about this movie. 2/10. Held Taiki in high regard but not anymore, so much potential here that he ruined. Thor, dark world is no longer my least favorite Thor movie. Thank goodness GOTG crew was only in this movie for 2 minutes and he didn't have time to ruin that.

title: Too much Comedy runied the film ! Disaster
text:
I didn't expect this from the movie
very disappointed from sequel
This is not much action and emotional scene but is full of useless comedy
Last Movie Thor Ragnarok was good but this one is disaster.

title: Not surprised and not even disappointed anymore.
text: If you have no expectations this can be a 'good' popcorn movie. The humor and the action are there. That's it tho. It's also the reason why I don't like it and why I hate Ragnarok. They turned the entire Thor franchise into a big joke. There are no stakes, there is no drama, everything serious and Shakespearean that made the first two movies unique and interesting is gone. Chris Hemsworth was made for this role, he embodies Thor, but everything else was a complete dumpster fire. Christian Bale was also good as a villain & he stood out as one of the (rare) positive things in this.

title: Had great potential
text: Honestly with a anti hero as deep as Gor it was a terrible display of depth, they essentially white wash him and downplayed his layers. The story line was ok but to completely disregard any real development of Jane coming into the powers of a god is lazy. 1 sec she's dead next she's a god, the movie felt sanded down to a easy digestible cinema experience. Boo.

title: absolute tosh
text: If you're 10 or under you'll probably love this, but for anyone who enjoys more than kiddies cartoons? Prepare to be very VERY dissapointed. It's purile rubbish, no plot worth speaking about and the acting is terrible, even for a franchise film.A fat man turns up with a comedy greek accent portraying Zeus (by that accound shouldn't Thor speak with a dodgy viking accent?) and makes everyone laugh by ripping off peoples clothes.Even the Carry On films were less childish than this.Seriously, avoid like the plague or expect a cameo by the Micky Mousketeers in the next episode.Thor Love and thunder? More like crap and blunder.

title: WOKE FILM WITH A FUNNY FACE
text: THERE IS A LOT OF ABSENCE OF VALUES IN THE FILM, THE ANTI-GOD ATTITUDE, SAMESEX COUPLES, AND OTHER EDUCATIONAL ELEMENTS IN A FUNNY WAYIF SOMEONE WANTS TO MAKE AN WOKE FILM, THEY SHOULD PRESENT IT AS SUCH, AND IT SEEMS THAT DISNEY HAS GONE DOWN THE WRONG PATH AGAINIS NOT A MOVIE FOR CHILDREN.

title: its ok but not great
text: Can tell that this is a do in for thor a character assassination. Because man haters are allowed to make movies in Hollywood now. Constant condescending belittling of the character. Its ok because the old cast is back but its not great because of the toxic feminist part.

title: Just an advert for MCU merch
text: This movie is just an example of poor and stupid advertisement for MCU merchandise.The target audience is even younger than for previous movies.The humor is flat and dumb. Many goofs about power tossing around. Too much unneeded information about those stone reproduction system.Those characters are sometimes too powerful, sometimes too weak. What's going on?The MCU overall is falling in quality. Remember that humor of Iron Man? We need that, not this one for 3 y.o. Children.And we need strong and whole characters, not splashed between man and woman, you know?I know, that you are making this just for advertising purposes, but if you make movies just slightly less stupid, you'll get much more money ;)

title: Worst MCU film
text: Let me say I've seen many terrible movies in my time. Total wastes of time that made me wonder what I was thinking, but this takes the cake! I've seen every MCU film and while none of them are what I would consider masterpieces, they are entertaining and I do enjoy them. All that being said, this was by far the worst of all of them. The jokes are so over the top and stupid it takes you out of the movie. I was glad to see Natalie Portman again but I feel that she was wasted in this movie along with Christian Bales great performance. Taika Waititi Should have stopped at Ragnerok as that had a much better balance of a good story, acting, and jokes. This was just too many jokes, bad CGI and bad over the top acting. After the first 15 minutes I wanted to turn it off. Don't waste your time with this film, much like with She-Hulk the MCU is really going down hill fast.

title: You better to separete thor movie and thor cartoons
text: What the hell i just watched ? Its fighting kids, stupied jokes, rainbow and very very bad script for movie.I could not decide to watch it for a long time, because after the last part of the Thor I have bad impressions. Why such a twisted plot? In 6 minutes, reveal the personality and motivation of Gore? Why there isn't any explanation of becoming Mighty Thorm it;s not important ? Yes, lets skip it, all good (NO!). I'm tired of your LGBT agenda in Thor films. Why are you doing this? We also have freedom of identification and chosing. Or is it just for check ? To have all of diffrent genders. I want a normal movie about the God Thor, and not about the clown Thor, who is either able to give children gods power and at the same time can't do anything and he is just entangled in shadows. Make a normal movie for adults and a cartoon for children.

title: WOKE THOR
text: Where to start with this absolute mess. The frustrating thing is that it contains glimpses of what we loved about Ragnorok, but, unfortunately, the writing partnership shows its inexperience and this movie is one hot mess. It has no idea what it wants to be. But it is sure of one thing. It wants to reinforce all the wokey stereotypes of the day. Well, well done. You succeeded in that, but along the way it makes for some really bad story telling and third rate scripting. Remove your brain and watch it like a 6 year old and you'll be fine. And BTW who signed up GnR for the sound track. Can't these directors get any original music to use rather than 30 year old dad rock. The closing track by DIO is 40 years old for Gods sake. Don't get me wrong. I love classic rock but it really comes to show a lack of creativity and imagination when you are a director in 2022 and you have to rely on 40 year old music for 90% of your sound track.

title: The Guardians carried lol.
text: The overwhelming amount of comedy forced into this movie resulted in a Thor that didn't feel like Thor. I'd call it a "feel good" and just that because unlike 90% of Marvel, it doesn't exceed good. The entirety of Marvel has made movies that encourage and allow a broad range of emotions and an escape from reality all while limelighting the super hero's and action. Lol Thor Love and Thunder got lost and then strayed far far away. My emotions were not brought out, but in, as I cowered over cringing at the script that had Academy award winner, Natalie Portman, delivering lines that belong in DC. Don't get me wrong some of it was humorous but the balance wasn't there. The dad jokes and dead humor every five seconds made it difficult to hear anything else. Guardians of the Galaxy is by far my favorite group in the franchise and that movie, my friends, is how its done.

title: As a die hard MCU fan, this was a struggle
text: There's much, I mean... so much comedy within dialogue and scenes that it got overwhelming and the movie started to loose the excitement and the grip early causing me to loose focus on the big picture. Ultimately I was in this point that I did not get any emotional feelings of the story and outcome.Thor, Foster and Valkyrie has evolved as a characters since their first appearance and personally I don't like the direction where they are heading with these characters. Most delightful character was Korg with is truthful and humorist dialogue.Finally Bale's Gorr was shining because it felt that Christian was the only actor doing his job as any job should be done; do it well.This movie might be entertaining for those who aren't interested in the depths of MCU lore, timelines and entwining stories, but for me as a die hard fan since the first movie this was tough watch.Being a parody of itself isn't something that fits into MCU, let Wayans' bros do that for you if want to go overboard.

title: Poor direction
text: Movie was okay it's was not what I accept you can't even connect with goor only thing you can see in this movie are stupid jokes and nothing else. There is no wow factor in this movie not even a proper fight Sean of thorgoor Power was also not shown properly.

title: Like a cheap kids TV movie
text: Christian Bale provided the only redeeming acting.Felt like a bag of cheap plastic toys I can get at Dollar General. It was supposed to be tongue-in-cheek funny sometimes I guess? However, no memorable memes. No laughs.Marvel trajectory plummeted here. I look at the ones that made an impression on me ... some of which I've watched repeatedly, starting with Iron Man. Took my kid out of school to watch the opening. Surprised him by letting him play hookie for an afternoon. Brought him home first to Iron Man pumped up on the stereo. Blew us away. Some of the other productions have matched that experience.This one doesn't even get in the ballpark. Glad I waited to watch it for free. It's only been worth my time because it made me reflect on the good ones and motivate me to say something.

title: that was TERRIBLE!!!
text: It seems like Taika just tried to wing this one and just make it one big laugh - but what worked in Ragnarok cannot just be repeated and reused. Rather than throw in a few laughs this one tried to make it a neverending stream of jokes and laughs, which REALLY doesn't work when you are also trying to sell some seriously dramatic content.Honestly it feels like this one was phoned in and Taika didn't know which direction he was going - and even with Christian Bale, Portman and Hemsworth working hard to make this one work, its just wasted opportunity and a very poor ending to the Thor saga.I had really hoped that this was just the usual ruckus with a stronger female co-lead but honestly jump part this one in the watch list and avoid seeing some great Marvel properties being squandered on cheap laughs.Kind of wondering where Kevin Feige was on this one? Has he stopped having a watchful eye on the Marvel line?

title: Nope ðŸ˜©
text: Different is not always better. Sadly, this was almost like a bad try to make it more Â«funnyÂ», parody.or satire.Was expecting the movie to be more like the others.The producers failed this time.Not in the Marvel spirit.Sad to see so many good actors in a movie not worthy the first Thor movies.Don't think I will bother seeing this movie twice.Storyline was also quite thin and lots of the actors lines were cheesy.Krossing my fingers about seeing the next Thor movie.Living up to Marvel-fans expectations.As a long time Marvel-fan, I must say.. There were some highlights, making me smile, but not enough to waste my time seeing it once more.

title: Marvel should sue Taika for this movie
text: This is far the worst Marvel movie in my opinion.It's like watching a bad improv class, if this movie has a script I'm scared to read it.There is NOTHING of substance of weight here, it is insane. The movie accomplishes the impossible: diminishing Thor even more than previous films.After seeing the making of I know that not only Taika is to blame for this, even Chris seems to care little about the character anymore and just wants to goof off.The whole plot about Jane Foster is so uninteresting and forced I had to shut the film off halfway and resume the next day, being more prepared for the level of writing I was in for.I really enjoyed the previous film but I found out that Taika had nothing to do with the script so that explains a lot.Being one of the people that thought him to be a fresh voice in the dull and stiff world of the MCU, I now back down from that stance and apologize.I was a mild fan of Jojo Rabbit but that wasn't even an original idea of Taikas...This film is utter garbage on so many levels. It looks, sounds and feels cheap. At times even the lines are mumbled and the scenes with the guardians are just embarrassing. This cost 250 million dollars! That is insane. Someone must have pocketed that money because it doesn't show anywhere on screen.

title: Romper Room with CGI
text: To admit I watched this movie is completely humiliating. The CGI effects were like visual diarrhea, The cutseyness between Hemsworth and Portman was vomitous. First, Natalie Portman is not capable of 'cute' it all comes off as False and proof she's "slumming it" to actually gain a fandom outside the cultish Hollywood cliques. She brings the whole production to a screaming yawn, an exact replica of the anchor that is Gwyneth Paltrow that sinks the Iron Man brand. Let's be thankful Scarlett Johansson doesn't make an appearance, Johansson, Paltrow, Portman, the trifecta of boredom and over-hyped snooty American whiteness.The story was and the director should be insulted that any effort he/she made was destroyed by the abhorrent special effects, a trend sadly dominating American cartoon movies. Is this what Marvel "universe" has become? Money trumps quality? Sad.... Hopefully DC comes up with a better offerening in the future.

title: The only good thing about this movie is Bale's and the little girl's acting at the end
text: This movie is nighter entertaining nor good, if you are 15 and bellow you will probably enjoy it.The story don't make any sense the acting is horrible and it's just a waste of time. After the End game Marvel movies are just waste of time and money.It is funny at times but so are funny clips on YouTube. The only good thing in this movie is Bale's and that little girl's acting at the end.Thor in this movie is portrayed as a dumbbb and moroooon character that takes nothing seriously. And you end up rooting against him. I just wanted Gurr to finish his dumbbassss.

title: Decent, just about
text: Not significant in the grand theme of things ie nothing to do with the overal arc of this phase. The movie itself was ok, i would not watch it again and I can't recall anything of importance or awe inspiring moments. I do wonder whether it's superhero fatigue? Dr Strange was far better in terms of a watch and future significace.

title: Disappointing film that mocks itself.
text: I was emotionally sucked in at the start, it was credible motivation for a revenge obsessed bad guy, but as the movie went on it seemed to fall to pieces. Maybe it was the writing, maybe the directing, but at the end of the day, no-one seemed to be around to make sure the movie stayed on point. It was the gags, it was the lines, even the acting seemed below par in places. The voices of goats was clearly a human. I just don't get it, Ragnarok was so well balanced while this one looked like it was given to a different director with the instructions to make it like the previous one. In other words, it tried, missed the point and ended up mocking itself.

title: Left on the cutting room floor
text: It really feels like wasted potential, it could be that it was always written in the way it was but Thor's characterisation came across as far too humourous for me far surpassing what was done in Ragnarok; Gorr was excellent but there wasn't enough of him. I feel like the best content was left out because Disney wanted to push for a more PG rating. Thor should be the Allfather posessing Odin levels and more of power by now.

title: Forced comedy never works
text:
Christian bale, Natalie portman and chris did a nice role
The whole idea of goofiness and forced comedy is awful.Christian bale made a good villian with a nice background story but everything was rushed and he didn't get much screentime..need more time to develop
MCU needs to stop trying to force comedy because sometimes it just doesn't work.Let's hope the next movie is less goofy and has more of a story
And it also gets kinda boring trying to push the idea that a same sex couple of creatures is getting married or anything
It's cliche..forcing it in places where it means nothing is dumb...
It's a good movie though
Not pivotal and you won't miss much if you don't see it,

title: A joke that gave a chuckle... and that's it.
text: Gorr the God Butcher was easily the best part of this film, and Christan Bale knocked his role out of the park. That being said, that might've been because his character had the most emotional baggage that wasn't ruined by awkward one-liners every 5 mins. His scenes also gave my eyes a break from the oversaturated color fest that overstayed it's welcome.Not a bad film by any means, but I think Ragnarok was better... and I somewhat miss the more serious tone of the phase 1 marvel films.

title: Where is Marvel going ....
text: Acting : Trash 4/10 (you can't relate to the emotion because they fell so fake. The deaths feel so empty so unsatisfying, so many flaws I can sit here and write but it will be a waste of time)Action : Garbage 3/10 (Comparing to other Marvel movies, even taking into the account the color tone structure the action does not have any heart any feel of dange or anything at all )Writing : Broh 3/10 (I know they have to make it PG-13 and family friendly but my god wtf is the this joke of a story)Alright, instead of rating all the characteristics that I would usually rate I will just mention the flaws: the pace / character development / boredom of the scenes / unused potential / zero feel of sacrifice or lost / you know what the list will just get too long.But still I give it 5 stars since it has some of it's moment.But come tf on , one of the death in this movie , we all know which one that just came out of f nowhere, and using it as f nothing for the story or even for anything.

title: Waste of time!
text: First time i write a review for a movie on Imdb and it had to be Thor Love and Thunder. I walked out of the theatre after about 40 mins. But you can see right at the beginning that this movie is a complete joke!!! I am so disappointed...Marvel films are getting from bad to worse in the last years. Especially in phase 4. Don't waste your money on this! Not worth it!

title: V.bad!
text: Don't do it! No story, poor characters assembly, only saviour is Hemsworth & Bale throughout the movie. Need to mirv this movie. Sad end to the Thor series.

title: As bad as I thought it would be
text: I avoided this like the plague, but eventually I caved in and now I saw it. And it was worse than I thought.I wasn't expecting to laugh at all, considering that I never did with Thor Ragnarok, a parody everybody thinks is so much better. But I also wasn't expecting not to chuckle once, not to see even one clever thing in the entire "film".Christian Bale somehow survives this abomination with a proffesionalism that this movie and director doesn't deserve, but serves him and the respect that we should all still have for his career, even after the baffling decision of taking a deal to participate in a Taika Waititi movie.

title: I wasted my time
text: "While "Thor: Love and Thunder" had its moments, I found some aspects of the film to be disappointing. The movie took a more unconventional approach to the Thor franchise, which may not resonate with all fans of the series. The costumes and visual effects, in my opinion, felt over-the-top and somewhat ridiculous at times, taking away from the gravitas of the story.Additionally, the inclusion of certain scenes featuring LGBTQ+ characters felt forced and not seamlessly integrated into the plot.I believe that "Thor: Love and Thunder" had the potential to be a great addition to the Marvel Cinematic Universe, but it missed the mark in most areas, making it less enjoyable for me as a viewer. However, others may have a different perspective.

title: Bale good, rest was 'meh'
text: One word to describe the film is Meh. Far from being even close to the best Marvel film. Its watchable and Bale redeems it somewhat, but far to much posturing and unfunny attempts at jokes. Feels like one too many Thor movies have been made and should have perhaps been left alone.

title: SILLY movie that left plot holes
text:
After the first 2 movies, Thor: Ragnarok came as a refreshment. Nice comedy moments but still taken seriously. From the first 5 minutes you would think this is the wrong movie, low budget parody ( It was intentional). It's too silly, too comedic to be taken seriously. In an attempt to close some unfinished stories from previous movies, this movie left a lot of plot holes and contradictions which makes you scratch your head ( if you can't see any, it's enough to see goof on this site and much more).You see some new characters and it give a nice introduction to next Thor movies but IMHO Taikiki went too far with the comedy bits. Ragnarok was one thing, a refreshment, this is exaggeration and I'm not even talking about that absurd intro scene.TL:DR
exaggeration in "comedy bits" that aren't funny at all, it's in top 3 worst MCU movies.

title: It's okay
text: Christian Bale does a wonderful job as Gorr the God Butcher and Natalie Portman bring back some great emotional scenes between her and Hemsworth.That said, this Thor movie is trying to be Ragnarock, but they thought by putting even more jokes into it and even more VFX it would be better, but it just turned out average. There were even times when all the VFX pulled me out of the movie and just became noise.I'm also a big fan of Taika Waititi's humour and style, but the jokes had very little room to land in this film and most of the time just boring puns.Worst of all, the movie is super predictable and where Ragnarock worked because if character interactions which brought the humour, this has very little interaction between characters which might be why I didn't find this film that good.If you are a Marvel fan you don't need my recommendation, you probably would like this review, but if you are a woman like one of my ex's that just love to watch hunky dudes in movies where the plot kinda dosen't matter for you, then I would recommend it. Hell! The movie actually kinda joke about that.

title: To must jokiness
text: Why so must jokes its not even funny. Its like they taking a piss in the idea of the movie and the characters in it. A little funniness is okay but the thing with the kids and jane and clothing in the begin and the sheep. And the talking to the hamer. I want to see the thor from the first to films. Now finally thor and jane together but them they make is awkward nobody wants to see half lovey things and half hero's. This is because of the producer he is not the person for these movies. He things the movie need to lighten up but this is to much. The other thor film before this also same vibe. The first 2 was good !

title: Bale crushed it, the rest was lackluster
text: The movie felt like it had no depth, and the only saving grace was Christian Bale. His performance as Gorr was terrifying, and his mission makes sense in the grand scheme of it all and I found myself rooting for him. The overuse of humor felt like a cop out for poor storyline and poorer script, but the most the humor brought was a dry chuckle or snicker. It was not actually funny, if you understand. Many of the "funny" elements got old fast.And Jane's character above all was unnecessary to the story. She's been missing from the overarching story for years, and she added nothing to this movie, other than some small character development for Thor. Beyond that, the character development from Endgame to this movie, it feels almost like Thor has regressed in all respects, going from a noble Viking to a babbling, love-obsessed buffoon. He is an absolute joke and insult to the character and the hero.The cgi was done half-ass, with some areas of the movie appearing more vivid than others, like the monsters and fight scenes. However, I recognize that the costumes and set design was nicely done, with a total revamp to Thors armor.I feel like bale was wasted on this movie. I would not have paid for this in theaters. The movie felt like one big joke.

title: Nothing was accomplished
text: I enjoy humor in Marvel movies just like everybody else but this time it's just too. Much. Usually they're done in an offhand way to lighten the severity of a situation and it's really refreshing. However. There were some plots crucial to the overall storyline that was rendered moot by the importance placed on everything having to be funny.While Waititi's cinematic style is undisputedly visually stunning, everything just felt superficial and even the characters (actors) feel like they're not invested bc of poor directing, which is a shame for such a massively talented cast. It just doesn't carry like the magnitude of a Marvel movie usually does.Bale is an exemplary actor, portraying an intricate character, and you def got the "the God Butcher" every scene he's in. Then again, Portman and Thompson aren't no slouches either but there was just no way to connect to this movie. What a shame.

title: Fun for the kids
text: Fun for the kids. For adults not so much. At first it's easy to think Christian Bale might be overacting and then as the movie goes on you begin to realize.. it's because everyone else is UNDER acting.

title: Taika's Lovely Blunder
text: Sadly this film isn't good. I truly was hoping to enjoy another Thor adventure but the plot lacks, the 'Disney greater message' is forced as usual and the overall acting is forgettable (save for Bale of course) it had some good spots that had me genuinely laughing but that's the only plus of the film: the laughs and that's not enough to get me to see it again.Taika what have you done. :insert sad face:

title: Not to good !
text:
You can say one of the worst Marvel movie ...
Maybe some scenes are made for kids not for adults.Christian bale's work is great in this movie despite of not so much screen role ....

title: A Dogs Breakfast
text: The comedy failed, more slapstick, about as funny as cancer. The great soundtrack couldn't save this movie.The storyline is not weak, rather poorly delivered.The characters are wasted in this film. The villain is reasonable considering the mess to work with.I will be considering Ragnarock to be the last Thor movie.Gave it 3/10 as special fx were ok and there ARE worse movies, but not many with a similar budget/cast.Chris Hemsworth had done a great job with the Thos character until now, this movie undies all the good.Sadly Taika is going to make a Star Wars movie, so that will also left in tatters.

title: The mighty have fallen...
text: Marvel hit the highest of highs with Infinity War/End Game and even releasing the next two Spidey films, Shang Chi, and the Final Spider Man film but my lord have their films taken a nose dive since. BW, Eternals, DS2, and now this film hitting the lowest point yet in my opinion. Bob Chapel better let Fiege have creative control back ASAP because this is approaching DCEU territory bad. This film is horrible with the humor,Gorr is barely in it, too much focus on kids, on and on I could go. Pray things get better quickly.

title: Parts of the movie were enjoyable
text: I enjoyed previous Thor movies and was looking forward to this one ? It was quite disappointing to tell you the truth , never heard so many kids criticise it leaving the cinema ? A lot of needless boring one-liners a soundtrack that was from the 1988 era? And a stupid story line with really odd scenes. The graphics and film photography were very good and Christian Bales portrayal of the villain were the highpoints in my opinion ðŸ‘ I think the director could have left out the dry humour jokes that we're littered in almost every scene it really spoiled what could have been a decent movie ðŸŽ¬ overall very average.

title: The decline of Marvel
text: Every time we say that this is the worst Marvel movie, we are surprised again that it can be even worse.At the beginning of the movie, with the humor added to it, I was expecting a popcorn movie, but gradually the quality of the movie and the story was decreasing to the point where I decided to save my popcorn!There is nothing unexpected in this series, completely predictable with a weak story, with this process that Marvel has taken, soon all the creatures of the galaxy will become superheroes or gods!They don't even have the ability to make exciting music anymore, it's a disaster that they got here from that old line-up, it's a shame that they started making this nonsense, no creativity can be seen in any of Marvel's works anymore.

title: Funny parts but overall a dud
text: I tried going in with an open mind and a fresh take as so much has happened since the last Thor movie. Needless to say, even with an open mind, I left very disappointed. The acting was dry, characters were stiff, jokes and comedy inserted in every line, way too much of certain characters while not enough of others, couldn't take Gore seriously as he is a discount Voldemort, and Thor himself was basically a laughing stock to the average Joe and kids in the film. It was hard to feel very little or any emotion for any of the characters and the trials that they were going through as there was no build up or chemistry.Thor:Ragnarok had a perfect blend of comedy, tragedy, seriousness, and darkness.Thor: Love and Thunder was a ballet of comics quickly strewn together for a quick buck.I think over all, the director caught lightning in a bottle for his first major film and then tried to piggyback off that but tried too hard. Will not be seeing it again.

title: oh boy
text: Bale as Gorr was amazing and i loved the scenes with him, but he was absolutely wasted in this joke of a movie. A serious setting would have been a much better fit for him.The main plot was alright, but the whole story kinda felt rushed or bland or i don't know the right word to describe it.. They should have put more effort in it.I was really looking forward to one character, when i heard his/its name, but oh boy was i let down.. They could have done so much with it, but it was garbage. Again no effort or creativity.It had a lot of cringe worthy scenes, the acting was "ok", the visuals were as usual and Thor's character is almost painful to watch with all these "jokes" and his braindead behavior.Other than that, the only real enjoyment besides Gorr, were the freaking goats, enough said!5/10 only for gorr and the goats otherwise maybe a 2/10 (3-4/10 if i would watch it drunk)

title: Could have been better
text: Marvel movies have become so sloppy and more focusing on the funny parts. I know that it might be just Taika Waititis but he is also a director that I love. He is very good but I might believe that he is not the right one for Marvel and Marvels future. Since Ragnarok, the funny parts has been the more important parts wich I believe is a shame. I believe that previous Marvel movies has been very thougthful and not ending the plot in the movies but instead keep the story until the next movie which i think have been their strength. Thor: Love and Thunder though was just so stressed plotwise. Although my thoughts was the movie pretty good and entertaining but far from the previous ones.That the most hated Marvel movie Thor: The Dark World has a better rating is concerning...

title: A very boring and weak story
text: I was hoping to watch an exciting movie with interesting action scenes, but I saw a very imaginary and boring movie that I fell asleep in the middle. It's really unfortunate that Marvel releases these movies.When I think about Marvel's past great movies, these movies are nothing compared to them. If this continues, Marvel will definitely lose its fans.In my opinion, either another Thor should not be made, or if it is made, it should be in such a way that the disaster of this movie is erased from the minds.For example, the character of Thor should reduce his jokes and continue his role in a serious manner.

title: Painful
text: Please Marvel no more Taika Waititi! This is a mess and his Thor is a mockery of the character. Was no one watching what he was doing? This story is all over the place. A literal farce. The characters are cartoonish. The acting is over the top. If I had paid to see this I would have been angry. Even seeing it for free in my own home feels wrong. The actors do their best with the nonsense they are asked say and do. These are good talented people who cannot overcome this silliness. And the woke MCU message gets old. Make some changes Marvel or go the way of DC. Sooner or later your audience will tire of this.

title: Ultimately... Meh.
text: The Good: Great performances, SFX, script, morally ambiguous characters + fractured father/daughter relationships (yawn).The Bad: Thanos did moral-ambiguity and had more heart, the comedy, though funny, doesn't match the film's overall tone, and there's a seemingly superfluous LGBTQ+ references in the name of representation? These are superheroes/aliens-- why do they need human sexuality?!The verdict: More character-driven than the dumb-fest that was "Thor: Ragnarok", but less spectacular with a boring Guns 'n' Roses soundtrack. This film suffers the same problems as "Doctor Strange in The Multiverse of Madness" (great 1st act, but disintegrates fast into boredom). If you liked the latter two MCU references, then you'll probably enjoy this. If you didn't-- you won't. I didn't but I kinda did-- probably the best in MCU Phase 4 since "Shang-Chi", so far, but I'm kinda over the whole CBM thing now. I'm sure you will be too by the end of this.

title: A surprisingly dull short filler
text: This movie was labelled on HotStar as the greatest Thor movie so far!!! Really? Somebody had to grease palms there.Come on guys this is Thor the regal and royal superhero. But in this movie everything is a joke.Don't get me wrong the humour is what made me push this to a 4 rating. But I just felt that this movie is like a filler towards something.The return of love interest Jane. Whom I had no clue why she broke up with him. Christian Bale hung up his Batman shoes for this?In fact Bale's character was the only thing that added a level of seriousness that is needed in a superhero movie.

title: Expectantly Disappointing
text: I want expecting much from this latest Marvel installment because they have been steadily declining in quality and this movie continues that downward direction. They tried way too hard to be funny and ended up making every character goofy and the storyline muddled. The plot was meh and predictable as well. The only value for the whole film was the lines that made me laugh. But after a while, it became distracting and redundant. Additionally, the insistence of the director to bring the woke agenda to the forefront, and this film ends up as a complete joke--unworthy of it's predecessors. I like to watch movies to escape reality--not to be reminded of today's political and cultural battles.

title: As corny as they come
text: Nothing original in the movie and tons of unnecessary plots. Taika Waititi is funny as Korg, but other jokes seem just irrelevant. I mean, Thor's flick moment, why??? Bale is brilliant as Gorr but could have been more prominent. Overall disappointing, just another movie in the name of Marvel.

title: Badly written
text: Marvel/Disney just phoning it in with their latest efforts, in all areas to be honest, not just limited to this movie. This movie however has very little going for it, particularly on account of bad writing, politics aside, though there are some clear efforts to exclaim certain ideologies, which pull you out of the movie, but generally speaking they didn't have very much to work with.Thor, it would seem, doesn't do very well in so far as even numbered sequels are concerned, though this one is sat in the middle of a Disney period of output that isn't doing well at all on all fronts. They're in cash cow mode, and seem to care very little about the quality of their output at this time. This is also evident here with regards the visual effects. In fact this film feels rather like a fan edit, as if taken from a lower budget series.It has a couple of good moments - I particularly liked the goats, and some of it's more sentimental moments were reasonably effective. In fact it had some nice ideas in most areas, however none of them were particularly well executed at all.

title: Failed attempt to recreate Ragnarok.
text: Not that terrible, the problem is the new approach they took with an established character that people cared about and drastically changed his whole dynamic. Thor in this movie felt more like a Will Ferrell character and the movie felt like a parody of a Thor movie. The running jokes from the previous movie failed, goats didn't work and the movie had so many cringey moments. I did enjoy Bale's performance as the villain and wish we would have seen him slay gods. I also liked some of the side villains designs, I got a Jim Henson vibe particularly in the first 10 minutes. The rest of the cast did an average job, I guess it works as a goofball comedy.

title: Worst marvel movie till date
text: One of the worst marvel movies ever. Totally disappointed. It feels like thor died in infinity war and never returned. This is not the thor we know, like at all.

title: Watchable but nothing special
text: This movie is watchable, has some funny moments and overall kept me entertained. However I couldn't help but feel disappointed at a movie with so much potential. I felt the tone was just all over the place and couldn't really take anything seriously. Thors character has just become a huge joke, spewing unfunny jokes every 30 seconds. Christian bale is the best part of this movie, giving us a cool, creepy intimidating villain and seemed to have a lot of fun with the character, although I felt he could've had more screen time.I felt the cgi was severely lacking there were times when me and my friends were taken out of the movie to comment on how terrible some of the visuals were. The pacing also is all over the place with the film feeling rushed even though it's 2 hours!!In short I feel taika missed the mark here. It's definitely not an awful film but I can't really see myself rewatching it any time soon.

title: Hated it
text: Possibly the worst Marvel film. Poor writing. The acting poorly done. The storyline just horable. The dialogue is laughable, but not in a good way. All in all, a very juvenile, and poor excuse for a movie. I can only guess that much of the short comings of the film falls on the director. Everything in this movie feels rushed, and seems half hearted, and unprofessional. The sad thing for me is that I really like everyone in this film, but I am not going to just give a positive review due to the personalities, instead of the performances. To me it seems like they were more interested in an agenda than entertainment, or doing the job the public expects them to do. This is my second submission I have made for this movie. Several of my reviews have been ignored entirely by IMDB. I cant help but think that any mention of wokeness, PC, and how the entertainment industry pushes an agenda automatically gets censored. After all we cannot have anything said that the PC crowd disagrees with. It will be interesting to see if this gets by the censorship.

title: Disappointed but maybe there was method to the madness
text:
Chris Hemsworth was excellent in his portrayal
of Thor and Natalie Portman was great as Dr Jane Foster however I thought the movie lacked the Marvel WOW factor, as in a thrilling story. There were no moments where I was sitting up or on the edge of my seat.... except when Tessa Thompson was on the screen, she is gorgeous !!! Christian Bale was very good as the villain and the special effects were outstanding but i was expecting a major visual change in Gorr once he possessed the necrosword. A few funny moments and emotional ones also which is why I was happy to see it. Only seen it once and you need to see all Marvel movies at least twice in case you miss something. For me personally, it's been Thor Like and Thunder, the only time I loved it was when I saw the beautiful Tessa. Just changed it to 5 stars.

title: Disney Has Ruined Marvel...again
text: I have been a long time fan of superhero movies. I used to enjoy and looked forward to watching the new releases. But the turn that has been made to the focus being "tee-hee, ha-ha moments being the focus for the films is saddening. Just compare the original Thor and the second Thor film to what has been released in recent years is IMO appalling. Whomever started calling the shots at Marvel after the 2nd Thor film should be given a severance check and sent back to comedy central for their next big gig.These characters have been developed over many years and there appears to be no respect for their legacies. All that seems to matter now is having quick catch phrases that keep a certain audience type chuckling and sharing these jokes with there friends on Instagram while in the movie theater. As this appears to be the trend, I guess I'll just hope the DC Comics doesn't follow suiteLove and Thunder? Perhaps is should have been called. Love my Blunder.

title: Does not unfortunately live up to its prequels
text: I had some great expectations prior to watching this movie. The prequels were very good in fact and Thor Ragnarok, in particular, was great entertainment to me.However, I felt that this movie did not seem to have the same interesting story/plot/dialogues. The portrayal of Thor this time seemed out of touch/reality and a bit too cheesy if you ask me. A lot of digital effects was there but the main plot lacked depth and meaning. The humorous scenes were not really funny, not even close to its prequel Thor Ragnarok, which is a great entertaining movie. Therefore, unfortunately being a big fan of the Thor series, I can't really recommend this movie.

title: Unfunny waste of time.
text: Wow how the mighty have fallen. Rehashed jokes like matt Damon and Chris brother playing loki n thor. Rest just lack luster and lame. Seemed to be struggling to have any reason to exist.The story is just terrible and bale is just wasted.Seems the steam and luster has left the mcu.

title: Meh
text: Quality of Marvel Universe keeps declining. Cheesy acting. Over the top woke. Some humor, few good parts, but all in all just meh.Only went to theater to see because my son wanted to. Even he was disappointed.Will not be going to theater to see any more Marvel movies. Quality of scripts are just not worth it.

title: Worse Marvel movie ever!
text:
Marvel finally did it! They made a movie that topped Black Panther. Captain Marvel and Eternals got close but Thor Love and Thunder is now the Worse Marvel movie ever! None of the characters acted like themselves at all. The story and pacing were all of the place and it wasn't even funny. The movie made no sense and that might be because I feel asleep during it
Also why the f is Zesus fat? #horrible.

title: Corny and emasculating!
text: The movie straight up targets the attention towards a certain group only and favoring them. The script was very corny and emasculating towards Thors character and the mythology culture. They made the movie more as a Slappy comedy, rather then some of the maturity and serious aspect of the characters and culture. If they would of took some of the aspect how Thor 3 was, it would of been a lot better movie. They poorly jumped into certain senes without explaining the background of the situation and story. Overall they went to far over the top with the music and satisfying a certain group only, with trying to mold our kids generation as that future outlook.

title: Why marvel tell me just why
text:
Zeus is in top 10 strongest marvel characters
Its op!! And they just decide to make him loser
he can't even walk properly one of the strongest characters become one of the weakest..... Maybe in the future they decide to create the living tribunal as a very cute puppy!!!And please marvel for once become little more serious and grow up it's not necessary every movie to be a comedy!!! Every 10 seconds they tried to say one joke.We all love humour but do not force it like that it's not necessary and after start getting boring,annoying and cringe.And also one of the big problems....
Just make the movies longer
Just give the time to know more about the bad guy!!!! Yes we understand the hero is the main protagonist but give a few minutes more to the bad guys.

title: Gorr the only light in this movie
text: Tbh when i went to watch this movie i didn't expect too much.. some action and funny scenes and i would be satisfied. But the movie is empthy there are too many unnecessary scenes.The only bright thing is Gorr and they did i bad job of putting so little of him and focus on some scenes that makes movie boring.I am fan of Marvel but the last few movies are not so good.Hope they change and start making good movies like before.

title: So Disappointed
text: I so much love these characters, not so much Christian Bale. The music in this film takes me back and I love it! Then comes the plot, the overreaching for comedic value. It just falls so short of what Marvel has been and what they could be. I'm a huge Thor fan, I will watch those films over and over. Not this one though, once was already too much.The plot is not to standard, the character acting is not really good, Chris is great as always. It's just thin and always looking for a laugh. In the other films you always had a laugh, you didn't need the actors always seeking one. More Hemsworth, more Thor less tugging on people's patience.#shame, #disappointing.

title: Cringeworthy godlessness and a ridiculous Thor.
text: First off, the cast of this debacle is not to blame for it. Crowe, Hemsworth, Portman, Thompson, etc... have all proven mastery of their art on multiple occasions.No, the culprit here is Taika Waititi, and while Ragnarok was palatable, but only just, what he did to Love and Thunder borders on criminal negligence for the damage it will do to the reputation of said cast. I will avoid everything he does from now on and speak of him no more.The ONLY noteworthy character in Love and Thunder is that of the villain, Gorr. Christian Bale's monumental performance stands out even more because virtually every other character is depicted as a one-dimensional, frustrated neurotic on the verge of throwing a toddler tantrum, it is that bad.The only times this thing has any sort of superhero movie feel to it are the scarce occasions when Bale is in the picture, and on those occasions, it feels like the Gorr scenes were inserted from a completely different movie altogether. Gorr is also the only one I ever felt any sympathy for, as he's the only one who resembles an actual person one can build some kind of rapport with.I was a toddler in the early 1970's, and I grew up with the original DC and Marvel comics, reading and re-reading about the gods that were my heroes. Watching Love and Thunder, I halfway expected to hear the complete cast join in for the Oompa Loompa song. (Which would have been funnier than all the 'jokes' in the film combined.)There are no gods in this monstrosity. So sad,... and so bad that I have to wonder if this was done deliberately...

title: No Love No Thunder only Boring..ðŸ˜´
text: No Love No Thunder only Boring..ðŸ˜´ . A cartoon comedy for Kids, and a Parody movie for Adults.Too many meaning less one to one conversations which kept me check my phone and what ever the little action scenes makes Thor looks like an powerless god.

title: The best thing this movie offers is a runtime of less than 2 hours
text: All throughout the CG in this movie was a mess, and at times was funnier than the never ending onslaught of jokes that rarely land. The pacing was fine considering everything else. The fight scenes are the same as in every marvel movie, and character development is attempted but feels incredibly forced and not earned at all. I never felt bored while watching but that is the only thing this movie really does well.

title: Too much forced humour
text: I felt like this could have been a much better film if they just toned down the amount of quips and one liners littered throughout the script. It's like the writer(s) made a conscious effort to cram a wise crack or cheesy quip into every possible moment to see if they could get away with it.

title: Terrible
text: Like anything Marvel has made in the last 10 years it is insulting, predictable, boring, ugly, nonsensical and cringe. If you enjoyed this you're a simpleton, end of. If you enjoyed this you're everything wrong with the world and are the equivalent of a pig with his head in the trough. Who runs hollywood, piggy?

title: Ehhh... Is this supposed to be funny?
text: Eh... Is this supposed to be a marvel parady or something? Jokes were lame af. Portman = puOnly the 2nd movie I have walked out of the theater in my life time... The other was les mis (2012)..well my gf kicked me out cause I couldn't stop laughing when Russell Crowe started singing...

title: just lolzz
text: A comedic take on the movie Immortals... as serious as that movie was.... is as comedic this movie is... plus the women power and all that jazz included lolhonestly, a bit supprised the actors went for it.. i mean they agreed to be turned into a joke... why??? Loll GOG was a good movie on its on... Thor was a good movie on its own... but this is just pure charlie chaplin and Mr. Bean level of silly comedy lolll .. it will make u laugh.. but then you feel sad at what these characters ended up as.... a joke in a comedy movie..

title: Disappointed
text: Christian Bale did a great job, but the rest of the movie is a joke. From the stupid goats to the dumb gods and the theme park scene. Very disappointed in the MCU, I think this is worse than DC's WW84.

title: Ragnarok 2
text: The comedy aspects were trying to rekindle the same type of movie Ragnarok was. However, it needed to be darker because it did the villain no justice. In order to make a movie great you need a great antagonist. That is why Thanos was perfect. Disney put too much of its "family content" spin on it. Only watchable as it ties into the overall MCU storyline.

title: Thor more like Bore
text: This film tried too much to be funny at every occasion. It felt like Chris Hemsworth and Natalie Portman were treating it like an SNL skit. Only redeeming feature was Christian Bale.

title: A bland turn for the series
text: The acting in this movie was great. A fine cast that was unfortunately forced to act a terrible script that doesn't land any area very well. Considering Ragnarok was arguably one of the better Marvel movies, this was a complete flop.The 5 stars go to the cast for doing what they could to try and save this movie.

title: MCU Thor is a joke
text: Honestly the only movie that did partial justice to Thor is Avengers Infinity war. Even though other Thor films were ok if not bad, Thor Love and Thunder is a cringe movie and pushes the Thor character to lowest level possible. Mjolnir and Strom breaker now have feelings. What ? Yes. That is the cringe level of this movie. Thor is shown as a comedian. In MCU movies only Iron man, Black Panther and Thanos Characters have some depth. Rest all are woke, illogical and utter nonsense. This movie wasted an excellent actor Christian Bale. His character is poorly written. Jane Foster role is disappointing.

title: parody movie
text: Too much cheesy jokes. Looks like a Thor parody movie. They try every possible way to make this crap .Very disappointed, firstly, they overused stupid and dumb comedy on what meant to a serious movie. Second sues was a joke he was in the movie in 5mins in a place with all the most powerful character in this universe and I have to say how terrible the cgi was it looks like it was unfinished. And the biggest disappointment what great, emotional, scary and powerful and I mean very powerful, well awful. Such a waste of time.

title: CGI and demeaning superheros does not a movie make
text: If they wanted to make a movie that would kill of the superhero franchises, I guess this is what they tried to do. But then again, this comic books based CGI action theme was always destined to go the way of all the other 'popular' themes like musicals, westerns, 3D, etc etc. What we started to see during Covid and are seeing more now, especially with Spider Man, Thor and Jurassic World is the declining end-game of the CGI based action hero movies. I guess Iron Man saw it coming and got out in time with his dignity intact - end game indeed. I wonder what will become popular next. I hope it involves mainly adults and intelligent dialogue (mostly) and rational plots that are well directed and produced, with quality actors giving their all for their art - you know, like it used to be. I am sick of western teenage girl targeted movies - hopefully they will grow up soon.

title: Hmm
text:
I think the problem for me is that after avengers end game I thought yeah, that's a very good way to say goodbye to these characters, close the book and move on.This movie seems like a cash grab. It would help if the film had raised the bar
Or just been better. It seems to try and be funny rather than interesting, it has all the ingredients to be fantastic, christian bale is excellent, but it waisted the opportunity, this script would have been better as a Thor Lego movie, it would have made for a better experience all round, instead it comes over as overly silly. Please put these characters out to pasture in the mcu field next to the mcu
Care home. Peace out ...

title: Thor has gone from a comic to a joke.
text: A bit of comedy would have been fine, but Thor: L + T constantly goes for humour that i chuckled at only once or twice. Mostly just felt sad that it fell flat after growing up reading all his comics (and tons of others) and expecting a great adventure. Jane was mostly good as a high point, but the writing just made it a farce. Generally a well written show has a comedic relief character, but none of the characters displayed any gravitas, leaving nothing but a hollow waste of what could have been a great story. The cast had some great actors and I'm very surprised that after reading the script (that put Zeus in a mini skirt) that it passed the first read. I have to believe that a poor showing at the box office will cause a more impressive outing, as i would hate this slop to herald the end of Thor's adventures.

title: Gorr the WEAKLING?
text: This movie is the 2nd worst among Thor series. It totally discredited and blasphemed one of the Marvel Universe's best villain. Totally disappointed. All Black Necrosword which is almost invisible in the comics is portrayed poorly and Gorr is here Godkiller only because he killed 1 low level god. Director Taika Waititi should have created longer Thor movie starring Gorr as main villain divided in two parts just like Avenger Endgame. Short movie timing and editing to match it destroyed this movie!

title: Do not watch it if you are a real Thor fan
text: I just created account for this comment.I wish I would not watch it. It reined my mighty Thor.So many unnecessary jocks. No story base, not action. The move has failed in many directions.Nevertheless, the actors were amazing and well acted.

title: Not what we want to see in marvel
text:
Its bad to make a movie and to keeps us listening to someone telling the story its like unprofessional work
We came to see a movie a story we dont meed this bad starting let us see what marvel do giving us a story we can't predicted and keeps us wants to discover moreAlso this expand on thor with zeus and this things u become like wonder woman story dc bad ideasMarvel comes on story with infinity stones and science and huge challenge
No challenge in the movie and no hard enemies it was all easyBad.

title: Weak storyline
text: Screentime of bale was less than expected. Only Hemsworth and bale are the reason to watch this movie. Some parts of movie will left you frustrated especially if you follow comic. Marvel is doing same bogus ending in almost every movie. Very predictable, as a marvel fan I'm disappointed.

title: Decent, but tries too hard to be every genre at once
text: If you watch Love and Thunder with the hopes that it will be just like Ragnarog, you'll be disappointed. Ragnarog was a pleasently surprise and a great movie. This is not that.There is a HUGE waste potential from Christian Bale, who is usually one of the best actors in Hollywood, there are moments where he looks and really feels "evil and twisted", and then others where.. Its just bland and meh. And screentime-wise, he doesnt get enough to hammer in the character and too much for him to be really mysterious.There is an, and this is hard for me to say, overuse of Guns N' Roses, like they bought the greatest hits album and only use that.Overall its a decent movie, but it tries too hard to be funny and quircky, and for me, that was more facepalming and cringey. And at the same time it tries to be serious with battling some serious questions, but again fall flat here. If you know you comic material, you won't be surprised,what I am talking about.It starts out good, but by the end I was abit bored.Not a movie I nessarily am gonna watch again.

title: Worst Marvel Movie
text: I was extremely disappointed in n this movie. After Ragnarok , I had big expectations and left the theatre bewildered. I even waited a few days to give a fair opinion. If anything , I like it even less now. Maybe Marvel is putting out too much now, but it definitely took a wrong turn here.

title: Mediocre Fun
text: I definitely wouldn't consider this a good movie but I had plenty of fun. It's not particularly rewatchable or memorable but I loved seeing some of my favorite marvel characters back onscreen again.

title: This franchise is going down hills!
text: Tails Waititi had a lucky shot with Ragnarok and he thought he can reuse the same recipe again. Duh! You failed! This movie is like being directed by an eight year old. What a waste of Mr. Charming of The Universe-The Sexiest Man Alive Chris Hemsworth. Marvel should bring back Kenneth Branagh for the next Thor project, Kenneth makes masterpieces!

title: This was the final straw.. I'm done with Marvel
text: All of Phase 4 has been horrendous. Dr Strange was a huge disappointment. My girlfriend took a video of my reaction at the theater because of how bad it was and now Thor 4 is my breaking point... The words disgrace and joke come to kind when thinking of what to say. It touches on sensitive subjects such as Jane having cancer, going through chemo and mjilnor being a possible cure?!?There's screaming goats every 2 secs like it's funny or something. I thought I was watching a parody film or an snl skit. Christian Bale's talents are wasted and I've never seen him in a movie this stupid. Guardians of the galaxy are barely in it. More walking and talking. Disney is a joke. Watiti is a joke. And the biggest joke is me thinking I was going to find entertainment at marvel film after all the crap Disney puts out. Don't waste your time.

title: What happened
text: The entire Thor series is far from homogenous. The original and Ragnarok were pretty outstanding, though being rather different in the ways they presented themselves - one more serious, the other more comedic. Never the less, both delivered an outstanding cinematic experience with depth of storyline and characters. This particular film fails on all fronts. It seems like an excuse to get together an all star cast and milk the franchise with millions of dollars without delivering anything new. The jokes in this film are simply not funny and rather childish to be perfectly honest. I think the Thor series ends here.

title: Dissapointed
text: As a Thor fan im not satisfied with this movie this movie isn't engaging at all. Probably kids will love this movie. The climax is decent. At least Thor will return and I'm hoping it'll be great.

title: I rarely write reviews...
text: I rarely write reviews, but I had to come and give my opinion on this film. The Thor movies are by far my favourite Marvel films. However, this one has let me down big time. Unmemorable, silly, and quite frankly...boring. Can we please go back in time and redo this movie? Thanks.

title: Disgrace of a script.
text: This was written from a 10 yr old for an audience of 8 yr olds.Ridiculous!Not a serious movie. Flat jokes, worst Marvel movie so far.I should've read some of the reviews before watching.I can't believe what they are doing. Better to not make any Marvel movies any more.If they continue this I won't be watching any more Marvel movies, just like I stopped watching their series.Bale is the only one with a meaningful role in this thing, but even that can't make me watch it. Thank god I'm watching it at home, if I was at the cinema I would've left the theater.And with that, if you are a Marvel fan, above 12 yr old and not looking to bang your head against the wall, do not waste your time with this, "not even worthy to be called a movie" thing.

title: I miss good Marvel movies
text: Too much comedy. Trying to hard to be progressive, ruined opportunities with Zeus and other gods, weak execution. Marvel turning everything into a joke. Lame.Power and magic turned into a free for all for everyone to wield. Screaming giant goats make it feel like marvel is running out of ideas. Christian Bale was amazing - Wish he would do another Dark Knight.Dragging kids out of bed in the night and being disrespectful to peers makes it feel less suitable for kids. Nudity and sex orgy references from Zeus we unnecessary and downplayed any respect for Zeus..Marvel movies were pretty good until Iron Man died.

title: You wanna hear a joke?
text: Joke Joke Joke Joke . Everything is that damn thing.Thor 4 is THE most immature MCU movie ever.Thor has a character-wise assassination. He is one of the people who lost the most during the infinity saga, he should be the most damaged, everything about that is just like "MEH ITS ALL GOOD".The monologues, and recaps about the past easily breaks the immersion. They treat the audience lime dumbos.Stakes are too high to value it, and the use of children who have insanely high plot armor also devalues it.It's like there is always something more powerful and more better than what we saw in the Infinity Saga in every recent MCU outing, but nothing is coherent or seeming to lead up together soon.I had hopes for this movie and that was because of two people mainly, Christian Bale and Taika Waititi. Bale is given a not so good script and bloated with makeup. Taika well, this script was a joke mate!

title: Just a joke
text: The entire movie seemed like a joke, nothing really connected or made sense, they just threw a bunch of stuff that they thought was "funny" or "cool" which just made it stupid. Most of anything in the movie was just made up in the movie, which is horrible to have. It makes a movie seem like they just made a sequel with no plan just for the money, which I'm very sure is what happened. It had no relation to anything else in marvel, it didn't build up on anything, the movie itself was just pointless and random. A wasted opportunity to build on Jane and Thors relationship, which wasn't that good in the first place. This could've gave a Jane a personality, but instead changed what little she had completely. Definitely the worst marvel movie I've seen, tied with multiverse of madness.

title: Not getting any better
text: I can appreciate a lot about these movies. I won't say it's not worth seeing, but it's certainly not the greatest one yet. No worse than the second though, so that must say something. Overall, it takes after the third movie with silly jokes and rushes too much that I can't take everything in at once.

title: Should've been a Disney+ release
text: The movie is entertaining but it's not as good as Thor Ragnarok. The dialogue is in Love and Thunder is very Corny. The acting is terrible, Natalie Portman is very bad in this movie, her acting is the worst I've ever seen from her. The CGI looks kinda cheap in a lot of scenes. The plot is weak.

title: The perfect word to describe this movie: Silly
text:
1) The acting in this movie just seems....lacking. Empty. Silly. There are too many jokes, too much stupidity (screaming goats getting annoying after the 30th scream), not enough character development except for thor and jane
2) Christian Bale's character was not developed enough. I feel like we didn't see enough of him. Same for Lady Sif (who disappeared for years). Same for the Guardians of the Galaxy. Same for Russel Crowe
3) Seriously.....Natalie Hershlag (Portman) as Thor? Be realistic! She's a meter and a spit, and she's supposed to be so powerful. I get the hammer is powerful. But her....no. Not believable>
4) TOO MANY REFERENCES TO SAME-SEX COUPLES (I. E: "MY DADS...", "MY MOMS....", FEMALE HAS A CRUSH ON ANOTHER FEMALE!) WTF...DISNEY TRYING TO BE SO PRO GAY-LESBIAN THAT NOW, AN ACTION MOVIE IS A POLITICAL STATEMENT.... I HATE MOVIES THAT HAVE TO PROMOTE THIS KIND OF STUFF...ONCE IS ENOUGH...TWICE IS TOO MUCH.5) ZEUS! You see zeus for maximum 10 min...and he's fat, has a bad greek accent, is literally sitting alongside the Bao, the Dumpling God....wtf....oh...and his thunderbolt looks like a gold-platic plastic toy. It's a joke.Conclusion: The movie isn't in any way serious, even the dark parts feel "meh", the acting was mediocre, such a waste on an incredible cast. It's entertaining to watch, but nowhere near the level of intensity, comedy, seriousness, drama of Thor Ragnarok.

title: Bore and blunder
text: Perhaps the worst MCU movie yet. An incoherent plot, endless jokes that never land, a weird tonal mix where cancer is trivial and amusing, a big bad who is neither big nor bad and an ending that makes absolutely no sense upon a modecum of reflection. Thor has gradually gone from an epic character to the butt of a long tedious joke.Ragnarok on Netflix would be a much better option for anyone yearning for a modern interpration of the Norse god.The actors here try to do their best but the blame must surely lay squarely at the feet of the director who managed to put this monstrosity together, hopefully his last rodeo.

title: Ocassional glimps of what could have been
text: Thor: Love and thunder is a ok movie, mostly because the cinematography is beautiful and the actors are good. The movie itself feels like a a room of writers just brainstormed whatever they found funny and mashed all of it into the movie. The movie is very juvenile and lame most of the time. Sometimes I saw a scene that would have worked beautifully as a unexpected break/joke in a more serious movie, but due to the overload of lame jokes they fell flat on their face in this one.The movie will do as entertainment if you have nothing else to watch, but it really isnt very good. Gave it a fair shot and was disappointed. Will not recommend this movie to my friends.

title: Thor: Love and Thunder Review
text: Massive disappointment from both the MCU and Taika Waititi. Feels more like a parody of Thor: Ragnarok more than a continuation to that movie. Waititi's style works incredibly well for his other films but here it's just too much. The comedy undercuts almost every emotional moment and deflates almost any tension in every scene. The character development here for anyone who isn't Thor is underwhelming. Natalie Portman returns as Jane Foster and she feels more like a mandate from Disney to include her rather than Taika wanted to. I also don't think Portman is doing a great job here but the script she is given doesn't help her at all. Chris Hemsworth is good as Thor. It's clear Hemsworth is having a blast and his charisma kept me somewhat invested. Christian Bale's Gorr is a very mixed bag. On one hand you have a really fun, engaging, and great performance from Bale but that character of Gorr just isn't great. His origin is rushed and confusing before the film bizarrely chooses not to show him kill any gods besides one. A character called The God Killer only gets to kill one god on screen. Great job Marvel! The other actors like Tessa Thompson and Russell Crowe are doing a good job but their characters feel like an afterthought. The filmmaking here in general honestly feels a little bland. Taika's style is there but it feels awkward this time. The visual effects don't look great most of the time either however with the recent news about how Marvel treats it's VFX workers and how little time they have then it's understandable why they look incomplete. The film wasn't completely devoid of anything fun though. There were some fun sequences and fun jokes though. The black and white fight is very creative and fun to watch and The Rock at the end was pretty great. The rest of the jokes in this film really aren't that funny though. The screaming goats weren't funny the first time and they weren't funny the 15th time they made the joke. With the lackluster output that Phase 4 has given us, Marvel is in trouble right now if they don't course correct soon. If you enjoy Ragnarok then maybe you'll enjoy this but at the end of the day you can skip it.

title: No stakes, not remotely serious, not enough Christian Bale and unfortunately too much Taika this time
text: Having thoroughly enjoyed Thor Ragnarok, enough to rewatch it multiple times, I was excited and had high expectations for Taika Waititi's next entry in the Thor series of movies and as such went along to an advance screening last night to check it out. Unfortunately I left the cinema feeling thoroughly disappointed with what I saw and that I had once again been tricked into watching another extremely formulaic and tonally misguided piece of modern Disney film/television.The whole film is just memes and jokes throughout with almost no breathing room whatsoever, all the characters are now moronic quip machines and poor Christian Bale, who gives a pretty good performance as the antagonist, is given very little screen time with which to develop his more seriously toned character. At no point did I feel like he was an actual threat, due to the happy-go-lucky way the characters were treating their mission at times and as such the whole story fell flat for me. Taika has over-injected his humour throughout the whole movie but also over-injected himself as Korg, which failed to get many laughs out of the cinema I was in, a packed New Zealand cinema nonetheless which by contrast was roaring with laughter when I went to see Thor Ragarok.The movie relies heavily on its licensed tracks for music, one of which gets very old by the end (Sweet Child O' Mine). The dialogue is outright cringe-inducing at times, which Taika has balanced well in the past but it really seemed like things were given a pass on the first take or went unchallenged. The action is decent, but felt like it was spread thin between the many often inconsequential "comedic" and occasional "dramatic" character/dialogue driven scenes and there wasn't anything as awesome or goosebumb inducing as some of the scenes in Ragnarok (when Thor gets his thunder back and obliterates a bunch of goons on the bridge). There were actually some nice dramatic moments and conversations, but they were always immediately undercut by some comedic quip or gag, sometimes in the middle of the moment.I dont know, I'm still coming to grips with what I saw but I cant deny my first impression, which was that the movie was trying way too hard to lean into the comedic success of Ragnarok, which came at the cost of other more important aspects (story, character, tone and arguably action), and ultimately failed at even being particularly funny. It doesn't help that I went to see this coming off the back of being immensely disappointed by Disney's "Kenobi" series which felt like a saturday morning cartoon/kids show like Power Rangers, but if it werent for the good cgi in parts I would say that Thor Love and Thunder felt something like that also. To be clear, I thought Doctor Strange 2, despite some pretty shaky dialogue, acting performances and narrative choices, was a really fresh and tonally consistent movie which I enjoyed thoroughly and that despite relying extremely heavily on shoehorned memes and character cameos, Spider Man NWH was a competent but mayb slightly overrated blockbuster. I just think I'm done with Disney shows and movies for a while after seeing Thor Love and Thunder, I get that they are probably being more geared towards children at this point but they had managed to appease everyone in the past successfully so maybe each of their projects is suffering due to issues with over-production (spreading good staff/teams too thin across MCU/Lucasfilm projects).

title: Silly, Disjointed & Worst Of All, Boring

There's a blatant neo PC ideology (that has nothing to do with the majority of folk) forced onto the canvass & on this occasion, it doesn't sit or stick.Really disappointing effort from Taika Waititi. I'm a fan of his work, but, this film is, by far, the worst thing he's done for a mass market.Bad writing, directing, editing, acting; it's basically a bad film.3 stars is generous. Very! Generous.

title: Missed opportunity
text: Silly and bad movie. Most things went badly. The movie is just a comedy nothing more than that.
