As I said, it's a missed opportunity. The consumption of the character in a bad movie, and consumption Christian Bale with a character didn't take enough time.The action is very bad from the beginning of the movie to the end.The film is a satirical comedy yet many times it was very bad, This is almost Marvel's first movie with this weakness in comedy, I barely remember a scene or two in which I laughed. And the problem of comedy that exists negatively affected the movie, The movie takes comedy as a basis even in important scenes, To the extent that I never felt danger to any of the characters.An empty movie as a story, Bad handling of most points, it's just a bad comedy movie.Better to be forget.

title: Thor does his best Boris Johnson impression, huzzah!
text: Exactly who is this film made to appeal to?Seriously I have no idea at all as to the target audience.Shadow monsters are probably too scary for younger children, the action and jokes are probably too lame (and forced) for older children\teenagers. Many parents (and adults generally) will balk at the in your face and completely unnecessary, tacked on, LGB dog whistles. The actual diehard fan base have clearly not been given a first, never mind a second thought.Looking for something good to say about this film? It's not as bad as the Eternals.Disney are single handedly destroying every popular movie franchise of the last 40 years. It is actually remarkable how successfully Disney are turning billion dollar brands to trash.But you'll probably want to watch it, it's Thor and marvel after all. How much longer we'll keep saying that is anybody's guess but my expectations are now rock bottom such that I don't really care if there's another MCU film and there's certainly no way I would pay money to go watch another one.

title: I liked his new outfit, but this film hurt me.
text: Thor: Love And Thunder (2022) -Hello? Yes, I'd like this film to be remade please, without all of the nonsense and with Chris Hemsworth's real bottom. I mean who tuned in to see a CGI version? Surely it's a thing of beauty in its own right?Lose the stupid goat noises and the odd "quirky" jokes that were just for the sake of it and really focus on the fantastic story that this could have been.It even started daft. They took his recklessness too far and it certainly didn't seem like the comic book version of Thor that I was used to from his appearances in the X-Men collection.I liked the use of Korg narrating things throughout, but that was enough humour.The jokes in 'Thor: Ragnarok' (2017) worked because they weren't every two seconds and were appropriate to the storyline, but they seemed to have saturated this script or probably ad-libbed the dialogue in some sort of attempt to outdo the laughs of that previous instalment, which has ultimately ruined the whole thing and put me right off of Thor as a character. I realised recently that actually Liam Hemsworth is probably the better of the brothers having seen him in 'The Dressmaker' (2015), but watching this film definitely put me off his brother Chris, because he obviously agreed to take his greatest character in this ridiculous direction.I think that Chris and Taika Waititi need to part ways now before they ruin the franchise completely. The 'Guardians Of The Galaxy' (2014) part at the beginning was quite clearly to explain away the fact that the "Asgardians Of The Galaxy' film was never made and they had to show how Thor had moved on since leaving with them in 'Avengers: Endgame' (2019).Unfortunately it got too stupid and was far too busy with new and existing characters.And I am really very angry about this, because, as I've said, the story was such a great concept. Bringing back the gorgeous and talented Natalie Portman as Jane Foster+ and facing them off against 'Gorr The God Butcher', played superbly by Christian Bale, were class ideas.If this had been produced and directed in the same way that the other Marvel films had been, then I believe that it could have been one of the best stories in the series, but what they actually achieved (If you can call it an achievement) was a conglomeration of a kids adventure film, a bittersweet romance and a comedic farce all rolled into one. It really lost its way.I feel as I did with 'The Eternals' (2021) and 'Shang Chi' (2021), that this film was rushed out to keep the Marvel momentum going, but didn't have the thought or consideration put in to ensure it was worthy of the franchise. It was missing that final proof read and edit and it showed.I'm actually glad that my mother fell over and I had to take her to hospital on the night that I was supposed to see this film, because I'd be furious if I'd paid to see it.460.72/1000.

title: Disappointing
text: Marvel continues its downward spiral with another Thor movie that could off worked. But tries too hard to be up there with the last one.It's another messy, CGI filled mess that tries too be funny In its first half, before getting into the decent dark stuff it should have done from the beginning.It tries to repeat "Ragnorok" with its cartoony style. But it looks horrible, and goes overboard with the modern stuff, and setting up characters no one cares about. While the reliable guardians of the galaxy take a back seat.The movies saving grace is Christian Bale. Who's always the best thing in average movies these days. title: Really?
text: Must be the first movie I only give 1 star on IMDB. I loved Ragnarok. It is one of my favorite MCU movies. It was exciting, different, colorful, suspensful and pretty cool. I know Taika Waititi is overdoing it sometimes. In Ragnarok there were at least five situations where I thought he ruined the moment with the strange humour. In Love and Thunder it's different: There is not a single moment that's NOT ruined by the unfunny humour. Doesn't matter what scene, you just KNOW it will be ruined because some bad joke. What's wrong with people? What's wrong with the movie industry? Will we never see a good movie ever again? Everything turns into crap lately.

title: Marvel moving out of track
text: Please keep trends and disputed ideas out of your movies. For me personally this is not something I want to take my young ones to.I used to enjoy reading Marvel/DC comics since my childhood and raised up children to love Marvel/DC stories. Now I regret doing that as they seem to push ideas that I do not agree with into the younger generation brains to normalize the abnormal.I am getting fed up with the current disappointing releases from Marvel and it hurts to turn my back on something that was so pure and enjoyable to me in my childhood.

title: COULD HAVE BEEN MUCH BETTER.
text: Having read the comic series this was based on, a few years ago, I was really looking forward to this. If they had done it more like the comic, it could have been a pretty amazing epic movie. They decided not to, missing out certain details and events, that made it seemed rushed, and also made it heavy on the comedy. As a fun, family, movie, it was fine, but it was a wasted opportunity to make something that could have really stood out, and been much more memorable. The Korg character, was a sworn friend, to the Hulk, who was by side in the Planet Hulk series and after, and had nothing to do with Thor from what I remember. Seeing him, as funny as he is, just reminds me of how much they have completely flushed the Hulk down the toilet, after giving him some amazing stand out moments.

title: what are you doing Marvel?
text: Was this meant to be a comedy? Because if yes, then it failed at that. It is full of unfunny jokes, but whatever, i can just ignore those. But what i can't ignore is the bad writing. We get our typical dose of woke cringe that comes with most of these Hollywood movies lately, nothing surprising here, (do they really hate making money this much?) with the two main female characters, although luckily it's not as bad as in different movies.It never feels like there are any real stakes. (Constant fakeouts "Oh no they are dying." And they they are fine a minute later, just removes any sort of tension. You never worry about anything bad happening to anyone here. ) Plot and any serious buildup often gets sidelined to make a space for an unfunny comedic moment. (And I'm not trying to be jaded here, I love me some funny jokes, but I think most of the jokes in this movie were objectively bad). And in the end you just end up with a very generic watery sauce of a movie. Marvel used to be good at this superhero thing. What happened?Christian bale and his character were wasted and out of place in this movie, he deserved better.

title: Would Really Like To See The Movie Taika Was Trying To Make
text: So much of the pacing felt rushed. Repeatedly we're thrown into the middle of a giant set piece or action scene with next to no build, and then tossed right into another without letting what just happened sit with the audience. Word is Taika's first cut of the movies was around 4hrs long. Disney mandated a two-hour cut. This was the result.

title: So Bad
text: Only thing I have to say is save your money but most importantly use your time one something else. If ever going to watch don't waste your time. Just total nonsense. People get paid to make this stuff?

title: How disappointing
text: I've thoroughly enjoyed the previous Marvel Studios Thor movies with Chris Hemsworth. That said, I eagerly awaited the release of "Thor: Love and Thunder." I'm utterly disappointed in the film.The move was mostly just plain stupid and sought to obtain humor that it simply couldn't reach and ended up being disjointed with that effort at humor and Marvel's classic style. What a letdown! I can't imagine anyone paying to see the movie, and the disappointment most will inevitably come out with feeling! I've been saddened that the movie is now part of Chris Hemsworth's legacy, and It saddens me more to have seen the first-ever Marvel Studios film that has disappointed me so.

title: Why Marvel?
text: The movie sucks to be honest, bad plot.... infact the only thing I loved about this movie is Christian Bale as Gorr. His performance and look were so rich and incredible. That's all! The rest of the movie is Soo that I tried my possible best to sit through. I mean why would Marvel do something like this? Also what happened to the special effects team? The VFX was so poor in this movie; looked cartoonish and cheap, with un-laughable humor... Only humor I did enjoy aside Bale was the bleating and screaming from the Goats. This is a very forgettable movie and will definitely not add this to my library cuz I feel so ashamed of it. Production and directing were too poor and won't recommend this to anyone.

title: What is this? What happened?
text: Thor movies used to be cool (except for The Dark World, which was not that bad) but even The Dark World was even better than this. In fact, I regret watching Love and Thunder.Why I chose to watch this movie on a Friday? Friday was supposed to be fun!! I just wish I can travel in time to never watch this movie.Thor has been one of my favorite super heroes but I will never watch a new Thor movie again.There are so many things to say, that I just don't gonna say anything . Too much and I only have 557 characters remaining to write, and I need more. So, I will summarize with one thing: I am afraid that Disney will ruin the MCU.

title: Average
text: Good cinematography and funny but lacks in storytelling. There is no plot building like taika waititi's previous film Thor Ragnarok". Christian Bale performance is great but his 100% is not used in movie ,fans can tell that. Probably the last good movie in Thor's Franchise.

title: Another huge fail from Disney; pass this one by!
text: Seriously, is this what we can expect from the Marvel franchise in the future?The pointless jokes, children's stories narration, everything is just so... I don't even know what it is. Absolutely useless that is all it is.I love Marvel, I can binge watch Captain America, the Avengers, all of them up until now and now this? How could they let this one go out for public viewing?I couldn't even finish the whole movie, and I suspect I never will.Disney should have a serious think through and send these writers to finish kindergarten or if they want to keep them use them as janitors, cleaning toilets is just about how useful they are.,I cant but agree with another reviewer: Another franchise destroyed, Disney strikes again.

title: Excessive jokes all over the story
text: This episode of Thor was almost annoying because of the excessive use of jokes, even in the parts that the story should be serious. The humor is very important and very appreciated in the Marvel stories, but this one exaggerates too much.The producers must review the balance of humor and seriousness when it is required. Of course, the actors are great and so the special effects, and they saved the day.I hope the next Thor's movies show us the real pose of a hero, instead of showing smiles all the time. I just felt that I wasted my time watching this movie, and the money used was wasted so.

title: Few strong moments, buried under a funny mess
text: After Guardians of the Galaxy, Marvel went into a comedic direction with GOTG2 and Thor 3. Now Thor 4 takes it a step further and pushes it over the edge with non-stop misplaced jokes.Thor 4's only redeeming qualities are a very impressive Christian Bale and Nathalie Portman, who put some soul and motivation in this movie. Thor has become a funny sidekick and some of the cameo's, for example Korgg and Zeus, are downgraded to clowns who add little to the story.The same joke can only be funny for a few times and Marvel/Waikiki/Thor obviously didn't get that memo, and so they ruined a movie that had the potential to be dark and compelling. Who knew gods could be so unintreresting and annoying.......

title: Feels like betrayal
text: No story, no sense. Marvel Movies are not what they were now.I wait for Marvel Movies for so long and they serve me this. So disappointed. Only good thing is the love triangle.

title: Conflicted & Entertained.
text: I'm not sure this was mean to be a huge staple point in their phase. Granted I am a mcu lover & face little bad this one just wasn't it. I'm starting to not enjoy goofy Thor. And the light hearted person he's casted to be now, leave that to the guardians. It was a good appetizer, almost like a Disney plus movie that made it to theaters. The villain was amazing but underserved, would've loved to see him in bigger battles that had more at stake, I mean with an ending like that... you'd think more would've happen but what happened? Jane was also under used... she should be able to stick around. This will end up being towards the bottom of my mcu ranking. Looking forwards to what's next but this one I'll just skip over.

title: Disney should choose its directors more wisely.
text: Taika Waititi doesn't seem a capable director when it comes to franchises, when he's given too much control. He was okay as a director in the Mandalorian,, where the creative overseeing laid with Filoni and. Favreau, but he only has respect for.subjects he created himself. I fear the worst for the Star Wars franchise, after he destroyed Thor in the MCU.

title: Embarrassing
text: I only gave this a 5 because of Bale. The writing is horrendous and childish with a thousand plot contrivances. It's just lazy. Taika has let his past success go completely to his head. I honestly can't believe we've gone from Infinity War and End Game to this and the other phase 4 Marvel rubbish in only a few years. I doubt I'll pay to watch another Marvel movie at the cinemas. It's just not worth it anymore.

title: funny and very stupid
text: What was that??)))) I've been watching "Torah" for two hours? This is some inflamed nonsense about the God of Thunder. The video sequence is excellent, but the script is generally needed. Marvel, do you really take people for idiots? Apparently yes. Otherwise, I can not explain this pun)))))The foregoing part, although it was rustic, was at least meaningful. And here, apart from the terrible "humor", I do not see anything that somehow made sense. One thing is good, Thor is in great shape, handsome. But he became too stupid. Unfortunately, Marvel is a thing of the past. After the "Final" is getting worse and worse. It is very sad.....

title: Woke garbage
text:
If you like boys names Astrid, female
Kings, rainbows and a woman "Thor" (as it suddenly were a title, not a name)... go wild. Otherwise... stay clear. The Thor movies have always been a cool way to make our great Norse
Mythology relevant and interesting again, but this movie makes a mockery of it. It is a shame really... the movie has a star specked cast. Christian Bale is great as the villain, and Zevs greek accent is spot on. The movie is occasionally funny and if you love screaming goats... like I do.. you're in for a laugh...but all in all the movie is a steaming pile of sh**. I guess the frase "go woke and go broke" should apply to this movie. I'm glad I didn't pay for the ticket, but streamed it on Disney+, which by the way , seems like a more and more waste of money too.

title: Extremely disappointed - it was awful
text: This movie was unfortunately awful. Thor all of a sudden went from being a strong warrior in the previous movies and legends to a buffoon in this movie. Like many of the other reviews I agree that the writers put too much liberal agenda into the movie instead of focusing on the strength of each character. And the relentless barrage of bad jokes did nothing to help advance the story or keep our attention. Zero desire to watch the next one as I can only imagine what the people at Disney will try on that take. And what is up with Cronk now having two dads and his entire species being male? What happened to his sister and mother? Please stop!!! And the Molnyer and Stormbreaker all of a sudden are sentient??? Give me a freaking break.Wi try out giving away the ending it continued to build up for the whole time and then just ended in a flash.

title: Gorr: Love and Thunder
text: Marvel WHY? After No Way Home, Marvel get down. Too many jokes, too many cringe jokes. Bale was fantastic but sadly and for no reason he has very little screen time. His character carry this movie and his character development at all Marvel look for Black Panther Wakanda Forever. Do it!!!! Do a very fantastic tribute movie.

title: Offensive to your mind
text: This movie is offensive to human mind.I watched the first half and I just couldn't help but think qbout all the actors and how little they care about what they are even making. I kept asking myself, are they even sober do they even know what they are doing?? Why would Natalie Portman agree to be in this movie?The entire time I felt like my mind was being taken out of my skull and squeezed and juiced and then put back.Dont watch this movie if you want to keep your mind intact.What happened to television over the last few years is honestly tragic and I can't believe some of my favorite actors are all in on this. So disappointing!

title: Simply awful
text: Awful dialog. Awful acting. Awful script. Awful music. Awful directing.I am a huge fan of Marvel films. I've watched them over and over and loved them on every viewing.But this....This is not what I've come to expect from Marvel Studios. There is very little to tie this movie with the prior films. The tie-in with the Guardians where we left off with Endgame is simply painful to watch. It is indescribably corny and a total waste of the Guardians.To have soared so high with Infinity War and Endgame only to fall so low with this, Marvel Studios needs to get their mojo back or risk fading into second-rate studio oblivion.Needless to say I won't ever be watching this awful mess of a film again.

title: Over stays its welcome
text: The first 2/3rds is actually enjoyable. Then it just drags and drags. The jokes get stupid and hammy. It tries to give you a bunch of emotional, tear jerky moments that just don't work. It just tries too hard. Action was fun and it looked amazing. I can't even tell you who the bad guy was or what they were fighting. Natalie Portman and Kat Dennings looked awesome though.

title: "If You're Ever Lost, Just Look Into the Eyes of the One You Love."
text: Thor: Love and Thunder is the twenty-ninth film in the Marvel Cinematic Universe, a franchise which has been barreling ahead since The Avengers first game out in 2012. To reiterate, this franchise has released nearly thirty films in about fourteen years, starting with 2008's Iron Man. After all of this time, with films so frequently released, one would think audiences know these characters intimately and those in charge wouldn't have to spoon feed expositions into our gullets like mother birds. One would be wrong.The film follows Thor Odinson and Jane Foster on their quest to bring down Gorr the God Butcher, a man cursed by the Necroblade who seeks to...butcher gods. Thor must also reconcile his feelings for Foster, who wields Mjolnir now as The Mighty Thor, as they traverse a couple of worlds on their journey to take down Gorr. The pair are also joined by characters introduced in Thor: RagnarÃ¶k, Valkyrie and Korg, who are also in the film, accompanied by some extremely irritating giant screaming goats.The overarching problem with the film is its tone, which careens bombastically from glibly farcical, to sappy and overwrought, all the way down to solemn and sentimental. There's hardly a mood the film doesn't attempt to evoke, resulting in a messy, unfocused, and tensionless product. The blame for this confused tone lays at the feet of the film's writer/director Taika Waititi, returning from Thor: RagnarÃ¶k and audience favorite Jojo Rabbit.Where the latter's dramatic pretensions work because of the intrinsic weight of its Nazi Germany setting, the Thor entries flounder because they're not grounded or purposeful in their world or atmosphere. Keeping dramatic focus in a film about Nazis, even a comedic film, is simple; keeping dramatic focus in a film about odd alien worlds, lovesick musclebound gods, and characters who quip about their own cancer diagnosis isn't so easy. When every character, in every moment, has a glib, grating retort to the present danger, tension is erased, and stakes are annihilated.In addition to tonal problems, Thor 4's story is nonsensical and half-baked. Gorr's plan to butcher the gods of the universe makes no sense after three seconds of thought; his motivations are conveniently set up within a single scene and much of the needed character work for a satisfactory arc is nonexistent. Much of the film feels simply like wheel spinning, as we follow Thor and Foster from one world to the next without much forethought or context. The plot is there, but it's flimsy, and many connective threads exist as little more than action cliches.Much like The Rise of Skywalker, there never seems to be a structure or plan on the end of the writers, who substitute quick movement, hyper-paced dialogue, and heavy-handed, frequent exposition for any semblance of a story. The exposition in particular is grating because it washes away any awe or mystery for the audience, and because it's incredibly clunky and transparent. All of these problems make Thor 4 play less like a story within a fleshed-out world, and more like a hastily assembled collection of cheap, impersonal scenes. The whole thing feels so disposable.Continuing the theme of poor writing, let's take a second to discuss the Thor Odinson. For much of the MCU's run, Thor has been a powerful, stoic, and plain-spoken deity, with a likeable charm displayed charismatically by Chris Hemsworth. These qualities were seriously disrupted in Thor: RagnarÃ¶k, to my chagrin, and evaporated entirely during Infinity War and Endgame. The Thor presented in Love and Thunder is, to be blunt, a bumbling, childish, aloof buffoon, totally bereft of the qualities which made him an intimidating and forceful presence in previous entries. This brand of character assassination seems to be a trend, as it was featured prominently in Buzz Lightyear's characterization in Toy Story 4, and throughout the Despicable Me franchise for the minions, who as recently as last week descended further into idiotic caricature.It's frustratingly difficult to root for the Thor of RagnarÃ¶k and Love and Thunder because he never seems in tune with the danger or circumstances around him. It does make sense though, in a way. The old Thor films were semi-serious actioners, which require a likeable, dependable, capable, and resourceful hero. Thor 3 and 4 are essentially screwball farces, which in contemporary comedy terms require a man-child incapable of change or introspection until seconds before the credits roll.This rationale is made even more frustrating by the real-world limitations of Hemsworth and comedy in general; being a macho, musclebound, unstoppable badass and a self-deprecating, nonchalant jester is obviously disingenuous. These are diametrically opposed archetypes which shouldn't generally exist in the same body; it's not Hemsworth's fault that he can't convincingly play both at once, but he can't.Hemsworth isn't the only actor flailing around in the vain hope of making the script work. Every performance is glib and listless. Waititi as Korg keeps the zingers flying hot and fast, Tessa Thompson is rather unconvincing as an apathetic yet committed town leader and warrior, and Natalie Portman is particularly adrift in her role.Portman's performance is fluttery and cutesy, not helped by her lack of established or developed character. She acts as if she's been cast opposite the jock in a film about high school melodrama, working hard to keep any and all emotion from crossing her face. She's played stoic and broken before in actioners, but this is a far cry from her performance in V for Vendetta. It's hard to put too much fault on the cast; Waititi uses heavy improv in his films, which is an increasingly bizarre choice for a film which shouldn't be a farce and isn't inhabited by those skilled at improvisation.Thor 4 keeps within the marvel tradition of looking incredibly expensive yet visually bland and flat. Like most MCU films, and most new films in general, there is absolutely no attempt to block scenes in a manner that establishes context, continuity, or basic immersion. Actors mostly stand around and talk and nearly every action scene is filmed without flair or personality. It's just baffling to watch a piece of art, made in a medium specifically capable of drawing in the eye and mind, look so flaccid and so stock. The world is clearly uninhabited by anyone not standing on a small set in front of a greenscreen.For such ballooning budgets nowadays, one would think film studios could afford to higher more than fifteen extras at a time. Bresson and Eisenstein are rolling in their graves as filmmakers explicitly shoot scenes with no sense of place and editors cut with no sense of rhythm, meaning, or purpose. It's all so random and thoughtless; no number of assembly line productions will make me shrug my shoulders and mutter, "eh, that's just the way movies look I guess." To be fair, the non-CGI props and locations don't look convincing either - every piece of armor looks like low-grade Chinese plastic.Yes, most of Thor 4 is annoying, ugly, and pointless, but there is a silver lining of quality, and his name is Gorr. Most everything about the film's villain is aesthetically impressive and dramatically interesting, if not wholly satisfying. While his plan makes little sense and his motivations desperately need deeper exploration, Christian Bale's portrayal is, in turns, both sympathetic and humane.Unlike most MCU villains, Bale doesn't shoot for plainly stoic; he and his delightful British accent play up the intensity when needed and simmer down when the situation demands solemnity. His color palette and design are intriguing and he's genuinely intimidating, a nice departure from the recent crop of bland baddies. Many of the fight sequences involving Gorr, while clumsily cut and hard to keep track of, are at least conceptually interesting and imaginative. Gorr's scenes are the only times when Waititi even attempts to create cinematic images.Overall, it's whatever. Thor 4 is more of the same; if you subscribe to the Marvel formula and feel like you know the characters inside and out, you'll probably like the film well enough. If you've been alienated by the sheer volume of output or any of the tonal shifts of the last few years, the film is hardly likely to win you back. Thor 4 keeps on the same tract as most entertainment, likely assembled by a random number generator with data scraped from a sampling of social media status updates and trending hashtags, designed to stimulate our decimated dopamine systems and distract from our dismal reality for a couple of brief hours. Have fun.4/10.

title: Worst Marvel in history!
text: The writing is very poor, Jokes are not funny at all and the acting was not even good enough for a schoolplay in 6th grade.I hope the next Marvel lives up to the Marvel expectations. For sure I'll never watch this one again.

title: Not the kind of Thor film I like
text:
This film
I enjoyed it much more than Multiverse of Madness which isn't a very hard accomplishment to achieve in all honesty. The film was very funny and Christian Bale's performance is the main strong point of the film. He definitely carries the film on his shoulders, his presence is so dominating and steals the spotlight from the protagonists Hemsworth and Portman. That is where my praise ends. Although comedic that's all it has going for it as the action scenes and plot are sub par, predictable and frankly don't have much depth to them. This film continues the trend of tearing down Thor from being an incredibly strong hero both physically and writing wise, completely turning him into a clown who's only purpose is to entertain the spectator through his comic relief. This change in attitude to characters is a trend I've noticed with the Marvel Cinematic Universe at the moment. They take a once serious and 3 dimensional character and create this weird amalgamation of complete goofy and ridiculous nature with just enough of a serious edge to care about them slightly. Some audiences may actually prefer this style of Thor but I certainly do not share that view. To conclude I only recommend watching this film if you enjoy the current MCU releases.

title: Expected
text: I love Thor and Thor movies he is one of my favorite marvel characters but I knew this movie was going to be mediocre. The story line was boring and the ending was kind of silly. The one thing I loved about this movie was the villain his character and image was really well done and I loved how it added a little bit of darkness to a movie that previewed to be so happy.

title: Feels like Taika exaggerated way too much.
text: Thor: Love and Thunder has no Love and no Thunder to talk about. It's difficult to even begin, but let's do this.I returned home from the theater (july 2022), trying to make sense of what I had just seen. Right out of the gate, I will say this is not the worst MCU movie to date. Dark World and even the atrocious Antman movies are below. I'd say it's a tie with Black Window. Another unnecessary movie that lost its way. It's 4 out of 10, and I'm being generous.To be fair, the visuals and the soundtrack are actually very good. The production value is the one good thing that didn't make this journey unbearable. The general idea of the plot is also nothing to sneeze at. But my summary is: Taika Waititi is a genius. He can make gold with whatever garbage they throw at him. He proved himself by reviving Thor after the disastrous Dark World into the cool Ragnarok.They asked him to perform the same miracle, unrestrained. And I think this happens if you leave Taika unchecked: he tries everything and cuts nothing. And the thing this movie needed the most was better editing, especially cutting a lot of things off.Korg was great in Ragnarok. Because it was a very minor part. The comical relief was used very sparingly, and it worked. Now they turned the notch up to 11, and it's too much Korg. The joke of Asgardians of the Galaxy at the epilogue of Endgame was great. But again, Love and Thunder take too damn long lingering on this Guardians joke.The first section of the movie, closing up the Endgame joke, took too damn long. It could be dealt with in a very fast 5 minutes montage. But Taika liked the joke so much that he overdid it. And then you have the conflict between the tone the director wanted and the tone that the plot required. The director clearly wanted a light-hearted Ragnarok 2-like style. The plot of Gorr is a very tragic, dark, and serious storyline. If the Guardians section took too damn long, the Gorr introduction was too damn short.He's a great villain, but we see a short montage of him losing his daughter and just making an exposition dump with God Rapu. Show, don't tell. He gets the necrosword out of nowhere and from there becomes the so-called God Butcher. But it's too short. I would have cut most of the Guardians scenes down to 5 minutes and increased the Gorr introduction by at least 10 minutes because it seems much more interesting and relevant to this movie.Another carried over consequence from the other movie: the New Asgard city turned tourism attraction and the Matt Damon theater that was a short joke in Ragnarok. It had a context before because it was another Loki shenanigan. But here, it was just a very long exposition section for the broken Mjolnir arc. But it breaks the meme. It was fun back then because if you didn't pay attention, you'd miss that the actors were Matt Damon and Hemsworth's brother. But here, they made their roles take more time with close-ups. And this breaks the meme aspect and incorporates them as actual scenes for this movie. And it doesn't work. This is the classic taking the joke too seriously.You could've made a more dramatic flashback montage with Hella herself breaking Mjolnir, taking far less time. And on the note of New Asgard. The Valkyrie was a great addition to Ragnarok, and she had a role to play there. But since then, they have no idea what to do with her. And here again, she did absolutely nothing. They could have just cut her, and the story wouldn't have unfolded differently. We already have Korg for comic relief; now they added Valkyrie as another comic relief. There's too much comic relief in this movie.Then there's Jane Foster's arc inspired by the cancer thing from the comics. And that's fine. But there's a big MCU problem here. My girlfriend pointed it out in the theater: what about Wakanda? What about the other gods? The world post-Thanos has Wakanda. Shuri was able to make surgery and take a bullet off the spine of that Shield's agent (I forgot his character name, but it's the Hobbit guy) like it's nothing. They imply that the Vibranium-based technology is unmatched to the point of nano brain surgery on Vision. And you want me to believe they don't have the cure or even much better treatment for cancer?Not only that, both Valkyrie and Thor seem to have this vast networking with several other Gods, several realms, and several different species in far more advanced technology states than us. Think of Nova. Thor has Stormbreaker, which is basically space Uber. He can teleport to any part of the Universe in the blink of an eye. And you want me to believe there's no cure for cancer anywhere in the known Universe at this point?The writer could forcefully patch this if he incorporated the whole Dark World's Aether, making her condition particularly unique because she had the Aether in her body. But again, they wasted too much time on jokes and not so much on the movie's stakes. Gorr didn't have much of an introduction. Jane's cancer didn't have enough development for anyone to care. Actually, they treat it like it's nothing. This movie has too little stake and too much flashiness.And when I say that they wasted too much time on jokes. The goats. It was completely unnecessary and annoying, and they insisted on it for far too long. I hate the goats. And the costumes. Thor's new uniform feels more like a cheap Aliexpress cosplay than a warrior garment. And they used the whole Power Rangers transformation joke too much, again. Thor is basically a Power Ranger at this point.We have two characters that were supposed to have tragic arcs, Jane and Gorr. But because there were far too many jokes all the time, their stories got diluted to the point that we don't care. The ending makes no sense. The whole "worthiness" thing means nothing at this point. Mjolnir and Stormbreaker were reduced to anime tsundere characters. Korg and Valkyrie didn't have to be here. The whole Korg narration works at first, but repeated too many times becomes very boring.Again, visually the movie is stunning. Great visuals. Hemsworth is in his prime. Battle scenes, taken in isolation, were very well built. Too many great scenes are poorly mixed with too many jokes, and very sloppy editing kills the pace and the tragic storyline. I would go as far as to say that if a better editor took the realm and re-edited this movie without Taika in the room, we would have a movie that I could add 1 or 2 points more, bringing it to at least a respectable 6 out of 10. But the way this movie is right now, it's a 4, at most.Seems like Taika can't be left unchecked. I would say that maybe it was the opposite, Disney demanding too much of him. But the parts that I feel are extra are exactly the Taika-like jokes. This is easily his most unbalanced work. It's a shame because the overall plot has a lot of potentials, and the production value is still very good, but the pieces were glued all wrong. That's my take. Not worth going to the theater to watch this. Wait for the Disney+ release.

title: Sad changing
text: The main character (Thor) has lost his majesty and has become a character with silly humor, low profile. Cheesy, suitable for a sit-com. Only the artificial applause is missing. Even the plot does not stand up very much and does not contribute to the story of the character. To be forgotten quickly. Obviously nothing to do with the Thor from Infinity War.Good the performance of Bale, almost unrecognizable. Worst of all, however, are the terrible jokes assigned to Thor that are definitely different from those with subtle humor found in previous films. 5 is a too high score, given because of the love for the original character.In hindsight I wouldn't see this movie. Strangely, the teenagers in the theater laughed like crazy, almost like a comic film.

title: Too MUCH Taika Waikiki, unfortunately.
text: First thing: i loved, i seriously LOVED what Taika did to Thor in Thor Ragnarok (TR in short). He gave Thor a new breath of personality. Some of the humor was cringy, but it only made Thor feel more real.Unfortunately there is such thing as overdose. And Thor Love and Thunder is exactly that.While TR was full of jokes and humor it also kept some moments of seriousness. Thor Love and Thunder just went full comedy using main character as the butt of the joke for most of the jabs.Some of the jokes were AMAZING (goats, axe, "moon landing", olymp, flick).. But for every good joke, there was that one that came at the expense of Thors identity. The kind that left a tiny crack on how we see his persona.Personally: i was not happy with TLT. It had alot of the best jokes and a handful of the very bad, hurtful instead of funny, ones.Also the idea of the title being explained in last minute of the movie... Yeah. Not the best idea.Overall: while i did love some of the scenes I rather disliked it as a whole. Next time i hope Taika would be limited with his humor, because even if its amazing from time to time, it also can ruin the movie.

title: Finally a great villain but wasted in the dumbest marvel movie yet
text: The Thor franchise now lays claim to the worst marvel movie (Thor 2 Dark World) and the dumbest marvel movie (Love and Thunder). Unlike Thor 2, this was more watchable, but it was still just dumb. I love the mcu. But this movie was like a parody of cheesy 80's crap and marvel at the same time. It's almost like they made an entire movie out of the Matt Damon and Sam Neill characters. Bale's Gorr was great. Probably the most intimidating villain yet. This is the kind of movie you watch on a Saturday afternoon when you either want to sleep or when you literally have nothing else you can think of to do to put on in the background.

title: It's a drastic decline
text: Storyline just went down the drain and that is very bad felt like a parody movie, no content and i felt really bad for the costume design of Gorr like MCU designed ebony maw, Thanos and can't do a Gorr costume. The phase 4 of the MCU is not even up to the task, then they had to make zeus to be a character who has no wisdom just dull and all he wants to have is fun nothing inspiring about Zeus just jokes and more jokes felt like a spy kids movie seriously if this is the path the MCU is taking i don't think they'd last. I advised a friend of mine who is a vivid MCU fan not to watch it but he didn't listen he ended up regretting watching it.

title: You don't expect much sense from Marvel movie but...
text: This movie is an example, that even great actors can't save horrible script. It even seems like the director is fully aware how badly he wrote the dialogues, because half of them makes fun out of the other half - and that's what Waititi calls "comedy". It seems like Marvel gave him movie, said "make it a bit funnier", it worked, so they gave him another titles and now we have to watch two hours of Taika's superhero-parody movie.The absolute peak of nonsense is a plot of the movie. It's hard to make superhero story bad, but to make it completely unwatchable can make it only this particular director. It seems like he delivered eight years old child's comic book it drew with crayons and Marvel Studio accepted it.Complete waste of actors, Taika Waititi becomes a synonym to crappy movie.

title: Huh?
text: It's no Ragnarok! Fun, but dumb....very dumb. The visuals were above par, but it just couldn't escape the underlying current American culture. Way too "happy"! No chemistry. Surprisingly too long. I couldn't wait for it to end. That said, it ended on a welcome high note.

title: 6.5? How?
text: Looking at the people reviews I dont know where did the imdb got the 6.5 average from? The movie is ridiculous and horribly disappointing which is what most of the fans think. Yet somehow it end up with rating which might suggest that its better than it is... when is not? As a Marvel fan I'm disgusted with what they did to this movie and all the characters. They made Thor look like complete idiot. The dialogues are so cheesy thats its painful to listen. Disney thinks everything needs to be thick and stupidid for people to like it... they should stick to making a movies about princesses for a 5 years old...

title: Had such promise...
text: Fort is such a great villain played by such a great actor. It's unfortunate the story had to be absolutely ruined by such a trash director. Thor goes from a star redeemed in the Infinity Saga back to a comic relief in a movie filled with unnecessary and disgusting sex/orgy/masterbation jokes and poor writing and acting. I was excited to see Zeus too and they managed to turn him into a sex craved slob who appears no mightier than a welfare bum. Truly unfortunate that such great characters like Thor, Zeus, and Gorr could be ruined by such awful writing and directing. Taika Watiti should never be allowed to help with a Marvel movie again.

title: Very uneven
text: There are some awesome visuals and great fight sequences in this film. Some funny jokes, unbelievably heart wrenching scenes and some truly breathtaking cinematography.The narrative is a mess, a lot of the comedy doesn't land and the film feels less like a movie and more like a bad theme park ride. There are questionable character decisions some genuinely stupid writing decisions and a particularly bad character assassination. One great post credit scene, another wasted one.It's fun, but the fun often drowns out the substance.

title: The poorest of the series!
text: Movie was really weak! Definitely poor script, poor dialogues, poor direction! Acting were below par, plot were nasty, even the jokes were lame.I think that this sequel may put and end to the standalone movie series. I think enough is enough!I was also really so disappointed to see Christian Bale humiliate himself in such a sleazy and zanny role such that.By the way, the idea of using the children in this movies as an army was also a cheap attraction scheme Tails Waititi thought of, mainly to gain more profit from really nothing!For anyone who is a true MCEU fan, and hasn't seen this crap, please ignore it!

title: Painfully Average
text: Ragnarok was one of the funniest MCU movies, some would say it was the saving grace of the movie. The opposite is true with Love and Thunder. Not a single joke landed, not due to poor chemistry or delivery, but a feeling of forcefulness ruins each joke. It feels like Waititi heard the praises of his last movie and decided to run with that and that only. It doesn't work with this story. Balancing screaming goats with a lead who is dying of cancer is not a good idea. The greatest compliment to this movie I can give is Bale's performance as Gorr. Bale is terrifying, entrancing, and unhinged all at the same time. This greatness from Bale almost is a detriment to the rest of the film, as the tonal clash between the different plots is genuinely distracting. Nothing was more disappointing than Russel Crowe's character Zeus. I was stoked to see what angle they'd take with Zeus. Instead he's just a minor inconvenience on the way to Thor's inevitable victory. Hemsworth and Portman's chemistry is better than it was in any other Thor film, but that isn't saying much. The actors are giving it their all, and I don't blame them in the slightest for the outcome of the film. Instead I blame the 'comedy' writers who overkilled their roll in the writing process.

title: Silly thor
text: What a mess great cast, to much so called comedy story must have made a few of the cast cringe if they knew where they were in the relevance of the film taika ragnarok great this one poor was so looking to it ?.

title: Marvel's getting out of line
text: Thor: Love and Thunder could've been better or at least good if they had a better writing department. It just felt like a parody movie of Thor.When you introduce Gorr, the God butcher, we expect huge violence and some amazing fight scenes between gods. But there was no character development at all. Not much screen time for Gorr, don't even know how Jane got the Cancer, no chemistry between Thor and Jane. Even the serious situations, they made fun.It felt like there's a rush in the movie, without any emotions and character development. We need real emotions between characters, not between the hammer and axe. Bale was literally wasted.Very Disappointed with this.

title: I never laughed
text: Sex, screaming goats, joke, someone dies, repeat. That's the entire movie. What is going on with marvel? Christian Bale was the only good part of this movie. I watched this because my friends were trying to convince me to watch all the shows and movies because they all have there own "purpose" and to take them for what they are. Animations are really cool in this movie but every joke and goat scream made me want to turn it off. I genuinely felt like I was forcing myself to finish the film. I feel like they're condensing all these characters to the bare minimum just to keep the content machine rolling. I've been Marveled out for a while now and it just keeps getting harder to watch the next thing with everything I force upon myself. I really hope Black Panther lives up to the hype.

title: Way too much comedy!
text: I had no problem with the comedy in the beginning but when it took away from the seriousness of the film and villain, it went all downhill. This Gorr was nothing like the comic book version who was ruthless and unforgiving. They should've made him as ruthless as Thanos in Endgame. It's really a shame since Bale is a great actor and they weakened this character bad.

title: Marvel and Disney should be ashamed...
text: This garbage pale of a Saturday Night Live parody is easily the most ridiculous scramble of bad comedic timing, horrible dialogue, and piss-poor CGI that the MCU has ever released. Literally from the first 5 minutes I wanted to walk out of the theater. I gave it an hour and it didn't get better. Save your money, pretend this film doesn't exist.

title: Disappointing
text: When it is Thor, the expectations are high. But the movie doesn't even offer average entertainment. It is boring to the core. There is no story and no acting. I can only appreciate Christian Bale'e performance. Being an Avenger and a Thor fan, this comes out as a huge disappointment to me. I wish makers understand that series of bad films like Spider-man Far From Home and Thor Love and Thunder will bring down the reputation of the franchise.Please invest some time in building a quality story and an interesting screenplay. I am hoping the next movie in Thor series will be amazing. All the best!

title: Thor's love & thunder review
text: Did you ever get stuck on the cloverleaf thinking how do I get off this thing? Then you do exit eventually. Only to find yourself going the wrong direction. Welcome to the latest Thor. It had all the potential of any film to succeed. Major studios backing strong leading man, an Oscar award winning leading lady a returning cast with new stars for marvel to introduce for upcoming films. Then the details a script with a plot.... And that's where we can't get off the cloverleaf. It's a mess. What was I watching? Pick a genre sci/fi, action, horror, comedy, drama. Which plot lines they trying to tie down its a mess. At times it just felt like a long Molly Hatchet video a big riff and case of heart burn. While trying to find any exit.For the positives, the actors and effects saved an sci/fi multi genre action film. The classic rock music soundtrack eases the ride.Oh there's an exit.

title: Unbelievably bad!!!!!
text: I'm being generous by rating this a 2 because it sucked so badddddddddd!!! As some of the other reviewers have said, Christian Bale did an awesome job but the rest of them ughhhhh!!!! The jokes were dry as a potato chip and I wanted to turn the movie off and stop watching because it was just that bad!!!! I never cared for Natalie Portman and her acting anyway therefore to see her playing the role as the new Thor was ridiculously stupid!!! I'm so thankful that I didn't pay any money to see this movie or else I'd really be upset!!! I feel like I've been cheated out of my time for even watching this nonsense!!!! The first Thor movie was the best, no more movies should have been made after that!!!!

title: The ONLY reason rated this high is because...
text: Chris Hemsworth is good looking.The plot is lame. The characters are weak. The dialogue is pathetic. If it wasn't for the action and CGI, it wouldn't be worth the $3.99 to rent. Not sure it would be worth free streaming for anyone not hard up for something after having watched everything else on offer.If you turn off the audio, it's a better movie. The visuals are good. But the emasculation on Thor just continues Disney's slide into obscurity.Other than The Hulk, I really enjoyed the Marvel Universe right up until Captain America Civil War. Then good until Black Panther. Avenger's End Game sucked. With Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness, Black Panther: Wakanda Forever and Eternals, the franchise is dead.

title: Needs More Overall.
text:
It was ok. It was about on par for what I would expect from a Marvel Movie:-Excellently Choreographed Action/Fight Sequences
-Good/Decent CGI
-Decent ActingSome of the things I thought were wrong with this movie are the same things I think are wrong with the current track of Phase 4:-Too many one-liner jokes/quips at once. Comic relief has always been a hallmark of MCU films, especially the newer ones, but it seems that there are too many jokes at once that you don't have a chance to laugh or even chuckle. It's also not comic relief if you add the same kind of jokes in almost every sequence of every scene. Not many of them landed because they kept trying to be funny with the script instead of putting jokes in at natural cues. It takes away from the actual story or drama that is seriously needed in this movie by adding quips or jokes in every minute.-No Direction to the Overall Plot or Overarching Saga. I didn't have a chance to see the mid or after-credits scenes so I can't even spoil anything here, but from what I heard the mid and after-credits scenes don't add to an overarching plot, which is what they are usually meant for (unless it was a reference to a joke mentioned during the movie). The story itself seems to be stand alone and most conflicts are resolved at the end of the movie. That seems to be the case with the previous movies as well (Multiverse of Madness and Spiderman: No Way Home) and by extension the entirety of Phase 4. There's nothing to look forward to or keep the audience engaged in these stories. Shang-Chi did a stand-alone story, but did it right because we got introduced to new characters that need a stand-alone story, and it connected it to the post-Infinity War Avengers in a mid-credits scene, meaning that there was still something to look forward to. The thrill of crossover characters and the multiverse is gone now; the audience got all of that during the Infinity Saga and are now looking for a new engaging story or plot in which characters from several different movies meet up and fight the big bad. There doesn't seem to be a big-bad yet and there seems to be this awkwardness where Kevin Feige is still experimenting with plot lines while he focuses on "expanding the multiverse" without a direction in mind. I hope we get more direction in future films; otherwise more and more people won't be motivated to see more of these films. It just seems like there's more cash-grabbing than actually setting up a real story with passion like the Infinity Saga did.-Christian Bale plays another crappy forgettable villain who has a sword that can "kill gods" (a lazy plot device)-Thor's appeal continues to wane. I've loved Thor as a character for a long time now. He's generally regarded to be one of the most powerful characters. But like the state of Phase 4, his character seems to have lost direction as well (that part was even mentioned by Star-Lord earlier on during the movie). The writers also seem to want to make him into a walking punchline in every scene. They got him to lose weight, but all of the other vulnerabilities such as the romantic/physical insecurity of a 13 year old or the constant jokes that don't land are still there. I don't like seeing Thor in this constant insecure state. I hope Chris Hemsworth's contract doesn't expire, or else this would've been a disappointing conclusion to Thor's character.-Jane Foster was reintroduced just because. I was actually looking for some re-introduction to Thor and Jane's relationship. Many of us were wondering why we haven't seen Jane in theaters for almost 10 years (since Thor: The Dark World). I now know why. Her character is boring, pointless, & why the 1st two Thor films didn't excite me. I felt for her in this movie only because of why she becomes she-Thor for a little bit, but that's about it. I could watch another 30 MCU films without Jane Foster in them and be completely content.Overall, it's about what standard MCU fare is these days. Pay money to see it in theaters or don't. You'll get the same result when it's available to stream.

title: Bad acting, bad storyðŸ˜³
text: In my opinion, "Thor: Love and Thunder" is a movie that fails to live up to the high standards set by its predecessors. The pacing of the movie is uneven, with the plot feeling rushed and disjointed. The special effects are lackluster and unconvincing, with the use of green screen technology being particularly distracting. The humor in the movie is forced and often falls flat, detracting from the emotional impact of the story. The performances of the star-studded cast are wasted on a poorly written script that fails to deliver a compelling narrative.Overall, I would not recommend "Thor: Love and Thunder" to fans of the Marvel Cinematic Universe. The movie is a disappointing addition to the Thor series and fails to deliver on the promise of its star-studded cast.

title: Not the promised party
text: I guess everyone was expecting it would be a party of the year. But, it was not. The movie is more drama than action. Marvel introduced new characters and instantly killed them.The movie is getting out of logic. For exampe, Jane Foster is a science person, writes books about the time and space. Yet, the movie is about magic. Also, the atheism is kind of promoted in some way.It is getting a tendency of kids' movie.

title: Trying to harf to be funny
text: Allthough the acting by Bale, Portman and even Hemsworth is good. The movie itself is to full of ridiculous jokes and seems to rush through the rest of the movie.The serious tones can't be taken serious because of this. Since you will just skip from lame joke to lame joke.It was a grand movie with lots of things happening, but I think I might even prefer the dark world over this.

title: Unsure of Itself
text: 3 of my top 10 favourite actors wasted except for Christian Bale who I recognized from his teeth. My expectations were high. Glossing over Jane's story and making it OK for kids with too many kids in the film killed it for me. I suppose it was a win for parents. Russell Crowe WTH was that cameo for by the way? Ugh. It could have been a cartoon instead. As a movie it missed the mark. Too much comedy and a ridiculous ending as well. Sif was in it long enough to get her arm cut off but only got seconds of screen time. So Thor is for kids under the age of 9 now? Did you people forget who pays for the tickets?

title: Well...Thor has objectophilia. Who would know?
text: For those unaware of this perfectly "normal" mental condition, Thor is in love with his axe, and are afraid his axe is jealous of MjÃ¸lner, his ex. To complicate matters, MjÃ¸lner is no swinging by our old BRILLIANT scientist Jane Foster (Nat Portman with big abs), who NOW is The Might Thor. Why, you say? Well, sadly she has 4th stage termal cancer, but visiting TÃ¸nsberg, were Ã…sgÃ¥rd now is run by King (WHY not Queen??) Valkyrie, she spots the pieces of ol' MjÃ¸lner, and gets to be Thor. We will never know why. And Thor still loves the NEW Mighty Thor. So this is a love...triangle? Or something.Over to storytime? It's about a godkiller, cause a guy was upset with his God for destroying his family, so he found a sword called Kronos (That's actually the name of the God of War, which is pretty ironic), and starts killing Gods. All soon to the jam of several old hits from Guns N'Roses.In my "review" of Thor I mocked the story, talking about how stupid it would be if they got Greek mythology into MCU. BUT look no forther, cause, Thor, Mighty Thor Jane Foster, Korg AND Valkyrie travells to...someplace, and meets the mighty Zeus (fat Russell Crowe)....who is kind of a dick. But that part I liked, cause it's pure comedy. Specially the nice ladies around Zeus fainting when they see Thor's mighty....penis. That's F-U-N. Zeus lightning thingy looked btw incredible stupid, but hey, it's a cartoon movie.So, what did I think of Thor: Blood and Thunder? Oh, not Blood, but Love. It was ok'ish. Compared to the multiverse mess in other movies in stage 5 or whatever, it's a little funride, although director Taika Waititi really has to be hold in strains to keep from comedy which isnt so funny. Oh, we are going for a Guns N'Roses theme, so Heimdall's son wants to be called Axl, the biggest idiot of all vocalists.The movie doesnt do anything really to push the so-called MCU envelope any further. It's action in space, with comedy. I didn't shed a tear when someone "important" died, just whatever. BUT the most stupid thing comes in the end credits, when we get exposed to a new "villain". Yes, Thor will get hunted by Hercules, Zeus son. And he looked redicilous.

text:

Most terrible move of marvel ever , stupid humor. I love marvel but where did this go wrong. Its Thor is back being a child. title: Cringe
text: As a huge fan of Marvel movies I was super disappointed with this movie. I was expecting another Ragnarok but this time, it was not up to the hype. At. All.I was super cringe and the Zeus scenes were not funny at all. Plus is this supposed to be a comedy? I am super confused.I also did not like the post-credit scene. Seriously, wtf with that Hercules? Enough with Taika Waititi Marvel movies.I like Marvel, Natalie Portman and Chris Hemsworth so only for them I am giving this a 4 instead of a 3 or a 2.
