title: Generic story, half-baked character development, use of great music to fill in the gaps, uncreative comedy and a slight intent to stop being family movies
text:
The movie started well with the introduction of the villain, the current state of Thor and some funny jokes but in its development the moments that should take seriousness for the characters' lives were not correctly executed so we did not take care of them.A Movie
There is a difference between being funny and trying to be funny, in Ragnarok they managed to be funny and maintain interest in the story but in Love and Thunder the comedy seems far-fetched and the story loses a lot of prominence.The moments
You can see the use of epic Rock songs to try to compensate but the only thing I perceived was some smear and scenes that sounded epic while the movie made fun of itself, it actually felt like a parody and a generic product.The hero
I also understand that Thor is a good formula for a fun character but they made him a dumb character and also weaker for script convenience.I remember many moments in other Marvel movies but this movie is perfectly forgettable, the only states I was in were laughing, lost and uncomfortable. The character deserves more and the audience deserves a better story.

title: Good core idea, but the way it's done....
text:
Well.... Idea of God killer could work very well. But why did they make a joke (not funny joke) out of this movie?? All these gender highlights everywhere... Why you just can't make a serious story line? It's like a "scary movie"... said enough...
I sincerely hope it won't be similar next time as a lot of audiences may just lose interest...
It might be good for kids, but I wouldn't show it to mine. All the Gods were messed up. What have you done to Zeus?I have a hope, but seeing what's going on Netflix etc. There is no light in the end of the tunnel....
Christian Bale did what he always does a great acting. . The rest big disappointment...

title: Pretty Bad Movie
text:
Rating: 5.0
Overall, a movie that is poorly executed and cannot be saved with Thor's charm as it tries too hard to be funny with its meta jokes and constant volume of jokes (even when it mostly does not work) as this takes away from actually building a storyline that should really be developed, the relationship between Thor and Jane and how Thor comes to terms with being at the end of his character arc.Bad Direction (Really tries too hard to be funny and really is chaotic with trying to progress the story forward), Acting (Very Good from Chris Hemsworth (Really shows the experience he has with the character and effortlessly is able to command every scene he is in), Very Good from Christian Bale (Really shows the level of dedication he goes through as an actor as he is very captivating even in this villainous role), Pretty Good from Tessa Thompson (A good comedic relief that is menacing this time around and picks up where she left off from the previous film), Decent to Pretty Good from Taika Waititi (Plays the comedic relief character and has his ups and down given the script he wrote), Pretty bad from Russell Crowe (Really was not that convincing as Zeus as his acting was not there and his accent really did not sit right (which is surprising because this role was really written for him)), Decent to Pretty Good from Natalie Portman (Tries a bit too hard in this performance and really falters when it comes to the emotional side of the character (something that is surprising to me given her experience)), Very Good from Matt Damon (It was really funny how he is able to carry on his cameo from the previous movie and have such a small role even though how big he is), Pretty Bad to Decent from the rest of the cast (though Good from the Guardians of the Galaxy (really just stayed on brand for their characters given how short of screen time they had))), Pretty Bad Story (The overarching story was not that bad as it deals with Thor post Avengers as he is trying to come to terms with unfinished love, it is just not that well structured and the ending really is not that good; plus the general breaks from the narrative were really sloppy and not well executed (given that it was amateur style and it really was not that funny); also, for a movie that is meant to be about Thor and Jane's relationship it does a real bad job in helping develop it (we are kinda just thrown into what happens)), Pretty Bad Screenplay (The movie tries way too hard to be funny and because of it only 1/3 jokes really hit in the movie, plus most of the lines are really predictable and bland), Pretty Good Score/Soundtrack (though it is really annoying how much they play Sweet Child o' Mine throughout the movie), Good Cinematography, Decent Sound, Pretty Good Editing, Very Bad Visual Effects (Given the budget for the movie it is really alarming how unfinished and cartoonish it looks, it looks like they did not spend any effort to change this up before the release), Good Costumes (Did a good job in the Asgardian armor), Plot Structure was a real mess as the movie tries to follow a simplistic Marvel structure but tries to be quirky with it with different breaks and changes that it really hurts with the execution; also the rising action in the character arcs was really poorly done and the resolution really is thrown at the audience and the ending really takes away at what it was trying to build, Pacing was incredibly fast (and this is from the short runtime; the movie could have really benefited from 20-30 minutes added to help with developing and building character relationships), Build to climax was fine and pretty typical of Marvel; climax was incredible formulaic and predictable to any Marvel movie, Tone was pretty 80s and i think he did a good job in helping build this (but is too meta at times with how it is like this)

title: Decent film not terrible not great
text: Had an amazing villain amazing actor FOR that villain and completely missed the mark for nothing shorter than a comedy show complete average movie nothing special missed the mark on lady thor definitely an average marvel film.

title: What a waste
text: So...the movie started off quite nicely but one could see right off the bat that cgi in this one is sub par compared to previous Thor movies. However the guns n roses soundtrack kick ...all it should :)We then get taken to Jane Foster story which has huge potential and is a main drive of the movie. In fact, it never gets exploited enough due to various pointless subplots, such as the one with Asgard kids...Mad Max 3 anyone? Such a miss from the writers.Now, along with bad cgi and the general feel of a kids movie, we got a very bad looking costumes. At times Thor looks as if in an SNL sketch. The green screens were awful too, so one could conclude that the post production was rushed.Overall started well, with second act being okay and third one being super bad. I sure hope they bring back the bad ass Thor in future films.

title: Bro this movie was aids
text: I can remember when the mcu first began and our heroes were these epic brute badasses. Watching this movie I couldn't take a single character seriously (aside from Gorr who actually had a great performance). A movie CAN be too funny. I was more than disappointed. Come on Marvel you're beatin a dead horse...a really really dead horse.

title: What a complete waste of time!
text: Hands down Chris Hemsworth is the best person to play Thor. However, the last two movies weren't so good. Not because of the acting but because the writers/director/producer have changed for the worse. This film has completely made Thor look stupid/whimpish. The writing is horrible! They need to bring the originals writers back from the first film. No more directing from Taika Cohen (aka - Taika Waititi). Why does Natalie Portman call her self Mighty Thor? Why does she call herself Thor at all? There is only one Thor and its Chris Hemsworth. It really is too bad as this Thor in this movie is nothing like the comic books. Message to Chris Hemsworth if the following writers (Taika Waititi and Jennifer Kaytin Robinson) are back to write Thor 5 please tell Marvel/Disney you want either new writers or the orginal writers (Ashley Miller, Zack Stentz and Don Payne) from the first film. The first film was creatively done.

title: Nothing To Love in this Thunderous Mess
text:
Just walked out a screening and am still trying to process what I just saw. I struggled with Thor: Ragnarok and watched it a few times, without feeling much better about it. This is much worse...So, no spoilers, just my opinion:
1. Thor is not a comedian and this film is so stuffed full of one-liners that it becomes a distraction
2. Russell Crowe's accent would be more acceptable at a fruit and veg market, not as Zeus, king of the Gods
3. The script is a mess and it feels like there was no one to pull the writers, producers, and director into line
4. I am now so over Chris Hemsworth and really wish Thor had died in this movie. His muscles keep getting bigger (so boring) and he hams up his role with the same set pieces we've seen in 3 previous movies (even more boring)
5. The constant narration is irritating - talk about a narcissistic piece of film-making! Korg is as welcome as Jar Jar Binks - yeah, I said it!6. Since Stan Lee died it seems Marvel is slowly but surely going downhill. Thor is a parody of himself and it's no surprise that we once again see Matt Damon and a lesser Hemsworth acting out Thor stories. Give me a break!!7. Watch the credits and it looks like the entire Hemsworth clan and their mates were invited to this party... they certainly had more fun than I did watching this crap.

title: This MCU thing is getting really old
text: Thor will be back. I can't say that I'm excited. I also can't say that this will be in another Thor movie, because in the MCU universe it doesn't matter who's name carries the movie, as long as they appeared in any marvel comic everyone's welcome whether it makes sense or not. This leads to a messy storyline and many stars standing in front of a green key. I have to admit, the Omnipotence City looked absolutely stunning, but I would have been much happier watching a good scenario. Every recent MCU movie seems alike. Lots of stars, heroes, CGI, yet another apocalyptic threat, a more interesting mid part before the final fight, credits, a teaser for a future marvel spoof, more credits and a final scene. This has become a total drag. On the plus side : 3 funny scenes and a good villain.

title: Even Godly butts of Thor couldn't save this film
text: I did not expect much going into this but hoped for some nice jokes. I loved what Taika did in Jojo Rabbit. Sadly, there were mostly bad jokes this time. Loved Thor doing a Harry Potter and an Ajay Devgn (guess TW sees a lot of memes) - it promised to be funny with these few good moments in the beginning.But it got painfully one-dimensional, so much so that everything was a comedy, which doesn't even make you laugh. Only Bale is able to spur some kind of emotion in the film, and he is rushed through, and Gorr as a character was quite paper-thin. Needed more work on him.Love and Thunder has nothing for which you'll remember it, save for Guns N' Roses.Glad I didn't waste my money watching it at the cinemaAnd was that Matt Damon playing Loki? WHY?

title: A mockery of fans
text: One of the most overhyped movies of the year, by one of the most overhyped director and company, with one of the most overhyped cast, and yet it turns out to be an empty film. The entire storyline is irrelevant to Thor's character development, Jane is literally just shoehorned in, Gorr's character is wasted, and the side characters are....just irrelevant again. This movie is the answer to the question - What happens when you combine the worst selling series (The Mighty Thor) and the best selling series (Gorr The God Butcher) of a fan favorite character? The answer is that it turns sour. Gorr, who was supposed to be scary, is reduced to a mere kidnapper, and somehow feels way worse than the comic counterpart. The jokes rarely land, and they just keep on disrupting the movie, which itself wasn't enjoyable in the first place. Let's just hope that Marvel learns from their mistake.

title: Not an ounce of originality
text: Why am I watching Thor Love and Thunder. I'm not watching it because I like Thor, god no! I mean he is a fine character I guess. I don't even remember if I liked the previous movie. I think I did. It was the one with Hulk and Jeff Goldblum, or no wasn't there something in between? Did I ever see the Dark World, or was it called the Dark Elf, I won't look it up, that is how much I care. It's possible I saw that movie. Anyway that is all a blurr. Thor is fine, Chris Hemsworth is ok. Don't love him, don't hate him. Again, can't remember if I've seen him in something else? I do remember the all-female Ghostbusters remake but not much else. He is kinda been only Thor. So yeah, I don't know why I'm watching this film.Does anyone care about the MCU anymore? I mean seriously, is it still sold as the mix of multiple different genres and storyline into one big showdown? That sound awfully like a 2010s thing. For the first Avengers movie it was fun I guess, but by the time they are fighting Thanos the amount of footage you have to consume just get up to speed is too much. Feel like you have to do homework to understand who is who and doing what. And the first thing you feel when you watch any of the latest Marvel films is that you're again watching something set up the back story for another upcoming movie which will set up the stage for another movie and so on. The MCU has become the film equivalent of a requiring reading list at the start of the semester, only it never ends. Like a perpetual wheel of sub-par movies.There, the movie is sub-par. There is nothing else to add. The story is generic, the plot is predictable, and the dialogue is atrocious. The film gives the villain a very valid motivation. He is the gods slayer The "gods" in this film are horrible. And they're not gods mind you, they're not deities, they're just another type of overpowered super-being. In this "universe" a god is not a being that creates life or punishes evil, they're merely beings that seek very basic pleasures. I'm going to stop here; this is already giving it more thought than anybody that worked on this film. That is why this movie is so bad, because it is not interested in what it means (unlike Guardians of the Galaxy vol.2 for instance, although it wasn't Nietsche either). It isn't interested in what anything means, it is only interested in rehashing things over and over. Just to keep the wheel spinning while we're waiting for the next one.

title: Of For the Days of Phase 1
text: Pros: Beautifully shot film Good FX. Nice cameos from the GotG. The kids (to not spoil) were a riot near the end. Great use of GnR tunes. Absolutely mouthwatering pit shot from Tessa Thompson (too bad not the same from Portman....remember Black Swan?).Cons: Plot was so so. Too many jokes for its own good. The goats scream was funny the first couple of times. 500 times later it was just bad. Thor is a male bimbo. Underused Bale. Crowe can't find a gym or sound Greek.I hope the next film is better. It feels like Marvel shot their shot in Phase 1 - 3 and is just floundering now. I hope they can find their footing again soon. Just throwing out content isn't going to cut it in the long run. They need to focus rather than trying to give shows to every character, etc.

title: The Origins Of Old Thor 2011 Is Now Dead
text: Quite a terrible viewing experience with dollops of puerile comedy and unfunny jokes. What a far cry from a decade ago where Thor was seen as a more serious arrogant otherworldly being as depicted in the classic comics, to what we have today - a childish juvenile made in the very image of it's over the top overrated director who doesn't have a clue. Keep burning into your profits Disney, the world no longer watches like they did in droves before 2019.

title: Not the best movie
text: Was so looking forward to watching this movie as I am a huge Thor fan.The script and plot were awful. Christian Bale was supposed to be the god killer but he was weak and even I could have defeated him with a wooden spoon. Chris Hemsworth great performance as usual but did not like the new suit. He looked like a male Wonder Woman. Jane or Ms Thor was a great addition except they played the cancer card so much in the movie. So much I new more about the disease when I left the theatre. It was really off putting.The script was not the great and was really surprised Disney released this. Did they not test screen with the public first? I hope for a new Thor film but please change the writers.

title: Worst of the Thor movies
text: Absolute waste of time.Nothing made sense, random jokes and sexual references throughout.You don't feel any real loss for the antagonist cause theirs no background or heartache concerning the daughters death.He kills 1 god the entire movie on screen. Then references killing a few others.He shouldve bursted into the arena scene and started chopping heads. Instead Thor and them do more damage in killong zuez for his thunder bolt which they didnt need and somehow can travel like the biofrost.In short Gore isnt taken seriously or felt a real fear of death or loss. Everythings a joke, Thor is perfect and itll all be fine.And the Kids!? Why? No more child acters trying to make every movie family friendly.This shouldve been rated R and filled with blood and loss. Then Thors "love" would have some actual substance in defeating Gores hate and want of revenge.Worst part was Zeus's "accent". Half stereo type italian, half Australian.Taika needs to take a break and do some soul searching.

title: Very disappointing
text: The movie started with a very nice and attractive fight scenes, but after that it drastically fell. I felt there was no story, they just made it for the sake of making. There was no strong direction, no strong dialogues. It could have been a very fantastic one, but it was a very disappointing one. Even the short length (1 hr 59 mins) felt very long.The acting is decent, but it lacks in strong story and direction. The music is pretty bad. Overall, Thor: Love and Thunder is a boring and failed to touch the heart of the people like the previous movies. The look of Thor after Avengers: End Game is completely ruined. Please bring back the old one.

title: Unwatchable
text: OMG what was that ? Why is Marvel keep doing this, they are litterally destroying their characters. I tried really really hard to stay untill the end of the movie and it kept becoming more stupid and dull as the minutes passed.This failed in so many levels, story, script, CGI, characters, plot -- I mean it is litterally unwatchable unless you are 12 years old and I guess, after Disney acquired Marvel, this is their target group.There is no cinematography, no characters, no reason, only some unfunny lame jokes, the repeating Thor goofiness which seems out of character now, some bright colours and some lame CGI battle. They must have given Russel Crowe and Christian Bale a very fat paycheck in order to agree to participate in that monstrocity.

title: Hate and boredom
text: I liked just 3 things in this movie : the beginning with the Gardians of the Galaxy (1 point), the Guns (1 point) & the Roses (1 point).More seriously, I was quite excited by the first half hour, Thor and Starlord's team could have been a terrific movie. Too bad it ends too soon.Concerning the music, it is simply perfect. G'n'r most famous themes are incredibly used.And.... that's all. I almost slept during the second half of the movie, I was completely bored. I recognized Christian Bale only at the end. And to be honest, I think that his character is completely uninteresting and underused.

title: Hands down the best thing about this movie is Guns 'n' Roses!
text: The movie delivered far less than expected, it was just weak.Christian Bayle's character story was believable but, as hinted before, weakened by the overall story line.And I do hate the overuse of man to man a lovelines (out of several, what are the hammers'es sexes), one would have been enough but several- think the intended humor got very lost in the process.As said, Gun 'n' Roses all the way!Welcome back, Axl (and the rest of the gang)!

title: The only reason I watched this movie is Christian Bale
text:
Let me begin by saying that this was a terrible movie, with zombie actors, don't care about anything or to impress anyone, and feel bored and tired of consumed stories, I was barely able to watch it till the end, you are giving us more reasons not to go to movies and pay money
Christian Bale's performance was brilliant as always, the guy made took very little time on the screen, but shined like a diamond in swamp of terrible acting, plot and commercial crap, please end this disgusting era of terrible crap movies and start making some good movies like before. Stuffing a movie with famous names will not make it better.A good story and good acting will.Enough of this superheroes crap, make movies like the departed.Watching Christian Bale acting is a joy I would love to see more.

title: Don't bother
text: If you want a good film this isn't it. Weak story, superficially told. Comedy quite frankly is not funny, the screen was full but there wasn't any laughing going on. I wouldn't expect gratuitous sexism in this day and age. Although a 12A the story wasn't worthy of that rating. It is the biggest yawn I've had in a long time.

title: Marvel has turned into Comedy
text: This continues the comedic line of Thor: Ragnarok and moves the amount of comedy up even more. As a result, half of the movie now feels like a parody of itself.As a result, whenever the tone is serious, we can see the potential of what could have been a really good movie - and Christian Bale does an excellent job there. But the large amount of comedy injected into this movie makes the majority of this movie feel more like a children's story than an actual Marvel movie.Seeing similar amounts of ccomedy in recent series like WandaVision and Ms. Marvel gives me the feeling that soon the majority of Disney's Marvel movies will not be of interest to adults at all anymore... though the Moon Knight series gives me hope that adults may still get an occasional movie or series to enjoy.Unfortunately, this one isn't among them.

title: It's time to change
text: If it wasn't for Gorr and Bale performance this could've been way worse . This Film is another disappointment in the MCU after Endgame . For the first time ever The Marvel formula has killed an MCU Movie . Gorr is too freaking good to be in this movie . Bale gave us ( in my opinion ) the closest Villain to Thanos if not even better . But he can't be better because this movie didn't take anything seriously and it's in a bad way .If this movie was in a dark theme or at least took the serious stuff that has been going on in it without the bad ( yes very bad ) jokes from the scenes this movie could've been up there with Endgame , Infinity War , No way Home , Civil war & Winter soldier as the best Movies in The MCU .But unfortunately This Movie is down there With . Captain Marvel , Thor 2 as the worst movies in The MCUOne last thing . What the heck happened to the Badass Thor that was in infinity war . He's just a joke now ( Too idiot of a character ) it's too much.

title: It could be a better story
text: I thought this movie would be best work of Taika Waititi. But I am frustrated with such a weak plot and boring story. Didn't expect this after Thor Ragnarok. Everyone wishes the God butcher to be a awesome character. Christian Bale was awesome but its marvel's failure not to utilize such a strong actor. I believe he could do better in butchering god rather than kidnapping some poor children.

title: Good story, too slobbery
text: The background story is great! However, the actual implementation is too slobbery... ruins the whole thing. This is a child's movie, but it should have been a good comic movie!! 4 stars... unfortunately (I would very much like to give 10 stars)The background story is great! However, the actual implementation is too slobbery... ruins the whole thing. This is a child's movie, but it should have been a good comic movie!! 4 stars... unfortunately (I would very much like to give 10 stars)The background story is great! However, the actual implementation is too slobbery... ruins the whole thing. This is a child's movie, but it should have been a good comic movie!! 4 stars... unfortunately (I would very much like to give 10 stars)

title: How bad can a MCU movie get?
text: Thor: Love and Thunder. This is as bad as it gets. The only good thing about this movie is the CGI. Acting is poor. Story is poor. Directing is atrocious. And it is not funny. It is taking the mick out of itself and every other MCU film. Whoever thought the killing of Zeus should be played for laughs needs to have a good long hard look at themselves.I struggled to watch it and it took 4 sittings at I could only stand 30 minutes max of this poor attempt at a film. It looks really expensively made but what a waste of time and money.I do hope there are no plans for any further Thor movies as I want to get back to being enthralled by MCU movies. Can't wait for Black Panther II and out looks to be everything this movie is not.There should never be another Thor made by this director.

title: Surprised with director
text: Bale is playing great as usual. The actors are great but their characters and dialogs are awful. It feels like a movie nobody wanted to make, but they had to (especially the cast of the Guardians of the Galaxy, they did pretty much nothing...).Zeus is catastrophic, it has nothing to do with the comics version. Hopefully Hercules will do better.Too many cheap jokes are killing the jokes and the movie. The dialogs are like written by a 10 years old.The plot is pretty bad, while it had great potential (gods vs mortals, questions about worshipping, interaction with the Eternity being,...).Hammer and Stormbreaker being "jealous" and "emotional"... WTFIt does not feel like a Marvel movie, more like someone tripping on strong drugs.The ending is ridiculous, doesn't make me want to see Thor anymore in the MCU.They could have done a way better movie by taking the plot more seriously. It's a lost opportunity.I like the colorful visual design from the 80's though, but it feels better done in Ragnarok.

title: Terrible! Don't waste your money.
text: I just saw this movie and I can honestly say it was terrible!! The attempt at comedy was terrible. The villain was terrible. The storyline was terrible!!! I loved Thor Ragnarok but this was nothing like that movie. Find something else to watch!

title: MCU in a downward spiral
text: The MCU is just getting worse and worse. This latest installment is a wannabe drama come comedic mess. Waaaaaaaaay too many laboured attempts at humour that just fall flat. They devalue genuinely funny moments throughout the movie by constantly trying to make silly jokes every two seconds. There's a genuine heart felt drama sub plot throughout this movie that is completely ruined by these terrible half attempts at comedy. If you want to make a movie funny, just go ahead and do it. Don't try dip in and out of drama to comedy and back again. It just doesn't work.With movies like this, Shang Chi, Black Widow and the slate of terrible mini-series, the MCU is more filler than anything else nowadays. They're in serious jeporady of ruining the greatest movie franchise in history. I was once a die hard MCU fan. I'm not even arsed when the next movie or whatever is out now.

title: Disappointment
text: Childish comedy in a movie with sex jokes. The Director was given way too much credit for one good movie and of course fails to deliver in this one. The villain is so limited from the childish story, bad humor and little screen time, it almost feels irrelevant to the story, which is a shame since he is a great character, delivered brilliantly by Christian Bale. It feels like they tried to make a kids movie and market it towards adults, but failed at both ends. A big Disappointment as a sequel to a good movie.

title: Truly awful film
text: So disappointed. Think this kills off the Marvel franchise. No points in listing where this film failed. First time I've walked out of a movie in a long time. Thank god we had a bottle of wine in the cinema or we would have walked out in the first 20 mins.

title: Lazy Lazy Lazy
text: Thor has long been one of my favorite characters in the MCU...now they have turned into a moronic lug nut. This movie dragged on forever. The best part by far was the soundtrack with Guns N Roses. The storyline was boring. Good actors doing bad things. And my goodness Disney...can we have kid friendly shows that don't talk about orgies and sexuality. Nobody really cares and it adds nothing to the movie.

title: Thor: Love and Thunder is a beautiful movie, but it is cowardly when it comes to telling a good story.
text: The 4th Thor solo film and the 2nd directed by Taika Waititi are among us and the result is disappointing. The film has no personality, it doesn't reach its full potential, it ends up being a victim of itself.The film shows us the journey of Thor after the events of Endgame, in a search for self-knowledge alongside the Guardians, when a threat arises at the level of his death. But don't get involved, what you'll see will be a bland and meaningless comedy. Even though I'm a fan of Ta, I don't recognize her identity in this work, something is made of anyone without any explanation, as if it were a test session.The humor out of time, a rushed and terrible development. Lack of time, because 2 hours of duration doesn't help and ends up ruining the film even more. He's an climax and doesn't convey the emotion he needs, when he has to, he looks robotic and salty.Gorr is a villain and a bad explorer, even though his generic atheism is very well done, Bale delivering much more with his interpretation and his beautiful look, not even the villain is saved.Does Jane become a hero just by being dignified? Does she only get Thor's powers, as it is here by Odin in Thor 1, not her combat and strategic experience, does she learn from nothing? Looks like Mary Sue. Since when did Thor have Odin's enchantment? Why and how do guns have feelings?The soundtrack is good point, it gets boring and ends up becoming bad up to a point. It's all the time. It's a passing experience, if you don't film it and end up being forgettable food court, it doesn't even remember you right.Even though it has one of the best photographs and opening sequence in the MCU, it doesn't save itself.

title: COMED-EEISH!
text: I've read Thor comics. I've seen the current run on Gor and Thor (plus Loki) in the comics. I saw how powerful Gor was (is) and how difficult it was to keep him at bay.Therefore, it escapes my person as to why he has been made a laughing stock (including Thor, Valkaryie, and the Goats!).Phase 4 has to be the cringe of all cringe.Now for the non-emotional criticism.Hollywood needs to fight the need for gods to visit the therapist or experience human weaknesses. They are gods. Not flimsy humans. Have a little respect. Please ðŸ™

title: Mannnn
text: I really, really wanted to like this, as it's my favorite side series. Unfortunately, it's just not that great.Main Hemsworth looks great, and is as charismatic as always. Cameos are fun. Supporting cast is solid. Bale steals the show and is, as expected, best actor on screen.Writing, subpar.Themes, what?Cohesion, huh?Point, none.It has its nice moments, and it has its sweet moments, and it obviously has plenty of cgi action, but...It's a mess. No spoilers, it's a mindless fun watch, but it's now supplanted Captain Marvel as least fav of the marvel universe.It's just too much and too little at the same time. For me.

title: Astonishingly Average
text: Not enough here to hate. Not enough here to love. And definitely lacking any thunder.The first scene in act one showed promise and I actually was excited to see what was to come. Then came Thor. Again made to be a buffoon even though he is 1,000s of years old. As such, he would not be oblivious to the carnage caused as a result of his battles. He would have loved and lost hundreds of times and so Jane would not have been his 'first'. This is one of the points that illustrates that the story writing is weak. The fact that the reassembling of Mjolnir took place off screen just reinforces this point.To me the jokes were not as bad as others make them out to be but they were a distraction. The musical score was complete trash. It was an irritant and did nothing to enhance the mood of a particular scene. The scene which took place in the city of the gods truly does seem as if it were written by a 5 year old.The last scene just further solidified my dissatisfaction with the Marvel formula. A bunch of 'good guys' fights a bunch of generic foot soldiers and somewhere the main hero(es) will defeat the main villain. After so many 'Vanilla' 3rd acts Marvel should give the audience a taste of 'Rocky Road considering these Phase 4 movies have mostly been shyt.

title: Cancer
text: You can teleport to different planets, but can't cure cancer. Nice. Quite an empty movie, Thor will return again only to die in battle and finally meet one of the many loves of his life in Valhalla and be happily ever after. The bleating goats saved the movie.

title: average everywhere except for the villain. pretty average for a Thor movie.
text: As the movie dragged on, it starts to feel that the villain's performance is becoming too good/serious vs the rest of the movie. Towards to end, his face becomes more familiar.I'm not sure even if this worth it for kids, the fight scenes are boring, sometimes illogical, amateur, poorly made. Maybe a pass for a six year old?There are also some scenes/shots with terribly cheap distracting CGI.Nothing compelling in the story where one wants to be in this world or character's shoe. While there are some funny lines, it takes me out of the movie and feels like wathcing streaming or online video.The scenes with Zeus pretty much filler where nothing there makes sense or of importance.

title: A
text: What a waste of time.What comedown from the highs of Black Panther, Civil War, Avengers, etc.Even my 10-year-old daughter thought it was stupid, and she has been in love with Captain Marvel since she saw that movie.Thor acts stupid. He says stupid things. He says foolish things. Russel Crowe shows up and acts all silly. Huge tragedies occur, dangerous situations, and Thor speaks and reacts like a buffoon.Christian Bale is the one highlight of the movie. He takes his role seriously and his performance reflects the darkness that inhabits his character.Thor: Ragnarok may have been a fun ride, but Love and Thor takes its predecessor's fun nature and goes into an entirely stupid direction with no gravitas. Think how Batman Forever was followed by Batman and Robin. The MCU franchise may require more Thor movies, but if Thor was a standalone franchise, Love and Thunder would have been the franchise killer.Good on Robert Downey Jr., Chris Evans and Scarlett Johansson on getting out when they did.

title: Disappointed with no expectations
text:
CGI was hit and miss with a scene rendered at like 3fps.Story made 0 sense
Taika forgot what backstory he wrote for korg in his last film lol
It retconned almost everything about Thor's backstory.(new never seen op powers, his weapons have feelings? Etc etc)Villain was the most op villain you can imagine off screen. Gorr killed 1000+ gods in a span of a single war that Thor won, then struggles against Natalie PortpersonJokes are meant to be everywhere, but I can't remember a single time I found it funny.

title: Thor : Laugh and Try not to sleep (3.4)
text:
Yeah that's how I would discribe this movie.It's a comedy and nothing else.I'm a huge marvel fan btw and I was really really disapointed.The movie trys to be as funny and dramatical at same time as Thor Ragnarok and fails at both.The acting was weird, Chris Hemsworth and Nathalie portman had a great connection in the first 2 thor movies , but in this movie it didn't fit at all.The main reason I think that was like that is because Thor had this kind of vibe like "I am funny" out of the last movie which Jane or "mighty thor" didn't had and fact she wasn't even it the last thor movie and this made it so weird that Jane felt like she was complet out of place.It's like trying to make the Batman funny and the joker a character that is sad and "nice". Wouldn't really fit , would it?When we are talking about Batman we also can talk about Christian Bale as "Gorr".The character is.. ...lame and his backstory was way to short and unoriginal. We have seen a million times how the villian lost someone he loves , feels left out and want revenge. I mean like a sword said : "yeah kill all gods or nothing will happen" Marvel really a sword ?!?I don't understand why Taika said "Yeah I have createn the BEST marvel SUPER DUPER villian "
Taika is a great director I love him ,but this is not even close to beeing the best marvel villian.Christian bale's potential was wasted for that short amount of time he was in this movie and like I said previouslyhis role was just boring.Overall the movie is just trash ,the only thing I liked were the guardians of the galaxy ,but they were in the movie for like 5 minutes and that was it .

title: Painful watch even for a diehard Marvel fan
text: It's empty! What worked magic in Thor Ragnarok, feels like a spoof in Thor LnT. Only good acting was Christian Bale and the kid playing Axl...not enough to save the movie. It's the first time I have ever yawned while watching a movie in theater. A painful time to be a marvel fan.

title: A 2 hour promo skit...
text: This movie was a poorly paced bad joke... This is everything Ragnarok was right on the edge of being, all punch line with no set up. If this is acceptable as an MCU entry then Marvel has become everything it's critics have tried to make it out to be and lost the substance the fans knew it had...I dont know if this was mainly killed on the editing room floor as it feels like every scene has had the content edited out with simply the first line and punchline left in. I'm convinced Taika Waititi was forced to make this film, I hope so anyway because I can't stand the idea that this is film he wanted to make and is proud of...

title: Christian Bale 2 thumbs up.....
text: If it wasn't for Bale this movie would have been a total flop. I actually can't believe that I sat through that whole movie to almost cheer for the bad guy. If Gorr had of triumphed it would have made a better ending then the ditzy ass thor they created; im pretty sure Thor got stupider with ever movie. After watching this I'm convinced that the marvel universe has really died with ironman sooooooooo sad. The only thing that has been refreshing in this new stage of the marvel universe has been the show Moom Knight, at least it had something new to offer compared to all the other shows and movies that have followed End Game. I seriously hope that there isn't another Thor to follow that greek tragedy.

title: Not UP to marvels standerd
text:
Story was irritating at many places and looks like low budget movie in the beginning. Wasent like a Marvel movie gor Entrance was cheap nacrosward
was shown less powerfull then it is story is like hey lets Kill zeus it will be fun in just 30sec childrens may like it because they don't expect much just Show us thor talking and throwing strombreaker and who was that god of light who killed necrosward holder and killed by another sward holder in like 10sec , why do they Show gods so bad what script writing is this even zeus was afraid of gor really man he is supreem god show some respect that comedy was pale it continues in whole movie,no wow moment in whole movie they don't Show even a single god death properly,you will more relate with gir not thor,lack of exitement in whole movie not gutts in the movie nithing new overall its boring.

title: Pure cringe. The very first Marvel movie I had to fast-forward
text: Oh Lord. I could not bear watching the first 10 minutes so I had to fast-forward. Clowning the strong male superheroes so that there could be female replacements (similar to She-Hulk), almost every scene was an unfunny cringe, masculine women with suit pants, men wearing skirts (Zeus walking down the stairs like a ballerina) and with no sense of purpose. Disgusting. Clownish new MCU. I'm sure you remember the com-mie references in Doctor Strange 2 ("we go on red", "everything is free here"). Here, they used the god killing. Perhaps once the "gods" are dead, we are going to get some com-mie hero to look up to.

title: Butchered It
text: Very, very disappointed. Story was messy and didn't make much sense. Characters were one-dimensional. Too many jokes so you can't take any of it seriously, there's a joke every minute, and often the jokes really weren't that funny. Visuals lacked any subtlety, nuance, or sophistication - the colours were just too damned bright, my eyes hurt after about 10 minutes; it's like the film-makers only understand how to use primary colours. Also everything just looked cheap, bad, and plasticky. For example the 'armour' they wore just looked like the plastic toy viking/roman costume armour that you get from the Dollar Store. While these devices may have worked for Ragnarok, I just feel that they went too far this time, like they thought "oh, this worked on Ragnarok, let's crank it up to 11!" I guess the only saving grace is Christian Bale as Gorr, who is sadly and criminally under-used, which might actually be a good thing because the tone of his character really didn't fit in with the whole hokey-jokey tone of the movie. Overall, this was just a parody of a Thor movie.

title: Too Much And Too Little
text: In "Jojo Rabbit" Taika Waititi (who wrote the screenplay and directed) takes an epic real horror story (WWII and the Holocaust) and narrows it down into a dark comedy about a boy and a girl leavened by episodes of fantasy farce (Hitler and Jojo) which are generally tightly controlled.In "Thor: Love and Thunder" Taika Waititi (who did the story, co-wrote the screenplay, and directed) takes an epic fantasy story (Thor's quest for meaning and love in his efforts to save the universe), which he attempts to portray as a pure farce Viking saga (note the references to "Thor Odinsson" and the oral history narration done by Waititi) not tightly controlled and often not funny, leavened by episodes of pure darkness which are generally tightly controlled but often overdone and overlong (too much screaming and fighting), and mostly shot in real darkness (and part even in black and white) except for the first one in stark sunlight (pushing in our face how the darkness was created).In the farce he throws in cameos by big stars (Russell Crowe, Chris Pratt, Matt Damon, Melissa McCarthy, and others even more briefly) as if saying "Hey, look, this is a real Hollywood trivia inside joke."The primary actors (Chris Hemsworth, Natalie Portman, Tessa Thompson, and Christian Bale) do solid jobs; Bale is superb as the believer driven by the death of his daughter and finding the uncaring nature of those he worshipped to kill all the gods, Hemsworth, Portman, and Thompson gleefully overact and "wink, wink, nod, nod," while Hemsworth and Portman do a great job of switching to darkness and sadness when required.There are strong messages about friendship, love, and the meaning of life. But the result is unsatisfying because Waititi had too much control but didn't exercise it enough, unlike "Jojo Rabbit," where he had total control and managed it effectively.

title: A beautiful* parody of superhero movies
text: Well when I say beautiful, I'm not exaggerating. Can't believe they actually went to space to film this movie. The most immersive experience I've ever had at the teatres. Almost like I was travelling into the space myself.Now, on a serious note, this is a pretty bad movie. To describe it correctly: all of the thor movies have this theatrical bits in them. They are supposed to be a fun parody of the characters. It seems they decided to create the whole movie around this idea which is: thor love & thunder.1) Visuals: the visuals are pretty bad right from the begining. You can tell that they're using green screen in every scene even if you are not deliberately trying to look for it. Can't believe that the movie could look this bad given it's sky-high budget.2) Acting: Christian Bale is descent in the role, but his screentime is too short for being the main villain. Chris hemsworth has portrayed the character of Thor in a much better way in the previous few movies. In this movie, it seems like not too much interested in the role. Right from the beginning of the movie, you can pretty much tell from his face that he probably doesn't want to be there. Credit where it's due, he's in a very good shape. Rest of the cast is just fine.3) Screenplay & tone of the movie: probably the weakest point of the movie. Thor ragnarok was a good 3rd movie in the series, that pretty much saved the thor series & made thor one of the most popular character in the giant MCU family. Part of the reason was the good humor & making thor a badass of a character while still having a serious tone. This movie doubles down on the humor aspect but the quality of the humor has gone down so significantly. The movie seems like a parody of itself. Most of the jokes don't4) Narration of the movie is pretty bad. It's supposed to be over the top I guess. But it turned out to be pretty silly & cringe. I can't understand why they went forward with it.Overall, it not only is a bad movie, but also not entertaining even a little bit, to justify watching it just for fun. If you're a die-hard MCU fan, you could watch it once I guess. But even at that I hardly doubt if anyone would unironically want to rewatch it.

title: Should have been a Disney+ series
text: Too campy and just too over the top trying to be funny.Guardians of the Galaxy didn't even need to be in it, didn't contribute to the story.Only one god death seen in a movie about a god killer.Jane Foster story was made to bring some emotion but was lost in the goofiness.It was so bad, trying to figure out if WW1984, Howard the Duck or Thor (L&T) is worst Superhero movie of all time (though I haven't seen Morbius).

title: They Already Had Much More 'REFINED' Movies Before
text:
Just watched #ThorLoveAndThunder . The movie is all over the place. Natalie Portman has always been great actress, but her chemistry with Hemsworth is really bad. The dialogue is silly. The editing is choppy. It's a mess. The worst thing was "THE TOO MUCH HILARIOS"
It's down there with Captain Marvel, Eternals, Thor 2, Captain America and Black Widow as my least favourite Marvel movies.I really thought it had potential. I didn't mind Jane Foster wielding Mjolnir as much as I thought; it's explained well.But as the Marvel movies are progressing, you begin to question if there are stakes at all. What is there to lose? How do you define 'danger'? Anyone can do anything now and the rules we've been establishing for the past decade are now irrelevant. It's quite annoying.Also, that being said, the movie is still watchable. Marvel's worst movies are still worth watching; they're still fun. It's just they had much more 'refined' movies before.

title: Where are you going, Marvel?
text: There used to be a time when I went to see every new MCU movie on release date. I was excited about it, I was generally really into it all the way through, I was one of those staying every single time until the end of the credits just in case and calling a "boo" to those leaving earlier like "are they new to Marvel? You can't just leave yet, you don't know what's coming!"There was excitement. There was a plan. There was a goal. There was a Thanos slowly bulding himself in the background.I'm not sure where Marvel is going after Endgame. They keep talking about "we'll start seeing the new plan soon", but for now I see "meh" movies except maybe "Spider-Man: No Way Home". Then came "Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness", which was not that multiversal neither that crazy. It was just okay.And now we have Watiti leading a Thor story for the second time... And not as great this time.I don't know where Marvel is going with this, but as a standalone movie, I don't see its potential either. There's no drama even during the dramatic moments because they spent too much dialogue on the jokes, and most of them don't work. The Jane situation, the Mjolnir-Stormbreaker jealous mumbo jumbo... Even the other Gods, ironically specially Zeus, feel like a joke. How come Thor, Jane and Valkirie are the only three people in the entire universe giving a heck about a guy literally killing all the Gods and looking for a way to kill them all at once?The plot felt also... I don't know. Imagine your daughter dies, you go to your beloved god to ask him for mercy and to bring her back and he basically jokes at your face. You know there's an entity you can find that can give you one wish, whatever the heck you want. So what do you do? Instead of looking for It and ask for your daughter back, you decide that all gods in the world are the same, they all deserve to die, you'll kill them all and you'll take that One and Only Wish to ask for them to die at once.That also brings many questions that could shake the foundations of the whole Infinity saga. If there's this known entity that can grant you one wish, whatever in the world you want, why would Thanos spend so many years looking for the Infinity Stones instead of just finding Eternity and ask him to erase half the universe?Or, if the Asgardians know about this entity, why didn't Thor just go for it instead of all those five years of drama, all the time trip mumbo-jumbo, all the sacrifices made? If he was so desperate and self-destroyed about what happened with Thanos in Wakanda it feels a bit weird he didn't even thing about that possibility.I don't know. Bale was amazing as the God Butcher, even when his character ended up being such a generic I-want-my-vengeance-and-you-all-are-gonna-die villain. Thor-Jane was a nice thing to see, even when due to all the jokes and forced lines I wasn't able to feel the drama under her situation.What can I say? Right now I'm not quite sure "Thor: The Dark World" is the worst Thor movie.

title: less than ideal
text: After Ragnarok, I was really looking forward to this film. We waited long enough. But sadly this film was not to going to resurrect the franchise. Instead it buries it far into the ground. The film just indulges itself in its own reputation and glory, with a bunch of A-lister actors. Putting aside the tedious narrative that tries to be meaningful, the film simply lacks the level of humour of its predecessor. There's a lot of poor attempts at humour, almost bordering on juvenile. Ultimately, what really bothers me is the sheer budget that went into making this substandard film. Here's hoping big studios become more responsible with the quality of content they produce in the future.

title: Good for entertainment but overall a bad movie
text: I still do not get some jokes, the humor in this movie are just so bad and sometimes it made me become such a weirdo in the theatre that I couldn't laugh at it like other viewers.The CGI is... nearly okay? It didn't come up to my expectation to be honest.Besides aforementioned points , the movie is empty. It has been a week since I last watched it and I don't have any positive or striking memories from it. It's just good if you want a movie to hang out with friends, family, spend time with other people. Otherwise, seriously, it is such a bad movie in both visual and content for me.

title: Childish
text: They are killing the character with their stupid, childish lines.I mean i cant take Thor seriously with this is lack of seiousness.Thats why people didnt love ragnarok at first but they didnt learn anything from that.

title: From epic god hero to goofy depressed dude with lightnings
text: Thor movies used to be about saving the world in the most epic ways possible, but now the movie felt like I watched a parody of the originals. The entire movie is just a long joke and stupid memes. Thor, the character, not the actor, feels like an idiot. The actor did his best, it s not his fault that they decided he should be interpreting a goofy depressed Thor instead of an epic god hero. It s sad because the idea of the movie has much potential. Imagine a god killer fighting all the gods of the universe in the way marvel used to make movies.

title: It is a parady of a film called 'Thor love and thunder' that was never made - World creation 7/10 - Story 2/10 - Script 3/10 - Character Depth 2/10 - Coherence 4/10
text:
I respect Taika's art unfortunatley his style is not suited for Thor
When thor ragnarok took a different direction then the lore, as someone who does not enjoy casual comedy over the honesty of expressing the story, still I enjoyed it as it was a creative choice.But that was a well crafted film with solid story.For me ragnarok lacked the depth and the magic of Thor but the magnificence of multi colored world was a great addtion.With Sad heart I wish I did not have to write this as I trully admire Taika.This film is poorly carfted.Scenes does not flow.Top preference is on creating jokes that are intended to be unconventional.The action is monotonous and sadly becomes boring.Charector depth is lost as no origin story for new charector transformation.

title: Marvel movies have finally fallen
text: I don't wanna get too into it for anyone who hasn't seen it- this movie is empty.... Marvel movies now seem to have these characters play parody characters of themselves- they have severely dumbed them down and it's all a comedy/rom-com with little storytelling and lame plots.... Disney afraid of killing characters, and no personal growth... no drama, nothing screams "invest in me"..... it's a long way from where we had so much emotion in Marvel and their vision, especially phase 1. Marvel still makes grand movies that look and sound amazing.... But leaving Thor and shaking my head asking why... is a issue... the comedy could have made me laugh and feel organic and fun, if the movie itself wasn't such a cringy comedy from start to finish...

title: Bad, and not in a good way.
text: This film is a step backwards from all previous Thor films in every aspect. The story clutches at meaning like a thumbless raccoon gathering apples with his tail on fire. The subtext is typical, mindless and utterly predictable. Moo. The costumes were designed by a sideshow barker. The meaning was as clear as a heavy lead curtain and the wit as sharp as a bowling ball: it hurts actually -before- it hits your toe. Cinematog-- oh you mean CGI, yeah we have that. Camera angles? Well, they're kind of boxy with mostly square angles and a round thing at the end.The makeup artist probably needed Harry Potters cloak to get his work past the Peter principle that dominates the rest of the film.There is a difference between character and caricature, unfortunately the director missed it. Like the point, which he missed also. There is a fine line between vision and delusion, but director self-indulgence makes it all a thing of the past. Rejoice numbskulls, a new dawn arises.I gave this film 3 stars. One star entirely for the final after scene with Portman. One star for makeup (Portman and Bale) and one star for the trio (Hemsworth, Portman, and Bale) for the integrity of turning in their usual awesome performance despite riding this donkey cart of destruction strait into a ditch.I offer one additional star if this smoldering stack of stank shows the decency to skulk off to dropped and forgotten story lines where it belongs.

title: Thor: Jokes and Bad Writing
text: I didn't hate this movie but I didn't love it either. Things I liked: the soundtrack, Christian Bale as the god butcher, the action sequences (particularly on the black and white planet). Things I didn't like: moments that should have emotional weight being undercut by jokes that mostly fall flat, Tessa Thompson as Valkyrie has all the charisma of a door knob, killing a potentially significant character with little effort and no regard for consequences in a room full of people with the power to overwhelm our hero who for no explainable reason do nothing.The biggest problem I have with this movie however is less to do with the movie itself and more to do with the journey Thor has taken over the course of the MCU. The first three movies were about Thor learning to be a righteous king and a wise ruler. He learns self-sacrifice and putting the needs of his people first. He learned in Ragnorak that Asgard is a people, not a place, and he had to make the hard decision to sacrifice his home to preserve his people (and even an incredibly emotional moment like that was undercut by jokes). Infinity War provided Thor with a great challenge to the character development he had thus far and ideally his failure to kill Thanos should have made him a more bitter and hardened king, making his people an isolated and battle-hardened nation, prepared to take on another cosmic threat like Thanos, with Thor rediscovering his mantle as righteous king being his character development going forward. But instead, he got lazy, depressed, and fat, making one of the MCU's most tragic characters the brunt of a joke and this movie continues that awful trend. Thor is dumb and constantly outwitted by his counterparts. Everything is a joke and nothing is treated with the seriousness that it ought to be. Characters carry no development from past films and only act in ways that are convenient to carry the script forward. None of the threats carried any weight because the characters never took them seriously. When the movie is so lighthearted, how can the audience be anything but that? Despite some new responsibility late in the film, Thor is just the same as he was when the movie started and it's a shame they didn't use Gorr to his full potential to test Thor and develop his character further.Like I said, I don't hate this movie but it's taking Thor in the wrong direction. Could have been worse but could have been a lot better.

title: Another Let down. Bale outshines in unplanned mess of a movie.
text: Marvel put themselves in worse situation where they clearly have less resources than what they tried to produce after endgame.They didn't have enough great writers, good stunt coordinators and vfx artists to produce quality stuff in so little time.Which results phase 4 being worst among all.Couple of good shows and Shang chi were good. But all other things were average or worst.Thor love and thunder... has no clear path and fixed script or story with a goal.Because of many reasons it just cut 2 hours and tried to replicate Ragnarok. And maybe some in Marketing or production said that movie worked due to short run time and jokes, so make this one where every single scene has a joke in it. And finish editing upto 120 mins.Lot of stuff got cut, Vfx artists couldn't meet unrealistic deadlines and in the end we got mess of a joke.Story: This movie tries tell a story of God-Butcher, Story of Jane and Thor's love, what be get is nonsense plot.Acting: Christian Bale being a master of his craft plays his role perfactly, unfortunately a lot of stuff got cut, because he was way too serious actor to be part of this spoof of a Ragnarok movie.Thor is dumber than ever. Not much action and all cgi crap and non of fight sequence stands out.Gaurdian of galaxy are in it because of contract I guess. Again fake deaths.Tone: this movie suffers because it tried too hard to be a comedy movie. But felt like cheap sit-com of 90s. Overall whatever goodwill was earned untill Endgame is now completely ruined in this phase.Black widow, Eternals, Multiverse of madness and now Thor 4 are the weakest mcu movies in same order.I think Marvel brand doesn't have same value after Disney plus, some of their tv shows are even better than these movies.

title: Thor movies are 1-3. Amended.
text:
AMENDMENT: Out of sheer boredom and curiosity, I finally finished watching this. The last 20 minutes or so resonated with what made, again I say MADE, Marvel movies special. However, Marvel is dead. Make no mistake. I still stand by my initial review.INITIAL REVIEW: I'm not sure where to begin. I know where I'll end. Here. For Thor and Marvel Phase Clueless. Perhaps there is some master plan to make a...much like this movie, I cannot finish this sentence.Let's begin again. Taika got drunk on the success of Ragnarok and as happens forgot the moment of the...
If this review seems slapdash and incoherent, unenjoyable, you've already watched this movie.The chemistry between Hemsworth and Portman is non existent. Two boring movies should have proven that. To make matters worse, the script and story are rushed and muddled by the thought of horrible flashbacks that are not flashbacks and gratuitous mugging trying to convince the audience that the first two Thor movies resonated. They didn't. And the forced "humor" is like listening to a great joke that the teller cannot tell.Marvel, Waititi, Feigie...Stop before someone really gets hurt.It really was Ragnarok. You've destroyed Asgard.

title: straight up bad.
text: This is the most disappointing movie i've seen all year, it had Christian Bale on it, along with the cast from Ragnarok, WHAT HAPPENED?The cgi is bad, specifically the face scene, oh god that looks terriblethe concept of gods is interesting, however they are wasted, big time, Zeus could've been a good character, but the whole "infamous naked scene" is just TOO out-of-touch for me.Christian Bale kills it, but he has so little runtime, that he cannot save the movie from all of the bad jokes, to all of the bad action to some of the scenesI hated almost every single moment of it.THE STORY is so bloated i wanted to get out the theater that time.

title: Movie for Money
text: This Thor movie sucks bigtime. Made solely to make money. Waste of time and money. The story was not thought through. The outcome of the plot is very basic.I hope the movie was thought about first and not rushed.The comedy that is not fun, just plain blunt nonsense. The movie also falls short on emotional impact.In the scenes that should be sad did not feel sad at all.This is far from the previous Thor moviesJane is annoying as Fak. Natalie Portman was good, but sadly the dramatic elements of her character didn't pull on my heartstrings.On the other hand, there are some cool action scenes with her, even though it's strange how fully experienced she is in fighting with these powers despite how recent she got it.Overall the plot is dull and underdeveloped, plot holes all over and.

title: Jumped the Shark?
text: Starting to wonder if MCU has jumped the shark. Other than SpiderVerse, recent releases including this one are marginal, sorry. OK for the diehards, but no way does this bring in new fans.With any Thor flick you expect some humor/tongue in cheek--but too much here. The plot is razor thin with a very suspect ending, the intro of Zeus et al is a good idea but completely wasted! The thunderbolt looks like toy from Dollarama, and the portrayal of Zeus was pathetic.Why were the Guardians even in here, as towards the end clear opportunities to bring them back in were wasted.MCU seems to have lost the ability to weave stories together, too many movies (and endless Disney+ junk) with no common thread. MCU desperately needs a new villain (Galactus anyone?) to link movies together. Does anyone think it will be Hercules?Only good thing--goats were funny and so was Korg. I know this movie had a good weekend, but I went on the 11th and theater was 1/2 full at most.Marvel (well Disney) needs to shape up fast! I saw this in 3D and again, marginal quality at best and not needed.

title: The Villian We Deserved But Never Got
text: I am really disappointed. Taiki made Thor, Jane most importantly Gorr silly even with Christian Bale great performance. What a waste of talents and time. He even wasted a great talent Russell Crowe. He should never direct a movie ever again in Marvel and I hope never in DC. He had the perfect characters yet he ruined every single one of them. Gorr is strong, powerful and feared. He even enslaved Thor in the comics. I was really hope and expecting to see a great movie but I didn't. I would only recommend seeing it for Christian Bale's performance. Let's hope someone else continue Thor's journey specially with the what happened in the first post-credit scene.

title: Disappointed
text: Being a die hard fan of Marvel comics I'm totally disappointed with the storyline. Obviously too much extra comedy. C Bale's screen time is short by the perspective of gorr like villain.

title: Needs more Wolverine..
text: I had no expectations going go the movies last night. Perhaps that was a good thing.. This time there's not much holding up and here in terms of storyline and script. The acting is mixed and too filled up with comic relief. Though carried with tons of comedy from previous movies, here, it lacks the sharpness and funny spin to it, it's just often too silly.Mr Bale had the opportunity to portray a fantastic villain, still there wasn't much time added to the character that would carry through the film. A good performance but needs more depth in storyline & script to add more to the whole movie.Hemsworth does a solid performance, as always since he's grown to really own this character fully. But it gets too silly and too flat from time to time. What's needed here is the depth and darkness from for example Wolverine, where you truly got a new dimension to the character. If the route would've been more dark and emotional I think there's a chance this could've climbed a few steps. A dark thor and a darker bale could've really smacked it out the park.I hope they dare to darken Thor and give him more sadness, his character needs it and WE need a more emotional story from here one, enough with the silly humor.A mediocre movie at best! 5/10./Rob.

title: Rune King Thor just became a JOKE!!!
text: Worse Thor Movie EVER! Four films for character development totally wasted as a cringe joking THOR, when there should have been RKT introduce to MCU by now. Taika Waititi just didn't showed backside of Hemsworth, this was showing the butt for every marvel fan. Very disappointed and can say directors like Martin Scorsese was right all along.

title: Garbage!
text: Honestly, the worst piece of crap from Marvel and that's saying something considering everything since Endgame other than No Way Home. Marvel has become a joke beyond imagination. I am not even going to try and explain the storyline of this attempt at a movie because when you see crap, you know it's crap. No need to explain. Soap operas have better writing and acting. Confident Marvel has no hope to recover. Sad because they had an amazing approach that became stale. But instead of being true to the source material with writers/directors who are competent they have gone the route of taking their fans for granted and assuming any content is good content. Disrespectful and lazy.

title: Thor at the Roxbury
text: I didnt hate it, I didnt love it. I couldent figure out what this movie was trying to be, it went from insanely serious christian bale moments were amazing. To zeus talking about orgies, to kids getting super powers and fighting. At points I thought I was watching a night at the roxbury comedy, at points I thought I was watching a finding nemo kids movie and then they started talking about orgies.The zeus scene was so cringeworthy, I was so excited for the buildup of russel crow then they just completely fell flat.I think it was worth my time to see some big budget effects, but the plot was so thin. At no point did I feel the bad guy ever really had a chance, there was very little actual suspense.I love comedy in movies like this but I think they went from funny to stupid funny. Went full Zoolander on this movie, almsot expected Thor to do Magnum to save the world.

title: It was to silly
text: Yeah it was fun but the whole story of Jane having cancer really did feel boring and they could have done so much better than just saving a bunch of kids.

title: what can you say?
text:
This is what happens when you give a direct too much freedom :(I like Taika Waititi films, they were subtle, funny, but had more or less the right balance, ragnarock was a great fun movie, But this??It starts dumb, carrying on the childish gardians 'chemistry' for far too long, remeber bigger is better in hollywood.And worse than the forced unfunny 'comedy' it looks cheap, the first 20 or so minutes are really hard to sit through.Then things get a little better, we get to the core of the story, the stupid 'jokes' calm down and we're back to a Marvel film. But Taika Waititi just couldn't resist and we have more childish humor that just doesn't work, and thats basically the film, normal swimming along then stupid jokes to kill the flow. Its such a long way from how the original Thor films were.Some cameo's that are just annoying and stupid, and a lot of very good actors being totally wasted.I'd be pretty annoyed if I'd payed to see this at the cinema to be honest, at least it was 'free' on disney plus.I'm sure really young kids would find it amusing? Maybe??Its a clear sign that Marvel have totally lost their way, they have nothing to replace Ironman or the Avengers and you just don't really care what happens to the characters in this movie, The story doesn't really make a whole lot of sence especially when you think back to end game etc, hundreds of 'gods' just sitting around and not one of them got involved with taking out Thanos, an ultimate supreme being who anyone could have visited at anytime who would sort out the mess - but no one did etc etc so it really doesn't flow with the rest of the universe.Highs - Bale is excellent
lows - childish, cheap looking, story (or lack of)

title: No real storyline
text: Aside from a few laughs there's not much but an empt soulless movie that lacks to capture the imagination of its audience. Movie Director decided to take Thor a different route but failed miserably.

title: Thor: sloppy and bumpy
text: Christian Bale was great but the beginning of the movie set a more serious tone that didn't match the rest of the film. Our theater room was full, yet, there were only three times people actually laughed. I was bored for the first half of the film, especially with Taika Waititi's repeated narrations. When the joke about the dramatization of Thor and Loki showed up I looked at my wife, wondering why Ragnarok's scene had been recycled. I guess it proves the director ran out of ideas.The film got better after they meet Zeus but still, everything feels too easy and nothing is at stake. Without spoiling it, you know from the first minutes to lives and dies at the end. No mystery here. Finally, wasn't the hammer on one piece at the end of Endgame? What happened to the continuity of the MCU? I guess phase 4 is when everything goes down the drain.

title: come the f on marvel ...
text: She-hulk now this ?! Where are you going with this nonsense . You turned the mighty thor to a blah comedian. Zeus is a joke ?Yeah there's some who disagree with me but you can't hide the logic and all this unreasonable changes that just made us dissapointed.This is NOT thor not even close to what we saw , the actual thor who being through all loss and saddness . He is a god for f sake this isn't just a normal man talk with his ax . And the worst part is when you critisize this shows and movies they just lable you to just ignore the truth .Las part is rate : 2/10 just because of christian bale performance that just wasted by the whole movie and those bs jokes.

title: God awful Marvel
text: If your a Marvel fan avoid this absolute garbage . If your 10 year old kid you'll love it. Marvel studios it's time to stop I think there just in it for the revenue. Hemsworth should be ashamed of himself he's ruined the character, you've played him out please stop, Christian Bale should have his equity card burnt. The cancer storyline really no need for it. There's better classic Thor stores out there in the comics. I'd rather watch the Avengers Assemble cartoons on Disney+. At least the Guardians of the galaxy didn't stick around, to embarrassing for them to get involved in this rubbish. It great waiting for the next blockbuster from Marvel a few years back no I couldn't care less.

title: Hilariously Horrible, Dutifully Disappointing
text: Thor, the God of... wait, was he an Avenger or something?Anyway!Are you looking for a completely unrelated Marvel movie? Something that's exciting, and maybe a bit weird, with random homosexual characters that only appear in the background and at the end of the film? (Cowardice). This is the one for you!Not only does the storyline have 100% NO correlation with the previous Marvel movies, it's storyline is also complicated and feels disconnected. On its own, it's a goofy, semi-family-friendly movie, but relating back to all of the possible content from previous stories, disappointing. Someone described the movie as having been dreamt up by a bunch of middle school boys, which is accurate.

title: Letdown in a big way
text: Wasted performances from Christian bale and even Chris Henesworth. Seems all he did was bulk up for the role. Entire movies is a funny sequence and not in a good way.

title: Movie for 12 years olds
text: This movie was made for 12 years old's period. There is no way this movie was made for older adults. There are no stakes no intense scenes and a very very simple plot. Every scene is a comedy scene with an average punch line. No, I mean it. EVERY scene is comedy and when you try to make EVERY damn scene a funny one then no one is.They should at least advertise it as is. A family comedy with your friendly goofy superhero Thor.I feel that Taika Waititi played a prank on Chris Hemsworth. He had him bulked up and made himself literary a legit bodybuilder and when you see that physique you expect some intense scenes, showing how strong Thor is, making an argument for being the strongest avenger and instead, he just made him a goofy clumsy bodybuilder. What a waste...

title: The worst of the sÃ©rie
text: It seems like they're competing for the worst movie of the year. Acting wasn't great and excessive jokes stick to the old style Thor in the comic books!

title: As I was saying...
text: Yeah, the decline in MCU "quality" continues! (Disney gotta be proud).Just when you think couldn't get any worse, that writers/production must be deliberately degrading it; down it goes!Avengers Civil War used a no excuse plot hole just because someone wanted to use that story theme... to use no logic, but simply to create a whole main story, nay, universe on buildings get destroyed during a fight with Avengers fighting alien invasion... sign an accord... some even believe aliens should not have been so hostile, so as to fight other Avengers members (what?) just so can have a civil war theme movie by irrationally get them to do it (what?)Ah, then Universe degrades even more...
