title: The worst movie I've seen
text: I normally take IMDB reviews with a pinch of salt. 1 or 10 stars are rarely accurate however as the title states, this is the worst movie I've seen and therefore is completely deserving of a 1 star.I don't know what's happened with Marvel. I regularly lamented them for their excellent work bringing all the storylines together in Avengers whilst making entertaining solo movies. Yes there were a few dull movies however overall the stories were excellent with some great plots and character arcs.Thor's own arc was great. They took fun of his god like arrogance yet made him a serious person. A leader with integrity and a brain. I was interested to see where this would lead however this new movie is like a total spoof and completely destroys his character. The actors who play him on the stage within the movie are actually less of a caricature of Thor than Helmsworth.Straight from the off it feels like we're in a Monty Python movie with the back story to Cristian Bales antagonist. Natalie Portman is also a strange version of Jane that nowhere near matches up with her previous version.The story is just stupid, unexplained, unbelievable and without any feeling or jeopardy due to the farce of a script. The funniest parts were actually the bits we were supposed to feel sad at as it was just so ridiculous.I feel like I'm done with the Marvel movies now. I thought Strange 2 was along a similar vein but still a lot more engaging than this turkey.It feels like they are just taking the mickey now and throwing together whatever rubbish they can in the knowledge that fans will still go to watch it.The only good thing I can say is that whoever edited the trailers deserves a raise as they made me think I'd enjoy this movie. I didnt!

title: This film sucks
text: This film sucks. The characters are all wrong. I made it less than 40 minutes. It's like someone had a fever dream and tried to write a thor movie. Just awful. How dare they even call it a marvel movie. Really bad acting in this movie. I love most of the thor movies but not this one. I am really disappointed in the direction marvel has chosen to take as of late. The acting and story reminds me of the plays Loki has put on. No magic in this movie just total crap. I really hope they fire some people and get back to making great movies. They have tons and tons of great material from the comic books and they need to go back to it. I bet Stan Lee is rolling over in his grave.

title: ME'H TRIED TOO HARD ....4/10 ......!!!!
text: I did want to like this film because THOR : Ragnarok was i.m.o. The best of all the marvel films , but i was left wanting , this film even tho was amusing in parts the lack of good story let it down and just looked silly .....!!!!!

title: Not funny, not exciting, a solid Meh of a film.
text: When the funniest thing in your comedy is an inanimate object (ie., Thor's axe), your movie is in a lot of trouble.Only Christian Bale's performance (and his characters arc) kept this film interesting.If Disney is thinking of more Thor films like this, then don't. Just don't.

title: Pirates of Valhalla?
text: Why does King Valkryrie sound like Captain Jack Sparrow? I mean, the accent drops a lot but it's strongly pirates. This movie just can't find its pace. Slapstick? Sad story of vengeance? RomCom? It's all over the place.The only consistent message is that Thor is weak and has to be the butt of jokes. The dialog is atrocious. Reminds me of high school drama class. Not trying to make any spoilers, but Christian Bale is wasted on this movie.Where will they be taking marvel? All these new ideas and scripting is landing flat. All the most recent movies and streaming shows are totally formulaic. It's literally a plug and play just with different faces. Any message of empowerment is hypocritical.It's sad. We started with beautiful and inspiring characters. Characters that were flawed but filled with depth. Now we have more depth in a kitty pool.

title: Don't Expect High Hopes
text: Average Movie, not as good as previous Thor Movies. So don't expect, it to be extraordinary l, it's one time watch, Comedy too in this movie is not upto the Mark.

title: I wanted to love it...
text: After loving taikas take on thor: ragnorok I wanted to love this too. I just think he pushed it a bit too far. It became less super hero and more like a parody of the marvel franchise. They pushed the fat Thor story line in the avengers a bit and then way too ridiculous in this.

title: Pretty consistent with MCU.
text: A lot of people are saying "they destroyed Thor" and they are really, really mad... Almost like suggesting these Thor films were like The Godfather or some other real movies, with real writing and performances.Take it down a notch MCU fans, it's just a silly movie from a silly and superficial universe. Nobody ruined anything because there wasn't anything worth ruin on the first place.And don't get me wrong, please. I understand why a lot of people like these movies, I enjoy them too. I'm just saying these MCU fans need a reality check and to stop with the rants.These movies aren't cinema at its highest, and that's completely fine. So, please, stop being so annoying.I recommend the movie, it's funny and for the whole family.Plus, if you like Christian Bale, he delivers as always, what an amazing actor!!

title: Thor's average movie
text: The movie story is good but after every scene the humour is not good . Movie don't take the story and seriousness of story . Although a great movie to watch with family.

title: Swing and a miss
text: I've been a fan of the MCU since day one, and found Ragnarok to be a welcome addition and a refreshing tonal shift. However, as Hollywood does, following it's success they've just taken the comedy from that movie and absolutely saturated Love and Thunder with it.Throughout the movie, it stays in "comedy mode" and so anytime a more serious moment is needed it feels totally out of place, and Thor as a character has now just become a total characature of even the silliest moments in the previous movies he's appeared in.It's a shame and I really hope they can pull it back.

title: Terrible, nearly the worst film marvel have done
text:
The first thor was amazing, great epic presence, fight scenes were amplified by him being a bad ass.This film , however is a joke. They can't stop the cringe humour even for 2 minutes, constantly forced. It loses the epicness of thors fight scenes when you know he's a comedic joke. The CGI was questionable at times too.All they needed to do was keep thor serious and the other characters and add humour through the guardians. They don't need thor to be funny, they don't need to make Zeus (another great story of a god) a comedic jokeThis is like a film aimed at 10 year olds, it won't take much for DC to better marvel now. We just want thor to be bad ass and save everyone with great fight scenes and build ups that are not full of one line jokesEven the goats, they were a joke because they scream. Give it a rest its bloody painful to watchHonestly don't know whos writing the new
Marvel scripts but it's god awful.

title: One word : Beautiful.

The writer/director must have worked for free and had no brains to ruin this movie.Why all the bad lines? Why is Thor suddenly so stupid? I could go on and on, but why waste my time. Thor is now ruined forever.Disney get a grip and stop ruining films with your political correctness. It's just so so bad. The writer/director must have worked for free and had no brains to ruin this movie.Why all the bad lines? Why is Thor suddenly so stupid? title: No wonder why Robert Downey Jr left MCU
text: After Disney bought out MCU, strong scenario and strong acting have gone. I think producers in MCU tried very hard on creativity until MCU becomes side product of Disney. Instead of making better movies afterwards, producers of MCU settled on big pile of money and spoiled by it. Love and thunder & Madness of multiverse are disaster so far. Congrats guys.Well, Christian Bale is my favorite actor, that s why I watch it. He has a talent for acting as both villain and hero. But still just one actor cannot save the show while scenario is collapsing. The reason why people go I think it is because they wish to see something similar to thor ragnarok again.

title: Hugely disappointed!
text: Thank you marvel for making this film! I needed a reason to stop watching your garbage of a films! I'm so glad Taika took one of the most gruesome story arc of Thor and turned it into a poop potato! Seeing you guys destroying Stan lee's legacy is enough reason for me to save my money from spending on your bs films.

It was a nice, enjoyable movie, but Tessa Thompson can't act. Christian Bale was amazing as always. Natalie Portman was ok, but it was not her best movie. Chris Hemsworth's acting was good. I didn't understand why Zeus had a Russian accent. The goats made the whole movie.

title: Terrible and empty
text: Empty shallow and an absolute joke, they had the opportunity to make a good film here but chose to make it farcical. Thor and his constant one-liners, screaming goats that just annoy and endless puns with no content or grounding.I don't think I've ever been so disappointed with a film. This makes a mockery of the Marvel universe and removes all credibility from the character of Thor.I'm shocked that such a sound director,Taika Waititi, would ruin his reputation and make this film. Jojo rabbit was spectacular and yet this falls short in so many ways.I truly wouldn't waste your time watching such a film, it will ruin the Marvel universe for you so you're better off watching paint dry.No diving in this pool. There's no depth. Save this for an unpaid viewing on Disney+ if you're a subscriber. If not, wait to get it on loan from your local library after it comes out, and go see Top Gun: Maverick again.Just got back from seeing this with my 17- and 18-year-olds... and we're just stunned at how underwhelming this movie was. My 17-year-old described it pretty succinctly as, "really just jokes, and most of them not funny, with punching in between." She said, "When I was younger, I used to look forward to every Marvel movie. These are just bad." My 18-year-old used more expletives.A couple of good things... I have to say Christian Bale played a great, at times creepy villain, Gorr the god butcher. Second, Taika Waititi uses some different and interesting filming techniques while the heroes fight Gorr on a small moon.But while Gorr was probably the most interesting character, he varied little--just slamming his sword in the ground, calling forth shadow creatures, and then striking his sword against good guy weapons. That's pretty much it.Other concerning issues:1. Man, Thor's time with the Guardians of the Galaxy was wasted. I wonder what the storytellers behind Endgame envisioned for that team-up. Their time as a "team" fizzles before it starts... and Waititi definitely doesn't bring out the same in the actors that James Gunn does. Just as generic dialog as you can get. One has to ask, "Why was Thor even with these guys?"2. There's just no depth to these characters. Viewers feel little, if any, connection to any of them. There is a hook to Jane Foster, but Natalie Portman's acting is akin to her Padme Amidala performance. After all he's been through, Thor regresses to the Homer Simpson-like character he was in 2011's Thor.3. I'm not sure if Waititi knows who his intended audience here is. It's like he aims for kids with certain events in the end... but this Thor flick has more swearing, violence, and nudity than what we've seen before. If you're going to give us all that, how can you end with Thor (spoiler) bestowing his powers on whom he does? And, if Thor can do that, then why couldn't he grant his powers in the same way to the Asgardian parents, at the start of the movie, so they could prevent their kids from being taken??? And this leads to points 4 and 5:4. It's a shame... once again we see the common thread in all Disney is putting out over the last couple of years: Lackluster story telling. It's a bunch of random, "You know what'd be funny/cool" moments strung together in the hope it will all gel. It doesn't. It. Doesn't. This is inexcusable considering the money and creative "talent" behind Disney and Waititi. The actors in this film were paid who knows how much for this sub-par creation. It's another rushed product, and I found myself thinking, "Now Disney's pushing Waititi to crank out a Star Wars trilogy? This movie shows the danger that could follow." Marvel Phase 4 continues to mostly disappoint...5. This may be the most irritating to me.This film is used as just another set-up, this time on the big screen, to launch another minor character Disney hopes to make $$$ off of. They've used it to introduce (spoiler) kid Thor for what I'm sure is their upcoming Young Avengers. Isn't anyone else tired of seeing a quality character's time in the spotlight being used to promote another supporting character--Bo Katan, Ahsoka Tano, Kate Bishop's Hawkeye, etc. These add so, so little to the major characters' story arcs we'd rather be watching.But fear not true believer! Very soon you will get your Marvel version of Saved By The Bell!

title: Very very ok
text: Good, but not great, humorous but not funny. It felt like it was trying to live up to Thor Ragnarok without the strength and dynamics of strong leads.Thor, loki and the hulk, vs Thor, Mrs Thor and a disgruntled king/ queen/ flying hose rider warrior. Not so much.Story was ok, God scene was underwhelming and the action scenes were same same. The wit was replaced with slap stick cheap laughs.A missive hike in the budget has once again come at the cost of quality.

title: Completely Mess
text: The worse movie i ever watch. Too many contradiction to previous movies in mcu. Filled with worse directing, illogically plot, worse joke and worse action squence. Every character they tease in the trailers are so dissappointing.

title: Entertaining, silly and nothing more
text: This movie fits perfectly into the mold that Marvel had given us some years ago, being the highlight of this movie.When you go to see a Marvel movie you don't expect anything extravagant or artistic, you expect a movie to turn off your brain, watch the action and laugh a little, something this movie does perfectly, it doesn't try to be something it's not. The story is entertaining, with some exciting moments, but the tone is what makes it not so good, it's very childish, the jokes and the way it approaches some interesting topics like love is very silly, it seems that children wrote those parts, there is no maturity in the story or in the characters, that is the most counterproductive thing about this film. But the rest is everything that we would expect from a Marvel movie, good special effects, entertaining fight scenes, a predictable but enjoyable story, new characters, some cameos and very childish jokes.It's definitely not trying to be something it's not, the director knows what franchise the movie is in and does a good job with the narrative, but the very childish and silly tone of the movie makes it not the best or the most remarkable among the movies of this character.

title: Worst film ever!!!
text: Worst film ever!!! I left before ending. Is a completely joke, don't bother going...read more reviews before or listen to your friends. Lost of time, I feel frustrated by this film lack of meaning...

title: Probably the worst MCU movie
text: I've liked all the MCU movies as far as endgame but the appeal has gone and don't get me started on the shocking series they are just pumping out on Disney+ With crap CGI, anyone who's watched she-hulk knows what i mean.Thor was always one of my favourite characters but this movie was just empty,boring and irritating throughout its looks like marvel are just cashing in on an endless flow of crap since endgame, I'd go as far as saying these movies are now as bad as DC's recent attempts of movies, even Christian Bale couldn't save this movie. Unfortunately people will still watch all of these so marvel will keep churning them out.

Big sigh this movies fails to tell a compelling story with the characters that are used in this film some of the scenes that deal with some serious issues hit home but for the most part the true meaning behind this film gets smothered with fart poop jokes that really was just a huge miss for me, this movie also ties into nothing you could easily not watch this film and still know what's going on in the mcu I would just skip this film and wait for something else.

title: Was it a joke about itself?
text: Great cast, super creative, amazing reinterpretation of the villain but no story at all. Disconnected from the previous MCU movies not adding anything to the general storyline.A complete waste of the GotG members but above all - Too (badly) funny. Was this a joke or a superheroes movie? What happened with Ragnarok? They went from a brilliant Thor movie to a complete crap.I get the creativity and new look to it almost like joking about itself, but didn't it go too far? Very few serious moments and lack of good usage of a great actor like Bale...I don't know, feels like we waited forever for this disappointment.

title: MCU had died
text: I didn't think it could get any worse after Doctor Strange Multiverse release but here I am, shedding a tear for a legendary franchise that is no more. The Thor character has been eviscerated and made into a buffoon. New characters introduced in the film are a sorry attempt at humor and add absolutely nothing to the story. The forced jokes throughout the film are corny and poorly timed. The entire plot is akin to a parody like Naked Gun or SNL and lacks any depth or continuity in the greater MCU franchise. I would not have made it through the entire film had I not watched it on Disney+.Movies on par with Ironman, Avengers or Guardians will never again come out of this woke, tired and boring franchise. RIP MCU.

title: Disappointing
text: Besides the Effects - Thor's character has been turned into comedic joke. I don't think Stan Lee and the giys at Marvel ever envisaged their "Mighty Thor" being the butt of so many jokes. Some were genuinely funny makes Thor out to be a bit of a buffoon! This is not what THOR started out as. Its time to let someone else other than Taika Waititi direct the next one (if there will be anymore). Christian Bale as usual is excellent and Russel Crowe with his fake Greek Accent is just another joke that didn't make me laugh! As I said Taika Waititi needs to take a break from directing any more and we want our "MIGHTY THOR" back as he was in the original comics.

title: Love is Eternal Love is Blind but This Film is .....????
text:
Making me lose my mind...Meh.Starts off with pickup from Endgame and New Asgard, following Thor's handover and Korg picking up the Thor thread, but......
Not funny, Pedestrian , loads of talent present but wasted in direction and script.over-hyped and Empty....

title: Just Ok
text: While it wasn't a total waste, it felt like they tried to hard to copy the energy and momentum of the last movie and failed miserably. Certain scenes felt like recreations and/or could have been left out and not missed. The music felt forced this go around, with the exact same fight stances making it feel like they used the same CG and just bit in a different cassette!

title: Not the best of Thor's
text: I had a hard time deciding on seeing this film. I have only really liked one of the Thor films even though I have been a Marvel fan. This one comes in at the bottom of the four. While it did keep my interest, it seemed slow until and had me questioning selecting this movie to pay for. This would be available on Disney+ eventually.

title: Meh
text: One of the best things about Thor: Ragnarok is the chemistry between Thor, Hulk/Banner, Valkyrie and Loki. They play off one another wonderfully. Unfortunately the only relationship I truly got into in this film was between Thor, Mjlonir and Stormbreaker (the only time I truly laughed) and that was not enough to hide the forced humour and lack of spark between Thor and Jane.There was so much potential with Gorr, but the attempt at upping the "girl power" moments between Valkyrie and Jane meant he was relegated to the sidelines and so I really didn't really have any feelings either way about his quest.Guess it's back to watching Ragnarok for me.

title: bad cut. wait for full release.
text: Movie is 4 hours but they released terrible 2 hours cut. Scenes are empty, i was wat da hell just happened ? How they got here ? How mjolnir glued ? Wat are they fighting against ? Wats the purpose ? Where da hell thay guy came from ? Why god killer suddenly have lots of cuts ? Questions questions. Zeus scene soooo boring. It is really boring movie. Dont watch this crap. Just wait for full release.

title: Thor Parody
text:
After watching this movie in cinema can say it felt like a bad parody movie , rush movie ,stupid humour , we didn't even see gorr actually kill the gods (i was really looking for that ) , wanted to see him do it since that's what he was supossed , instead no , they just said he was mass murder gods...
I'm not into comic books , never seen any , when it comes to marvel and dc movies i'm not expecting some oscar movie , just some fun , pure fun and good CGI .I like all the 3 thor movies , specially dark world , but this one... to bad i could not ask for a refund , i would gladly ask for a refund , very bad movie with stupid humour , childish story and rushed ,complete lack of substance.

title: Underwelming and wokeðŸ™„
text: Im sure what happened with thor. It was way to much hidden wokeness and didn't really affect the mcu storyline as a whole. Hopefully the new thor will be better with a mew director.

title: Not good
text: If directors could only stick to the original source material and not just take a piece of it then stretch it way out into a farce that makes no sense. I love Thor: Ragnarok but Thor: Love and Thunder is a failure in my book. Try reading the original graphic novel version of the story instead.

title: Disappointed
text: I really wanted to give this a good score after being a big Thor fan but was really disappointed.Loved seeing the Guardians of the galaxy stars and having some Guns and Roses songs as as the sound track, after that it fell flat.Thor was a strong and important character in the previous phase. Now I feel the have turned him into too much of a joke to even take serious anymore. There wasn't much of a story, felt like a predictable story line that anyone could have made up.

title: Another step in the comedy direction
text: I loved the original Thor movie, in fact it's my favourite of all the Marvel releases. Kenneth Brannagh did a very good job.I struggled with Dark World; it was considerably weaker. Then the switch to comedy came with Ragnarok, which seemed very popular but I found it hard to get through once again.Love and Thunder goes back to basics with a decent, simple story but unfortunately just has too much super power tennis. Clashes are just bam, bam, bam, bam, win/lose. Then, the other to serve and I can't get into any of that kind action, which is prevalant in most MCU movies and just lacks effort in the writing.The comedy and serious emotional moments don't mix too well either. The light vibe was just lost.Jane Foster as Thor was fun but why she was called Thor I don't get. Why not just be called The Mighty Dr Foster or something? No harm to the plot but these kind of token hand-me-downs are distracting.Overall, not much to write home about. It was OK watch but less good than Captain Marvel, which was already heading in the direction of generic super power movie.I'm not a big MCU fan but I suspect even those that are will find this a bit forgettable.

title: Dreadful and a waste of Christian Bales talent and character
text: Marvel meets Sesame Street .. I am a huge Marvel fan and they have produced some of the best made films in history...this is not one of them.This was made for young school kids...and very young! A few minutes into the film and you think Christian Bales character has potential...but as soon as he comes into contact with the first of the easily forgettable other characters, that's it...after the first few minutes you have seen the best of the film!From then on the dreadful script tries desperatly to be funny but serves up humour that would be better served in a cheap xmas cracker and the so called story goes from bad to worse...even the Guardians of the Galaxy can't save this and they should be thankful that they only had a brief appearance.In short, this will be 2 hours of you life wasted!

title: Not Marvel worthy!
text: Poor Marvel. Reaching the top with extraordinary revenue and strong characters only to stumble down with no sense of direction or balance. It is, quite frankly, hard to watch. This colorful mess of a movie should not be a Marvel entry. The God of Thunder is one of the strongest and most feared deities in ancient Norse Mythology, and Marvel's portrayal of him needs to be closer to the ruthless warrior people he represents. The Thor we see in this movie is a domesticated, apologetic wimp. It makes me wonder who the MCU is catering to. I dare say, the majority of the fandom have little to no knowledge of the source material and won't spend money on seeing this type of movie. The colors were overexposed, the plot was only so-so, the writing was bad and I will not even dive into the extreme sexism in the Zeus-scene. The comedic reliefs were lame, while Christian Bale's Godbutcher was genuinely undervalued and wasted. I don't see the MCU recovering to its former glory after the less-than-mediocre installments post Endgame. Marvel has clearly chosen to focus more on identity politics than actual character building which ultimately is reflected in the box office.

title: Meh
text: Thor's Love and Thunder is a mixed bag at best. There is nothing here to make me want to go back and watch this again.The story really ran out of steam in the second hour. I enjoy the Guardians cameo for what they were but once the movie was done it made me which they'd do a full crossover movie because it probably would have been more entertaining than this.Russell Crowe is entertaining enough and Valkyrie is an understated and captivating highlight. Christian Bale's Gorr is a really great villain, truly scary with some Voldemort vibes (if a little too much at times).As the movie starts you're not sure where Thor's place is and where has the story got to go after everything that has gone before. It has to usual Thor banter (though there's an argument to be made that the goofiness goes on a little too far at times).

title: RIP to the Marvel Universe
text: Thor has been reduced to a boorish oaf who acts like an idiot most of the time.The script is abysmal, poorly written, makes little sense and doesn't engage the viewer at all.The jokes are not funny. At all. In fact, most of the time I was cringing.The myriad of stars in support roles should be ashamed for taking a paycheck for this trainwreck. Especially Russell Crowe, in a role which had me squirming because it was so pathetic.Most of the time I was shaking my head and asking 'what is this crap?'. A lack of cohesive writing leaves you plunging through the movie with little idea of where it's headed. In fact, I was wondering why it had bothered leaving the starting gate in the first place.Don't bother with this one, I've always loved the Marvel Universe , but if this is the direction it's headed, I'm done.

title: A total disaster makes you wonder why you watch this
text: The whole movie is full of bad tastes of B-class films and pissed me off from the start to the end. The director should put his personal bad tastes in his own low-cost films, not in such high-budget Marvel movies that everyone will watch. This plain Marvel movie is not only bored and a waste of time, but also irritating. I can't help to roll my eye every few minutes and wonder why would I watch this movie. I love "Thor: Ragnarok", but "Thor: Love and Thunder" is totally a disaster. Recently, the most Marvel movies are so hard to bare, especially the scripts. The only reason I watched Marvel movies was for beautiful visual effects, but I can't stand these stupid scripts anymore, now it's really the time for me to stop watching Marvel movies.

title: A Dull and Some-What Vacant Feeling Marvel Romp, but, Some Slight, Charming Humour Manages to Sneak Through.
text: I can't say that I am a huge MCU fan, I find a lot of Marvel's characters pretty interesting, but most of the MCU films, to me, just seem like bland, action flicks, rather than a Sci-fi film, which just aren't for me, although in saying that, I really loved 'Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness' earlier on this year, so I had hoped that I would also love 'Love and Thunder', unfortunately, that was not the case for me.'Thor: Love and Thunder' is helmed by Takia Watiti, whose comedy stylings I quite enjoy outside of the MCU, but Takia Watiti's other MCU film, 'Thor: Ragnerock' also failed to capture me and 'Love and Thunder' could not be e of a follow up to 'Ragnerock', so, regardless of what else I say here , if you liked 'Ragnerock' at all, I think you will like 'Love and Thunder'.You see, there is nothing inherently bad or wrong with 'Love and Thunder' outside of a few issues, but its main problem is that, to me, it feels soulless, void of any real personality, and any attempt at humour or quirk just feels extremely forced to me, though, once again I can see many people loving this, but it just didn't work for me. However, an aspect of the film I really loved was the storyline involving Jane Foster, and I wish that had been pursued further, but isn't explored to its fullest possibilities. Christian Bale's performances also felt slightly over exaggerated to me also, and the action scenes seemed quite poorly directed to me also.Ultimately, 'Thor: Love and Thunder' is a stone-cold crowd pleaser, which, if that's what you're looking for, you will love this, but, if you're looking for something more, I'd recommend 'Doctor Strange' 2 instead.

title: Atrocious
text: It's too bad marvel studios completely gave up on the Thor franchise. I loved all the previous movies, including the last one Thor: ragnarok. It was clever, visually stunning and funny. This movie was very weak. Bad acting, really not funny, it felt like a parody and not a real movie. CGI was very poor as well. There were parts of it that made me cringe. Natalie Portman was completely miscast. She's a great actress but she wasn't suitable for this role. First 30 minutes are unwatchable but then it picks up a big. Christian Bale was the only good thing in it. I'm surprise someone greenlit it and produced it. I hope it was an off movie for them. Looking forward to the next better Thor.

title: what a loss of time..and money :)
text: What a loss of time..and money!!!!! :):):):):):)Made for children and still very bad...a piece of advise: when you see the film is made by Taika Waititi skip it! He is such a bad director. He ruined the myth of Thor, made of him a caricature. He mocked out of this character and by this he mocked out of all the true fans from the entire world, starting from Thor Ragnarok with a lot of brainless scenes, like the one in which Thor is being electrocuted, after he discovers the powers of lightning. It was such a bad scene. I for one felt like i was cheated, like i was robbed. I have waited such a long time for this to come and the taste was bitter!

title: Good story, bad movie!
text: The story is good. One or two moments are funny as hell and the beginning and the ending with Christian Bale is nearly good. The rest is so bad I cannot tell. The whole movie suffers from trying to be funny. It feels like theater. Bad costumes, bad jokes. No character acts like he did before. Its so sad. Marvel/Disney please stop Taika Waititi making movies like that. This ruins the MCU.

title: Story of Marvel Comics was much much better
text: First Let me tell You in short what happened in Comics and Cartoon series-Gorr was a great believer of God, but due to famine, starvation started taking lives of people on his planet. Every Family member of Gorr died, his last SON also died. Gorr got convinced that there is no such thing called God and his ancestors fooled him since childhood. Later he found that Gods actually exist, but they are so busy in themselves that they no longer bother about people's suffering. Thus he killed a God with Necrosword. Then he baptized himself with the blood of the god he killed. Then he started killing other gods in vengeance and became a god butcher (why not named 'god slayer'? Because marvel universe already had one god slayer with name of knull). He kept absorbing powers of gods he killed and kept on becoming more and more powerful, and thus was able to create a living copy of his wife and son ujsing Necrosword. Still he wanted to kill all gods in all universes. As the sword was corrupting his health, he had less time to travel multiverses, find all gods and kill them all. So he started creating a super weapon to do this thing in one go. He started enslaving gods to work for him. In this attempts, he captures multiple Thors from different timelines and universes. As he had captured hundreds of gods and became master of them, his wife calls him a God himself. He angrily kills his wife, his son gets angry due to this. He had finally become what he hated the most - gods. He was now the 'god of hypocrisy'. His son decided to help all Thors, All Thors unite and kill him.Final twist in story - he still does not die, just disappears..Now coming back to Thor Love and Thunder, nothing of that sort happened in this movie. It was a movie purely made for kids. Story was not aligned with any part of marvel comics. Mighty Thor was unnecessarily introduced, stupid jokes ruined the fun. Overall, the move was a big let down as compared to other Thor movies.

title: Completely piece of s....
text: This Film is good for a 7 years old kid no one else. Special effects IS so weak. Marvel is going to destroy our good memories from super hero movies.Thor is not strong , he hit easily . Thor ragnorak can kill Thor love and thunder.Christian bale acting is good but the others .....I hope marvel's next movies be good enough.This was a kid movie.Marvel is trying to make the movies funny but it is making it trashthe Thor 2011 Special effects was better than Thor love and thunder.And Jane Foster was stronger than Thor.At last the ending of movie was so boringTessa Thompson acting was strong and good as Valkyrie.

title: Story was lost in between Jokes and humour.
text: I had so much expection from this movie and it turns out to be disappointment it wasn't bad I would say it was decent. You can watch one time if you're die Marvel fan otherwise I won't recommend it. It was too much Joking I was expecting something Dark and serious because of Gorr. I would say this is the worst movie of Thor even Dark World is better than this.

title: Overused humour, no villain character development and kind of feel too fast
text: MCU is now using Thor as a joke now a days. Taika Waititi tried to repeat the magic of Ragnarok but badly failed. Just feel a too rushed movie. Gorr never felt like a dangerous villain in this movie. Overused comedy scenes even during the intense scenes.If you are a THOR ODINSON fan like me then u will hate this movie for sure.

title: Half in the bag
text: Well the first half was pretty enjoyable but the second half literally made no sense. Bale was great, Chris was as always great as Thor tho too goofy at some moments, Portman was boring like Tompson the King and the script was a bit of a mess with no heart and clear vision.

title: A Big Mac
text:
The way I can best describe the experience of this movie, is with hamburgers! Let me explain.I really liked Thor Ragnarok, which was like a Hamburger made in a great restaurant and which thoroughly I enjoyed eating, and even after eating the burger I felt satisfied. And wasn't hungry for more after.But with Love and Thunder it was like eating a Big Mac at Macdonald's, I did enjoying eating it but it just wasn't the same as that great burger I ate at that great restaurant, and after I finished the Big Mac I still wasn't really satisfied plus I was still hungry.And now actually talking about the movie, the thing that botherer me the most was that the seriousness didn't mix great with the sillyness as it did with Ragnarok, the emotional scenes didn't really hit me and the jokes didn't land. It was also kinda chaotic and inconsistent.Luckily I didn't go into this movie with too much expectations, so I enjoyed it for what it is:
A Big Mac.

title: Feels like MCU died with tony stark -_-
text:
What happened to Thor? What happened to MCU in general?I get it that they are trying to show how thor is coping grief with making jokes and stuff like that, but literally go watch the first thor movies and this one, its 2 different characters.I dont know maybe they're trying to reach the younger audience? But im literally gen z and this is just weird;
Because every character is becoming less "scary(?)", first hulk now thor?I just want the original avengers back man :(overall the movie is average and feels too bubbly even tho the story is dark and its amazing, it just feels too disconnected with the production of the movie.The villain and his story are amazing, the acting of Christian Bale is so great as well!It might just be me but Thor is just not Thor for me in this movie, some scenes he comes and goes but not even those gives me the jump like it used to; they also just through his god mode with every punch -_- it used to be a few scenes in each movie when we got to see Thor go full mode but now it's just everywhere.

title: MCU Bosses must've asked their under 10s kids Script this and produce
text: I don't normally leave reviews but felt the need to for this one..MCU Bosses must've asked their under 10s kids Script this and produce itWhy because they can and the KNOW movie goers and fans will go watch for the SAKE OF THE TITLE...WE NEED TO DEMAND MORE IF WE ARE TO PAY FOR THIS ABSOLUTE BAG ...!!!I WISH IMDB had negative scoring to accurately reflect this rubbish..You can't even save this film with another Thor there's absolutely nothing to follow up on, loosely stiched, even my kids couldn't laugh. ..What's worse is there you couldn't even fall asleep on it cause of all the unnecessary background sounds in the FilmIf you have NOT seen this Film, please please save yourself the emotional trauma not mention the waste of cash on this verified trash..!

title: What in the World?
text: Some say it is Comedy?!NOPE. It is bad written SNL sketch of 2 hours long.Meme is good. Screaming goats funny once. But this is absolutely mockery of Marvel superheroes line.We had full theater of all age variety. Not a single laugh through whole movie.

title: Guys, you don't want to watch this
text: They call it a Thor movie, but it's completely something else. You don't get Thor, but a female Thor. Speaking as a male, I found Portman's transformation into a masculine body to be quite disgusting, To add further insult to male fans, the female Thor rescues the male Thor at the end. I'm not sure why the Director wants male fans to stop watching Thor movies, but he's definitely succeeded.

title: It had some funny parts
text: I was super disappointed with this movie from the start. I tried sticking it in, hoping that maybe the movie would get better.... It didn't. I gave up after the first hour and even then, I had already started to tune it out before I turned it off. Lots of acting talent wasted all because Taiki Waititi wanted more screen time (and he honestly sucked). He should not have been allowed to make this movie and I really want to know if he was high while writing and directing this movie because there is NO way he watched the same movie that I did and thought it was good. There's just no way. I feel bad for anyone who actually paid to go see this movie in theaters. The somewhat funny but cheesy lines throughout the movie could not save this movie. It reminded me of one of those spoof movies that try WAY too hard to be funny. This was not supposed to be a comedy and somehow ended up being one.

title: Thor love and mid
text: Marvel underused the goat Christian bale he was really good and only good part of the movie but Chris Hemsworth has a fat dumpy,he didn't even say 'his mask of sanity was about to slip' I felt like my mask of sanity was gonna slip every time I heard them stinky silly poppy clowns I mean goats,Jane is mid and when she said eat my hammer I was considering it to die than finish the film,very unfunny big joke with no punchline 0 morbs WHAT SO EVER and wasn't gud plot it was smelly ewwwww Rodrick heffly wasn't involved and I'm furious that's a problem with most movies so in conclusion go watch Rodrick rules and go on opening night for Oppenheimer to see daddy Rodrick screw this film it smells 4/10 stupid rat goats thor mid and mid ps guns n roses is a fat W.

title: Could be Better
text: The visuals are really good for the most part, except for the character Gorr who didn't look at all like the noseless alien with fleshy appendages protruding from his head that fans of comics were familiar with. It comes as no surprise that so many fans of the source material and art buffs feel very disappointed and won't ever agree with the decision made by the producers. Gorr was good, but could have been so much better, and even though Christian Bale does a great job, it is also very cringey to watch him make the exagerated expressions.The movie was good otherwise, the comedy excess is a style that could be better if there weren't so many unfunny jokes, but it still delivers a good time of entertainment. The whole story could have been better though.

title: Mediocre at best
text: Literally, the movie is mediocre at best. I can't mention how often i cringed and was flabbergasted by the stupid dialogue and plot of the movie. A big step down from the third Thor movie. We just notice that the director didn't wanna make this movie, and made in spite of an unbelievable goofy one.Most of the joke are very flat and some annoying as hell, i was kind of shocked on how bad the humor was, cause I expected more. What i did find cool was this one scene in black and white, i must admit, it felt pretty fresh and felt really cinematic, loved that scene. Other from that, i can't mention anything memorable from this movie. The villan was wasted by not fleshing him out more.One of Marvels worst imo.

title: Thor still not given his due!
text: Thor has yet to receive the appropriate portrayal as in the comics and is reduced more and more to a bumbling idiot and not the powerful Norse God that he is. Why does Disney and Marvel feel they have to make every Thor movie a comedy and one with too many jokes that aren't funny? If you're not a "die hard" fan of the original Marvel comics or you know nothing about them, then you'll probably like this movies. All the actors were great but the script was horrible. I could go on but why bother?What's done is done.Thor has yet to receive the appropriate portrayal as in the comics and is reduced more and more to a bumbling idiot and not the powerful Norse God that he is. Why does Disney and Marvel feel they have to make every Thor movie a comedy and one with too many jokes that aren't funny? If you're not a "die hard" fan of the original Marvel comics or you know nothing about them, then you'll probably like this movies. All the actors were great but the script was horrible. I could go on but why bother?What's done is done.

title: Cinematic Travesty
text: Forget streaming platforms or the shift to other forms of media such as podcasts; Thor: Love & Thunder is what has ultimately ruined the cinematic experience. As everyone was exiting the theatre, I was delighted to overhear a group of high schoolers say that they will never sit down and watch a movie ever again. They seem to be a sharp group of kids.The entire movie front to back contained less substance than the vacuum of space itself. During the climactic buildup, I came to IMDB and took the opportunity to remove a star from my beloved Thor: Ragnarok review in order to offset the one star I was required to give this abomination. This gave me just enough time to return my focus to the movie, where I could watch the comically atrocious ending.One person in the theatre clapped as the credits rolled. I believe they should be arrested.

title: Too much forced silliness
text: I think they were trying to bank on how well Ragnorok did and use the same formula and failed bad! Just too many forced jokes that just were not funny and went overboard with silliness. Don't get me wrong, some were very funny but most were not, I think I sat through this movie with a dumbfounded look on my face. I love most Marvel movies but this one was just bad. I almost stopped it halfway through but kept giving it a chance. Also the story was just bad. This was the best acting I've seen from Portman and Bale did the best he could with the roll given to him. It was extremely hard to take this movie seriously, what a huge disappointment. I think this one killed the Thor franchise for me.

title: Lacking
text: It was entertaining at times but the first have was definitely over-bearing on empty 12 year old comedy just to tone down the serious moments and/or cover up lacking character arcs. What a way to waste some potentially great characters and actors. Natalie Portman really could have delivered well with the jane story-line but they gave her entire role a comedy aspect to it?? I know it ties to old thor films but those films didn't work so this was the chance to really change her character around and they failed majorly. What happens to Jane is still interesting and probably the second most interesting arc in the film but they tone it down horribly. As for Bale? Not only barely in the movie but they also severely watered his storyline down. Although, he actually delivered on the performance. Two of some of the best Thor storylines really just tossed in the trash shoot. Every other character was also horribly utilized and I would have been okay with Thor's repeating character arc and goofiness if everything else in the film was turned up a notch. Or actually given creative and serious thought. I will say the moment they entered the world where Zeus and all the Gods were till the moment where the black and white scene ends, my eyes were glued to the screen. They were good getaway scenes and had the action comedy, romance, and entertainment I was expecting. Thor questioning the Gods himself and Jane's one serious moment, it looked creative specifically the black and white scene and Gorr actually seemed like a Villain I wouldn't want to go against for a minute. The comedy was paced in much better in these moments and in general It was the only effective scenes of the film. I would call it the middle act, whereas it is squished inbetween two other acts that were pointless, lazy, rushed, and all-around ineffective. The new character at the end seems like they could be interesting in the future but made the character that brought that character into the film feel even mire lazy. At least Multiverse of Maddness actually put in effort in the all around story, the comedy was in the back seat, and most sequencers were entertaining; it was just the writing that was weak. I can't even say what it is about Thor that they failed at because it kind of seems like they through anything at the wall to see what lands.

title: Great fast food with poison
text: I like 'Thor' series from 'The Dark World' and 'Ragnarok' was great.I hadn't watched any film that I don't need to think a lot so it was nice to watch it. It was my first time watching MCU at a cinema and I enjoyed it as fast food but not as great delicious food. So I want to thank my friend who took me to watch it. Otherwise I would write not good thing a lot. It was for watching with friends and having fun.I haven't watched any of phase 4 of MCU but I wasn't confused which is good because phase 3 requires a lot of informations of previous series but not this film.I realised that MCU presents social issues and asks to the audiences but never gives them any of answers. I did liked it but I can accept now somehow.There were so many heavy theme in this film ex. Religions, killing the gods, the way of using rest of the life and so on. However its director Taika Waititi showed us that how light he was going to show those issues in this film in the explanation part at the beginning. And there were too much comedy parts looking like a parody which I laughed a lot.I like the fight in the colourless planet.I generally liked it in some reasons which I watched it with my friend at a cinema and comical parts ex. Stopping two bikes with legs, two nosy goats, a speaker, the god of the dumplings, nude and so on. But I wonder Taika Waititi's intention in this film. 'Thor: Ragnarok' included his origin Kiwi and 'Immigrant Song' by Led Zeppelin fitted so much this concept was quite similar to James Gunn who directed 'Guardians of the Galaxy' series and 'The Suicide Squad'. However, he didn't do it in this film even he could do it. Guns N' Roses sounded cool in this film but there wasn't any deep meanings. Maybe he intentionally didn't put those things. MCU films make so much money anyway even it's not great. What if he makes 'damn' one? It's still able to make big money. It can be his irony for the world.I felt a bit bad about the children's fighting because of the Ukraine situation.Every single actors were good. Specially Chris Hemsworth, Christian Bale, Russel Crowe and Matt Damon.

title: Taika was trying to shine brighter than Thor.
text: I just finished it and let me just tell you I'm confused, and Is not because the ending is confusing is just the decision making was like what? Also you can really see that Taika wanted the entire movie to revolve around him, that was a mess. But the final fighting scene I think is my favorite of all the avengers films the cinematography and CGI is just so good everything in the battle is perfect. Some things could have gone different, some things could have been explored more and some less. But bale, hemsworth and portman did an amazing job.I just finished it and let me just tell you I'm confused, and Is not because the ending is confusing is just the decision making was like what? Also you can really see that Taika wanted the entire movie to revolve around him, that was a mess. But the final fighting scene I think is my favorite of all the avengers films the cinematography and CGI is just so good everything in the battle is perfect. title: I had a dream
text: Sometimes people can believe so passionately in a vision that their beliefs extend to, or are supported by, others.The risk to the others is that their belief is not in the vision but the individual with the vision, so if the vision is fundamentally flawed, or they are unable to execute the vision, that impacts all of them.This is perhaps what has occurred here.Thor: Love and Thunder is an extraordinarily disappointing addition to the MCU catalogue. And I see that this as an ardent fan of the series.It is a movie which fails to achieve objectives of humour (there are some very brief moments of comic relief), emotion, connection...It may become perhaps one of the films many of the actors will add to the list of films they regret contributing to as they reflect back on their careers in time.

title: Not an honest review
text: Yet to watch the movie. So this is a review for MCU in general and not the movie. I think comic book multiverse is different from live action multiverse and after delivering the best Marvel movie ever in "no way home" MCU is now headed to a downward spiral due to too many characters (they ended up messing Kingpin of all characters, the most intimidating villain MCU gave us) and not many of them being nearly as charming as the original Avengers of MCU. And the stories will get too convoluted probably. Remains to be seen but I think Spiderman was it, not much to be expected. Look at doctor strange, Ms Marvel, and probably now thor. Only 1 I have hope for is guardians of the galaxy, I have a strong hunch that quantummania is going to bomb despite antman being my favourite character of MCU. Introduction of X-Men won't bide well for MCU spiritually, though they will earn tons.

title: not sure why marvel fans didnt like
text:
This movie is like any other marvel movie created by disney.Bad jokes. Check. Even sarcastic joke about stage 4 cancer. Good job disney
bad writing. Check.Bad adaptation. Check.So what went bad for marvel fans? Some old bad movies since decades.And no marvel didnt go bad after infinity war or endgame, it went right at the 3rd Blade movie that Wesley Snipes born to play .But hey nice to see old 13-14 year old market start to grow and they realize how bad is the product. This movie is a passable one time watch. The thing that annoyed me the most was the number of fakeout deaths.Chris Hemsworth natalie portman anthony hopkins tom hiddleston.

title: Love the Thor Story, but this was terrible.
text: I love Chris Hemsworth as Thor throughout the MCU, but this movie was just abysmal. At no point was I invested in the movie whatsoever. The story was all over the place and I wasn't worried about any of the characters ... at all. Maybe watch on a streaming service if you have it, (and have 2 hours to waste), but don't pay for this and don't purchase a streaming service to watch this. Ever. I really wanted to like it. Worst Thor ever. Without exception, not even close. :(The whole cast should equal cinematic gold, but the story was so bad that it fell completely flat. I was waiting for a point to finally get excited and then it ended. Just so very disappointed. All of the actors did a fine job, but the writing was so bad that the star power couldn't save this one from being a total crap show. I hate to say it. I really do. Watch it if you have time to waste. I was excited to see this one to come to Disney+ and was thinking, "Nice! I know what I'm watching tonight!" But I was left severely underwhelmed. Massively disappointed. Don't blame the actors, blame the movie. Yuck. Ouch.

title: Fun watch just a few flaws though.
text: Thor 4 is my second favourite Thor film because I felt excited most parts of the movie there were some questionable cgi but everything else I enjoyed whole heartedly.

title: Good but not blown away
text: I thoroughly enjoyed watching this film and feel the rating is too low however It is not as good as Ragnarok. The end fight scene in Ragnarok got you going, especially with the song but In Love and Thunder not as much however Taika Waititi's brilliant humour still shows through especially through Korg. All in all it was a really fun film and I do recommend going to watch it.

title: kinda confused
text: This is really two movies squished together, the first 20-30 minutes (I think) was amazing, picking up right after the avengers movie with Thor traveling with the guardians of the galaxy, comedy, fun action and just sheer visual vibe was wonderful, and then the movie collapses into a sort of boring half sad romance story and half something very forgettable. The valkyrie character could have been replaced by almost any other character and the story would be the same, but more entertaining since her role was very much a downer. If they could have melded the first and second parts of the story together into a more cohesive whole that could have helped as well but overall this is just a bit of a confused mess and not that rewatchable but still better than at least 2 of the phase 4 movies.
